Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: b0r0
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful week in Playa del Carmen. This was our first time there and will most defiantly return. The location of this resort is perfect. Neither one of us have any complaints, about anything! Seriously...it was just that good! The buffet has something for everyone, and if you can't find anything there, go to one of the fine restaurants that the hotel provides. If you are still not satisfied, you can either order room service, or tour around 5th Avenue. The beach is really great. We met Alex at the swing bar, and had a great afternoon with him and the many other visitors. Alex truly put a smile on our faces no matter where he was stationed to work. Always attentive, and always smiling! Great job Alex. At the pool bar, a special thanks to Montero (aka Mark Anthony) who taught us some Spanish, and learnt some English lol. When we went to the beach to get some sun, we met one of the hardest workers on the resort...Pablo. Walking on the sand, all day, in the heat, catering to our every needs, this guy truly goes above and beyond the call of duty. Sometimes carrying two trays of drinks...great job to all of you. Our room was 128, which was very quick access to everything. Only steps away from the 24 hour bar/food area, ice machine (very important), towel exchange, beach, massage hut, pool area, lobby bar, elevator...and yet, surprisingly very quiet at night. The bed and bedding was to die for, and with the ocean view room we also had a mini bar with rum, vodka, tequila, and scotch whiskey, and a small fridge with water, Pepsi, orange pop, 7-up and beer. Upon request, they brought us more of whatever we asked for. Our guy that stocked our room even found us a liter of tomato juice (so sorry we forgot his name). Claudia also did a fine job of cleaning our room and leaving beautiful towel art every day. It is important to hang the sign outside your room door to get faster service with the room cleaning. We figured this out after a few days. I was a little unsure of how I would like the main floor room, but it was perfect for us. I wouldn't want to change a thing. You never have to worry about seating on the beach, as there are tonnes of loungers. Some with cushions and some without. We liked the cushions. The small tables are an added bonus, but there are not very many of those. If you prefer to sit by the pool, you will have to get up pretty early to snag a great seat. All the activities are awesome. Thanks Chicken for a great time at the pool!!! All Staff members were truly great at whatever they were doing, from the gardener watering the plants to the staff that shone up the garbage cans (yes...daily...impressive), to the guy on the beach that picked up all the straws and cigarette butts, to the front desk staff...I could go on and on. This is truly a wonderful place to stay. We enjoyed it and will return, and we hope you enjoy it too.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Bill O
Reviews.Content: The facilities at the Gran Porto were very good. The Dining room staff and bar staff were also very good. The negattive review is based on our experience with the hotel security. We were robbed during our last night at the Gran Porto and the security staff were (in our opinion) incompetent. It took over 8 hours to get access to the listing of the indivudals that had entered our room. As an FYI, we were able to pinpoint the theft down to a 3 hour time frame. There was only one individual that had entered our room during the time frame when the theft occured. However, that individual was never questioned and we never recieved any follow-up. If you stay at the Gran Porto, please keep in mind that multiple individuals are given access to the rooms.....and every single day you will have at least 4 maybe 5 individuals entering your room throughout the day. (One person stocks the bar, another individual is responsible for housekeeping, another individual puts chocolate on your bed, another individual does a fancy towel sculptor, etc etc). A safe is provided in the room. And if you stay at the Gran Porto, keep ALL of your valuables in the safe. Unfortunately the safe is only the size of a shoebox. It can be difficult getting all your jewelry, watches, I-pads, I-pods, laptops, etc into a single safe.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real, Playa Del Carmen, Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Lynne M
Reviews.Content: We spent a fabulous week at Playa Del Carmen. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and the service was exceptional. The food in the three restaurants was excellent. The bag lunches were bland, my only complaint. The resort had a pool, inside bar and pool bar, beach front access and cabanas if you needed shade. The resort was the right size for us - we were able to keep in touch with each other yet still "do our own thing" when we wanted to. We were just around the corner from 5th avenue - major shopping district which was a fun activity in the evenings. The "collectivo" bus station is about 12 blocks away and we used the bus to visit Akumal to go snorkeling. All seven of us had a relaxing time and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent bar staff”
Reviews.Author: victoria b
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen and we have to say we loved Jose, Jesus, David,Marc Anthony,Pablo,Felipe,and Alex. They gave us the best service possible, and we will return next year. This was our third visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfu 2 weeks”
Reviews.Author: LynnE151628
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Gran Porto Real from Mar 6 - Mar 20. this was our third stay. The hotel is exceptionally clean, the rooms are lovely, the oceanfront view is spectacular. There is always a lovely breeze. The grounds are impeccably kept and beautiful! All staff are friendly and accommodating. The food is great, Florencio and May at the Albatross took super care of us, Ricardo as well! The Maria and the El Pescadore serve the finest of food, Rigo provided exceptional service. A well educated sommelier was readily available to serve us. We are already planning our trip at the Porto next year, where the sun is alway shining! Lynn and Gary Evans, Saskatoon SK Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren S
Reviews.Content: Our trip started off a bit shaky. When we arrived, the hotel didn't have the room that we had reserved available. They upgraded us for the one night and tried to give us a "deal" to stay in the upgraded room for the rest of our stay. It felt very shady and we felt like we were being taken advantage of. We ended up declining the offer and after that our trip was fantastic. Our room was literally ON THE BEACH. The staff was wonderful. We especially loved Pablo! The trip was celebrating my 30th birthday. He hunted me down on the beach with a birthday cake and candle in hand. We loved the special attention. If you're wanting to sleep in in the morning, this probably isn't your place. The staff rolled big carts up and down the hallways in the morning and it was just flat out loud. The food overall was just okay. We found a couple of the restaurants at the hotel's sister resort across the street that were much better than the food at the Gran Porto. We loved the water aerobics every afternoon and the waiters that brought drinks to you while you're laying out on the beach. It was the perfect trip for just laying on the beach and reading a book.

Reviews.Title: “A great 4 night break”
Reviews.Author: vicandpaul99
Reviews.Content: Our family junior suite was excellent - great sea view, large, 2 balconies, spirits on optics, very clean. Easily accomodated 2 adults and 3 small children. Food - Didn't like the Albatros buffet! Room service was excellent. Because our 3 small children went to bed by 7pm each night, we ordered a full meal to the room - with cocktails. It always came quickly, was well presented and served with a smile. Beach bar, good choice, but worst chips ever. didn't use any of the other restaurants due to fussy eating children! Hated the fact that people did the sunbed grab with towels early morning and then didn't use them til 10!!!!!!!!!!! Pool bar and lobby bar good - good service and good cocktails. Kids club - our children loved it (ages 4, 4, 2) and kept wanting to go. Staff very good, but it would have been nice to have some kind of published timetable of activities to drop in and out of. Overall we had a great time staying here, but would probably choose somewhere else next time, but only because we like trying different things.

Reviews.Title: “2 Weeks of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: karenk2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real for 2 weeks from Feb 28 - Mar 13 - the hotel, food, drinks, service, staff, activities, pool - everything was very very good. We found the food at all three restaurants to be a wonderful variety. The buffett with Rodiver and all the servers so friendly, hostess Ricardo, and we were treated just like family. Maria's Mexican Restaurant we found to be excellent food with a different menu each night. Service was so, so good - Rutillio and Lorenzo are experts at their jobs and make the best, THE best "Mayan Coffee" & equally good was the service and food at the Italian Restaurant. All these waiters take pride in how they look, dress, and carry out their job. Check in - room designation at checkin seems to be disorganized. Standard rooms are small - I think it comes down to what can you live with - smaller room or upgrade to ocean view or front. I want to see & hear the ocean so we upgraded to the ocean front. I read some negative comments about the pool activity organizers but we found them very friendly and always talking to many people. They would go and ask the visitors if they wanted to join in with the planned activities - Mike, Ivan, Cesar, Chicken, Rodrigo & Jesus - they were all very good. They had organized lots of games etc for the kids. They are a definite asset to the staff at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Celebrating 25th wedding anniversary and had best vacation ever!!"”
Reviews.Author: LoriWish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from March 4th-March 11th.It was our first time in Mexcio and our first time at an All- Inclusive resort and we were not disappointed!We could not have asked for a better stay...unbelievably friendly staff who went out of their way each day to make your stay perfect!Food was great...both the Italian and Mexican although we ate mostly at The Albatros buffet as we liked the atmosphere there the best!The breakfast buffet is AMAZING and the chef who makes the omletes each day was superb!Also LOVED the friendly Hola each morning from the lovely hostess at the front!(Can't remember her name but it started with IS lol!)Also...fav waiter at night was Antonio..wonderful smile!!!Our room was nice..had a Junior Ocean View...room 316,view was distant but room was very quiet!My housekeeper was THE best...Veronica...and we were always greeted with a smile and had different towel art each day!! Rubi the concierge gal was super friendly and loved her! Fredy Jesus...friendliest bell boys ever. And last but not least...probably the best waiters/bartenders around: Huber-beach waiter. Alex-beach bartender Jose-beach waiter And whoever was cleaning/helping out on the beach while we were there was great as well! Overall...I would HIGHLY recommend this resort if service is important to you...it is to me and it couldn't possibly have been better! (The only non-friendly person we came across the whole time we were there,staff wise, was the girls running the gift shop...not so happy...lol!)

Reviews.Title: “Birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: chicomon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from March 3,2012 for 10 days. The hotel, food,drinks, and staff were excellent. The lobster @ Maria's was superb and Jaime in the buffet restaurant made our trip all the more special. We had family come with us for the birthday holiday and they would not recommend the standard rooms. We had ocean front and the view was beautiful, definately worth the upgrade. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Del Carmen Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: doug k
Reviews.Content: Hotel and amenities were great; staff very helpful; convenient walking distance to downtown and all the shopping. kuddos to the bell boy Aaron for all the help while we were there. We would definately visit this hotel again. Kids had a great time too.

Reviews.Title: “Service at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: JVB526
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Playa del Carmen for the past 11 years. We have stayed at the Gran Porto Real for the last 6. Originally we tried this resort because it was the only All-Inclusive hotel actually located in Playa Del Carmen and on the beach. The location is prime being that it is only one block off of 5th Avenue. The service at this hotel is unbeatable. Coming from a management position in the hotel industry, I have pretty high standards when it comes to service. I would do anything to have some of these employees working at my hotel. They really get it. This kind of service is hard to find. Pablo - waitstaff at the pool, Chiken (Victor) - entertainment, and Dave - Bartender at the swim up bar, remember us from year to year. It is truly amazing how they are able to do this with seeing so many people per year and we only travel their for one week. There are alot of kids at this resort and the night-life at the resort is non-existent. So if you are looking for a place to party, this really isn't the place. You have to travel outside of the resort for any night life. The food is so-so. Usually snack during the day and go to the Italian restaurant or order room service at night just because it is convenient. Breakfast buffet is delicious. They have upgraded the hotel a lot in order to try to make it a 5-star resort, however, I don't feel that it can truly be rated 5-star just yet. All in all, this is my favorite place to stay while traveling to Playa del Carmen. Special thanks to Pablo, Victor, and Dave for always making our stays memorable! We will see you again next year hopefully! : )

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Walt L
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Gran Porto and this time we upgraded to the Grand Master Suite. A beautiful room, a beautiful view of the ocean and pool and harbor area. Florencio and Carlos provided outstanding service in the dining area and Bernardo and Marcos at the front desk were very instrumental in helping us through some unexpected travel problems that developed with our airline. Thanks so much all you guys! I agree with hamrhed who says the service is second to none. The food is great, there is so much variety and with the upgrade, so many restaurants to choose from it was hard to pick a place each time meal time came around. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sarah439
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at an all inclusive resort, and I have to say that, all in all, it was an excellent trip. I felt that the customer service was the most impressive. Willy welcomed my family and I upon our arrival and continued to check in with us during the remainder of our stay. The wait staff were friendly and helpful, but like many others stated, the buffet food got to be a little old after a week. However, the Mexican restaurant down the street was fantastic. Best lamb and guava pie I've ever tasted. The food styling and plate presentations were perfect at both restaurants. It's definitely worth a picture or two. This is definitely a family type of resort, as far as entertainment goes. There is lots to do during the day including bike tours, beach volleyball, kids crafts, scuba lessons, garnishing and cocktail-making demos, bingo, etc. Thanks to Ivan, Miguel, and Rodrigo for making it a trip worth remembering. It's nice to have staff that recognizes you and remembers your name after having known you for only two days. The shows at night (which were pretty impressive) usually concluded by 9 or 9:30, which was okay because my family and I were usually beat by then. We're consider ourselves night owls, but the sun, along with the activities during the day, had us in bed by 10:30 most nights. Attending Coco Bongo was one of the best nights I had there. Amazing performance by talented dancers... a must see. A little crowded, but worth it. I would also suggest planning some day excursions to go snorkeling in Akumal or to see the Tulum ruins. Just watch out for all the salesman that will give you a deal to buy timeshares. They'll offer you free or incredibly low-priced excursions, but be prepared to spend 4 or 5 hours being talked into buying $40,000 worth of time shares. In my opinion, I think it's better to spend a little more money and refrain from attending any type of time share presentation. I was not ready to head home after my week of vacation at the Gran Porto Real. I loved the people and the experience more than anything, and I am almost sure I will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, wonder staff!”
Reviews.Author: stressedoutMichigan
Reviews.Content: Just returned 3-14, miss it already. Outstanding customer service. Employees truly happy to help. Buffet ok, only ate there for breakfast and some lunches. Went to the Italian and Mexican restaurants for dinner. Mexican was good (try the Mayan Coffee), Italian is reallly good! Pool is clean and refreshing, a lot of kids when we were there. If you travel with kids, I would call this a kid friendly resort. We were two adult couples, a little annoyed by all the kids. Get up early if you want a chair around the pool. Parents with kids staking them out with blow up toys. Beach is great! Not too many hawkers. Walked into town every night, that is outstanding. Lots of activity, lots of people, felt very safe as there was a lot of visible security. Ate out at El Ranchero restaurant in the city, it was great! Shopping, bars, bands, and lots of stuff to see and do. Went scuba diving for the first time, Erik trained me in the pool, then had lessons from Victor. Went diving right away just past the pier at the resort. Wonderful experience! Did a day trip to Cozumel, watch for a day when you don't see any cruise ships! Went to Chankannab, excellent snorkeling, no one at the park that day, some stuff was closed due to no cruise ships. No problem though, same stuff every where. I would go back to this resort. The Royal next door is an adult resort (topless), if you are offended, stay in your own beach area. Rooms very clean, turn down service, wine & fruit, fully stocked mini fridge. Very happy we went!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Dana V
Reviews.Content: From the arrival to the departure I was not pleased with the overall vacation. Upon check in, we were harassed to look at the newer more expensive resort across the street which I wish now we would have stayed at. Our first room was awful...it was right next to the children's day care and the reception desk. Granted we reserved a room with an ocean view on a higher floor which we had to pay an extra $200 for to get even though we reserved it. The hotel itself was beautiful and the rooms were very nice. The service was good and friendly. Loved the beach and the pool except for the fact there is no pool bar and you are constantly harassed for having any drink anywhere near the pool. The food was awful!!!! You could not even get a chicken sandwich or anything normal to eat. I ate tortilla chips and guacamole everyday and fruit. Every person we went with wound up having stomach problems and it wasn't from the water. There was absolutely no night life at the hotel and nothing to do past 8:00. After this vacation I realized that I am not an all-inclusive traveler because the quality of food is horrible. Hotel looked nice, staff was friendly, good beach but atrocious food!!! Overall a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: hoodey427
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while dated in its decor, is absolutely lovely. It is big, yet has a very comfortable, homey feel. I think the staff contribute to that a lot, they seem to genuinely want to please you and make you smile, everyone is super friendly. Everything is very clean (how does such an open hotel keep the bugs out?? they do a great job!) and they pay attention to the little details. Bring earplugs though, as there is no sound barrier to the outside so if you're not a deep sleeper, you will be woken up by random noise. The food is really tasty and a good variety at the buffet. Maria's restaurant was our favourite... at first we were surprised at the menu as it didn't seem very typical mexican (not a burrito or enchilada or taco on there), but we ate there 3 nights and enjoyed every single thing we had, Eddy the Chef does a great job. The beach is quite rocky but if you walk down the beach a ways it gets less rocky. There's only one main pool area so getting a chair by the pool means you have to be up early (we were usually up and down there between 7-7:30 and even then we seemed to snatch the last 2 available). There is a "roof/patio top" pool on the 3rd level above the spa, but it's pretty small and secluded. There's loads of chairs on the beach. The location of the hotel is great, as 5th Avenue is a short walk away with lots of shops and beautiful restaurants and cafes (including 2 Starbucks! Although Ah Cacao became our favourite cafe). The only thing really lacking at this hotel is nighttime entertainment. If you're into clubbing, Coco Bongo is the place to go (expensive though, especially on Fri/Sat), but if you're not there's not much really to do at the resort. The entertainment/shows the hotel puts on are really lame, sorry to say for the performers. For us, we weren't really looking for night life too much so we were happy with our trip; there's great variety of excursions you can take to explore Cancun and the Riviera (Chichen Itza is fascinating). Oh, and the wifi is included and works well outside but in the room the signal is weak and it cuts out more often than not.

Reviews.Title: “Service/cleanliness made up for "not amazing" but good food and beach”
Reviews.Author: ksh1964
Reviews.Content: Traveled March 5th - 12th. The resort was exceptionally clean with very friendly, attentive, helpful staff. Thanks Willy for the warm welcome from guest services. (He helped get us a complimentary car rental for a day). We have never had such good service, on the beach especially. (Thanks Pable and Huber) Leave your "bubba kegs" at home. Don't need it for this resort. Drinks did not seem watered down like other places we have been. The beach was not "amazing" but hey, your looking at the carribean sea. What can be bad about that? Food was not "amazing" but we didn't have to cook or clean up either! Food was not labeled very well so not sure what we were eating, but it was over-all pretty good. The resort reminded me of disney world. So many people cleaning and sweeping and attending to your every need. We took our sons 19 and 21 along. Not much going on at night in the resort for them. They seemed to want to go out to the clubs most nights. Coco Bongo was a favorite. They thought it was worth the $60.00. So don't stay here for the "wild" nightlife. Very family friendly. All the shopping/restaurants/bars and then some are available just steps from the resort. So many policia and security around to help make you feel safe. So, if you want "Newer/Amazing" food and rooms stay at the Real Royal next door. You will pay for it though. The hard working people at Gran Porto deserve even more name dropping as far as I am concerned!!! Thanks Gran Porto for an awesome vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “A True Review”
Reviews.Author: Nicole I
Reviews.Content: This will be 4th time traveling to Mexico, and my 7th all inclusive vacation over all. I have stayed in many different hotels from Cuba, Mexico and Dominican. We stayed from Feb 27th - March 5th, traveling with Thomas Cook Vacations. Overall we had a good time on our holidays but not becuase the hotel or the staff did anything to WOW us. The Good: The Italian Resturant was fantasic, we had dinner here 3 nights out of the 7 and every single time it was fantastic! Walking Distance to 5th Ave was fantastic! I loved that the hotel was so much to shops, bars, and resturants but also a beach front property. Coco Bongs - This is a bar off the resort and you have to pay to get in but it is soooo worth it to go and see the show. This would have been my 4th time going to Coco Bongs and it was just as good as the first time! Don't worry about your age etc you will find people from 18-70 who go to see the show. Pools - the option to have two pools 1. The Main Pool with all the activities and tons of kids 2. the small Sushi pool. If you wanted noise and entertainment go to the big one if you want rest and relazation spend the day at the small pool Roof Top Hot Tub - This was our fav little place to go around 2:30-5pm everyday when there was no more sun at the small pool, the hot tub was warm, there were TONS of lounge chairs, and hammocks. Most days it would just be me and my boyfriend and felt like it was our own little hide away Day Trips- We went to Xplore and it was fantastic!!! Zip Lines, Swimming through the caves, ATV's, and Cannos. It was kind of expensive but it was well worth it!!! The food was fantastic!!! Bring Watershoes they help The Bad: Rooms - Yes I will admit I have stayed in WAY nicer rooms. If you are booked for a standard room here is what you can expect, a SMALL room with a huge bed. The Bathroom is very very tiny, with the sink outside of the bathroom. The Balcony was very very small, but overall you only spend a couple hours in your room sleeping and getting ready it will do. So who cares Food: The Buffett was good always lots to choose from (try the Nachos they are the BEST at the beach food area), the Mexican resturant was TERRIBLE. The worst FOOD and serivce I have ever experinced in my travels.. and I have had some bad stuff before. Checking in - It was fine, we checked in at 11pm at night and the hotel looked like a ghost town. No one asked up to upgrade. I had read reviews about the CREDIT CARD scam, here is your simple answer. Just tell them you don't have a Credit Card on you - simple! They didn't hassle us or question us at all for not having one. We did notice that when they were making copies of people CC's they would look at the back of the card.. not sure why but I can only assume they were looking at the 3 digit code on the back. NO one needs to look at the back of the card, if you feel comfortable with them making a copy let them but no need to look at the security code on the back Staff- After reading MANY MANY MANY reviews we noticed that everyone would mention peoples names in their review - well here is the answer why... The staff want you to mention their name in here because they get bonuses and incentives if their name appreas in these reviews. Great concept but not one person impressed up to include a name mention. As well I found it hard to get a true review of the resort as all people were doing were mentioning peoples names and not actually details on the place (hopefully mine helps you) Like I have said I have stayed in many hotels and this was probably the worst for staff interaction! The Activites team consisted of two people maybe (thats all we ever saw) they never made an effort to come and say hello, its kind of like they had their own little Clique. Out of all the trips I have been on this was the WORST exntertainment staff I have ever seen. The Lobby wait staff was terrible and never went around to ask us if we wanted drinks Entertainment - Again this was the worst I have even seen. The shows would start wound 8-8:30 and be done by 9ish. We wouldn't believe that the whole place became a ghost town at 10:30 ish. The lobby bar DEAD, this was just BAD BAD BAD! The only night we had a good time at night was Casion night when we got to play some Blackjack. Make sure you bring board games, cars, whatever to keep you busy at night. I understand 5th Ave is right down the road but they hotel should be providing good Entertainment. Beach - Knowing that you are right near the port to Cozumel you have to know the water is going to be choppy, and a little dirty. Yes there are sand bags to climb down to get into the ocean but they have to do this so the tide doesn't pull the nice beach front away. BRING watershoes as there are lots of big rocks in the water you can't see it and they hurt! Courtesy Room - Our bus didn't come to get us untill 8pm at night so they gave us 30 mins in a courtesy room to shower and get ready. Funny to see that this room was soo nice and BIG! It makes you a little pissed off when you know your room was nothing like this one I hope this helps any future travellers who are considering this hotel. It is not the best but for the right price it can be perfect! We paid 1050 for our trip from Toronto, if I had spent anymore I would have been pissed off with the lack of quality and serivce, but for a 1050 for a week its not the worst I have ever stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!!”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in the Riviera Maya, and first time staying at the Gran Porto Real. Overall, it was an incredible vacation, despite some cloudy weather at the beginning of the week (the five beautiful days of sun more than made up for that!). HUGE thank you to all the staff, who were incredibly friendly, helpful and very hardworking. Would like to especially mention Huber and Pablo, (the very attentive beach servers, who work so hard, remember everyone's drink orders, and always have smiles), Edouardo (hands out beach towels and is always friendly and very hospitable), Frank (pool bar), and Leidy (our maid). The servers at all the restaurants, including the buffet, are also the most attentive and hospitable people I have ever met at a resort. Thanks to all of you for making our vacation so much more memorable. The hotel itself is beautiful - we had a standard room, which was plenty of space, nicely decorated and very comfortable (our mini-fridge was always fully stocked). The pool and beach areas are great - right on the water with plenty of chairs and places to sit or lie. Location can't be beat - 5th Ave and downtown is right down the street and the ferry to Cozumel is a 20 minute walk. The food was very good. The buffet had a good selection, and the restaurants were just divine! Drinks were delicious, with plenty of booze and always tasting great. Overall, this was a great trip and an amazing resort. Definitely deserves top billing for resorts in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: ddd594
Reviews.Content: We just completed our week of vacation at the GPR in Playa Del Carmen. We arrived on Saturday, March 3rd. Transportation to the resort was very nice and fast. Our transportation guide met us and we were off. When we arrived, check was a bit of confusion. We were to get a Beach Front Walk out, reserved from the start. We were told, two different stories, that our room was experiencing "pipe" problems and we could upgrade for the night at the Royal. Myself, I did not want this and told them to put us in an ocean view room for the evening until the room was "repaired." Our other traveling party met with somewhat of the same results and were also put in an ocean view room for the evening. We checked later that evening and were told at the desk that we could get adjoining rooms the next day and we were a traveling party. When we arrived at the front desk the next day, things again changed and were told the clerk should not have told us that but after a little show of "displeasure", we were given the rooms that we were supposed to get. That was not a very "friendly" exchange from the supervisor that morning and of course, things were a little different from then on. But, we did speak up and got our rooms, by the way, were at a great location on the beach and the view was less obstructed than that of the other beachfront rooms. Enough on that--just don't fall for the upgrade talk that they want to give you!! The food that is served in the Albatros, the main buffett area, is basically the same every day. Some days you may have a little difference but not much. PLEASE eat the restruants that you are allowed on a nightly basis rather than the Albatros. The food served at these restruants are of very high quality and really good. Go early as well so you can get in quick and with ease. The drinks that are served are, I felt, watered down unless you tell them you want them strong. If you want a good drink, order the strong!! Now, if you are a couple just wanting to relax, find another place to stay. This resort is "kid" friendly and believe me, there were lot's of kids there. Kids are not the problem there, it's the parent's letting the kid's run them!! The pool are was full every day with kids and pretty noisy. We stayed on the beach most of the time and really enjoyed this. The "drink" runners are very prompt and keep you supplied, just throw them a small tip every now and then. Now for the big rip off. The world famous "5th Avenue.." Gosh, what can I say about that. This place is just like all the ports you visit when you take a cruise!! It's nothing but an over blown "flea market..." Same thing in all the shops.. And these people will do nothing but "hound" you all the time, step by step!! The prices are not that good either. We found better deals on jewelry, beleive it or not, at the airport on the way back home.. So, just watch out when you go there. If you just want to experience "5th Avenue," good. I was not the least bit impressed. Overall, I really would have to say I had a good time, not a great one. The nightly shows are alright, just have a couple strong drinks before, during, and after. I will say this in closing. This was our first trip to the Playa area and we wanted to experience something different in the area away from Cancun. I will say that I won't go back there again. We have stayed in the Palace Las Americas in Cancun and will continue to go back there from now on. PLA has the GPR beat in many, many ways. I would talk more about PLA but I feel I shouldn't becasue this post is for the GPR. However, if you want more info, just ask and I will let you know. Glad to be back home and am now planning for a return trip to the PLA in the Cancun area.

Reviews.Title: “The food!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke A
Reviews.Content: At the restaurant Marías, in the resort, the food is phenomenal. We had Mariano for a waiter and he was so generous. Edi is a fabulous chef and makes the best beans and guacamole. Spent every night at María's.

Reviews.Title: “I WAS VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!”
Reviews.Author: billywilly76
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start off by saying, DON'T listen to any of the reviews on here PLEASE!! This was my first time staying at this hotel and my first time in mexico. we booked this trip almost 2 months ago so I was reading up on it almost every day, reading what great things people had to say about it and let me tell you I was very disappointed. Guess it was my fault for getting my hopes up and getting so excited. Rooms: so everyone was was saying as soon as they went to check in that they would ask you to upgrade, well that didn't happen with us. Instead they stuck us in the other end of the hotel, away from everything in the smallest room possible!! no view of anysort, a small bathroom, a little balcony that only one of us could sit outside on and they room was very outdated. the only good thing about the room was the massive king size bed!! an hour after we checked in we went down to the front desk and asked them to upgrade because it was soooooooo bad!! they said to us that they didn't have any other rooms available all week. meanwhile the next morning we went down and were sitting in the lobby and we heard the person at the front desk asking the people that just checked in if they wanted to upgrade?? are you kidding me? very bad start to a vacation when you find out people are lying to you after you spend so much money to stay there food: the food in the buffet was horrible!! coming from a culinary background i was horrified to see that they would let them serve the food that they were serving. they used a lot of left overs from the previous services and a lot of it was tasted like it was sitting there for hours!! the cooks making the food looked like they were very unhappy to be serving you and the grills that they were cooking on were at too high of a temp. so they were just burning everything they would put on it. i've served buffet style food before and i just cant understand how a 5 star resort would approve of any of this food being served. the service at the buffet was great though. they always had a smile and were always at your table asking if you needed anything and cleared our plates right away. the mexican restaurant at the resort was probably the worst mexican food i have ever eaten in my life. I work with a mexican man at my work so he cooks mexican for me all the time... i was hoping they it would come somewhere close to what he cooks but boy was i wrong!!! The Italian restaurant was Great!! we went there 4 out of the 7 nights we were there and every time was better then the last. now that's how food should taste!! fresh, hot and finger licking good. STAFF: other then the waiters at the buffet and the maids that were delighted to see you and say hello to you every time you walked by them, everyone else seemed like we were a burden to deal with. i just don't understand why everyone is saying that all the employees were so nice. the waitress in the hotel bar was always giving us snarly looks every time we ordered a drink and the bartenders (other then dave, who works at the small pool) would always look at us and look like he was thinking to him self "do i really have to make you that drink." well yah, it's your job and it's only a rye and coke!!! common now!! Over all i really hope that we just caught this hotel on an off week because i really don't see what the heck other people are talking about. i would not recommend this place to any one who's been to other 5 star hotels and want to enjoy themselves without having rude, moody people to deal with. if i wanted that i would have just stayed at home, saved $3000 dollars and visited our local holiday inn which probably would have been better!!! PS. if you're looking for a nice relaxing place just to have fun and not worry about anything like screaming kids and bad service stay at a adults only resort cuz this one was filled with kids and parents who don't know how to control them!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, check in dreadful(unless you're the bride&groom apparently)”
Reviews.Author: atorres533
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding here at this resort on march 3rd. The resort is beautiful, yes there are sandbags on the beach but its to prevent erosion, i didnt mind them at all. The food inside the resort(the buffet) i didnt like, The restaurants Marias, and il Pescatore were very good. My wedding went perfectly and everyone had an amazing time, as did myself and my husband. I will say though that EVERYONE (20 people) who came for our wedding had issues with checking in and getting the room they paid for. My husbands best man and his groomsman paid for an oceanfront room, when they checked in they told them the hotel was overbooked and needed to go to the sister hotel 15 min away!!! They refused so the staff gave them a tiny standard room, in the end they got a little cash back but never the room they paid for. I stayed at this resort for a week and everytime i walked passed the check in station, someone was angry because they did not get the room they paid for. They really need to get their crap straight on checking people in and giving them the room they paid for! Other than that the servers/bartenders/housekeeper and manager were amazing!! You really get waited on like royalty there, of course after the check in nightmare.....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: JasOzm
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this resort. The location, rooms, beach, pool, food, drinks, kids club and staff were fabulous! I will definitely return to this property. The one thing that is lacking is the house wine which is pretty minor in the big scheme. I highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: Ben G
Reviews.Content: This vacation property was wonderful. The poolside service from Pablo was amazing, we now consider him a friend. Thank you Gran Porto Real and Pablo for making it an amazing Honeymoon!!

Reviews.Title: “This is paradise”
Reviews.Author: SwedenMartina
Reviews.Content: Best hotel ever and the staff are so helpful and serviceminded. Deliha, Filiberto and chef Enrique gave us à great evening in the restaurant "Pescatore" and the bartender Dave in the Health bar are the best..

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: tracie s
Reviews.Content: there are several individuals i would like to mention ..they are as follows..Pablo and Teresa were our pool side servers..in the albatros restaurant the outstanding individuals are...Delia Jose and Verlan..also the entertainment crew by the pool are ..Ivan, Chicken(rodrigo), Cesar, Mike and Jesus ..also worth mentioning is the hostess at the italian restaurant Mila ..thanks for making our vacation awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The people make the differance!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deonna763
Reviews.Content: I wish to thank Tereasa, Jose, Cecilia,Patricia and Elizabeth and Willy. Everyone was every good. But these people stood out with their outstanding service while we where there from 2/21/2012 to 2/28/2012 Because of these 6 people we have found our "home away from home" We will no longer be looking for a place to go for our next vacation. We know from now on we will be going to this hotel. Note to the owner, boss, head masters. I say this to you. There are a lot of 5 star resorts around the world people can go to and get the great ocean view, the fine dining at a good price. So what makes people want to re visit the same place? Your staff. The people who work for you. The hotel is wonderful and you can see the staff treats everyone like family. They only thing and I mean the only thing that could even make it better would be to have a few more games during the day and night and the pool open a bit longer. Thank you. Deonna Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: AmySMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 2nd stay at the GPR, the first time with our kids (ages 6, 3 1/2 and 1 1/2). We picked the right place for a family vacation! An all-inclusive is the way to go when you have little ones, there is always a snack to be found, which is important. The food at the restaurants is average but the kids had noodles every night, which they loved! Our room was perfect, a family suite with bunk beds, a trundel and 2 "queens". We were on the 3rd floor overlooking the pool and ocean and were able to watch the nightly entertainment from our balcony, something our kids looked forward to! The staff was incredible, although we weren't able to get to know idividuals as intimately as some (our kids had our full attention) we were greatly impressed by the staff and will definitely be going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “1st Time in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: RDE_59
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Mexico for her 13th birthday (really her 52nd) she is a leap year baby. This was a suprise trip and I had no idea what to expect after putting all my faith in our travel agent. I am not sure where to start. This place was amazing. The facility was beautiful and spotless. The workers were all constantly cleaning and preparing the hotel for the guest. The whole staff were the nicest & most caring people I beleive I have ever meant. They were all so polite & accommodating making sure that we wanted for nothing and that we understood all of the do's and dont's of the area.The food was endless as well as awesome and we had a great selection of resturant to choose from. I espeacially want to reconmmend our new friends Miguel, Filiberto & Auila. These employees were outstanding and in my book and are a huge asset to this resort. We are already trying to decide when we can go back. This is a 5 star + resort for us!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: TOMAN2
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 week vacation at the GPR Resort and it was a great hoilday! The food is excellent and the rooms are very very clean.... The waiters give you great service and so very helpful with getting you any drink you want..... All activites are there for you to use, DO see Miguel Morales head of the Animation Group for any assistance you may need, he will help you! His team works very hard all day with activities, sports, bingo, mixology, spanish lessons water sports and then at night they do the entertainment show for you to enjoy and particpate in you so desire... do it ! It is alot of FUN!! WE are back in Playa in April for a wedding and will be staying at the same resort, over 80 of us will be there at the same Hotel... Great Job Mikey and your Team, keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “Was I at the same hotel as all the opthers...”
Reviews.Author: lisak_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel had such great reviwes that I was excited to stay there. Big surprise when we did! Our "ocean view" was not an ocean view. Our shower flooded, oyr toliet broke, our safe broke, our keys never worked, the maid left out door ajar. There were hardly ever towels pool side. Now I can under all the sand bags because of the hurricane but it was a bit unsightly. Much of their beach is gone. The food was about the wort of AI I have ever had. The Itallian restaurant was just ok. I'm mystified by all the good reviews. When I would sau something to the staff about all the things that were going wrong they always had an excuse OR they would just stare at me. We were VERY disappointed by our stay. I have stayed at about 10 different AI's all over Mexico and this is the bottom of the list. The only thing that was nice was that you could walk to the avennue in about 2 minutes. We even paid to have dinner elsewhere because the food was SO bad. Hopefully I was just there on an off week. The weather was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Third vacation at this Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: There is not a resort in the world that everyone will enjoy. This review is why we like this resort. I just celebrated my 50th birthday at this resort with my wife and two sons who are in their mid twenties. My wife and I had been here twice before but this was our sons first time. To be honest we have never stayed at any other resort in Mexico. I often ask people while I’m there if they have stayed at others resorts in Mexico and how they compare. Overwhelming people tell me this is the best resort they have stayed at. The food is very good. I must say that one year we had an upgrade that allowed us to use the facilities at the hotel next door (Royal). I can tell you that the Asiana & Pelicanos at the Royal are fantastic dining experiences. Besides dining at the Royal we enjoyed the Gran Porta much more because it fits us. The atmosphere at the Royal would appeal to people that enjoy a more upper class resort experience, but to us it felt stuffy. This is why we like the Gran Porta Real. It has a fun, warm family feeling. The staff is awesome, they take time to get to know you, they will joke with you and laugh with you, they go out of their way to make sure you are needs are fulfilled and you’re having a good time. Each time we vacation there we get to know different staff members a little more than others. All the staff deserves recognition for providing such great hospitality. This time a few stand out, Jose (Lobby Bartender) & Miguel (Pool Bartender) are great! Always smiling and will make you just about anything you want. Cecilia & Elizabeth (Servers) were also wonderful! I have been teaching myself Spanish since our first trip to this resort and Cecilia & Elizabeth took the time to help me with my Spanish. So once again we had a great time! Because of the resort’s warm personality I believe it attracts that type of quest which makes the whole vacation so much more enjoyable. We always meet so many great people when we vacation at the Gran Porta Real. Suggestion: I think it would great if when you stay at the Gran Porta Real for a certain number of days that one day should be an upgrade to try the facilities at the Royal. And they should do the same thing for the guest at the Real should have a day at the Gran Porta Real just to see what the resort is like and try the different restaurants. The Gran Porta Real was at full capacity during this our stay, however we never felt we had a long wait for dinner at any of the restaurants so I can’t imagine it would create a problem with a one day upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at the Gran Porto Real!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Caralyn M
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our first ever all inclusive. Although our trip started out on a sour note by being told upon arrival at midnight that they overbooked and our room wouldnt be ready till the following morning. (and being sent to a sister hotel for the night that I wish to never remember) When we did arrive monday morning Claudia was amazing at getting us our rooms as soon as possible, supplying us with 80$ for the gift shop and 2 massages, to help with our inconvenience. The staff really made up for it all. Starting with Dave the amazing at the Swim up health Bar. Ask him for "The Dave" or the "Carolina" I promise you will love him as much as we did!! Miguel and Hector were also amazing, singing and dancing for us. Frank was so friendly! Ceaser and Ivan and the whole entertainment crew were awesome, So friendly and welcoming.we Loved the decades show. And make sure you get those 3 guys to dance after. Eduardo at the towel stand, making us use every bit of our spanish even tho his english is perfect and always greeting us with the biggest smile every morning!!! In the Albatross dinning room, Jorge and Juarez always made us smile,We loved seeing Rodiver, May, and luis. At the end of the of our trip, we were sad to say Adios to everyone, and would definitley visit again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beachbums”
Reviews.Author: Don M
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our vacation. Our staff was excellent, and when we did the lobster it was delicious. Thanx Chef Enrique Salgade. The buffet was great with a large selection of dishes, The beach was being rebuilt at night due to a recent storm but was good anyhow. Proximity to all the amenities, ie the ferry to Cozumel, shopping, bus to Tulum, Cancun, and other places,was easy to access. The local law enforcement is very visable to hopefully ensure that the tourists feel secure. And they don't mind if you take pictures, lol. We had a very good time and will probably book there again as we need another vacation to do the things we didn't have time for.

Reviews.Title: “First time”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl I
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Mexico at an all inclusive. The resort was beautiful in every aspect from the amenities, to the activities, to the food and the staff were fantastic. Our favorite pool side server was Pablo. And our favorite sports/recreation fellows were Ivan and Cesar. Definitely want to go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Todd D
Reviews.Content: good food at all the restaurants and excellent service from the bar staff especially pablo and miriam.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GayleBob
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd year and we're already planning our 4th vacation there. The resort is perfect being right on the beach, close to shopping, the ferries, great resturants and night life! We were there for 2 weeks and as always we didn't to leave all the wonderful employees. I can't say enough about all the fantastic staff, they treat you like royalty. Eliasar the capitan, Juan Canul and Rene the chefs, Aurelio Cocina who makes delicious omletts each morning, Jose (who's a wonderful amigo), Pablo, Jesus, Teresa our bar servers are always right there with a drink. Eliazar set up not 1 but 2 very special surprise lunches for us that were absolutely delicious! Then I can't forget to mention Claudia, Chicken, Ceasar, Edwardo, Rodrigo, Ivan, Miguel (great drinks) and Floencio, May and Antonio in the dinng room. The hotel manager Carlos Melgar does wonderful job.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, warm, attentive Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Lynn O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great mix of all the things we love about our trips to Mexico...beautiful beach, a great variety of good food, clean comfortable spacious room but above all a team of professionsal Customer Service people that make you feel "at home". From the moment you step out of the taxi you are greeted by the most attentive, warm team that we have ever experienced. Always a smile and a genuine desire to go that extra mile for you. The lobby team of Miriam, Adriana, Cecilia and Anahi seemed to have the ability to suggest and service (with the most beautiful smiles) exactly what made afternoon or evening cocktails something to look forward to. Warm sunshine, soft white sand, the ocean and Huber catering to you every need (sometimes even before you know you "needed it") makes this one of the best beaches ever to spend time truly feeling indulged. Thank you Gran Porto team for making our week with you exactly what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation Location!”
Reviews.Author: Beth V
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Gran Porto Real in Febraury 2012. The food and service was outstanding. Our favorite servers were Jose, Pablo and Jesus. They greated us everyday with huge smiles and always brought our drings promptly and remembered our favorites and had them on their trays. We love the location of this resort, it is an easy walk to 5th Avenue and Senior Frogs. Hated to see the week end...it was a wonderful relaxing week!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: agirl14
Reviews.Content: The moment you get to the hotel you are treated extremely well. I love how attentive the staff was at this hotel. Mari, Huber, Cecilia were amazing, always providing service with a smile on their faces. The hotel was very beautiful and the location is perfect, probably one of the best family hotels in the area. The Junior suite was kept very clean and was spacious. The beach was ok, they are trying to preserve it using sand bags but if you walk a few blocks away there are nicer areas. You can walk around in la Quinta avenida to have a break from the hotel. The shows were nice, and the live music was great at night. The food is ok,nothing extraordinary but the superb service makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Angelica58
Reviews.Content: We highly appreciate the warm and concerned service. Special thanks to Chef Aurelio , and Paul in the reception. They are class acts!! Family Laurens Nymanson

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in playa del carmen”
Reviews.Author: gordy n
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel and the service is second to none. The very moment we arrived we were treated as if we were royalty. The staff got our luggage out of the taxi for us and brought us to the front desk where we were handed a most tasty cocktail even before we checked in. We were greeted by Ricardo Hernandez at the front desk who made us feel very welcome and helped make our check in a breeze. As soon as we finished the check in the staff again took our luggage and us to our junior suite. The room was far better than I could have ever imagined and very well stocked with every type of beverage you could ever want. The hotel is so clean that it sparkles and you see the help cleaning everywhere you go. Every night we had towels made into the shape of beautiful birds decorated with flowers and candy on our bed. Ana M did a great job of keeping our room spotless and well supplied with everything we needed. The food was great and Filiberto at the Pescatore restaurant was the best waiter you could ever hope for, he even tried to teach me a few lines in Spanish but I was not a very good student and had fun trying anyway. We had a different show to watch out at the pool area every night and lots of fun activities during the day. Ivan took us bike riding and was so kind to us. I loved to swim in the pool and walk in the gulf and on its white sand beach. When I needed a snack I would get out of the warm sun and head inside to the air conditioned snack bar where Cicilia would be working very hard and had the nicest smile as if she was the happiest girl in the world. She told me she was excited because she was going to have a baby and I could tell that she would make a great mother. She also told me that she loved working at the hotel and it showed in her work. It would be nice if we all had employees like her working for us. I could go on and on about how great this place is but I won't, there are just too many good things to say. If you can, go there and see for yourself as you will not regret it. Thank all of you at the Gran Porto Real for making us feel so welcome and important. We would not go anywhere else and will recommend you to all of our friends and family. You all are so kind and wonderful. Thanks for everything. G Nelson / D Paulson.

Reviews.Title: “Like visiting with family!”
Reviews.Author: heatseekerwpg
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real February 5-19, 2012. This was our fifth time at this resort and as you might guess we like it very much. It is a small resort by Mexican standards (297 rooms); however, what you may not find compared to some of the mega resorts is more than made up for by the fine service you receive from the staff. Check-in took about 15 minutes. A credit card imprint is required; this is returned to you at the end of your stay. As you are attending to this you are served a refreshing drink. You are fitted with a wrist band; then the porter takes you to your room. We had an ocean view junior suite on the third floor. There is a good view from the balcony. These rooms are on the street side of the resort. There is a lot of activity on the road with tour buses coming and going during the day. We don’t care about that as we are at the beach. At night the street is quiet. If you prefer, you can upgrade to an ocean front room which faces the sea. The weather was threatening rain the first few days so we requested to be moved to a room that had a covered balcony. This ocean view room was on the second floor and had a large covered balcony that we could sit on when it rained. We waited only one day for this request to be fulfilled; and it was done happily. Most of the rooms have king beds, with a few with 2 doubles. The suites are spacious and bathrooms have a walk in shower and a single sink. There are robes for your use. Plenty of good towels. The air conditioning is quiet and effective. There is a 4 bottle liquor dispenser for your use plus a bar fridge stocked daily with beer, water and canned soft drinks. There are 2 restaurants; one Mexican themed and one Mediterranean themed, as well as the buffet restaurant and a 24 hour snack lounge. The food is ok but the menu in the buffet is repeated each week. We always found something we liked. In the evening, you can check out the buffet, and if nothing appeals you can go to one of the a la cartes, as there is no limit on the number of visits, and no reservation required. Clothing there is casual to dressy, as you wish. A new innovation on Fridays is Steak House night. The buffet serves your choice of 3 cuts of steak; or chicken for those who don’t want steak. The fillet was the best, followed by the rib eye. The steaks are small compared to what we are used to at home, but we enjoyed it! If you want lobster you will pay extra. They also offer a steak and lobster dinner on the beach that we had for Valentine’s Day, but for $49 a person you had better hope the weather is nice. Our night was windy and the food cooled before we could eat it, but we enjoyed the experience. The beach is a work in progress. It shifts from year to year. I believe they have a handle on it now. Two rows of large sand bags were placed in the water and that has apparently changed the currents because there is a big improvement in the amount of sand being deposited in the beach area. There are small sandbags along the shoreline as well but these don’t interfere with the use of the beach. There is a large area of shallows perfect for small children. My opinion is that the beach is improving here; even as it seems to be disappearing further south. There are many cabanas with curtains, we always saw vacant ones. There are plenty of loungers which people can pull further onto the beach for sun tanning. A snack bar serves hamburgers, hot dogs, fries, chips and dips. There is beach service for those who like a cold drink brought to them. The waiters are very good and deserve a tip now and again! One of the best features of this resort is the fact that it is built so it follows the shoreline. Every room is a short walk away from the beach! The pool area is usually crowded and if you want a spot you better get out there early and lay down a towel on your chair. The pool is not large but it is very, very clean. You won’t see any debris drifting on the bottom of this pool! There is another, smaller pool with a swim up bar located on the second floor of the resort, next to the standard rooms. On the roof there is a hot tub with a nice view of the sea. The employees of this resort are a credit to management. They all seem to really enjoy their work. We want to mention a few standouts. First of all, Enrique Gio at the front desk. Enrique was willing to engage in conversation with us and because of this we were able to learn a little about the lives of Mexican people. Our vacation was a learning experience as well. Thank you! Teresa, a waitress in the lobby bar area, went out of her way to get us a little plate of cookies to take back to our room each night. Huber, Jesus and Pablo will make sure you are never thirsty on the beach! Antonio, Ivan and Jamie were standouts in the restaurant. Also, thanks to Ana, Arturo, Juarez and May for helping to make our Valentine’s Day dinner on the beach something to remember! Last but not least, Juanita, for keeping our room spotless and for the wonderful towel art! The location of this resort makes it perfect for those who want to enjoy 5th avenue; the main shopping area for tourists in Playa del Carmen. There are many shops, bars, and restaurants. It is a great place to go if you like to walk and people watch! In conclusion, if you are looking for a resort that is very clean, has people who make you feel welcome at all times, and is small enough that you don’t need a golf cart or hiking boots to get to the beach, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Two fantastic stays!!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon O
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic resort. In 2011 we spent 7 days there and in 2012 we went back for 10 days with 4 other couples and kids. The staff are fantastic, the food is terrific and the resort was spotless. We loved Pablo around the pool and Jamie in the buffet. My daughter loved all the girls in the kids club but especially Georgina whom she remembered from being so good to her last year. The location of the hotel is terrific if you are at all interested in walking 5th ave which you have to do to see the great sights or even just to walk off some off the fantastic food. We may very well be going back in 2013!!! Our friends that joined us are for sure going back. We love this resort and everything that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: Coleen M
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Gran Porto. The staff is amazing and I would stay there again in a heart beat! Special Thanks to Huber, Caesar, Pablo, Jose and Mike!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: 1snowbird
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Gran Porto Real. It had been 5 yrs since I was there and probably about my 8th visit. It is the best place I've ever been! The SERVICE is AWESOME! Special note to Eliazar Gonzalez. Eliazar goes above and beyond every time! This year, he made me and my friends our own private lunches with the special assistance of; Chefs: Rene, Mauricio, Weiter and Ventura, Jesus-Ndnana. Jesus is the best beach butler as well. Eliazar made our trip extra special! This may (due to cancer) have been my last trip. I will never forget Eliazar and the entire STAFF! Beautiful beaches, clean rooms, good food, unbelieveable service. Best location in all of Playa. Can walk to pier to take ferry to Cozumel and 5th Ave. for shopping. This is a gem that I'd like to keep to myself, but its too special not to share this place with all travelers. If you go, say "hi" to all -especially Eliazar from Paula! Ahola!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda H
Reviews.Content: This was our first all inclusive hotel (we have always booked a villa for more privacy)! We were impressed with the customer service. Victor treated our kids amazing and confidently during their first scuba dive where they saw, Sting Rays, Octopus, Electric eels, incredible experience for their first time! I highly recommend this hotel absolutely everything was done well and we had a most relaxing family week! Well done Porto Real!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stacey J
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms were always clean. The food was good. The staff was very friendly. Miquel and Avila at the outside bar always made sure we were taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Adam S
Reviews.Content: We traveled January 16th - 23rd and got an amazing deal on our vacation. I booked just a couple of weeks before and got the trip for about 1/2 the price on Travelocity. It was for my sisters wedding and being a poor recent college graduate, I was happy my girlfriend and I were able to make it. The service was beyond excellent - you could be on the beach or near the pool and servers would be there to provide drinks around the clock. The wedding service was beautiful and the staff did a great job with the presentation of the food and decor. Location is top notch - if anyone is planning on traveling to Playa Del Carmen this is the PERFECT spot. It is located right near downtown so everything is just a quick walk away so I didn't feel "trapped" in one location all week. The buffet and restaurant food was decent, not great, but combined with the excellent service I would rate the overall dining experience 4/5 stars. My only gripe was that I was woken up a couple of times during the week with what I assumed were workers talking and chatting loudly outside our room. Overall, I would highly recommend this all-inclusive resort to anyone traveling the area. Also, I used Olympus tours as my shuttle to and from the Cancun airport, and also used them to book our one day excursion to the Tulum Mayan ruins and a jungle adventure zone where we did zip lines, rappelling, and snorkeling in the underground river systems. I had one employee in particular that made our trip so much more amazing. Her name was Kate from Olympus tours. I feel a lot of tour workers from different companies try and pressure you into things while only thinking about how deep your pockets are. Kate, on the other hand, really cared about us and gave us honest recommendations without pressuring my girlfriend and I into doing anything. I feel like I was booking a trip through a friend, and not a money sucking agency! So thank you again Kate and Olympus tours for making our trip that much more special!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: chipotle11
Reviews.Content: My stay was one of the best. I was especially happy with the breakfast buffet and the service I received every morning by Chef Aurelio. My spinach omelette was always made to perfection. Oh did I mention always made with a smile. I will always remember the service at this Hotel and highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “the best family vacation”
Reviews.Author: jamzgang
Reviews.Content: Vacation=Feb18-25, 2012- 6th time coming back and will again. True family hotel with style! came here with a family group of 11- 8 adults,3 children (13, 9, 21/2 ,toddler). Staff was always attentif/helpful to make a memorable experience for every one of us, especially to the youngest one. Great welcome at reception desk- 3 rooms (Junior Suite Ocean View), 1 Master Suite were ready, buffet restaurants and 24hrs lounge were plenty sufficient varied food for our appetites, El Pescatore italien restaurant has a very elegant menu and impeccable service, let alone the beach restaurant. Beach is contantly being groomed every AM, the fishermen's boats add a quaint element to the atmosphere. We all had our dreamed FAMILY REUNION TRIP and vacation. We are thankful to every staff member. We had a grand time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs updates-lacked the "wow" to make me come back”
Reviews.Author: Addy_May
Reviews.Content: I was hoping the reviews I read before going were going to be off from what I experienced but that was not the case. If you want to be in Playa Del Carmen close to the water and don't care about the little things then this is the resort for you. I have a hard time calling it a resort-it is very small, there are only two restaurants and a buffet, the beach is small, and there is only one pool. Technically there are two but the other one is on a roof top and in the shade 99% of the day. The rooms need a remodel. The floor tiles are cracked or chipped. The showers are not modern. The room furnishings are dated. The food in the buffet is at the most tolerable and the space for the buffet is cramped-hard to move from one station to the next and to see what is being served unless you butt in line. The beach is crowded and a public beach with reserved seating for the guests. There is no shade except for some pergolas. The beach has nice sand but you have to go more than 50 yards into the water before you get more than waist deep. The pool is crowded. We tried for three days to get 4 chairs together at the pool. People had staked a claim to chairs before 6am each day and never left. The two restaurants were the only saving grace for the resort-excellent food with fairly knowledgeable wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real, Excellent Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Sue647
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real (via WestJet vacations) from Feb 10-17, 2012 with another another couple. We are Canadians, francophones from the province of Quebec, fluent in both French and English with a little bit of Spanish. Both ourselves and our friends are retired & in our mid-fifties. This is our 2nd vacation in Mexico (numerous stays in the Dominican Republic) but 1st time at Playa del Carmen (PDC). We had a wonderful vacation at the Gran Porto Real. Beautiful and quaint resort, warm and welcoming atmosphere, great location. When facing the sea, the resort is to the right of the pier to Cozumel & 2 blocks from the 5th Avenue. The resort has wonderful staff who worked very hard to make your vacation perfect. We always had a warm welcome and smiles from all employees who speak English and a number are also good with their French. All of the resort is kept very clean, our maid Patricia was excellent & clean towels were always abundant. Beach: great beach, very large and long (sand bags are evident but no problem), lots of cabanas & chairs, service all day long from waiters right on the beach making sure your needs are met. You pick up your towels in the am and return them at the end of the day (near the pool). This resort is also very good for families & offers family junior suites & a kids club which resembles a daycare. The pool is very nice, not overlarge, good music & a very relaxed atmosphere with pool bar of course. Bathrooms are well located throughout the resort both inside and for beachside. Resort also has a beach snack bar with a simple but good menu (hamburgers, hot dogs, chicken, chilli, guacamole and fruits and more!) Just watch out for the sea gulls! Restaurants: the Albatross buffet is great & both food & service are very, very good. There is also a 24hr all inclusive “snack bar”, w/ coffee machines offering a variety of selections. Also, you don’t need to make reservations for dinners a la carte! Both Maria’s (Mexican) and Il Pescatore (Italian) offer excellent menus & great service, not to mention special menus for myself as I’m celiac (allergic to gluten). We ate twice both at Maria’s and Il Pescatore. Excursions: we booked via Best Day staff who work on site at the resort, accessible all day. Many thanks to Sylvia and Victor for their warm welcome and great services. Best Day works with the Real Resorts in Mexico for transfers to/from airport & excursion services. They are very reliable, trustworthy & work hard to make sure everything goes smoothly. We took a full day excursion for Tulum (Mayan ruins) & Akumal (snorkelling w/sea turtles); booked via Best Day with “Go Natural Adventures & Expeditions" which are great. We had an excellent tour guide, special thanks to Yair (pronounced “Jahir”) for his attentive care to our needs, great source of information on both ecological, historical and archaeological subjects. And funny! Strongly recommend this excursion. Also, special thanks to our personal guide at Tulum, Ramóndo, he was fantastic. We had a late check out and the hotel provides a hospitality suite for 1/2 hr to shower & clean up. Suitcases are very secure & safe. System for check out is smooth and well organized. A special mention of thanks to the following Gran Porto Real employees who were great and so friendly and made our vacation extra special: At the Albatross buffet restaurant, Marcos & Gustavo . At Maria’s, Rigoberto who is a fantastic and great guy & the team he was working which included Edgar, Chef Edi and Capitan Antonio. At Il Pescatore, Ton and Ramiro as well as Jorge & Yoni & the Chefs. At the front desk, Claudia and Paul. At the 24h All Inclusive Club, Elizabeth and Teresa. At at the lobby bar, Alex our bartender & waitresses, Teresa & Adrianna. Also a special mention of thanks to the employees who work at the luggage and concierge desks, sorry, wasn’t able to catch all of their names. We definitely intend to return to the Gran Porto Real & definitely recommend this resort for a great vacation, whether you are travelling as a couple, with friends or with family and children. Suggest you visit their web site to verify the variety of rooms offered. Muchos gracias Gran Porto Real, Hasta proximo ano! Suzanne Seguin & Paul Vachon, Gatineau, Quebec, CANADA

Reviews.Title: “Gran Master Suite Not as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: DrDeth
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our experience at the Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa was not like others. The resort is beautiful and the location to the ocean is ideal. The junior suites are very nice (we had 2 for our family). Our biggest problem was the Gran Master Suite (3rd room for our family) that we reserved, was not at all like they advertised. The pictures and layout showed the bathroom and a large closet between the living room / dining room and master bedroom with a central access to the closet and bathroom. It turned out that the bathroom was an ensuite to the master bedroom, so anyone sleeping in the living room / dining room has to walk through the master bedroom in the middle of the night to use the bathroom. When we brought it to their attention the first day, they said that this Gran Master Suite configuration was only available at their Royale Playa del Carmen across the street (adult resort only). After the trip, I contacted the hotel by email about some sort of refund (staying over Christmas, and paying a significant premium on a room configuration that does not exist at their resort I find unacceptable) they confirmed in return emails that they were aware that the room we got was not as advertised; however, they did supply us with a Grande Master Suite, so no refund. It was hard to remember through all of this that their Mission Statement is "Exceeding Your Expectations". Food was average. House wine was less than enjoyable (barely drinkable), and if you want to order off a wine menu be prepared to pay $90US plus per bottle. Also, make sure you don't get a room across from the housekeeping storage area. The hallways are all tiled so noise travels a long ways, and housekeeping generally rolls out the carts at 6:30 in the morning. It make for a great alarm clock if you want to be an early riser. It will be a long time before we return to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Cancun”
Reviews.Author: musicnurse
Reviews.Content: We have been to Cancun three times and loved it. We decided to try Playa del Carmen this time though and will definitely return! We loved the area, the ease and safety of walking on 5th Avenue and especially the resort - Gran Porto Real. The atmosphere was not the loud, partying group often found in Cancun - but more quaint - and busy enough if you wanted to partake in activities . The staff was always attentive and going many steps beyond what would be expected to make the vacation memorable. We ate all meals except one at the Albatros buffet and loved the service and the variety of foods. It is impossible to be hungry there! For the one meal we strayed - we went to the Italian restaurant on site, and though it was lovely, and it was nice to be served, the selections were not as great and the quality not any better than the buffet. so - we returned to the buffet. On our last night there - February 17, there was a special sit down dinner - steak night which was more than amazing! The wait staff was even more attentive if that is possible, and the food presentation was delightfully elegant. Antonio was our waiter and we cannot say enough about how special he made us feel that evening. There was truly not one staff member who disappointed in any way. Maid service was excellent and each night we had our bed turned down, chocolates left on our bed and a special decorative towel arrangement done for us. We will return to Playa del Carmen and to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Stay at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Larry H
Reviews.Content: I’ve never spent a minute writing a review (positive or negative), but after recently returned from a one week stay at the Gran Porto Real I have to compliment the hotel and staff on a fabulous stay at a fabulous resort. Our daughter was married at the resort, and I was truly overwhelmed by the attention given by the hotels Wedding Planner, Lisa Alvore, and Manager, Marco Ramos. Their attentiveness to our daughter and son-in-law, and their attention to detail in every aspect of the wedding and reception was absolutely impeccable. They are true professionals in every aspect of their profession.
