While the wedding was planned for the beach (with chairs, tables and covering set up early that day), the rain came about an hour and half before the ceremony. But before the rain had hit the beach the staff had quickly moved the furniture to an inside alcove/hallway that looked onto the beach and ocean. The location was perfect and the wedding planner saw to it that the guests were informed, and the wedding went on as scheduled. The reception was perfect, from the h’ordevers served prior to reception to the exquisite meal served during, and the staff was constantly attentive but never obtrusive. We found all of the resort staff friendly and accommodating. It was if the word “no” was not in their vocabulary as they continually went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. A particularly noteworthy staff member was Jose Lopes who serves in the Italian restaurant at the resort. We had the pleasure to be served by Jose on two occasions during our 7 day stay, and found his hospitality engaging and his service impeccable. While the buffets selection and food quality was first rate; if I could offer one suggestion it would be to put big warning sign close to the buffet tray that holds the hottest habanero chili peppers one can imagine. Both my wife and son sampled, and both felt the pain. The rooms were clean and well-appointed and were pleased with our decision to upgrade to a jr. suite ocean FRONT room. Initially we had an ocean VIEW room, and as is typical of many resorts, the term ocean VIEW means the ocean can be viewed..........by leaning over the balcony. Overall though the experience was outstanding, and I would highly recommend the resort. I hope each has the great holiday we enjoyed at the Gran Porto Real. Larry Haas

Reviews.Title: “long stay”
Reviews.Author: kittyuk71
Reviews.Content: Just returned form great holiday,21nts.... thanks to good service of friendly staff. & after change of rooms from the smelly one on the first day,to the lovely big one we end up with. cant say enough of the all bar staff Aurelio, Cecilia, Elizabeth. Resturant staff Capitain Tony, Ana Elisa & most of all entertanment team ''Chicken'' yes that's his name, Victor & the Gt.Cesar with his sala lessons,cycleing,water aerobic& lots more made our holiday memerble. walk up 5th Ave in the eveings..just perfect to let dinner go down..and little shopping!!!! Annie uk

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: CarolcrystalLake-Il
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks at The Gran Porto Real. We have been going there for 14 years. It's like a 2nd home to us.What a wonderful staff they have. We have several people we've gotten to know very well. We can't say enough about all of them. Pablo, Jose & Jesus as well as Teresa & Miriam are very special to us. So much fun & so attentive.All the waiters are so friendly & right there if you need anything.Can't forget Samantha & Enrique at the front desk. Will do anything to please & be sure we're happy. Can't wait to return next year. Carol & Jim Iddings

Reviews.Title: “Staff and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Brian F
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from 7 excellent days of fun and sun at the Gran Porto Real. The staff at this resort go far and above the normal duties of what I would assume to be normal. From the arrival where the bell men meets you with a huge smile and a very helpful hand, all the way to the server out on the beach who never lets your glass of choice fall below an inch of bottom. Some of the staff members who made our trip so memorable are Elesandro who I will assume is the wait staff captain, Jose, Jesus, Anna,and Mirium who are servers on the beach,they get to run through some of the softest sand my feet have ever been in, with drinks and snacks all with a smile and some funny one liner to make your day. Being a 1/2 block from 5th ave really didn't hurt either. We walked just about every nite up and down the famous strip and found something new with every step. Across the street is the sister resort being the Gran Royal Resort, didn't spend any time over there however there amenities were available to us with being all-inclusive. In a nut shell, great place, great service, really good food, endless flow of your fav ingestable liquid and a location being on the ocean, we will be returning next year for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “staff”
Reviews.Author: barb d
Reviews.Content: just got back from gran porto real hotel . It was fabulous ! The staff there are extremley helpful , curtious etc... Anything you need their there for you. To be more to the point some staff or waitress (not quite sure of their title) went out of their way no matter what. Their names are : CECILIA , AURELIO , ELIZABETH . If you go there be sure to ask for them. One note is that theres not much of a beach. But a very short walk away there is other beautiful beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation at the GPR!”
Reviews.Author: Weloveplayadelcarmen
Reviews.Content: Our family vacationed at the Gran Porto Real from Jan 28th – Feb 4th 2012. This was our 4th stay at this resort. This hotel holds a special place in our hearts, having been married here in 2005. We’ve returned to this resort for many reasons, but mostly because of the wonderful staff, great food, amenities and excellent hospitality. We find the staff at the resort is always very helpful and we’ve become close with several of them over the years. Concierge: We have gotten to know Astrid very well over the years and consider her a friend. She is a true professional when it comes to attending to people’s needs. Albatros Buffet: There was always a wide range of food for breakfast, lunch or supper, either already prepared or prepared for you. Florencio and Rodrigo are amazing as well as many other waiters. Maria’s Mexican Restaurant: Featured a different menu every night with foods from different Mexican regions. Our friend and waiter Mario is absolutely awesome. Ask for him the next time you go. The entire staff is excellent as well, including Diego, Edgar, Mariano, Sergio, Rigo and Alberto (bartender). Chef Edi always made our meals to perfection. IlPescatore Italian Restaurant: The staff here is fantastic as well. A special mention goes to Ton (a fluently tri-lingual waiter) and Elias. We also want to mention the chef Ehrique Salgado; he too made our meals to perfection. Beach waiters: We had the pleasure of meeting Jose, Pablo and Mari and they were always happy to bring us drinks from time to time. They walk back and forth from the beach to the beach bar and they work very hard. Please remember to tip the beach waiters if you can. Room cleaners: The rooms were cleaned daily. Sometimes they’d leave us towels shaped as a swan with flower petals scattered about. It was a nice touch and we’d leave them something from Canada that they couldn’t necessarily get there.

Reviews.Title: “WOW What A Place”
Reviews.Author: Kim C
Reviews.Content: This was the first time staying at this hotel. With it being right in Playa You had the best of everything Beautiful Beaches, only steps to 5th avenue and the Ferry to cozmel.This resort in my opinion is a five star. the food and the restaurants were to die for. THe Restaurant LL Pescatore is an excellent place to eat. Chef Enrique, make and Mean Meal and with Jorge and Jonny serving you, you will feel as you are their only table. The service at the bars, around the pool and beach was great always someone to ask if you needed anything. Pablo was a saint.We thought about staying at the Royal next door and boy am I glad we stayed at the Gran Porto. It would have been a waste of money. I can go on and on but i will not forget about the activities. The dancers at night were great and during the day Chicken, Cesar and Ivan were always getting the place going. Lots of variety. Take advantage of everything. Aquafit, Bike Tours, Kayaking, Chess, drink instructions, Salsa lessons and much more. THe one problem was Bestday transport. We checked in in the early morning we were leaving they gave us a time to be in the lobby. We got their 5 min early. Well the van had come 1/2hr before and left without us.Good thing we had cash in our pocket because it cost us $100 to take a taxi to the airport. I when i have traveled before gone home with not much cash in pocket, if that was the case that day we would have been screwed. A Tour recommendation for tours is : Maya Can Eco Tours Just a Big WOW, our own tour with eric as our driver. We went were we wanted go and left when we were done. No waiting like with other tours where you on a bus with a large group of people. Barry is the guy to talk to tell him where you want to go and he will get you there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Gman1375
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Gran Porto Real. It was a wonderful time! I was very skeptical at first. I wasn't sure the GPR's location in the heart of Playa was for me. I was wrong. Having instant access to 5th Avenue, its shops, bars and restaurants provided the best of both worlds. While the GPR is smaller than recent resorts we've visited, it offered everything we were looking for... nice pool... beach... good Kids Club, etc. But what really made our trip was the staff. Ivan, Cesar and the rest of the activities team warmly engaged our group (5 kids, 10 adults) and had us playing volleyball, doing water aerobics and taking dance lessons in no time! Jose, Miguel and the rest of the servers were quick with refreshments and took great care of us. The front desk staff were very welcoming... special kudos to Enrique. The staff as a whole made this a great little vacation! The food service in general was excellent. And, while the quality of the food wasn't always the best, the service was impeccable. We especially enjoyed their Italian restaurant, Pescatore's, where Mateo, Tony and staff were extremely accomodating. Again, I was very skeptical about Italian cuisine in this setting, but the chefs at Pescatore's nailed it - we dined there 2 nights in a row! The other surprise was the GPR's 24 hour, self-serve area, where snacks and drinks were abundant and super convenient! Overall, I was very pleasantly surprised! The GPR offers a rare blend of a beach resort located in a wonderful seaside town, offering a truly authentic Mexican experience!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal! Resort, staff, location, nightlife, relaxation were all amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Kayleigh C
Reviews.Content: Having, visited several up-scale resorts, Gran Porto was by far the best I have ever been to. It seemed to have something for everyone, whether you're looking for a great nightlife or relaxation. What really made the trip for me were the amazing staff! Just to name a few: Chicken, Armando, Cesar, Karina, Alejandro, and Edwardo. They did such a great job getting people involved in activities around the resort and bringing everyone together. Cesar and Karina did a fabulous job with the exercise classes and were so welcoming. Armando was so warm and really brought a joy to the resort. Chicken and Alejandro were great entertainers. Edwardo brought a smile to my face every time a picked up a towel in the morning or dropped one off in the afternoon. Upon going to this resort, I didn't expect that I'd feel such a sense of community and meet friends from around the world. The activities at the pool were for all ages too, not just kids. Pool volleyball or salsa lessons were a great way to break up the day of relaxing and tanning. Even if you're not looking for a communal feel, this resort is also perfect I think for those who just want to relax on their own. The beach is beautiful. The rooms were very impressive, even the hallways with their open-air style were impressive. The food was good. There is a Mexican restaurant, Italian, and a buffet open during the day. As a vegetarian, I didn't have any problems. The Italian restaurant I found was extremely good. Lastly, I think it's important to note that the resort is in a superb location. You have the all-inclusiveness and entertainment of the resort, but you can literally walk out the resort into a very safe, attractive shopping, dining, and bar district.

Reviews.Title: “Gluten Free Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa T
Reviews.Content: I am worried about spending a week in Mexico and being Gluten Free, but the hotel restaurant staff was AMAZING at working with me for my allergies. For breakfast I had omelets, and for lunch and dinner every meal was made for me at my request. I could pick through the buffet line,but even better was that I was able to place a custom order that they made for me immediately I always felt safe and cared for in their hands. Antonio, Ana Elisa, Juliana, Moreno, Lorenzo, Carlos were all so helpful in taking my orders and making sure that everything was correct. They purchased gluten free desserts for me and had them available for me upon request at every meal. Mauricio is the manager that oversaw everything, but Tony was captain that helped me daily. There are 3 restaurants at the hotel, I was most comfortable with the main restaurant at the hotel, but did visit the Mexican and Italian restaurants each once. Many thanks to my friends at the Gran Porto Real. They did indeed become friends. I had my own place in their refrigerator for my desserts and I made sure to enjoy them before leaving. If you're GF, rest assured that they will take care of you. Just identify yourself to Mauricio or Tony and sit back and enjoy your time at the hotel. (:

Reviews.Title: “don't use credit card at the resort for anything”
Reviews.Author: kim b
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we have stayed at this resort. Our first trip experience was great so we wanted to go back. Our experience the second time was just OK but they had overbooked it and had to ship us off to another not so nice hotel for the first night. This time we decided to pay for a room upgrade when we checked in so I used my visa to pay for this. After arriving home I discovered after reviewing my credit card online that they put an extra charge on my card for $600 U.S. dollars and that was over and beyond what I paid for the room upgrade. No luck trying to communicate with the resort about resolving the issue but Visa is great about taking care of it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk personnel made our trip...”
Reviews.Author: Vivian T
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Gran Porto Real but fifth with the Real chain. We have stayed at the Royal in Playa twice and the Royal in Cancun once. This trip was made even better than the rest with the assistance of Paul and Samantha of the front desk at the Gran Porto. We stayed at GP for the first four days and were upgraded to the Royal for the last half. Again, this would not have happened without the assistance of Paul's initial offer for the upgrade and Samantha's aid in the additional evening. There were six of us on the vacation and we all enjoyed it even with the three days of iffy weather. This resort offers superb customer service and the perfect location (minutes away from Fifth Avenue). I have stayed at several other resorts in this area and the Real chain is my favourite...will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Super Time during the Super Bowl !”
Reviews.Author: OParent
Reviews.Content: Once again ,(our 11th visit since 1998), the wonderful employees of THE Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa Exceeded our Expectations ! Under the ever watchful eye of the General Manager ,Lynn de Repentigny, her staff carries out their duties with a smile and a joyful attitude,they truely enjoy making your vacation the best it can be..every request is granted quickly and cheerfully. Lynn de Repentigny makes herself available to her guests and greets you as if your family. She is easily approachable and she has her staff greet guests the same way. Their attention to detail during the super bowl was spot on complete with large screen tv,balloon decorations,delicious super bowl buffet and the entertainment team dressed like quarterbacks and referees giving tequilla shots...fun times ! The beach was in excellent shape with very little erosion,Alexus the lifeguard doing a wonderful job keeping the kiddos safe. The staff that continue to dazzle us with their ability to work tirelessly and serve delicious food and drinks are Albatros Restaurant : Eliazor Gonzalez Cruz (this fella never rests he plans many of the speciality dinners and his Super Bowl party food was most delicious ),hostess Sandy. Pool Bartenders: Miguel ,David, Alex Lobby bartenders: Hector ,Hose 24 hour room: Elizabeth,Cecelia,Adriana Beach servers :(Love this whole crew) Teresa ,Mari,Miriam,Pablo,Jesus,Jose, Inside bar (near kitchen ) David bartender. The waiters in all the restaurants are excellent but this trip we really enjoyed dinner at Maria's Mexican with the Hostess Delia and chef Edi and waiter Rigo,the lamb chops,corn-smut soup and tuna appitizer were out of this world !!! Tradewinds bar continues to be our favorite beach area to sit at during the day a new Bartender was there... Leonardo ,he was fantastic at both mixing delicious drinks but quick too,the new umbrella fella Jose was prompt ,after the first day he knew when we arrived at our chairs that we would like him to put us up a umbrella most pleasant in his duties! Edwardo at towels instructed us in Spanish every morning ,what a delight he is ! Bell boys Aaron,Julio and Aaron Pat along with front desk staff Astrid were helpful and delightful to talk with . Our room was suite 280 and was kept spotless by Ms Vasquez she made cute towel art and flower decorations every day. We have been returning to this hotel for 14 years and we already have our next visit booked ,give them a try and you too will understand our continued support of the Real Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “very --very good service”
Reviews.Author: bettytill
Reviews.Content: service by pablo & rebeca beach service was just great miguel & avila also great service

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous Vacation thanks to the out standing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Karl H
Reviews.Content: Wow what can I say, this was my second year in a row at the Grand Porto and once again Dave ( Dave Ancona ) that was at the lobby bar last year was fantastic! Only problem was he wasn't at the bar where he usually works so I did not enjoy my evenings as much as last year but he made sure that when he had a spare moment during the day to come find us with a drink which made our day every time! Pablo, Jesus, Teresa, and Jose the beach waiters and waitresses were fantastic as always! But my favorite was Mari my Waitress out on the beach! She took such good care of us and had us laughing every time we saw her. Which was a lot on account of how much we were drinking! I will be booking here again next year for 2 weeks at least. Being in the heart of playa so close to 5th and having all of the shuttles taking you straight to excursions from the hotel lobby is a plus! Also having the boats there to take you fishing with an always improving beach. Hats off to the whole staff! Oh and Antonio and his whole crew were great at the albatross! Everything was delicious!!!!

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB time once again at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: f1fever
Reviews.Content: I only have wonderful things to say about the resort. My husband and I took our children (5 and 3) from Jan. 27 to Feb. 6. It was our second stay at the GP. We are planning to return again next year. The staff will go above and beyond to make sure your vacation would be a fabulous and memorable one. The hotel staffs are simply the best. Our favorites were Pablo, Theresa, Jesus and Jose. They are simply the best at what they do. The Kids Club staff is also very nice and friendly. Our little ones kept asking to go back and play with them. The resort has the best location in Playa del Carmen. The food was very good, employees are always in good mood, smiling, friendly and all spoke English very well. We had a fantastic time and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Time of my life!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel R
Reviews.Content: This resort was more than I could imagine! A week long trip with my girlfriends would not have been the same if it were not for the awesome staff! Avila, Miguel, and Filberto are the bartenders you will meet while you sit at the bar and enjoy the great view of the beach. Want to sit by the pool? No problem! Jesus or Pablo will bring the drinks to you so you can soak up the sun! Need to cool off? Join Ivan for water aerobics! The food is great and staff is so friendly! I can't wait to go back and see these smiley faces again! Thanks for the memories!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: loruhlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here December 10, 2011 for a wedding on the beach. When we arrived, we were greeted with a drink, and smooth check in. We were 2 rooms, my parents, and ours, us, with a 14 yr old and 11 yr old. We were given the Jr ocean view suite. It had a king bed and a bunk bed with a trundle bed, so we could have easily had us and 3 kids in the room comfortably. The view was of the ocean and the main street that was excellent. (it was a little noisy at night and in the morning, as the restaurant of the other hotel was just across the road) but we had 2 balconies and it was really roomy and nice. The food was good, we enjoyed the restaurants each evening. The breakfast was excellent, but we were there for 4 breakfasts, and I know that a few more I would have gotten tired of them. The wedding was beautiful, they took good care of us. Overall, I'd recommend the resort, it's not huge, and the "events" were small, and for teens, there wasn't too much to do, but it was very relaxing, food good, service excellent and drinks flowing. What more can you ask? Playa del Carmen is a good place to stay as it's pretty close to airport and the outside excursions that you may book (which I'd recommend to get out of the hotel for a day or two)

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real better that expected”
Reviews.Author: Beaumont68
Reviews.Content: The resort exceded our expectations in all things friendly and efficient check in, food was very good at all location in the resort, staff all appeared happy, smiling, friendly and almost everyone spoke English very well. The resort was extremely clean and fresh looking and it seems to kept that way. A special call out to "Mari" at the beach she always knew when to get you another water or drink.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and scenery make this resort pure magic!”
Reviews.Author: Diane C
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the Gran Porto, the first being my honeymoon, this second being with my 3 best girl friends. We were not disappointed! What was honeymoon magic, translated well to 4 girls ready to party! We had such a fantastic time, I'm sad our trip is over already! The service is impeccable and we wanted for nothing. I cannot wait for another excuse to go back and visit Miguel, Filberto, and Avila (Gaviotas Pool Bar), Ivan (Activities), Eduardo (towels), and the whole staff! These guys are amazing and truly put that magic touch on an already fabulous trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best visit to mexico of the three iv'e had!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laue0066
Reviews.Content: This place rocked! If your looking for an all-inclusive that has a self serve 24 hour bar then this is your hotel! The drinks never stopped flowing. The staff was all super friendly and speedy with any assistance for any issue. The rooms were comfortable We spent the first night in the Junior sweet (a free upgrade because the other room we had wasn't ready). This room had a private balcony and the bathrooms and bedrooms were spacious. On the wall was 4 full liters of alcohol, all begging for the drinking. The next three nights we had the more basic room which was defiantly smaller with no private balcony, but it did have a nice open patio that was shared with neighbors so you could be very social. The itialian restaurant was the best place to eat. Sand volley ball was amazing as well. Props to David, Theresa, Mari, Samantha, Claudia for your great conversations and awesome service!! As the iconic ex governor of California said...Ill Be Back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing vacation ever, with such friendly staff.”
Reviews.Content: Miguel, Avila, and Filiberto were amazing bartenders. On the spot with genuine great service. Super friendly and efficient. Couldn't have asked for anything more. Our maid Simona was super friendly, very thorough and there whenever we needed her. All in all these fine people made our vacation a once in a lifetime dream come true. When I come back I hope to see these four again. Sincerely Aimee stillwagon, room 518.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Best Resort with the Best Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sherie S
Reviews.Content: I have only had experience in large resorts so i was a little unsure of the smaller scale of this one when we booked. But after my brother highly recommended it we went for it and we were NOT disappointed!!! It is a beautiful resort that is laid back and not rowdy like some of the other resorts! They catered to English, even the TV had English channels! The beach was amazing, the food was even more amazing, our oceanview junior suite was beautiful, and we loved being so close to shopping! Pablo and Mari served us our drinks on the beach and they were the absolute BEST!!! They always had us laughing and kept the drinks flowing :) Antonio in the buffet restaurant was great and had a way of brightening the room. We will DEFINATELY be going back! This is now my number one pick in the Mayan!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place. Great staff. Excellent service. The best location.”
Reviews.Author: Chayla
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip in four years to the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen, and we had a great time again. Superb weather, great food and drinks, outstanding staff and the location is perfect (only two blocks off 5th Avenue.) Some of the bar staff said they remembered us from our first visit. I'm not so sure about that, but hey, they treated us like long lost friends and that's what counts. Our room (a Jr. suite) was ready when we checked in around 3:30 PM and the room was perfectly air conditioned and spotless ... a great start to a relaxing week in Mexico. We booked everything through Delta Vacations and I'd book with them again. All the details were looked after ... just like they said it would be, and all the flights were on time.

Reviews.Title: “I loved Playa Del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: monique m
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice holiday. We stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen. We met wonderful people there. The assistant manager of food and beverages, Ventura Gonzalez gave us a very good service. The chef Jorge made us gastronomic meals to die for. The buffet was good and had a big variety. The maid Miriam always made our room pretty. In the morning at the lobby bar: Aurelio, Cecilia and Elisabet gave us a good service and took their time to talk with us. Then for breakfast at the Albatros restaurant, Rodrigo and Daniel were very pleasant and always smilling. For dinner at the Albatros resturant : Yuliana, Moreno and Jaime were very professional and always made us laugh too. Every night at 8:30, there was a show given by professional dancers with a different theme each day. After the show, we would go at the lobby bar. The drinks were excellent and even discovered new ones. We were served by a great team: Jose. Isaura and Hector. The gift shop has good prices and nice souvenirs. The hotel has a very nice beach with a lot of chairs. The Gran Porto Real is really close to the 5th avenue, the place to shop. I've been to a lot of places in Mexico, but Playa Del Carmen is a paradise. I highly recommend this hotel, it's very nice and the people are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxrsx
Reviews.Content: Albatros restaurant u guys were great!!!! Yuliana! Toni! Moreno!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LBCanada
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed @ this resort for the very first time on a ten night vacation in January. We absolutely loved everything about the resort. The resort, grounds & beach were always kept clean. Food in all restaurants was very good. We booked a gran junior suite beach front walkout which may not be suitable for those seeking privacy as privacy is limited due to ppl & workers walking by to access the beach. This was not an issue for us. It was very spacious, convenient & thx to our house keeper Patricia for keeping it impeccably clean.The staff was exceptionally friendly & courteous. Always greeting us with a smile and a warm "Hola". A great big thx to Mari,Jose & Pablo for the excellent bar service on the beach and also to the high level of security staff for always making us feel safe. Great shopping, bars & many restaurants within walking distance.The only one complaint I have, which has nothing to do with the resort is the noise level of music & base going on until wee hours of the morning (once until 5:30am) coming from a neighbouring hotel (Coco Bongo). It interrupted our sleep several times nightly. I would much have preferred listening to the sound of the waves lapping against the shore. As one previous reviewer mentioned, keep the a/c running & it will drown out some of the noise. We will definitely return next year in hopes that a solution to my one complaint will be resolved.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VACATION”
Reviews.Author: cubagalandguy
Reviews.Content: This is the first review that I have ever written and am doing so because the hotel definately deserves recognition. The hotel itself is small and very charming. A lovely family hotel that makes you feel safe, comfortable and welcome the moment you walk through the from door. Everyone at this resort deserves a heads up but a few definately stood out among the crew. Big thanks to IVAN for getting my extremely shy daughter to take part in the activities. She looked forward to water volley ball everyday and of course the amazing arobics workout in the pool.Thanks to Chicken for the towel art instruction. And I thought folding a towel would be easy! Thanks to Mari at the pool. You never left us without a drink and you always greeted us everyday with a lovely smile and a warm greeting. Our morning breadfast guy always get the name wrong Florencio? Always prompt with coffee and OJ. The food we found to be good. Always something on the buffet to fill a plate. I always tried something new everyday and was always pleasantly surprised that I always liked it. The Italian a la carte was nice and the service was excellent. The Mexican was OK and the service was excellent. I think that the only thing that I would suggest would be to have a pasta station at the buffet each night and to cancel the sit down friday night steak dinner. Being that friday was our last night we really missed the buffet. The beach grill was good. I didn't like the burgers but everything else was excellent. Guacamole, salsa and chips for lunch yum! All in all it is Mexico and you are at a Mexican hotel. Expect Mexican style food. The rooms as far as I am concerned were lovely. We stayed on the third floor. An ocean front suite. Beds were a little firm for me but clean with deluxe linens and clean pillows. I thought that the rooms were not outdated and had plenty of space. Large closet but not enough hangers and No dresser to put clothes in. Just two small drawers in the armoire. The bathrooms were nice with large showers. Tip* Had to leave the shower run for a bit to get hot water. Do not fret it will turn hot after a short wait..... Lovely patio with a hammock that stretched across. My daughter loved to stretch out here in the morning to catch up with her computering. Wifi was a little iffy sometimes but in general worked fine. Always had fast wifi reception in the lobby. Mini fridge worked fine and was always stocked. Liquor cabinet does not have top shelf brands but I am sure it would do for a quick drink before dinner. The room also had a DVD player and some english channels we never had any trouble finding something to fall asleep too. Overall, I would return to this resort without hesitation. Loved the location. Just a short walk to 5th Avenue. To all of you that are there now or are soon to be going I am jealous and wish I could be there too. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “lwdelves B.C. Best holiday Ever”
Reviews.Author: LeVern D
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying this was one of the best holidays my wife and I have ever had everything worked out perfect the trip down on Westjet was great and the transportation to the hotel was on time and very pleasant . The service at the hotel was beyond expectation . The staff were all extremely courteous and pleasant, sometimes think some of the staff in Canada should go down there and learn how it's done. I would personally like to thank Daniel and Rodrigo in the Albatross restaurant for their extremely excellent care and service. It was fantastic to go for breakfast or lunch and see their smiling faces.Also Chris at the Asiana was excellent waiter who kept our wine glasses full.I could go on for hours but it was a very good resort and there seemed like the there was something for every age . The beach is really good for children because it was quite shallow in the entire bay .The fact that the resort was so close to Pala del Carmen was great for shopping and if you like to try another restaurant. The only thing I was't to pleased about was CoCo Bongo which went till 4 am but all we did was keep the ac running all night and didn't hear it . It was great value for the money and we would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: 4southpadre
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Jan. 17th to 21st. Not nearly long enough! Had a little wait for our first room, a 3 hour wait! Had requested 3rd floor w/king bed but received a room w/two full size beds. Went back down and ended up on the 1st floor for the first two nights. It was an ocean view room but the people walking by were really close so you had no privacy. The concierge we worked with originally was no help at all but on Wednesday, we spoke w/Astrid who was so sweet and extremely professional. She had us moved to a great room (342) on Thursday that we were very happy with. Food in all restaurants was very good. Maria's was excellent! We loved the beach (didn't really mind the sand bags but they are not "picturesque"). Shows were really good and drinks were great. Have to recommend you see Felipe at the "quiet" pool bar. He will take very good care of you! Only a block away from 5th Ave. which is fun too. Felt very safe here the whole time. Resort was great, location was great and the staff of Best Day Travel were very helpful. Had no problems as all, just know that the next trip will be a lot longer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MJ0606
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa last year and I had the most amazing two weeks there. The hotel is spotless, the service is impeccable, all of the staff are extremely friendly and the food is great. It was the most relaxing holiday I have ever had. Shops, bars and restaurants are within walking distance so the location too is very convenient. The beach is absolutely beautiful and there is waiter service while you are sunbathing. It was pure heaven and we enjoyed it so much we are planning on going back this year. I cannot recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bartender”
Reviews.Author: tannedsouthernMN
Reviews.Content: David is the best bartender in the lobby bar. We stayed at the Gran Porto Real in 2009. Last year (2011) we stayed at the Gran Caribe in Cancun with exchange privileges, so we went to the Gran Porto Real for a day. David came up to greet us with hugs and handshakes. He made us feel like he was greeting us at his home. Plus he makes one of the best margaritas.

Reviews.Title: “As a travel Agent, I do recommend it ...but”
Reviews.Author: joger1961
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at the hotel, most of the people are nice !!! so close to the fifth avenue The beach is so so... lot of rock in the water make sure your bring water shoes, but you can walk on the right side till the port of Playa del Carmen and you will find very lovely nice beach Food is good, but not enough choice of restaurant, the buffet is kind of so so , but love the service of Mora and Florenzio But the star of the hotel is Jose ..this guy should stay on the beach or he should be the trainer of the rest of the bar staff, is the king pin of the service. As for the room do not take a standard Room, the are so small and you will get a bad situation in the hotel also MAKE sure you got what you have paid for because the Concierge ASTRID she wont be any help, this girls doesn't represent to friendly and good service of the rest of the staff !!! but i would mention that her college Jenny Lee at the front desk mad us re conciliate by taking care of the mess Astrid but us true i was there 6 days and i lost 2 days, change room to go finally in the on i had paid for it seem this happen a lot from what people told me i would recommend but next time I will be going in a Iberostar, they have nice beach, and more restaurant and look more of 5 stars the one i kind of fall in love with do was the Playacar Palace close to the port senior frog and beach BEAUTIFUL all and all the Gran Porto Real, was good but not a 5 star for me and believe me I have been in 5 stars in my carriers of 30 years !!! more of so a 4star's hotel

Reviews.Title: “Service at the Real Gran Porto, Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Donna T
Reviews.Content: this was my first time in Mexico. I was extremely impressed with the staff, they were at all times very professional. However, there was also a sensation, of relaxiation, free from being hassled. The staff of the Albatros restaurant, went out of their way to make us comfortable. Their was always someone their to take us to our table, which we could choose, if we wished to. We really appreciated the attentive service we received from Isabelino, as well as his manager, Tonny and Marcus Gozmon. The cleaning staff came our room very clean, and always wair-yed to clean after we had left the room. It was always nice to come back to clean towels and a freshly made bed. We were even treated to towel arrangements on on beds of swans and fresh petals ( a nice little touch). Overall it was a completely Divine experience. We will certainly recommend The Real Porto and will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Our opinion”
Reviews.Author: river1253
Reviews.Content: General. We as grandparents booked an Air Canada all inclusive package to the Gran Porto Real Hotel in Playa Del Carmen and at the same time our son and his family booked a package at the same Hotel , We flew from Toronto and they from Victoria, our package was Air Canada and theirs was Westjet. Hotel. The Hotel was excellent, the Gran Porto Real is very clean, the food is good, and the Hotel is centrally located in town Food The food was good in the buffett and the two A La Carte restaurants, Service The staff, desk clerks, servers, cleaners and all the other workers were first class in all respects. I would like to especally compliment a Bell Boy Alex for his grest service. Transportation Both Air Canada flights were one hour late, and we had to wait at Cancun Airport for transit to our Hotel. The air Canada reprsentetive at the Hotel was less than effective, upon leaving to come home, a mix up occured in transport, no transport was supplied by Air Canada, finally the Hotel provided a Taxi to the Airport. We were lucky the flight was late or we would have missed it. We can thank the Bell Boy Alex for arranging transport for us and the Hotel for paying the Taxi fare. Alex made many phone calls, liased with his superior and did an excellent job. I am sorry to say that we are badley dissapointed with Air Canada sevice

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ion V
Reviews.Content: I like to thank to rest.Mexicano,Mariano Poot Oscar,he is one of the BEST and "Maria"Pescatore, the italian restaurant,Delia is so friendly and nice with costumers,she is doing a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting "you" was an unexpected pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: XSATG
Reviews.Content: Imagine soft sand beaches; gloriously warm water; Colonial Spanish grandeur; Old World hospitality; employees with happy faces; top-notch service with a smile. Want that?---Go to this 5 star "all inclusive" resort, and we mean "all inclusive"! Our ocean front suite was stunning; the hotel floors, ceilings, walls and overall decor, beautiful to behold; the pools and gardens immaculate. The food was very good and had variety. Each day at the "Albatros"( the buffet style general restaurant) brought a few different dishes to the day before. Something you didn't see that you felt the desire to have? Just ask your waiter and Voila!! With all this there were some irksome minor problems--eg. one of our suite entry keycards kept having to be re-activated and the hot-tub on the roof was only lukewarm. But then who really needed the hot-tub with the warm Caribbean right in front of the hotel? The icing on the cake (as if the above wasn't enough ) were the happy, always smiling staff, in all the various areas of endeavour a hotel requires. Their service was impeccable and was "top of the heap", and while I commend all of them with whom we made contact, I must mention our specials (everyone has them, right?). So-and in NO special order- here's to: Erika; Mora; Willy; Yuliana; Chucho; Rodrigo; Ricardo. "Así que muchas gracias,nuestros amigos, a todos vosotros. El Capitán." Would we go back--you bet !!

Reviews.Title: “Better the 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: nicurn72
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Gran in January of 2012. Our first experience 4 years ago had us changing rooms because of being over booked, but this time they did it all right. We had requested specific rooms and they were able to grant those requests! The food was your average All-Inclusive food. Maria's restaurant was very slow- expect to have a 2 hour dinner here. They kept the drinks coming, but food service was slow. The bartenders were wonderful- especially David, Hiran, Nico and Miguel at Gaviota's Bar. Huram was wonderful with beach side service. In the activites department, Chicken was great! He always went out of his way to speak to us and just sit and chat when he had some down time with his full activities schedule. This hotel also has a great location for making short walks into town to do some shopping, nightlife, bars, massages..........

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay with a 6 months old baby...”
Reviews.Author: cataserban
Reviews.Content: We came back from GPR on Jan 29 after we spend 7 perfect vacation days at this resort. The place is very clean, well maintained, the food was excellent and the stuff very friendly. I give this hotel an A+ for offering free wireless internet on the premises. I cannot complain about any aspects of our stay here which makes it a perfect destination. You cannot get a better location ...you are basically on 5th Avenue (Avenida 5)...and also on the beach. What I wish it was better is the beach which has some sand bags to protect from waves corrosion...but is about the weather not the hotel. We've got excellent service from everyone at the hotel and I can mention here Cecilia at the main lobby bar, the guys at the buffet, reception and room cleaning lady (forgot their names)

Reviews.Title: “1 night at the Porto”
Reviews.Author: LACToronto
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Gran Porto during January 2012 as The Royal (next door)was sold out, the front desk was nice enough to give us an upgraded room, it was great room 208. However there was tremednous banging and what sounded like moving and dragging of furniture throughout the night, even at 1:30am!!! we both slept with earplugs yet it still woke us up, pretty much no slept that night. I spoke with the front desk when checking out to ask what this could have been? perhaps it was because there was 2 weddings the night before and thef urniture was being moved...either way this was the most noisy room my husband and I have ever had in all our years of travelling...we moved to The Royal it was great. We had dinner at Maria's, and it was very good! much better then I thought it would be...overall the hotel is very nice...however the noisy rooms would deter me to stay here in the future, but I would stay at The Royal again. The Real resorts are a very good chain of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Our Oasis for the winter”
Reviews.Author: EasyBurner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I escaped the winter cold January 17-24 by spending a week at the Gran Porto Real. This was our first stay in Playa del Carmen although we did a day trip to there last year. During our day trip we scoped out the GPR and decided we would stay there rather than in Cancun the next time we were in the region. We had liked the location just off 5th ave and being right on the beach. We weren't at all disappointed with our decision. We had actually booked the lowest grade room to get a cheap rate and planned to upgrade when we got there. Upon arrival, we asked for an upgrade but there wasnt a full week upgrade available, unless we moved to the Royal PDC. We've stayed in the Royal in Cancun and LOVED it, but we had firmly decided we wanted to stay at the GPR. So, we stayed in the standard room we were assigned. We knew what to expect in a standard room so we weren't upset or surprised. The room was basic with two double beds, bathroom area, mini fridge and no balcony or view. However, we actually really enjoyed the room (#411). We were on the same level as the Tranquility pool, its swim up bar and sun loungers. It was nice to spend the early part of the day just 14 steps from our room. As this area of the hotel faces east, it only gets sun until about 1 PM. Over the course of the week our maid service was excellent, as was the towel art. There was street noise only on Saturday night, otherwise it was quite quiet after midnight. Most days after lunch we hit the beach or the pool. We never had any problems getting a great spot on the beach. On only one day did we have trouble getting loungers by the pool. We went to the beach for an hour then came back to the pool and found two loungers side by side. Being a smaller hotel, it has only three main restaraunts, Maria's and il Pescatore ala cartes and Albatros buffet. We were satisfied with breakfast and lunch at Albatros, but most nights had dinner at the ala cartes. There's enough variety in the menu's that the two are fine for the week. We also had a special night on the beach. For $100/couple we had a 4 course dinner (salad, soup, steak and lobster entree and desert) on the beach, accompanied by a live Jazz band and our own waiter. Upon returning to our room there was a chilled bottle of bubbly and two tall wine glasses. Well worth the money - thanks Ana Elise! A big plus is not having to make reservations at the ala cartes. In fact we stopped in at Maria's twice, just to have the Mayan coffee as presented by Sergio. Sergio is an excellent waiter for dinner, but his Mayan coffee is outstanding. We also visited the 24 hour bar a few times and had a late night snack or two. The liquor bar was very well stocked with Dos Equis on tap, quality international brand spirits, wine and Champagne. Entertainment wise, the live shows by the pool are enjoyable. They're done by 9:30.The Lobby bar bands are OK and usually play until about 10:30 or 11:00. Each band we saw has at least one strong perfromer. One night the guitarist was channeling a Jeff Beck'ish groove and on another the Cuba Jazz band's Bass player was awesome. We didnt really interact with the hotel entertainment team other than some pool Volleyball, so I cant comment on them. The hotel staff were all very friendly and provided a very high level of service. On the beach and around the pool Pablo is the go to guy. Mari on the beach also kept our glasses full. In the Albatros, all the servers were very attentive. Shouts out to our man Chuchin. If you're wondering if we tipped, we did. We didnt tip everytime a drink was served but we did recognize the servers for their efforts. As we waited for our transfer to the airport I dropped into the lobby bar for a going away drink. Aurelio poured me an Adios special - a stiff shot of Don Julio! I guess he had me figured out by that point. I had no pesos left and he didnt expect any so we parted with a handshake, gracias and adios. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the GPR. We met great people from the good old USA (Tom & Nancy), fellow Canadians from Fredricton (Rod & Norma, Tom & Rolond), Montreal, and Edmonton (Bro-mance), Linda and her old retired husband from the UK, and others from Sweden and elsewhere. So, yes we would recommend this hotel. we truly enjoyed the staff and the facility. Could it be better? Sure it could. There are areas that need updating. The free wifi is a little spotty and we could have used another option for lunch (a Sunset Grill, like at the Grand Caribe). We don't rate this hotel as Excellent, as we've stayed at excellent Mexican resorts before (ie the Royal) and this isnt the Royal. However, its an awesome All Inclusive Resort for a great price so we rated it very good.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: wannagoback48
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Gran Porto Real. We enjoyed our holiday there last year and decided to return again this year and we were not disappointed. Service was excellent right from pre-check in to checking out. All of the staff is very helpful and friendly and willing to accomodate or fix a problem as quickly and efficiently as possible. We had a standard room on the 4th Floor right next to the pool and it's a great location for us (we requested the same general area as last year and got a room 2 doors down) The rooms are not huge but were kept very clean by our maid Esmaralda (interesting towel art as well!!) My only "wish" would be a king sized bed. Felipe, the bartender at the swim up bar was terrific - good service and always a smile. I foget the name of the bartender who worked on his Felipe's day off but he was great as well. The food was good as well both at the buffet in the hotel and the one on the beach. We ate at the Mexican restaurant one night - had to wait quite awhile to get in because it was so busy and then weren't happy with the menu (totally our fault as we didn't realize that they change their menu every night and it had a lot of seafood on for the evening) Every salad contained seafood but they did offer to make a plain green salad to accomodate us. We ate at the Italian restaurant 2 nights and the food was good. Entetainment staff is very good as well - Chicken and Cesar are very entertaining!! We also really like the location - so close to 5th Avenue that you can go for the afternoon or 1/2 an hour. All in all a very good vacation and we would defintely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great holiday!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pepito10
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time at the Gran Porto and it won't be our last! We've never had a bad experience with anything or anyone there. When we arrived, we found ourselves in a room with two double beds, even though we'd requested one king. We checked the next day, and the only one available was amazing (I guess the only minor thing was that instead of a terrace, we had two very small balconies - just enough room for chairs, but that was no biggie). Our room and the entire hotel was always immaculately clean. The food was great, whether it was the all-day buffet, Maria's or Il Pescatore (amazing Shrimp Risotto!!). I don't have enough kind words for the staff! We were treated like gold from the time we got there to the day we left. We love the beach staff - Pablo, Teresa, Jesus, Jose, Miriam and head waiter Eliazar, and they were once again amazing. A huge thank you to chef Nepomusemo, who went out of his way to help with a very special meal! The entertainment staff, Ivan and "Chicken" made every day at the pool so much fun - thank you! They all take the time to get to know you and make you feel like you're the most important person there. Thank you and, God willing, we'll see you next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel i´ve never seen”
Reviews.Author: YOANNBOITE
Reviews.Content: The best hotel where we have been with my girlfriend!!! very frendly and professional staff. We add ALL INCLUSIVE and it was so fantastic. The only thing that we have to say is that all the staff should speak english. Hubert on the beach, Miguel at the pool bar, Antonio at the buffet, Jose at the lobby bar were so helpfull. and many others...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Bulldogsoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here December 2010 in one bedroom Gran Master. Clean and pleasant and well run. Food was good. Kids had a great time. Had reciprocal privileges at the Royal next door minus the kids. Very good time. Would return. Steps to 5th ave. Great time.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Both worlds”
Reviews.Author: Victor B
Reviews.Content: This was our favorite all inclusive! Why? Because we could enjoy breakfast, lunch, and drink all day with out opening our wallet. The at night we could have diner for free in our hotel or skip to enjoy the many amazing restaurants in Playa. The rooms were very nice! I took a tour and there are many differnt kinds. We were lucky to have an ocean front view looking out at the Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Two great weeks!”
Reviews.Author: atjo
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen this January, was a wondeful two week escape from our dark Scandinavian winter. Sun, sand, good food and great staff (especially Cecilia Mesia who our 8-month old baby fell in love with, and Chicken who my two boys (11 & 12) and I (40) played excellent beach soccer with. Thanks!). We expected sun and fun in the sea, but did noe expect to do so many cool things at the parks like X-plore and X-caret, so we have been recommending PdC to everyone we know. Also, the hotel was spotless, very nice and of perfect side for us. We hope to return some time!

Reviews.Title: “Could be nice but...........”
Reviews.Author: davroduk
Reviews.Content: It really is down to luck wether you have a good or bad experience of this hotel. I cant really add much to what has been said by others about the upgrade scam and quality of the rooms. Upon check in you will be asked if you want to upgrade, and be offered this at "half price". We refused and were then (eventually after being hassled to go to a presentation over the road) shown to one of the "Standard rooms". All I can say about these rooms is that we have been in better 2 star Greek Island accommodation, they are the worst rooms you will ever have the misfortune to stay in, unless you upgrade. We bit the bullet and paid over $500 to get a decent room. When we explained to the Thomson rep that we expected the rooms to be 4 star standard as this was a 4 star package holiday we had paid for, he seemed bemused, and told us that the standard rooms were not 4 star, and just very small and very basic, and that they had been very clever with the camera when taking the pictures for the brochure. THIS IS THE THOMSON REP TALKING. The Junior Suite we ended up in was the type of room we had been expecting and apart from the constantly dripping shower (which they asked us to give them half a day to knock the wall down to repair it) was ok. We refused obviously, and decided to try and forget the fact that my wife was in tears at the quality of the Standard Room, and start afresh. It was at this point that we also realised that Thomson advertise this hotel as having eight restaurants. We could only see three (the Mexican, Italian and buffet). The hotels own map they hand out when you arrive showing the position of all the facilities, only shows these three restaurants. Upon our return we pointed this out to Thomson Holidays only to be told that the resort staff confirmed that the hotel had eight. You will have to make up your own mind on that one because neither my wife or myself are registered blind people. (Again the on site Thomson rep confirmed at the time that the hotel does not have eight restaurants.) If you take away the very poor standard of the rooms and the missing facilities then the hotel isnt all that bad. By the time you have added on the cost of the room upgrade though, you can get far superior accommodation for the same price, and I mean FAR SUPERIOR !!! I would not rate the hotel as the 4 to 5 star it is advertised at, more 3 to 4 star depending on which rooms you go for, On a positive note the staff are very good and cant do enough for you. Food is ok, but the theme nights in the restaurant were great. Entertainment consists of a group of dancers performing a different style of dance each night, but you are only round the corner from 5th avenue, so plenty going on there. Did we enjoy it ?????? After the first day, yes. Would we go back ???? NEVER !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: Marcin W
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Gran Porto Real on Jan,12-18-2012,it was our first time to Mexico. I was very happy with the hotel and everything around it bars restaurants and staff were amazing,the only issue we had was with the staff at the front desk upon check in.The guy checking us in was kindda rude and not very helpfull.Other than that we had a really good stay and would definetly would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “When can I go back?”
Reviews.Author: EmilyFromChicago
Reviews.Content: I just got home from my second trip to the Gran Porto Real and I had a blast! There is never a dull moment with the members of the Sports and Entertainment Team (Chicken, Ivan, Cesar, Jesus, and everybody else!) They made the trip memorable and will make you come back for more. I am a teenager and there are activities for people of all ages such as beach volleyball, water aerobics, and the daily crazy game. The resort is on the smaller side, allowing the staff to know you by name. Its location is great being right on the beach and a walk away from downtown Playa Del Carmen. The restaurants are also very good, offering a variety of freshly made meals. I would go back in a heartbeat and can't wait until my family plans our next trip down!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great vacation until I hit the sushi bar”
Reviews.Author: tmur154957
Reviews.Content: The weather was great, accommodations where great until the Blue Parrot Disco Bar on the beach a stone throw away from The Gran Port Real starts into action around 10pm and sometimes doesn't close down until 6 am therefore if you have a ocean view room around the pool area you are in for a long loud night.... a lot of loud bass and shaking your room. The staff at the resort is very friendly and do their best to speak English to you, they are fast and extremely accommodating. The beach and pool bar service are also very fast and friendly. I wish they had a third restaurant instead of just the Mexican and the Italian. If you eat the at the buffet for breakfast and for lunch it is nice to go eat elsewhere for dinner. I love the part that you did not have to make reservations to any restaurants on the resort, you just went when you wanted which is great. If you are conscious of your salt intake this is not the place for you, everything is very very very salty, almost takes away from the taste of the food. There is a Sushi bar by the pool on the third floor that I would strongly agree you stay away from, ruined 3 of our seven day trip and I am back home now and I still don't feel really good and I am going on day 5 (after taking many gravol and inodium). We saw the waiter come and get one platers from the sushi bar and filled one up and covered it up to take away and the rest he put in the trash. In my opinion if they say they don't reuse the sushi why wouldn't he have not thrown the whole trays away!!!! Good question that none of the food staff could answer after we got sick. It is a shame that happened, when you only have 7 days and 2 or for travelling you hate to waste 3 of them really really really sick. The chef did try to accommodate us with some food that would try to settle our stomachs and a dinner which was really nice of them, but we weren't feeling well enough to appreciate it. I felt bad for all the effort they put into it to make it up to us, maybe another time. The bars do close down early since it is a family resort, but then when the Blue Parrot kicks in, it kind of defeats the purpose of closing down early not to keep the kids up. We were on the 3 floor with a ocean view, maybe it is not as noisy next door at the Royal or other parts of the hotel. Did I mention how hard they work to keep the place shining clean? You always see someone cleaning, non stop. the only concern I have is at night when I gets busy in the bar and they run out o glasses I noticed more then once that they give a quick rinse under the tap and serve that drink...yuk! I would suggest to bring your own glass or get some tequilla to kill the germs. I would probably go back to that hotel, but would wait for a better deal then I paid. I was talking to many people who paid over $1000 dollars cheaper then we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Great location... that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: FuninPlaya
Reviews.Content: I'll be concise. the rooms are magnificent. We were actually impressed and that takes a lot to do! You are located on the beach and in the heart of Playa Del Carmen. the beach was ok... not to bad. Far better than Royale. Their beach, although only a pier and a stones throw away, smelled horribly. The problem I had with the resort was the service and the restaraunt/food/selections. Drink service was virtually non-existent and required both pursuit and patience. The restraunts were not air conditioned. MISERABLE!!! The food in the buffet was not only poor quality, there was so few options I thought I was missing something... like another room filled with, you know, food? It was silly. the ala' cartes were ok but once again, hot as hell!

Reviews.Title: “execellent”
Reviews.Author: tattdragon
Reviews.Content: second time there...property was beautiful....needs a few updates but the food and staff make up for everything....we love jesus,,pablo,,the are the best servers and terissa pool side..they treat you like ur home...always a smile and willing to chat....fast service....pool is great...ocean side amazing..love that they are so close.. the restaurant are great...the bars and nice..could use one swim up bar....but swing beach bar is fun....the place is extremely clean...bedding is new and fresh....the showers are large and always hot hot water to shower in which is nice...the sky hot tub could be open abit later and a couple degrees hotter for us.....the nightly entertainment could be abit more...will be back again next year..hope we see Jesus and Pablo still there...thanks for a wonderful week....love to walk the beach....and 5th avenue is right there....adios...

Reviews.Title: “Quality Inclusive Hotel, Great Service and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: marcusbrampton
Reviews.Content: All in all, a good to great resort. We really feel like we got our a great value for the price. Granted that we believe we got a good deal, considering the price when up almost double after our stay. The hotel is starting to get a little dated (Build 1997), but up-keep seems to be a high priority. Reception was the only average aspect of the hotel and the night staff weren't the friendliest. The staff throughout the hotel go out of their way to keep the everything clean and are typically very pleasant. The food was great. The only problem with the food was we ate too much. The Italian restaurant was better than the Mexican restaurant and the buffet for breakfast and lunch was always a treat. It was nice to see Mexican night at the buffet considering the food is typically geared towards tourists and lacks a lot of spice. Trip adviser seems to be very important to the staff, I get the impression that they get a bonus if their name is mentioned. I would likely mention some of the names if they stood out beyond the others, but to be honest, everyone was above average and everyone deserves credit. There are other places in the world that I need to go before I go back to Mexico again, but I would consider this location again if the price is right. Thx. Playa Del Carmen and the staff at Gran Porto Real for treating us well. MB

Reviews.Title: “Great resort made better because of Juan and Pablo!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mathieu L
Reviews.Content: This being our first all-inclusive trip me and my wife were overall impressed with everything. The beach service was incredible, you need to ask for Pablo on the beach!! he is simply a wonderfull guy. Now if you get hungry the Albatros has excelent food and if you ask for Juan you will get service like no other even though its a buffet. Thanks again Pablo and Juan for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Albatros PM”
Reviews.Author: Jazrick
Reviews.Content: We did an all inclusive, and through the week we made several visits to the hotel restaurant Albatros. The food was very good and the menu changed daily. The food was beautifully presented. One of the things we will remember is our evening waiter Antonio who was not only charming, fun, and excellent in multiple languages, he exemplified what service should be in a five star resort. Thanks Antonio!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation spot to relax and go out”
Reviews.Author: Sebast_berg
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very clean and with excellent service. Pablo, on the pool side, was an excellent waiter. He was always close by, ready to take our drink order and was back in a flash. Ask for him when you come here ;) . The overall service was excellent, the best I've has in a resort as of yet. They also have excellent service for "expeditions". They know the area very well and use reliable companies/guides to take you out (snorkeling, diving, visit mayan ruins, they have people to advise you and make sure all is safe)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience all around”
Reviews.Author: Hoksters
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at the Gran Porto Real for a week earlier this month and had a wonderful time. The service is absolutely fantastic - every request is addressed promptly and with a smile - by far superior from any other resort we've stayed in. Special callout here to Ivan and Adriana who made our stay that much more enjoyable. The hotel and grounds are very clean, there is a great variety of food and the evening shows are excellent. The performers are extremely talented and rival any professional tour out there! I have noticed a few comments from guests who felt pressured from the staff to upgrade their room or participate in activities. Frankly, I was impressed at how little pressure we received. While we were asked whether we wanted to upgrade, as soon as we declined, we moved onto another topic. I fully understand why they ask (they are after all running a business!) and respect the approach they've adopted. Unlike many resorts, there was no one walking around trying to push paid activities on you. There is a photographer on site named Bernardo - any of you visiting the resort should absolutely get a photo shoot done. He is a fantastic photographer and the prices are very reasonable (we would have paid 3X the price we did in Canada). We purchased a set of pictures that we will cherish for a lifetime. One word of caution for those of you who are looking for more of a party scene - since the hotel caters to family, things do quiet down fairly early in the evening. Even during the shows, I was disappointed at how quiet and unresponsible those attending were - must be very challenging for the performers to stay motivated. Thanks to the entire staff for making our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: doucesgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two travelling besties stayed here in December of 2010. We picked this property mainly becasue of the location and we've had good luck with this chain in Cancun (see my review on teh Gran Caribe Real) We elected not to upgrade to a Junior Suite, and I was a bit apprehensive at first, since when we were given the "tour" of rooms, when they attempted to upgrade us, they showed us a room below pool level.. you literally had no view and could see inside the pool... it was freaky and I wasn't looking forward to staying there. But, we decided it wasn't worth the cash to upgrade, so we checked in anyway and to our surprise, they put us way at the other end, closer to the street above the Italian restaurant by the "cold" pool - or what we lovingly call the torture chamber (it's freezing because it gets no sun whatsoever) We ended up liking out little quaint room, it had two double beds but I liked the genuine feel of it, totally not pretentious and the bathroom was fine, great shower! All the windows opened, which was nice. Really, how much time do you spend in your room anyway? We are out and about 95% of our vacation. This hotel is not "fancy" but it has an authentic Mexican feel and the staff were all amazing. We spent alot of time at the lobby bar after dinner before going to 5th Ave and became good friends with David Ancona, who we've remained friends with :) The food is good and the drinks are plentiful! We ate at all the restaurants, the Italian is yummy and be sure to eat the rolls with the creamcheese inside! We also were able to eat at the Asian next door because we are return clients of the Real chain, so we had our Black bracelets. It is unreal the food is so good! Too bad the Royal is so pricey or we would definitely stay there! The main pool is nice and the beach is wonderful for walking. Make sure you hang out at the beach Swing bar, closer to the Royal. As always, we met some amazing fellow travellers (shout out to our Winnipeg friends!) and spent a fair bit of time off the resort since we love Playa and like to shop and go to the clubs. Mandalay is really fun :) Playa del Carmen is by far my favorite vacation destination, so for me, it's worth it to stay at the Porto, but if you are expecting luxury, you will be disappointed, pay the extra money and stay next door.

Reviews.Title: “Total relax”
Reviews.Author: Pad A
Reviews.Content: its a excelent hotel, you will be like home, excelent attention, ill going to be there next year with all my family, especial attention to the employes Samantha, y Ana Elisa.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MrsWiskers
Reviews.Content: We spent from Dec 31/11 to Jan 7/12 (3rd time this year) at the Gran Porto Real and once again we had a fantastic vacation. Although the hotel itself needs a bit of TLC - paint, updated furniture, the staff here are unbeatable. Where do I begin. Thankyou to all of the Entertainment Staff, Chicken, Cesar, Ivan, Miguel, Daniella for entertaining us all week. I love coming down to the pool first thing in the morning to their smiles and their banter. A very special thankyou to Elias and Delia. Thanks for making our dining a great pleasure. You truely made us feel very special. Thanks also to Jose and Mateo - great service. And we can't forget our special bartender David Ancona - thanks for our special drinks. The pool waiters - Jose, Pablo, Theresa - always a pleasure to be waited on not only by great waiters but great people. Excellent service as always. A big thankyou to all the staff at this hotel. It really isn't about the hotel itself, it's the people that make our vacation. Until next time. Can't wait to come back to see all of you - now not only our staff but our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...however....”
Reviews.Author: M_A_Ellis611
Reviews.Content: My husand and I stayed at the gran port real from jan 4-11. the location of this resort is definitely what made this trip for us. It was nice to be able to walk down the beach and be right in the hear to all of the shopping and restaurants in about 5 minutes! I don't really understand the complaints about the beach, yes there are some sandbags but they are there for a reason!! No sandbags= no beach. Also don't understand the complaints about the rooms being outdated, they are clean and spacious so maybe I am just too easy to please as far as that is concerned. We had an oceanview junior suit on the 2nd floor. The hotel staff were friendly and on the 2 occassions where we needed assistance someone came right to our door in less than 5 minutes. The not so good....as far as my picky husband is concerned the food was awful...he didn't like the buffet at all but the a la cartes were much better. I didn't have any problems finding something to eat most days as long as we caught the buffet at the start. I found the A la cartes great and the mexican night at the buffet was so good I could have had those dishes every day for every meal!!! There could be an improvement at the beach bar as far as we are both concerned....grey hotdogs and soupy hamburgers!! no thanks....these things should be grilled to order instead of sitting out in the heat all day.... The drinks here were awful.....worst I have ever had anywhere ever....I tried to stay away from the enticing sugar on sugar drinks and ordered only cranberry vodkas and mojitos....which were watered down to the point of grossness....I had to start requesting my drinks strong and the bartender would comply by filling the glass 3/4 with "vodka" and a few splashes of juice and it was STILL extremely weak....We ended up going down the beach about 1 minute to COCO MAYA most days and PAYING for delicious food and drinks....$8 for a margarita which I sipped on for the majority of the afternnon (and only needed 1 because it actually had booze in it) they have the best chicken wings by the way!! Overall the location is what made this trip for us but really has me considering opting out of the all inclusive choice for future vacations...

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: WIShamrock
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Gran Porto Real for the sixth time for 10 nights and enjoyed every minute of it. We have been to many other resorts in the area and the GPR is by far the best. The food is excellent. From the Buffet to the main restaurants we did not have a meal that we did not totally enjoy. On the flight home we decided that we will not take anymore chances at another resort. This resort is paradise for us. The service is outstanding in every regard. Whatever you want, they will try to get it for you. We can not say enough about all the staff we have become friends with. Upon arrival to the resort about three of the wait staff met us at check in to welcome us by name. They remembered our names after two years! They made our welcome so special. I would like to mention some of the staff that made our vacation so wonderful. Eliazar the captain of the bars, food and pool area, Teresa, Pablo, Jose, Jesus, David, Ivan, Victor, Ceasar, Ana, Esaura, Alex, Miriam, Hector, chef Rene and Jorge, Yuliana. If we have forgotten anyone, we apologize. All of you made our stay memorable. The room was always spotless with towel art everyday. The entire resort is immaculate and well cared for. Everyone always had a smile and greeted you everytime you met anyone in the hallway or anywhere. We hope to return to our Mexican home next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great time with some qualifiers and tips”
Reviews.Author: Travele R
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this resort with a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 teens). The Good: - The resort facilities themselves are showing their age in many spots, but it is very clean and well tended to by the staff. - Staff is terrific The Bad: - They have the "Family Suites" right over the bar area. The bands and entertainment go until about 10:30 or 11:00 each night - Just like Brad173 noted on December 28, 2011 review there is a Credit Card scam going on there. I had read that review and watched carefully on check-in. They run your card and then flip the card over and write down the 3 digit security code from the back of the card. With your card number and that security code (the hotle doesn't need that if they physically ran the card) they can go web shopping with no problem. I scratched out the code from the card imprint, so hopefully they won't go shopping with my card Tips: - Watch the Credit Card scam mentioned above - To get better tasting drinks, just specify what specific brand of liquor you want. I found their house brands to be weak and flavourless as others have noted here. Just say you want "smirnoff and orange juice" or "tanqueray and tonic" instead of "vodka and orange juice" or "gin and tonic". They happily will provide it. - Don't get rooms over the bar area (258,259,260, 261...) unless you don't want to sleep until after 11PM.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing go there”
Reviews.Author: madeline c
Reviews.Content: I dont usally write reviews good or bad but i had to with this hotel spent new years there on a 2wks hols and it is amazing also got married there and me and my husband couldnt ask for more the food is great the room is basis and very clean but we only book a standard room anyway, The staff ther work so hard at making your hols relax and worried free the hotel is spotless, there is something to do for everyone. Would like to mention some of the staff that made our holiday brillant, Jose Be and Alberto in the Lobby bar, Lorenzo in Albatros restraunt. Also would like to mention Captian Manuel, Hostesee Ana, Mesoro Antonio jimenez and Cantinero Alex. Also the kids club our 7yr old boy was very entaintained its non stop there which allowed me and my husband some well earned time together all the girls in kids clubs gina, Sandra, Cynthia and Lali worked really hard. Thanks you girls. And last of all thank you sooooo much Denys from the Wedding Centre who made our wedding truly amazing you are great and such a professional. I hope we can return again as by far it is one of the best hols we have ever had. Also if Randy and Scott from Washington DC read this I have lost your contact details sorry please get in contact and will send you the picturesxxx

Reviews.Title: “Great! Great! Great!”
Reviews.Author: Becky S
Reviews.Content: My family and I were there last week and absolutely loved it! The food was great and plentiful, the rooms were excellent. Their service in the hotel, restaurant, and beach was amazing. Pablo on the beach was great and never let us go without a drink in our hand! He was personable and made us laugh and feel like part of his family. He was so excited to see us every day when we got there. Everyone was super friendly and they were always working hard.

Reviews.Title: “New Year´s family vacation”
Reviews.Author: tviherkoski
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my wife and three children, aged 5 ja 3 year old twins in Gran Porto from Dec. 26th, 2011 to Jan 9th, 2012. After having some problems in the front desk about our room, we had a fairly decent room # 226 with a limited sea view. I decided to upgrade our room to sea view after couple of nights in the old room. The second room # 359 was excellent with a stunning sea view.
