I highly recommend to pay extra 40 USD for the sea view, but make sure you are facing the beach front. I was offered also the beach front with an instant access to the beach, but I would not recommend it, because who have no privacy unless you have closed curtains all the time. Please make sure, who have a junior suite!!! Service was outstanding. The only problem was New Year´s gala dinner with a la carte dinner. The waiters were not able to keep up with the usual high service level and sometimes mixed the orders. The other problem was the breakfast with a constant line up to ten people waiting for eggs to be fried. The lady working behind the stove was not able to keep up with the numerous guests wanting to have omelett or fried eggs at the same time. You had to wait for up to 10 minutes to have your order done, which is difficult for a family with small kids. The numerous bars in the hotel were functioning fairly good, but occasionally you got a little frustrated, when you have ordered your drink and then comes a waiter serving for beach clients and he has orders for ten people. The bartender takes the waiters order first even the the waiter came after you. I had to remind couple of times about this problem. The beach is not very good for swimming for adults, being too shallow, but if you go just 200 m to the left to Royal´s beach, the swimming is perfect. For kids Gran Porto´s beach is good, even though the sticking sand bags are not very nice looking. Overall we were very with our choice, Gran Porto. We think the personnel was doing their best to make our staying as enjoyable as possible. The last, but not least was the excellent 24h buffet with bar for self service in the lobby. I have never seen anything like that, but the idea was outstanding! Thank you, Gran Porto for making our family holiday in Mexico perfect! T.Viherkoski Moscow Russia

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, but beware.”
Reviews.Author: modye61
Reviews.Content: We had to give our credit card at check in for any extra charges that might be charged to our room. My husband didn't want to sign a blank slip, but they assured us that it was common practice and not to worry...well we didn't use our card anywhere else, and we paid cash for any charges to the room. Our credit card was used fraudulently the day after we got back from our trip. Two charges totaling $2,000.00, one for an Aero Mexico flight and one for hotels.com. Seeing that our card never left our safe, it had to be hotel staff that used our card. If it weren't for this I would recommend this hotel, the staff were friendly the location was great, close to 5th ave. We had a family suite ocean front, and I wouldn't stay in anything less than this. The buffet food was okay, Il Pescatore was the best restaurant there, the salmon was delicious. The room was spacious, but lacked storage, had a sewer smell really bad one night, and the pillows were way too big. I know I sound like I'm only complaining, but we really did enjoy our stay. We were with our two teenage sons, who loved it and 10 other family members, 3 which were staying next door at the Royal. We went on a 90 min timeshare meeting, and I did not find them pushy at all. There were fishing boats to the right of the beach, but I think they add to the vista, and didn't hinder swimming in the ocean at all. Jesus was our man on the beach, excellent service, and always with a big smile! Once again because of the credit card fraud, I can't recommend this hotel, otherwise I would.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto has great service.”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C
Reviews.Content: It was a rocky start but after room issues were sorted out it was a great stay. It was all about a few great staff that really made the trip enjoyable. Beach service could not have been better as Pablo took care of us every day. He made us laugh and we felt like we were the only ones on the beach except when we saw him running to take care of others with the same warmth and attention. The Mexican restaurant was amazing with great food and service. Could have ate there every night. The buffet food was slightly better that average but again service made the difference. In the evening Juan and Amabiael took care of with service you would never see in a less than 5 star restaurant, and remember this was the buffet. From special meals, drinks, laughs and the entertaining Spanish coffee Juan was outstanding. Special meals were thanks to our Chef Edi. Housekeeping was also great with the cute towel animals and she never intruded on us and besides that our room was neat and clean. Will say if you want to party late into the night, or really just talk and laugh with friends this is not the place as they shut the lights out by 12:30-1pm and the 24hr bar is self serve, cold and not really inviting. Great location in terms of beach and shopping, doesn't get better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a fantastic vacation”
Reviews.Author: Trishwms
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic trip with our entire family of 6, with children ages 21, 19, 12 & 9. There was something for everyone or nothing for everyone....your choice! Can't say enough about the staff...so friendly and accommodating. Especially Restaurant staff members including Rebeca, May, Chucho and Daniel. Recreational staff was fantastic, Daniela, Ivan and Cesar. Front desk stff member, Erica Estrada was superb as well. Only complaint is the location of our room was very close to a nightclub that played very loud music well into the morning hours- 6am. Do not stay in a room on the north side of the property, or be sure to bring ear plugs. Our beachfront room had an incredible view.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto is great”
Reviews.Author: jim m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the center of it all, the rooms are great and clean. The food is very very good!!! everything about this place I loved and I have been on 30-40 trips. I highly recommend this place and would stay again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Porto Real !”
Reviews.Author: megbass26
Reviews.Content: We went the Grand Porto Real this past July and had a great time. We stayed on the first floor in a Junior Suite very close to the wedding reception room. We had no trouble with noise at all. Although I did bring ear plugs just in case. The beach was beautiful, however the beach next door at the Royal was much nicer - worth the walk over. At dusk we would walk the beach very far down toward the Cozumel Terminal. This is a beautiful walk and you can look at and or visit the many bars that are along the way. We also really enjoyed both pools, the downstairs one during the first part of the day, and then the upstairs during the second part when it was getting really hot. There is a lot of shade up there and it is more quiet than other locations - we also enjoyed the swim up bar. Their sushi bar was pretty good as well. There were a few kids around but we really didnt mind. My fiance and I also went to the gym every day and really enjoyed it. It was nicely air conditioned and maintained. They had water with fresh lemon available. The food was good - breakfast buffet had a lot of options including fresh fruit, for lunch we mostly went to the beach for burgers, fries and nachos. For dinner we tried each restaurant and enjoyed that as well. The portions were small but I feel like this made us be able to try many more items than we normally would at an american restaurant. We went on an ATV tour and an "Edventure Tour" and would recommend both - I wish we had also gone horseback riding. Finally - DO NOT waste your time listening to a presentation across the street at the Royal - they will offer you 500pesos to go do it, however we felt it was high pressure and they would not let us go easily. We would have rather been on the beach. This cheapened the feel of the "Real" chain of hotels for me. The location is great, we went to 5th ave many times and really enjoyed it. I never once felt unsafe, and I am a very anxious person! All and All I would go back for a family vacation again. It seems like a nice place to bring kids if you are looking for something like that.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant”
Reviews.Author: Aracely328
Reviews.Content: I went on vacation this Christmas to NYE. The guy at the front desk with glasses is an arrogant son of a gun. He inconvenience us 2 days asking for a balance to be paid when we paid Expedia in full. We ended up having to pay and now we are fighting with the credit card company to refund the amount in full. Expedia made the mistake and had that we came with 3 babies the age of 1. We made the reservation over the phone and gave the gentleman the ages of all the children. Between Expedia and the arrogant guy at the counter did not make the trip enjoyable b/c we tried to get a hold of Expedia for hours by phone, and email and to no avail. Rediculous!!! Beautiful place but we were not enjoying ourselves b/c we had to take care of the problem with the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the closet safe!”
Reviews.Author: Yoav B
Reviews.Content: My family of five travelled to the Gran Porto Real in July 2011 primarily because they would accomodate 5. My hildren are 6, 3, and 3. Ghe room worked well having a bunk bed with trundle. The food was lackluster at best. The beach had a horrible smell not present on other properties. Exposed sand bags were present making parts of the beach unusable. On a positive note, it was a short walk into town. The biggest problem is that the safe is in the closet at head height. I hsve always seen them at foot height before. My wife hit her head on rhe edge of the open dolr and gashed it so deeply, she needed three stitches. The life gajrd was very attentive, and administered first aid. When we vrlught this to the attention of the manager, his first response was to deny responsibility, before even checking on howmy wife was doing. Needless to say, my wife was in pain, on antibiotics, and unable to swim for the rest of the trip. The only occomodstion the manager was willing to make was to offer us $15 in the gift shop! Overall, the experience was marginal and we would never go back. The manager's attitude was disgusting! I am so disappointed that I hope this review costs them at least the money they should have compensated us. If you make the mistake of going to this hotel, beware the safes. Make sure to always close the door! Otherwise, save yourself the $1000 bill at the local hospital and pack your own suture kit (or wear a helmet).

Reviews.Title: “Jaki and Lynn”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline l
Reviews.Content: Arrived very tired after a 11 hour flight from England and were offered a very refreshing drink as we checked in, very efficient transfer to our room but we were dissapointed by the standard room we had booked it was dark and had very little wardrobe space also the balcony was a shared one, if you opened the shutters people walking past could look in the room, but everything was very clean the mini bar was well stocked there were plenty of towels and the beds were very comfortable. The choice of places to eat was amazing and the staff were wonderful,our breakfast waiter Chucho made us feel so welcome and our evening waiters Raul Varguez.M and Rodivar were so professional, the service was really 5 star. The beach waiters also deserve a mention Huber was so helpful but they all worked so hard to keep everyone happy, I have never seen so many smiling faces. Everywhere is so clean, we really want to say thankyou to all the staff for making our holiday a wonderful one and we would definately go there again and thankyou to the lady who makes the lovely omelettes for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Poor food, ugly beach and overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: KayCee100
Reviews.Content: Having seen a lot of positive reviews, we were excited about staying at this hotel for a fortnight to relax and unwind. Food: The breakfasts were amazing and the lady who makes the omelettes was a pro. However things went downhill when it came to lunch and dinner. Do not bother booking at this hotel if you are a vegetarian. There is barely any choice of food especialy on steak night where we actually had to get up and go to the a la carte as there was not a single option for vegetarians. I did mention i didnt eat meat and they said to me "what would you like to eat? Pasta? " Pasta is all i ever had here. They do have grills where they are making a variety of food but they do not understand why you don not want your vegetarian meal cooked away from the pork and beef so I had to stay away from these too. Desserts - poor apart from the ice cream. The staff in the buffet restaurant weren't particularly helpful with providing vegetarian food so we spent the majority of evenings alternating between the 2 A la carte restarants which were a little bit more accomodating. Rutilio in Maria's restaurant was lovely- very helpful and made a fabulous mexican coffee. I did get sick of the food after 2 weeks as there were about 3 things i could eat between the two restaurants for a fortnight. Beach I saw a lot of comments on here about the sandbags but went with an open mind. Unfortunately they do make the beach look very ugly and the sea has random rocks in the seabed and my husband came out of the sea one day with a large bleeding cut from one of these rocks. Not ideal! It wasn't the prettiest beach to look at either. The sea near the Royal is better but I have seen a lot better. A big positive thumbs up to the beach bar waiters though -Jose and Pablo-absolutely lovely. Location Adjacent to a shopping street (5th Avenue) which is fabulous to walk through after dinner although prices are a rip off so don't do all your holiday shopping here. Stuff can be found a lot cheaper elsewhere. Reception: Didnt find the staff very friendly here and stayed well away from the reception area for the duration for the trip. Although a lot of the staff are genininely kind, there are also many who are just nice purely for your tips -you can see the difference. Check in took over 45 minutes and it wasn't even that busy Rooms: Very clean but dated and dark. We were on the fourth floor and had considerable noise one of the weekends we were there from one of the neighbouring rooms where there was a group of young people drinking into the early hours. The walls are thin and although the noise was so loud and sounded like it was next door, it was 5 doors down! horrible! We did complain but reception were very unhelpful. The rooms have no privacy unless you keep your blinds closed. Overall: It is the only holiday we have been on in our lives where we were almost pleased to leave and will certainly not be going back to. It was one of the poorest quality (apparently) 5* hotels we have ever stayed at. Although Mexico itself is beautiful, there are plenty better hotels to stay at. I have never actually lost weight on holiday until this trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Nice, Hotel was not Accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: SaundaB
Reviews.Content: I was married here 2 years ago and never wrote a review, actually traveled here in Jan 2010. The actual wedding itself was phenomenal. The coordinator was outstanding and every guest had an awesome time and I could not have asked for more in that regard. HOWEVER, The hotel was not accomodating at all! I booked a wedding package and a bunch of rooms but no one informed me that the beach was going to be rebuilt at the time of our stay. I booked a walk out room and the second day I woke up to a pile of sand in front of my room and no beach to use. They changed my room but charged the extra money to do so which was inappropriate since I paid for a walk out room I could not use. Further, they set up a beach area at the Royal across the street but separated the hotel guests of Porto into another area and you had to walk a good distance to get there. My father who was sick at the time could not walk the entire distance that they set up so he didn't get to enjoy the beach either. I tried desperately for them to help us out more because we had so many rooms booked and no beach, etc but they were unwilling to accomodate us with anything else and just blamed it on the Mexican government. I will not book again with this resort, but at least the wedding itself was nice. Food-- buffet was ok, all other restaurants at this hotel were poor.

Reviews.Title: “Best barmen ever!”
Reviews.Author: bigbeers
Reviews.Content: This is our first time in mexico and started with a small negative. After a 26 hour delay in England we finally arrived at the Gran Porto very tired and just wanting to crash out only to be told of the latest offer. You are told that the Royal Hotel on the other side of the road has a promotion that you can upgrade for 40 dollars a night. My question is if you wanted to stay at the Royal you would have booked in the first place. We were in a junior suite on the first floor near to the reception and never had a noise problem. The room was very spacious with a large shower and seperate hand basin area. There is a large king sized bed and plenty of seating and storage. There is a safe provided free of charge that you input your own code. Food is served buffet style in the Albatross dining room and there is plenty of choice from freshly made omelettes at breakfast to themed nights for evening dinner. Ther are two seperate restaurants that you can dine at, one being a Mexican and the other an Italian. We tried both of these and we were not disappointed. There is a 24 hour snack bar near to the lobby bar replenished on a regular basis and help yourself to drinks when the bars close. The pool is of a good size but you will have to get out pretty early to grab a sunbed and towels are supplied. There is a bar at the pool called the Gaviatos which translated means seagull and if you take your lunch at the beach buffet you will soon realise where this name comes from. The beach is made up of sandbags layered on top of sand and is adequate and make sure you have a walk to the Trade Winds beach bar for a drink and sit with a great gentle breeze just looking out over the ocean. Although the hotel was full at our time you never feel overcrowded or rushed. The centrepiece of the hotel has to be the Lobby Bar where any cocktail or drink can be had. This is run by some of the best bartenders I have ever met and a special mention has to go to Dave, Alberto and Chris. Also a shout out to Miriam, Isaura,Adriana,Elizabeth and Fabian who were pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. I would return to this hotel with family and friends and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay at this hotel. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: Hurricane0000
Reviews.Content: Just thinking about this place makes my skin crawl. I’m usually in agreement with trip advisor members’ views on hotels. This lemon is one exception. Its as if I read the ranking of this hotel on April Fools day. The reviews and the reality just do not align. Read these next four words very carefully before you book: This. Place. Is. Rancid. Think I’m being precious? Check out the photos I’ve attached to my review and form your own opinion. If you still don’t agree with me then you’re not right in the head and you deserve all that this monument to nasty has to offer. My only conclusion for why this hell-hole ranks so well on trip advisor is that your average reviewer loves to drink alcohol that more closely resembles methylated spirits in taste, thinks tribal tattoos actually look good, believe teen pregnancies are par for course, and likes their food so processed that any hint of nutritional value was fried out of it on the third re-heat. To summarise: if you live above the poverty line, best you look elsewhere for somewhere to stay. And stop by this armpit end of the beach for a laugh at the people who didn’t read the reviews of those few sane ones of us slagging this dump. (specific gripes: upon check-in, you get smacked with a 30 minute marketing talk that books you in to a 90 minute tour of their sister hotel unless you forcefully refuse; the rooms are terrible – think $40/night motels you’d get elsewhere, and reduce the quality by another 50%; the ‘all you can drink’ mini-bar in the room didn’t refrigerate; housekeeping left rubbish lying around after they cleaned; the handle of the shower door fell off; the hairdryer on the wall fell off; a light in the room kept flickering even when it was turned off until I removed the light bulb myself; the free wifi doesn’t reach most of the rooms; the beach in front of the hotel is fine if swimming between fishing boats moored on the beach is your thing. And here’s the kicker, you get to wear a yellow wristband that screams “I’m a package tourist!”)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Marco9
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 ocean view suites, 1 for us and 1 for our kids. The rooms were large and beautiful both overlooking the pool and the ocean. Loved the location, being able to walk out to the beach and downtown was nice. Found the food excellent and the service too. Being a smaller AI sometimes there was some waiting for food and drinks but overall a very enjoyable experience and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could be great”
Reviews.Author: 36Mags
Reviews.Content: We stayed at GPR in November choosing this hotel because of the good reviews and it was close to the centre of Playa Del Carmen. We booked a standard room which was a big mistake. It was awful, nowhere in the brochure did it mention having to climb up wooden steps to get to the room. The room itself was just so dark with hardly any natural light. If you dont mind living out of your suitcase (there was nowhere to hang more than a couple of items of clothes and no drawers) then you might manage but if you want something more then you have to upgrade. We had to pay 9030 peso's to upgrade to a Jnr Suite for the standard of room we expected to stay in but ,I must say that this room was great and if we had been shown this room to begin with our overall score of the hotel would have been much higher. Cleanliness of the hotel and the friendliness of all the staff was superb, food was not brilliant but OK and you would never go hungry here. We were offer a transfer to Caribe Real in Cancun for the second week which we accepted and preferred the location much better. The CR staff were not as good as GPR and the Jnr.Suite was not as good either but it more than made up for it as we were placed on the VIP floor with access to the VIP 24hr lounge which had food and upgraded drinks available all the time. The transfer was to try to get us to join the Real Club and we were shown round the the Royal Hotel next door (adults only) which was fantastic. A short presentation was given explaining about the Club and its benefits but when we refused to join we weren't put under any pressure at all. It was a bad start to the holiday which was a shame as the rest of the time was great so if you are thinking of staying here look at upgrading before you go as it is much cheaper than when you are at the hotel. All of the computer screens on the reception desks at all of their hotels are showing "Why not upgrade your room" and I personally believe that they put you in the worst standard room available so that you will have to pay for the upgrades. If we had known how much it was going to cost to upgrade we would probably have chosen a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “How does this get 4+ rating?”
Reviews.Author: Garret P
Reviews.Content: Definitely the worst all inclusive I've ever been in. Reasons (1) over booked the hotel so they didn't have a room for us until we showed them the confirmation number. Then they gave us one with a king bed and a double cot for 5 people. To add on, there was no pillow brought in with the bed so we had to call. (2) We had to wait in a line up for 30 minutes for seating at the buffet! What the hell? (3) the 24 hour snack bar had literally a few scraps of luncheon meats and veggies. We asked if more food was coming and were told that's all there is. Also, all the drink fountains were mysteriously out of order in the snack bar and had to go to the overcrowded bar to get a soda. (4) One bar in the whole hotel to get anything after hours and it's crowded with people who've had too many. Not the best thing you want your 2 yr old daughter around when she wants an orange crush. A disgraceful hotel. Will never, ever return to a Real resort.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Brad173
Reviews.Content: Ill start with the ugly, so for those that dont like reading the whole review will at least get a heads up. My wife and I got married at this resort at the beginning of December. We had 50 guests come with us. At our reception, three of our wedding cards were literally ripped open and the money was taken right out of the cards. Our on site wedding coordinator then delivered the cards to our room the following day (along with our decorations and other stuf that needed to be returned). When questioned, she flat out lied to our face and said that she did not deliver the cards to our room. We talked to management about it, but they basically said they dont care but will look into it. They never got back to us regarding the missing money. Now since weve been home for a few weeks, our guests have been notified (either thru the credit card company or when they were doing christmas shopping and had their credit cards denied) that their credit card had been being using fraudently in Mexico and on the internet. Now let me state a fact here. At check in, they require a credit card on file for any expenses you may charge to your room or for any damages to your room. None of our guests left the resort during their stay and if they did do some shopping they only used cash. So being that they were at an all inclusive, they put their cards away and did not touch them again till they got home. Each day it seems that another one of our guests finds out that they were victims of credit card fraud. So put the pieces together. the people working at the resort were the only ones during their stay to have access to their credit card numbers and all of a sudden, weeks later they are racking up tons and tons of bills. Over $9,000 on one persons card. Thankfully, the credit card companies are taking care of everyone, but this is very very bad business. I in fact will never go back to this resort or any Real Resort for that matter. Ive done extensive traveling in my time and never had anything like this happen. Also, there was some stuff stolen out of peoples rooms. (i undertand that this does happen from time to time at places like this, so I wont really make a big deal about that) but to have mutliple people taken advantage of with their cards is just unheard of. We are completly embarressed about this and dont know what to do. Soooooo, if you dont care about possibly getting your money stolen and would like to visit here anyway, here is the rest of my review. It was a decent resort, set in a good location on the beach and a two minute walk into Fifth Ave. The beach was nice except for the all the sandbags, but they are trying to do what they can to fix it. The pool was nice and a good temperature. Breakfast buffett was great everyday, especially the omlettes. I mostly ate lunch at the poolside shack where they set up pretty much the same food everyday. it was decent, and got boring but I could have easily went inside to the lunch buffett which was sometimes really good to just alright. Dinner at the buffett was good and had a lot to choose from, Italian resteraunt was really great (pay the extra to get the lobster), i myslef did not eat at the mexican but all our guests had mixed reviews. Our room was nice but could use a little updating (we had an ocean front walk out suite). Our shower had cold water all week, but the room was nice and spacious. Our wedding was wonderful. everything turned out better than we had thought (except for our cards being ripped open). Drinks here were nonstop, but not very strong at all.....very hard to catch a buzz. there was essentially no entertainment here which was disappointing as other resorts weve been to had entertainment that was really good. They really had nothing going on at the pool during the day, and at night they set up near the pool and had a lousy show for about 30 minutes. one night i went back to my room for a few minutes and came back out and the show was over (within 10 minutes)....... Anyway, we were upgraded to the Royal for a few nights....(still trying to figure out if it was because we brought 50 guests there or if they felt guilty about our money missing) but everything there was great. I would never go back to this resort again because of our horrible experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Real Club is a SCAM: Do NOT Buy!!!”
Reviews.Author: truthwithproof
Reviews.Content: Note: Our ratings here are based on the actual hotel but our following review and WARNING is based on the Real Club membership that they will try to sell you. DO NOT BUY A REAL CLUB MEMBERSHIP!!! We spent HOURS with them while our kids were made to sit in a corner with a babysitter with no offer of food and only one beverage offer because we HAD to go through the presentation at their Royal hotel which doesn't allow children. We thought the deal sounded very good, they processed the deposit on our credit card and THEN AFTERWARD they showed us a list (which they had briefly glossed over in the beginning and even put in the "get back to later pile" when we didn't understand it) again detailing the "Member Preferred Rates." The BIG emphasis is on all these credits you get to use and with the bombardment of information, you assume that all you need to do is use these credits (1 for standard room, 2 for junior suite, 3 for 2 bedroom, etc.) whenever you want to use one of the Real hotels. They NEVER clearly tell you (until after you have committed) that you STILL have to pay for the all inclusive for EACH person on top of using so many of your credit points (the all inclusive for food and beverages is MANDATORY). AND, the rate you pay is according with their Member Preferred Rates chart which is not cheap! When you question this, they say, "Oh, but you don't end up paying what's on this list; you end up getting much better deals than this at the time you book." But, there is absolutely no guarantee of this. When you review the contract, it only states that what you have to pay is in accordance with the Preferred Rates list. So, in brief, you pay tens of thousands of dollars for the program depending on the number of credits you buy and depending on whether you want to be able to stay during high season periods--like Christmas, New Year, Holy Week--(e.g. $20,000 US for a re-sale for 450 credits and no stays during high season special times, to up to over $80,000 US for 20000 credits and open stays) BUT you still HAVE TO pay for the all inclusive each day, per person, ON TOP of this. We worked out we'd still be paying well over $400 per night for us and our two boys for Jan (after Jan 01) to Feb stays, ON TOP of our membership payment which was nearly $20,000 US!!! And get this: When you review the Member Preferred Rates list, you realize (afterward) that the all inclusive rate GOES UP according to the size of the room you book. So, not only do you use more credits for bigger rooms (which is obviously fair enough and to be expected), you also PAY MORE for the all inclusive per person. Hang on, isn't the all inclusive rate per person just for food and beverage? How can they justify paying more for all inclusive per person simply because you book a bigger room? Then you realize that it's such a scam. We just didn't feel right after signing up and making our deposit. We went over the contract in fine detail and found a clause that allowed us to cancel within 5 business days of signing as long as we hadn't used any of the gifts. We went through another hour and a half worth of being passed off from one person to the next to try to cancel (they keep sending different people your way to try to convince you not to cancel). Only when we stayed firm did they finally process the cancellation. BUT, the first guy who "handled" us tried to pull one over us by telling us we'd still have to pay some fees and charges for cancelling, to cover their costs for various things. We didn't see this anywhere in the contract and stated so, showing them that the contract said we were due a full refund as long as it was within the 5 days, so they dropped that one. We told them we actually still liked their hotel Gran Porto Real Playa Del Carmen and would still strongly consider returning whenever we found online deals (we phoned the hotel chain directly on Dec 24, 2011 – yes, Christmas Eve - and they gave us a last minute deal of only $280 per night all inclusive for the four of us, no extras fees, for Dec 25, 25 & 27! See how it would have been insane for us to go through with the membership – which excluded peak periods – when we can get deals on our own like this EVEN DURING peak season) BUT only if they would, in the essence of good business practice, at least compensate our poor boys (who had missed out practically a whole days worth of activities and the food that we’d paid for). Their answer: They avoided answering our request until we made them process the cancellation and then they rudely told us “we were free to go” with nothing but the original 500 peso voucher they HAD to give us because they had used that as an incentive to get us to the presentation in the first place. Now we will never return to any Real hotels nor recommend them to anyone. Very poor business.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property !”
Reviews.Author: mgduranmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the christmas holiday and we had the perfect room corner room at end of property walk out to the beach. It was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Emotions”
Reviews.Author: cccAlberta
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful and maintained impeccably. The bay window seating at the buffet is outstanding, but the food is just average. The first night we were in a ground floor room right off the lobby which was horrible. The open air hacienda style is lovely, but sound is amplified and carries down the hallways, so this location was terrible. Thankfully we were moved to a third floor room above the pool which was much better. They unfortunately allow people to claim poolside chairs by placing clothing or towels on the chairs. As this seating is limited, one plays the exclusion game. The Italian restaurant was awesome for dinner. Pasta cannot be frozen and reheated, so it was always fresh. The common areas are too crammed and loud by trying to squeeze in pool tables, stages and seating. It was never relaxing in that area. Grounds staff and housekeeping were hardworking and friendly. Overall, it was not enjoyable or memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* in our opinion”
Reviews.Author: JoyandAndy
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in July after consideration of the reviews online. When we arrived we were shown our standard room for my husband, myself and our 8 year old - it was along a row of doors a little like prisoner cell block H and when we entered the room it was like a small cave - ok if your the flinstones - it was appalling. Shower room no bigger than a small cubicle w.c. and where do you put your clothes, there was a 6" gap to hang a few items between the lot of you, that was it, needless to say the cases didnt even get unpacked. I went down the next morning and was asked for 590 dollars for the two week upgrade to a junior suite, but i did get this somewhat cheaper as i threatened to book out the hotel. We were moved to a junior suite near reception at the top of the stairs and directly above the live entertainment for the night, needless to say we did not get a wink of sleep, then the hotel was filled with Americans who were extremely loud and obviously had no consideration for any1 else. We complained. Next night same again till 1pm and when we came to open our room door there had been a food fight on the landing with cakes, bread, coffee and drink directly outside our door and so we were unable to get out. Again we complained and were offered alternate room with a free further upgrade, which i have to say was a stunning room, but my argument is this, never have i been into a 5* hotel where you have to continually upgrade to get a decent room, is this not what you pay for when booking into a 5* hotel - it seems not here. Then watch out for the timeshare people who are actually in the hotel as they are promoting the Royal which is part of the hotel across the road, if you get stuck in there it is a 6 hour visit not 90 minutes as they ask of you. The food, apart from the breakfast is of poor quality i think for this type of hotel and the entertainment is okayish. The excellent points for this hotel is that the cleaning staff around the hotel and the rooms was of a very high standard, almost to the point that they got on your nerves, constantly cleaning around you while you were eating. If you are prepared to pay the extra 590 dollars for the upgrade when you get there it will be a good stay but personally when yyou have paid that much money for the hotel, in my opinion it should come as standard that you actually get a nice room. Watch room 250 by the way we constantly got electricuted by the light switches due to the condensation falling behind them from the air conditioning, although the hotel didnt seem really to want to know about this.

Reviews.Title: “Staff”
Reviews.Author: Saskone
Reviews.Content: Great staff all through the resort. The cleaning, gardeners, maintenance and entertainment staff all greeted us with a smile. Shout out to Pablo, Danielle, Ivan, Viktor(Chicken),Lorenzo thanks for looking after our family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: j4schern
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 12 days at the Gran Porto. I will start with the bad because it was very little. Food: While I don't normally complain about food (my expectations aren't high for Mexico) this was terrible. I keep reading about how good it was...I unfortunately got very ill and basically spent two days in bed, or the bathroom...Now my husband didn't get sick at all. He thought the food was wonderful. After getting that sick I was just so unsure what to eat. I think they let the buffet food set out too long without the correct temps. I did like the 24 hour lounge the finger food there was very good. We did have access to eat at the Royal, however, they are pretty stuffy over there so we didn't feel comfortable. But the food was really good there. Noise: The first 7 days were fantastic, we had an Ocean walk out (talk about later) so we didn't hear any noise except the ocean. Well then the Blue Parrot opened down the beach, they would play techno music until 4:30AM every night!!! We complained and I'm sure we weren't the only ones. You figure between the Gran Porto and the Royal they have a lot at stake. I couldn't imagine staying in the hotel right next to the Blue Parrot...just saying you might need ear plugs if you stay here. Hopefully, they will have so many complaints that the Blue will turn the music off outside. The Good Hotel: The hotel is very beautiful and well kept, very very clean. I've seen mention of tired rooms, ours was just the opposite it was wonderful. Easy access to 5th avenue and quick from the airport. Beach: I've seen comments about the sandbags. This must be from people that dont understand they have to do this or they wouldn't have a beach. Also, very few sandbags were present. I thought it was an awesome beach. The best part about Playa Del Carmen is getting to walk the beach grab a beer from the beach bars ( you can't do that in Cancun). Again we stayed in the beach front walkout and it was right next to the beach bar. I've noticed no one comments about the beach bar at this end, it was super! Thanks to Fabian and Omar, they were wonderful bartenders, miss you guys! We are beach people, we spent everyday on the beach. Pools: We never even got in the pools however they looked very nice and clean. Lots of people around them, again since we didn't use them I won't comment much. We did go up and look at the pool on the 3rd floor, but we never went back. It faces the road so I wasn't too impressed and wasn't sure why anyone would stay up there... Rooms: This had to the best room ever, we had an Ocean front beach walkout, room 155. This room was amazing the bed a kingsize with pillowtop matress. So I'm guessing that if you don't upgrade to the nicer suites you just have a standard bed. We had six pillows too:) Stocked fridge with soda, juice, water and beer. We also had some snacks but they only replaced them twice. Walk in Shower that was huge! Now you did have to run the water for about 10 minutes before it got hot...our room was spotless, our maid Patricia did a fantastic job. I never thought I would write about towel art...but it was always fun to see what she would make us each day:) Had an Ipod home, and flat screen TV one of the best rooms I've stayed in! Tipping: I think most people who go all inclusive don't think they should tip. I know different cultures think differently too. We tipped our everyday, the 24 hr lounge waitress, the maid, the bartenders, we didn't tip alot but it went a long way. I would love to go back, but I might check out some other places first!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best breakfast buffets ever!”
Reviews.Author: ourplanetisbeautiful
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has character and is beautiful--but it is the breakfast I can't get enough of--the array of choices they serve weighs heavily when choosing where to stay when in Playa del Carmen, everything is so delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Not our idea of a beach resort”
Reviews.Author: Debra69
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Gran Porto Real because we wanted to be on the beach but in town. The reviews were good and we got a reasonable package deal. Check in took way too long and all the while we were waiting we could hear the not-so-dulcet tones of a live band playing Top 40 covers very loudly and very poorly. The reception area is very grand, though not to my taste at all. The loooong corridor to our room was also very smart and had a colonial feel to it. The rooms, in contrast, are very outdated and shabby. The junior suite was huge, but lacked character and ambiance. The amateurish paint effects on the walls and ceilings are meant (I assume) to give the place a 'Mexican' feel, but they did nothing to warm up this cold, characterless hotel. Our shower was broken, so we had no hot water in the morning. It was fixed promptly, though, after a call to the front desk. We had a tiny balcony (with no privacy) overlooking some sort of promenade and a sliver of a view of the tiny beach. I gather much of the sand has been eroded away by the sea, because the pictures we saw on the booking site showed a much larger beach area. The room was very far away from the beach and pool area, and there was no real 'resort' feel to the place. After settling in we ate at Maria's, a Mexican a la carte restaurant. The food was ok, although it was not served as described on the menu because the ingredients weren't available. The cocktails/mixed drinks were awful, and made I suspect with inferior alcohol and sweet bottled mixes (which is true for most bars and restaurants in PDC, by the way). We decided this was not the place for us, and arranged with our travel rep to move to a different resort the next day. We were extremely happy with the move to Mahekal. I would never recommend the Gran Porto Real. Perhaps it is to some people's taste but I can't imagine why.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: longboat9
Reviews.Content: I went at the beginning of December. The Gran Porto Real is a beautiful resort. The lobby was welcoming and the surrounding areas were kept spotless. The staff overall were friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite outdated with a strong mexican feel to them. On the brightside they are kept very clean. The bathrooms are very outdated also and there is only a shower. That was really not an issue. The oceanfront suite had a stunning view but again these rooms are in the past. Oh my god! the beds were the most uncomfortable that I have experienced through my travels in Mexico. The mattresses are firm. The pillows were impossible to sleep with. The rooms are clean though. The walls are paper thin and you here the maids carts at seven a:m. Please bring earplugs. The food for an all inclusive was quite good. The bufffets had a variety of food and even supported the vegeterian dieter. The specialty restaurtants were good and no reservations required. This is such a plus. I really liked the fact that reservations weren`t required. The pool and beach were beautiful. Now! the beach isn`t the greatest but the scenery surrounding you and being right in the town of playa del carmen was awesome. 25.00 dollars massages everywhere on the beach. Like I said the beach isn`t the greatest but the royal playa del carmen is just a short walk away. There beach is much more spacious. Lots of loungers to choose from. Overall, the hotel is nice and the staff are great. The rooms are little drab but everything else is okay. I will return for the fact the resort is situated right in Playa and the rooms are not dumps. I did fell comfortable enough to stay.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: denisefroton
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time back and we can't wait to go back again. The staff was wonderful you felt like they were family, would like to say thank you to the staff: Dave the evening bartender, Elizabeth, Mariam and Theresa the waitress's ,they kept you laughing and always had a smile on their face. Jose the beach waiter whom became a close friend to us.Eliazar the capiton who surprised us with a very speical dinner,Anna our housekeeper she did an outstanding job keeping our room clean. All the staff were great thank you again for a wonderful vacation for my husband and I. We will miss you all. see you next year!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy and good hotel with great position”
Reviews.Author: lacosta001
Reviews.Content: We have stayed and got married in the royal next door, but like the Gran Porto better! It is not so uptight as The Royal, and service is even better! Especially on the beach with Jose and Annahi, to bad the beach is getting smaller again but that is not the fault of the hotel... Still an excellent choice!! See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Above All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: allan f
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd vacation at this Resort, and just when we thought it could never get any better, it has! The location is ideal, right on the beach, and close to any outside activity you could imagine. The food choices, and presentation is unbelievable. The special restaurants even change their dinner menu daily! The building and gardens in total are kept immaculate. Evening entertainment is exceptional. Every employee working there loves their job, and goes out of their way to accomodate any wish you may have. I don't know how it can get any better, but I'm sure when we return next year for our 4th visit, they will certainly surprise us again with their solid, continued improvement program!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous holiday”
Reviews.Author: Sher P
Reviews.Content: I was in Playa Del Carmen from December 4th until December 11th. The Gran Porto Real Resort was awesome. The casualness of this resort makes for a very relaxed and fun vacation. The staff are absolutely amazing. Friendly and always smiling and happy. Very helpful and full of great info about the area. A large number of the staff are very good at english. Here are a few of my favorite staff. PABLO, one of the servers on the beach. Such a great guy!! IVAN, a server in the buffet restaurant - another wonderful staff member. And also Chicken, Daniela, Miguel, Victor, Alberto and Mary at the gift shop. Pepe at the Italian restaurant. These servers are all wonderful at what they do!! You will not be disappointed if you stay at this resort. The Italian restaurant on site is very very good!! As is the mexican restaurant and buffet is great. They had a oriental theme at the buffet one night which I didn't like too much. But other than that one theme, it was great. The lady who makes the omlettes at the buffet is a treat to watch. She makes a fabulous omlette!! The nightly entertainment was great too. All the activities throughout the day are fun! On Monday and thursday nights, they have a few local artisans that set up their wares around the pool area and you get a chance to buy wonderfully made jewellry, painted tiles, woodcarvings that are authentic and without the pressure you would expect on 5th ave. Buy one of Martin's 'finger' painted tiles. They are so beautiful. And say hi to Alberto who is at the booth with Martin. A fabulous vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “First time in All Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: blenis
Reviews.Content: Giving it 4 out of 5 and not 5 is truly a matter of preference... this was my first time in an all inclusive hotel and realized it is simply not my style. Appart from that, this hotel delivered everything the other reviews or their website promised. Great accomodations, great pool, great food....etc The highlight of our trip was really the Kid's Club and their amazing staff. A big thank you to Laura, Gina, Sandra & Cynthia for having taken such good care of my 2 little girls. They allowed my wife & I to lounge and relax by the pool and my kids could not wait every day to go back to them. Entertainment by the pool with the famous 'Chicken' is great as well. Tons of energy and also the salsa dancing with Daniella was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “50 and loving it”
Reviews.Author: Pattie_1960
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to an all-inclusive resort. I loved it. The food and drinks were great. The service was over the top. A special thanks to the Lobby Bar Bartender Hugo Mejia for making the Banana Sexy drink. Two other Bartender's from the Lobby Bar Alberto and Dave thanks for the great service with a smile. The service at the il Pescatore restaurant was out of this world - Israel gave us such great service we asked for him the next night along with Filiberto. Our maid Veronica was so nice. We upgraded to a Junior Suite Oceanfront 3rd floor - What an awesome view

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: this was our first visit to Mexico and it was amazing, our stay at the hotel was above our expectations, the food was unbelievable and the staff was second to NONE any where in the world! Isaura and her smile, Huber and his prompt service, come to mind because of these two especially and all the caring staff we will be back, no question

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, spotless Resort, fantastic food and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kerri P
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at Gran Porto Real, Playa Del Carmen for 11 nites and our stay was nothing short of amazing. We it dubbed our holiday of a lifetime & it’s really going to take something incredible to beat it. The beautiful individuals that make up the GPR team are caring and attentive, always greeting you with a hand on their heart, “Hola” and a smile. Our sincere and heartfelt thanks to the following individuals (in no specific order) who helped make our special holiday a very special holiday: Miriam, Hiram, Cecelia and Elizabeth, Tereza, Rebecca, Hugo and Alex. Chris, Jesus, Mari, Yuliana and of course Captain Elizar. Also to Thelma and Sarah (housekeeping). Thankyou again, you are wonderful people and we wish you all the very best. I will part with …”Aussie, Aussie, Aussie, Oi, Oi, Oi” Larry and Kerri Piggott, Tasmania, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday party”
Reviews.Author: RedTed_10
Reviews.Content: This is our annual trip to celebrate 50 Birthday parties. We always go to this place because the staff is so fabulous and we feel very safe traveling there. We love the entertainment crew, Victor, Cesar, and Danella. The pool wait staff Jose and Teresa are also the best. We had our birthday dinner in the main dining area, Juan was fabulous in making our celebration the best! We can't wait until next year!

Reviews.Title: “make your dreams come ture our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: HappyFeet010
Reviews.Content: youweDreams do come true starting r lives together , they madeit all possible the staff go wayout of their way to make magic happen capitan FREDDY,JUANMTOS,VICTOR,JORSE TUCUCH ,Miguel lopez,David duello Poncho,sherly,Morisol Marina,LORENZO<ALEJANDRO<VENTURA<NAIROBEand AARON thease are the very best employees that we expenicedthey made us feel at home it was the most wonderful honeymoon and 50birthday ever!!!!! full of fun ,excitment ,great intertament and the food we rate5 and the service was out standing ,we will be back .we miss the staff they are the very best ,most friendly mexico people hard working Very help full and they treat you like gold ,when its time to retire wepick mexico to make it home. god blessyou for making magic and dreams come true !!!!!!!!! its very family friendly to.we are from canada Cawston B C

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, perfect size, great staff”
Reviews.Author: AlyG68
Reviews.Content: For an "all exclusive" I was very impressive by the choice of restaurant. Our favorite was Maria's and the staff was fantastic and spoiled us. On the beach, Jesus took care of us all day long with laughter and cocktails. Antonia & Miguel at the Albatros at night were a blast. Loved the in room drinks and water - so handy when you just wanted to hang out on the patio. My only complaint - fellow travelers: people who allow their children to scream and run up and down the hallways at the crack of dawn. the only reason I wouldn't return to this hotel is because I am interested in an adult only resort. It is a shame this hotel has to suffer because so many people let their children turn into wild animals just because they are not at home.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: janjan3839
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Playa Del Carmen. The stay at the Gran Porto Real was incredible. The first time visiting the property, but I will definitely consider returning. The Hotel location was wonderful, and our room, an ocean front junior suite, 319, had to have been the best room in the hotel, The views were unbelievable, with the pool below, and ocean beyond that, large living area plenty of storage, and a wonderful marble bath. This was my first experience with an all inclusive, after having taken several cruises. The food was good, something for everyone, with lots of fresh fruits available, and a choice of two more formal restaurants for dinner. The service at all the dining rooms was fabulous, but our server at the Il Pescatore's, Filberto and Israel were top notch and we were glad that we could seat in their section two nights in a row. The Bar staff were so attentive, that they soon became friends and it was hard to say good bye at the end of the Stay. The lobby bar is lucky to have Dave, Hugo and Alberto. The beach staff, also Oscar, Miriam andTheresa, thanks for making the trip a wonderful experience. I miss you all and hope that if I get back to visit, you are still there. The Programs were fun and got me involved in things that I may not have, if the staff wasn't so inviting, Chicken got me into the water aerobic class, and towel folding, Daniella taught me some Espanol, so now yo entiendo un paquito de espanol. The resort like I said, wonderful, the experience an A+, will I return, I hope too, but for now, Hasta Luego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations with terrible beach”
Reviews.Author: bustermania
Reviews.Content: Just returned Dec 8 and was a bit disappointed with the overall stay at the GPR. The food was good but lack of choices with only 3 restaurants. We upgraded to a front ocean suite on the 3rd floor with a beautiful view which it made a difference. They were in the process of extending the beach by adding more sand but it is a very slow work project, I'm guessing it is very typical in Mexico. Also, we called room service several times to have extra beer brought to our room but every time it was difficult to come with our demands eventhough we tipped the staff very generously. Overall we had a good time and met nice people but would not return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: widyse
Reviews.Content: Teresa,Meriam,Pablo,Jesus,Jose,Ivan,Ricardo,Cecilia,Elizabeth,Eleazar,Sherley,Trini,Jaime, Tom and all the others working in the nr.1 hotel in Mexico the GRAN PORTO REAL we want to say thank you from the bottom of our hearts,for another great vacation.This was our 6th time,and it felt like coming back to friends,but we missed one friend Rodrigo at the Albatross,we really hope he is feeling well again.So once again Thank you all and we want to wish everybody working in our nr 1 hotel Feliz Navidad y Prospero Ano Nuevo. from Mieke and Wilma La dos hermanas de hollanda.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: My son and his wife got married Nov 15/11 on the beach at the Gran Porto Real and it was awesome. We had a group of 26 adults and 2 children. Everyone had a wonderful time. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The food was great, especially the Albatross buffet and the Italian restaurant. Room service was also very good and a nice treat! I had read some reviews that the beach was not good, but our group found the beach to be just fine. The resort has done a wonderful job of re-building the beach after the hurricane(s). Yes, there are sandbags at the water's edge, but nothing that takes away from using the beach or the water. The hotel is close to shopping and clubs. I highly recommend this hotel and I will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: gothic1
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd stay at the Gran Porto Real. We just can’t express enough what a great place this is. You can walk anywhere on the property and the employees are always smiling and asking how everything is and wanting to make sure that you have everything you need. From the start of our vacation in the lobby to the end we always feel like we meet so many friends. I don’t mean to sound corny but the employees are amazing. From the start Aaron took care of our luggage when we arrived and took care of us the whole week. He was always helping us out with any questions. Aaron ways had a smile and a hug when we saw him. The security is great – they are constantly checking the beach day and night and they are always making sure you have a bracelet on when you enter and leave – the bracelets are not uncomfortable nor do you even realize they are on. We thought the 24 hour place had upgraded since last year. They had very good finger type foods and plenty of beverages. I have to mention Teresa – I met her the 1st time we stayed there and she still remembers us when we come back. She normally works the beach but when we were there she was in the Lobby Bar. She is such a nice person and always has a kind word to say. She is the best. We always had breakfast at Albatros - the omelets are fantastic and if you don’t want that there are many other things you can find or they will make it for you. We did lunch at the beach stand Parrillada Grill – great nachos and french fries -also had hamburgers and hotdogs. At night we would go to Maria’s or il Pescatore. Service is excellent at both places and so is the food – we did like the change of menu each night at Maria’s but il Pescatore had super lasagna. We also noticed that people from the Royal were enjoying the restaurants at the Gran Porto. We did room service one night – very good. Very prompt and they asked us to give them a call when we were done and they were up to our room immediately to pick up the trays. The service at the beach - can’t say much more the EXCELLENT. All you have to do is ask and they will get you what you want. If your drink is not strong enough just let them know and they will get you a stronger one. Always came by with water – good idea. We were on 2nd floor ocean front – nice big balcony with a roof – which I would ask for next time. Before we had a small balcony and no roof – we enjoy sitting outside for cocktails at night and it was nice to have a bigger area. Watching the hotel and ocean change into nighttime was great. We were by the pool area and could watch the entertainment from our balcony. The entertainment was over at a reasonable hour so loud noises were not an issue. The shower is super – I have to laugh but when we were there last year our group was always commenting on the showers. Very roomy and good water pressure. Plenty of room to put toiletries in the shower and very nice towels. The bathroom is large. Safe is big enough for a netbook – probably a laptop but I did not have that. We liked the beds – thought they were comfortable – they were on the hard side but that is what we like. It’s a very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A second Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: jmorin
Reviews.Content: Wow, we stayed for Nov 28 to dec 3 and we had amazing time. The hotel is very clean..very very, well located and the food is so good (try the tournedos at the Italian restaurant, is tenderloin, so good!) The staff is always smiling, there is staff everywhere, it's a very all-included vacation! The only thing that I can complain of is the beach, clean but when you want to get in to the water, is...."rocky"..Well a place to go and to come back for sure! The hotel slogan is "Exceeding your expectations", and they really are able to do it. Every nites we went walking on 5th avenue, at 1 block away from the hotel. There you can shop souvenirs, there's also alot of cafes and restaurants. But watch out, the sellers are a little agressive to ask you to come in there store. The hotel is directly from the center of all activities. You can go to Cozumel ferry in 15 min and to walmart in 10 min by foot.I found big seashell few meters from the hotel...Great!

Reviews.Title: “place is ok”
Reviews.Author: grum09
Reviews.Content: this place was ok , not the best food or rooms but the people are nice ...if u get a chance to upgrade to the royal across the street do it !!!.....that place is A++

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Porto for a week while attending a wedding. Most of the wedding guests stayed next door at the Royal which is a little bit nicer, but you're just a wrist band over there. I really am glad we booked at the Gran Porto. The staff is, without a doubt the best I've ever experienced in Mexico. The food is phenomenal and it's just got a great atmosphere. The room service was top notch and overall its just a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our fourth time here and we come back next year”
Reviews.Author: Birgitkessel
Reviews.Content: It was our 4th time at GPR and we`ll come back next year.The Staff as every year is amazing. The rooms are very well maintained and the maid left a towel animal every morning. Many thanks to the bartenders and Wait Staff Jose, Aurelia Pablo, Miriam, Jesus, Dave, Cecilia, Rebecca, Adriana and Hector. To the waiters in the Restaurant Albatros Chucco, Yiuliana and of course don`t forget Ivan. We got wonderful omelets every day from May. And last not least many thanks to Felipe, the bartender, who served at the Sushi Bar near the relaxing pool.This was our favourite place every morning till one. They all are amazing, We are looking forward coming back next year in November again

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: aynz29
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Gran Porto Real was unforgettable. The place was beautiful, right on the beach and close to shopping. The service was Amazing, while there you really get to know the staff because everyone is so friendly... Miguel and Avila did an awesome job bartending. I would recommend this resort to anyone who is planning a trip to Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “10th time”
Reviews.Author: shelbyj01
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 10th time to the Gran Porto Real, our group this year consisted of 8 people, upon arriving Miriam was there with a tray of ice cold drinks for our arrival, the only glitch this year was that the front desk staff was not aware that we were return guest to the hotel, once we explained the situation they were more than happy to help us upgrade our rooms as soon as they were available!! Pablo our dear friend on the beach was there to greet us with open arms and excellent serviceas well as Jesus and Theresa. The food in the restaurants was as delisioso as always, the rooms are beautiful and clean. We are already looking forward to our 11th trip to The Gran Porto Real, Thanks again for a great holiday!!!! Shelley & Stephen,Terry & Don, Darlene & Glen, Marie & Lorie

Reviews.Title: “Best yet”
Reviews.Author: Burtode
Reviews.Content: As a somewhat extensive traveller, I have been to many many carribean destinations and hotels. The gran Porto real ( playa del Carmen ) is absolutely at the top of the list.... Without question. The hotel is situated right down town so no cabbing or busing to shop! And it's on the beach as well. Although the hotel is not massive and sprawling like others..... It's meticulously clean, the staff is extremely friendly... Especially Pablo, our poolside wAiter, the activities and entertainment was endless and the food was good

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: dlmimarketing
Reviews.Content: We worked with a travel agent to book our trip to Playa. We had a few places to choose from and after going on Trip Advisor, we chose this place. SO GLAD we did! The staff is beyond amazing. Avila and Miguel made the best drinks. Pablo was the best pool/beach waiter! The entertainment staff Chicken and Armando got us involved in a ton of activities. The room was very nice and spacious. The cleanliness of the entire property was superior! Seriously, I don't think I ever saw ANY garbage anywhere. We were so sad to leave but will definitely return and recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jeanie D
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Mexico. This was our first time staying at the Gran Porto. We will definitely be back. There were six of us (two adults and four teenagers 13, 14, 19 & 19). It was an amazing eight days. The staff are always friendly and helpful. The rooms are very well maintained, spotless. The maid left a different towel animal each morning. The kids loved this. The mini bar is kept well stocked. An extra bed was brought in for us. The food is really good. There is poolside and beach service. Great location with a swim friendly beach. There are boogie boards and kayaks included. The hotel is just a couple of blocks from 5th Avenue shopping. They also have ping pong, pool tables, etc. There is nightly entertainment. They really think of everything and have everything. We could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa ~ 5 Diamond Property ~ 10 Diamond Team”
Reviews.Author: BurlingtonChica
Reviews.Content: First let me begin with a very sincere and heartfelt thank you to the Gran Porto Real “TEAM” for the information and safety provided during the “Rina” days, in October. All of the staff kept the guests well informed and extremely safe before, during and after “Rina” made her grand appearance. A very special mention to the Maintenance Team, Gardeners and Housekeeping who worked around the clock to ensure the Resort was picture perfect. Actually, this is the norm for these extremely hard working individuals, not just during a hurricane or tropical storm. “Beyond Expectations” ~ “Expect the Exceptional” ~ these words have never had so much meaning except when describing the Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa, and everyone who makes this incredible Resort so very special. There are not enough words to describe the amazing Team who make up the Gran Porto Real Family. From the Airport pick up by “Best Day”, the arrival at the GPR Reception, to the end of your stay; every aspect imaginable to create a vacation of a lifetime will be accomplished by the amazing Gran Porto Real TEAM. This incredible Team of very sincere, talented, caring and devoted individuals goes above and beyond in every aspect and detail of this Resort. All of the very special people who make up this exceptional Team ensures that your visit is in fact “Beyond your Expectations”. They accomplish this mission with amazing smiles that would brighten any rainy day, but most of all their care and concern for all guests comes from the bottom of their hearts, and this shows in every aspect of this Resort. My Mom and I have been so very privileged and lucky to have visited this amazing Resort 5 times, and each time our stay has been PERFECT. The service, food preparation & presentation, the entertainment, safety and cleanliness is exceptional and yes, PERFECT in every way. Don Fernando, Dona Lynn and Don Nicolas, a very special thank you for creating such a beautiful and exceptional Resort that we are so very proud to call our home away from home. We are so very honored to include and call everyone in the GPR Team our friends and family. The Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa is a 5 Star/5 Diamond Resort; however, this exceptional group of individuals are a “10 Diamond” Team. From the Lifeguards/Security, Reception/Bellboys, Chefs, Bartenders, Waiters/Waitresses, Management, to the very special people who take such pride in making this Resort so very clean and beautiful, together they make a perfect Team, which is the Gran Porto Real Family. From the bottom of our hearts a very, very special and sincere thank you to the following amazing individuals in our GPR family: Ciro, Cruz, Eduardo, Pedro, Freddy, Julio, Aaron, Claudia, Yendaly, Jordi, Laura, Enrique, Paul, Astrid, Cinthya and Jose Luis. Your hard work, care and concern certainly does not go unnoticed. From the amazing Spa Azul ~ Karina, Sergio y Magna, and all of the Spa personnel. What a great way to either begin or end a fabulous vacation. A special thank you to Victor and the amazing Dive Team; another great way to experience the beautiful Mayan Riviera with the number one dive team!! The very creative and talented Chefs: Chef Rene, Chef Jose and Chef Jorge ~ all of the GPR Chefs are included in this heartfelt thank you!!! The most amazing and hardest working Bartenders and Wait Staff who ensure your days and evenings are very well looked after and their service is definitely “10 Diamond”: Miguel Luna, David Ancona, Lorenzo Avila, David, Jesus, Alejandro (Alex), Hector, Hiram, Hugo, Chris, Aurelio, Jose and the morning Pool Bar Team, Teresa, Jesus, Pablo, Jose, Elizabeth, Cecilia, Carolina, Rebeca and Miriam. From the outstanding Albatros Restaurant ~ La Señora who makes the most amazing omelets, May, Florenzio, Ivan, Mora, Lorenzo, Huber and Ezeaquis and all of the wonderful Chefs ~ all of the staff are exceptional, I am very sorry if I have missed mentioning anyone. I am sorry that we missed Rodrigo on this trip; hope to see you the next time!! From the amazing Mexican Restaurant ~ Marie’s ~ the wonderful Chefs ~ waiters Rigo, Elias. All of the amazing waiters are exceptional at Marie’s. Love the new menu at this outstanding Mexican Restaurant. Each night the menu is prepared representing a different state in Mexico. A very special thank you to our friend Elias and your team who make the most amazing Mayan coffees and made sure that we wanted for nothing. All of the individuals at Marie’s ensure that your visit is memorable. IL Pescatore Italian Restaurant ~ the wonderful Chefs ~ gracias Chef Jose, amazing waiters Jose, Mateo, Verlain, Amador, Pepe, Daniel, Luis, Domingo, Johnny, Filberto, Salvador and everyone who ensured our visits were very welcomed and memorable. The food, presentation and especially the service is such a refreshing and welcoming experience. IL Pescatore Restaurant and the incredible team are exceptional in every way. Another huge thank you to Edgar, Ricardo and the wonderful Room Service Team ~ muchas gracias Francisco!! A very heartfelt thank you to the most amazing Sports & Entertainment Team who ensure that your days and nights are filled with a lot of fun and wonderful memories. This wonderful Team works countless hours day and night making sure that all guests are well entertained. All of the evening shows are incredible and a must see. Mil abrazos ~ Miguel Morales, Victor (Chicken), Cesar, Armando, Daniela, Rodrigo, Jesus and Eliseas. An extra special and heartfelt thank you to the amazing individuals who keep us so very safe, and they are the Lifeguards and Security Team ~ Rogelio, Alexis, Rafael, Manuel (Manu), Javier, Miguel, Victor Manuel and the entire Security Team. A little reminder, all of these amazing individuals work extremely hard to ensure that all tourists have the vacation of a lifetime….so please remember to tip these incredible individuals who actually make your vacation so memorable. Also, please take the time to say Hola and smile….it costs nothing and is a joy to receive. Last, but certainly not least, a very, very special thank you to the amazing Management Team ~ Lynn, Nicolas, Carlos Melgar, Jordi, Miguel Lopez, Miguel Morales, Manuel and Marcella (Marie’s), Arturo and Delia (IL Pescatore’s), Eleazar (Elizar), Ricardo, Eduardo, Edgar and Shirly (Albatros). To all of the tourists from around the world who have never had the opportunity to visit Mexico or have listened to all of the negative reviews, comments or news casts regarding Mexico; you are truly missing out on a very special experience and meeting the most beautiful people in the world. There is more to Mexico than drugs and tequila. Open your eyes and minds and broaden your horizons to experience one of the most beautiful cultures and countries in the world, which is MÉXICO. Why not start by visiting the Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa, the gem of the Mayan Riviera!!!! Again, I am very sorry if I have excluded mentioning anyone, it was not intentional. Mi Familia Gran Porto Real para siempre en mi corazon. PARA NUESTRA FAMILIA GRAN PORTO REAL, UN MUY SINCERO AGRADECIMIENTO DESDE EL FONDO DE NUESTROS CORAZONES. REALMENTE TE PIERDAS TODOS MUCHO!!! HASTA PRONTO!!! MIL ABRAZOS!!! Laura y Mama Lynda.

Reviews.Title: “Superb First Holiday in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: abattoir
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks in room 246 which is a junior suite with partial sea view and a small balcony. The room was kept spotless and the cleaner left us a different towel animal every day which was really sweet. Our room included 4 optics with a litre of non-branded vodka, rum ,whisky and tequila, and our mini bar was re-stocked daily with bottled water, beer and soft drinks. The beach was so goegeous that I walked along it every morning and watched the fishermen sailing out and also throwing nets from the beach. The main buffet restaurant called The Albatross had the most amazing choices for breakfast. Ranging from made to order omelettes, scrambled egg, fried egg, fresh fruit, sliced meats and cheeses, freshly squeezed fruit juices (about 8 different types) croissants, porridge, sausages, various mexican breakfast dishes that I had never heard of, chicken nuggets (yes thats right! LOL) jams, yogurts, freshly made waffles and pancakes, various breads. The only thing I can criticise is the toaster. Its a huge thing that looks like it was made about 20 years ago and is so so slowwwww. We must have spent ages queing at the toaster, waiting for it to pop out at the bottom. But thats a monir gripe really. There is a snack bar on the beach which opens at 11-30am and serves basic food like hot dogs, burgers, tortilla chips, cheese sauce,beef chilli, chips and fresh fruit. The other 2 restaurants, one Italian and one Mexican are also free to use whenever you want. The service was excellent and the food was pretty good too. There's a 24 hour self service "cafe" just past reception which has a choice of about 7 different dishes such as chilli, soft cheeses, fruit, danish pastries, cereal, meat skewers, mainly things to snack on. It also has a selection of spirits to help yourself to e.g. smirnoff vodka, bacardi (normal and gold) tequila, gin, whisky and also various wines, tea and coffee and a soft drinks dispenser and a beer pump! I heard there was a bottle of Baileys one night, but someone pinched it! This is also where there are 4 computers with internet access. 20 minutes costs 20 pesos (about a quid). The pool was fairly small, but the hotel is right on the beach, so it didn't really matter. Plenty of sunbeds on the beach and the waiters were amazing, constantly checking if you needed a top-up. We were regulars at the tradeWinds bar located near the Jetty and Dave the barman made some brilliant cocktails, my favourite was the "Mexican Flag". Try asking for one if you go. There were plenty of activites organised during the day e.g. bike rides, kayaking, spanish lessons, water aerobics, beach volleyball. The local is located about 200metres from fifth avenue where there are lots of touristy shops, bars and restaurants. We went to the Texan Burger restaurant a couple of times because the food was really great - onion rings to die for! There are plent of places to visit in the area, we went to Xel-ha (google it) and swam with Manatees which was amazing. Overall I would say the staff are some of the best I have ever met. Very efficient and always smiling which is very unusual. Our holiday at Gran Porto was superb and I am hoping to come back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “gran porto real-something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Barbara B
Reviews.Content: Nine women went for a two week getaway and we had a great time. I wish I had more info befor we went. Such as they will put up umbrellas on the beach for you if you ask and fifth avenue is more fun one direction than the other. We upgraded to an ocean front room and am very glad we did-so much more to see. The staff was really good especially our dining room waiters Ivan, Daniel and Huber. I would love to go back and go on more of the tours.

Reviews.Title: “Bad bad bad”
Reviews.Author: noellemd
Reviews.Content: I go to a lot of all inclusives, and this one was the worst. While the hotel itsself was nice and the location is good (hence two stars), the food was terrible, the drinks were even worse, and the kids club was a flop. To top it off, the beach is held together by sand bags which you have to climb over to get into the water. Once you get to the water, the bottom is so rocky (sharp rocks!) that you can't enjoy yourself. SO ugly! My kids dibbed it "sand bag beach". Three days in to our seven day vacation, we were ready to leave. Save your money and DON'T go here.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay if you want to be close to 5th Ave in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: skeetzoid
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen. 2 things that we really liked about this hotel: 1. The location is great - step out of the lobby and you’re 1 minute walk to 5th Ave. 2. The staff is so friendly and accommodating. Willy from the welcome desk was very charming. Our waiters Juan Cavich and Amabiael were so attentive that my wife found it difficult to stay thin and sober during our week stay.
