There’s also a Mario Lopez-lookalike at their italian restaurant Piscatore that she had the hots for. Don’t forget to try the nachos at the 24 hour Lounge at the lobby. They taste great like authentic Mexican homemade tortilla chips, not the commercial kind from Doritos. If you plan to visit the Mayan ruins (Chichen Itza, Tulum, Coba), we highly recommend getting Gonzalo from GoNatural as your tour guide (you can book the trips directly at the hotel lobby). He is the most entertaining and knowledgeable tour guide in the area. If you’re not laughing from his funny anecdotes and antics, you’ll be deep in thought thinking about the alternative theories he discusses on Mayan history and culture. He’s very passionate about his job, and some of the things you’ll hear will blow your mind. We were fortunate enough to visit Coba while the government still allows tourists to climb up the steps of the tallest pyramid in Yucatan, the Nohoch Mul pyramid. Don’t miss the Coba tour, because (like Chichen Itza and Tulum) climbing up the pyramid will be forbidden soon by the Mexican government.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real what a great discovery! (ask for Avila and Miguel @ poolbar)”
Reviews.Author: VictorNava
Reviews.Content: Excellent attention, excellent food, excellent ocean view, the perfect vacation. Our wonderful experience started the very second we stepped in the lobby. The location: second to none, just in front of the beack whith a beautiful dock view, and just 2 blocks away from 5th ave... If you go visit, go straight to the pool bar and ask for Avila or Miguel, two of the best barmen i've ever known...wonderful human beings!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort, the Staff went over and above their duties”
Reviews.Author: Lia G
Reviews.Content: I love this resort. I just went on my second trip and once again, the staff outdid themselves. My first trip to this result was for my wedding. I arrived and thought it was a dream. The resort was very beautiful, room ocean front, white sand, and the bluest water I've ever seen. My wedding was perfect, the kind little girls dream about. This trip was just as perfect. The staff at this resort were outstanding. Upon arrival, we needed to switch rooms and the woman at the front desk (Claudia) went out of her way to make us extremely happy. This continued throughout our entire trip, she went over and above and made our stay at the GPR impeccable. Two waiters on the beach, brothers ( Pablo and Jesus ) also for both trips made us feel very special, treated us like family. They remembered us from our wedding 1.5 yrs ago, which I found amazing and that alone made me feel very important to them. They were efficient and very good at their jobs. The staff at the Grand Porto Real made our vacation truly luxurious and we will definitely be returning again. Thank you Claudia, Pablo and Jesus Sincerely Grateful

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road... would NOT go back”
Reviews.Author: Radiati0nTherapist39
Reviews.Content: We are generally not complainers, so we had to be quite disappointed to actually write a review. We are not beach, pool or outside activity sort of people, so for our needs this hotel did not meet our expectations in the least. Heavy mould smell (almost suffocating) in the elevator, shower, and one entire wing of the hotel. The rooms are nicely air conditioned, but the buffet, hallways are not (open to the outside), so it is sweltering hot and uncomfortable to enjoy. Room balcony was so small it was difficult for 2 people to enjoy a drink out there. Food was mediocre cafeteria food and was very disappointing. There is no one enforcing hand gel usage at the entrance of the restaurants. We were looking very forward to visiting the Mexican restaurant, Maria's, but it was mostly American dishes and was sadly lacking the yummy Mexican food we were craving. The Italian restaurant was good. The room (Jr Suite Ocean View) had a gorgeous view and was spacious, but we had to call Maintenance to fix the air conditioner that leaked a puddle on the floor, and to fix the shower that wouldn't drain. A soft drink accidentally blew up in our fridge and it took 3 days for housekeeping to clean it! Be aware all restaurants shut down at 10 or 11pm except the 24hr snack bar which has about 4 or 5 items (which were dried up & horrible). No room service after 10pm. If you have late night munchies, you're out of luck. Very limited activities & shows (1 an hour but not a great variety). Free alcohol but drinks were mediocre and inconsistently made. You never know what you'd get! Pool closes 9pm. I do have to say that all of the staff we encountered were incredibly pleasant, friendly, and the majority spoke English enough to communicate. Hotel in a fantastic area with shopping a couple of blocks away on 5th Avenue. Good night life until 11pm - streetside bars & restaurants. Lots of little street shops open til 10 or 11pm. Wal-Mart is close enough to walk. All the locals we encountered were quite friendly and spoke quite decent English which can make non-Spanish-speaking visitors comfortable. Taxis everywhere with friendly drivers asking if you need one. But mostly everything you'll need is within walking distance. For many tours, hotel has a bus that will pick you up so you don't have to worry about that. Forget about wearing pants in this sweltering humidity. Shorts, tanks, dresses, bathing suits. Lots of little places within a couple of blocks open until 10 or 11pm. Some restaurants & bars open later. Great little Cuban bar nearby with live entertainment. Not much in the hotel itself. There are some "tacky" shows at nightime in the hotel, but virtually nothing after 8:30pm, so you will have to go outside the hotel if you're looking for something to do besides get drunk on free alcohol.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location....will be back”
Reviews.Author: Sands76
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my second visit at the Gran Porto in PLaya del Carmen and once again I am delighted with my experience at the hotel. The staff are simply outstanding in all areas of the hotel. From the front desk staff who were helpful and always friendly to the maids. Service was top notch. The food at the a la cartes is great. Its nice to not be limited to eat in them. Marias was my favourite the staff were fantastic. Maricella and Manuel were the perfect hosts and always took good care of us and Rigo was great...kept the wine flowing and always spot on with his recommendations for the night. I loved that the menu changed to different regions of Mexico....everything we ate was to die for. We found the buffett a delight every morning and lunch with plenty of options to suit even the most picky eaters. The service in the buffett was always exceptional...big thanks to Carlos and Mora. I'm a beach girl and spent most of my time walking up and down the beach. I love the fact that you feel like you are in Mexcio and can watch the fisherman get ready for their working day. Sand bags are not an issue at all in fact make a great place to sit and enjoy a cold cerveza :) The beach was great...plenty of chairs...very clean and the service from the beach staff outstanding, always greeted with a smile and a beer. Carlos, Jesus, Miriam and Jose....muchos gracias. My only complaint about the hotel would be that the rooms are starting to feel a little tired. Perhaps a fresh coat of paint and some new furniture would go along way to making a lovely room much grander! Overall though it was a wonderful experience. I am already booked to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort in the best Playa del Carmen location.”
Reviews.Author: NicolefromCalgary
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful resort close to shopping, nightlife and restaurants. Very safe and friendly. Excellent service, especially the pool and beach waiters. Visit Pablo and Jesus. They will keep you drinking the best Margaritas and Mojitos all day long. The rooms are very clean and comfortable but quite noisy (could be the concrete construction). Music goes til very late at night so if you want quiet you may want to try the Royal next door. For families though this is probably the best in Playa del Carmen. We came for a wedding and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: curtis_rak
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 week at the Gran Porto for a wedding during the second week of Nvoember, 2011 and very much enjoyed the stay. The food at the buffet was basic and decent, but nothing too fancy. The two a la carte restaurants (marias and il pescatore) were both very good. Although the portions were average, the food quality was great in the dishes that we tried throughout the week. The lunch-area near the beach (i forget the name) was consistently good. Id like to make a special comment in relation to Pescatore restaurant. Our group went on a fishing trip on day and brought (2) barracuda back to the hotel for preparation by the restaurant. The staff took a lot of care in ensuring that the fish was prepared to our liking and also arranged a special dinner reservation for our group to feast. When the food arrived, it was prepared WAY BEYOND OUR EXPECTATIONS. The kitchen staff did an unbelieveable job in accommodating our request. I would have never expected the resort to take this much care in fulfilling our request. Onward, our room was very clean, although starting to shows some signs of age. Getting fresh linens and supplies were never an issue during our stay. Our room was situated at the north-end of the resort and due to the configuration of ours and 4 other suite doors being very close together, we were able to hear every single door close and open, and every door knock which did wake us up a few times. I suspect this problem is isolated to only a few certain areas of the hotel. The pool area was great at the Gran Porto. It was spotless (as was the entire resort) and the service by the beachside and poolside waiters/waitresses was outstanding. The service that we received from all employees was top notch. Everyone was friendly and helpful. I would return to this resort if I got back to Playa Del Carmen, and was definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel and Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Linzforber
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and myself have recently come back from 2 weeks at the GPR, and we have had a brilliant holiday! The food and service at the hotel is brilliant, the Italian restaurant being our favourite of them all!! The rooms were gorgeous, we upgraded before we went to the Junior Suite, which im glad we did, it was well worth the difference in price!! The staff at this hotel work so hard, they are constantly cleaning, painting and serving you with drinks, they are an asset to the hotel!! The hotel is also perfectly positioned at the heart of 5th Avenue, the bus station is at the other end of the avenue so you can easily get to Cancun if you want to save money and not get a taxi! The beach is gorgeous, myself and my boyfriend walked it every day! Okay, there are a number of sandbags on the beach right outside the hotel, but this is too stop the beach from eroding, what else can they do? Without them there would be no beach!! Once you step over them which it is easy to do the water is clear, or just walk a couple of meters down the beach past all the boats and you have perfect flat sand and sea!! Cant complain! We visited this hotel as part of a package holiday with Thomson / First Choice, the rep at the hotel was called Ricky! He was brilliant, so helpful. We booked a lot of trips with him and he gave us loads of advice about local attractions, shops and restaurants, as well as tips on how to deal with the shop owners on 5th avenue! Thanks Ricky for making us feel at ease on holiday! The only negative point I have about the hotel, and it was quite important, was the noise within the room we had. It was as if the walls were paper thin, noisy boys next door, music down the street, footsteps and trolleys going down the corridor above and outside did become very annoying, when they wake you up in the middle of the night. I know it would be hard to do much about this, but it is a big flaw in the hotel. Despite the above myself and my boyfriend would definitely return to this hotel. We would more than likely visit Cancun next time, but will probably stay at a Real Resort there due to the fabulous 2 weeks we had! Thank you so much to all the staff!! You made our holiday very special!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous People!”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi33
Reviews.Content: This resort is great! The service is outstanding! This was my second time to stay at this the Gran Porto and I will be back again. I have no complaints. The bartenders; Avula, cristopher, and Miguel where always so accommodating. The waitress in the lobby were so sweet. The entertainment team (Cesar, Armondo, Chicken, Daniella) made me feel a part of the family. And the beach waiter, Pablo and Jesus, just excellent! It is a very relaxing and fun place to stay. Simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday, Beautiful Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Denise M
Reviews.Content: My son got married in Playa at the Grand Porto Real Nov 08 2011. 56 people attended the wedding. Everyone had a great time. The service was amazing. A bunch of the boys went fishing and caught several fish. They gave most of it to the people that took them out but did bring back a Marlin which chef Maurico and captain Antonio prepared for us. They did a fantastic job. The staff are very friendly and helpful (Thelma the housekeeper is great). We would go back in a heart beat and highly recommend it to anyone wanting a great holiday. Location is great, close to all great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paulina D
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awesome and the service was beyond!!! Pablo, from the beach staff was amazing! I had a great time at the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Mother - Daughter Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Pamela S
Reviews.Content: Don't get caught up in the ratings number game. This resort currently is rated #20 and should be in the top 10!!! This was my 6th visit to the Maya Riveria in 10 years and this resort is way under rated. The location is about the best you can get besides The Royal. My daughter (25 years old) and myself (50 years old) decided to take a girls trip and spent over a week searching and decided on the Gran Porto Real. If I had based my decision on ratings, we probably would NOT of stayed here because so many other resorts were rated higher; but am I glad we stayed at the Gran Porto Real. Everything was fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “what a great resort!”
Reviews.Author: chriscmah
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a really great week at the Gran Porto Real. We booked with Westjet Vacations and the transfers to and from the airport to resort were seamless. Check in was a breeze as well. We didn't bother upgrading, the room was great! Lots of room and space for 2 girls. All the staff were great too, Jose at the pool bar kept us well supplied with drinks all day...we didn't discover till the last day that they can make caesars for all you Canadians out there, nothing like a morning coffee with baileys and then a caesar. We had dinner once at the Mexican restaurant which was really good and 2x at the Italian one, we loved the pasta there. The buffet was great too. All the staff were very nice and accommodating. Daniella and Alex, the entertainment people were very friendly and great fun. We didn't want to participate in anything but they were a joy to talk to. The location is ideal too...steps away from 5th Ave so if you were going stir crazy on the resort you can get away for a bit easily. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Leeann D
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel very pleasant and the staff amazing! Jesus provided amazing beach service and always seemed to know when our drinks were getting low!! Migel and Jesus at the pool bar always had the biggest smiles and were too happy to serve us! They made our stay much more special! We will definately be back! See you all next year :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: getawayfromhere
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, sister and I just came back from a week at the Gran Porto. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The room was very nice. We stayed in rooms 320 and 322. The rooms smelled a little musty but not bad. We just opened our balcony door and aired it out every day. The bed was a little harder than we were used to but not too bad. It sounds like I'm being negative but we really liked the resort. The location was wonderful, the beach was beautiful. Yes there were sand bags but that didn't bother us. Plenty of chairs around the pool and the beach. The food was pretty good. Some was very good but a lot was your average buffet food. I'm sorry I didn't get her name but the lady that made the omelettes every morning was fantastic. Also Willy the concierge was exceptional. Everyone who works there that we came in contact with would always greet you with a smile and and "Hola" but those two were special. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Cliff S
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our one week stay at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen. We had a great time during our stay. The service was excellent! Marcos helped us with our room accommodatons. We were originally booked in a family suite overlooking the pool area. However, we asked Marcos if he could move us to a room overlooking the ocean. Marcos said "no problem". He moved us to a room (#239) with an amazing view of the ocean. Thanks much, Marcos! The rest of the staff was just as accommodating. In particular, Delia, Tonny, Eduardo & Jesus deserve special recognition. They each went out of thier way to make our stay at Gran Porto Real a "special" one. For example, Tonny sent a piece of chocolate cake to our room for our 5 year old. He noticed she was sad earlier in the day so he asked her to name her favorite dessert. She told Tonny that she liked chocolate cake. All of the staff at Gran Porto Real go out of there way to make sure guests are comfortable and happy. Thanks again to all of our friends at GPR. We'll definitely be coming back in the future. Best regards, The Singerman Family

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.....”
Reviews.Author: pixie1313
Reviews.Content: Let me premise my review with the fact we had upgraded and stayed at the Royal (their sister hotel across the street) which was incredible. We stayed at the Porto our last 2 days because the Royal was booked. After staying at the Royal, it was really hard to compare. The rooms (standard) were pretty hokey. In their defense, they were clean. Staff seemed nice enough, my husband could not find anybody to give him change (so we could tip). The buffet wasn't so hot but again the staff was polite. Both days we were gone on excursions, so we really didn't get the full flavor of the hotel. I just felt like it was a little low end as far as rooms. Lots and lots of families and kids in strollers, not my type of vacation venue. I'm sure it would work for families with kids but not so much for couples. It was kind of like going to a small carnival after being in Disneyland...kind of a let down, as far as an analogy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: danb7935
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Gran Porto Real. Very nice facilities, the food and service was excellent and the location was wonderful! We especially enjoyed the pool and beach service by Pablo, Jose and Jesus. Aaron the concierge was very helpful in locating our delayed luggage and in providing some helpful hints on the area. Miriam, one of the servers in the inside bar, was very attentive and made our cocktail hour very enjoyable. Carlos in the restaurant was a great server for us! We spent the extra money and upgraded our rooms. This allowed us to enjoy the excellent restaurants available at the resort across the street. Well worth the money! Beautiful beach in each direction for walking or swimming. We will return to this resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service=Superb Experience at the Gran Porto Ral”
Reviews.Author: PSUDanO
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Gran Porto Real was a relaxing, wonderful experience. The property is impeccably maintained; the staff is constantly cleaning and painting. There are some areas that need renovation (bathroom fixtures dated, some cracking masonry) but that does not detract from the experience. And the main experience is the great staff--we did not have a single experience of unpleasant or unhappy staff--every member of their team strove to make our experience a great one. We upgraded to a junior suite--well worth it for the additional space and private balcony. The beds and linens are nice though the matress is quite firm-but my family likes firm matresses. The main pool is nice and there is a "tranquil pool" with jacuzzi and suishi bar on the 3rd floor roof. The beach is pleasant but has suffered a bit of erosion; the hotel is trying to restore it wit sand bags. The food is quite good, especially when taking note this is an all-inclusive. The buffet restaurant does excellent breakfast and lunch with a varying menu, and the specialty restaurants are also good, with the Mexican restaurant offering a revolving menu and the Italian restaurant having a fixed menu. The hotel is just one block from 5th Ave and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuzzblogger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 5 days with my boyfriend recently and we had an awesome experience. I have stayed at more than 20 all inclusive hotels across the Caribbean and this hotel ranks as one of the best. Food was great, service was impeccable, property was spotless. Pools were big and clean, clientele was better than usual for an all inclusive and the location is absolutely the best in the area. You can walk out the front of the hotel and be in a charming little town with restaurants and shops and then you can walk out the back of the hotel and be on a pristine white beach with miles to walk along the coast. We will definitely be back. Special shout out to Pablo, he served us every day at the pool, he was friendly, thoughtful and funny and we never had a moment without a drink. My only comment to the hotel...ditch the sushi bar at the quiet pool, its such a pretty place and the sushi just isnt great or popular with the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real, Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Kimm H
Reviews.Content: Pablo, Jesus, and Jose from the Gaviotas bar were absolutely fantastic. They tended to our every need without us even having to ask. We have stayed at this hotel 6 times in the past 8 years and have never been disappointed with the service, staff, and accomodations. I love coming back to my room and having the towel animals on the bed - so fun. As usual, the food was exceptional, along with all the staff. We'll be back -

Reviews.Title: “BEST SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Holamigo
Reviews.Content: (french canadian writning in english..) Ever had a nightmare in paradise? That's what happened to us... Because of us! But with some help from the staff, everything came back in perspective... Paradise is Gran Porto... Alex, and friends, you're the best. We've travelled a lot, but without a doubt, You're 4 diamonds...

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC VACATION!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: peter m
Reviews.Content: I Would like to thank everyone at the hotel for a great vacation starting with Pablo and Jesus at the pool area.... i never felt so pampered these guys were great..... then Miguel and Jesus at the bar Gaviotas, followed by Ceasar the animator... Tonny (the manager from the Buffet restaurant and our waiter Juan Amabiael, and chef Jorge for our last night request... Great staff.... Im already looking forward for next year ...... And i would also like to add a thank you to JORGE (the COCO BONGO rep.... for his hospitality ..... see you Hermanos next year

Reviews.Title: “Service Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Venier W
Reviews.Content: There are many great hotels to stay in Playa del Carmen on and off the beach. I stayed here because I had a special promotion for this hotel and I was pleasantly surprised on a number of things and appreciated what the hotel had to offer. There are two primary reasons to stay at this hotel. The service provided by housekeeping, room service and restaurant staff were outstanding and I would say the best service in terms of speed, friendliness and going above and beyond in meeting your needs - especially when I did not request anything! Everyone is constantly working incredibly hard. The second reason to stay at the Gran Porto is to eat dinner at Maria's Restaurant every night, it serves excellent Mexican cuisine with a daily regional menu reflective of Mexico's cultural diversity. We had many different servers in all restaurants and everyone was superb, but I would like to mention Huber, Osorio and Mauro, Salvador, Jesus and Mariano. The only improvement I would recommend is that the hotel needs better quality beds, re-modelling and to offer fresh fruit juices at the restaurants instead of can and powdered juices loaded with sugar. Fresh fruit is always available at the buffet but there is no fresh natural juices.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Holiday at Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: Barbadosdreamer
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the GPR on the 16th Oct and arrived to torrential rain. We were a bit concerned about the weather but we were on holiday so it didn't worry us too much. After an hour on the coach we arrived and were greeted with lovely cocktails to start our holiday off. It was quite busy at check in but was an easy process and it went very smoothly, we were offered an upgrade to an walk out ocean front room, which we had a look at but for an extra £750 we decided to stay in the original junior suite that we had booked, and as hurrican Rina hit whilst we were there we were glad we did. The rooms we had were lovely anyway. They were cleaned daily by our lovely maid Lissett who did a fantastic job in both of the rooms we had, The kids had there own room and she made lovely towel art for both rooms. All the staff at the GPR are fantastic, I have never been anywhere that has got such lovely friendly staff. Our favorite staff need a mention so I will start with David in the main pool bar, he was great fun, all the staff at this bar are great and make such lovely cocktails, the beer is good too, my husband loved the beer on draught but my friend and I always drank the cans of Sol, they were freezing cold and soooo good on a hot day. Pablo was great on the beach and was always coming around offering us water and taking our order for any other thing we might fancy at the time, my fav were the mango tangos, yummy, Eduardo was the lovely friendly guy that gave us our towels everyday, he was always so friendly and happy. Alexs (i think that's how you spell it) was the life guard on duty on the beach and did a great job, also sooo friendly and very reassuring when the Hurricane hit, It was our anniversary whilst we were there and my husand and our friends we travelled with booked the Surf & Turf dinner on the beach, I would recommend this to anyone, the food was fantastic and the setting was stunning, I will never forget that night as long as I live, so special, a big thanks to Tom our waiter who made it such a special occassion. Daniella on the entertainment staff is such a lovely girl and has the most beautiful smile, thanks for the aqua aerobics Daniella, it was fun. The food here was unbelievable and so much to choose from, Our fav was the Mexican resturant and we went there a few times, Try the mayan coffees they are supberb. I did get a bit fed up with the buffett but that was only because we all ate far too much and were there for two weeks. Rina arrived on the 27th Oct and she was a Tropical storm by the time she hit us (thank god) but the staff were amazing the whole time and I didn't feel unsafe at any point, I did feel sorry for some of the staff that night as they finished shift at 11pm and had to get home to their own families who they must have been very worried about, but they didn't show it, just kept on looking after us, ( thank you all for that as it must have been hard). Would we return here again? YES YES YES, in a heartbeat, I probably wouldn't ever go again with Thomson/ first choice, it was like going longhaul with easy jet, worst ever experience with an airline, just rubbish, everything is an extra, very small luggage allowance and charged nearly everyone for going over on their luggage allowance, (20kg, not a lot if you are going for 2 weeks) if you go over it is £15 per kilo. Drinks on the plane are pricey and to watch all the films you have to pay extra, So have your purse with plenty of money on the way out and the way back for them. Next time will look at BA probably work out cheaper in the end. Anyway didn't let it ruin our hoilday and had the time of our lives, THANKYOU GPR.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip Well Looked After During Rina!”
Reviews.Author: DaddyFTO
Reviews.Content: First let me say thank you to the many workers who went 24/7 preparing the resort for what was forecast to be a category 3 hurricane with winds of 115mph. Luckily Rina took her time and was a Tropical Storm when she hit Thursday night with winds of 60mph the workers didn’t slow down after the storm had past? We were sitting by the pool in the sunshine with a cold drink Friday morning only hours after a Tropical Storm! It has been mentioned in many reviews that the staff at GPR are the best and I totally agree not that the people at the many other resorts that we have visited were slouches just that the staff at GPR go way beyond what is expected. We only had one grumpy bartender –the dude with the blue shirt at the swing bar who must have a brother in law in management it was a pain for him to serve us- but as a mentioned to Mommy FTO a staff that large with only one bad apple is unbelievable. Some of our favourite staff were Sarah who kept out room spotless and made the most incredible towel sculptures. Felipe who was steps from our room at the sushi bar, always had a smile and a cold “Sol” for Daddy O. And Ivan in the dining room was outstanding as were all the folks who served us for breakfast lunch and dinner. The fact that the resort is so close to 5th avenue is nice for those who like to go into town it is two blocks away. Also it is nice to walk the beach into town or north where the beaches are a little nicer for a dip. Gran Real Porto is great!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Paradise”
Reviews.Author: OParent
Reviews.Content: The first part of this trip review is to thank all the staff and managemet of the Gran Porto Real for helping us navagate through the days leading up to Tropical storm Rina.We visited the resort for 8 nights prior to Tropical Storm Rina,the manager Nicolas Vasquese kept us informed of all the current weather info and made sure his staff was prepared to help the guests and keep us safe at all times. His management style is hands-on and very detailed oriented ! Thank you Nico for calming all out fears. The front desk concierge , a girl Astrid was most helpful in checking flights and airport conditions. We even went down to the front dest at 2am with concerns and they allowed us back into the office to get on the internet to check airport conditions and changes to our flights. Aaron Pat and Alexander Hernandez ,Bell Boys, went out of their way to help us also. Prior to the storm was a week of beautiful sun and sky so I will now discuss the fantastic time we had. The bars: Trade Winds has a new bartender Dave,excellent drinks and always a good time.The umbrella fella,Evelio, at Tradewinds greeted us every morning with a smile and put up our umbrella to keep us cool Beach/pool bar ; Miguel previously at Tradewinds is now there and still holding court with delicious drinks and fun times.David is there with him and sometimes in the Lobby bar too. We invinted a Hurricane Rina drink and it will forever be "our drink" David called it "Rina with a B". The beach drinks were delivered with speed by a most beloved group of tireless workers who bring us joy every time we visit they are. Teresa,Jose,Jesus,Pablo love you guys ! The food was outstanding Eleazer the food manager does a supurb job mixing it up,the ribs out at Parrillada were delish.The addition of Steak Night at Albatros was also a pleasant suprise.Mexican night a huge hit too.The 24 hour room ,staffed by sweet Elizabeth who is also interning at the front desk ,is always kept cool and has different treats and full bar.Elizabeth is a great hostess .Shirley the hostess at Albatros is so friendly and always greets us with a smile. Edwardo at towels continues to help us with our daily spanish lessons never tiring of the fact we are terrible students. Jorge at Il Pescatore and Mariano at Marias served us a special and delishious dinner,the best lamb chops ever! .Patricia our housekeeper thrilled us with towel art everyday she kept our room spotless.Snorkling out front was great many tropical fish to see and the lifeguard Alexis kept a watchful eye on us.There was a new girl just starting ,Adriana, who was pleasant and will make a great addition to the fantastic staff already there. The Mexican restaurant changes the menu nightly and we had some of the best food ever there.Tuna,duck,lamb,corn soup the chef outdid himself. In closing The Gran Porto Real once again proved to be Vacation Paradise for us,give it a try you will love it too. ***Our vacation was extended 3 nights due to Tropical storm Rina(and Delta cancelling all flights) so we went to the Gran Caribe Real in Cancun to be closer to the airport. A trip report also there. But for the record I will say The Real Resorts went above and beyond the usual to see to it our vacation was FANTASTIC !

Reviews.Title: “Think i need to write a review Because this place was so not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: khuckett33
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Grand Porto resort in playa del carmen and don't usually write reports on hotels as people will have there own opinions on places but i really feel i have to on this as i felt very cheated . The hotel staff are great and Miguiel the barman is amazing in the pool bar but the rest was a great let down . The food is very poor and was a great let down had to fill up on breakfast as that was the only one edible . The al carte food was a absolute joke you have to leave the hotel for the two places are up the road and no access from the Hotel . The mexican was not for people that might like there food more for the size 0 model who barely wanted to eat we had to order 2 of everything when we went in there . The italian was hilarious there no lights you basically had to sit in the dark the waiters give you torches to see the menu which was stupid . The Spa was also up the road not on resort and was well well over priced you could go up the road to one of the many other on 5th avenue and get it much better . The beach was very small and not private at all there locals and people working on it constantly as the seaweed is all you can see near the beach . The rooms well where do i start if you booked a standard room your in trouble i have stayed in better hostels across asia they do it on purpose so that you have to upgrade to a junior sweet its all a big con . Be carful not to lose your wrist band or room key as they try to charge you 100 dollars for a new one We changed rooms two times due to problems they were having with them as in leaks where they said they wanted to dig up concrete floor and the air con had a winey noise all night . after being moved twice there was another issue where they want to take down tiling in room and still was not prepared to upgrade us and tried to offer it to us at a discount was a joke i stood firm in the end we got it for free . i paid a lot money for this hotel and well was more impressed with a 3 star in egypt for quality i have noticed that thomson that i booked this with do not now have it on there books only can imagine thats because the problems so if you do book good luck i hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Great staff! Can't wait to be back...”
Reviews.Author: Gbita
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'm not the one who usually takes the time to write a review unless it's a bad one. This one was a must. I traveled with 2 friends and we had such a great time in Playa del Carmen. It wouldn't have been possible without the lovely staff at Gran Porto Real. They always greet you with a smile and nothing is too much trouble. Hugo and Hector at the lobby bar kept our glasses full and made sure we didn't run low. Same goes for the guys at the Beach bar Jesus and Avila. The food at the 2 a la carte restaurants was amazing! The best thing is you don't need to make reservations. Breakfast at Albatros was good. The staff were always there to get you coffee, juice or pop. The 24 hour lounge is great if you want a midnight snack. They kept our mini fridge full for the whole time we were there. We loved the beach snack bar, really good nachos....the hotel's beach is not that great as they have a lot of bags of sand but you walk a few meters to the Royal and the beach there is really nice fro swimming. The rooms are very nice and spacious. The beds could be comfier but no complains. The night entertainment could be better but what do you expect from an all inclusive? The location is really good. You are walking distance to 5th ave so if you're ever bored you can go shopping there. Overall a great stay. I can't not wait to go back. Loved it. It was hard to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Even a potential hurricane does not stop the service”
Reviews.Author: cancunjoe5
Reviews.Content: 8 days 7 nights and our 16th trip to Playa del Carmen/Cancun. We were there with hurricane Rina looming,the staff was readdying for the worst (cat 4),we had little concern as the staff was drill like,filling sand bags,removing or securing glass items and setting up evacuation plans Oh the staff--the best of any resort we have stayed at-- including their own Royal in Cancun. Pablo on the beach -excellent as well as Jose---I have never commented on housekeeping,it is usually a given,but ours (I wish I knew his/her name,room 289),had our room absolutley spotless,and added with flower petals and great towel art . We were upgraded to to a king for our anniversary. Outside bartenders ,also excellent,they were more than willing to serve,and remembered what we were drinking-even days apart. Food Ok,---Italian was our favorite loved the hostess and Isarael our waiter. Nice beach and pool. prime resort location in playa del Carmen. We have only stayed at the same resort twice,but this will end up as out third--will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: mterp21
Reviews.Content: We traveled to this resort the last week of October. There was 12 of us in our group including 6 kids. I have nothing but great things to say about this place. The staff is awesome and very friendly and helpful, the pools are great, rooms and resort are very clean. The bartenders were very good and making anything you could want. They also had a lot of name brand liquors unlike a lot of other resorts. The food at both the italian and mexican restaurents were awesome! Also, love the location of this place. 2 blocks from 5th avenue which has great shopping, eating and entertainment. You feel like you're part of the city and culture. There were only a few issues: one was the beach area right outside the pools. looks like they are trying to fix the beach. Lots of sandbags everywhere and not nice access. If you go down a little ways or around the bend the beach is great so don't let this scare you by any means. The rooms at night are a little noisy from the nightly entertainment if you are going to bed earlier like we did around 9 since we had little kids. After a few nights, we were used to it though. We will for sure put this place on our list next time we're looking for an all-inclusive trip!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Canadiangirl02
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting too much of this place, as I've been to Cancun before and really disliked it. However, Playa Del Carmen, and Gran Porto Real were amazing! Such a nice experience. The food was great (especially the nacho bar and the Italian bar). The beach even was nicer then I thought, and I loved that we could get lounge chairs any time of the year. The shows weren't the greatest, but I really liked that that hotel was in the actual town so we could go see the sights at night. All in all, I would definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “first time in playa and had an amazing time!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: antonella p
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend went to playa oct 24 to the 31st i had never been to playa but have been to mexico many times my boyfriend it was his 7th time and told me that i would love it and i sure did!!!!!!!! the hotel was beautiful well kept, great food, and GREAT staff! our cleaning lady ADDY was fabulous leaving us great suprises on our bed with beautiful towel art everyday! PABLO was our waitor by the pool and beach and he always knew what we wanted. Daniela , victor were amazing on the entertainment staff !!!!!!! all and all despite the hurricane that was suppose to come but thank the lord turned into a tropical storm which the hotel did a great job keeping us updated on what was happening and keeping us safe it was the most faboulous trip!!! you are located about a block from 5th ave were all the shops resturants and night life are! everything was walking distance! we went to COCO BONGO!!! WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND GOING! buy tickets at hotel its cheaper and easier to get in!!!!! worth every penny!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Maya S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a Beach Walkout Suite for 7 nights/8 days. We love that we can walk directly from our room to the beach. The beach service is amazing. Pablo and Jesus took wonderful care of us during our stay. We also enjoyed a couples massage in the spa with Magdaluia and Lucia. They were great too! It is a beautiful area although sadly the beach is eroding. We will definitely be back though. Thanks for a wonderul vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great place- not so great beach”
Reviews.Author: JessCross
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here for 5 nights/6 days. The place is spotless. The staff is always cleaning the hotel. Our cleaning lady always left us towels made out of something which I found cute. The "jr suite" to me is a standard room in a nice hotel. Maybe the ocean view or ocean front ones are different. The food was good for a buffet and out of the two restaurants on site we favored the Italian one. Great food!! My only real complaints are the beach has nasty sandbags to help with the erosion and some boats docked out front. The Royal has a better beach! Speaking of the Royal, don't get suckered into a "tour" of The Royal.... It's a sales pitch! They say its not a timeshare it seemed worse!!! Made me angry because it's 2 1/2 hours wasted on my vacation. I guess I was gullible to think they were just showing me so I can stay there in the future. So beware of the "tour". Other than that it's perfectly situated right next to 5th ave. Had a blast there!! Day and night!! After all that I'm torn whether or not I would recommend this place to a friend. Maybe

Reviews.Title: “The staff is great at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Don P
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the staff for making our stay at your hotel one of the best vacations we have been on. Special thanks to Marcela at the Albatros and to Filiberto at Il Pescatore. We highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best All-Inclusive We've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: CharlieMax211
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real was fantastic! The resort itself is gorgeous and located in a great part of Playa del Carmen - very close to the downtown 5th Avenue with a ton of shops and restaurants. The rooms were beautiful, clean and always made up by housekeeping first thing in the morning. The food was really good, especially for a all-inclusive resort. It was nice not to need a reservation at the restaurants, the presentation and food was very good. The service was impecable. The service at the Gran Porto was fantastic. I can't say enough about Dave @ the Tradewinds Bar, he was excellent. He is very personable, attentive and fun. Jesus & Pablo were also very good as was Miriam @ the lobby bar. Daniel made sure our breakfasts were a wonderful experience also. Very attentive and very nice. We tipped all of them because of how great they were. Overall - it is the best all-inclusive we've ever stayed at. We had Jr. Suite ocean front room and will never book anything but that room because it is worth it. It is a truly fantastic place!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest spot in Playa !!!”
Reviews.Author: GayleBob
Reviews.Content: We love the Gran Porto Real. The resort is lovely, right on the water. The rooms and service can't be beat. The employees all are so special and really make you feel right at home. The food is delicious and the drinks are always cold and delicious too. We've gone there several times and everyone remembers us, GREAT STAFF !!! Needless to say we're set up for next year already and our kids and grandchildren are accompanying us. We look forward to our vacations there every year. Can hardly wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: m b
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real was fantastic! The resort itself is gorgeous and located in a great part of Playa del Carmen - very close to the downtown with a ton of shops and restaurants. The rooms were fantastic, clean and always made up by housekeeping first thing in the morning. The food was really good, particularly for a all-inclusive resort. The buffets were decent (breakfast was delish) but the restaurants were very good. It was nice not to need a reservation at those places. We upgraded our rooms to get access to the sister-adult only resort across the way and their food was REALLY top notch and delicious. The service at the Gran Porto was fantastic. The drink servers including Pablo, Miriam, Jesus, Jose, Theresa - were all wonderful. Very attentive and very nice. We tipped all of them because of how great they were. All the other staff including Samantha at the front desk and Aaron, a bellman, were great. Our bags were lost initially - but the staff was very willing to help. Overall - great place to stay, upgrade to the ocean front room because it is worth it and enjoy the time, it is a truly fantastic place!

Reviews.Title: “amazing time.”
Reviews.Author: cmgalvez
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the worst after reading some of the reviews. after 12 hours of traveling i just wanted to check into my room, change into my suit and take the kids down the beach. The check in was smooth but the only food available was the snack bar which was not so good. The concierge was nice, they try to sell you an upgrade and you have to meet with a host who will try to get you to buy some sort of membership. Luckily, Ernesto, our host was more than a sales person. He was our go to the whole time at the REAL for questions, taxi's, advice etc. He was very helpful. The first room we had was on the second floor above the pool and lobby. nice room, but very loud. the next day they moved us way down to the other side of the hotel. ocean view on the the 3rd floor. room 354. The room was just incredible. The room was always clean and our maid left the cutest towel animals. The kids loved it. I was expecting the food at the main buffet to be less than stellar from the reviews. We were pleasantly surprised and actually preferred the buffet to the other restaurants. We have 2 kids - 2 & 8 and they always found something to eat. The pool area is nice. Jose was my waiter the whole week and he was just on top of it. very friendly and my drink was always full. the pool is clean but feels small since it is spit in half. The food at the pool bar is nothing fancy. Hamburgers and hot dogs. everyone writes about the sand bags. didn't bother us so much. the beach on the real side is amazing. you can take a short walk and use the beach there. the best part of our trip was renting a boat - Muneca, right behind the Real. We spent $35 per person and we were taken to this snorkeling area and we got to swim with turtles. there were 4 of us, but we were not charged for my 2 year old. Best money we spent the whole time. they have a kids club that we stopped in a couple of times. Sandra is fantastic and so sweet. the kids loved her. the place is very nice and a great value. once you get the room you want, the vacation will be amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: 8TexasBeachBums
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real and their sister resort (right across the street) are without a doubt two of the BEST places in Playa! The service, staff and food are exceptional. We hope to get back there again this coming spring!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Judy D
Reviews.Content: The staff at Gran Porto are so amazing! It was my first trip to Mexico and everybody was so friendly. They treated us like family and not guests!! David, Miguel and Hiram were so great. Really took care of us and would come over and say hi and give us a big warm smile wherever we would bump into them at the hotel!! We first met David at the Tranquil pool and he was so warm and friendly we felt like we had known him forever!! Hiram was our favourite bartender at the lobby bar!! Always had a huge smile on his face Willy at guest services was like a friend from the moment we met him An extremely kind and welcoming man, we will never forget him!!! Highly, highly recommend this resort for the staff if nothing else, considering everything else, including food and services is exceptional!!

Reviews.Title: “Our family paradise”
Reviews.Author: Luey9189
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have always loved Playa del Carmen from when we back packed around 14 years ago. A truly magical place. We stayed in the Gran Porto last year for a week...these days with the kids and my mum...and it wasn't enough. How can you describe a five star resort that caters perfectly for a family? We had a family room with bunks and two queen beds and still plenty of room to spread out. The food and buffets were fantastic and suited every member of our family. The kids club when we needed time out. The drinks were flowing whether it's by the pool, lobby bar or in the room. Of course the staff are sooo lovely and wonderful and always friendly!!! It just makes it easy when it's an all inclusive package. So this year we went for two weeks....and of course it was just as we remembered, but only better as we had double the time!!! We desperately wish that Mexico wasn't so far from Australia or Real Resorts could open the same type of resort in Australia. We use brant entertainment for our private transfers and tours which is always reliable and takes the stress out of travelling... I have to mention Angeles Torres who took care of our room...always perfection! And Jesus Merano in the restaurant who made us the best Mayan (flaming coffee). We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Sharks Ready to Rip You Off" Gran Porto Hell ,Worst ever Holiday.”
Reviews.Author: jazzdupUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: PLEASE TAKE THE TIME TO READ THROUGH THIS FULLY. GOOD POINTS :- 1:-Beach Is very close with good soft sand . 2:-Water is shallow easy Bathing /Swimming. 3:-Staff are always cleaning. 4:-Location Is good for 5th Avenue. 5:-Animation try hard in the evening shows,some are very good. 6:-House Maids are very good (Lillianna) looked after the room very well with daily Towel art to amuse us,well worth the $20 u.s dollars tip. 7:-The Italian (Il Pescatore) has good table service with good food although Limited if staying for more than a week.by far the best this hotel has to offer. 8:- Overall it's a clean Hotel,in a good position with good access to the beach ,Although access to the sea can be difficult due to sand bags directly behind the Hotel. BAD POINTS:- 1:-The Time Share People hassle you continually ,Even direct Phoning to your Room,They Contacted us 7 times over the phone in two weeks,that's without the constant hounding every time you walk through the Reception,there Desk is just off the Reception so you have no choice but to run into them . 2:-The Front Desk are on Commission to upgrade you to the sister Hotel The Royal we were asked for $1,200 u.s for 21 nights,it's cheaper through your own Rep ,They seem to make up the figures as other couples were quoted different Prices for the same Package as ourselves,so BEWARE. 3:-Food is O.K for 7 days after that it is repetitive ,the Buffet is at best Terrible ,lack lustre Frozen food ,poor deserts ,No Fish only frozen dried out & Cheap. Meat is tough to chew & are cheap cuts very small Off cuts i expect from the Mexican & Italian Restaurants. 4:- The waiting on in the Buffet is best in the evening ,even if you tip you will be greeted with slow service in the Mornings & Lunchtime Menu. 5:-The Pool ,small split into two Nothing to inspire you here. 6:- The Americans ,they seem to own this joint they are loud & Obnoxious when in groups, yes there are nice Americans too when on there own ,But in groups all you get is YAHOOOOOO all day & Night Loud & Louder The Hotel definately caters for them . 7:-The Bars in the lobby,pool area are all Plastic glasses horrible cheap plastic ,you know the ones you squeeze your drink overflows,.But the bar staff are good very good actually you don't wait for a drink when tipping ,no tipping you see there selection process NOTE:-We Upgraded from the start to a junior sweet with seaview & were Charged £450.00.By our Agents First Choice ,It was Paid for in full prior to leaving the U.K. Upon Arrival we were booking in & were asked to choose One of two rooms available to us ,THE FIRST ROOM was a STANDARD ROOM ,NO VIEW OF THE SEA,Only the Taxi cabs & the Entrance to the Royal,It Was Very small with low cielings,Poor Quality. The Second Room was a Juniour suite as shown in there Publicity Pictures Room 342, You get a half view of the Sea but the main view is of the Royal,But you do get a large Balcony,This is the Room we Chose ,we signed for the room As Normal when Checking in,ONLY THEN WE WERE TOLD WE HAD TO PAY ANOTHER $632.00.u:s. We explained we had already upgraded the desk Staff(Salesmen) agreed we had, & agreed it would be sorted out & not to worry,we asked to check our Room charge due to a water sport (jetskis),We were told we had to pay Not Only $65 for the jet ski They Also asked for the $632.00 for an upgrde to a junior suite,We Refused to pay we were threatened with intervention from the police ,our rep was now no longer bilingual as were the front desk they seem to no Comprendo,to cut short ,we moved hotel Riu Cancun (Brilliant),But it cost us £300 for an upgrade we had already paid ,Also £280.00 for the room at the Riu Cancun & $65.00 for a transfer ,Ripped Off ,not only us but also Another Couple staying at the same time because they were not given there upraded room although they had paid in full as we had done.BEWARE THEY ARE SHARKS & THE REPS NO IT GOES ON!!!!!! Totally spolit our Holiday, Never Again would we stay in a Real Resort especially this ONE. We were sold this hotel by the reviews on Trip Advisor as well as our Agents ,These reviews are not a true flavour of this hotel,we thought how good the reviews were it must be a safe Bet how wrong we were to assume ,The Reviews are in our opinion not a true reflection of this hotel. Yes it went wrong for ourselves as well as another couple ,also a a couple on Honeymoon ,it seems The Hotel Staff(salesmen) are on commission to sell the rooms at whatever cost this was confirmed when we officially complained by our Manager Rep > Take from this what you will the hotel is good for a week at most after that you will need to look else where,This Holiday cost us £4,300 so i would say Riu Cancun For alot less with better service better Food Better staff allround . The Gran Porto Real has a good look but is well worn with Dated Deco & not worty of it's 4* More 3* cheap ,than elegance alot of the fittings & Fixtures are ready for Renewal. Having said that it will appeal to some .

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Astrid.”
Reviews.Author: Sophie B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in the Gran Porto Real. I wasnt impressed with the room. I spoke about my issue to the receptionnist and they wanted me to pay for an upgrade. I didnt feel it was right for my honeymoon. Astrid the concierge noticed my concern and offered her help. She took the time to show me other suites and went out of her way to make our honeymoon special. We will come back to the hotel and recommand it to our friends and family. Astrid was caring, professional and really took the time to make our honeymoon special. Thank you to the Gran Porto Real and to ASTRID!! We hope to see you when we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: BobbiHamel
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Gran Porto Real in the past two years, and we plan on going back every year! The service really goes above and beyond! The resort is really clean and well-maintained. The staff are incredible and always greet you with a smile and respect and are always willing to help you out with anything you need. They also remember you when you come back! A must do when going to Playa Del Carmen is to go to Coco Bongos, this place is amazing the shows are incredible and the service and dancing are great! I can't wait to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: kristinindurham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Porto for a girl's trip in September. The resort was very clean and well-maintained. The food was adequate. The real selling points for this property are location and the amazing service that the staff provides. They will bend over backwards for any request. Just make sure to take ear plugs if you like to sleep, The hallways are all tile and every noise echos.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Clive B
Reviews.Content: We have gone to this hotel many times in the past and love it and this is the reason I am again returning. Last two years due to mobility problems I have had to request a certain room and as I book well in advance I again made the same request for my next trip, it was confirmed on the strength of a phone call with a young lady in the office named Cinthya, whom I met last year when we spoke about the same request. This hotel, Cinthya, and all staff, are always so accommodating and anxious to assist if at all possible. Over all the years any contact with them has been a pleasant experience and thus I keep returning and I feel compelled to write to the tripadvisor.at this time C Bonner

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pam B
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time at this hotel & we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Playa. We like it so much, we brought friends this time. It has the best location - everywhere is walkable. The service is impeccable. Food is great at both restaurants and so nice that you don't need reservations or dress code. Buffet has lots of variety, with lots of fresh fruit & vegies. The hotel is beautiful, and location of pools and bars is perfect. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Everything”
Reviews.Author: joanne b
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Gran Porto Real 20th September to 4th October. First trip to Mexico and so lucky to pick a fabulous hotel, made by the friendly happy staff, who could not do enough for you. Our room was a standard double which was basic but clean and it may of well been a Executive Suite the way our Maid Leidy kept it so lovely with her towel sculptures and petals everyday, it was such a lovely touch. The restuarants where delightful, again with the smiling waiters who couldn't do enough for you, particular our waiters, Antonio who was so professional, Juan, May and Chucho.There was also an elder waiter who unfortunately we did not get his name, he was so gentlemanly, they were all in the Albatros where the food was excellent, so much choice and something for everyone and Caroline who greeted us morning and at lunch with her beautiful smile. The Bar staff where equally fantastic, Pablo, Jose, Jesus and Miriam, there was also another young girl who worked a lot in the 24 hour bar who was lovely, think she was called Catherine. The pool area was clean relaxing and the water so warm with the entertainments staff making sure everyone was having a good time, Chicken was great, just loved his name too. The whole stay at this lovely hotel was just fantastic and we would certainly return. Well recommended and have to say the Hospitality of the lovely staff was warming they were all so genuine. Thank you for a great holiday. Joanne and Shaun (UK)

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOLIDAY - EVER”
Reviews.Author: booo75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real at the end of September, this was our first time to Mexico and would strongly recommend staying at this hotel. The hotel is immaculate and is perfectly positioned on the beachfront and within minutes of Fifth Avenue, the shopping area. All the staff were extremely helpful and nothing was to much trouble. Our maid Leidy was always cheerful and the room was always spotless when she had finished. We looked forward every day to see what she had made with the towels and was never disappointed. The food was excellent with something to please everyone and the desserts were yummy, the waiters Chucho, Juan, May and Antonio were super and always on hand. (only complaint was they ran out of breakfast tea - with only flavoured/herbal tea or coffee available. On one morning we asked a waiter (whom havent named) if breakfast tea was available and without checking he say no, but on leaving the restaurant we found several packages of tea in the lobby and 24 hour bar). The poolbar staff Pablo, Jose and Jesus along with the lobby bar staff Miriam and Caroline were excellent and always on hand with re-fills. Would we stay at the hotel again - most definitely and would like to thank everyone for making our stay so fantastic

Reviews.Title: “"Place is that good I keep coming back"”
Reviews.Author: Debbie R
Reviews.Content: Not long back from a wonderful 2 week stay at the Gran Porto Real. This is my 3rd time here and I am still impressed with the place and all the staff. My partner, son and my mum & dad stayed here 25 Sep to 9 Oct 2011. The bar staff Jose, Miguel, Jesus, Ricardo & Salvador and just brilliant and are always happy and pleasant. They will even give you special drinks to try and do that little bit extra for you. I wish the bar staff back home could take a leaf out of their books. Same goes for the entertainment staff of Chicken, Ceasor, Armando, Mike and Rodrigo. They took my 13 yr old son under their wing and let him help them with their work. I hardly seen him for the whole 2 weeks. They all kept the entertainment up by the pool and I espcially loved 4pm as it was bingo time. The food is always good and there is plenty to go around. The place is always clean as they have a lot of staff making sure that is the case. The staff are so polite and always say hello when you pass them. The maids leave wonderful decorations on my bed every day. It makes the holiday just that bit better. The hotel is situated just a 2 min walk from fifth avenue which is an ideal spot. I heard that people who had stayed in Cancun hotels then came to Playa Del Carmen actually prefered Gran Porto Real & Playa Del Carmen. Gran Port Real is a really friendly hotel and I have made a many new friends from there. My mum and dad came with us 2 years ago to this hotel and loved it that much they came again this time. They just wish they had come here years ago instead of going to Spain. I will definately by coming back. Started saving the pennies already.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark333333
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend love this place. We just got back from our second holiday here the staff are exceptional.We got engaged on my girlfriends birthday which was amazing thanx to Marcella,Marco and tonni the restrant staff who made it a very special nite to remember!my plan to ask my girlfriend failed in the daytime so I asked for there help which they could not wait to help and were excited to do so,within 1 hour they had a beautiful private table set out by the pool,romantic music,fire torch lighting with our own special menu and 2 great waiters Huan and Ton. They put the ring in her desert were I was able to ask he to marry me (she said yes).I couldn't have done this without them!are other friends who made this holiday better than before are Tillo the bellboy who welcomed us home and was made up to see us again,the lobby bar staff Mirian and mari,the poolbar staff Jose,Pablo and Jesus they all look after you so well and are pleased to do so!the entertainment team work nonstop and keep everyone young and old entertained from morning till night especially Mike and Chicken(Victor).The hotel is in a great place with a great beach and close to fifth avenue me and my now fiancé are planing are next holiday here because it's the best place to be with the best people!thank you all at gran Poto real we will see you again soon Mark and nicola xxx

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Porto!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay in Porto!!! My wife and I visit Playa del Carmen from october 1- 8 and we stay in Grand Porto, wonderful stay if I must say! specially thanks to the front desk staff, who always were willing to help us with our little inconveniences (broken A/C). Besides that, everything was great, our bed was decorated with petals and they also give us a sparkling wine bottle. Thanks to Carlos (front desk manager) and Laura (supervisor) for they help and good service, thank you guys for a wonderfull vacations!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Terry R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen Oct. 8-14. This was our first stay at this resort but not the first time in Mexico. Our check in was very simple, however, they did try to get us to upgrade to The Royal across the street. We have stayed at The Royal before and is well worth it but wanted to stay at the Gran Porto Real. The rooms are decorated very nicely, great amenities. Our maid was great, one day I left my IPhone plugged into the charger on the bed and she made the bed and graciously left it where she saw it. Pools & bars are great. The food in the buffet was fine, what you expect for an all inclusive, you will find something you like. Speciality restaurants were very good. All the staff is hard working, always an 'hola' greeting, grounds are beautiful. The only downside is the beach, it is a bit rough and they are trying to rebuild it which will take time, you will see sandbags, but you can walk around those and enjoy the beautiful ocean. We had excellent service by everyone, but there were a couple of standouts at the beach bar, David and especially Rodrigo. Rodrigo was exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded ALL expectations”
Reviews.Author: candaceram
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, we're looking forward to our third. What brought us back was the wonderful staff and they were even better than we had remembered. At check-in, we had the pleasant surprise of being greeted by Yendaly. She was the last person we saw last year -- I remembered her from being able to retrieve a souvenir baseball cap after we had checked-out and turned-in our keys. She's a great representative of our whole experience at the hotel. She loves her job and seems to most enjoy surprising people by going above and beyond any expectations. We hope to see her again next year! I give Yendaly 100% of the credit for leaving us with a positive ending to our vacation in 2010 and starting our 2011 vacation with a WOW! The hotel is beautiful. There isn't a corridor or hall that didn't have a wonderful view. The restaurants would have been our preferred choice, to be part of the all-inclusive plan was fantastic. Our room, #145 was beautiful, romantic and wonderfully inviting. It was clean. Actually, super clean (as if we were the first guests to use it.). Were we comfortable and happy ? YES! We give the whole experience a 5+++ rating. See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place if you avoid the time share presentations.”
Reviews.Author: WebMaster2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for a few days on my honeymoon. Everything was awesome, clean, happy staff, amazing location, etc.... However, within literally the first 20 minutes of our arrival we had almost been pressured into seeing a timeshare presentation. We even asked straight up if it was a time share presentation and if it involved high pressure sales techniques and the woman lied to us and said "absolutely not." After talking to some other guests who actually attended the presentation we went back and told the woman we were not interested in seeing the presentation. Terrible start to an overall great experience. Just keep your head about you and never agree to see a "90 minute" presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: terryfox2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Porto Real Hotel & Spa 28th September to 12th October. The most friendliest staff you are likely to meet. Slightly disappointed by the extensive use of plastic receptacles, particularly in the main bar (understand the need for them around the pools). The tranquil pool on the 3rd floor is great for getting away from the hustle and bustle of the main pool and has a great Sushi bar. Felipe deserves special mention, he manages the swim up bar at the Tranquil pool, and provides excellent service and has a wealth of knowledge of Mexico. Miriam, who mainly works in the main bar, will make sure that you don’t wait for your drinks. She usually already knows what you want! Food is consistently good at all of the restaurants. Unusually there is no information in the room regarding hotel facilities ( I did check that other rooms were the same). Most information was gained from the staff near the Lobby area but they tended to be more focused on selling the Spa and the Royal Hotel next door. However all in all a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “T tgray D Gray”
Reviews.Author: Troy33
Reviews.Content: This is our 30th time to the gran porto real and we love it. The staff makes the whole trip worth it. The hotel manager Nicolas a very special treat. As you can see by the number of times we have been there we will go back. We love the junior suite ocean front the views are fantastic.The extra 29.00 dollars for the lobster is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Porta Real Hotel. Porta Del Carmen. Mexico”
Reviews.Author: capbadge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had 2 weeks at this hotel and were more than happy. We are in our late fifties and do no less than 3 foreign holidays a year, we are not fussy people but we like value for money and our expectations are to receive what we pay for but not prudes. We like to dress up in the evening to compliment the standard of meal we are hoping for but enough about us. Throughout the 2 weeks the down sides we experianced were as follows: We flew from Newcastle to Manchester for fuel. This added an extra 2+ hours flying time. 3 hours before the flight and 3 1/2 hours at Cancun Airport going through imigration, bagage collection and Customs, A further 1 hour to the hotel all added to a very trying journey all in all about 22 hours from Newcastle to the Hotel. We had 2 double beds in our room which is good if you fall out with the missus but takes up a chunk of your living space, this would have proved better if there was one double bed and chairs and a small coffee table and not a second bed. e booked in and was immediately confronted with the receptionist pushing us to upgrade, we did'nt and gladly so as our room was absolutely fine, comfortable, clean and cool and in a quiet part of the hotel so we were never disturbed during the night. I found the Thomsons excursions very expensive but most enjoyable. That is about the only negative thing we can say about our holiday. The food, the facilities, the location to the beach and local shops were spot on. A visit or two to the Hotels Mexican and Italian Resaurants are highly recommended, the service, presenation of food are highly commendable, in addition you have the Beach Food Bar, the Main Restaurant. the 24 hour snack bar and the Sushi Bar on 3rd floor all provide quality food and service. The service we received throughout by the waiters, Hotel Staff, Cleaners can onlyu be described as a humbling experiance, they really go out of thier way to ensure you receive a proper service and always with a smile, each and every one of them wins a smilling badge from us. Thje beach was excellent and we spent a lot of time sunbathing and sea swimming, there was plenty of sunbeds and some with shade frames round them. There is always a barman/lady close at hand to feed you a cold drink of your choice while you are sunbathing. The sea was warm and delightful. I have heard people making grunts about the sandbags on the forward edge of the beach, this is just to prevent sand corrosion and was not an issue for us. The area is charasmatic and is shared with the local fishermen so you can view thier catch or even go fishing with them for a reasonable rate. The swimmimg pool on the beach appeared to be well ru, pleasantly noisy with lots organised in the terms of games etc. Our preference was the beach for most of it but daily we paid a visit to the Pool on the 3rd floor with the odd visit to the jaccuzi on the roof. Like all holidays you tend to get friendly with certain staff members who always seem to grab ones attention, We would like to say a huge thank you to Fiorencio who provided us with our beach towels every day, he was good fun and an excellent sense of hummour, Filipe from the Sushi Bar is a true professional and pampers you, tom and Joime from the main restaurant were smart, very efficient, good fun and took the time to make you feel really wanted. They all made our holiday special. The cleaner whom we seldom saw or heard cleaned our room and left it immaculate with the nice towel designs. Would I go back. Absolutely, did I get Value for money as regards the hotel, absolutely. Did I get a quality service, absolutely. Thank you The town starts about 100 meteres from the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Kristina K
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 5 days and had a great time! The staff is incredibly acommodating and friendly. The resort is beautiful, immaculate, and in a great location. It is beachfront, with great pools, and is only steps from shopping and nightlife on 5th Avenue. It is one of the only resorts in the area that is on the beach and near 5th Avenue. The food was very good, and service in the restaurants was spectacular. The drink waiter at the pool, Pablo, was fantastic! He was always on top of bringing our drinks over. The resort was also family-friendly. Our kids had a great time. We were close to Xcaret, where we had a great time, and were able to rent a car for the day and drive down to Tulum, which was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing week”
Reviews.Author: LSMDO
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went for a week to celebrate my 30th birthday and we couldn't have had a more relaxing and enjoyable week. Nicolas, the general manager, was wonderful. The resort is beautifully kept and their food & restaurants were great. They have a great beach and pool area and the staff are very attentive and friendly. I can't wait to go back again and bring my husband!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: brett i
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time - we went there for our honeymoon and everyone was friendly and we want to thank Aaron Pat- Bell-Boy- he was the first to meet us and he was extremely nice and each time we saw him he greeted us with friendliness and enthusiasm. Along with everyone else- but a special shout out to Aaron - Bell Boy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Brooke G
Reviews.Content: We recently went down for a friends wedding and we stayed at the Gran Porto (where the wedding was). I have nothing but great things to say about our experience. Though they initially had us in a room with a single bed and we requested a double, they fixed it immediately! Anything we asked for we were able to get. Even my special requests for food were met with the highest satisfaction. (I'm a picky eater) The food in the buffet was really good. We loved the Italian restaurant. The Mexican restaurant was good too, the only thing is that we wished for a bit more selection on that menu. (and that is not a complaint though, it was still all good) From checkin to the house keeping staff (Thema o Teressa (creo, I'm not sure of the spelling) y Errca, to the waiters in the bar areas (Dave, Avila, Mirian, Miguel, Arturo, Carolina), all of the waiters in the buffett and the Italian Restaurant "Il Pescatore" (Jorge, Mateo, Jose, Delia, Paco y Arturo; everyone was amazing!! We really appreciated their friendliness and service. I would highly recommend this all inclusive resort to anybody. Good activities, great people and just a wonderful experience. Muchas gracias a todos! Espero que nos vemos pronto!

Reviews.Title: “The best trip ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: chuckymon
Reviews.Content: We just came back from this amazing resort, come and see for your selfe the best service ever, exelent food, the best suite and above all the best staf, specia thanks to Tonny from Albatros and all of his waiters.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Value!”
Reviews.Author: maureen b
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here September 29th for 5 nights. I am a seasoned traveller to the Mayan in particular Playa del Carmen, this was my ninth trip but my first time at the Gran Porto Real. The check-in was efficient, they got the bags to our room quickly and even though we were at the back of the hotel, it was easy to navigate. Our room was not large, but sufficient, we booked a standard type of accomodation and there were mattress pads on the beds as many hotels in Mexico have hard beds. We appreciated this. The walk-in shower was nice and the variety of TV channels and VCR was an added bonus. One you usually do not receive in a standard room. Although not all rooms have private balconies, every room have a common wide balcony separated with wrought irorn and has 2 large chairs and a table if you wanted to sit out side. The windows also gave you a choice of sun/no sun, another nice touch. The housekeeping service was very impressive. Spotless! I left a tip every day and it was not touched until I realized there was a special envelope for such a thing. This made me put some trust in the hotel staff..nice to have in Mexico. Now the food. Wonderful buffet breakfast and lunch and several waiters to bring you whatever you needed. For the dinner times, one restaurant did not require reservations but every night rotated its menu.
