The service and food was 5 star. Unreal!!! The busiest eatery was the glamourous Italian restaurant and once again the food and service was terrific. The beach was nice but a little rocky, although nice for snorkelling . If you wanted to walk down 300 hundred yards you could swim way out. The beachside service was excellant as well. All in all would return to this hotel. The staff very customer oriented and the location right in Playa del Carmen, can't be beat. Maureen Brennan NOVA SCOTIA CANADA

Reviews.Title: “The greatest wait staff”
Reviews.Author: capera2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a couple of weeks ago and I was impressed by the wait staff, everybody was amazing, but the greatest was Jose. He is the most proactive waiter that I've met in my life and he is always happy and with a smile. In regards to the hotel facilities it's average. It seems a little in the old side, food average, and restaurants average as well... The housekeeping services woke us up one day and the other day it was the lady cleaning the floors who woke us up...

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Plus”
Reviews.Author: Karen0412
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a wonderful vacation at the Gran Porto Real Resort in Playa Del Carmen. I have to say the service and staff were phenomenal. You couldn't ask for better service. The food was very good. I have to mention Miguel at the pool bar, he was the Best bartender ever! Delia, the hostess at the Italian restaurant was so sweet and she makes you feel right at home. We have food allergies and the Italian restaurant was very accomodating, the chef actually came to our table to make sure we were satisfied with everything. The location is perfect for walking to all the shops on Fifth Ave. Exceptional people and hotel. We will go back and probably stay longer! Karen, from R.I.

Reviews.Title: “How can I say thank you...”
Reviews.Author: Jackie M
Reviews.Content: Having the honor of being served by Domingo for our evening meal was one of the most pleasurable events of our week´long vacation! His willingness to be kind, informative and friendly was beyond measure and made our meal the best we have had to date! THANK YOU Domingo for just being YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sue F
Reviews.Content: This resort is the very best. From Monica at Member Services to Felipe at the Sushi Bar to Dave at the Beach bar to Caroline at the 24 Hour Lounge to Delia at El Pescatore Restaurant. Every single person made me feel welcome. The food was outstanding, and the entertainment was fun. No matter where you walked, you always got a friendly smile and "hola". The sushi bar has the freshest and tastiest sushi around. Dave at the beach bar will make whatever drink you wish for----even a Jersey Shore!!!!! Delia at the Pescatore Restaurant made us feel so welcome. Caroline at the 24 Hour Lounge was a sweetheart!!!! Can you tell that my husband and I loved this resort???? We would go back again in a heartbeat. Thanks to everyone for making our stay so fantastic. Bill and Sue

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful magical place”
Reviews.Author: JJBAZ
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 5 night stay at the resort. I was concerned about some of the bad comments about the food and service. I was shocked on how wrong this was. For anyone to say this resort, the food, the place, service and hotel was bad really either has not traveled anywhere in the world or has standards that are not believable or obtainable (basically will never be happy with anything). First, I have been to many places. All around the US in major cities (San Fran, NYC, Chicago, LA, San Diego, Miami) as well as exotic places like St. John Virgin Islands, Belize, Costa Rica, Hawaii, Punta Cana, Greece, Spain, Holland, London and Turks and Caicos. Also, traveled to Mexico many times (Puerto Vallarta, Cabo San Lucas and Cancun). By far, this has been one of the best places I have ever been to. The food was excellent. I went with 7 other friends for my birthday and everyone was happy with the food. We ate breakfast at the buffet every morning being greeted with a wonderful waiter each time. There are two restaurants for dinner (we all wanted to be waited on). Both Mexican and Italian were amazing. People stated the Mexican was worse than Italian. I think it was the opposite. The Mexican place changed their menu every night and we ate their 3 times and were wowed each time. The Italian was good as well. Very classy and service was amazing. We didn't try the buffet for dinner, but it looked great (just a bit hot in the place with all of the hot entrees). Service was amazing. Staff was amazing. Pablo and Jesus on the beach were amazing. Pablo worked his butt off each time. I would recommend tipping all waiters (gave $20.00 each day to the staff at the beach). We didn't even go to the pool which was really nice. People said the pool was small in reviews, it seemed fine to me. Ana also was amazing at waiting on the beach. Other servers who were great were Mari and Jose. Maid service was amazing. The maids did a special treat of animal shapes each night and did a special one on my bday. They asked when I check in why I was hear and notated my room. I was shocked to see a huge cake made out of towels and fresh flowers on the bed. Tip the maids, they deserve it. I recommend upgrading to a beach view (only costed 150.00 for 5 nights-cheaper than online at time of check in). We stayed in rooms 237/235. Great views and quiet. We also brought plastic drink cups that made our drinks bigger and didn't melt faster. They had no problem filling them up. I would also recommend bringing inflatable floats b/c the ocean is so smooth and no waves. Only recommendations I would say would be to improve the wifi (free at hotel but slow, more restaurant choices with waiters, beds are a bit hard, better drainage for the bathrooms, filled up a bite due to the hotel being older and larger beach area with less boats. First time in Playa and in love with the city. Recommend going to the Glass Door for dinner (did it for my bday) amazing food (went off the resort and ate). Bars off the resort are amazing also (Fusion was great). Beaches were a bit nicer off the resort but we had no compliants with the seating and cabanas to use. Also, cheaper massages off the resort. 25.00 per hr for a massage. Can't beat that. By far, this was one of the nicest places (people, food, environment) I have ever been too. I would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “It just gets better and better”
Reviews.Author: SherylEugeneOregon
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd attempt to write a review that doesn't get lost. Hopefully this one will work. My husband and I returned to "Our" resort for the 3rd time. We have gone the last 3 years from Aug 29-Sept 10th. Obviously we love it there. We were greeted at the airport by Lomas (who we requested since they were so good last year). They took us from the airport to the resort and then back when it was time to go home. They were very friendly. We checked in and all the paper work was done in advance with our wrist bands ready to go and the exact room that we wanted. All of the staff is respectful and friendly. Last year we went every night at 6 to our favorite restuarant "il Pescatore" picture below. We were greeted by name and sat at the same table. We did the exact same thing this year and it was amazing. We were treated like royalty by Mateo, Isrial,Jorge,Pepe,Edgar,Delia, Arturo and Amador. I hope I am not leaving anyone out. The last night we were there it was amazing. Our table was the only ones with flowers and a special wine holder. We were waited on hand and foot but still allowing us privacy. We had a picture with us from last year of Mateo and my husband. We showed it to him and he looked surprised in a happy way that we cared enough to take a picture with him. We did it again this year (picture attached). I would say that I was not expecting so many kids there since last year there wasn't. It was unfortunate that there were a couple boys around 10 that their parents were not paying attention to and the boys were pretty disrespectful to the adults with splashing, etc. There was also alot of seaweed and smell but that is not the resorts fault. The service around the pool wasn't as good as last year but it was still nice. It was a little hard to sleep past 8am since they were doing repair work the whole time we were there right down the hall, but I guess it needs to be done to keep the upkeep. If we are able to afford the upgrade we will definetly go again next year and request the same room. We like to think of it as "Our little hideaway" from the rest of the world. We were thinking about checking out the sister resort across the street since it is adults only but we know what to expect at "ours" that we may just take a chance that kids won't take over the pool if we are able to go next year.:-) I think besides the room we love the Italian Resturant was our highlight. Oh and of course the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel , Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Brooke H
Reviews.Content: When we got into the hotel they welcomed us with apple martinis. Once we got to the room I notice there was no shampoo or conditioner. And there were little bugs near the sink area. A call to the front desk brought the maid and shampoo in tow. Reluctantly they showed us another room, also with small bugs in the sink area. Normally this would have sent us running, but we were tired and the bugs looked more like ants than anything else, so we opted to stay. Things only improved from there. Staff were courteous and friendly. Delia at el pescatore (one of the restaurants) was on top of her game. She knew likes and dislikes after one night, was aware of allergies and our room number. The hotel for the most part was clean and tidy. Lots of space, it's a large property. The food was okay nothing to write home about, and there were a lack of vegetarian options. The hole is nicely located on a beach which could use more sand over the sand bags that were placed there probably to prevent beach errosion. All in all except the ant issue, it's a nice hotel with a good staff. Oh yes, time share scam is here too, just like just about every other hotel in the area nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ym m
Reviews.Content: This was amazing hotel, great staff, Christhian and Ricky and some other ones went out of their way to help us with everything , we had a great time, great food, and close to all nightlife and shopping. We will go back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: Bob M
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at this hotel. The staff went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience. This is not a 5 start hotel. If you show up thinking you are staying 5 star, you will be disappointed. I would put it in the 4 star category and it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable time”
Reviews.Author: pzdrake
Reviews.Content: This was not a 5 star hotel, but it should be. The hotel was beautiful! The grounds, the pool, the food and the staff were wonderful! There was great shopping within walking distance. The only small down side was the firmness of the mattress. Much too firm for us, but it didn't prevent us from having a good night's sleep. On the last night of our trip, the wait staff surprised us by setting up a beautiful dinner table outside so we would leave with a very special memory of our stay. Incredible! Thanks to Marcella, Tonny and Sara for helping to make our stay so wonderful! We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto-Best Holiday Ever”
Reviews.Author: kworrow
Reviews.Content: The most amazing and beautiful place you could ever imagine. Service is excellent, staff are so friendly and cater for your every need. Hotel is well maintained and looked after by the staff. Loads to do around the hotel, breathtaking beach and 5th avenue is great. Hotel food is spectacular. Great place for any age, couples and families. At gran porto you never need for anything, i will DEFINATELY be going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real for our daughter's sweet sixteen, and she as well as my family were amazed!!! The service was excellent!!! It was also my mother's birthday, and on the night of her birthday we dined at il Pescatore (Italian restaurant), the food was great and they brought her a delicious cake(one of the best I've ever had)!!. Chef Jose prepared a special meal for us that was absolutely delicious!! On the night of my daughter's birthday, we dined at Maria's (Mexican Restaurant). My family all agreed it was the best Mexican food we had ever had!!, the service was outstanding, our waiters Sergio, Mariano, and Manuel, treated us like royalty. Chef Jorge also prepared a special dinner for us, it was outstandingly good that we dined there every other night we stayed at the Gran Porto. We would like to give special thanks to Mauricio Silva, the executive Chef, whose service was outstanding!! Thanks to Miriam and Elizabeth for the excellent service at the lobby, who served us our drink in a timely matter, and were very courteous. We will definitely return to the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Staff were outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Xvikkix
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a wedding and were impressed with the staff, and service with a smile. Location of the hotel and their beach are unbeatable. Daniela & crew at kids club were fantastic with my 6 year old. I will continue to reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but needs to make some changes”
Reviews.Author: MrsWiskers
Reviews.Content: Returned home from the GPR on Sept 18. This is the fourth time at this hotel and the 2nd time this year. The best thing about this hotel is the staff. Jose, Juan and Miguel at Il Pescatore. Pablo, Jose and Teresa - the servers at the pool. Florencio at the buffet restaurant. Segio at the spa. And last but not least Miguel and his entertainment staff (all of them). Every single staff member in this hotel is amazing. Many, many thanks. Rooms are big, well stocked and very clean. Everyday you get a different piece of towel art on your bed. Lovely touch. All the restaurants are excellent. The food and staff are not to be out done. We were there over the Mexican Independence day and the food that night was unbelievable. Excellent night. I would have rated this hotel excellent except for one issue - they need a dedicated kids area that needs to be enforced. They also need a kids pool. The entertainment staff did there best to include the kids but I thought that's what the kids club is for and the entertainment staff were for the entertainment of the adults. If they address this issue this would be the best hotel in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Dont know why people complain!!!!”
Reviews.Author: christina41
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband on the 5/09/11 and really enjoyed our stay. We upgraded to an oceanfront and were not dissapointed, it was lovely with a stunning view. Staff were fabulous, especially Pablo he was amazing!!!! Food was of a very good quality but found both restaurant portions a little on the small side. On the whole the hotel is spotlessly clean, and would recomend it to anyone. Well done Real Resorts!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: JoannaS3
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. The staff very helpful and friendly. 5th Ave just a block away for night life and shopping. The room was very clean as with the rest of the hotel. The food was OK.. typical all inclusive food. We upgraded to a walkout ocean front room and it was perfect. I would recommend this hotel for singles and families alike. They also arrange tours and we enjoyed the one we took.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - AVERAGE RESORT - CRAP FOOD”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real is in a great location. It's only blocks from 5th avenue and all the tourist stuff. It also has a sand beach (not a cove like a lot of resorts). I would rate the food selection as HORRIBLE but my wife says it's OKAY. They have 8 restaurants listed, however all but 3 are actually snack bars. Only 1 restaurant is open for lunch and breakfast. It is a buffet and the food sucks. The other 2 restaurants are open for dinner. 1 is a mexican place that is awful. The other is an Italian place that is good but only by comparison. The food here still isn't "good" but better than the other choices. Bottom line is that if I had to PAY to eat at any of these, I would never return. The best description I can give of the food is "tolerable". The Good: Friendly Staff Good Maids (room cleaned very well) Beach The Bad: Small Pool Horrible TV stations WiFi doesn't work in rooms Phones charge to make calls

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walid2011
Reviews.Content: Unfurtunatly i just arrived from this super, great amazing hotel and place. We had high expectations when we booked and red the reviews, but it was even more fantastic then we expected. Gran Porto Real had everything: good service, good rooms (we had jr suite, absolute better then regular), good food and drinks and is great located near the 5th. I want to thank specially Jose our waiter at the pool and beach! Tip: if you want to go to Tulum, go by your self and stay the night at the beach in a ''cabanja'' (small villa;s at the beach). Very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: Christoff22
Reviews.Content: Just come back from our vacation from this beautiful hotel. Excellent location , low key , extremely clean, relaxing and friendly hotel. It is a small local hotel rather than a large international chain and as such not an international 5 star rated hotel. The room was large and beautiful decorated in Mexican style with full ac. The staff went out of their way to help us with a special thank you to Jesus and Pablo who kept us supplied with drinks around the pool and on the beach. Would definitely recommend for a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: burdy123
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place for vacation. Verry helpfull people to serve u a drink on the beach. Always with a big smile on there face :-) the are verry friendly ! Ana and Jose who take care of me and my girlfriend earn a great compliment ! We wil not forget. We are treated like king and queen in the Gran Porto Real ! Like Arnold said... I' be back, hasta la vista.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: robbo1425
Reviews.Content: first time in mexico,and what a hotel,just fantastic in every aspect all the staff were great,resort very nice,pool,beach,bars etc,would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not one single complaint!! Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: nwgecko
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days, Sept 13-17 and this was an fantastic resort. Every single employee went out of their way to make sure we wanted for nothing. The resort is emaculate and exceptionally clean. Food was gourmet and fresh, very good tasting. Every night was a special entertainment show. I can't say enough about this hotel. I plan on returning to this resort every time if visit PDC. I would not take any chance on any other hotel. Ivan, Israel and Mario were exceptional waiters in the restaurants, Grace in guest services, and Alejandro on pool side were very special. All the bartenders and servers were always attentive and ready to make your stay very special. Housekeeping was impecable, never needed anything.

Reviews.Title: “better than cancun!”
Reviews.Author: jahzeel74
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for 4 days and it was one of the best vacations we ever had! Last year, we went to cancun and enjoyed it but the beautiful stretches of white sand and turquoise blue waters right in front of the hotel property, the grill restaurant by the beach, the excellent service by almost everyone not to mention 5th avenue only a few minutes away, made me pick playa del carmen over cancun anytime! The absence of people selling time shares also made it nice. Special mention to the following outstanding employees - Jaime and Tom, who made sure everything we needed at the restaurant was met, even cooked a special ribeye dinner for my hubby when it wasnt steak night! Marcela, the hostess, was very friendly and made us feel like we have been friends for a long time. Lucy and Sergio, our spa therapists, the BEST! (we are spa lovers so we know). The only thing the resort needs to improve on is the lobby. It doesnt look quite as grand and as impressive as the other hotels/resorts have. Plus the restaurants dont have AC which can make it quite unbearable specially at lunch. And we are from Florida, so we know what hot is. Over all, I would definitely recommend this to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Jim & Jess Scotland”
Reviews.Author: GOLFCLUB156
Reviews.Content: Pro's Just returned from our fifth Trip to Gran Porto,for me this says it all,we did not come all the way from Scotland to not enjoy ourselves,the staff at Gran Porto as always make our holiday,special mention to Avila (Lorenzo) for his hospitality,not forgetting our maid Liliana who ensured our room was always spotless,in the Lobby bar our thanks go to Felipe,Miguel and the trainee Raul,I am sure he will do well,at the Pool bar Alex,Eduardo & Fabian kept us well supplied with drinks,and on the Beach or by the Pool,Jose,Jesus,Rebeca & Pablo worked tirelessly to keep everyone supplied with their favouite tipple, The beach this year was particularly contaminated with seeweed,and the staff worked very hard to clear it,so I am always disappointed with some peoples attitude as to the state of the beach,yes it could be cleaner,but the force of nature decides this not the hotel. Once again a great holiday in a great location, Cons, If the hotel could come up with a device to reduce the volume from some of the guests,particularly some Americans who have two settings,Loud & Louder. Having said that we met lovely people from,Texas,Arkansaw & New York who were great company. The new seating arrangements for the A La Carte is not working,scrap this please. See you soon

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ♥”
Reviews.Author: Kelseyleianne
Reviews.Content: gran porto real made my first visit to Mexico, Amazing! The entertainers were awsome! My favorite were Alejandro, Ceaser, Chicken, & Even the towel boy was super nice (: I would highly recommend this hotel, & I can't wait go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real - Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: LisaH082011
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have selected a better hotel! It is all-inclusive, 2 blocks from 5th Avenue, and with only 300 rooms, there is an intimate personalized feel. The nightly entertainment is fantastic and an oceanfront room is half the price of the sister hotel next door. Food was amazing! Enjoy the cabanas!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Balmoral99
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about our vacations at this resort - food, service, drinks, entertainment and special - location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Grandpupa_11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our daughter's wedding 9-10-11. We had fifty guests that attended and everyone (I am not joking) said that this was the most beautiful wedding they have ever been at. The location,the staff, the wedding coordinator,the servers, the front desk, the pool people, the hostesses, house keeping were absolutely the best. The food was excellent. The resort was clean and if a small problem did arise (and I mean small) it was taken care of immediately. I have names of some of the staff that were particularly helpfull but all could not have been more caring. Thank you for a wonderful five days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 5 year anniversary trip!!”
Reviews.Author: sassystar
Reviews.Content: I was told about this resort from a friend of mine. It was by far the BEST experience for the price!! We loved the food, activities and mostly the LOCATION!!! Playa is such a fun place to vacation. One of the best parts about this hotel is you can walk to 5th ave. I have found that many of the hotels are way off the beaten path (especially the closer you get to Cancun) this one is not. You can walk to 5th ave in about 5 min. There is so much to do here, they always have the FABULOUS activities crew out and about, getting you going. My husband was kept busy with water aerobics, water volleyball, water polo, water basketball, relay races, sand volley ball...and much more. They have a theme night after dinner each night and they put on different performances. We will be going back for sure!! ONE THING TO KNOW>>>>KIDS ARE FREE HERE SO THERE ARE A TON OF THEM. If you want a relaxing trip with NO kids...try the sister resort across the street. :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort, very polite and friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: andy2k
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean. The restaurants are very clean, they offer a variety of good food options. The hotel reception staffs are very professional, we had a minor problem with the Junior Suite room we were first given, we were promptly moved to another even bigger room with a better view, thanks to Jose (supervisor). This hotel was recommended to me by another family and I would definitely recommend it to other families with kids. One disappointing factor about this hotel is the beach. It is not that pretty compared to another hotel we stayed in at Playa Del Carmen. When we were there the hotel maintenance staffs were cleaning tons algae that had washed off on the sand, it maybe because of the time of the year we went, but it was a disappointment for us.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Fun Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SusanMiddleton
Reviews.Content: I would definitely come back to Gran Porto. Excellent location. The staff is wonderful. One superior team of waiters were Pako and Rodivor. Most attentive and went out of their way to accomodate our table. The room maids were awesome. They kept everything tidy. The event and entertianment team really engage the guest. They were wonderful. I went to a spanish lesson, stretching, pilates, and water aerobics. Cesear,Victor-aka: Chicken just to name a few members, all were excellent and wish I could remember all their names to give full credit. As mentioned previously I would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Sand bag beach with nobody on it”
Reviews.Author: julestravels2
Reviews.Content: After seeing the dark halls, limited dining,street view from the room and that the beach and pool seemed abandoned, we decided to move next door. That wasn't worth the upgrade cost. I would suggest this place only if you intend to spend a lot of time in town, and if so, why pay for A/I?

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but would not return”
Reviews.Author: JimH_11
Reviews.Content: Great facility, great food, excellent staff and service. We are beach people who love to swim and snorlel in ocean and this resort was not what we were looking for. The small beach was rendered unusable by the high winds, which brought in mountains of seaweed from the ocean, and being extremely shallow. Sister property had beautiful beach which we could use like the public by carrying towels and laying on the beach. I felt like when the beach at our facility was unusable we should have been able to use beach chairs ect., at the sister property but we could not even walk thru the sister property. We ended up at the pool at our resort which we could have done at home in our own pool.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: MGohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a friend's wedding. There were good and bad things at the resort. Let's start with the good things: The location is amazing- 3 minute walk to 5th avenue in Playa Del Carmen. The staff is wonderful- they would bend over backwards to help you- if you were waiting for them and walked away, they would come find you to follow up! Aaron the bell boy and Isidro Jesus of room service were awesome! It is an older resort, and the wear is evident, but it is VERY clean- they do a great job. Sheets & towels were always clean- even towel animals made on the bed every day! The rooms are beautiful and spacious- the bathroom was large- the shower was so big it didn't need a door!!! We had an ocean front room- the view is WELL worth the upgrade from ocean view. The mini bar in the room is included with the all inclusive package, and we called room service to refill our beer- they would bring it right to the room as we hung out and enjoyed the view. The $20 local snorkel trip is worth it. Now for the "needs improvement" areas: The beach is beautiful & in a great location, but the exposed sandbags really did take a lot away from the view, espcially when you walked down the beach to see other properties. The food in the sit down restaurants was good, the buffet was ok (although the same everyday) and the girll was bad. The best food we found was roomservice- just make sure you call early because it can take about 30 minutes. Good in the morning for a pot of coffee while you get ready. The only places in the resort with A/C are the rooms and the 24 hour coffee bar. It is very hot in August in Mexico! It would have been nice to have A/C in the restaurants. The pools close at 9 and the swim up bar closes at 5:00!!! So, not much of a night life at the resort. All in all, we had a great time, although we will probably visit a different Porto Real property on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: shoo490
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was excellent. Jesus, Mari, Forencio, Marcello, Chicken, Domingo, and Elizabeth went above and beyond taking care of our family. They were extremely kind and helpful. The rooms and hotel was always clean. This is our second time staying at the Gran Porto and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “awesome time, i want to go back”
Reviews.Author: mehayes479
Reviews.Content: This was my first time out of the United States, I went with my family and had an Awesome time there. The hotel was very clean, and the food was excellent. As soon as we arrived the hotel staff gave us a welcome drink. We had to wait about 10 minutes so that the hotel staff could check the room but I didn't mind. Just be aware that the hotel is very open, the rooms have air conditioning but the restaraunts, lobby, and hallways have no a.c. Albatros which is a buffet was very good, there is so much food, as well as different types of juice in cluding Cactus, and Hibiscus Water. Each night the buffet changed, one night was mexican, another was italian and one night was oriental. The Sports and Entertainment Crew at the pool were always doing some activity. I actually tried some of the activities they did. Water aerobics, pool volleyball, and learning how to dance merengue was a few of the daily activities the pool staff ran. If you choose to try going jet skiing, parasailing, try and find John on the beach or around the pool, he can help you go and try those kinds of activities. The only minor issue was the beach, there are sand bags everywhere to prevent erosion, there are rocks in the water you should watch out for, but it was still very nice. Overall, I had such an amazing time at the gran porto real, I hope to go back to this hotel again. Thanks to: Alejandro(works at the pool), Domingo& May(waiters at ALbatros), John, and Ana (works at the spa) these 5 people are a few of the staff members who are very helpful and incredibly kind

Reviews.Title: “Great service, terrible food!”
Reviews.Author: Nixjay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Real group and they have a new adults only hotel opposite which they are very keen to upsell, obsessively so! This hotel whilst being immaculately clean with excellent staff is a little tied. The position in the resort is good but the beach in front of the hotel is eroding which is a shame as 200 metres away it is amazing! What really is to the detriment of this hotel though is the food, it was cheap, inferior quality and repetitive. This is supposed to be 5 star but the quality and choice is more 3 star. There are buffet, Mexican and Italian restaurants.  The menus are small. All this meant that we ended up eating out more than we intended, although we found a fantastic beach bar (Fusion) not far down the road where the food, atmosphere and music was amazing. On a more positive side the pool area is comfortable and friendly and the sports /entertainments team make taking part in daily pool side events fun and enjoyable (not something I would normally participate in).  Ultimately Gran Porto is a hotel without a real heart, it does not have a 'focal point' and needs investment in looking after customers who pay to stay in THIS hotel as opposed to using these residents as feeder customers for their flag ship hotel next door (which we were unable to use anyway as we had two 15 year olds with us). The owners really seemed to have lost site of what us the holiday makers are paying for and this is disappointing.  In summary, good hotel but 5 star.. Definitely not.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel......”
Reviews.Author: seabrogrin
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, beautiful grounds.... very polite staff. Beach is quite rocky, not the greatest beach, more like an inlet on a bay... but is beautiful none the less. Food was great, plenty of choices. In an amazing location, a minutes walk to 5th Avenue. I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone looking for some R&R, also close to all that Mexico has to offer, shopping, amazing Cenotes and Eco parks ! Very safe area, nothing to fear. P.S. Bring your Mosquito spray !

Reviews.Title: “gran porto real outstanding”
Reviews.Author: brian b
Reviews.Content: Would like to express our appreciation for a great trip. Certain staff made this one of the best trips ever: Ricardo and Laura at the front desk. Felipe at the beach bar. Pablo at the main pool. Elizabeth at the lobby bar. Thank you to all for a great week.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for our next visit!”
Reviews.Author: stacy f
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to the Gran Porto Real in Playa since 2002. We have made it every year (at least once) since! We absolutely love the resort and all Playa has to offer! All the staff is super friendly....especially Pablo the beach waiter. He is the best bringing you drinks all day super fast and always with a smile! We can't wait to get back...hopefully a Christmas vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing family vacation..."El Capitan" & "California" will definitely return!!”
Reviews.Author: Christi M
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto exceeded our expectations in many ways. We traveled with our daughters, 17 & 19 and knew that we were right on the cusp of staying at an adult only resort. We wanted a resort that would allow both rest & relaxation and activities (for when we peeled ourselves away from the cabana or the lounge chairs!). With that said, we weren't disappointed with our choice to stay here. After acquiring the nicknames, "California" and "El Capitan", my husband and I knew we'd be treated right! We found a perfect balance of relaxation and fun. In the mornings, we looked forward reading the daily activity board....our favorites were the bike tour (takes you up to Playacar and back, it ended up being just the four of us w/ Alejandro), water aerobics (the most fun we've had in a pool, especially if Chicken leads the class!), pilates/yoga outdoors at the sand (doesn't get much better than that!), Kayak tour with Armando and bocce ball on the sand (again, w/ Alejandro). The great thing about the sports & entertainment is that it's there if you want it, and there's something different offered all day long. Otherwise, peacefully basking in the sun can pass the time just as well! Our room was a Gran Junior Suite Beachfront Walkout. Access to the sand is literally right out the slider door. Our room had one king bed and we requested two rollaways for our girls, that worked out fine. The bathroom is spacious, huge walk in shower. The built-in liquor cabinet was cool, but honestly, we didn't tap it for too much since all of our drinks were being served to us on the beach! The value of staying in the beach front walk out is not having to go back through the hotel, or up an elevator to your room. It's worth every penny! Occasionally someone would walk along the pathway to another room, but we weren't bothered by that since we spent all of our time outside the room. These suites also come with a designated cabana, only for your use. Similar to a double bed, it offered curtains for privacy and constant beverage service from one of the many amazing servers. We don't have any complaints about any of the restaurants. Our meals were delicious and they did a great job at offering a variety of cuisine. Some may grow tired of the same routine that an all-inclusive can have,...my suggestion is to make it a point to try different things at each meal, which may add the variety your looking for. Our room category got us privileges to a few of the restaurants at the Royal, which was nice. The beach was beautiful, but isn't every Caribbean beach beautiful? There is a sand volleyball net and a great stretch of beach to walk or run along. We also noticed how clean the beaches were in front of the Gran Porto and the Royal. Hotel security was present at all times, walking the beach, cabanas, lounge areas, and a lifeguard as well. It was very nice to be so close to the 5th Avenue shopping. We went back several times simply because we didn't cover everything in just one visit. The nice thing about the Gran Porto's location is that shopping is only about a block away, and we felt comfortable letting our daughters walk to and from on their own. The staff went above and beyond to make the stay as enjoyable as possible. Jesus and Jose never let your cup run empty. After a day or two, Jesus knew our beverages of choice, so thirst was never a concern. El Capitan sends an extra thank you to Jesus!! Alejandro, Armando and Chicken get an A+ on the sports & entertainment. Thank you Alejandro for the great conversations and fun activities. We've never experienced such a complete package of fun and relaxation at a resort before. Nothing was overlooked by the staff, we would love to see them all again during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “I ENJOY BE THERE.”
Reviews.Author: FLASH1955
Reviews.Content: The people in this hotel is the most valuable asset, everyone try always you stay confortable . I take a suite with direct access to the beach and a very nice pergola. The food is very good, very good drinks and snacks and once in a week a Gala dinner with very carefully Menu..

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: joakinrp
Reviews.Content: I want to share my great experience lived at gran porto, it was my fisrt time at this resort and I had a wonderful time here, it started when I arrived in the hotel we had a great and warm welcome by the front desk, check in was complete and fast we had thorough information by Ricardo Hernandez, and then we felt very comfortable because the front desk manager Carlos Melgar scorted us to our room and show us the facilities we were entitled to use, he was outstanding, then we checked the room it was an ocean view it was gorgeous, we didnt want to left the room, we had breakfast at albatros, and spent the whole day at the pool, the beach and the bar, Cecilia at lobby bar was very pleasant and waited on us very well we were very happy with her service we enjoyed it all, unfortunately for us the next day we had to leave, but we had an exceptional time here everything was outstanding and excellent, I wolud recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “second visit & will return”
Reviews.Author: conchasdiver
Reviews.Content: Spent several days enjoying the all-inclusive comforts of Gran Porto Real resort which is located on the beachfront in Playa del Carmen, MX. The flight from Houston to Cancun is an easy two-hour hop, then it's a one-hour trip south from Cancun airport to the laid-back town of Playa. There's plenty of nightlife in Playa if one wishes, but it's not as crowded or expensive as staying in Cancun. Playa is also closer to many of the attractions the Mexican Yucatan offers, such as the Mayan ruins of Chichen Itza & Tulum. A pleasant day trip might include a ride on one of the large air-conditioned water ferrys from Playa to the island of Cozumel for shopping & wandering around the large plaza. Gran Porto Real offers very comfortable air-conditioned rooms w/ free wi-fi throughout the facilities. This is a family-friendly resort but speaking as one who travels without children, I was never bothered by them as there are plenty of distractions to keep them busy. The resort includes several well-appointed restaurants, including a full-time interior buffet & a nice exterior lunch buffet by the large pool. Bars are seemingly everywhere w/ a large one overlooking the pool, so no one goes hungry or thirsty. The staff are pleasant, accommodating & most speak very good English. This visit was my group's second visit to Gran Porto Real w/ both trips booked through Continental Vacations which does an excellent job, from greeting you at the airport, arranging all transfers & remaining available to vacationers throughout the trip. Overall, a very easy & affordable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Once more fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rivier66
Reviews.Content: This has been our fifth visit to Gran Porto Real and most probably it hasn't been our last. Why we think you should stay at GPR when going to Playa del Carmen? The location is excellent, near 5th Avenue in downtown Playa del Carmen. The hotel has a very nice atmosphere, being not too big and not too small. Rooms are awesome, but make sure you take a family suite, which is bigger and more convenient. Oceanfront family suites overlook the beach and the ocean: gorgeous, if you are willing to spend the extra money. We felt it was certainly worth the extra money. Food and beverage: excellent service all-day-long. The buffet restaurant serves different buffet themes throughout the week, but if you can't find anything you like you always have the option of ordering something else from the kitchen. Apart from the buffet restaurant you can opt for a-la-carte-dining in the Mexican or Italian restaurant. The entertainment team has a full program every day from 10am to 5pm. Participate if you like, and if you don't that's ok as well. Apart from everything we have mentioned above, what really makes this hotel special is the excellent staff all around the hotel. Truly friendly, always willing to help and and doing their utmost to give you a true vacation feeling. This extends from the reception to all the people responsible for cleaning and from the entertainment staff to to the waiters on the beach, in the restaurants and in the bars. At the risk of forgetting some people we would like to say thank you to a number of people that have contributed to another great vacation for us at GPR. Thank you Samantha for getting us two excellent rooms. Thank you José, Pablo, Yuliana and Jesus for numerous drinks on the beach and nice conversations. Thank you Teresa and Miryam for excellent bar service in the evenings. Thank you Mike, Victor, Caesar, Alejandro, Armando and Rodrigo for entertainment and fun througout the day. Thank you Verlain, Frank, Chucho, May and Florencino for excellent service in the buiffet restaurant. We loved the food and we loved the Mayan coffee... And last but not least: thank you José, Luis, Gus and Armando. We've spent many nights with you in Il Pescatore and enjoyed it every time. Needless to say we had a real good time and will probably be back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: hajjj
Reviews.Content: i was in the gran porto real hotel in june 2011 for 2 weeks with my girlfriend, we realy enjoyed our time and the service! Special thanks to Ivan!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.... standard room smaller than expected but fab hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: louise19802
Reviews.Content: Prior to our stay at the Gran Porto Real we had read on Tripadvisor on a number of reviews about the upgrade offer upon checking in, following a fantastic welcome and service, being given a welcome drink also we was offered an upgrade. Though unlike some places they weren't pushy and were very nice, with it being our honeymoon they gave us a free upgrade to a junior suite for the first night. Our first impressions of the hotel, service and room was WOW!! excellent location, food, staff and hotel.. however, while the junior suite was excellent, when we was allocated a room the following night for the remainder of our stay we wasn't happy with the room, don't get me wrong, great decor, very clean but there was no balcony (2 chairs outside in the area outside of the room) very small and dark also and instead of one double or larger bed there was two beds which weren't quite as big as a double... if this hadnt been our honeymoon, we probably would have been fine with it but when we paid £3500 for the 2 weeks we at least expected a balcony and a bigger room, we've paid less than this on holiday before and had a lot mor from a room for our money. Therefore, we upgraded to The Royal accross the road as there was no more rooms to upgrade to at The Porto Real...having been impressed with The Porto Real as a whole, we didnt think we could be anymore impressed...wrong!!! The Royal was even more impressive, 5 5 star a la carte restaurants all at Michelin Star standard and it blew us away!!!! amazing, however, if you are a family with children then it is an adult only hotel... Overall, I have no complaints about the port real, apart from we expected more from the room for our money. The food and service was excellent and although we ended up staying at the royal, we still came back to The Port Real on occasions for drinks or food as we was still entitled to with it being ran by the same 'Real' name. Enjoy...I would go back tomorrow!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: jeeprus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real Aug 6 thru Aug 13. We booked the Beachfront Walkout room. The room was clean; a little worn, but nice. We had direct access to the beach which was a plus. The food was above average and service was excellent. The pool was kept very clean and the nightly entertainment was pretty good; everything shuts down around 10:00pm. On the negative side, when we checked in, we received no info on the restaurants or activities. The buffet restaurant had a couple "surf and turf" nights that we did not know about until after the fact. The restaurants and lobby are not air conditioned so around lunch if you want to eat at the buffet you will sweat while eating. We had stayed at the Moon Palace a couple of years ago, and their restaurants and lobby are air conditioned; it makes it nice to get out of the heat for a little while. Excursions....We did the Coba tour thru Trafictours at the Hotel, Jose was very helpful on booking....We toured the ruins,had lunch, and visited a Mayan home...our tour guide was one of the worst we had ever encountered. We also did the swim with the dolphins,manatees, and sea lions at Dolphin Discovery. Everything was top notch other than when it was time to buy pictures a CD was $25 per picture or around $270 for the CD. All in all a pretty good trip, would probably not stay again at this hotel due to the lack of air conditioning in restaurants and lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Barnesy66
Reviews.Content: I have been reading some of the other reviews and am beginning to wonder if we are talking about the same hotel! I honestly don't know how anyone can be even slightly negative about this place. Yes they did try to get us to upgrade to the Royal Hotel opposite but I had read about this and only had to say "no thanks". Our room which was a junior suite was clean and spacious it might not of been amazing but it was a lovely room. I am glad we upgraded though as some of the standard rooms over looked what looked like the staff accommodation which was a bit unsightly. We returned every day to beautiful towel sculptures and sometimes chocolates. The whole hotel is spotlessly clean with staff working around the clock to keep it this way. The staff are the most helpful I have ever known, nothing was too much trouble and they were continuously smiling. A big thankyou to Aurellio in the roof top cocktail/sushi bar I think we sampled every cocktail there is and more! The food is more than adequate, with plenty of choice in the buffet reataurant, the Italian was really very good (our favourite,) the Mexican was dissapointing. We were really surprised that the drinks were not just local ones, they were all branded (you know the real stuff) which is very unusual for an all inclusive. I have to mention the 24 hour room we renamed this room"The Best Room In The World", as it had everything you could wish for. It was stocked with food which was changed on a regular basis including fresh fruit, Pastries, sandwiches, hors d'ovres and tortillas to name but a few, and you could help yourself to any drinks including beer on draught and sparkling wine, at any time of the day or night. The beach was beautiful, pure white sands and palm trees, sun beds a plenty and no need to get up early to reserve one. The sand stays cool all day and there is a lovely breeze if you sit near the beach bar at the far end near the Royal Hotel. The only slight problem was some noise in the corridors in the mornings. We travelled as a group of 3 couples and can quite honestly say we all had a fantastic time and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort i have stayed at and will definitly be back.....”
Reviews.Author: jose m
Reviews.Content: This is an all inclusive resort and it is definitely worth the price. They had something for everybody and that includes children. They have a kids zone there and that was perfect for my 6 yr old daughter. It is not just a babysitter type service, they actually had activities that included movie nights, a luau on the beach only for the kids and costume partys. The girls there DULCE,DANNY SANDRA AND GINA are awesome. They also have a teen zone there thats for kids 12 and over and it was perfect for my 12 yr old son. It might sound bad because it really is only video games in there but its good for my son because he would be in the pool with us for a few hrs but usually when he would get tired we would all have to leave the pool and go to the room. In this case he had the option of doing something he enjoyed just to rest a while from the hot sun and as long as he enjoyed himself i didnt mind him cooling off in the teen zone. And he actually made friends in there that he actually ended up doing other stuff with around the resort. The food was great and not the usual buffet of the same old stuff. It was different food for lunch breakfast and dinner everyday. So that was good and the waiters there CECILIA, MANO NORBERTO AND CECILIA were great. Very attentive and if your cup was empty it would be refilled quickly. With my kids sometimes they would need something different and they were very accommodating towards that. JESUS the waiter by the pool is the best person ever. He busts his butt and makes sure everyone not only has a full cup but is also having a good time. Service alone will make me come back to the resort and all the other good stuff is just a great added bonus......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: NJ_JK
Reviews.Content: The GF and I arrived to the hotel after a long day of travel to have the front desk inform us that the room we reserved was not available that night and that they were upgrading us to a Junior Ocean Front Suite with a walk-out and that we could move to the room we reserved (Junior Ocean Front Suite) the next day. Aware of their upgrade sales tactics, I informed them that I did not want to switch rooms in the middle of my vacation. But even after discussing the situation with a manager, we made no progress and took the "free upgrade" and planned to switch the next morning. Surprisingly, we had no problems switching the next morning and happily settled into our third floor Junior Ocean Front Suite. The rest of the vacation was wonderful. A few topics to touch on: Food: The food was fine. Nothing 5 star, but perfectly edible and tasty. Not a ton of selection between the buffet and two restaurants, but enough of a variation where we were happy with staying in the resort to eat all week. A note: the portions at the Italian place were rather small, so order 2 or 3 entrees to get your fill. Pool: The pool was great. A little warm for our taste, but it made relaxing easier. As far as the pool-side waitresses, Theresa was really the only one that continuously came back. We tipped quite generously, but it didn't seem to help. I'd recommend ordering multiple drinks at a time to help pass the time until their next pass. Even though the pool didn't open until 9, you had to be out by 7 or 8 to get a chair; we would drop a towel off on our way to breakfast. Chairs also seemed to open up after 3. WARNING: The pool deck is VERY slippery, so be careful when walking. Speaking of towels, Eduardo was always waiting to hand you the towels with a smile on his face. He took the time to talk to you and we walked away each time with a smile on our face after seeing him. The pool activity staff was LAZY. There was the standard pool volleyball and water aerobics, but otherwise they seemed happy with playing the "lazy game" (guess how many beans in a jar or guess how many pages in a book). Nightlife: There was none. The nightly shows started at 8:30 and ended by 9:30. If you wanted more, you had to head onto 5th Ave. Beach: The beach was very nice. We didn't spend much time there, but there were always plenty of chairs and even gazebos available. The walk-out rooms have reserved gazebos with outdoor mattresses, but they didn't seem too comfortable. We preferred the gazebos with the beach chairs. It was a bit sad to see all the exposed sandbags on the beach from the beach erosion, but the water was clear and warm and with minimal waves, it was quite enjoyable to float and relax. Room: We had a Junior Ocean Front Suite on the third floor. We were right over the "stage" by the pool, but since the pool closed at 9 and the shows ended by 9:30, there were no noise issues. The bathroom was well stocked, though the soap tray had no drainage holes so the soap sat in water almost the entire week (it's the little things). Guest Services: These guys are amazing. We got to calling their area "the shark tank". Don't make eye contact with them unless you want your ear talked off. We managed to avoid them the entire week, though they called the room earlier and earlier each day to try and get us. Luckily we were out for excursions almost every day so all we got were voicemails. They did try to lure me down with the threat of having to sign some government papers. I'd highly recommend avoiding them at all costs. Scuba/Excursions: My GF and I both did a scuba trip through the shop that's set up in the hotel. We actually went to Cozumel for the day and had a wonderful time! The trip was well organized, and while the scuba boat was a bit small, the guides made the day worthwhile. A high recommendation is you're certified, or not (GF took the resort course and went down with an instructor). They also have snorkling, which we heard people raving about. The tour desk on site was also helpful. We booked a "swim with the dolphins" tour through them. The only odd thing was it was a cash or cc payment; they couldn't put the tour on your room. Playa del Carmen: The area around the hotel was very nice. 5th Avenue was a 5 minute walk from the hotel and is a nice pedestrian shopping street. There's everything you could want there in terms of shopping and eating. Be aware that a lot of the merchants can be a bit aggressive to try and get you into the store, but a simple "no gracias" was enough to get them to back off. We felt very safe walking there at night, and even ventured out early in the morning (6am) to run. We saw plenty of other people running as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, excellent service, perfect location, many more visits to come”
Reviews.Author: Michael O
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa and will definitely be back. The location is perfect! Right on the ocean and 2 minutes, walking, from 5th Ave, shopping, food, clubs, etc. hub, of Playa del Carmen. Resort: The service was amazing, very friendly and kind. This was our first all inclusive vacation and we found it to be exactly what we are looking for. The resort was recommended to us by family that has visited Playa and stayed at the Gran Porto Real for almost 9 years and they said nothing but wonderful things. With the help of Paul at the front desk, we upgraded to the Beach Front Walkout Suite which was fantastic. We had our own palapa and had a perfect view of the ocean. The room was immaculate and the housekeeper did an excellent job everyday. Paul, who worked at the front desk was very professional and courteous and always greeted us by name when we saw him. A few other hotel staff that stood out for us was: Alejandro, activities person, very friendly and funny and we enjoyed our bike tour of Playa with him a great deal. Eduardo, towel counter by pool, very nice and courteous. Ismael, Frank, and Oscar, who all worked at the various restaurants at the Hotel, they were all very kind and thoughtful and were very efficient with their beverage and food service. Victor, a security guard, is also worth mentioning as he assured us of our safety and gave us helpful tips about our stay at the resort and other tips about Playa del Carmen. It is difficult to remember all of the staff who also provided spectacular service as the whole staff seem to understand how nice it is to be treated special while on vacation. We felt a genuine kindness from each of the hotel staff during every interaction. My wife and I are looking forward to many more visits to Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa in the future and hope we will see the familiar faces that have left a wonderful impression of the resort on us. The location is perfect, close to everything. The beach is great and the town is wonderful too but we truly enjoyed staying in the resort for most of our stay in Playa. The food is great, always a variety, many choices and it was all wonderful. The beverage selection is superb as well. The spa is wonderful, sauna, steam room, jacuzzi, & cold plunge, work out room and full spa treatments, massages etc. You must try the resort for yourself and feel the charm of it. Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful. ( I tried to put more pictures on here but the files were too large, I guess you'll have to go see for yourself!)

Reviews.Title: “Have been back three times and we will be back again.”
Reviews.Author: cpizzy
Reviews.Content: The food and entertainment is fabulous. The location is perfect. Within a walking block you have 2 miles of shops, restaurant, bars and even a casino. All inclusive that you could not ask for more of anything. Security is at it's maximum for all tourists and residents. Typing this makes me want to take an immediate vacation back to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Won't visit this one again!”
Reviews.Author: thebroons1630
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 weeks at this hotel. Before we even checked in the staff were trying to get us to upgrade to their sister hotel across the road at a cost of USD40 per night. We declined the offer as we'd already spent a considerable amount on our holiday! We had a 'junior suite' as this is all that was available when we booked. Quite disappointed as it was no different from normal hotel rooms we've had in other hotels in Mexico. However on the plus side the bed was comfy, air con effective and the shower was good. The room was kept very clean too. There was a lack of storage space for our clothes unfortunately and some of our clothers had to sit on a small table for the fortnight. There were connecting doors to rooms on either side of us so I suppose they couldn't place a chest of drawers in front of these. They could have put one behind the door though instead of the dining table and 2 chairs! The food in the buffet restaurant was not to our taste and while we used it at breakfast time, we only used it twice in the evenings and on the 2nd occasion encountered a cockroach in the middle of the dining room which put us off eating! There are only 2 other restaurants, Italian and Mexican, which are NOT bookable in advance as they're open to the general public. We used the Italian restaurant one night and had to queue for about 10 minutes which wasn't too bad. However the table we were given was outside the main restaurant on the balcony. There was no lighting out here which made reading the menu quite a challenge! When the waiter came to take our order, he produced a torch! We didn't go back there again. The Mexican restaurant was much better and we could see what we were doing there and what we were eating! We ate out one night at Karen's on 5th Avenue where we had a much better experience! The beach also disappointed us as we were encouraged not to move the sun beds too far from their straight lines. It was pretty stoney and rocky in the sea although the water was lovely. Finally it was sometimes a bit of a challenge getting a drink! This depended very much on who was on duty and in the main the staff were very good - polite and trying their best to make sure we enjoyed our holiday. So we won't go back to this one again I'm afraid!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this resort and will definitly be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Donald J
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a four day trip to the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen. From the minute we arrived at the resort we were treated like VIPs. They gave us a welcome drink during the check in process and fully explained our package. We did take advantage of the upgrade from a junior suite ocean view to the ocean front. The view was amazing!! The room was beautiful, very clean, and the mini bar was kept fully stocked. Each evening we came back to beautiful towel animals and one evening there was a bottle of wine and fruit. We did some tours and the staff was extremely helpful in planning out our watersport rentals and very informative in regards to local things to do. We ate at all of the restaurants on the property and they were all good but our favorite was the Italian restaurant. The trendy 5th Avenue was only a block away and walking to that area was safe and we had a great time there also. All of the staff were wonderful but I must say that Jesus at the pool area was the greatest! He was fun, so very nice, and he never let our drinks run out. He is a very special person and the Gran Porto is very fortunate to have him on their staff!! Also, the three bartenders at the pool were great too ( Miguel, Hector, and Auvelio). This resort is in a perfect location with many Mayan ruins and other places to explore very close by but we could also be very happy just staying on property. This was our first trip to Playa Del Carmen and we fully intend to go back to the gran porto and bring other family members with us Donald and Susan Jett

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: pamela r
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. It is such a comfortable and intimate atmosphere. It definitely goes beyond your expectations. The staff there make you feel at home and makes your stay as pleasant as possible. If there is any need you may have, the staff will make sure they will diligently meet that need. This is my first day back in New Jersey since my five day stay at the Gran Porto Real and I woke up this morning wanting to go back... I will definitely make this trip again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: KatieMcD6386
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived here on Friday 7/22/11 around 2:30pm...we were greeted as soon as we arrived, by the bellhops and someone gave us both a glass of sparkling wine. It was really nice. Richard helped us check-in, we did online check-in prior to arriving. Since we arrived a bit earlier than check-in time, we were told by Richard that our room was being cleaned and it would be ready shortly. We were also shown on a map where our room would be so while we waited, we went outside to go look at the type of view we were going to have. Turns out, he was going to put us on the ground floor with a small patio. We noticed that the rooms above were the same type of rooms (junior suite), but a bigger balcony with a nicer view, so we went back in to Richard and asked him if we could be switched, he switched us and it turned out that room was ready...not sure why he didn't just give us that room in the 1st place. So the point is, speak up if you have a concern, because they were more than willing to accomodate us when we asked them to. The ground floor pool is nice, but there are a lot of kids running around everywhere. We preferred to use the pool on the 2nd floor, it's smaller, but it has a pool bar and less kids around. Both pools were extremely warm, like bath water. Their beach is nice and had plenty of seating. We only smelled the sour smell of seaweed if the wind blew a certain way and it only lasted for a couple of seconds. The buffet was O.K., especially for a snack...they had lots to choose from. The Italian place was delicious, but small portions so make sure you order some appetizers, or 2 meals. The Mexican restaurant was pretty good, I'm not a big fan of that type of food so I'm probably not a good judge of that, but I enjoyed it for the most part. All places are not air-conditioned. I found that sitting outside was cooler than being seated inside. Also, during the day they have grilled foods behind the pool on the ground floor...pretty good food! Every single staff member that we came across was exceptionally nice, they are all very hard-working. When you're out at the pool or on the beach, they make sure you have a drink in your hand at all times, water...alcohol...soda, you name it, you got it! The room was nice, we had a junior suite overlooking the street, the only thing that we found to be a little strange was that you had to keep your room key inserted into a slot in order to have your electricity on (all outlets, and lights) so we would walk in the room at night and go to turn a light on and completely forget that we needed to insert the key. The room has an iron and hairdryer in there, along with a safe that we used and had no issues with anyone trying to steal our money, etc. out of our room. My family arrived at The Royal (across the street) on Saturday morning and we already knew this, but it was an inconvenience that we were not able to use the same facilities as they were...therefore, we went over to The Royal on Saturday and asked how much it would cost if we transferred over there. They gave us a VERY good price ($200 extra for 6 days), we had to take it...that way we were still able to come back to Gran Porto and also have the ability to use all of the other sister resorts amenities. We transferred over there on Sunday 7/24/11. The room was bigger, a lot nicer, every room has a jacuzzi, right away we knew we had made a great decision. Although the front desk staff wasn't as friendly as Gran Porto's, the resort was a lot nicer and more elegant than Gran Porto. The Royal is adults only, which made for a much more peaceful vacation. Their beach and pool's were nicer as well. If you have the money, and are able to transfer...I highly suggest you do so. We received a better deal by transferring over than if we had booked directly online, so I would also suggest that you wait until you're there to transfer. 5th Avenue is a block up and it was interesting to say the least, men are begging for you to come in their stores to buy things...just ignore them or say no thanks. They also ask if you want cuban cigars and/or drugs. Very bizarre. If you walk down a little bit more, noone really bothers you anymore. Also, the federales drive around in trucks and stand around all over that area with their machine guns in hand, a little scary at first but then you got used to them. There's a Starbucks on both ends of 5th Avenue, too, which I thought was great. You can haggle with the guys that beg you to come into their store, but you can't haggle too much farther down because those stores are more professional. Another thing, make sure you know what the conversion between pesos and US dollar, etc. is because they will try and trick you into thinking that the price in pesos is really the price in US dollars. Just speak up and say no, it's actually only this much... By the way, they do not serve Corona at the resorts, they have Sol which they think is better tasting down there. They also have Coors Light, but that's about the only other familiar beer I remember seeing. The water that is served, is treated so don't worry about drinking it. Also the mixed drinks aren't that strong so ask for double shots. It's extremely hot and humid in Mexico at this time of year. I packed jeans and a hoodie and I didn't even come close to needed them and I get chilly very easily. It is HOT day and night down there. Bring lots of sunscreen and a hat! Overall, Gran Porto Real was great even though we only stayed there for 2 nights, it was a very nice resort and I would highly recommend this to families going on vacation with their kids. If you're a couple going on vacation without any kids, stay at The Royal Playa del Carmen, across the street. I hope this helps! Enjoy your vacation! :)

Reviews.Title: “Does NOT live up to expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Veggiefuel
Reviews.Content: Their motto is "exceeding your expectation" they should get another one maybe "heard you had expectations, we could care less" Maybe if you drink a lot the food is good. We don't drink, the food was horrible. I'm no food snob, my family calls me the garbage disposal. We ate at places other then the hotel even though we paid for the all inclusive meals. The first thing they do is try to sell you on a time share. They do this under the guise of giving you information about the resort. Beaches have sandbags for erosion. Once you get past those, you better be wearing shoes, the rocks will cut your feet. Try to find bottled water…Good luck. They ran out one day. Best day travel is in the lobby, but you have to pay best day on the spot. There's a very helpful man on the beach "John" that can arrange all the same things, charge it to your room and you sea doo, parasail etc with out having to go to a different location and waste a half day with "best day" Wi-Fi? it's advertised, good luck keeping a signal. Wouldn't go there again if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “friendly family stay”
Reviews.Author: kirk441
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and attentive at all times, they were there to make our stay a memorable one. The buffet which serves three meals a day has plenty of variety to suit all taste buds. The also have an italian restaurant which is specially good! We found the suites to be very comfortable and with all the amenities one needs. The beach in front of this property is not particularly pretty, so we went swimming at the beach of the other Porto Real (the only adults one). The nightly entertainment is OK and serves the purpose. I did´t really like the beverage service (part of the all inclusive plan) because they were too sweet and were served in plastic cups, which sort contradicts the hotels efforts to save energy by using towels and sheets more than once. I saw those plastic cups flying around sometimes. Apart from that, the hotel is always clean. Great for families!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed - Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: morlar
Reviews.Content: We were first booked at Real Playa del Carmen, and was a bit dissapointed. We were then offered an upgrade to stay at Gran Porto Real for $ 50 a night. We stayed for 2 weeks at GP and absolutely LOVED it. The staff is amazing, we could not beleive the hospitality EVERYBODY are so polite and go out of there way to please you. A special thanks to Aaron (bell boy), Chicken, Armando (and the rest of the sport animation crew), Frank (Francisco), May, Antonio in the reasturant, Lucas for the diving trip, and not to forget all the personel around the pool and bar for serving drinks non stop. We would definetly like to come back and can highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, loud staff, below average food and small pool area”
Reviews.Author: calcio22_9
Reviews.Content: We would encourage anyone considering the Gran Porto to highly consider other hotels in the area. Our experience at the Gran Porto was lackluster from the very beginning. CHECK-IN: At check-in, they encourage you to upgrade to their adult-only sister resort (The Royal). It's across the street. I won't touch on this much, but I would say the only reason to book at the Gran Porto is so that you can upgrade to The Royal when you arrive (less expensive than booking The Royal). If you have kids, this is not an option since the Royal is adults-only. We did online check-in to speed up the process, however, that was useless. We arrived into the lobby of organized chaos and the online check-in person was away at lunch and thus we went through the standard check-in process. We arrived prior to the 3pm check-in time and our room was not ready, so the bellboy took our luggage and placed it insecurely at the entrance of the hotel. Once our room was ready, I informed the bellboy who told me me that a colleague of his would be taking it to our room. Two hours later and our luggage was still sitting in the hotel lobby. My wife and I walked up to it, along with many other pieces of luggage and just took it to our room. No questions asked from the staff. ROOM: Having been to the area before, we booked a King Bed Junior Suite (no oceanview). When we arrived at our room we were surprised to find a very small bathroom and all of these category rooms facing the busy and loud Play Del Carmen street. The minibar was empty (only a single beer in it). We requested a quieter room and they obliged. While the room was still noisy from the street, more care was put into it and the room was larger, even though it's the same category. Unfortunate, that such a difference exists for the same price room. The room's amenities were fine, however, one can hardly relax. The room faces the street which has trash pick-up and tour buses constantly stopped early in the morning to pick-up for excursions. We were up by 6am each day because of this. In addition, the housekeeping carts begin at around 7am and you hear every wheel of the cart as it slaps the ceramic tiles. They really need rubber wheels! It also did not help sleeping when the ping pong table is directly outside of your door. DINING: Some of the worst food we ever had on vacation, unless your idea of good food is precooked hamburgers and nachos with bright orange cheese sauce. Albatross, the main buffet style restaurant served breakfast, lunch and dinner. Breakfast was acceptable with make-to-order omelets, pancakes, french toast and waffles, as well as a good variety of juices. Albatross is the only breakfast option. Lunch was hit or miss and sadly the only option at the resort other than the pool bar that served hamburgers, hot dogs and some small pizza slices. Dinner could be had in Albatross, Pescatore or Maria's. Pescatore and Maria's had very attentive service and tried very hard to go out of their way to accommodate our requests, however, the service could do very little to hide the fact that they were cooking on a budget. Shrimp were about the size of a quarter, steaks were an 1/8 of an inch thick and the menu did not change throughout the week, nor were their any specials available. None of the restaurants were air conditioned making most meals uncomfortable. Room service ends at 10pm and the 24/7 lounge is the only air-conditioned area in the resort other than your hotel room. It provides a television, light snacks, a soda fountain and coffee machine. AMENITIES: We spent most of our time pool or beach side which was absolutely gorgeous. No complaints about the beach area and while the pool was nice, the resort does not have enough pool-side lounge chairs. This resulted in lounge chairs being reserved in the wee hours of the morning. The resort has only two pools, one near the beach and one on the third floor of the hotel just for adults. Only the small adult-only pool had a swim-up bar and sadly the two times we went up to the pool, it was closed (middle of the day). Also, unfortunate, the resort pools close at 9pm for cleaning. Far to early. Other than the pool and the beach, this resort does not have any other open areas to be entertained -- and the only air-conditioned area is the 24/7 lounge. SUMMARY: The resort is in the heart of Playa Del Carmen, just outside of the pedestrian-only fifth avenue. If you're looking for a city-like vacation environment, than consider Cancun or stay next door at The Royal if you have no kids (we stayed one night). If you're looking for a tranquil escape for you and your family, then consider any of the many resorts on the Riviera Maya, but do not stay at the Gran Porto unless you would like to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss It !”
Reviews.Author: Laredo_TXBolovan
Reviews.Content: The staff was great. The food was good. Two specialty restaurants and the buffet were great. The waiter in the Italian restaurant Mateo was the best. The bartender Rodrigo was also very nice. The pools are a bit crowded but there is one pool on the second floor that is not as noisy and it has its own swim up bar. The lobby and rooms are excellent. The only downside is that the hotel shuts down at midnight. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is located next to beach and really close to the world renowned 5th avenue. Great staff !! I've stayed in this hotel twice already.

Reviews.Title: “family vacation”
Reviews.Author: tonyram1975
Reviews.Content: Gran porto excceding your expectations from service manager to people in lobby. Special thanks you to the restaurants and bars Marias restaurante y Albatros. Domingo taaes for the service

Reviews.Title: “We liked it enough”
Reviews.Author: MilenaANDJarek
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Playa. Previously we stayed in a small hotel on the beach with breakfast only. GPR is a completely different experience. The hotel is ok, but we agreed that we would much rather do a B&B again.. We enjoy eating authentic food in different restaurants and cozy atmosphere. Anyway, this time we went for an AI mainly because we wanted to spend as little as possible and there is no secret that AI's work out a lot cheaper. We still went out for food few times as we were getting a little tired of the food at GPR. We found the food to be good overall, but not excellent. Buffet selection was good, Italian restaurant had nice steaks, mexican was ok, but everything we had there seemed to be over salted.
