Drinks are not the best, far too sweet, to much grenadine in all of them. We always asked them to make a sour drink for us and we found Clementine to be the least sweet. Mojitos were also usually ok. In terms of the rooms, we stayed in a junior suite and it is important to mention that not all junior suites are the same. The ones in the newer part of the building are a lot nicer than those in the old part. We actually changed rooms twice.. The first room was the nicest but it had two double beds and we wanted a king size bed. The second room was in the old part, on the ground floor. It wasn't as nice as the first one but had a king size bed. Unfortunately we had to change it as well as there was damp on the ceiling and unbearable smell which we hoped would go away as we left the balcony open overnight, but it didn't. The third room was again in the old part, but on the first floor, it was not the greatest room, but we decided to stay in it as we didn't want to moan and keep moving rooms. In the end we realised that the first one we had was the best of all three and actually regretted that we didn't stay in it. The biggest problem in this hotel in our opinion is noise. You can hear everything there, so it is not good for light sleepers. Overall, the hotel is ok, staff is nice, nobody ever bothered us,nobody was trying to sell us anything, nobody was trying to make us upgrade to the Royal. The beach is ok, however not great for swimming as there are lots of rocks in the water. The location is great. Overall, we would probably not return... Big hotels are simply nor us, too noisy, too busy, food- no matter how varied gets boring after a while. We prefer small hotels, food in different places every night even though it costs more.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great. Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: filam567
Reviews.Content: This was me and my wife's first trip to Mexico and first all inclusive trip. The resort was okay. The rooms were musky but clean. The food was terrible. The best food we had was on the way home at the Bubba Gumps in the Cancoon airport. The alcohol and drinks were cheap and tasted it. The wristband/cattle tag that you have to wear is annoying and a contsant reminder of how disappointed I was. Everyone in Mexico that worked in the tourism industry were very pushy and sly about trying to sell you anything. It's a very beautiful area but there is no authenticity to be found. It's a tourist trap. We purchased an upgrade to eat at the nicer Royal Playa next door but every time we went over to eat we were accosted multiple times by security who requested to look at our wristbands and confirm that we had the upgrade. And then the food at the Royal Playa was just as bad. Don't go unless you stay at the Royal Playa as long as you don't mind below average food. At least the Royal Playa had better grade alcohol.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: MoJoJo22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real in April. We are in our 40's and brought our 15 and 16 year old boys with us. It was our first time to Mexico and our first time to an all inclusive resort. We had a fantastic stay. I read what seems to be a thousand reviews on this site before we went... so let me sum up opinion easily for you: Positives: ~ CLEAN Hotel ~ FANTASTIC Location - never felt unsafe, loved 5th ave... everything you could want is right there - took a trip to the Mayan temples - amazing! ~ Super friendly staff!!! ~ Great food, lots of variety, Italian and Mexican restaurants were excellent. ~ Upstairs pool bar lots of fun ~ Poker night fun ~ "Swing" bar (bar with swings instead of bar stools) was wonderful ~ Free non-motorized water sports, fun, minimal to no wait ~ loved the hidden hammocks and jacuzzi on the roof ~ Junior Suites are beautiful!!! ~ Safes in every room - I don't understand how people can get things stolen, we locked up plenty of cash, jewelry and iPads... NO problems! ~ Free WiFi... was able to use my iPad just about everywhere ~ fast and friendly room service, will bring anything you ask for ~ great family resort Negatives ~ Check in - they didn't have our room available the first night, so we got pushed from Jr. Suites to a standard room - the standard rooms were tiny and unimpressive. ~ Sandbags on the beach, although it didn't bother us much, the beach is still beautiful ~ Main pool gets slightly crowded, but not that bad ~ Forget the sushi bar... it is sitting in the sun most of the day Other items of interest: ~ Teenagers were allowed to drink, although we were there when they got their wristbands, so they were supervised by us. ~ Great spa, but expensive... can get wonderful massages a short walk away for 1/4 of the price ~ Can easily walk the beach to night clubs ~ plenty of places to parasail and do other things right close by Feel free to email me if you have any other specific questions! ENJOY your vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to come home!”
Reviews.Author: Theholidayduo
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews of this hotel and was a little bit apprehensive. It was our 25th Wedding Anniversary so wanted it to be perfect. We picked this hotel because it included families and although we weren't taking our children we felt that we liked a relaxed atmosphere and it's always nice to see families enjoying themselves whilst knowing we were having a bit of respite from ours. The other reason we picked it was because of the location....... and it did not disappoint. It is in Playa del Carmen. You can see the beach and the water from the hotel pool! It takes two minutes to walk to 5th Avenue and the shops. On the beachfront are hotels, beach clubs and some shops at the ferry end. There were plenty of fishing boats for hire and beach activities. An ideal location for us as we did not want to be stuck on a resort in the middle of the jungle and have to pay taxi fare to have a stroll in town. Yes, people have said about the sandbags - that is natures fault. People have said about the seaweed - that is natures fault, but people worked hard to clear it. If you walk for two minutes either direction yes the beach is more as you imagine, but people were swimming in front of the hotel and the small fishing boats added character. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted with a drink. Check in went quick and our room was ready. Yes we were asked if guest services(ie the Real people in the blue shirt could show us about but we declined). We were taken to our room. We had booked a Junior Suite. It was on the ground floor. Have to say the room was fine. Everything worked not a problem and plenty of space for the two of us.In fact we were happy we were on the first floor because if we needed to go back to our room it didn't take long! The service we received was lovely. The people who worked there whenever you went by said hello and there were times in the restaurant that if I tried to tidy up they come over and did it and told me stop I was on holiday!. The maid for our room was excellent. In fact we never saw her and we stayed there a fortnite. She left beautiful towel animals for us. One person who made it for us was Jesus, the pool waiter. He was friendly without being intrusive, refilling our drinks when he saw we were low. We didnt like Maria, Marias the mexican restaurant but enjoyed the Italian. We only went to these once each, the rest of the time we eat in the buffet. yes, there was food we didnt like because of all the spices but the mexicans there did. They do though try hard to have european. They would cook your beef, chicken, steak as you were waiting. Had a beautiful steak. Evening entertainment was a hit or miss for me but plenty others enjoyed. Some of the dancers though were very good. All in all a fantastic holiday and yes we are planning to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it, will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: pinksneaks
Reviews.Content: The resort was incredible. A wonderful experience, the resort was clean, and they had a great variety of food. The guys in the recreation and entertainment made the entire trip more memorable for the entire family. Cesar, Victor "Chicken", Armando, and Alejandro were great with not only the kids but provided fun activities for all ages. I also really enjoyed the variety of tropical drinks at the bar. Avila the bartender was excellent and made some of the best drinks I have ever tried and some of which I have never heard of especially the Mango Daiquiri's. My family and I will definetly return and I hope to see the same familiar faces. I felt safe, and even their gift shop items were reasonable. I will advise to bring plenty of sunscreen, the waitstaff is excellent but ice seems hard to come by and melts at the blink of an eye.

Reviews.Title: “HAVE YOUR WEDDING HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: MonkysAndrea
Reviews.Content: My (now) husband and I decided to have our wedding here after a visit in September 2010. It was fantastic - everyone was so well taken care of. All of our family want to go back! The wedding was beautiful, and exactly what I wanted. And it was far less stressful, and expensive than it would have been if we got married at home. We had 41 guests, and no one had any complaints. Many (including us) are already planning their return trips.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite resorts”
Reviews.Author: ccsparks
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night June 19, 2011. My sister and I had been down at Moon Palace the 3 previous nights but as a travel agent I wanted to experience at least one night at the Gran Porto Real. This place is really great! Samantha at the front desk goes above and beyond to help. The resort is clean and up to date. The food is good. One of the best things about this resort is the proximity to Fifth Avenue, ferry to Cozumel and the beach. I'll return again and again.....

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: PSB2
Reviews.Content: This is my first review, but my wife and I use tripadvisor all the time, so I thought I would write quick review. I would agree with most of the reviews that the hotel is clean and the service was very good. That is the good. However, what was not mentioned by the reviews or our travel agent, the hotel is packed with little children. If you have young children and want to take a vacation in Playa Del Carmen, then this resort is a good option. However, we had a 20 and 19 year old children. The amount of younger children was almost too much and the parents of these younger children were very pushy. The other very large negative for this resort is the beach. Don't be fooled, the beach here is terrible. It is filled with rocks and seaweed. You cannot swim here. Next, the pool(s). The larger pool by the beach is not very "large" and tends to be filled with children. The upstairs pool with the three seat pool bar is more like a bath tub. It is way too small and has a view of the street. After the first day, we switch the sister property across the street, the Royal. This resort is awesome. It is 18 and over so families with young children cannot stay here. I will try to write another review for the Royal, but it is was spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “They stold my camera and $200”
Reviews.Author: Yeyani
Reviews.Content: My family and i went to this hotel for 3 days, it was a family, we got late that night and did the check in, the policy of this hotel is that security has to go withh you to the room, and showed you everything, inclusive the security box, this wasn't informed at the ckecked it either, and security didn't come with us, after 10 minutes we decided to rent another room, i went to the recepcion, and he just gave me the key for the other room, security didn't come with me this time either, next day we went to the beach and back to the hotel to go shopping, i didn't find my money that was on my wallet inside my luggage, my sister started helping me and she realized her camera was missing too. We went to the recepption and they started the process, but they said it was difficult because the housekeeper had been working with them many years, i didn't think this was treated profesionally, the Operartor Manager, Cenobio Aguilar, just tried to focus on us not using the security box, Hello!!, i got there about 1 am was tired and just wanted to sleep, nobody told me about no security box, if security would have come with us and show us then i woulded put the things the next day. Obviously they didn't recognize nothing, I won't come to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of everything; great for families”
Reviews.Author: maigirl713
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean resort. Food is good. Great for families with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation - exceeded expectations of a 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rich49022
Reviews.Content: It's very clean and the service is fantastic. This is where the hotel excels, especially David at the beach bar - ask for a mai tai. The buffet is what you should expect from a 3.5 star hotel, nothing exceptional, but good. The best dinner option is the Italian restaurant with great service from Jose. The beach is good with lots of seating - while there are some sand bags, it was not a distraction. As for rocks in the water, it's not ideal, but there are plenty of good sandy spots. The depth of the sea is about 3-4 feet deep. As for seaweed, it all depends on the wind. When/if it appears you can walk around it. It's a 3.5 star beach - still very scenic. Kids Club worked out great. Really liked the smaller size of the hotel and location. Unfortunately had Pepsi products, not Coke which we were incorrectly informed of by reservations. T-Zone needs more age appropriate games. Don't need pants and shoes for restaurants as their website states.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , graet trip , great rooms , OK service worst food i ve had in mexico”
Reviews.Author: spence99
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth trip to playa in the last couple year , we went to the hotel for a wedding so i didnt get to pick where we stayed and was really happy we where going to this hotel after reading reviews and i had walked by in many times before and wanted to stay right in town instead of the 30 to 40 min cab ride every time you wanna go to town . And being so close to fifth did make it a great trip ,but the food at the hotel buffet and al cartes where so gross that i ended up eating out most nights thank god that was an option . One of the people in our group found a roach cooked into one of her buns at the italian resturant . That aside the hotel was great after reading the reviews i knew to expect our room would not be ready the first night and would have to stay in a diffrent room for the night or upgrade , i had already wanted to upgrade and thanks to the good people here knew it would be cheaper to wait and upgrade when they tell you your room wont be ready and it was i got a family suite for the first night which had the best view in the resort with a huge belcony that was at leat 4 times biger the any other at the hotel , then for the rest of the week had a great ocean view with king bed so if your looking to upgrade rooms wait till you get there , or if you want to eat some deccent food upgrade to the royal there sister hotel next door

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Going back as soon as I can!”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi33
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at an all inclusive resort and I had an amazing experience. I read so many of the reviews on this page before we went and my three main concerns were check-in, the timeshare sales, and the beaches. My experience was check-in went easily. I was asked if I wanted to upgrade and I said no, there was no pressure. One person in our group did upgrade and had to wait about 15 minutes but it was no big deal at all. We did talk to the timeshare people once and politely declined the offer. We were stopped one more time again said no, thanks, joked around some and it was really no big deal. The rocks, sand bags, and boats were also not a big deal. We actually used the snorkel gear and the rocks that were out a little bit made snorkeling interesting. I feel the boats were just a part of the scenery which was just amazing. The service was absolutely amazing. At the pool bar, beach and the restaurants. All of it exceeded my expectation. Salvador and Christopher were wonderful! They worked so hard, were so accomodating and fun. Pablo was our beach server and he was excellent! My experience at the Gran Porto Real exceeded my expectations. All of the service was amazing (housekeeping, restaurants, check-in). But I would suggest that you visit the pool bar when Salvador and Chris are there and find Pablo on the beach to be your server. They truly made our vacation vacation experience excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good mix of great and average”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaSherri
Reviews.Content: Location: If you enjoy easy access to shopping and restaurants this is a great location. Pool: Large resort so if you want a pool side chair be prepared to "towel" reserve early Beach: This was my biggest disappointment. Beach is mainly held together by sandbags and is rocky. Not a great walk-in beach. Food: The food at the buffet "Albatros" and their Italian restaurant were far above my prior experiences at All Inclusives. Buffet had nice selection of fresh foods, grilled at request options, and plenty of stations so not much in the way of lines. The Italian restaurant (pasta and steaks) did not require reservations and served wonderful food Service: The wait service at both restaurants was EXCELLENT!! "May" at the Albatros remembered us daily and took great care of us!! Front desk was not quite as helpful and didn't seem well informed. Spa: Nice spa area : Marta gave a great relaxing massage

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Great service and super clean.”
Reviews.Author: ofe_n_stl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real with our adolescent daughters and pre-school son for 6 days and had an awesome time. The staff is very friendly. The whole hotel complex is super clean. The pool is a decent size and has areas throughout it that are shallow for the little kids to enjoy it. The beach is spectacular; it is very calm to enjoy swimming in it and has plenty of lounge chairs. The main restaurant, Albatros, is very specious and is buffet style. The sushi bar is totally hidden and you have to walk a long distance to get to it. The Activities Staff does an okay job of keeping all age groups active. The nightly shows can be enjoyed by the whole family. We stayed at the Gran Caribe Real in Cancun 2 yrs ago and definitely liked the Gran Porto better for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you exoect”
Reviews.Author: jaimismo
Reviews.Content: Good location, excelente service but too small a very lousy beach. The water sport team is lazy and avoids giving service unless a tip is paid. They are underequiped ( one sailboat for all resort, no padles for the kayaks}

Reviews.Title: “Second time even better than first.”
Reviews.Author: neverneverrand
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, better than average for quietness, well-appointed and comfortable, as well as adequately-sized. Our experience was very positive for appearance, service, food, amenities and activities. Service, in particular, was outstanding. The poolside server, Jesus, went out of his way to provide friendly, speedy service.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Rickylalane
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous stay in June. Our daughter's wedding. The staff could not have been more accomodating. We have stayed many times in Mexico and many times in Playa del Carmen. Of all of our stays, we have never had better service. Our power went out in our bathroom....5 minutes after our call to the front desk, it was repaired. Needed an extra blanket at 11 P.M. 3 minutes after calling housekeeping, it was delivered. Our room was always neat. The bar service was fabulous. The pool waitress and waiter were fast and extremely polite. We will definitely be back. But next time, just my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “nice place and would go back”
Reviews.Author: MarkTexas
Reviews.Content: our group stayed there from 6/18/11 thru 6/26/11. it is a nice beach front hotel where the entrance is on a quiet side street. the place was clean, food/drink was good and security people were visible. do not get a room above the bar area if late night (till 11pm) music bothers you. the employees were great as were the hotel grounds. close to 5th street for shopping/walking. the in house mexican and italian restaurants were good. didn't do room service, internet or the spa. mb.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, well worth the travel from Australia”
Reviews.Author: 67tracy
Reviews.Content: We travelled with another family from Aus, Their children are 7 & 9 ours are teenagers. The youngs kids loved the kids club and the teenagers loved the activities around the pool and getting the chance to meet other kids. Could not fault this hotel, the staff from the conceige, bar staff to the maid who cleaned are room where very friendly and couldn't do enough to make our trip an enjoyable one. We had the misfortune to misplace a wallet, expensive sun glasses and an Iphone all at different times and all showed up in lost property the next day. We were very impressed and grateful!! All of us would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real Resort”
Reviews.Author: kbtrn1
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this all inclusive resort. The facility was well kept with excellent staff in everyway. They really catered to our needs and our children. Activities were well thought out and kept our kids 10 and 7 entertained. Pool games were for adults and kids as well with excellent entertainment staff. The food in the all-inclusive buffet was diverse and of good quality with a unique 24-hour room where snacks and light appetizers available thorughout the day. All inclusive include alcohol beverages and they certainly didn't make it difficult to enjoy a coctail if in the hotel, beach, pool and even your own room. Two restaurants made regular dining a nice option away from the buffet. Downsides: the common space is very small and the nightly entertainment, although very good, was hard to enjoy; the beach has some erosion and collects seaweed - although they work very early in the morning to remove it all by mid-morning; the hotel is in town and compare with other resorts doesn't have a lot of common space. Two blocks to shopping and safe area - but the persistent callers for cigars, hats and jewelry made strolling along difficult. Good value if you can get a cheap flight!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough place, but definitely not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: MrFrozendrink
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 5 days + 4 nights at Gran Porto Real. We have no regrets about going, but probably won't be returning, either. In summary: THE GOOD: The food at breakfast and dinner at Maria's (the on site Mexican restaurant) was great. The Italian restaurant's food was so-so, and the A/C was broken, in Mexico, in June...uh. The guys at the beach bar and the tiki bar were wonderful. Quick service, drinks made to order, would bring to your spot on beach or at pool. The room was clean and spacious. The beds were quite confortable, and the showers were great. THE NOT SO GOOD: The swimming at the beach was weak in my opinion. I don't know if it is always like this, but there was a major seaweed problem (literally a foot deep and 12-15 feet to water) which made it next to impossible to get into the water. Once you got in, it is quite rocky. The only option for ocean swimming access was a pier to the right of the hotel, but there were often locals fishing in the same areas where guests were swimming...not good. The main swimming pool was nice, but far from relaxing. There were games with an emcee going on about every 1/2 hour which was very loud and took up most of the smallish pool. There is a "tranquil pool" on the rooftop that has a small with a swim-up bar. It was our understanding that this was supposed to be an adult pool......not. It was more like a motel pool from Wildwood NJ got dropped into Mexico. THE UGLY: Lastly, we were told on several occasions that we could go next door to the Royal (their "sister resort") to use the pool and get drinks. Could not be farther from the truth. After going over to the Royal's pool bar and ordering a drink, me, my wife and her friend had the luxury of being escorted by security out of the pool area, down the beach, and all the way to the edge of the property. It was a nice walk of shame through the jeering of a few hundred strangers as we were shown off of the property. I honestly didn't care one way or another, but I felt really bad for my wife and her friend. Probably sums it up best to say that it was a nice place, we definitely had fun, but probably won't be going back anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Exceptional - a MUST all-inclusive vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: bruceskisr
Reviews.Content: Exceptional hotel room, view, entertainment, amenities, food, drinks and staff! Special thanks to Joan and Frank, Capitan Tony, Ischmael, Yuliana, Richard, Martha, Salvadore and Jose - these people made my stay beyond imagination. Once you experience their presence, professionalism, you'll understand... These special people made me, my family and friends feel like immediate family. I can't explain how that made me feel; you'll have to experience it directly. Frank, in particular, goes out of his way to assure that your every taste bud is satisfied. We even pulled a rabbit out of our hat and requested Chicken Wings...(lol). Frank said, "Let me check...I don't know if we have them, but I will be right back". He returned with plates full of the most DELICIOUS wings I have ever tasted...and I am a chef, but tehse wings, WHEW-WEEEEE! THANK YOU FRANK! Ischmael, you taught me lessons in Mayan history. Thank you my friend...you cleared up so many myths for me. I LOVE history; I love people, I love learning the truth; I love experiencing new cultures; you allowed that to happen...much love my brother - keep boxing man! I'll see you on TV soon! Richard...man, you gave me quick lessons in French, Spanish and Arabic history...and what a powerful personality you bring to the Gran Porte Real...thank you my brother. Yuliana, thank you for your never-ending, true smile. And yes, I will forever, remember our name now...remember mine..."Ski" ;). Thank you my sister... Each of you touched my life...even those of you whom I never knew..many people would tend to believe that you went out of your way for us. I believe that you were simply the most genuine people...you made my vacation more worthwhile than I ever dreamed it would be. We will see you again my friends. Keep your hearts pure. Ski & Mary - July 2011. Gran Porte Real staff

Reviews.Title: “Still a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: REDMAN23
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another great time vacation at GPR.We took family and friends and had a blast.We can't say enough about the staff ie Ana,Miriam,Mary,Duia,Cris,Juan and Frank and Capitan Tony who walked my nephew through the dining room for his meals each day.Jose and Jesus,Theresa,Margarita,Richard,Avila and too many more to name.The beach is still a little rocky and more fishing boats are taking up more room in front of the property.This is my third time to GPR and they still treat you like family away from home.If you have the time take time to go to a time share presentation they are giving cash a free vacation weeks through RCI.We got a lot of tip/gift money that way.Xel-ha is still a good day trip.

Reviews.Title: “What service!”
Reviews.Author: mich60795
Reviews.Content: Just had to take the time to leave a review for this hotel. My family just returned from this resort on 7/1/11...we were there for one week. The best highlight I want to mention is the phenomenal service provided by the waiters in the buffet eating area. Although there are several very nice restaurants (Italian and Mexican) within this facility, we chose to eat most of our meals in the general buffet-style eating area. We were astounded at how observant the waiters are. They wait on you "hand and foot" - always ready and willing take your plates etc. as soon as you are done and will get anything for you that you ask. They could not be more polite and professional! I would like to personally mention and thank the following waiters: Frank, Amabiael, Juan, Jhony, and Ivan. They are first-rate!! And by the way, the ocean-front view from this eating area is second-to-none and the food is absolutely wonderful...WOW!!

Reviews.Title: “dishonest employees”
Reviews.Author: tho6267
Reviews.Content: we were very excited to stay here since we usually do cruises. we arrived and were shown to our room which stunk SO badly that we could not have stayed in it.we requested a new room and were told that only upgrades were available. we checked out the room and took it. we then put our money and valuables in the safe and went to eat. The food was really good (the first day).we came back to the room and got our wallets to do some shopping..that is when we realized that 250.00 was missing from my daughters purse. she had traveler's checks as well but they were in my wallet.It was a last minute decision to bring the cash.she was hysterical! we called the manager and were accused of lying!!!! they brought in the police and said that they searched all of the bell hops! they made all of us open up all of our bags etc. what a way to start the vacation. the manager offered to give us 150.00 off of our room but that was it...the food was o.k. in the buffet , my husband and I ended up getting food poisoning but not our daughters. we were sick for a week after,had to go to the doctor when we arrived home. That is the risk you take tho. the hotel was very pretty and MOST of the staff were friendly. Management was poor. the shopping nearby is very nice..what a great town.I would advise you to be very careful if you stay there.oh and beware of the people selling the timeshares!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: pugsmom2
Reviews.Content: We booked 28 rooms for a wedding, spend a fortune on a wecome dinner on the beach for 60 people and we were given the absolute worst room in the hotel. The room smelled like raw sewage. It was right next to a resturant so the noise level was ridiculous. The hotel told us there weren't any rooms to move us to. 6 days and 5 miserable nights........no apologize or anything from the hotel management. NEVER AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: elcapytan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our son's wedding at the Gran Porto Real in Playa. Great rooms, food and service. We appreciated the service we got from our housekeeper Sara. She went above and beyond everyday to keep our room neat, refer stocked and made special towel animals daily for our suprise. The front desk was great from checking in to checking out with Laura. The bar staff at the pool side palapa was really great. The two Davids were always there with a smile. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeding your expectations.......”
Reviews.Author: katiebeth
Reviews.Content: Our daughter decided to have her dream wedding in Playa del Carmen at the Gran Porto Real. My husband and I were thrilled as we have been coming here for years and love this place. Our wedding guests added up to about 50. The hotel couldn't have been any nicer to our guests. What a beautiful wedding (even in the middle of some pretty horrific weather). We had a wonderful time! Our wonderful dear friends from previous trips, Teresa, and Ivan welcomed us like long lost family and made us feel so welcome. Thank you!!!!! As always, the rest of the staff was warm, friendly, helpful and eager to please. Special thanks to Jose and Jesus at the Manilla Bar, Mataeo and Edgar at El Pescatore, Ivan at Albatros, and Teresa for your much needed hugs and beautiful smiles of encouragement. The motto of Gran Porto Real is "Exceeding your Expectations", you know, sometimes that is exactly what they do. Thanks everyone! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: kj07
Reviews.Content: i,l start with all the positives the hotel and setting is perfect big pool split in half one side they do games and fun the other side is quieter, well it would be but will tell you that later firstly the staff are great from larenzo and marcelo in the albatros restaurant they did the morning and dinner times they new what you wonted to drink and was on table the minute you sat down thank you, then you have jamie tom and frank in the evening always there with a smile and had lots of fun with us it was great jamie makes the best mayan coffee my husband loved it, Then there was the bar staff Ana was the absolute best lookin after us all the time also miram teresa and yuliana always there with a happy smile they could,nt do enough for us, even the pool staff never stoped bringin drinks to be fair all the staff are brillant and always there to help, on the down side of the food was the evening meal never any potatoes or veg most of it was in sauces not to our taste breakie was great plenty of choice and dinner time not to bad but then you have the Italian and marias, got to say the steak in the Italian was very good. And now for the bit i said i would tell you its the American,s and o my the American,s got to say alot of the couples we,r very nice and stoped and chatted then youv got the groups who were there for weddings these one,s are rude arrogant and obnoxious and very very load tryin to out do each other, they also think they have a right to do evrything there not supposed to do like drink eat and smoke in the pool they flick there ash into it not nice at all and yes there are signes up to say dont do these things, mums were takein there kids away beacuse there language was disgusting you dont need to hear this an American couple even came up gto us and apologized for themso that says alot anyway even so this hotel is great our second time there and would go back to-morrow we still had the best time wonderful place go go go and at last iv done just like to thank all the staff for makein it the best holiday

Reviews.Title: “Most likely will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Izle76
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location and most of all incredible staff. I would like to personally thank Marcus (sushi bar), Hugo (mini bar), Addy (housekeeping), Cecilia & Rebecca (pool waitresses), Hirum (lobby bar), Claudia (front desk), Gustavo & Tom (servers). The employees mentioned above made my family's experience in Mexico unforgettable. Unfortunaately everything else was a disappointment. From not having the countries national beer Corona or Modelo to not having more authentic ethnic mexican food or dishes. Also, we were there for our friends wedding. She was staying at your resort as well but were getting married in Xcaret. Your resort was forcing her to payfor her 3 photographers that were only there for 2 hours to take pictures which was inconsiderate in your part considering she brought in thousands of dollars to your resort with all of her 62 guest. In spite of these unpleasureble moments youe staff continued to smile, be friendly, work hard, and simply be genuine that made us forget the negativity and keep enjoying the rest of our stay. Hopefully, you take the time to thank them on our behalf!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the service from very specific employees!”
Reviews.Author: mburns12
Reviews.Content: I would like to personally thank Marcus (sushi bar), Hugo (mini bar), Addy (housekeeping), Cecilia & Rebecca (pool waitresses), Hirum (lobby bar), Claudia (front desk), Gustavo (server), and Tom (server). The 9 above mentioned group of employees made our first experience in Mexico MAGNIFICENT!!!! Their work ethics, professionalism, and beautiful friendly personalities really made for a wonderful vacation, not only for my husband and I, but the other 62 guests staying at Gran Porto Real. We could not thank them all enough for making our vacation memorable and relaxing. I really do hope that their hard work is taken into consideration and that thier desire to want to make others feel welcomed and embraced is recognized. Customer service like the one experienced by the the employees above is certainly not what we experience in the states....it was a breath of fresh air to be pampered and catered to by such humble and friendly employees. We plan to go back with our children and it is all because of the service received by the above mentioned employees....that's it!!! They are the reason we are going back and I truly hope to see them ALL!! THANK YOU Marcos, Addy, Hugo, Claudia, Hirum, Cecilia, Rebecca, Gustavo, and Tom!!!!!! Thank God for these amazing people because we were all bummed out the hotel did not have Corona or Modelo beer and would have enjoyed more authentic ethnic mexican food/dishes. Burns & Quintana Family

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Adam069
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real is a very nice hotel located in the heart of Playa Del Carmen which makes it ideally situated as a base to explore the town and is within a couple of blocks of 5th Avenue the main tourist street. We stayed from 18th June to 25th June in a standard double room which was more than an adequate size for us both. Upon arrival to the hotel you are asked if you would like to upgrade to a room in the partner hotel over the road at a cost of 60 USD per night - this appears to be a standard practice. Also another member of staff attempts to get you to have a breakfast one morning in the hotel over the road which will then be followed by a promotional talk which one can only assume is related to a timeshare, My only real critical comment of the hotel is due to this as after an 18 hour journey this really is the last thing you want to be hearing about and would rather just get to your room! The hotel really needs to rethink this as all it does is create annoyance as the first impression. However this point aside there are many great things about this hotel. The access to the beach from the rear of the hotel is excellent. The pool area is great with plenty of sun loungers both in this area and on the beach however if you would like a lounger by the pool then you will need to get up very early in the morning. The beach itself is nicer a little further away from the hotel however that is not to say it is not nice where the hotel is. The hotel contains a few places to eat and drink so you will be spoilt for choice. We must mention the tireless efforts of all the staff at the hotel as they never stop. In particular we have to say thanks to Miriam in the lobby bar who worked really hard and helped to enhance everyones holiday. Also we noted the cleanliness level of the hotel is outstanding and the cleaning staff work non stop to keep it this way. We stayed in room number 526 and did not get any disturbance from any other guests however everynight you could hear a noise which sounded like a washing machine or tumble dryer upstairs which did not bother me as much as it did my wife. Also the balcony was small but just big enough to sit on. We would highly recommend this hotel and would love to go back ourselves some day.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Djiboutitraveler
Reviews.Content: First, after being to Cancun many times I can write a review that hopefully makes sense! Well, First the good stuff! The hotel staff was great and helped in any way they could with any issue I had. I loved that as they made you feel good as issues that come up and the other good thing was not one person was pushing about money! The overall resort was super clean and always some was cleaning something and really that is a first for me to see them clean so good! The room was very clean and our Maid Landy did a wonderful job of keeping our room spotless! I had money and change laying out and nothing was every messed with. The good thing is that the room had a nice safe for your valuables! Now, for what I call improvements! The food wasn't great and all three restaurants used the same ingredients for their food! So, the food was below average for me and out of of 5 stars I considered it about a 3 star. Really, after my week I didn't want to eat there! The little 24hr snack bar had better food sometimes! The pool was super clean but the music was horrible and they cut out the party atmosphere but they want to be more family friendly. There was only one side of the pool that had music and the other side was totally boring. The activities crew was great and they really have a good time but because everything has been toned down it was kinda boring! No more Tequila Volleyball or crazy games with alcohol! Well, the beach was beautiful and the ocean clean and clear! I recommend this hotel if you have kids or just want to party a little and relax! I didn't see anyone crazy drunk there! Okay, my last is I highly recommend the Mayan Experience Trip with Mika! It goes to Coba the tallest Mayan Temple and they let you climb to the top! Things I recommend to take! Off mosquito Wipes, Factor 50 and Factor 50 Face sunscreen( very Expensive there)! Boca Beach Towel clips to hold your towel to the chair( Right side and get there early!) Gatorade packets, Snorkeling gear, lots of $1 bills for tipping, beach bag, outdoor shoes for trips(Skeechers or Ativas) good sandals(cheap sandals don't work in the jungle areas!, Small first aid kit for cuts! There is a mega mart and Walmart ($5 taxi there!) Expensive if your willing to pay! The Hotel gift shop has kids T-shirt at a good price! Also, 5th avenue was fun but expensive compared to other location. Haggle everywhere! Swinging Hammock chair are $25 no more! I saw alot of people get ripped off. Just walk away but be willing to haggle hard to get what you want!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and great service.”
Reviews.Author: BLopezD
Reviews.Content: Place is real nice, clean and great customer service. Perfect for people with children. Beach is wonderful with see through waters and no heavy waves do to sea walls. Take your own snorkel gear because they only have two you can borrow and they are not very nice about it. You can see all kinds of fish especially by the sea walls. We had a great time. Nice entertainment, every day had a different theme. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: jactan
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. Our group of 5 adults was accomadated with 2 junior suites that were next to each other (2 queen beds and a bunkbed with a pullout). We had a wonderful view of the pool area and the beach; was able to watch the nightly entertainment shows from our balcony. The housekeeping staff did an outstanding job keeping the rooms clean (white tile floors in a humid enviornment can't be easy to maintain). They also left us fresh flowers and cute little towel animals on our beds (my favorite was the octopus). The entertainment staff was great. Props to Cesar, Chicken (Victor), and Alejandro!! All are very charismatic and approachable. Il Pescatore, the Italian restaurant, was great (I recommend the caprese salad and salmon). We ate there three times and requested our favorite waiters Amador and Daniel each time. They are very attentive with very warm smiles. Hostess Delia is a doll and very accomadating. Pepe and Gustavo were also excellent. Maria's, the Mexican restauant was good too but I was partial to the Italian. We ate at the buffet every day for at least 1 meal. Good variety of food. There is a different theme every night (Mexican, Oriental, Tex Mex, International, etc). Flaming Myan coffees are excellent and quite a show to watch prepared. Ask Ismael or Frank to throw one togther for you. Speaking of Ismael and Frank, they are 2 amazing servers at the buffett. They honestly made our experience special. They both made our family feel as though my family were their only concern. We often kept them at out table longer than we should have getting to know these gentlemen (and them getting to know us). I will truly miss them. The biggest problem we had with this hotel is that the beach is pretty rocky. It is difficult to get it due to the rocks (and watch out for Rock Fish, someone stepped on one while we were there!). The area of the beach that is not rocky has boats docked there so it is difficult to get in and out. Just walk down the beach a bit in either direction and you will eventually find a place without rocks!! Don't forget to book some excursions. We tried the Extreme experience (wonderful), swiming with dolphins and manatees (breathtaking), and Xel-Ha (outstanding). FYI if you go to Xel-Ha don't forget to bring insect repellant!! In addition, if you purchase an all-inclusive package to Xel-Ha keep in mind they serve breakfast so you don't have to eat before you go.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Playa Del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: dem104
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my wifes first time staying at the Gran Porto, we stayed at the Gran Caribe in Cancun last year, and decided to see Playa Del Carmen and we weren't disappointed! The resort is very spacious and laid out well. The main pool has activiities going on most of the day, with shows on the outdoor stage at nighttime. Our pool waiter Pedro, made sure we never went thirsty! The 3 restaurants provided a wide variety of food. The Albatross was a buffet, serving up breakfast, lunch and dinner. Maria's provided delicious Mexican food, and Pescatore's satisfied us with Italian food. The staff was wonderful, especially at Pescatore's, Delia our hostess, and Amador and Huber Gonzalez were exceptional! For our last night of stay, they gave us a dinner that we never forget, with rose petals on our table, champagne and wine, and the best meal we had all week! Our room was perfect for the two of us, with a small balcony, and the tranquility pool right out our door. Free WiFi is available, but we couldn't connect from our room, and had to go down to the lobby or to the tranquility pool area, which wasn't no big hassle. The ferry to Cozumel is only a 10 minute walk and then a 45 minute ride on the ship. We spent a day snorkeling, touring and shopping. The island is absolutely gorgeous! Be sure to add this destination. Edgar at Best Day Travel helped us out with our extra activities, and was a pleasure to do business with. The location is excellent, only 2 short blocks to 5th street, where you'll find shopping and clubs to top out the night! The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5, is the beach. It's very small, with exposed sand bags all over the area. But, a short walk over to the Royal is a beautiful beach where we enjoyed sand and Caribbean water! We would definately stay here again! Adios!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Exploradorita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 9 nights in May 2011. Having been to Playa before, we knew that we loved this location. (We looked into The Royal as well, but it was fully booked for some of the nights of our stay.) We are are not typically all-inclusive resort people, so we went out each day for dinner and usually lunch. (Playa is full of great restaurants for all tastes, do yourself a favor and leave the resort!) However, the breakfast buffet was great, with omelets made to order, different egg dishes, plenty of fresh fruit, and a variety of breakfast meats (bacon, American sausage, chorizo, turkey, etc.). The lunch buffet was hit or miss, and we never went to the buffet for dinner. We tried the two a la carte restaurants, they were both fine but nothing special. We had an ocean front junior suite, which was plenty of space for the two of us. The view was lovely; we were facing the Royal and the ocean. The air conditioning worked well, and my only (minor) complaint about the service is that they didn't restock the mini-bar every day. It was very easy to walk downstairs and grab yourself a beer, though, and I'm sure we could have called and asked someone to bring whatever we needed. The service by the pool and beach is excellent. We sat by the beach every day, where there are tons of chairs. People by the pool got a little bit territorial, "reserving" chairs by putting towels on them hours before they planned to actually use them. I think this happens at a lot of resorts, though. If you want to enjoy Playa del Carmen, stay right next to the ocean, and have access to free drinks, breakfast, and snacks, I would highly recommend the Gran Porto Real. However, if you do not plan to leave the resort often, you might want to look into some of the resort in Playacar, which are outside of town but where they have more variety in terms of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “First Time awesome”
Reviews.Author: BallsfromPA
Reviews.Content: First time to an all inclusive place and was blown away. The staff was so attentive, but not to the point of bothering you, they all seemed truely concerned about you having whatever it was, that you needed. ( especially drinks). They are constantly picking things up and keeping the grounds in great shape. Ismael and Frank where are waiters at the main Buffet, and where outstanding!!!! The beach with it's sandbags isn't much to rave about, but you cannot complain about the water, it's unreal. Take the ferry to Cozumel, rent a jeep and tour the island, you will not be disappointed. Jose worked his but off around the pool everyday supllying whatever drink you wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Resort was amazing and so was Playa Del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: JonMegPatton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa for our honeymoon and from the very beginning to the very end...it was spectacular! In all honesty, the best part was the service. Everyone was so friendly, kind, enjoyed teaching us how to speak Spanish and they always made sure we were taken care of any time day or night. The water was just the right temperature, the weather was nice and hot (mucho calor!), the drinks were flowing, the food was delicious, the shopping was truly unique and the events (dolphin swimming and Adventuras Mayas) was unforgettable fun. And we can't forget our good friends we met...Amador, Dalia, Daniel, and Rodrigo! We definitely plan to revisit in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: munson24
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first time to an all-inclusive, and we we not dissapointed with our choice. The resort itself was beautifully maintained and immaculate! The service was above and beyond what we expected, from the front desk staff to the bartenders, waiters and the refreshment providers were awesome! Two thumbs up to Jose (Numero Uno) who we ran ragged on the beach, Rebecca and Pablo at the pool, and Felipe at the swim up bar. Our housekeeper, Guadalupe, kept our room spotless and we loved the different towel animals she made. As mentioned previously, if I had anything negative to say about the resort was the difficulty getting into the water at the beach. It was rocky, but well worth it when you got in. I would return to the resort anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: BrandyLeeBC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a friend's wedding. The wedding was beautiful and the AC worked very well. That's it.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made the trip memorable!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatedJL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto for a family vacay, 13 of us total. We had a great time but especially because of the excellent service we received from Jose, Pablo and Rebeca!!! Jose and Pablo brought us drinks to the beach, pool and our patio, even in the rain. They, along w/Rebeca provided superior service and even brought us rounds of water and food w/o us even asking. It's fantastic to have such amazing, friendly service, especially for the whole week we were there. The best bartender was by far Felipe up at the swim up bar. He not only introduced us to the Mexican Dream (muy sabrosa), but helped us improve our Espanol while we were relaxing at the swim up bar. My only real issues were that other than the buffet, none of the restaurants would seat a group larger than 8 unless you paid the concierge $10 per person to arrange it. And most of the restaurants seemed put out that we had 13 people, although we saw many large groups and families there and you couldn't make reservations in advance and some of the bars seemed to "run out" of beer and other alcohol and then would magically have it when Jose or Pablo ordered it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay!! Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: denise8312
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Riviera Maya and we all agreed this was the best resort we have ever been to! From the moment we pulled up to Gran Porto Real, it was nothing but extraordinary. We were greeted with a smile and automatically asked what drinks they could get us. The staff were there to please its guests and they did just that. The bartenders loved to have fun and make sure to take good care of Pablo -- he works hard walking up and down the beach to get you all the frozen drinks and beer you could dream of! I never had one complaint about any of the staff. Unlike other resorts, Gran Porto Real is in the heart of 5th Avenue - with it's amazing shopping and great nightlife. It was a mere 5 minute walk from the resort to the shops and very busy with tourists and very safe. The drive from the airport was about 30-45 minutes but well worth it! The resort was very clean and so were the rooms. There were staff constantly cleaning and repainting and the housekeeping was impeccable. They not only cleaned the room and scrubbed the floors, but also organized your toiletries. We were in Room 309, which was an oceanview suite. It lived up to it's name as an ocean view, but I would recommend paying the extra couple of bucks to receive the oceanfront as the views are breathtaking. But if you forego and get a standard room or oceanview suite and want to remain central to the resort's amentities, our room was great! Overall, the food was good. The only reason why I just state that it was "good" was because of the buffet versus the restaurants. The restaurants (Italian and Mexican) were superb. The service was great; the food was amazing; and the presentation was beautiful. The restaurants offerred a full menu and full bar. The buffet locations were average. Although fresh and well presented, the quality of food was just OK. It was nice to go in from the pool to get a plate or to visit the outside buffet, but it was nothing to write home about. Another great aspect of the food at Gran Porto Real was the free room service. Such a great accommodation and good food, too!! Overall, Gran Porto Real has been the best resort both myself and my friends have been too. We have been to numerous all-inclusive resorts in many locations and this place, by far, surpassed all of them. Great for young groups of friends or couples and also a great place for the lively older crowd!! You will feel at home here and never want to go back to reality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience !”
Reviews.Author: redincl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to the Grand Porto Hotel and Resort in Play del Carmen. It far exceeded my expectations. Wonderful staff and helpful in every way. Beautiful setting, with aweseome views of the ocean. The food was fabulous and we ate in every restaurant available in our all inclusive package. Waiters were so kind and respectful. Our daughter was married on the beach and the staff fulfilled our every wish. The flowers were breathtaking and the wedding was beautiful. Pablo Jesus Jose and Rebecca were at everyone's beckon call. Our glasses were never empty whether it was a day at the pool or a day on the beach. They remembered what everyone had to drink and not only us but every other vacationer. It was such a joy to see Pablo and Rebecca's smiling face each morning ! I just can't say enough about our pleasant experience...except that we are already planning our trip back in April and this time we will stay LONGER !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Proline
Reviews.Content: There was a party of 9 that went to this gorgeous resort. It was more than I hoped for. We have never been to an all-inclusive, so were not sure if we had chosen well. We certainly did. The resort is kept immaculate and everyone we came in contact with were as nice as you could want. They went out of their way to help you. Jose, Pablo and Rebecca were our "refereshment providers" and never let us down. Jose outdid himself serving us in our lounges on the beach. We did not even have to ask, and he was there. He definitely was "Numbero Uno" with me. As other reviewers have commented it is definitely rocky and diffciult to access the water. Once in, however, the water was fantastic. Our only other issue was it seemed they ran out of beer every night. I would return to this resort. You could not ask for a resort to be any cleaner with staff that could be any nicer. As other

Reviews.Title: “Great, polite, helpful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MalloriWillisRauch
Reviews.Content: Everyone was great! This was our honeymoon and our first trip out of the country and the Gran Porto exceded all expectations. Get to know Gustavo in guest services, Antonio at the Albatras, and Sergio in Spa Real.

Reviews.Title: “Voted: Most Helpful Review”
Reviews.Author: gruntlumber
Reviews.Content: How about a summary at the beginning? Ok: Great resort, you will have a wonderful time if you choose to stay here. After researching the heck out of Playa/Cancun and reading many reviews about the Gran Porto Real here on TripAdvisor, I had a good idea of what to expect. For the most part, all the the raves about this place are absolutely true; as well as two of the negatives. My biggest fear was to show up and go through the check-in fiasco and room shuffle that so many other people went through. To avoid this, I called two days ahead of time to confirm my room (Ocean Front Jr suite) and the number of people (4). Having prepaid the trip through Delta Vacations and receiving verbal confirmation prior to arriving, I felt confident check-in would go smoothly. It didn't! They only had a room with one king which required an hour of waiting before we could check in. The option to switch rooms the next day was possible, but unpacking and repacking to switch rooms is a pain. Their normal procedure is to bring in an extra bed or two, as needed. So, they brought up two twin-sized beds for the kids and put them in the room. We were not happy about this at first, but we got over it and it actually worked out fine since we were not in the room very much anyway. Besides that, the room was awesome. Everything was spotlessly clean not only in the room but throughout the entire resort. The bathroom was really nice and had a BIG shower. The room had an impressive feel with high ceilings, great balcony ocean view (room 256), stone pillars and crown molding/trim. I was a big fan of the liquor dispenser mounted on the wall (rum, tequila, scotch, and vodka). The air conditioning felt like air pumping straight from Antarctica. Daily housekeeping was perfect. The highest marks for the Porto Real are for the staff. Every single server, waiter/waitress, bellhop, cook, maid, receptionist, entertainment director, etc provided top-notch service. A special mention needs to go to the Kids Zone girls. They are fantastic. It might be hard to imagine leaving your kids with strangers in a foreign resort but they were excellent and our kids (aged 5 and 7) loved them and looked forward to various activities, movies, or whatever they had planned for the day. They will even bring food in and feed your kids so you can go have dinner at one of the restaurants if you want (did that twice). Another special high mark goes to the entertainment & sports staff. They made the activities really fun (beach/water volleyball, basketball, bingo, yoga, palates, bingo, bocce, kayaking, scuba demo, etc). My fav activity was a bike tour through downtown Playa to the Playacar Palace. There are a few small ruins to look at and a great beach, along with some sweet private residences in the area. Nightly entertainment is hit/miss, but enjoyable nonetheless. The best show while we were there was an acrobat routine. Very cool. The food was great all-around. We ate twice at the Mexican restaurant and once at the Italian. Both were splendid (side-note: if you read about needing to wear long slacks and no open-toed shoes, ignore it. This must be old dress code info). We ate a lot at the buffet since it was easy with the kids. I wouldn't say I got tired of the food because the variety each day was grand, but I grew a little weary of the setting. We ate at the beach buffet a few times too (burgers/hotdogs/fries/chips/guac) and the sushi bar once. Without kids, the upstairs "adult" pool and sushi bar would be a great change of scenery; up another flight of stairs, at the very top of the building, is the hot-tub and 3 hammocks. Go up there at the crack of dawn for picturesque views and peacefulness (before the heat sets in). First impressions of the beach were disappointing. I didn't expect to be amazed after reading the reviews, but hopes were high anyway. Basically the beach is 1/3 rocks/coral, 1/3 sandbags, and 1/3 parking lot for fishing boats. A silver lining to the coral part is being able to check out snorkel gear (free for an hour) which was fun. There's a little sliver of ocean in the middle that's pretty good for swimming, but you need to walk a little north or south to find the best beach. North, across the pier, a little past the Royal is the best place to go. Beautiful beach and water. Although this beach description may scare you off a little, don't let it. The rest of the aspects of this resort are so good they easily made up for it. Keep in mind I'm talking mostly about the beach as far as swimming in the ocean; if your routine is lying out in the sun on powder-white sand and having drinks brought to you, you will not be disappointed. I would go back to the Gran Porto Real in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Time Share sales pitch!”
Reviews.Author: IVANALOVESCUBA
Reviews.Content: Since we had won our trip to the Gran Porto Real - we can't complain. But - if we had to pay for it, we would have been disappointed, as we are beach lovers and the beach here is not pretty, nor is the water and you can smell the diesel from the ships going back & forth to Cozumel. The water is not that azure blue that we're so accustomed to in Cuba. So we stuck by the pool everyday, which was actually very nice. The waitress would come by and refill our drinks when she saw we had finished-thank you Teresa! A lot of birds zooming in and around the pool area. Our room was clean, the maid was prompt and made lovely towel arrangements every day. We stuck to the buffet for both lunch and dinner, and the food ranged from good to great. One of our favorite waiters at the buffet was Antonio May! Also Rutilio!If you wanted something quick, the beach "diner" was ok. You just had to grab a drink from the pool bar. (Love the tortilla chips - so fresh!). What we also didn't like about the Gran Porto, was the time share sales pressure. What a waste of time-we got suckered in for a "free breakfast". If you're smart you won't sign the waiver where you promise to spend 1 1/2 hrs with to view the Royal Hotel next door. Also, there are a lot of weddings = PARTY TIME! A little annoying? Yes! The entertainment was not very good at all. The shops on 5th avenue was interesting, but everything was overpriced. Would we come back here? No. We love the hotel and their staff, but it's in the wrong place!

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: mkfalese
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Gran Porto for the first week of June, and couldn't of been more pleased with our stay. The food, rooms, pool, and espesically the service, was all excellent. There are a number of specific employees that helped make our trip so enjoyable. Every morning at the breakfast buffet, Ivan, served us. He truly took the term "all-inclusive" to a whole new level. He treated my mother, my sister, and I like true queens by presenting us flowers and pushing in our chairs. On our last day he even told us, "thank you for giving me the opportunity to serve you", how sweet! His every response to our request was "claro que si" (of course) , and often told us he is here for us and whatever we need can be done. I'd also like to mention one of the poolside waitors, Jose. He served my family and I everyday and all day during our stay. We would see him help set up tables at the buffet in the morning, and serve drink to numerous groups by the pool all day. He was always ready to take our order and ensured we were happy. He never got a drink order wrong and was overall a joy to be around, we sure hope he is there when we return! I wish I knew all of the employee's names because I appreciated them all! I would highly recommend this hotel to any type of vacation!

Reviews.Title: “i'd come back”
Reviews.Content: the service overall was outstanding! our room was kept clean and stocked. the bell-boy Tilo was friendly and helpfull. your concierge Richard always had the straight forward information about what to do and how to do it, which as you know isnt always easy in Mexico. the bar staff was excellent. they were fun and good at their jobs. David, Chris, and Dave from the lobby bar as well as Miguel from the swing bar were standouts. I will recomend your resort to others and will look forward to the next time we can come visit Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: solprincesa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing vacation at the Gran Porta Real. My husband and two girls (ages 2 & 4) had the best family vacation. We have traveled to the Cancun area in the past, and stayed at larger resorts, but with bringing the girls for the first time we thought a smaller, more personable resort would be better. We were exactly right! Gran Porta Real treats you fantastic, everything from the check in, pool area, beach, food, entertainment, and most importantly the staff was simply the best!!!! We arrived at 1pm, so a bit early for check in, but the staff immediately told us we were welcome for lunch and pool time. While we ate and checked out the hotel, it was already 3pm, so we officially checked in to our Jr. suite. What a beautiful room, perfect size for our family of four. We had a balcony which faced the street, first a bit disappointed but soon realized it was best for our children for naps and bedtime. It would get a bit noisy during the day and nighttime with entertainment. We were right above the lobby in the second floor, truly a perfect location and seconds from the pool and main lobby. We spent all of our time at the pool, restaurants, and kids club. Our first day our kids were entertained by the Kids Clubs Representatives, which were fabulous! Shortly followed by an absolutely amazing nighttime performance!! We definitely looked forward to the show each night, as well as our children. The Kids Clubs became a quick favorite with our kids: Dulce, Georginia, Diana, and Sabina were fantastic, patience, and fun. My husband and I felt completely comfortable with allowing our older daughter to stay with the team during craft time/lunch each day. Each day was organized with new projects group! Our daughter misses them each day! The Sports and Activates group were the best we’ve seen!!! Katrina, Alejandro, Armando, Chicken and Cesar . We had so much fun with you! A special shout out to Alejandro for being so sweet to our family and especially our daughter. She still talks about him each day. What a wonderful asset to your team! The food staff was wonderful. Each entrée we had, was delicious. Omelets, Chiliquiles in the morning, fresh fruit served all day, and gourmet meals at night with a large variety. Couldn’t ask for anything more. We often had sushi and guac and chips for lunch, what a treat!! The upscale Mexican and Italian restaurants were fantastic. It was a bit chaotic to completely enjoy with two young children, but we definitely had a wonderful meal and servers. I have to mention we did walk downtown Playa Del Carmen a couple times, we brought a single stroller for the little one, which worked out perfect. Found some good treasures: coffee, jewelry, souvenirs, and very friendly people. We felt very safe everywhere we traveled. We absolutely had a wonderful vacation!!! Definitely will return next year for our vacation and will recommend. We all miss the beautiful ocean, white sand, food, and wonderful staff. Many memories were made, especially by the fantastic photography on the beach!! Thank you Gran Porta Real for the best, most relaxing vacation ever!!! We miss you!!!!! Please feel free to ask any questions! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “It Gets Better Each Time”
Reviews.Author: KcDoglover
Reviews.Content: Our family and friends just returned from the Gran Porto where my oldest daughter was married in a beautiful, beach ceremony. This was our third trip and we love this resort for many reasons. The people who work at this resort are incredibly hard working individuals. You will never encounter anyone who doesn't appear to enjoy their job which they show by their eagerness and willingness to go out of their way to make your vacation experience the best it can be. A few people that should be recognized are Jose and Theresa who bring drinks around the pool. The reason I remember these two individuals is because of their friendliness and warmth which they extend to everyone. We won't forget them. Dave, the bartender at the lobby bar makes the tastiest Mojitos. We usually ate dinner at the Italian restaurant and several people there must be mentioned. Daniel, Amadour (probably not correctly spelled) and finally Mateo who remembered us from our last visit. We miss you all. This resort will spoil you for breakfast, which could be our favorite meal there. We love to eat a nice breakfast but never have the time to make at home, so it's a real treat, especially the omlettes. We always get the least expensive room, but they are still a joy to wake up to each morning. The location of this resort was the main reason we chose it originally. The proximity to 5th Avenue can't be beat. If you are the type of person who likes to get out, meet new people and see new things, this is the place for you. There are few things about 5th Avenue that some, including my 20 something daughters, find not so pleasant. While walking past shops, there are men standing in front who will attempt to lure you inside to look around. There are some who go a little overboard and can intimidate some. One of my daughters said she just keeps her sunglasses on so they can't make eye contact with you. For myself, being somewhat older, OK quite a bit older, these guys can sometimes make my day. It's all in how you look at it. The Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen is a resort that we most likely will return to many times in the years to come. If anyone has questions, I'll do my best to help.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mountain2109
Reviews.Content: Food - OK Room - Good Staff - Good Beach - the best part of the beach is taken up by moored boats Volume - Intense - very loud until 23:00 Having previously stayed at The Royal I did not expect the drop in standards to be as great as they were. Would I stop here again or stay in The Royal, definately The Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tootl
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful stay with great service by Juan and Juan in the dining room, Pablo and everyone else! We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “'Beautiful , great service , we will be back !"”
Reviews.Author: 2fortheroad02
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Gran Porta and it was so nice that its hard to consider staying at another hotel. There are to many Good things to mention so I wont, but I would to say a big thanks to Vektor the bartender who would start mixing our drinks when he saw us, and to Gabriel the bell boy who kept us company while we waited for our airport shuttle, but truly every member of the Gran Porta staff are excellent ! See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time. No Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: RonH2
Reviews.Content: We have been to 39 of the US States and 17 different countries. I find that it is most often very difficult to repeat a wonderful vacation. When something is so wonderful it is nearly impossible not to set expectations so high that they are nearly impossible to duplicate, but duplicated they were. This was our 2nd trip to the Gran Porto and the service, attendance and food were simply wonderful. From the the pool side service of Pablo, Jose, Jesus, and Margarita; to the Lobby Bar service of Miriam, Cecilia, Dave, and Chris; and the Dinning Room service of Frank & Ismael. Our expectations were truly exceeded.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: SpiroE
Reviews.Content: This was a very relaxing and pleasant stay. Granted we only stayed for four days, but it was great. We did upgrade our room, however, to a larger suite. The Jr Suites were very junior. The key to this resort, apart from the very friendly staff, was the location that was right at the beginning of the main street of Playa Del Carmen. So overall, definitely recommend this place. Some positives: our upgraded room was fantastic. The beach was pretty empty, we had most of the seating to ourselves. Most people went to the pool. The restaurants were pretty good. I loved that we didn't have to make a reservation like I've had to do in other resorts. The location was perfect. Right on the beach and right by 5th Ave. If I were to be picky, some negatives; you could never get a seat at the pool. Everyone would save their seat from 7 am in the morning with a towel and then go to the restaurant for breakfast, Silly. The main pool had this large divider in the the middle separating the two sides. That was odd. Also, there was no swim up bar in the main pool, I do enjoy those. There is one at the roof top pool, but its very small and you can't get a seat there either. Their was a Sushi Bar at that roof top pool as well, but I never saw and food there. Ok, let me repeat, this was a great place and I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Wonderful staff, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: wiz1908
Reviews.Content: Just spent an amazing 2 weeks at this hotel. Had a bit of a shaky start with reception trying to get us to upgrade. We knew from previous reviews that they would try to persuade us to do this & were prepared but we weren’t prepared for them to be quite so aggressive about it. When we arrived after travelling for almost 18 hours we arrived tired, hot & a little bothered after all the travelling. The lady at check in asked us if we wanted to upgrade to which we said no (we couldn’t afford it) she then proceed to tell us that the standard room we had booked wasn’t up to much “very small, with small beds & no private balcony – a bit rubbish actually” she suggested looking at the standard room then looking at the junior suit so we could compare then decide, when we said we really couldn’t afford to upgrade & didn’t have the money she snapped “how do you know you haven’t even asked how much it is” we could see from the price list how much it was. She then stomped off to get our key cards for our “rubbish standard room”! Our room number was already written on the card but she crossed this out & wrote another room number on & off we went with the lovely bell boy. When he opened the door it was obvious that it was still occupied or at least not been made up from the previous occupiers, he apologized & asked us to take a seat while he tried to sort it out. It was swelteringly hot & we were a bit peeved by this point & just wanted to get into our room. He came back after a while & was very apologetic & took us to another room on the floor above which was a corner room & this one was ready for us (unbeknown to us at the time it was right next to the cleaners room). It still wasn’t the same room number that had originally been written on our card though - did the reception lady muck us about cause we’d refused to upgrade & gave us the room next to the cleaners cupboard on purpose?? I have my suspicions! This was the only problem we encountered & if you have booked the standard room please don’t worry as it was absolutely fine the only problem was it being next to the cleaners room so it was very noisy from early in the morning with them clattering around with their trolleys etc (we had room 501). The room was plenty big enough – after all we only wanted to shower change then sleep in there. We did miss our own balcony a bit, there was one but is was out the front along with everyone else’s on the whole floor although having the corner one it was a bit more private. If we had of upgraded we would have had our own but still would have had the same view of the street as the sea view rooms were obviously much more expensive. The shower was amazing – the best we’ve ever had in a hotel. The beds were quite small just a standard double I’d imagine, there was 2 of them so you could have had one each if you’d wanted to. I’d rather of had 1 big one rather than 2 small ones. The buffet in the hotel was excellent – especially the breakfasts, amazing omelets made to order, everything you could possibly want – lovely little mini pastries. For lunch & dinner there was always something cooked to order, chicken, pork beef etc & loads of other stuff & not a chip in sight. All the staff in there were lovely always smiling & Sherly was so lovely, we didn’t have the same waiter each time so can’t remember names but every single one was polite & attentive. The serve yourself food on the beach had burgers, hot dog, chips etc. We didn’t like the Mexican restaurant but it was always busy so probably just us – think we are too used to the “western Mexican food” however the Italian was excellent, we ate there 5 times & every time the food was amazing I loved the seafood Linguine , the staff were so nice & friendly – a special thanks to Israel who was lovely. The bars were great, our favorite was the pool one which shut at 11pm – we loved watching them make the cocktails & the staff were so lovely, special hello to Salvador & Avila. We didn’t really bother with the 24 hour bar but the few times we went in there they didn’t have any beer which, had we wanted it, would have been quite annoying but I did notice it was back on again after a few days. The beach/pool waiters were amazing always walking passed seeing if you needed a drink – Special hello to the lovely Pablo & Jesus. The beach does have a lot of seaweed but of course this isn’t the hotels fault & they were clearing it up most days & it didn’t seem as bad a bit further up. Although we didn’t partake the entertainment at the pool it seemed good, it did get a bit repetitive for us as we were there for 2 weeks & sometimes a bit noisy but if you wanted to get away from it just use the beds at the far end & you won’t really hear anything.
