We love to spend our days on the beach and move as little as possible. The service on the beach (from our friend Jose) was amazing. He always carried extra drinks and would always make sure we had what we wanted. The hotel was very clean and the hotel staff were great. The 24 snack bar was great and well maintained. We loved the pool but could understand why some people were upset with the ocean area. The section of the beach for lounging was well maintained and kept very clean but part of the beach washed away during hurricane season. A large part of it was covered in sandbags to prevent more from washing away. Other than having the walk over those the water was great. The staff were out everyday cleaning any seaweed off the beach. Night life was good and the shows were OK. We're not big into the shows at the resorts but being a 2 minute walk from 5th ave opened up so many more options. You could spend your days on the beach and quickly hop into town to enjoy the night life. Since it was so close you didn't have to plan a full day to go shopping. Great resort, great food, great people and great times. We'd go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: J0c0le
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, hospitable, and nice staff. Only downfall is the beach, many rocks which hurt your feet. Stayed for 5 nights. Pool area awesome. We crossed over to The Royal hotel and used their beach. Our room was spectacular with great view and service. Definitely upgrade to get the full feel of the resort. Restaurants were great with little wait. Walking over to 5th avenue was also nice. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “pampered in paradise”
Reviews.Author: skeffie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends and family on the occasion of our son's wedding. This has to be the best place to be married. Fantastic service, rooms lovely, beach amenities plentiful. Never scrambled for a cabana on the beach. The beach itself in front of the hotel has much coral, so it is a question of bathing rather than swimming. A short walk to the north along the beach and it is totally free of coral for a better swimming experience. The staff throughout the hotel VERY accommodating. On the beach, Jesus, Pablo and Jose will take great care of you with the help of the poolside bartender Hiram. We also enjoyed service in the Albatross thanks to Jesus and Verlain. All staff pleasant and made you feel totally welcome there. Food excellent. they have two specialty restaurants and two buffet options as well as a sushi bar locataed by a small quiet pool away from the beach. Food was great in all facilities. Rooms were maintained well by housekeeping staff. Didn't use the room service, but heard from those that did that it was terrific. Salon staff for hairdos and makeup wonderful. Having a massage on the beach was heavenly. Zulma, our wedding coordinator, worked so hard to make sure everything was perfect for my son and his fiancee. There is one caveat-the Gran Porto Real has been known to overbook and we found this to be true for a few people in our group. It is annoying to say the least after flying all night (from the US West coast and after the trek on the bus), to be told you must be downgraded for a night. Certainly an inconvenience after having paid plenty to stay in a certain accommodation. Several of our party had to move at least once while there. One couple were only there two nights and spent them in different rooms. For myself, I never book oceanview or oceanfront rooms as I know I am never in my room while traveling in Mexico, except to sleep. One other caveat and this is true for most places in Mexico: the timeshare people are all over if you don't make it clear that nothing they could offer you could tempt you to be distsracted from one minute of your time in such a beautiful place Overall this place totally rocks and if you don't have "the time of your life", it's gotta be your own fault!!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real Exceeded our expectations, we did not want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: jmlile
Reviews.Content: Our stay was more than we expected, the room we booked was a jr suite ocean view. We were on the 3rd floor and had a great view, nice room size and very clean. The servers in the restaurant were always ready to serve and clean up, we had minamal wait times for whatever it is we needed. The beach bar was very convenient to grab a quick drink. However, if you were lounging on the beach/pool PABLO was always around to bring a fresh beverage and with a SMILE.. HIs saying was "Dont worry be happy, Pablo will get it". He was Great and worked very hard to please. THANKS PABLO!!! Jesus was also great as well as Tilo the Bellman. Pool was great and nicely landscaped. The upstairs pool bar was WONDERFUL as we hid from the sun there on several occasions.. AH! Only thing to improve is larger menus at the 2 restaurants. Hubby is not an italian eater so a plain steak and shrimp would be helpful. Ocean had some rocks due to mother nature but the staff worked hard everyday to clean up whatever the waves rolled in.. GREAT STAY! GREAT HOTEL! GREAT PEOPLE!! GREAT LOCATION if you like to shop and walk town which was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation spot and wonderful service!!”
Reviews.Author: jesskeller
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an amazing stay at the Gran Porto Real, where I stayed with family and friends. We had nine people in our group and everyone loved their stay. The location was amazing and the resort was beautiful. In particular, I wanted to give a special thanks to Jesus, who works on the beach helping with food and drinks. He was extremely friendly and helpful the entire week we were there. We enjoyed the beautiful beach everyday and Jesus made every effort to make our time as enjoyable as possible.. Whether it be a tray of drinks without even having to ask, a helpful tip about town, or what the theme would be that night at dinner, he was he had it all! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: Kevin41952
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful, relaxing vacation and I would do it again in a heartbeat. I couldn't believe how the staff goes above and beyond to help you. A few employees who deserve an extra compliment are as follows: Hiram, Aurelio, and Jose at the Beach/pool bar, Paul at the front desk, Rodrigo and Carlos at the breakfast/lunch buffet, and lastly Jose at Pescatore's. I hope to return to this destination next year

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Grand Time at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: adventurediveseeker
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabuous week at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen. We book the trip with another couple through Expedia, based on reviews from Trip Advisor. We made the right decision with out a doubt. The incredible hospitality and good nature of the native people started from the moment we arrived at the airport in Cancun and met our transportation (provided by "Best Day"). Upon arrival to the resort we were pleasantly greeted with a refreshing cocktail in the lobby and by the bell boy and front desk. We booked a standard room with the all inclusive package, which was the only way to go. After a semi breif introduction by one of the customer greeting staff we were shown to our rooms. This would be the ONLY dissapointing moment of our stay. We ended up with the rooms 292-296 which are equivalant to an interior stateroom on a cruise ship. The rooms themselves were as nice as the others, just no balcony or view of any kind. We spent the first night there and in the morning spoke with the manager at the front desk about a different room. I did not ask for an upgrade but just a room that at least opened to the outdoors. The manager checked the availability of the other rooms and found two other rooms almost next to each other and had us moved in no time. These rooms were great. They had a front patio with two chairs and a table outside each room and the balcony / hallway that overlooked the pool with the swim up bar. These were rooms 502 - 530ish. The room itself was no suite, two queen beds, but very clean and the bed was very comfortable. That was when we started to be really impressed by their customer service. As we found out the rest of the week, it would never stop. Every single employee we encountered at the resort was exceptionally friendly and genuinely conserned with our happiness. Our beach / pool side waiter, Jose, was awesome. Between him and his partner Pablo we were never without a cocktail or water. Jose would even remember what everyone was drinking from the day before. The food at the three main resturaunts was good to excellent. The buffet style resturaunt was good for breakfast and lunch and the beachside lunch was pretty decent too. The Italian resturaunt was our favorite and the Mexican "Maria's was second runner up. When it came to drinks... top shelf was no problem when you requested it and they have a good selection too. The Beach was nice. I have read some reviews of the beach being to rocky to swim... I dont know what they are talking about. There is one area at the very end of the beach near the large pier about 150 long that is a little rocky, but the rest is pretty nice. The only thing was the fishing and dive boats were all moored in some of this area. That seemed to be the norm almost all the way down to the ferry pier. The town and nightlife was great too. From our room to Fifth st., where all the shopping is, is a short 3 minute stroll. The nightlife starts late for us early risers, 11:00 or so. But once it gets going, WOW it's one big party. We never saw anyone causing problems and all of the personel were very curtious. A walk down the beach after the clubs start kicking is quite an experience to take in too. In all, the people of Playa del Carmen were some of the nicest I have seen. The service at the Gran Porto Real, exceptional. We all said we can't wait to go back. And it will be to the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “It really is like "coming home" to stay at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico.”
Reviews.Author: cowalk25
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit and it was just as great as the first. The staff is gracious and looks for ways to help. I have yet to run into a rude staff person at Gran Porto Real. The rooms are very attractive and clean as is the entire hotel. The menu has a lot of variety and I was never disappointed in any of the many entrees I tried. Staff to look for as being particularly helpful are Elizabeth, Astrid, Juan, Teresa, and Ana. But they are all terrific. You won't be disappointed in your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning our next trip”
Reviews.Author: ocean702
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night vacation at the Gran Porto Real. My boyfriend and I visited Playa del Carmen for the third time. It was the first time for our friends. This was our 3rd all inclusive hotel and for us it was perfect. The location can't be beat with just a quick walk to all the shops, restaurants and bars on 5th Ave. The drinks were great, the buffet food was delicious. The activities staff were very friendly and respectful. We enjoyed playing pool volleyball each day. Overrall the service was great, our room was clean, the servers were friendly and efficient. There were plenty of chairs under huts to keep in the shade on the beach, which we were able to get around 9am each morning. Getting chairs by the pool was difficult if you were not up by 7:30am. Downfalls: the beach isn't great for swimming. Pretty to sit on, but to get in/out of water there are sandbags/coral. The mexican restaurant was not very good, the italian restaurant was good but always had a wait. The public bathrooms, while clean, could use updating. Upsides: pool on 3rd floor with swim up bar was quieter than main pool. Beach bar, with swings was quiet and relaxing and Miguel was on top of keeping yoru drink full. Buffet food was good and always had a variety for lunch. Drinks were delicious! The size of the resort was good. We will definitely be back to the Gran Porto Real!

Reviews.Title: “Had a BLAST!!”
Reviews.Author: travellady99
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off by saying the staff here are AMAZING! I have to thank a few for making our vacation extra special ( Avila, Hugo, Marcos, Ana, Sotres, Armando & Alejandro you guys are the best. Thank you!) Our trip would not have been the same without these friendly, hard working and funny people that gave us memories to last a lifetime. In general the hotel was good. We had to move rooms once because we were put in a room under the pool that was very dark, but once we moved everything was much better. Housekeeping was great and the entire hotel in general was kept very clean. As for the buffet, it did leave something to be desired however the Italian restaurant was fantastic and we never had a problem getting a table. (Hose & Dahlia Thank You as well.) All in all this is a great hotel. The only thing that was really upsetting was the hours of operation for the bars. When people are on vacation they would like to sit out and have some beverages past 11pm (12pm for the lobby bar) without having to go off resort to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: medygarcia
Reviews.Content: These are just a few words to express my gratitude for the excellent service that I recieved during my recent stay at the Gran Porto Real Playa Del Carmen. Special thanks to the following individuals who made my stay particularly enjoyable. MainRestaurant: Rodrigo and Carlos Maria's Mexican Restaurant: Salvador and Mariano Lobby Bar waitress: Miriam, Ana, & Mary Recreational activities: Alejandro, Armando, & Victor I highly recommend this place as the services are great, the beach is very wide (unrestrictive width), the water is clean (no rocks), shopping at Playa del Carmen is just a few steps away, and the food is delicious! I would certainly visit a second and third time and a few more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service except for the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Brewser111
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our 6th visit to the Gran Porto Real and had a wonderful time with one major exception. I will start out with the good first. As a whole the staff throughout the hotel are very friendly, kind and work very hard to ensure that you enjoy your stay. I would like to recognize Ivan(morning buffet waiter),Teresa(our waitress at the pool), Miriam(lobby bar waitress) and Victor or as everyone refers to him "Chicken" who is by far the best of the entertainment staff. These are the people that make us want to come back year after year because of their hardwork and friendliness. They make you feel like family when you are there. The hotel is kept very clean and the food is better than other all inclusives that I have stayed at. the Italian restauraunt is the best:) The hotel is a short walk to 5th ave where all the action is so that is also a big plus. The major exception that I noted involves the poor treatment at the front desk. Granted the people working at the desk do act kind the management that supports them needs to step up and improve their reservation process. Over the last 3 years we have never rec'd the room that we originally booked when we arrived and have had people from our group bumped to other hotels. This trip we had to wait an extra day for the right room. This happened even though we booked many months in advance. This trip we also heard numerous stories of people not getting the right rooms or being bumped to other hotels. Bottom line is if you can get past the front desks inefficencies you will have a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeding our expectations, as always!”
Reviews.Author: chuckCapeCodMa_
Reviews.Content: Weather was hot and sunny. We love this resort and have been there many times; spent 10 days there this April; most of it at the pool. It is centrally located to activities and shopping on Fifth Ave. The reason we keep going back is their dedicated staff. We were at the pool most days. Jesus, Therese, Pablo and Margarida were there to greet us each day and provided superb poolside service with friendly smiles. What energy! We ate mostly at the Albatross Restaurant (buffet). Hostess Sherily seated us with waiters, Rodrigo and Carlos, every day,who provided excellent service and were very personable. We ate at their italian restaurant (Il Pescatore) once, had a fabulous meal, from pasta to Beef Tournedos, and was greeted by name by Mateo (and Naum), a great waiter. Look for him when you go! A big thank you to Captain Eliazar, Chef Rene and waiters, Antonio and Rutilio. He surprised us with a grand special dinner, w/Tiki torches on the lawn. Amazing!! The meal was incredible. They treated us like royalty. The couple we were with had a medical emergency and had to cut short their trip. You cannot believe how helpful and wonderful the Concierges (Astrid and Richard) and Real Members Services (Bernie and Ana Morales) were in helping get them home and coordinating with the airlines. Our heartfelt thanks to them all. We wholeheartedly recommend this resort and their staff.

Reviews.Title: “As always great place and good service”
Reviews.Author: nathb189
Reviews.Content: This is my second time around at the GPR since October and was not disapointed. I went this time with my sister and she also fell in love with the place. I had love my room so much I had it again (Oceanfront junior suite). Astrid the concierge was again a great help. The place was spotless, the food excellent (they upraded the buffet.. much better!) but it is the people that makes the difference: Pablo, José and Jesus on the beach, good guys. Sheryl, Rodrigo, Lorenzo, Carlos and Freddy my little joker where the best, always happy to see us and great service. This place is also nice because its very quiet but in the middle of everything, so people with kids or teenagers that get bored easily would love this place mainly because of 5th Avenue (hot spot) being a 2 minutes walk from the hotel. The only thing I think is missing is the numbers of restaurants, there is only 2, mexican and Italian, they are excellent but if you are staying 2 weeks or more the choice get a little redundant. But I would not hesitate to go back and if I have the chance I am going!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I got two words for ya,,This place was over the top service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: billjfraser
Reviews.Content: gran porto real was just amazing , excellent service from all the staff , great,great food , wonderful location , beautiful beaches , the sun gods were on our side , not one complaint , all this from a group of 18 people , special thanks to all the staff but just to mention a few ... salvador, jose , and marcus at the bars , paul , samy at the front desk , arron , freddy bellboys , Thank-you for all the time .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing, beautiful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: jacksons4hokies
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from Gran Porto Real last night (my husband, my two boys 18,22, and myself). We had a wonderful experience. The room was lovely, the food at Marias and the Italian restaurant was delicious, the drinks were tasty, the staff was fun and friendly especially Cecelia and Rebecca - for us, it was a delightful 4 days. The Gran Porto was so clean - there were always staff members shining and polishing everything! The wait staff at the pool were on the ball - always ready to serve! We loved Maria's - the mexican food was delicious, and Salvador, our waiter, was just precious! We were never had to wait for anything - We were treated so well! I would make several suggestions to those getting ready to travel: *Call ahead and check on the room that you are expecting. We did have a room "situation", but were moved to our Junior Suite that we reserved. *The food at the buffet is okay - not great - but, I wasn't expecting a 5 star dining experience. I wanted a quick bite at breakfast and lunch so that I would spend my day in the sun. *Get to the pool early for chairs. I dreaded this, but it all worked out okay. Who wants to sleep last on vacation when you are in Mexico! My husband and I were down at the pool by 7:15 every day - We got our chairs and sat there ALL day! *The beach in front of the hotel is not great - walk down a bit - there are better places to swim. Personally, we enjoyed the pool better just because of the service. *Visit Xel-Ha when you are there. VERY nice place - well worth the $99! Ask in the lobby about arranging the day trip. *DO NOT get fooled at the airport! If you have an arranged shuttle, go straight out to the shuttle area. If they start talking to you in the airport, it's a group that is trying to sell you something! I would go to this resort again in a minute. For the price, it just can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible experience!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysmexico24
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real is one of the best resorts I have stayed at yet! I have traveled to Mexico 8 times and Gran Porto Real was one of the best resorts I have stayed at. Gran Porto Real is not included in the crazy spring break scene, this hotel had a mix of families, couples, honeymooners, and some teenagers which was a nice variety. This hotel was not too big and not too small... the rooms were larger and more comfortable than any other hotel room I have stayed at.. the air conditioning worked extremely well and the shower was fairly large. Even though, Gran Porto is an all inclusive, they also have room service and the liquor and soda in your room is included, as well. The rooms were always very clean and was always prepared with enough towels and other supplies. The best parts of the hotel are... The Staff (activity staff, waiters, bartenders, cooking staff, and cleaning staff). The Activity Staff including.. Cesar, Karina, Chicken, Alejandro, Armando, Mike and the DJs were extremely professional and made everyone feel welcome. They were always friendly, helpful, and not too mentain funny! They ran creative, entertaining, and fun activities for everyone for all ages. Also, they work wonderful together and as a team! They really made my stay very enjoyable and I would go back just for the activities. The waiters and cooking staff and especially, Eliazar, Joel and Luis (chefs), Ismael, Geovanni, Frank, Lorenzo, Sergrio, Matos, Antonio were very accomodating! Everyday they came to work with a smile on there face and wanting to assist you in anyway possible. One of the people I was traveling with had a peanut allergy so the chef prepared a special meal with no peanuts.. The staff were insistant that if you had any complaints about the food prepared at the buffet that they would cook you whatever you wanted. The waiters and cooking staff were extremely hard working and dedicated to their work. The grounds of the resort were always spotless and well kept.. the cleaning staff was out there first thing in the morning cleaning the grounds. The beach is very clean and beautiful. There is not one thing I would complain about this resort... it was relaxing, fun, and always something to do if you wanted to! The staff really makes your trip worth while but the gorgeous atmosphere helps too!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC customer service!! R*E*A*L treatment morning thru night!!”
Reviews.Author: gee_gee6
Reviews.Content: The Morning service at the buffet was Fantastic thanks to Ivan & Carlos!!! Ivan greeted us every morning with our coffee & tea instantly & Carlos provided a clean table when we left the table to sample our seconds!! The dinner service was above & beyond Thanks to FRANK!!! He really tended to our request's with a GIANT SPARKLING PEARLY white smile every moment!!! He assisted in pictures with humor & charisma. Delivered chocolate dessert when there was none that eve without requesting; very intuitive & keenly aware. Ismael is a dashing, humorous, & pleasant host to be entertained by at any dinner table. He instantly connects with the guest's & ensures a relaxed dinner all the while offering a amazing smile with dancing eyes. We also enjoyed the Italian Restaurant so much we went back twice!! outstanding service again & the food was exceptional!! The buffet food was very good!! Incredible selection at every meal. So much so, that it made it hard to choose what to have at each meal, yet created interest & excitement to see what was being served.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: albertha
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disappointing more than anything. I would not rate it as 5 star. It is more like a 3 star. I know it's a bit of an essay, but I wanted to detail what we went through in order to make others aware of what was going on during our stay: We stayed for 2 weeks with First Choice and booked a Junior suite. On arrival we were told our room was not ready, it would be ready the next morning and as compensation we would get 40 US dollars to spend in the gift shop. Fine no problem, we stayed in an upgraded room. The next day we were asked if we wanted to keep this upgraded room, paying extra, or move to another room, we moved. However, in order to receive 40 US dollars compensation we were asked to sign a disclaimer which said we would take no further complaint to the hotel or First Choice about this room change. We signed, fair enough no problem, these things happen. Unfortunately we were put in a room by the lobby and the ping pong table and between the bar closing at midnight and the staff going to work at 5am in the morning - trolleys and all rolling past the room, we were back at reception to change rooms again, this time due to noise and lack of sleep. We were then put in a room which was a lot smaller than the previous suite - the bathroom is not even separate to the bedroom - and not as advertised on the website - we did complain about this, but we took it as at this point we just wanted to get settled - it was now tuesday pm and we arrived sunday pm - we have so far spent 48 hours messing around with rooms. On finally getting on with the holiday we spoke to several other people and it appears that everyone booking a junior suite goes through this whole farce of room changing - we thought we were the only ones at the time - not at all and signing the disclaimer makes me feel like I've been subject to a scam in some way. It's this underhand way of dealing with guests that definately puts this hotel on a back foot. The reception staff are left to fend off the public while managers hide in the back - the longer we were there the more chaos ensued at reception with room changes happening all the time - it appears to be the norm for this hotel. First Choice were apparently not aware of this and our rep was very good at gathering the stories that came to light and we have officially complained in order to try and prevent this from happening to others. It's something I have not come across before. Good points: Rooms were very clean Housekeeping, room service and bar staff were excellent. Reception staff generally good, but one girl completely unhelpful and rude Restaurant service at Marias and Italian excellent Food at Marias and Italian excellent Snack bar at beach excellent 24hr buffet generally ok selection Sushi bar generally ok selection Pool on roof quiet until pm when turns into a party pool for adults with swim up bar (not much shade here until pm) Always found a lounger Good location to go to Cozumel or get bus trips to Tulum Xel-ha, Xcaret etc... Good location for shops and night life Not so Good points: Very noisy round main pool - mainly for kids, not couples relaxing Buffet food at lunch and dinner not great at all - not good selection - not good cuts of meat and overcooked - more veg selection at breakfast than dinner (would have struggled to eat here if it wasn't for beach bar, Marias and Italian) Staff in buffet restaurant not as on the ball, had to ask for everything from coffee to cutlery Beach ok to sit at, but very rough to swim just in front of hotel This hotel especially let itself down due to the room changing and actually trying to get the room we paid for, as advertised on the website. First impressions are important and I feel cheated. Therefore I do not feel this was value for money either. We had a good holiday, but I would not return and I would not recommend this hotel to others. You should start your holiday as soon as you arrive not days later when you've calmed down from frustration.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumRealEstate
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying in Playa Del Carmen in the past 3 years. I always stay at The Royal Playa Del Carmen which also allows me full access to Gran Porto. I decided to stay at Gran Porto this year and I choose the Gran Master One Bedroom Suite Ocean Front which allows me full access to The Royal . The room has an awesome view of the Caribbean and all the comforts of home.The service at the hotel is exceptional , the facilities are very clean and the staff always friendly. If there is a problem it gets solved right away. I must say that when I did have a small issue with my room location Samantha said she would take care of it and as expected she corrected it right away. The hotel has great restaurants, complimentary nightly entertainment and is in walking distance of 5th avenue. If you like to be above the action then get your room above the pool. If you want seclusion request a room away from the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort a Wonderful Holiday”
Reviews.Author: TrimPenticton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real April 2nd to April 9th. We had a fantastic vacation. There where eight of us in total four adults and four kids (8,8,6 and 4 in age). The Gran Porto Real is a very kid friendly resort. Let me start with the rooms we decided to go with the Junior suite the rooms where very spacious (I would not go with a standard room to small). The Junior Suite had two queen beds in a very big room with a well stocked fridge daily. We had a nice balcony with seating for four and a hamock for the kids. The Bathroom was very roomy with a huge shower. All in all we where very happy we upgraded to the Junior Suite. The food was very good the buffet changed daily, going to an all inclusive you would think the buffet would be bland and boring the same thing every day. The Gran Porto Real changed up its buffet daily. For dinner they would have a pasta night, a mexican night with tacos, they had asian night with hand made sushi stir fries etc. we had lunch occasionally outside at the beach bar you could find anything from hotdogs for the kids to hamburgers, salads and nachos with salsa. You could also go to the ala carte restaurants, there is an Italian restaurant and a Mexican. I would recomennd the Italian. The good thing about these restaurants is it is walk up no reservtions required. One last note the kids and adults could not get enough ice cream. All the bars where well stocked you name it they could make it. The service was phenomenal theese people work very hard and are always very happy. The resort is very close to shopping, on five ave we walked there every other day for general items and a change of pace. Just three blocks away there is a store called Mega it is a grocery store and department store combined in one it also has a pharmacy if needed (if the kids got to much sun). We found the area very safe. The pool was very nice, but we came here for the ocean. The ocean directly in front of the resort is a little rocky not to bad though, if you walk North of the Ferry pier you will find a very nice sandy beach we spent hours here (no more than a five minute walk). One nice thing about the beach in front of the resort is there are living reefs with an array of fish for snorkeling in about two to three feet of water, the kids loved this they could not get enough of the ocean. One final point the staff treat each and every one of its guests like royalty. No matter who it is they always have a smile on there face and a polite Hola for everyone. The service from all employees from the Gran Porto Real is top notch. The only regret we had as a family was not staying longer. We are already planning a holiday next year Same time and of course the SAME PLACE. Thank You Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: SAKDGK
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real was the site of a friend's destination wedding. Our group had guests coming in from all over the U.S and all seemed to have similar experiences. First, the front desk is very unorganized. Almost everyone in our group had some issue with their room. Some were unavailable, some were overbooked, some were the wrong type of room. The hotel worked to rectify this by offering credits, upgrading rooms, and even moving guests to the Real across the street.(which we were not allowed to go hangout with them in their hotel) All were ok solutions, but why were there so many issues in the first place? For us, we were upgraded to an amazing master suite with an ocean view, but only for one night. We couldn't get settled in and the next day had to move to a dungeon room. What a disappointment. The other downside to our move was that we were give a credit to the gift shop. it would have been ok, except the front desk called to remind us of our credit every morning at 8am. Several other guests received these early morning calls and none seemed to happy to be getting them. Maybe a note left by the housekeeper would be a suitable alternative. The food and drinks were ok. Maria's restaurant was definitely the highlight and the rest of the food was pretty monotonous. As for the drinks, drink beer or ask for doubles to avoid sugar overload. The pools were nice, however the main pool is fairly small and all the chairs are claimed with towels very early in the morning. The secondary pool with the swim up bar was nice. The staff was friendly and worked hard to make sure the hotel was in good shape. The wedding was very well done and was definitely the highlight of our time at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “fun chilled out atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: craigmcmanus1987
Reviews.Content: 5 star all the way, service was exceptional, my first time in mexico and the staff made me feel like it was my second home a big shout out to Ana who made sure all my needs were met and more and also to Rebeca, Miriam, Avila and Alcfandro, cant wait to go back next year

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation property with excellent staff and location...hard to beat!”
Reviews.Author: TKS_Family
Reviews.Content: Went to the Porto Real in 2001 and love it - actually we love all the Real Resort properties - so we decied to go back this year. The hotel has made significant investments in the property over the last 10 years and continues to enhance the beauty and quality of it. The resort is a short walk away from 5th Avenue, the main attraction of Playa del Carmen, which is a meca of excellent dining, entertaining and shopping no matter what you are looking for - so its in a perfect location! Every staff encounter is excellent and the dinning quality including the All inclusive experience is second to none. The pool experience with the Annimation team is unbeatable during the day as is the entertainment at night. The beautiful long Myan Rivera beach is right in front of the hotel including a vast array of extracaricular entertainment opportunities for Parasailing and Deep Sea Fishing and much more from the trust worthy locals. We cannot say enough about this very beautiful picturesk resort! Check out www.reslresorts.com for actual pictures etc. They are genuine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - don't make your friends stay here”
Reviews.Author: HaveTowel
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give it 0 stars. It's amazing that this crap-hole ripoff is in business. This is not a luxury resort or at least hasn't been one for years. Its a 2 star has-been that should be charging $120 a night. Instead it manages to charge $360. The whole con is that it offers couples the romantic experience of being one of 4 weddings a night to grace their beach. These couples pay incredibly cheap rates for their weddings while their guests pay 4/5 star prices for a 2 star experience. The rooms are shabby. The service is poor. The food is sub par. The beach is largely eroded and packed like a sardine can. This is not the pristine Caribbean beach you see in the well cropped photos. There is a large concrete commercial pier at the edge of the resort. The water is full of rocks and continuously gives off he spell of sulfur. And if you are looking to get married here, I can tell you the wedding planners are unresponsive once you've got your deposit in and they rip you off by up-charging you for every little adjustment you want.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ginger36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Porto Real from March 30th to the 10th of april. We had a great vacation.The staff were super. I have read the reviews and cannot understand why they said the food was not good............. We have been vacationing for the last 15 years and have found this resort to have great food. This staff are great , yes not a great night life, but maybe that could be improved on if asked.............. Great family resort............. We went there to relax and that we did,! Thank you to all at the Grnad Porto Real!

Reviews.Title: “EATEN ALIVE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ONEANGRYRN
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write this review as there were so many issues during my staff at Gran Porto Real. First of all let me say that I am not one of those travelers who is very picky or entitled but when things are very wrong something has to be said. I spent the majority of my trip at another all inclusive resort and it was absolutely amazing...food, room, staff--everything! They were booked for the last 2 days of my trip so my travel agent suggested the Gran Porto Real and from the reviews I thought it would be great. I decided to upgrade (at my travel agents suggestion) to an oceanfront room just for fun for my last two nights of my trip. I arrived early and knew that my room wouldn't be ready and thought no problem I would do a little shopping on 5th avenue. When they took me to my room I was shocked to see the view! It was of the bus stop/street. I immediately went to speak with someone at the front desk and was told that this was in fact ocean front. When I showed her the photo she seemed disinterested. She assured me that they would try to give me an ocean front the next day so I thought ok, I can deal for one night. I woke up the next morning with literally dozens of bites on my knees and thighs and thought uh oh...not bed bugs. When I inquired about the change of room I was promised I was told they were full and there wouldn't be any changes. The next morning, (they day I checked out ) I had dozens more bites on my legs and arms and was miserable. I told the person at check out that they have bed bugs and he said "oh we'll, check and see". Now for the food...in a word-yuck. I might not have had such high expectations if I hadn't just come from another all inclusive where they got everything right but wow, it was awful. The pool was too crowded and small also. Overall, you couldn't pay me to come back to this resort. Im not exagerating when I say I paid the same amount of money to stay here as I did secrets capri. If you want a great vacation with great food and be treated wonderfully, book there instead but if you do decide to stay here beware and bring your OFF bug spray cause you'll need it!

Reviews.Title: “WOW AMAZING HOTEL AMAZING FOOD AMAZING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: tammyhowlett
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to and surpassed every expectation we had for our vacation. Our only frustration was at check in time. Things were confusing with everyone in the lobby at the same time checking in and checking out but eventually everything was sorted out. Our rooms were great with a terrace on the first floor facing the road. The rooms were always spotless, cleanliness of the whole hotel was fabulous. The maids were attentive to detail, the waiters and waitresses were friendly and courteous. This was the best service I have had anywhere including my own city. the food was excellent, best buffet foods from anywhere including my own city. The variety and quality of food was excellent. You did not have to have the same foods each day. Had a great stay and a great vacation. We would return to the same place again and recoomend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: pylon21
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in from March 19-26. I can't say enough good things about this place. It was our first trip to Mexico but not our first all-inclusive. The staff at this place are the best we have ever come accross. It didnt matter if it was someone cleaning the floor to the bartenders, they are all super friendly and can't do enough for you, they are second to none. Honorable mentions go to Pablo (the best beach waiter ever), Jesus, Alejandro (this guy is awesome), Avilla, Mari, Mirium, Jose & Hugo. The location is awesome with walking distance to 5th avenue which is full of shops, outlet stores, restaurants, bars & nightclubs. We went every day and never felt unsafe. It was a nice option for an all inclusive being able to go out whenever you wanted. The bars were great especially the lobby bar with Alejandro & Avilla leading the way, a small tip each day and they looked after you like gold. The resort was a perfect size, not too big but enough amenities. The only thing I could say was that it was hard to get a lounger around the pool, you really had to get up early, the beach however was not a problem, you could go down at any time of day and get a spot. The food was good, like all resorts after a week you are ready for some home cooking but no complaints, the italian restaurant was especially good. Rooftop jacuzzi was good with an amazing view, you had to get your own drinks and take them up from the swim up bar located a level below. I know a lot of the negative reviews are about the beach itself, I am not an ocean swimming kind of guy so it didn't bother me, but the waves were very strong when we were there and the beach front had a lot of sandbags, I guess to reclaim some of the area. Over all there was lots of beach and you could walk for miles as it connected to the adjacent resorts. no complaints from our group about it. We upgraded to a junior suite when we booked with our travel agency, and got it with no problems. Not sure about some of the reviews about the rooms but ours was perfect with nice furnishings and high ceilings. The toilet some days was a little slow but always worked. I guess if you are comparing it to the Encore/Wynn in Las Vegas you may be wanting a little more, but for an all inclusive the junior suite can't be beat. Playa del Carmen is an awesome city to relax in, we had five families with kids ranging from 6 - 18 and always felt safe. If you are a partier you may want to consider Cancun, but if you are a family looking for a great vacation spot you cannot go wrong with this place. Did I mention Pablo and Alejandro?

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto needs truth in advertising - Would NOT return”
Reviews.Author: kshofer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Gran Porto Real. Our group was comprised of 5 adults, 6 kids, aged 11-15, & 2 grandmas - a total of 5 rooms. We had fully researched this hotel and booked last October. For our family of 4 plus 1 grandma, we booked the Gran Master 1 bdrm suite plus a Jr. Ocean front suite - the website says that we could adjoin these 2 rooms to make a 2 bdrm suite. The Gran Master is the top room for the hotel. If you look on the website, this room looks amazing, and to us, worth the extra price. We liked the listed amenities (fully loaded iPod, complimentary cabana on the beach, ability to use the sister resort across the street, etc.) There are only 6 of these rooms at the resort, so we booked one. Again, booked last October. When we are able to get into our rooms at 3pm, we were suprised and shocked at our "Gran Master" suite - it was a completely different room than is shown on the website for this class. The room we thought we were getting had 3 balconies, wall of windows looking over the ocean, separate living room, etc. The room we walked into looked over the pool, but a palm tree blocked our view. You could see the ocean past the bar. Our balcony was tiny - not worth sitting on. This room also had a sitting/living room with a worn out couch, chair & table. The bedroom was nothing special - just a bed. Meanwhile, we were told we couldn't get our 2nd room adjoined to this one, but they were 2 rooms down the hall - that was fine. My brother and his 2 children were next to Grandma and our kids. We walked into their room....WOW! Jr. Family Suite with 2 queen beds, bunk beds and a trundle bed. Columns, huge balcony with flowers growing on it - beautiful. These Family Suites were so much nicer than our Gran Master Suite. My husband went down to the desk to find out what happened to the room we were supposed to get. Long, long story short - we were able to move to our requested room in 2 days. The room in the picture is the only ONE that looks that way! There are 2 others with nice views & balconies and then 3 like the one we initially received. The room was amazing & worth the wait. The bad thing was that if my brother and mother wanted to move out of their 2 family suites with us, they would have to have rooms with only a king bed (1 king - 3 people) Another family in our party was given a better room for one night and then they had to move or pay for the upgrade. I think that is the norm - giving a better room for a possible upgrade when you have to move. The truth: 8 Dining options - not even close! There are 3 restaurants (Mexican, Italian & Buffet) plus food at a tiki hut on the beach for lunch each day. The 24 hr self-serve is snacks - sometimes there would be salmon mousse, sometimes corn dogs - mainly snacks & fruit. The website lists "Gaviotas" as a pool & beach bar. This is a bar where you can bring the food you found at the Parrillada Grill (the tiki hut with food on 2 sides) and sit at tables. You can not order food from this bar. It is seating for eating. The Trade Winds "snack bar" has chips and I saw peanuts. We based our decision on where to vacation this year based on accommodations first, but also, how many restaurants there were in relation to number of rooms. We thought that this would be great - fairly small resort with 8 restaurants - not even close. The "Health & Sushi Bar" is hardly that. It's a bar that will make you fresh juice and in the corner is one cart that holds 3 kinds of sushi. Also the "Teen Club" - my 13 yr old said "Teen Club, right. More like a closet!" It was a dark room with 6 or 8 flat screens on the wall and a video chair for each. The room was probably 6 feet by 20 feet. A closet, not a club. Good things: Chairs - always found one, no problem Drinks - great Wait staff - very attentive Family Jr. Suite - great option for families Mexican Restaurant - great food Omelette station staff Buffet at breakfast Getting our room after 2 days The problem with the room could be solved by telling the truth. There is only one true Gran Master Suite like the photos and floor plan pictured. That should have it's own price and should be able to be rented. If it's full, it's unavailable. Don't charge the same amount for a sub-standard room. The other 5 Gran Master Suites should have lower prices, so you know what you are getting!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5*”
Reviews.Author: jules167
Reviews.Content: This was definitely not a 5* hotel by any standard. The room we had been led to believe would have a private balcony and sea view, had a two chairs outside the bedroom door on the walkway for all the rooms. The room itself was very cramped, the furnishings very tatty and the bed was a concrete base with a mattress on top. As for wardrobe space - 14 inches wide for a week's worth of clothes!!! The bar area was dirty. The buffet restaurant was so dimly lit you couldn't see what you were eating and the waiters were rude and unhelpful. Trying to get cutlery and a cup of tea at breakfast was impossible. This hotel would possibly pass for a 3* but was most definitely not a 5* with the 5* prices that were being charged!!! Would I consider going back? Not a hope!

Reviews.Title: “3 out of 5 at best, won't go again”
Reviews.Author: 41stealth
Reviews.Content: Not the worst but you can see it from here, but for sure not the best. Food, OK at best, not great. Seemed to specialize in buffet trays of sloppy ??? depending on the theme for the day. Found myself wondering around hoping to find something appealing that wasn't overcooked and sitting is a mushy sauce. Steaks were 3/8" thick, were fried up in less than 5 mins and tough as leather. Certainly not grain fed AAA beef. Drinks may have had alcohol. Service good to very good, especially when you tipped early in the day. Again, you can find that at any resort working for tips. Nighly entertainment - god awful. Someone thinks they are an artistic director???? Men dressed in dresses, attempting to do ballet, falling out of poses. Laughable. Women in mermaid costumes trying to hold their tails in the air, yes I said trying to hold their tails in the air without success. Hysterical. Maybe it was comedy??? Staff - typical of any other resort we have been to. "Chicken" of the "animation team" can be found at every resort, he was mediocre at best. Resort had a bit of a more personable feel because it is smaller than the mega resorts, you do see the same staff every day from morning until night thus you do remember names. They purposely overbook and then offload guests to the sister resorts they operate, happens to often, you are powerless because they simply tell you they don't have a room for you. They also will put you in the worst room in the hotel trying to squeeze more money of you. Don't go for the beach. Don't go for the large pool, isn't. Go for the proximity to 5th ave if shopping is your thing. Always scamming to get you to the front desk to upgrade or attend a timeshare presentation. For those who don't travel much, you will possibly enjoy yourself. For everyone else, lots of other places to try.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , not a 4.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Jfdupras
Reviews.Content: We spent last week at the grand porto real and had a great time.We where expecting more from a 4.5 rating , the worst was the beach.You pretty much have to walk 200 M the be on a nicer beach, there is boats all over the place and many many rocks, watch for you feet!!! The staff where really good, we did received a excellent service from Jose and Miguel , at the pool bar Marios and fabian where amazing and what a great service from Rigoberto at the mexicain restaurant.The hotel was clean and the staff really friendly.There is only 2 a la carte restaurants and the buffet is not always the best choice.The hotel a located close to Playa Del Carmen downtown , really nice walking.Don't expect to much nightlife, the advertised discotheque is a kid playroom.Overrall we had a good time , but I wouldn`t go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Clevelynne
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real was the perfect resort for my family. This was our first trip to Playa del Carmen and we will return!! Let’s put it this way, there were tears in my eyes leaving the resort. I just didn’t want to go home! There are so many reasons, I will try to list as many as possible. The HOTEL is just the right size, not too big or small. It is a beautiful hotel in a hacienda style, with lots of tile, plants, arched doorways etc. It is kept SPOTLESSLY clean. The staff is constantly keeping it maintained. The rooms are beautiful too. We had an oceanfront suite, which was lovely. I think it’s called the Gran Family Suite. It was large and airy with one large balcony with doors onto the balcony from both rooms. It gave us the privacy we needed while traveling with 3 children (8, 6, and 4) The couple we traveled with were in a suite on the 3rd floor and it was even nicer than ours! The KIDS ACTIVITY CENTER was amazing. The girls who work there were fabulous. (Diana, Gina, Nelly and ?? ) My girls WANTED to go in there. The girls were engaged with the children and we could drop them off as needed. They would bring them back out to the pool when they were ready to swim. The first part of the trip we had the kids go into the activity room while we went out to dinner, then we found out the girls babysat in the rooms, so we would have a sitter from 8-11. We would go out to dinner at 8pm often at the Adult resort across the street. LOCATION: It is just a short 5-minute walk to 5th Avenue where there are shops and restaurants etc. It is very safe. The beach was really nice, and the Real Adult only Resort across the street was GREAT. We ate there (with out kids) probably 4 nights. It is very upscale resort. The restaurants there were very nice. Loved that we could take advantage of their amenities. The POOL was the right size for us. They have activities from Yoga at 10 am to water aerobics in the afternoon. The staff works very hard at engaging you in an activity. Eduardo, at the towel desk was friendly and tried to teach me a new word every day. The wait staff at the pool was great too. Pablo was our waiter and he was great! They have a Hobie Cat if you are a sailor and kayaks to use too. The STAFF was great! I felt they were friendly and warm. Honestly, they bent over backwards to make our stay wonderful. From friendly greetings day or night with a smile. The girls painted pottery by the pool. We also went off the hotel to go snorkeling. The hotel arranged this trip, which was safe and fun. I am shocked to read any negative review on this website. Our stay was so wonderful, I can’t believe it’s the same resort! I would recommend the Gran Portal Real!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- not so great beach”
Reviews.Author: nadiashaindra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GPR from March 25th-March 30th, for our one year wedding anniversary. the great thing about the hotel is that it is about 40 mins away from CUN airport, and the ride didint seem that long. when we arrived at the resort, we noticed that it was only one block up from 5th ave, a great location overall. the GPR is VERY clean and spacious. as soon as we walked in, we felt like we were in a palace. the hotel staff greeted us and offered us something to drink. husband took a beer, and i took cold water. they immediately took our luggage and we started our check in, which went pretty easily. Alejandro, one of the BEST staff at the GPR, took care of us. we originally had a regular jr. suite, but he upgraded us to the ocean view, which we loved. the suit was VERY spacious, clean and beautiful. we had a few problems with teh shower, however. the cold water would not turn on at all. we called the front desk, and within minutes, someone came up and took care of the porblem. the second problem we enountered on teh 2nd day was that the water from the shower did not go down. we called again, and someone came up very quickly and fixed it. besides those two porblems, we had no other complaints abt our room. housekeeping kept it clean and neat everyday- and did towel art, petals on the bed almost everyday as we did leave her a tip each day. for my husbands birthday, she made him a huge heart with many rose petals on the bed. very nice adn thoughtful. the food at the hotel was very good- especially the italian restaurant. cant rate MARIA's because we ddint get to eat there. the buffet was good- always a great variety. breakfast was very good as well. we enjoyed room service for breakfast the best. everythign was well plated and i noticed the chefs and staff paid attention to details. for our anniversary itself, my husband got us the private romantic dinner, which was out in the gazebo, on the beach and it was just the two of us and our waiter. it was seriusly the best and most romantic dinner experience yet... the food was VERY good, and so was the spraklign wine, and the music. the beach was NOT TO GREAT!! we usually like to go swimmig when we go away- but not this time. it was terribly rocky and hurt a lot. u have to wear water shoes, but still too rocky. but the water was beautiful, and felt so good- too bad we couldn't swim in it or walk into it iwthout getting hurt by the rocks. this is one aspect of the hotel that we HATED. the pools were clean, and clear. we enjoyed lounging on the beach chairs, under the shades, relaxing and smoking cubanos the most. every day we walked out to 5th ave, where we had a great time shopping, walking around and also having Chai and mango lassi at Namaste Chai cafe. we also had coffee and mexican cocoa at Ah Cacao- def try these two cafes. i miss going there :( Also, we had lunch one day at a restaurant on 5th ave, but cant rem the name. outdoor seating, and excellent Mexican dishes. at ngihts, we would watch the resort shows/entertainment, but then we would walk out to 5th ave and go to the bars. we enjoyed teh hooka bar as well on 5th ave. we miss 5th ave the most. we did not use teh spa, but it looked awesome. we did use the gym every day- cute little gym, very clean and well kept. besides teh beach, this is a great hotel, and excellent location. close to everything- clubs, restaurants, cafes, shops etc. We will def come bk in the future with our children, as this resort caters really well to families. the staff were excellent- and we miss Alejandro, sorry we didint get to say bye to him. hope he reads this!!! sorry for any typing errors! - Nadia and Shaindra

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Reece15
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week any longer and I would have come home. Food is disgusting and what was eaten for lunch was served in a different way for dinner . Bedrooms are dated, damp and smelly. Furniture is falling apart in the lounge. Nightlife was a mexican band everynight for one hour between 8-9pm. The 24 hour bar was not stocked and we saw people having to bring drinks in for themselves from the wall shelves in the main bar area. Your drinks are served in cheap plastic cups (ok if you are outside with children about) but who wants to sit and drink out of plastic when you are supposed to be on a night out. It was very noisy with trolleys being pushed passed your rooms from 7a.m and maids chatting. Rooms were not cleaned until 5pm some days. The beach is also to dangerous to swim in due to under current and a hugh drop from where they used sand from the sea to re-build the beach after the last hurricane. On a plus note the staff are nice and the Italian was the best place to eat if you didnt want to get poisoned but everyone had the same idea so you could queue for 2 hours for a table. Handy for 5th Avenue for a change of scenery.

Reviews.Title: “won't go back”
Reviews.Author: sportsbuff
Reviews.Content: we go to this area for sun and sea. lots of sun but can't swim as filled with huge rocks we had to wear wet shoes just to walk in the water. We had to walk to the sister resort to be able to swim. That meant unless we willing to pay extra we had no shade The food is only average. Breakfast was the best meal of the day. What made our holiday was the people who work at this resort. Special thanks to: Martha in housekeeping Fabian & Marcos in beach bar, Antonio & Rutilio in the Albatros Rest., Amador & Daniel in the Italian Rest. Without these people our holiday would be nothing Special thanks to Allan at best day tours

Reviews.Title: “They made paradise perfect!”
Reviews.Author: landon11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had our wedding at Gran Porto Real and were absolutley taken away by the service, quality, and attention to detail. We had a group of 40 friends and family and each one felt that they were top priority. There are numerous weddings at this resort on a given day and we felt like we were the only couple on the resort. We owe a great THANK YOU to the resort and staff for making our big day perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Got Food Poisoning! Don't waste your time!”
Reviews.Author: SpringBreak2011
Reviews.Content: Trip Date: March 28th - April 3rd 2011 / Spring Break I don't usually take the time to write these...but our experience was exceptionally awful. If I can save someone else from wasting their money on this place, I am willing to put in the time to write this to do that ;) If you read other comments on Trip Advisor...the word is getting around on this place. Offering "room upgrades" to customers checking in, when our needs have not yet been met, is inexcusable. We had a party of 3, and they stuck us in a King Size Bed room, and offered to bring in a "bed" for our 20 year-old daughter. I expected something like a "cot". We actually got a "mattress" covered in linens, sitting on the floor. After my daughter moped, I offered to sleep on it...there was no way. Had to go down to the front desk and ask for a "manager". There must not be a manager there, because they do anything not to get one for you. We talked with many guests experiencing the same issues, and many comments on Trip Advisor state the same thing, so were prepared. Although they offered to switch us to the room we actually booked, with two double beds, we had to wait until the next day. Tuesday morning we saw many guests with their suitcases moving to new rooms and searching the room numbers. Since you can't even get over the lobby threshold without a bell boy grabbing your luggage, it is obvious we are all moving to "new" rooms. As yes, we all shared experiences as we walked the halls and traveled in the elevators. The food definitely needs to be evaluated. Food poisoning is unacceptable. The food that is supposed to be hot, is warm. The food that is supposed to be cold... isn't. The fact that the buffet room is virtually "empty" at dinner, is a sign that customers are eating elsewhere. The hotel was "over-booked"? Where were the guests??? And as a result, the food is not moving fast enough to stay fresh. I might suggest that a member of the staff sample the lunch or dinner buffet. At lunch, you can barely eat in the dining room, because the smell of the seaweed outside the wall is undesirable. They pile it there to ferment, until the dump-truck arrives to haul it away. At an all-inclusive, the food is a big part of the experience. Don't be fooled by "Caribbean seafood night" it consisted of unpeeled shrimp, tuna salad on tortilla crackers, and mystery "whitefish" being grilled "sauteed" while you wait. Or, you can have grilled Calamarii, which was really sauteed, while you wait. Oh, and cold mussels, which were sitting out for a bit, and were luke warm...eeek. The dining room buffet is not air conditioned. If you have more than 4 in your party, you will eat at banquet size tables in the kitchen at the Italian Restaurant., and be prepared to wait...and wait. But you are at least eating food cooked to order, and it is hot. The Mexican restaurant was o.k. But again, the food was at least hot. O.K., on to the food poisoning, My daughter had the chicken, and I had the steak Saturday night at the buffet. The steak and the chicken were cooked on the same grill together, side-by-side. Everyone in our party (we traveled with neighbors) ate something different. And we all had hamburgers at the grill for lunch, so it wasn't lunch. My daughter and I had a very difficult travel day on Sunday. We asked for a late check-out due to our sickness, because our airport shuttle was not due to pick us up until 2:50. I did not think I could sit in the heat without getting more sick. The front desk was not accommodating at all, telling my husband our room was "promised" to someone else, and we had to be out by 12:30. Thanks for caring!!! So I guess this is a "booking" cycle. I think they have a GREAT location (walking distance to 5th Avenue), despite the seaweed (and smell), and the sound of the bobcat hauling the seaweed away from the beach thru the day, so you cannot even hear the pool music, and the beach lined with sandbags, AND the FOOD POISONING!!!!... our experience just wasn't 5 stars. I'd give it a 2 or 3...at least it was CLEAN...as many of the other reviews state. I did call our Travel agent, and she was totally unaware of the seaweed, bobcat, sandbags, and room issues! Do your own research..this one is definitely a PASS...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Value and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MRB2598
Reviews.Content: Spent a week with 2 teenage girls in March and had a fabulous time in a very clean and comfortable resort just a block down from 5th ave and a perfect spot on the point of the beach with 2 ways walk for long beach walks. Really felt comfortable in a non secure resort with good food, very friendly staff (especially Rafael at the Mexican restaurant) and all of the staff at the front desk including Samanta and Ydalvy (not sure of spelling). Very glad we chose this place and would highly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not a 4.5 hotel!”
Reviews.Author: erin1973154943
Reviews.Content: The good: hotel was beautiful inside and very clean. Service in almost all areas of the hotel was excellent ( Philipe in the sushi bar is THE BEST!). The service at the buffet was hit and miss. The location was awesome.. only a 5 min walk to downtown Playa which was safe to walk at night. The quality of the buffet food was good although the selection was a bit limited. We didn't know until the end of our trip that you can make food requests directly to the kitchen ( ie pizza) so take this opportunity! The pools were nice but small. The shuttle to and from the hotel was excellent and prompt. Check in and out of the hotel was very easy and quick. Thank you to Julio the bell boy! Great service :) The bad: There is no beach! You must walk to either side of the hotel and you are not permitted to use the sister hotel's lounge chairs :(. The hotel does not enforce a 'towel rule' so many lounges at the hotel around the 2 pools were taken by 6 am.... and sometimes they were NEVER USED! This can create conflict amongst guests and does not make for a fair system. There were some guests that take up more than one chair, and other's that put down their towel only to leave for an excursion. The hotel needs to step in on this matter. The standard room was small and disappointing. The hotel wants you to upgrade at their cost! We requested a king bed and didn't get it. The toilet leaked our entire trip and we needed a towel on the floor for the full 7 days to catch the water. The night entertainment was lacking in creativity and energy. We made a full effort to leave the hotel at night to catch the nightlife in town. Most guests did the same. The friends we arrived with to the hotel required special services which should not have come with any fees or additional charges. They were charged for items to make the hotel wheel chair accessible which we thought was very poor customer service. This left us disappointed in the hotel and their lack of interest in promoting accessibly to all.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time!!!”
Reviews.Author: JHinman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! Our rooms were great and the shower you could fit 6 people in it at a time! The employees bend over backwards for you and are so nice! The food is good and the drinks just keep coming. Our son got married on the beach and there was 38 of us that came to the wedding. It was so professional and special for us! We all had a great time. It is also great that you can walk 2 blocks and there are lots of stores to shop! Contests at the pool daily, volleyball, walking the beach, entertainment at night, massages at the spa and on the beach. If you don't have a good time, it is your own fault! One of the employees really bend over backwards for us and that is Pablo. He is the pool & beach drink waiter. He was awesome!!!!! I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Twoelys
Reviews.Content: Just got back on March 27th from a week at the Gran Porto with my 21 year old daughter. Loved it. Very clean, good food, great staff. Loved Miguel down at the beach bar Trade Winds......so sweet. Liked that the restaurants didn't need prereservations.....could just walk in and get a table. The beach was a little rough right up by the water.......so families with small kids may have issues. We didn't mind a bit. Loved the pool area the the pool bar. Good mix of ages. GREAT location......2 blocks from all the shopping. I did hear some people complain that they got dark rooms but we got a junior suite.....not a lot more money but a very bright spacious room. Would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: squeezicks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to this resort with our 3 teenage boys. Everyone had an incredible time! The resort was immaculate at all times! Every single staff member went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable, and relaxing. Staff would always greet us with "Ola" every time they saw us, and always with a smile on their face. The food in the Albatros was ALWAYS delicious, and fresh! I am not a fan of buffets, but we ate here ever single meal, except for one. We loved it!! There was tons of variety, something for everyone! Frank was our favorite server in the Albatros :) Our room was beautiful, and we had a nice view of the water. I will say the bed was quite firm, but we slept great every night! The beach directly in front of the resort is not as nice as I hoped, but a short walk up the beach it was much nicer! The Bestday reps were extremely helpful with planning our excursions, and shopping was just a few steps away. Jose, the waiter at the pool was my favorite staff member, always had a fresh drink for us, and often brought us new things to try. The boys made fast friends with Eduardo the towel guy :) I would highly recommend this resort to anyone, and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Getaway Resort - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: KEHNCSU1988
Reviews.Content: Everyone is nice ... the pool wait staff ... David and Margarita are especially pleasant. Nightly local resort events - easy walk to Playa Del Carmen Clubs and bars Short walk to 5th Avenue shopping 24 Hr Snack barPlenty of Good food in Diners

Reviews.Title: “this is a hotel that have aktivitis for all ages.”
Reviews.Author: ann2113
Reviews.Content: perfect holyday for me and my son. there are a lot of aktivitis and thinks to see, shopping very god food, but if you choose you can just relax on the beach and look at the view. And the hotel have different show every evening that was very good

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but something needs to be done with the beach, it's washing into the ocean.”
Reviews.Author: Barry1951087
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at this resort for one week. The food was great, expecially the Italian resturant, and the staff were second to none in every way. Keep smiling ladies you're the best. Some of the folks I like to mention are, Anna, Miriam, Mary,Avila, Alejandro, and Sherly. There are more just can't remember the name now. 5th Av is a great shopping area, with some fine resturants, only a block from the resort. All in all it was great. Barry. Edmonton, Alberta, Canada Barry

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service with delicious food and a beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: Grause012
Reviews.Content: The second we stepped into the hotel the service was wonderful. After having a slight mix-up with our room situation the staff pleasantly did everything the could to make us happy. The entertainment group including Alejandro, Armando, Carina, Miguel and Victor were amazing. They made everyone feel welcome and had great sense of humor. If we had been traveling with small children i know there would have been plenty for them to do and i would feel more than comfortable leaving them with any of the staff. the servers and bartenders were also amazing. i enjoyed sitting in the lobby bar because Avila recognized his guests and made sure that everyone was taken care like royalty. If this hotel had nothing else going for it i would still stay there again because of the service. However, this hotel was beautiful, had comfortable beds and had delicious food. the Mexican restaurant that we could visit was delicious and Domingo made us have a great experience that none of of will forget. There was also a wonderful Italian restaurant and the chef made a personal visit to our table to make sure everything was up to his outrageous standards. This hotel is located right on the beach but also right in the center of town so you can experience the city as well ocean views. This experience was once in a lifetime and I hope to go back to this fantastic establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: gibbo12
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to go to mexico and thought cancun was to obvious. I checked trip advisor on playa del Carmen and the reviews on this hotel. Here is what I thought. We arrived on the Tuesday afternoon,reception were quick to sort our room and offered us the upgrade for the room. We stuck with the standard room. When we got to the room we were very disappointed, it was small dark and had no private balcony. We unpacked but felt unhappy. We slept in it the first night but found next morning we had to change. We spoke to the rep who came back and said yes they will change. They offered us a room the same. We stuck firm and got room 426 standard but much bigger with a balcony. After that all I can say is amazing. Our anniversary was on the 17th and we went to the italian, fantastic meal. The albatross restaurant is very good the service everywhere was amazing the bar staff brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at a Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: thistledoc
Reviews.Content: Travelled recently to Playa with 2 families including 5 teenagers. Fisrt time for us in Mexico and at an all-inclusive. Thrilled with the resort location/comfort and cleanliness. People were cleaning around the clock and staff were always friendly. Loved being able to wander over to the 5 Avenue atmosphere 1 block away yet have access to the beach within 1 minute. Beautiful beach and pool area. Food was beautifully presented, varied and tasty. Room was quiet/comfortable/roomy and had a phenomenal view down the beach.(Oceanfront Junior Suite). Especial note of staff Ismael and Jaime in Albatros for their service abd friendliness. Aquasize in the pool at noon each day was fun and invigorating. Only negatives were the lower quality shows in the evening(amateurish/some technical issues) and the lack of more choices for a la carte dining( although we were very happy with the 2 choices we had-went to each restaurant twice). Very hapy overall with the all-inclusive choices and could not be happier with the resort itself.

Reviews.Title: “Muy Bueno!”
Reviews.Author: aries416
Reviews.Content: We just retruned from this trip last night. I traveled with my 15 year old daughter, we had a great time! If I had to choose one thing that stands out about The Gran Porto Real it's their friendly staff. They are so nice & always think to ask you if you would like something to make you more comfortable, such as a drink (we stayed all inclusive so they aren't making extra money), or put your umbrella up, etc.. there were all different types of people staying there, families, couples, both young and older, single folks like me with their teen(s). Overall the food is good, with many different choices at the Albatross which is the main dining area serving buffet meal; breakfast, lunch & dinner (theme dinner each night). El Pescatore is probably the best of them but expect to wait 30 min for a table if you arrive after 7:00pm The location is very good as it's only one block to the center of town which has many restaurants & shops. Disappointments; the beach, the water was too rough for swimming or sports. We did stay for 6 days and it was consistanlty rough. if you want a spot by the pool you better be a rooster because the chairs are gone by 6:00AM (5:20 am on my last day)! The towels get to enjoy the morning sun while the owners go back to their rooms for 5 hours. This is the one fault of the resort, they should enforce first come first serve with a person actually occupying the chair. there are plenty of beach chairs if you like the sand...and plenty of cabanas for shade.... on the side < I highly recommend the Coba excusrion with zip line, Myan village and more, an awesome day!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: denkris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from March 21-28 and absolutely loved it. We were expecting an hour long ride from airport to hotel, but it was really only 35 minutes. Upon checkin, they did offer us an upgrade to an oceanfront room (we booked an oceanview JS), even offering us a chance to check out the two rooms first, but once we said we weren't upgrading, they didn't push. Everything from that point was awesome. Any one who wrote a negative comment about this hotel must have gone looking for all the negtative, and be EXTREMELY hard people to please. The food was great. We ate at the buffet for all but 4 meals (3 were had on a day-long trip to Ek Balam and one was at the Italian restaurant) and there was always lots to choose from. My favorites were the pasta and carving stations. As for lounge chairs near the pool or beach, it was always much easier to find good chairs by the beach. There isnt much of a beach, and there is a lot of sandbags, but you can still go in the water. Lots of beach on either side of the hotel to walk or put down towels. The service at the main pools bar was sometimes slow, but that's because they would be making drinks for the people on the beach. The most we waited for drinks was 3 minutes. So not a big deal at all! The room we had was 240. Yes, the "Oceanview" rooms are only oceanview if you look to the right off your balcony, but we were close enough to the end where we actually had a pretty good view unobstructed by trees. Our fridge was always stocked with extra water and cervezas. The bathrooms are massive. I'd like to have that shower in my own house. The cleaning times were pretty random, but we found that if we requested room cleaning it got done much quicker than not. As for the location, it really doesn't get much better. Being that close to 5th was awesome, and we felt safe all the time, even at night. The only "bad" part of staying there was during our trip to Ek Balam (or chichen itza)... We were the first ones picked up (at 7:10am) and the last ones dropped off (at 8:30pm). If you don't mind sitting on a bus for a majority of your day, then go the group route for excursions. If you don't, check prices on cabs and entry fees at the destination and maybe do that. Then you get all the time you want to tour and won't be shuffled all over with a bunch of people. I will say, that seeing the ruins was definitely worth all the time on the bus, just we would do it differently next time. The only reason we wanted to leave the hotel was because our 15 month old daughter was at home waiting for us. We will definitely go back to the GPR.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice!”
Reviews.Author: HatSlam
