Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple searched for weeks to find just the right place to go in Mexico. After looking at MANY different resorts, we ended up choosing the Gran Porto Real. I'm so thankful we did! The resort is amazing. From the time you walk into the lobby until the time you leave, you are treated with the utmost service! The staff makes the resort that much more enjoyable. From Ismael showing you tricks using a toothpick and forks, to Jose at the swim-up bar bringing you drinks without you even getting out of your sun chair, the staff is fantastic! We were all there for a lot of R&R and that's what we did. It was so nice not to have to worry about going to dinner at a certain time, since no reservations were needed. The restaurants were exceptional! If you want to really feel relaxed, get a massage at the spa! It was the perfect way to start the day! We signed up for a snorkeling trip through Lomas Travel by the front desk. That was definately one of the many highlights of the trip. Not too far away, awesome fish to see, and a great beach to hang out on until it was time to go back to the resort. Both of us couples stayed in the Junior Suites. They were very spacious, clean and even though not oceanfront, still worth every penny. Besides, with the perfect weather down there, you're not in your room that much! I was a little concerned about walking around 5th Avenue at night, but one trip there and I changed my mind. At no point during our stay did we not feel safe. 5th Avenue is a great place to go and people watch and have a few drinks, not to mention the great shopping. We were there for 5 nights/6days and were so extremely sad to leave. We have all vowed to stay longer next time! So thank you to the entire staff at the Gran Porto Real! You made our vacation exactly the way we hoped it would be! We look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Staff made this vacation maravilloso!”
Reviews.Author: karenk2011
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel really stand out - friendly waiters, great sense of humor and always treated with attention. The waiters - Rutillio, Ismael, Antonio, Mora, Frank and all the others were so good to talk to and very accomodating. The Mayan coffees prepared at each table was awesome! Our room was ocean front and I loved the fabulous view.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was fantastic in every way!”
Reviews.Author: goatladieblue
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this resort was wonderful. The staff was pleasant,helpful and attentive. We had no negative experiences from the moment we arrived through our time to leave. I wish I could walk through a door and be there right now. This was a true vacation! Thanks to everyone at the Grand Porto Real Resort! Gabriel who was among the first people we met and the last to see as we left was especially gracious. Everyone was great.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royality from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: cbahr7511
Reviews.Content: We had planned a destination wedding at this resort and 23 of our friends and family attended as well. They treated us like royality the entire time. Everyone was so kind and always made sure we were taken care of. The resort was being cleaned 24 hours a day and sparkeled. The food was excelent! They had a lot of choices that accomidated large groups and small groups of people. Room service was delicious as well. My only small complaint would be the beds were too firm for my liking but it is not enough to keep me away. The ocean was perfect and the pool side waiters were perfect as well. The wedding went off without a hitch! Every detail was perfect and they spoiled us rotten!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KarenAnn83
Reviews.Content: Staff was very pleasant, rooms were big and comfortable, beach and pool were excellent, closeness to shopping district was nice, food was very good

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: kashleedoll
Reviews.Content: We upgraded from the Real Beach Club resort right in town on 5th ave up to the Gran Porto hotel when we checked in. The Real Beach club was a little small and far away from the beach. The Gran Porto was quite the upgrade indeed and we checked into a junior suite. The suite was very large and we liked the individuality of the bathroom. The in room bar was a little scary with off brand cheapo booze, but come on, how many drinks were we really going to make for ourselves?! When tipped, the maids make fantastic towel animal art :) The staff here is great. You read so many reviews about how good they are and its all true. They remembver who you are, your drinks, and even your names! Our favorite bartenders were the guys at the beach bar, always smiling and being great servers! Also the beach runners/waitresses always remembered my name, and my drinks. I tipped 20 pesos for 2 drinks most of the time. Its pretty fair to take about $100 on the one week vacation with you and use it as tipping money. These folks dont get paid a ton, you keep it in the country and not giving to rich hotel owners, and they are out working in the heat all day to make your vacation! ALso a good tip for booze is. if you ASK for the brand name they will give it to you.. if you dont ask.. you get local cheap stuff. No problem! We ate at the buffet and the a la cartes a few times, but we mostly just went into town! Resort food is resort food. Its always lack lustre. Its edible, and does the trick, but it wont overwhlem you with its flavor. The best restaurant for us was the Italian 'Il Pescatore' and we had the priviledge of having Luis and Gustavo as our servers. They were amazingly funny and great hosts all around! If you are craving something a little more healthy and a little less buffet-grease... just head to the 3rd floor where there is a smaller non crowded pool, hammocks, and a sushi bar. The sushi is actually really good and we snacked on it almost every day guilt free. With so much to do in town we sure wandered up and down the streets as its very safe and cosmopolitan. Tons of shops (both high end and low end) are all up and down the strip as well as on the side streets. Many different types of cuisine can be sampled on 5th as well. The best restaurant for us wasnt to far down 5th from the hotel. Its name is ' Los Tulipanes' and our waiter both nights was Fernando. He remembered us when we came back and gave us not only the best meals, wine recommendations, but also the best service of the week. I would check out this place for sure! For desert, check out the gelato shops... its lower in fat than icecream and the Hagen Daas and Ben n Jerry stores are VERY expensive considering where you are! The beach right infront of the hotel has some rocks and sandbags, but fret not my friends, just simply walk down the sand in either direction and you have much softer entryways to the beach. You can walk all the way down the beach to the ferry if you wish, seeing many bars and condos on the way that you may patron. Take the ferry to Cozumel just not on Sunday.. eerything closes very early if open at all and there is some great shoping over there as well. We did the runis tour in Tulum and the beach there was fantastic if you like big waves to play in. The ruins were of homesteads as opposed to pyramid style but had some great history and they were close by to the hotel. The other tour we did was Rio Secreto! AMAZING!!! unlike anything you will ever see! The tour guide Andrea is so excited to give the tours! Warnings: DONT go on a tour of the royal if asked.. its a time share presentation and NOT worth it.. it will eat up your monring and they send you through 5 different closers before they let you leave. YIKES! We got a $50 gift card for the gift shop out of it , but in retrospect not worth it. Also this hotel does not have a disco. Some poeple want that, so if you do, there is not one on the property. (however you ARE right in town) In a nut shell, good resort for its proximity to the beach (some room OPEN onto sand), righ tin town, great staff, and a pretty fun vibe. We fell in love with the city of Playa Del Carmen

Reviews.Title: “It just keep getting BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: markcarlson
Reviews.Content: We have been to several ALL-INCLUSIVE RESORTS in our travels to Mexico over the years however I do believe that the Gran Porta Real Resort and Spa was one of the BEST if not THE BEST resrort that we have stayed at. The people there were FANTASTIC! Everyone went out of their way to make us feel like we were the only people there. We met several of the staff that we now consider family! David Carche (our bar tender) was the best in fact he and his family had us over to his home for a lunch that his wife, mother in-law and neighbor had made for us ... needless to say it was a big highlight of trip and we still talk about it. Carolina's beautifule smile everytime you saw her was a blast of sunshine, The restaurant that were included in our package were great, the food and service were beyond compare, Mario in the Mexican restaurant made sure that everytime we joined them for dinner that it was a new dining experience, The Buffet was remarketable place to dine as well as the food was better then most restaurants that I have been in and Ivan, Osmar and Sherly also became FAMILY as they took very good care of us. If you can find any fault with your stay at the GRAN PORTA REAL RESORT and SPA then you will find a problem with anything you do and you need to change your life. CLEAN, FRIENDLY and in the perfect location for your vacation needs. The rooms wer fantastic as was the views from our rooms, we took our Sister and Brother-inlaw with us for their first trip to Mexico and they were more then impressed with the Gran Porta Real ..... When I return I will only consider the Gran Porta Real for my resort visit, the only thing that I will change is my airline carrier as DELTA sucks (problems getting there and problems getting back)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service - we enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: CeeJay073
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed this resort. The service everywhere was fantastic! We have stayed in about 7 different resorts in the Playa del Carmen area over the last 5 years and this place had the best overall service of any of the resorts we've stayed at. Everyone was amazing and GENUINE: the bellboys, concierges, maids, front desk clerks, bartenders, servers, chefs, etc. It really made our stay comfortable. The beach wasn't fantastic for swimming but we just like to lie in the sun and have drinks so it was wonderful for us. The grounds were really kept up, the pool was clean and beautiful and the eating options were great. You could choose from very casual to very elegant for dinner and for lunch you could have a more formal buffet or have great, but casual, lunch at the beach. The rooms were nice. I had heard a few people complaining about having small rooms with terrible views but our room was fine. We had a view of the road, but we could sit on our balcony and see the ocean at the end of the street. It was charming. The rooms are not "modern" and they do seem a little dated, but not in a bad way, almost more rustic. Our room was clean, big, had a flat screen TV and a stocked fridge and a liquor dispenser. The bathroom and walk-in, step-down shower were huge, again a little dated, but not nice. The hotel also has an adult’s pool up on the 3rd floor and hot tub way up above the hotel that overlooked the ocean. It was nothing fancy but something different. The night life was lacking and the shows were okay but it is a half of a block from the main entertainment street in Playa so you could go there, although it will cost you beyond the all-inclusive. Upon check out Samantha was very helpful and ended our trip on the right note. We definitely want to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip was wonderful no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Sun_11
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I(daughter) had a wonderful relaxing two weeks at the Gran Porto Real. It was a sun beach vacation along with visiting some friends we had made over the years of holidays that live in Playa. This was our second stay at this hotel as we really liked all it had to offer before and its great location. We had excellent beach service from Pablo one of our beach waiters - always checking to see if you wanted a drink and also Migel our bartender at the beach bar. One morning it was a bit quieter and Migel remembered what we usually drank and brought us our two drinks with out even asking.. WOW that was great. I can't imagine how he remembered waiting on so many people each day. We also had another great beach server when we sat closer to the pool area Jesu. All the employees are just wonderful and so friendly. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, THE BEST STAFF, and very clean”
Reviews.Author: witch1
Reviews.Content: There were six of us that stayed at the GPR for 8 delightful nights. 2 Gran Master Suites and 1 Jr Family Suite. All of the rooms were perfect. The maids were very timely and left a new towel scupture and flowers daily. My husband and I have been visiting Mexico 1 to 2 times a year for the past 8 years now. I can truely say that we have never stayed at a resort where ALL of the staff is so attentive. Every staff person that walked by us said hello and had a smile on there face. Our staff at the buffet JUAN CAVICH, Amabiael, and Eleazar made the stay even better. Although the buffet got a little boring, we still wanted to go to dinner there because these guys made it fun. Juan was the BEST. The location is great because you are only one block off of 5th Avenue to do shopping. As other reviews state the beach directly in front of the resort is not so great for swimming. If you walk to either side of the resort the beach/swimming is much better. As stated we stayed in the master suites so we had access to the Royal Playa right next door. That is much more upscale which didn't really appeal to us. We ate there 1 night and the food seemed to be better, but like I said we really missed our waiters from the Buffet. We also tryed the Mexican and the Italian restaurants and both were good. Over all this is one of the nicest vacations we have been on.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Yet”
Reviews.Author: gallrl
Reviews.Content: I, along with 13 of my friends spend an amazing 5 days at this resort. The staff was beyond amazing. The Italian restaurant and Mexican restaurants had wonderful food, and very efficient staff. I have never had such a great vacation before. The rooms are amazing and cleaned to perfection. The pool area and beach was pure bliss and the pool-side service was crucial. I would like to list a few extra-ordinary staff members: jordi: Best waiter at the mexican restaurant. freddy- host at buffet jose: pool side bar. He was beyond excellent. margarita: waitress- so accommodating, alexis: pool lifeguard. teresa: Beach waitress. She helped us so much and took the time to be extra nice and have a smile on her face. Thank you all so much for an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: jskirb
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great trip at this resort. I traveled with a group of friends for our college spring break and we are so happy we chose this destination. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was so nice! The resort is great for families, couples and friends! If you go look out for these staff members, they were amazing! Addie Jordi Freddy Jose Jesus Erick Samantha Margarita Ana Anacona Alexis Alejandra Reprecce Teresa David Lorenzo Naum The staff was really great!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Wendy G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Porto March 8-20, 2011. The resort was lovely. Our room was nice and perfectly located. Not much for late night entertainment but that is what 5th Ave is for. Breakfasts were the best meal of the day, especially with Ivan as our server! He's the best make sure you get a table in his section. The food was all good but found it got a bit repetative after two weeks. We started our holiday at the Real but quickly upgraded. Really poor food, no hot water and miles from the beach! The staff were very helpful, but just not what we wanted for a holiday. The quiet pool at Grand Porto had Filipe bartending and he was the best! He had my fav drink ready before I got down the stairs! Oh how I miss his Rum Punch! All in all was a great holiday! Lovely resort & great weather make for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “I have never stayed anywhere with a staff that is this friendly and willing to help”
Reviews.Author: snookie514
Reviews.Content: I just got back from one of the best vacations I have ever been on. I traveled with 13 of my sorority sisters from the University of Georgia, and all of us has an extraordinary time at the Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa. I wanted to give a shout out to some of the best resort staff that I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. jordi freddy- host at buffet!!!!!! jose jesus- pool side bar erick samantha- from the front desk!!!!! soooo helpful margarita- waitress ana anacona- pool side bar David- pool side bar alexis alejandra reprecce teresa david lorenzo naum Addie

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations for a relaxing and much needed vacation.”
Reviews.Author: JimandStacyL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in need of a getaway this spring and started looking at All Inclusive's in the Carribean. We got a great deal on a week at the Gran Porto Real and booked the trip. We had an awesome week and will for sure make a point to go back to the Riveria Maya and also the Gran Porto Real. The hospitality from all of the people at the hotel and restaurants was amazing. The location is also perfect fit. It is just a block away from 5th Avenue, yet you don't feel like you are crowded by tourists. Although my wife and I went without the kids, we could tell that this hotel was a great place for a family vacation. Obviously we went during the spring break season, but PDC didn't seem to have any of the college aged, frat party atmoshere which was refreshing. The best part of each day for my wife and I was the time in the sun on the beach. The Can brothers (Jesus and Pablo) quickly would pick up on what your specific drink of the day would be and somehow would find a way to have your next beverage to you by the time you finished your last. Miguel was also the best bartender at the hotel and was always quick and efficient. At first the food seemed to be very spotty from looking at some of the buffet areas. But the menu and preparation at the Mexican and Italian restaurants was 1st class and very appetizing and the ala carte entree's at the Albatross (Buffet) were always well done. I learned to stay away from anything that wasn't made fresh and the food always delivered for me. The only negative thing about this hotel was the swimming area on the beach. There are quite a few areas of washout from the tides and many rocks and sandbags to negotiate. The beach was still very good for relaxing and getting sun though. It was also very easy to walk a bit down the beach on either side of the hotel and there was more than enough areas to swim in the ocean. They also stuck us in the worst suite in the building upon arrival, but that was easily fixed by switching to another suite (Without Upgrading) and this was a much better room. All in all I would highly recommend the Gran Porto Real for your next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE IT HERE!”
Reviews.Author: papekind
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Gran Porto Real. We absolutely love it here. The staff is wonderful. We are already planning our stay for 2012. Pablo and Jesus, beach waiters are the best! Pablo remembered us from 2010 when we were there. The food is great especially the Italian restaurant. If you are up for a massage this is the place to do it. The couples massage is fantastic! The location is perfect, you can pretty much walk to anywhere you wanna go. Famous 5th Ave. is very close for those that want to venture out on the town. We highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Our Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAnn25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real and had the best time ever! The hotel staff was very friendly, accommodating and attentive to us from beginning to end. The property is beautiful! My husband and I and our 14 yr old son stayed in an ocean view junior suite and the room was very comfortable. They have many activities that you can participate in throughout the day, something for everyone. The food was excellent, even for our very picky son. The restaurants were very clean. The whole place was very clean. We were a short distance from 5th avenue and enjoyed lots of shopping and people watching there. We felt very safe! We had a blast out at the pool. Teresa, Victor and Chicken were AWESOME! We will definitely go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and just beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: canadian077Manitoba
Reviews.Content: Our experience was great. The location is great, as it is so close to the beach, and 5th ave. We had a wonderful ocean view room, with a king bed, over looking the main street with the Royal across from us. We were on the third floor, wonderful breezes, and really enjoyed having a balcony to spend time on. We spent most afternoons at the swim up bar, shady, and the bartender made the best drinks ever. All bartenders and waitresses/waiters were great. The food at the buffets got tiresome by the end. I had trouble with getting sick, which wasn't a pleasant way to spend half of my holiday. Our favorite restaurant was the Italian. The Mexican one was ok, but wished there had been entertainment. The housekeeping, check in and all other staff were wonderful. They really enjoyed their jobs and strived to make things right for all travellers. I thank you. We loved the spot and will recommend it to others who want a really relaxing holiday. The hotel rooms were so quiet, we were never disturbed by people or outside noises. Our room was very large and the air conditioning worked perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Was a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: kanatalovetotravel
Reviews.Content: The resort was welcoming and wonderful the minute we got in. They quickly offered us refreshments after arriving late - our check in was painless, although they did offer us an upgrade - but wasn't pushed on us. We were shown our rooms (Jr. Suites - totally worth the price - nice and large) - the rooms were spotless, and air conditioning was wonderful. We had a lovely balcony that had a view of the ocean. Food and staff always kind and totally at your beck and call. We would go to get things ourselves and they'd beat us to it most of the time. At breakfast there were times when things were forgotten - but not big deal - we just got up and got it ourselves. The staff was amazing. We enjoyed both restaurants and the buffet but the Italian resturant was our favorite - We tried Havana coffee while we were there at the Mexican/Steak restaurant - They were wonderfully entertaining while they made it - You really should at least try them. The beach was just literally out our door. Although there were sandbags under parts of the beach (due to storms and errosion) - if you walked just a little ways down the beach was lovely for walks. Bring water shoes though- the coral and stones can be rough on the feet when in the water - not really bad anywhere - but a very good precaution. Town was literally out the front door. So much to see and do - worth the walk - look for hidden art stores in what you think is a store alley - but it's actually a court yard - and it has new shops. Some of the vendors are a little pushy - but most of them are just friendly - give a bit of an effort to get you into the stores - but if you say no- they smile and just keep on with their conversations! People in Playa were very warm and friendly. We loved Mexico - the trip was amazing - the resort was small enough you could walk it easily - there were two pools (one very kid friendly one with arts centre) and an adult one. The entire resort was very kid friendly with their kids zone. You could get food in their 24 hour cafe - which also provided soft drinks, and other drinks 24 hours a day. Bar staff - amazing both in the hotel and on the beach. Great place to go for a vacation........ cheers

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jesrob
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our wonderful 11 day stay at this hotel. Would highly recommend to anyone that enjoys great food, great service and great facilities. Claudia at the front desk always helpful - even to assisting in getting our "special room"; Freddy the concierge could always be counted on to provide excellent service and assistance; Pablo and Jesus on the beach always smiling even at the end of a long day, both remembered our favorite drinks and kept us well supplied; all the wait staff in all of the restaurants were extremely friendly and efficient. The rooms were immaculate and afforded spectacular views. The hotel is located close to 5th Ave which a wonderful place to wander after dinner or shopping throughout the day. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “2 Weeks of Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Studtmanns
Reviews.Content: We loved the aspect of the 2 restaurants on the resort, Maria's & Il Pescatore, not having a reservation required. Walking in when we want was fabulous, and the food and service were excellent! It was also very nice to have room service included in our all-inclusive package on those days when you didn't want to leave the room. Being downtown Playa Del Carmen was also nice for seeing the night life and local shops. We also really enjoyed Pablo & Jesus, the two beach waiters we had the 2 weeks we were there. They were very friendly and had great memories of what your drink of choice was.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL VERY NOISEY AND NEEDS AN UPGRADE, BUT STAFF FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirelass2010
Reviews.Content: First stayed in this hotel Jan 2007, and again March 2011, On the first stay the Thompsons brochure stated all rooms have a balcony and sea view, 2 weeks before departure, travel agent rang to say that room no longer available but could have a refund, at that late date we could not book another holiday for the dates we required. On arrival the room was very basic with a shower that did not work and two single beds overlooking the dustbins, no balcony or sitting area, one very small window in all the room, dark depressing place, we could only stand one night in here, next day upgraded to a junior suite with ocean view at extra cost. Beach was nice staff helpfull. Went back with friends March 2011 the hotel has gone downhill, beach has got smaller, covered in smelly seaweed. On arrival the Junior Suite rooms with sea views ocean front, that we understood we had booked with travel agent, were not what the hotel had us down for, and if we wanted them, then we had to pay an upgrade several hundreds of dollars extra per person, per week. Girl on reception not very helpful. Explained that we had simular problem a few years ago, did not expect this again. We were sent to the sister hotel next door for 2 nights as rooms not ready, the Royal is a far superior hotel and we wpuld have liked to stay there but cost too prohibative. We had paid for junior suites, at Grand Purto Real Hotel, but they say not ocean front. So took juinor suite, ended up with no view. Had 4 rooms before decided to put up with it. First room was near to the kitchens, the noise from the extractor fans from the kitchen was a continuous drone, plus building works, concreate breaker hammers all day, could not sleep day or night. No view at all internal rooms looking at other rooms. Asked for a room change, again they tried to push upgrade for more money. Moved to ground floor 11#, very noisey, overlooking the road, kids screaming and running about in the hotel, trolleys for cleaners ratteling up and down at all hours. Room was for disabled, so wc raised up, on make shift concreate block covered in floor tiles, but a lot bigger than the base of the wc, so it stuck out and when you went to the wc you knocked your toes up on it. Could not get a good nights sleep. Asked for a room change, got another seemed okay, again over looking the road but level 2, before un packing noticed a foul odour of sewer drains. Spoke to reception, they sent a cleaner, she put bleech down the sink, wc and shower, this made no differance, it was not a cleaning problem it was the drains. Complained again, they sent cleaner with a supervisor who put disinfectant down the sink, wc, and shower, and threw bleach all over bedroom floor, and said it was now okay. It made no differance, we asked for maintaninence to find drain problem, they looked and took shower trap off, nothing there, took ceiling vent out and sprayed it with disinfectant and said it was fixed. We could not put up with the smell and sent for them again, they said that we should leave air conditioning FULL and then we would not smell it. We could not put up with the smell so asked to speak to the manager, he offered us another room but said they were fully booked and had to take what ever they had. Gave us one over the front entrance next to the lift shaft, but decided to put up with the noise of the busses and lift as we had spent the first week packing and un packing changing room. The food was okay, but all spicey and sauces, no simple plain food. The quality of the food has gone down from a few years ago, the Italian resturant menue never gets changed. And you have to wait 30 - 60 minutes to get in. The mexican resturauunt was very poor service they take your order and nothing happens for an hour. Bar Staff at hotel very helpful, but not many international drinks, served mainly in plastic tumblers, there is always a shortage of glasses, desert and soup spoons as well. The furniture in the lounge is broken, very worn and in desperate need of replacement, in fact the whole hotel needs refurbishing. The public toilets are VERY SMALL, you struggle to get in them and they quite often do not work, will not flush. Magic eye hand wash basins in public areas, again some do not work, you can report these as broken, but no one does anything about it. My friend found a massive cockroach in her bed. Very noisey in March its the Americans break, young teanagers come down to get drunk as they are not allowed to drink until they are 21 years old in America, so they come down here in big groups to get drunk and run around the hotel all night and early morning shouting and screaming and it echos on the corridors. Staff do nothing about asking them to keep quite. Best thing about this hotel is the location, there are plenty of sun beds and drinks deliverd to the beach. Trips available in the hotel in mini buses max 12 persons. They are better that the ones supplied by the Thompson rep who's trips are on a 56 seater, it takes 2 hours to pick up all customers before you even set off on trip and another 2 hours to drop them off, adds 4 hours to your day. The nightlife / shows at the hotel are very poor. This hotel is not as good as 5 star hotel's we have been in before, we think it would be rated a 3*+ to max 4* Flight time about 12 hours, plus transfer times, the upgrade in flight is worth the additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “GRAN PORTO REAL RESORT & SPA ~ A VERY RARE MAYAN RIVIERA GEM”
Reviews.Author: BurlingtonChica
Reviews.Content: “Beyond Expectations” ~ “Expect the Exceptional” ~ these words have never had so much meaning except when describing the Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa, and everyone who makes this incredible Resort so very special. There are not enough words to describe the amazing Team who make up the Gran Portal Real Family. From the Airport pick up by “Best Day”, the arrival at the GPR Reception, to the end of your stay; every aspect imaginable to create a vacation of a lifetime will be accomplished by the amazing Gran Porto Real Family. This incredible Team of very sincere, talented, caring and devoted individuals goes above and beyond in every aspect and detail of this Resort. All of the very special people who make up this exceptional Team ensures that your visit is in fact “Beyond your Expectations”. They accomplish this mission with amazing smiles that would brighten any rainy day, but most of all their care and concern for all guests comes from the bottom of their hearts, and this shows in every aspect of this Resort. My Mom and I have been so very privileged and lucky to have visited this amazing Resort 4 times, and each time our stay has been PERFECT. I do not know how you can prefect perfect, but the Gran Porto Real Team does. The service, food preparation & presentation, the entertainment and cleanliness is exceptional and yes PERFECT in every way. Don Fernando and Dona Lynn, a very special thank you to the both of you for creating such a beautiful and exceptional Resort that we are so very proud to call our home away from home. We are also so very honored to include and call everyone in the GPR Team our family. The Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa is a 5 Star/5 Diamond Resort; however, this exceptional group of individuals are a “10 Diamond” Team. From Reception/Bellboys, Chefs, Bartenders, Waiters/Waitresses to the very special people who take such pride in making this Resort so very clean and beautiful together they make a perfect Team, which is the Gran Porto Real Family. From the bottom of our hearts a very, very special and sincere thank you to the following amazing individuals in our GPR family: Ciro, Cruz, Eduardo, Pedro, Omar, Sanna, Freddy, Tilo, Julio, Aaron, Yendaly, Jordi, Laura, Enrique y Jose Luis. Your hard work, care and concern certainly does not go unnoticed. From the amazing Spa Azul ~ Sergio y Magna, and all of the Spa personnel. What a great way to either begin or end a fabulous vacation. A special thank you to Victor and the amazing Dive Team, your knowledge and patience was greatly appreciated. Victor, we enjoyed speaking and spending time with you discussing your interests and the beautiful Mayan culture. The very creative and talented Chefs: Chef Rene, Chef Benjamin, and Chef Jorge ~ all of the GPR Chefs are included in this heartfelt thank you!!! A special thank you to the very interesting and knowledgeable Sommelier, Alonso ~ he is so knowledgeable regarding the different types of wines available at the GPR. It is very apparent when speaking with Alonso he is very passionate about his background. The most amazing and hardest working Bartenders and Wait Staff who ensure your days and evenings are very well looked after and their service is definitely “10 Diamond”: Miguel Luna (Tradewinds Swing Bar), David Ancona (Comedian), David, Lorenzo Avila, Alejandro (Alex), Hector, Ivan, Rodrigo, Jose, Aurelio, Marco (Marcos), Hiram, Teresa, Jesus, Pablo, Jose, Mirian, Margahrita (Mari), Elizabeth, Cecilia, Ana, Carolina y Rebeca. From the outstanding Albatros Restaurant ~ La Señora who makes the most amazing omelets, Rodrigo, May, Verlain, Florenzio, Ivan, Mora, Lorenzo, Huber and all of the wonderful Chefs ~ all of the staff are exceptional, I am very sorry if I have missed mentioning anyone. From the amazing Mexican Restaurant ~ Marie’s ~ the wonderful Chefs ~ waiters Salvador y Domingo. All of the staff are exceptional. A very special thank you to our friend Elias who makes the most amazing Mayan coffees and made sure that we wanted for nothing. All of the individuals at Marie’s ensure that your visit is memorable. IL Pescatore Italian Restaurant ~ the wonderful Chefs ~ waiters Jose, Mateo, Amador, Pepe, Daniel, Domi and everyone who ensured our visits were very welcomed and memorable. This Restaurant and the people are exceptional in every way. A very, very special thank you to Miguel Lopez, Edgar, Francisco, Samuel and the Room Service Team, Elizar, Freddy, Erick, Shirly, Manuel, Virigina, Rodrigo and Delia. A very heartfelt thank you to the most amazing Sports & Entertainment Team who ensure that your days and nights are filled with a lot of fun and wonderful memories. All of the evening shows are incredible and a must see; countless hours goes into preparing these Vegas type shows. Mil abrazos ~ Miguel Morales, Victor (Chicken), Cesar, Karina, Alejandro, Rodrigo, Jesus, Eloisas, Nelly and the wonderful Kids Club Team. Last but certainly not least, an extra special and heartfelt thank you to the amazing individuals who keep us so very safe and they are the Lifeguards and Security Team ~ Rogelio, Alexis, Millan, Rafael, Manu, Javier, Miguel, Victor Manuel and the entire Security Team. A little reminder, all of these amazing individuals work extremely hard to ensure that all tourists have the vacation of a lifetime….so please remember to tip these incredible individuals who actually make your vacation so memorable. Also, please take the time to say Hola and smile….it costs nothing and is a joy to receive. I would also like to take this opportunity to thank all of the Mexican people who so willingly and graciously open their arms and hearts to all tourists from around the world to experience and enjoy one of the most beautiful cultures and countries in the world, which is MÉXICO. Again, I am very sorry if I have excluded mentioning anyone, it was not intentional. Mi Familia Gran Porto Real para siempre en mi corazon. GRACIAS TANTO CON TODA SINCERIDAD, MIL ABRAZOS, LE VEN PRONTO. PIÉRDALOS TANTO!!!! Laura y Mama Lynda.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Kris098
Reviews.Content: Fun activities for all throughout the day and great options to explore the nightlife. Staff was very friendly and there to help with anything. Could have a few more restaurant choices but food was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Gallant45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from February 26 for 1 week and we had an excellent stay. The service is exceptional, the variety of food at buffet exceeded most other resort we have stayed in the past. Dinner at à la carte was also of good quality, twice at the Italian restaurant and once at the Mexican. Either you are at the beach or the pools the bar services is next to nothing, always ready to get you more. Brothers Pablo & Jesus are always ready to serve you. There is no shortage of beach chair and sand is at it's best, water temperature is nice but several rocks in front of resort making it hard to walk around in water. We really appreciate the easy access to the shopping on 5th Avenue, 2 minutes walk and your there. We would not hesitate to go back. Tks Gran Porto Real

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE WENT OUT OF THEIR WAY TO PROVIDE GREAT TRIP”
Reviews.Author: tomnblanca
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were excellent!! They made our stay so pleasureable and enjoyable. Thy catered to our every wish. Lorenzo at the bar was so nice he found out my wife Blanca loves spicy things and the next day he brought special spicy ingredients for her drinks and made special drinks just for her. He and Brandy were great always there telling jokes and making sure we were taken care of in everyway. Ventura was a great guy arranged a special romantic dinner by the pool for us. Was very special time and all done without even asking. Chef Jorge and Alex prepared and served a special menu. The food was excellent. The hotel was clean and nice. Unforetunately cannot remember the housekeepers name but she did a great job. My wife likes things a certain way and just said one thing to her and everyday things were perfect. Waitstaff was great too every morning they would have thins ready for us as soon as they saw us. We had such a great time and they made us so happy and cared for. I have never felt so well taken care by hotel staff. The best thing about it was that it was done because they are genuinely nice people and did things from their heart not for tips or because someone told them to do it. We cannot wait to return and I have already planned a surprise anniversary trip for my wife. sorry the review is late but i am sure the hotel and servce is still excellent

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good”
Reviews.Author: sunseekerinVT
Reviews.Content: My husband i took our 5th trip to mexico, just returned on 3/12. We stayed at the Gran Porto Real for the first time for many reason, mainly location and positive feedback on trip advisor. we arrived on thursday 3/3 to be told that the room we had book - an ocean front jr. suite was unavailable and would not be available until the next day. they said they would put us up at their "sister" resort. My immiediate thought was at the Royal across the street so we thought that would be fine for one night and they had told us they would upgrade our room to a jr. suite ocean front walkout for our troubles. All sounded great until they said we'll get you a taxi, they weren't sending us to the Royal, but to the Real, about 5 blocks away, Not on the ocean....however, what were we supposed to do, they didn't have a room for us, so we went... OMG the room they gave us at the Real was horrible. it was dated, dirty, the plumbing was questionable and didn't really work well, found an ant in the bed, i was horrified. we left our things and went back to the GPR where they assured us that we had a room the next night with them, so we sucked it up. They did indeed have a room for us on friday afternoon at the GPR and did upgrade as they promised. Samantha at the front desk was amazing through this whole ordeal. She was calm and sweet, even though i wasn't. I know she didn't personally overbook the hotel, but she more than made up for our inconvenience. She was amazing throughout the stay. Now for the good... once we got our room, it was great. comfy bed, well kept, nice location on the beach, the walkout was great. No complaints for the most part. On thursday 3/10 (7 days into our 9 day stay), we went back to our room after lunch to freshen up and the door key didn't work... Samantha to the rescue, fixed it up and no worries. At that point the maid service hadn't been in yet, but no worries... around 2 the maid did show up, stripped the bed, left sheets sitting on the table, took the $2 that i left (i left around $2 every day for her). Anyway, thought this was weird but i know they were checking in a lot of people that day, so i assumed they pulled her away to make up another room for a new guest. I went to the front desk to let them know the room wasn't complete, they said they would send someone right down to finish it. At 5 it wasn't done, we were ready to take a rest and shower and prepare for our evening, so i made the bed. about 530 the maid showed, of course i turned her away, there was no need. so i'm guessing the room they gave us that was an upgrade was technically supposed to go to someone else on 3/10... oh well, no harm. All in all, it was a good stay. nice beach, the people are all amazing.. as mentioned above Samantha at the front desk and miguel at the tradewinds bar. the food was very good, we didn't really stick around in the evenings to see the entertainment, the reason we stay in PDC is so we can go into town in the evenings... so that's what we did! All in all, i would certainly consider going back to this hotel, but admit i would be a skeptical due to our issues at check in. I would need to be reassured that this would never happen again. Thank goodness we did not have our children our my parents with us on this trip, we often to bring them. it would have been disastrous if we had a larger. I also know that we weren't the only ones affected by this booking situation. there were 2 other groups at the Real that were in a similar situation.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of paradise”
Reviews.Author: dkcorrall
Reviews.Content: It is not just that the Gran Porto Real and Spa is for the most part excellent, but the location of it cannot be beat. The staff could not be nicer or more gracious in their service to vacationers. The "5th Avenue" shopping availability just around the corner puts everything you could want in a Mexican vacation right at your "door step". From restaurants to curio stores to tequila parlors to clothing stores, the experience of the area is excellent. With the close proximity to the passenger ferry boat just at the southern end of "5th Avenue", the island of Cozumel is just a short ferry ride away from additional sightseeing an shopping experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - one of our best vacations”
Reviews.Author: 1458betty
Reviews.Content: This is the 7th year we have returned to the Gran Porto and plan to return again next year. We would totally recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff make this one of the most enjoyable places to stay. The outside bar staff (Teresa, Jesus, Pablo, Jose), the lobby bar (Myriam, Anna, Margarite), the entertainment staff (Victor - Chicken little, Karina, Ceasar, Alexandro, Amanda), the resturant (Elizar, Verlain, Ismeal, Treenie (ccok) Sergio) the above only lists some of the many staff that made our trip enjoyable. The front counter staff is always courteous and very helpful. Betty and Roland

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Gergen3310
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this resort for our 1st wedding anniversary. The resort was very nice, clean, and in a perfect location for what we were looking for. We were able to relax on the beach and by the pool, and still able to shop 5th avenue, which was the perfect walking distance. While there we had a wonderful experience at IL Pescatore, which is the italian restaurant. These people went out of their way to give us an absolute memorable anniversary dinner. Thank you to chef Benjamin, and staff Amador, Daniel, and Delia. You guys were so great to us, we thank you! As part of our Anniversary day, we had couples massages at the Real spa. What a wonderful and relaxing experience. Thank you Lucy Santana, and Magdalena Mairoz. Sorry if I spelled your names wrong. The both of you are truly talented at what you do. Thanks!! My husband was also very impressed with the fishing crew we went with through the resort as well. It was very reasonable and convenient. Lastly, how could we forget about Jesus. He was a remarkable waiter. We always had a drink in our hand. Jesus brought us drinks even when we did not ask. He always remembered us and called us by name. You were wonderful Jesus! Thank you!!! All of you made of trip an unforgetable one. Thank you so very much!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous - would return tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: betty1458
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th year returning to this hotel and plan to return again next year. Would recommend the Gran Porto to anyone. The staff (the outdoor bar staff, Teresa, Jose, Pablo, Jesus, lobby bar staff Myriam, Anna, Margerite, the entertainment groug, Victor, Caesar, Alexandro, the resturant staff, Elizar, Verlain, Ismal, just to name a few, as there are so many to name) go above and beyond to make your stay the best you ever had. Thank you Gran Porto and all the staff for making our stay one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT WEDDING AND ALL AROUND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: prairiegirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto for a week in January as we had booked our wedding there. There were 40 people in our group and from what I hear everyone was pleased with the resort and the ammenities. The service and the cleanliness of this resort were outstanding compared to many other all inclusive resorts we've been to. Our room had an ocean view and although the ocean front rooms had much nicer views, we thought our view was pretty great and it was nice to be able to watch people going up and down the street between our resort and the sister resort. I don't think I would've enjoyed the stay as much if we had a regular junior suite or a standard room though. The food was pretty good especially at the Italian Restaurant! It was nice not having to make reservations for a la cartes! I absolutely loved the breakfasts at the buffet. The ammenities were good, lots to do, the roof top hot tub was a lot of fun. The pool bar and beach were very good as well and we had excellent service from all the bar staff especially Pamela, Pablo and Jesus! Being within walking distance of 5th Ave was convenient for such a big group so that everyone could come and go as they chose. It would've been a bit of a pain if we had to take cabs everytime we left the resort! The wedding itself was amazing and more than we could've even dreamed it would be! Our wedding planner Lilia was fantastic and she made it so that we had very little planning to do. The vows, cocktail reception and reception/dinner/dance were all on the beach and everything was perfect, the staff were amazing. Freddy was my absolute favourite and did such a great job and was awesome with our special requests. He even made sure he memorized everyone's names from the wedding group and would greet us by name when he would see us at the restaurants for the rest of the week. A nice added touch!! I really don't have any negatives to comment on. The top thing that makes this hotel so great in our eyes is the amazing staff the Gran Porto has employeed. Thank You to all of the staff for making our wedding and trip so special!! Thank You, Kim and Mark

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: degfam
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in February. We chose this resort based on reviews on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. The service is what makes this smaller resort Great! A Big Thankyou goes out to Teresa, Jesus, Ismael, Juan, May, Rees, Dani, Daniel and of course Miguel with his never ending drinks at the beach bar. The whole resort was very clean and every employee went out of their way to say "hola". The food is good at the buffet and is ever changing. Breakfast was excellent! Thankyou all for a wonderful vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “One Word- WINNER!!”
Reviews.Author: sandw2011feb
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to any resort in Mexico, but I went with a friend that has been to a few. This was the first time to Gran Porto Real for both of us. From check-in to check-out everything was wonderful. We were greeted with beverages while waiting to check-in but check-in at the desk was speedy. The room (326) was spacious and super clean. A great view from the balcony and a nice breeze with morning sun. We had breakfast and dinner at the Albatros. Something for everyone. Breakfast was mostly the same but with a huge variety. Dinners were themed with something different every night. Fresh fruit and salads always. Main courses were fresh with cooks behind the grills, grilling 'to order' dinners. Some lines, but they were quick and efficient. Frank, Ismael and Antonio were just a few waiters we had that were fabulous and again-efficient. Drinks were always filled,(even when only drinking water) never wanted for anything. Spent all of our days on the beach. Jesus was our main 'cabana man'. In observing the area they cover with service, I was amazed that they were able to get to us on such a continuous cycle. Again-efficient. We had Pablo a couple days and had the same service. The snack bar on the beach served the same thing daily, but worked great if you didn't want to leave the sun. Chips, cheese, 'salsa', burgers, dogs and refried beans just to name a few things. Betty made sure our room was always clean and stocked. She even went to the trouble of 'towel critters' with red flower petals on the bed. The ocean was great to swim in. Some seaweed to contend with, but they even have a staff to clean that up. And if ya do have to walk through it, it isn't slimy. Security walked the beach all day and night. I noticed they keep the non-guests moving to avoid loitering. 5th Avenue shopping is just a block away. Safe to walk to and enjoy. We plan a yearly trip and will return to Gran Porto Real for our stay. On a closing note:there was always staff around whether they were cleaning or just available for guest services. All the staff we encountered seemed truely pleased to be there and to have us there as guests.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VACATION!”
Reviews.Author: Sweets41
Reviews.Content: HOLA! We just arrived home from a 7 day family vacation at the Gran Porto Real and let me say, we have travelled a ton, including MANY all inclusives throughout the Caribbean (Cuba, Dominican, Tobago, Caymans, etc.) and this hotel was extremely safe, clean, and had THE BEST service we have ever had... we'll definitely go back! We booked through Air Canada Vacations and every part of our holiday was seamless, including the transportation provided from the Cancun Airport to Playa Del Carmen and back again. The hotel is in a GREAT location and is only a couple blocks walk from 5th Avenue where you'll find shopping, restaurants, nightlife, etc. When we arrived at the hotel in the early evening, we were greeted with smiles and offered a welcome drink as we checked in. The staff at the front desk were friendly, fast, and efficient --- we need to give a huge thanks to PAUL, the new front desk trainee, who had just started working at the hotel that night and took exceptional care of us for the entire duration of our stay. He's a keeper Lynn! (General Manager) We stayed in a Junior Suite Ocean Front on the 3rd floor and it was well worth it. It was large, comfy, with a King Size bed and a big balcony overlooking the beach and ocean. We could look down to the grounds, pool and entertainment stage to the right, but were far enough away that our room was quiet when our 5 year old son was going to sleep. We called down and requested an extra bed for him, which they set up immediately, so we all slept well. Being on the 3rd floor is much better than the 1st floor as there aren't as many carts rolling by, etc. The bathroom was fabulous with a huge shower, lots of hot water and pressure. And the included bathrobes, slippers, turn down service with chocolates on the pillows, fancy towel art with fresh beautiful flowers left daily for us, a wall cabinet with 4 full bottles (ie. rum, vodka, etc) for top ups any time of day, bottled water provided in the fridge daily, as well as free Internet were all excellent. There is a 4 digit room safe to lock up all valuables as well, so no worries there. As part of a promotion, we received a $50 resort credit to use any way we liked (room, spa, etc.) as well as a bottle of Champagne, flutes, and a plate of fresh fruit which arrived to our room shortly after we checked in. Very nice. What impressed us most about this hotel were the employees and the top notch service we received. We have NEVER stayed at an all inclusive where you look around and see every single employee working hard, very happy, joking, and extremely accommodating. This includes the towel attendant, the bar/pool/beach servers, the lifeguards, the grounds security, all the food and beverage servers --- everyone! They put a HUGE emphasis on customer service and it shows! We found the beach was just fine -- beautiful white sand, lots of chairs in or out of the shade, and with water shoes to avoid a few rocks in the ocean, swimming was wonderful! You can walk right or left further down the beach if you're extremely picky about a few rocks, but we didn't have an issue as I thought we might from some of the other reviews. Just bring some water shoes and you're set. The pool was big and separated into two sections. One section is where they had the games, water aerobics, water volleyball, etc., but it wasn't too loud or annoying and it didn't go on all the time, all day. The other side was quieter and more relaxed. Both sides have a shallow section and the pool has an enclosed area for very small children. Something for everyone, young and old. Overall, the food was great. We always found something we loved in the Albatros buffet and our favourite restaurant was the Mexican (Maria's). The Countryside Skewers were excellent! As with every all inclusive, not all food is to everyone's liking -- it's individual taste. You will always find something delicious to eat, especially at the fresh grills (ie. chicken fajitas, french toast, pancakes, etc.). Our 5 year old is a picky eater and we ALWAYS found something great for him, so that speaks volumes. We did eat at the Italian restaurant, which was extremely busy and popular every night... the only complaint I had with it was my food sort of tasted like palm oil on the grill. Everyone else seemed to enjoy that restaurant and went back many times, so maybe it was just me. Wish they would use a different cooking oil there, but alas... We didn't get hassled by ANY timeshare people at all, so can't comment there. Even if we had been approached, a simple "no gracias" would suffice I'm sure. We also tipped all our servers and housekeeping staff daily ($20 to $40 pesos) as we believe in rewarding great service. Especially the drink servers on the beach and by the pool who walk back and forth waiting on people in the heat ALL day. I couldn't do it... so I definitely wanted to tip them! CECILIA MEJIA was one of the best servers we had during our trip -- she is a beautiful person with a fabulous smile and sense of humour... and the service you receive from her is perfection. We loved her... and so did our son. She tickled him and blew kisses and won him over immediately. And young OSCAR in the main Albatros restaurant was a fabulous server as well -- he took great care of us whenever we ate our dinner at the buffet. Thanks Oscar! The night entertainment was really good -- not the super cheesy stuff that we've encountered for years at all inclusives, where we have mostly cringed. The dancers were trained, athletic, beautiful, and entertaining. Every show was different and had a theme and we saw 3 of them during our stay. We took one full day trip to XCARET, which is fabulous for families and very close to Playa Del Carmen. It was my 3rd time there and I thoroughly enjoyed it once again. Book through BEST DAY for the XCARET PLUS -- that is the best way to go. $119 per adult, $60 for children over 40" tall, and free for small children under 40". Some would say that almost $300 USD for the day is expensive, but we thought it was well worth the money. We ate our lunch at the Peninsula Restaurant overlooking the ocean and right beside the Dolphins - the meal was included with our Plus package. Excellent food, service, and view! My favourite thing to do at XCARET is float down one of the underground rivers with a lifejacket and flippers -- a must!!! We also booked the 4 course meal at the night time show (Tlachco Dinner) which gives you the best seats in the house, excellent food and wine. It was very reasonable and I highly recommend it. It's a full day with lots of walking, but very fun!! I'm sure there's much more I can comment on, but I think I've covered the main points. Just remember... if you want everything EXACTLY like home (ie, food, language, etc.), then STAY HOME. You are in a different country with a different culture and this hotel aims to please and ensure you have a great vacation. If there's an issue, be nice and polite and ask for what you want and I'm sure they'll bend over backwards to accommodate. Go with the flow, don't sweat the small stuff, and you'll have a terrific holiday! CHEERS!

Reviews.Title: “Sunny Family Weekend Wedding”
Reviews.Author: BackEastDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort the last weekend of February for my sisters wedding. The resort is exceptionally clean and service is very good. The resort is in a great location for shopping on 5th Avenue and walking in dowtown Playa Del Carmen. My wife has celiac disease and we had never been to an all inclusive resort before and had been assured we would be ok. The first night we tried eating with family at a specialty restaurant only to be told they did not know or understand a food allergy (no wheat/ gluten). My wife was very upset as we had 5 more days to stay and we were unsure where we could eat or what to do. Luckily we met Eliazar the Capitan at Albatros he warmly said he would personally take care of her and not to worry. Every time we went for dinner he would warmly greet us and personally take care of her. Even the night of the wedding he personally brout her dinner and dessert into the ballroom from Albatros! I would also be remiss to not recognize Freddy from Albatross who every morning and afternoon would greet us by name and again personally assure she would be ok. Freddy we would see throughout the resort and he would stop smile and chat with us making us feel lucky to have friends now at this resort. In short the resort was great these key employees I would steal away in a heartbeat for my business. Only drawback keeping the resort from 5 stars is the beach it's not good for swimming full of seaweed from boats (they cleaned it up every day for hours trying to make it better) and rocks on the dock side. Not something that totally would dissuade me just a note if you want to be in the ocean you might want to walk a distance from the actual hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was awesome and we are very appreciative of houskeeping staff , Thelma, Regina, dining staff Rodrigo and Verlai”
Reviews.Author: LindaLaneDevlin
Reviews.Content: We had a great vacation and starting with EriKa at the front desk, then Freddie our bell man. We then really enjoy the humour and good service from rodrigo and Verlain every breakfast and lunch time. On the beach Pablo and Jesus looked after all our needs. Thank you so much for all the five star treatment and we look forward to coming back in November

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation thank you staff!!”
Reviews.Author: nikki45667
Reviews.Content: This was an above average all inclusive! I can not say enough about the wonderful staff, from the housekeeping to the wait staff to the activities staff, everyone was wonderful! The food was top notch, the drinks where all tasty! Avila and Hugo in the main bar had my drink waiting for me when they would notice I was ready. . . what more could you ask for! Jesus and Jose where always smiling as they beat the heat to fill my cocktail on the beach. Cesar, Chicken, Amanda and Karina not only kept you entertained with games, they would sit and visit they truly felt like friends! Ismael and Frank always kept me smiling! Thank you everyone for the wonderful above average vacation! I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: Brenda154943
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay here for the week...the staff were friendly & helpful and Ismael & Frank in the buffet dining room were a lot of fun - good humor!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for the vacation of a lifetime!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Kelly821
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa is like your home away from home. From the moment we boarded the bus in Cancun for the resort, we were made to feel welcome. Upon arrival at the resort, we were greeted with wonderful drinks and check-in was quick, gracious and extremely well organized. The staff at this resort are beyond your expectations and they take customer service to the highest level possible. The food was amazing, the restaurants beautiful, and the resort had one of the highest standards of cleanliness I have ever seen! I could truly not find fault in anything we did or saw. The location was perfect - close to wonderful shopping, steps to a beautiful beach and a pool area that was wonderful! There was no end to the different opportunities available for day trips as well as a full schedule of events right at the resort for all to enjoy. The evening shows and bands were very enjoyable and the whole atmosphere was one of relaxation and having fun! The suites were amazingly comfortable and the housekeeping staff left us wonderful towel sculptures and flower petals every day. I couldn't wait to go back to the room each day to see what they had left. Thank you, Loyda, you were terrific. A special thank you to Fernando of Best Day, you are a true gentleman and was extemely helpful during our entire trip. I can't say enough about the staff at this resort; they knew what you needed before you did and always performed their duties with grace and smiles. To everyone, if you do not spend some time at this resort, you are definitely missing out and to all the staff at the Gran Porto Real Resort I say Hola! from our hearts to yours, we will be back!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Santiago150782
Reviews.Content: The food it´s excellent, the service it´s quick and the private beach are the best characteristics of this hotel. The people at the lobby bar (Avila, Rodrigo, Ana and Hugo treat me like i was in home), thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful position, nice rooms but tired, good food plenty of cheap alchohol.”
Reviews.Author: TysonSamarkand
Reviews.Content: Excellent helpful staff, Big rooms early Bonanza style furniture with concrete accessories, reasonable value, The food in all the restaurants and cafes was good to very good. The beer was limited to mexican but OK the wine which was includud in the price kept you sober at mealtimes as two glasses were as much as we could drink. The spirits were OK The bar cocktails had vast quantities of ice and tiny quantities of other ingredients. Electrics and plumbing mostly work in a nervous way.

Reviews.Title: “TRUE PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: wilsonsmama04
Reviews.Content: Don't let the media shy you away from going to Paradise. The Gran Porto Real was the perfect vacation destination for my family, we have two young children and felt safe and secure in the heavily guarded Gran Porto Real. The hotel was gorgeous, food was excellent, the drinks were stronger than your normal All Inclusive, the pool area was fun with lots of activities, the Kids Club was excellent, all of the staff was friendly and great with the kids and the nightly shows were fantastic. The only negatives were the beach area - not the best, not the worst just lots of errosion and the beds were hard. We had a family suite with bunk beds and it was perfect for the kids. Awesome vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We're Definately Coming Back!”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo_and_Sandy
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Gran Porto Real, looking for a relaxing vacation and long-awaited honeymoon. We were overwhelmed by the friendliness and high level of personal service provided by the Gran Porto Real staff. Upon our arrival, the Bellboys took great care to make sure we felt welcome. The Albatros restaurant waitstaff was excellent -- Mora and Ivan took care of us during many of our meals -- we appreciated their great service and care! The beach waitstaff -- Jesus, Pablo, Margarita and Mariam -- were always smiling and providing great service with a smile. Jairo of the beach security staff was a very nice gentleman. Lifeguard Rogelio was very helpful to us and was great with the kids! The Sports and Entertainment staff -- Alejandro, Karina, Amanda, Cesar and Victor -- were awesome; they took the time to get to know us and kept us active and laughing every day. By the end of our 8-day stay, we felt like we were part of the Gran Porto Real family! We will defiinately be coming back soon and have been recommending the Gran Porto Real to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GuitarSonny
Reviews.Content: We have been to Mexico the last 8 years and have stayed in Cancun and the Riviera Maya. This is our second stay at the Gran Porto Real. We have found the Gran Porto Real in beautiful Playa del Carmen to be the best. Fantastic service with a smile, great food and a very convenient location right on the beach. 5th ave. is right around the corner. Busy street lined with all kinds of shops, art and crafts galleries, cafes, restaurants and bars. Very friendly people! You won;t want to miss this unforgettable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: bettybroderick
Reviews.Content: Great stay, staff exceptionally friendly and helpful especially Sports & Entertainment people (Chicken, Karina, Alejandro, Cesar, Amanda). Beach staff (Jose, Jesus, Pablo, Rebecca) were wonderful. Room Service (Miriam) very nice. These are all very hard working, friendly people. We really enjoyed the evening entertainment shows. The restaurants (especially the Italian) were finominal. We would recommend this resort to anyone (especially families). John & Betty Broderick

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GayleBob
Reviews.Content: This was our second vacation at the Gran Porto Real and we were welcomed with open arms by Jose Ventura, Chicken ( Victor), and our wonderful Theresa. Ricardo at the desk was terrific. I can't stop there however, Capitan Eliazar is always so attentive a great manager, and charming to all of his guests, everybody in the dinning room including Sergio, Antonio, Rutilio, Ivan Canul, Salvador Mora and Naum are fantastic.Erick,and Karina with all the Sport Team really keep it fun. Every day Edwardo ( towell service) was such fun! The weather was great, the Ocean Front Suite has the best view ever. The food is good and the service is the BEST, great drinks, however, they don't have Corona! Already setting up plans for next year, can't wait!!!!! P.S. The Caribe is so clean, clear and WARM OMG!!! Tulum, Xel-Ha and Chichen-Itza are excellent excursions!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: MindilovesMexico
Reviews.Content: Went here with husband and 2 other couples. The staff are unbelievable. Everyone from the waiters to the guys painting the railings were incredibly courteous and helpfull. The front desk could use a little help with the customer service - offer us the complimentry champaign maybe - but the wait staff easily made up for this. The rooms are nice, large bed. Houskeeping staff made little towel animals with flower petals for us each day. Fridge was stocked well. Location is awesome. Never any trouble getting a chair on the beach. Hot tub, swim up bar, 24 hour serve yourself bar - ARE YOU KIDDING. This place has everything. I cannot wait until I get to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: kayakgirl52
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Playa del Carmen and at the Gran Porto Real. It was the perfect place for us because of it's location and size and amenities. The staff were mucho friendly and willing to please. The food was of good quality with a nice variation every day. No waiting ever at this place because it is small and therefore not overpopulated. Our room was an ocean front right on the beach. We loved this because we could sleep with the patio door open and hear the waves during the night. The beach waiter service was excellent. We will definitely go back and take some of our friends with us.

Reviews.Title: “A great all inclusive in all respects”
Reviews.Author: clsof62
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights with a large group of friends. The rooms were beautiful and the bar and refrigerator were well stocked, the food was great and different everyday, the beach, pools and landscaping was picture perfect, and the service was the most attentive and friendliest I have ever experienced anywhere. The wait staff on the beach, Jose, Jesus, Pablo, Ventura, Teresa, Rebeca, Carolina, Miriam and Mago were so accommodating and friendly they seemed more like fiends than staff. Four members of the group had birthdays during the week and as soon as one of the staff found out a delicious birthday cake arrived with them all singing happy birthday. The cakes were always so large and rich we were never able to finish one. There was differing entertainment every night and the hotel was only one block from Fifth Ave. the main street for shopping, sidewalk cafes, bars and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay!!”
Reviews.Author: joan48713
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto for one week for our 25th wedding anniversary. What a great trip! We had booked through Liberty Travel to make sure everything went smoothly. We had one setback when we arrived we had booked a king oceanfront and we were put in a double ocean front with bunk beds. The bell boy quickly called the desk and they assured us a room would be available the next day. We continued to enjoy the day but we could not settle in until we saw the room the next day to see if it was what we requested. It turned out to be a perfect location. We had terrific weather-sunny days and warm breezes. The staff worked very hard in all locations. We want to acknowledge a few special people, Veronica on the third floor who made our room so special and romantic with flowers and swans. Miguel at the swing bar. Verlain at breakfast. Ishmal and the staff that works with him in the evening for dinner. Bell hops arriving and leaving were very helpful. Plenty of chairs in different locations, good food, very clean hotel and room, great pool and walking distance to a fantastic beach next door.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: nelly_182
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 2 week vacation from Gran Porto Real and can only rave about the incredible service provided by all staff members. The hotel is spotless and everyone is incredibly courteous and friendly. The food was consistently excellent in all restaurants and competes with the best tables in Montreal. Special thanks to the following people who gave extraordinary service: at Albatros restaurant (Sherly, Florencio, Isamel, Sergio, Ivan & Carlos) the staff at the italian restaurant and of course, the whole team at Marias who made every dinner memorable (Manuel, Virginia, Jorge, Elias, Mario, Cristofher, Tito, Salvador, Diego, Rafael, Domingo, Jordi, Moriano, Rigo & Naberto) and provided amazing memories for our last night at the hotel. I would definately recommend the hotel to everyone, for everything ranking from location, food, entertainment, service...). Lastly, special mention to our maid Adriana Poot who was extremely nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Holiday at Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Gus24060
Reviews.Content: Hotel was at a very good location, close to 5th Avenue. Staff all were very helpful especially Cristhyan, Enrique, Cecilia and many others that made our stay so enjoyable. Rooms were very clean and housekeeping staff kept us entertained daily with their delightful creations. The buffet was superb as well as the nightly entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: cbisping
Reviews.Content: Best service ever from Miquel at the Trade Winds Bar & Sara Morales did a great job clean and decorating our room.

Reviews.Title: “MY DAUGHTER'S WEDDING WAS ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: fund45963
Reviews.Content: My daughter selected your resort to have her destination wedding. We had a total of 52 attend. The wedding corordinator, Denyse, was very professional and a delight to work with. The wedding was spectaculor thanks to your STAFF and detail to attention. MY DAUGHTER WAS THRILLED WITH EVERYTHING!. The front desk staff, Ricardo, Yendaly and Christian greeted us with smiles and took care of all of our needs. The resort was beautiful, clean and had lots of activities for all of our guests. I highly recommend this resort for a wedding, or just a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The service provided by your staff is the major attraction of the resort.”
Reviews.Author: red_eye_1
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to the Gran Porto Real resort and my parent’s fifth trip starting back in 1999. My parents have found no better resort in their numerous trips to Mexico. From Cancun to Akumal, this resort is their absolute favorite. I can understand their feelings. This is based on a few factors including location, size, and service. The location on the curve of the beach is perfect. The size of the resort is perfect, it is not a mega-resort. However, the service provided by the staff is the major attraction of the resort. To a person, everyone on the staff was polite and helpful, however there were some that made this trip to Mexico more memorable than previous trips. I would like to thank the following people for service that exceeded the already excellent service: Thelma in housekeeping, Florencio in the dining room, Pablo, Jose, and Jesus on the beach. These people went out of their way to provide excellent service during our stay and they did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: janeNewYork
Reviews.Content: First I will start with the location. It couldn't be better. Just a short walk to 5th Ave., the shopping area with plenty of restaurants, bars, and shops selling everything from clothing, souveniers, beautiful jewelry, and gorgeous Mexican pottery. There are no cars on 5th...it's strictly a pedestrian walkway which stretches for about a mile and a half with shops on both sides. Go at night.....it's beautiful. The hotel staff is probably the best I've encountered. They are all so very nice, polite, and helpful. They always have a smile on their face. The nightly shows are excellent, and far more professional than I've seen at any other hotel. The hotel itself is lively and upbeat. I can't comment on the food because it really is a matter of taste. Some things I tried were delicious, and other things were awful. But again, it's a matter of taste. There is plenty to choose from, so I'm sure you will always find something you like. We had quite a few little problems......the toilet backed up, the AC wasn't working well, the phone wasn't working, etc. .....BUT, just a call to the front desk and each time someone was at our door within 10 minutes. I especially liked the 24 hour lounge. It's self serve.....snacks, desserts, sodas, beer, any liquor you might want, and a wine refrigerator filled with bottles of white and red wines. The room was nicely decorated, and the bed linens were fresh and pure white. The bed itself and the pillows were more comfortable than mine at home. The housekeeping service was excellent, and the room was always stocked with anything we might need. I would recommend this hotel. We vacation twice a year, and the only reason we would not return is because we like to go somewhere different each time.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real - Magnifico!”
Reviews.Author: hufna1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real from February 13-20, 2011. We had a wonderful time while escaping the cold and snow of Northern Ohio. During our stay we spent a lot of time on Fifth Avenue which was just a short walk from the resort. We enjoyed our time walking, shopping and drinking our way from the hotel down to the ferry dock. The staff at the hotel was very, very kind. If we could, we would acknowledge everyone, but here are a few employees that really made it a point to make our time at the resort very special: Gaviota’s (Pool) Bar: Aurelio, Marcos, Hiram Pool Side: Teresa Lobby Bar: Avila, Marcos, Josebe Dining Staff: Rodrigo, Verlain Event Staff: Karina, Cesar, Chicken, Alex, Amanda Each and every one of these employees went out of their way to meet and exceed our expectations. Thank you to all of them!

Reviews.Title: “good comprise”
Reviews.Author: BcCanadaCateyes
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Gran Porto Real . Our room was ocean front on the third floor what a great view we over looked the swing bar thank you Astrid for your help picking our room.
