Room service was great thanks Veronica for the beautiful towel art . The beach in front of the resort is not good for swimming you can walk the beach in either direction and go swimming . Just don't sit on the lounge chairs at the Royal or you will be asked to leave the beach area. The food was fresh and plentiful at the buffet if you got there early breakfast offered the most food options . The two restaurants were very good we ate dinner there several times . We did not eat at the 24 hour lounge to many young children picking at the food. Our best times were at the main beach/pool bar where we met some great people and had some great drinks . The friendliest bar tender Avila makes the best Caesar cocktails better than any other bar tender on the resort. The location couldn't be any closer to fifth avenue the merchants all sell the same things just different prices all the bigger stores have there prices marked in American dollars or Peso. That being said I don't go on holidays to go shopping . The weather was great 7 days of sunshine

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing - Everything!”
Reviews.Author: heaterd
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay when in Playa Del Carmen. It's central location in all the action is perfect. Far enough away from the social/shopping 5th, So the noise was not a problem, yet close enough to stroll freely down the streets. Beautiful large pool beyond which, was the white sandy beach and the incredibly blue ocean. The food was amazing! Great variety always. Every staff member I encountered was equally helpful and polite. There were a few, however, that stood out. Ismael, Frank and Giovanni from the buffet serving staff. Their talent knew no bounds! From the flaming coffee production to their eagerness to please. Bartenders Avila, Ancona and Christopher were delightful. Their service and attention peppered with stimulating conversation was a treasure to find. Two true treasures were - Carolina and Miriam. Beautiful, funny, friendly. Always there when you needed something. I highly recommend staying at this hotel, and will stay there again! Heather December British Columbia, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed. Would not go back!”
Reviews.Author: Licenciada
Reviews.Content: Have traveled to many hotels in Mexico, this was a letdown. Booked through a conference rate and when we upgraded they totally ripped us off. The upgrade to an ocean room was not worth the difference. The rooms are old. . All inclusive but food was mediocre- worse than any all inclusive. The service at the restaurants was beyond slow. Deserts were horrible. Only good thing was the location: a few blocks from 5th Avenue. Colleagues who stayed at the sister hotel, the Royal, got a better deal. The staff at front desk was rude and not helpful. I would not recommend it unless you have low expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: sassy1974
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 5 night stay at Gran Porto Real. We reserved a Jr Suite with an oceanview,. It had a large balcony facing the sister resort The Royal and had a fantastic view of the pier, beach and ocean. We loved the large walk in shower. The food was exceptional--you could find several options at the buffet. We also ate at the Mexican restaurant one night and to the Italian 2 nights. The Italian was our favorite. The service was excellent and the food was of the highest quality. The location is great--you could walk to 5th Avenue to shop or eat,or take a bike ride to the beach on the other side of the pier where the ferry comes in. This is the first AI resort that we have been at where it wasn't a gated facility. We felt safe at all times and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. The only negative would be that the hot tub was located in an out of the way place on the 5th floor and closed at 6 p.m. It also was not hot enough.

Reviews.Title: “No, not for Europeans like us”
Reviews.Author: chillcat66
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a twenty hour travel from The Netherlands. The first thing the unpersonal acting like front office employees did was telling us that our room was not available and they put us in a ocean front room in the hope that we would like to upgrade. This room had a horrible old socks smell, and the promised extra beds for our kids were not placed. Finally they came up with two old, damaged and smelling beds. Our linnen was dirty as well. The front office people try to satisfy you with a 30 dollar freed to spend in the hotel shop. Going in there depresses one directly. As a former hotel manager and now investor I decided tot open up my eyes through out the day and night to look closely to this All Inclusive Show. I am used to this business model so I let the show began. Like so many other All Inclusive you see the typically things to make the margin. The post mix pistols give more water than cola. Put a lot of ice in it, some alcohol and there you go. The more the hotel sells, the better the bonusses probably they receive from houses like Bacardi or brands like Pepsi in Mexico? Amazing to see that almost every American or Canadian can be fooled so easily. In Europe te Russians come to All Inclusive, they are not easy, far from that, but not as dumm as I have seen so many other guests in the Gran Porto Real. The beach is te worst from all of Playa del Carmen. Please go 500m further and have a really good swimm. The beach beds are old, many are damaged and far from comfortable. Towels are free and clean. Entertainment is a word that cannot be used in this hotel. Please go to Turkey and het a training! When you come to relax on the beach this will most likely happen. You have to leave the relaxing spot you found because day after day there is a wedding on the beach. Americans or Canadians. These happy people will return to the restaurant in the evening to disturb your dinner and finally they take over the bars to disturb you evening.Of course you can find another place on the beach between heavily tattood guests. ( seen some neo nazi tats ......) So you go out to 5th Avenue where 80% of the goods you can buy is made in China and can be bought in China for 90% lower prices. And again the U.S. amnd Canadean guests buy and buy. You can try to book f.i. a trip to Xel HA in the hotel for USD 99 pro person. But after a 15 min walk you come in the Wal Mart and you pay 80USD incl transport and the same conditions BUT NO TIME SHARE. The hotel is very noisy and you come in tired and leave even more tired. The one that deserves a raise is the Chef. The food is top!!. Housekeeping is top as well!! Waiters and bar staff are clearly trained. Overtrained and they loose spontanity. Maybe it works for USA and Canada but Europeans do not like this kind of service mostly. Good staff like Avilla and Verlain would make loads of money in European All Inclusive. Hotels must make money, they suffer under economic conditions directly, but hotels like this must have a soul to survive. The soul here is sold to a money making show that is far to obvious. The best experience by far are the housekeeping girls and men and the worst is the front office. We were discussing to come back in 2012 and try again. But the unpersonal, uncaring money focussed check out made it easy for us. We will come back to this beautiful country and it's friendly people, but in another hotel and we will not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: mlsp
Reviews.Content: We spent Feb 05/11 to Feb 19/11 at the Gran Porto Real. We were not disappointed from the moment we arrived to the time we left we were treated extremely well! The lobby bar bartenders Ancona and Cristopher (till they were switched to pool bar and Mexican Restaurant) were extremely attentive to our needs...the chocolate martini's were the best...Our room was always spotless thanks to Sanna! We enjoyed the spa and had wonderful massages by Adriana & Ana Clemente...this resort is in an ideal location...we love to walk around town and enjoy the feel of the city...you are only a very short walk to the famed 5Th Avenue....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing dining experience.”
Reviews.Author: happyfamily20105
Reviews.Content: Eliazar(the captain of tbe dining room) organized a memorable dinner for our last evening in playa. We were greeted at the door and he ushered us to a romantic, under lit table, surrounded bt tiki torches, in a round veranda. We were assigned Juan and & Carlis, who kept our wine and champagne glasses filled, while serving us a scrumpcious dinner of surf and turf. They were exceptionally attentive and accomadati ng. Iliazer truly made our trip special.p

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest, most helpful service that we've ever experienced at an all-inclusive”
Reviews.Author: JCalllin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Feb4-11, 2011 with my husband, 15 month old son and mother. We had the best time! The staff are all so friendly and helpful, they loved our son Luke who got so much attention, he was like a celebrity! Everyone (and I mean everyone) was so nice and treated us so well that we would definitely return to the Gran Porto in Playa Del Carman, for two weeks though next time! We especially want to mention the event staff (Karina, Victor, Alejandro, Amanda, Cesar, etc) who make it FUN, as well as the dining staff, Florencio, Freddy, Rodrigo, and especially Luke's new "uncles" Ismael and Giovanni who would just take Luke in the evening so we could actually eat our dinners, they are truly amazing people. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful, Jendaly, Claudia, Samatha, Enrique and Ricardo. We cannot think of one negative for this resort. It is right in Playa Del Carman so shopping is so close and handy when travelling with little ones. My only recommendation for families with young children who want to sleep early, would be to get a room opposite the ocean side otherwise the entertainment may keep you up or just bring some white noise to play in the room. The food in the main dining area was really really good, we did not make to any a la cartes, the pool area and beach area are all great too. Our son loved the water and swimming in the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderersl
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Gran Porto but it definitely won't be our last. The hotel is beautifully designed to be airy, light and provide places to be without feeling crowded. We were there during peak period but could always find a seat in the bars and restaurants and would always receive good service. All the staff were friendly and helpful but I would like to mention a few that went the extra mile and made our holiday so enjoyable. Particular thanks to Eliazar in the main restaurant and waiters Ismael and Antonio. Their efficiency and knowledge of the food, together with their humour and cheerfulness made every meal fun! Also I appreciated the warm welcome we received to the restaurant every day by Sherlye. In the lobby bar Rebecca made us feel at home whenever we walked in (which was often!) and was another example of Gran Porto staff putting in that extra bit of effort.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation ...”
Reviews.Author: Weloveplayadelcarmen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned to the Gran Porto Real with our young daughter. We had a wonderful trip! We were there between January 29 and February 12, 2011 escaping the excruciating cold and snow in Atlantic Canada. During our stay, we had the chance to rent a car for a day and go exploring a few Mayan ruins, some we had seen on previous trips that we wanted to show our daughter (we have been to this region many times) and some off the beaten path as we enjoy doing. It was so special to be back at this hotel, particularly since this is where we got married years ago! The staff at this hotel is very, very kind. If we could, we would acknowledge everyone, but here are a few employees that really stood out and that we which to send a special thank you to for making our stay extra special: • Concierge: Astrid • Beach: Pablo • Buffet: Ferlancio (sp?) / Rodrigo / Edgar Ruiz / Lorenzo • Maria Margarita’s: Manuel (Supervisor) / Mario / Tito • Italian restaurant: Amadore Each and everyone of these employees went out of their way to exceed our expectations and we were sad to say good bye. Thank you to all of them! We look forward to seeing you again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible resort with amazing, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sandy_G48
Reviews.Content: We just returned to chilly Nova Scotia after a week at the amazing Gran Porto Real. We LOVED it! We were in a junior beach walkout suite, and had a wonderful all inclusive package that included access to three restaurants at the Royal. The room was exceptionally clean, comfortable bed with lots of pillows. Let the water in the shower run for a bit and you'll have plenty of hot water! We were able to sit on our balcony and watch the sun rise, as well as view the activity at the beach bar. This room was on the windy side of the building which we appreciated on those hot days. When we wanted to get out of the wind, we escaped to our cabana which was assigned to the room. The mini bar was well stocked and replenished daily; towel art was beautiful; robes and slippers came with the room and were greatly appreciated! Another nice touch was the bottle of wine and fruit plate delivered to our room on our first night. The staff were all amazing; the buildings so clean and well kept; service exceeded our expectations, and the weather was magnificent! We did it all...parasailing, snorkelling, massages on the beach...and a LOT of eating. Our travelling party were particularly touched by the approach to heartfelt service (demonstrated by the hand on heart!) this resort demonstrates. Several staff were exceptional in their service. Astrid (concierge) went above and beyond to assist us with locating a lost piece of luggage, and then Aaron (bellboy) who kept on top of getting the luggage from the Air Canada Vacation office, then located us in the hotel to make sure we received it. We also had wonderful experiences with Magda (massage therapist), Miguel (beach bar), the great band Tequila, Florencia (Albatross), Alex (guest services), Geranamo (Pelicanos), Patricia (room attendant/maid), Chris and Angel (Asianas)...and so many more amazing staff members who made our trip so memorable. The food is almost impossible to describe - it is SO delicious! The chefs that Real employs are second to none. Every meal we ate we described as the "best ever"! We enjoyed traditional Mexican at Maria's; a mix of oriental dishes at the Royal's Asiana's (try the Tempura ice cream for sure!); amazing Italian cuisine at Il Pescatore; wonderful steaks at Maria Marie's (Royal); and incredible fresh food daily at the buffet Albatros. The morning omelettes (made with a smile by a wonderful lady) were a hit with our group. The wait staff in Albatros are so friendly and made us feel welcome. None of us are big drinkers, but we were always brought tasty smoothies from each of these locations. We did really enjoy the house wines with our meals. The beach is nice - very clean. The water directly in front of the Gran Porto is challenging to swim in due to the number of rocks, but it is a quick walk over to the Royal where the swimming is great. We didn't take advantage of the pool nor did we take in many of the evening shows, although the one that we did see on February 14th was amazing! It also looked like a great place to take children - the entertainment staff kept them going and busy, despite language barriers. It was a pleasure to see. We took an excursion to Xcarat which is not to be missed. You really do need two days to get everything in but at minimum, try one of the floating river trips and the closing show. It is spectacular. We also snorkelled and parasailed. The Gran Porto is a quick walk to 5th Avenue where the nightlife and shopping are great. We'll be back and we are already highly recommending the Gran Porto Real to anyone who will listen to us!

Reviews.Title: “Go with your second choice.”
Reviews.Author: Chicken1201
Reviews.Content: This was our first all inclusive experience and we had high hopes that the reviews we had read and our travel agent would steer us in the direction of a relaxing few days on the beach with sun, food, drinks and a good sleep. Luckily, the sun delivered. I would not recommend this resort to anyone. We chose it because it fit our budget and looked from the website to have all we needed and our travel agent said she would return her as she had stayed int he past. Several key points were huge disappointments for us: 1. They try to sell you a timeshare. For all their advice to stay away from the time share people in the airports it's actually a self serving piece of advise - they want you to buy their time share. Which they will deny is a time share but instead a different type of vacation that you can use anytime in any of their locations - it's just a different way of saying a time share. When we were 'invited' to tour the resort next door in exchange for 500 pesos to use at the resort we point blank asked if it was a sales pitch (twice) and were told in very clear terms that it was not. This was a bold faced lie - it was a sales pitch. We were also told that since we were celebrating our anniversary we could have breakfast at the nicer resort next door. However, only if we went with the sales rep. So it was NOT romantic to say the least. We lost an entire morning of our vacation to this baloney before we just walked out. They were rather rude to us about the experience and when we pointed out that we were lied to they clammed up and wouldn't say another word. And no, we didn't get 500 pesos. I felt the staff were dishonest and misleading because of this. 2. The other disappointing piece of this resort is the food. The analogy I have come up with is that if you order a cappuccino and don't mind getting one that is squirted out of a machine, then you'll probably like the rest of the food too. It's all tasteless, overcooked, and reused so many times it's a bit scary. The one good meal we had was at a restaurant out in the downtown area. And while they claim to have a number of restaurants - they don't. There are three. The buffet cafeteria that is open most of the day and then a 'mexican' and 'italian' restaurant where the poor staff are overworked so that you wait a long time for a meal. And when you do it is often cold and usually bland. 3. The room. We explained to our travel agent who I can only assume explained to the hotel that we wanted a vacation with a quiet room so we could sleep well. They put us in the first room on the first floor next to the air hockey table, kids room and bar. And all of the halls are tiled so everything echos. Needless to say we asked to be moved and they told us they only had one other room available but it had double beds instead of a king. Or, for 150 dollars we could stay next door in a room that was only slightly less noisy. We chose the double beds. We witnessed and talked to several guests who said they also tried to put them in these rooms. It is my opinion that they attempt to put people in these undesirable rooms and then move the ones that complain or rejoice when people don't say anything. 4. The beach. Most of the beach here is covered in sandbags to prevent erosion or has boats docked in it. If you walk to the resort next door the beach is FANTASTIC - sandy, wide open. So while you can't sit over there with out getting yelled at you can at least go in a nice beach. I believe there is the option here of JUST getting a room and not the food/drink portion. If this hotel fits your budget, go this route. And make sure you ask for a different room if you don't like yours RIGHT AWAY. There is a supermarket in walking distance and tons of restaurants close by so it will be easy to do your own food and you'll be much happier. We were pleased to discover that we saved a bunch of money by walking down the beach a ways to find a massage - two people, one hour each for 45 dollars. And it was way quieter than the beach massages offered at Gran Porto. I hate to sound like all I am doing is complaining about a much needed vacation but we were expecting so much more from this resort. Luckily we were smart enough to put our towels out on the chairs we wanted very early in the morning so we enjoyed the beautiful sun and walked over to the lovely beach several times. We will go back to Playa del Carmen but just to a better resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pina Coladas on the beach, great food, great people.”
Reviews.Author: retired010111
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real was great, the people are very friendly and helpful. Tilo the Bell Boy, Alonso the Somalier, Astrid the concierge, Shirley the Hostess, Jesus the Waiter they were all very professional very friendly and helped to make our stay wonderful. Reservations for the all inclusive restaurants should be optional, first come first served doesn't work for large groups. I would recommend the upgrade package that includes dining at the Royal across the street. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love the Porto!”
Reviews.Author: JayneandPat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived back several days ago from a wonderful week at the "Porto", as we fondly called our resort. This was our second trip to the Gran Porto Real, and we have decided to make this an annual holiday destination. We enjoyed a junior suite ocean front room which was bright and nicely appointed. We felt very welcomed by the staff at the resort, Jose and Teresa looked after us at the pool and beach and made sure that our glasses were never empty! Mora and Naum, our waiters in the main dining room, were very attentive, and made sure that there was a Mamosa at my table for breakfast each day. There is as much or as little to do as you like. Many days were spent by the pool and beach, however, only five minutes away, was busy Fifth Avenue, where there were many deals to be had. You could walk the beach in each direction for miles and watch the fishing boats go out in the morning and return in the afternoon with the days catch. The evening shows were very professional and had a Cirque to Soleil feel to them. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the "Porto", and will be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: LAspa24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at several resorts in the past. The service by the waiters at this hotel was exceptional. Pablo was by far the best waiter we have ever had! His service at the beach was amazingly prompt and friendly. Al other staff wasalways eager to meet our needs.This made our vacation really enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Resort staff is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: pskruse
Reviews.Content: I liked the Gran Porto a lot - the hotel personnel was outstanding and the food was great as well! We had a beachfront walkout room which was nice. The outside bed that was reserved for us was okay but we only used it rarely. I would have like a reserved table and chairs with an unbrella more. The beach infront of the hotel has sharp rocks scattered around and I wished that I would have brought my water shoes. We did bring along and use our large insulated mugs. They kept the beverages nice and cool. We ate at the Italian and Mexican restaurants which were a la carte, 4 times during the week, however the buffet restaurant had wonderful dinners as well. They had different themes and we loved "Carribean" night. The rooms were comfortable and if you had a complaint or question about anything they took care of it right away. The hotel is just a block or so away from the shopping on 5th Avenue. The property has its own security, and the police were quite visible around the area as well. At NO TIME did we feel unsafe. A couple of special people who worked there were: Manuel at Maria's - Pablo on the beach - Cecelia at the lobby bar and many more that I can't name. I also appreciated the woman who made the wonderful omelets for us every morning (egg well done). I wish she had a tip jar!

Reviews.Title: “We felt like we were in paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Chindvall
Reviews.Content: This was the third time that we stayed at the Gran Porto Real. We loved the design of our room #305 and felt that it was extremely clean and was kept extremely clean during our stay. The staff displayed positive attitudes, were friendly and were always conscientious of our needs. We ate each of the restaurants and were pleased with the presentation, flavor and serving size. We would like to mention a few of the staff that went above and beyond in making our vacation as wonderful as it could be. Those staff are Jesus, Jose, Teresa, Pablo, Caroline, Muriam and Margarita. We look forward to returning to Gran Porto within the next few years.

Reviews.Title: “Our annual experience is exceptional each year!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatetheGreat225
Reviews.Content: Our annual trip was so much fun and relaxing! Mari, Elizabeth, and David at the lobby bar are wonderful and always at your service. The entertainment staff is so much fun. Victor (Chicken), Ceasar, Karina, and Amanda are exceptional and passionate about what they do! Victor (Chicken) will get anyone excited and motivated to participate in some or all of the day's activities. Ceasar is very coordinated and an excellent instructor at any group excerise routine. Karina is very genuine and loves to meet you and speak with you. Amanda is fun and witty with entertaining the guests. This group is an essential asset to the hotel. Bravo! Pablo and Theresa are just a few of the exceptional waitors that will make sure your drink never runs empty. They all clearly work very hard and are wonderful to be around. Thank you Gran Porto Real for the fantastic experience this February! We will be back the same time every year! Thank you again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto suited all needs”
Reviews.Author: Shasta17
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a mother/daughter vacation in February, and really out of all the Mexican resorts I have stayed at, this one was my favourite. Great location in Playa Del Carmen, close to 5th avenue for shopping and less than a 10 minute walk to a large grocery store called Mega. The junior suites were very large and had a lot of space. The buffet restaurant had great food and always had a lot to choose from. We enjoyed dinner at the a la carte restaurants as well where you do not have to make a reservation - it is a first come first served basis. The service and cleanliness of this hotel can't be beat. The activities staff were great and there was always something to do (if you so desired). This is a family type of resort and the only down side was the actual beach. The sand was beautiful but the water was no so great. We would wander to the beach side of the sister hotel where we could swim in the ocean. If you are a senior or have mobility issues, ask for a room with a walk in shower, and be wary of the step from the room to your foyer/bathroom area. And if you are a light sleeper, make sure your room is nowhere near the lobby bar. Just a note to travellers, people work very hard in this hotel so please show your appreciation by leaving gratuities for the excellent service you will receive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - the staff is great!”
Reviews.Author: bare_trax
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week all inclusive. The service was second to none. The food was great. Our poolside server Cecilia Mejia went out of her way to ensure we had anything we needed. This was especially helpful as we had our grandson with us for this trip. The accommodations are average but this is offset by the people that work here. The cleaning staff went out of their way to ensure the room was tidy and we had everything we needed. We recommend this resort as a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ease!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at ease the whole time our two boys (14, 11), and us the parents. We had a group of us, nine people there. To put tables together was no problem at the main restaurant where the amazing buffet was. The other two a la carte restaurant was unable to make such large tables. We has two tables then of 4, 5. That was okay. We were very spoiled there. It is a twenty min walk to the ferry to Cozumel. We were sooo close to the main shopping strip which was easy to go to. We would so go back. All of the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed with this hotel and restuarant.”
Reviews.Author: rbridout
Reviews.Content: Eliazar, the evening head waiter at the hotel restuarant, was outstanding. He made our Anniversary Dinner one we will truly remember. The head waiter at the Mexican Restuarant next door, Manuel Balam, went out of his way to surprise my husband on his birthday. We had a lovely dinner and were served Mayan coffee which we had never had. The presentation was outstanding by our waiter, Rigoberto. This was our 3rd time at this hotel and it keeps getting better. Raymond & Elizabeth Ridout Vacation Time: 02.06.11 thru 02.16.11

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with superb service”
Reviews.Author: HLHSgrandma
Reviews.Content: PERFECT location! On the beach, but yet steps to shops, markets, and interesting sites! We felt completely safe, and I am a nurse in a jail, so I tend to be EXTREMELY paranoid , especially with all the recent trouble in Mexico we have all heard about. Hotel was fabulous, food great, we only ate at the buffet, and I usually hate buffets, but our waiter Antonio was so fabulous, we ate there every night! Rooms were lovely and I will suggest the beach front walk out rooms, right on the beach with a private cabana bed on the beach! Any questions will be happily answered!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. GREAT experience!”
Reviews.Author: ManitobaMic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Purto Real from January 22 - January 29th with a large wedding group. Right from check in the staff at the Gran were exceptional! The beach was great and we were always able to find a beach chair at any time throughout the day. Alexis, the lifeguard was so friendly and was always keeping an eye on the water! The beach waiters were amazing, and always served us with a smile on their faces! Big thank you to Pablo and Jesus who made sure we always had a drink in our hand! Also can't say enough about Pamela at the beach bar - she was fantastic and treated was so well! We really enjoyed the roof top hot tub on the cloudy days! We ate at the buffet regularly (loved the omlettes in the morning) and tried out both the Mexican and Italian Restaurants and loved them both. It was especially nice that you didn't have to make reservations! The hotel was SUPER clean and our oceanfront room was amazing! The location and proximity to 5th Avenue was second to none. About a 2 minute walk down to 5th Avenue and you could wander up and down the streets to experience the shops, restaurants and bars! The wedding was beautiful and both the ceremony and supper were held right on the beach. The staff that night were awesome and we had an amazing time! Big thanks to Freddy - Miguel - Nepo - Tito - David - Norberto! All in all, this was a great experience and we wouldn`t hesitate to go back to this resort in the future!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but hold out for the cheaper room rates...”
Reviews.Author: Jen082978
Reviews.Content: Our overall stay at this resort was 4 days in total. The resort itself was very pretty and our experience was very positive. The resort really does a great job of creating an experience for you that you don’t have to leave if you don’t want too. However, there were a few minor issues that we did have that revolved around availability of only one concierge during peak hours creating long wait times in line, requesting a king and instead receiving 2 double beds and being told there were no kings (finding out later that our friends got a king), the bars closing down at midnight on a Friday night and an all inclusive resort, and lastly, the resort getting very noisy about 7AM so don’t expect to get a great deal of sleeping in time (especially if you were partying all night.) With those complaints out of the way, Gran Porto Real has one tremendous asset and that is Emilio Lopez of Best Day Travel. Emilio was the individual that helped us schedule our shuttle home and all of the activities we did. Both activities (swimming with the dolphins and visiting Rio Secreto) we had to book late due to various reasons and he was able to make a phone call and get us in to both tours. He was available every step of the way to answer our questions and even remembered us each day. He made us feel like his only customers and his constant enthusiasm, attention to detail, and exceptional customer service and support would be the number one reason why we would return to Gran Porto Real. If you do go, ask for Emilio of Best Day Travel. You won’t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Scene for the Perfect Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: TheHotOne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with a group of 26 for a friend's wedding. It was the perfect accommodations! The wedding was performed on the beach on a Sunday afternoon and it was absolutely gorgeous. The staff was extremely helpful. Our favorite was Freddy Capitan, who was kind, helpful and courteous despite the craziness of some in the wedding party! The bride was so pleased with his service, she made him come out onto the dance floor for a group dance! Oh, and the Chocolate cake 5 layer cake in all the restaurants was AWESOME!! The hotel is in a perfect location--close to all the area attractions, and a just around the corner from downtown Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway ... for a smaller proerty”
Reviews.Author: rkalish12
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a great 5 day stay at the Gran Porto. Even though I knew this was a smaller property, I had a bit of a shock upon arrival seeing that this is located in the middle of a fairly populated area. There was no sprawling drive to the entrance, no grand lobby nor elaborate grounds like the other all inclusives that I've stayed at previously. However once I got over that, I continued to be impressed at the high level of service, cleanliness and how they were able to do so much in a limited amount of space. We booked a Junior Suite Oceanview which was a gorgeous room with a gigantic bathroom, however the view directly overlooked the neighboring hotel (the sister property, the Royal). You had to stand on the balcony and look over to the right to see the ocean. There were no upgrades available on our arrival, but the next day we moved to an oceanfront room for just $40 more per day. The gorgeous view of the pool, beach and ocean was well worth it. A picture of the view is attached. The beach is fairly small and as others have said, it's pretty rocky. There are also quite a few small motorized boats that are anchored in front of the hotel which you'll occassionally see come or go (but it's not like a busy dock area). If you walk 2 minutes in either direction, you'll find very few rocks and no boats. Also there is quite a bit of foot traffic on the beach from the large boat dock next to the hotel where many cruise ship passengers (from Cozumel) arrive. The hotel security does a great job at not allowing anyone without a resort wrist band from using the amenities. I personally had no issue with the beach as I was looking for soft sand, a comfy lounger and the sound of waves to relax too. The food was very good at the buffet and the two ala carte restaurants. To get to the ala carte restaurants, you need to literally exit the hotel lobby and walk down the block which I found odd at first but got over. There isn't much nightlife, which was fine with me as I really just wanted to veg for a few days. If you want more excitement, there are plenty of lively bars within walking distance on the beach and the shopping area in town or you may want to consider a more livelier resort. The Gran Porto does provide some basic activities during the day and they do a really good job with their nighlty shows. The best part of my stay was probably the service. I've never been at an AI where just about every employee greets you and makes you feel very welcome. Even at the buffet, a server would be at your table within seconds greeting you and taking your drink order. I was extremely impressed with the wait service at the beach too. Of course giving the attendant a dollar or two always helps, but was happy to do so as they were extremely accomodating and guest focused. I'd very likely stay here again ... or pursue their sister property, the Royal, which is located next store. I heard from many people that the service is even better there and they have quite a few more restaurants and amenties.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, but juice is inedible, printer needed, and who gets tips?”
Reviews.Author: bunburyintoronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel was immaculate, rooms comfortable and spacious, the staff were just incredible, food tasty, and the beach is white and clean. I would definitely go back. You will NOT be disappointed with this place. The ONLY complaints we had (and these are minor, and should not suggest our overall experience) are as follows: The juices were terrible. Don't order juice of any kind. It's from a syrup, it's just sugar and colour. Disgusting. Also, I tried to print my boarding pass the day before we left, only to be told by the front desk that there were no printers attached to computers with internet; eventually, Aaron, one of the bellboys, managed to work something out for me, but this should be a standard feature in any good hotel. Guests need to fly, and flying needs boarding passes. Get on it! Finally, there was some ambiguity about tipping which I'd love to have cleared up...doubt I ever will. Anyway, we tipped everybody on an individual basis, though an all-inclusive claims to "include tips". So, is it the case that all the staff in the hotel divide a pool of tips determined by the number of guests, or does the hotel just assume that guests will tip and therefore withhold any gratuities and keep wages low because of this? This is an issue of exploitation, and I think it would be better if the hotel management were clear about this. Would like to thank the staff who really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and memorable: The bellboys, Tilo and Aaron, the housekeeping staff (especially Rosa and Martha), as well as the servers Ismael and Ceclia. Our kids also had an incredible time with the Kids Club girls: Gina, Diana, Nelly, and Dulce. Thank you all, and we'll tell our friends about you!

Reviews.Title: “Absoultely the very best in all ways”
Reviews.Author: cajuna
Reviews.Content: The visit was exeptional. A lot of good things but one thing that is missing is night life/disco for dancing on site. Due to the recent bad publicity, going to find entertainnemnt off the resort makes people nervous and with the limited music available on the resort we found the evenings a little lacking. The shows were very good The activities staff were very good. Victor, Amanda, Ceaser, Alehandro and Karina kept things moving and added a personal touch that made the days and early evenings a lot of fun. The restaurant staff were superb. Rodrigo,Mora,Osmar and Naum in the buffet treated us with the best service we could have asked for. At the Italian restaurant Il Pescatore, Daniel and Amador showed us what real service is. The hotel should appreciate the excellent work that these individuals provide for their guests

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME TIME!”
Reviews.Author: Kikiwiki
Reviews.Content: What a great resort. Chicken well what can I say about him? THere is so much to say - Chicken kept us entertained as he was my husband's "TWIN", as he said. Not exactly, but he still made us laugh all day. Ceasar and his custumes were quite amusing in the heat that we had. Ceasar was a great host for the shows at night too (Sorry for spiting on the new mike LOL!) All of the entertainment staff was awesome, Alejandro, Amanda and Katrina - you are all awesome and keep up the good work. Amadore at El Pescatore (which translated means - Lover!) what a great server. Along with Daniel they make an amazing team. The buffet, such great food all the time. OUr servers were Osmar, Mora and a their companions, awesome guys and always there to help. The tequila bom bom's were great in the morning! great service always makes the food that much better. The rooms, the food the entire hotel - so amazing. My husband and I were amazed at the cleanliness of the place. They were always cleaning and so accomodating. Everyone was kind and you could tell that they served you from the heart. A smaller resort but it made everything SO close to each other. That is what was awesome. If there was anything that I could complain about at this resort was that the live bands stopped at 11 and there was no disco, or dancing. It is so close to 5th avenue that they don't have a disco. That was dissappointing as we were not bar hoppers and would have loved a place to dance at night. I am sure that this is same as many at the resort. All in all a great place for some fun and some relaxation. I would recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: snowboarderguy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend snd myself just returned from our extended vacation at the gran porto real in playa del carmen, we stayed from january 22nd to february 10th, the moment we got there we were met with smiling faces, and it didn't there, everyone we met was so nice and friendly, we drank alot at the pool bar galviota's where lorenzo always met us with a smile and a very good drink, when we were not there we were hanging out at the swing bar pablo was our waiter almost every day we were there, he always had a smile on his face, miguel was the bartender at the swing bar, we never had to ask for a drink he always knew what we wanted. our housekeeper Addy always kept our room super clean and made fancy towel arrangements on our bed which we looked forward to everyday, we ate alot at the buffet resteraunt where we had may servers, the one that stuck out the most was fransisco he was always smiling and when we asked for a mayan coffee he was happy to make it. with out these people our trip would not have been so awesome. i recommend staying here everytime you go to playa,

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real experience was everything I had hoped for, and more.”
Reviews.Author: LPLSMAN
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, everyone here went out of their way to make our stay as fun and problem free as possible. The beach is outstanding, the room was excellent, the variety of food was great, and the location of the property is ideal. Set a few blocks from a long stretch of the usual touristy shops, it was close enough to be convenient, but far enough away so you didn't realize it was there if you are not into that experience. We were barely hassled at all to buy the local trinkets while on the property, only saw women selling bracelets for about a half an hour a day and they were not pushy about it at all. All of the staff worked incredibly hard at all times to make sure we enjoyed our stay. My favorite part of the whole stay was the lobby bar. The shows were very good, and a special thanks to Ancona. Best bar tender, ever. Kept the good times rolling even when the weather wasn't the best. We will be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will Defiantely be back and this time witht he kids!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KarliRae
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2 weeks tremendously. Everytime you turn around there is a caring, charming and friendly staff member to assist you. From Delia at il pescatore's beautiful Italian Risdtorante to Jesus and Pablo at the Pool Bar and Thelma in housekeeping our trip was that much better just thanks to the staff. Many Excursion and sights to see right at your fingerprints. We could walk safely on 5th avenue to have great shopping right from authentic artisans to top of the line stores. We will for sure be back and probably next year, and this time with our kids and Grandparents. Its a great place for all.....thanks so much everybody!

Reviews.Title: “best ever”
Reviews.Author: dazzoo
Reviews.Content: been to mexico 23 times.finest facility,service and location ever. !!!!mexican restaurant is superb.stay again in a heartbeat.only complaint[minor] the computer at front desk which asked for guest reviews offered FRENCH as the language for canadians to reply.guess they aren't familiar with our demographics bip bips nearby features best margaritas i have ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “it was AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Rony57
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in at the front desk with the smiling face of Christian we knew it was going to be the place for us. It only got better from Freddy the Bell Hop to Shirley the greeter at the ala carte restaurant . Verlaine our waiter the first day looked for us every morning at breakfast and lunch the rest of the week and gave us superb service thx again Verlaine. Hose our server at the pool looked after us and made sure our glass was never empty.Soanna our chamber maid was first class also doing her towel sculpters and keeping our room spotless. We ended up going to Maria`s three nites because of the food and the special waiter Rigoberto who made sure we were in his section.The last nite Chef Jorge made us special appy`s that were not on the menu and made our last meal there even more special. Thanks Rigoberto for those special coffees they were awesome. Would we go back? Yes in a heart beat. And special thanks to Emillo from Best Day who looked after all our excursions. The only down fall is the beach out front not as nice as the one`s next door but they are working on it daily to restore what they were like before they got damaged by Wilma. Can`t control mother nature. Yes we will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Clark/ Chapman wedding”
Reviews.Author: rock1949
Reviews.Content: Our experience was fantastic! The wedding was planned very well and fun was had by all.The buffet was always a joy to go to. The beach was kept very clean and the waiters were friendly and very efficient. We want to recommend the following waiters: Freddy Capitan: He was the best waiter we have ever had. He never forgot our names for the whole week and his workers were great at the wedding. They were; o scar- Basilio Geovanni- Rene- Tito-Nepo,Norberto. Our best waiter in the restaurant was by far Lorenzo Camas Sanchez. He brought a smile to our faces every morning.Aaron was perfect in the lobby. He kept us together when we were confused. Great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dirt116
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous week with my family at this hotel. Our room was the family suite oceanfront and it was huge. Enough space for everyone. My two kids (7 and 9) tried every games at the pool with the animation team. Without them, our vacations wouldn't have been the same. I thank you personnaly Karina, Amanda, Alejandro, Cesar and Victor(chicken). The food was good and the hotel exceptionnaly clean. i would return tomorrow morning!

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel at home”
Reviews.Author: CYRIL29
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 weeks at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen. After a bit of a rocky start , they had overbooked our suite. (It seems it’s a common occurance in Mexico). Just be patient and it will be resolved .You may have to stay in an alternative room for a day or two.I can admit initially we thought the limited restaurants may compromise our dining choices. Holy cow were we wrong. The buffet changes it’s menu every night and the food is excellent. The capitan Eliazar is amazing. He personally greets everyone he can and the waiters are there to please.The hotel is in such a greet location to 5th ave and generally a short taxi,or bus ride away from world class experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Relaxing Holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: wannagoback48
Reviews.Content: What a great experience!! Check in was quick and painless - when we inquired about upgrading, we were told that wasn't an option for that night as they were 100% booked! That wasn't a problem though - we had a standard room and it was perfect for us. Our room was right off the smaller pool with the swim up bar and it was the perfect place for us. Not too noisy and the bartender Filipe was terrific! The food was excellent - something for everyone at the main buffet. We tried the food at on the beach snack bar and it was good too. We tried the Mexican restaurant and enjoyed it. We went to the Italian restaurant (Il Pescatore) and received AWESOME service from our waiter Israel, his partner Ramino and the manager Ricardo. Israel's recommendations were always good - the food was excellent. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we went back the next 2 nights as well and received the same great service from the same great people! The staff at the whole resort was always smiling and happy to help in anyway they could. We were looking for a quiet, relaxing holiday and we found the place for it. There were a variety of ages from young families to seniors but this hotel had something for everyone. We would definitely return to this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: laxhopkins14
Reviews.Content: The trip was absolutely wonderful. Everyone at the resort was extremely nice and most every employee spoke nearly fluent english. The best restaurant was the italian themed one, but Albatros was also a really good one. Ask to have the waitor Lorenzo Camas-Sanchez, he was awesome. Overall the time here was great. Just NEVER EVER leave the resort at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: gabrielgarciamtz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights as part of a promotion we got online. Hotel room was the standard which is good but in my next stay I would definetly recommend a junior suite Hotel staff was very friendly to change our room as the original one had extra stairs and we were using still a stroller for our 1 yr toddler . Amazing service, all tips and room service was included. They had a babysitting service which we used one night as my wife and i took an escapade to the Italian restaurant for dinner. Kids club is also excellent. We even bought a membership for Real Club and are expecting ot book this yr with them at Gran Caribe ...we are also anxious to hit one of the Royals

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a bettr holiday”
Reviews.Author: Paulinevogel
Reviews.Content: This resort goes above and beyond to make you feel at home. The staff is wonderful. Check out Lorenzo Avilda and Marcos at the pool bar. Whatever you want they will make you. The bar waiters/waitresses treat you like family. Teresa, Pablo. Jesus, Jose, Muriam all know how to make your holiday a special one. Jose the bar tender makes the best mojitos. Willie and Esther in guest services will answer all your questions and get you the information you need. We have stayed here many times and keep going back for the excellent service and the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, quality, and value - a great destination in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: MN-Brian
Reviews.Content: First, my thanks to other TripAdvisor members for your reviews of the Gran Porto - I used your input when making my decision for a hotel in Playa del Carmen. Summary: I highly recommend the Gran Porto Real for your vacation in Playa del Carmen. The location is perfect, service is very good, quality is very good, and I feel I received good value for the money. I'll try to touch on some key thoughts below: General impressions: We really liked Playa del Carmen and the Gran Porto Real. The beach is long, wide, and beautiful. 5th Avenue offers browsing and shopping and an escape from your hotel. We stayed in the tourist zone, behaved ourselves, and as a result never felt insecure. Having access to the ferry to Cozumel was a big plus. The weather was fantastic - very comfortable. Check-in: smooth and fast. I used on-line check-in from home before arriving, but the front desk still wanted to see my physical credit card on arrival. I didn't perceive much value from the on-line check-in process. Regardless, the check-in process was friendly and fast - no worries. Service: with a smile. You truly get the sense these people care about their work and doing a good job (i.e. taking care of you and your family). Everyone was friendly and helpful. Security: watchful and solid. My wife and I were stopped several times by hotel security (politely and professionally) to check our hotel bracelets and ensure we belonged there. Rooms: good size, clean, comfortable. We elected to go with an Ocean View room, and I'm very glad we did. Sitting on the balcony, with a warm breeze and a view of the ocean - priceless. I agree with the comments from others - the beds are quite firm. I normally like a softer bed, but slept just fine. The rooms are cleaned very well. Note: be aware that on humid days moisture can collect on the cool floor tiles and be slippery - tread cautiously. Food: tasty, and a good variety. The buffet has something for everyone, and the overall quality was very good. We ate dinner in the specialty restaurants, which offer a decided step up in service, flavor, presentation, and quality. Beach: In front of the hotel - not good. A few hundred yards away - excellent. If a requirement is to stand up from your beach chair and wade into the water for a nice swim in the ocean, this is not the hotel for you. If you don't mind walking down the beach a few hundred yards in either direction and sitting on a towel, everything is great. The Gran Porto beach is unfortunately situated such that the ocean bottom is rocky, and there's quite a bit of seaweed floating by the shore. We spent the bulk of our time sitting around the pool (beautiful) and swimming in it to cool off. We went for long walks on the beach north and south of Gran Porto, and the beach is gorgeous. Demographic: During our stay the average age was upper 50's / lower 60's. A very low-key, relaxed group. North American primarily, with smaller numbers of visitors from Europe and Central / South America. Location: Excellent. Going north from Gran Porto the beach is wide and beautiful. Going south from Gran Porto the ferry terminal is a 10-minute walk away. 5th Avenue shopping is about 2 blocks away. You're right on the beach. Overall: An excellent hotel. I would recommend it to family and friends, and would certainly stay at Gran Porto Real again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “exceptionnal”
Reviews.Author: Sergio073
Reviews.Content: Ecological hotel, large rooms, very clean with all commodities, balcony, personal very friendly and attentive, lot of trees and garden, situated 3 minutes from the main street, I enjoy this hotel, which provides me with all my needs of confort, garden, view of the ocean, excellent food (3 restaurants), large swimming pool, friendly environment and also posibility to use facilities of the others Real hotel in Playa and Cancun. Sure, I will go back there without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Book with confidence. Perfect location, great resort.”
Reviews.Author: mystify11
Reviews.Content: I booked with this resort because of the strong recommendations on TripAdvisor, and was not disappointed. Other than a less-than-perfect check-in (only one of the five couples who had booked upgraded suites got the king-sized beds they expected), and VERY noisy rooms (as another poster noted, there is not a lot of sound insulation, and balconies are anything but private in most areas; we had lobby noise outside our first room and construction all day long in the second), things were excellent. IMMACULATE hotel with staff that is friendly and eager to please. The food was second to none and not one person in our 14-person group got sick. And believe me, we ate a lot. Rooms were well kept (Yesmenia, our maid, was outstanding), we barely noticed any bugs, the staff worked hard to keep the beach clean (it is much more private here than at neighbouring resports, with loads of chairs and shade cover -- though ocean swimming is safer at Royal next door because there is less rock), and service was top-notch (thanks to Antonio and Pablo especially, and Amadour at Pescatore restaurant). No problems to speak of. Everyone in our group was immensely satisifed. Being a mere two blocks from 5th Ave was a luxury! Re: Excursions: We pre-booked the Xel-ha/Tulum trip through Cancun Discounts and HIGHLY recommend it. A perfect day worth every last penny. Do yourself a favour and book this trip. Also did Coba Express through Best Day Travel (booked on site at hotel through Expedia) and found it worth the price, though our guide was somewhat lacking (if I had to do it again, I'd take the cheaper bus to Coba from 5th Ave and then hire a "Mayan taxi" on-site at Coba, where the local guides fill you in on each ruin site for a fraction of the price: $10 US). In short, book with confidence at this resort. To travel in a group of 14 and have no real complaints was nothing short of a miracle. Well done, Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and smiling faces!”
Reviews.Author: Sturgis06
Reviews.Content: We just got back lastnight from our week stay, and had a great time! Beaches are great as is the food and hospitality. We enjoyed our evening meals with the smiling faces of our two great waiters, Ismael and Geovanni. These two guys were great to listen too and kept us entertained while eating. I must say all the staff had smiles on there faces and were very pleasant to be around. We would go back to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Time of My Life!”
Reviews.Author: NathanTaylor
Reviews.Content: As I stepped off the tour bus, I had no idea what to expect. Buying this trip at the last minute, knowing very little about Playa De Carmen and having never been to Mexico I was cautiously optimistic. I lucked out! My first impression was very good. The resort is at the end of a dead end street and next to two other higher end resorts and close enough to 5th ave and the clubs. The lobby is gorgeous with marble flooring, high ceilings and was meticulously clean. We arrived early and had our luggage stored until we could check in at 3pm. We acquainted ourselves with the hotel and found ourselves at the buffet which would soon become our mainstay for food while in Playa. The food was definitely above average, but it was the desire and the passion of the staff that made it what it was. Antonio was the epitome of this, high energy, desire to please and very entertaining. My game plan for the week was to relax and take in as much sun as possible. I got to know the sports and entertainment team very quickly. There were five of them ( Karina, Cesar, Alejandro, Victor and Amanda). The first night I was there I went to Coco Bongo with Victor and Karina and several other hotel guests. My family wasn't interested in going so I went by myself. The two staff members went out of their way to make sure I enjoyed myself, and introduced me to the other guests there. It really set the tone for the rest of the trip. I really can't say enough good things about the entertainment team. They all excelled at different things, but they all did an excellent job at remembering your name, making you feel at home and being genuinely interested in what you have to say. The activities ranged from the standard to the unique, but they were always enjoyable. I think one of the most impressive things was the execution and efficiency of all the staff. There must of been 150+ staff on site. From security, entertainment, food and cleaning. It seemed like they were always busy, quick to fix any issues that show up and always pleasant. If tours and excursions are your thing, there are plenty. Ranging from $50 to $100, some from your doorstep others are to a 1-2hr bus ride you can scuba-dive (gorgeous, highly recommend), visit several Mayan sites, nature sites/zoos, zip lining, para-sailing etc. There is something for everyone. I think that's everything... Bring tip money! The staff are worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Vacation/wedding”
Reviews.Author: BMCONE
Reviews.Content: Our first all inclusive vacation and we were not disappointed. We were very pleased with our room - large, clean and comfortable. Very happy with the food and selection both at the hotel and at the A la Carte restaurants. Rigoberto at Marie's gave us great service.We also attended a wedding and it was tremendously well done.Freddie( Captain) and his team- Jose Be,Nicomendez, Naum, Tito- Norberto all did a wonderful job . The set up was beautiful, the meal was great and the service was awesome. We would definitely go back and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday, would go again, great for all ages.”
Reviews.Author: MitchellHampshire
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 2 weeks all inclusive, taking parents and meeting daughter and 4 year old granddaughter, so 4 generations. The hotel staff couldn't be more helpful. We were in standard rooms which are perfectly adequate, kept clean with a fridge housing chilled, bottled water and soft drinks, all replaced daily. The 3 rooms did vary in size quite considerably, but it wasn't a problem as we wanted to be near each other. One unexpected thing was that the lifts only go to floor 3 and there are 5 floors in the hotel, so if you have mobility issues, then there could be problems with lots of stairs. Fortunately our senior members are reasonably fit, so could manage the final climb of 2 floors. Entertainment staff do a first class job and are so good at remembering guests' names. There was a quality 45 minute show 6 nights a week at 8.30, so a good time for kids. Pools are great, but be warned, if you have a confident child who is a non-swimmer, arm bands or buoyoncy jacket (as we had) are essential, as there is a shallow 18" ledge which leads straight into 4 ft 9" pool. There is a Kids' Club where I saw 2 buoyoncy jackets and arm bands, and we borrowed buckets and spades from there. Before our granddaughter arrived we enjoyed the first few swims of the holiday in the tranquil pool and sampled the sushi - very nice. HOTEL TAKE NOTE: please make a separate area for smokers outside (Gaviotas bar and bridge only?). It is not at all pleasant having smokers either side of you on sun loungers, especially with children nearby too. Restaurants - Albatros buffet restaurant is excellent. The Italian and Mexican are over-rated - nice for a traditional meal 'out' and for atmosphere - in 2 weeks the menu didn't change and food was presented nicely, but was nothing special. The Albatros is great for all meals, with SO much choice and particularly good for breakfasts. And Sergio in the Albatros does a mean Irish Coffee - worth having one for entertainment value alone! Gym is good and so is the jacuzzi on the roof top! Beach in front of hotel is a bit seaweedy and coral rocks jut out in sea - but contrary to current reports, the Mexicans are out there working hard for our benefit, clearing the debris and improving the seashore for our benefit. Loads of sand though and excellent seashore either side of hotel. Lovely for early morning walks up 5th avenue and along the beach. All in all, a very good place - lovely building, excellent staff, improve the no smoking areas and Italian and Mexican restaurants, and it will be a perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Best service and attention ever in 20years of vacations!”
Reviews.Author: rjthetraveller
Reviews.Content: The motto of "exceeding your expectations" is practiced every day by the very friendly and helpful staff members who made our 10day vacation extra special! Our needs were always given first priority from all the staff we encountered and we especially got to know the bartenders - we enjoyed many an evening with Ancona in lobby bar area and had fun with David at the main pool bar during the day. Many thanks to Ivan, Antonio, Oscar and Eliazar in the buffet restaurant who really were glad to see us each day and knew what we wanted almost before we did! And, thank you chef's Rene and Joel for the special order gourmet meal within the more layed back buffet eating area instead of al a carte! We did enjoy excellent meals at both the al a carte's (italian and mexican) as well! This resort is exceptionally clean - even the beach gets raked every night - we couldn't believe that it is actually 14years old. The location is great with 5th Avenue shopping just 1.5 blocks away plus the ferry to island of Cozumel is very close. We have travelled annually to a tropical location for the past 20years and felt this resort was the best we have experienced. We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: sheelie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Gran Porto previously and what a 5 star experience. The closeness to Fifth Avenue, walk up the beach to the ferry to Cozmel, all is wonderful. Great choice of restaurants, no limitations. Service is wonderful and they are very accomodating. The rooms are cleaned thoroughly each day and towel figurines are made up for your bed each day. Meal choice is excellent. We took a beach front walkout and had our own palapa and the extra money is worth that service to my husband who likes to be able to sit in the shade and be guaranteed "his spot". There are lots of activities of which you can choose to participate in or not participate in. I appreciate that there are not always people hassling you on the beach to sell trinkets and tours. The Mayan coffee that Rigoberto made at Maria's restaurant and his service were wonderful. My niece was married here and the wedding planners and service on the beach were awesome, Thanks Freddy our capitan. Beach service for drinks has been consistent the past three years with our favorite Jose. We also like that there is no disco on site as that is quieter. There are discos nearby if you choose. There is one up the road that is too noisy, but Gran Porto has no control. Easy access to great tours. This is definitely a five star hotel and we recommended it to our niece for her wedding and everybody raved about it.. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Felt like going home”
Reviews.Author: Pepito10
Reviews.Content: We have been blessed enough to come to this hotel for the third time, so we knew what to expect. We brought nine others with us who had never been there because we wanted them to experience what we had. We were very happy to see Pablo, Jesus, Teresa and Jose are all still there. They are fun, amazing people that make everyone feel like part of a huge family! Another wonderful staff member is Addy, who did up our room every day. We waited anxiously to see what she would make out of the towels in the room. She even used our own glasses to dress up a couple of really sweet animal creations!! I have to say that I walked in one day as Addy was cleaning, and she pointed to our son's iPod Touch (that I didn't realize he'd left on a table) and then to the safe. She didn't have to do that. I guess the only issue I had at the beginning was that the Jr Suites our group was booked into were not the ones we were expecting (smaller). I found out later that they have done extensive renovations and now have several levels of Jr Suites. While we would have preferred the larger ones, not one person in our group really had a problem. (Everyone was just grateful not to be in the snow!!). The food at the buffet was good, with something for everyone. Il Pescatore, the Italian restaurant on the corner, was amazing yet again. Unfortunately, we didn't remember the names of the staff there, but they all make sure your evening is one to remember. I want to point out too, that at no point did any of our group feel at all unsafe. There is always security patrolling the beach, and you see them all over when you are shopping on 5th Ave. Not that the drugs aren't there - most of us were approached at one point or another, but just said No and kept going and that was that. We also made sure we were always somewhere that was busy, and that no one went anywhere on their own. I guess I just want to say too, that your trip is what you make it, too. If you're looking for screwups, you will definitely find them, but if you go realizing how lucky you are to even BE there and can let some little things slide, it will be the trip of a lifetime!!

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Stay at Gran Porto and once again FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: ketyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our fourth stay at the GPR and once again everything was fantastic. We return here because we feel like we are with friends and family and not just staff that are there to do there job. Capitans Freddie and Eliazar went well above and bbeyond to make us feel special even going so far as to set up our own special dining experience on our last evening. We had our own designated waiters as well who did a fantastic job (Juan and Amabiael) as well as our own chefs who made a superb meal (Marco and Rene) Thank you again - this is a memory I will never forget. Our breakfast waiters Ivan and Daniel always had our mimosas waiting for us and did everything they possibly could to see that we were very well taken care of. The pool staff is also unbelievable - Pable, Jose, Teresa and Jesus always had a friendly smile and hello and never let you go without a drink. After the first day they never even had to ask what we were drinking anymore - they always remembered. The activities team once again was fun and enthusiastic. Chicken, Ceasar, Allehandro and Amanda always tried to include everyone and make your time fun filled. The crazy game of the day I would have to say was by far the best and most fun. Phillipe at the swim up bar makes probably the best drinks in the whole resort but be careful (I think he makes them a little stronger than anywhere else!) Our housekeeper Sanna always had our room done early and it was immaculate and she always left us some beautiful and fun towel art. I cannot say enough about the staff at the GPR - they truly treat you like their friend. As for the hotel it is by far my favorite for the location as well as the size. It was a little busier for the week after New Years but there were still chairs around the pool and on the beach and no really long lines for the restaurants. Albatross, Marias and El Pescatore again delivered with fantastic food and lots of it. The beach in front of the hotel has had a major overhaul in the last year. It is beautiful for walking or taking in the rays - the water is a little rocky for swimming but just around the corner and over the peir there is great swimming. I literally could go on and on about the GPR and I am truly looking forward to next year and returning once again

Reviews.Title: “Love the Gran Porto Real !”
Reviews.Author: OParent
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1/10 - 15/2011 in a Junior Suite. 7th visit over 11 year span. Nicolas Vasquiz met us in the lobby as we exited the shuttle from the airport, (Best Day tours provides the shuttle always efficent), we were the last flight out of Charlotte during the snowstorm of January we were so relieved to arrive in Paradise ! Nicolas made us feel as if we had returned to visit family at home, his warm smile was ever present when we saw him through-out the week. Julio the bag boy was also friendly, quickly took our bags and handed us beers,(he offered anything we wanted). Our smiles were then fixed for the entire stay! Our Junior suite was ready so off we went with Julio to settle in for a fantastic week of relaxation. The resort is well maintained. The staff is constantly maintaining the resorts spotlessness .Loyda was our housekeeper and she did a fantastic job with the flowers and towel art,spotless Junior suite room as well. The food :Excellent, Fresh, and Varied.Love the Creveche ! The Albatros Restaurant recently has been refreshed and captained by Eliazar and staffed by Verlan ( who can read minds as he suprised me with a special dessert at lunch one day, ice cream !), excellent servers,Amabial, Victor and Juan Cavich . The head Chef Narcos prepared us a special private dinner organized expertly by Captain Eliazar a very unexpected romantic dinner under the stars. CAPTAIN ELIAZAR (love his smile and willingness to always see you are satisfied with the food) EXCEDED our EXPECTATIONS ! Chef Narcos stopped by our table for a short pleasant chat. to discuss the delicious sauce that was on the beef.It was a spectacular evening. More drinks than we could enjoy (but we did our best). Migual at the Tradewinds bar helped us with our Spanish and Teresa, Jesus & Pablo, Elizabeth, David, and Jose see to it that we are always satisfied with drinks . They treat everyone as if they are special not just repeat guests always chatting with the guests and sharing a laugh. Each day Mateo at the Trade Winds bar find us and provides an umbrella to keep us from getting sun burned.. The view is of beach, boats, sky, and paradise. Edwardo hands us our beach towels and also helps us with our spanish word of the day such a positive fella to be around. I have the feeling that the staff truly love their jobs and the owners give them the tools to get the job done. We will return in April for our 8th visit and can't wait. The O'Rear's from South Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: Stewartsgetaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks and had a fabulous vacation. My husband and I travelled with our 15 month old son as well as extended family. The food at this resort was great, lots to choose from, room service was very good and the Italian a la Carte was awesome!!! We always found something for our son to eat which was a concern before we left home. The staff was exceptional! They always seemed to go above and beyond to make our time there great! Eliazer Gonzalez Cruz, from the dining room, was always making sure we had everything we needed. When he would see us in the dining room he would always come to our table to ask how the food and drinks were and ask us how our vacation was going! He made a point of learning all of our names and there were 9 of us in our party!!! He made us feel like he truely cared! 2 other exceptional servers in the main dining room were Fransico and Ismael. They worked so hard at bringing us drinks refills and clearing away dishes. They also treated our son great. They were always walking by giving him high fives & bringing him juice - he just loved them!!! We also had a fun time around the pool thanks to a few members of the Sports and Entertainment Team - Alejandro and Chicken (Victor). These 2 were a blast and also made a point of learning our names!!! Everyday they would make a point of coming over to talk to us and ask how our vacation was! They had so many activites going on and they were always trying to get more and more people involved. We had a great time here and would definitely come back to this resort! We were sad to leave, after spending 2 weeks with these people we knew we were going to miss them!!!! We were treated great and would definitely recommend this resort to family and friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely staff, lovely wedding”
Reviews.Author: CaroleRandy
Reviews.Content: Thirty three of us attended a wedding held at Gran Porto Real. People stayed for 1-2 weeks and enjoyed the wedding festivities, and had a vacation at the same time. First of all, for any one putting on a wedding on the beach, come here. I can't say enough about the wedding team headed by Lilia, and including Carolina, Gustavo Mariano, Geovanni and Freddy. Marvellously organized, friendly and efficient with many lovely touches. The food at the resort is great!!! Upscale Ill Pescatore restaurant featuring seafood, pastas and such, with all the waiters we had being knowlegable and extremely professional. Another favorite was Marias and their beautiful Mexican cuisine. Magical! Kudos to the chefs for the ever changing buffets in the Albotross every day. There was something for everyone. They even prepared the fish that the guys caught during the day for dinner. We also all enjoyed Pablo and Cecelia M., and Miriam, the beach/bar servers and our Albotross dining room servers, Lorenzo, Camas, Ishmael and Sanchez (and so many others) were superb. Ma. Magdalena from the spa gives the most wonderful massages - had one in the end beach gazebo while hearing the surf murmuring on the beach. So wonderful. Manicure by Gilda also. Several of us tried the activities put on by the activity staff - water aerobics, snorkling, yoga - all really fun. All kinds of dancers, singers, salsa band, games, jet skis, kayaks, fishing, cycling and other activities to entertain us Canadians sheltering in Mexico from our cold season. Also Best Day tours can arrange tours to Tulum and many other cultural destinations. Thanks Emilio Lopez and Pamela for their arrangements and attention to detail. We booked only a standard room, and while small with basic furniture it had a lovely outdoor gallery corridor with a glimpse of the sea and great ventilation. We hardly ever used the AC. Very nice shower and moderate furnishings, but extremely clean with artistic towel decorations daily in #510 created by our cleaner, Adrianna(?) Poot. In all, it was a memorable vacation. This is not a huge resort, so it felt like home and the staff almost felt like family, which is why I have mentioned so many staff by name. Also, there was excellent security staff, who patrolled the beaches and the hotel and lifeguards who kept watch on the beach. Thanks again. The location is really great, because it is only 2 blocks off 5th Avenue which has many, many blocks of shopping and restaurants and yet the hotel seemed quite quiet. I would totally recommend this hotel to all kinds of travellers except maybe the 'spring break' types who want to do excessive noisy partying. (That would spoil the ambience of this remarkable resort). We are already planning a return trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Service+++”
Reviews.Author: Sandsculpturer
Reviews.Content: WOW!! So impressed with service that we are returning for our spring break opposed to the usual Florida trip!. Staff really represents service to the upmost level. Our days began with Ivan seating us with a smile and knowing to have your coffee and juice ready for you when they see you walk in, allowing you to venture in to the buffett to the many many breakfast choices. The chefs prepare your eggs whether its over easy or a "caliente" omelette they always have a friendly smile. The next great representation of service is receiving your towels nicely rolled and warm!. To retreat to either the pool or beach to watch the many activities that the beach of Playa del Carmen offers. Your needs are well catered for your bebida's by Jose, Pablo, Teresa, Jesus, and Cecelia. When the lunch buffett re-opens at 12:30pm the choices are fantastic. However, if Sushi is your desire the 3rd floor pool bar has that option for you most of the day. Continuing the great service is the many entertainers and bartenders such as, Amanda, Alejandro, Jesus, Chiken, Cesar, Victor, Christian and of course Lorenzo and Alejandro at our favorite pool/beach palapa bar called Gaviotas.
