While all this is going on you retire to a room at the end of your day that has been cleaned, with a tightly made bed, fresh linens, chocolates awaiting and of course the nicely laid towel sculptures. A special thanks to Andrea who took the time clean around and to lay out our things just right!!!! During our stay we were informed they just passed an inspection changing the Gran Porto Real to a 3 Diamond status. Lo Siento if we forgot anyone as the everyone was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: RVTripTip
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Check in was fine as we were the only two checking in at that time (at 10 am and got a room right away). Very nice and comfortable. Resort is small about 300 rooms so it is a nice size and is fairly quite. Everything is close. Getting around is easy and convenient. Very clean – staff were always cleaning the floors, bathrooms, etc. Great location near 5th Ave – great for walking in the evening after dinner or if you want to shop. If you forgot/need personal care items– the Wallmart is about 15 min walk (and have better prices than along 5th Ave). Westjet rep. They want you to go to the meeting so you can get your transfer voucher. As soon as I told them that I had been to the area before and had seen most sights (which I did) the meeting took about 10 minutes. I just wanted to find out about two excursions that I was interested in. Room We booked a Junior suite but they told us were the room was (overlooking the roof of the hotel) but for an extra $20 US pp per night we could get upgraded to a Junior suite with Ocean view. We looked at the regular junior suites and they faced a concrete wall over looking the service entrance to the hotel and the room didn’t seem very bright. The Junior suite Ocean view was a bit larger and had a much nicer view and the room was more airy. For those who like to drink – it comes stocked with a 4 bottle liquor cabinet. We took the upgrade but were able to negotiate a better price. Book the junior suite ocean view before leaving home (we were in Room 324 so any room starting at 322 and higher will get you a nice view of the ocean). I think they purposely have bad junior suites and standard rooms so people pay for the upgrades. Staff: Excellent service. Very curtious. No complaints Beach: Sand was beautiful. No problems getting a bed at any time of day. Rather than trees or those papalapas , the resort has these structures with screening on them. Waiter service at the beach was great. Only disappointment was the water. It was very rocky so you really couldn’t use it except for a narrow path that everyone used. If you want to play in the water you have walk to the resort next door –which was no big deal. Food: Buffet was ok (all meals). Smaller than other places I have been but enough choice. Service was good. Restaurants – only 2 a la carte Italian and Mexican. No reservations needed so you can go as often as you like. Dress is casual (even saw people wearing shorts). Both are very good but don’t have the pasta at the Italian (then again I’m fussy when it comes to pasta). The house wine is good. Very good service. If you are a big group you may want to get there as soon as they open so you can find a place together. There is always food around somewhere. The lobby snack bar is opened 24 hours. This is also the Internet room. The mixed drinks are very good and all good sizes including glasses of water (or you can get bottles of water at the lobby bar). You don’t need to bring your thermal mugs as the waiters are constantly asking if you want drinks. You don’t have time for your drink to get warm. Shows: Very tasteful. They have a dance troop that performs different dance styles every night except Sunday. They last bout 40 minutes. There is usually a small band that plays music after until about 11 pm. If you want to party there are many bars and clubs along 5th Ave. Highlights: We didn’t do any excursions this time. Walking the beach at night. It was very nice and safe. Neat to see what the other hotels do at night on the beach CocoBongo Nightclub. What a crazy and fun place. Well worth the $60. It is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Two hotel staffers (Cesar and Alejandro) walked us over and made sure we got a table and that a waiter saw us. They stayed with us for ½ hour. We took a very quick cab back at 3 am. There are taxis all over the place as soon as you come out so it is very safe. The bouncers pat down the men before going in including the hotel staff and women get they bags checked. We felt really safe and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real was amazing......AGAIN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 67pisces
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort 7 times in 4 years. Each time is absolutely amazing. We have made many friends and it feels like home. We are welcomed with open arms. From the bartenders at the pool; Aurelio and David, Jose who was covering them, and Miguel at the beach bar to the wait staff around the pool; Jose, Pablo, Theresa, Jesus, Miriam, and Margarita we hardly had to ask for a drink. Rodrigo in the buffet even remembered that I like iced coffee in the morning. The entertainment staff was as wonderful as ever. Chicken Little, Mike, and Cesar (who made a phone call for sun for me). The hotel staff cannot do enough for you and it is astoundingly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Well let me tell ya”
Reviews.Author: Turk204
Reviews.Content: They have a on line check in which are to make things quicker and that did not work at all and they did not seem to know about it. It even gives you confirmation on line that you print so when you get there you just pick up your package but do not bother. We decided to stay here for it was closer than the Blue Bay Grand in which we stayed last year. Yes it is right by 5th Ave but that is the only plus. The rooms were very nice and large, clean and modern, I had a problem with ants for a couple of days and they did not seemed concerned with my problem and finally just left a can of raid in my room which I sprayed around the perimeter of room and bathroom every day. The beach is nice and no worries about chairs for this was not a problem and beach service was excellent. Entertainment was very little and early and we thought they must expect you to go up town. The food was OK but did not even come close to the Blue Bay Grand and had the same food every day, nothing special. If you want 5th Ave night life every day this is the spot but would not stay here again and back to BBG and take a taxi when I want to go for the food, entertainment would keep me there.

Reviews.Title: “don't book a standard room !!!”
Reviews.Author: Tatt
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a ten day stay at the Gran Porto, we enjoyed our holiday but there were a few issues that people need to be aware of. We booked with First Choice and paid brochure price for a standard room, on arrival at the hotel I was horrified at the room, which was on a long corridor with seats outside the front door with no privacy and like a motel 6, it was dank and dingy with stained pillows and wooden shutters on the windows for privacy which were fiddly and heavy to close. the bathroom was virtually in the bedroom not seperated at all. the safe was like a tin box welded to the floor operated by a steel padlock. I was very disappointed and asked for a change of room, we were told we were to pay for the change and feeling shattered after the flight and transfer we payed $350 USD extra for a junior suite. This room was a vast improvement, very spacious, little hanging space and drawers, smelt a bit damp but on the whole nice. If you are thinking of booking with Thomson / First Choice make sure you do NOT !!!! book a standard room and upgrade in UK, or online to a junior suite which in my opinion should be the lowest grade room available, otherwise you will be forced into paying more money for a decent standard room. On the whole a great location, staff were excellent especially Lorenzo in the buffet and Pablo on the beach bar who does not stop running for drinks all day !, thanks Pablo for the mudslides and mojitos.

Reviews.Title: “The staff customer service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: debbie19540228
Reviews.Content: The service and food in the buffet restaurant, The Albatross, was very good, especially the cooked to order omelettes. We appreciated the excellent service of Ivan and his co-workers. The a la carte restaurants, Mexican and Italian, were very good and the service again exceeded our expectations. Jesus was our favorite server for several evenings.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Cannadeza
Reviews.Content: We upgraded from Real Playa del Carmen Resort to Gran Porto Real and it was a good move for us, spending the last 5 nigts there..The staff Claudia,Erika and Victor made our vacation memorable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION,GREAT STAFF,TRUE VALUE IN THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: replicas11355
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled with my wife, mother-in-law and wife's aunt to this hotel for 5 nights. We absolutely loved this place. There really is nothing bad to say. The location to the downtown pedestrain walk is truly close. Had elderly women that did great going and returning. The food at the hotel was very satisfying. I am a difficult eater and really had no problem. Actually the food exceeded our expectations based on previous reviews we read prior to going. Visited Cancun and was able to eat and hangout at sister property, which was a nice bonus. The wait staff are at your beck and call for all your needs. Room service was great with the understanding of Mexican time. My sincere complements to the following staff: Tilo and Gabrier(Bellboy's),Verlain and Floencio(Server's Albotros rest.), Fabian, Aurelio and David(Gaviotas Beach Bar), Isreal and Rannro(?)Sherly(Hostess Buffet) and Lorenzo,Alejandro,Ventura,Nairo Bee(Gaviotas, Bar). I wanted to say a special thanks to a couple staff members that went above and beyond expectations: Virginia(Hostess Maria's Resturant) and Manuel Balum (Head Waiter, Maria's Rest.). Finally, Lordi Delaluz,(Front Desk).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honey Moon”
Reviews.Author: iegm
Reviews.Content: Great service at the Bar Gaviotas. Lorenzo is the funniest and most talented barman ever. He served us drinks we had never heard of. The rooms were great.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: linric
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real for one week and really enjoyed it. The staff absolutely go out of their way to help in any way they can. They are always cleaning and checking that everything is going OK. Food was great. The location was near 5th avenue - you can walk there in a few minutes. We never go back to the same location a second time but might consider going back here. We had an oceanfront room. We could sit on our balcony and enjoy the view of ferries going to Cozemel, the beach is nice to walk on. If you want to swim in the ocean, there is better swimming infront of the Royal which is next door.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: veresk1003
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Grand Porto Real with our two children ages 2 and 7 months and we had a fantastic time! We stayed in a family junior suite that had bunk beds with a trundle bed which the two year old loved sleeping in. It was all one room but we had a balcony that we could sit out on after the kids went to bed. We had a great view overlooking the pool and beach but the downside to that was that it got noisy at night with the bars and the dance shows. Luckily our kids slept through them but the noise might bother older kids. The room was clean and the housekeeping staff did a great job every day. To a person, every staff member at this resort was friendly and helpful. They were kind to our kids and made us feel comfortable and welcomed. This resort is very family friendly, there were lots of kids around and people (guests and staff) were understandable about kid behavior. Unfortunately we only ate at the buffet because of the unpredictability of the two year old but the food there was good-there was a lot of variety and always something that was made fresh. Our daughter loves fruit and she was in heaven-eating tons of watermelon, pineapple, and cantaloupe at every meal. The guacamole was fantastic- our baby son loved it! There was always food being served somewhere which was great for snacks and early toddler meal times. We liked that we could take food out of the buffet to the room or the pool and no one minded. Room service is also included but doesn't start until 8 am. We spent all of our time by the pool or on the beach and loved being so close to the hotel. If the baby needed to eat or the toddler needed a nap, our room was right there. We also enjoyed being be able to order drinks whenever we wanted them. The entertainment staff was very friendly and enthusiastic. Our daughter liked joining in the water aerobics class. The beach does have some sandbags on it but that didn't bother us too much. The ocean is beautiful and clear and pretty shallow for a while out, you do have to watch your step because there is coral and rocks on the bottom. We really liked how the hotel is close to the town, especially because we had to buy shoes for our daughter the first night we were there and we easily walked to Mega, a Mexican Wal-Mart. We also walked around Fifth Avenue a lot which is the pedestrian street with stores selling touristy stuff. I used the fitness center in the hotel and it was small but had two treadmills and there was always one free. There is a kids club where you can leave children over the age of four. We went there with our kids and the staff was really nice to them and had things for them to play with. It was a good place to go when the kids needed a break from the sun or we had some time to kill before a meal. All in all this was a great vacation, we loved this hotel and would highly recommend it for families with young children. Next time we're bringing along the grandparents so we can enjoy it even more!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, generous, hard working staff, and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Bazinga1686
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and we booked through Westjet vacations. We did not know what to expect, but the photographs of the Gran Porto Real looked fabulas. We were not disappointed. The staff at the Gran Porto Real, West Jet Vacations and Best Day Travel bent over backwards to ensure that our holiday was everything that we had hoped for. The staff at the Gran Porto Real did everything possible to make our vacation enjoyable. The staff were very friendly, generous and hospitable. The Gran Porto Real was very clean. If a customer spilled anything there was always a staff member by quickly to clean up. The staff organizing activities were very engaging and helpful. Our room was spacious and clean. We had some minor plumbing problems, but a call to the front desk had a maintenance person up quickly to do the repair. Our daughters found the mattresses on the hard side, but to tell you the truth it did not affect our sleep. The food at all of the restaurants on the resort was excellent. We are already talking about returning to Mexico and would not hesitate to recommend this resort. This resort is ocean front, so great access to the ocean. It is also just a block away from Fifth Avenue, the pedestrian market in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “A great winter get away at wonderful hotel resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaHawkeye
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our 5th one week stay at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen and plan to return next January. We have never been treated better at any other hotel. At the front desk Enrique Gio did everything to make sure we got a room that was just what we wanted. Thank you so very much, Enrique! The room was perfect. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job of taking care of all our room needs. The Gran Porto Real provides all the amenities any guest would desire. We enjoyed the beautiful beach/pool, restaurants, snack bars, and lounge area. A big plus is the cleanliness of all these areas. My wife enjoyed the spa and the care provided by Ana Clemeute. We have been impressed by the accommodations made for families and young children. Our experience at the Gran Porto Real has always been remembered for the great food we have eaten at the restaurants. We have enjoyed the Albatros and its buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Our servers have always been so friendly. We would like to thank Ismael and Franasco for their great service this year. Our day always started out with a bright and cheerful greeting from Shirley the hostess at the Albatros. Gran Porto Real is a beach front hotel that is within walking distance of the Fifth Avenue shopping district and the ferry access to Cozumel. We would highly recommend the Gran Porto Real to any vacationer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: windowpane
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. The location was excellent, only one block from 5th avenue, the major market street. The food was also great. The buffet was switched around daily, giving a lot of variety. The two a-la-carte restaurants were also great. The only downside is that the beach is fairly rocky once you get in the water, so you have to watch your footing, or weave around the rocky areas when taking a dip. Other then that, the service and everything else was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real-something for everybody-kids, teens, adults”
Reviews.Author: ndbpsy
Reviews.Content: We move to Gran Porto after we stayed at Real Playa (hotel from hell as we called it). What a change... Kids club: WOW. My 4 y.o. loved it. All the girls were so good, Dulce, Georgina, Nelly, and Diana (you just want to take her back with you). I was never worried, and that is just priceless. Whenever your child ask for you, they bring him/her to you. Service/waiter: the best of the best: Pablo. Jesus was good too. Retaurant: WOW. eat both at the 2 restaurants and at the buffet. Everything was amazing. One day, I met the chef and I was telling him how much their arroz con leche was good, and I had an upset stomach, so he told me that he would make the arroz con leche the next day and if I did not feel better, he could make me a chicken noodle soup for lunch or supper, now, that's outstanding client service. We were there for the 24 of december and we had amazing lamb chops. On our last day, they had sushi for lunch and dim sum at night. I gained 3 pounds...in 2 weeks :-( One conept Gran Porto understand better than most resort: you DON'T NEED reservation for the restaurant, and that's a BIG PLUS. I wish resort would understand when you are on a holiday, you do not want a schedule. Maria's is Mexican and Il Pescadore is Italian, both excellent. At the italian, they have buns stuffed with cream cheese, they are Soooooooooooo good. Housekeeping was really good too. The last day we were there, there was a small explosion with fire, it was one of the A/C (condensator). Evrything was under control after 20 minutes, we did not even smell the fire (the A/C are located outside). The only reason I realized it was because my room was next to it but always felt safe. They were very efficient in handling it. Entertainment: these guys are doing an amazing job: Ceasar, Pollo, Amanda, Alejandro, Manuel. My 11 y.o. went biking with them, he took scuba diving lessons, played in the Tzone (Xbox), learn how to fold towels in animals. They (entertainment) tend to speak too much spanish, but when we were there, there were some people from Latin America and Spain. I was surprised by the quality of the shows, the dancers are very good. The Dec 31 show was outstanding. The disappointment was with the beach, it has a lot of coral, however, if you do not mind walking a few minutes, it was much better on the other side of the Pier. Bring swimming shoes. One big plus: there was no trouble finding long chairs and shade. I do not recommend the standard rooms as the have plantation shutters, and although it's great for fresh air, it's really bad when you want to sleep. Sometimes they do not realize that their big charriots are making so much noise (towels, sheets, room service). Make sure you choose at least a junior suite, not to encounter such a problem. The resort's location is perfect, you're never afraid to go outside at night, you are always in busy street with lights (near standard rooms...). The weather was a little chilly the 1st week, but better on our second. I booked a massage by the beach and I did not relax at all, I was so cold ! Plus, the massage therapist was so-so. I specifically asked for a strong ankle massage, she barely touched that area. If you want to call Canada, it's really easy, there is an internet/long distance shop on the 5th, you can call for 6 pesos a minute. I absolutely recommend to get a latte at Ah Cacao, on the corner of 5th and the hotel street (can't remember the name, Constitu something), the coffee at the hotel is just really, really bad. I will never understand why you can't have real Kahlua in all resorst in Mexico...Another great thing when travelling with kids: room service, included. Definately a very good resort, especially with kids and teens.

Reviews.Title: “The best place in Playa Del Carmen - in our opinion without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: gothic1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from Nov. 4-Nov.12, 2011. My husband and I have stayed there the year before and this year we brought friends and relatives. There were 8 people in our group. We did not care about getting rooms together since some had different room requests. Check in was smooth and enjoyed the beverage while we checked in. Our room was as we remembered from the year before – plenty of room, comfortable bed and very clean. The bathroom amenities were always refreshed every day. The employees that cleaned our room were great – always had very cool towel images or fresh flowers on our bed and our refrigerator was always kept full of our favorite beverages – beer, water and pop. I wish I could have taken the shower home – it was a great shower. Everyone with us really enjoyed the hotel. There were no complaints and a good time had by all. The staff is the best – Amanda was excellent. She worked with the activities crew that kept everyone going. The activities staff are very energetic and fun to know. They keep everyone smiling. It was my sister-in-law’s birthday while we were there and Amanda had given her a cake – the cake was beautiful. Everyone in the area by the pool were able to enjoy the party. It was so kind of Amanda to do that. The waiters on the beach – Jose, Teresa, Cecila, Aurelio, Manual, Alonzo and Pablo were excellent. They always knew what we wanted and were refilling our drinks whenever needed. Alex – the lifeguard was a treasure. He was so kind and had the nicest smile. Always upbeat and always making sure things were ok in the water and on the beach. David is the bartender in the Lobby Bar during the day – he is a very nice person – he makes everyone smile. He is fun to watch as he works behind the bar. He always has a smile on his face. Claudia worked in the Lobby Bar at night – she spoiled my brother-in-law. She was a very nice lady. The 24 hour snake bar room was very nice – always had good snacks and could get any kind of beverage you wanted. We really enjoyed our Mimosa’s with our breakfast. The staff in the buffet was great – Osmar, Verlain and Eliazar were great - they would always make the sure there was plenty of champagne for us in the morning. They were always making sure everything was good The breakfast at the buffet was excellent. We had great omelets and cheeses and fruits – always too much but so fun to eat. We never did eat at the buffet for dinner but enjoyed the Italian restaurant il Pescatore. Our group really enjoyed eating there and most of the nights we were lucky to have our same waiter – Amador. He was the best waiter and was always taking very good care of us. The food was excellent too. On the nights Amador was not there we had Daniel. He was a good waiter too. If you go around 7 at night plan to wait – very popular but well worth the wait. We enjoyed Maria’s too – Mexican . Very good. Most of our time was on the beach – some would be in the sun and others would sit under the shaded areas. As said before the waiters were excellent. It is a great people watching place. The beach might not be the best in front of the hotel but a few feet down it is fine. The hotel is in a great location but the real fact is the Gran Porto Real is a very friendly and clean place to stay. The hotel has the architecture of Old Mexico – it’s beautiful, the people are happy and take great care of you. Almost all of the staff was there from the year before so you know that people enjoy working there – it shows. Thanks to all for making our vacation one we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Time Of Our Life”
Reviews.Author: sunshine02_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 week and it was pure paradise. Check in and out was extremely fast and easy, we were never hounded by timeshare people and everyone was very friendly and helpful. The first night we got a plate of fruit with a bottle of wine complimentery sent to our room. It was very nice. The rooms were cleaned in a timely manner each day and the hotel itself was always very clean. We were in room 108 which over looked the street side and it was just fine. Very quiet as we were away from the pool and bar area. It was fun to sit out on our patio area and just people watch on the street. I cant say enough about the food and all the restaurants. I dont think in the whole we week that were there that our meals were duplicated. Each day and night it was something different. I'm a very picky eater and I had no problem finding something that I would like everyday. All the activities were nice. We took the bike tour that the hotel offers each day and that was really fun, It takes about 30-40 minutes and I'm so glad we did it. You got to see area's that you typically wouldn;t see. Well worth the 30 minutes. We also took a side trip to "Xplor". It was the best thing ever. We spent the day in the caves exploring, kayaking, swimming in the caves, ATV riding and then doing the zip lines. It was the funnest day ever. The place was beautiful, clean and again very friendly. The restaurant there was like a 5 star restaurant. Well worth the money. The other thing I liked about this hotel was that it was not so big that you had to walk for miles to get to your room or the beach or anywhere. You could go out to the pool or the beach area at any time of the day and would have no problem finding seating. It wasn;t like you had to race out there and put your towels down on chairs at 6 am. big change from other hotels we have ever stayed at. By far the "real" chain of hotels is by far the best chain of hotels ever. I dont think I would stay at any other chain of hotels except "real" hotels. We also got massages and it was the best massage ever. Ana did my massage and she was fantastic. The other person that really stands out for me is Caroline. She was always at the beach area bringing us drinks. She always remembered everyones drink and never forgot them from day to day. She always had a smile on her face and was very friendly. We cant wait to go back there again,

Reviews.Title: “The food and service at the all inclusive restaurants was incredible.”
Reviews.Author: willgoede
Reviews.Content: Our entire stay was great, the hotel was beautiful and the staff were very hard working and helpful, which made for a week in paradise. The thing that my family was most pleased with was the service at one of the all inclusive restaurants right next store to the Gran Porto Real. The restaurant is called Maria's. Our waiters, Domingo Rene, Elias Daria, and Tito Fabian gave us service that we have never seen in the US. They took so much pride in their job and were so friendly. Specifically Domingo Rene, who we started asking for by name when we went to Maria's, did an incredible job.

Reviews.Title: “two weeks wasn't long enough...”
Reviews.Author: bradnoel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned(Jan7) from a two week stay at the GPR.. We absolutely loved it!! The food, service and staff were completely amazing. If time and money were of no consideration we would have loved to stay another two weeks!! My husband, myself and our two kids (ages 2 and 5) completely enjoyed our stay most definitely will visit again. There were certain staff members that really made our vacation amazing. Chicken and Ceasar were the main entertainment staff that we had interaction with daily. They made our kids feel like they were the most important kids on the resort... I have to say that they seemed to have this rock star effect on all of the kids staying at this hotel. Chicken, Ceasar, Amanda and Alejandro also made us, the parents, feel very welcome and made a point of chatting with us each day. My little guy has been pretending to be Chicken since we got home. The kids club was totally amazing and I was very skeptical about kids clubs prior to this vacation. Diana treated our kids like they were her own and they are still asking for her. The other ladies in the kids club were also exceptional - thank you Dulce, Nelly, Alejandra, Gina and of course Diana you made it so that my husband and I could also relax & enjoy our vacation. Laura at the front desk was very helpful and satisfied every one of our requests professionally and promptly. Astrid the concierge was very helpful and thorough and completely reliable. I will say that most of the staff made a positive impression on us.They all work very hard and we certainly appreciated all of their efforts! We have travelled on two week vacations before and have been totally ready to come home by about day 12- not this time, not even a little bit. This was a fabulous family holiday and we can`t wait to go again - soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Noon_family
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this resort! Traveled with my family (4 adults). The food was amazing at the Mexican and Italian restaurants. The service was excellent, and the staff was so friendly. The entertainment staff kept you entertained if you wanted to go on a free bike tour, water polo, beach volley ball, taught you free Spanish lessons every day, water aerobics ect or they just let you chill out. Within a 5 min walk to 5th Ave where all the nightlife, restaurants and shopping is. The resort isn't so big that you have to take carts to get places, everything is within a couple min walking distance. We stayed in a princess suite with a full ocean view that was amazing. The nightlife sound does travel though, and it was difficult to sleep at times with all the base coming from the clubs. Want to give a shout out to my favorite staff members Claudia at the front desk was very nice and accommodating, Lorenzo "the roadrunner" in the buffet restaurant was the best waiter I've ever had. Veronica our house keeper left out room very tidy and left us fresh cut flowers and towel decorations in swans, elephants, and fish every morning. Also have to give a shout out to the hostess in the mexican restaurant Virginia for being so pleasant and the waiter Manuel Balam for his great service and hilarious sense of humor. All and all it was an amazing trip thanks to the amazing staff at the resort. Thanks again :) Canadian Family

Reviews.Title: “it was our most great vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: Dezireh
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we ever had! it was clean, great food and nice people! the locations is great, drinks nice en beautiful place to stay. special thanks to eliazar, victor, juan and chefs marcos en rene from Albetros buffet restaurant! they give us a private dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Best thing about it was the service.”
Reviews.Author: laurenleeski
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was it's staff. In case the hotel managers read this I'd like to mention Capitan Edgar Ruiz from Albatros Restaurant, Delia from Pescatore, and David- the lobby bartender. Each of these individuals were exceptionally great to us. This hotel has the most accommodating, friendly staff of any hotel we've stayed at in the Riviera Maya (and we've stayed at 10). So, the rest: Food: AWESOME! We went back to Pescatore 4 times! We loved it that much. There are only 2 a la carte restaurants- Mexican and Italian/Seafood/Steak- but they were so good, with so many choices that it wasn't at all boring. We tend to be food snobs and we absolutely loved our meals here. The buffet was good, too. It's not very big but They cooked a lot to order so it was just the way we liked it. One day I wanted Pizza (it wasn't at the buffet, so Edgar brought me one with the toppings I liked. He was great! Drinks: Many premium drinks with no extra charge. Great Bartenders. Beach staff brought drinks as often as you wanted them. Beach: Beautiful, of course, it's Playa del Carmen. There were Catamarans and boogie boards for us. We liked that. For some reason there were a lot of sandbags along the shore. Activities and Shows: There was always something going on. I enjoyed a Spanish Lesson and Bike Tours. Rooms: Here's my only complaint. The Room was nothing like I expected. It was not a terrible room but, I had seen photos on the website of a beautiful room with nice decor and plenty of space and this was NOT it. Granted we did choose the Standard Room and we could have upgraded but, the difference in looks and accommodation was just ridiculous. I expected a King bed- we got two fulls. I expected a tub- just a little shower. I expected a private balcony- it opened to public (but open air) hall. More than anything, I expected it to look nice and it just really really didn't. It looked like They had a bunch of left over decorations from redoing other parts of the hotel and just stuffed them in their. The bedside table , for instance, was literally one of the cement umbrella stands from by the pool with a table top put on it. There was this hideous sponge paint all over the walls and the ceiling that looked like someone vomited in a pattern. All that being said, the rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and there was a nice, new TV. Location: We usually stay further south where the hotels are away from the city and spread out into the jungle with long beaches. This was different for us but we really enjoyed being in the city. It's only a couple of blocks from 5th avenue, which was really fun. We went out almost every night for crowd watching and shopping. There were plenty of clubs if we wanted that sort of thing, too.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real - Awesome Hotel/Service, but front desk staff need work!”
Reviews.Author: FitMom68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a two minute walk from the popular 5th Ave in Playa Del Carmen. Its a gorgeous hotel with amazing staff with exceptions of the front desk. Not at all accommodating, not even a little for the amount that you pay. We booked with West Jet Vacations and we were shorted one room. We tried to explain this to front desk and they said they would contact West Jet. they said West Jet could do nothing for us, but when we returned we learned they didn't even contact them at all. There really isn't anyone in charge there. They tried to push you to upgrade if you don't like your room and even though it was low capacity they would not accommodate us whatsoever. Terrible experience with the front desk. The rest of the staff A+++. The pool is nice and big and so is the beach. However, the beach is not your typical walk out to sea. It has a bit of a drop and then lots of plastic on the way down with huge rocks. The food was amazing all around and so were the drinks if you give them a little tip. They have an amazing gym there too. If you walk to your right on the beach and down about 5 minutes you will be able to get a nice massage right on the beach $ 25.00 for one hour. If you head out to your left you will get to Mamitas beach where at the time they had a huge Jazz festival. All in all this was a great hotel to stay at. I would give it a 3.5 star due to the small average rooms and rocky beach.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous vacation at my second "home".”
Reviews.Author: Tobysmom08
Reviews.Content: Our family spent New Years Eve with the wonderful staff at the Gran Porto Real Resort and had an absolutely fabulous time. The staff went all out to make sure the evening was a night to remember - music and food were great, with champagne at midnight, and dancing as long as we wanted. The beverage servers, Teresa, Elizabeth, Claudia, Margarita, Pablo, Jose, and Jesus, as well as the restaurant waiters, Mora, Verlan, May, Ivan, Rodrigo, Lorencio, Matteo, were always very attentive to our needs, and the captains, Eliazar, Sherly, Freddy and Nairobe were very welcoming every time we met. Jordi at the reception desk was, and always has been, extremely accommodating to any request we made. It truly is our second home.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, average food, twin beds”
Reviews.Author: Jeff154913
Reviews.Content: On paper this hotel looks really good - five stars, central location, nice pictures on the web, good reviews. Reality is a lot different however. It might be rated 5 stars, but the location is 1 star, the food is 3 star at best, and the front desk staff are unable to make even the simplest decision to satisfy a customer. Our air conditioning did not work when we arrived and in order to change rooms for the night they wanted to charge us initially $80pp to `upgrade` because there were not more rooms at our class available. Really, your A/C doesn`t work and we owe you more money? We did get a different room and did not pay for it, but only after a lot of arguing. Is the $80 really worth upsetting a customer? Management needs to empower their front desk staff to make small decisions like this. How can a `five star` resort have only twin beds!? Yes, they do have king size as an option, but with 2 small children we needed 2 beds and the option was 2 twin size. We did eventually get switched into a family suite, but this still had 2 twin size and a bunk bed. The kids liked the bunk beds, but my wife and I slept in seperate beds as 2 adults in a twin size is less than comfortable - and we are 2 skinny, fit adults! `Ocean front` is missleading in some cases - yes you might face the ocean, but if you are on ground or 2nd floor then half of the hotel is behind the pool and the view to the beach is very restricted. Also, facing the pool and beach might sound nice, but when the evening show starts at 8:40 to 9:40 ity is not as nice. The shows are average, but with the hotel wrapping around the pool even if you do not want to watch yu will be forced to listen if you are in your room. It was very loud and our kids usually go to bed between 8:30 and 9pm. Right at show time. Aweful. On the topic of noise and sleep..... The `Blue Parrot` beach bar and disco is about 400m down the beach and the loud bass starts at 10pm and continues until 6am every single night. Makes for a noisy unpeaceful sleep. Worse than aweful. The buffet was average at best. Display and presentation were barely above a cafeteria, selection was limited. Not even close to `5 star`. The a la carte restaurants are Mexican and Italian. Both are quite good, but after 7 nights and trying to avoid the buffet they got boring. You can use the 3 restaurants in the sister resort across the street, but it is a $40 - $80 per person per night upgrade. Bottles of wine at the a la carte are extra charge and way too expensive. Real Club people for the members were very good and helpful. Willy was awesome. The timeshare concept they use is actually very interesting in its structure, but with the location of the resorts I would not consider it. Also interesting how the prce went from about 70k to 4k in the period of half and hour...... Pool water is cold and `hanging out in the pool` was not an option. The kids played in it quite a lot, but had to take a break every half hour or so to get out and warm up. How hard would it be to maintain a more comfortable temperature? It is the tropics is it not? Beach was good, nice sand, nice shallow area with a breakwater to reduce waves for the kids. Kids club was good for 2 - 5 or 6 years old, but over 6 years they would be bored. More of a babysitting service than a `kids club`. The hotel itself was quite nice - marble floors, clean, spacious, nice to look at. Maid / room cleaning staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the trip!”
Reviews.Author: Plasticman4U
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after the problems we had heard about, and all the armed security made me wonder at first, but the friendly staff everywhere in the hotel made us forget about any concerns! WestJet travel arranged for the bus to and from airport, and the company contracted gave us an intro as to what and where to go, where to shop, tours that were available etc. We went down 5th avenue and enjoyed shopping- no big pressure, and the cleanest street I've ever been on!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: KarenfromKalkaska
Reviews.Content: Security was awesome felt very safe! Hats off to MIgel and Segridad. Miguel Balam, not sure if they are the same person, but appreciated their service and presence in and around the resort!!! Thank-you Victor Manuela Notario was also of help and deserves the same credit! Appreciate his service and presence in and around the resort as well. Thank-you!!! And to all the bartenders who worked the outside pool area during our stay Dec. 9th through the 12th of 2010. Too many to mention, but they deserve credit for putting up with all our roudiness, a BIG THANK-YOU TO YOU ALL!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent atmosphere due to outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Canada794
Reviews.Content: First let me state that all staff at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen have been very pleasant to deal with, but worthy of special mention are those with which we had daily encounters and which have provided us with pleasant and exceptional service. At poolside, (Gaviotas Grill) exceptional service was provided by Carolina who was always upbeat, smiling, and who made every day quite a bit more pleasant by remembering everyone’s first name and by recommending exotic drink, but our favourite was definitely the Mango daiquiri. All pool staff, Jose, Tere, Mari and Margarita were extremely pleasant to deal with. During our stay, we had dinner three times at Maria’s and the food was excellent. But again it is the pleasant and great service provided by the restaurant staff which made our evenings so enjoyable. Responsibility for such great and pleasant service rested with Alonso Lagaro Arias which on every occurrence ensured that everything was perfect. Special thanks to Fabian or Labian who was in charge of the restaurant and who provided us with good food and wine suggestions and provided us with a special treat on our last visit. Thanks to our waiters Domingo, Pascual and of course special thanks to the restaurant chef Marco for such great meals. Special thanks to Lorenzo, Verlan, Freddy and co-workers Camas and Sanchez which provided the service at the Albatros restaurant morning and noon. Lorenzo’s great smile, cheerfulness and excellent service got us all into a good mood to start the day. Finally, a memorable moment was provided by Samuel and his co-worker Victor, when specialty coffees were requested. The show that Samuel put on for us, and which was much to the delight of other restaurant clients, is unforgettable. We still proudly describe the event to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “ONCE AGAIN GRAN PORTO REAL TREATED US LIKE ROCK STARS”
Reviews.Author: THEONLYMRSHOLLYWOOD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had yet another AMAZING vacation at Gran Porto Real. We were there for 10 wonderful days 11-25-10 to 12-4-10 to celebrate our 12 year wedding anniversary and a belated birthday for my husband. The AMAZING staff at GPR once again exceeded our expectations and treated us like ROCK STARS!!! Our anniversary was so nice, we had a special table set up on the grounds by the pool and an AMAZING dinner prepared by Chef Rene who is a GREAT chef and friend. Chef Rene and Chef Mauricio took top notch care of us our entire stay. We get the same beautiful ocean front jr. suite everytime and it did not disappoint, the view was BEAUTIFUL. Our maid took excellent care of us and made towel art for us everyday. The food was wonderful as always, and the drinks never stopped flowing, ha! I can't say enough great things about this hotel, we are never disappointed. I want to make sure to metions some of the OUTSTANDING staff: Felipe Contreras (3rd floor pool bartender and dear friend and best bartender ever); Cinthya Ortiz Estrada (General Management Asst. you took great care of us) & her boss Lynn De Repentigny (General Manager); Carlos Melgar Orellano (Front Desk Manager) thank you Carlos you took great care of us; Nicholas Vazquez Cuevas (front desk); Chef Rene & Chef Mauricio (you both took wonderful care of us); Elizar (Capitan); Teresa, Jose, Jesus & Pablo (beach waiters); Jose, Lorenzo & Miguel (beach bartenders); David (lobby bartender); Miriam (lobby waitress) and the entire staff at GPR you all are the BEST EMPLOYEES ANYWHERE!! We miss you all and can't wait to come back! Thank you so much for all you do! Debi Michalowski Dallas, TX

Reviews.Title: “Great but lousy check in team”
Reviews.Author: f104jet
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great except the front desk team. We loved the hotel, staff, beach, sun, booze, and the food. However when we checked in we were supposed to be in a Junior suite, but they had us in a Standard room, which was too small for three people. The room had no place to put your suitcases, so we asked to have our upgrade that we should have gotten, and we got the royal runaround and ended up paying $500 more for the upgrade.Once we were in our Junior Suite everything went fine from then on but having to deal with the front desk manager left us with a very sour taste towards the resort. The Bell Staff, was fantastic, the waiters, and waitressing staff was great. the Bartenders were phenominal, the maids were courteous, and friendly, even the Maintenance staff that we talked to were nice. Security was tight, store staff were friendly and knowledgeable, and the entertainment staff was great too. We take our hats off to you all, except the front desk manager. Christmas at this hotel was fun as well as entertaining. Oh yeah the swim up bar pool was freezing, because it spends most of its time in the shade.

Reviews.Title: “I dare you to try to find something that isn't awesome about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: connormckee13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely awesome! The food is great, from the buffet to the fancier restaurants that are all included in the all-inclusive package. The bars were great, and Jose Ivan and Lorenzo Avila took great care of us at the pool bar. Inside, Claudia was always super friendly and always brought us drinks (which is the first thing that happened when we arrived at the hotel). To top it all off, Freddy Capitan, one of the managers, was constantly checking in on us and making sure that we were having a great time (which we were). The beach is pretty nice, as are the water sports (which are included in the all-inclusive package). The water is a bit rocky, but better than other resorts that I've been to. You also can't beat the location. While many of the resorts in Playa Del Carmen are further away from the city, the Gran Porto is only a 5 minute walk down the beach from the heart of the city. We were able to quickly and easily get downtown to go to the Blue Parrot and Coco Bongo, which we attended many times. I can't recommend this hotel enough, and I will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME-Like the 8 previous stays”
Reviews.Author: thesolking
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Gran Porto, the lobby was pretty packed. We were pulled out of the crowd and givin a private check-in. Pretty cool. We were givin the same room we always stay in. EVERYONE remembers us everytime we go back and this time was no different. Except some days it seemed as we had a security guard close watching over us. Yeah we felt pretty special. We were there celebrating our 12th Anniversay and it couldn't have been better. Filipe(3rd floor bartender) and Chef Rene made our Anniversay and the entire stay so awesome! They always go out of their way to make our stay the best it can be. We know most of the employees and brought alot of them gifts, which were very much appreciated. Beach and pool waiters won't dissapoint. Pablo, Jose, Jesus, Teresa, and the rest are the best we have ever seen. Drinks were brought to us every morning on the beach at 9:30, whether we ordered them or not. We have stayed at over 20 different All-Inclusive resorts and this by bar the best one. Chef Mauricio and Elizar always made sure we were happy. All the restaraunts were great as always, even though we had many special meals prepared for us that weren't on the menu. Every meal was unbelievable. Bartenders, Miguel, Brandi, Lorenzo,and David were as great as everytime. The front desk staff and Mangement went above and beyond to make our stay the best it could have been. At check out the front desk girl referred to my wife as the famous Debi, 'cause we knew the management and so many others there. It was pretty unbelievable. There are many more wonderful employees I haven't named but will next time. There were so many places in town we wanted to eat at, but the chefs at the Gran Porto always made us whatever we wanted. Try getting that anywhere else. There were weddings almost everyday on the beach, yet the staff still made us feel very special everyday of our 10 day stay! We can't wait to go back! See you guys soon! PS Dear Tripadvisor, I have done a review on this resort a year ago, so if you need to get rid of my old review and post this one please do. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: iheartshoes21
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real from Dec. 20-25. We are a family of 4, my sister and I being in our 20's and my parents. We were very comfortable in the Ocean view junior suite we booked but had to move after the first two nights due to the birds in the lobby chirping all night long. Our first room was above the lobby on the 3rd floor - we then moved to the second floor away from the lobby and it was an equally great room, but no birds. The beach does have some erosion issues but they were actively trying to fix it during our stay, this didn't bother me by having some sandbags in a concentrated area. There were other parts of the beach that were in great condition from their hard work. We were at the beach every day - that's what I go to Mexico for! My parents did the bike tour the activity team offers twice and had a great time, my Dad took a Spanish lesson, my whole family went kayaking, all at no extra costs. We also had a great time just laying on the beach and having the amazing beach bartenders bring drinks - thanks to them! The buffet was always changing and I've stayed at a few other resorts in the Playa area and I must say this was one of the best I've had! In the morning they always had a ton of juice options which my mom loved, we tried cactus juice for the first time! :) My sister and I are big Iced coffee lovers and when requested they would make it for us special, Dion was the best - and always offering some baileys - that's the way to start the morning! The specialty restaurants were delish we ate at both twice during our stay. I loved the rolls filled with cream cheese at the Italian place - yum! The food was great and a nice variety in the menu. The swing bar on the beach was a great time in the late afternoons to get out of the sun a bit, watch the sunset and socialize. The resort is very close to 5th ave. we walked there a couple times during our stay, always love the shopping and walking around! It was a wonderful family trip and I would go back to the GPR anytime! http://stylemecheaply.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service, Accomadations and People at this Resort!”
Reviews.Author: rje123
Reviews.Content: I could go on and on about how wonderful our family vacation was at this resort hotel. The service was top notch, the food was superb and the staff are some of the most friendly people you'll ever meet. Eveyone who works there has smiles on their faces and are more than willing to go out of their way to make you feel confortable. Our favorite bartender was Miguel who tended bar right on the beach and our favorite waiter was Jose Lopez who was at the restuarant called Ilpescatore. We will definitely be back and soon, I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest service ever”
Reviews.Author: Collette61
Reviews.Content: It was a last minutes planned trip for me thanks to the Hines group for asking me along on their special trip. It was the all great service and a fun and most relaxing time. Thanks to all the staff and room services they were great. All the special treatment and cakes and entertainment was great. A special thank you to the lobby bar and Nicolas and his staff for the great time.

Reviews.Title: “definitely we'll come back...”
Reviews.Author: adolfo60_11
Reviews.Content: The food and the service were very good.The staff made us feel at home.They were very warm and attentive.The location was excelent because the fifth avenue was just around the corner where we found a great variety of restaurants,bars and shopping stores,the night life was very vibrant and the most important of all we felt safe.It was a memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “My first time in Mexico, WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: luke870
Reviews.Content: I have never been to Mexico, and my wife's family decided to celebrate her Grandparents 55th wedding anniversary down there. I was very nervous, but right from the begining I knew it would be a great trip. Nicolas, the manager met us with a smile and was extremely helpful and accomadating!! The Gran Porto Real was very clean and inviting!! Miriam was a great waitress and was always smiling! There are three main restaurants there. The first night we went to the Buffet. Eliozor (Elijiah), the captain was wonderful and helpful. The morning waiter Verlan always greeted us with a smile and my two month son loved him!! He was always on op of keeping our drinks filled and busing our table, and kept my son smiling too!! I always made sure to sit in his section. Jose, the waiter at the corner restauranwas also great!! I enjoyed sitting in his area as well. He and all the wait staff were very put together and I was amazed at how they would be moving food constantly and no one ran into each other and they were all organized!! I was amazed at how clean and beautiful the hotel and resort was! The caribbean is beautiful and the rooms are great!! I'm very happy this was my first experience in Mexico and can't wait to go back!! I plan to go back to this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice.”
Reviews.Content: Great location, 1 block from shopping yet quiet beach front. Nice addition to the sand quality of the beach since our last stay. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Food is excellent with a wide variety of choices. Great from start to finnish.

Reviews.Title: “positively PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: ScottHines
Reviews.Content: From checkin to checkout, we had an excellant vacation. Thanks to Nicolas, the hotel manager,Jose, the waiter at the Italian restaurant,and all his help,all the waitstaff, for the bar, and the food service. the maid service, the whole staff, made for the most enjoyable stay anywhere. (Closest thing to heaven, without dying!!) THANKS TO ALL

Reviews.Title: “one of our favorite places to stay in the whole world!”
Reviews.Author: kknappit
Reviews.Content: WE love the place and go back often! The staff is wonderful, expecially those who were so kind to us in our Dec. stay there: Delid, David Ancona, mss. canela , claudia, mar mirian Freddy, Chicken, Antonio May, Jaime Rutillio, Lorenzo and Verlain

Reviews.Title: “The MOST fun you can have in a week!”
Reviews.Author: jroc_the_champ
Reviews.Content: This was a very enjoyable vacation. I loved the all inclusive and being able to eat and drink whatever you want. I had the most fun in the evening down at the lobby bar. Capitain Freddy is crazy and so fun to hang out with. Claudia is probably the hottest waitress ever. Mari, Ancona, Jose Ivan, Margarita, Mirium, Horacio, and Lorenzo are great, too. I liked seeing Cecilia after breakfast for my morning pina colada. The entertainment crew, chicken and alejandro, were a lot of fun as well. The maids were very funny, too. Jose, at the italian restaurant was awesome and I'm glad he told me his age.

Reviews.Title: “great getaway with kids of all ages”
Reviews.Author: jbjorkmn
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for an extended family getaway. We were welcomed with smiles and open arms. Check in went smooth, Nicholas the hotel manager, made sure all our accomodations were met! No problem - they exceeded our expectations! Food in the restraurants and on the beach was excellent. The entertainment staff was exceptional as well. They got the young and old involved with the activities! With the help of other staff membersl (including Nicholas, Eliazor, Jose, Alionzo, Mariom, Teresa, Claudia, and Victor (to name a few)) our trip was a great success and will most definately be made again. My parents celebrated their 55th wedding anniversary and the staff most made their evening one to remember. You could always find something to do. Pool, hot tub, spa (a must do!), work out room, pool bar, beach, swing bar - no matter where you were at the hotel, the service and food was fabulous! I don't want to forget the rooms, very clean filled with fresh fruit, wine, soda,water and liquor! A must go to place for families!

Reviews.Title: “Entertainment, Excitement, Excellant”
Reviews.Author: MAHines
Reviews.Content: If you want excellant activities, entertaining time, or just relaxation, this the place to go. We were never bored and Alejandro and Chicken of the activities staff made sure there were always fun things to do. Everything here is just the best. The manager, Nicholas, was so great along with the entire staff. Elizor, Jose, Theresa, Mirium and so many more were just wonderful. We look forward to going again.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DesireeMP
Reviews.Content: Our vacation at the resort was fantastic. The people that worked at the hotel were excellent, very helpful and friendly. Nicolas the hotel manager was wonderful in making sure that our vacation was going great from the time he greeted us when we checked in to the time we left. All the restaurants have excellent food and excellent service, they have a buffet that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner with a wide variety of food, there are two sit down restaurants, an Italian restaurant and also a Mexican restaurant. They have a lot of activities during the day and excellent entertainment every night. 5th Avenue is only a couple of blocks away so there was never a need to take a taxi which is really nice. Jose, Freddy, Theresa, Mirium, Chicken Little, Verlan, Elijah were just a few of the staff that really made us feel welcome. We took our 18 month old daughter with us and couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “family vacation”
Reviews.Author: mhines80
Reviews.Content: our family of 35 people just went to this resort to celebrate a 55th anniversary and our daughters honeymoon. this is a great resort and we had a blast. check-in went quickly and our rooms were clean and comfortable. plenty of room for a large group . Nicolas Vazquez was acting manager did a great job. we celebrated 3 birthdays and needed birthday cake , it was made beautifully and we had plenty of room to sit. music was wonderful as well as nightly acts. the activity guys were great and provided lots of games to keep all included. We also had 2 massages by Ana Clemente and a male massager who did a wonderful job. and they understood english which helped alot as I have back problems. would recommend this resort to anyone. wonderful place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Like dying and going to Heaven”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyJack
Reviews.Content: The service there is fantastic and the entire staff from the manager to the housekeeping staff there are so cordial and they always make you feel at home. We have been there 10+ times and always look forward to the next trip, they have become family and they make you feel like you are part of their family as well. This trip was to celebrate our 55th wedding anniversary and went down with 34 family members, what a fantastic place to celebrate. Nicolas, the manager for many years, goes completely out of his way to make sure your vacation is the best, he is so personable and generates such a welcoming feeling and that is the reason we continue to go back every year. Eliazor, Freddy, Jose, Theresa, Mirrium, Claudia, Verlan , Mary, Rene and so many others were just the absolute best, we couldn't of asked for any thing better. There is absolutely nothing that I don't like about staying here. See you in 2011!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BrandonHines
Reviews.Content: I had a great time, with relaxing at the hotel and beach area to the busy of 5th Avenue, just two blocks away with all kinds of shops and eating places. Nicolas, the hotel manager along with all of the staff went out of their way to see that our vacation was great. My roommate celebrated is 21st birthday, my uncle is 49th birthday and my grandparents their 55th anniversary and we even had cake and balloons in the lobby bar, the band played happy birthday and a special song for my grandparents and it was great!! This was my 3rd time staying there and look forward to going there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: hornetfan30
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd xmas at Gran Porto Real. It is the best gift I could ever have....to spend time relaxing with the ones I love. We spend most of our time at the beach. Thank you, Miguel, for taking care of my family! Our room was taken care of by Patricia. I looked forward to seeing what decorations would be in our room daily. She did a wonderful job. We were treated to xmas eve dinner outside....beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Best family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Mauihigirl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time! The staff is excellent. This was our 4th trip to the resort and it gets better every time we visit. Our children participated in kids club activities and had a wonderful time. A few employees that stand out are Verlan; who is an awesome server! He greeted us every morning for breakfast, always with a smile on his face. He would visit us even if he wasn't our server. The kids loved him also. Eliazor, Jose, and Nicolos were also fabulous! They each went out of there way to see that we had anything we wanted or needed. Our daily entertainment staff; Chicken and crew were also very fun. Thank you for a wonderful vacation! We can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant vacation, excellant place to stay and excellant staff.”
Reviews.Author: Joannemh37
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation and would definately recommend the Gran Porto Real to anyone. We have stayed there 10+ times and plan on going back again next year. This year we went down there to celebrate my parents 55th wedding anniversary, there were 34 of us from infants on up (we celebrated their 50th there too). The staff and manager are wonderful. Nicolas, the manager, was and has always been great in welcoming us and making sure all was going well. The staff went out of their way to make sure our vacation was great. I want to thank Nicolas Vazqez for all he did, I can't say 'thank you' enough. Thank you also to Jose, Ivan, Claudia, Mary, Margarita, Captian Freddy at the Itialian Restraurant - Captian Eliazor, Chef Rene, waiters Rutilio, Juan, Ivan, Verlan and everyone at the buffet restraurant - Mirrium, Theresa, Mari & all the wait staff at the bar and beach - and if you want a massage on the beach go see Ana Magdaluer at the Spa, fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VACATION! AMAZING WEDDING!”
Reviews.Author: hop49424
Reviews.Content: We chose Gran Porto Real for my daughter's destination wedding about one and a half years ago. We had a group of about 30 family and friends joining us. Everything was amazing! The vacation, the wedding, everything! Our room was kept immaculate by Beatrice. Lily, my daughter's Wedding Coordinator exceeded our expectations. The ceremony, cocktail hour and reception were more than we ever imagined. Our wait staff for the cocktail hour and reception anticipated all of our needs. Special thanks to: Freddy, Gerardo, Francisco, Nicolas and Horacio. They were on top of it all! Thanks! We are planning to return for a one year anniversary party celebration.

Reviews.Title: “best holiday i have ever had”
Reviews.Author: leebonaldi
Reviews.Content: the mexican people are so freindly and nothing is to much trouble this hotel had just the best service it posible to get, The staff service while lay on the sun bed on the buitiful white sand you never had to get off the sun bed to fetch a drink we had a waitress called caroline who just never stopped checking on our needs quite outstanding and always with a smile,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome accommodations, best food & service beyond”
Reviews.Author: rsmaui08
Reviews.Content: We had the best time on this trip. We have been to Mexico several times and this was the best and will be going back to the same hotel for sure! The food was great and the service was even better. Our room was gorgeous - we just could not ask for a better location - Gran Porto Real has it all!

Reviews.Title: “It is the perfect place to relax and enjoy. Staff are very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Abuelo1982
Reviews.Content: The events in the pool are really enjoyable and makes one meet people from all over the world. The restaurants are very good, especially the italian restaurant. Service is great everwhere you go. The bars at the beach and the pool are great. One of the best Margaritas i ever tried!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: mojonhush
Reviews.Content: My hushband and I have traveled to Mexico 10+ times, many to Cancun and this year we tried Playa Del Carmen. The area is terrific but this hotel is absolutely wonderful. We stayed for 2 weeks.We have stayed in other Real resorts but this on is very special. I must admit the people there make this superior to the others. Yes the beach is beautiful, the room excellent and super clean, the food...omg..out of this world but still it was those who you encountered everyday that really made this a very special trip and excellent hotel.You MUST use the spa rooms with the hot steam, sauna and whirlpools. The massages were the best I've ever had- Ana was THE BEST!! In the Albatros Resturant the was our "special man" Mora who made breakfast and lunch a total enjoyment-he couldn't do enough for us, Verlan too was extra special-especaily when dealing with children. In the Lobby bar area our wonderwoman was Elizabeth who isn't just a gorgeous young lady but fast, effeicent and very friendly.Fly in Maria's was another excellent server and in the Italian resturant Luis,Isreal and Gustavo were over the top in service. I truly inderstand why this hotel is ranked so high and will stay like that. We will be returning next year for sure. I do have to mention the Best Day travel group there- they pick you up at airport, other transportation and also excursions.Emillio was our rep.-wonderful job! One they recommened was the Coba Sunset. This was on of the BEST trips we took. An all day round trip to Coba, through Coba, buffet dinner (excellent) bottled water, a mayan pottery workshop were they are perserving the way Mayan pottery was made and their designs (plus you get to make something too!)& a fantastic mayan theatrical representation - in an open sky cenote! OMG the best. If you book this make sure you get Jorgee and Jose (the driver)- they were excellent. www.themayanexpress.com.The other must do day trip is Xcharete---the underground river swim is a once in a lifetime experience (at least to this 53 yr old). Loved this vacation and as I said we will return in 2011...

Reviews.Title: “I always go back!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaGal67
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from another wonderful holiday at the Gran Porto Real. It really is great place where you are extremely well looked after. The hotel is in a great position close to 5th Ave and the Ocean Front rooms we had were only steps from the fine beach, where you can walk for miles in either direction. Our room was huge and well looked after by the maid. In fact all the staff at this hotel is top notch when it comes to looking after the guests. The food at the buffet restaurant for breakfast and lunch is great, lot’s of choice and variety washed down (at lunch time!) with some very drinkable white wine. Two very good al la carte restaurants add to the choice in the evening and the fact that you don’t need to reserve in advance is great and we never had to wait more than a few minutes for a table. Add the very fine Asiana restaurant at the “The Royal” next door (which is free if you upgrade to a master suite or walkout room and 50% for other room categories) and you put the icing on the cake. All in all a very stress free, relaxing holiday with great service and great food. No wonder this was our 4th visit!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip”
Reviews.Author: kyjo27
Reviews.Content: Family of: Parents, three children ages: 16, 18, 20 Location: -It is about a 45 minute drive from the Cancun airport. Lots of interesting things to see when driving to the hotel! Would recommend just using taxis though as your transportation (if you aren't used to driving in Mexico) because driving is a little bit different there. You'll see that people don't always stop at the stop signs and such :) -It's located right by 5th Avenue! Spend time here at night, my family and I spent a couple hours down town nearly each night. Be ready to bargain! They will take both US dollars and pesos at the stores, some stores will even accept your debit/credit cards. It's a lot of fun and is a safe area, many tourists come here. You will see a lot of police men all over as well. The rooms: -My family stayed in a family suite the first night (this one wasn't ocean view or ocean front). We were disappointed in these rooms because we were given rooms with no view, only of some green turf and a wall. We talked to the front desk and they were wonderful about upgrading us to a different room free of charge the next and were very pleased about it. -They are very clean! The maids do a wonderful job and are very friendly. Just remember that these women speak mostly spanish incase you ever try to talk to them. Most of the other workers speak at lease some English. I would recommend tipping a few dollars/pesos every day per room, I think we left around 2-3 dollars in both of our rooms (you'll receive some towel art, too). We tried to leave a buck for the person who stalked our fridge daily also. You will learn that tipping is a big thing here! My parents brought about 100 1's for our 1 week stay, we definitely got through those if not needed a few more dollars. We tipped on occasion for drinks and also for meals. Food: -All inclusive includes three meals and I believe room service is not included as one of those meals, we used room service a few times and there were actually some decent food on the menu. Food was ok in general from our opinions: -Breakfast was great. There is an omelet bar, you can get pancakes made for you, plenty of fresh fruit and juice, cereal, etc. You should be pleased with this and be able to find something. -Mexican restaurant was alright. Wasn't terrible but I don''t think anyone in my family really liked anything here too much (maybe it was because of the mole sauce they put on a lot of the food, not used to the taste) . -Italian restaurant was ok. They have pastas, a couple small pizzas to eat, cesar salads etc. We chose to eat here a few times and were pleased with it.I am a picky eater and I was actually pleased with their menu. -Lunch buffet: It was decent, sometimes you'll find some odd foods and deserts to eat there though. We were definitely not overly excited with the food but could always find something. If you get the chance to eat their cheesecake at any of these places, that is very good! -Outside snack bar: Hot dogs, hamburgers, fries, chili, etc. This was kind of nice to have around, this isn't included as one of your meals. There's also a 24 hour snack bar inside that occasionally has something ok to eat in there. -Unlimited drinks! Try the mango tango :) That was our favorite. There is a menu with a bunch of drinks on there but you can always request something of your own too. I really liked lemonade smoothies with alcohol. The Beach: -Yes there are sandbags in front of the resort (because of erosion), but if you walk down a little bit to the Royal Real resort, you will find a lovely swimming area. Just remember you can't use their chairs just their beach unless you are staying at the Royal (they can use both resorts facilities). The sandbags don't ruin the view at all and if you would like to you can still swim in front of the resort away from the fishing boats. It's so beautiful- turquoise water and white, soft sand. Don't be afraid if you ever see a soldier on the beach or in town, they are there just to make you feel safe. -Water sports: There is a boy that has snorkel equipment, kayaks, etc. It is free but for he tells you he wants a tip- just a warning. -Parasailing: My brother and I parasailed with the man right out by the resort. It was 50 bucks per person. This was fun and I would recommend it! -Massages: We also got an 18 dollar massage for 40 minutes on the beach. This was just a few feet away from the resort on the beach. You could also do a 25 dollar massage for 1 hour. This was relaxing and a lot cheaper than the spa's massages. Activities we did away from the resort: -Selvatica Zipline: Do this, we did the Extreme Canopy Tour! So much fun! 12 ziplines in the jungle, then a 30 minute cenote swim. You can zipline into the water. It's about 100 bucks/adult. Check it out. -Deep Sea Fishing: We did this with Captain Rick's in Puerto Adventuras. We did 4 hours of fishing here for a pretty decent price. You can do more/less hours. We didn't catch anything the 2 hours of trolling but caught about 10 fish while bottom fishing. This was awesome! For this time of year though we would have rather just bottom fished the whole time because sailfish were a little slower to catch at this time. -Day trip to Tulum Mayan Ruins/Xel Ha: This was fun, but we would have rather not went on a tour bus so we could have done what we wanted. After Tulum we went to Xel Ha (Shell Ha), I would go here with your family no matter what age! It was about 115/adult and you could snorkle as long as you want with tropical fish including sting rays (no stingers) and fish such as barracudas and colorful fish. If you don't want to snorkle you can just sit on a tube in the water. My family loved this and can't wait to develop our water camera pictures! Such a cool, cool experience. You get all inclusive meals here too and it was decent food. You could also pay extra to do things such as swim with dolphins here, Sea Trek, and so forth. Here we needed to wear only biodegradable sunscreen so it wouldn't harm the fish, you can always buy this in Mexico but might be more pricey. *****All together my family and I were very sad that we had to leave this area and are already talking about our next trip (this was our first time in Mexico). We love Playa del Carmen, the resort was great but I"m sure we would just like to try a different resort next time. I recommend this place and am sure that you will love this resort whether you are going as a family trip or with your friends! This isn't a huge partying resort though, surprisingly didn't see a lot of drunk people hanging out. Keep your mind open, enjoy the lovely Mexican people surrounding you, and have a good time.... Maybe stay away from the entertainment at night if you want something good, but it is something to watch (mostly just dancing though). I hear Coco Bongo is a good entertainment place in Playa. *******Also, don't drink the tap water or brush your teeth with it. Restaurant water comes out of jugs and is ok and the ice they use in their drinks is also ok to have. You might have to request a few more water bottles in your fridge each day too! ******* If you need to exchange money there is a person there to help you with that by the front desk (but there are money exchanges all over 5th Ave), there is an atm with a small fee (like 4 dollars)- you will receive pesos with this machine. If you need internet you can use their computers for 1 peso/minute. ****Also, we DIDN'T have any trouble with timeshare people. Yes at the airport there were a few people there asking questions about it but all you need to do is walk by them and either ignore them or say no! So easy and not a big deal at all. At the hotel we had no idea who was even the timeshare people and to this day we still don't. So don't worry about that at all. - I will try to post some pictures on here but would love to answer any questions or show you more pictures, so feel free to email me at johnsonky@mnstate.edu

Reviews.Title: “Pablo made our trip very Enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: Washington98
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to this Hotel. We just returned home and are already planning another trip to this same Hotel. Beautiful Beach shopping two blocks from Hotel. Restraunts have amazing food and service! Pamala from restraunt greated us with a sencere smile and told us to have a safe journey home. The staff at the hotel are amazing! A few names I remember were Jose, Jejus, Pablo, Miguel-bar, Pamala. Pablo greated us every day and Miavel who worked at the bar made sure the teenagers did not have alcohol in there drinks. Amazing service you will not find anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ninny2_1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the gran porto to get married and the experience was unbelievable! we ourselves were there for 7 days 7 nights and our guests, mostly immediate family, stayed 5 days 4 nights. We were all super impressed with the hospitality at the resort! Not only on our special wedding day was everything superb, but the staff went above and beyond our second last day at the resort. Captain Nairobe organized a special dinner for my wife and right on our oceanfront porch. While we waited and relaxed in our room they came and set a special table and up for us with lights and candles, champagne and wine right outside our patio! This was our 2nd "romantic" dinner together as one was already included in our wedding package on the beach.
