I must mention the special people at the resort that made our day special and enjoyable, wedding cooridinator- Michelle, Captians- Freddy, Nairobe, also Guadalupe, Jorge, Francisco, Canela, Nicolas, and Horacio! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Reasons for there quality …”
Reviews.Author: ernestrivait
Reviews.Content: There are reasons why the Gran Porto Real consistently receives ratings in the Excellent – Very Good range from approximately 75 – 80% of its guests. My wife, Elena and I just returned from a 2 week all-inclusive stay … this was my 17 trip to Mexico over the past 25 years. Firstly, let’s look at the hotel itself. It is unique in its Spanish-Italian-European architecture … beautiful arches, with granite and tile everywhere. The layout facilitates ease and fun as the reception area moves into the lounge, garden, bar and beach …. it is closer to the water than any other hotel. In short, it is a beautiful, charming hotel of medium size with the best location on a world class beach! Secondly … food. Being extremely health and weight conscious I was delighted. Of course they had such a wide choice of chicken, fish and meat at every lunch and dinner … and so many vegetables to choose from, always beautifully spiced. However, what impressed me most was the quality of the food and its preparation … the fowl, fish, and meats were tender; the vegetables perfectly cooked … never over or under cooked. In having a sweet tooth I was most impressed with the desserts … both at lunch and dinner. They usually had 10 different choices ranging from flans to fruit mousses to chocolate cream cakes … always fresh. They were never too sweet … just right. They obviously have talented pastry chefs. In short, the food was of high quality both in content and preparation. The a la cartes were good but the Albatros, which is the main dining room was so exceptional we ate most of our meals there. Thirdly … service. This is always a deal breaker. I put this in the category of being cared for, nurtured and pampered. The hotel is rather “spotless” for they have an army of staff always cleaning before things even seen to need it. I must mention the excellent service we received with our meals at the Albatros. For breakfast and lunch Sherly was our hostess and Lorenzo Camas our server. For dinner Delia was our hostess and Jaime, Juan and Antonio our servers. We rate them all in the excellent category. Sherly and Delia were so welcoming and gracious. The servers were so attentive, friendly and always very professional in serving us during our meal. We were so impressed that they seemed to really enjoy there work and conversing with foreigners …they even remembered our names and looked forward to seeing us. The downside … just in case you think we are being too biased. The standard rooms are just that … they are adequate but have small shutter style windows with no views. For the extra money it is well worth an upgrade to a suite which is larger with terraces, views and sunlight. The evening entertainment was great … we loved the dancers … however the stage location near the pool is not great for the audience. It was much more exciting when they moved the stage into the hotel lounge on the cool evenings. In conclusion … the hotel provides an excellent service for many good reasons. Nevertheless for those world travellers it is not the “Ritz in Paris” … however you always have to evaluate what you are getting for your money. In this regard it is of excellent quality and value for the cost. And worthy of its high rating. Although we like to travel to new places I would not hesitate to return to this well managed, unique, and friendly hotel… that possessed a touch of elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Content”
Reviews.Author: Linda F
Reviews.Content: this is the first time i have ever gone all inclusive and what a treat it was. This hotel goes beyond what i ever expected. the pool staff, Manuel Balam and Sherly, everyone was absolutely delightful. the place is very clean, food amazing, sand and water unbelievable. we will be going back again and again. i highly recommend this hotel. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, the best service and we'd love to go back next year”
Reviews.Author: doug042
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary and had the best experience ever ! The service was excellent, superb, the staff just couldn't do enough for us ! They all made our special time together even more special with their friendly attitude. They would go out of their way to do extra special things for us. Captain Elizar made special arrangements for a surprise Anniversary dinner for our last evening there ! Ancona (Dabid) the lobby bartender was great...not only was he very competent at his job but so friendly and always made time for us when we had questions for him so patient when we wanted to learn some spanish ! Jesus and Pablo were so good, always there to bring us a drink on the beach...those two work very hard to make everyone happy ! Claudia, Antonio, Francisco... you were all so wonderful, sorry if I've missed anyone. Housekeeping also so very good, room was spotless with something beautiful they created for us almost everyday. We felt very safe inside and outside the resort/ beach area, the security was great. Location was the best, just a couple minutes walk and we were on 5th Avenue. We had beach front which was beautiful, the only down side was it got a little noisy at night. We could hear 'The Blue Parrot' beach club and Coco Bongo's often until 5;00 am. We want to go back next year...can't wait !!!

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!!”
Reviews.Author: neocon
Reviews.Content: Very clean, well maintained facility. Interesting Architecture. We had a junior suite facing the ocean and then a first floor suite with a cabana. We paid the reasonable additional cost for the upgrades. The staff was very friendly and accommodating; specifically Lorenzo Sanchez and Benigno Capbotones. Treat people the way that you want to be treated! TIP!! You will have more fun. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Sun,fun & relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: JamesM55Calgary
Reviews.Content: Returned for the second time and had another super vacation. The staff is the best and they make your vacation special. Spent lots of time keeping Miguel and Pablo muchos busy! Thanks also to Teresa, Jose, Antonio, Dion, Mirium, Claudia and Claudia at the front desk, Beatrice and Magnelaina. Looking forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, the staff is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: roxCalgary
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we were kind of disappointed because we got a room with two double beds instead of a king size that we booked, we were offered another room with a king, but we decided to stay in the first one. The room was clean and big. The location of the hotel is great, just steps from the 5th avenue. The food was average, but good quality, very clean, well kept, and the most wonderful staff. The Capitan Eliazar, at the restaurant Albatros, Marcelo, Mora, Lorenzo, Camas, Sanchez, Antonio, Sergio, Pablo, the girls from the Lobby Bar Claudia, Viviana ; Cecilia from the pool bar, Alejandro from entertainment... It seems to name only these people because there are a lot of faces that we don't remember the names, everyone you passed by in the hallways, counters, everywhere had smiles and their hand to their heart. It was a great experience. So thank you, thank you for make our stay so enjoyable. If there is one thing that I would say it bother us a lot was the first morning there, someone called us from downstairs. At 8:30!!!!! Saying that we had to go to get our ticket for the ride back to the airport. And when we get there, it was a presentation for the hotel across the street. We fell for it, and thats something that we have to learn for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Persall
Reviews.Content: Great service from Batender Miguel at Trade Winds Bar, Mayela at customer service, Francico restraunt, Lorenzo Avial, Brandy, Rodsigo at Guviofus bar.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service..”
Reviews.Author: 23leslie23
Reviews.Content: just spent another week at this hotel - a repeat from last year.. Many of the same people still there - which says a lot.. It's a beautiful thing to see people taking pride in their jobs.. Astrid the Concierge was incredible - above and beyond PLUSPLUS.. Lorenzo at the outside bar...WAY too good at producing 'uno mas' alcoholic concoction.. Edwardo at the towel (toalla) counter - always with a friendly smile and one new Spanish word.. and finally, Alejandro - the Games Director - Man...does this guy work, and yet - he clearly loves it..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LMP2010
Reviews.Content: Stay in the Playa area before, but was at a very large resort. so large it seemed we were always lost. At the Gran Porto it was very small and we felt like we were friends with all the staff within a day of arriving. Only one buffet restaurant but when it has such variety and good food, you don't need more. We met most evening by Delia, who was a gem and always greeted us and made us feel so welcome. She even arranged a birthday party for my Mom, where all the staff made sure she was treated royally. Bartenders usually remembered what you drank - even when the order changed at different times of the day! All in all, loved the smaller resort and would definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “THE PLACE THAT HAS IT ALL”
Reviews.Author: jcristobal
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto is a great vacation place. If you like shopping, drinking, great dining, a place to relax, a place to party or to see mexico for what it is then this place is for you. Rooms are great and people are fiendly. I have been recominding this place to all the people I have been talking to and are planning to bring my kids there in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Wedding.. :)”
Reviews.Author: cappie_girl
Reviews.Content: We booked a wedding package though the Gran Porto Real and stayed there from November 21-26 2010. This resort is absolutely wonderful, the service is top notch and as for location you really can't get any better, it's a 2 min walk to 5th ave! We were getting married on November 24th and had Michelle Madrid as our on site wedding coordinator, she was absolutely wonderful and so friendly and helpful. I had a couple special requests for our wedding such as certain music when I was coming down the isle, labels for water bottles and little diamonds to be sprinkled on the reception table and they handled it all wonderfully. The wedding center is right across the street from the Gran Porto which made it very convient to drop things off to her. I cant say enough about her and her professionalism, wonderful!..Everything went so perfectly it was like a dream! I had no complaints or concerns with this resort at all. We transfered from the Gran Porto to another resort just outside Playa del Carmen for the honeymoon which we never should have done, I would've much rather stayed right were I was at the Gran and was sad to go! The second resort didnt compare, I wouldnt hesitate to recommend this resort to anyone and would go back in a heartbeat! I'll try and upload pics later to attach, it's taking forever right now!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tlj1087408
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, very friendly people, good food and nice rooms. Extremely friendly to children. A good possibility that we may come back. Very friendly employees and especially Lorenzo during our breakfast every day. ~ Just That Little Bit More, That Which is important! We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not what they claim - definetly not a 4.5 star”
Reviews.Author: SunLover1502
Reviews.Content: Their add claims to be "located on the finest stretch of white sand beach available in one of the most beautiful areas of Playa Del Carmen". Well the stretch of beach located 20 or so meters from the resort was full of sandbags because the water was erroding the beach. For anyone who goes on vacation to sit by the pool I guess this would be acceptable, however not the case for vacationers who enjoy a dip in the ocean and to play by the shore as the water splashes in with your kids. Also their standard rooms is more of a motel style room and not to the Mexico standard as other resorts. We were transfered to another resort which was indeed a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Best Mexican Vacation yet!”
Reviews.Author: CoqYip
Reviews.Content: I've been to many different Mexican resorts over the last 20 years and the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen is the best one so far. The quality of food was excellent no matter which restaurant you went to. As a metter of fact, we preferred dinning at the Albatros which is main buffet restaurant because there was a different theme every night and the food was great. We especially enjoyed the traditional Mexican food because we couldn't get the same back home in Vancouver. Delia our hostest always welcome us with a big smile. We were also very impressed with the high quality of night time entertainment. Very morden to say the least. The Lobby bar was a great place to hang out after dinner or after the night time entertainment has completed. Our server Claudia provided us excellent service and great laughters the entire week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic in every way !”
Reviews.Author: tishy38
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, i really feel those people stayed elseware.Everybody and everything could not have been better. The hospitality was second to none ,completely worth it's stars in every way. We would recomend the Itaian restaurant as the food is superb. I have never been anywhere before, where the guest is truely put first.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth..........”
Reviews.Author: halfadimer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Gran Porto Real. This was an incredible trip. The all inclusive hotel stay is a perfect way to travel. All you need cash for is some gratuities for the exceptional employees like Pablo from the beverage service on the beach and any extra tours or activities. From Pablo to Carlos with Guest Services, the entire staff is so friendly. The hotel is in good condition, the food is delicious, the beach is beyond wonderful. A great visit for our first but not last Mexican vacation!!! From ATVs to sailing to parasailing, the activites were the perfect adventures too and the prices not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelBears
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen is one of our favorite places. The hotel is lovely, rooms comfortable, and food is excellent. But most of all, the wait staff is superb. Every person we came in contact with was friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed Dion, who works in the dining room, with his charming personality and attention to detail; he was right there whenever we needed anything. Pablo and Jesus, who works on the beach, cheerfully delivered drinks to us all day while we relaxed in the cabana. Cheryl, the dining room hostess, greeted us with her cheerful smile each evening. And Eduardo, who hands out the beach towels, was funny and engaging. One thing to note, although we had reserved a room with queen-size beds, the hotel does not have that size; Their standard rooms come with full-size beds. To get a larger bed (king), an upgrade is necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel and the staff”
Reviews.Author: twtruckman
Reviews.Content: My fifth stay at the Gran Porto. Edgar and the food serve staff were excellent. David at the Lobby bar was great and Teresa,Jesus and Jose were great on the beach and at the pool. The entertainment staff was fun and full of energy. Completely enjoyed our time spent at this resort. A good spot to relax and good central spot to explore the area. Have Ana give you a massage on the beach and feel 10 years younger. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Time Was Had By All at the Gran Porto Real!”
Reviews.Author: Maryatdesairlake
Reviews.Content: It's the 7th annual "girl's turning 50 in Mexico" trip and as always, Gran Porto Real took exemplary care of us. From the water aerobics with Cezar and Martin, to the wait staff in the buffet and restaurants, Ivan, Mateo, Pamela, Pepe & Antonio, to the staff serving beverages at the poolside and the beach, Jose, Cecelia, Jesus, Ventura & Pablo, to our favorite dance and Spanish instructor, Victor, AKA, Chicken Little...or as we like to call him, Rooster Mucho!...as well as the staff who kept our rooms clean/fresh - and I'm sorry that I can't say their names, but we were at Gran Porto from 11/29-12/4 in room 365, so that should identify them...we cannot say enough how much we appreciate the care/service we receive each year we have spent at Gran Porto Real. We are already talking about next year's trip and we're anticipating year 8 to be a great as the past 7 have been! Thank you staff at Gran Porto Real!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!"”
Reviews.Author: lilith28
Reviews.Content: We selected this resort because the price was great and we were looking to travel to this side of Mexico. We didn't expect to enjoy it nearly as much as we did - what a bonus! The location was great; one block off of 5th Avenue. Everyone was helpful and very friendly. The beaches were beautiful and one could walk for miles in either direction. Food was good; however, we would have liked a bigger selection with regard to the "a la carte" restaurants. This did not cause a problem though as we were able to discover some great restaurants and bars in Playa that were not far from the resort. Our rooms were spotless and always well stocked. We would highly recommend this resort and plan to return in the future. Thank you to all the many wonderful accommodating staff!

Reviews.Title: “Paid too much for average food and being near renovations”
Reviews.Author: Jem030
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Porto Real in November 2010 and although the hotel was nice and the staff were very friendly, I don't think it was worth the price we paid. We were in an oceanview room and it seemed fine at check in but came to realize the next day there were renovations going on above us. I had a 20 month old baby who needed to nap during the day so I think they thought that they wouldn't be bothering anyone but it made my life very difficult because it was too loud for my little one to nap. I called front desk to see if we could move rooms..I didn't even mind to be moved to a lower-grade room just as long as it was quiter. The front desk manager convinced me to not move and that the renovations would stop until we checked out, I thought the situation was looked after and felt relieved but the next day the renovations continued.. and I just was too tired to complain so just accepted it. Not sure why they would just not move us if they didn't want to stop the renovations.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: shelbyj01
Reviews.Content: This was our 8th trip to Gran Porto Real, this resort has it all for us, the rooms are beautiful, the food is exellent and the staff are eceptional. Of course we have our favorites,such as Pablo & Miguel on the beach, Claudia at the front desk as well as margarete in th elobby bar. We will continue to return to th eGran Porto year after year. It is our home away from home!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It really is paradise”
Reviews.Author: fernierain
Reviews.Content: Had a totally awesome time at this resort. The staff are genuinely kind, friendly and eager to please. Not one complaint about the stay...well except maybe it was too short....there is not a minute that you don't see someone cleaning every single part of the resort...Pool staff were entertaining and awesome..

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Party”
Reviews.Author: RedTed_10
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to spend a vacation! The Gran Porto Real has been a favorite spot of ours for years. The staff is wonderful. I especially enjoyed Ivan, Naum , Mateo, Pamela, Antonio, Rotilio, Celia, in the restaurant. Lorenzo, Jose, Jesus, Paulo, at the pool. We also had great activity leaders with Victor, Cesar, and Martin. What a great place to have a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tallie21883
Reviews.Content: I stayed together with my byfriend and parents. We had a very great time here! Everything is very clean, nice staff. They all work SO hard! Food and drinks were good, don't forget to ask for Mayan coffee as desert...really nice!

Reviews.Title: “UNFORGETTABLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: julian0007
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days with my fiance and it was truly magical, the hotel was absolutely amazing, the pool, the beach, the view was spectacular!! Particularly and what I liked most was the restaurants; the food was truly spectacular and the service and attention we received from the waiters, specially Lorenzo from Albatros was really something! The only truly negative thing about this trip is that it had to end and we had to get back to our house!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: BTStevens
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this resort and we weren't disappointed!! The resort, the food and the service were superb. Our beachfront junior walkout suite was beyond comfortable with beach access right at our doorstep. The staff were very friendly and efficient, their service exceptional. The food was excellent! We would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for value for your buck. We will definitely be repeat visitors!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, plenty to do!”
Reviews.Author: ScrapHappy44
Reviews.Content: We spent a fabulous 4 days at the Real Gran Porto! The hotel is in a great location, just a block from the main shopping. We were also within walking distance of the Cozumel ferry. The hotel was spotless! Someone was always cleaning throughout the entire hotel. The rooms were very nice, spacious, quiet. The beds were extremely comfortable. We had a family room suite with 2 queen size beds and bunk beds. We didn't have kids with us on this trip, but I would imagine kids would love the bunk beds. Our view was beautiful and our balcony was enormous! I think the service at this hotel made the trip even more special. The waiters in the restaurants would do anything they could for you. One of the breakfast waiters named May, even went into the kitchen to make me oatmeal one morning because it wasn't on the buffet that day. On the beach, Pablo was incredibly entertaining as he brought us an endless supply of drinks! He's quite the dancer! With the exception of one guy at the front desk with an attitude, every employee at the hotel always had a smile and a kind word. The beach was very nice, with beautiful, white sand. There were plenty of chairs, so that was never a problem. Plenty of shade, too, if you didn't want to be in the hot sun all day. You had to climb over some sand bags to get into the water, but that really wasn't a problem. Once you got past those, the water was calm and great to swim in. We never sat near the pool, so I can't really comment on that. It looked nice. The food was okay. We liked the breakfast buffet the most. Dinner was a bit frustrating. The choices are a Mexican restaurant, an Italian restaurant or the buffet. You could get into the buffet just about any time, but the other 2 opened at 6pm and they didn't take reservations. There was always a line and unless you got there exactly at 6pm, there was usually a wait of an hour or more. The people staying at the Real next door could use our restaurants, but we weren't allowed in their hotel. That made ours very crowded. I think they could use a few more restaurants to accommodate all the guests. My last comment is about the location. Perfect! You could walk forever on the beach. It was about a mile to the Cozumel ferry, which we did one day. It's only a block to the main street, which has some fabulous shopping and restaurants. The shopping seemed to go on and on! I would definitely stay at this resort again. We felt safe the entire time. Lots of hotel security to keep an eye on things, but we never felt there was any danger. We went shopping at night and there was never a problem. Overall, I'd say we had an amazing time and the great service at the hotel made the trip!

Reviews.Title: “paradise in playa del carmen”
Reviews.Author: mexican_at_heart64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 weeks at the Grand Porto Real what an amazing experience! From the moment we checked in we were met with delicious cocktails. The staff and service were impeccable, from the front desk to the housekeepers all very hard working. The entire staff cannot do enough, they are always there asking you if there is anything more they can do for you to make your vacation more enjoyable. There is so much to say about this little piece of heaven. the rooms are great, large beautiful and spotless, the restaurants and buffet are delicious and staff always serve you with a smile, and they are also very friendly. The entertainment team were great they all made sure to keep you involved in the fun. The Resort is next to the famous 5th. Avenue which is breathtaking to walk, shop, and for the people that like to party The night life is second to none, with clubs like Coco Bongo, and Senor Frogs. The beach is miles long with white soft sand, the Spa is out of this world, they are very professional. We also had the opportunity to meet the General Manager Miss Lynn de Repentigny and made us feel like we were talking to a close friend, and that's when we realized that her professionalism reflected on her entire staff. We will be returning very soon without a question. We recommend this Resort to anyone that needs some peace and wants to be pampered and treated like Royalty.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: Kirkcaldy67
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I have just returned from our 4th visit to the Gran Porto Real and once again all our expectations were met and exceeded. The hotel is super clean and extremely well looked after and the staff from the housekeeping to management always very friendly and efficient. Smiling all the time was Freddie, super efficient at Marias was Eliazar and we never went without a drink on the beach from the brothers Pablo and Jesus. Nothing was too much trouble for Yendaly at the front desk and she always had a smile. Carlos and Cynthia from the “behind the scenes crew” were wonderful and helped us on numerous occasions with restaurants, trips etc. All in all, a great hotel with great staff which resulted in another first class holiday at the Gran Porto Real which is becoming a bit of a second home to us and I’m already planning a return! I would recommend this hotel unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful and Memorable Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ginster1116
Reviews.Content: Each year, a group of girlfriends and I have been treating ourselves to a "Women's only-little R and R Vacation" and this year, we decided on a stay at the Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa and am I glad we did!! Our group has grown over the years with this year's trip totalling 38 of us. From start to finish, everything was superb!! We were welcomed into the lobby by a very friendly staff. The lobby is spacious and very nicely decorated. Once we checked in and found our rooms (again, very spacious, clean and lovely) we explored the grounds. The pool is tremendous with plenty of chaise lounges. I would imagine it would have been a pleasure to swim in but I never got the chance since I spent all my time at the beach which is just a few feet away....again, plenty of chaise lounges and beach barbeque right there AND the absolute best waiter in the world-Pablo!!! He made our trip complete! Wasn't even finished with my lst drink when all of a sudden, Pablo would appear to take our next order. He was a delight and alot of fun. In fact, all of the staff were very friendly and accomodating to our every need-I was impressed by how nice they were. There is parasailing, kayaking, deep sea fishing, right off your beach so there is no reason to leave the premises to look for any water sports. The resort has 2 restaurants and a buffet. We ate at the Mexican restaurant one night-very good and the Italian another night-again, very good but you may have a wait to get in. The other days were at the buffet where you'll find quite a selection--you'll never be disappointed. I was expecially fond of all the vegetables. I don't know what they put in them or how they make them, but they were delicious-I could very easily become a vegetarian eating this all day! The resort is located a block away from "5th Avenue"-shops, restaurants, entertainment galore!!! It truly is a prime location. Our stay at the Gran Porta was wonderful-all 38 of us agreed on that. Hopefully, we'll be back again next year. I would recommend this resort to anyone-there's plenty to do and see for all ages!!!

Reviews.Title: “Keeps us coming back year after year”
Reviews.Author: powelljd
Reviews.Content: Our first experience with the Gran Porto Real was for our son's wedding eight years ago and we have been back every year since. This year we brought down our whole family including the grandchildren. There was 15 all together and the staff went out of their way to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The service of all the staff was outstanding. Everyone from the servers to the bartenders to the cleaning staff and front end did a first rate job. In particular, we would like to thank Carlos, the desk manager, for accomodating all of our room requests. The Kid's Club was a great place for our five year old grand daughter. She spent countless hours working on crafts and playing games with the other children and the attendants. The hotel offers numerous free activities such as bicycle rides, kayaking, volleyball and various water sports which we all participated in. Every night there was great entertainment offered. Cabarets, fun gambing nights and variety shows were all done really well. The resort's proximity to Playa del Carmen's famous 5th Avenue was a real plus. You can do an easy stroll down the Avenue and look at the hundreds of stores selling their goods. In addition, the people wacthing is something else. On any given night there will be thousands of people walking the street. Playa del Carment and the Gran Porto Real in particular is our favorite holiday destination and we will keep coming back. John and Donna Powell Calgary, Alberta, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Simply Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Hummergrl2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spactular, Our room walk out to beach totally the best room ever. From the time we arrived till we left everyone was very nice bend over backwards to please us. But everyone has their favorites, Lorenzo the waiter from Albatros was ours , anything you wanted he would get it for you. Trade Winds bar Miguel absolutely the best , he actually went and got me nachos from Gaviotas Grill , And took our bags to front desk the day we left gotta love him. Loyda cleaned our room fantasic job every day couldn't wait to see what animal she made us.

Reviews.Title: “We found the good, the bad and the ugly by choosing the Gran Real Porto ;-)”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: The Good •The Gran Real Porto was one of only two all-inclusive resorts near Cancun that our agent could find offering rooms for three adults and 2 children. Our group was my wife, daughter, her two girls - 4 and 6, and myself. The Family Jr Suite Ocean Front was perfect for us! •Each evening there is a show and the balconies of the FJF provide the perfect spot for watching the show while the kids sleep! •The girls loved the kids club. The staff was wonderful and kept the girls entertained with games and crafts. A couple of times, we couldn't get them to swim or go to the beach because they wanted to stay at the kids club! •The pool is very nice for novice kid swimmers with shallow ledges for those who really can't swim but also provide a nice easy out for the little ones that are just learning to swim. •The activities are fun but not well attended. It seems many on vacation are not interested in salsa dance lessons, aqua aerobics, yoga or many of the other activities that we found enjoyable. This is the second resort where only one other person showed up for yoga with my wife. •The beach stretches for miles and is great for shell hunting with the kids because erosion has left a 3 foot wall where the shells are literally "for the picking". The beach on The Royal side is better for swimming and wave riding. •The food was good in every restaurant. In particular, the "made to order" stations in the buffet made the meals more like an a la carte restaurant than the buffet. The woman making omelets in the morning taught me a new and much better way to make them quickly for many people as happens in our family around the holidays. •The shopping district was very close and included all the right shops for any tourist in our opinion. •The service staff tried to be very attentive. The Bad •The restaurant selection only includes two a la carte specialty restaurants and that is not enough for the 500+ registered guests. They don't take reservations and every night was a 40-60 minute wait for a table so that the girls never ended up eating. They fell asleep at the table. •The service was good but seemed a little slow in the delivery of food and drink. The fault did not appear to be the wait staff but the rather the amount of wait and prep staff for the size of the crowds eating every night. •They offer lots of promotions like spending your last nights at the Gran Real Caribe in Cancun so you are closer to the airport. But no one at the front desk seems to know how to get you into a comparable room. We were in the FJF with 2 full beds and a bunk bed with a trundle bed. They tried to put us in a room at the Caribe with one King bed and a roll away and thought that was a good deal. •Getting our free swim with the dolphins and the half price off for the rest of the party was a 90 minute argument around the height of the kids but when we got to Dolphinaris, no one cared about the height and there were lots of kids the same size as ours! •Getting a second cup of coffee with breakfast means literally chasing the wait staff with the coffee pots down. They should just put a pot on the table! •The breakfast drink bar includes every juice imaginable as well as champagne for mimosas but no ice water. Getting a glass of ice water at the table is harder than getting a second cup of coffee and forget it if you want a second glass. The Ugly •They really want to sell membership in their "club" which is just a different kind of time share. •First they trick you into sitting down with someone to sell you on listening to the club presentation by offering you a "gold card" which gives you discounts in the gift store and on massages. This eats up more than a good hour of time that could have been enjoyed with the family. •Second they assure you the presentation and viewing of the rooms at The Royal across the street will be no more than 90 minutes. •Third it turns out to be a 2.5 hour event. The strange thing about The Royal for us was that we saw more Real Porto people being led around by sales agents than we saw guests! •Fourth, the sales agents are sleazy. My daughter found the guy selling us rude, arrogant and uninformed and she told him so. When we mentioned the issue with getting a FJF at the Caribe, he disparaged the Mexican desk staff for being uninformed because "they've probably only been working here for a week". It's not a good thing to imply that your resort has a personnel turnover problem or that the staff are not bright. Bottom line: we thoroughly enjoyed our vacation, the pool, the beach, the food, the drinks, the trip to Dolpharis, our room but we all agreed that we would a) never go to another Real resort, b) never go to a resort that also sells time shares or "club memberships", c) never go to an all inclusive with only 2 premium specialty restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The best service from staff anywhere I have every stayed”
Reviews.Author: RTaylor82
Reviews.Content: David in the lobby bar was my favorite bartender, Lorenzo in the buffet restaurant and also Benito in the buffet restaurant were all exceptional. House keeping was amazing and we were very happy to have the level of service we did. Benito even went as far as to help me with where to buy Don Julio tequilla and which type gave me directions to the store and everything. it is always nice to get a locals opinion. I would recommend any and all Canadians to not hesitate to book your trip at this resort. Food and everything was good but it really comes down to the staff and how good they are.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best place in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: win4blue
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico in this resort. We didn't really know what to expect with the resort's ambience, food/drinks, staff service and location. The moment we checked in, the service has been efficient, welcoming and informative. Our bell person, Gabriel was very cheerful and welcomed us in the resort ending the encounter with a friendly 'Gracias Senor'. The sports and entertainment team comprised of Miguel, Cesar, Alejandro, 'Chicken' and Amanda are a funny and hard-working bunch ensuring events such as Spanish lessons, beach volleyball, water aerobics, water basketball, mini golf are some of the things they do to keep the fun and games alive for everyone in the resort. They all have an infectious charisma in getting, even the most laid back person to take part in some of the most funniest events they hold in the afternoon, such as Salsa dancing in the main pool and audience participation in the daily night shows. I recommend everyone staying in this resort to meet Philippa, which is 'Chicken's' alter ego on one of the show nights! Not to forget the tirelessly, hardworking waiters and waitresses who are ever so friendly and helpful in ensuring that your beverage is always topped up from strawberry dackerries to mojitos! One waitress who always meet us with a happy 'Buenos Dias', by the pool side is a charming lady by the name of Cecilia Mejia. We almost feel guilty that we cannot mention all of the waiters, waitresses and bar persons who have made our stay a very pleasant one. The resort's amenities, location and restaurants is very commendable and trully deserve its five stars!!! Thank you for making our stay a verry happy and memorable one! Tank you Melissa & Winston (Room 519)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: MarieMacKenzie
Reviews.Content: The service and detail that was given for our wedding was beyond expectations. The romantic dinner for two blew us away, Samuel our waiter was awesome! Our massages in the spa were very professional and satisifying, thank you Ana! We travelled with 18 of our family and friends. The food was fantastic and being steps away from 5th avenue shopping and nightlife was a highlight. We highly recommend to anyone to stay at this resort and also to anyone to plan their wedding here.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: jeremy_jeremy
Reviews.Content: Great location and cleanliness, average service & value, ok rooms with decent food, and a poor beach. Opinions in comparison to previous vacations at Riu Playacar & Valentin nearby and Grand Velas, Club Velas and others on the Pacific Coast. My party consisted of 4 rooms of couples including one with a child. Every one of use had been to numerous all inclusives in Mexico on both coasts. We were immediately disappointed with our www.CheapCarribean.com booked jr suites. We were offered to upgrade and pay $100 a night for upgrades to an ocean facing room that would have included three dinners across at The Royal. My family got three rooms in the 101-110 range. My girlfriend and I transferred across the street to The Royal for $60 a night instead. My families stayed and their rooms had king sized beds, walk in showers with bench-ledge, a Chaise lounge , 'flat-screen TV' (not HDTV) with DVD player...and that's about it. A couple beers, Pepsi, club soda, chips, nuts etc. Nothing too impressive. The pool was quite small and under the bridge is a wall so you can't swim under it. No drinks in the pool which makes sense but I still like to have a drink in the pool. The pool bar sits on top of restrooms. Only made it to the pool on the roof with the swim up bar once about 3:30pm and it was about to close at 4pm and we were reluctantly served. The rooms we had all faced Constituyntes so at least get a room on higher floors to see the ocean to the east as the ground floor looks at taxis & commuters. The beach was disappointing, the 'water crew' refused us sailboats and kayaks and even boogie boards almost every time we asked even though the waves were never more than a couple feet high. The beach itself is a small area with a Volleyball net sitting about 6' above sea level next to a fairly steep walk down 6 or 7 layers of sandbags designed to combat erosion (see picture). It's not dangerous but it is imposing. You rarely see people in the water because it's a small area inside the buoys next to the fishing boats. You would never go running into the water from the sand. The water was actually closer to the building than anywhere else I've stayed so if you just like being close to the water without actually getting in you may enjoy this. The food and drink was maybe average. The couple of restaurants were ok but otherwise there's just the buffet which was not that good in comparison. The beach 'grill' doesn't have a grill and is really just a station of the buffet that workers roll out chafing dishes to periodically so it was not too fresh. Every restaurant offered lobster tail for an additional $29. At other all inclusives the food has been overall better. Push button cappuccino, no ice cream machine, no cutting station, no pool side or beach food delivery. For beer they have Superior, Dos Equis, Tecate and Coors light at some bars. Cocktails were often weak and margaritas come off the tap. We really enjoyed being that close to 5th street with all of the shopping, restaurants, and night life. There's a place right next door that has massages on the beach 2 for $45 for an hour, we liked Coco Bongo and Blue Parrot for a night out. We took the bike tour, went scuba diving, went to Tulum, and went to the Riviera Maya Jazz Festival as well.

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: widyse
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 wonderfull weeks at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen.I could say it in one word FANTASTIC!!! All the people that work there are great and o so friendly,like Alonso,Pablo,Jose,Jesus and all the other waiters on the beach,always smiling always joking. And there is nothing they would not do for you.There is also a great animation team with Amanda,Cesar,Chicken Little and Alejandro.They start early in the morning till late in the evening with so much energy en fun that it is a plaisure to see them working.So if you ever want to go to Mexico go to the best place there in Playa del Carmen at the Gran Porto Real Wilma

Reviews.Title: “Sports and Entertainment Team!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyFromChicago
Reviews.Content: I am fifteen years old and just got back from the Gran Porto Real. I went with extended family and everyone from my grandma to my young cousins had a great time thanks to the Sports/Entertainment Team (especially Alejandro, Chicken, Cesar and Amanda). From bocci and bingo to snorkeling and bracelet making they offered a wide variety of activities for all ages. They were all hardworking and consistently put energy and effort into every one of their activities all throughout the day, making them a blast. They were also very fun- always dressing up, joking around, and taking time to get to know their guests. I especially enjoyed the 12:00 water aerobics with Alejandro, Chicken, and Caesar. Playing beach soccer with Cesar and Chicken was so much fun (even though we lost- we made a good team Cesar)!! And I can't forget to mention my favorite time of the day, 3:00- Pool Volleyball Time- so much fun!!! The activities kept me entertained all day and made my stay enjoyable and memorable. Everybody was friendly and gracious and really worked hard to make our vacation unforgettable! If anyone from the Sports/Entertainment team reads this- Thank you for a wonderful trip, keep up the great work, and hopefully I will come again soon!! Oh and Chicken- Nathan liked his prize!! Thank you! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it was smaller which allowed you to get to know the staff, and it was in a great location, I will miss all of the great activities!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for my First Vacation !”
Reviews.Author: alyssa91
Reviews.Content: This hotel overall was one of the best ones ! I loved everything about it . No complaints !

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Fun”
Reviews.Author: jlstew
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at an all inclusive resort so I have no other experiences to compare it to. With that said I loved it!!!! The staff is awesome...Alejandro, Pablo, Daniel, Samuel, Chicken......Way to many to name. They all did an exellent job! The sports and entertainment team was our favorite! The waiters in all the restraunts we great! Altho they could come around with coffee more often at breakfast at the buffet! Not totally happy with the room tho. The bed was not really very comfortable, and we were at the end of the hallway right by the elevator. Very noisy. The Best Day staff were all very friendly and did not push you into anything...just told you what they offered and let you say yes or no. We only did the dolphin swim with them which was really fun for our two daughters that did it. We were not bothered by the time share people...just avoided them. And told the lady no when she did catch up with me. Our biggest complaint would be the night life at the resort. The shows were Ok...the sport and entertainment team are what saved those,they put alot of humor and fun into them...a lot of hard work on their part. But everything closes by eleven and then.......nothing! Unless you go to Coco Bongo or another club on 5th st. But we were traveling with teenagers so that was out. It would be nice to have a place that is teenage friendly for dancing and music so you have that option. Over all it was the most relaxing vacation I have ever been on, I even extended my stay for 2 days and there was no problem getting my room for those 2 nights. I will for sure be going back in the future.....hopefully soon!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: blinksbabe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 12th stay at the Gran Porto Real with my mother in law (her 35th stay). As always, our stay was outstanding. Not only do we return year after year, but we highly recommend the Porto Real to everyone. Our rooms (ocean front jr. suites) were ready upon arrival (am arrival). The beach was a few steps from our rooms. The staff is exceptionally attentive & friendly and a lot of them consider us family. The food & drinks were great. Security is of the utmost importance. There are tons of activities at the pool/beach so you can do as much or as little as you want. This resort is in the best location in Playa del Carmen. We are scuba divers & are only 2 blocks from Phantom Divers whom we dive with. You're within a 5 minute walk of Fifth A Avenue with all of it's shops, restaurants & bars. We will definitely be returning on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: saltlakegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Porto Real. We were greeted by very friendly staff that checked us in with a lovely champagne cocktail. The room was spacious and clean, and the beds were very comfortable. We booked a junior suite, which came with a private cabana right on the beach, just a few steps from our patio! Wow, it was so nice to to be so close to the fantastic pool and the ocean at the same time, without having to walk a New York block to get there. The pool and wait staff, especially Alonso and Teresa took very good care of every need we had at our cabana and poolside. The restaurants were yummy, with a wonderful and large buffett at Albatros and lovely Mexican food at Maria's. But it was the staff that really made a difference. At Albatros, Carlos and Rodrigo were there for every question or special request we had. At Maria's, the entire staff was there to attend to our culinary desires. Martin and Domingo atteneded us with skill and knowledge. We even met the Chef, Marco, after our third visit. The place was romantic, lively, and the food was very good. The shopping was great, with so many shops to go to, and tours to take. You were just steps away from La Quinta Avenida, 5th Avenue, the main shopping spot. We found lovely treasures and gift for ourselves and our friends/family. We also found the food outside of the resort wonderful, from the beers and wings at La Fe and the steaks and pate at John Greys. If your main goal is to relax, unwind, and recharge, this is the place you want to go to. Everything you want and need is here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great”
Reviews.Author: josnow2078
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner loved this place and would definately go back. Would definately go back just to go back to PG Sandbox (1st Ave Calle 26 - about 5 mins walk away from the hotel) The Good Stuff We have been on All Inclusives to Egypt and this was by far the best holiday we have been on. The food was amazing, their is one main restuarant that serves brilliant breakfasts, lunches and Dinners with so much variety in the food (breakfasts were the best with pancakes, French Toast crispy bacon, smoked salmon etc) then their are two Al La Carte restuarants - 1 Italian and 1 Mexican. The other restuarants are more bar food than restuarants with burgers, hotdogs etc but the 24 hour bar/room always had nice food. We didnt partake in the entertainment side but the animation team work extremely hard and certainly kept everyone entertained - basically loads of activities are included in your package from bike tours through to snorkelling if you want to have a go and there is so much for kids to do! The rooms and hotel were kept so clean and you always saw someone cleaning - warning they do try to get you to upgrade and will put you in a different room for the 1st night, but we swapped the next day as we were already in a Junior Suite and didnt want to pay anymore for the same room with an ocean view as we were hardly in our room. We didnt get bothered once by the timeshare people which was brilliant but neither did any of the other UK guests - only Americans The Swings Bar and the main Pool bar were the best and served the best cocktails and a big thankyou to Miguel for always keeping our drinks topped up :o) The location of the hotel is great and we were so pleased we didnt stay on a big gated complex hotel - you are 2 minutes walk away from 5th Avenue and if you got bored of the hotel you just went out. So many good places to go but I would highly recommend the following: PG Sandbox on 1st Avenue Calle 26 - this place is a must if you are a Sports fan as they always had the Premier League on, American Football, Boxing - you name it, it was on or they would find it for you. The food and beer were fantastic and excellent value for money but the best were the staff - a big thankyou to Chris and Carrie and their gorgeous sausage dogs for looking after us El Diez Steak Restuarant - food was amazing here and very good value for money - go right down 5th Ave for about 10 mins and you will find it Bip Bips Restaurant - will remind you of Spain but the food is great and they always had 2 for 1 on cocktails!!!! The not so great stuff The staff at the hotel were friendly but places like the Lobby Bar the staff were just plain rude so we didnt go there. The beach isnt great but if you walk 1-2 mins either direction then the beach is great - they have built the beach up round the hotel but as the sea washed it away it did smell quite bad so we stuck to the pool which was great. The tours - Chichen Itza we didnt bother going as it was a 3 hour coach journey there so we went to Tulum instead which is only 30 mins away - great day out and would really recommend going but they start off trying to sell you evrything under the sun and force you into a jewellry store at the beginning and we got told off for staying outside - lets just say we told the tour guide where to get off!!! We also went on the Truck tour to Conzumel which again was brilliant but the ferry journey took 30 mins and people were throwing up all over the place but once you got there they took you to a nature reserve and the beaches are amazing - just be warned the snorkelling is hardcore swimming and not suitable for kids or not so experienced swimmers. The Spa at the hotel is ok but not worth the amount they charge - loads of other places outside of the hotel do great massages. Cost us £47 each for a 50 min massage of which mine was good but my partner had a rather disinterested person that when he looked up she was reading a magazine with 1 hand!!!! Overall would really recommend you go as you wont be disappointed!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: tb_blue
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real is our home away from home. This was our sixth visit to this resort and won't be our last. We stayed eleven wonderful days and we still didn't want to leave when our last day arrived. The main reason that keeps us coming back is the staff!!! We can't say enough good things about all the workers here. They make sure that your stay is memorable year after year. We wish we could list every staff memeber there because they all make an impact on your stay but a few people who stand out are Alonso who was constantly checking on us and making sure we had everything we needed also a delight to talk with. This resort is also super, super clean, I don't think you can find a speck of dirt if you look. They are constantly cleaning everything. Our room was immaculate from the day we got there until the day we left. Magdalena did an awesome job keeping it clean and leaving surprises everyday. We also had the pleasure of meeting and talking with Miguel Domingoes, Pedro & Eddy who also were always cleaning and making the resort beautiful. The wait staff is really the people who make your stay wonderful. We spent our time on the beach and never went without a drink or being offered something. Pablo, Jose, Jesus, Cecilia, Mari, Claudia & Carolina are all really hard workers and deserve every tip they get! And we can't forget Teresa- she is the BEST!!! We spend any minute we can talking with her. We can't wait to see her next year!!! The towel service is also very handy. There was always someone there and you could trade in your wet towels as much as you wanted. Also Eduardo is the friendliest guy around. We always made sure to stop and talk to him everyday. Take advantage of the free water activites they offer. Like the boggie boards and kayaks. Tristian is very helpful and fun to talk to. Also beach volleyball, and the bike tour are fun. Victor and Miguel from the activites are lots of fun. The food here is also great. We never got tired of the choices the entire time we were here. Look for Ivan and Dion in Albatros (breakfast/lunch buffet) they will take good care of you and get you anything you need. Also find Trini at breakfast, she makes the best omelettes around!! Dinner in Albatros is also always good. Dehlia is the cutiest hostess and Benito is the best waiter. We always sat in his section. Ask for the Mayan Coffee, you won't be sorry. Maria's restaurant has a great menu and atmosphere. Ask for Domingo or Victor, they are great waiters. The beach snack bar is always good with hot dogs, hamburgers, chips & salsa. Daphni does a great job keeping it clean and stocked. And we can't forget the bartenders. Jose Be is our favorite and the one person we look forward to seeing every year. We just sit and talk with him as much as possible. Also Lorenzo and Brandy make awesome drinks at the pool bar. Miguel at the tradewinds bar makes the best Mojitos and really makes sure you have what you need. David in the lobby bar is also fun to talk to. Our check in and out went very smooth and got everything we asked for. Claudia was very pleasent. The bellboys were great, thanks Aaron for bring up all our bags. As far as the timeshare people, just ignore them and say no. All in all this is our most favorite place in the world and will be back next year. The main reason we love this place is because of the staff. Just take your time to get to know these wonderful people. They are who makes your stay memorable. We consider them all our family!!!! See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: eddiebraun
Reviews.Content: spotlessly clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Spent the first night in junior suite room 115 near the pool and found it too noisy and moved to room 102 ,slept like a baby. Good rooms , great showers .Breakfast and lunch were very good but we did not care for the dinners, there was a lot to choose from, just not my kind of "meat and potatoes dinner".Claudia at the front desk was very helpful,Addy the maid did an excellent job, and Verdy was agreat waiter. good location in town so you can walk to 5th avenue in 3 minutes . the beach is not as good as other places but we used it and if you don't like it a 5 minute walk will pit you on a better beach area. If you leave the resort for dinner I recommend the blue lobster restaurant and stay away from los ranchero, .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual!!!”
Reviews.Author: flamingijoe
Reviews.Content: This is our eleventh year staying at the Gran Porto Real usually going about twice a year sometimes more sometimes less. Excellent greeting upon arrival by Freddie, Arron and Benny some of the Bell Boys at the front. They Nicholas the Operations Manager greeted us and got us an excellent room as he often tries to do which we appreciate very much. We usually now get the Walkout Suite which gives us our own Private Reserved Palapa plus we can to to The Royal to eat. Morning. Elizabeth is kind to help us in the All Inclusive Room while we are getting onto the Computer to check our emails. Morning Breakfast. Elizar and Ivan in Albatros Restaurant. Also at the Pelicanos at The Royal Alex and all of his staff greet us and get us seated and brings us double Mimosas that Matt at the Bar so greatly prepares for us --- and yes all we can drink at 700a!!! Excellent waiters are Pedro, Manuel, Jiovane, Sergio, Eleno, Lucas. William, Chan and the cooks all make us what we want to order. Morning Bar Staff at the Lobby and Gaviotas Bar. Alonso and Roland oversee the Bar and Teresa, Mari, Claudia, Carolina, Elizabeth, Pedro, Jesus, Jose, are Waiststaff that serve the excellent drinks and beer poured by Bartenders David, Horacio, Brandy, Hector, Aurelfio, Ricardo, Alex, Miguel and other excellent Bartenders. Lunch at Parillada Grill, Albatros at the Proto and Tapas and Pelicanos at the Royal servides by the same excellent and previously mentioned staff. Night Lobby Bar. David Acuna is good new Bartender. Margarita, Claudia, and Miriam are excellent excellent Waitstaff. Carlos does an excellent job of overseeing the Restaurants as Assistant Food and beverage Manager. Evening Dinner. Il Pascatore excellent Italian Food where Jose and Mateo have give us excellent service. Asiana is Asian at The Royal where Rebecca oversees her excellent staff where Chris and Ernesto waitied on us this time. Benito does an excellent job at Albatros also we greatly miss him at the Beach and Pool as Waiter during the day and really want him back out there!!! We missed seeing Eli and Raquel around this time. Si, Si, Si, from Flamingo Joe and Debbie

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBruce
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Rm. 261 November 7 to 16 with my family (2 adults & 2 kids 11 / 14). Friends also came along with same family size and stayed in similar room. Definitely would recommend this hotel for families with kids of all ages. Smaller hotel with only 280 rooms. ** Location ** - Can’t be beat location for any hotel staying in Playa del Carmen on the beach - Right on the beach and 2 short blocks from 5th Avenue for shopping of all sorts, sports bars and very nice restaurant selection (if you want a break from hotel) - Great prices for souvenirs at the Playamart General Store at the far South end of 5th Avenue ** Room ** - Junior family suite will easily sleep family of 6-7 (2 double/1 king and bunk beds with slide out trundle bed) - Large oversized shower - TV with DVD player - Small 2 chair 1 table balcony overlooking pool area - $1 per day tip gets you some fun towel art ** Pool ** - Small pool with one side being more active where the activity team worked and one side quieter - Activity team had pool volleyball organized each day - Jesus was a fun server around the pool and not a bad basketball shot ** Beach ** - North end of beach a bit rocky and was better to the South (suggest wearing water shoes you hopefully brought for excursions anyways) - Negotiate the parasailing down to $50 from $80 advertised price - Highly recommend the $18/40 minute massages on the beach just South of resort ** Dining ** - 2 very nice al a carte restaurants (take advantage of dining there every night) - Pamela at El Pescatore (Italian) made sure our group of 8 were well taken care of - Salvatore and Rafael at Maria’s (Mexican) were great - A good tip the first night goes a long way for the rest of your stay - 24 hour room was always stocked with very good food if you need a snack anytime - Albatros buffet was perfect for breakfast (don’t miss the personalized omelettes and pancakes) - Lunch was not always the best as it all began to taste the same (ate on excursions anyways) - Paradilla Grill at the beach was an alternative for lunch as well - Visit Relaxation pool on the 3rd floor North side for sushi and california rolls ** Bars/Drinks ** - Recommend the usual tips for best service (always order 2 drinks at a time) ** Kids ** - Xbox room (TZone) was a nice distraction for the kids - played ping pong (only 1 table) - Check out the ceramic craft by the quiet pool side - Daily bike tours of Playa del Carmen - Pool tables for a small fee (10 Pesos per game – just under a dollar) - Comfortable with the kids going anywhere in the hotel since the hotel was not to large ** Excursions ** - Highly recommend both Xel-Ha (snorkel/snuba/lazy river/ziplines) & Xplor (ziplines/atvs/rafts/swimming) - Did both excursions from “Best Day” tour desk at hotel (Xel-Ha - $99 and Xplor - $107 per person over 55”) - Questioned the insurance coverage of other cheaper operators ** Golf ** - a true 50% discount on golf at Playacar when booking through concierge will cost $70 to $100 depending on time of year (challenging course from all tees) - Mayakoba 15 minutes away for $250 or Iberostar Paraiso 20 minutes away for $195 unless you can find deals on 5th Avenue for $105 * ** Amenities ** - Workout room was small but stocked with dumbbells up to 50 lbs., 2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 2 bikes and a universal machine (1/2 cables were off and in need of repair so I snuck into the gym at the Royal across the street for some of my workout)

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic vacation”
Reviews.Author: Brenda1234321
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience from beginning to end. We went with a large group of family (13 people in total), including our two daughters - aged 7 and 4. We had no problems with check in, and everything flowed smoothly. Our room was great - and our kids loved the fantastic animals that the cleaning staff made out of towels on our bed each day. The hotel was very clean - I always saw people cleaning and sweeping and mopping, and our room was always cleaned very well. The food was good - one buffet open for breakfast, lunch and supper. A good Italian and Mexican restaurant. You did not need reservations for these - first come, first served. The dress code is quite relaxed as well - guys could wear shorts. The self-serve food on the beach was good too - hot dogs and hamburgers, pizza etc ... good for the kids. Maybe not as many food options, but if you like the feel of a smaller resort, this one is great. The staff were great - very friendly and accomodating. The service was great for drinks and in the buffet etc. The pool was great - the kids spent most of their time there. We had an adult only pool with a swim up bar right outside of our room. I loved that it was only a block away from 5th Ave., we walked down to the market a few different times. I would recommend this resort for sure, and will likely be back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mul8r
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Jesus at the pool could not have been more attentive, not just to me, but to the numerous others in my party. I can't say enough about him or the house keeper, Esmerelda P.. Whatever both of them are making is not enough. They are both the kind of employees that places like this are dying to find: WONDERFUL! This place is extremely clean...everyone was working like buzzing bees early in the mornings (6am) when I would awaken and go to the pool, and they discretely kept it up all through the day. Even issues as minute as cleaning the flaps of the trash cans that would become soiled with food from the outside bar were cleaned immediately. The food was the best that I have had at an all-inclusive. Everyone was happy to make special dishes, and the room service was prompt and very good. The rooms were large, as were the bathrooms and showers. The location is great for shoppers, as it is literally around the corner from 5th Avenue. Others in my party enjoyed the zip line/scuba diving/rafting and other fun at Xel-Ha, and have been numerous times. My only knock on the Porto Real was the beach...the actual usable part was pretty small for a resort this size; they have had an erosion issue, and there were sandbags on the beach, and a steep drop-off to the actual water. At times, the sandbags left a foul odor to waft up to the resort pool area, which was very disappointing. Unfortunately, my room was situated over the lobby, and noise became an issue in the evening, especially with newly arriving guests. Overall, I would return, but would request a room that is a distance from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: joann1234
Reviews.Content: my favorite part of this hotel was the location . 3 short blocks and u r on 5th ave-so many beautiful shops,restaurants, bars etc.. and so safe-and clean-someone called it little europe. the hotel was spotless-. we upgraded to an oceanview room-was great- very large-could have slept 5. the staff were extremely attentive-especially Pablo-at the beach-he was always there with great drinks and service-the drink of the wkend was SEXY MANGO. the hotel has 3 restaurants 1 buffet that is open for breakfast ,lunch and dinner-great variety . then a mexican,and italian-ate at the italian-was very good. would definitely go back and yes i would highly recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One bump in the road but the rest of stay was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Funguy31
Reviews.Content: Our group just returned from GPR on Tuesday after being there for a week. We had a great time. My 10th trip to the Carribean and my comments as follows. Check in: I will get this out of the way... after booking with the resort for three months, it was upsetting to get there and our room (standard) was not available. They try to force you in paying ($40/night) to upgrade to a Jr Suite and we did not want this. They put us in the suite room anyway and told us we had to move the next day. I am on vaction to get away from all the hassel and like to have my stay flawless. I tried to talk to the guy at the front desk. He just hit the bell on the desk and instantly the bell boy came and took bags and went with them to the room. Not impressed. The next day we were out enjoying our time and then when we came back to the room we were locked out and had to move in 10 mins. The bell boy came and packed up our stuff, underwear and all in the suite case and walked us out. We just needed some time to get our stuff together. We were put into a standard room that we requested and the room was nicer than the Jr Suite. Right by the adult pool and hot tub. We were happy with this and moved on to enjoy our stay. Room: Standard like a hotel room, nice big shower, fridge with pop, water and beer. It was nice to have a table and 2 chairs outside our room. No complaints with the room, maid was very good and room was very clean all the time. Phone rang alot, club membership people, check out person and room service people. I was not used to that on vaction. Food: Buffet had very good food, selection and freshness. The beach resturant was good and well maintained for burgers, hot dogs etc. Nice to have a snack. The 24 all inclusive room had good little sandwiches. The room service was very good and quick (10 mins). We did not go to the a la cartes. Pools: Very nice and clean. You could play sports or just lounge around. The adult/swim up pool (3rd floor) was under utilized. Good drinks there and hot tub on the roof top was great. Beach: Little rougher than I have seen before. Sand was very nice but no where to really swim. If you go a little ways to the north, it is much better. There was no sea weed and very clean. Nice place to tan or play beach volleyball. Service: This is an area that needs alot of praise. The staff at this resort is top notch and they work real hard. From the cleaning staff, to the waiters and bartenders, is what made our experience one we will never forget. Lorenzo and Brandy the bartenders at the oval bar were the best, they deserve every tip that they get. They engage the people and serve with a smile. The drinks were all very good and I hope they appreciate the 'blinky' glasses we left them. Others that were great were Migel at the beach bar and Ivan in the buffet, what a nice man. Other: No disco at this resort, bar closes at 11 pm. The self pour 24 hour bar was good and a nice place to hang out. Resort is one block from 5th ave for an easy stroll. You MUST go to Coco Bongo's (3 blocks from resort). This was a show you must see. Fantastic and the all included drinks just kept coming and coming. I highly recommend you go and see this. Free wireless internet at the hotel so you are able to talk to home if need be. Watch the trips you take, we went to Cancun to the Island and shuttle was 2 hours (3-4 drop pick ups) each way and made for a long day in the bus. There are closer trips and check out Cozumel. Our group had a very good vacation here. I will be recommending this resort to all my friends. The main reason was the service that was provided by all the hard working people there. Email me if you have any more questions. Thanks GPR, we will be back.....just like I promised Lorenzo and Brandy. :-)

Reviews.Title: “One of the most relaxing times in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Sherbans
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location, Fantastic. Food was always great. Rooms were incredible!!! Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The pool area was so relaxing that we never headed out on the beach (wich is only 10 feet away). You cant go wrong here. Walking distance to great shopping for all. Went for a wedding, and would recomend to all. Families and couples. If there was one thing wrong with this trip....it was too short. We will definatly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: mckeon5boys
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the Gran Porto. Traveled with a large group of women. The trip was great from beginning to end. The employees of this resort could not have been any more accommodating and friendly. The food was very good and the drinks flowed. The beach was beautiful and we especially appreciated the waiter service on the beach. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. We joined in a couple of pool activities which were a lot of fun and some games at the tiki bar. Much praise and thanks to Pablo, Jose, Jesus, Alejandro, Lorenzo, Lucy, Cecelia, Ana, Cesar and Amanda.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing. A totally enjoyable vacation.”
Reviews.Author: meme3777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 45 minutes from the airport, but worth the distance. We were offered an upgrade upon our arrival at a decent fee. Make sure your upgrade room is NOT on the first floor anywhere near the lobby. Very noisy. We ended up on the third floor, oceanfront, view was fabulous. Room was great. roomy. Terrace lovely. Food delicious. Room service was great. The spa was great. I had Magda Munoz as my masseuse. She was INDREDIBLE. Pable was our waiter on the beach. Kept us very happy. Astrid the concierge was very helpful as was Yendaly at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax and recharge the batteries-- and have fun!”
Reviews.Author: mohercrieve
Reviews.Content: From the food, drinks, rooms, amenities and especially, the service, Gran Porto Real does all it can to make sure you have a great vacation. You get what you pay for and the staff goes out of its way to help you if they can. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with lots to do”
Reviews.Author: Wendywu1
Reviews.Content: We arrived here 3 days ago. On first impressions the hotel is very nice. Be warned when you enter the lobby and check in you are told your room is not ready and you have to go in a suite. This is a Roose to get you to uograde. It's works out another 200 dollars. The room you originally book is not sea view but just as nice! The food is lovely and cannot fault the service! The first choice rep pedro is great apart from the nightmare of living out suitcase for 48 hours and not knowing where you will be all have so far run smoothly. I still have 8 days left and will be booking excursions and so far booking through your own travel rep seems to be the most cost effective!

Reviews.Title: “Its OK”
Reviews.Author: totallyhip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to our neice's wedding along with 24 friends and family. The hotel is pretty average. Originally my sister in law booked us in a standard room. The room was way too small for my 6'3" husband. They had 2 double beds in the room and he couldn't fit his whole body in the bed. The 2nd night we upgraded to a King suite that was Ocean walk out. Much better room and more of what we are used to. The Ocean walk out view wasn't great. They have a ton of Cabanas blocking your ocean view. We did like the idea of our large deck with hammocks and easy access to the beach. But the staff stored all their lawn chairs in our corner. A few things were wrong with the room (fridge didn't work, drain clogged) but as soon as we told the desk they sent someone immediately to fix it. We were very impressed with this. The strange thing we found was that our maid would come and clean the room and make up the bed, then late afternoon we would nap in the room and then go for dinner. While we were out for dinner someone would come and toss chocolates in our unmade bed and not bother making up the bed. The water in our fridge only got replinshed twice. Having only 2 bottles of water each time wasn't enough for 2 people when its 30+ outside. The food is mediocre and the 24hour snack bar is barely worth mentioning. The choice of restaurants is limited and you had to wait a long time to get a table at the Italian restaurant. With our upgraded room we were able to use the amenities and the restaurants at the Royal across the street. This would be the ideal place to stay. Much nicer resort and the food is way better. If you get a chance to upgrade there you should do it. The rooms are bigger, and the pool is much better. Ocean walk out rooms don't have a ton of Cabana's blocking the view. Our room was at the end of the hallway. It was LOUD! We could hear all across the hallway while we were sleeping. The noise just carried so far. The staff are pretty good. The front desk was great. But there never seemed to be enough people working the desk for check in or check out. There was always a line up. There are 4 computers there but you have to pay for internet access. And there was no printer. People like to check in for their flights and print their boarding passes and couldn't do so. I love the location of being close to 5th Street but we are not resort people and would prefer more acitivities. Its pretty remote. About a 2 hour bus ride from any of the ruins and attractions. That's 2 hour one way! Cost was alot to partake in the tours as well. The hotel doesn't have a club onsite and the entertainment at night is sub-par. There isn't alot to do there besides lay on the beach or pool. You can only walk down 5th so many times. The EZ bar was great. They showed all the NHL hockey games so we spent alot of time there. Although the resort was clean, If I was to return we would go to the Royal across the street.

Reviews.Title: “best holiday so far”
Reviews.Author: alexvandes
Reviews.Content: we would like to thank all employees for the beautiful time we had. Alejandro Ventura, Alonso Pascal, Eduardo Vazquez, Benito,Aurelio, Jesus, Pablo, Jose,Ektor and all the others I don't remember the name of..... Especially the ladies of the housekeeping because they do a very good job, always friendly and always a very clean and nice room. Let's not forget the recreationteam, lot's of fun we had! Thanks to all and greetz: Alex, Aartje, Chantal and Chris from Holland!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Vacation Destination”
Reviews.Author: jmbeard
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Mexico a number of times and this trip only reconfirmed why. Our travel agent Diane Mounts once again found us a great value with Continental Vacations. Cecilia Mejia took care of us by the pool. Maro took care of us at breakfast and Gustavo helped us with the Guest Services and information on the hotel and the area. The food and variety were wonderful for an all-inclusive resort and the house wines were very drinkable. At the recommendation of the sommelier (Alonso) we tried a very nice Mexican wine. The location of the hotel is outstanding as it is right in town. We took a number of walks in the evening just to stretch the legs and shop. There are so many wonderful outside excursions that are available and the only complaint I have is the size of the bus for the trip to Coba and the fact it had so many stops to make before we had a full load, meant we spent 2 1/2 hours on the bus before we reached our destination. (Not the fault of the hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “I liked it so much, I am going back in April!”
Reviews.Author: nathb189
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful and clean place. My husband and I got there at the begining of October 2010 for a 2 weeks stay and we were not disapointed. We got there and as I had requested we got everything we had ask for. Astrid the concierge near the front desk, was the greatest, she really help us a lot and it was appreciated , muchas gracias Astrid!! The room we had was a oceanfront junior suite, wow! Worth the couple bucks more! The view was incredible, the room was huge and on the balcony we had a hammac which my husband loved.
