Like many people before us many are impress by the cleanliness, the beauty of the place and most of all the service, and they are right. I have to name a couple of them that gave us such good service: Pablo and José at Gaviotas on the beach (I will be coming back for my Whinnie the POoh!). Sherly, Ruby, Victor and Rodrigo at the Albatros, always happy to see us. As for our chamber maid, I can't remember her name but she was a sweethart, she left us everyday beautiful shaped animals on our bed. We were also very lucky weather wise, we missed by a hair a hurricane (Small hurricane Paula), All we got of that was a couple of hours of rain. The hotel was very responsable and was keeping us in the loop. The were prepared but nothing happened, the hurricane just changed direction and missed us completely. A couple of comments regarding food, time sharing and the beach: I am not the most picky eater in the world, so the buffet, even if it was sometimes repetitive, was good. They had something for everyone, even if the selections was not the biggest. The people behind the stoves must have been sweating like crazy but the smile and the service was always there (gracias Ruby!). If the buffet that night was not to our liking, we would go to any of the 2 restaurants that were available to Gran Porto Real guests. Mexican or Italian which were fine. We would have appreciated a couple more choices of restaurants, 2 weeks is a bit long with only a buffet and 2 restaurants, but being so closed to the main street (5th Avenue), the choice of restaurants is endless, you can very easily eat out. One thing that was missing is the self serve Ice cream machine at the buffet, we had to beg everyday to have some. PLEASE BRING IT IN SO THAT WE CAN ENJOY IT ANYTIME... As for the time sharing, they are indeed a pain in the neck, but just say no, even if its sounds like its the hotel that wants to talk to you and make sure 'your all inclusive is OK' Just run the other way! As for the beach, it is picturesque with its fisherman boats and sandbags. I liked it a lot, much calmer and less windy than our counterpart at the Royal. They take great care of it. I would recommend highly that you always wear sand shoes in the water, many corals and rocks but also many fishes, great for snorkeling! The water was usually very calm. So like I said earlier, I loved it so much, I am going back with my sister in April. This is a fun place, great for active people and hard to please people. So many things to do if you want. If not you can just lay on the beach and get great service from José and Pablo!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: luvsjojo
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Gran Porto Real Resort to anyone. We went for a wedding and they did a wonderful job. The employees were very nice. Our house keeper Thelma really stood out. I don't know her last name but we were in room 227. She was wonderful and always took great care of our needs. Also Eduardo vazqvez in towel services was sooo pleasant to talk too. Always something nice to say and a smile always on his face. The only thing that needs inprovement is your check in system. We paid for a ocean front view and was given an ocean view the first night after waiting 3 and a half hours to get our room. Some other people in our group checked in after us and were up graded to ocean front views, when the room should have been our. We did get the room we wanted the second day we were there but things like that shouldn't happen. I feel like I was cheated out of the money I paid extra for that one night.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation at Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: sanders28
Reviews.Content: Special thanks to Luis at the front desk for being friendly and helping us with any special requests. While the guys were watching Sunday football in the bar I enjoyed a quiet and relaxing afternoon at the spa. After my wonderful massage by Magda I enjoyed tea and more quality time in the jacuzzi and steam room.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding”
Reviews.Author: cancun021
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place, the service is great, the breakfast very good and Dion and Ivan were great, 3 different restaurants and my 7 year old son loved it the only bad thing was the beach front.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here! Smells like an outhouse, terrible service, bad food!”
Reviews.Author: emailgreg
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and am very patient and open minded, I usually give the benefit of the doubt. This place really let us down, severely. First of all they put us in room 116 which is just off the lobby on the main floor by the 24 hour snack bar/bar lounge. It was extremely loud, people, kids walking by yelling, screaming. The following morning I went to the front desk to ask to be moved. They said it would cost us extra to move. I had to explain to the front desk agent that we would check out if they didn't change us to another room for free. The second room they sent us to was on the 3rd floor at the end of the hall way. Exact same type of room it was nice. Until we went back in the afternoon and the wind shifted. Down our hallway it literally stunk like someone or something had died and pooped all over the place. It was SO extreme - I have a pretty good stomach and it actually made me gag. I attempted to call the front desk however they didn't do anything about it so I walked down to the front desk and advised them. The same front desk agent said that we would have to pay to be "upgraded", again I told them it was the second time we changed rooms and that I wasn't going to pay. He said he would see what they could do and call me in my room. So I waited in my room for an hour, still nothing. So I went back and the supervisor finally came out. She got me to sign this little paper that said "free upgrade" I did and they gave me keys to our new room. It wasn't an upgrade, it was the exact same room, just on the opposite side of the resort. They said it was an ocean view but you really only had a small glimpse of the ocean if you looked from the balcony. It didn't stink so we were okay with it. Later that evening we went into the buffet restaurant and it stunk like an outhouse again! Whatever we smelt in our second room we smelt in the restaurant! The windows were all open and it was apparently coming from the beach. Seaweed or something like that washes up on the beach and rots, creating that god awful stench. I couldn't even eat! When they clean up the seaweed from the beach the smell gets worse. Literally one of the most disgusting stenches I've smelt in my life. On top of that when you check in the front desk asks you to go see these people around the corner to get your free present and information. They are all very nice but they will ask you to go and take a tour of the hotel across the street. DON'T! They will only waste your time, show you around and then bring you to another office where another person will try to sell you a part of their property until ROYAL CLUB. If you say no they are rude, tell you not to get upset and are straight up pricks about the whole situation. Do yourself a favour and don't bother, just say no. The food is not even worth trying to enjoy, the drinks are not made well, their beach sucks and there's always police out front with their lights on stopping someone or another. Do yourself a HUGE favour and stay at a proper all inclusive on its own property on the outskirts of Playa del Carmen. They are much better. I will never stay here ever again, I will also warn anyone I can to stay away! FAR AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Vacation at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: MoosejawLeen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 6th trip to the Gran Porto Real and each year is better than the last, its like coming home to see our friends. Several of the staff have been there for many years and never forget their guests. Upon our arrival, we were greeted by the hotel Manager, Lynn and her Assistant Manager, Nicholas and Carlos Melgar, the Reservations Manager. Nicholas personally escorted us to our beautiful Ocean front suite. The rooms are gorgeous and spacious and Thelma did an exceptional job keeping the room spotlessly clean. Everyday, Thelma would have beautiful Towel art on the bed and in the bathroom. Each evening, they would come into our room and put chocolates at the bedside. The housekeeping staff work tirelessly and the resort is spotless inside and out. The pool at the hotel is large and there are lots of pool lounge chairs and also on the beach as well. Ciro, the "pool man" and Cruz keep the pool crystal clear. I was up very early every morning and they would be working so hard to ensure the pool was top-notch for the guests to enjoy for the day. The pool/beachside waiters are wonderful and very attentive, you will never wait for a drink for very long. I want to take this opportunity to thank the waiters who took such good care of us.....Alonso, Jose, Pablo, Jesus, Benitto, Margarita, Theresa, Elizabeth and of coase, lets not forget the bartenders who mix those wonderful drinks..Ancona, Lorenzo and David. You all do such a great job! The Activities team.....Mike and his staff, Cesar, Alejandro, Jesus, Patty and Alejandra who work tirelessly all day and into the evening to ensure all the guests are well looked after and entertained. There are several activities to participate in thruout the day in and around the pool and on the beach and each evening they host a wonderful show as well. We really missed seeing Victor this trip as he was on his well deserved vacation. To all of you......you do a great job! A special thanks to Jesus for the kayak journeys as he did all the work and I enjoyed the scenery! The food......it is amazing and delicious! We had breakfast and lunch at Albatros everyday. We were personally escorted to our "favorite" table by Delia and Edgar. They greeted us each time we arrived with a smile on their faces and May and Verlan looked after us at our table. Every morning we had a wonderful Omelet prepared by Triny. She is the Omelet Expert. She has worked at the resort for many years and always remembers us and has a smile for us every morning. The quality of the food is excellent and was enjoyed by all. Each evening we had dinner at Ile Pescatore, the Italian Resturant. We we greeted by Jose, our "special" waiter who has looked after us for the past 6 years. He took great care of us each evening. The food is amazing and the presentation of the food is exceptional. We had a Romantic dinner on the beach one evening and it exceeded all expectations. Eliazar took special care of us and tended to every detail. The dinner was delicious. Carlos Canela is the manager of all the resturants and he ensures that everything runs smoothly! Also, a special thanks to Franceso and Freddy for your wonderful friendship. It was great to see you. We will be returning again next year for our annual trip to the GPR to see all of our friend

Reviews.Title: “Super resort, super staff, had the time of our lives!!”
Reviews.Author: rtarsi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with my brother, his wife and 12 year old child stayed (seperate rooms) from Oct 28th-Nov 5th. We truly enjoyed this resort. The food was great no matter where you ate. The staff is just super starting with Aaron the Bell Boy to Sara in Housekeeping. Also need to mention the above people who went above our expectations and they are Felipe who works at the Sushi Bar, Chef Jorge, Servers Ventura, Alex, and a special mention of server Sumuel who was just the best. He catered to our needs like no other. The whole staff are very pleasant and always smiling. They truly made us feel important and showed how important it was to them to have us as customers. They should be commended, it is people like that who will make my next vacation plans very easy. I want to go back because of them!!

Reviews.Title: “Just as wonderful the 2nd trip as the first!!”
Reviews.Author: Bullock51
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Gran Porto Real. This time we brought our daughter/husband and 2 grandchildren ages 12 and 6. We all love the hotel for it's friendly and efficient staff. The rooms are spacious and clean and Thelma did a great job of cleaning our room daily. They have alot of activities for the children over and above the pool and beach. The bartenders and waiters/waitresses were awesome. Hello and we miss you to Jose, Samuel, David, Elizabeth,Delia, Benigno and Eliazar!!!! See you all next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeUbuntu
Reviews.Content: Service is excellent. Personnel has this ability to remember you day after day which makes your stay even more enjoyable. Room was very clean, even for a standard room. Junior suites, the next level, are simply amazing. Food was very good. Even if the hotel was not full (early November, only the start of the season), the food was always fresh and the variety was excellent. This hotel is located near the "shopping Avenue". Two minutes walk and you're ready to experience Mexican shopping if you feel so. The beach is small though, but you can walk another 2 minutes, and you get a beautiful beach. If you like to walk on the beach, you won't be disappointed. Also a big plus, they offer FREE Wireless Internet throughout the site.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot WAIT to go Back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: megak81978
Reviews.Content: Not too big not too small, great location, beautiful decor and top notch service!

Reviews.Title: “Hector Cruz was the sweetest bartender!”
Reviews.Author: Ann43603
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the hotel the minute we arrived. The front desk help was happy and helpful. The pools, beach & rooms looked just like the pictures online. We met some great bartenders and waiters. the two that stand out moset were Hector Cruz and Cecllia. They had a great attitude every time we saw them. We looked forward to seeing them around the resort. The food in the buffet restaraunt was amazing especially breakfast. The Mexican restaraunt was OK. The Italian one was OK. The beds were hard. They ran out of bottled water. But other then that it was a perfect stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll do this again!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyAlice
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful experience here! Exceptionally clean, friendly & upbeat environment. The staff was friendly & helpful. We felt very safe. The one & only sad part was that the beach was washing away & part of it was packed with sand bags. That detracted from the beauty of the area. I am not a strong swimmer, but the slow, gradual grade of the beach made it fun for even me! Take flip flops, casual clothing, sun screen, & if you participate in the surrounding activities - take your aqua socks. You can be as active or as relaxed as you desire. The food is fabulous. I'll certainly choose an all inclusive for my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Ever...Thanks Gran Porto Real !”
Reviews.Author: OParent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from celebrating my birthday with a week at the Gran Porto Real,it was our 5th visit to this property since 1998. The staff continue to be the hardest working and loyal employees that we have ever incountered ! Whatever the general manager and CEO of this company are doing to retain such fantastic people should share it with the rest of the hospitality world! Smiles are everywhere,as well as the folks wanting to get you whatever you need to make your stay perfect ! The food was delicious,even the food in the main buffet ...I will say it was pretty warm in there for lunch but we just got a take out plate and took it back to the beach to eat. The Trade Winds Bar is staffed by Miguel and Johnny (extremely hard workers)...ALWAYS a great drink and a good time !!These fellas along with Teresa,Bonito,Jesus,Pablo saw to it that if you were sitting on the beach you were not thursty,if you declined a mixed drink or beer they would be there with cool refreshing ice water !( In the hottest sunny weather ) WOW--- they just do their jobs far beyond what you expect ! Inside the main restaurant Albatros and lobby bar,Elezear,Verlann,David and Elizabeth were ready to take care of your inside needs. I have left off many including housekeeping who never stop,the hospital is not as clean as this property.As you can see we feel the Gran Porto is special due to many reasons but the smiling faces and helpful attitude make it stand out as extra special ! We can't wait to return !

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: nevertheless7
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real was the best vacation we ever had! I can't say enough about the professionalism and friendliness of the staff, in particular: Claudia at the Front Desk - thank you for your lovely smile, the wavying and "Hola" whenever we walked by. You never failed to make us feel special! Alejandro in Recreation and Activities- thank you for your excellent Spanish lesson and for the pool and evening activities. Also Jesus, and "Chicken Little" for the humour at the shows. Ivan in the Albatross restaurant - thank you for looking after us like family, and for remembering I liked my coffee on ice and bringing it every morning without my asking. Clara in the Albatross restaurant - thank you for the best pancakes and french toast made to order I have every had on a vacation. Way better than on a cruise ship, where they sit in a warming tray for hours! And of course, Flor Rico, our Real Club rep, who contacted us several times before we arrived, who kept me informed of the weather, arranged for our ride from the airport and for her excellent presentation on the Real Club. We will be back to talk to you again! This hotel was SO CLEAN. Staff were always visible, doing everything from raking the sand around the beach loungers at 6 in the morning to dusting the corners in the hallways during the day. We felt comfortable and safe at all times at this resort. People are always writing about the beach here - let me tell you, I have been on all the so-called "best" beaches in the Caribbean, and this one is far superior as far as cleanliness, water quality and the ability to take a long walk. My husband and I thought the fishing boats added character to the beach, not detracted from it. And the small sand bags show a committment by the hotel to keep the beach from eroding even more. If you are super fussy, the beach at the Royal next door is as close to perfect as you can get anywhere. As far as being bugged by timeshare people at the Cancun airport, as soon as we said we had a ride, they left us alone. There were only about 5 people anyway, so this was no big deal as far as we were concerned. Even having our bags thoroughly checked (we pushed the button and got a "red light") was not as bad as we have experienced in some US airports. All in all, this vacation went off without any hitches and was thoroughly enjoyable. I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat! Thank you to all the staff at Gran Porto Real and we hope to see you again soon, with the rest of our family in tow!

Reviews.Title: “The best destination wedding spot!”
Reviews.Author: Dana1023
Reviews.Content: My husband & I visited Gran Port Real 4 years ago and fell in love with this place. It was a No Brainer when we decided this is where we wanted to get married and honeymoon. Talk about a stress free wedding. Zulma or wedding planner took care of everything and the gazebo was a great setting or our special day. Everything turned out great: the flowers, the cake, all the little details exceeded my expectations and I didn't have to spend months planning. My wedding planner sent me a catalog of choices and I made my selections and that was all it took...so easy! Our guests loved the service, rooms, beach, price, food, and location. Besides the gorgeous hotel and views I think the service is better than I have seen at any Ritz or other fine hotels. A few staff members really stood out and I want to mention them by name: Claudia, Erika, and Ricardo at the front desk. Miquel, Bento, & Theresa were our beach servers & bartender who made our days on the beach relaxing and fun. Henri at Asiana and Jorge at Maria Marie's. Everyone was great! Thanks so much for making this so special for us and we will be back for our 1 year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st time all-inclusive experience”
Reviews.Author: kalkawan
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a great stay at this resort; we don't have much to complain about except for the noise outside our room (#132) and the scam we experienced from the guest service representative who tried to sell us a time share at their next door hotel The Royal. This is our first time in Mexico and they obviously have mastered the art of tourism. At checkin, the receptionist tried to upgrade us to an ocean front room for $480 (1 week) but we had juts had a long flight and I though we already had an ocean view room. We were wrong, it was a partial ocean view. But that didn't matter because all we wanted to do was to hit the beach and start binging ourselves with margaritas and mojitos. But stay away from these reps as they are on the look out for new arrivals and they usually start by telling you about the hotel amenities and then slowly get you on the hook for a 90 minute breakfast tour of the adjacent hotel followed by an aggressive sales session by sharks who will make you feel like a loser if you don't buy into their $700/yr time share. The service was really great, friendly and fast. Everyone was smiling and the staff tried hard to entertain us. There were lots of daily activities from beach volleyball to biking. The beach was sub standard and had rocks and lots of sand bags. If you want to run and smash at the incoming waves then forget it. But a few minutes away on both sides there are very nice and clean beaches. The best part about this hotel is the location. It's right in the middle of playa del carmen and 2 blocks from the bustling 5th avenue. We really enjoyed this nice escape. Other hotels between playa del carmen and cancun or tulum have to take a 30 minute shuttle bus or a taxi to get to this nice little town. We recommend a great beach club called Fuzion at the end of 5th avenue (turn left just before the bus terminal). They had great live bands and frequented by locals. We also ventured deep into the city near Juares st & 40th avenue where we found a street taco vendor. They had amazing tongue and cheek tacos for those that are into tacos de cabeza.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, fun filled vacation!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyPoster
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I had an incredible experience at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen. Everything was wonderful: the food, the staff, the location, the weather, the activities...and the list goes on. The hotel is located right on the beautiful white sand beach, the turquoise water is a perfect temperature and beautifully clear. It is walking distance to 5th Avenue, which was great too. I think the one thing that stood out most from our trip was the excellent service and friendliness of the staff throughout the resort. The entertainment team was top notch: friendly, engaging, fun, exciting. I would like to especially thank Cesar, Chicken, Jesus, Alejandro, Amanda, the guy at the towel desk (whose name I have forgotten, sorry!) and Miguel. They were awesome and full of energy every day! One of the brightest highlights of our trip were two of the waiters at the great on-site restaurant, Maria's. Elias and Tito impressed us the very first dinner we had there. The food was great, but these two guys had us laughing and feeling special the entire night! They continued to treat us like gold all week...we only went to the Italian restaurant once, which was also good, but Elias and Tito and Virginia, the hostess, inspired us to go back night after night to Maria's. On our last night, which happened to be my birthday too, they threw me a very special party in the restaurant, and went out of their way to coordinate a special menu with the chef, complete with appetizers, an incredible main dish, champagne, and they even got me a birthday cake with candles while the entire staff sang! It was one of the most memorable birthdays and a true indication of the exceptional staff at Gran Porto. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! Rico aka Ricardo, who strolls the beach and has friendly conversations with everyone was great too! You should book an excursion with him or Christian because they are great guys as well! Edhino from Best Days travel was also very helpful with helping us book our excursion to Xel-ha and Tulum.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: vwbooy
Reviews.Content: While on the surface the Hotel looks to good to be true the fact is that it is. Food while free had little or no taste at all. Most staff on the surface seem genuine however management was rude and uncaring when faced with a serious situation. During our stay ALL of our cash was stolen from the room safe. A total amount of over $3500 USD. When this was reported to the desk it was treated with indifference and we were asked not to talk to any other guests or staff about the incident while it was being 'investigated'. The manager was very rude and accused me of lying about the matter and threatened to remove my family from the hotel if we were not quiet. Police were involved and staff were spoken to but to no avail. These hotel safes are a joke the PIN number can be hacked and to top it all off there is a master key for every safe in the hotel with the security staff. What a great scam, steal money from safe and then wait for the 'poor Gringo' to go home a few days latter. INSIDE JOB for sure. Even upper management did not bat an eyelid. All these people want is your MONEY, THEY DON"T CARE. BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort...everything you could want for a mini-break”
Reviews.Author: rebeccap30
Reviews.Content: We went to Playa Del Carmen for a wedding, we stayed the first 2 nights across the street at the Royal and then switched to the Gran Porto for 2 nights because it was a better price. Very nice, clean resort. Waitresses circle the pool with drinks, bartenders are all very nice and friendly. We ended up staying another night because our flight was canceled due to Hurricaine Paula and we got a room at a great rate. There is a nice quiet pool that is on an upper level, has a swim up bar too. It is above the gym and spa. There is also a hot jacuzzi 2 floors up from that pool, no one was there! It was so relaxing for my boyfriend and I to have the space to ourselves. Great views of the beach from up there. There is also a bar with swings that is kind of hidden, its on the edge of the resort that faces the Royal. Short walk to 5th ave, great cheap sports bar Tequila Barrel (they also have sports betting). Hotel has Wi-Fi and a good selection of TV channels. Our only bad experience was being stuck there an extra night and because of rain there was a wedding receiption in the hallway outside are room for a few hours, but thats it! Food was good, great Italian resturant!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Home”
Reviews.Author: Sherri2010_10
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto is my favorite Resort. The beaches are well kept and safe. Its location allows you to walk the streets of Playa, in order to shop and explore, without taking transportation. The Gran Porto is a mix of old and new world, in style and service; well done. It is not so large you get lost in the crowd, it is more personal. The staff is exceptional. I want to give special recognition to Tilo the bell-boy, Mora the waiter, at the Albatros Restaurant ,and Madga Munoz who works at the SPA Real. Madga gives the best massage I have ever had. We have traveled MX extensively in the past 15 years. The Gran Porto is the only Resort we have returned to for a second stay. Infact we have stayed there 4 times now.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Would definately go again!”
Reviews.Author: DanielleKaty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real for two weeks and loved it - the staff, service, food, rooms and the hotel in general were all excellent - you definately get what you pay for! The staff really look after you making sure you've always got a drink in hand (Benito, Jesus, Jose, Alonzo, Pablo & Teresa!), staff higher up the ladder (Ventura) to even the lifeguard by the pool make sure you have everything you need! I'm already looking to go back next year - well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: AGenealogistMike
Reviews.Content: Our second year at Gran Porto, be sure to look for: - Teresa in the outdoor pool/beach area - she's fantastic, great humor, super service, a real personality... - Lorenzo is a super bartender. - Eduardo "keeper of the towels by the pool" is a sweetheart and enjoys a good chat - Oscar of Club Real will do whatever he can to assist you - Frederico ad Edhinho of "Best Day" are incredibly helpful and friendly for excursions and for any other assistance needed. The staff make this hotel special - these are only a few of the special folks who will ensure your stay is fantastic. The hotel is wonderful. The management and the "Club" system leave a lot to be desired in terms of the complexity of the system and the lack of responsiveness. We had a weird and negative experience in that we paid a lot of money last year and "joined" the Club Real. When we tried to book the vacation through their office, we were mislead/misguided - having been told we'd get the best rates. Unfortunately, when we found cheaper rates online, and repeatedly contacted the "Club", we did not receive the matching rates, and we were informed if we booked the online cheaper rate we'd still be treated with full Club membership entitlements when we arrived. When we got there - with friends in two to whom we had recommended the hotel and membership - we were met with "oh, no...you booked online through another company and therefore you forfeited your "Club" benefits. After paying an additional 1/4 each of what we paid online, we upgraded, and through a very unpleasant multi-hour complicated negotiation, we received very basic Club level membership. It was a HORRIBLE way to start the vacation. Given that we are out $9,000 paid for membership, we decided to make the best of it and treat it as a learning experience. We are not sure what will happen when we try to book our next trip. I can only hope it will be more pleasant and also that the Club will honor the matched lowest fares. The best I can figure, the "Club Real" only has a limited number of rooms in its own properties, and that if you do not get a reservation in one of their allotted rooms, then you are out on your ear, can book on the open market (at a lower fare), but you will thereby sacrifice being treated as a "Club" member. It's terribly complicated and feels like being dropped into a parallel universe. All in all we love the property, the staff, the food, the environment. However, we are less than impressed with the "Club" system and are wondering if the payment we made in joining is not simply lost at this point. I hope things turn around for the future. The only other bad experience was when I tried to offer two friends a drink on the beach. Within or two minutes a security patrol showed up from the hotel and made a scene. I had made it clear that we wanted to purchase drinks for the friends (who were staying at another resort in Playa), but we were told that was not possible. The security person got a manager and two more security guards within a couple of minutes (we were just sitting here post-SCUBA dive chill) and insisted that my friends leave the property immediately, or sit on the sand about 20 feet away on the other side of a volleyball court. We were all very calm throughout, and we were astounded, but very quickly moved down the beach where we dropped the $50 on drinks and snacks that we would have gladly spent at our own "Club". Only about 1/3 of the beach chairs were in use at the time, and all of the menus and drink lists at the hotel and its restaurants have prices (for the non-inclusive package guests), so we assumed we could purchase the drinks. The bottom line: we were all humiliatedand exasperated by the treatment and inflexibility, and this well-healed Dutch couple who had been interested in Club Real for future visits are needless to say very unimpressed. Bottom line: Great place...just learn the many rules, abide by them, and be prepared for inflexibility. I would suggest staying there (buying the best rates on the open market) and not paying the many thousands of dollars to "join the Club" unless you have tons of flexibility, patience, and very thick skin - and nearly $10K to throw at an organization that clearly has little interest in working with its members once the money is paid. I truly hope this changes - just have to keep learning the system. Always remember: the hotel and the Club are two different corporations...that seems to be the key to understanding the challenges in the very complex way the organization is structured...and it seems geared to always err to the advantage of the organization, not the client....sometimes with incredibly surly and testy personnel in management and leadership (not in the service staff - who make this place WONDERFUL!).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: kimmy155019
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Grand Porto Real in Playa del Carmen and had a wonderful time. My friend and I have been to the Porto now 2x and to the Royal Real next door 1x. This time I noticed that the food in the buffet resturant had improved substantially since our last visit - lots of variety, fresh, well presented and you could ask for special meals with no problems. The entertainment by the pool is actually superior to the Royal - more variety, lots of enthusiam from the staff and the evening shows are wonderful. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the beds are so comfortable. Thank you again to the staff at the Grand Porto Real for making our holiday amazing!

Reviews.Title: “booking nightmare - no customer service”
Reviews.Author: internationalgato
Reviews.Content: We booked online directly with the hotel. Our credit card did not go through and nobody contacted us - they had our email and phone #!! We lost out on the rate and no one would make it right. Our room category was "sold out". Thankfully some friends gave us their room and upgraded theirs - otherwise the five day trip would have been way too expensive. Lesson learned: Book with a travel agent or a reputable company with customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: ALNMTRAVEL9200
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this vacation thanks to the accomodtions, friendliness, and value at the Gran Porto Real. We left the husband and families behind and went for a girl's vacation. What stands out is the staff. From the moment we got there, the staff asked us our names and remembered them. They remembered what we drank and continually brought us drinks by the pool and beach. Special thanks to Teresa and Cecilia. They worked the pool and bar areas and couldn't have been friendlier. Every staff member there is great...too many to name. The pool towels guy, the waiters(Carlos) the bellboys, the front desk. They are trained well and take pride in going out of their way to help. The rooms are clean. There is a big difference between the oceanfront view and ocean view. We stayed in a jr. suite ocean view. Our room faced the Royal Hotel across the street and from the right-side of our balcony, you coul see the ocean. The ocean front is full view of the ocean facing the back of the hotel...the ocean, the beach, and the pools. The jr. suites are fantastic. Lots of room, good air-conditioning, very clean. The housekeeping staff keeps things very immaculate. Resturants are very tasty...I have been to other all-inclusives and have to say the food here was outstanding. Playa del Carmen is great. The hotel is within 2 blocks of the 5th Ave. shopping. Seemed like they preffered pesos, but had not trouble taking dollars too. The beach at the hotel was nice. There is a small portion that is rocky so be careful. I hurt my feet until someone told me to just keep walking several steps in the other direction. There, the beach was smooth with a few rocks. Very beautiful views and fun to swim. Pool was terrific. So was the bar with the swings and the pool on top of the third floor where there was a swim-up bar.The spa and workout areas are clean. I used the equipment every morning and had a great massage by Lucy-thanks! I had read other reviews and was prepared for the time-share pitch. We had just checked in and turned around to get our things, literally the guy was right in my face. Saying no was really a waste of time. He kept talking and walking in front of us. My friend finally had a pretty good smackdown with the guy telling him she was tired, hungry, and wanted to go to her room. After trying again, the guy said he would call later. My friend very forcefully had to say not to. They seemed to leave us alone after that. Be warned that they really don't take no for an answer. However, once you get past that, the rest is paradise and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real~best location in Playa Del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: dmnisk
Reviews.Content: A friend and I, both women in our mid-thirties, just stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen. Our main concern while booking a hotel was that it is close to shopping, restaurants and pubs. Our travel agent told us this would be the best hotel as it is close to everything. She was right!!! The hotel is one block from 5th Avenue, the best shopping I have ever experienced (and I am a shopoholic!). All the staff at the GPR were amazing, friendly and could actually answer every question we asked. They truly went out of their way to make our stay a good one. The rooms are clean and the food is fantastic! I have only two complaints, and they are small ones. 1) Room service only available until 10pm. There is a 24 hour restaurant that you can use but it would be nice to not have to leave the room once you are settled! 2) We arrived at 7pm after a long flight only to find out that our room was not available. We ended up in a room with a king bed after specifically requesting two doubles. No biggie, they made it up to us the next morning but a bit of a disappointment to arrive to. With that said, I would make the trip back just to eat at Maria's and to visit with Willy all over again! Thank GPR for making our trip a great one!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Mcella
Reviews.Content: Me, my parents and my sister visited Gran Porto Real during the last two weeks. We had a wonderful time! The hospitality is great, the people very very nice! My sister and I want to mention Alejandro, Cesar and Chicken from the entertainment team we've had a great time with them. Could not be better, the best and fun guys! If your planning to visit we can recommend you to find Richardo on the beach, he had organized the most beautiful snorkling trip for us. Everybody in the hotel wanted to make sure we had a lovely time, and they did a great job, we're missing the people and the wonderful county now already, and we're hoping to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Mexico October 2010”
Reviews.Author: Hellou19
Reviews.Content: the hotel was great staff were fantastic especially Mora the waiter, Chiken entertainment team, Carolina bar staff, but this is to name a few.... Location of the hotel is excellent as loads of shops in the local area and loads to do at night. Trips in the area are great a must see is Coba. You can do your own trip to Cancun by local bus. Cozemul is lovely. Well worth going there...

Reviews.Title: “Already itching to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Angela_Jerry
Reviews.Content: WOW!! From the minute we walked in, to the minute we got on our shuttle back to the airport, this trip was nothing short of amazing! Our room was fabulous even though we declined the upgrade. Samantha at the front desk was extremely happy and helpful right from the start and during our 10 day stay we peppered her constantly with questions and favors and she never once hesitated with anything! Gustavo at guest services was always there with a smile and some friendly conversation, offering to take us out to Coco Bongo (once his arm was healed!!). Amanda & Chicken with the entertainment were such fun people. I highly recommend a beach volleyball match with either of them!! At the pool bar Ecktor and Jose were always on top of things with a smile and a little chit chat, and Brandy is one of the happiest people you will ever meet! The food was delicious at all 3 restaurants, we did the buffet in the hotel every morning and Lorenzo was such a treat. Always happy, and seemed genuinely glad to see you each morning. No one in particular stood out at Maria's (the Mexican place) but at Il Pescatore (the Italian) Pamela and Sebastian were AMAZING. Should you decide to do any excrusions or have any questions about the area in general, you MUST find Ricardo. He can usually be found where they kayak rentals are (or they can point you in his direction) Being my first trip ANYWHERE, I really don't have much to compare it to, but I do know this....I don't want to go anywhere else but here! They have set the bar and set it high!! Can't wait to go back again and take the kids too!! Thanks for everything guys and girls! Angela & Jerry (Superman)

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: mellis26
Reviews.Content: In fact the best beach vacation anyplace. We have been to Playa del Carmen a dozen times, and though we have stayed in other places, we will never stay anyplace but the Gran Portal in the future. It has a great location, right on the beach in town, and is one of the prettiest hotels in the area. Though we normally like to dine out, (and because of its location, it is very easy to walk to dozens of restaurants), the food is quite good at the hotel, and we ate in most nights. We particularly enjoyed the hotel's Mexican Restaurant, Marias.. The rooms are large, comfortable and lovely. The staff and service are outstanding. Samantha at the front desk, Verlan at breakfast and Teresa at the pool bar are just 3 of the names that stand out, but everyone we came in contact with was very friendly and helpful. They made us smile, and greatly contributed to a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BiancadeKruijff
Reviews.Content: We have visited this hotel during the first 2 weeks of October and this was our best vacation ever! We can't wait to go back and we'll do so next year!! Our special thanks go to the entertainment team - Alejandro, Cesar, Amanda and Chicken (Victor), to Eduardo (towel guy) and Alvain (restaurant waiter). These people have coorporate in making this vacation special for us!! The food was good, every day something different. The rooms were fantastic (we had a junior suite which I recommend). Everything in and around the hotel is clean. Thanks to you all and we'll see you next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: brira16
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic week there. The architecture of the whole building is special and so is the staff. We would especially thank Cecilia, who was the friendly waitress at the pool bar( always with a smile, even as she was ill), the guys from the Animation team, especially Alejandro, Ramon & Cesar and the whole team from the kids club. Although our children (8 & 10y) did either know English nor Spanisch (apart from some sentences) they somehow managed to communicate with them. Also the food (incl. its presentation) was fantastic....we had the comparison, as we unfortunately changed to Cancun, to get an upgrade in the Real Caribe hotel. Never again. The only disadvantages of Gran Porto Real were the time-sharing blokes, who tried to get into contact with you by presenting the services of the hotel (we thought they were "officials") and that directly at the beach it was either rocky or the "harbour" for the fisher boats were in front of the hotel, so you had to walk about 200m to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: cart0250
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful place to stay. Just about everything is positive, the rooms, food, location, pools, maid, waiters, etc. The reviews saying the ocean is rocky are true, but just walk down a little further and it's fine. The one thing to watch out for are the dreaded time-share people in the hotel. Just tell them NO! These people are vultures! Of course they present themselves as people who will show you what the resort / sister resort has to offer etc, but don't be fooled by that. I avoided them throughout the check-in process, but one of them literally run after me to the elevator and I made the mistake of giving him my name / room #. The phone rung several times over the next few days. I'm willing to believe it was just a coincidence, but each time I didn't answer, the in-room safe stopped working! All you have to do is call the main desk and they fix it right away though. Anyway, it was basically a perfect vacation. The resort is amazing. If they could get rid of the time-share hounds, it would be even better, but these people are everything you go in Mexico. Simply say NO, walk away and just ignore any further comments. It may sound rude, but you are paying for a vacation, not be conned and harassed! Also, don't buy the tours through the Best Day travel outfit at the hotel. Simply walk up the street and the vendor will sell you the exact same tours at half the price. They are exactly the same! Don't miss out on them either. They are great tours! I have been to many all-inclusive hotels around Mexico and elsewhere, and this is one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return for our honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: helenandadam
Reviews.Content: We visited the Gran Port Real hotel in August/September this year following the really good reviews on Trip Advisor. We had never been to Mexico or been all inclusive before and didn't really know what to expect. We liked the idea of not having to carry money around all of the time, and all food and drink was included in the cost, but we were concerned that we might get bored with the choice of food after 2 weeks. We needn't have been concerned at all. The food was lovely in all of the restaurants, especially El Pescatore (Italian) and there was always a good varied choice in Albatross (buffet restaurant). Then you had the choice of a Mexican Restaurant (Marias) which again was lovely, and a sushi bar which we never went to. All in all we could not fault the food at all. The drinks were great too, a huge range of cocktails, all with a generous amount of alcohol in them, and plenty of ice cold Sol beer with lime. Now to the most important thing about this hotel, the staff. They were absolutely amazing and could not have been friendlier. There are too many to mention but the following people went out of their way to make our holiday extra special. Victor (Chicken), Mike, Cesar, Alejandro, Jesus, May, Eduardo (towels), Victor in Albatross restaurant, Alberto in the shop, Verlain in Albatross restaurant and Addy our room cleaner (who did amazing sculptures with the towels). The entertainment team (mentioned above) were fantastic and there was always something fun to do both day and night. We went on quite a few day trips and enjoyed them all. Try not to do the Tulum/Xel-Ha trip in one day, you really want a whole day in Xel-Ha to sample everything and get your moneys worth. Xplore was amazing and we tried the zip lines even though we were scared of heights. If you want to go horse riding through the jungle and then onto a deserted beach, try Rancho Baaxal as it was amazing and really good value for money. We didn't want to come home as we enjoyed it so much and we have booked to go again, for our honeymoon in October 2011. We can't wait. Thanks Gran Porto Real for a great holiday, see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hartman8
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from The Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen on the Mayan Riveria and as before had another wonderful experience with this resort. We cannot praise the staff enough for the great and friendly service we recieved. Some names to mention are in the Albatros resturant we were served by Mora and Verlan and Marcello and Ricardo. The hostess Sherly was such a friendly person it was a pleasure to see her each day and the manager for the resturant Elezar was always checking to see if we needed anything else but the staff was so good we didn't need anything .We also recommend the staff at the pool bar the bartenders Alejandro ande Aurelio were always ready to serve what ever we were asking for eveb if it was mostly just water. The many waiter and watresses that we would like to mention are Cecilla , Benito, Paoblo, and Jesus, they never stopped checking ion us to see if we needed anything. The lobby bar was also good service I did not get the name of the bar tender but he and a couple of the waitresses Miriam and Teresa remembered us from previous visits and made us very welcome.The food was excellent with a good variety at the buffet and also the al carte resturants which we tried out as well. We cannot say enough about the people that served us and helped us out in so many ways. Our room attendant was so wonderful and had our room done up shortly after we would leave in the morning and we would come back to see a new towel arrangement everyday. it was wonderful. many thanks to Anna with the Real Club and the conceirge who answered many questions and helped in other ways. We have been at this resort 4 times and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: e-eelina
Reviews.Content: Very good service in the restaurants. Specially Alejandro and Lorenzo at Albatros. Good locations, good variation of food everyday, both lunch and dinner. Our family junior suite was very clean and fresh all the time. Always towels and everything you needed. Thanks to our roomkeeper Gabriella. We liked the hotel because its Mexican style. The sports and entertainment team was very funny and kind. They made the days perfect and it was always something to do. Chicken, Julio, Cesar and Alejandro was keeping it fun all the time. They were always in a good mude. They were VERY funny, helpful and social. They made it to the best holiday I ever had. The bars inside/outside the hotel had very nice bartenders and servitrices. The Scuba Diving people were also very nice. Alejandro Mendoza (our diving instructor), Fernando and George were very kind and nice. They helped us with everything and was always in a good mude.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly faces and beautiful places!”
Reviews.Author: DivaDeej
Reviews.Content: Three girlfriends and I just spent 5 nights at the Gran Porto Real and had an AMAZING time. Many of the staff didn't speak too much English, but made up for it with their friendly, smiling faces, and great service. The atmosphere was colonial and laid-back, and the hotel was clean and central. The food was a little bland in the buffet even though there was a huge variety, but better in the Italian and Mexican restaurants. The staff remembered our room number and we always got our favorite table. Alejandro in the buffet was quick and friendly, and always refilling glasses with a smile! The tongs used to pick up food in the buffet were TOO heavy and flimsy though - they need better ones!! Amador in the Italian restaraunt was a cutie, and made good menu suggestions David Ancona in the lobby bar made excellent drinks and was lots of fun to chit chat with. Lorenzo in the Tiki Bar by the pool was a hit with the ladies, and kept the margaritas coming!! Gustavo in guest services was super friendly and we had no problems renting a car to visit the sites, from right in the lobby. We went down for Mi Casa Es su Casa, a house music festival - and many others were in the same hotel. Others who stayed at different places were not as satisifed as we were. We had an enjoyable, relaxing time, we partied HARD and will be returning next year for SURE! The people totally make this resort - not to mention the variety of activities available and the great location! I miss it already!!

Reviews.Title: “The vacation I'd like MOST to repeat in my lifetime and the sooner the better.”
Reviews.Author: jancampo
Reviews.Content: From the moment I encountered our jovial driver at the airport, to the most welcoming arrival at the front desk by Ericka and Luis, I truly felt so comfortable and safe (just like home). The hotel offers the total vacation package of fun, sun and complete luxurious treatment. My meals and accommodations would have to be rated as exceptional right along with the quality of care by those who provided them. My highest accolades go the the staff and their superiors (trainers). Every single one of the staff members I experienced was friendly, eager to serve, and seemed totally dedicated to satisfying my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise and our home away from home at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Martinez_CO
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel from the moment you walk in the door. You're greeted by friendly staff, excellent service from the hostesses, waiters/waitresses, bellboys, cleaning staff and everyone associated with the hotel. The "Enterainment Staff" is FIRST CLASS and provide the best activities and shows your whole stay. Thank you Miguel, Julio, Cesar, Victor and Alejandro!!! You're the best! Thank you Nairobe for the special attention, treats in our rooms and for making our special celebrations unforgettable and amazing (birthday and anniversary), you are amazing!!!! The Chef Ricardo is excellente!!! Thank you Dion, Rodrigo, Verlain, Lorenzo, Mora, Ivan and the Captain Edgar for the birthday celebration, it was the best!!!!! Thank you Nairobe, Iran, Francisco and Canela for the special dinner celebration at the Pescatore Restauante, excellent food and service!!! The beach is beautiful, the pool area is wonderful and vibrating with excitement and entertainment. The beach is peaceful, beautiful and serene. The hotel is located next to the infamous "5th Street" which offers fine dining, shopping from the local vendors and specialty shops, night life and is charming. This is our 6th year in a row to the Gran Porto Real every time has been special, we feel like family and are looking forward to next year. We have been invited to visit and dine at several different resorts, but none compare to the Gran Porto Real! The food is excellente and the atmosphere is the best!!! I would definitely recommend this resort!! We have referred many friends and family and they have had a wonderful experience at the Gran Porto Real. THANK YOU ALL AT THE GRAN PORTO REAL, WE WILL SEE YOU IN 2011.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: teeterkeene
Reviews.Content: I spent five days and four nights at the Gran Porto the second week of October. I have no complaints with the hotel. Here is a summary of my thoughts: Room: I stayed in the junior suite ocean view. Upon check in they stated that all the upper level rooms were booked for the first night but would be available the rest of the stay. Sounded sketchy but I went with it. They lived up to their promise but there is no way that the upper rooms were full. The resort was empty and they allowed us to move at 10am the next morning. Either way, the room was large and the bed was comfortable. The shower was huge and the water pressure was powerful. Beach: The beach at the hotel is non existent. Erosion is hurting this resort. There was a steep drop off on the beach (4-5 feet before the water). A lot of sand bags. Once you get in the water it is really rocky and you can walk forever and the water does not get deep. I recommend exploring the other side of the boat dock (up the beach) about a 5 minute walk near the cement wall. The beach is great and the water was amazing. no rocks, great waves.. Food: The food at the buffet was better than average. Every morning we ate at the buffet and the food was great. The omelette station was delicious. The staff wasn't too eager to assist with coffee but once asked they were helpful. With a standard stay we could choose from two restaurants for dinner. The Italian food was good, my ravioli was under cooked but my girlfriends steak and potatoes was amazing. The second night we ate at the mexican restaurant. No complaints here. The other nights we ate off site. Drinks The bar staff was great but I question if the hard alcohol isn't watered down. Beers were delicios and bountiful. Staff: The staff was friendly and helpful. I am not sure if I woudl stay here again but it was not because of the resort. I like to stay at different places and feel a better value could be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mellymomma
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real Resort is one of the best all-inclusive resorts I've ever been to. Upon checking in I was not happy with the location of my room. I went down to the front desk and spoke to Luis Armando the man in charge. He was quick to upgrade my room instantly!!!! I got to the next room only to hear a crying baby in the next adjoining room. Once again Luis took care of me quickly making my dilemma not more. I found Benito my forever barman by the pool very accommodating whenever I was thirsty. He was the man!!! I loved the beaches here, there were very clean. Our daughter was married here on the premises and the resort did a superb job. The food was wonderful and service was impeccable. We will return and soon! Thanks for everything!!!!

Reviews.Title: “trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: c-dubble-ya
Reviews.Content: Amazing place, amazing location amazing service, can't wait to go back. Special thanks to Samantha, George, Candy and Patty.

Reviews.Title: “Mexcio Fun”
Reviews.Author: CHUCK1013
Reviews.Content: Every summer we go to Mexico, Playa Del Carmen..(about 45 minutes south of Cancun), and stay at the Gran Porto Real resort. It's an all-inclusive and 2 blocks from 5th Ave, where there are about 2 miles of great shops and little bars etc. The resort itself is small compared to others, but that's the reason we like it. We usually get the same room(on the 3rd floor)..we look out.. and the ocean is right there. I mean really. We walk out in to the hall, go down 3 flights of stairs, and we're on the beach. My girl friend threw me a towel from the balcony.... that's how close our room is to the ocean...and the water is so clear ..you can see your toes when your up to your chin in the water...The staff at the Gran Porto are very professional and really seem to like making people happy...Room service, great food and drinks...Gran Porto Real....

Reviews.Title: “It has been an excellent visit and everything and everyone was superb!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vissie_10
Reviews.Content: From the beginning untill the end full service, lots of entertainment, very friendly staff whom we laughed a lot with and the food and drinks were great!!! It was a great holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Yucatan luxury”
Reviews.Author: GarryB85
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were welcomed & given a option of upgrading which we did & got a great room with the Ocean view,..What a awesome view & one that we'll all remember. The service was very good & the hotel & resort was kept very clean. The Maid service was impeccable & the fridge & bar was kept stocked up & often came knocking asking if we required any refills. The Food was spectacular & there was always a catch of the day fish,..& the pasta & desserts were to die for ,..The ocean & beach was simply fantastic!! if you walk along to the left of the pool towards the Adult Real resort next door. There you'll find sandy white powdery beaches & awesome swimmimg in the beautiful warmth of the Yucatan Peninsula.. 5th ave was a mere 5 min. walk & it was bizarre having these shops so close to our resort yet it remained peaceful & serene inside the resort while lavish nightlife & the best of the bar scene was minutes away,..& foresure repeat in order,.. & the Resort in a whole I would say was one of the best boutique resorts I've ever stayed in. Tremdous vacation spot at the Gran porto Real,..can't wait to return this year!!! 8/10

Reviews.Title: “Worse desk staff ever”
Reviews.Author: mariacarlos
Reviews.Content: The service at the front desk was horrible. We had problems from the minute we tried to check in. From leaks, to the safe not working, to construction at 7:30am down the hall, there is very little good I can say. I accidentally knocked a small soap dish off the back of the bathroom vanity and was told on two occasions that I would not be charged. Then at check-out was told there was a 350 pesos charge for it. I was also repeatedly asked in the lobby about time-share deals. Not worth the hefty price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelYada
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen is located only 2 blocks off the main shopping strip along a private beach. I was ecstatic about the location in reference to the strip as we would not have to plan a day excursion to go shopping or check out the local bars/restaurants. We had purchased the Junior Suite, but decided to upgrade to the ocean front room when we arrived, which was totally worth it. Our balcony gave us a gorgeous view of the pool area and the beach. We could even see the ships at Cozymel about 20 miles across the ocean! The hotel is well kept and very clean. Maids and workers were seen constantly mopping, cleaning, and painting to keep the hotel looking pristine and each would provide you with a kind smile, “hola.” Our room was on the third floor overlooking the beach and pool area and was well stocked with an in-room bar as well as drink mixers. I was pleasantly surprised that the room even had a DVD player. The king-sized bed was comfortable and the room spacious enough for the three of us. They provided a cot for our son to sleep in too at no extra charge. The bathroom has a large walk-in shower complete with a laundry line to hang your wet suits. The food at Gran Porto Real was excellent. They have 8 different food options. 1) The Albatros restaurant is buffet style open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Typically, they offered traditional Mexican flavors (not your typical tacos and fajitas). There are 2 grill stations that would offer different items grilled fresh. They always had a section for vegetarian dishes too. 2) The Gaviotas is located on the beach by the pool and is also a buffet style with typical American food for lunch like hot dogs, hamburgers, and French fries. There is a 24-hour snack-food restaurant located off the lobby with drinks and mixers available at your leisure. 3) Maria’s is a sit-down traditional Mexican restaurant only open for dinner. The food here is good, but the portions are tiny. The good thing is, with all-inclusive, you can order as many items as you like. 4) Il Pescatore is Italian and was our favorite restaurant. Only open for dinner, this restaurant serves fresh baked pizzas, pasta, shrimp, fish, and chicken dishes. My favorite was the Shrimp Risotto, while my wife’s was the ravioli. The pizzas are phenomenal there too. 5) There is a Sushi Bar located at the “private rooftop pool”. This was tricky to find, but since it was off the beaten path, not many people chose to hang at this quiet pool and bar. The sushi was pre-prepared rolls of various types and was really tasty. 6) Room Service is available twice/day per room. The menu is slightly limited, but when we did order it, the food was tasty. Sometimes it did take a while for the food to make it to the room. 7) The Beach-side private dinner is an additional fee, and we did not partake in this option as the all-inclusive options were plenty for us to choose from. 8) The Lobby area had coffee machines with biscuits, cookies, and other small sandwich-type snacks for nibbling. There is a main pool area with two pools separated by a walking bridge. This area was nice as both pools had a toddler section that was only about 1’ deep. There were bartenders constantly checking to see if you needed drinks or anything else. The beach offered cabanas at first come first serve, which were nice to have to stay out of the sun all day. The entertainment was ongoing throughout the day including water aerobics, trivia games, bingo, and other activities hosted by the spirit staff. They also offer twice a day bike tours through private neighborhoods and to some Mayan ruins. The Water Sports offers kayaks, sailboats, and snorkeling every day. Gran Porto Real offers a daycare open every day for ages 4-12. The kids would make crafts, play games, play on the playground, or watch movies. The staff there was very courteous and the kids always had a good time. They also offer night-time babysitting for a small hourly fee, where a babysitter comes to your room while you go out and enjoy a romantic dinner or night on the town. They also offer a teenage room filled with flat-screen televisions and every game system imaginable. A travel agency is on site to offer many different excursions including ATV Rides (a must), XCaret (an adventure park with zip lines, rafting, and other outdoor activities), Mayan Ruins of Tulum guided tours, and many more. Many Mexico resorts are off the beaten path, secluded, and require taxis or shuttle services to get into downtown for shopping. This all-inclusive resort is in the perfect location for families who don’t want to plan for shopping or seeing the city. We would definitely recommend this resort to anyone looking for an all-inclusive Mexican vacation. See pictures of this resort and others on www.travelyada.com

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best resorts I have...”
Reviews.Author: Diegoevelyn
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best resorts I have ever been to. The service was more than great, the food exellent. The most that I loved was the serviced received by 2 bartenders at gaviota bar and they are Lorenzo Avila and Brandy, they are so excellent that on my next return which will be for my wedding I would like to ask for permission for them to part of my wedding, not as bartenders but as guests. Their service and the rest of the resort has made me make the decision of coming back again. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: WJJ-TO
Reviews.Content: My wife and 8 month old son, Jackson went to Gran Porto Real with the belief that we were going to a resort that was child friendly and in a great location. We weren't disappointed. The resort is located on the beach and just a 2 min walk from the main strip in Playa del Carmen. The staff were great too. Verlan at Albatros Restaurant took kindly our son and was a pleasure to be around. Ivan, Mora and Benito were also great. Gustavo greeted us at the start of our trip and promptly got us acquainted with the resort and amenities. Nice beach and good food. All in all, we would definitely recommend this resort if you are looking for a nice getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Gran porto real is GREAT, i will book it again for my next stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kuppie83
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen is an excellent resort. I don't have any complained at all. I can recommend this resort to everybody. The complete staff of this resort is very friendly and working very hard. There is also a very good animation team. We had a very nice room which was very clean. I would like to thank you our house cleaner for this excellent service! Also the location of this resort is very good, you are a few minutes away from several disco's and the fifth avenue with all the little shops, bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Best vacation we had in 50 years”
Reviews.Author: Becky019
Reviews.Content: Our trip was for our 50th annverisary. It was Awesome, the service staff, the activities staff, the best.of everything. The Food was great. The front desk was very proffesional. We will come back. We had the best ever time anyone could have. We met up with some family that have been there for 5 to 6 times and they to will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Veru good hotel”
Reviews.Author: itsmejc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good. Only there is a little shadow on the beach. Must be better.

Reviews.Title: “It was Great!”
Reviews.Author: FredDWG
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful. The food was superb. Their 'sales' people were not overly aggressive - like the 5th Ave folks are. Cleaning is a priority for them. The hotel's location is perfect on many levels. Close to 5th Ave where there is a wide variety of retailers. And, if you wish to take a side trip, Playa Del Carmen is close enought to all the major attractions. The hotel is also very close to the beach. Snorkelling can be done right there. I saw a variety of fish.

Reviews.Title: “Staff will rob you blind”
Reviews.Author: April041
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort for 10 days. Overall the resort was good amenities, value, etc wise. Close to the end of our vacation our safe was robbed of 700.00 usd. The hotel conceirge and security were of no help and when we urged them to look into furthur they basically accused of of lying and that we didnt really have the money. After pulling the door card log to see who was in and out of the room during the time frame in question it was very obvious that the mini bar staff had been the only one in the room at this time. The staff lied to our face, and the management was siding with them, refusingb to look furthur into the matter. They were of no help at all. I will never return to this hotel as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: spdrman
Reviews.Content: There was seven of us that went down there and we all had a wonderful time. The hotel was gorgeous and the service was outstanding. The staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Aaron the bell hop was so wonderful, Cecilia the waitress was so funny, David the bartender made the best drinks and last Benito the waiter always made sure your glass was full.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing holiday at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: NatalieandJC
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen is AAAMAAAZING. We will definetely be back for new years . The rooms are large and so clean. The staff is really friendly and non stop making you feel welcome especially Lorenzo & Pamela in bar Gaviota they really make our stay more enjoyable can't wait to see them again soon, keep the good work.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't horrible but for the money, I think I will try somewhere else next time . . .”
Reviews.Author: Likwyds
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th visit to Playa del Carmen and my first stay at the Gran Porto Real. Normally we would stay at the Grand Coco Bay which is a solid 3 star resort. We thought we'd try something a little nicer and nearer to 5th Ave, so we selected the Gran Porto Real. The hotel is very clean and beautiful. We had a super cute, super small standard room with a king size bed. The staff was friendly and helpful and the location in proximity to 5th Ave was unbeatable. The cons were the food and the beach. Where the food is concerned, for the amount of money we paid, I was definitely expecting more variety. There were so many repeats that by the third day I was bored and tired of seeing the same vegetables, the same 5 desserts, etc. The specialty restaurants were also just okay. Eating at each once will just about do it. The menu selection did not change which was a real disappointment, especially when it came to the desserts. It would have been nice to have something other than the same 3 choices. The beach was pretty to look at but there are a TON of large rocks and stones under the water making it IMPOSSIBLE to walk out in the water and not hurt your feet or bang your shins. Whenever I went for a swim in the sea, I would tell myself that if I keep walking out eventually the water would deepen and I would not have to worry about the rocks . . . unfortunately, that never happened. So, that's my story. Overall, it was a nice place but not for the price. In my opinion, the value just wasn't there.

Reviews.Title: “Re-visit to Our Second Home”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBee83
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from my 3rd trip to Gran Porto Real and yet again it didn't disappoint! The location of the resort can't be beaten with Fifth Avenue, with all the shops, bars, restaurants and clubs, less than 5 mins walk away. The hotel itself is pristene. The service from all the staff is amazing especially from Benito & Pablo our pool waiters, Miriam the bar waitress and Lorenzo and Verlain the waiters in the Albatross restaurant. Over the 3 years we have visited this hotel I am pleased to say that we have made many friends at the Gran Porto Real namely the guys on the Entertainment team; Miguel, Julio, Victor and the new editions to the team since our last visit Alajandro and Cesar are amazing. They work so hard and keep everyone entertained from morning till night....great guys! The evening shows have improved since our last visit...the 4 Elements show was fab! I would highly recomment this hotel to anyone...it is very family friendly but also caters for couples and groups of friends who are there for relaxation and a good time! We love it and will be booking to go back to our 2nd home in 2011!!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in the Grand Porto real”
Reviews.Author: Anne007_10
Reviews.Content: We had a great vacation in Grand porto real. This hotel is near by the 5th street and nightlife. There was a wonderfull service in the hotel but specially the service on the beach. The nice weither Benito bring us our Mango tango cocktail always with a smile. Thank you!! Greetz from Holland

Reviews.Title: “everything was up to amazing service”
Reviews.Author: redflame99
Reviews.Content: guest service was amazing and very informitive , service by pool area was amazing .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JanetMissouri
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen is wonderful. We will definitely be back. We had the Junior Suite Oceanview, what a view! The rooms are large and so clean. Everyday they would leave beautiful flowers on your bed and in your bathroom. You will feel so pampered. The staff works non stop making you feel welcome. My husband and I and another couple also had massages and it was so relaxing laying next to the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome”
Reviews.Author: lisa-greg4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with some friends and loved it. When we arrived we were greeted by Aaron who within a minute had us all a cold beer or two. check-in went quickly and we ate lunch while they took our bags to our rooms. The buffet was not what we thought it would be. The food was very bland but we did eat there several times. The rooms are beautiful and the staff leaves fresh flowers and towel animals in your room everyday. We had an oceanfront room which i'm glad we upgraded the view was awesome. The spa we didn't get to use but if you do, you have access to it all day. It was very humid so we stayed in the pools most of the time. We went right after the hurricanes so the ocean was really rough the first two days. The pools were perfect and the wait staff was great. Bonito was the best waiter, he had a drink waiting for you before you finished your other one. The Italian resteraunt was great and you don't have to have reservations. 5th avenue shopping was good, it is 1 block away. The best night was when we went to Coco Bongo it's 50.00 usd to get in but it starts at 11:00 and is the best show. Be sure to get early tickets and go early. It gets packed but is well worth the money there were people of all ages(18 and up) in there. It was a great trip, the only thing we didn't like was the beds they are very hard, but everyone from other resorts we talked with said the same thing about theres. It was an awesome trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort experience of my life and a dream wedding at one place!”
Reviews.Author: LiveLaughL0veTravel
Reviews.Content: WoW! I have to write my review in 50 characters? I could write a book about how AMAZING this resort is. I have to first say that if you are planning a wedding in Playa Del Carmen.. HAVE IT AT THIS RESORT. Zulma Dominguez, the wedding coordinator is fabulous. I just had my dream wedding and everything completely exceeded my expectations. Zulma took care of every detail. Please contact me privately for more details/pictures. The service at this resort is amazing. Every employee went above and beyond when ever we needed something. They all seem so happy and friendly and are always smiling. The rooms are very large and updated. The food and drinks are wonderful. The salon and spa was the best I have ever experienced. I wish I had room to write more. The Gran Porto Real will forever hold a special place in my heart and we will be back many more times!

Reviews.Title: “the best holiday ever!”
Reviews.Author: kasperandanna
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Gran Porto Real! the entertainment team was the best!! cesar, alejandro en Victor a.k.a. chicken, thank you for making our vacation the best one we ever had!!! we hope to see you again

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: MPL68
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 14 nights and had a wonderful time. The staff is great, friendly, correct, helpful loved Lorenzo and Pamala and the others at the pool bar, these guys/gals were great. The room was big, clean, fully stocked mini bar, clean towels everyday, etc. Breakfast and lunch were great, very good selection off warm and cold food, Sherly was especially nice always a friendly chat and a smile. Diner was a mixed bunch, some nights amazing, some not so good. But they also have two special restaurants available. Which we went to a couple of times. Here the same thing, order something twice and you will get something completely different. 4 minutes walk from 5th avenue which has some great shops and bars. Final words are about the entertainment guys, man those guys work hard. Alejandro and Cesar even got us to join in, which is not easy because we are lazy. Thanks to all the staff at Gran Porto Real for this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real was Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: Lovey63007
Reviews.Content: Was there from 9/10 - 9/19 and had a wonderful stay. As we arrived they served us a tropical drink. Went for my bday and they brought me a piece of cake, card & bottle of wine up to our room. We had a standard room it was small but it worked. Bathroom was small the sink was outside of the bathroom. Our so called balcony had 2 chairs in the hallway facing the street. The bed was a lil. hard. We were offer to upgrad to a suite for $20us more a night but we declined. Rather spend that $ on shopping or sightseeing. Location is perfect just 2 short blocks from 5th ave. Beach was a little rocky, not as clear and kind of smelled but we walked 5 mins away and found the perfect beach spot. All the drinks are great they have name brand liquor, beer on tap is Dos XX, they do have Tecate Light n a can but u have to ask for it.
