The swim up bar was small but I perfered it better then the main pool. Jose @ the swim up bar was on top of things never once had to ask. The bars all seem to close by 11pm and there is no club on site. There is a room with snacks, tap beer & liquor open 24hrs. Food was ok kind of got burnt out after the 3rd day seemed to have same varity of food each day. We had a chance to go to Maria's and it was just ok. But they did have great chicken tortialla soup. We had a 25 min massage they were wonderful. The spa is $13us but when we went it was 50% off making it $7.50us per day. They gave us an offer to go to the sister hotel in Cancun The Gran Caribe for free with transportation and so we did for the last 4 nights. The hotel is a lot more fancy and double the size. The beach there was perfect but they had no swim up and the 2 pools were smaller. They have a water park area with 2 big water slides that adults can use and boy did I have a blast on them. The food here was a lil. better. Maria's you had to make reservation were @ GPR you didn't. The lobby bar stood open till 12 am and they had a live band each night but again no club on site. All rooms are suites so they were roomy and nice. Here they only had Dos XX on tap but all other liquor was the same as GPR. The taxi ride to the ferry going to Isle Mujeras was $15us one way. The night life in Cancun was not with in walking distance. I would say its a 10min drive or shorter depending on the taxi driver. Both resorts had security day and night so we felt safe. 5th ave even felt safe. Not once did we see anything out of the ordinery. If you want to use the internet it's $1us for 10min. I liked GPR better cuz its walking distance to 5th ave. You could walk to town for shopping, dinner or drinks without paying a taxi. We were also able to walk along the beach from GPR to the Cozumel ferry. Just wished GPR beach was better and would make this resort 100%. Both resort are wonderful and would recommend to everyone. I cant wait to go back I miss it already!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: vsheri9457
Reviews.Content: Ours was an all inclusive resort that surpassed all of our expectations. The ambience in Playa Del Carmen is absolutely wonderful. The service at our hotel was great. Special call out goes to Teresa, our beach server and Benito the poolside bar tender. They were always gracious and always watched out for our needs. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place where both you and your older children can have a great time together

Reviews.Title: “viva mexico ''”
Reviews.Author: hillary37
Reviews.Content: we had the pleasure of staying in this great hotel,we heard that Playa del Carmen is beautiful and we checked food from the restaurant are exquisite we love mexican food,everything was excellent the lovely pool a bar nearby and the beach a few steps the incredible spacious lobby be i,n this hotel is something that will not soon forget but a comment is a thank you to everyone who made it worth the long trip,especially Mr. iran who attended us like royalty all the waiters were good but mr.iran exceeded my expectations.asked us not forget Mr. ventura his captain, thanks and viva mexico

Reviews.Title: “undecided on this resort”
Reviews.Author: marler94
Reviews.Content: This resort has definite tradeoffs to other places I have stayed in Playa. They are a time share hotel and the pressure to upgrade and sit thru the presentation never let up. Also I found one memember of the staff to be deceptive about booking our excursions with our travel arranger. The beach was very small and extremely rocky. The food however was EXCELLENT. Five star dining to say the least. The beach front walk out room was exactly as described. Merely a few feet from our room to the beach and pool and very beautiful. Many families with small children so it was really kid friendly. Bottom line if you dont mind the hassle and the beach quality then you will like it. If it matters, then not.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil vacation with friends and family.”
Reviews.Author: Lainikai
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Gran Porto Real. The location is right on the beach and 2 blocks from Playa's downtown shopping. The best part about our whole vacation was the service we received. All of the front desk people, servers, bartenders and housekeeping was top notch. Jose at the Sushi Bar was amazing. He was extremely attentive and professional. We spent most of our vacation in the tranquil pool on the 3rd floor. Tranquil is a perfect way to describe the pool. It was mostly adults and had a swimup bar. If you are looking for a perfect location to relax this is the place for you. We will definately return to the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “excellant”
Reviews.Author: suzannekees
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Gran Porto , we had a really fantastic holiday and thought it was excellant value for the amount we paid . Having been to other All inclusives we were suprised at the range of International drinks ( from Baileys to Bacardi ) , the large choice of seafood etc.( the best gambas & mussels we've ever eaten anywhere ) and in general the buffets and restaurants . We enjoyed all the activities and entertainement ( including the 9 girls from Mid West !!)The staff were VERY hard working and always polite and friendly (to mention a few ... Jose , Benito , Victor, May ) . Compared to hotels & resorts weve stayed at in the USA , Far East etc. we found this hotel to be VERY GOOD and will be returning soon .

Reviews.Title: “Jose @ Swim-up Sushi Bar”
Reviews.Author: GoodTimes29155019
Reviews.Content: The best bartender in the hotel. Kept our cups full and we had a great time. Thanks man. PS. hotel was ok. W E HAD A GREAT TIME IN MEXICO. GREAT LOCATION!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as brilliant as I thought it would be.”
Reviews.Author: trishnal
Reviews.Content: The downside On arrival - even though this holiday had been booked for over a year, the rooms were not ready so they put us in a "Junior Suite" until the next day. No way were we going to pay extra to stay in this room it was on the inside of the hotel, overlooking the air con units that supplied all the hotel. The food was average I was very disapointed,If you could speak fluent Spanish and knew what to ask for then you were OK otherwise you had to guess that what was on little signs in front of the food trays was all that there was, when in fact if you spoke to the short order chef he produced other thing from behind the counter. The beef was an experience in itself, it was so tough to eat that you needed teeth like razors to bite through it, that was of course proviiiding you could cut through it in the first place. The main hotel eatery was not my most favourite place, the Italian was very good and the Mexican was also nice, Saying all that you can't please all of the ppeople all of the time.. Oh and where was the ice cream, never saw one all the time we were there. The standard rooms are very standard, and the hotel try to push you into upgrading to other rooms. The standard rooms have no balcony and then to add insult to injury, they removed the table from outside our room. so when we sat out there was nowhere to put your drink only the floor The hotel security is slightly overboard, one day I felt like I was being stalked by one of the security guards, walking behind me and speaking into his radio while writing things down on his clipboard, very un-nerving. The positive side. The sushi bar pool was my favourite place, Jose` is a little gem. When us lot and the 12 American ladies from St Louis & Kansas City were there, he worked like a trojan and never lost that lovely smile. Will miss the guy. The rooms are the cleanest I have stayed in, clean towels every day and loads of them too. The 24 hour bar was a nice cool place to go when you had finished you evening meal, or if you just wanted to go for a snack, you just helped yourself to the booze. In general. The entertainment staff try very hard with the shows The reception staff are very helpfull The food is adequate the hotel is lovely & clean All in all a good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “great great place”
Reviews.Author: mrman1955
Reviews.Content: we been to gran porto real twice in the last year and cant wait to go back..its all you can think about after you visit..perfect location right on the beach and a short walk to 5th av..which is where all the restuarant and clubs are and the pier where you can catch a ferry to take you to cozemel $22.00 round trip..we loved it there so much we cant imagine going anywhere else..chichen itza is a great day trip for the whole family. the people here are so nice and will make you feel like royalty..well worth every penny...kenny

Reviews.Title: “A great family friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: Whoze
Reviews.Content: Before anything else I would like to commend the incredible staff at the Porto Real. At no point were we greeted with anything but smiles and a wonderful attitude. In particular there were three people who really made our experience; Pamela Sarvido, Lorenzo Auva, and Ronal Godines. (I apologize if I misspelled their names.) All three of these employees went way above and beyond to make sure my wife and I had a great time. The service and welcoming attitude were phenomenal. I have been to Cancun before but due to having a child my wife and I needed a more family friendly resort for a friend's destination wedding. The Gran Porto Real was outstanding. We had a gorgeous view of the beach from the third story. There was an activity center for our daughter and the staff there were amazing. They played with the kids, made animal balloons, and had nutritious snacks as well. We did not leave our daughter to be babysat at the activity center, but that was an option. Th restaurants are numerous and there is enough variety that we never got bored with the food during our one week stay. The food is great. Fresh seafood and plenty of options if you are a vegetarian. I will be recommending this resort to friends and family who are traveling to Mexico. We managed to get many touristy activities in (visited ruins, swam with dolphins, etc.) while also finding time to relax by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “a real underrated gem”
Reviews.Author: dougthebarber
Reviews.Content: every aspect of this place is class a...the food is great, even at the buffet and the service everywhere here is second to none....the drinks decent...the pool clean, the beach so so....the entertainment at the pool is good..the location is excellent for shopping and sight seeing.....parking is ok.....the rooms are fantastic and if there is a problem, it is handled in seconds not hours like most places.....the only negative is the regular room which is on the service street side and around 6am the truck and trash collection noise wakes you up....i would get the ocean view if i went again to avoid the disturbance....and the beds are hard as a rock......overall the place is great....the reviews dont do it the justice it deserves......

Reviews.Title: “everything was possible and all empolyees delivered great service”
Reviews.Author: arjenvandoremalen
Reviews.Content: special thanks to: capt. Freddy, samuel, fernando Alex bar. (beach party crew) Alberto and Pamela of the bar at swimming pool Armador at el pescatore the lady's of the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Caarolyn
Reviews.Content: Have been all over Mexico, my favorite place, and for a beach resort hotel, this is the best one I have stayed in. Everyone who works there were friendly and helpful. The resturants were delicious, the rooms large and very comfortable, and the beach beautiful with waiters everywhere to wait on you. I will definately go again. Carolyn Gorham, Lake Kiowa, TX

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Copas2008
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation in another hotel outside Playa del Carmen and i changed to Gran Porto Real at the last minute because all the good reviews and i m so grad i did it. A big "A+" for the staff so helpful and polite, anything you ask you will have someone to help you right-away, any little problem had in less then 5 minutes there was someone at our door to help. The Hotel is beautiful, very well maintained and very important CLEAN. The location is just great, walking distance from all the restaurants and bars, right on the beach and at one block from the busy 5th avenue. There's a buffet, Italian and a Mexican restaurants and a hot dog and burgers Hut right on the beach and a 24 hours snack bar, almost forgot there's a sushi bar on the second floor...the buffet is not WOW but is good, lots of variety, the Italian and Mexican are very good, i liked the Italian better. sushi i can't tell because i don't eat fish. Couple of bar around the resort and for my surprise the drinks are good, not watery at all, couple of months ago i was in Las Vegas and payed $14 bucks for a Mojito at the mandaly Bay and it was pure water.. The ground are nice there's a big pool by the beach and there's another pool on the 2nd floor and a jacuzzi on the 3rd floor. I was our anniversary and we had champagne and a cake waiting for us at our bedroom.. It was my fifth time in Cancun/Playa del Carmen and now this is my favorite place, believe me, it is that good.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing luxury”
Reviews.Author: paulie86
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations, excellent service at all the resturants and bars, although the Mexican was a little slow to seat us both times we visited. The Italian resturant was lovely and Pamela greeted us with enthusiasm and warmth each time we visited. The tranquil pool and bar is a hidden jem and we spent most of our days lazing around this pool! The hotel had lots of other extras such as a complimentary soft drink minibar, room service and a 24hr bar with named spirts such as Smirnoff and Tanquerry. One small downside was that the standard rooms were a little small with tiny bathrooms and we felt upgrading to a mini suite was not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: katefromboston
Reviews.Content: I embarked on a solo getaway to the Gran Porto Real on Thursday, September 2, 2010. My flight arrived into the Cancun airport at 10:30am and I had luggage in hand and was sitting in the Lomas van within 15 minutes of landing. Lomas had me walking into the hotel lobby at 11:45am and I was ready to get to the beach/pool. I didn’t think that my room would be ready since check-in is 3pm but I was pleasantly surprised to learn that it was! Oh happy days! I had “checked-in” online the day before and it asked me for my airline, flight number and arrival time so maybe that helped. While I was waiting for the key the bellman brought me a glass of Champagne to sip and then he escorted me to my room which was a Gran Jr. Suite Beachfront walkout. He walked through the room with me and showed me all the features/amenities and asked if I had any questions. He also pointed out my private palapa on the beach and said that it was marked with a sign the said: “Reserved for Suite 135”. After he left I practiced the sport of “speed changing”, grabbed my bag and hit the beach! The remainder of the report I will break into categories. Rooms: I was fortunate enough to book an upper level suite and I would do it again in a heartbeat! The room was spacious, clean and well maintained. The air conditioning unit worked so well that I had to burrow under the covers at night. Also, the in-suite refrigerator kept everything ICE COLD which was a surprise based on my experiences at other resorts. The closet was fairly spacious with an in-room safe (numerical pad), iron and ironing board and 2 robes and slippers. The bathroom was large and spacious with a HUGE shower. The water pressure was phenomenal and I always felt I got all the soap out of my hair…….I know the men won’t appreciate that as much as the women.  I brushed my teeth everyday with the water from the tap and never once felt sick. The entertainment center in the room came complete with a 32” flat screen television which I believe had satellite television since I got a lot of channels (English speaking I might add) including 2 or 3 HBO channels. There was also a Bose docking station but it would not “charge” the IPODS and I didn’t bring my charger since I assumed the docking station would take care of it for me. No biggie though! One of the drawers in this center was my liquor cabinet with full bottles of Jose Cuervo, Johnnie Walker Red, Barcadi Rum, and two other liquors that I am having a hard time remembering. The room service staff was stellar! My room was generally cleaned somewhere around 9-11 since I was out of my room by 8am every morning. The Room Service staff took care of restocking my refrigerator everyday and then turndown service happened around 8pm. Bars and Bar Staff: There are 3 bars at the hotel aside from the ones located at the a la cartes. The lobby bar is a great treat to sit and take in the action, both inside and outside, if you were tired of being out in the sun. The beach bar (Gaviotas) is located at the pool but the hotel employs so many servers that you never have to leave your seat, either beach or pool, before someone is asking if you need a new drink. By far the best drink service that I have ever experienced! The quiet pool has a pool bar and it also serves sushi around 11:45ish. My favorite was the beach bar but that was where all the action was taking place. There is a 24 hour lounge that is self service and has snacks, beer, wine, champagne, soda, coffee machine, and top shelf liquor. This lounge also houses 4 computers that your can purchase minutes for……$1.00 for 10 minutes. Food: Albatros – This is the buffet restaurant and it is typical of most AI’s with regards to variety and types of food served. I ate here every morning for breakfast, twice for lunch and once for dinner. I feel that even picky eaters could find something to tickle their fancy. Parrillada Grill – This is the beach grill that serves nachos, hamburger, hot dogs etc. while you are lounging around the pool. Typical snack shack food. Room Service – The first night that I arrived I was so tired from my early flight/lack of sleep and then 5 hours of sun that I ordered room service and was asleep by 8pm.  The room service meal was delivered by Nairobi who also delivered fruit and wine to me earlier in the day. The dinner menu has around 6-7 entrees ranging from burger – tacos; it has soup and salad on the menu as well. Il Pescatore – This is an indoor (air conditioned) Italian restaurant. The menu includes pricing since it is open to the public as well as the hotel guests. I had a Caprese Salad as a starter and then the Salmon as the main course and tiramisu for dessert. My drink of choice was red wine but the waiter brought me a “special” drink which was a chocolate martini. Stellar service! At each of the a la cartes I had 2 people waiting on me since the work in teams. Maria’s – This is an outdoor restaurant that services Mexican food. The night that I ate here the weather was very nice with a breeze so I was very comfortable. I had the Tortilla soup as a starter and the Enchiladas as my main course. The food was very good! I was pleasantly surprised my entire stay with the food and beverage quality. I skipped dessert this night so I don’t even know what they offered. Pools: The quiet pool is located on the third floor of the hotel and has a pool bar. It is mainly an adult’s pool but a few kids went swimming with their family one day that I visited that pool. I chose not to frequent it too often because 1) I like to be close to the action and 2) I watched a newlywed get snookered and hurl all the Miami Vices she consumed all over the pool deck. No offense but I don’t find that behavior fun to be around. The main pool is where all the action is from water aerobics to salsa lessons to pool volleyball. There were not that many children while I was visiting but I believe that is because school had started again. I also want to mention that this resort takes great precaution for guest safety at the pool/beach. There are always around 4-6 lifeguards, and quite possibly more, patrolling the area. Beach/Ocean: Ok, this might be the only semi-negative of the whole resort. The beach does in fact have a 1-2 foot drop-off to the ocean, however, they plowed a section to allow for a gradual slope into the ocean. The ocean was very shallow for quite a ways out but it was rocky. There are numerous boats tied up to the right on the beach. One day, due to an obscene amount of seaweed you really couldn’t swim in the ocean. They brought out a tractor of some sort and started to remove it. I have no idea what they did with it after that. Spa Real/Spa Azul: The spas, at both the Real and the Royal, were very nice and for some unknown reason all their services were 50% off. I had an Emergency Sun Treatment one day at the Spa Real and it cost $25.00. I then had a pedicure at the Spa Azul and it cost $24.00. I can say it was well worth it for a little pampering!!! I must say that I would go back to this resort again! What an amazing experience that I had in this paradise. I would also like to comment that I never had any qualms or reservations about visiting solo and I felt safe the entire time! If anyone has any questions please feel free to PM. Kate :)

Reviews.Title: “Total Relax”
Reviews.Author: Anishabella
Reviews.Content: The quality of the service is the best of this hotel. Lorenzo at the beach bar makes the best margaritas in all Playa del Carmen (proved) and Benito makes sure nothing is missing you while you are at the beach. Another great tip... omelettes at breakfast. I would improve the room with better air conditioner and tv, but still the room service was a 5 star. A great place to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners delite! AMAZING SERVICE! AMAZING EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: missbebe12
Reviews.Content: I went there with my husband for our honeymoon! THe minute we arrived, we were instantly greeted with a cocktail! We had the all inclusive package which is totally worth it!! As honeymooners, we were surprised with little sweet touches throughout out stay! One night they left us champagne and fruits! Another night they made a heart from bath towels on the bed with flowers, then they made a swan... and another night two swans kissing and making a heart... all with flowers! One of the simplest, but cutest things they did was go in our rooms in the evening and left a hershey mini candy bar with a note that said "We hope you have sweet dreams." So yeah, great service!! We were always greeted by everyone that worked there. They would stop and ask us how we were doing, and about where we were from, etc... definitely making we knew we were important to them, and felt comfortable. Our room was great... it was cozy and always well kept! We even had a mini bar and a mini fridge with sodas and beers that we had access to included in our all inclusive package. Several of their employees stood out! Mind you, all of them were super friendly! Tips are included in the package (you may tip extra if you want) but what I liked most is that they didn't lounge around waiting for you to tip more... most of the time they were gone before you could even do so. There is poolside bar service too. Pablo (one of the outside waiters) even learned our name and was super attentive! Besides that there is a sports and entertainment team that made sure we were always having fun! They even would bother me and my husband and have us participate in some games they do! They did bicycle tours, kayaking, snorkeling, volleyball, etc... again, all included! Victor (aka Chicken) and Cesar were more than just attendants, they literally befriended us from the first night and were always super cool and nice. The restaurants were pretty good, our favorite was the italian one... by far the best waiter there was Israel! If you decide to do a tour (not included), I recommend doing the Rio Secreto. It's a underground cavern/river... a beautiful and amazing experience and its actually one of the cheaper tours too. I am honestly not doing justice to the hotel in this review. I will definitely return and recommend this place. It's even nice if you have kids because they have kid zones, so even when we expand our family...we can still stay here. The ONLY complaint I have is the TV. It's out dated and the reception isn't all that great... but then again if your vacationing in Mexico you shouldn't be watching tv!! Another convinient thing about the hotel's location is that it's walkign distance from some place street much like a South Beach/Saks 5th Avenue in NY. There are stores, more restaurants, and even night clubs! So it's pretty cool not to have to worry about taking a taxi to go shopping. Even though the hotel itself has a giftshop, and sometimes I noticed they had better prices than the other stores in the area... Again, if you are considering this hotel, I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: itfc_10
Reviews.Content: just returned from 2 week hol in the gran porto real, mexico - 2 adults, 13 yr old & 10 yr old. We had a fantastic stay,the hotel was extremely clean and well staffed. We wanted for nothing. The staff (all the entertainment team, manuel the conciege, benito, teresa, maria to name but a few) were lovely. They couldn't be more helpful or friendly. The food in all the restaurants and the grill bar was really good. Importantly, the kids always found something on the menu that they liked. The beach was golden, the sea blue. Just up the road (5 min walk) you have 5th avenue which is the main shopping street with lots of bars/restaurants but to be honest we didn't need to visit anywhere else as the hotel food/drink was perfectly ok. Always felt safe as there are security guards around all the time although they are not "in your face"

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Michou3012
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time at this hotel mainly due to the clean environment and well decorated space. But expecially for the personnel who worked there. They were all very friendly to us and always smiling. We especially liked Alonso and Ceasar who were naturally friendly and who made us laugh. The rooms are extremely well kept and clean. Rooms are also well decorated with alot of taste.

Reviews.Title: “service”
Reviews.Author: bakers32037
Reviews.Content: rooms are excelent the service in the il tescatore italian restaurant exceeded more than y expected MR.MATEO the waiter an CHEFF BENJAMIN and all the kitchen staff did an excelent jod with the service and the foof i want to say that the food was delicious and had an amazing taste CONGRADULATIOND CHEFF BENJAMIN..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, service, huge family room, beach a letdown.”
Reviews.Author: FoodieMama2
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (children 10yrs & 9yrs) had a fantastic stay. The food and service exceeded our expectations since we stayed the previous week in an AI further south that was beautiful but had mediocre food and very poor service. The oceanfront, family junior suite room is huge. The decor is very Mexican which we liked. The only disappointment was the beach. The water was dirty and smelled so we stuck with the pool. Central location for Playa del Carmen perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vacaciones23
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, all amenities are great, our only negative comment is about the beach area it was a little dirty, you have to wall about 400 meters right or left for a nice spot at the beach, not a big deal, but the pool, swim up bars, restaurants, and the staff are great. Thaks to Benito, Carlos, Astrid, Victor, Eduardo, and all the others that made our stay at the hotel so good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: LindasTripReviews
Reviews.Content: This is a review for Jaime Serrano, fabulous waiter for the buffet restaurant in your hotel. He is a gracious, warm, friendly, and extremely competent waiter. He always served us with the utmost respect, and went out of his way to be helpful. He always had a smile! He would be a reason to return to your hotel and to eat in your restaurant. Sincerely Linda Gabrilo

Reviews.Title: “Entertainment and staff were exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: ARK0810
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful! Everyone was very friendly and helpful, but not overly attentive, so I never felt bothered. The room (jr. suite) was very nice and accommodated 4 guests perfectly. The location was exactly what we were looking for. It was near the city, so we were able to safely leave the resort and walk to restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. to experience the culture. The best part of the experience was the staff members at the hotel, especially Chicken, Cesar and Julio. They were respectful, helpful and fun. A big thank you to those guys! There was always some kind of entertainment or activity to join throughout the day: volleyball, pool games, water aerobics, dance lessons, water sports, bike tour, salsa band (excellent), nightly outings, etc. The themed night shows were awesome too! The dancers were amazing. Coco Bongo is a must!! The only thing I wished was different was our beach. It had a lot of seaweed and coral, so it was hard to swim right there. Although, just down the beach there were better swimming areas, so it was not that big of deal. I would most definitely recommend this hotel. It was so relaxing, but there were also so many opportunities to be active throughout the day, meet people and enjoy the beautiful scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: jasmineinaugust
Reviews.Content: The moment we entered the lobby they were trying to get us to upgrade to a better room. That was a bit suspicious to us but we looked at the standard room anyways. We walked in and not but two seconds later my better half said "No way". So they screwed us 500 US for upgrading to the Jr Suite. During our stay they also bothered us anytime passing the lobby to "joing their club for a small fee". When they realized that wasn't working they started shooting flyers under our door every night for us to upgrade to their sister hotel next door "for a small fee". The food was horrible. I am not a picky person by any means and if I am not the one cooking it I will eat it, but by the second day we started paying to eat out at other restaraunts in Playa Del Carmen. Their dishes were soggy, recycled food with either no flavor at all or way too salty and it was the same food day and night. There were many people working at this hotel that did not seem very happy. I did not feel comfortable eating or asking for anything because some of the staff came across as if we were inconviences. The towel boy was the only one who smiled and seemed like he meant it. The room was semi-clean but there were little bugs all over the washroom. The entertainment was a dive. The dancers did not seem to know what they were doing from one skit to the next. We had to leave the show in fear that we may burst into a fit of laughter. The only good thing about this resort is the security is great and the waiters at the bar are very speedy.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: GOLFCLUB156
Reviews.Content: Jim & Jess Scotland, Just returned from our 4th trip to Gran Porto Real,as we knew what to expect were not disappointed,the location of this hotel is perfect,the staff friendly,efficient and above all seem to enjoy having you visit their country,to arrive jet lagged,tired and in need of a sleep it is great to be recognised and met with WELCOME HOME,special thanks to Felipe at the Tranquil Pool Bar,he has now become a good friend,Carlos and Chicken Little of the entertainment Team,Miguel at the Bares swing bar,not forgetting Alonso,all these people and many more make this an enjoyable holiday to which I am sure we will return,I have read previous negative comments about this hotel but am not sure which world they live in when they can be critical of this hotel,once again many thanks for a memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly charming and so hospitable!”
Reviews.Author: laticia586
Reviews.Content: We found everyone so willing to help us make our stay there as comfortable and fun as possible. We enjoyed the water exercises in the pool and found Carlos to be exceptionally helpful, kind and fun to be around. The amentities are great! The restaurants around this area are wonderful..........The restaurant inside the hotel was grand and we especially appreciate the fine service attention from Rodrigo and Mora. They went out of their way to make sure we had everything we wanted. Accolades to them for their attentiveness and great service.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Mawui
Reviews.Content: Yendaly who is the receptionist showed an excellent arrangement for our trip out the best in world She knew that my wife and I were on honeymoon and the service made us feel like a friend to us. Congratulations to her and the entire team All the services were perfect I recommend this hotel and i will not hesitate to return

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: gut73raf
Reviews.Content: This is my second year going to Porto Real. Last year was not that great as the beach was not in good shape. However, this time around the beach was great so the experience was 100 times better. The snorkeling was great!!!!! They still have problems with reservations as we were given a room we did not paid for on the first day. However, they moved us to our room on the second day and gave us a $40.00 credit on their store. My wife was very happy with the gift. All in all, we had a great time. The food was good, the drinks were great but the most important part was the service. Everyone was extremely friendly and did their best to make us feel welcome. We also tried the "Maya cafe". It was great as they prepared it for us on the spot, see pictures of "Rutilo Puc Uh". All in all it was a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Kids Central!!”
Reviews.Author: DF75
Reviews.Content: From an Aussie's perspective this hotel is great if you have kids as they can run around the pool, beach and 'all inclusive' means they can eat and drink when they want. Great for kids, lots of activities food suited to them. For a couple wanting quiet time you need to stick out on the beach. Nowhere to read your book if it is raining other then your room as the lobby is filled with kids and parents entertaining them. Food not bad but not amazing, although the Italian restaurant is good. We ended up moving next door to the adults only The Royal (one of their sister hotels) and definately made the right decision. It was quieter, food was amazing and just a little more chilled and spacious. Highly recommend The Royal for couples.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY SATISFIED...”
Reviews.Author: Ruth005
Reviews.Content: Since we got there we felt high level of service, Enrique, Mayela and Claudia at the reception always willing to exced our expectations, very very eficient even when they had lot to do. All the bell boys -wonderful service. The food exceptional, good service, the waiters very active and good attitute Julio, Victor Jaime and Ventura, so special. Variety in menu, fresh food, italian restaurant, mexican restaurant, international restaurant, wine, champage all day long... wow ! for my children cool smooties and favorities snack in front to the beach, Alonso and his team very friendly and ready to serve and prepare the proper drink for you and your family. The swimming pool area very good atmosphere with the entretaiment teem lead by Cesar, it was fun, very creative !!. They were prepare for everything, one day it was raining and they did prepare indoor activities for everybody.!!! Also the security and life guard team very efficient Octavio, Alexis and Rogelio watching everything for us !! We felt safe all the time. I enjoy the junior suite we had, the cleaning staffl very nice and polite, we received the room every day with a beautiful decorations hand made by Guadalupe, very humble and honest. The Spa, relaxing and personal time for me that I really enjoyed with good service massage and deep cleaning. Well, outside the ventures with long walks through "5th Avenue", hot spot to shop, plenty of souvenirs and other stores. Well, in general we believe when people is trained to serve you have to be prepare to receive... GRAN PORTO REAL is the place to have a GREAT VACATIONS. WE HAD IT.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Wedding Come True”
Reviews.Author: Hcrenan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned yesterday from a week stay at the Gran Porto Real. We chose to have a destination wedding with some of our closest friends and family and we knew Playa del Carmen was the perfect spot. After reading countless reviews and just taking a leap of faith, we decided on the Gran Porto Real (mainly because it was kid friendly and wouldn't break the bank for some of our friends and family). Major perks of this resort: 1. The resort is located right in the middle of the city with close proximity to shopping and bars/clubs. Most of our friends that attended were between the ages of 24-32 so it was very convenient having a wide selection of bars at night to entertain everyone. 2. The resort is very kid friendly. Other than our group of 60 people, there was another wedding there that also had several children between the ages of 5-15 and it always seemed like there was something going on for everyone at all times of the day. My nephews had a blast playing in the pool and going to the beach! 3. The food at this resort was honestly much better than I expected it to be - I've stayed at other all-inclusive resorts before and the food here was much better than previous experiences. 4. Most importantly, the staff was AMAZING!!! They always say the month before your destination wedding is when most of the stress will hit you and it definitely did, but once I arrived and met with Michel Madrid (pronounced Michelle) at the Wedding Center, all of my nerves were put to bed! She made every vision I had come to life and the entire event turned out better than my husband or I could ever have pictured it. Eduardo, the head waiter for our private reception on the beach, was amazing! He made sure the event kept running and everyone was having a good time. Even if you had the smallest request, he made sure it happened for you. The rest of Eduardo's staff was great as well - Samuel and Alberto. After the dancing had started, we even managed to get them out on the dance floor with us for a number or two. Eduardo and Samuel even hosted our private romantic dinner for two the next night and the amazing service just continued. The DJ did an amazing job - we just sent him a list of music we liked and the rest of the night went by request and he filled in the gaps with more fun dancing music. All in all, it was a perfect week and I will remember it always. It's a great place to go for the family, large group, singles and couples (if you don't mind children). The Royal, their sister hotel located directly across the street - they even share the same beach and most of the wedding sites, is adults only and I'm sure the amazing service continues there as well. My husband and I will definitely be returning to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lmmathews
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! We had a great, relaxing, fun, time. There was so much to do...and not do! The service and food was incredible...everyone always has a smile on their faces, and were sooooo eager to help. Our trip was especially made special by these employees: Lorenzo, Teresa, Carlos, Aaron and Felipe. Can't wait to go back!!! Chad and Lori Mathews

Reviews.Title: “awesome place... wonderful staff... can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: pinkpenguingirl
Reviews.Content: We just got back on the 26th after spending 7 days in the gran porto real.. at first i was worried cause of all the reviews i had read. But i found out i had nothing to worry about.the place was very clean..when you get there they bring you a drink,they bought my husband and son a soda, the room was nice and clean our maid margarita kept it spotless..we had and oceanfront room 360 the view awesome. hammock on the balcony.over the pool. the food was good the hallways are not airconditioned neither is the buffett.. but ceiling fans are always going and there is a nice breeze while your eating. and if you don't find anything you like all you have to do is ask the waiter and ta-da..we did order room service a couple of times..they have shows nightly and the entertainment staff does try to keep you busy and entertained with all kinds of activities if you want or you can just watch.my son loved the t-zone he played the x-box games quite a bit and basketball in the pool. it does get loud cause the place is not large where you have to walk a long way to get anywhere. but we didn't mind the noise.. after all we're on vacation .enjoy yourself..the staff at the hotel is very nice and willing to get whatever you need just ask. there is a 24 hr room open where you can get drinks with or without alcohol and some food .nachos, small sandwiches ,pizza ect...the beach is not perfect there are rocks and a small drop but wear water shoes and it's all good or just walk down the beach a bit.. thanks to gaspar of lomas travel we went to Xel-hal which is beautiful snorkeling must go.and our tour guide Gonzo made our trip even better. . also we went to Tulum, beautiful BUT take the train it is a long walk to the ruin , and also Coba take the bike it is very humid and a long walk. tip the driver .5th ave is not far. but the shops off of 5th ave are more likely to bargain..wish we could've stayed longer looking forward to going back

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, the best place to stay in Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: lvagher
Reviews.Content: Once again, the Gran Porto Real has exceeded our expectations! Our first trip to stay at this resort was last summer and we knew we would come back again and again! We fell in love with Playa del Carmen, the resort and all of the staff. They have, by far, the best animation team I have ever seen. Mikey, Carlos, Chicken, Julio & Cesar....ya'll ROCK!!! From bellhops to pool servers, (Jose', Jesus, Pablo, Benito, Teresa & Amondo are awesome!) the entire staff gives a whole new meaning to customer service. They are the most friendly, accomodating and welcoming staff I've ever seen! We'll definitely be going back next summer!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - would love to do it again!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie321
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my 18yr old daughter (I'm 48) and we had a fantastic time. We booked with First Choice. The staff are helpful to the extreme and were always asking if we needed anything. We had a standard room just above the 'tranquil pool' and it was perfect for our needs. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade when checking in but we declined. We did the ‘sales visit’ to the Royal. It took 2 hours from start to finish and wasn’t that bad! Just keep saying no at the end then collect your reward of a $500 peso voucher, photo frame and beach bag! The food in the main restaurant was good and varied, we could also eat at the Italian or the Mexican restaurants as well as lunch at the beach place that served burgers, pizza etc. The pool was very popular as they held activities there daily, you could watch without getting involved if you wanted. We had no problem getting a sunbed at any time of day. The Tranquil Pool was often anything but tranquil! It has a pool bar and there was a particular group that loved this pool and the free alcohol - the pool was often very loud ...... but they were on holiday and enjoying themselves and it was only open during the day. The entertainment was good and we used to watch this before our evening meal as it was over by about 9.15pm. Guests were often asked to participate but a polite 'no thanks' was gracefully accepted. I also did the bike tour which was good but the guide didn't give any info about the areas we cycled through until we got to Playacar. The beach was a bit disappointing but we'd read other reviews so this wasn't surprising. There is a drop in the sand but that didn't bother me - the seaweed, the occasional hidden rock, the murky water and the shallowness did. It wasn't good for swimming but OK for cooling down. If you turn left and walk past the pier, the beach is much better - another couple informed us that if you walked along that beach to the next one, it was even better. The Spa - I had a mud massage and my daughter had a Sun Saver massage. The massage experience was lovely and we then had the use of the spa for the rest of the day. The massage was expensive but worth it - we also used the spa facilities without a massage another day due to tropical rain, this cost $15 for the whole day. The hotel is perfectly placed for shops, bars and nightclubs without being too close. The shop owners will ask you in and if you say that you'll come back later in your stay, they will remember you and hold you to your promise! Most stuff isn't particularly cheap but I suppose you have to bargain - being British I didn't find that too easy so I bought very little! We did lots of trips and I'll post reviews on the relevant pages later - but briefly:- Mayan Encounter with Alltournative Tours - excellent! What an adventure and good value for money. Swimming with Whale Sharks with Blue Dream Diving - fantastic experience. I wouldn't bother unless you really want to see the sharks - it's expensive and a really long trip but sooo worth it if you are that way inclined like me! Sealife Discovery Plus at Peurta Aventuras - the animals are fantastic, sadly the whole experience wasn't - a real money making affair. I'm not sure what other places are like but I wouldn't recommend this one. Formula 1 tour booked through Playa Info - OMG, what an adventure! All done in the most spectacular thunderstorm and we swam with turtles too - thoroughly recommend this one! Snorkelling Adventure booked with Best Day at the hotel - lovely trip, worth the money (we saw a wild croc on the way back which took my breath away). Xel Ha - lovely! Worth the money but don't bother buying biodegradable sun lotion in town even if the pharmacist say's so - apparently it's not good enough. They do give you free sachets of their stuff though (my daughter is pale skinned and it didn't work well even though we applied it regularly – hence the afore mentioned sun saver massage!). Money – I took Dollars and Peso’s. I changed money before the trip but the exchange rate on my credit card was better! Withdrawing cash had a fee but it was very useful having an ATM in the lobby. Sun lotion – take a high factor. I didn’t sunbathe as such but did lay under the canopies on the beach – they take away a lot of the suns strength but you can still burn through them if you’re pale skinned like us. Tipping – I tipped on all trips apart from one. I didn’t tip at the hotel until the last day and I still had excellent service. One more thing – my suitcases put on weight as well as me! This is the first time I’ve been charged for excess baggage - £15 per kilo. They are hot on this and there is no escape unless you unpack your suitcase at the check in desk and transfer weight to your hand luggage. My tequila wasn’t such a bargain after all. Apparently there is no ban on liquids in your hand luggage in Mexican airports (if I hadn’t wrapped and buried the stuff in my case I’d have saved a small fortune)! Would I go back - most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location for holydays”
Reviews.Author: gera99
Reviews.Content: Good service, nice rooms, nice loacation Wonderfull staff and very kindly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip with Kids”
Reviews.Author: shanekrueger
Reviews.Content: We returned Saturday, July 17th, from a 5-night stay at the Gran Porto Real. My husband and I went with our kids, ages 12, 14 and 16, and my sister and her husband and their kids, ages 24 and 19 (and boyfriends, ages 25 and 19). We all had a wonderful time. If you are expecting this to be a 5-star resort, it's not, but it serves it's purpose well. I've read quite a lot of the reviews on this hotel and it seems like some of the bad ones may have been written by someone who has been to a more luxurious resort. For the cost, I would recommend this hotel. It cost all five of us the same as it cost my husband and I to go to a 5-star all inclusive resort in Costa Rica. The breakfast buffet was very good, as was the grill by the pool/beach, and dinner at the buffet was decent. One of my main complaints was that you couldn't have any drinks in the pool (only the adult pool on the 3rd floor). Also, the main pool didn't have a swim-up bar, but the service was excellent, and I never had to wait to get a drink. The waitstaff and all employees of the hotel were very friendly. The beds were a little hard, but I've heard people have that complaint about a lot of resorts in Mexico and the Bahamas. All in all, we were very pleased with our vacation. If you have a laid-back attitude and don't expect perfection, you might be pleasantly surprised. Also, I would highly recommend the catamaran excursion. All 11 of us thoroughly enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and quality staff”
Reviews.Author: xgov00
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from the Gran Porto Real where we were visiting for 4 days for a family member's wedding at the neighboring Real resort. Upon arriving to our upgraded ocean fron walk out room, we were discouraged by the construction of a bar immediately out front of our walk-out. We contacted the concierge service and they changed our room immediately to one with a perfect view! Our room was immaculately clean, linens impeccable and daily maid service was wonderful. They keep your refrigerator stocked (even with a giant bottle of rum and Tequila!). The food was wonderful and there was always somewhere to go to eat! The most important event that occurred was when we checked out, I left my diamond earring on the bedside table. I realized this at the airport! As you can imagin, I knew I would never see them again! I called that night, they had been found and were overnighted to me back in the USA! Not sure how many places around there have that kind of integrity! Loved the beaches, loved the rooms, loved the food, and it was great fun for the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday - thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: blatchfamily
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from this resort and had a great holiday. The hotel was spotlessly clean and staff were fantastic. In particular we found the entertainment staff were great (Chicken, Cesar, Julio, Loredana and the team). Due to their efforts our teenagers were occupied most of the day and night and allowed us to relax and enjoy our stay to the full. The meals in the hotel were also really good - breakfast spread was never ending with plenty of options! The Mexican and the Italian were also very good but were very busy and you would have to get there quite early to avoid long waits. The standard rooms were standard (not outstanding) with a shower room attached and not really 5 star but the beds were extremely comfortable. The beach also outside the hotel was not brilliant and after a day of rain it did not look too great. However a short walk and it got better. The hotel was well placed in Playa del Carmen just a short walk to the 5th Avenue shops and the ferry to Cozumel was a 10 min walk. We are very likely to go back there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “you got one choice if you want a family resort off 5th ave, this is it”
Reviews.Author: luvplaya40
Reviews.Content: if 5th ave is not important to you, then no I would not stay there. I for one would go back. let me get what made me mad out of the way first, this is copy pasted off the hotels website and it is not true, fact it's a total lie, you can not walk over to the sushi place across the street at that Royal and use it too (unless you want to pay, went round and round with manager).. here it is: Stay at One - Play at All As an added bonus, Real Resorts guests staying at the Grans or the ROYALs may take advantage of exchange of privileges providing guests with an opportunity to experience all the facilities and restaurants at a different hotel in a different locale. Guests of the Gran Resorts in Cancun and Playa del Carmen enjoy reciprocal privileges between these two sister hotels. Guests staying at THE ROYAL resorts may use the facilities, ok it just does not get any clearer but Carlos the manager didn't think that means I could walk across the street. in fact he said they could use our facilities but I could not use theirs? hmm? Rooms: I got a jr suite. Very-very clean, the pillows never smelled musty, the room was as soo clean. Some english TV, very cold AC that you controlled. No room for a couch (only 2 hardish chairs with a little bitty table), just 2 firm beds, big open shower-no tub. I liked the room Food: Always fresh, Kinda so-so. I had to eat buffet food until the evening. The buffet room was very hot with no AC, you had to get used to eating in the heat. The buffet was better than most but I would give the buffet 2 stars and could not say yuck, just kind of ho-hum. Service was good in the dinning rooms and they kept those tables clean, the only problem was when my glass got empty, they looked at the empty glass as something to clean off the table instead of something to fill. On average, I had to ask for more to drink; 7 or 8 times for every time I was asked. The night time dinning food was hit or miss but the service off the charts. There is a mexican and an italian dining room,. food was 2 to 3 stars, very typical for all inclusive. The steaks at an all inclusive are not going to be all that good anywhere.. If you crave a good steak, pay for one on 5th ave. the fancy Italian place: Not like the olive garden, it was a mexican version of italian. lacked any strong pesto or real italian flavors but had it's own nice seasoning . the pesto margarita pizza came out as a red sauce thick bread pizza with just a tiny bit of regular ole mexican white cheese. For the most part, the kitchen did really well for what they had to work with. great presentation. The fancy mexican: Get the fish it was the only 4-5 star plate served in the 6 days we where there. it was a toss up of which dinning room was better. we never set our expectations too high and enjoyed both of them both. Pool: No swim up bar, no drinking in the main pool but you could drink on the side of it. The all adult seclusion pool had a nice swim up bar and some sushi (don't expect real sushi, expect california rolls and good stuff like that in a cold buffet chest). Bars: outdoors you got dosxx on draft, no light beer to speak off. it was good fresh beer. The mixed drinks where great. At the bar in doors, you could get a mexican light beer. The house red was from spain and good. snack bar: excellent drink selection but poor food selection. Lobby and hallways: hot-hot-hot, no AC, I sweated from the time out the door until I jumped on the pool. Kids club: My 4 year absolutely loved it. Something you need to know: You may not leave the hotel if your child is in the kid club unless you hire another baby sitter for $12 an hour. I had no problems with that at all. Very good kids club! Gym: like a comfort inn, not all that great but good enough, had a bike and treadmill with AC. the dumb bells stopped at 50 pounds. no way to do any pulls. low-rent machine weights Location: That's why I am coming back, it's right there in the middle 5th ave. There is no other all inclusive resort that is waling distance from 5th ave. hope that helps and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST choice for all-inclusive in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: KcDoglover
Reviews.Content: My family of five just returned yesterday from our second visit to the Gran Porto Real and I know we'll be returning in the future. In fact, my oldest daughter is planning to get married there next summer. Sorry this review is so long, but I just can't say enough about this resort and town. SERVICE: The service you'll receive at this hotel is top-notch. Every single person you come in contact with is smiling and seem to only have one goal and that is to serve hotel guests. At check-in, we were pleasantly surprised when Erika gave us a room upgrade to ocean-view rooms. Our maid, Ana Mateo, always left the rooms shining and a pleasure to return to after hours spent in the hot sun at the pool. While at the pool, we were very lucky to have Jose treat us as if we were his own personal guests for the week. The folks in the casual buffet always seemed eager to help, whether it was finding an empty table or filling an empty coffee cup. Our favorite place to eat dinner was the Italian restaurant. The hostess, Pamela, worked very hard to get everyone seated as quickly as possible. We were lucky enough to be seated at one of Mateo's tables because this guy knows what he's doing and always seemed happy to see us. I must also mention Alex who assisted Mateo with our meals. There are many employees I could mention, but then this review would never be finished. Let me just end by saying that everyone was extremely friendly and always willing to pause and answer my questions and patiently help me practice my pathetic Spanish. I would also like to add that we are in the habit of tipping when receiving excellent service. Some will say that since the hotel is all-inclusive, you shouldn't have to tip anyone. During our week we saw many guests who did not tip and I wasn't able to discern a difference in the level of service. For us, tipping is just something we always do and include them in the price of our vacation. ROOM: The rooms can best be described as oppulent, or maybe elegant. Look at their website to see for yourself. LOCATION: The main reason we first chose this hotel was because of its proximity to 5th Avenue. A very short walk, perhaps two blocks, and you're there. Our three daughters are 20, 21 and 24 and we felt very comfortable allowing them to explore the town on their own, as long as they remained together. We aren't stupid. They did find it uncomfortable when walking past the stores and young guys would shout out invitations to come shop. Differences in culture. I myself enjoyed the attention and never minded being called "sweetheart" in the hopes I would spend a few pesos. If you are in the market for jewelry and not the type found in souvenir shops, please stop in a small shop owned by Salvador. You'll find him on the same street as the hotel just a few store-fronts before reaching the corner. I found him to be very honest and not pushy. LIKED BEST: The hotel and all the employees; location very close to 5th Avenue. It's also kind of small when compared to resorts where you need a shuttle to get around the property. LIKED LEAST: Small things really-we would like to be able to swim in the evening but the pool closes around 9 pm. It would also be nice to have your drinks while standing or sitting around the edge of the pool. We got around that by purchasing water bottles at Walmart. The beach directly in front of the hotel is not the best. A small walk in either direction will bring you to beautiful sandy areas and gorgeous, clear water. Like I said, this review was long but there are so many good things to say about this hotel. If anyone has specific questions, I'd be more than happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: chuckCapeCodMa_
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days the end of April thru May 1 and its our 12th time there. We love it. We keep coming back because the staff is wonderful. The food is great and its a perfect place for us. Thanks to Luis at the front desk; special thanks to Jesus and Pablo at the pool; Therese in the Lobby. We love the special restaurants but truly enjoyed the buffets, too. Eliazar at the Mexican Restaurant was great to us and we had a great time. Each time we go there they make improvements and/or changes that make our visits even better.

Reviews.Title: “the sports and entertainment team was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: bubbacheer617
Reviews.Content: the hotel was great the food was good our room was a bit small but it was clean. the location was perfect just a short walk from the town. everyone in our party of 50 loved the sports and entertainment team especially loredona! she was great everyone loved her!

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: nellygal
Reviews.Content: I just got back from GPR a few days ago. I went down there with my fiance and got married in front of immediate family and friends. The staff was super friendly, the food was great, something for everyone. There is always some activity going on and therefore can be loud at certain spots. But by 11 at night it's all quiet. They also set up and ran our small wedding wonderfully! Once you are finished with the sometimes hectic check-in and the distribution of all papers and such...then it is all fun. Don't expect a serene, far-from-civilization kind of relaxing place. If that's what you are looking for then explore elsewhere. Otherwise you would have to be an uptight snot to complain about this place.

Reviews.Title: “please with the service offer by waiters, maids etc not the receptionist!!!”
Reviews.Author: gloriella77
Reviews.Content: we were a group of 46 people or more. I will remember the names of those who make us feel at home. Martin from the Buffett and Xavier they provide us with the best costumer service. from the Bar Alex the bartender and Myriam. I can not say the same for the people on the front the receptionists they don't know what customer service is.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Not all that great”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyHappy60956
Reviews.Content: The pictures of this resort make it look a lot nicer than it really is. Positives: The food was good, not great, but plenty of it. The coffee machine coffee was good. Try the Italian restuarant, it was great. The entertainment saves the place. Nightly shows that are truly well done. The staff did a great job of providing many fun activities throughout the day. Very talented and well run. The hotel staff were very nice and friendly. Always there to get you something it seemed. Negatives: This place is older and a bit run down IMO. No way its 5 star. There are no on site grounds and is quite small considering the number of rooms it has. The beach is horrible. it smells most of the time with a constant battle of machinery removing seaweed. Lots of rocks in the water just off the beach to avoid. The beach is tiny and sandwiched between a long pier with ferry boats and a bunched of fishing boats tied up to the beach. Your view of the ocean is dominated by the boats. If you reserved a "ocean view" room, you will be in a room that backs up to the street and you have to look down the street to see the ocean. A true ocean view room is what they call their "ocean front" room. Different price. The pool is always packed and is way too small. Its really loud and for me, hard to relax. I went down to get a spot at the pool at 7:30am one morning and they were all long gone. People just put their stuff on the chair and go back to bed. The "tranquility" pool on the 3rd floor designated for adults is nice but usually has screeming kids jumping in and out. Bottom line: If you are expecting a new look/feel resort with huge beautiful grounds and multiple large pools and a great "Corona commercial" type beach, go somewhere else. If you want to go somewhere with a friend for 2-3 nights...and you get a screaming good deal, then knock yourself out.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, Great Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBanana64
Reviews.Content: There is not enough good to say about this resort. We stumbled upon this resort after initially being in their sister hotel in Cancun. We had an awful experience at the Gran Caribe in Cancun and demanded to be transferred to this resort. From the very beginning this resort was wonderful. This is totally a family resort. The staff was amazing. Jose Gomez at the front desk, Theresa the waitress at the pool bar, Patricia, the maid, all of the waiters in the Albatross (Marcello) and of course, i would be remiss if i didn't mention the Sports and Activities staff...Victor, Loredana, Cesar and Julio. All of these individuals work harder than i have ever seen anyone work and always have a smile on their face. The entire place is immaculate. There are always people cleaning and sweeping everywhere you look. The food was very good much to my surprise. I must admit i am a little picky and could find something to eat at each meal. My familiy enjoyed the food more than i did. The only negative thing i can say is that there is only 4 restaurants to eat in unless you want to go across the street to The Royal in which you will have to pay 50% of the bill which is okay but we chose not to because we had such a large group. We also enjoyed being so close to the downtown. It is a hidden surprise, especially at night when it is all lit up. There are many bargains to be had. The teenagers enjoyed this. The sports and activities staff has a daily events planned from morning to night. If it should rain, they bring activitities inside (cards, board games, etc) They are incredibly friendly and again work from morning til night...with a smile on their face The beach in front of the Porto real is just okay, but about a quarter of a mile down towards the Royal, it is beautiful and free of coral and seaweed. Again there are always people working even on the beach cleaning up. Every attempt is made to solve any problem that you may encounter I thoroughly enjoyed my vacation in playa del carmen and would definately visit this hotel/resort again

Reviews.Title: “great trip for large group with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: napes
Reviews.Content: We were at this resort from July 4th-11th with 46 people, the majority of us have teenagers and it was great!!! We started out at the Gran caribe in cancun and it was a nightmare, we actually checked out at 1am and arrived at this resort at 2:30am. We upgraded to Junior suites by the pool, 60dollars a nite for 2 rooms and well worth it. The rooms were spacious with big walk in showers and beautiful bathroom. The pool was always busy with activities and the service at the pool is excellent. Teresa was our favorite waitress by far, so make sure you tip her..she works hard. We love the italian rest. and went there 3 times, it is the only one with a/c and the service and food are both excellent. Downtown is only a 10 min. walk and has great shopping and restaurants and music playing constantly. We shopped but did not eat there, but would if I went back. Be sure not to miss the swimup bar on the 3rd floor and the hot tub ( up the winding staircase). The entertainment is constant until about 11:30pm and then it pretty much stops, which was fine with us, since we were exhausted from the sun and drinking all day. Our kids parasailed and jet skiied for about 50 dollars each. Great vacation and I would definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a week of relaxation”
Reviews.Author: rminear68
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a week here, and it was wonderful. The meals were terrific in all three of the restaurants, and the pools and bars were wonderful. The beach was a little small, with boats tied up on one side, and fairly rocky on the other, but a short (less than 5 minute walk) either way made for great swimming. The staff had great activities for the kids...volleyball (both pool and beach), bike tours, aerobics, and such. The three girls had massages on the beach, and were very happy. Be careful for the sales pitches. A "free breakfast and a few gifts" were offered at a resort right across the street, but it was a fairly hard sell...90 minutes you won't get back. The nightly entertainment was wonderful...full of music and dancing. The staff was very attentive, and a small extra tip for the maid service will land you surprise each day that the kids will love. The beds....a little hard. But we were so tired at the end of each day...it didn't matter. Make no mistake...this is a family oriented resort...if your just a couple....you might look elsewhere. But if you have kids....its wonderful. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience - would definitely like to go back again!”
Reviews.Author: camerafreak
Reviews.Content: A group of family and friends traveled to Playa del Carmen and stayed at the Gran Porto, where our son was married in a gazebo by the water. The staff at the resort were very attentive, our rooms were spacious with great a/c, good water pressure, plenty of hot water, and the bed was huge and so comfy. We found the staff, from the concierge to the maid service to the restaurant and gift shop workers to be very helpful, friendly, and attentive to us at all times. They were also there to assist with any problems we encountered, and assisted us in printing our boarding passes for the return flight home. The evening entertainment was outstanding, drinks were delicious, and the buffet became a favorite place for us to eat. (The snack bar by the pool was also very tasty.) We would highly recommend this resort to any and all for a great time in paradise :) The wedding was perfect - everything we had expected plus much more.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best vacations yet!”
Reviews.Author: so3008
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience the Yucatan but you DON'T want to be around the drunken spring break/vegas crowd... Playa del Carmen is perfect! It's only 45 south of Cancun and it's beautiful, easy to navigate and safe. The Gran Porto Real is directly on the ocean and offers access to plenty of activities for the family (our girls are 7 & 9). Here's a pro/con breakdown of the resort: Pros - Beautiful grounds and building, our 1-bedroom Gran master suites was huge and beautifully decorated, staff is UNBELIEVABLY FRIENDLY and willing to do whatever you ask, food at the buffet was delicious for all meals, the resort restaurants were very good, poolside and evening shows/entertainment were fun, main street in town is easy walk from hotel. Cons - not very many cons, but kids club could be a bit better (our girls didn't love it and one of the babysitters didn't comfort our youngest when she cried for me and later told me that it's "bad" that my daughter is so attached to me), the floors throughout the hotel are very slippery b/c of the constant humidity so one needs to be extra careful, we found a few ants in our room (only once) but we're from Florida so we understand life in the tropics comes with a few ants. Other than that, we had a broken door handle but maintenance fixed it within minutes, housekeeping was fast to respond to everything and we truly felt like royalty during our stay. The activities desk assistant gave great advice and helped us plan some AMAZING excursions to Chichen Itza and Xcaret. I don't recommend this hotel for very young children (not much for them), but elementary age kids and up will really enjoy the massive pool and ocean activities. We will likely go back. (ps. if you get Teresa as your poolside bar server, you've struck gold! She's delightful)

Reviews.Title: “THE people at GRAN porto”
Reviews.Author: trevor0801
Reviews.Content: We had a great 10 days that were enhancedby some very special people, felipe the Bar man at the Tranquil Pool was great, looked after us & everyone with humour & expertise. We went every day and a lot of the time becuase of his service! Veronica Poot also gave us great room service & was always keen to make sure we enjoyed our stay. The Girls in the Spa also made our treatments very special

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome week”
Reviews.Author: adbelew
Reviews.Content: The entertainment staff was excellent! Food and drrink was good. You have to eat at Maria's, and get a flaming coffee from Rodrigo and Alex in the buffet. This is a real kid friendy place. We are planning to return next June 2011 for our thrid trip to the Gran Porto.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Buggs_10
Reviews.Content: We took a family vacation to Cancun for the first time ever. We went through a travel agent who suggested the Gran Porto Real since we were traveling with our kids, 13 yrs. and 5 yrs. old. From the time we got out of our limo at the hotel, we felt like we were VIP's. The hotel was beautiful in and of itself, but the staff far exceeded any expectations we had. From our check-in to our check-out, we were greeted everyday by the friendly staff, and they helped me brush up on my Espanol. The kids had plenty to do, but of course the pool won out most days. Our 5 yr old was not afraid to stay at the Kid's Club by herself and didn't want to leave when we came to pick her up. Everything was in walking distance, the shopping, restuarants, etc. However, we did the all-inclusive, and I would say that is the way to go if you are doing a family vacation. After we checked in, we had Freddy, our Bell-boy show us to our room (which was beautiful, clean, something out of a movie) and handled everything, expertly. He even took us to see another room just in case we were not happy with the one we had. Then we got to meet another Freddie, he was Capitan of the Albatross Restuarant. He was so attentive and took time to notice the drinks we drank and the type of food we chose, so that when we went into the hotel restuarant, once we found a table, our drinks were there waiting for us. Before we left, he had a "special" seafood lunch prepared for us. Delicious! How awesome is that. There were so many others who just made our trip the best one we have ever taken. And the hotel definitely got raves when we went back home to Texas. I would definitely recommend the Gran Porto Real, Playa del Carmen Resort over and over again. Along with the wonderful staff (Maria-poolside waitress, Pablo-beach waiter, Naum-waiter at the restuarant, and so many others. It is a shame I didn't get everyone's name.) Me and my family, along with others, will definitely vacation their again. Valencia Buggs, Houston, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Roy829
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from our 6th trip to the Gran Porto Real in Playa de Carmen. As always we truly enjoyed our stay. We really love this hotel. We were a party of 15 adults and children. All the employees work hard in making your stay enjoyable and pleasant. From the time we arrived we were provided exceptional service by Carlos Melgar, Luis Armando, and Laura at the front desk. Other employees providing exceptional service were Mora, our waiter for breakfast and lunch and Rodrigo and Alejandro Pascual, our waiters at dinner. Martin, restaurant supervisor always made sure everything was in order. The pool bartenders, Jaime and Miguel always provided excellent service as did Jesus and Pablo the pool waiters. Very enjoyable stay, but now it's back to reality. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carissa_25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and it was beautiful! Our cleaning lady for our room was so nice and always left us beautiful towel decorations on our bed. Our room overlooked the ocean and it was so beautiful!! Actually all the staff were very friendly and always greeted us with a smile. We would always hang out by the pool and have drinks. Our bartenders Jaime and Salvador were great!!!! They greeted us by name and knew what drinks we wanted and they made them so good!!! They did an awesome job and we always looked forward to when they were working!!! This trip was amazing and we can't wait until we can go back!!

Reviews.Title: “"Gran Porto No!"”
Reviews.Author: dstoli
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed at the glowing reviews for this place. But let's start with the good: If you want to drink endless supplies of the cheapest, swilly booze imaginable—with name brands you've never heard of—this is your place! People who like it that I observed are there to drink, and gorge on the endless and endlessly mediocre food. Poolside, lobby, eateries—it's all about the booze. Also good: The Beach is very nice, except that the portion for swimming in front of the hotel is too close to the smelly, dirty deep sea fishing boats parked right on the beach in front of the hotel. The nicer swim areas are a walk in either direction. Okay, now on to the bad, the ugly, and the worse. First, the noise. This place is not for relaxing. The lobby is loud, the bars are loud, the pool area is a joke -- always filled with blaring disco music, annoying "recreation guys" on the loudspeaker, and loud people ... driinking. At night, the shows and the music are all happening poolside and it is ridiculous. Like you went to a serene place and a disco broke out. The oceanfront rooms all face the music -- your room is neither tranquil or peaceful becase there are loudspeakers right outside up until 11pm EVERY NIGHT. We asked to move and we got a nice room down nearer the ocean ... only THEY SET UP WEDDING PARTIES WITH MORE LOUDSPEAKERS right under your room ALMOST EVERY NIGHT. We complained again and were told we had to pay more per night to "upgrade" from the oceanfront room to a "master suite on the street side." Somehow, the street side was actually quieter. Not perfect. Quieter. And the room was nice. The help is neither especially helpful. Nice most of the time, but not really helpful. Except when they want to usher you off to a "Welcome Host" who can try to sell you some activity packages at ridiculous prices. NO matter that you arrive ridiculously tired and frayed from travel, they start selling RIGHT AWAY. The place pretty much sucks ... if you're not drunk and you don't care. The staff of workers is very nice ... although when we got to our first of four rooms, there were five of them hiding in our room watching soccer, instead of doing their jobs. Should I continue? Okay, I will! They tell you in advance they don't have parking for your rental car, but then, if you find a nice bell guy, he tells you he can park it for you in a covered lot across the street .. .no charge. Probably cuz they don't want you to rent a car, they want you to be stuck taking their ridiculously pricey bus tours. Onto the food: The main buffet is ... okay ... good even for many items. But, the room is not air conditioned and the grills are right out front and the place is like 120 degrees in there to sit and eat. The food is on ice but quickly wilts and melts and you have to wonder about the Tomain poisoning that could hit at any minute. The grilled food is the best ... fresh. The carved beef ... good. Not great, but good. breakfast are good ... waffles, pancakes freshly prepared. Lots of fruit that is decent. And lots of warmed over trays that are kinda gross. Again, have some cheap liquor and it goes down a little easier. At the beachside grill, nothing is grilled. All the burgers (filled with lots of filler) and hot dogs are brought out in hot trays from the kichens. There's nothing grilled about it. Hence, no grill smoke for miles. The nice Italian restaurant is good, a nice setting, the food about a 6.5. The Mexican place had good food ... it was pretty darn okay.
