All in all, Gran Porto Real is about the all-inclusivo booze and okay food ... and the booze .. .and the loud music. It kinda sucks. But hey, at least it's not as expensive as the nice places in Playacar and Myakoba. Don't go there for qualkty. Go for the bulk. The rest of Mayan Riviera has plenty to offer and is quite enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Salvador Mora took care of our meal request, very, very accomodating and excellent service. He is the best.”
Reviews.Author: sylvia7799
Reviews.Content: Awesome, Awesome, truly made us feel like V.I.P's.   We look forward to our return trip, this is our 2nd trip here and we look forward to many more.   The dining staff Salvador Mora and Freddy remembered our name and our regular items that we like.   Truly made us feel special.  we are telling all our friends to come here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Not Great; Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: hoostraveler
Reviews.Content: Spent several nights at Gran Porto Real in mid-June in a Grand Master One-Bedroom Suite. Note that we traveled with a 11-month old baby - we stayed here because the wedding we were invited to was at the adult-only hotel next door. Overall, we found the hotel to be very good, but not great. The hotel room was lovely, clean and spacious with a beautiful oceanfront view. We stayed on the side closest to the Royal hotel, making it an easy walk to the hotel next door (we had full access to restaurants next door) where the wedding festivities were located. The hotel food was fine, buffet was okay. Service was great. Beach was okay. We probably will not go back, but if you're looking for a good value all-inclusive, this seems like a safe choice. See below for more details. Hotel Room We were very happy with the Grand Master One Bedroom. Very spacious with three balconies overlooking the ocean. The air-conditioning worked great - there were two systems. Bathroom was shower only, but very large with plenty of room for our little one to play/bathe. Bed was very comfortable. Hotel supplied an average crib. Two LCD TVs, with plenty of channels to watch USA content like the NBA finals. The mini-fridge was not very cold, but plenty of drinks. Downside was the noise - lots of weddings. Service Check-in was slower than expected, and we didn't get a tour or explanation of the facilities so we had to figure things out on our own (no big deal). They supplied the crib pretty quickly after we settled in. Housekeeping was friendly, and they left a nice decorative towel arrangement with flowers every day. We tipped, so we didn't find the maid service to be slow or anything. The staff at the restaurants and at the pool was terrific, very friendly service with a smile. Food The buffet was okay, with breakfast being the best. Fruit selection was disappointing. The Italian restaurant was solid and the Mexican restaurant was decent - safe bets for dinner - you can take a nice stroll after dinner in the local area. The grill at the pool/beach had good snack/comfort food. Pool/Beach The main pool was crowded, but finding chairs was not too difficult. People did reserve chairs with their towels in the early morning, but there was always a place to sit. The pool water was warm, a little too warm in the late afternoon, but still refreshing. Lots of kids, including our own, so a little loud, but some drunk adults were more annoying. Pool was large, so never felt crowded. They had a basketball hoop and floaties for people to entertain themselves. The beach was okay - there is a drop off and a subtle bad smell on the beach. It's a bit rocky too - not as nice as Cancun. Our hotel room did have a private cabana, which was nice. Ocean was warm and calm. Misc. * Lots of weddings. Seemed like there were at least two per day. * We did the snorkeling adventure. Not bad, but be prepared for a two hour ride out round trip. * No air-con in the buffet or lounge area. * Forty minute ride to/from airport - about 600 pesos each way. * Mosquitoes linger - bring Off.

Reviews.Title: “good quality”
Reviews.Author: donoban
Reviews.Content: hello all, I take the time to send my congratulations on vacation because I had were unforgettable, thanks to the service of Gran Porto Real hotel, but above all the staff, I would mention everyone but I do not remember so I will mention The ones I agree, Samanta in reception, bar david, Teresa on the beach (I hope this at noon always, help with hot drinks because it uff) Regarding restaurants I remember Ivan and mahumael always give excellent service along with his captain edgar in the morning, always smiling, attentive, savior of Mary and Joseph's pescatore, rutile albatross, and I apologize to those who do not remember and write his name wrong, tell everyone thanks, thanks, thanks, I will return soon

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bobo80620
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa! The staff was great! Starting with Teresa, Jesus, Jose, Pablo and David. They were all very friendly and helpful and they made our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend! The staff and facilities at Gran Porto Real exceeded our expectations in every respect.”
Reviews.Author: Saxman3
Reviews.Content: My 19-year-old son, his friend, and I spent a week at Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen in June of 2010. From the moment we arrived at the Registration Desk, to the time we checked out 7 days later, we all commented that this was the best vacation we had ever had. The bellmen were right there when we arrived with our pre-arranged ground transportation with Travel Impressions--many thanks to Benigno, Aaron and Josue for getting us comfortably into our rooms! The Front Desk staff was more genuinely friendly than any 5-star hotel I have ever stayed in. I hope I don't forget anyone at the Front Desk, but I do want to specifically thank Erika (and her sweet smile!), Claudia, and Yendaly not only for making us feel so welcome on arrival, but also for their helpfulness during our entire stay. Luis and Gabriel we also at the Front Desk when we checked out, and made the process completely painless for us. All three of us speak fluent Spanish, and I have to say, we felt like we were part of a family by the end of the second day of our stay. The Gran Porto Real also has world-class entertainment every night by the pool. I understand that the Entertainment Director has experience in television performance himself in Mexico City. Again, I'd like to thank the Entertainment Group, Julio César and Lori (I hope I got her name right--"Philomena", from Boulder, CO) for putting on all the poolside activities and entertainment. The pool and lobby wait staff could not have been more attentive--they were right there with food and cold beverages, always delivered with a smile and a kind word--great work, Teresa, Jose, Pablo, Lorenzo, Jesús, Naúm, Elías, and Benito--muchísimas gracias. Another amazing experience on our first day occurred as we were exploring the grounds of the hotel. A Security official, Víctor, actually took us on a walking tour of the entire facility, One of the highlights of our trip was getting to watch and listen to an excellent jazz and salsa music group called "Tequila." Álvaro, thanks for letting me sit in on saxophone! We also rented jet skis at the Royal Hotel next door, and played golf at Playacar, a 15-minute cab ride. All the restaurants associated with Gran Porto were gourmet quality--María's, Il Pescatore, and Albatros. We also got off-site to eat at some local restaurants--El Fogón, Tacos Acá, (both informal) and La Parrilla, I highly recommend El Gran Porto Real to anyone looking for a low-stress vacation, at a great value. We have made frequent trips to Hawaii and will probably never go back there. Denver to Cancún is a 4-hour non-stop flight, and Playa del Carmen is only about 45 minutes from Cancún. The hotel itself is right on the sand, and a short walk away from Quinta Avenida, with plenty of restaurants, clubs and shopping. Almost all transactions can be done in US Dollars. This was our first attempt at an all-inclusive trip. This is definitely the way to go. All food and drinks are included in the cost of your room (the staff appreciates tips, and earns every bit of them!) There is so much to do, we couldn't get it all in in one week. We do plan on returning to El Gran Porto Real next year. We give them a giant "A+" for service, quality and value. Bill from Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickSam74
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in Mexico and found the Gran Porto real to be an excellent choice. The food was excellent in both the buffet and 2 restuarents, although the Italian was our favorite. The Hotel is kept very clean by the hardworking staff. the pool is spotless and the waiters very freindly. The service and attitude of all the waiting staff was excellent. The day time entertainment team were very good and provided plenty of activities. The evening shows were also good. The Hotel is in a great location, has an excellent beach and is only 2 mins from 5th Avenue. Would certainly recommend this Hotel to anyone who hasnt been before. There are probably better places to stay but for value for money this was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel BUT....BEWARE OF THE VACATION CLUB THEY OFFER!!!”
Reviews.Author: JtrippleJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice to VISIT but do not get fooled into joing it's vacation club. I am speaking from experience. They make everything look great on PAPER and tha'ts how they get suckers to join. They will promise you many perks but beware of what you are really able to use once you try. They will be as nice as can be until you either decline to join or ,if you do, have any problems with what they promised you and what you really sign up for. That is when you will discover that you made a BIG MISTAKE. Then it's too late! After going down and using my "membership" prices I did the simple math and found that no one ever pays their "RACK" price and so it is cheaper to just go on line or through a travel agent and book your stay because that price will include the airfare and is still cheaper than their "CLUB" price which is without air. Don't believe what they tell you about the perks with RCI it's just another selling tool they use among many others. They are very good in what they do. JUST DON"T DO IT! I learned the hard way and hopefully this will save you from making the same mistake. BE WARNED or BE FOOLED!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: jonnajohnson
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay in the same hotel and I always have a great vacation there. The staff is fun and friendly. The hotel is in a great location, you can walk wherever you want to go and not have to worry about taking a taxi or booking an excursion just to go out to a club or shopping. The rooms are clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: rebann_55
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this place. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They made my first international trip a very pleasant one. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time, Wonderful Service, Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: beachlakeliz
Reviews.Content: My mom, my aunt and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen last year in April/May 2009. The staff at the hotel is exceptional. Every single person is as friendly as they can be. One person in particular that went out of their way to give great service and be so friendly was Dion in The Albatros dining area. He is so professional and is always willing to give 120% of himself to make us feel comfortable. He has a great personality and is always smiling all the time. Tourists love to see staff who are always smiling & friendly. Dion is the epitome of a wonderful employee. Dion is a fantastic asset to the hotel. He is a real treasure to the hotel! We will definately be back and have recommended the hotel to many friends because of the warm employees at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: DS62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Porto Real June 13 - 20... took the kids ranging in age from 13 to 23. My husband and I stayed at The Royal last year, which we really loved. Would have returned this year if it weren't for the 13-year-old. So we did the next best thing and stayed at the Gran. The rooms were comfy and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The a la carte restaurants were fantastic. And although they "officially" have a dress code, it was not strictly enforced. The pool is great, but of course, you have to have your towel out before 7 a.m. to get a lounger. We also enjoyed the "tranquility" pool and swim-up bar. There's always something to do... pool activities, bike tours, kayaks, etc. And we loved the close proximity to 5th Avenue. There were only a couple of minor negatives... the elevator had an overwhelming stench of mildew, as did the T-Zone. Our room was right above the speaker by the pool -- too loud! I highly recommend trying to get a room at either end of the building and not in the center over the pool. Our in-room safe regularly malfunctioned. They always sent someone up immediately to take care of it, but eventually we just stopped calling and put out the do not disturb sign when we weren't in the room. Overall, we had a fantastic time. Our little complaints would not be enough to keep us away if we returned to PDC with the family again. Special thanks to Pablo for taking such great care of us and our beverage needs at the pool!!!

Reviews.Title: “The property sells itself, but it's the wonderful people who make you come back”
Reviews.Author: RJAYR
Reviews.Content: First and foremost I would like to thank everyone at Gran Porto Real for making our trip absolutely fantastic. You really feel welcomed and the people you encounter are genuine. I will break up the reviews so that it's not one huge paragraph. Location- One of the most important things about this hotel is Location Location Location. GPR sits right in the Heart of Playa Del Carmen. Just steps away from the beach, 1 block away from 5ave Shopping and a quick stroll to the Pier to catch the boat to Cozumel. This will save you the trouble of taking a Cab or worrying about public transportation since you’re already in the central shopping area, but be ready to pay for it…tourist prices. Front desk / Check in- we checked in the afternoon and not to my surprise they could not find our reservation. I have read this happening to quite a few people. They asked to see a copy of my itinerary which I provided them, but you would think that the last name of a person would be enough. Like any hotel they offered me an upgrade to an Ocean front suite walk out, I politely declined and we stayed with our Ocean front suite. Staff was very nice. Bell staff - Very Professional, hospitable and attentive. I spent time getting to know one of the Bell man name Aaron. Every time I saw him he was always smiling and always ready to offer assistance. Aaron is a genuinely nice person and it shows. I enjoyed our conversations and I just wanted to say thank you for the great service and for being a great guy! Concierge- I rarely need to use the concierge while on vacation, but I’m glad Astrid was there to help us out. My wife and I booked an excursion and to make a long story short the people at the resort next door (The Royal) made me very happy I did not book at that hotel. The Staff at the Royal need to learn from the Staff at the GPR about SERVICE. Service was inexcusable and I will be writing to the Diamond award association about my experience at The Royal. Remember if you’re not staying at the Royal they will treat you like $%*! Astrid at GPR was very helpful and she went above and beyond to remedy the situation, she even chewed out the idiots who screwed up our excursion…THANK YOU ASTRID !!!!! you saved our trip! Real Club Concierge- before we could even make it to our bags I was greeted by a gentleman from the Real Club. His name was Orlando and I have read many reviews about how guest felt annoyed and bothered by these individuals working for the Real Club. Orlando is a sweet heart! He was not pushy at all; he knew we just arrived and that we were tired from our trip. He sat us down in the lobby and gave us a quick run down of the property and what it had to offer. He was very informative and got to the point. I knew he was going to ask us about the going across the street to see the Royal so I beat him to it. He said that if we would like to go over there just let him know, but if we didn't then that was fine too. Through out our stay we would run in to Orlando and he was always a delight to talk to and he was always ready to take care of any of our needs. Thank you Orlando! Rooms-1st room- They gave us room 115. In general the rooms are wonderful. Tile Floors, high ceilings, Ceiling fan, Cold A/C, lots of flush lighting and eye pleasing furnishings and a good size King bed (HARD). Closet space is ample and the bath room is also a good size. The Patio is barely enough for one person let alone two. Two people max for a room of this size. Pros- The room is close to the lobby and the restaurants. 24 hour self serve bar literally next door. Wifi signal very strong so you can go wireless in your room. Roomy bed. Cons- The room is close to the lobby and the video game room & the 24 hour self serve bar ( you can hear every yell and scream). Since the floor is tile throughout the property you can hear everything. All the yelling, screaming and more yelling. The Ocean view from your balcony does not exists. It’s a pool view. The Bed was hard, woke up with numb arms..LOL I complained and said that I did not pay for a pool view I paid $300 more for an ocean front view. I would not have cared, but that's still $300. They told me that all the rooms were full (BS) and that if I checked back the next day they would get me a different room. I had to wait for two days since we were out all day the following day. We had to repack everything and leave all our stuff with the front desk and when we returned we would have a new room. 2nd room- we get back from a long day at Xplor (a must do!) And they reassigned us to room 215...WOW really…one floor up? That’s the best you could do?. The room is a lot better than 115 and the view is an improvement, but not worth the $300 I paid, but what can you do? I didn’t want to waste the rest of my vacation fighting with the Front desk so I just stuck I out enjoyed the rest of my vacation. Pros- View was better than 115 and you still had a strong WiFi connection. Close to stairs and elevator. Good viewing location for the nightly shows. Roomy bed. Cons- No hammock, small patio, view could be better. Hard bed. Our Housekeeper Mari Cruz always made great towel figurines which always brought a smile as we got back to our rooms. Thank you. Restaurants/bars- I will only mention the 5 restaurants we went to, but there are 8. Albatros (buffet)- I’ve been to other AI’s before (RIU) and I think GPR really missed the mark on this one. The food was hit and miss and there was a lack of flavor. Breakfast was usually the worst. Nothing to rave about. Lunch and dinner were OK, but I have seen better. They need to add more choices and a lot more authentic Mexican food. Even the generic American food wasn’t that good. Service during Lunch and dinner were was nice, but the breakfast service was down right unpleasant. I know it’s busy, but I did not see one smile out of any of the servers during the 7 day stay there, and even with bad service I still tipped. IL Pescatore- This Italian restaurant was great! Everything was delicious and the service was excellent. I suggest the Shrimp risotto, prosciutto and melon and the beef Capriccio. Everything we tried was very good and this was became our dinner restaurant for 3 of the 6 nights. Our servers Pepe and Israel were very attentive and took care of our needs before we could ask. The head Chef even stopped by our table, Nice. Maria’s- I have heard complaints about this Mexican restaurant, but my wife and I didn’t see any problems with the food or the service. Large groups did have trouble getting seated and I can see where that might be a complaint. My wife and I got seated quickly and the atmosphere was festive and romantic. Our server Fernando took real good care of us; my drink never hit the bottom. The food was good & spicy. The portions were larger than the Italian restaurant and the flavor was excellent. Parrillada Grill- Located out side on the beach this is great if you don’t feel like going back into the hotel. The food choices are American (hamburger, hot dogs, and nachos) and they even had fresh cevich. 24/7 self serve- question, what do you do with food that was not eaten at the buffet? You put it in the 24/7 self serve. The food tasted like it was left out for a while, but at 2 in the morning you get what you can take. There is also all you can pour alcohol and beer on tap and in case you needed your daily internet fix there are 3 computer to use, for a fee of course. Lobby Bar- service was good and fast. TV’s in the lobby were a life saver since they had the NBA simi finals on. Bar service on the Beach- Service was excellent! All I remember saying was “uno mas Theresa”. Service with a smile and I owe it all to Theresa. She remembered what my Wife and I were drinking and where we were on the beach every day. I can’t say enough about how Nice Theresa was and how she made our days on the beach a memorable one. Special thanks to Carlos who also hooked it up! Nightly entertainment- Besides watching some of those who had one too many, the scheduled nightly entertainment was good. It’s a full production and they put a lot of time and effort into each show. On Nights My wife and I got back to the hotel early we sat out on the balcony and watched the show. They really try to get the crowd involved and its worth catching at least 1 show. Seating is awkward since the pool takes most of the area and the seats are to the right of the stage or up near the bar area. One night it rained and they moved the show to the lobby…that was a tight squeeze, but they still pulled it off. Beach- I’ve read the reviews about how the beach was torn up, don’t worry it’s not. The beach is great, lots of room for football, volleyball, catch or just lounging around. The water was really nice and salty. Be careful because there is a 4 foot drop from the beach to the water before you even hit the water. This is thanks to beach erosion. There are plenty of beach chairs and covered cabanas, we were on the beach 5 out of the 7 days and had no problems with finding either. The beach has a few drawbacks: Boats anchored to the beach, left side of beach closest to the pier is rocky and the water can get crowed fast since there is only a narrow portion of good beach/water. I never really ran into a problem and no one really cared, every one had a great time. Pool- pretty average, but a bit small for a resort. I would rather jump in the ocean. Lounge chairs around the pool don’t fill up until 10ish, so you can sleep in. Special Dinner on the beach- My Wife and I were celebrating our 3rd wedding anniversary and I surprised her with dinner on the beach. It was priceless! The candle light dinner was Magical and we will never forget it. There was so much attention so detail and the Service was outstanding, thank you Carlos(waiter)! and Omar/Estaban (event coord….sorry I forgot your name!). I can not say enough oh how impressed i was with the staff and how they pulled this off. You have to ask the front desk about this, it’s not advertised. Spa- did get to use it, went across the street to Veronica's Massage. Security- I felt very save during my stay at GPR. There are the unsung hero which are the Security guards. I would wake up in the middle of the night and grab a drink from the minibar and just sit on the patio. Like clock work I would see security walk past and check the property. There is always some one patrolling and I just wanted to acknowledge there hard work. Overall the Property is what sells people to come to this resort, but it’s the people who make you come back. I totally recommend the Gran Porto Real to anyone and everyone. Thank you again to the wonderful staff and to my new friends.

Reviews.Title: “My Sisters Fabulous Wedding at the Royal with 50 friends!!”
Reviews.Author: MeekaSingh
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent! I am so thankful to have interacted with great staff that does everything from their heart! The food was good and the activities were great! I enjoyed the Yoga! Thank you! The staff member Carlos - Anima stood out and went above and beyond expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about the Gran Porto Real!”
Reviews.Author: SunSeaSand04
Reviews.Content: Me and my family visited Playa del Carmen July last year. The rooms are beautiful with views over the ocean and beach, also the minibars in the room are restocked daily with Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta, beer and water. The beds in the rooms are very large and comfortable. The Mexican restaurant is beautiful, would definitely reccommend eating there. The hotel is close to 5th avenue, so very handy for shopping! The staff at the Gran Porto Real are extremely helpful and they always come to you if you're sunbathing on the beach or by the pool asking if you'd like a drink. The buffet had a wide variety of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner and the beach grill offers a number of tasty snacks throughout the day including hotdogs, burgers, nachos and much more. Entertainment at night was very good, although it didn't seem to go on that late. Casino night is a must do! It's such a fun night with a lively atmosphere and you win prizes, such as wine! The kayaks which were available for free are exellent to go on and I would reccommend that people would use these! I loved my visit to Gran Porto Real and would love to re-visit sometime soon!

Reviews.Title: “We had 13 in our family at GPR. Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: wanda4womensministry
Reviews.Content: The GPR is a GREAT resort for families. The on-line check in is wonderful and there was no waiting upon arrival for rooms to be readied. Staff is helpful and friendly. Rooms around front lobby and pool area are noisy throughout the night but rooms further away are GREAT. Beach was always clean and great. Best place to stay if you want to be close to the shops on 5th Avenue and be on the beach! All good!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money spent.”
Reviews.Author: Bozfam
Reviews.Content: Great, friendly and helpful staff. They were eager to assist us in all ways. Great Italian restaurant with excellent service, we ate dinner there 3 times. Poolside service was great, we were never left wanting a cold beverage. Outside small buffet for lunch served hamburgers, hot dogs and nachos, very accessible to either the beach or pool. The two disappointments were: the beach and the noise level at all hours of the day and night. Our room was next to a short staircase that was frequently used to transport luggage and what sounded like cleaning carts step by step. Many families with young children playing in the pool. I know that nature cannot be controlled, but the ocean was very rocky and full of seaweed, making it difficult to enjoy the beach access. However, there was a beautiful beach within walking distance, just not very convenient. It was extremely difficult from the hotel and staff were unable to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Was the perfect place for our wedding and trip with young children!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbernaldez
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this resort and the people. From the first night we were there, every person we came in contact with was so helpful and nice. Telo showed my fiance around to make sure that he knew where everything was---by the way---it was at 10:30 PM. That didn't matter to him---he treated us like his family! The whole time we were there, Jesus made sure that we had a cold drink in hand or waiting for us when we came back to our palapa! Our Master suite was beautiful and was more than we expected. Zulma, with the wedding service, took care of everything. I didnt have any worries! The food at ALL the resturants was excellent! My children stayed at the kids station---and that is not because I wanted them to stay there---they didn't want to leave:) Frederico with Best Day Travel helped out so much to make sure that our travel plans were still on time and that our shuttle service was on time. We will definitely be back and we will recommend it to our entire family!

Reviews.Title: “Teresa is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: BrutusBuck
Reviews.Content: We are finishing up our stay tomorrow. There are 8 in our group for an anniversary trip. Overall the trip was good. It is in a great location. The food was good. We were unhappy with the fact that you cannot drink in the pool. We were also unhappy with poolside and beach service until we met Benito and Teresa. We only had Benito a few times but he was good. We met Teresa when we spent a day at the pool. By the third round she knew what we all wanted and then just started bringing drinks before we would ask. She was awesome. She was very personable and prompt. If it wasn't for those two I would tell you that bar service outside is bad but they were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Julio was a fantastic entertainer - great with both kids and adults alike!”
Reviews.Author: ajwteacher
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Mexico and had a ball at the Gran Porto. Great for kids and adults who want lots of fun activities. All the staff were outstanding, especially Julio Cesar, who did such a great job of entertaining everyone. He has such a nice demeanor - friendly, not pushy, great sense of humor and lots of energy and enthusiasm! Especially loved the crazy games, crafts, and nightly shows featuring lots of wonderful dancing. Terrific place to go if you want an all inclusive resort for adults and kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wood5
Reviews.Content: Our group of 10 had an incredible time at the Gran Porto. Everyone from check in to check out was very helpful and wanted to make sure our trip was successful. We were greeted with drinks upon check in. Yolanda was very helpful at the front desk – making sure everyone was happy with their rooms. Our group either had ocean front or ocean front walk outs. All of the rooms exceeded our expectations. The rooms were clean and roomy. When cleaned we were left amazing “towel” art. Each day we had something different in our room. The cleaning staff did an outstanding job. The service on the beach and the pool was outstanding. The waiters: Teresa, Jose and Jorge were always right there when another drink was wanted. Fillipe at the swim up bar always had a smile and a drink ready for us. 7 out of our group had massages on the beach. What an experience. Lucy, Magda and Cecilia did a fabulous job. Some of our group went deep sea fishing and caught mahi mahi. They brought it to the resort and they cooked it for us. We were served in the buffet room. We got our own sides and the fish was delivered to the table. INCREDIBLE. The Italian rest was good as well. The Mexican (Maria’s) was not so good. But there is enough food on the resort that it is not that big of a problem. Snack shack on the beach was great for a lunch or snack. The food on the buffet and snack shack was turned over and fresh for the most part. It seemed that every rest. we were in – Freddie was there to take care of us. The only downfall was the rocks in the water. Obviously not anything the resort can change. The sand ledge is not a steep drop down. The resort staff worked hard to get the seaweed off of the beach everyday. This is a perfect size resort. You do not have to walk forever to get to the beach, pool or restaurants. Our group ages ranged from 25-76 and everyone was happy. Would we stay here again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “GRAN PORTO IS PARADISE ON EARTH”
Reviews.Author: THEONLYMRSHOLLYWOOD1
Reviews.Content: We loveGPR, we go twice a year and it just can not be beat! The location is the BEST, the hotel is soooooooo nice and clean, food is great, and by far they have the BEST STAFF ANYWHERE! Felipe Contreras who is the 3rd floor pool bartender is a dear friend and the best employee ever, he makes the trip worth it just to see him. We can't wait to go back in November again to see Felipe and all the wonderful staff at GPR, See ya soon Felipe! HOLA TO ALL OUR GREAT FRIENDS AT GPR

Reviews.Title: “Really wonderful vacation experience”
Reviews.Author: dsjrn
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Our group included my husbad, myself all of our adult children and all of our grandchildren. The little ones loved the "kidz zone" they even asked to stay longer some days. I said "if the kids are happy everyone is happy!" The service was excellent. Everyone is so friendly and cordial! The food was very good. We loved the room and the resort. Our room was cleaned daily but the only problem was we never knew when, sometimes in the morning sometimes in the afternoon. We were so close to 5th street which was great if you needed to shop. There were many people willing to set up tours if we wanted. Our transportation to and from the airport was the best, they went out of their way to accomodate us which was difficult since there were 14 people in our group but they made it easy. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Real Porto is the best place to enjoy a nice holiday or vacation”
Reviews.Author: lorydaleC
Reviews.Content: Real Porto is the best place to enjoy a nice holiday or vacation i had a great time! i really loved all the night shows, the service and also the guys from entertainment made my stay a wonderful experience, congrats to Loredana, she was so kind and funny, also took good care of our children. Thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: sandrien1983
Reviews.Content: felipe from the pool bar was verry good and did a great job. verry friendly to!! and the people that bring the cocktails and drinks on the beach, where verry good to!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Rita073
Reviews.Content: Ww love the Gran Porto Real, It's a wonderful hotel the people are amazing, the food is tremendus, thats why we keep coming back. We have Been here four times so far, I'm not too sure that any other hotel could compare with this one. I highly recommend going to the shushi bar, Filipe the bartender is awesome he takes very good care of you, and your glass never goes empty!!! I would also highly recomend eating at the Albatros, The chef Renee is an amazing chef, he knows how to cook a spectacular seafood and many other dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach location and frozen cocktails”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaMay
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Mexico before and looked at so many before deciding on the Gran Porto - and we are glad we did. The room (Junior Suite) was great, the service was excellent. The food was ok - the two restaurants do well and the buffet changes lots so you don't get bored. The location is amazing - on a quiet stretch of beach but right next to the action/clubs. Try the Miami Vice cocktail - heaven in a plastic glass. And head to the "Tranquility pool" on the roof if you want the best Pool Party at the swim-up bar.

Reviews.Title: “First Mexico Vacation Experience”
Reviews.Author: 2winsdaddy
Reviews.Content: The employees of the Gran Porto Real were very helpful on our first trip to Mexico. Although the main pool was large enough to handle big crowds with plenty of in pool lounge areas to catch some sun, it did close a little early for those that like to swim late. Our clean room had a king size bed and a large walk in shower, which we found clean every day with a stocked frig. The food was very good and had plenty of selections to choose from that helped us experience the local flavor. I will be considering the Gran Porto Real in the future for a vacation with my children.

Reviews.Title: “Parents can rest - Great for young kids”
Reviews.Author: shf2000
Reviews.Content: Our boys are 4 and 6 years old. This is our first vacation trip as a family, though my husband and I have travelled extensively prior to having kids. We wanted to be near the kids, but not necessarily with the kids 24/7. I wanted each of us to have a good time. That meant the kids needed to be busy with fun activities, my husband needed quiet time, and I needed good bar service on the beach. All of our wishes came true. It is about a 35 minute drive from the airport to the hotel. When we checked in (early evening), we were handed drinks and the kids had OJ. Check in was not a problem as we had done it online. We checked out our family suite, it was not the king size bed we wanted, but knew that it was a request - not a given. THe kids loved the bunk beds and the view of the pool and ocean. They really loved the hammock on the balcony. Then we checked out the kid's club to see if the kids would want to do some of the activities. Let's just say that the club didn't open until 9am and they were waiting every morning for 9am to role around. Some of the activities that they did: face painting, making cookies, watching movies, basketball, soccer, pirate day complete with pirate show that the kids were in, pool time, etc. Some of the activities the grown ups did - sleep, drink, sleep, and enjoyed adult conversation. The staff was spectacular, the hotel was clean, and the food was very good. The drinks were definately the best and they kept them coming! We never left the hotel for the 5 days we were there. It was a great vacation and a wonderful first travel experience for the boys. I cannot say enough about the kids club and the rest of the staff. It was such a relief to relax and know the kids were having their own fun that they chatted about non-stop. I strongly recommend this for the younger group of kids!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: Hellrzor
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fantastic, great service, great food. La Maria's Italian restaurant was amazing, Mateo was probably the best server I've ever had. My wife and I plan on going back next year. Very nice grounds, pools, lots to do. Very close to fifth ave for nightlife. Will definitely be going back

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome.”
Reviews.Author: tkbrown86
Reviews.Content: I would like to mention Ivan who works in the hotel restaurant he was amazing and made us smile everyday. He is a truely a blessing and he made us feel very welcome. we hope to come back someday and cant wait to see his smiling face again. I would also like to mention David who was a bartender in the lobby bar. He was also amazing. Kudos to these guys they make your resort a place people want to come back too!

Reviews.Title: “If Location Is What You Want...”
Reviews.Author: Sue_Maryland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights (5/21 & 5/22) before checking into another hotel in Playa del Carmen. We chose this hotel because of its location, which was perfect. Other than that, it didn't do much to impress me. Check in was easy, they gave us their house drink, Wilma Hurricane which was delicious. After about 30 minutes in our room, it was pretty clear the A/C was not working very well. I called the front desk and asked if we could be moved. She offered me a bottle of wine. Wine? That will cool our room down? I explained that really wouldn't work, so she begrudgingly agreed to send someone to my room who could show us another room on the same floor. Great, a plan in place. A very nice gentleman showed up, took us to another room, A/C worked great. At this point I realized that while we had reserved and paid for a Jr. Suite, the first room was not what we had paid for, since the second room was actually a junior suite and much larger. The rooms are actually quite nice, very Mexican in design, and while definitely dated, they are nice rooms. The cleaning of the rooms was not done very well, but it was adequate. The beach is okay. There is a large drop off, many, many fishing boats. It didn't seem like a relaxing place to go, so we skipped the beach. The pool, this is where I had some issues. The main pool doesn't allow drinks while in the pool. I realize there will probably be a lot of varying opinions on this, but it is vacation. I enjoy a drink while I'm floating around and relaxing. Now here is where I know many people will disagree with me. You can't even sit on the edge of the pool with your feet in the water and smoke a cigarette. Are they afraid the pool will catch on fire? I know smoking is offensive to many, I didn't plan on jumping in with a group of people and lighting up, but if I'm sitting off by myself, I might want to smoke. I could have moved back 2 feet and had my cigarette, so it's not like it was a non-smoking area. I do try to be respectful of not smoking around kids or any others, but it was the outdoors. Please don't spend a lot of time bashing me about this, I smoke, I know it's offensive to others and I try to be respectful. We went up to the adult pool to try that area. This is a pool that is not much larger than a backyard pool, even smaller than some. It looked like they were having a frat party there, so we left. Another note on both pools, if you have mobility issues, there is no easy way to exit the pools. You either climb a ladder or pull yourself up on a big ledge and then stand up and walk out. We didn't try the a la cartes, so I can't comment. The buffet was good for breakfast, just okay for the other meals. We had some intestinal issues (my first time in over a dozen visits to Mexico), but it's hard to tell if it was from our next hotel, because they started our first day there, or from GPR. The staff at this hotel work very hard, they were all very pleasant (except for the front desk who offered me wine instead of A/C). The location was exactly what we wanted, close to PDC to get our shopping done before moving to another location for a week. We really didn't have any issues with noise from the street, I'm not sure whether we were facing towards the street, the only thing I could see from our balcony was a white building and an exhaust fan below on the roof. If you're looking for a basic hotel that puts you in a great location in the center of Playa del Carmen, this hotel is a good choice. Otherwise, I wouldn't suggest GPR.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - But felt like being in one big wedding party - even though i was not a guest!!”
Reviews.Author: Xavier_uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relativley small and compact compared to many of the hotels in Mexico. There are 3 gripes I am going to get out of the way straight away:- 1 Room cleaning - It is very thorough,but takes for ages (1 hour plus and I had a 2 hours one once!). But you have no clue when it will happen. If you put on your please clean sign on the room at 9am it may take them to 3pm (even 5pm starts are not uncommon) for it to be cleaned even though rooms without the signs are done first!! 2 Service in the buffet. The buffet is a self service except for drinks, these you have to order. There were a couple of lunch times when I was ignored for the entire meal by the waiting staff as they were getting ready for the next meal service. Not impressed at all. 3 Boxed Lunch - Don't bother it is foul and good enough for the bin. Went out one day and ordered them the night before, the take out lunch. That morning went to reception in order to pick them up, they was not ready. After 15 minutes they arrived and I would have been better to have gone to 24 hours snack bar and picked up bits there. In our 3 boxes there was 1 rancid sandwich between the boxes. This has many positives and also a lot of negatives about the resort. The positives is that everything is within easy walking distance and that it is not too far from one side of the hotel to the beach. The hotel is within easy walking distance from the centre of Playa Del Carmen if you want to walk out and explore. A lot of fresh fruit in the breakfast. The main negative it that it is too small for the number of wedding parties which happen. I was there for a week and there was a wedding there at least an average of 1 wedding a day. This would not be that bad but this one wedding party a day. Some of the wedding parties were 40 plus people. There are 2 main bars in the hotel and it happened on several of the nights that the wedding parties would take over 1 of the bars. I do not like going to a hotel and feeling second rate. While I was there is was windy for most of the days. This was okay as the hotel blocked the wind from the main pool and beach side of the hotel. The downside of this was that you would be "moved" in order that the outside wedding could be accomodated. There is nothing realy wrong with the hotel but it did not feel as relaxed as I had hoped. Would I go back to Mexico, yes, would I go back to the Gran Porto, if i was in a wedding party yes, if not, probobly not.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Resort-Would Not Stay Again Though..”
Reviews.Author: LRapkin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for families with small children. The property is very clean and the staff is great (Jose, Cesar, entertainment crew). I traveled with my partner and extending family for a wedding at their sister resort (The Roayl-Adults Only). We had children in our party so we decided to stay at the Gran Porto. The food was pretty good. Two sit down restaurants open for dinner (one Italian and one Mexican). The buffet , open for breakfast, lunch and dinner was only good during breakfast and lunch. Housekeeping came between 4-5pm the first two days so we requested they come earlier while we were gone for the day. It seems like they are in there forever, but the room were spotless. Beds were pretty uncomfortable but we were so tired every night it did not make much of a difference. We stayed in a Junior Suite and were very happy about that. Since we did not stay in the room very much it was not necessary for us to spend the extra money on the view. I had two massages while I was there... Walk down the beach towards the pier and a block up you will find the "Massage Center." Two massages for $40 an hour. Can't beat that! It is a white outdoor building, bar below, massages upstairs over looking the ocean. All in all the vacation was very nice. The resort is a bit outdated so if you can afford to spend a little more and you do not have children, stay at the Royal. the Royal is much larger and luxurious, well worth the money! On the other hands this resort is perfect for families. Vendors come every night to the resort.. My family in total bought six tile ceramic paintings from this very nice man who did oil finger paintings. They are amazing and only $20.00. He was so appreciative and his work is wonderful. Must travel outside the resort to 5th Avenue! Plenty to do and a great nightlife!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Holmes182
Reviews.Content: This resort is a great all inclusive. It has a 24 hour snack bar with bottles of liquor and wine and a beer tap so you can make your own drinks. The Italian restaurant was great. The regular buffet was decent. Room service in the morning was awesome. The mini fridge had beer, water and soda in it all the time. Housekeeping was always trying to clean your room, which was nice. The 3rd floor pool and bar is pretty nice. The pool downstairs has a lot of chairs around it and got pretty filled up by 1 PM. The beach is decent, there are some rocks at the bottom though. There are a lot of chairs by the beach and the waiters are pretty good with the drinks. The beach grill area had some decent food. It wasn't the greatest but it did the job. The place is about 1 block away from where all the shops and bars are on 5th ave. I recommend Blue Parrot for drinks and dancing, and Tequilla Barrel for watching sports and betting. The hotel itself is very big and there are a lot of people staying here at one time. The front desk seemed a bit unorganized when we checked in but overall check in/out went pretty well. Make sure you change your dollars into pesos at the money exchange by the front desk before you go out on the town because you will get screwed by the bar tenders and locals on the exchange rate. There was a lot of wedding party's here also and a mixed crowd of older and younger people. I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I won't go back”
Reviews.Author: iris58
Reviews.Content: The holiday was great the hotel was just ok. The service was beyond reproach. Our room was small but very clean. I guess if you go all inclusive a person might be smarter to pick one with more choice for meals. Only 2 restaurants and a buffet. All were good but you get tired of the same old. We booked 3 people in one room and all paid our fair share. The fridge was renewed for two people. 2 beer 2 pop 2 water. It was not refilled on a regular basis and they were very slow when we requested more. If you ordered more beer for your room they would only bring two at a time. Even though we were three people. The people beside us were on a timeshare tryout and they received unlimited amounts of everything. The location was great and the staff were great. We made the best of it and did lots of things. Overall a good holiday but I wouldn't stay at the Gran Porto Real again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kitchen33
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Playa del Carmen. The hotel was different from other Mexican hotels as it lacked the big breezy palapa lobby, which I really missed! Not having the breeze made our stay alot hotter. We sweat any time we were under a roofed area. Except in the restaurants Over all the hotel seemed over crowded. The beach was very disappointing. They had sandbags every where and was also rocky. My husband cut his foot on a rock and the First Aid guy was great! even checked on us in the room 2 hours later. Food was good. Nice Spa. Pool was small for number of guests. They offered us a chance to go to the Real hotel in Cancun and we took the opportuniy, but it was worse. I

Reviews.Title: “Everything was amazing. Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Deb029
Reviews.Content: My 3 sisters and I recently stayed at the Grand Porto Real for one week. This was the best trip I have ever taken. The location of the resort is prime. You are right in the heart of Playa Del Carmen. You have the beach on one side and the city on the other. You are literally blocks away from 5th Avenue (which has amazing shopping outlets) and wild night clubs. The beach was beautiful, clean, and very spacious. The amenities at this resort were all perfect. The rooms were comfortable, cool, and clean. Our mini fridge was stocked daily with beer, pop, and bottled water. The pools and grounds were maintained daily. The food at the buffet was fresh, delicious, and the variety was spectacular. There are 2 a la carts which we enjoyed very much. The 24 hour snack and beverage bar was perfect for the wee hours of the night! The nightly shows/activities were always entertaining. There were both indoor and outdoor performances which ranged from a casino night to cultural dancing. The service at this resort was absolutely amazing. We were greeted with smiles and handshakes and left with laughter and hugs. Each staff member made an effort to ensure that every aspect of our vacation was perfect. The servers in the restaurants, on the beach, and at the bars were outstanding. I felt as though we were always taken care of. The service was prompt and always with a smile. My sisters and I truly enjoyed the entertainment staff at this resort. Each member (especially Cesar, Chicken, and Carlos) was welcoming, happy, funny, enthusiastic, and personal. During the day they kept us engaged with beach volley ball, dance lessons, and other fun activities. Throughout the evening they accompanied us to the night clubs to ensure we had perfect spots, non stop drinks, crazy fun, and amazing memories. One staff member in particular (Cesar) made our “sisters” trip memorable. Cesar always took a little extra time to ensure we were getting the most out of our vacation. He played a huge role in the amount of fun we had on that trip. Cesar made sure that us girls were always safe, always together, and always having a blast. We are definitely returning to the Grand Porto Real next year. We will anxiously wait to re-unite with all the individuals we made friends with.

Reviews.Title: “A good vacation but hotel could be better”
Reviews.Author: moviHouston
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Playa del Carmen a week ago. This is our 2nd time visting the city but first time staying at Gran Porto Real Resort. Beach is beautiful. Weather was hot with scattered rain. Pros: Gran Porto Real Resort did a good job in keeping the beach clean daily. The staff is accomadating. Hotel is outdated but they do make attempt to keep place clean. Great location: just minutes from 5th Ave. Cons: For an all-inclusive hotel, the food was not the best even with the buffet changes menu daily. Like other reviews, I admit breakfast was good (plenty of fresh juices and fruits). Take note: Hotel Mexican and Italian restaurants open in evening only. The food is decent but small portion. Recommendation: 1 hr body massage along 5ht Ave is much cheaper than hotel. A couple massage cost $55 USD. The facility is clean and safe with certified therapist. Experience was relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back in a heart beat!”
Reviews.Author: shannonrae250
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real for a week. We have 3 kids and stayed in a Family Suite, which was perfect. The hotel itself is kept immaculate, staff constantly cleaning. Our room was very spacious, but the Family Suites do vary in size. The first one we got had 2 double beds (despite having requested a King bed 3 times - when making the reservation, by phone after making it, and again doing the online check in). However, we went back to the desk and were immediately given a room with a King bed. It was on the corner, and had about twice as much space as the first one and two balconies. (One facing the pool and ocean, one facing some ugly lot and distant ocean view, but still nice). There weren't bathtubs, but huge lovely showers. I thought the restaurants were all pretty good. The buffet had a decent selection, the snack bar at the pool had nachos, hamburgers, hot dogs etc (The guac was excellent!). The Mexican and Italian restaurants both had a good selection. They are outside the hotel, but attached to it, which is kind of nice because you actually feel that you are going out. One of our daughters has food allergies, and we brought a list (in English and Spanish) of what she could and could not eat, and they were extremely accommodating, even the buffet would make her a special meal. We were there for our wedding, so about 30 people were there with us. We were able to use a large private room in the Italian Restaurant the 1st night for a private meal -- just had to buy a couple bottles of wine. The wedding planners who I dealt with before the trip (who are located in the US) were by far the least helpful, unaccommodating and generally stupid people I have ever encountered. The day we left for our trip, I received an email indicating that we were booked for June (a month off), 4:00 pm (our wedding was at 11) and on North Beach (we were scheduled on Central). That is really the least of it. . . it would take them 2 emails and a phone call to get an answer to the most simple, basic question like "what are the meal options," "how much is cake" etc. This turned out to be a blessing in disguise because I got fed up with them and instead booked a Catamaran for our wedding reception which turned out to be the best wedding reception ever. The onsite wedding person was wonderful, she expressed frustration with the phone/web planners because they hadn't told her if I wanted a bouquet or any details about the ceremony either, however, she pulled our very basic wedding ceremony off without a hitch and was lovely to work with. The location of this hotel is great - you just walk up the street to 5th Ave where all the shopping/restaurants are. You can also walk the beach to the ferry. Several reviews indicated that Ocean Front rooms are noisy at night because of the noise from the Blue Parrot, but our room was on the corner closest to the Blue Parrot and we never heard any noise at all (the hotel nightly shows are pretty loud, but they are over by 10). Huge props to FAT CAT Catamaran out of Puerto Adventuras -- our 4 hour rental was a huge highlight of our trip. So many of our guests told us it was the best wedding reception they'd ever been to, and the customer service was so above and beyond it was amazing. We went on a 4 hour trip, stopped at a reef to snorkle (I got to hold a live starfish & sea urchin) then we stopped and lazed around in the ocean and got to ride the boom net). The boat is beautiful, the staff friendly and fun (and they looked out for the little kids like hawks). One other thing about the hotel is that the kids club is wonderful. You have to stay on site while the kids are checked in, but they have all kinds of fun activities, and our little kids begged to go. . . which gave all of us a really nice chance to relax. Finally . . . there are tons of places along the beach offering massages for $18 - $20 for an hour. The very best is almost all the way to the ferry (you pass 3 lifeguard stands) and then there are just 4 tables under a palapa. We've been there twice and they are amazing. It was $30 for 90 minutes, and both my husband and I were in heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Experience from beginning to end was a true pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: ValentineMs
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen was, as always, perfect. Perhaps the most ideal thing about this resort is its staff, all of whom make guests feel valued and appreciated. You will be treated with wonderful warmth and hospitality from staff members who work tirelessly to make sure your every need is catered to. In addition to their personal touch, you will notice that they work continuously to keep the resort spotless and well maintained. This resort has the feel of real luxury yet it is casual enough to be unpretentious. You will see people in shorts and sandals and those who prefer to dress with more elegance. There is also an interesting mixture of young and old, families and singles. We saw several lovely indoor and outdoor weddings while we were at Gran Porto and noticed that many large families came to reunite from around the country and, no doubt, from around the world. While in the 24 hour snack bar, I took some time to watch the young women working in the daycare and was impressed with the constant care and attention given to the children of the guests. It seems that no matter what your age, you are treated like royalty when you are at Gran Porto Real! One of the things we like best about the resort is the location. It is within easy walking distance of downtown Playa del Carmen. However, once inside the resort or beachside on the grounds, you feel that you are away from anything resembling a city and truly in a beachside paradise. The rooms, the common areas and the pool area are close enough to the beach so that almost anywhere in the resort you can either see the beach or, at the very least, hear the ocean and feel of ocean breezes. What a choice in food! You can choose from the Albatross Restaurant (elegant and extensive buffet), Maria’s Restaurant (Mexican), Pescatore Restaurant (Italian) and numerous snack bars. The resort food is amazing, in all restaurants the presentation is something out of a magazine and your wait staff will be the icing on the cake. We chose to go to the buffet for most meals and were blessed to usually have a marvelous waiter by the name of Dion. His service was impeccable. Dion was a charming young man with a warm smile and cheerful attitude. He never seemed to tire of giving us Spanish lessons when we asked or answering our many questions about the Mexican Riviera or Mexico in general. The other wait staff was marvelous as well but we tried our best to have Dion as our server whenever possible. The junior suites are very spacious and, if an unobstructed view of the ocean is important to you, make certain you get an ocean front suite. An ocean view room may have some view of the ocean but it can be either from a distance or with some building obstruction or both. I spoke with several people who had the least expensive rooms (not suites and without any beach view). They all stated that because they spent very little time in their rooms, they were quite happy with their rooms and felt that, due to the lower room fares, they were getting an excellent value for their accommodations. Our housekeeper, Patricia, was phenomenal. In addition to keeping the room in perfect condition, she also left us lovely swans sculpted out of towels and made certain our refrigerator was full of the drinks we preferred. As with other staff members, she made us feel welcome and completely at home. At the resort you will probably have the pleasure of meeting Monserat, the patient woman who works at the money exchange. Despite my repeated math errors and inability to accurately ask for change, Monserat never lost her smile or her sense of humor. I have no qualms about recommending the Gran Porto Real. The experience from beginning to end was a true pleasure. The one thing nicer than the accommodations and the location is the staff; you will never meet a finer group of people anywhere. The only problem I encountered during my stay was feeling incredibly sad to leave and knowing that I will not be able to return until next year.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise visited”
Reviews.Author: Stullerchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Porto from May 10- 20th. We were greeted with cervezas via Julio, who is just a gem! We then met with Yendaly who was to check us into our room. We had booked a standard room, but were offered an upgrade immediately- they were kind enough to let me look at both rooms before I decided- even though I knew I would go for the junior suite!! We got them down a little on the price for room 336- Junior Suite Ocean View- well worth the pesos- we had a view of the boardwalk to the beach and the ocean- just beautiful!! The service down at the pool was on the ball- Jesus, Pablo, and Benito are very good at what they do- we always tipped even though its "all inclusive", it assures even superior service- even if it just a few dollars, they appreciate it, and show you with their service. We ate in the main dining room for breakfast every morning which was delicious- lunch and dinner were good- you must order Mayan Coffee- its quite a show and yummy! We did venture out to eat alot at night just because we like to change it up- just up the street Luna Rossa has the best pizza Ive had in a long time!! The entertainment at night was fun- dancing, costumes, music, crowd involvement- these guys and gals seem to work every day- Chicken and Patricia are full of energy!! Our room was lovely- just a few things needed to be updated, like towel racks, tv, but really over all we were just over the moon about the whole experience! I cant forget to mention Orlando, who worked really hard to get us into the time share presentation the first day- I was resistant, because I know the time it takes, but he made it worth our while! This hotel is located right in the heart of things, two blocks from 5th Ave, and on the beach- we looked around town and wouldnt stay anywhere else! We are already planning our next visit this Christmas!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Gran Porto Real is so awesome I want to live there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn_hamo
Reviews.Content: The service at the Porto Real is Spectacular. Every single staff member made us feel welcome and helped with whatever they could to make our stay enjoyable. The food was excellent and was always available (love the all inclusive!). We especially loved the 3rd floor sushi bar next to the pool. And cervaisas & other yummy drinks were also always available! Drink service on the beach was awesome - we were never thirsty! The rooms, pools and other amenities were beautiful and exceptionally maintained. Room service was great - our mini fridge was always stocked with everything we needed. The Entertainment staff is the best part of the resort. They always have daily activites planned like water sports, aerobics, dance lessons etc etc - my favorite was beach volleyball. The staff are super friendly and so good at getting everyone involved and having fun which made it really easy to meet other people who were staying at the resort. The evening entertainment was always awesome too. They had indoor and outdoor events with dancers and performers - we even got to dance on stage with them!! When you stay at the Porto Real, ask for Cesar - he is a member of the Entertainment staff. Cesar made our trip so much fun I cannot imagine what we would have done without him! He made sure we were having fun all day when we were at the beach and he also went out to the clubs with us at night and made sure my sisters and I were comortable, taken care of, and that we were having a blast!!!! And lastly, I LOVED the location of the Porto Real. It is in the city of Playa del Carmen but is right on the (gorgeous) beach and only a couple blocks walk to major shopping centers, the 5th Ave markets, and all the awesome Night Clubs!! My sisters and I love the Porto Real so much that we consider a lot of the staff our friends and we are already planning our next trip there - and taking the rest of our family with us, including our parents!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: vancitymissingmexico
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Gran Porto. My family has stayed at the hotel for the past 5 years and I was delighted to go with them and some friends this year again. Despite having one day of rain, the trip was absolutely amazing! The food is not the best, but that is expected from an all inclusive. We had some problems getting settled in our room, but that is Air Canada's fault. The staff was very helpful at getting us our correct room. The restaurant staff was always very friendly and we had wonderful service. The entertainment team is excellent as well! They are always very lively and run some really fun activities. Cesar and Chicken took us out twice and we had a great time both nights. The clubbing was sooo much fun and they made sure we had good service at the clubs. Cesar has to be my favourite entertainment staffer. He always has a smile and you can tell he loves his job. The hotel in general is just so much fun. I cannot wait to go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “stayed here many times and gran porto real is excellent as usual.”
Reviews.Author: flamingijoe
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at gran porto real in playa del carmen many times over the past 10 years. all the staff is extremely excellent. we book the jr. stuie ocean front walk-out and we have our own reserved palapa on the beach with a bed and lounge chairs with this upgrade. we can eat at all the restaurants in both this hotel and also the royal playa del carmen which is just across the street. the food at all the restaurants is very excellent. also the drinks at tge palapa bar and lobby bar. long time waiters we know such as teresa, pablo, jesus are still here at the palapa bar as well as david and miguel. also new waiters as well. ivan is excellent in the albatros for breakfast. beach front has been restored and very excellent. hotel is right downtown just 2 blocks from 5th avenue, the main shopping and paderstrian street in plays. cannot beat this place and hope to be back again in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “2 Adventures in 1!!!”
Reviews.Author: librasmile05
Reviews.Content: We booked to go to this hotel for our honemoon as Mexico seemed like a great destination and I'd read good reviews on Trip advisor. I also liked the fact that it was outside Cancun and a lot less busy. When we arrived we were greeted by great service at the front desk with the bellboys and a welcome cool drink. We were shown to our room which was very basic indeed, but as we'd not upgraded in the UK, this was what we were expecting. As it was our honeymoon, we decided to upgrade to a Junior Suite which had an ocean view and was about 4 rooms back from the front of the hotel and directly opposite the sister "Royal" just across the avenue. We were also shown a direct ocean view suite which was more expensive, but the one we chose was by far the best. The food was gorgeous, the service in general and the pools and beach were so good. We felt we were in paradise and having such a wonderful honeymoon. It was everything we wanted and more. On the 5th day we noticed there was lots of drilling and banging going on so after a few hours I spoke to the manager to raise our concerns and was assured it would be finished that day. It continued the next day and we agreed that as we were going to be out all of the following day it wasn't causing us any undue distress but one more day of it when we returned and we would not be happy - after all.....we were honeymooners! On the 7th day we awoke to more drilling and banging and I went to see the manager who totally understood our concerns and summonsed a bell boy to take us over to "The Royal" to choose a room for ourselves.....he was upgrading us for the 2nd week of our stay absolutely free! We were convinced that they would show us to the worst room in the hotel, but thats not possible because all the rooms are just amazing....in room jacuzzi's etc etc! It was beyond anything we ever thought possible and we were so grateful to the manager for this. I would definitely stay at the Gran Porto Real again because even without the upgrade to The Royal, it was still an amazing location and the service was out of this world. Infact, we are going to be going back in 2013 with our children to renew our wedding vows. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: rcrane
Reviews.Content: I went to the indoor spa.Had a great massage by Sergio.I left feeling terrific,relaxed and peaceful.Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MJ_Howard
Reviews.Content: When our group arrived and reservations were made 6 months in advance. The associates at the front desk seemed unprepared. There was 33 in our group but arriving at different times of the day. The first thing out of their mouth to every guest "would you like to upgrade for $50per night for an ocean view?' Our junior suite was to have 2 queen beds many in our group got a room with a roll away cot as the second bed. They said "they supply the room not the beds." This is a Buyer Beware. We could not unpack as the next day they did move us. With that room the electrical sockets did not work. They said keep your key card in the electricity acitvation slot. Told them I had did this and check the power surge buttons on the sockets. The electircity did not work. I think we were treated as dumb women who had never even cut on an electrical switch more less fixed one. WRONG. After the third time to the front desk on this issue, which at that point I explained most of my first 30 hours in Mexico had been at their front desk. They came to the room with a maintence man and guess what he found a fuse issue. The food was average at best. Our group paid extra one night (ll Pescatore) so that we could eat together. Other than that we never overwhelmed the staff; however one night we had 12 of us (Albatros) and we begged just for a glass of water. Many of us had finished eating before we got water. The 4 at our table when 2 did get water ended up sharing their water. We were never asked about soft drinks, tea, etc. Forget. The staff was arguing on who's tables they were. At lunch one day (Albators) I went to the hostess stand and got plastic silver ware to eat with. Thank goodness I had just got a pina coloda from the bar. No one asked did I need anything. If you are use to average dinining this might be okay. The best meals we found was breakfast....how do you mess up waffles, yougart, fruit, pastries? Our safe we had to fix the batteries and then we ended up having to get the front desk twice to come fix it on our last day. I have used many of these type of safes and we finally decided just to carry our valuables with us. There is absolutely nothing that would make me recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad or great.”
Reviews.Author: Guitar_player_NS
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Apr.18 to April 25. We booked an Ocean View JR. Suite AI package through Air Canada Vacations. The Resort's online booking was painless and it worked. We had been to Mexico 2 previous times and wanted to try a place right in Playa Del Carmen, this seemed like the place. We travel at least twice a year. CHECK IN: As I said earlier, we used the Resort's online booking, 48 hours before arrival. When we arrived, it was 10:30 AM; I asked where we should go if we had checked in on line, we were escorted away from the line up of 20 or so people to the concierge desk. Our room was assigned, but not ready until 3:00 PM. We knew this would be the case long before we arrived. We received our bracelets, checked our luggage with the bellhops, had some champagne, explored the resort and had lunch. THE RESORT IN GENERAL: The resort is well maintained, and "see yourself in the floor tiles" clean, I mean it’s CLEAN. It's not a large place, if you plan on having just a "Resort Experience", this is not the place for you. We used it as a base to play in Playa Del Carmen. There are "ZERO" grounds and the property is small, you have a pool and beach...that's it. The pool was ok, and the beach was ok as well, now that the beach reclamation is complete. Activities are the usual, some water sports, pool games, beach games, a Kids Zone and a cool room with XBox 360's with LCDs for the "tweens", our children are in their 20's and did not travel with us, SO, we couldn't care less about activities for kids. THIS IS A FAMILY resort, so if you don't go for that, DON'T book the place. The shows at night are like any other resort, the animation crew works hard and you will laugh at the “on stage” contests. OUR SUITE: Well the online booking payed off. We received a beautiful Spanish colonial suite, with King Size bed and an Ocean view that didn’t require leaning precariously over your Balcony rail, we also requested an "upper level" suite, we were placed on the top floor. House keeping was the best we have experienced to date. We have traveled 6 times since April 2007. The fridge was always stocked with Beer, soda and water. I don't know how many times a week this is supposed to happen, but a dollar in the fridge insured that there was always beer in the fridge, TWICE on one particular day. The Wall mounted Liquor Cabinet was stocked with Vodka, Rum, Scotch and Whiskey...we didn't even use it. EVERYTHING in our room functioned, hot water, TV, toilet, Air conditioning and door locks. Those of you that had trouble getting your rooms in order...did you arrive late at night; was your travel party a ridiculous size of 8 or more? Let me tell you, you are not the only people that were booked at this resort...it's usually early bird gets the worm. Try showing up before early evening for your rooms, talk to your travel agents and get better arrival times. I've been witness to a travel agent telling a traveler one thing and actually selling them another, meaning you paid the agent for a suite and they booked you into a room; check this out when you get home, you may have been a victim of this, we do not use agents. When asked if we wanted to upgrade to the Royal across the street, we simply replied if we wanted that, we would have booked that...end of the topic for the entire week. THE SPA AND FITNESS CENTER: Sorry, didn't use it. It looked very nice. THE WEATHER: One overcast day, still hot but a good day for a walk up the public beach. It rained that evening, so we watched the show which was moved indoors, a bit crammed. The rest of the week was 35 to 37 Deg. and sunny. THE BUFFET: This has got to be the worst Buffet I have ever been to, my wife on the other hand enjoyed it. A reviewer had mentioned it was just like a RIU buffet, sorry dude it wasn't even close. I've been to 2 RIU resorts in 3 years, THEY have good buffets. The only thing good about this buffet was Breakfast and the sweets they offered. There might have been one good lunch, and one good dinner there all week. THE ALL INCLUSIVE 24 HOUR ROOM SNACK BUFFET This was stocked from the main buffet...end of review. THE ITALIAN A LA CARTE: Unlimited visits walk up...no reservations...THANK GOD. The atmosphere here is great, the food and service enjoyable, no bad experiences. With just 2 of us, we never waied more than 2 mins for a table. We ate here a lot. THE MEXICAN A LA CARTE: Just like the Italian, less formal. Ate here a lot as well THE POOL-BEACH SNACK BAR. Hotdogs, fries, burgers, Nachos and Chilli......blahhhh. I grabbed the fruit, which is good everywhere. The french fries (Chips for you Brits) were terrible everywhere on the resort. ROOM SERVICE: It was included, other guests said it was ok, but we didn't use it. We were just too busy to "CAMP" out in our room. The menu appeared to have good choices. THE RESORT STAFF: Excellent, every single one of them. WEDDINGS: This place is small, with sometimes 2 weddings a day, this equates to too many weddings. This created "Bridezillas" out of otherwise sweet young women. I understand, this is the Bride and Groom's day, but the rest of us view yourself and your entourage as just another bunch of guests, we see you as NOTHING MORE and NOTHING SPECIAL. Lol, I've never seen so many grooms so wasted and drunk that the Honeymoons must have been a sleep session. Still laughing over that one. GROOMS, your new wives were beautiful...what's up with the "so bombed" that you can't function routine anyways? lol. BARS, BOOZE and BOOZE SERVICE: The bar in the 24 HR AI room was self serve. Beer on Tap was called "Montezuma" it was ok when cold, in fact all of the on tap beer at the resort is Montezuma. The liquor bar in the AI room is well stocked. The main lobby bar was great and fast. The pool bar also was fast. Our favourite was the "sit down" service, anywhere you sat, including the beach; your drink order was taken and delivered quite speedily. If on the beach, you could get around 4 drinks per hour brought to you..not bad..not bad at all. The booze is like any other resort, if you want premium Alcohol, tip and ask for it, it's that easy. The A la Cartes had the best beer, all of the local brands as opposed to "Montezuma" at the rest of the resort. Superior was the beer in our fridge, it was ok as well. Benito on the beach will not allow you to go "dry". THE REAL CLUB. Very good salesmen/women when it comes to selling you a RIP-OFF package. Their base is the "Hospitality" desk, don't get fooled. When you get into your room, you will get a call to come pick up your "Discount" card for use at the resort, DON'T TAKE IT..in fact don't take anything from them for free...it's far from free.
