Use the "Welcome" phone call to inform them you are not Interested and you prefer not to be contacted or approached again for the duration of your stay...it works, they just smiled and waved for the rest of the week, BUT they did not approach us for a sales pitch. If you fall prey to the discount card, hand it back directly to the Real Club member that gave it to you, if you don't or you lose it....a charge shows up on your credit card. I am giving the resort a 4, based on the buffet and the WAY too many weddings, some of them really did not look happy. We have been to better places. I would recommend this place to friends and family, but not to ALL of my friends and Family. We would personally return here, but we have this thing about trying a new place each time, so it may be years before we return. In closing all I can say is traveling to places like Mexico successfully is all in your mind set, THAT will make the difference in a good or bad trip for you, don't sweat the small stuff. You are on vacation, you came here to relax and get away..so get started. That's it. HAVE fun here..promise me ..ok? If you don’t like this review...we can never travel together.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn’t waste your money staying here, i'd spend a little more and go to the royal”
Reviews.Author: beachgurl101
Reviews.Content: I went to Grand Porto Real Playa Del Carmen for my sister’s wedding. We booked a year in advanced jr suit ocean view, 2 queen beds. Upon arrival our room had been given away, so we were placed in another ocean view which was fine till we walked into it and there was 2 king size beds and one of them was a fold up cot. There was no place to move in the room and the fold up cot was as hard as a brick. The garbage’s had dirty tampons in them, it was gross. Then in the afternoon when I went to get a shower there was no hot water, so taking all day for them to come fix around 12 am I was finally able to shower. After my shower I crawled into my tacky cot and the covers were damp, both beds had damp covers. Finally the next day we went down and requested another room, again none were available other than an upgrade to ocean front which cost us another $200. Also at the end of the week after the cleaning lady left we found a man’s dirty shirt on the table in our room, and my mother’s ring was missing. They would not explain to us why it was in there, they didn’t care. **The beaches were gross, full of seaweed and boats. You have to walk a ways to get to a nice beach.** ********THE POOL CLOSES AT 9pm****** ****THE SWIM UP BAR CLOSES AT 6pm AND SO DOES THE HOT TUB****** (I thought that was kind of silly) As for the food the buffet was terrible, breakfast was the only good meal, the two restaurants were good though just not the buffet. The entertainment was awesome and the spa was nice too. I wouldn’t waste your money staying here, id spend a little more and go to the royal it’s worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Service was the BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: artisimo29
Reviews.Content: To start with, let me say that the service at this resort is the BEST I have ever received in the 15 years that I have visited the Mayan Riviera. We have stayed at different resorts every year, and love to try a new Resort each year. On arrival, we were greeted with smiles, drinks, and the suggestion of an opportunity to upgrade. Elena and Luis were very patient with us in explaining the added amenities, and with one of our party not there yet, they encouraged us to check out the rooms before making the decision. I don't want this to come across as a negative in anyway, as I always assume that you get what you pay for. We did negotiate from the first offered price, and after viewing the rooms, there was no comparison, so we agreed to the upgrade. The downside was we could only have the room for 6 out of our 7 nights, and although we tried to keep the room the last night, we had to move to our lesser room, and were glad we had been fortunate enough to have the 1st room for as long as we did. Our upgraded Suite was FABULOUS!! Close to the pool, ground level, fabulous King size bed, with big fluffy duvet, a great bar, brand new furniture and chocolates every night by our bed. Our maid was exceptional, and our room was spotless and well maintained the entire time we had that room. She left Hibiscus flowers decorating the beds and bathroom each day. We had our own sun bed outside on the beach, and were able to use the restaurants 3 nights at the Royal across the street. The Asian restaurant there was amazing! The Pelacanos on the beach was fabulous as well, and Victor was very efficient to greet us with bug spray on the very still night that we had dinner there. We didn't really have a bad problems with Mosquito's, but found that if there was no breeze, there were bugs. Mateo and Alex were wonderful at the Italian restaurant and I will be forever grateful for Mateo making us Mayan coffees, his fabulous service and hugs when we left. Alonso, Jose, Benito, and all the other Beach staff that I can't remember their names, were wonderful. Friendly, smiling and offering their services constantly. The drinks were top notch. The Entertainment staff, Alejandro, Jesus, Caesar, Alex, (sorry if I missed anyone), were wonderful!! The Buffet staff were all so friendly, and for our group of 3, always accommodating. Teresa at the 24 hr. cafe/bar was so wonderful!! Always smiling, and always offering her help, We felt very pampered the entire time we were there. The one thing I have found in the Mayan area, is if you want to have a good time, you will. If you smile and are happy, everyone loves you. If you treat others as equals, you WILL have an excellent experience. Stuff happens sometimes, but everyone is human, and if we move on and laugh about it, it's all good. Now for some things that the Porto Real needs some help on. The Gym....what can I say. First of all, I work out 5 times a week. I went once there. It is extremely cramped, and the floor is warped badly, never mind the amount of sand on the floor. The treadmills are ok, but if you aren't prepared to just use some free weights to get through your workout, don't waste the effort to go there. The Older rooms....our last night we were put on the 3rd floor above the pool. The view was it's saving grace. The beds were ancient, and saggy, with very ugly covers that you pulled away from you. They have tried to extend the life of the beds by adding the contoured foams to them. Our shower didn't drain properly, and I cleaned the floor behind the door around the toilet, because it had been missed for sometime. The floor had spots of tar on it,, and the mirror frame was chipped and really needed to be tossed. I assume they are going to renovate like the room we stayed in initially, because quite frankly, I could not have managed to stay in that room for a week. We had seen the other room next to this one when we first arrived, and I assumed they showed us a bad one to encourage us to upgrade....no such luck. Our glass sliding door leaked so badly, that although we had the A/C on the entire day and night (we had a spare key that we left in so the power stayed on) we cooked all night. If you walked near the glass door, you could feel the heat. The towel shelf is clear on the opposite side as the shower in the bathroom, so don't forget to get one before you get in. Room # 359. The Nightlife at the resort was very difficult. We would have loved to experience the shows every night, but they were on at 8:30 p.m. and we found it interfered with our meal times. It was over by 9:30 and then there was pretty much nothing except a small band on 2 of the evenings. The Friday night the band was outside by the pool until 11:00 p.m. and it was a fun evening of dancing and making new friends. I must admit the Resort does offer fully escorted service to Senior Frogs, and Coco Bongo which we did not take advantage of. Most of the other resorts we have stayed at have had their own Disco and nightlife, so you are free to arrive and leave at your leisure. We were 3 girls and didn't feel we could do that with the service offered. So there you have it. Would I stay there again?? Absolutely. I would still choose the upgrade though, so for the money, it 's a bit pricey for a very small resort. But for the Service, it would be worth every penny :)

Reviews.Title: “sorry to say but”
Reviews.Author: 8fortheroad
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed . We were 4 couples and we arrived around midnight . We had pre-checked in online as they recommended we do on their site ,confirming our junior suites. Well to our surprise they had already assigned us to standard rooms . The rooms were assigned as they were booked 2 close to each other as on each file. So this tells me they were not giving us what we payed for from the beginning. We were not ready to accept this and they said they could not do any thing now to come back in the morning. So we let our rep take care of it. If 4 js rooms were not available , then how did we get standard rooms assigned together. They play games in my opinion . They really want you to pay to upgrade ,they even have a monitor on the from desk showing you what you will get to upgrade. I am sorry but I've been to many resorts and so have the people we travel with and this was the first time ever that something like this had happened. Never down grade your guest never. If we had not been informed on our reservation , we would have stayed in the standard room or payed again to be upgraded. As for the resort , yes the staff was great , fast service at the bars, room service was great. The hotel is very clean , spotless I can say. The Italian restaurant was the best . Maria not so good and the buffet was hit and miss. Sorry to say but I can not recommend this resort for the games they play left me with a sour taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, seriously...”
Reviews.Author: freestylecruizer
Reviews.Content: Okay, before you think that I had a seriously bad experience at this hotel, that is wrong. I have travelled lots, most recently on cruises. This was our first resort stay in several years and this was chosen because our oldest was getting married on the beach on April 20, 2010. Arrival/check in was a gong show. As we had 3 people in our room and requested to be near the remainder of the wedding party, the hotel put us in the back corner below the roof top hot-tub - not sufficient - despite being called an "ocean view junior suite" - you could only see a portion of the ocean. So, we were told that the hotel had overbooked (common response to a number in our group). After some feet stompin' by my wife, we were moved to a closer ocean view junior suite. Tilo, the bellman, was wonderful figuring this out for us. The hotel is in serious need of upgrade/attention. Our air conditioning did not work for the first 3 nights. Thank goodness it was raining, because it would have been intollerable at 30c outside. It was tankfully fixed, but it was either on or off - you get the point. The fixtures in the room are all worn, the bathroom needs attention and so do most of the furniture in the lobby/common areas. Food - the buffet has to be the worst I have ever encountered while travelling. I won't go into details suffice to say that several members of our part got violently ill after eating there. Again, I get it, food is subjective, but this was beyond being subjective. Despite being told that there are 7 restaurants at this resort, there really is only 3 (the buffet, the Italian, and the Mexican), the other 4 that they refer to as "restaurants" are the "pool grill" which is basically a wealth of heating trays of food such as hamburgers and hotdogs (I wonder if that's where we got sick from); the sushi bar (not really a restaurant); the 24 hour (older food from the buffet); the Tiki bar (which is basically food from the buffet as well). The 24 hour room service menu is okay, but don't expect it fast - one order took 1.5 hours to arrive, and when it did, it was cold. On the note of the room service, if you are in an Ocean View or lower category, you are only permitted to order room service once per day - something they neglect to telly you when you check in. We should have seriously opted from the all inclusive package with this hotel, as it's not worth the major dollars that WestJet Vacations/Air Canada Vacations charge for this place (or Real resorts for that matter). For a few more dollars, move accross the street to the Royal. Which brings me to another item - no more than three times did ask us if we wanted to "upgrade" to the Royal - to me "upgrade" means free, what they should say is "upsell", because there is a surcharge to move over to the Royal. We took the upsell and for a mere $300 extra for 6 nights, we were moved into a far superior resort - the two resorts cannot compare which is truly sad. I can go on about the resort, but suffice to say if you want a better experience in Playa, move to the Royal!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic time, despite 3 days of rain!”
Reviews.Author: 1happykat
Reviews.Content: After many, many hours of research, I settled on the Gran Porto Real for our 11th Anniversary trip. Despite a bumpy arrival with not much communication as to how to get to our room, how to get around the restaurants and bars or what there was to do, we ended up having a great time. The only complaint would be about the front desk staff; every other worker was extremely helpful and nice. The food was great, the bars were great and most importantly, the location was the best! Our room, Ocean Front room #343 was divine and had the best view I could imagine! For our first all inclusive experience, it was an A!!!

Reviews.Title: “better than most but service is poor”
Reviews.Author: val100781
Reviews.Content: tons of kids here... it is a family resort. i am pregnant so i didn't take part in the drinks but my fiance did and seemed to enjoy it. while on the beach however, it was practically impossible to get a water.. that's all, simple h20 and they would not bring it. i saw couple after couple go through round after round while my request for water went un answered. the head waiter of the RESORT heard about it (from a very irritated father to be) and came to check on me... for the remaining thirty minutes there was plenty water... the food is mediocre at best... bring not only your antacids but also any anti-emetics if you have them.. and if you don't plan to party or bring kids, i would also recommend a sleep aid as the blue parrot can be heard until four am loudly if you have a beach front view. the property was lovely, the shows were insipid. the room (grand master's suite) was beautiful and spacious. recommended only if you need a resort and have kids. my five year old may have loved it.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: DNimko
Reviews.Content: All inclusive week. I found the Hotel to be extremely well located to walk along the beach or on the 5th avenue. Be aware the merchants are tenacious. Hotel architecture is nice and charming. There is only 6 restaurants in the hotel. There was demolition and then construction outside (adding 2 palapas) and inside (at the main restaurant) while we were there. I was offered a drink only once in the whole week by the exterior barman/barmaid. Personnal is friendly and smilly. Beach is dirty with algeas or other garbages (2 litres plastic bottle floating around, plastic wraps) We cut ourselves on the rocks even if the water at the beach is only 1 to 3 feet deep we were often unable to locate the numerous rocks. Water shoes are a must. The beach is dropping about 4 feet ( see photo) so you can not see your child from the chairs and can not bring your chair near by. I suspect sea is taking back the sand and then when you enter the water it drops again another feet or so. They constructed a pier to try to slower the waves but even with this we were always deported near the boats (and their anchors). For the price charged it is very deceiving. If you like to swim in the ocean, go elsewhere. see photos In the rooms the electrical switches were not cleaned, the door knobs where sticky and the lamps (we called them larva lamps-see photo) on the night tables where intermittent. I desinfected these but if hygiene is important to you go elsewhere or do a complain at front desk to have them cleaned. I upgraded from a standard room on the roof near the small cold pool on street side to a junior suite on beach side and was charged 400$ us (+ tax 480$ us ) for 5 days and found out on the return flight some did upgrade for 250$ wich means you can not trust the front desk because if they feel they can take advantage of you, they will. To my opinion if I can not trust hotel administration and its front desk better go elsewhere. Food was very good with a large choice and disponibility and restaurant personnel is very friendly and professional. Most important thing is that we did not get sick. Beds in standard rooms were more confortable then the king size bed in the junior suite. There was ants in both bathrooms. Showers, toilets, sinks, hot water, windows and doors, TV, fridges and A/C were all working fine. Honestly, they should put Safes with electronic codes in all room and get rid of the safe with the keys. I would recommend the hotel for someone who prefer to swim in the pools rather than swim in the sea and for the food, drinks, personnal (except front desk).

Reviews.Title: “It was a wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Tracy B
Reviews.Content: Check in: sorry don't remember,had a bit of a train wreck on the plane, my friends however said it was great. Rooms: One friend stayed in a standard room and it was really nice,had everything you could possibly need.The standard rooms do not come with a balcony so be aware.Those who book junior suites with a view be aware that is all you will get is a view when you lean over the balcony.We booked an ocean front junior suite as we wanted to look at the ocean while sitting on our balcony so that is just a little tip so you won't be disappointed. Buffet is very good and staff is excellent.Mexican and italian restaurants were very good as well. Location is amazing,two minute walk to the infamous 5th ave.where you can barter like crazy,they love it. Many great places for dinner if you tire of the resorts food and have a hankering for something different.There is a Scotia bank three blocks straight up from the hotel or you can walk the length of 5th ave. and there is another on the end left side.Avoid the money exchanges if you can and the further down 5th you go the rates will rise. We found the look of this hotel inside and out extremely pleasing to the eye.When approached to upgrade to the Royal across the road we just asked them why would we upgrade from this building to that ugly looking white building across the road.If you want a vacation with out kids around then upgrade.If you want a little more ritzy then upgrade. In a nut shell,beautiful rooms,good food,excellent staff,nice beach,very clean .Last but not least give the poor front desk staff a break,they are kind and accommodating until some self important smuck takes the wind right out of their sails,saw that a few times so if your that person the Royal across the street beckons, the rest of you have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel in Mexico!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cool100Georgia
Reviews.Content: The workers at the pool are very nice. most of all Julio , Chicken, and Rodrigo. The food is great and I also tried cactus. It was the best thing I have ever tried. The setup of the hotel is awesome. Each night the have the most beatuiful shows,and for holidays they throw big partys. I love this hotel so much that I have come back 8 times. This hotel has really captured my attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Beach Resort in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Galaxian1999
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Gran Porto Resort operated by Real Resorts in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. What can I say. Amazing! The staff and accommodations were five star. The beach was amazing, the best spot in Playa Del Carmen. The food was outstanding and the all-inclusive package made every meal easy, especially for our three boys 12, 10 and 8. I woudl highly recommend this resort to anyone, especially families, looking for the best place beach resort in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! The Gran Porto was perfect for our wedding!”
Reviews.Author: kimmykims
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding on the beach on Feb. 19th and it was just a 'dream come true'! There were 36 of us (family + friends) and everyone truly enjoyed their stay and vowed to return again next year! Most everyone stayed Thurs thru Sun and our wedding was on Friday. I highly recommend that as it gave everyone a day to relax/do their own thing before heading home on Sunday. The food was wonderful (especially the mexican & italian restaurants). There's a room that's open 24/7 with yummy food and drinks (non-alcoholic & alcoholic). The hotel staff was SO friendly! Our wedding planners were GREAT, a big thank you to Zulma, Denys, & Eduardo! We had a 'beach reception' the night before our wedding (Thurs night) and it was gorgeous, they put out the white covered chairs in a heart shape w/ a full bar, beautiful tropical plants, torches and a great music set-up. Our wedding was just what we'd wanted, very romantic and warm. Our photographer was fantastic, Cesar Rioja, 'highly' recommend him! We also loved our minister, Gabriela Joublanc, she was so warm-hearted and funny, she really added something to our ceremony. We also made iPod/iPhone mixes for all our events (reception the night before, ceremony, wedding reception, etc. - it worked out great just to plug ours or our friends iPod/iPhones into their speaker systems, loved that!) We got married at the Gran Porto because we had kids in our group and then we switched hotels and moved to the sister all-adults resort next door (The Royal, Playa del Carmen) on Sunday for a mini-honeymoon, it worked out PERFECT! If you are having your wedding at the Gran Porto, give your guests the option of staying at The Royal next door (it's nicer and adults only), they can come over to the Gran Porto anytime they want to hang out or eat. I'll also post a review of The Royal. The Gran Porto just redid their beach and it was 'really' nice, the kids were finding tons of great seashells. I could go on an on, if you have any specific questions, feel free to contact me, I'd be glad to help in any way I can... (For some reason, I'm not able to upload any of our professional wedding pics that Cesar took, just let me know if you'd like to see them, I can get you a link to them...)

Reviews.Title: “I love the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Tobysmom08
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Gran Porto Real hotel since 2004, and have always had a fabulous experience. The staff here treat us like we are family, and always more than willing to take care of us, whatever our needs. There is never a frown - everyone does their particular job with a smile. The sports team is constantly trying to encourage guests to participate in the activities, but do not pressure if you choose to just sit back and relax. The beach is beautiful - you can walk in either direction for hours.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC !!!”
Reviews.Author: GayleBob
Reviews.Content: This was our first vist to the eastern side of Mexico. We loved it. We loved the GPR Resort and Spa. Everyone there was wonderful, I wanted to bring them all home ! We'll be back this year in Sept. What a fantastic experience, the Carib, the ocean view from our balcony, the fun, fun, fun at every turn. By the way we're in our sixties. The quests were so interesting, from all over tge world !!

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great trip”
Reviews.Author: NapsSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real was a beautiful resort. All in all it was a great trip. We had 5 parents and 15 kids on their high school senior trip. At first, we were the only spring breakers with teenagers which made us stand out. After a few days, some more groups came in and made us look small. The beach was beautiful with the exception of about 10 fishing boats tied up out in front of our resort. The pool was nice and the guacamole poolside was delicious. The website is a little deceiving that it states a "pool bar". This bar is on the roof at a small pool that doesn't face the beach. Also, there aren't really 8 restaurants. There is a buffet, 2 restaurants (Italian and Mexican), poolside grill, 24 hour snack area, and sushi sometimes by the pool on the roof. The food was great at the Italian restaurant and OK everywhere else. We loved being able to walk to 5th Avenue for shopping and clubs. It felt safe but you will be hounded to buy everything from the locals. The staff was nice at the resort. Loved Jose at the beach. He never let our drinks go empty. When we checked out, we did have some problems. We were accused of breaking a toilet paper holder and charged 500 pesos. There was no sign of any breakage, but the maid had supposedly reported it. Also, there was blood on a washcloth because someone stubbed their toe and used it. We were charged 200 pesos for it. Just beware of every little thing because they check before they let you leave. Also, early in the morning you hear carts for room service wheeling down the hall on the ceramic tile. It is very loud.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mexicolovers10
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutley amazing place! The restaurants were great! Every restaurant we went to on the resort had great food and wonderful servers! Coming from a VERY picky eater that was a huge plus for me! Our room was beautiful and our housekeeper Beatriz was great! She made sure everything was in its place and clean! The beach was also unbeleivable! The sand was white and the ocean was blue! The servers on the beach we will never forget! Pablo and Benito! They made our vacation a vacation! They were so friendly and outgoing and always made us smile! Also they always remembered our names! I could'nt beleive it! We have never had such great service before! They were amazing! Also at the bar in the loby there was a server named Theresa, she also made us laugh everytime we saw her! She has a great sense of humor also! She is so sweet! We honestly cant say anything bad about this place! We loved every minute of everyday we spent there! My husband and I cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation!”
Reviews.Author: kathyMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip here and it was truly fabulous. The hotel staff and food were great! Very clean and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer2694
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay again! Staff was wonderful, weather was great. shopping was fun

Reviews.Title: “Five Diamond Staff and Resort”
Reviews.Author: BurlingtonChica
Reviews.Content: A huge thank you to Lynn and her wonderful staff at the Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa. Words cannot express the incredible service and attention the Porto Real family offers!!! Exceptional details in all aspects have not been missed at this resort. From the time you enter the resort until you leave, the GPR family will more than EXCEED YOUR EXPECTATIONS. A huge thank you to EVERYONE in my GPR family. The Animation/Sports & Entertainment Team are truly the best Team in any resort that I have visited around the world. A huge thank you to Miguel Morales, Julio, Victor, Carlos, Cesar, Paty, Jesus, Eloisa, Rodrigo, Alexandra, Patricia and Veronica. This special Team ensures that you are kept as busy as you want to be and happily entertained during the day; with very special evening shows. The evening shows are a must see. The Food & Beverage Team are outstanding....a huge hug and thank you to Miguel Lopez, Elizar, Edgar, Mirna, Luis Cueves and Pamela for their amazing staff...Miguel, Alex, Alex, Alex, Salvador, Teresa, Benito, Jesus, Jose, Pablo, Elizabeth, Carolina, Hirian, Marco, David, Rolando, Rodrigo, May, Florencio, Ezeaquis, Dion, Samuel, Margarita, Miriam, Sara, Leonardo, Lorenzo, Jamie, Hector, Lorenzo, Jose, Mateo, Jose, Elias, Alex, Sebastian and Fernando. Of course not to forget the wonderful Chefs and their assistants for their wonderful presentation, and five star dining. All restaurants are outstanding with a lot of variety. ALL OF THE FOOD & BEVERAGE TEAM deserves an outstanding award for their professionalism and wonderful service that is truly from the bottom of their hearts. I am very sorry, if I have missed acknowledging anyone...it was not intentional. The family atmosphere and wonderful service at the GPR starts with the Bell Boys, Reception and Security. Hugs and a very, very sincere thank you to...Julio, Freddy, Josue, Tilo, Jordie, Raul, Luis, Enrique, Oyuko, Yorick, Victor Manual, Franko and Juan. I would like to thank Thelma from housekeeping from the bottom of my heart, for the wonderful greeting each morning and for taking such wonderful care of our suite; the beautiful daily towel art and flowers were a nice surprise. Our suite was so clean and sanitized that I did not want to walk on the floor...thank you so very much Thelma!!! Speaking of being spotless and sanitized...all areas of the GPR and extremely clean, and when I say all areas, it is true...the dedication from housekeeping, the gardeners and everyone who is responsible to keeping the GPR beautiful is exceptional...and it truly shows!!!! Last, but certainly not least...I would like to acknowledge the outstanding LIFEGUARDS at the GPR...Rogelio and Alexis. A very, very, very sincere thank you and acknowledgement to you both for taking such pride and great care in your professions. We had a medical incident in our group and I cannot express the professionalism, knowledge and genuine care provided by Alexis and Rogelio. I would also like to acknowledge the wonderful care that was also provided by the Lifeguards from their sister property - The Royal...a huge thank you to Manu and Raffael, along with the care and concern provided by the Doctor and the outstanding Management Team at the Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa. The care and concern provided by all of these wonderful people was outstanding. I have never experienced such professionalism, knowledge, genuine care and concern, as I did during my visit to the GPR. If anyone has not had the opportunity to visit the Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa then you are truly missing out in experiencing a GEM in the Mayan. A very special thank you to Sergio from the Spa for his great massages and facials. All of the Spa therapists are exceptional!!!!! Everyone at this resort will "EXCEED YOUR EXPECTATIONS" and will ensure your visit is "BEYOND YOUR EXPECTATIONS". AGAIN, FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART A VERY, VERY, VERY SINCERE THANK YOU TO EVERYONE IN MY GRAN PORTO REAL FAMILY....TE EXTRAÑO MUCHO, Laura.

Reviews.Title: “Sun Surf Snorkel and bring me another Corona!”
Reviews.Author: Lillimarie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is is the best location ever! The beach is literally outside your door, the employees are helpful, courteous, and plentiful, and 5th avenue is a block away! If you walk up the beach one way you end up at the Blue Parrot and all the party bars and clubs, the other way leads you to Mamita's Beach and unbelievable beaches. I have stayed twice for 7-9 day stretches and have not one complaint to make. The rooms are all very nice, but I always request the beach side, private palapa first floor rooms. I plan on returning in June once more but I may try another type room--perhap 2nd floor overlooking the main drag to 5th avenue! LOVE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel away from Cancun craziness”
Reviews.Author: Jaxfan
Reviews.Content: We're pretty much hooked on the Yucatan Peninsula and Cancun but decided to give Playa Del Carmen a try. It's been over a year since we've been to this hotel but still wanted to write about it. Seems with most hotels in Mexico, once you get past the front counter, the rest of the time is very relaxing. Our original room was scheduled to be ocean view. We decided to upgrade to ocean front. The first night they put us on the first floor so we had no view of ocean. They re-located us the second night, unfortunately it was right above the kitchen so our alarm clock came about 4am every morning. We just wanted to settle in so we dealt with the noise after that. The room was still very nice and spacious for a family of four. If you get away fron the kitchen, it would be very relaxing. Now that that's out of the way, the rest of our stay was awesome! The weather was actually sunnier than the other two times we went to Cancun. I realize Cancun has a new beach but Gran Porto has an area similar to a small wave machine great for young children getting over their fears of the ocean with a huge sand area for walking and exploring. We saw some beautiful private yatches and a boat that reminded me of the Star of India that would anchor overnight. It was pretty cool to see these vessels lite up at night. Our first night, we were served by Isreal and Majuheal. If he's still there, have Mahujeal make you a spider, grasshopper, cricket, or balloon animal. You will be impressed by his talent to make something out of nothing you'd never expect. We had to visit Mahujeal almost every night just to see what he came up with next. Isreal is very cordial and greated us (by name) with a smile every time we saw him whether we were eating there or not. Our poolside server was Jose most of the time. I don't think I ever saw him without a smile. He kept our family entertained and worked hard to keep everyone he served happy and laughing. The resort was very quite. Unlike Cancun hotels, you didn't have to rush to the pool to get a spot before they're gone. Most of the time the pool and beach areas were barely half full giving us plenty of room to have privacy if desired. They also have a swim up bar on second floor but was a little too cold to enjoy since it was on the shade side of hotel. It does have real cool windows underneath where we were able to get pictures of our kids under water similar to a fish tank. For some reason, there were many different nationalities represented there, I don't know if it is common but it sure is fun. It was a lot of fun trying to figure out where they were from when you'd hear another dialect. We meet some great people from Finland. Luckily they spoke better English than we spoke Finnish. It was nice to talk to other nationalities and learn about their culture rather than talk to Americans most of the time in Cancun. I love America but really enjoy learning about other countries. The food was good but by the end of the trip it started tasting the same and the drinks weren't as strong as other visits to Cancun but they were still good. It's definately not about the drinking with us anyway. Kind've eliminates seeing a lot of drunks which is nice for families, too. Sometimes, the pool gets too crowded in Cancun for kids our age to enjoy. The entertainment staff was very friendly and worked extremely hard. The activities are similar to the other resorts but not as crowded. We didn't do any siteseeing this trip but understand it's a pretty easy daytrip to many areas. I believe Cozumel is a 45 minute fairy ride away. The Royal (adult resort) is right across the street and looked very nice. Unfortunately, no kids period. We thought we'd take a peak with our kids and were turned away at the entry. We got to go over without the kids for a few minutes one day, looked very relaxing. The flee market or 5th street (I believe) is right up the street. Fun for a while but a typical flee market. Buyer Beware! If you're looking for some place to stretch out and relax without the crowds, this is the place to go. Your kids will be safe, which helps parents relax more. Just make sure to stay away from the room over the kitchen. We will probably go back but still enjoy Cancun. Had a hard time deciding between Cancun and Playa this year but decided on Cancun. We probaly be back to Playa next year.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley the best holiday we have had!”
Reviews.Author: sookie75
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 7 day stay at the Gran Porto Real, and it was truly wonderful. This hotel has the best staff I have ever encountered, From the time we checked in to the time we left we were treated extremely well. I had checked on trip advisor before we left and was worried as all the comments were not all positive, but we found everything to exceed our expectations. There were 7 of us in our group, they had our junior ocean front suites ready for us. The rooms were very clean and very nice. Maid service was excellent, and we enjoyed room service on our last morning there, which was also great. We were travelling with our 2 children ages 8 and 9. Our 9 year old daughter had a great time going to the kids club, and she kept going back because of one very special girl Paty. Our 8 year old son and 12 year old nephew prefered to join in the outdoor activities where he quickly became friends with "Chicken" (Victor) He was wonderful with the 2 boys,and ended up playing board games with them. The beach was beautiful, the pool was the perfect temp. Service for all of the the restaurants was excellent. These folks really love what they do and it shows. The only negative things I have to say about our stay was the noise from the nightclub on the Saturday night that we arrived, and that when I tried to use the payphone with a calling card, I was unseccessfull, even after getting assistance from 3 staff members. They were not going to give up until I was able to reach my contact. They eventually sent a fax, I was not going to pay $4.00 per minute to use the phone in the room. We will definatley be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing time - great value!”
Reviews.Author: harley011
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real Hotel was wonderful - We had a great time - the service, food, drinks, cleanliness and entertainers were great. Also nice because you can walk into town. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: terryamy
Reviews.Content: A group of us went to the Gran Porto Real Resort for our wedding. We couldn't have asked for better. The resort is impeccably clean. Our junior suite was very spacious, quiet, great view of the main street with a bit of ocean. Being so close to the Cozumel Ferry and 5th Avenue was very nice. We would relax on the beach in the morning, and then stroll around Playa del Carmen in the afternoon. I couldn't get over how friendly everyone was, staff and the people staying at the resort. We never had a problem getting enough chairs on the beach, didn't have to go out at 6am to mark a chair with our towel, so that was excellent. Swimming in the ocean was a bit tricky as it's very shallow and lots of rocks. We went to the sister beach for a swim and it was perfect, but you can't use the lounge chairs. Food was great, very different choices which we all enjoyed. Wedding went perfectly, was very relaxed and fun, just as we wanted. Everyone had a wonderful time and we all want to return on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: hamrhed
Reviews.Content: we have visited this facility numerous times. the service and staff has exceed my expectations on every trip. i would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxing vacation with people who soon become friends. The greeting we receive from Arron in the lobby to Luis at the desk, dinning service with Florencio and activities with Julio and the rest of ther staff. I can recommend a visit to this to all looking for a wonderful vacation. thanks for reading, regards Hamrhed

Reviews.Title: “It was the best vacation we've ever had, period.....”
Reviews.Author: djcullings
Reviews.Content: The beaches were perfect, white powdery sand and lots of it. The food was outstanding and we were sure never to miss a meal. The buffet had everything you could imagine and we ate like pigs. We even ate a pig, a rosted one, one evening. Although there are two resteraunts on site we ate at the buffet because their selection was so great. The staff is great and attentive to the point they anticipated our needs. We never waited for service and the service was outstanding. The hotel is just a block from 5th street so walking to shops and activities is easy. Our weather was great which made the experience even better. When we left, and unfortuantely we had to, my wife cried. We stayed 5 nights and six days in a Jr. suite with an ocean front....how amazing. We stayed on the second floor just for security reasons although we never had any problems as the hotel is secure. It's not a question of if we will go back but only a matter of when. We did make a point to be gone before spring break however. We wanted to avoid the kids. We booked our tours after we arrived at the hotel and we planned our trips during the middle of our stay which worked out well. One day on the beach, shopping and relaxing then three days sightseeing which left us one more day on the beach. When shopping the magic work is negotiation. Work for a better price and you'll get it.

Reviews.Title: “a great time on a great beach in a great country”
Reviews.Author: Dewey096
Reviews.Content: The people at the hotel are some of the most gracious that i have ever seen. They constantly do their best to please the people at the hotel, and even on the rare occasions of something messing up or going wrong they will fix it and clean it up in the quickest most efficient manner possible. The staff are enjoyable and vey sociable as they get involved in most of the activities and give great showes durring the night. It is situated in a very unique sector of the town that allows you to get out and around in the mexican city to experience their ways of living with local quizine and shops.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: southtynesidediane
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 15 feb 2010.We checked in on the night time and were just about to get in the lift when a member of staff asked to talk to us about going to see the hotel over the road which was the royal a sister hotel.Basically they were trying to flog us a time share even though they said it wasn't.We had just arrived, so be prepared for this.They also tried to get us the following day to go over again.You get some free gifts as a thank you but they want to see your credit card for proof so that puts you off aswell The room they first put me and my husband was 528 which was a nightmare as we were right below the air conditioning we asked them to move us the following day which they did.Our next room was great as it was next to the pool on the third floor.The jaccuzzi on the roof top is worth going into too as its georgous and warm.The complex was nice but we,ve stayed in better.The food was excellent and you good a good variation of it.The entertainment was pretty good too although it was only on for about an hour each night at 8.30 roughly. Everyone puts towels on the beds to reserve them early in the morning aswell even though you're on the beach,which was beautiful.The only bad thing was it was a little rocky in places as i found out when i tried to go in and you couldn't see where you were putting your feet,one poor bloke got stung by a stingray as it had been washed in with the tide as it had been quite windy,so wear a pair of water shoes.We picked this complex as it was near 5th avenue.Be prepared for the hassle off the shop owners.Loads of shops selling silver jewellery. I'd reccomend going to Chichen Itza.Our guide was called Miguel he was fabulous with all his local knowledge of the place.The trip in the submarine to see the marine life over in Cozummel was amazing too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome staff, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaM62
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the beginning of February at the Gran Porto Real was an awesome experience. The staff was excellent. Everyone from the fron desk (Luis) to the bell staff(Freddie), wait staff, housekeeping were super friendly and accommodating! The hotel rooms were spacious and clean. Spent extra for awesome walkout beach front room and it was well worth it. I even checked my emails every morning on the walk out patio with the free internet. The cabanas were nice the pool area was not too crowded (water aerobics were fun! so was the complimentary bike tour to the mini ruins). The new beach is clean and roomy, and the sand is soft. The food was good aldo but we ate at some of the restaurants on 5th Street also. The location of the hotel is perfect, just a block away from the fun and happening 5th Avenue and a short walk to the ferry to Cozumel. Cozumel is a great day trip. We rented jeeps on the ferry and they were ready when we arrived in Cozumel. We spent the day hopping from one beach bar/restaurant to the next around the island, don't forget Coconuts and Paradice Beach. Xplor was another great day trip. I can't say enough about the staff at the hotel. They were genuinely happy to see us and extremely helpful in making sure our vacation was perfect. By the way we had no trouble at all with time share people bothering us.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EVER”
Reviews.Author: whsweeney
Reviews.Content: we thought barbadoes was nice, this vacation was the the best ever, the cleanliness, service, and friendliness, of the staff, was excellent. when you say inclusive you really mean it, paid for nothing, only the tips. we will be back. wayne & rita sweeney st. albans, vt. 05478

Reviews.Title: “Great two week vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: 16Sunset16
Reviews.Content: Check In No problem, our room was exactly what we had ordered, ocean front - king bed, with hammock on the balcony. We were not offered an upgrade to the Royal. The bellman helped us with our luggage and showed us how everything in the room worked. When we walked in our room, it was exactly like the photos, it was very clean, and smelled good - just like you expect your tropical oasis to smell like. I was pleaseantly surprised to find a walk in closet with plenty of hangers and shelves for storing our clothing. The safe is located in the closet as well and fits a lap top no problem. Our maid Sylvia surprised us every day with beautiful towel art and our room was very well kept. Our room number was 347 and we like to sleep with the patio door open, but we did have problems with the disco from the Blue Parrot music till like 4AM every night, but I think we got used to it after the 3 or 4th night. There were no robes in the room but when I asked for them, they were promtly brought. Food We ate at the Italian twice and both times the food was really good, the problem I had with this place is that it is very loud, I prefer a quiet place for evening meal. They ran out of red wine, on the second night we were there so we never went back. Marie's was great, Salvador explained what everything was and his attention to detail was much appreciated. We ate here four times, and had something different each night, and each night the meal was excellent, from start to finish. Beware of the hot sauce - they serve it on the side and it is HOT!!! This was my favorite place to eat. You have to have a Myan Coffee served here - the show is spectacular - the coffee is soooo good. Buffet - I enjoyed the buffet, things could have been a bit hotter, but that is always the nature for buffets. I liked the different theme nights, and enjoyed trying all new things, thats the great part about all inclusive - you can take a chance on whatever suits your fancy and not worry about not likeing it, just try something else. Great opprotunity to be adventurests here as there were so many choices at every meal. The Italian and Mexican nights were my favorite. We did use room service, but only for breakfast - it wasn't always hot, but it was tasty. Something I did find was that if you wanted something for either room service or in the resteraunts or buffet and you don't see it - ask for it and they will get it for you. No problems. Staff Can't say enough about how hard the wait staff on the beach - kudos ot Pablo - no matter how big the crowd -he gets it done with a big smile. Jose - in the pool bar at night great guy and lots of fun. I wasn't impressed with the lobby bartenders or the wait staff, bad attitudes - and we were tippers every time we went. Pools- We didn't use these much, but the water in the main pool was warm, the water is the 3rd floor pool - so cold you couldn't put your feet in but it was a nice quiet place and the shushi was good although limited to 3 varieties. The top floor hot tub - you need to go at least once for the view at sunset - awesome. Beach There is a good size drop off that could be dangerous for kids, parents have to keep a close eye on them. The beach is rocky, you need to bring your water shoes, but it is warm. Every morning big conk shells wash ashore, its like a treasure hunt every day to find them. I loved it. Here is a tip for Trip Advisor Junkies - if you are in a room that doesn't have a designated beach bed and you want one, there are four that are not numbered. They are located near the bar on the beach - the four beds closest to the pier. Great place for quiet relaxing days. Very comfy way to spend the day. Spa We had a cloudy day but it was warm and we were in and out of the water all day and I didn't apply enough sunscreen and burnt my chest and forehead real bad. I went to the spa for an after sun facial that was so refreshing and cooling and whatever they use helped me heal quickly. First time I had a facial where they give you a hand and foot massage too. Overall I liked this resort a lot, but like other reviews I have read here, I was disappointed in the amount of resturants. What they did have was very good, but still - they should be more honest with thier hotel details. I would go back here though because the wait staff is awesome, the food they did have was very good, the location is great being so close to 5th AVe, the decor is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room on the top floor”
Reviews.Author: juba30
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to this lcation. We stayed Feb. 16 to 25th in a Jr. Grand Suite walk out. Our suite had a reserved palapa on the beach. Unfortunately the reserved palapas are all in the back row so any ocean view is obstructed by the free palapas constructed in front of them. Our room (suite) had a very obstructed view and could best be described as partial ocean with obstructed view. We had no problem at check in and got the style of room that we had requested and paid for. Of course we were immediately offered an opportunity to upgarde but declined. Had we known about the view we would have initially requested a less expensive room on a higher floor and got a better unobstructed view. One thing about the rooms, they are concrete, marble and plaster with no soundproofing so noise echos down the hallways. You may want to take something to dampen the noise for sleeping. Our room had an excellent airconditioner so we ran it to counteract the outside noise. The food was adequate, void of any real flavor. Waitstaff was extremely customer oriented and were willing to please. Beach waiters were excellent but like other people commented, tipping brought them around more frequently. Wife took advantage of the Spa area. The massage was good but the faclities are lacking. Again there was no soundproofing so all conversations between all Spa goers could be heard by all. The Spa like the gym area has a moldy or mildew aroma. I thought the gym was less than adequate and the two weight machines were old and did not work properly. This facility has a staff to keep children entertained and seems to do it with pool activitites and crafts. The beach has been rebuilt from a previous hurricane. There is about a five foot drop to the water so if you travel with small children watch them. In the water it is very rocky so you may want to take someting for your feet to avoid stubbing a toe or maybe cutting a toe on a sharp rock. The shopping area is convenient to the hotel but many or almost all shops now have set prices so deals of the century are a thing of the past. If/when we return to Playa del Carmen we will not stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort Bad Management”
Reviews.Author: funguyupstateNY
Reviews.Content: Our vacation at this resort was about as bad as it gets. Upon arrival we were checked into a room directly over major jack hammering. We asked to be moved to a different room and were told all rooms were booked, but for an extra $50.00 per night we could be moved to an ocean view room. After much negotiating we agreed to pay an additional $30.00 per night for ocean view rooms. ( Our party had 3 rooms) We were then told that part of the beach was closed for restoration. The next morning at 7:00 am we were awakened by the large earth moving equipment operating directly outside our room. The equipment operated daily from 7:00am until 8:00 pm. To top it off, the entire beach was closed not just part of it as we were assured during check-in. To help make up for our inconvenience, the front desk management at check-in had agreed to give us $30.00 per room credit to use in the gift shop. The only problem was, despite asking for it repeatedly, we never received the credit! This was their standard operating procedure and we watched the same thing happen to many people as they checked in. Some were transferred to another resort in Cancun. When we asked for a credit to be applied to our credit card, we were told that they never refund money for any reason. This is a nice resort ruined by management! We will never stay at another Real Resort !

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but false advertising about restaurants”
Reviews.Author: mrniceguy333
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at Gran Porto Real from Feb 6 to 20. This was our 5th trip to Riviera Maya but our first at this resort. We thought we would try this resort because it was right in Playa del Carmen. The ads on the company website and Westjet Vacations stated there were 8 restaurants. The number of restaurants is one of our first considerations in choosing an all inclusive resort. We would have preferred an all adults resort but thought that this sounded great. On our first morning there, at the welcome (sales pitch) meeting, I was shocked to learn that there are really only 3 restaurants on the property. The two a la carte restraunts were good. The buffet restaurant was fine. There were no other restaurants. They claim that a self serve stand of hamburger patties (half cooked) and wieners outside the buffet restaurant next to the pool is a restaurant. Not by my definition of "restaurant". The claimed "healthy bar" restaurant consists ot 2 plates of sushi at a bar. That is not a restaurant. The other restaurant was apparantly a beach restaurant which has not been there since the hurricane 4 or 5 years ago. Room service apparently is also considered a restaurant. The 8th "restaurant" consists of the 3 tables outside of the pool bar (even though you cannot order any food at these tables). When I expressed our concerns about this to the sales people and the concierge, I was asked to write a letter outlining my concerns and assured that I would hear back by the next day. I did a letter and to date no one has even acknowledged my letter. I suppose we should consider ourselves lucky at our room allocation. We reserved an ocean front room and used the online bookin in advance and got the room we ordered. From what we heard from other guests, from hearing complaints at the front desk and some of the reviews on tripadvisor, many others seem to have had problems getting the room types they reserved. Our room was very nice. It was large, the view was terrific. Maid service was excellent. Servers on the beach and in the restaurants were excellent for the most part. My compliments to the omlette lady (sorry I didnt get her name). There were some problems with construction and repair noise but not bad on our part of the hotel. The main construction was on the other side of the hotel. Spa staff was very good. We enjoyed the fitness room although it could use some new equipment. Overall the hotel is good. We paid a premium price for the ocean front room and feel that was worth it. Our only real complaint is that the listings misrepresent the hotel by stating it has 8 restaurants when it only has 3. False advertising.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChantalMarks
Reviews.Content: Food was amazing, drinks were aplenty, actual bottles of liquor in your room as part of all-inclusive feature, beautiful room, great pool, kids had a great time and walkable to downtown shopping strip!

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Ktown_girl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Royal 3 yrs ago and had a awesome vacation. We planned a vacation with friends this yr. and because of the price increase we had to choose The Gran Porto Real instead. We flew with Air Canada and used Cancun Valet for a private transfer. We all used the online check in with 3 couples in Oceanfront and 2 couples in a Jr. Suite. Check in is suppose to be smooth when you do this which is a joke. The 2 rooms in the Jr. Suite catagory were offered a upgrade for $30.00 a day p.p. They said no thank you and got 2 rooms over the building construction. If jackhammers and banging all day works for you book a Jr. Suite. They went back to the front desk to request a room change and they just kept saying no even when one room had no hot water.After the 3rd time a new Supervisor was on duty and he gave them a free upgrade to a oceanview room. We couldn't get our Oceanfront room that we paid for and booked with the online check in because they didn't have any. They gave us a Family suite overlooking the pier with a king size bed and bunk beds with 2 balconys. It was a nice room but they said we had to get out the next day as a family was coming in. We had to go back in the morning to see what room we could get. They put us in room 227 but we couldn't get in till 4:00PM because someone was sick in there and wouldn't get out. :-0 We had to get out of the family suite so they could clean it so we basically had no room for half a day. Thank God we had our friends so we could put our things in their room. They also moved our other friends with the Oceanfront so we could all be together. We thought that was very nice until there door broke. They couldn't get out from the inside of the room. Three rooms had to have someone come and reset the safe with them coming to our room twice. I have to give credit to the maids as they did an amazing job. The room smelled of bleach which made me happy. Two of our friends got really sick for one day but we aren't sure what happened there. We did Xplore the day before and it was lots of fun. 5th Ave is so close we loved that. We went to watch the hockey game one night with both the end zone and tequila barrel having a full house. There was alot of Canadians showing their Country pride. The Canada/U.S game we watched at Legends. It is off 5th and had a nice patio with a T.V facing out. It was a great place to watch the game with a full house also. Everything is in walking distance and that is the best thing about this resort. Out of ten of us 0 liked the food. The beach service is very good and both Benito and Pablo work very hard to please everyone. They have security on the beach 24 hrs. I know you can't compare a 4* to a 5* but The Gran Porto Real dosn't come close to the Royal in all aspects. We won't be back. If you want to spend your vacation arguing to get what you pay for book this resort. We saw it happen alot.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Even Better Than The First!!”
Reviews.Author: MabelRye
Reviews.Content: We visted this hotel for the first time February 2009 and absolutely loved it so we were a little concerned we had buit it up in our memory and our 2nd trip would not measure up. We were wrong! We had a wonderful vacation. The staff are fantastic - Pablo even remembered us from last year. All of them are very friendly and willing to help. We had no issue with the "sales pitch" at all - we said no and they let it go at that.The food is great everywhere. The beer was good and cold - do you need much more! They make the best mojitos as well.The new beach is wonderful. Last year we didn't do much walking along the beach but we did everyday this year and discovered some cool little beach bars along the way.The addition of the cabanas was great. We had a beachfront walkout so this was included with our room which was great. The room was as nice as we remembered it. I don't think i can say enough about this hotel. We are looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Familly trip”
Reviews.Author: mfgrazier
Reviews.Content: Good service. Nice staff. We had a great time. We've stayed here before and we'll be back in later years.

Reviews.Title: “Great wedding on the beach”
Reviews.Author: nateandjojo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has construction going, so as long as you make sure your room is on the beach side you'll be okay. Our wedding went very well, but I personalyl didn't think the wedding coordinators did a very good job. I certainly do not like destination weddings.com, they are a scam. If you have traveled anywhere or done anything, don't use them. Gran Porto Real waiting staff were AMAZING! The hotel was pretty cool, but if you don't have kids and can afford a bit more, GO TO THE ROYAL across the street, it was better. Food was okay, but it got old. The Italian place was the best.

Reviews.Title: “cool place to chill out”
Reviews.Author: 13vidaa
Reviews.Content: the hotel is full of many activitys and things to keep your interest. the shows at night are very entertaining and the live band is great. the computer room is awsome with plenty of great food and drinks. All the people working at the hotel are very kind and always have a smile like Carlos. The location on fifth ave is perfect for a walk after dinner with plenty of life and fun. It is also not far from many of the mayan sights and incredible natural waterholes. Its gym i small but has all the equipment you need for a run of full body work out. The mexican resterant contains the many flavors of mexico. the morning buffet has a wide spread of foods and great coffee. the hotel itself is very mexican in its architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasMoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Porto Real Feb 9 - 16, 2010. This was our 14th vacation to an AI resort in the Cancun/Playa area and this trip far surpassed all previous trips. Think we have found the perfect place to return to! We upgraded to an oceanfront suite at time of booking--well worth the additional cost. Our room and balcony view were so fantastic we hated to leave the room. Thought the food, overall, to be above average basis other resorts we have been to. We took advantage of room service for several breakfasts and one dinner. Each time food and service was excellent. Benito and Pablo kept us well-supplied at the beach/pool. The weather could have been better, but that was beyond the hotel's control....we plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again-Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: m_miller20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our daughter and niece to the Gran Porto Real from December 18th to Christmas Day 2009. Everything started off great, plane ride great, arrived at the hotel, had a glass of champagne and then found out they didn't have our ocean view room we reserved. After waiting for 2 or more hours in the lobby and traveling since 3am we just wanted a room, they put us in a garden view suite which actually faced the street and was above the kids play area. No garden at all. The whole inside of the patio was full of bugs which I had to kill, they must have had the window open for days, one of our beds had hair in it and we had 1 coffee cup and no coffee. Nice room huh.They told us that was an ocean view room, my husband said "What is your idea of an ocean view anyway?" To make a loooooong and horrible story shorter, we were told the hotel over booked (not our fault and don't want to hear excuses) and we were to come down to the desk each morning between 11 and noon to see if they had a room for us. We did not get into a different room until Monday night at dinner time! We got there the Friday before. When things go wrong you are supposed to be able to go to your Worry Free representative because that is who we used, she did absolutely NOTHING for us! My husband and I had to fight for the first four days of our vacation to get the actual room we paid for. We were unable to take the girls on any tours because we had to keep checking with the front desk to see if they had a room or not. Funny how they don't know "IF" they have a room or not. I will NEVER use Worry Free again so keep this in mind people, nor will I ever stay at the Gran Porto Real. I have worked in Hotels for 14 years and I have never seen such a cluster of people who did not know what the h*** they were doing, OR did they ever once try to compensate for the problem that was their fault! I really do not have anything good to say about the place either, it was nothing to brag about, the only good restaurant was the Italian one up the street, food not impressive or very good. The beach was terrible and rocky and fullof sea weed crap so we went to the Real sister property next door every day and used the beach over there. The pools were cold and the oneon the roof never had anyone in it the whole week we were there because of the cold temperature. The hot tub on the roof was only luke warm like bath water, it should have been 100-104 degrees. The staff needs a good round of customer service training and how to treat their customers rather than hiding in the back office to avoid us. I am a firm believer in you get what you pay for but for $5000.00 this was an absolute joke. NEVER AGAIN. Feel free to contact me if you are wanting more information on this property, I am nothing but honest and would hate to see anyone go through what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around – Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: luvz2travl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at the Gran Porto Real. Our first trip was in 2005, and we were amazed by our beautiful room, the beach, the location of the resort, and an amazing 5th Avenue just steps from the resort. We had the same expectations for this trip. Of course the location is still perfect, and the newly-restored beach is great, but we were greatly disappointed by our room experience. Just like on our first trip, we reserved a jr suite – ocean view, and paid over $400 per night. This time, our room (#313) turned out to be hidden in the elevator alcove, and was tiny –we are certain it was originally intended to be a storage room. Our "ocean view" faced the street, although if you went all the way out to the edge of the tiny balcony and looked sharply to the right, you could kind of see the ocean at the end of the street. After a night of listening to guests talking loudly as they waited at our door for the elevator and horns honking on the street below we asked to be moved to a different room. After many "sorry, no" excuses and much determination on our part, we were eventually moved to a room still facing the street (#146), yet much closer to the ocean so that it could at least be considered an "ocean view". The newer room was larger than the closet room (we were told that room 213 is equally tiny), yet nothing compared to the amazing room from our previous visit. Most reviews say the buffet food was great, however we found it to be mediocre and mostly cold. Maybe the challenges with our room dampened our spirit. If you decide to stay at the Gran Porto Real, be advised that the rooms - even within the exact same category - vary greatly. You may be pleasantly surprised or greatly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Central to having Fun”
Reviews.Author: turczi
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa from Jan 30 to Feb. 6, 2010. It was the place to be for the money. Centrally located in Playa made is easy to walk Fifth Avenue for shopping or nightlife, to take the ferry to Cozumel, to partake in any beach activity, including parasailing. Anything you needed was all right there. Met some folks staying at the bigger Riviera Maya gargantuan hotels and they wished they had a smaller and centrally located place like the Gran Porto. Food was good, rooms were spacious, and the waitstaff were very attentive to all your needs. I will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Enjoyeachday2010
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed a week (2/5 - 2/12/2010) at the Gran Porto Real hotel in downtown Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. Based on input from our travel agent & all the information available on the internet, we chose this hotel for this winter's vacation to Mexico. As many otrher reviews stated, the employees here were fabulous & their attention to service with a smile could not have been better. Our ocean view junior suite with balcony was just as advertised. Even though we were on an all-inclusive trip, I intentionally brought along about $45.00 in $1 bills for tipping money - from the young mexican lady that cleanded our room daily, to the waiters at the resteraunts, to the bellboys to the drink servers, etc. Many of the employees have been working at this resort for many years & it shows. A special thanks to: Julio (bellboy), Hilario & Jesus (at the hotel's italain resteraunt), plus Carolina, Benito & Pablo at the pool bar........we hope to see you again in the future. We were blessed with great weather, with highs averaginbg about 78 degrees. The cooler evenings also made the (only two block)walk on Playa's 5th avenue both comfortable & memorable. Lastly, even though my wife & I are barely seniors, we enjoyed the variety of people we met from the US, Canada, Sweden & western europe. Most of the "children" at the hotel were babies or less than 10 tears of age. If you want an adult only, go to the Royal (next door), otherwise pick a gem & make the Gran Porto Real your home away from home & have a blast!!!!!ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip to Mexico so far.”
Reviews.Author: wes101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from Feb 4-11, and with all the news of recent construction going on there, we were a little nervous as to what we were getting ourselves into, but within minutes of arriving at this property we realized there was very little to worry about. Rooms: We upgraded to the Oceanfront suite, which was very spacious and had a king size bed. The bathroom was also very nice, with a large walk in shower, and a large sink area. The suite also came with a DVD player, an Ipod dock and a 30" LCD TV. The room also has a fridge stocked with water, pop and beer( which got restocked every morning) as well as a stocked bar. The upgrade to the oceanview or oceanfront suite is definetly worth it! Beach: Recent beach restoration in the area has added up to 50 to 60 feet of beach at this resort, meaning there is always space to get your feet in the sand. Service: The service at this resort is absolutely amazing. The waiting staff at the beach/pool area are very friendly, especially Pablo and Jesus. Room service was also quick and very friendly as well. Housekeeping: The housekeeping staff are very accomodating. We were travelling with our 2 yr old daughter, whose naptime seemed to coincide with the cleaning schedule for our room, but our housekeeper would always skip our room until naptime was over and promptly return to clean our room. Activities: The nightly entertainment was held outdoors most nights, as long as the weather held up. This added a lot to the experience. The activity staff were always by the pool encouraging people to play volleyball or dance lessons etc. but were never pushy about it. The Kid's Club was very good for kids 4 and up. Kids under 4 were allowed in, but had to be supervised by an adult. Food: With this resort being a smaller resort, I wasn't expecting a lot from the buffet. Breakfast was always pretty standard, fresh omelette, eggs, bacon etc. and lots of fruit, but nothing that really took my breath away. Lunch at the buffet was about the same, so most of the time we just went to the poolside snack bar for burgers, hot dogs, nachos etc. which didn't dissapoint. Dinner at the buffet was hit and miss, one night was really good, the next was not. The Italian a la carte was pretty good, with unique presentation and very good taste. I recommend the caprese salad, the beef steak with green pepper sauce, the canneloni, and the salmon, which were all quite good. The Mexican a la carte was also quite good, but a little on the spicy side. Still a very good restaraunt though. Overall: I would certainly recommend this property to anyone travelling with children, the spacious beach and great pool area, combined with the kind staff at the kid's club make it hard for the kids to run out of things to do. This resort is also in a great location for anyone looking to take in the sights and sounds of 5th avenue. A 2 minute walk takes you to the heart of the shopping/restaraunt district. This was my 4th trip to Mexico, and probably the first resort that I would honestly return to.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel,great employees”
Reviews.Author: dakotaColorado
Reviews.Content: Stay for at least a week to enjoy all the amenites, the beach is great ,the employees go out there way to be accomadating, the location is excellent every time we go there we look foward to returning next year. the attmosphere is also very charming.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: jennytollie
Reviews.Content: Best steak ever at the Italian restaurant, which didn't require reservations! The atmosphere was welcoming and casual, which made relaxing very easy. The buffets were so good we didn't get to the al a cartes until the 4th evening, and I'm not a big fan of buffets! The buffet lover in the group had such a good steak at the Italian we returned the following night! I loved the guacamole and pico de gillo and had it for lunch everyday at the pool snack bar. When we arrived our rooms were right over the construction, Samantha worked her magic and we moved down the hall the next day. The cheapest room category, was just fine for us as we don't spend much time there anyway. We were right in front of the 3rd floor pool and swim up bar, plus close to the hot tub. We really enjoyed the fantastic beach and great beach wait staff! We are seriously considering changing our MO from need new and different things to lets relax where we know we're gonna be treated right!

Reviews.Title: “exceed your expectation”
Reviews.Author: MontrealZorro
Reviews.Content: and that's what they did to my family from every department from the kids club to housekeeping... beautiful memories and I would like to say gracias to : jesus , pablo , teresa ,sara and fuentes.... I cannot mentionned everybody but i wishe could because they made our vacation unforgetable by professionalism and hardworking ethic. gracias

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real = Muy Bien”
Reviews.Author: rdubbs08
Reviews.Content: Overall - great experience! Service was top-notch, beach was breath-taking, cuisine was delish and room was more than enough. The only complaint I would have is that the bed linens were not the softest and I did not get a hammock in my room. Will definitely return and recommend this resort to others!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome 2 weeks at Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Chanel56
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks at the Porto Real, Playa del Carmen, from January 15th to January 29th 2010 and the only negative thing I have to say is "WE HAD TO LEAVE". Spent 2 awesome week with hubby and met up with Manitoba family. We were in a Junior Suite (after a few upgrades, personal preference) and have nothing but good things to say about the hotel. The rooms were soooo spacious, ours was a beach front. The staff are SO hard working, friendly with genuine smiles on their faces. Pleasure to be a part of that. There was beach construction for the 1st week we were there, but did not upset us because the pool was really good. We could have used the beach next door at The Palace but did not need to, we had plenty of good times in the pool. The 2nd week (beach construction terminated) we did manage to go in the Hocean...and did some serious sea shell hunting and enjoyed the waves. We also rented a car and went snorkelling (2nd year we do this) in Akumal...and actually got to swim with the turtles...(well they stayed there, we did the swimming) and saw plenty of fish along the reefs. We had 2 weeks of great weather. The Porto Real is really nicely situated for anyone who wants to go for a walk on 5th avenue at night and see their nite life. Its a 5 minute walk to the Ave....and its fun just to see. We were in Playa del Carmen last year and stayed at the hotel zone and to be honest, I preferred this year because of the access to the 5th....The staff at the hotel were all so nice and friendly, helpful. Benito and Jose kept our drinks replenished at all times and so happy to be around. The servers in the buffet room were all really helpful and the food was very good and plenty. Say hit to Verlain, one of the servers. I was impressed at the cleanliness of the place and the caution the staff took at keeping things clean including their hands..even if it meant waiting in line at the omelette station while they washed their hands...There are 2 specialized restaraunts, one Mexican and one Italian...no reservation required and the food at both were very good...This was a very positive experience and would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling down there. By the way, DO NOT BRING BACK A SINK...when you go there...it will be shattered when you get home... Have a good vacation! and remember, YOU TOO will have to leave

Reviews.Title: “Great staff enthusiasm,amazing food!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Spencers70
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful vacation!!!Rooms were spacious and impeccably clean with a wonderful Mexican flare,even the doors are decorative! Food was excellent and plentiful with flavour and variety that made selection on 1 plate difficult. Snacks were neatly presented sandwiches,fruits,pastries+coffees, the service was quick,discreet and courteous..just like elves. Being walking distance to 5th Ave was great activity for after dinner stroll. The beach has been refurbished and is amazing!! Beach walk for miles,shells are good if you're up early enough. Our one complaint was early morning service truck noise from a back alley that woke us by 5:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with staff, service, food, and location - had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: ECFA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 day stay, and were very pleased with our experience at Gran Porto Real. I knew my vacation had started when I was handed a "welcome" cocktail while I was still standing at the check-in desk with my suitcase!. Very clean and well kept, and the service was excellent - all staff were very friendly and helpful (the maid even arranged little "towel figures" on my bed decorated with fresh flowers).
