The location is great - just a block or so from 5th Avenue shopping district and walking distance to the Cozumel ferry pier. The hotel also has bicycles available for exploring the town, which we enjoyed several times - once guided by hotel staff and later on our own. The newly restored white sand beach is finished and beautiful, with great pool area and activities staff. We always felt very safe - even at night walking on the beach there was hotel staff keeping an eye out for you. We actually loved the buffet! We are fairly picky "health food" eaters (no meat, low salt, low fat, minimally processed, etc), and were worried about healthy restaurant food choices while travelling. We found that the GPR buffet always included a great choice of fresh fruit, vegetables, salads, vegetarian selections, and seafood (as well as plenty of other heartier fare for meat and dessert lovers). We always intended to try the other 2 fancier restaurants, but chose the buffet each time (even on my birthday, when we found they were serving 4 kinds of ceviche!) as we liked the ability to preview and control what and how much went on the plate. We were not travelling with children, but the hotel appears to be very family friendly with lots of kids' activities available. There were also nightly music/dance productions every evening on an outdoor stage set up by the pool, so you really didn't have to leave for entertainment. The onsite travel services with Best Day were very convenient and helpful in arranging any side trip excursions - we arranged day trips to Chichen-Itza, Tulum, Coba, and Rio Secreto - all of which provided pick-up right in front of the hotel. We really had a wonderful time and wouldn't hesitate to return to GPR. Our ONLY (and minor) negative comment would be the fairly persistent time-share/vacation club pitch. Our vacation time was limited, and we really did not want to give up any of it for a sales presentation. We said 'no", but did have to do so several times. It is still a great vacation resort, and we were otherwise very happy with our choice of Gran Porto Real. Excellent service from everyone!

Reviews.Title: “You can find a better place........”
Reviews.Author: Jessica41908
Reviews.Content: The beach was beautiful. The staff was incredible, the area of Playa was neat. Overall it was enjoyable but we won't go back to that hotel. The food in the buffet was so-so. The fruit wasn't ripe and the fruit juices were weak and basic. There were no fruit drinks at any of the bars, just super sugary syrup stuff. The only options for dinner are the buffet (yuck) the Mexican Restaurant, Maria's which was pretty good and the Italian Restaurant which was wonderful! After 5 nights were were sick of alternating between Maria's and Il Pescatore (Italian). The WORST was having the staff constantly try to sell us a timeshare and up-grade to the Royal across the street. The staff caught us in the lobby, they CALLED our room and shived things under our door. Every day that we were there. So basically they were conveying that the Gran Porto Real was a bad choice and they were right. I was truly disappointed in the hotel and the way they handled themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: lkronstadt
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weeks stay at the resort. Got home 1/31/2010. l was very concerned about the construction we read about before we left, however the beach construction was completed by the time we arrived. Our room was in a wing away from the hotel construction, so we had no problems. The beach was wonderful, staff delightful and our stay overall was one of the most enjoyable we've had. We will surely be back. Don't hesitate to give this resort a try, you'll be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Keep coming back for more.”
Reviews.Author: BogeIndiana
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to this resort. Two of the trips included our two teenage kids and this trip was for my husband and I. Our family loves coming here, it is very family oriented with many activities available. The entire staff goes all out to make your stay enjoyable. We especially have enjoyed Benito, Teresa, Jesus, Jose, Pablo and "Chicken Little" for they went out of their way and made us feel at home/special. My advise to you is if you get the opportunity to include the restaurants at their sister resort I would highly suggest it, for it is well worth the extra costs for the additional options for eating out. Like the Asiana, which was excellent! I would also suggest that you not take the "90" min. presentation because it will be more like 120+ mins and a hard core time share pitch. Our guide was very professional and informative but his advisor was a baseball wannabe without the proper manners for sales. Sir, you do not use foul language when you are trying to entice a prospective customer. to buy and no means no. The front staff at this sister resort also seems think that their resort is so much better and was always putting down the Gran Porto Real. Come on, you are in the same family, support the other like the Gran Porto supports you. If you want a beautiful place to stay that is two blocks from the action on 5th St., comfort, fun, beautiful beaches and a very accomodating staff, this is the place to go. I know we will keep coming back for more.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Breanskis
Reviews.Content: I admit the front desk isn't the best experience but if you don't fight with them and then get Gabriel the bell hop to help you get the room you want he will be invaulable to you on this trip! Be sure to see Jose the pool waiter if you want stronger drinks.....I recommend the watermelon magaritas with an extra shot of 100 yr old tequila......it's free and will get your party started....trust me! 10th st. has the happn'in dance clubs...find it as soon as you get there and you'll save time! Coco Bongo is worth it on Tues.get Chicken with the activity club to set you up with a table! Trust me bring your dancing shoes! I'll be back and soon!

Reviews.Title: “In spite of.........the best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ronniecan
Reviews.Content: In spite of the aforementioned construction previously noted in recent reviews, I just returned from my best vacation ever. Just to give readers an update, the massive beach reconstruction appears to be approx 95% complete as of Jan 24 and it looks marvellous! The other construction is the conversion of existing office space into hotel units. This amounted to 12 hour days of jackhammers in stereo beginning at 8:00 am. To be honest it didn't bother me abit because it motivated me to get out of my room to enjoy the delights of Playa del Carmen. It also appears that the noisy construction is over and further inconveniences should be minimal. I could be repetitive to other reviewers and describe my experiences regarding staff, food, hospitality etc....but let me suffice to say that every aspect was exceptional. A couple of random thoughts 1. As I travelled alone, I considered the basic "Standard Room" to be sufficient for my needs. Actually it was. However after a couple of days walking many miles around Playa del Carmen, I would have given my right arm to lie down in a tub. The Standard Room only has a shower. 2. BEWARE....BEWARE...BEWARE. Sorry for the headline but I want all future travellers to Gran Porto Real to understand that after they register at the hotel they will be told that they are to meet one of the Vacation Consultants. (or whatever their official name is). These Consultants are in an open area just off from the Registration area. These Ladies and Gentleman have one purpose and that is to lighten your wallet by $5,000 or more. They are SMOOTH professional high pressure sales people who have the advantage of greeting you after a long stressful flight. Your guard is down....and their Charm is over the top. It is important that you refuse to meet these people.....or perhaps do as I did and tell them that I might see them in a couple of days if I run out of things to do. Another BEWARE.......after I declined their invitation for a breakfast the next day......I was given a special card that would allow me 10% savings at some gift shops. I took the card to get rid of the Consultant but almost flipped when I read the fine print on the back of the card saying that failure to return the card on leaving would result in a $30 charge to my account. 3. A great mixture of folks from around the world and my unscientific evaluation was approx 40% Canadian, 40% American...a smattering of fine Brits and a collection from European countries. Oh yes....there were a few children here and all well behaved. I will be returning again soon to Gran Porto Real and would highly recommend this exceptional resort to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: buckwheatfromalberta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our third stay at the Gran Porto Real and once again it was exceptional. The staff is wonderful and helpful in all parts of this hotel. Anything you wanted they would do their very best to accomdate. Freddy, Elliazar, Sara, Theresa, Carolina, Carlos, Victor,Patricia, Ceasar just to name a few. We stayed in an oceanfront room this time and I highly recommend it. The construction that is taking place along the front of the hotel could not be heard in our room. The beach was under construction while we were there but I just checked the GPR webcam and it looks like it is now open and beautiful. Looking forward to returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “No beach! Noisey!! Construction!!!”
Reviews.Author: grrrr1
Reviews.Content: The entire beach is closed for construction, yet this was never mentioned....not even to the bride! Also the hotel is under construction. All day long starting sometimes shortly after 6am, no matter where you are, all you can here are the jackhammers or chisleing. If you want to lay by the pool you'll notice that about 30 feet away, there are big CAT's running up and down the beach with the wonderful aroma of diesel....Oh, and dont forget that jackhammer in the background. Not only did the hotel not warn anybody of this but they did absolutley nothing to try and make our stay any better. Switching rooms to try and get farther away from the construction was like pulling teeth!! On a good note, the restuarant staff, servers and bartenders were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “No Beach! Lot's of Construction Noise! Check first before coming!”
Reviews.Author: Frzn1
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be a great place in maybe a month or two. The Beach was closed due to reconstruction and you had to walk to an area past the Royal for a beach spot. You are not allowed to use the beach at the Royal even though it's the same company. There is some sort of demolition / construction going on in the front of the hotel that extends from Maria's toward the lobby. Jackhammers and construction noise 12 hours a day , just one floor below where people's rooms are. I was put off by the vacation club sales pitch. Don't waste your precious vacation time for 500 pesos and and some cheap tequila unless you are seriously considering something like that. The service , rooms and food are all excellent ! The pool is ice cold and you can't stand being it very long. The location of the hotel is close enough to town to walk into and far enough away so you don't have to hear the many bars and disco's late into the night. I will definitely come back , but I will be checking into the construction very closely.

Reviews.Title: “NO beach”
Reviews.Author: dnd55
Reviews.Content: Very noisy with beach being closed. massive project if you like the beach you had to go past the Royal next door and sit over there We checked in jan 2 and the beach acces was closed off shortley thereafter If you want to go here and want the beach check with the hotel first to see when they will ge finished

Reviews.Title: “service,service, and more service”
Reviews.Author: WIShamrock
Reviews.Content: How do I begin? Well to start the service at this hotel is outstanding. We have been to many other resorts in and around Playa Del Carmen but none compare in service to the GPR. Freddy, Elliazar, Sara, Theresa, Pablo, Jose, Jose, Miriam, Carolina, Carlos, Victor, Patricia, David, and many more I just can't recall their names did their best to make our vacation wonderful. The beach at the hotel is under renovation by the Mexican Government and soon will be back to the original beach of ten years ago. This is not a problem because you can take a five minute walk and use the Royal's beach. There is wait staff there to bring your drinks to you from the GPR. The only problem is you can't use the Royal's bathrooms. We thought that the Royal being a sister hotel that would be the least they could do for our inconvenience of having no beach at the GPR. But that never happened. The food at Maria's was excellent as was the buffet. The omelets for breakfast were prepared by a nice lady and they were Excellante!!!!!!! We had a oceanfront room, which is in our opinion a must. This was our fourth return visit to the GPR and for good reason. The location, service, great food, and a very good entertainment team. The big question is; Would we return to the GPR? The answer is a big yes, in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value, Great Sevice”
Reviews.Author: Becky33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 9 days, from December 27, 2009 - January 5th, 2010. It is true about the upgrade and the time share pressure upon arrival. We had booked the Gran Master Suite so there was no way to upgrade, though they were upgrading to the Royal if you didn't have children. Also once we said no to the time share bit they didn't bother us at all. The place is spotless. They are always cleaning and the staff are the best around. Very kind and willing to do anything for you. Jesus at the pool bar never lets your drink get empty. He is outstanding. We brought lots of US $1.00 bills for tipping. The food at both the Mexican and Italian restaurant was great. We never had a bad meal at either. The buffet for breakfast had a huge selection but the dinner was limited. We only had one dinner at the buffet. The kids club was outstanding. All the girls in there seem to really want to be there. We had a hard time dragging our 6 year old son out of the club. The beach is not great, but as we were leaving they had removed all the sandbags and are working to correct the problem. The beach in front of the royal is a 5 minute walk and is beautiful. The pool is very cold and even on the hottest day it is difficult to get in. The activities staff work really hard to get people to participate and they seem to have a lot of fun for both kids and adults. This is not the type of hotel we would normally stay in but with the location and having the suite we thought we would try it. We would probably not return only because I think once is enough at a place like this. There were many partying teenagers/ young adults and it had that vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler41
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property twice now. It has a lot of things that are really good about it, and a few that are less so. Our daughter, who is seven, absolutely LOVES the Kids' Club, and the young women who work there are very nice. I would say that all of the people who work in service are very nice and genuinely try to make everyone's stay enjoyable. There are some things that go on at the front desk about providng "upgrades" that are nothing more than attempts to upsell -- but that is the nature of this type pf peppery. If what you want is a sophiaticated, sleek hotel with five star service, you are going to the wrong place. Go to the Banyan Tree. If what you want is a nice place for a young family at a reasonable price, you should consider this hotel -- especially if being able to walk to the commerial area on Quinta is important to you. One thing to consider right now is the status of the beach. According to the information we received, the beach on front of the hotel will be closed in varying degrees as beach work mandated by the federal government is undertaken. The hotel did a good job of trying to maximize the part of the beach that was still open, and it offered people the ability to move to its property in Cancun free of charge. The hotel in Cancun is not as nice, in my opinion, but it does have a large beach.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: libelluleGeorgianBay
Reviews.Content: My first encounter with the hotel reception was very bad therefore I was left with a bad taste about the place;I spent at least 2+ hours upon arrival at the hotel reception explaining to numerous employees, ?Yennifer, a supervisor Raoul and Manager, Carlos that I had paid for a oceanview Jr Suite for myself and my 3 daughters.The Grand Porto had me booked for 3 persons only and had me staying in a standard room. We showed them the invoices etc via my daughter's laptop that she had taken with us.They phoned the Air Canda rep (Caroline)which I found out afterwards from her and she explained that I had paid for 4 persons in a Ocean view Jr Suite...but the reception never informed me that they had called her however they tried unsuccessfully to tell me that Grand Porto had not been paid for 4 persons to stay nor had they been paid for a Ocean view Jr suite. I showed them my visa bill online. They gave me a big runaround indicating that even though I had paid for a room with 2 double beds, I was only guaranteed a room when I booked a Air Canada vacation so initially we were sent to a room with 1 King size bed for 4 persons ( myself and 3 daughters) When I complained they said they would send me 2 cots. I paid too much money for 2 of my daughters to sleep on cots all week. The reception kept saying they had no other rooms in the Hotel...What a mess!!! and I was humiliated in front of other guests that came to the reception area. reservations were needed to eat at the regular dining room that night New Year's eve which no one informed us about even at the reception upon arrival. The reception staff kept speaking Spanish to each other about our situation which did not include us. I was finally given a room ( isn't it amazing that a Ocean view Jr suite was made available for me and my daughters after 2+ hours in a hotel reception lobby on New Year's eve.) I don't know why it's called ocean view because my view was of the Royal Hotel across the street and the ocean view is available once you look out from the balcony to the right. The ocean in front of the Grand Porto is very rocky so water shoes hightly recommended. I had some friends who were staying in a condo nearby and they are not permitted on the beach in front of the Grand Porto nor were they allowed in the hotel. My friends and I were allowed to on the beach all together in front of beach at the Royal. The Royal across the street allows guests to stay there over 16 yrs of age and older ONLY.The guests at the Royal are allowed to use the facilities and restaurants at the Grand Porto but not vice a versa. I found out that it was cheaper to book excursions on line (before leaving home)than it was via the hotel. The waiters on the beach ( example: Benito) do not ask you if you would like a drink if you do not tip them all the time. This trip was very expensive for us and I would like to think that we should be able to receive service without tipping all the time.

Reviews.Title: “lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: mexicotrip0910
Reviews.Content: really seems like a 5 star hotel, new years party was very good, and VERY hot, and food takes a little long.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: ORCon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Playa on Dec. 16. We took the ADO bus from the airport then put our luggage on the street bike and had a fun ride to the hotel. When we arrived our friends were waiting in the lobby. They had come the day before. They had booked flight & hotel through realresorts.com and had a jr. suite booked for less than us booking our air ourselves and using hotels.com. We only had a standard room. The friends upgraded to the Royal for free. Since we just had the standard room they wanted another $80 night to move to the Royal. We said no. Our room was #422 right by the 3rd floor pool and sushi bar. The room was just standard - nothing fancy. In fact it looked like a motel 6 room. The shared patio was fine and only a few steps from the pool. The workout room was just down the winding stairs. The Mexican and Italian restaurants were right there also. I had been told on tripadvisor that for a week we could only eat at the ala carte restaurants 3 times. Not so. No reservations required. Just show up anytime. The Italian was great. The Mexican reataurant was good also. Our friends had to come to Gran Porto to eat with us. We could have eaten at the Royal Asian restaurant with them but would have had to pay for 50% of it. We did enjoy using the Royal's tennis court on their roof (grass court). Just had to make a reservation. We enjoyed our stay overall. The buffet was great for breakfast. We didn't like it for dinner. The other two restaurants were much better. The room was cleaned late the first day then during the morning hours the rest of our stay. Except for the show at night out by the big pool, I did not see a lot of night life here. The shows were just okay. The pool water was not warm at all. I found the ocean water much warmer. We would sit to the far side close to the pier by the swing bar. That way we could get drinks then cross over to the Royal side to go in the ocean. The ocean in front of the Gran Porto was way too rocky. We loved the food service out by the ocean. The guacamole and chips, hamburgers etc. were great. Drinks were good also. We took the kyaks out once - that was fun. The weather wasn't very warm the first part of the week - warmed up on the 22nd. Security guards were noisy a few times while trying to sleep talking on their radios. I'd consider staying here again, but if upgrading was considered I'd definitely book a jr. suite.

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair accessible”
Reviews.Author: TorontoFatcat
Reviews.Content: I recently had a look at Gran Porto real to see if it is wheelchair accessible. Since I'm not in a wheelchair I can only say that it looks acceptable. It has a ramp from street level no obvious barriers on the leading to the accessible unit I was shown. I don't know about beach access but there is a bar and pool area close to the waters edge. I took a few photos that I will try to attach.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: NAmericanTraveler
Reviews.Content: We went to the Gran Porto Real as an entire family and had a great time. Our ages ranged from 5-60 and everyone was entertained whether by the water arobics during the day, the entertaining shows at night, or by making bracelets in the kid's club. The food was fabulous and it was never a problem to get into the a la carte dinners. The resort is smaller, with only one main pool, but it was perfect for our family holiday. We could keep track of the kids easily, and the adults had a great time too. Maria, Benito, and Pablo keep the drinks flowing during the day, and the bartenders keep it going at night. We especially enjoyed getting to know the waiters/waitresses because they were so friendly. I would go back again at any time!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Is Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: THEONLYMRSHOLLYWOOD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 7th or 8th time at GPR, we were there for 10 days to celebrate our 11 year Wedding Anniversary. We were just there in May for 10 days also. This hotel is the greatest hotel ever!! The Staff is THE BEST EVER! We are as always treated like Royalty there, everything is perfect, beautiful room, amazing food (we have had many "special" meals prepared for us) and everyone goes above and beyond to exceed our expectations, we are constantly suprised with the wonderful level of service the staff provides to us each time. Our Anniversary dinner there at Maria's was AWESOME! The staff at Marias were bringing out suprises left and right. The location of the hotel is perfect too, you can walk pretty much anywhere you want. We can't wait to go back, hopfully in May again :-) We would like to mention some of the AMAZING STAFF: Felipe (3rd floor bartender & great friend), Luis (bar mgr.), Rene (chef), Jose-Benito-Teresa - Miram (beach waiters), Miguel-David-Jose (bartenders), Cinthya & Lynn (reservations), Carlos & Nicholas (reservations), Elizar (Captain) and everyone else at GPR you are all the most friendly and wonderful people we have ever had the pleasure to meet and become great friends with. Keep up the good work and we hope to see you all very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort and location... only drawback is rocky beach”
Reviews.Author: harshu
Reviews.Content: Really wonderful all inclusive resort with great staff, services, food, activities and location close to 5th ave, the heart of playa del carmen! excellent sports and entertainment activities. only problem here is the rocky beach.... but walk 100 yards to the left or right and the beach is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “We won't go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: loverofsunTexas
Reviews.Content: We had been going to Mexico for the last 8 years at Thanksgiving & finally found our favorite place. We liked the Iberostar Quetzal very much & had been there 3 of the 8 times but thought we'd always try different all-inclusive resorts. The first highlight was you can check in on-line, so that saved time when we got there. We had a beachfront walk-out room for the 3 of us and it was great. When we got there we were sitting on our patio & the beach bar tender came up to us and offered us drinks. I knew we were going to like it there. The beach wait staff is wonderful, always ready to serve. Our favorite was Pablo. Everyone is very helpful. The meals were great. We found at other places you could only use the specialty restaurants 1 0r 2 nights for dinner depending on how long you were staying & always had to make reservations in the morning. This was the best. No reservations to any restaurant, just go to the italian or Mexican anytime. Also with the walk-out room you could use the restaurants at the Royal across the street. We ate in the seafood restaurant at the Royal & both specialty rest. at the Real. Very good & great service in all. We always walked right in because we are early eaters. We got there about 7. We did see some lines when we were leaving about 8:30. The shows are okay, not great. We loved Sarah, in the lobby bar. Very sweet. Also being right in town is a nice thing. Getting to 5th Ave in less than 5 min. is nice. We will definately go back. We also paid less than than some other places. My travel agent recommended it (yes, I use a travel agent). Her price was less than the online price. There are sandbags on the beach, but there aren't near as many rocks as some other places we've been to. I love swimming in the ocean. The water was great. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: LanaH1
Reviews.Content: We were told by travel agent about this hotel-it was all inclusive-enjoyed the hotel's buffets & they had 2 other nearby restaurants you could also eat at. had nice pools, swim up bar, nice beach outside, service was pretty good @ the hotel. The only things I was disappointed in was-we had to go thru condo selling high pressure-thing that man approached us about @ the hotel-gave up hour of our time for free beach bag & beach massage free certificate-we already had one booked later that day & was able to get the free massage. It was also lots of noisy roof construction going on outside above our room when we tried to have romance or sleeping. And, people keep approaching you in lobby-hotel staff-to get $ from you to sign you up for the tourist tours-which we did take & enjoy the tours but it's hassle being approached all the time especially when we were on our way out of the hotel for meeting up with the tours or shopping/walking the down after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast at this resort.!!”
Reviews.Author: Dulcey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from Nov 12 to the 22. Hotel was beautiful, lots of room in are room. We were suppose to have two queens in are room but ended up with one king bed. There was four of us, my Husband and two boys age 10 and 12. The 10 year old just slept with us and they brought in a cot for my 12 year old witch worked out well. They would of moved us to a different room but they would not have been ocean front. The staff in this place is amazing they really make you feel at home. Miss Jesus, Theresa, Alex in the lobby and Jamie at the swing bar, you people are really great. O I can't forget Rodrego the guy who works at the desk for the teen club, my boys had a blast with him he played countless hours of ping pong with them as well. The entertainment staff is first rate. If you go make sure you do the bike tour and then take the bikes out on your own for free to really see PDC we did this several times. Went in the the not so nice part of town for the kids to see and have a real eye opener. The last day before we left we took toys and all the beach toys we didn't want to take and gave them away to the kids over there, it was a great thing for the kids to do. We visited Tulum and Xel-ha, they were both great. We did the tour though the hotel. Found it really rushed. Next time we would go on our own. We rented a boat and a captain and a snorkel guide from the guys just on the beach. This was a lot of fun for $200 5 of us fished for three hours and snorkeled with a guide for about an hour. The sides along the coast were beautiful.. Coco Bongo's a new night club is wild but lots of fun as well. The food at the hotel is ok, we got tired of it in the end. The Italian restaurant is was really good we ate there about three times. Maria's we didn't care for. The Main buffet Had great breakfast and lunch, but some of the suppers weren't so good.. We wald down the beach and ate at the fusion and took in the fire show that was cool kids liked that. Also down the beach is a restaurant called Wickey, they have the best burgers. Try the Wicked burger. I still dream about it it was amazing. The only thing we didn't like about the hotel is they cleaned are room so late, like 4 -5 in the evening some days, and the people in the lobby trying to get you to do the Royal breakfast. Which we did get roped into doing for the free t-shirt, wrap, bag and $75 dollars to use in the hotel. They were real friendly to you to try and get you to do the breakfast but once you go and don't buy in their not so friendly anymore. This hotel could do away with this. The night entertainment wasn't the best some evening either. All in all are family had a great stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “overall good”
Reviews.Author: loco29
Reviews.Content: every thing about the hotel was good. the staff at the hotel were fantastic and very friendly. the only negative was the beach around the hotel it was good for small children and thats it. the beach was sand bagged at the water and the water was too shallow. on the plus side you could walk to the other side of the pier and use the beach in front of the royal and that beach if perfect! the hotel is also beside a group of boats that will take you fishing and snorkling with sea turtles. the hotel was also very close to 5th ave which is a very long street for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: joejoe5
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from the Playa Del Carmen, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa. My sister held a wedding there which was the purpose of our visit. The Hotel staff we wonderful and it is by far the best experience we have had as a family on vacation. We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Home-Best Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: tb_blue
Reviews.Content: We just spent 11 wonderful days at "Our second home". This was our 5th time staying at the Gran Porto Real and we are already looking forward to next year. The staff at this resort is the reason we keep coming back, they are like family to us now. They are the hardest working people around so please remember to TIP them! Even though the resort says tips are include they all deserve tips. The beach/pool staff are the best; Pablo, Jose, Bonito, Carolina, Jesus & Theresa will take care of you all day. Our most favorite bartender that we go back year after year to see is Jose A. He even remembers our same drinks that we have every year. We can't forget Miguel L. This year he went out of his was to set up a "Special Dinner" for my husband and I. The cook, capitan, two waiters and Miguel met us outside the resturant and brought us a dinner that wasn't even on the menu and then finished the meal with the flamming mayan coffee. It is quit the show if you chose to ask for it. So just remember if you tip a little and treat the staff like you would your friends, they will go out of their way to make your vacation that much more memerable. The Capitan's also take really good care of you. Alonzo & Eliazar always went out of their way to see if everything was ok and got us anything we need. Everyone there take care of you 24/7 Another favorite thing about this resort is the location. 5th Ave is a must see! Never a dull moment there. Also the fishing boats that are along the beach add so much character to the area. Every year we have the guys take us out on their boat. We've gone snorkling and fishing with them. It's nice because it's always just us or a few other people on the tours. We love visiting with the fishermen and they even remember us every year. As you can tell we love this resort and wouldn't go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “terrific hotel for fun,sun and a great time.”
Reviews.Author: bart9
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd. stay at this hotel and we highly recommend this hotel to everyone. The drinks, food and facilities are wonderful and the entire staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Carolina_Clancey
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first trip to Playa del Carmen, and first trip to an all-inclusive, and we had a great time. Because of some mix-up in accommodations (which we knew about before arrived) we stayed each night at the Gran Porto Real (family resort), but had full access privileges to The Royal (adult resort) across the street and spent our days at the beach and pool there. The staff at both locations were tremendous – very friendly and very much wanting to make sure our needs were met. The waiters at some of the restaurants really did not know what some of the dishes they served were, but were helpful anyway. Francisco, at Maria’s (a Mexican restaurant) was outstanding! A great guy who seemed to enjoy serving us as much as we enjoyed being served. In general, the food was very good, and there was plenty of it. As well, the drinks were excellent! There are better brands of liquor at The Royal so if that is what you are in to, you might want to stay there instead of the Gran Porto. Also, the last few storms have not been too kind to the beach at the Gran Porto so if you want a lot of sand on your beach, check out The Royal. Both facilities were always kept very clean and seemed very up-to-date. I got up early each morning to watch the sunrise and would see the staff already hard at work lining up the beach chairs, raking the sand, cleaning the pools, etc. Everything was always spotless, and our rooms were immaculate each day. We received great help from Carol at Farnesi Travel in planning our trip, as well as the guys at Olympus in Mexico who got us to and from the airport in Cancun. Playa del Carmen seems like a nice little sleepy tourist town. Although we did not go out into the town in the evening (safety was not an issue, just felt like staying at the resorts) we did go shopping a couple of times along 5th Avenue and even walked up to Wal-Mart for some good prices on quality tequila. I would not hesitate to recommend either resort to my friends and hope one day to be able to get back down to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: 39islandgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Gran Porto Real and had a great time. We went with a group of 25 people ranging from ages 4 - 69 and everyone had a great time. The food was terrific thanks to the wonderful chefs and their captain, Nairobe, who made sure that everyone was taken care of. They even made a birthday cake and sang happy birthday for our daughter's 10th birthday. Derek, the new waiter, was very keen to learn and was eager to do his best job. Good luck Derek! The waitstaff around the pool and beach are the hardest working people I have ever met. Maria was our number one girl for service. Always smiling and wanting to make sure that we were all taken care of. Next to her were Pablo and Benito, equally as hard working. The resort was perfectly located if you want to be near town yet not bothered by town. Everything within walking distance if you wanted to do some local shopping. The resort and its grounds were spotless and very well maintained. Our room was always very clean and we even had our beds turned down in the evening - an extra unexpected touch! The sports and entertainment crew put on excellent evening shows and worked very hard during the day to keep things hopping around the pool. Thanks to Julio and Chicken especially! The only thing that I noticed that could be better, would be the teen club. Not much going on for that age. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you had a big group and wanted to be able to find eachother, unlike some hotels that we saw were so huge that you had to walk long distances to get to the pool or restaurants or anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon resort”
Reviews.Author: SharonDoverEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had 11 perfect nights at the Porto Real. What made our stay was the staff, they were fabulous all of them. This is a laid back resort ( you don't have to change your bikini 3 times a day) the theme of this hotel is "relax". Don't get me wrong there is Lot's to do if you want to right on the beach and 5th Avenue is amazing for nightlife. The Italian restaurant is really really good, we had the best carpaccio ever. Lorenzo (barman at the pool bar) is a genius ,but he will get you seriously drunk if you let him. We didn't have to ask for a drink he just seemed to know! I could go on and on about this resort, it's fantastic ,we loved it and are going back next year, taking the kids this time (they have a room dedicated to XBox, Playstation etc if the beach or pool get's too much) so watch this space. Colin & Sharon England

Reviews.Title: “The reasons why I keep going back to the Gran Porto Real 10 times !!!”
Reviews.Author: sueintc
Reviews.Content: Lynn,Nico,Cinthya,Nery,Aaron,Benny,Freddy,Louis,Migel,Manuel,Eliazar,David,Miriam,Mirana,Ivan,Carlos,Bennito,Theresa,Jesus,Paublo,Jose,Margarite,Sara,Thelma,Victor,Fernando,Ernesto,Freddy,Ricardo,Chef in Italian,Jose,Mataeo and all the incredible staff members names I have left out..a millon thanks thanks for making the last stay beyond wonderful. We started out with a great transfer thru playinfo.com. It is always so heartwarming to be greeted by all staff when you arrive & everyday after with hugs & smiles..& "where everyone knows your name". The rooms are huge..beautiful night view of Cozumal..clean..great shower. The food was extra special at the Italian & Mexican(welcome back Fernando)..

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i ever had”
Reviews.Author: widyse
Reviews.Content: Next wednesday i am going for the 4th time to the gran porto real,and if i go to the same place four times than it must be very good,because i am a spoiled traveller.I have been to many places one of them being Barbados wich costs me a fortune from Holland to go there.But i have never ever had a hotel that was so great. The people that work there are so great the are the friendliest people i have ever met.And the service in the hotel is really great.If you ever want the best holliday you can go to GRAN PORTO REAL in PLAYA DEL CARMEN

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: langfott
Reviews.Content: We go to Playa around 3 to 4 times a year and in late Oct 09 it was the first time to stay at the Gran Porto Real. It is a wonderful resort. The beds are really hard as most are in Mexico. As with most all-inclusives they have restuarants you can eat at to get away from the buffet. The Gran has 2 one mexican food and one italian. You can go to them every night and they have very good food. The only problems we had at this hotel was the toliet plugged up one night but they were there in 5 minutes to fix it and when they clean your room they will turn your A/C off so you need to run up after they clean and turn it back on so it won't be hot at night when you come in after being in the sun all day. And that is it. There is not many times you can go somewhere and not have any problems. The staff are very friendly and will accomodate you very quickly. If you every go, book the cheap room and then upgrade when you check in. Also, ask about moving to the Royal hotel across the street. It is a sister hotel and it is all adult.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it immensly”
Reviews.Author: elena94
Reviews.Content: The staff, Manuel & Ignacio from the Albatros and Thelma from Housekeeping were the best. They made our stay a pleasure exactly what we were craving! We want to go back next year. Food and the entertainment staff were wonderful as well. The room was beautiful and very clean. The beach very clean and enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday with kids/spouse”
Reviews.Author: RJBOOK
Reviews.Content: We actually staying at this resort in the beginning of this year for 2 weeks. We had our 2 children with us ( ages 3/5) We were upgraded front an oceanview room to an walk up ocean front suite. We had to twin beds for our kids. The room was so beautiful with 2 balconies and loads of space. We also had the option to upgrade our restaurant selection and attend the sister hotel ( Royal Playa Del Carmen) with the kids. Food was good overall for an all inclusive ( Your not going to get 5 star good anywhere in mexico!) but it was good-really.. Drinks good and lots of choice, Non alcohic drinks for kids which they love, pool nice and spacious but a bit chilly, Resort itself is really nice, clean and layed out nicely.. Only complaint we had was the beach, due to natural erosion the beach area had quite a few sand bags lined up..Not the nicest feature but just a hint to cross over in front of "The Royal-sister hotel" and use their beach as it is public, much nicer there for kids..Staff was friendly, some staff not so much but whatever, We've stayed at the Royal Playa Del Carmen and honestly The Gran Porto Real is almost as nice and much more cost effective, If you are travelling w kids you won't be disappointed, a block or so away from 5th ave which has Diary Queen, shopping, restaurants and street entertainment at night. Fun for kids too...We're well travelled and its really a good place, would go back for sure! Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Safe & Cosy”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaG4
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel,great food.Beach next door very smooth,and great for long walks. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mholla00
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort! We have never been treated nicer! The staff was wonderful especially Jose the pool waiter. The rooms were amazing you can tell they took the extra effort to make you feel welcome. The drinks kept coming, at the resturants as well as the bars the waiters would bring you extra drinks that you didn't even order just to see if you like it and we always did (especially the Mango Sexy) The location of the resort is very good, you are 2 blocks from 5th ave where you can shop till you drop and is very safe to do so. We used Best Day Travel to book our excursions, we did "Xplor" and it is well worth the money if you do the ziplines! There are 15 of them and 3 of them you land in water in a river in a cave. Then we did the "Tulum, Xel-Ha all inclusive combo" It is where you go to the Mayan ruins at Tulum in the morning and the natural water park Xel-Ha in the afternoon. Tulum was the most beautiful place I have ever been in my life! and Xel-Ha is fun if you like to snorkle, if not then don't go. We like to snorkle but I would recomend a tour of the reef over this, plus we were snorkling and a 4 foot baracuuda swam about 2 feet infront of our face so we got out pretty quick. As for the beach at the resort it is nice and relaxing, yes there are boats and yes there are sand bags but it didn't bother us one bit. If you are wanting a party beach walk 100 yards down to the Royal and what ever resort is next to it it is much larger and no sand bags and is all young in shape people partying and playing beach sports. The food at the resort is pretty good. Room service wasn't the best in the world, if you want a normal lunch like hamburgers and hotdogs you will need to go to the beach snack bar. Il Pascatore the italian resturant was very good and Marias was average to me. But hey when your drinking and everything is already paid for food is food to me. Overall we can't wait to return! If your wanting a family vacation or a relaxing vacation this is the resort but if your wanting to party this resort has waaaayyyy too many kids and older people. This was great for a honeymoon in our case but when we return we will stay in an all adults all inclusive for sure this place was soooooo clean

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: mbez
Reviews.Content: We traveled with 3 couples total. We somehow got three rooms right in a row, which was perfect. From the moment of check in to the time we sadly drove away, this trip was beyond what I expected. The food was good, very fresh, and selections changed daily at the buffet. The room was very large, great bathroom, and very clean. My two favorite things about this trip, #1, the housekeeping staff was awesome. They made a heart out of roses on our bed and always refilled our drinks. #2, the bar/wait staff at the hotel. Jose, Israel, and Pedro - so much fun. Thanks for dealing with us all day with a smile. I would say watch out for the lakuka racha shot.. that was pretty nasty. The location is ideal, just a quick walk to street vendors and great places to eat. Overall, this hotel was the perfect mix of casual fun and excellent service. We will be back as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Best week of my life!!”
Reviews.Author: krazeeredhead
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Playa del Carmen with a friend for a week of relaxation and fun. We stayed at the Gran Porto Real. We arrived around 1:30ish and our room was not yet ready, no big deal to us, as check in wasn't until 3pm. The bellman took our bags to storage, the front desk gave us our bracelets and the servers came by with drinks. We headed to the buffet restaurant at the hotel for some lunch. The food was delicious. So much to choose from. We did frequent that restaurant most days for lunch and breakfast...again, a nice selection everyday, the fruits and salad bar stayed the same, but the hot selections changed daily and that was so nice. The pool area was so relaxing and beautiful. Just to be able to sit at the pool and see the ocean everyday and feel the cool breeze off the ocean - it was heaven! The poolside servers were wonderful - especially Carolina. She was just smiling and smiling the whole time and always made daily chit chat with us. Service was very prompt and the frozen drinks were DELISH!!!!! We always made it a point to throw a few dollars each day to the servers, even though gratuity was included. My friend and I were both servers and it's not an easy job, especially in the hot sun. We also hung out at the inside bar, David was the greatest bartender - our drinks weren't even 100% empty and he had another yummy drink waiting for us. We also made friends with Maria, the cocktail waitress - she was such a joy to chat with. Everyone was just so nice. We also had dinner at the Mexcian and Italian restaurant on property. Again, wonderful service, delicious food and I think the best part was the strolling mariachi bands.....it just made you feel so at home. We also went to 5th Ave to shop a few nights. TAKE SMALL AMERICAN DOLLARS when you go to Mexico. The hotel didnt have small bills to change out and it was a bit of a pain when you wanted to barter with street vendors or leave tips for servers, drivers, guides, etc. Sometimes if you paid in bigger bills for items, you got peso's back and you can't barter with pesos. I wish someone would have told us about taking smaller bills....it would have made things easier for sure. Another thing I liked so much about this hotel was the activities board. It was posted daily and we pretty much planned our day around the activities. One day we took the kayak tour. You were set up in two man kayaks and a guide went with you...we just paddled out to the sea and talked and looked for some sea life..stingrays, turtles, etc. Now, you didn't have to take a guide, you could sign a kayak out anytime, for 2 hours...and it was free, which was super nice. We also signed out snorkle masks and snorkles one afternoon and just swam the ocean looking for sea life. again...free for two hours. The also had nightly entertainment, theater productions, outdoor shopping, etc. You really never have to leave this resort, as so much was going on. My favorite part of the vacation was the massages on the beach. My friend and I both work 2 jobs, run an at home business and are just busy working gals. We decided to treat ourselves to massages. they had quite a few different types to chose from..we selected the Two for Two package. You got two different types of massages, we both got the lower body relaxation and upper body deep tissue. We met our "Massage Queens" at the gazebo on the beach at sunset. we had our swim suits on and Francise and Magda got underway.......can we say HEAVEN!!!! It was by far the best massage I have ever had. It was so relaxing and being on the ocean, feeling the breeze, hearing the ocean waves...it was just the best evening ever. Both ladies were most accommodating, and so skilled at massage therapy - I asked Magda if she would consider moving to the states - it was that GREAT!!! The price was great and the best 50 mins of relaxation ever! Thanks again Madge and Francis. Overall, I HIGHYT recommend this property. It was great for a girlfriends getaway, and we did see a lot of families and couples as well. You really do get a lot of wonderful accommodations for the price and being all inclusive was even better. If you are looking to get the most bang for your buck, I highy recomment the Gran Porto real. We are def. rebooking next year!

Reviews.Title: “Still my absolute favorite place. As much as I want to try somewhere else, I am way too happy with this resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Darla41595
Reviews.Content: The one thing I hate about writing reviews is always trying trying to remember everything I wanted to say..... so here goes. This was our 3rd time at the Gran Porto Real. I had checked in online before arriving at the resort and we were booked in a Junior Suite Beach Front Walk Out room. I intentionaly wanted to upgrade to the Gran Master 1 Bedroom Suite when we arrived and requested it. Freddy (bell boy) was fantastic and showed us what our original room would have been (in case we did want it) and then showed us a very small 1 Bedroom suite (I was under the impression there were only 2 of these suites, room # 257 & # 357) but this one was on the 2nd floor and was really small. They let us go eat lunch while we waited for room # 257 to be vacated buy the previous guests so we could look at it. After seeing the room, we took it and had to wait about an hour for it to be cleaned but that was fine, went to the upstairs pool, got a drink and put our tired feet in the cool wonderful water! Room: Obviously was fantastic, huge, 3 balconies. They put a cot in the living room for our daughter (16yrs old) but she choose to sleep on the couch. Having 2 seperate rooms when you have teenager(s) is the smartest thing a person can do. She could fall asleep when she wanted and could watch what she wanted on TV without it affecting us at all and the living room had its own seperate air conditioning so she could keep it colder than the bedroom. I usually wake up early when on vacation and the lounge chair off the living room balcony was fantastic for reading a book in the morning before everyone got up. My only complaint was the time that our room got cleaned. We would go for breakfast, go back to the room and then head to the pool till lunch time. When we would go to the room to get changed for lunch, the maid would just be starting, so we only got our room cleaned a couple times (put the Do Not Disturb Sign on the door) Ok so enough of that. Food: Good. Even though we had the 1 bedroom suite & had full access to the Royal next door (our All Inclusive bracelet was actually a Royal Bracelet) we never made it over there. We do not eat seafood at all (any of us) so there were a few times that there was not much to pick from at supper. But there was always room service and breakfast & lunch were always great. On our last night our waiter Fernando found out we didn't like seafood and told us he would get us something special and he came back with 3 beef dishes for us. Ivan was fantastic at breakfast. Service: Overall everyone is FANTASTIC. Everyone has a smile & says hola. Felipe at the upstairs pool bar is great and that is where we spent the majority of our time. So the biggest thing I love about this resort is the location. I love to shop and we ae right around the corner from 5th Ave so I could shop all I wanted. We went to Coco Bongo's and that is by far the best night of my trip. What a great time. Highly recommend it to everyone & anyone regardless of age. (over 18) My daughter & I rented Jet Ski's out front of The Royal for an hour and had a BLAST. We booked Jungle Jim's ATV's online before going and booked a Flex Pass so we could decide what day we wanted to do it once we got to Mexico. The concierge desk was great, they called Jungle Jim's to arrange our pick up. That excursion was great, got to swin in an open cenote, and go to Atkun Chen (they had spider monkeys that you could feed, parrots that you could walk right up to and take pictures and a long time on the ATV's. Make sure you bring sunglasses and a bandana. It gets dusty. We also went to Lapis Jewelery Factory. Free to go there, arrange it with Best Day tours our your rep. Ok so I think I have written enough of a novel and I know that after I hit send I will remember something else but I think that does it. Please feel free to ask me any questions you may have. I have a million pictures and will get them (some) posted soon.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Just as Great!”
Reviews.Author: robynDallas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 nt stay with 3 girlfriends at the GPR. We were there last year about the same time and loved it so decided to stay there once again. What can I say, it's our favorite place! We have stayed at larger resorts in the past (Iberostars) , but always had to take a cab into town to shop. What is so great about the GPR is the location to Fifth Ave. If one of us gets tired of shopping it is such a short walk back to the room and we always feel very safe. Plenty do do for us 50+ ladies. We have found a great bar on the corner of 12th St. and 4th Ave called Diablita Chachacha...great ambiance..very retro with couches and a great people watching corner. It is more of a sophisticated local crowd. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel / Stay off the Hammock!”
Reviews.Author: DN361
Reviews.Content: The Gran Puerto Real truly is a beautiful hotel in a great location. We had a lovely room overlooking the nightly show. On the first night of our stay (after being there about 5 hours), I sat on the hammock which immediately flipped over and I hit my head on the stone table on the balcony. Six stitches at the local doctors office/hotel room - trip for me was over. The hotel helped in no way with the doctor bill or would even acknowledge that it happened. When I returned I emailed customer service, the GM, front desk manager and have never received a response. To me it showed how they take care of their customers. I'm in the travel business and after using this hotel many times for customers & friends I won't again. If you choose to stay at this hotel - Stay off the hammock!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Good Food, GREAT Service”
Reviews.Author: Frogwashme
Reviews.Content: We just spent 9 days @ the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen. Very nice place... We have stayed @ the Iberostar 3 times and thought we would try something different this time. We really liked the idea of staying closer to town. That worked out nicely. We were with 7 other friends and all enjoyed the rooms, service, and food very much. We would all go back anytime! A couple of items... The beach is not in great shape but once you get past the sandbags (a couple rows of small bags) the water is awesome of course!! Hard to fight nature... I do understand the re-building of the beaches in underway n ow. Another item is the pool bar... Not quite sure why they let underage into that pool. I did not see the kids there but our friends did. I did take long pants for the ala-carte dinners... but never used them. We alwyas dressed in nice shorts and shirts so there was no problem getting into those restraunts. The service is 2nd to none!!!!!! This staff was awesome. They were there for everything we needed. We would go back and stay in a heartbeat!!!!! Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions...

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was still there!!!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieTanner
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 of us stayed here for a week in July (super hot time to be in Mexico) and had an awesome time! Our room was on the first floor close to the main lobby. It was an excellent location for the beach and lower pool...kind of a hike to the upstairs pool. We had a great time and the entertainment staff was amazing. We participated in some of the "daytime" events like pool volleyball and water aerobics and then went on the "nighttime" excursions to different bars in Playa. I strongly recommend COCO BONGO!!! Best expericence!!! Now I'll describe some of the hotels ammenities: Room: Always clean and well stocked with water and pop. We even asked for extra water and from that day on we had extra water added each day. The beer in the room is sick...but maybe that was our taste. Downstairs Pool: very nice and the service while we were lounging was great. Jesus never let the glass go empty or the ice melt! There was also a bar in the middle that was good to go to when we needed a break from the sun. And there was a buffet restaurant that they set up at lunch until around 5 that had hamburgers, hotdogs, nachos, etc. Only downfall to downstairs pool...sometimes it would be come overrun by kids... Upstairs Pool: It was smaller and supposed to be adults only (but there were usually a few kids in there). There was a swim-up bar that was our favorite...we spent many afternoons/evening there! But watch out , Filipe makes his drinks strong!!! PS do not eat the sushi. Regular resturant: Met expectations for a resort hotel in Mexico. Breakfast was good...made to order omlets and waffles! Dinner always had a different theme. Italian restaurant: Our favorite. Probably ate here 3 nights at least! Great pizzas and pasta dishes...and the presentation was amazing! Mexican restarunt: Nothing special...only ate here once. 24 hour room: stocked with beer, wine, champaigne, liquor, and a fountain bar...and random snack type food. There was a pool table, air hockey, and WiFi. Also, this room had A/C! Beach: The Gran Porto's beach isnt the best in comparison but its not bad...it is really close to the boats that the locals take out to go fishing. And part of the beach has started to wash away. (i was told hurricane wilma in 2005 is partly to blame) There are kayaks you can take out for free and there is a bar with swings as the seats which also has chips and salsa at it all day. The hotels location was great. We walked down to 5th Avenue for shopping and down 5th avenue was a ferry stop. we took the ferry to cozumel to swim with dolphins at Dolphin Discovery!! Do it, you won't regret it. Amazing experience. I also recommend zip-lining as an excursion! Overall it was a great trip and the hotel was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Third time and it's still great.”
Reviews.Author: blaz5186
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10 days at the Gran Porto with some friends and had a wonderful time. The location is within walking distance to shopping and nightlife but far enough away to reduce the noise. The food and drinks were bountiful and the staff made every effort to make our stay pleasant. Pablo and Benito in particular were wonderful and very patient in trying to teach us spanish. We stayed in a Junior Suite and found it met our needs in every way. I would recommend the Gran Porto to anyone who wants a laid back peaceful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - Going back every year for tropical leisure trip!”
Reviews.Author: bchapman630
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place!!!! I had no idea what to expect but my travel agent recommended it....I brought my husband and my 9 month old son to this resort for a long weekend to celebrate my husbands 30th bday. The hotel was just fabulous -- so warm and welcoming. Everyone went above what should be expected of someone in terms of service. They were so kind. The food was AMAZING! If someone was disappointed then I think they live a very privileged life and probably have an overeating problem as the food was more than adequate. We liked the buffet the best as we had a baby with us. We tried room service twice and did not like it either time, so I do not recommend that although if you go all inclusive you can get it twice per day plus meals. There is a little sushi bar next to the swim out bar which was a nice snack plus several grills out by the pool and ocean. The ocean was great! We swam several times. I know people are upset about the boats but I really think if people understood that up until 10-15 years ago playa del carmen was just a very sleepy fishing town -- that is its livelihood! We loved seeing the locals in action. It is half touristy town / half just people living in Mexico making a life for themselves. We were not bothered at all. And the infamous sandbags -- I think its great they are trying to preserve what they have left after Hurricane Wilma. They are rebuilding the beach and bringing in sand but need bags to keep it from washing away. My advice is to climb over them and swim!! Some parts were rocky but mostly if you walk another 5 feet it is sandy and clean. They also have tour guides and excursion agents on staff, but we did not use them. I booked through other agencies for cheaper tours. We did an Express Tulum tour which was AWESOME. You must go if not for the Mayan Ruins then for the BEACH!!!! Bring your bathing suit! The hotel is right of Quinta Avenida (5th Avenue) where there are markets, bars, music, pubs, restaurants etc --- gorgeous at night. We felt completely safe on the main streets and went down every night just for the atmosphere. Cozumel is a 45 minute ferry ride away -- the ferry is about 10 blocks from Gran Porto Real. We never made it as we loved staying by the pool all day, but next time we will go. We are planning a trip for next September/October and will be bringing extended family with us. Its a magical place. Remember its Mexico and its not Italy -- There are some bugs here and there and don't drink the water outside of the resort. All in all I would give it 10 out of 10. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainRon1
Reviews.Content: The ocean front suite was fantastic! The service was attentive and immediate to assist with anything. Never saw a speck of sand on the mirror smooth floors. We got fresh towels beachside when ever we needed and had free use of snorkel equipment and kayaks and life vests. Food was top notch at all three of the property restaraunts and even the outside beach front snack bars were well laid out. Beach lounging is nice, and with the sun as powerful as it is, it was nice to have many of the coconut strand cabana covers to escape from the sun when needed. We laid our towels out early and had immediate service by some of the best smiling wait staff. Be sure to look for Jose, Pablo, and Jesus on the beach as they are non stop! This resort hotel is family friendly. If you want no one younger than sixteen around,I would recommend the newer "Royal" across the street, but the Gran Porto has the best beach which is protected by a breakwater and the water is shallow for at least five hundred feet off shore. We snorkeled one day for about three hours and there are some small corals with plenty of fish to keep you entertained! All in all,, one of the best trips we have ever had! We are going back!

Reviews.Title: “Service very good but think the upgrading is a scam!”
Reviews.Author: TMJScottishBorders
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the Gran Porto Real - my husband and I were so impressed with the hotel the first time around we decided to take our whole family!! After a long delay at Glasgow Airport and then the terrible ordeal to get through Cancun Airport we finally arrived very tired and ready to relax. However, we were greeted at the front desk by a smiling but determind member of staff pushing us to upgrade. This was a surprise having not experienced this the last time. We had paid for 3 Junior Suites already in our package deal with First Choice, but she said we could not get our rooms together so like a mug we paid an extra $423 only to find out later the hotel was only 56% full. We had a better view in the room we had 2 years ago so do not be fooled! The First Choice Rep is aware of this and has told the manager that the upgrade option is not really necessary unless you really want a room with a better view or a bigger suite. Remember the departure tax too which was $48 each and the constant barage of sellers trying to get you into their shops! Another thing to watch is your bag - I was actually in the check-in queue at Cancun Airport when a young girl beside me noticed a local with his hand in my bag!! But the money issue aside it is a lovely hotel, very clean and beautifully situated and a very relaxing place to be!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service from gavitos staff”
Reviews.Author: ville011
Reviews.Content: overall experience was wonderful but the service receives from Teresa, Miriam, David, Sara, Jesus and Pablo was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 50th Birthday!!! Superb Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: UtahPam
Reviews.Content: Been to this Hotel twice now and plan t o go back again soon! Everything was fabulous from the room to the superb sevice! I can't give thanks enough to Benito, Miriam, Pablo, Jose, Fellipe, David, the two sisters....can't remember names and honestly everyone was excellent! Best service EVER! Great 50th Birthday celebration the Hotel Staff and Room service made my day WONDERFUL....can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: alondraseattle
Reviews.Content: Our reservations were for the Real Playa del Carmen, which is the Gran Porto's sister hotel, it was our first time to stay in Playa, tho we had stopped there on a cruise once, and again visited while staying across the water in Cozumel. After the hour long cab ride from Cancun, when we pulled up to the Real Playa, there was a sign directing all visitors to the Gran Porto because this was closed for renavations. ( To be honest, I had read reviews from people who had paid extra to move there and wanted to check into it anyway) So we were happy about that . Once we were in our room , which actually wasn't that great, it faced the back side street and the bed was painfully hard, after a few minutes of checking out the hotel and all its amenities the plain room just didn't matter anymore, we know we weren't going to be spending much time there. This hotel had everything and then some, from free from service to a full sized bar in our room with full size bottles of liqueur along with the free mini bar that was stocked daily in the room. We stayed 10 days and after the 5th nite we upgraded too a junior suite, ocean view for an extra 20 dollars a nite, and really the only reason we did that was because I could not sleep in the bad in our room anymore. Anyway, while my hubby took diving lessons out of the lobby, I was kept more than busy with things to do at the hotel (painting class, learning Spanish) and on 5th avenue, which was only a few close steps away from where it started. Wonderful shopping ( my FAVORITE thing to do) We paid for the cheapest all-inclusive hotel in town, and were treated to what had to be close to the nicest hotel in town, so we were extremely happy . We have been to many different Mexican resorts, and the people who worked here were very helpful and friendly and just all around pleasant. (except maby the morning shift) The only negatives here were of course, the time share fellows in the lobby, and I hesitate call this a negative was the first room we were put in. It was extremely plain and although both myself and my husband called every morning to see if there was ANYTHING that might be done about the bed, because each morning I woke up almost in tears from the mattress, and was basically ignored about it.. But after a dip in the pool that was right outside our room I was fine, The room we moved to was a totally different story. The mattress, perfect, the view, better than perfect, At night we could watch the fire-dancers from the resort next door, which was pretty cool. The food was wonderful, except surprisingly for the Mexican restaurant. It was too foo-foo, I wasn't sure what I was ordering, and when it came it was as if they had spent more time trying to make it look like some art platter instead of making it look like something we wanted to eat. But the Itallian was yummy, and the main restaurant smorgasbord was always well stocked with a wide variety of dishes and desserts. After we returned home I had to check and see how much we had been saved by their renovating the Real Playa, and it was well over 1000.00. It could not have worked out better!

Reviews.Title: “Once again, we had a great time at the GPR!!!”
Reviews.Author: cyberjoh
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 2 weeks vacation at the Gran Porto Real. Went with sister and friend. This was our second visit at this hotel. Once again, we had a great time. 85F + everyday and sun, sun, sun!!! The rooms are perfect, clean and well furnished. I want a shower that big at home too!! There is a small fridge which gets filled everyday and a wall bar with 40 oz (all that for free!!!). The little attentions, like "goodnight" chocolates on your bed and the towels and flowers decorations around the room were really appreciated. The staff is amazing and very helpful. They really seem to enjoy what they are doing, that is: make your stay unforgettable . At the pool and beach, José, Jesus, Benito, Maria, Miriam, Pablo and the others are running around all day with the biggest smile to serve you the most refreshing and enjoyable drinks. The food both at the dining room and at the italian restaurant was excellent (we have not tried Maria's) Nothing to complain. We had plenty of bacon and the steaks at the Italian Restaurant was one of the best we had. At the main dining room, the "captains", Gabriel, Hilario, Alonso and Nairobe deserve a big applause. They came to our table often to make sure that "todo va bien" or just to talk. They take the time to take care of their clients. The waiters, Ivan, Verlain, Dion, Fuentes, Alejandro, Miguel, Samuel (Mr. bla-bla-bla), Guadalupe and all the waiters at the italian restaurant were fantastic. We enjoyed the magic tricks at the italian restaurant. Thanks to all of you guys to make our stay so enjoyable. We had a lot of fun joking and laughing with you!! The day-time activities are non-stop and diversified. The night shows are absolutely incredible. I have travelled a lot in the Caribeans and honestly, I have rarely seen shows that professional. The entertainment/animation team is terrific. Thanks to Carlos, Olaf (Chicken Little), Julio and the others for their energy, smiles and friendship. Keep on the good work! I could go on and on with compliments to the staff. I just wished that clients would appreciate a little more the service they receive and give tips, so small would it be. These guys work so hard to satisfy the clients. They deserve it !!! One bad comment: The beach in front of the hotel is terrible. It would be so nice if we could swim right in front without being stuck in sand bags and rocks. And the little boats should be moved 100 feet away. But if you cross the dock and go by the Royal, the beach is amazing. Keep on walking and you will be on Coco Beach (#1 beach in Playa in my opinion). In a few words, our stay at the GPR was once again something to remember and we look forward to go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time -- Great Service”
Reviews.Author: shellChicago
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Gran Porto -- it was great. Nairobe, the head of the wait staff was phenomenal and so was Horario and Ivan. Pablo at the beach was exceptional too! I have been to Playa many times, but the staff at this hotel made this one of my best stays... I surely give a thumbs up if you plan on staying at this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “We Had The Time Of Our Lives”
Reviews.Author: devsfan1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Mexico to the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen, after booking a 5 day/4 night trip. We arrived at about 2:00 Pm on Monday September 30. The room was a beautiful oceanfront front suite on the third floor. The room was large, clean, and also had a 4 bottle liquour cabinet, which was included with the room. After unpacking, we quickly hit the beach. As noted in other reviews, there are sandbags and rocky spots, but it was not unbearable. If you want, you can walk farther down to another spot. Towels and chairs were plentiful. Everyone from the cooks, wait staff, bartenders, etc were the friendliest people. Always smiling, and offering greetings and help if needed. We especially enjoyed the Lobby Bar, where David, Margurite, Teresa, and Carolina were extremely courteous and congenial. Hilario at the Albatross Restaurant in the hotel was always very friendly. There are too many names to remember or put in this review, but they all went above and beyond in assuring our stay was pleasant. We definitely plan on returning. This hotel is more family oriented, which was not a problem for us. They have a sister hotel across the street if desired. All in all, we had the time of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back”
Reviews.Author: anwil
Reviews.Content: As a group of 10 that has travelled together for many years to various 4/5 star resorts throughout Mexico and the Caribbean, we chose the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen as a result of the information available through Nolitours literature. Through this literature we were led to believe that we would be staying at an all inclusive resort with all the services and amenities that come when travelling to a 4/4.5 star resort. Our disappointment began as soon as we walked through the main entrance to the reception desk at 11:30 am local time. There was no Nolitours representative to greet us, we were asked for a credit card for imprint, our rooms were not ready – we were told in no uncertain terms that check-in was at 3 pm, there was no courtesy suite in which to change or leave our carry on luggage. We were basically left in the lobby with our luggage until our rooms were finally ready, which was well after the 3 pm check-in. It begs the question of why, when you are fully aware of the check-in time, would you schedule a flight from Toronto at 6:15 am? For all intents and purposes, we found ourselves in a hotel portraying itself as an all inclusive resort. All five couples had booked Standard rooms . Two couples in our party had concerns – one had to upgrade to a Junior Suite due to mobility issues, the other was put into a room that could only politely be described as a Studio, suitable for 1 traveller. This couple was informed by the front desk staff that they did indeed have a Standard room and were told they would be moved only when the couple explained they had already seen what the rest of us had. As far as our accommodations are concerned, although clean, there was no dresser and extremely limited closet space. In every other resort at which we have stayed, the Standard rooms have been at minimum, the size of the Junior Suites offered at the Gran Porto Real – at no extra cost. We had to wait until the following morning to speak to the Nolitours representative, who when told about our issues, said that she would write down our concerns but didn’t think that anything would be done – not a comforting thought, nor outstanding customer service. When we questioned the 4/4.5 star rating, we were told that the rating was to Mexican, not Canadian standards. When told that the rating standards were misleading, all we got was a shrug and a change of subject. Considering we trust tour operators to be honest and forthcoming, why would you not make a distinction in your literature regarding the rating standards that have been used or at the very least, downgrade the rating to one that would conform to Canadian standards? The buffet for breakfast & lunch was OK, but sub-standard for dinner. The dinner buffet was a hit and miss affair, with little variety and much repetition. Our only consolation was that we could dine at the Mexican & Italian restaurants as often as we liked. A couple examples/differences with which we were faced, there was no bacon available at breakfast, no carving stations during dinner, nor ice cream for dessert at lunch or dinner. We were finally told the day before we left that we had to ask the serving staff specifically for bacon and ice cream- as if it was a special treat, saved for only for a very chosen few guests. Although relatively small issues, these are illustrative of the many differences we noticed, which continued to accumulate throughout our stay. The representative stated that there were visiting privileges with the Royal across the street. The reality was that we had to have a voucher to be allowed to have breakfast or lunch only and when we tried to enter to look at the lobby & go into the gift shop, we were stopped, questioned, told we were not allowed in and essentially made to feel like criminals. We have never been to an all inclusive resort where we were asked for our room numbers every time we wanted something to drink or eat – at all other resorts, the wrist band has always been enough for staff to know that we “belong”.
