In fact, one of our party was told that if anyone could not produce their wristband prior to departure, they would be charged $100.00 USD. The front desk staff literally cut off our bands, gave us vouchers that we had to show if we wanted to get coffee or anything to eat and then collected them as we were boarding the bus to the airport! The measures taken by the staff at the resort throughout our stay were far more stringent than those taken by security staff at the airport. All in all, we felt mislead us in terms of the calibre of resort we had chosen. We paid comparable rates to the RIU or Gran Bahia Principe Resorts – where we have stayed all the previous years – and received nowhere near the quality of accommodations, services or amenities. Furthermore, due to flight times we lost 2 days of our vacation because they were dedicated to travel. The advertising stated that all the resorts Nolitours offers have been checked thoroughly and truly reflect what travellers can expect when choosing a destination – in our case, our choice did not match the expectation presented in the literature. As a result of the abovementioned factors, we will not return to the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience & will return again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mikatco
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the GPR on Sept. 19th and stayed until Sept. 23rd. I had completed the online reservation and when we arrived at 11:00 AM and greeted with a refreshing cocktail our room was ready. The location of room was not what I really wanted because I wanted an oceanfront room so we upgraded for a oceanfront room and were able to negotiate the price per night for the upgrade. They were able to provide us the OF room even though check-in was not normally until 3:00 PM. The room was 3rd floor as I had requested and had a beautiful view of the ocean, pool & beach. The room and bathroom were very spacious with a big walk in shower, stocked refrigerator and liquor dispenser. The furnishings were very nice. We quickly unpacked, changed clothes and headed to the beach and lunch. Food at the beach bar was about the same each day but a pretty good variety and was good. Hung around the pool for awhile and watched the activities but ended up on the beach where it was a little quieter. Pool chairs were always available and could usually find one in the shade and really didn't notice the towel game going on. Walked the beach to the Royal and although their beach isn't as rocky and doesn't have the sand whales we liked the beach area at the GPR better. The GPR had more beach space and less foot traffic. We went up to the tranquil pool late afternoon and it was very nice to have the shade and quiet time. Usually ended up there each afternoon. We went back to clean up and had a knock on our door and they brought us a beautiful cake and a bottle of champane and glasses to celebrate that this trip was my birthday present. A huge surprise and the cake was excellent, we never got around to drinking the champagne because the drinks flowed continually everywhere in the hotel. We ate at the Mexican restaurant that evening and the food and service were excellent. The only complaint was with the mosquitos and I had to go back to the room during dinner and spray and after that everything was great. Walked up to 5th avenue and wow, it was alive and a great area for a night time stroll and some shopping. Came back and listened to the band in the lobby bar before going back to the room for the night. The next morning I got up and walked up to 5th avenuie to check out Veronica's massage that I had heard had good massages. I was able to get right in and for $30.00 for an hour had a wonderful massage, in air conditioning and nice relaxing music. I recommend and would go back. Went back to the room and showered and off to the buffet for brunch. Food and service was excellent again. Spent the afternoon on the beach, relaxing, swimming and kayaking. That evening we ate at the Italian restaurant and it was very good, and was our favorite restaurant although all the food was good. Next morning we were up and had breakfast and took a cab to the ferry for $3.00 and went to Coxumel for the day. I had pre-rented a car with Isis and that was quick and easy and we were off around the island. Stopped at Coconuts for Guacomole and drinks. What a view and really neat place. Continued on south down the east side of the island and stopped at Marleys and had another drink and shared the fresh fish filet tacos. Very yummy!! We continued off in search of a place to snorkel. We went to Playa Corona and spent some time snorkeling there and saw tons of fish. We snacked again with Chicken Fajitas and they were good and a huge serving. Took the car back and Margarite had told us where to get gas prior to bringing it back or she would look at the tank and estimate the amount which is what we did and she was extremely fair with it. We would definitely rent from her again. Caught the 5:00 ferry back and walked 5th in the daylight back to the hotel. We snacked for dinner at the buffet since we had eaten so much during the day and we really were not hungry. The evening buffet was good and a lot of variety where everyone should be able to find plenty of what they would like. We watched the show that night and it was pretty good, it was entertaining and we enjoyed it. The next day was our last full day and we spent the day on the beach, relaxing, walking the beach and playing in the ocean before going to the tranquil pool prior to cleaning up for dinner. Met some nice people everytime we were up there but this day we met a lovely young couple from England and they joined us for dinner that night at the Italian restaurant. We had a wonderful dinner and great company from our new friends. Had to go back up to 5th avenue for some last minute shopping before leaving the next morning. We had breakfast prior to checking out and it was easy check out and back to the airport and easy trip home. We loved everything about this hotel. It was beautiful, good food ,EXCELLENT SERVICE, and great location. We didn't tour the Royal and I am sure it is wonderful but we loved the Gran Porto Real and would not upgrade to the Royal given a choice. If I had to complain about anything it would be the beach with the sand whales and the amount of rocks in the ocean which I knew about it and it would not keep me from returning to this hotel. I wish I had taken my water shoes because it would have been a little easier. I still loved the beach and you are able to find a large area without the rocks and you can always walk next door to the Royal and swim. They will even let you take the wave boards over there for an hour at a time. This was a short trip for us and was just to rest and relax after a very stressful summer so next time we will spend more time exploring the town of PDC and we would definitely return to the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: rieksmarion
Reviews.Content: we are from the nertherlands and we have travelled a lot but this hotel is absolutely the top! The room we had `with beach view and the personal were all so friendly and kind. Aspescially David and Carolina were good but the absolute the best hotel employee was MARIA. She makes you feel like you were at home, she wants to do everything to make you feel good. We had a good holiday and we would like to recommand this hotel to everyybody who would like to have an wonderfull stay! You won't regret is, we are sure! Rieks Vedder and Marion van de Polder The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, again”
Reviews.Author: oologah
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time to stay at the Gran Porto Real and we were not disappointed. A little too hot this time of year, but the hotel was everything we expected. Our room was clean and the AC as cold as you want. Food and service offered something for everyone. This hotel has a great location and is worth what you pay as far as we are concerned. We have stayed at the Royal across the street and found the food no better. The Royal is far more elegant and upscale, but who camps out in their room? Want to go back right now.

Reviews.Title: “best holiday! well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: UkSamlee
Reviews.Content: where do i start, i cant boast enough about the place!! we moved here from the real playa del carmen as that was excuse me saying but a sh**hole. We arrived at this hotel to friendly reception/bell boys and just staff in general. we stayed in a Junior suite which would recommend to the standard suite. we was greeted back to our room with different things made from the bath towels such as elephants, swans, and the mini bar was re-filled everyday. could not fault the cleaniness. every night we had a little maid knock on the door to give us chocolates! how lovely!! anyway, the actual facilities were great, restaurants were lovely, but maybe the buffet could have done with bein air conditioned. couldnt complain about the food, theres something for everyone. swimming pool was clean, beach i read that from some people moaned that there was sandbags on the beach - so what, it saves the beach from hurricans washing the beach away, its not a problem!! we had such a lovely time and didnt feel we had to leave the resort. brilliant place would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent holiday, enjoyed it 100%, thank you all at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Joe1961
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!, where do I start, this is a fantastic hotel, with lovely staff, who are all very helpful, polite & friendly, with a good sense of humour,, BIG thanks to Jose, who's beach service kept my "Mexican Water" glass filled at all times, and is " Numero Uno Hombre". The food was lovely with a very varied variety, and a special mention to my lovely little lady, who cooked my omelettes every morning ,Sorry I didn't get your name. Nightly entertainment was always very good, as were the daytime activities, Thanks to "Chicken Little" - Victor. The cleanliness, and style of this hotel is top quality, and the Hacienda styling, along with the luxury finishes were excellent, and very charming. I cannot say enough about this hotel, except that I was very impressed, and it was the best holiday I have had to date, and we will be going back, and lastly may I say a HUGE thank you to all of you at the Gran Porto Real, Muchas Gratias Mi Amigos ;0)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: luvmytigers
Reviews.Content: I have vacationed in Cancun before, this was my first trip to Playa. The hotel has pluses and minuses. When we arrived, we had a junoir ste., they asked us if we wanted to "upgrade" and brought us to see 2 rooms - the 1st was the jr ste which overlooked a bunch of junk - I'm sure they wouldn't really put anyone in this room, then they showed us a oceanfront ste - they told us it would be $80/night more, when I said no, they went down to $40/night and my husband said yes (sucker)!!! The room was great, very cold which is unusual for Mexico! Maid service was great, except you NEED to put do not disturb on the door if you are going to take a shower, b/c they DID walk in on my hubby! UGH!!! Drink service at the beach was GREAT!!!! Jesus is the man!! Ok, here is the bad: Food is really just so so and I don't have high expectations for all inclusive resorts at all! The buffet didn't offer much, Mexican and Italian restaurants were just ok. Our room again faced the beach and at night, there is a club down the beach that BLARES techno music - it was impossible to sleep and they played it until 4am!!! The beach/water is REALLY rocky - you are almost taking your life into your hands going into the water! Cancun is all sand, no rocks! We were dummies and took the "tour" of the sister property the Royal Real, which was really a time share presentation. They tell you it's an hour and a half but it was 3 hours!! They started in price at $69,000 and when we told them they were crazy, they came donwn to $2,500 - we didn't buy, but that is SO funny! We did decide if we went back there, we would stay at the Royal - it is SO much nicer and the beach is nicer too! Tours we did Xel-ha which is nice, but we like Xcaret better. Over all, I would give it a 5 out of 10, I enjoyed the Crown Paradise in Cancun much more.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: beachsun5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to the gran porto real and loved it. Have stayed at the Sandos playa car 2 years in a row but wanted to try something different. For the value of the resort it was excellent. Our room was upgraded to the master suite where they put bunkbeds in there for our kids (3) so that they had there space and we had ours. The staff was very helpful. A little dissappointed in the beach very rocky and had sand bags at the base of the water. plenty of beach chairs. The pool was nice but once the heat got strong they pool water was to hot to cool you off. The buffet for breakfast and lunch was good but not for dinner. Italian (by far our favorite) and mexican resturants were very good. Not enough to do for the kids (ages 16, 13,11). But we went away for family time and that is what we got. Walking along 5th ave at night was alot of fun and alot to see. Took the ferry to cozumel was not worth the money or the trip. Overall we would diffetnitly return to the gran porto real in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in the last years”
Reviews.Author: enra
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 days in this hotel in Playa del Carmen and I just have to say that it was the worst we had in the last years. We arrived at the hotel and had to carry my baggage bymyself inside the lobby cause no one was there to help us, the staff was standing in one corner and more interesting things to do but not their job. At the reception they wanted us to upgrade to another room than we booked, even after we said we were not interested. Apart from that it took the staff more than 20 minutes to give us a room. The room was okay, and clean. In the bars and restaurants they always want to know your room number, even if its all inclusive. That is absolutely unconfortable, the happens if you wanna have a drink, we felt very annoyed. A beach is not like they promise you, there are hundreds of plasticbags to protect the beach in front of the hotel but they dont allow you to go to swim, thats very frustrating, for what you book a beach hotel then if you cannot go to swim? We wont stay again in this hotel, there are better looking ones in the center...

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: Durhammakem
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Gran Porto, my wife and I have had a great time. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpfull . Good selection food and drinks available all day. The only down side was the lack of night time entertainment and air con in the main parts of the hotel. But this aside would stay here again if we were to go back to Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the Gran Porto Real exceeded my expectations,”
Reviews.Author: lt73187
Reviews.Content: We were here for my sister´s wedding. I came not knowing wha tto expect from the resort or the town. Both were very good. The staff was the best I have ever seen. They never stopped going the extra mile to make sure my stay here was perfect. The service at both the bar´s and restaurants was perfect. We never went without anything. The resort was beautiful and well kept. I will definatley be returning here because of the great staff members and beautiful resort. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: docbass
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Mid June with my girlfriend. Found the hotel to be very pretty, but the beach is horrible. You can walk down to the Royals beach and it is okay. Food only average. Service staff friendly and accomadating, check in staff not so great. Our main problem with this resort was our room or our room location. We had some wooden stairs outside our room and people walked up and down them all night long and it sounded like a wagon going over a wooden bridge! It was awful and we got very little rest. Asked to move after first night and they could not accomadate us. Finally on the 4th night was offered the chance to stay in Cancun at the Gran Caribe Real and we did that for rest of our trip. [see review of Gran Caribe]. The good points of this resort are the location being very close to Avenida 5 and in town, It is a pretty resort. Down side was the Beach, the food and awful awful room. We will not stay there again and unless you get a better room [ours was jr suite] then do not recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: EssexHolidaymaker_24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and having read some of the reviews I felt I should write an honest review of my experience. The rooms were clean, the maids did a fanastic job and made little touches like leaving petals and flowers on the bed which was nice, the mini bar was filled up every day without fail, the decor was very nice. The only thing I would stay about the room was it was a little small with no private balcony, we had a terrace at the front which was overlooking the road and hotel opposite but to be honest we did spend much time in the room so not a problem. We had a small pool outside our room with a swim up bar, nice and quiet when the main pool was busy although the a bit in the shade in the afternoons. Unfortunately had to get up early to put the towels on the sunbeds, we didnt at first but after a couple of mornings thought if you cant beat them join them!! Towel service was really good, fresh everyday. Waiter service at the pool side, very attentive, especially if you give them a little tip. The swimming pools were great, quite cold but so cold to cool off in the hot sun. The pools were stunning, palm trees and the beach hut pool bar. The pool pretty much on the beach. I didnt spend a lot of time on the beach, there were sandbags and boats which werent as scenic as I would have liked but I prefer the pool anyway and spent most days on a sunbed by the pool. The entertainment during the day was good, water aerobics and pool volleyball and lots of other activities if you wanted to join in. The evening entertainment was ok.. a little repetitive, we did venture out one night down the beach to a bar for a bit of a change and went on an excursion one day to a natural 'water park' which had a show in the evening. The location was ok..some bars and restaurants nearby.. wish we had ventured out a little more, but was only there for one week, after a 11 hour flight should probably have stayed longer. We stayed all inclusive and on the whole the food was very good. I'm not the biggest fan of buffets but there was plenty of selection of different foods, some cooked to order and everything was warm and clean. I really liked that there was a choice of sit down restaurants included in the all inclusive, Mexican and French restaurants, we had no problems getting a seat. The service was very quick, I didnt exactly feel rushed but I'd have liked to be able to take my time a little more with dinner. Understandable though given the amount of people at the resort. I didnt like the wine, I'm not usually too fussy with wine but I couldnt drink it. If drinking beer I'd go for the bottled one rather than on tap- it had scaly bits in! On the plus side though, there was a good selection of spirits and cocktails which I liked a little too much I think, its definately not watered down!! On the whole a wonderful holiday. I would love to return to Mexico, I really liked the hotel but I like trying different places so next time I might try the bit more lively Cancun!

Reviews.Title: “A good time in Playa del Carment”
Reviews.Author: gut73raf
Reviews.Content: This a review for the week of July 25th. It had been about 5 years since my last visit to this hotel so I was not sure what to expect. Most reviews were positive yet there some negative reviews, specially with the type of rooms assign at checking time. To my surprise, I got the room I requested so I guess I got lucky. Even though the room was great, it was starting to show its age, specially the bad room. Service:The best part of this hotel is the people, they were great. I can't say enough about them. Very friendly and quick to respond to any issues I had. Food: They have 3 restaurant, only one opens for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The other two only for dinner. For me the best one was the Italian restaurant follow by the buffet and last the Mexican restaurant. There is another self serving restaurant on the beach that serves hamburger, hot dogs, nachos and fruit. My kids love it. There is a dress code for the Italian and Mexican restaurant, however, it is not as strict as before. The pool area: At the time we were there, you needed to get up at a decent time to reserve a good chair by the pool. By noon, all chairs were taken. So I started reserving my chairs everyday until a wise guy stole my towels. The problem was not the chairs but the towels themselves. The hotels will charge you $30.00 a towel if you don't return them when you leave. I spoke with the security guard and he told me they had the same issues with other people in the last few days so he just replaced the towels. He told me not to leave the towels alone on the chairs and to place shows on top of them. It worked, I didn't have a problem after that or maybe was the fact they increased the number of security guards walking around the pool. With regards to the pool itself, it was good. However after 4:00 pm or so the water got extremely hot so if you wanted to cool off the pool was not the place. The beach: As some have commented, the hotel is loosing its beach. They added bags of sand and created steps for you to get in but sooner or later you will step into the rocks. I have two small children and it was just not possible for them to swim there. However as other have commented you can walk about 100 yards to an area you can swim. So everyday we would walk in the morning to that area, stay for a few hours and go back to the hotel. However, it could be a problem if you need to use the restroom or need a drink to go back and forth. So if you are beach person, this is not a place for you. Cleanliness: Workers are constantly cleaning every square inch of everything in this hotel so no issues there The hotel lost power several nights and one time it was out most of the night and part of the next day, no big deal but the generators did make a lot of noise at night. My biggest issue was the beach area. I usually go to Cancun for the beach not the pool. According to the staff, they will bring sand from another location to cover the missing area. However, I think this plan will fail. I just don't see how they can keep the sand from moving. All in all, we had a good time but I am not sure if I will go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: GueraMinnesota
Reviews.Content: I read the bad reviews for this hotel and I wonder who writes them? It isn't possible to write ANYTHING bad about this hotel or it's staff!!! My family and our friends (total group of 4 adults and 5 kids) just returned from 7 perfect days at the Gran Porto. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left we were treated like family. The staff makes this place what it is. From the bartenders to the kitchen staff to the people who scrub the place spotless......they are ALL fabulous! The management at the hotel is to be commended! You can tell that everyone that works there loves their job and it shows!!! The family suites were wonderful for our families! They are roomy and really beautiful! The food was fantastic wherever we ate and the place is so clean you could eat off the floor!! I can't wait to go back again and again and again! Don't believe the negative reviews. This place is heaven on earth........

Reviews.Title: “Best staff and location in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: taco-pt
Reviews.Content: Just returned from GPR last night after 7 nights with our family (kids are 5, 11, and 13). Overall, we had a great trip and would recommend the resort to familys looking for a quaint, all-inclusive, authentic trip to Mexico. Location: Certainly the best location in Playa (along with their 5 star, adult-only sister resort Royal across the street). The resort is right off of Constituentes (sp) and a block from the famous 5th Avenue. Lotts of great eateries, restaurants, bars, and shops can be found within a minutes' walk. Plus, you are only a short 15 mintue walk from the ferry to Cozumel. Beach: The hotel has many rooms right on the beach, literally about 20-30 yards from the water in some places. The beach is a little rocky and there are small reefs right off the beach. If you love to snorkel right off the beach, then this is great (we did). If you are looking for soft sand with walk-in beach (for the little ones), then this beach here is not ideal. Not to worry though. You can walk about 100 yards North, across the pier, to the Royal beach. Here, there is no rocks or reefs to worry about and the kids can walk into the water easily. We actually like the fact that you could enjoy BOTH types of beaches so close to one another. Further South down the beach, closer to the GPR pool and beach buffet, there are fishing boats. Personally, I thought it was kinda neat having them there but I would have been upset if our rooms were closer to this end of the resort. Basically, if you are a pool person, get a room closer to this South end of the resort. If you are a beach person, get the rooms on the North end. Rooms: We had a Gran Suite, first floor walkout to the beach (room 155). This room had a king bed. We had asked for 2 queens and I was a little annoyed at first during check in that our room reserved was not available. They had asked us to switch suites the next day. Well, they put in 2 walk away single beds in our room and we ended up staying because it actually worked out better. PLENTY of room. The rooms are very nice and very clean. Excellent bedding. The shower itself was larger than my entire bathroom at home. The room had two separate balconys. There were 3 hammocks right outside our balcony door on the beach. The beach bar with swings was right outside our balcony to the left. It closed at 5 so later bar noise was not a problem. We loved walking out for a dring while others in our family were showering for the evening. Two complaints with the room...1) water temperature in the shower was not able to be controlled. It was either scolding hot or cold, fluctuating constantly from one extreme to the other. 2) hallway noise was a problem. The acoustics were such that every noise from the hallway seemed to be amplified. The ceramic tile was loud as cleaning and maintence crew carts were rolled down the hall. A good set of ear plugs will take care of this problem. Service and Staff: The service was perhaps the best I have ever had at any hotel or resort. All of the staff go out of their way to take care of you. They all seem to really like their jobs, work tierelessly, and treat you like family. Special thanks to the beach waiter Jose, the entertainment/activities coordinater Julio, and Felix on the beach. There are daily activities planned and coordinated each day. Things such as town bike tour, pool volleyball, water polo, beach soccer, water aerobics, and snorkel tour are offered each day. There is a daily activities schedule listed near the pool for each day. Enterainment: Their is live entertainment each evening on Mondays thru Fridays. Singing, dancing, and various talent acts are performed at about 8:30 pm. Contrary to what other reviewers mentioned, we thought it was surprisingly good. Very good. Don't listen to the other reviews that claim it is "cheesy" or that it is performed by the hotel staff. These people clearly were professional dancers, gymnasts, and entertainers and NOT the regular resort staff. Cleanliness: Without a doubt, the cleanest hotel I have ever been in. Workers are constantly cleaning every square inch of everything in this hotel, including the light fixtures, the chandeliers, underneath the railings, the bamboo supports overhead at the beach bar, etc. etc. Food: Very good main buffet which is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I would give it 4+/5 stars. As about as good as a buffet can be and plenty of items to choose from each day. There is also a beach buffet which has great guacamole. For dinner, there are two full service restaurants. An Italian place and a Mexican place. Both restaurants have a very nice setting and excellent service. Regarding food quality, the Italian was average at best and I was not too impressed. However, I am Italian so my standards for Italian might be a little higher than most. The Mexican was pretty good, but the menus never change and you really cannot eat there more than 2 nights without getting bored. Recommendation: maybe offer 1 or 2 different chef's specials for each night to go along with the set menu?

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations in Playa”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaNorway
Reviews.Content: We travelled all the way from Norway and stayed 17 days. GPR has one of the best locations in Playa, on the beach and walking distance from Fifth Avenue (Quinta). The beach was ruined by the hurricane 2 years ago and I hope they soon will be able to make it back to the nice beach it used to be. Now it's rocky an no good for bathing (only with bathingshoes). We had a Gran Suite with direct access to the beach and loved it. The room was big an very nice. The room maid did a good job. The staff overall was nice welcomming. and smiling. But we did not like the pushing salesrepresentativ for Real Club (a time share club even if they call it a vacation club). The food was OK but we stayed for 17 days and you get boored of the food after 7 days. We had access to 3 restaurants in Royal next door (but one was shoot down) and the Asiana had great food. The buffet restaurant was OK but booring. The buffet restaurant in Gran Caribe Cancun was much better so I hope they do some change here in GPR to keep up. Overall I think this is a 3 star+ hotel, but with some few changes it could be a nice 4 star (the beach, the food). Our teenages loved the activity staff and got some friends among other guests - so they want to go back. We hope to be back again but that would only be if they do some changes...

Reviews.Title: “We felt so welcome”
Reviews.Author: adiverTexas
Reviews.Content: All the staff were happy we were staying at this hotel. The maids were friendly and attentive to every detail in our rooms. Wait staff all the restaurants were amazing! They were smiling and gracious hosts. Samual, Earnesto, Elizar and Edgar were so gracious. The Italian restaurant was great - we visited twice. The food in all 3 restaurants was excellent, fresh and beautifuly presented. All areas of the hotel were spotless!

Reviews.Title: “It was the best vacation ive ever had!”
Reviews.Author: pinkrox
Reviews.Content: The people are so nice to you. You can swim all day with awesome drinks brought to you whenever you want one. They come to you. Or you can get awesome adventures like snorkeling with sea turtles close. They have non-stop entertainment all the time like beach volleyball and water pollo and lots of music and dancing. They have shows every night with dancing from different cultures. It was the best vacation ever because the staff make you feel like family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for me and my guests”
Reviews.Author: romanoNewYork
Reviews.Content: Our stay at GPR was wonderful! We had our wedding in PDC on July 10, 2009. Our reception was at The Royal. Due to the fact that we had a few kids attending our wedding, we chose the GPR for our stay. The service at GPR was great. During the week, we had a few wedding events planned and our meeting spot was always in the lobby at GPR. The location of GPR is perfect! Honestly, I think GPR and The Royal have the best spot in downtown PDC. Now, we had many guests that stayed in other hotels in PDC. However, every time we had to meet at the lobby of GPR, the staff was always accommodating to my entire party. They allowed them to stay in the lobby, never gave anyone a hard time and overall was very understanding about the whole situation. I appreciated that a lot. About the food, it was great. No complaints. My guests that stayed at GPR also had no complaints about the food. Selection at the buffet was great. My favorite...grilled fish and paella that they served during lunch. =) The restaurants were also both very good. Honestly, I think it's best to stay at an all-inclusive for only a certain number of nights. It's always great to be able to check out other restaurants in the area...especially in PDC, since there are sooooooooo many great restaurants and hole in the wall places to try. Service was wonderful. We had an ocean front room and our first room was above the pool area. I requested to change rooms towards the pier area and they gladly did. Also, we misplaced a few items in the week (umbrella and a picture) and the staff did a fantastic job locating it in their lost and found. My only complaint is that they gave me a bit of a hard time because I had to cut off my wristband on the wedding day. I requested for another one that evening and they were almost about to charge me for it. I had to explain that I just had my wedding..had the reception at their sister hotel and did not want the wristband on any of the pictures. Basically, they gave me a new one w/o charge, but I had to put it in writing as to why I took it off. Basically, I found it very irritating. However, that was my only complaint for the whole week. I do only give it four stars because of the beach. The beach at GPR is not great. We always went to Kool Beach Club since the beach there is beautiful. It's only a few minutes walk and soooo worth it. Overall, GPR was great. It was a lovely week for us and our guests.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the Gran Porto Real Resort in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum2000
Reviews.Content: They bate & switch rooms! It's been a while since we were there but they did it to us & our friends that we were traveling with. I was shocked to see the state of the beach there. Our first trip to Playa was in 1998 *& the beach was big & beautiful. That was before the town was discovered and before the cruise ship dock. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay at Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: barneyArkansas
Reviews.Content: The website is very deceiving. It says 7 Restaurants, only 3 with a hut outside by pool serving hamburgers and hotdogs. Two of the Restaurants open at 6 so you are stuck with the buffet inside resort. Food is not good. Sushi bar consists of one tray of California Rolls, Game Room is a tray of fruit and a tray of sandwiches. About a teaspoon of liquor is poured into each mixed drink. They screwed up our room. Didn't get wake up calls ever and over all service stunk. We will never return to Mexico. Our first and last trip.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Fantastic Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TOMAN2
Reviews.Content: Had a great vacation again at the Gran Porto Real. Quick check-in and got a beautiful Suite which faced the ocean. The rooms are very clean and maid service was incredible. The food is still super and the Italian restaurant was my favourite. The staff are so very friendly and helpful to get you anything you need to make your vacation a nice one. Just be friendly back and not a demanding angry tourist !!! They do their best and a excellent best if I do say so!!!!! Activities are great, just get involved with the team, they work very hard and LONG hours to make you have a good time, so particpate and have some laughs, it's your vacation you will get out of it what you put into it ! Julio, Carlos, Natalia, Jesus, Chicken Little and Mike do a great job in the sports and entertainment group. It's hard work and long hours trying to get people to participate in the activites, so do join in , you will be so surprised how much fun you can have, take that first step and trust me you will do it the next day, because you broke that barrier, ENJOY! I have been staying at this Resort 5 times now and would NOT stay at any other Hotel. The staff are like family and so so nice, they "welcome you back home" and they all remember you by name! Super place will be back in the Spring and taking alot of my friends there this time. No other great place, and so convient to everything, 5th ave and all the shopping and clubs are walking distance away! Thank You GPR Staff for making my vacation another memorable one, see you soon !

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Sure”
Reviews.Author: sb1967
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I picked this resort for our honeymoon. We are not the typical honeymooners we are both in our 40"s. We waited 20 plus years to get married, so this was very special. First of all when we got to the resort our reservations were cancelled, but after 20 minutes everything was straightened out. We had a Gran Junior walk out suite and it was beautiful and clean.I was a little disappointed that we didn't get our honeymoon package but that was okay!!! The resort was beautiful BUT the beach was very disappointing we had to go over to the Royal to go to the beach because there were boats and rocks everywhere.The pool was nice but i went there for the beach and the ocean. The food at the buffet was very good and we ate at the Italian and Mexican restaurants a couple of times. The best thing about this resort was that it was close to 5th avenue!!!! I almost forgot stay away from the free breakfast at the Royal that the people in the lobby are going to offer you unless you want to waist 2 1/2 hours becuase IT IS A TIME SHARE or should I say Vacation Packages as they call it. We got pulled in hook, line and sinker. I really do not think that I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all worth it”
Reviews.Author: QueenSheets
Reviews.Content: I had been referred to this hotel from a friend that was traveling with us that had been here a few years before. I knew things would be bad when the front desk offered us a discounted upgrade to the Royal across the street then seemed upset that we turned them down. There were too many kids around without activities to entertain them. There is no swim up bar and no drinks are allowed in the pool (which is a huge draw for us when it comes to AI.) Our mini bar was not restocked with bottled water every day, even though it's supposed to be twice a day. The power randomly went out two nights in a row, the second night it happened several times for several minutes each time and was very disturbing. The pool bar service is VERY slow. The food is barely mediocore. You cannot access the beach for all the fishing boats docked on the shore. I've been to Mexico eight times and this has been the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. The only plus was that you could walk to 5 Ave and to the ferry to Cozumel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: gatormomHoustonArea
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Playa. Had a wonderful time! We were greated as we arrived, tired from an early flight and drive, with drinks! Got checked in quickly and absolutely were speachless at the room! HUGE! It was ocean view, fridge stocked daily, huge bathroom and shower! The cleaning staff left little touches of flowers which was really neat! The hotel was spotless! Hand sanitizer everywhere. And EVERYONE we encountered who worked there was very friendly!!! I cannot say this enough. If you were relaxing by the beach you didn't have to wait long for a cold drink. I prefer cold American beer and was worried about the Mexican beer. But all was good with a lime in it! They also had many mixed drinks! Several evenings we would wander up and down 5th Ave. On the weekends there were entertainers on the streets and art work on display. Our kids are young teens so we weren't really interested in the night life. We ate at both rest. and both were good. The buffet was awesome! Especially the breakfast! Anything you could imagine! Even the snack bar out on the beach was pretty good! They had dance programs in the evening which were pretty interesting. Something different each evening. The only things I could say negative was 1)the beach - sand bags line the beach and you have to climb over them to go into the water which is a bit rocky in areas. Overall not a big deal. You could walk down the beach to all sandy areas. But the rocks at the edge made for beautiful pictures! 2)was the lack of air conditioning. The rooms have AC but pretty much everything else is open air. (There is a small game room with AC) But after a rather warm night of walking the streets I was ready for some AC but not ready to go to the room. Not a big deal though. (I'm from the Houston area and it wasn't as bad as home). 3)you could hear people in the adjoining room, especially at night. Mostly radios or tv. Both girls had fun! They played volleyball and soccer, para sailed and relaxed on the beach! They also used the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: Bris2lUK
Reviews.Content: Only two words can describe our stay at the Gran Porto Real, absolutely amazing!. We are a young couple aged 25 and 26 and stayed at the Gran Porto Real during the first two weeks of June 2009 on an all inclusive basis. We were on one of the first flights from the UK after the swine flu outbreak and there was nothing to worry about. I've never been anywhere so clean! There was constant cleaning of the hotel from top to bottom daily. We had a fantastic time and would highly recommend it to anyone of any age. There were a mixture of age groups from young families, couples and older groups. The hotel has something for everyone. We were there for two weeks of relaxation and pampering, and we got it! We stayed in a standard room which was ok. It didn't have a balcony which was probably the only downside. I would definately go for a suite next time round. The food was great! Plenty of choice at the buffet daily and the two restaurants , Mexican and Italian were good too. We would highly recommend the Italian restaurant if told to choose a favourite. The best thing was that you could eat at the restaurants as many times as you liked! Room service was included also on the all inclusive. Neither of us had any problem with the food. We've been to Egypt and Turkey and both got ill from the food. Not the case here! The pool and service around it each day was undescribable. The staff work so hard and are none stop coming around asking if you would like anything else. We took a shining to Theresa and Jesus who rotated around the beach and pool serving all guests non stop for 10 hours a day. The location of this hotel is ideal whether you are looking for a none stop party time or a chilled and relaxed holiday. 5th avenue is a 2 minute walk from the hotel where there is loads going on in the evenings, whether you are looking for nice restaurants, shops, bars, night clubs etc. There is definately something for everyone. 5th Avenue is just far enough away from the hotel as not to disturb you if you are looking for a quiet time. This truely is an amazing hotel and we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: hemtravel1
Reviews.Content: If there is anything to be said about the Gran Porto Real is that its location is quite possibly the best in all of Playa. GPR is located approx an 8 minutes walk from the central downtown area. Shopping, dining, drinking, nightlife, entertainment, etc... are all at your fingertips. We were with a large group for a destination wedding granted the hotel had nightly shows and entertainment it was not always what the group wanted to do, a quick walk down the street gives you endless options. The amenities at the hotel were nice, but not over the top extravagant. The main pool had great service, but does not have a swim up bar. You are also not allowed to have/carry drinks into the pool or even have them along the pool's edge. Kind of a bummer for some. Grabbing seats at the pool was sometimes a chore, and the music they played got old after awhile. The resort does have another pool on the 3rd floor rooftop that is much smaller, doesn't have much of a view, but does have a small swim up bar with approx 6-8 seats. The bartender at this bar was not half as friendly as the rest of the wait staff at the rest of the resort. My wife mentioned the spa was nice, clean, and the gym facilities were perfect for what she wanted. Being an all-inclusive resort the food left a little to be desired, but one of the main reasons I enjoy traveling is to be able to try different foods/restaurants. The buffet at the beach grill was a nice way to get out of the sun for a little while; one can only eat so many nachos and cheese. We ate at the Italian themed restaurant at the resort which offered a nice change of pace, but you must either eat early (4-5 o'clock) or rather late (9-11) if you want to miss the rush. There was a line out the door and 20 people deep one night at 6:30. We stayed in a Junior Suite with an ocean view. Which means we could see from our balcony a small postage stamp size shot of the ocean. We were in room 124, but many of our friends were on odd numbered rooms which faced the main pool and the ocean. I recommend at check in being on the 3-4th floors, in an odd numbered room for your best view, plus you get a hammock on your balcony on this side of the hotel. This is an excellent hotel in a great location with great staff and wonderful amenities.

Reviews.Title: “It was very peaceful and child friendly”
Reviews.Author: CREIME
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here for 7 days with my family. two boys 11 an 6 wtih another family member 14. everyone had fun. The children had fun and did not want to leave. The hotel was absolutely divine. The intricate detail and design of our room was lovey. Our room had balcony's that were set with resting chairs to lay out and a hamock to lay in. It didn't have a whole lot of activities like other places, but there were some activities that staff got some of us involved in.... Just had to be in the right place at the right time. I was so busy concentrating on relaxing I didnt care. The sun is very hot there so DEFINITELY PACK ON THE SUNBLOCK!!!! I don't usually burn but this time I was hiding from the sun by the end of the week...LOL The beach grill was pleasant and the drinks were superb. Althought the hotel food was a little different, I had already packed a culturally diverse opened mind with me so I can't complain in that area. Everyone had an incredible style of work ethic. The staff was so pleasant it made me wish I spoke Spanish so that I could converse with them more. I left with a little more Spanish vocabulary than when I arrived. It was truely a wonderful family experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: krzysia
Reviews.Content: Location is the best !!!!! close to the fifth avenue what a fun street!!!! hotel is very clean !!!!!! they have sanitizer gels everywere , staff goes beyand being warm and friendly We been at many places but this place will be the number one if it comes to they treat you - everyone is number one there, beach is very nice and again dont worry you will never be thirsty there Jose and others will take care of you wile you lie on the beach, once I was playing in the ocean with my 3 year old son teresa brought us nice cold drinks and I though how nice of them you dont een have to ask so I think that every penny I spend there it was worth it and by the way I lve that hotel it not huge like most of them there so you are just couple steps from the beach in the other hotel you are so far away from wather they have to drive you on a golf cart and not to mention mosquitos, ouch and not to vorry about swine flu everyone is there having fun I am glad that I went there because my faily had the best tie ever!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Was very impressed, especially given the great price”
Reviews.Author: luvs2run27
Reviews.Content: Just returned a couple of days ago. The rooms were gorgeous, the service great, the food was overall quite good for an all-inclusive. The beach was a negative as I also read on another review. Not what I remember from Playa del Carmen when I stayed years ago at an Iberostar. The night life isn't great at the hotel, but there are really fun clubs nearby if you want to spend money on drinks. I would not recommend this hotel for singles. My counterpart didn't go so I was there by myself with friends who are a couple and they had their own room. I actually got bored a few times. It's mostly families and couples. I think I met every single person at the resort and there were only 8 of us!

Reviews.Title: “Its a pleasure to spend my money here.....”
Reviews.Author: Laredo_TXBolovan
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here in june, the hotel is just magnificent. The lobby is incredible. All the staff work really hard to make you feel welcomed. Valet parking was good and rooms service was good. The hotel has a couple of restaurants of which my favorite was the italian. The beach of the hotel is not so great. But the staff makes it ok. There is people constantly asking you is you need a drink or anything. The breakfast and lunch buffet were excellent. The drinks were fine. This hotel is very family orientes, in my case me and my wife traveled alone, and still had a great time. The people at the front desk are excellent. On our last day we went to the spa for massages and we were so happy to do so, because the spa is excellent, not necesarilly the best I have been to, but great. The hotel gives free acces to non motorized aquatic rides and the pool bar is good. The mexican restaurant is also good. The hotel is located real close to the 5th avenue and you can walk to all the bars and clubs. The good thing about playa is that you can be walking alone at 5 in the morning and nobody will bother you. Had and awesome time at oporto, would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the GPR”
Reviews.Author: SBAkp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel August 2008 and was so impressed I re booked again for this year. Due to travel in August again. The rooms were lovely and spacious ( Junior suite Ocean front) and the food was OK. The staff round the pool work really hard all day and keep you topped up with drinks. I found a small tip each morning got me exellent service from them with drinks replaced almost before I had finished the old one. The only drawback was the entertainment. It didnt really bother us too much but it was quite poor. The same people from round the pool all day doing a bit of dancing and singing in the evening with a guest appearence now and again from outsiders. Now don't get me wrong. With young children to put to bed it didn't impact on our Holiday too much at all . In fact we watched it from the suite balcony whilst playig cards. It was all a bit cheesy though and reminded me of hotel entertainment in Benidorm in the 80's Beautiful location and highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort but I probably won't return...”
Reviews.Author: Cozumel-Girl-TX
Reviews.Content: Went with two other couples and had a great time but we all agreed we wouldn't come back to this resort. Rooms were spacious and clean (some days housekeeping came late in the day and they never gave us water even when we laid an empty water bottle next to their tip, strange!) However, room service brought water within minutes of calling. The Italian restaurant was pretty good, didn't try the Mexican as the other guests didn't recommend it. Buffett was decent, omeletts were good but the lunch buffett wasn't too appetizing. Beach buffett was always there with chips, guac, hotdogs, etc... so there was always something to eat. Just wasn't amazing or anything to brag about. Beach area was small and rocky, some friends actually cut their foot open just by trying to get out to the deeper end. Bring beach shoes!! The pool was fine but usually crowded. Overall, if it was my first all-inclusive to Mexico I would say "great" but I've been to nicer and better and so I won't return to the Gran Porto. I prefer a longer stretch of beach and a more spread out resort. This was very cozy and seemed really compacted on this small stretch of beach. And yes, there was construction so you heard noise all day, they did stop in the evening but then the booming loud music would be going off till at least midnight. Again, all in all a fine place but I'll look else where if I return to Playa. It was certainly not a resort I would highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad and The Very Weird And The CockRoaches”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirlusa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Gran for 9 days. First the positive: we got there early and got to check in by one thirty. So that was very nice. The waiters and service was very good they work so hard. We did tip and they appreciated it alot. There were always chairs on the beach and at the pool so we didnt have to get up at 6am like other resorts. The resort seemed clean and well kept. The food was average and we seemed to find something we liked each day. We met alot of nice people....... Now the bad....... First we had a room that was on the first floor to close to the lobby and pool entrance.. Very , very noisy..... But we decided to stick it out cause we didnt want to pack up. 2. COCKROACHES IN OUR ROOM YIKES........ I have been to Mexico 6 other times and have never had this happen. After about the fourth one I went to the front desk they said they would send someone over. i will get to the second part of that in the very weird section...... 3. I booked thru expedia and Best Travel was the ride carrier from the airport.... Beware these people call your room everyday at 9 am and tell you to come to the front to sign in for your ride home, this is really about getting you to sign up for there excusions. We were hounded and hounded. 4. Also beware of the "Come tour our hotel next door scam" THIS IS A TIME SHARE THAT DOES NOT TAKE 90 MINUTES AS PROMISED IT IS HIGH PRESSURE AND TAKES 3 HOURS..... we did not go but met others that did. 5. Maid service is anytime they get around to it. Several days they didnt clean until 6pm. Now the Very Weird....... ok so I told you that I complained about the roarches. Well they did send someone to check our room and then never got back to us or left a note or anything. But i know they came because 1 things were moved around and 2 someone drank half a beer and left it in our garbage can!!!!!!! I could nt believe it !!!!!!!! They other weird thing is and I know this is going to sound crazy but my husband and I think the room was bugged/miked. This is why. The first morning when we didn t sleep and thought about changing rooms we had just got done talking about it and the phone rings ..... it was the front desk wanting to know if we were ready to change rooms. So this continues to happen everyother day. We are in the bathroom and i say to my husband did you use my hand towel could not find it........ Not 3 minutes later a knock on the door and it was the maid with a hand towel. ..... I never asked for it or callled..... Then again with bottled water.... 2 minutes later it showed up at the door..... Far to much of a coincidence for me. Overall I would not stay at the hotel again because of the above mentioned. But if you do dont get a room on the bottem floor by the lobby you wont get any sleep......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cgerk
Reviews.Content: Sixteen of us stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen. We were there for six nights. There are only two ala carte restaurants, which got old after that many nights for dinner. We ate at the buffet one night, which was a great light meal. The hotel has a perfect location to 5th avenue - only two blocks! We made many trips into town. The staff at the hotel is very nice and the rooms are excellent. They had construction noise during our stay but we only noticed it during the day. The beach is very narrow but you can walk for quite a distance. There are boats moored in front of the hotel so there is no swimming beach directly in front of the hotel. If you walk down the beach, either way, you can find a swimming beach. There were always plenty of chairs on the beach and by the pool. This was mainly because we traveled during the swine flu media frenzy. The mexican economy is definitely hurting because of that. We never felt threatened. The upstairs adult pool always had kids in it. The upstairs adult pool bar always closed early, which is a bad thing because the adults are the ones that want to drink. The only bad part of our trip was having the staff take a group photo of us and another staff person joining into the picture without our permission. This ruined the group photo for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, great value!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler110807
Reviews.Content: This was the best trip I have ever done. The location is excellent. The restaurants are EXCELLENT, we had the all-inclusive package and it was definitely worth it. Although we went during the remodelation time we asked for a room change and had no problem. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Pool bar, pool, beach snack bar, italian restaurant with great martinis, mexican restaurant, great breakfast buffet. Location is excellent, it is located at the beginning of 5th Avenue which let's you explore it and every place is in walking distance. Everything was excellent. I would definitely go back without a doubt!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little resort at a great location”
Reviews.Author: kociubin
Reviews.Content: ABOUT US: We're a "reasonable" couple in our late 20's and early 30's traveling with a 2.5 year old son. We've traveled quite a bit in the past five years, including 4 other all-inclussives, India, Egypt, France, Prague, and many others. POSITIVES: Overall, we liked the resort. It's very cozy and has a personality (not like some of the cookie-cutter mega resorts where everything looks the same). It's not quite 5 starts, but it's clean and comfortable. It's also memorable. The rooms (we had a junior suite) are very nice (4 stars), clean, well-decorated, cozy. The staff is well above average for an all-inclussive. They really go out of their way to make you feel genuinely welcome. The beach and pool service was top notch (best I've ever seen). Food is good. About average for an AI. The buffet was fine however it did feel a bit limited. There was always plenty of good stuff to eat, but it was a bit limited. No big deal. The a-la-carte restaurants are OK. Nice decor and ambiance but food being just OK (pretty typical for any AI). Location is excellent. You're in a little town. Not too big and not too small. Many options for dining, shopping and going out. The resort also offers bike tours and rents out bikes for free. DEFINITELY TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THIS. The bike tour is short (free also) but takes you to a nice little secluded beach and a mayan ruin. The size of the resort is its huge advantage. We were right above the lobby so everything was just a short walk from our room. This was very very convenient, especially considering that we were staying with a 2.5 year old who takes five steps sideways for every two forward. Trust me, if you've ever stayed at a mega-restort, you probably know what it's like to be walking 10 minutes to the beach or waiting for little carts to drive you around . You fool yourself into thinking that it's OK or that you get to "walk off the extra calories", but in reality it sucks. It's great to be close to everything. Also, because the resort is small, you get to know people better and the whole vacation feels more personal. For example, everyone got to know our son and would call him by his name and would help us out with him every chance they got. FEW NEGATIVES: In all honesty, the beach isn't very nice, especially if there are waves. Coupled with the sandbags, many parked boats, seaweed and rocks, the beach is not very good for swimming. THIS ISN'T A MAJOR PROBLEM THOUGH because you can just walk five minutes to the left and there are many beautiful beaches for swimming. BTW, the resort beach is fine if you just want to lie under a palapa (plenty of them around). There was some loud construction on weekdays. It stopped during the weekend but was a bit annoying at times. We learned to tolerate it but it was loud enough to get on your nerves at times. Snorkling/water sports: not much snorkling here and no catamarans or windsurfing. Plenty of little sailboats and kayaks though. The beer that was being served at the bars wasn't very good. Not a big deal as you can just drink other stuff, but it wasn't a major brand like Corona or XX. OVERALL IMPRESSIONS: We would recommend the resort. The staff, the charm and the size of the resort make up for the few negatives. ADVICE: -take the free bicycle tour -take advantage of other free activities (they make your stay more fun and memorable) -find the little air-conditioned "game room" with the hokey table, pool table and drinks. It's slightly tucked away so look for it. It's worth it. -explore Playa del Carmen

Reviews.Title: “More amazing than the last 6 times!!!”
Reviews.Author: thesolking
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were originally booked at a different hotel, but due to the swine flu all the hotels dropped their prices. So about 2 weeks before we left we changed to the Gran Porto Real. Having stayed there 5 or 6 times already we know most of the staff. My wife started out contacting Carlos to get the room we wanted. Once again he came through with our request, he always gets us what we need. Thank you Carlos! Arriving at 12:15 we were sent right up to our room. A quick change and off to see our very good friend Philipe at the upstairs pool bar. Philipe always makes sure we get what we want anywhere around the resort. Thank you and see you in November Philipe! Luis the bar manager always made sure we had really good tequila or special rum and took extra care of our drink needs. Yeah we drank alot. Jose a beach waiter always made sure we had drinks usually before we were even ready, thank you Jose. He is a great waiter. Benito also took very good care of us on the beach or at the pool. Jesus and Teresa also rock. Miguel and Jose, bartenders took great care of us in the evenings. Elizar, like all the Capitains always made sure we were having a good time and had what we needed. Once again Rene the head chef took very great care of our dining needs. He specially prepared us ceviche and other fish a few times. Everyone here remembers us everytime we go. We have stayed at 20 other all-inclusive resorts and the Gran Porto is by far in a class of it's own. Sure other resorts take care of you and are nice but not even close to this one. It was very slow due the the swine scare. Never a problem getting chairs anywhere. Usually you need to get to a chair early at most resorts, but we never saw more than about 25-30 people on the beach. Most of the staff didn't work for a few weeks because of the scare, so we tipped about twice what we usually do, and we always tip very well. The employee salaries are very minimal, they really do rely on tips. Tip the maids and put a couple of dollars in the frig for special treats. We would love to go somewhere else and stay but keep coming back to the Gran Porto because we know we will get treated like royalty by everyone at this resort! We will be back Thanksgiving Day again for 10 more days.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Earth”
Reviews.Author: DarlisD
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend (both ladies 40-48 stayed 1 week in an Ocean Front Jr. Suite.... This place is impeccable, beautiful, directly on the beach, 1 block from 5th ave. shopping, what more do you need? The staff is truly amazing, they are more like family than staff, we made so many new friends...we were treated like royalty and could not have had better service. I do not want to recommend this hotel only because there may not be room for us next time we go because this is the absolute perfect place to stay. The beach is fantastic, hotel beautiful, delicious food and the staff is personable and caters to your every need. We cannot wait to go back. I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel and the staff that work there. Mama "D"

Reviews.Title: “Our caring Mexican family”
Reviews.Author: Zwollywood
Reviews.Content: A year after our wedding we finally decided to head off to Mexico for a belated Honey Moon. Here in Europe, the whole "H1N1-virus" news was spreading like a virus itself trying to ruin our trip. We were still set on going! We never regretted it one bit. The staff in the hotel were so friendly. I'm not just talking about the restaurant,entertainment or reception staff, also the gardners,housekeeping, cooks and the people cleaning the beach every morning! We were really impressed by the spotless floors and even after a big rain fall, everything seemed untouched. People working day and night to insure an impeccable stay. The food was really good and there was a wide variety to choose from, be it breakfast,lunch or dinner. If we were to lazy to go to the buffet restaurant, you could also eat at the beach. The waiters Benito,Jesus,Jose and Margerita made sure we stayed hydrated during our stay at the beach. Hardworking and friendly people. Then there was the Entertainment-Team...Even under the hot Mexican sun they managed to organize fun stuff to do and even if you hadn't set your mind on an activity, they managed to animate you to join what ever and have fun. Anything ranging from sports,games and getting creative.Feel like learning some salsa moves or spanish class? They had it all! Great team, fun people! Every night they had a different theme going on at the dance-stage that made you wanna join in and dance too. Great dances were performed. At day time you could go kayaking,sailing in a tiny sailboat or snorkling. A guy named Hugo took us out snorkling and we saw amazing fish at the pier. He knew where you could spot the prettiest fish! The beach itself was okay. They had sandbags to keep the sand from washing away but that didn't stop me from going for my daily swim. The other side of the beach(where the sister-resort is) were no sandbags and is a longer and outstretched beach. It's just around the corner. Our room was very clean and every evening we were suprised to find a fine piece of "Towel Art" on our bed or chocolates on our pillow. Minibar was re-filled daily. The hotel also offers tours to different places ranging from snorkling,diving and other adventures or easy-going trips. Gran Porto Real is great for a short break and we had a great stay. We felt safe, at home and very relaxed. We're definately going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: guera40
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great get-away this is the place!! The Hotel is gorgeous and the staff is wonderful. The whole flu thing was so blown out of proportion!! Don't even think of cancelling your trip. Everything is just fine there!!! The weather and the beaches are perfect! The staff treat you like family and I guarantee it will be the best vacation you have ever had!!!

Reviews.Title: “we have been there 3 times already and will go back again!”
Reviews.Author: LapinOttawa
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, clean and well maintain hotel with some 250+ rooms which is nice because the staff remembers you after a couple of days and you feel like a VIP. The service is excellent, the people really get out of their ways to serve you and make your stay a very pleasant one. We were there when the H1N1 flu started but we actually only found out about the flu once we returned to Canada as there were no sign of any illness or anybody being sick at the hotel or anywhere in Playa for that matter. As I indicated in my title review, we are planning to go back to this hotel many more times...of course if health and money permits it!!! Very Satisfied customer

Reviews.Title: “I had a fabulous time!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaGal67
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 10 day holiday at the Gran Porto Real and had a wonderful time. It is the second time my boyfriend and I have stayed here in the last 6 months and this time was every bit as good as the first. We had a third floor ocean front room which was fabulous and the staff all remembered us from the first visit which made us feel very special. The hotel is spotless and the staff every last one of them, were polite, efficient, friendly and they always had a smile. We ate at the buffet for breakfast and lunch and never tired of the variety or quality of the food. Mirna always greeted us with a smile and a “good morning” then Fuentes and Florencio looked after us once we sat down! Our evenings were spent at the Italian and Mexican restaurants which were both very good with Freddie (who remembered us from our last visit) looked after us very well. We also spent a lot of time at the Royal’s Asiana restaurant which was also excellent. The Gran Porto’s proximity to 5th Ave is very handy for after dinner strolls to get rid of the good food and also gives us ladies a chance to go shopping! Days were spent at the lovely beach where Jesus looked after us in fine fashion. Suffice to say we never had to wait long for a drink. Again the hotel’s location makes “beach walking” a great pastime with lot’s to see as you walk up and down the beach and with Jesus to greet us on our return with a drink, what more could we ask for! We returned home in fine health and no signs of any flu and needless to say, we can’t wait to go back. The Gran Porto certainly exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A great adventure and honeymoon with every need met with a smile”
Reviews.Author: MarkSyracuseNY
Reviews.Content: Hospitality and service was amazing with an all inclusive menu of food and drinks that did not disappoint everyday. Many activities at the hotel and area tours for about $100 USD on average for the two of us each day. Great value and the perfect honeymoon. The fifth street shopping provided night time entertainment and many different shops. We have been on trips to Puerto Rico and the Dominican and this was by far the best and most for our money. Looking forward to returning to the area and hotel to celebrate our marriage and life in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: SussexSavvy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the last leg of our honeymoon. We were perfectly happy with the hotel in general, our room and the food but there were too many annoying things which stopped this from being as good as it could be. Of primary annoyance is that virtually all the staff presume that everyone is from the USA and don't bother to find out otherwise before bombarding you with a US specific approach. To be fair the staff did try to be friendly even though there were a lot of very rude guests who treated them very badly. Sadly, whilst there were some lovely US people that we met during our stay, without exception all the rude, excessively drunk and aggressive guests were from the USA and were very bad ambassadors for their country. The location was pretty good, and breakfast was reasonable and plentiful. We didn't sample the evening food as we hate 'all inclusive' deals that tie you to the same place, and anyway there were so many other places to choose from on the main restaurant strip. Wandering around the main areas of the town in the evening was a joy, and every bar and restaurant we went in during our stay was very friendly with great food. It's just a shame that the hotel itself fails to notice that not all their guests want to listen to loud music on the beach. When we did get a break from the music, all we could hear when we were trying to relax on the beach was the constant blowing of a whistle for up to an hour at a time as around a dozen people played water volleyball in the main pool. Shame that three hundred other people had to be disturbed by the activities of just 12 or so others. This hotel is good, but could be so much better. Unfortunately, I think that it is a victim of its own success and also it's proximity to a more financially dominant country nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, B- Menu”
Reviews.Author: moneywonder
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort, the grounds are well manicured, the rooms are clean and have a more expensive look and feel. Tile floors, large showers, comfy bed, amazing pool and great drinks, try the mango. The walk out ocean front rooms don't offer the best view, our room was the Junior Suite Ocean Front and was located on the middle level with a wonderful view of the ocean and pool area. Our shower temperature was malfunctioning two of the five days we were there but the staff was very attentive and helpful. They will exchange money right in the hotel which is a plus. Be sure to take the bus from the Airport if you don't get in too late, our experience with a taxi (10 passenger van) was scary to say the least. Short of the long is, dark, rainy, shady driver, exploding tire, strange man in Dodge Neon taking us the rest of the way to the Gran Porto Real: we thought our life was going to end that night... The food was ok at the beginning, after a few days it all tastes the same. The mexican restaurant is not actual Mexican food, they try to cater to various tastes of many international travelers and I have to say for the most part the food was bland. The buffet was good but again, we got sick of everything even though the mix up the menu a bit. I usually love eating while traveling and this was the exception. The food was included in the price of the resort so you might feel guilty if you go downtown to eat when you could eat for free at the resort. There are many restaurants downtown that had great menus and reasonable prices. I would suggest eating out a couple nights. Breakfast was good, fruit, cereal, toast, juice.... don't drink the Papaya juice, it tastes horrible. Burgers on the beach for lunch were ok, fries ok.... The club down the beach will pound their music until 4 am on Friday and Saturday night, bring earplugs....

Reviews.Title: “Everything you can possibly want in a hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: coco068
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have 2 children, 12 and 18yrs....they both did not want to return...need I say more??! Our youngest is a very picky eater...no problem ask and you shall receive! Now that's service! we all would recommend this hotel. It is close to downtown 5th Ave....a block away and you are in another fantasy world with everything at your disposal! WOW I cannot wait to go back. We did not even have to worry about taxi' I really have to emphasize on the food ! OH God was it Hummmmmy! I wish I was there right now. Keep up the good work every one. The service is fantastic. You all made me feel so good and at home. Thank you !!! Sophie

Reviews.Title: “Best ever”
Reviews.Author: pocololo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 18 times in the last 10 years. It gets better every visit!!! Swine flue is way overrated! Don't believe the news media! Go, You will have the time of your life! The staff is the best! Enjoy your stay! Food is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous week well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: TNOrange
Reviews.Content: We had a great week in PDC at the Grand Porto Real. The front desk manager Carlos really cares about your stay and wants it to be be a great experience for you. With the Flu scare going on at the time the hotel staff was cleaning the public areas 24/7. The food was good and you have several restauants to choose from. Most people do not realize there is a roof top pool with swimup bar for adults only. The beach pool area is great and we had a great pool bar attendent in Moreau. A small tip will get you non stop service everytime your drink is half gone. The hotel staff was super nice and Carlos was an shining example of the staff. Hotel is a short one block walk from the 5th which has the great shopping. Being a travel agency owner and used to rating hotels for their value. I found GPR to be an excellent value and will reccomend to my clients. My wife loved it and she always wants to get her moneys worth. We will return soon and send many clients in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Week of paradise”
Reviews.Author: sunnydaysiowa
Reviews.Content: Having been to other all-inclusive in the Playa Del Carmen area and this being our first stay at the Grand Porto Real Resort and Spa, we fell in love with the place. Its the perfect location and the resort is not a mega resort it gives you a nice comfortable feel to be able to get your way around and see many of the same fellow guest each day. The staff is fantastic and caters to you from morning til night. We tipped the staff often. I know with the all-inclusive you don't need to, but when you see how hard they work around the clock and always are smiling, you just want to give them a little extra for the great work they are doing! We ate at the buffet and Mexican and Italian restaurants. They were all pretty good. We did try room service one morning for breakfast because they do offer a few choices that are not normally on the breakfast buffet. The room service was great. We also tried room service one night when we got back up to our room and wanted some wine, a few minutes later we had a knock on our door with room service bringing up a full bottle of wine and 2 glasses- That was great! Our first night we had a standard junior suite that faced the street. Great nice size room. The following morning we decided to upgrade and get a room facing the ocean and beach. Which we were glad we did. The room was very nice, had a balcany with a hammock. the room also had a drink dispensor with vodka, whisky, rum and tequila. Our room was also located on the beach we were on the 2nd floor, right below our room is where they set up for all the weddings that take place on the beach. This was wonderful and gave us a chance to see about 5 weddings that took place during the week at the resort. They go to a lot of work to set up and take down for the ceremonies. We spent most our days just laying in the beach chairs by the pool. we did try laying on the beach a few times, but found a few woman laying out european style, so we decided to move as we just weren't that comfortable having that view starring at us...if you know what I mean. The nightly entertaiment was fairly good too. The only downside is that once the entertaimnet is over, there isn't much night life left to happen, so we just hung out at the pool side bar and drank until that closed. I know we would like to have more music that is played later in the evenings and also during the day while laying out by the pool. They do play music but only have speakers on one side of the pool, so if you are on the other side you can't really hear the music or hear what they announce at times from the entertaiment crew. Overall this was our best vacation we had, just a wonderful week of relaxing and getting pampered. The resort is very clean, and the staff works around the clock keeping on top of things.
