If you are looking for a extra fun spot to try, right down the beach from our resort is a bar on the beach called Infusions they play great Raggae music every day from 4pm-6pm. There are fishing boats right outside our beach area that offer deep sea fishing, we went out for a 1/2 day fishing trip and had a great time. We paid $200 plus you tip the boat captain. We saw several sea turtle swimming as we sailed too. If you are into fishing, this is a must to try as well. I know we are hoping to make it back next year as we wouldn't want to stay any where else than this resort, its very charming and it fit all our needs we were looking for to make our trip paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, great location”
Reviews.Author: pawnit2002
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real is great. The resort has an unbelievable location, great staff and awesome beach. Forget what you hear or see about sand bags on the beach and what not. We loved the proximity to 5th ave. The ONLY downside to Gran Porto in the fact that the bars close at 9pm. There is a 24hr bar there, but it is self serve, and 100% indoors. I don't mind helping myself, but being indoors when its 85 degrees at 9pm? Not for me. The beach is perfect. Like I said, avoid what you hear about sand bags. Once you're there, you won't even notice them. The restaurants are average at best, but as far as I'm concerned, that is expected. The pool on the roof never had any traffic during our stay, and Felipe is a great bartender. Be sure to check out the windows in the pool if you go, they are kind of cool. The pool near the beach is very nice. Plenty of seating. Has a small section for kids. The beach Buffet has servers that will bring drinks to you, just be sure to do the right thing and tip a little. Overall, a great place. We loved it, and will surely be back soon. Hopefully sometime this year!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: valerie5425
Reviews.Content: I traveled and stayed alone at the GPR in November for a friend's wedding. I booked the airport transfer along with my room, which worked out great. The hotel was wonderful and quiet - definitely not a mega-resort. As it was not the high season, it wasn't terribly busy. Service was excellent, food was pretty good. Room was perfect for me since I didn't spend much time in it. The location was fabulous! I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: ROBII
Reviews.Content: This is not the type or size of hotel we would typically stay at, but for first timers to Playa del Carmen, this place was excellent. This is an “all inclusive” hotel which we have experienced only once prior. We were a party of eight couples and I do not recall hearing any major complaints. Most of us had junior suites that are plenty large and nicely appointed. One couple was given two double beds when a king had been requested, but that was the only complaint I head. We requested a “walk out” suite because they come with a private palapa. That was very nice, but we actually seldom used our specific palapa. We ate dinner at three of the hotels restaurants and there were no complaints. The included red and white wine selections were acceptable but there is a “premium” wine list you may order from if you feel it’s necessary. We did. Breakfast, in one form or another, was usually had in the hotel. It is an ample breakfast buffet offering everything you might want, and all very good. Service throughout was friendly and helpful. The beach is not the best in the area, but not any worse than most. The newer, sister hotel next door has a better beach, is “adults only” and some other upgrades, but you are still at a large hotel. I am not sure it is worth the price unless you really want to avoid kids. The hotel’s location is excellent. While not there yet, as Playa del Carmen develops north, this will be the center of town. Either way, it is terribly convenient to everything you want to do in town. We did take a cab once or twice because we were lazy or in a hurry, but walking or riding a bike, you can get to most anything you want or need.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Resort”
Reviews.Author: LondonOnLondoner
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here the first week of Feb.. This is a beautiful spot that is just the right size, immaculately kept, and right in Playa del Carmen, so always lots to do and see. I have stayed at 9 all-inclusives in Mexico, Puerto Plata and Cuba, and this is the only one that I would definitely return to. The room was spacious and clean (and yes, you really could fit 8 people comfortably in the shower), the food at the Italian restaurant (we ate there every night) was excellent, and the staff were friendly and accomodating. My ONLY complaint was the loud hard-partying group that arrived on our second last day. After being woken a second time in the night, with yelling, screaming and glass-smashing in the hallway outside our door, we tried asking the people to keep it down (to no avail), then calling the front desk to ask someone to look into it. Apparently no one did, as it went on all night ... we were grateful to be leaving (sans sleep) the next day. The hotel really should have provided security to look after this kind of matter, for the comfort of other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall resort in the heart of Playa del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaSunseekers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two children, ages 4 and 6, stayed at this beachfront resort in Playa del Carmen from April 08/09 to April 15/09. If you like an all-inclusive resort with lots of activities, entertainment, excellent food and drinks, and minutes away from the famous 5th Avenue district, than this resort is for you. The resort is also very close to Xcaret, so it's location simply cannot be beat in the Mayan Riviera. However, if you prefer a secluded, quiet resort with ample beach space and lots of fellow tourists, then this resort is NOT for you. The real advantages to this resort are as follows: - smaller, family atmosphere with a cozy feel, and the resort itself is impeccably clean and well-staffed in evey aspect - the buffet, the grill, and the two a la carte restaurants all serve excellent, fresh food, with lots of variety - the staff is very friendly and the overall service levels are very high The disadvantages to this hotel are as follows: - the standard rooms are VERY SMALL for a family of four, there is no balcony, and there is NO bathtub in a standard room - there is very little quality beach area left here, as the hurricanes have taken their toll, and the Caribbean waters were rough here, and it is very windy every day - there is really NO swimming area for small children, as the majority of the pools are 4'9" deep, and I was concerned with the water quality of the pools Nonetheless, I would rate this hotel 4 out of 5, and would recommend it to fellow travellers with children! For couples and older children, your time would be better spent elsewhere in a much larger resort away from Playa del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back in a heartbeat! Edmonton, Alberta”
Reviews.Author: Happy357
Reviews.Content: We spent the week of March 29 to April 5th in this resort. We travelled with a 12 and 10 year old. We had an excellent experience from the moment we arrived. We went with Westjet Vacations which included transportation to the hotel. Since it is about an hour drive to the hotel, having this prearranged was the way to go. We had an absolutely beautiful room, very spacious with a few balconies facing the ocean and beach. The room was always very clean and well stocked. The beds were very comfortable and the staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating. There were often activities going on around the hotel including water activities in the pool, pottery painting, table tennis and nightly shows. The entertainment staff were enthusiastic and very pleasantly welcoming to all. I especially appreciated the way that they invloved the kids. We really enjoyed the location since we had the option of going to the beach or venturing out for a short walk to 5th Avenue for shopping, restaurants and the sights. It is also a short walk to the ferry which takes you to beautiful Cozumel in 40 minutes for a reasonable fee. We could have prebooked many tours from the hotel, but we chose to venture out and take the collectivos to a few places on our own. They were great and we enjoyed travelling with the local people. This was definitely less expensive and we met many wonderful Mexican people who shared with us some of there suggestions about where to go and what to see. The food was good. The best selection was at the hotel's buffet. There were many choices for everyone. We will definitely be back! Thank you to all at The Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto with Kids”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Lana
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am going to try to cover things that weren't overly covered by everyone else... First, I think your opinion of this hotel will depend greatly on what your ideal "Riviera Maya" vacation looks like. If you are the type who is dreaming of a secluded mega resort, private and removed from the world, venturing out only on planned excursions - you probably wont like the Gran Porto Real. If however, you like to stay at a great place but experience the culture and people of the area, you will love it. For instance, while the upper part of the beach is reserved for the resort guests, the lower part (near the water) is open to tourists and locals walking by, Mexican children splashing in the ocean, etc. We loved the people watching but some may not feel it is private enough. Also, the resort is only a block away from 5th street which is the main walking street of Playa del Carmen - mostly touristy shops and restaurants (including a Starbucks) but many locals stroll there too. Grab a bike from the hotel and in a 15 minute ride you can be where the locals eat, shop and live. Also, as some have mentioned the room classifications may be somewhat deceiving. "Oceanview" means a room that faces the Royal resort. However, if you walk all the way out on your balcony and look to your right, down at the end of the street you can see the ocean. "Oceanfront" generally means facing the pool area with the ocean behind. If you want more of a real ocean view, consider the walk out rooms. Next - tips for those traveling with small children. We had 2 kids with us, ages 2 and 5. We found everyone to be very kind and helpful with the kids. They do have a kids club for ages 4 and up. My 5 year old kept asking to go back although we tried to limit it because they mostly watched movies and played video games. But it would be great for parents who need some alone time. Luckily, Grandparents came with us so that was not a problem. For the room - if you are not on the first floor be warned that there are steps half way down the hallways to the rooms. So, like for us halfway down on the third floor - we could take the stroller up the elevator but then had to carry the stroller up or down about 7 steps. So maybe ask for one near the elevator so that you dont have to do that. Kind of silly. As for dining with kids, they are welcome in any of the restaurants but we only brought them to the buffet. We did see small children at the other restaurants though. They do have high chairs. The bad things were that for every meal they have these really spindly tall wine glasses on every table with hard tile floors below - a distaster waiting to happen. However, we only had to ask once and every time we came down after, they removed them before we sat down. They do have plastic cups, plates and even silverware sitting right by the host podium when you walk in. We often just asked for a plate and filled it up at the buffet and let the kids eat by the pool or in the room. We also did room service once. Also, when you walk in they keep the tall stacks of glass plates for the buffet right at waist level of a 5 year old. We had to keep reminding him "dont touch the plates." The food was very fresh and we had no worries about the kids eating it. Also, they loved drinking non-alcoholic frozen drinks! For the pool and swimming - there is a kiddie pool - it is basically just a section of the main pool that is one foot deep and has columns that keep the kids from falling in the deep end. It was great and they had loads of fun. However, do note that my 2 year old could squeeze through the last column so you still need to keep a good eye on them. There are 2 other areas that are semicircles 1 foot deep - they played in those too although there is nothing separating them from the deep water. Do note that throughout the hotel, there is beautiful tile floors - beautiful but slippery. Including the hotel room. Even the area right as you enter the hotel from the pool is this kind of tile. At least 4 times my kids had huge, feet flying out from under them, terrible head banging crashes while walking on wet floors. You may want to consider grippy water shoes or sandals and have them stay on at all times. This may also be a major consideration for other people with balance issues. There is at least 2 women who's entire job is mopping the floors - all day long so they do try. Overall, it was a great trip - the kids had a blast, we had a great time too!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for just about anyone”
Reviews.Author: TropicalPrincessLea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 8 days - and loved the entire trip! The location is perfect, a bit secluded but right near the action. It's an easy 5 minute stroll to the heart of Downtown Playa - and the Cozumel ferry. The wristbands were plastic and a bit uncomfortable, but OK. There are timehsare folks here, just refuse firmly and they will leave you alone. Remember, they are just doing their job, and deserve respect unless they don't give you the same. The rooms are grand and spacious - the minibar and liquor service in the room was very nice too. The housekeeping staff does an excellent job of making you feel welcome. The buffet was great, and the fresh fruit and fruit juices are fantastic! We made mimosas (free champagne flows freely) with mango juice, creating our own "mangimosas" - try it!! The mexican food was good, not the best but better than expected for an all-inclusive. The view from the restaurant was fantastic, the white powdery beach is near and the beautiful Caribbean is right there. The ala carte restaurants were disappointing, with strange food combinations, very small portions, and the flavors were...bad. However, there are a multitude of great restaurants on 5th Ave, just a few blocks away. We loved La Caprichoza, and there's a Carlos and Charlie's in a great upstairs location as well. The resort staff was very gracious and accomodating, and the bartenders were good at their jobs...they would remember you after a bit and try to make your drink upon sight. The hotel itself is large, but we were very impressed with all the private-feeling places. You can find a piece of beach, or lobby, or bar, or just an alcove with seats and views of the fabulous ocean. All in all, very very pleased with our stay, and we would definitely return. We did not have any of the problems other reviewers have had, with check-in, or timeshare pressure, or any of it. The kid's club looked great and the kids were having a blast. We don't have any, but it was nice that they had activities to busy them so they didn't bother us at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great food!”
Reviews.Author: SMLarson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real because friends were getting married there - I wasn't sure if it would be worth it, but it ended up being easiest for us to book with the wedding party, and I'm so glad we did! We had an oceanfront walk-out room, which allowed us to eat across the street at the Royal as part of our all-inclusive meal package - we greatly enjoyed the added variety of restaurants, but ALL of our meals (at the Gran Porto Real AND the Royal) were absolutely fantastic. The hotel is so close to 5th Avenue (shops and restaurants) and a short walk from the ferry to Cozumel. The only (very slight) criticism we had was that the bars pretty much shut down around 10 pm - you could still mix your own drinks, or occaionally you could hop on the resort bus to visit another location, or walk over to 5th Avenue, but other than that it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Check your room location”
Reviews.Author: daisyblue8
Reviews.Content: We had reserved an ocean front room and received a second floor room directly above the lounge area. We could hear everything going on with the nightly entertainment directly below us. Luckily we were able to transfer to the third floor on the second night and it made a major difference in terms of cutting down on the noise level. The view of the pool below and the Caribbean Sea beyond was lovely. Make sure you see your room prior to check-in, especially if you are spending the extra money on an ocean front room. Some of these rooms overlooked the cruise ship pier and seemed quite close to the main street. Overall, the service in the hotel was excellent and the food was fine (although it would be rather monotonous beyond a one week stay).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndreOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from 22 to 29 March. A couple, early fifties, second all-inclusive in Mexico. The location of this place is awesome. Right in the middle of everything, 2 blocks from 5th Ave. The check-in was good, got our room by 1430. Our flight was early but they gave us the bracelets just the same while we waited for the room. We had reseved a ocean front jr suite on the third floor and it was a beautiful large room room with a balcony. Time-share people, we did not see. The first night, they placed a card on our door telling us that we had an appt the morning after for 0900 with a gift. That went in the trash and we never heard of them again. The pool is very nice, water is fine and the place is cleaned everyday. A lot of the chairs have towel on them by 0600. Good bar service . Activities 2-3 times a day. The beach is also very nice with sun shelters and plenty of lounge chairs. Waiters at both the pool and the beach. Buffet hut for the afternoon with hot-dogs, burgers, fries and tortilla chips for those who do not wish to go inside for lunch. As well, there is a massage hut with 2 masseuses. Many chairs there are reserved early as well. For those who want to spend a lot of time at the beach, I would consider the suites on the first floor with walk-out to the beach, it comes with 4 lounge chairs and your own sun-shelter. No need to reserve, the back row is all for those suites with signs saying reserved by suite number. At check-in, everyone is given a card for a beach towel. You can exchange the towel when you want by the pool. Our room had a mini-fridge with 8 sodas, 2 beers and 4 small bottles of water, stocked every day. Also had a liquor dispenser with rum, vodka, gin and tequila. The bathroom was large with a shower big enough to wash a small car. TV, DVD player, clock radio and electronic safe were all working fine. A small table and 2 chairs on the balcony and a hammock as well. There are water dispensers all over the place and ice machine on all the floors and that is a nice touch. There are 2 restaurants for dinner and a buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The food is good, I would give it a 3.5 out of 5. If someone stays there for 2 weeks, I can see where it would get a little boring after a while. One can buy access to the restaurants at the resort across the street, we did not. There are several restaurants on 5th Ave, we went out one night and had a good meal. As someone else mentionned earlier, this resort is managed in the most efficient manner. Everyone is working very hard, the place is cleaned from top to bottom every 24 hours. The service at the this resort is simply outstanding and I do not think that it gets any better than that. You can book excursions right there if you wish. There was a show everynight and a couple of nights we had 5 or 6 vendors of gift and stuff. Good all-inclusive resort.

Reviews.Title: “This was the best week of my life... I can't wait to come back next year!!!”
Reviews.Author: ckJASPER0490
Reviews.Content: All the staff was wonderful! Housekeeping made sure our room was clean, and stocked the way we prefered; The bellboys ensured that we got to go on the tour we wanted to go on; my 5 year old son wanted to go to the kid's club everyday; and the beach waiter knew each of our preferred drinks! I especially appreciated the high level of security! The best part was that we even learned some Spanish! Everything and everyone was absolutamente perfecto y hermoso!!! I can't wait to come back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: SeaBreezeMinnesota
Reviews.Content: WE just returned from a dreamy 7 day family vacation at the Gran Porto Real Resort. Our family of 5 from MN had never been to an all-inclusive resort....we had done cruises in the past. I would return to this resort tomorrow if I could. It was beautiful....very very clean and well kept and the staff and service were TOP NOTCH. All the staff were always working so hard to make sure you had the BEST service. WE spent nearly EVERYDAY on the beach....enjoying the breeze and beautiful ocean. Each day 2 waiters REALLY made our days noteworthy......Pablo and Jesus.....these guys work SO SO hard in the hot sand walking and serving drinks and taking away garbage. Everytime they approach you they have a genuine SMILE on their face and really would do anything for you. THey were serving SO many people but always remembered what you ordered and brought it promptly and then came back just in time for the next order. We hope that a lot of travelers will write in about these 2 servers as they deserve some special RECOGNITION!!!!!!!!!! We found it hard to say good bye to them. Everything at this resort was superb......great food.......many diff choices........just TOP NOTCH and walking distance to the fun 5th street for shopping . You won't be disappointed if you go to this resort...our kids....ages 11, 17, and 19 all had a blast!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the truth about the gran porto real”
Reviews.Author: rb888
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, It Is absolutly beautiful It had a rich spanish look with a awsome pool and a great beach, But the best part was the way It was ran, It Is a well oiled machine. THE ROOMS: we had a junior suite with 2 beds and balcony over looking the street a beautiful cobble stone tropical street with great people watching, our friends paid $2000.00 more to overlook the ocean, I found the street much more Interesting,the rooms were spacious and grand and very clean! THE HOTEL: It was the perfect size not to big not to small beautiful and spotless, the location Is important to mention right on the beach yet only a block from 5th avenue a very cool street endless cobble stone and shopping!!THE BEACH: the beach did have a section with sand bags working like a retaining wall ,nice soft sand and crystal clear water, there were rocks in the water In certain area's but they were working on getting them out every day,right across the street I found a perfect beach about two miles long and great swimability, they also have boogie boards, kayacks, sail boats all completly free to hotel guest's! ALL-INCLUSIVE/FOOD: This was perhaps the best part of the hotel ,traveling with children the all-inclusive was perfect,I've been to other hotels that are all-inclusive and they try to get you eat at the buffet or serve bottom shelf liquor but not this place they don't play any games ,high end liquor and all the food you could eat. they have 2 very nice restraunts a mexican and an Italian also a buffet and they also have a pool shack that has burgers hot dogs nachos pizza ect. all day long. they also allow you to order room service once a day I really liked that option on top of that they have a 24 hour game room with a beer tap liquor bottles ,water bottles, pop and snacks and If that's not enough they have a mini bar In your room that they stock daily with pop ,beer, water, mineral water "free of charge", the service was great they wait on you at the pool and the beach or any where you sit down In the hotel your never thirsty, my children ordered virgin pina colados all day long It would have cost me a small fortune somewhere else!THE STAFF: The staff Is really what makes this place they bend over backwards for you they are hard working and always smiling I saw a couple of craby people they didn't get their room the minute they wanted It and It was actually several hours before check In anyway,but the staff never lost their cool very very polite,they work hard the place stay's completly spotless!THE WEATHER: I was there for 10 days and one day It was cloudy In the morning but cleared up by lunchtime every day was perfect! THE BOTTOM LINE: I felt I really got alot of bang for my buck and the location was key tranquil and private feel at the hotel but your still where the action Is 1 block away and feels like a celebration Is going on. I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Krunssila
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We stayed there between 22.2-8.3.09. Weather was good almost all the time. Best places to relax were the beautiful pool area and the awesome beach. Junior suite ocean view room was large and nice. Breakfast and lunch were great but they should pay attention to dinner, for example meat wasn't always so good. Italian restaurant was our favorite. We give ten points to hotel staff and service. Hotel location is the best in Playa del Carmen (our opinion), only 100 hundred meters from 5th avenue. We will come back to this hotel some day!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tannedsouthernMN
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. Not one complaint. The drinks and food were great. David, in the lobby bar sure did know how to make a tasty margarita.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip turns bad”
Reviews.Author: SierraBc
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice hotel, comfortable and the rooms are clean, and the service is pretty good. Staff are friendly and accommodating! There weren't enough elevators if one is travelling with someone who has had a knee replacement or an elderly as the whole building is concrete/rock/tile. The first night we checked were given a room with a view overlooking the street when we had paid for a deluxe oceanview room. After voicing my displeasure we were switched rooms the next day and it was a little better. My biggest complaint is the quality of the food.. it all looked good but i was very leery and stuck mostly to bread/eggs/cheese/chicken. Sure enough by the time we got home to Canada was diagnosed with Hep A .. i was NOT happy! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who was looking for a medium priced/quality rooms but we would prefer to stay somewhere else. The Spa was wayyyyy overpriced as they wanted to charge $70 U.S. for a pedicure. Oh and yes, the time share people are brutal, they mislead you into offering a tour of the hotel across the street and free breakfast (which of course you have already paid for) then they make you sign a contract for 90 minutes at which time several people take turns trying to lure you into parting with a lot of money. These guys are marketing professionals "slick" people! That left a bad taste in our mouths for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty place but several negatives”
Reviews.Author: Holasunshine
Reviews.Content: I finally got around to posting; lazy me: the hotel occupies a city block at the Playa Del Carmen beach, which means some plusses and minuses: PLUSSES: easy access to PDC shops, transport, entertainment and ferry to Cozumel; MINUSES: the hotel occupies all the land, so there are almost no trees, flowers or grounds, no tennis, sports, etc, tiny entertainment area, and the pool is very small for the number of pepole staying there. I disliked being coerced into paying $200 to upgrade to the room we had already booked but we had no choice: the offered room was awfully small and the view was a wall. Considering the bargaining started at $500, I felt we did not do badly haggling but you and I should not have to deal with desk staff that are bonused to sell you upgrades all the time. The time share sales guy was incessant (the time share grand hotel is directly opposite; do NOT take the tour they offer). The service staff (not the desk staff, who do not know the word service) are wonderful and charming. Some of the entertainmnet staff were surly (the young guys) but overall the satff were good. This is a hotel that has ben enlarged several times and some of the areas are very noisy. The spa is great (just take the steam room, sauna and plunge pool which are free) and the a la carte restaurants were great. The buffet is also good. The beach is [-] awful: man made sand over rock and reinforced slippery sand bags; dangerous and yucky. The beach side of the hotel has lovely architecture. We paid just under $1,000 Canadian each, for everything including all taxes. We would not stay here because of the beach, lack of space and the rip-off of the upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “All Inclusive, Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: wruwtrix
Reviews.Content: We booked a large group through a travel agency in Minneapolis, traveling for a wedding. Overall, we had a great time and had few complaints about the trip. Transportation to the resort was PAINFULLY long. We stopped at 4 other resorts before ours, and the advertised 45 minute travel time took over an hour and a half (blame the travel agency, not the hotel, I suppose). We were met by more painfully slow service at the front desk. It took 10 minutes to get any help, and a really unreasonably long time to get checked-in, in my opinion. Not a great start to the day. Everything after that was really great, however. Our hotel room was a standard suite (base room) - faced a fairly noisy street with some construction that started at 8:30am every morning. However, the room was very clean, had nice furnishings, and was huge! For marginally more (really, not very much at all), we could have booked an Ocean View Junior Suite. Several people in our group stayed in those rooms, and I would 100% say they are worth the extra $20 per night. Beautiful rooms, nicer bathrooms, great ocean/beach views, hammock, in-room bar, etc. We sure regretted not reserving one of those rooms once we got there (there was no room to upgrade - in fact, the hotel was overbooked and sending people to the nearby Royal hotel). For breakfast, you have 3 choices: cold continental breakfast, buffet, room service. For lunch you have 4 choices: beach snack buffet, normal buffet (same as lunch, and much of the same food), sushi bar, or room service. For dinner you have 4 choices: gourmet italian, gourmet mexican, normal buffet, room service. Eating at the all-day buffet got really old after about 4 days. We ate at the gourmet restaurants most nights, but breakfast and lunch at the same buffet were too much. Overall, the food was good. There were no meals where we didn't all find something we liked. I couldn't imagine staying here for two weeks though, always with the same food - every day! Beach drink service was always great. The servers were friendly and fairly prompt. The beach buffet was overrun by seagulls. We quit trying to get any chips and guacamole (which was really delicious) after the second day when a seagull attacked one in our group carrying a plate back to the beach chair area. Our best meal at the hotel was when my boyfriend and a couple of others went deep-sea fishing through the hotel and brought back several amberjacks (similar to tuna). We had a fairly large group, and the hotel chef specially cooked one of the fish for us. They set up a large table area just for us and brought out the best fish I have ever had in my life. There were several daily activities if you wanted to participate. I had a great time on the bike tour, and others tried the kayak tour and liked that, too. The on-site snorkel gear is really crap, and there's not a whole lot to look at near the hotel as far as snorkeling goes. You'd want to go to Akumal or Cozumel for that. The pools on-site were freezing cold (I'm from Minnesota, do lap swimming in pools here, and I thought the water was unbearable...). I would consider going here again, but I generally prefer a non-all-inclusive resort setting. I'm not a heavy drinker or eater, and I would prefer the variety of the wealth of nearby restaurants and bars. It was a nice introduction to the area in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of everything is here!”
Reviews.Author: mex3
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and so helpful, the hotel was beautiful and prices were great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but buffet so-so and be wary of the time share people”
Reviews.Author: JaneKingston
Reviews.Content: The good stuff first: fabulous staff, wonderful location, clean and spacious rooms (we were in an oceanfront walk-out). We would go back to this hotel for sure. That said though, there were a couple of niggling problems with our trip overall (one not even related to the hotel and I'll see if I can post it somewhere else). First, be very VERY wary of the time share people from the hotel who nab you early on. They're quite high pressure and lots of other Canadians we met said the same. A firm no for the briefing they try to get you to will hopefully keep you safe. Second, the food is only so-so although my husband liked it more than I did. My one recommendation to them would be to put in a standing pasta bar. On arrival, we bought the upgrade to get an ocean front walkout room and access to the Royal hotel restaurants across the street and found both the Asiana and Maria Marie's to be awesome. Was it worth the extra for the upgrade? Overall, I would say yes. We got the oceanfront walkout, our own palapa (this was almost worth the price itself) plus the opportunity to eat in the Royal's restaurants which we found far superior. Only downside was that while the staff inside the Royal restaurants knew by the colour of our bracelets that we were entitled to have access, the staff in the lobby and other areas did not and so we were twice questioned. Not appropriate and we were ticked about it. Made us feel less valued. I could not complete this review without mentioning the staff. Absolutely awesome, no kidding. Smiles and helpful while not being pushy. The actual cooks/chefs in the buffet were the only exception and we only noticed them because the rest of the staff were so outstanding. Special mention to Maria, our room attendant, and Benito, who worked tirelessly to keep us well supplied with drinks on the beach. Would be go back to this hotel? Yes. A very nice relaxing week. Final note concerns a non-hotel point of the trip. We booked with Sunquest and the airline is Skyservice, a charter. Each person is allowed 20 kilos of luggage (about 40 pounds) and this is really NOT A LOT. Going out was not too bad, only a few of us in the line to pay an extra 20 dollars per kilo (we were 4 kilos over going out) but coming back to Canada, the line in the airport to pay for extra luggage is substantial. Really ruined a lot of people's vacations. We talked to folks around us in the payout line and it wasn't unusual for folks to be 10 to 20 pounds over - souvenirs, etc. That means an extra 200 bucks to get on the flight to come home and there's not a thing you can do about it.

Reviews.Title: “awsome all inclusive over all!”
Reviews.Author: mexicana6543
Reviews.Content: The gran porto real is for sure a 5* hotel!! me and my Husband came with our daughter,12 and another family with kids also , there is a couple of things you all should know. anyways heres my review! Rooms= when we first got at the gran porto real we were put into a beautiful suite with 2 double beds and a bunkbed with a huge deck, great view.we were only staying there for a night though. The next day we got put into another really nice room with a patio where you could walk out to the beach, we stayed there for 3 nights loved it!. On monday there was alot of confusion with the rooms the staff wanted to put us in a room with no windows!! of course we didnt put up with that so they put us on a room across from the pool on the roof very nice and our last room change was to a standard and it was fine. Staff= The staff at Gran porto real were fantastic! they were all very friendly and great at there job.My daughter and her friends went to the kids club sometimes and had alot of fun with the workers ! and of course the kids and activities. The chefs were awsome! awsome food , and very nice! all the waiters were so charming! they make little flowaers made out of napkins and there so sweet! The front desk had a little complications switching our room on monday because they over booked ,that was a little stressful.But all of the staf were so nice! Pool/Activities and Beach! = the pool is such a happening place to be! theres some activities and performances that were alot of fun and the beach was so nice! yess it was sand bag but who cares? ur in mexico in the sun and the sand is still that white sand that everybody loves. The ocean was a blast!! it had a couple of rocks so watch where your going but the water is so clear and blue! if u really want an adventure , on the beach u can take a boat ride out to this really BEAUTIFUL beach ughhh it was so nice! it was like a mini jungle island and the snorkling was so fun but im scared of fish but...it was fun though i hoped u liked the review! and i hope everyone who reads this goe's to the gran porto real but doesnt run into the little problems we had !!!! it was so fun though!!1

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: boomhauer
Reviews.Content: I'd been to Mexico many times before but this was my first visit to the Yucatan Peninsula. I think this was an ideal place to stay as it was right in town and walking distance to everything...if you wanted to eat local food like 7 peso tacos at El Fogon, no problem. Groceries - the Mega and Walmart a very short stroll away. Of course the 5th Avenue tourist strip is right there with all its bars, clubs, restaurants, and shops. Some of those isolated resorts would have left me bored. Specifics: Rooms - we were upgraded to a larger jr. suite (after booking just the standard rms. which are MUCH smaller) but one overlooking the back of the restaurant. Not much of a view at all, but there was a balcony. Ocean front rooms would've been awesome, but ask for ocean FRONT not ocean VIEW if you want a real water scene. Mini fridge restocked daily (tip with a note if you want more beer, pop, water!) Large TV with more US channels than we expected. We wanted a king bed but got 2 singles. Wasn't ideal. Huge shower and great bathroom with hair dryer. Digital combo safe which we always like. Big closet area too. Pools - Main larger one just off the beach; another upstairs near the standard rooms (this one has the swim up and sushi bars). Hot tub (maybe 5 person?) on the roof with hammocks nearby. Have to say we were on the beach more than at the pools. Beach - Excellent. Not like Punta Cana or anything but fairly white sand. Yes, there are sandbags in one spot. Barely noticed them though. The berm kept the sea much calmer directly in front of the resort (a big deal as there are always fairly large waves near here) . You could walk out in waist deep water for a long way. Great wait service on the beach as they were always bringing more drinks. Bar near Constituyentes has no alcohol though. There are many loungers although they did tend to fill up and security won't let you drag them right down to the shore (public beach). Food: Our room was directly above the buffet/breakfast, so we always made it down. Good selection of everything from sausage/bacon to omelettes to french toast to fresh fruit (great papaya!) and yogourt. Buffet was decent midday and had a different theme every night. A la carte restaurants were Mexican and Italian. Staying so close to great local fare, we only tried the Mexican (which was really good). Best thing about these - no reservations needed ! (always a pain) Room service also included, once daily! Bars: Pool bar and lobby bar closed (I think) at around midnight. A decent menu of drinks and beers were Dos Equis on tap and Tecate Light and Sol in cans and Superior in bottles. Another great feature of this resort as most AI only include draft beers. There was a different theme of entertainment in the lobby nightly. Another bar at the upstairs pool near the standard rooms, which I think closed around sunset. There is also a 24 hour lounge with a self-serve bar incl. wine, most hard liquor, a beer tap, and coffee. They have snacks in here plus some video games, a pool table, and HDTV. You are so close to so many bar options on 5th Ave. though so it's not like you'll be spending all night on the resort. To sum up, it's a very nice property. Really loved the location, food was good, staff was friendly and attentive. I might try a boutique hotel in the area sometime but I am sure this would be more comfortable. I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pepper123
Reviews.Content: Just had a group of 13 of us return from the Gran Porto Real. Was a great week for all of us. No rain and lots of sun. Was our 7th straight year vacationing in the PDC area, our first at the GPR. This facility is probably the cleanest of any that we have visited. People are constantly cleaning and picking up. The wait staff is very attentive as are the Entertainment group. The shows are OK, probably the worst of the 7 years, but there really isn't a theatre for the group to perform, rather an outdoor stage. On our last night the show was in the lobby and was a lipsync tribute to music through the decades. Our group made it fun as we sang and danced to such classics as "YMCA" and the soundtrack of "Grease." The food was very good. The Italian restaurant was superb, while the Mexican was very good. The buffet was alright. Would have been much better if there had been a salad bar and ice cream. Only had ice cream twice during the entire week. Also the serving lines were a bit confusing as people were going to the 2 grills in the wrong direction so you had to fight the line in order to use the condiments. There should have been a sign of some sort to direct you to the proper direction. Only really big complaint that the entire group had was that the bartenders would not fill the Bubba kegs. Interesting as the resort claims to be "going green" but they would rather you get 5 plastic glasses of beer rather than filling the Bubba Keg. That is 5 glasses that they just throw away. Green?? I think not. Also noticed that quite a few people were sent to other resorts as the GPR was overbooked. Happened to 2 in our group. They were fortunate as they were sent to the beautiful Royal across the street, but others were sent to the sister resort downtown, a not-so-nice place. If the latter 2 problems could be fixed, I would give the place a 5*+ rating, but until they are fixed, a 4* is given.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: BJstrip
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 girlfriends went for a getaway and found this resort awesome! Let me first say I was a hesitant about this hotel, never having been to Mexico before. I found it online and I poured over the reviews.Our travel agent had never been to Gran Porto before either. But it was as beautiful as the pictures .. There were a few snags. Our room wasnt ready when they said it would be ,but when we got to it , it was beautiful! We had an oceanfront suite with a spectacular view. We all stayed in one room and it was more than enough room. As far as upgrading we were never asked, never hassled. Talking to some other guests they had less than adequate accomodations We booked through an agent with Funjet and I think that had something to do with our ease of check in. There was some one there everyday from fun jet. If we had any problems they would take care of it. The only other snag was that the room was set up for 2 people , as far as towels, glassess etc., and it took a few days for them to get it that we needed enough for 4 people not 2. Other than that the staff bent over backwards for us. They were wonderful.Very friendly. If something wasnt on the buffet that we wanted, all we had to do was ask and they got it for us. We sat in the same section in the main buffet for breakfast everyday and the staff got to know us and what we liked and had it there waiting for us. As far as the food , we ate breakfast and lunch at the buffet. Dinner we would go to the Italian or Mexican resturant. We would have fresh salsa and guacomole or cheesy chili fries in the afternoon at the hut on the beach. I would stay away from the hotdogs , that is about the only thing that really wasnt good. If you were there longer than a week, the food might get mundane. The place was very clean and very well kept . Our room overlooked the pool. I read in some reviews that it was noisy. Well we didnt think so . The pool closed at 9pm and the entertainment was over by 11pm usually, so if you went to bed at 8pm and were a light sleeper, maybe it could have been a problem. The pool and beach service was great. You were barely finished with your drink and they were there asking if you needed another. The drinks were a bit light on the alcohol but still very tasty,I would just ask for a extra shot . Besides we werent there to get drunk, just to relax , and we did. The hotel was perfectly located , only a block from 5th ave. We had a great time shopping there. Just a tip, dont pay what they are asking for!.You have to learn to haggle, but thats the fun part! We also had a massage on the beach. I didnt think it was that overpriced. Besides how many times, unless your a world traveler, do you get a massage on the beach with the sounds of the ocean lulling you?All in all it was a great trip, just what we were looking for. Beautiful hotel, very clean, very very friendly staff that waited on you hand and foot. A perfect relaxing get away. We only stayed 5 nights, and took an excursion to Tulum and Xel-Ha. Next time we will stay a week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and service but needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: DNB10
Reviews.Content: The service was great. Pablo and Benito on the beach were great. Guedelipe, Alonso, Luis and the others were great in the main dining room. Location was great for the beach life and shopping. The food was good some days and poor on others. The ala' Cartes were basic at best. Everything shut down early and we had to go to the 5th Ave strip for night life. We found it very noisy and were awaken at 7 Am every day due to the sound traveling freely into the suites. The swim up bar was closed at 5 PM and the htot tub at 8 PM. One person in our party had their IPod stolen from their room through the slatted window shutters. The front desk people were not very helpful or friendly at most times. We had fun but most of it came at an extra expense visiting other places to eat and drink. Tip and you will be served extremely well. The rooms were small and the beds were rock hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Porto!”
Reviews.Author: IzzyDeerValley_SK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 7 day stay at the Gran Porto Real and were very happy with the experience. Things got off to a bit of a rocky start when we got to our room. One of our primary requirements of this type of vacation is a great view of the ocean, we clearly indicated this to our travel agent. She said an "Ocean View" room would be prefect for us (we should have questioned the "view" part, but the reason we were using an agent was because she was supposed to know what she was doing). Well, our room was on the first floor (130) and opened on to a fairly busy street and had a fine view of 3 floors of rooms at a hotel (The Royal) across the street. If you peeked through a bush and no one was walking by on the street you may have been able to catch a glint of ocean. I went down to the desk to (calmly) voice my disappointment, the gentleman (Gabriel) behind the counter explained the difference between "ocean view" and "ocean front" and offered to upgrade us. I was prepared for a big number but it was only $40 a night! The difference was amazing, our new room (341) was on the third floor, had a large private patio and a superb view of the ocean, all was well. I should stress that the issue was not the hotel's, our travel agent caused the problem. However, at this hotel (and likely many others in the area) the ocean "view" part is highly variable, if you like to see and hear the water, pony up the extra $40, and make sure the reservation says Ocean Front. As many other reviews have mentioned, this hotel is spotless. When the maid is finished, the room is always immaculate (if you leave her a buck or two, you get all manner of towel art!). Another common theme on the reviews is how good the staff is, this is also absolutely true. Everyone is very professional, courteous and friendly to boot. The food is also very good, the main buffet restaurant has very good breakfast and lunch. The dinners are also very good with a couple of different cooking/grilling stations every night. Lots of salads, veggies, appetizers, desserts. The buffet has full wait service and they are as good as you will find anywhere. There is also a Mexican and Italian restaurant, which we didn't get around to going to (couldn't bear the thought of putting on shoes and long pants). There is a beach food bar with hamburgers and the like, it is a bit variable in quality, but very convenient if you are on the beach. If you want good food then you can just go to the buffet a few steps away. The beach service is also very good, many different types of drinks. The beach waiters work very hard and are always on the move with a tray of drinks. One thing that I noticed was that very (very) few people tipped. The guys (Hola Pablo!) and girls would be slogging through the heat and sand all day bringing trays of drinks to a group and at the end of the day they would all get up and leave, no tip! A couple of bucks here and there is much appreciated, this is a fairly high end resort, folks should be able to afford the small tip (on the beach and in the restaurant). The hotel location is great, two short blocks from 5th Avenue which is a couple of miles/kms of shopping, eating & drinking. This hotel is right in the middle of the action (it is very secure and quiet at night), if you like that type of environment, then you will like the location. We talked to some folks that stayed at resorts outside of Playa and they often complained that they were in the middle of nowhere and had to take a taxi to do anything outside the resort, this is not a problem at the Proto! The beach in front of the hotel is also fine, they do have a low row of sandbags but you just step down off of them. Many of the hotels up the beach towards the ferry terminal have virtually no beach (and no sand bags). The beach area could use more shade, there are a number of sun shelters but they get taken very quickly and some of them are reserved for the beachfront walkout rooms. Portable umbrellas that could be stuck into the sand would probably solve the problem. The beach is quite busy with lots of folks walking by, many people watching opportunities. Very few beach vendors and they are not at all aggressive, we also did not run into a timeshare person all week!!! (ignore the Gold card promotion if you don't want the timeshare blah, blah). This was our first trip to Playa so we can't compare the Porto with any other local hotels, but our experience was great and we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: elpeters
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-night stay at the Gran Porto Real. The hotel is very nice, clean, and in a great location. Food was fine. Spent most of our time on the beach soaking up the sun, and the wait staff was very attentive and friendly. Drinks were all good. Only two problems we ran in to: check-in and the rocky beach. As for check-in, we had paid for an Oceanview but were given a "free upgrade" to Oceanside upon check-in. Our room was on the east end of the resort, looking out into the street, on the third floor, so it was hardly Oceanview much less Oceanside. If you looked between The Royal resort across the street and the end of our resort, you could get a peek at the ocean. Our friends that traveled with us were not able to get their Oceanview room at check-in, even though we booked it six months in advance, so they were "upgraded" for the first night to a pool-side room. It was so noisy they were up all night. The next day they were moved to a room similiar to ours but on the first floor. Again, barely Oceanview. Just beware of check-in! They were not very friendly at the front desk, either, so that didn't help. As for the rocky beach, it is rocky under water where you go into the ocean from the resort's beach. You have to walk through an area of sharp rocks before you can get to a small sand bar, then the rocks are fewer and farther in between past the sand bar. You have to go out that far to "play in the waves" because the beach is sheltered by sandbags. We went to the beach next door at The Royal to play in the waves because it wasn't rocky at all. Overall, a very nice resort and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gran porto real Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: jeepmama
Reviews.Content: We went with 7 people and had a blast! The check in was smooth,they meet you with a drink and off you go to your rooms,we had ocean front junior suite and out of 4 rooms they were all great. the food was great, we did the buffet most of the time because it was open from 7am to 11pm and always good, we also tried the other restaurants and they were also good.. I found the staff all very friendly and most of them could speak good English. 5th ave was just a block away and a safe walk.We had a blast walking up and down and buying stuff but the drinks are a bit pricey.Better to drink free at the hotel. If you needed anything you would just ask and you got it immediately. We are already planning a trip back next year! The only thing you have to watch for are the time share vultures but if you say no they dont seem to bug you again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of little extras!”
Reviews.Author: jensjade
Reviews.Content: Amazing resort! The little extras are what made the stay extra special. Lots of free-of-charge bottled and filtered water available, (even in hallways and room) and specialty coffee machine available 24/7 are only a few of the unexpected perks we enjoyed. The rooms are gorgeous, even the lower-budget rooms have all the amenities. The beach in front of the hotel is beautiful, the staff are friendly and helpful, the food is excellent with a good variety, and it is close to 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Minnesotalovesplaya
Reviews.Content: This was myself and my best friends 4th year spending a week at the Gran Porta Real. It has been more wonderful every visit. The special people we meet every year and the ones that are still working year to year. The rooms are very clean, we always get a ocean front room. The housekeepers made us feel very special by making beautiful animals out of towels. The rose pedals on the beds was so special. My girlfriend and I feel very safe there. That makes our husbands not worry about us. The food is wonderful, never been ill in all 4 years, the beach is so beautiful. But above all else the entertainment staff was wonderful and we have made some great friends.. We missed Victor this year, but Julio, Michael, Carlos, and of course our Hector are the best. They make our trip extra special. I would recomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Animation team is truly animated”
Reviews.Author: SINSALE
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that the reason I had chosen this hotel as a definite is because of location, location, location. It did however turn out to be that location (although fabulous), the staff there made it mine and my mother’s vacation that much better. This hotel is in walking distance of the famous 5th avenue. Here you will find a European feeling of boutiques, cafes, restaurants, and characters dressed up ready to take a picture with you (of course for a little tip). I really believe that what you put into a vacation is what you will get back. I smiled at all employee’s/visitor’s, learned names, played as many activities as I could, and enjoyed the evening shows. The shows went on without a hitch, well organized and a possessed a different theme each night. I would really recommend anyone looking to stay at this hotel to get to know the Animation team. They are fun, kind, professional, and intelligent, even trust worthy. I would especially like to congratulate Theresa, Miguel, Julio, Hector, Victor and Carlos for allowing me to be part of a dynamic team of wonderful individuals.

Reviews.Title: “A Frustrating Time at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: zengecko
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gran Porto Real Jan. 26 - Jan 31, 2009 (5 nights, 6 days) Went with our vacation buddies, we were two couples in the 40-50 age range. Our 5th visit to Playa, our first to this resort. We originally had booked the Reef, and were "upgraded" to this resort as the Reef was overbooked, seemingly a natural and expected situation with them. After reading more reviews of both locations, we were all quite excited to be going to the Porto Real as it seemed to be much better by review opinions then the Reef. Airport, transfers and check in went smoothly and reasonably quickly. We were given a refreshing drink at the counter as we were checking in. We were given the option of upgrading our room to the Jr. Suite for the discounted price of $60 per night, a special price instead of the normal $80. we declined. We were suddenly put in those rooms anyway, for one night, at no additional charge and were told that we would be moved to the standard rooms the next morning. Fine, whatever. When we went into the Jr. Suite, both our mouths dropped open at how small the room was. We have always had spacious rooms at every other resort we had stayed at, so this was a surprise. The room was street side, and had a balcony. It was nice sitting out there for awhile people watching. We were moved to the standard room the next morning, and frankly we think that room was larger. But wow, it was problem after problem there. First, minor things like the tv not working, the a/c not working properly, etc. A call to the front desk and within 10 min. maintenance was there and all fixed. A/c continued to be a problem throughout.....either colder than antartica, or muggier then a sauna. Two nights in a row, no hot water. None. Nada. From the sink or the shower. We had to call the front desk each time, and within about 45 min. we had hot water. Toilet would not flush suddenly, and overflowed. ANOTHER visit to the front desk. When we got back to our room, some 6 hours later, it had not even been looked at! AND YET ANOTHER call to the front desk. Now I am not fussy, and I certainly understand that occassionally poo-poo happens. But there was never an apology, or any appearance of concern for our inconvenience. Wow. The beach was wonderful. The resorts location for beachfront is ideal. Pool was small. Swim up bar pool on the third floor is so cold you expect to see ice cubes floating around. The sushi bar is here. Every day the sushi is different, both in type and quality. Drinks were weak. I will say the pina coladas are the best!! I am dreaming about them, LOL! If you ask nicely, they will put more booze in (usually). Food is alright. I have had better and worse. For the most part I would say it was above average. the wait staff on the beach was absolutely fantastic. Always smiling, and friendly and fun. buffett waitstaff very, very nice and right there with more water, or clearing plates, etc. The time share folks are ready to pounce on you at every moment, and every turn. They are very nice and charming, but we aren't interested in time share. The Lomas reps were so fantastic. We have always gone with a competitor whose name ryhmes with "snapple", and the lomas travel/funjet people exceeded them in every area! We were so impressed with them. We enjoyed walking down to 5th ave. and shopping and people watching every night. That was always entertaining. we did not see any shows at the resort. The only entertainment staff that we saw was one guy who did pool aerobics every morning. That was it. There could have been more, and we just did not see them, but the resort is not real big, so it would be hard to miss that. Would I stay here again? Yes, but only if the price were right for a beachfront or oceanfront room. Under no circumstances would I stay in a streetside room again. I will poste photos in a couple of days for this. Any other questions just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: tdvogel
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at the resort, and it was more than we could have ever hoped for! The wedding coordinators (Mikaela) were awesome and made everything so easy. The day was perfect, easy and flawless. Our photographer (Ceasar) was so great and our photos are fantastic!! We could not have asked for a better day. Our stay was also great. Our room was very nice and the food and service was excellent. All of our 42 guests had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “sand bags on the beach”
Reviews.Author: victoriaQuebec
Reviews.Content: We had a small room with half a wardrobe and a small window. No balcony and 2 small beds. It's room 417. The worst part is the beach. There are many sand bags along the beach, 3 ranks of sand bags. The've been there for at least 2 years. It's the only hotel with this set up in the area, There are also many fishboats staying in front of the beach restaurant, therefore many seagulls over ou head and in our plates! We change hotel and went across the street at the Royal (same owner) for 600$ US. It was wonderful. We try to get a credit from our travel agent who was not aware of this kind of beach by the wholesaler. If you like to rest on the beach and swim, go to the Royal.

Reviews.Title: “The no so Gran(d) Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: JMC79
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of sourcing on this site to try find a decent review ont the Gran Porto Real. There were positives and a few negatives which in all is probably a fair reflection of this hotel. Upon check-in the hotel were able to give us a room that we had booked - a junior suite ocean view. Room 330. We checked in about 6pm so there was no reason why our room wouldn't be ready. Later on we found the couple who checked in after us who were also on our flight didn't get the room they booked and were forced to go over to the far side facing the road. This was not a nice part of the hotel. I guess it could've been us. Our room was ok. The Real website makes it look a lot better than it was. We had a noisy fridge and 2 double beds, which wasn't ideal. The beds were quite firm too. On our balcony you could see the sea a bit, but we knew it wouldn't be ocean front as we hadn't paid for that. In all, the room was ok. Big shower but no bath, which was a bit irritating. We actually upgraded after 4 days to an Ocean Front (Room 247) and the remaining week was much more enjoyable from a room perspective. It was indeed ocean front and away from the pool and the 'evening entertainment' noise and directly over the beach which was nice. The room was the same as the ocean view room we previously were in but it had 1 king size bed which was what we wanted. The rest of the room was the same (without a noisy fridge) and the view over the lovely sea was worth paying $210 for the upgrade for 7 days. You get alcohol optics and soft drinks all inclusive but you also got that with junior suite ocean view. The only negative thing about our room was that a couple of hundred yards away down the beach was a club which played rediculously loud music until 4am! I wouldn't of been able to sleep if it wasn't for ear plugs, and that's with the door shut and the air con on! Also, any weddings they have were under our balcony so we had the treat of listening to cheesy music when a wedding was on as well as the other music. I spoke to the hotel who weren't too fussed about this issue. I'll have to say the hotel is very keen on you to upgrade and they are heavy on it. Signs everywhere for it. We did first look to upgrade to the Royal for $210 which got us the basic room which consisted of a garden view, jacuzzi bath and a hammock, if you were lucky! We hated the Royal and were given a tour by one of the 'nice' reps....who only bombarded us with the sales pitch. We got out of it and decided to just upgrade to the ocean front at the Gran. The sales people at the Gran are a bit much too and stick cards in your door saying "Your appointment time is at 9.00am tomorrow morning. See you there". Some folk I imagine would go down and then be stuck in the sales pitch. We were approached upon check in by Senior Willy (great name!) who told us we would qualify for discount card if we came talk to him. We dodged him. The pool was freezing! Well, it was for the first week then all of sudden it was quite nice. Perhaps the hotel forgot to heat the pool because the sea was actually warmer. There is some noise around the pool from generators but enough sun beds to go around if you wanted to move. We wanted a shady bed so we always went for that side. The sea itself and the beach were the best thing about the hotel. Really lush and very inviting. Also very shallow too. Magnificent it was. Quite hard to find a decent sun bed which is strange seeing as it's private but you get the feeling anybody came along and took a sun bed at their leisure when they weren't entitled to. The pool entertainment team were very nice even though the 'bicycle tour', 'spanish lessons' and 'cocktail making' were all a bit lame for our taste. The food I thought was really bad. Alot of the time it was cold in the buffet section. Some bizarre choices for breakfast like chicken, beef, pork and you had the feeling that anything not eaten for breakfast were just put out again for lunch. The beach 'restaurant' which again is a buffet was the worst with the same food out every day. Burgers, Hot Dogs, Nachos etc and the bread was stale and just not very appertising. Still, people were munching their way through it! The Mexican restuarant was ok i guess and the italian was the same though the food was hot! The staff were a bit hit and miss. Some people very nice and friendly, others quite rude. The guests staying at the hotel seemed to all be canadian/americans (couldn't tell the difference i'm afraid until they spoke french!) who I thought were all quite off-ish. They seemed very cleaky and I believe they return to the hotel frequently so they have an air of arrogance about them. Location wise you were 2 mins from 5th Avenue which had loads of shops and restaurants. Not too many bars, more restaurant/bars. This was good the first night but it gets very repertitive and we were quite fed up by the end of it. The shops are all expensive and you get harrassed by people which just gets annoying after a while. To go on any trips was a fortune which is a rip off. A real tourist trap. I know it must sound like we are a couple of kill joys but we have high standards and expectations and I think it's fair to say after writing this that we weren't satisified on reflection with our choice to go to the Gran Porto Real, though one or two redeeming factors save it from being a disastrous holiday. Through our agency we were limited to this hotel in Playa Del Carmen as we certainly didn't want to go to Cancun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: katchow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gran Porto Jan 26th -Jan 31. We (my hubby and another couple) were supposed to stay at the Reef Playacar but, as usual, the Reef was over-booked, so they sent us here. Plane and customs was the usual run. bus ride was not bad, Lomas Travel/ Funjet, better than the Apple debacle last yr. But, that's another story. Check in was sorta fast, Got put in a jr suite for one night , then shlepped off to the nose-bleed rooms on the 5th floor. Don't bother asking for an up-grade unless you wanna shell out some major bucks. All the time-share stuff is true, just say no. and go about your vacation. Food was pretty good, mostly geared for U.S. guests. (yes I'm an American) I would have preferred a more cosmopolitan menu myself. The Beach was great, just lay in the sun and bake. The beach service was a very nice touch. Jesus and Benito are just fab! All in-all not a bad vacation for a last-minute booking. Beats Michigan in Jan anytime. Any ?'s drop me an e-mail. Will add pics ASAP

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Emma-and-Mark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto for a 2 week holiday in November. The facilities and service were very good and the food and choice was brilliant for an all inclusive resort, although you would expect that from a 5 star hotel. We stayed in a junior suite, which was lovely, although we had asked for an ocean view room but you had to crane you neck to see it. The only rooms with a real ocean view are classed as ocean front so I would bear that in mind if it is essential for you. Apart from that the rooms were really clean and huge. The location was brilliant, the resort centre of Playa Del Carmen was a 2 minute walk away from the hotel and had lots of shops, bars and restaurants to go to and the beach was literally on your door step and clean. You got left alone except for the waiting staff asking you if you needed another cold beer or cocktail whilst laying round the pool or on the beach, what more do you need!

Reviews.Title: “Mexicos best hotel”
Reviews.Author: cutiedelia
Reviews.Content: OKAY So where to begin. Gran porto is like no other. weve been to a few places in and around playa and well this one is the best yet. we went for the first time last year and this year although we stayed in another hotel,because some friends chose to we returned to gran porto to see our friends. the hotel is beautiful and has the best location ever. right near 5th, the food is amazing and the staff is very kind and accomodating. you can walk on 5th or by the beach and see all the hotels and stores. The animation team we quickly fell inlove with. Where to start. MIguel, Victor, Julio and Hector are all amazing. they made sure to take us out clubing and get us back safely every night. they had many fun and interesting activities planned for us such as volleyball, bike tours, aerobics, bingo ..etc.. the guys were alll sweethearts and veryyyy kind to us. they always made us feel like we were at home and as if we had known them forever. This place is magical not only because of its beautiful location. i would stay there forever and most definetly recomend it to anyone and everyone who is going to playa del carmen on vacation, young or old there is something for everyone there.

Reviews.Title: “Will return many tmes over!”
Reviews.Author: luv2vaca5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were upgraded to this hotel because the hotel we had booked at overbooked, so lucky for us! The standard rooms are subpar, but the junior deluxe suites and up are fabulous! The jr. deluxe suite was huge with a large bathroom and huge, walk-in tiled shower! It made for a comfortable stay. The staff all were very friendly and accomodating. The food is good but there is not really a different selection day after day; but it was the same as any other all-inclusive we have stayed at. The grounds are immaculately kept - we saw staff constantly sweeping the floors and cleaning. The pool is gorgeous and very clean. The beach is wonderful! Jesus will always be a memorable part of our trip. He was the beach waiter for drinks, and he is the best! He is so friendly and works so hard. We just love him! We booked off-site tours, and they have a representative there at the hotel to accomodate you for any of those. They just made everything easy and wonderful at Gran Porto Real. Will definitely return next year with our children!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: wwllkk
Reviews.Content: 11 of us stayed a week for our 50th birthday celebration and had a fabulous time. The staff was great: fun, good service, helpful. The food and drinks were good and available at all hours. 2 great a la carte restaurants as well as the buffet. Located just off 5th Ave which has lots of shopping (not cheap but nice shops). Also located on a beautiful fine sand beach. Clean and big room with a deck - comfortable bed. Not huge so not too far to walk to anything.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: merble
Reviews.Content: The Grand Porto Real in Playa del Carmen is absolutely perfect in every way. This was our second stay here and we have not been displeased in any way. The beach, the food and the service are awesome. The waiter on the beach, Pablo, was extremely great and his smile and great personality will make us come back. We highly recomend the resort. Merle and Sue Blaine, Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “The Beach Wedding was a dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: Playaonly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at the Gran Porto Real at least once a year for the past ten years. Each time we go, we watch beautiful weddings on the beach at the resort. It was a dream come true when our daughter and her fiance told us they wanted to get married in Mexico!! We booked the trip for us and 12 others with great ease. Then the apprehension started...how was I going to coordinate a wedding all the way from Mississippi? I contacted Zulma, the Wedding Coordinator at Gran Porto Real; gave a her a little information and she said " don't worry, it will be very simple to plan." I was still apprehensive....her email arrived within the hour, outlining all the details, options and prices for a beach wedding. There was also information on the legal aspects of a wedding in Mexico.Within a day or two the plans were complete. I was still apprehensive ( this IS our ONLY daughter!) On our second day of arrival, the wedding couple met with Zulma, discussed details in less than an hour, had the blood work drawn, and were seen by the doctor right there at the hotel, and they were all set! We had fun in the sun the rest of the week. Wedding Day arrived, we swam all day, then around 3pm we all began dressing for the sunset wedding. The weather was PERFECT, the breeze just right. When we arrived on the beach for the ceremony, we were speechless. It was absolutley beautiful!! The gazebo was arranged with gorgeous fresh flowers ( my daughter had many choices!!). The chairs covered with white linen, the JP was ready and waiting! We chose the cocktail reception with appetizers. The food table was elegant and delicious, the cake spectacular and the wait staff was incredible. NOT A SINGLE NEGATIVE EXPERIENCE! We could not believe how a perfect wedding could have been so easy to do. They provided the photographer, and he was excellent. He knew the timing of the sunset and took romatic photos on the beach, in the surf, etc. We ended up purchasing the entire CD of 125 photos, because each and every one of them were perfect. The music was great, and we all danced for hours. If you are planning a beach wedding, this is the place to go!! Be sure to ask for Zulma!! By the way, we love the resort, it is the ONLY one we will stay at in Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Fairytale Wedding”
Reviews.Author: CVBOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thought Mexico on the beach would be a perfect place for our wedding. There were 22 family and friends that were able to attend. Besides the first couple of days being quite stressful, we had a fantastic time! My husband himself describes our wedding as a "fairytale wedding." I agree. We had a transition in our wedding coordinator from Paty to Micaela during the planning process but that went fairly smoothly. For the most part, I recommend communicating mostly through Micaela the wedding coordinator and Walter who is in charge of the reception and dinner. Those two and your DJ (if you have one) will take care of all your questions and needs. They are very professional and great at their job. If you like the saxaphone, I highly recommend the saxaphonist. We had him for one hour during dinner for the reception. We planned for our wedding and reception to be on the beach. We got through three main songs for the reception before it started pouring rain. That was only the second time in eight days that it rained (which it didn't last long). We ran under cover and they set us up under the outdoor hotel restaurant. It was amazing how quickly they transitioned everything. We were disapointed it rained but there was nothing that can be done about it. We were quite impressed with how smoothly the rest of the night went and quite pleased how much of a good time everyone was having. Our photograph took such great pictures. He made us feel at ease and made that time enjoyable even though we took so many pictures. I would highly recommend this hotel and staff for a wedding for any bride and groom that likes adventure and spontaneity. Not everything will go as planned and there will still be a lot of unknowns no matter how many questions you ask until you actually have this experience but it is definitely worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Wedding”
Reviews.Author: FSURach
Reviews.Content: I chose the Gran Porto Real as the location for my October wedding. Every person I came in contact with prior to my trip, planning the wedding, and during my stay was pleasant and helpful. My wedding planner, Zulma, was right on top of things. She had everything figured out and even went above and beyond to help me add my own special touches to the ceremony and reception. The wedding was beautiful and everything went so smoothly. Our ceremony and reception both took longer than expected and the staff was accommodating and generous. (a family member performed the ceremony so it took a little longer) The photographer was very helpful and made a special effort to accommodate for my lengthy ceremony to make sure that I had all of the post ceremony beach pictures. Both the wedding and my entire stay were a hit! The staff is friendly, the resort was always clean and it's the perfect size. The resort is not to big, It's beautiful and comfortable. The size made it easy to find our wedding guests, but also be alone if we wanted to be. The food was great. We never had a problem with crowds, and the reception food was delicious and well presented. For anyone thinking about a destination wedding I recommend it! It made my life so much easier and it was absolutely perfect. I am kind of partial to the Real Resorts now that I have had such a wonderful experience. Mine and my husband's family are already planning a trip back to Gran Porto Real to celebrate our anniversary with us. One last thing... the staff is remarkable!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Impressed”
