Reviews.Author: The_Man
Reviews.Content: Ignore the bad reviews for Gran Porto Real. We've stayed at four other all-inclusive resorts in Mexico (El Dorado Royal, Dreams PV, Riu Jalisco and La Jolla de Mismaloya) and this one is very good. Some travel companies rate the resort as a five-star which it definitely is not; however, it is an excellent four-star resort. We had no problems at check-in and the cot we requested for our son was delivered to our room shortly after we arrived. We upgraded to an oceanfront jr. suite and had a magnificent view of the ocean. The suite was large enough that it didn't feel cramped even with the cot in it. Overall, the service at the resort was excellent, especially the beach waiters. We never had to wait long to order drinks. Our maid, the waiters at all the restaurants and bars and the bell men do a great job. I was concerned about the quality of the food after reading some of the reviews on this site but the Italian and Mexican restaurants were as good as any resort restaurants we've eaten at. We ate breakfast and lunch at the buffet restaurant every day and always enjoyed the selection. The sushi bar was also quite good although the variety was rather limited. The only downside to the resort was the quality of the performances in the evening. It was the most amateurish entertainment I've seen at a resort. One night, the entertainment included a fashion show for the boutique at the Royal across the street. Luckily, it's only a two-block walk to 5th Avenue so we we could find entertainment elsewhere. I should also mention that the musicians who performed in the lobby bar in the evening were also quite good. Some people have complained about the guest services pushing timeshares at the Royal across the street. We were approached as well but we never felt the staff were pushy and found them to be friendly even after we said that we had no interest. If you choose to waste your vacation time on a presentation in exchange for some small gift that's your own fault. We had a great time and wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip! Recommend this resort”
Reviews.Author: tdoll22
Reviews.Content: We are part of the Real Club and have stayed in Cancun and Playa and loved them both. We had a Junior Suit Walkout, which was great. Walk right out onto the beach to a private cabana and enjoy the drinks and the wonderful sand. Everything about this place is awesome. The staff is fun and friendly. The property is amazing and the location from 5th Ave and the locate clubs is great! Walk right down the beach to the Blue Parrot or Senor Frogs, or walk up the street to the new club Coco Bongos. I suggest Senor Frogs for events. We went there on New Years Eve and had a great time. Hope this helps with your future trip planning!

Reviews.Title: “luv the Porto so were going back !”
Reviews.Author: BellevueforMX
Reviews.Content: We went with 2 other couples in 2007, went in 2008 on our Honeymoon, and are going back in 2009 the end of April with another couple. We love the size of this hotel, (about 300 rms, not alot of walking like mega resorts) the staff will bend over backwards for you. The 3 different restaurants give you a great selection of what your preference is. Breakfast is simply awesome at the Hotel. Being right in town and not having to rent any car is a huge plus. Your a block away from the mile long 5th Avenue which goes all the way to the shuttle to catch to Cozemel , $12 each way. Also great you can stop along 5th Avenue for cocktails and keep on moving down the street. A great walk after breakfast, get your shopping in, and when the sun gets overhead around noon, and begins getting warm, take any side street one block over to the beach and walk along the beach back to the Gran Porto. Ocean front rooms are recommended and well worth it ! Views dont get any better than this, take a good camera ! We would like to request specific rooms, need a map of rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation !!”
Reviews.Author: lobstergirlQuebec
Reviews.Content: Although slightly apprehensive about going to the Gran Porto Real because of the negative comments viewed before leaving, I would have to admit I was very pleasantly surprised. The food is great, at both the Italian and Mexican restaurants (which, by the way, are unlimited in their usage!!!) The inside buffet was also good. The outside beach buffet, I will admit, had cold hotdogs and hamburgers, but the rest of the buffet was great. Great service from the servers on the beach, there's always someone nearby. As for the room : Yes, they did try to upgrade us, and propose us a Timeshare (beware of the Gold card.....it is to timeshare at the Royal across the street). We had booked the standard room, and it was available when we got there at 1:00 pm.....it was a little small to our liking however. Our door would not lock, and it took until 10pm that night to get things sorted out....these people are not stressed out like we are, and 5 minutes = an hour to them. So be patient :-) The hotel is also right beside 5th avenue, which is great to get out. The beach is quite nice, although the beach at the sister hotel (royal) is much nicer. Beware of the rocks in the water !!! They have a little yellow flag up, and this means that we have to be careful of rocks. of course, they don't explicitly tell you this, until you get hurt.... ! There are still sandbags from the last tropical storm, but aren't that bad. There are usually enough beach chairs, but we arrived quite early. For the skyhigh hottub, it was reallly hot, and no children were seen there during our stay. However, children were seen in the adult-only pool (at the sushi bar). Also take note of the SPA facilities that are free : sauna, nordic baths and steam room. US $ goes a long way here....the workers work hard, and appreciate the gifts we give them. For the Cancun airport comments we had seen, our luggage didn't go over. We had nice staff. All in all : we liked our trip, alot !!!! And we would definitely go back to the Gran Porto Real. It's a good cost/quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Good Holiday”
Reviews.Author: wackyjay
Reviews.Content: We had a really great two weeks at the Gran Porto Real. We took notes left by tripadvisor member with us (family with young children - stay August 2008) which was very helpful, thank you! On arrival, we were given a free upgrade to a Junior suite but heeded the afore mentioned member's advice and decided to view first and were not impressed as it offered no sea view at all. So we upgraded ourselves to a ocean front which was just great. Although fairly expensive, was worth the money. We had junior suite 331 which was on the top floor with a lovely view of the bay and sport fishing boats etc: we just loved it. The staff were excellent, food great the Italian and Mexican restaurants were good. The Mexican restaurant being more civilised as the didn't try to give you 'bums rush' out of the the place, unlike the Italian. The staff overall could not be faulted and were genuinely friendly and helpful. We found loads to do all the cultural trips could be done cheaper on your own using either the coaches (office in main street) or the small people carrier type vans (collectivo?) down a side street somewhere between calle 17 and 20. The reception at the hotel advised us exactly where. Visited Akumel Bay using the collectivo vans, then it's just a short walk from the stop. We saw Turtles which made the holiday for us. The Lagoon at Akumel was not that great and you need to get a taxi from the entrance if you are not on an organised trip. if you have children the Xel Ha resort would be better. Overall we had a really good time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time at GPR!!”
Reviews.Author: black_stiletto
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, parents and I just returned from our stay at the Gran Porto Real (December 17 - 23). We couldn't have asked for a better vacation. I've noticed that a lot of reviews complain about things unrelated to the hotel (i.e. airport issues ruined trip so hotel gets bad review - what?), so I will only talk about our time at the hotel, although our time at Xcaret and on 5th avenue was fantastic as well! I will try my best to be as accurate as possible in my review: Check In: Our check in was just fine, drinks on arrival ( thanks to Freddy and Tilo!), our rooms were ready right away, and all in all was very simple and quick. Rooms: Both rooms were very similar (411 and 420) - right by the swim up bar and although not direct ocean view, a great view nonetheless. We didn't upgrade as we didn't plan on spending alot of time in the rooms (why get junior suite if you aren't going to use it?). They were small, but satisfactory, and the fridge was restocked daily. Overall, a great place to shower and get a siesta in between activites. Food: We ate a the buffet and both a la carte restaurants. Breakfast: We had breakfast at the buffet every day, and were rarely dissapointed - omlettes, eggs to order, pancakes, french toast, fruit, bacon, sausage, beans - you want it you got it. Lunch: We usually just had whatever was on the grill on the beach, which was just perfect (look out for those pinckels). We did go to the buffet once and it was perfect for lunch (pasta day). Dinner: We went to the buffet a couple times, it was alright, what you would expect from a buffet in Mexico. The Italian restaurant was delicious and the Mexican restaurant was okay. Room Service: We ordered room service a couple of times, and every time it was wonderful. Drinks: All of the drinks were great, just tell them what kind of alcohol you want and what colour you want the drinks to be - you'll be suprised every time! Staff: If nothing else, it is the staff that make this resort 5 star. Everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful - from Jesus on the beach to Willy who even found out the football scores for my boyfriend. The staff here are absolutely amazing, kind, and genuine. We cannot say enough for the staff, they made our stay exactly what we wanted it to be. The Beach/Bars/Pools: The beach was great, there were sandbags as expected, but I would rather have them there than not! We never had a problem grabbing a few chairs at any time of day at any of the bars or on the beach. The swim up bar/tranquil pool/sushi bar (great maki for Mexico) was great, except that it closed at about 5. The other bars were open later, and there was always the 24 hour club. Overall, we had a great time at this hotel and would have no problems staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room inventory control”
Reviews.Author: guerne
Reviews.Content: As you might expect, you select a room category by name and features. This resort commonly asks you to upgrade upon arrival for a fee. The problem is that if actually booked and paid for that category and they sold the last one to someone else, when you get there they do not have a room for you. They will offer a room next door in a lesser category or perhaps give you an upgraded room for one night and then move you the next day possibly to your category. We were booked with friends for a wedding and never did get a room in the category we paid for after battling for 3days and had to stay at their companion hotel the Royal across the street but our friends were not allowed on the property which made spending the days together problematic. Be wary, ask exactly where the room category is and yell and scream at the counter to get what you paid for. Mitch

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay at Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: sharpee2
Reviews.Content: My wife and twin 4 yr old daughters stayed at Gran Porto from Dec. 5th to Dec 11th. Our check in was OK and we ended up with a nice Jr. Suite along the road. It was very spacious, comfortable and quiet.(303). We used most of the facilities including the kids club where we dropped our girls off for about 2-3 hours/day in the heat of the afternoon. They were great and professional. The main girl actually cried when they learned we were leaving the resort. The food was average. Nothing special. Not as much sea food as we had hoped. We had the buffett for breakfast everyday and rotated lunches outside by the pool and inside. We also ate at the Mexican resaurant which had "killer" celantro soup. The rest of the meal was actually cold and not very tasteful. The Italien restaurant was much better and we had a very nice meal. It was too bad there were not more a la carte but the buffet was OK. The resort and pool was always clean. Location was great. Service was good.(thanks Dr. Zeus!)Jesus We transferred to their sister resort in Cancun for two nights(no charge) and had a wonderful time as well. The worst part of the trip was the weather as we only saw the sun for three out of seven days. We were there the same time last year and had great weather. It is hit and miss I guess. It would not have been too bad but it was windy as well. After being in Mexico 7 times at various resorts, I would rate this hotel a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at GPR”
Reviews.Author: BeerinMexico
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the GPR 11/22 thru 11/29; we had a wonderful time. I want to thank those that have posted a review on the GPR as we found it to be very infomative and used this input to confirm our decision to book our vacation at the GPR. We found our experience to be pretty much in sync with others experiences here. We chose to book the Junior Suite and upgrade to Oceanfront Suite upon arrival- we were able to save $$ doing it this way, but you need to be prepared to negotiate. We stayed in room 253, which like a prior post for a couple that stayed in room 353, same room setup and views. We liked this location as we were away from the pool and kitchen noise, plus had a great view. The food was acceptable- not great, but what I would expect for an AI. Breakfast was great. The lunch & dinner buffet, Mexican and Italian restaurants were not great, but very acceptable. The staffs were all very good- cleaning staff, waitstaff at the pool / beach / bars and at the buffet. Jose did a fantastic job of taking care of us at the beach- thank you! I would recommend that you tip the staff- USD$ go along ways and over the course of a week, it does not add upto much out of pocket and it will improve your service / vacation. Summary, the reviews we found to be quite accurate and we would definitely return to GPR as the balance of quality of facility, quality of service, location for shopping & nightlife on 5th Ave, and total cost make this a great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time”
Reviews.Author: JeffandLoriP
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights and 5 days at this resort. All in all we had a good time. We found the resort very clean, virtually spotless. I would say that all of the positive reviews on TA are pretty accurate, Restaurants: We had breakfast every morning at the buffet, they had a good selection of fresh fruit, an omelet bar, Fresh pancakes and French toast, eggs cooked to order, along with other breakfast type stuff. We ate at the Mexican and Italian restaurants and found both pretty good. Presentation was really nice. All in all we found then food better than most of the AI that we have stayed at. Our main complaint was that most of the food was served barely warm. The beach in front of the resort was better than I had read, yes there were sandbags and they were ugly but there still was plenty of room for walkers and sun worshipping. For $50.00 per night we upgraded to an ocean front room. Room 353, it was a really nice room with two balconies, king size bed and a really nice bathroom. Our room overlooked the old cruise ship pier, and also faced the Royal. The room had a fully stocked mini fridge with pop and beer along with 4 waters everyday. There also was a four bottle liquor dispenser. It was a little noisy in the mornings as we also faced the street. Service trucks start rolling around 5:00AM The Pools were really nice and clean and heated by the sun. The sky high hot tub was not so hot. We were disappointed about this. This area would be the one area that we think could use a lot of improvement. There is a lot of potential here. This is suppose to be an adult’s only area and was not enforced. As this is the only area in the hotel that is adults only it would have been nice to see a little extra attention paid to the people who wanted to use it. Many people while we were there just turned around and walked away after seeing all of the kids. If you wanted to get a drink after 5:00 you had to walk all the way to the main bar by the main pool. About a ten minute walk one way. It also could use a lot more lighting up there as it gets dark by 5:30. The drinks were good for the most part. The hospitality/VIP room was a great idea. Beer on tap, wine, liquor, juice and pop dispenser, along with meat and cheese trays. FYI they will not fill your bubba kegs at the bar. If they see you have one on the beach they will not serve you and walk right on by. Another thing we liked about the place was the proximity to 5th Ave, about a two block walk. Would we stay here again? Yes we would, but would like to try the Royal next time.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent" said like Mr Burns.”
Reviews.Author: samkiddogordon
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, awesome food at the buffet, so close to shopping and everything, nice white sandy beach. great staff. #1 choice in area to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: googoos
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, and .I just returned from Gran Porto Real resort. After reading some of the mixed reviews I really did not know what to expect. Well they exceeded our expectations of all the good things that we could have envisioned . 1. The staff were great, 2.The Junior Suite was spacious and very clean. 3. Pool was used daily by all of us and beach chairs were available daily.4. Ocean was warm,beautiful and oh so welcome to us from the Midwest.. 5. Food was very good, not great except for Breakfast which was great. ie: cooked to order French Toast, Pancakes,and Eggs. 6. We were not bothered by time share people at all.at the Hotel . Hint ,do not go to guest services with the note they slip under your door about the Gold Package you will receive unless you do want to join their Time Share, I mean Club. This was the best by far that we have been to in Playa. As we usually stay at small < 30 rooms there. This was our 11th trip to Playa in 9 years. Would we go back to GPR.? In a Heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was excellent”
Reviews.Author: petunia26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real. Its the first time we have been in Mexico and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were asked if we wanted an upgrade but as we were staying for two weeks it would have been too expensive. We just had a standard room overlooking the Royal but it was very clean and nicely decorated and the maid service was excellent. We thought the meals were great and there was plenty of choices on the buffet. We ate in the both the Italian and the Mexican a couple of times and they were excellent. We didnt have to wait for a seat. The pool was nice and the activities team were really great. We will definitely return there if we visit again. hazel cuthbert scotland uk

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kckid62
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Playa for almost ten years and this is the first stay @ Gran Porta the service was terrible, when we arrived an checked into our room we noticed that they had painted it that day so it smelled like paint so we tried to change rooms but there wasn't any rooms til the next day, The property is in need of alot of maintenance. The restaurants were ok but you only have two (2) to choose from, I will never stay at Real again, If you want a good all inclusive resort go to a Palace resort!! if this is 5 star then Palace is 5 diamonds

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Linds80
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fantastic holiday at the Gran Porto Real in the Mayan Riviera. I traveled with a group of people, including my 7months old daughter. I was nervous at the beginning as it was our first trip with our daughter, but I needn’t have worried. The wonderful and accommodating staff at this hotel took away the worries and made our trip enjoyable. The holiday would not have been the same without them! Thank you Florencio, Freddy, May, Alfonso, Pablo (just to name a few)…who treated us like friends and family our entire trip. ROOMS We arrived at mid-day and were very happy to find that check in was quick and easy. We were able to leave our suitcases at the reception while we grabbed a quick bite to eat, before we were taken to our beautiful rooms. We booked Ocean Front rooms, which were well worth the extra cost, our view was fantastic. The room was nice and clean, the showers huge, the bed was comfortable, and as I said, the view was gorgeous. FOOD We all loved the food at the hotel. The buffet was good, with enough variety each day to keep all 7 of us happy for the week. The two specialty restaurants were also good and there was no problems getting seats for dinner. We even ventured to the Asiana restaurant one night, at the Royal next door. Gran Porto guests receive 50% off of the price. We all loved our meals. BEACH and POOL What a beautiful beach with nice white powdery sand and there are also a few shady bits, for those who want it. There are some (small white) sandbags on the shore, but it doesn’t take away from the beauty of the beach. Although we didn’t use it to much the pool was great, a good size and very clean with enough loungers to keep everyone happy. STAFF Simply wonderful! I found the Staff and Management at this hotel great. They really do make your trip extra special. To summarise, we truly enjoyed this hotel and hope to return in the future. Our group ranged from a single traveler to couples, to my husband and I with the baby. This hotel suited all of us. I now have lots of tips on travelling with a baby, and why the Gran Porto Real makes a great choice for those who are!

Reviews.Title: “Wowzers”
Reviews.Author: kebe
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real Hotel and Spa Oct 2008 Reviewer: North Battleford, Saskatchewan in Canada. This was our first trip to Mexico and we needed a holiday away from it all. This hotel had quite a surprise in store for us. The hotel is beautiful, is very clean and the all inclusive was truly all inclusive! The service was absolutely excellent - also a big surprise! The buffet was one of the best I have ever seen and the two a-la-carte resaurants were of very high standard. We came home heavier than we left! In the evening there was time for a walk down fifth avenue - sort of like running the gauntlet but very interestng shops and people then we would return for a different stage entertainment every night at the hotel. Great! This was all great but the real reason we went south was to get some beach time. There is beach service included with the package (also a surprise) and if you get a chance to go to this hotel - keep your eyes peeled for the waiter Jesus (on the beach)(pronounced "heyzeus"). I was reaching for a cookie one morning when this chihuawa dog barked at me from behind - I jumped - and turned around and here was Jesus (the dog impersonator) - we had a big laugh and became instant friends. He made our week! His partner (beach waitress) Theresa also worked very hard to keep up with Jesus to make sure you had what you needed. If you go - be sure to say hi to Jesus from Ken and Betty from Canada and you will go home happy as well! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “TWO LADIES 10:30PM AND NO ROOM FOR US”
Reviews.Author: lauraLA
Reviews.Content: After booking months in advance we arrived to hear we had NO room. Two ladies, 10:30pm on a Friday night. No reason why we didnt have a room -the front desk person sent us to the sister resort across the street with the bellboy pushing our luggage only to find the Porto Real not eager to give us a room as well. This person sent us to the very back upstars room next to loud motors and no view of the ocean like we had paid in advance for. The next morning we were on the phone with Travelocity and on hold for a long time with no reason why we had not gotten the room we paid for. This phone call was a $100 dollar waist of our money but we had to pay before we could check out and go back across the street to get our room above the restarnt with a wake up call at 4:30am that we didnt want. After crying at the front desk because of no sleep Sonja told me she would give me a walk out beachfront upgrade with no extra charge and we again for the 3rd time moved to the best room in the place. After a night of heck and another day of our 5 day vacation waisted waiting to see if we would get our room and another day moving we had a great time near the ocean and up on 5th ave. Went to Cozumel and took the jeep tour and snorkle ex. Had a great guide but the swim and walk to snorkle was too much for no more time than we got in the reef- did see a sea turtle and a few fish. Last year we did the Sea Passion and had a blast in lsland of women and saw more in the water. The wait staff told me that the no room thing happens a lot .

Reviews.Title: “"Poor"”
Reviews.Author: julygirl_8
Reviews.Content: The Grand Porto is average, (As laura from london says in her review) WATCH OUT FOR THE SCAM AT CANCUN AIRPORT as we had the same problem l left glasgow with the correct amount of weight allowed for first class and on return to the uk,, l had 2 picture frames and 2 bottles of tequila and ended up 6kg overweight as they do weigh all your cases together,, l ended up paying $120.00 as l did not have anything to leave to reduce the weight,,,SO PEOPLE PLEAS PLEASE PLEASE BE AWARE THIS IS A TRUE SCAM,,, The Hotel,, dont get me wrong it was clean,, good housekeeping,, but the meals in the buffet were not catered for any brittish visitors in my view, unless you are happy to eat eggs every morning,, and burger at lunchtime,, we were there for 2 weeks and on arrival we were offered to upgrade to the sister hotel "The Royal " across the road,,we went to look at it,, and it was excellent but decided to stay at the porto as my sister had orginised her wedding at this hotel,, HUGE MISTAKE" that she ever made, on the day after arriving we went to meet the wedding co-ordinator and my sister was shown the wedding cakes that she was to get but the one that she was shown was 3 ties but 1 was green 1 was orange 1 lemom she almost passed out,, and she said she was not accepting this so they ended up with a wedding cake that looked like a child had made, she had picked to have the wedding held at the gazebo at 16hrs, but on the day of the wedding we were getting frantic as at the staff as 1 hr before the wedding was to take place there was nothing ready and again we complained,, 1/2 hour later still nothing was done infact the ladys from the spa were still doing massages in the gazeebo,, 15 mins before they were due to get married the only thing they did was move the massage tables and place two chair the chairs were not even dressed like they show you in their pictures (as there were only the four of us for the wedding) but to give you an idea there was an american couple who got married a few days before and the gazeebo was beatiful and they also just had the basic wedding package, so we thought oh this is really lovely,, but no such treatment for my sister her wedding day was a disaster all in all l would never recommened this hotel,, oh and if you want any extras for the wedding the hotel is very expencive,, if you go there upgrade for the sister hotel THE ROYAL across the road paying the extra was well worth every penny,, bettere choice of resturants as you have 7 there and only 3 in the porto. OH and the photographer that the hotel use for your wedding photos is not profesional l have shown one of my sisters wedding very poor,

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: paddy010
Reviews.Content: We spent two lovely weeks at this hotel and what a fabulous time we had, the weather was absolutely gorgeous. The location of the hotel was superb close to fifth avenue but not to close that it was noisy. The staff at the hotel were very good nothing was too much trouble. The hotel entertainmet in the evening was a bit boring it was the same format every night they just changed the name and because we were there two weeks it was repeated again on the second week. Our room was a junior suite and it was exellent, we had a little mini fridge in our room and it was topped up everyday, the hotel was so clean. The food was good the only restaurant that was dissapointing was the mexican (marias) the italian was good however the choices were limited. The pool was well maintained and it was cleaned everyday. We would definetely come back we had such a lovely honeymoon we met some really nice people

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelnoelle
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Gran Porto for 6 nights, and had a great time. We were there for a wedding that was held at the sister hotel, the Royal. We tried going over to the Royal with the bridal party the day before the wedding, but we weren't even allowed inside. Overall, we really enjoyed the GP. The weather was overcast and rainy pretty much the whole time, which was a little upsetting, but the hotel has many nice features. The maid staff is great, and our room was cleaned perfectly every day. We ate at every restaurant, and weren't overly impressed with the food, but it was what we expected for the price we paid at an all inclusive resort. One day, we went up to the roof top pool to get sushi, and came to find that they had put ham inside the rolls. Very strange. Most meals we ate in the buffet, which was pretty good and had a great selection. The staff was all very nice, and the entertainment was fun. We did an excursion to Coba, which was the highlight of the trip. Its an all day trip, and they take you zip lining through the jungle, and rappeling down a cliff. They also take you into a Mayan village, where the women cooked us a Mayan feast. It was great!! Alltournative was the name of the company, and I would fully recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Darrel76
Reviews.Content: can't go wrong with GPR! blocks away from the famous 5th ave. shopping. top notch service, food, and staff. Right in the town so you can explore "real" Mexico. close to Mayan ruins and Tulum which is amazing. Take the collectivo, instead of a packaged tour, you will save tons of money and learn something in the process. This Hotel is not large so you get to know the staff by name. 5out of 5!!!! Walking distance to the ferry to the island of Cozumel, take this trip you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!! Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Laurafromlondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real for 2 WEEKS and we loved every single minute of it. But before saying more about this beautiful hotel let me warn you about the SCAM AT CANCUN AIRPORT. This has nothing to do with the Gran Porto but I believe it's important to know what happened to us and to many other passengers checking in at Cancun airport. When we got to the airpot (to go back home) I decided to go to an empty check in to weight my suitcase (as I normaly do). With my big surprise, my suticase was 3 kgs heavier than what it was at the check in in London. It was supposed to be much lighter as we had finished the shampoos and the sunprotections (the souvenirs were in the hand luggage). So my friend weighted her suitcase and even in this case it was 4Kg heavier. We also noticed that, once you had taken the suitcase off the scale, it was still showing 2.7kg for a few seconds and then go back to zero! Every became clear when we saw a cashier opening right next to the check it and there were signs poppin up at every corner saying that for each Kg overweight you had to pay £10 (or $20). When we went for the check in they asked us to weight our suicase together (even having a separate ticket!!!). They took away the suitcase from us and then said that we had to pay 7 kg overweight. At that point we had to fight to have our suitcase back while they were almost threatening us about the handluggage weight. We put everything we could in the hand luggage and went back to the check in, where we refused to weight the suitcase together. My suitcase was still 1kg overweight (it was 21kg!) so they asked me to pay for it. I went to the cashier and (almost furious) I gave her my credit card. She refused the payment!!!! But we can guarantee that if I gave her cash she would have taken it. Most of the people on our flight have paid. So.... make sure that all the heavy stuff is in the hand luggage, refuse to weight the suicase together and pay by card!!!! Remember: all the cash is going straight into their pockets and there is no record of it (don't be surpriesd if they want to give you a "deal" if you pay cash)! Don't bother calling the police, they are getting a piece of the cake. About the Gran Porto Real... I have to say thank you to Tripadvisor. We read many positive reviews and... we couldn't be happier of our choice. For reasons that I am not going to explain, we saw other hotels, and every time we were really glad that we had chosen the Gran Porto. There are other beautiful hotels on the Mayan Riviera but they are in the middle of nowhere!!! Be ready for a 30 min taxy ride to see the closest form of life. Anyway... we upgraded to a Junior suite (paying $20 more per night, to share in 2), the service was FANTASTIC, the beach is beautiful, the food is good and the location is just perfect. Some people said that the food is repetitive, please remember that you can choose from 6 different restaurants!!! Some people said that the beach is "rocky", well...we bought the shoes for the beach and we have NEVER used them (there are few big rocks here and there but the water is so transparent that you can just avoid them). I would just suggest to buy the tours on the 5th avenue, you will pay a third of the price,.... same thing for the massages (the spa is great but too bloody expensive!!!). Be generous with your tips, make sure you have a good amount of $1 notes... trust us...it's worthed... you will be absolutely spoilt!!! So... put a smile on your face, relax and enjoy your holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: par01
Reviews.Content: We visited the Mayan Riviera for the first time, and it was probably the most amazing family trip ever! There were 9 of us family members who went up together (5 kids, 4 adults) and we stayed at the gran porto real resort. We had the best time of our lives! The adults enjoyed every minute and the teenagers enjoyed every minute. They have entertainment for all ages. Plenty of nightlife that you wont get sick of, awesome awesome food, the best service, and just an amazing overall experience. We are going back again in April, to the same resort. Thats how much we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Mackaymac
Reviews.Content: This resort came highly recommended by my sister who stays there every year. We had a great time. The rooms are excellent, clean and large. We had a JR. Suite and it was terrific. I wouldn't upgrade for the money. They do a high pressure sales pitch to upgrade but once you tell them no they leave you alone. I was not ever approached by the staff to atttend any time share sales pitch either. You are so close to 5th ave where the action is. Walking distance easy!!!! 2 blocks. The beach did have sand bags from the storms and was a little rocky but wasn't too bad. We walked to nearby beaches and they were fine. There was some topless sunbathers so be careful if you are offended by this. Over all we had an exceptional time. The only downer was I got tired of the food. It was good but it all had the same flavor. What can I expect though if I am in Mexico. Don't book your tours at the hotel either, go to 5th ave, they are cheaper and the exact thing, in fact those who booked at 5th rode in the same van as we did. Great place with friendly staff and no language barrier. IF you are going to snorkle though you will have to go to Cozamel, there are no reefs in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed every minute!”
Reviews.Author: jaynelarry31
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at the Gran Porto Real and had a fabulous holiday. It was our first trip to Mexico and we weren't sure what to expect but we definitely were not disappointed. We loved everything about it. The hotel was great. Our junior suite was spacious, luxurious and well equipped. The mini bar was restocked daily and the maids did a great job . The towel art was amazing!! The staff in every area were friendly and helpful. We were reassured by the presence of the security staff and they certainly did not make us feel uncomfortable or restricted in any way. In terms of cleanliness, we were amazed at how thorough everything was cleaned every day, even down to door handles and the showers between the beach and the pool area. The food was excellent all round. Some strange combinations to be sure , to our English tastes, but that was expected. There was always a huge selection to choose from. And cakes everywhere!!! All in all it was brilliant and we couldn't find anything to criticise at all. Fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Ever!”
Reviews.Author: julesandkarl
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a wonderful two weeks at the Gran Porto Real. It was actually a last minute, rush decision for us - we'd originally booked for Cuba and had to switch at the very last minute due to Huricane Ike. We're fairly well travelled and it's quite common to come away from a holiday being able to criticise something or other - but we couldn't think of one single thing to complain about. I'm bewildered by others comments - we found the presence of the security staff quite reassuring. Nothing was too much trouble for any member of staff, from any department. The food was fabulous in all three restaurants - and it was plentiful. We couldn't walk 20 yards without passing a tray of cakes! OK, what particularly stood out for us? The quality of the accomodation - everywhere you look you can see someone cleaning something. Sunbeds get scrubbed in the middle of the night. It's immaculate in every respect. The rooms were superb - large sunken baths (roman style), DVD's in every room, mini bar replenished every day, loads of space. Friendly staff - look out for Jose the waiter around the pool. He's a gem. We DID tip the waiters around the pool and on the beach but we didn't get the feeling that it was expected, quite the opposite. Room Service - it's actually included in the All Inclusive package. It's not chargeable as an extra! Where else have you seen this? Hotel Activities - try the daily (free) cycle tour. It's 45 minutes and takes you on a gentle ride around Mayan Ruins. Would we go back? In an instant! A short while ago we paid three times the price of this holiday to go to The Almond Beach Village in Barbados - and this was better, much better!

Reviews.Title: “Choose wisely”
Reviews.Author: artbymic
Reviews.Content: Want the real story? The up side is it is clean very pretty and service staff is wonderful The bad, I made the mistake of having my wedding there and having the majority of my guests stay at this hotel. The managers didn't honor anything they claimed they would do and the conserge did only a so-so job. The managers and security staff treated us and our guest like crap. The place is like Las Vegas in it's congestion minus the manners and has the hospitality of an iron maiden (this during the off season). The security guards treat every one like they are criminals no matter what and followed me and my guests around. The guest I had who choose not to stay at this hotel but to visit us their where treated like extra special crimals. I regret the choice in staying there. My advice choose a different hotel. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Changed Resort”
Reviews.Author: big1bass
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 6th year in a row at the Gran Porto Real. We were very disappointed in several areas. I'm not sure if the price of fuel or the lack of occupancy controlled our dissapointment.. In the previous 5 yrs our visits to the Gran Porto Real have been remarkable. This year was different.. It started off by the supervisor at the front desk telling us at check in that we were going to be given a free upgrade since we were returning guests for the 6fh time. WOW we thought, until he gave us the same room we paid for anyway.. No big deal.. but didn't appreciate the hype with no reward. We also noticed the Chef's have changed at the restuarants and so with the menu's.. I guess if you have never been there before you wouldn't know the difference.. However the Food was not as good as it has been in the past. I assume with the price of fuel driving up cost everywhere, the Resort has to cut back.. Also I noticed the Resort was only about 40% occupied.. Good and Bad results with that.. Plenty of space, no lines, etc.. Services and Food were cut as expected with no revenue.. I understand but still disapointed. The one thing I can't figure out with this Hotel is why they do not cater to returning guests.. you would think as to any business they would market towards repeat business but You just don't get that feeling while your there.. 6 Years and you are treated like a first timer there.. Except for a few staff members that might remember you.. They just don't seem to care if you come back. We will try a different resort next year.. The First 5 years was great.. Time to move on..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gran porto and were coming back with friends!”
Reviews.Author: dglmlv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran porto real last year and had the best vacation ever.It was our 4th time down to the Mayan coast.Although every trip was great,staying at the Gran was a extra special experience.First off the staff went out of their way to be helpful.They were always friendly.The rooms were always very clean.We always saw someone working.The hotel was never dirty.The shows put on were well done.The food was very good.Never needed a reservation for the restaurants.We always got a good seat by the pool or the beach.The beach wait staff run their butts off in the heat all day!!!(PLEASE TIP THEM)You know you brought a little extra.Don't be cheap! People were coming over from the sister hotel (The Royal) wanting to stay at the gran because they had heard such good things about it.And they weren't wrong.We're coming back this year and bringing our friends.Can't wait!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The good Bad & Ugly”
Reviews.Author: dennis1963
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real - The Good The Bad & The Ugly… The Good… We were picked up at the airport and after several stops we arrived at Gran Porto Real on August 24, 2008. Check in was very easy and we were offered an upgrade and we took it. We had a Junior Suite Ocean front room. The room was very clean VERY BIG and just perfect & beautiful. I shower was huge. All the restaurants were just great! We thought the food was very good. Drink service on the beach & pool area also was very good. We really enjoyed our stay and would stay again. The Bad We were told to go to guest service to find out the hotel after we were told about the restaurants, pools and other info. I knew that this was going to end up a timeshare thing I asked when I first met the guest services rep if this was a timeshare thing. They said NO They lied I told them NO leave me alone do bother me. We was left alone. The said it was not a timeshare but a club. Call it what you want. Just Say NO! The Ugly The Beach was beautiful but very rocky I was told because of Hurricane Wilma very rocky. We really had a lot of fun and would go back Nice place good rate. Rev. Dennis & Carol

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: simonsummers
Reviews.Content: a four star hotel with a five star service WOW what a holiday . we went as a family myself my wife and 2 children we all absoluty loved this hotel everything was great. the waiter service was unbelievable and could not fault it in one way. our room over looked the pool and beach and what a view to wake up to every morning. food and drinks were great and never tired off it. the kids club well i didnt see my children for 2 weeks only for a quick dip in the pool and at night when kids club closed. they entertained my children for the 2 weeks we were there and my kids loved it and the staff in there. my daughter cried when she left that was how much of a good time we all had. i hope to go back next year to as no were else can match up to this place . i would recommend this hotel to everyone and anyone it had no faults what so ever and is in easy walking distant to 5th avenue it take 2 mins to get there and the shops are pretty good with something for everyone definaltly a place to go and visit

Reviews.Title: “Will Go Back Again And Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: aklkgarner
Reviews.Content: We just got back from another trip to the Gran Porto Real. This makes 6 times. We had a group of 13 people and we all had a GREAT time. Everything is always clean and everyone very friendly. Food was even better than in past years. Pablo, Benito, Jose, Jesus, Sarai- (lobby bar)- Thank you for all your hard work. You are what makes the hotel GREAT! Robert- (in the dining room)- Thank you for making our brithday celebration so wonderful. Philipe- (upstairs pool)- We had a blast up there with you. Thank you! When I read other reviews about this hotel, I just dont get it. I think Americans need to remember that you are in another country and Mexico moves a lot slower than in America. That is one of the things I LOVE about Mexico. Take a breath, slow down, and you will have an EXCELLENT time. We'll be back, Alan & Lisa Garner

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Not 5 star though”
Reviews.Author: IJustLoveTheSun
Reviews.Content: Well, I read previous reviews and I will give you our honest opinion.. ...................without the over dramatisation! Thoroughly rate First Choice Airlines!!! We paid for 4 upgraded seats into Premium Cabin. Excellent legroom/seat/food/drinks/service/ pampering packs/entertainment. If you are flying charter, this is the upgrade to go for. I would not upgrade short haul, but long haul every time. Hotel was excellent location, for when you got terribly bored of the hotel food, which was repeatative and buffet (which you have as only choice for breakfast) was VERY Mexican. Fajitas, Brocolli and Spicy Fish are not my cuppa for breakfast, or my bowel!. TOP TIP _ ask for bacon from one of the waiters, for some strange reason you cannot readily get it in the counters, but in this hotel, "you dont ask, you dont get". Omeletes and fried eggs good. Only one toaster though, which gets a que forming. Some of the waiters in buffet are rude, but overall, the hotel staff are eager to please. Theresa/Jose on pool waitering, are very friendly and work very hard. Entertainment is there if you want it. Beach has been damaged by previous hurricanes, but 100m to your left to the other side of the pier is the "Royal" beach, which is fab. We went snorkelling and the kids absolutley loved the little coral reef to the side of the Swing Bar.........highly recommend this! Staff at the check in desk "pounce" on every guest to upgrade......... ..British customers beware! They rip us off...........I spoke to many many other guests and you need to basically barter for a good price, everyone gets quoted different prices!. We booked a Junior Suite, and on arrival upgraded to Ocean Front Suite (which basically meant that we got optics in our room and a full ocean and pool view, NO OTHER DIFFERENCE, the ocean view rooms are at the back of the hotel and "at a push" you can stretch your neck to see it). We paid another 60US$ a night, other couples paid 50 or 40 and an American lady I spoke to (who has been 3 times and does fantastic Beach Sculptures) was charged 30US$ and given one of the best rooms in the hotel, with huge balcony with 2 sunbeds on it, and fuit and fizzy wine in room!. The repeat guests wear black wrist bands and first timers wear yellow ones. American / Canadian guests tip regularly, to all staff. On our welcome meeting we were told tipping is not required................. again beware!............if you want good service after day one you need to tip (the staff are very assertive), otherwise you are almost blacklisted by staff, and you will be last for everything! (you have been warned). Your are supplied with a towel card for each guest which you hand over everyday to towel desk and recieve a towel - TOP TIP_ smell the towel before you accpet it!, they are very sneaky and try to give you a nicely folded "used" one! You will be charged 30US$ per card on departure if you do not hand in your cards to reception at check out. Use "Best Day Tours" based in the hotel to arrange excursions, very reliable and good value. I recommened the Tulum and Xel-ha visit. You can't go all the way the the Yucatan pinisula and not see some Mayan Temples!, and Xel-ha is a brilliant place, snorkel, dolphins, snuba, sea trek...........check out the xel-ha website before you go for an insight...............food is great there too! Our room had excellent air conditioning, mini bar re-stocked daily with 6 mineral water, 2 coke, 2 diet coke, 2 sprite, 2 fanta, and 2 bottles of beer! woopee. Ice machines are available near the lift on each floor, so you can stock up, and water machines are next to them, so if you run out, you can re-fill yourself. TOP_TIP- The pool has very high (almost excessive) Chlorine levels (I know about this due to experience with pools), Blondes beware - you'll go a tinge of green, and all white swimming costumes will also go very green. TOP_TIP - Mojito's (alcoholic drink made with Mint leaves, fresh lime, rum, sugar syrup soda water and ice) are brilliant!, give them a try. And the iced mango and orange (available either with or withour alcohol) are delicious. TOP-TIP - Ice cream not readily available, you have to go to the buffet reastaurant and ask the floor manager. No flavour choices, you get what you are given, but this should be readily available in a country where the weather was 38degrees C every day!!! Kids and adults allike needed to cool down. The pool would become very hot by 1.00pm! We had a nice break, I can see why the Americans only do one week.... .............2 weeks here is as I mentioned before, is very repeatative.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Cosibella
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our Anniversary trip, we had never stayed at an all-inclusive before it was fabulous. We were there 5 days 6 nights. We can't wait to go back!! The resort was exceptionally clean, if we needed anything in our room someone was there to help all most instantly, there was never any waiting around for service. They recognized that it was our Anniversary, the food was great and the resort was very relaxing and pleasant. It was within walking distance of shopping and also the Ferry to go to Cozumel. We can't say enough great things about this resort. The beach was magnificent. The pool area was also Great! Nightly entertainment was awsome! We booked our trip through Worry-Free vacations and everything was taked care of,even our transfer from Airport to Resort and Resort to Airport. We would recommend this to anyone looking for a relaxing get away.

Reviews.Title: “An Alright Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachlover722
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying 5 nights at the Gran Porto Real. Here is my review. I apologize in advance for the length. Check-In- Check-in went absolutely perfect. We had a ocean view junior suite. They asked us if we would like to either upgrade to a jacuzzi room at the Royal or an ocean walk-up at the Porto Real for an extra $150. We said we'd think about it, but would like to see our room first. Check-in is at 3:00 and this was at 11:00 so they gave us a room right away while everyone else had to wait until 3:00. After seeing our room we were more than happy with it. It was very spacious. The "oceanview" was more of a view looking at the Royal and turning to right to see the ocean but we didn't mind at all. Food- The food was okay, but I am a very picky eater. The buffet is your only choice besides room service for breakfast and lunch. I always found something to eat. They have great omelets, but I will warn you that one of their choices of "ham" is actually cut up hot dog weenie. That really grossed me out. The other shredded ham for the omelet is great though! The snack bar on the beach has great chicken wings! We never made it down to trade winds though. For dinner you can have the buffet, the italian, the mexican, or room service. We went to the buffet twice. The first time it was extremely good! The second night was a Mexican theme night and I couldn't find one thing to eat so we left and wen to the Italian. The Italian restaurant is very good! We loved it both times...but both times we got sick afterward in the middle of the night. We tried the Mexican restaurant once. It was okay. Again, I'm picky and don't like spicy foods so I opted for the beef medallion with red wine sauce and it was alright. We really enjoyed the room service food. My husband tried the fried chicken tacos and the Mexican beef strips and loved them. I got the chicken breast and it was very good! All of the restaurants had wonderful desserts. Drinks- We spent a lot of time at the bar by the pool and beach. We really liked the evening bartenders, but didn't care much for the day time bartenders. All of them make a wonderful Amaretto sour and strawberry daquiri! Jose, part of the beach side drink staff was very nice. Those guys work so hard. Walking back and forth all day long delivering drinks. Service- The service is what makes this hotel just alright. I'm the guest, yet I was always first to greet the staff with a big smile and an "hola!". Many times there would be no response back. There weren't many of the staff who went out of their way to be polite. We tipped everywhere we went so it's not like we didn't show appreciation to them. There were many times a tip was not deserved, but we left one anyway. We would go an entire meal and not be waited on once. One of the first days we were there we left the maid a $5 tip and came back to a room that had the comforter thrown on top of the bed and that's about it. Yet, we still left tips everyday and one day she didn't even come until we called around 5:00 to ask if someone could atleast come sweep the sand out of the bathroom. The rude staff was one of the only things to put a damper on our vacation. Beach- The beach was great! It's not huge but it worked. It's very clean. I've seen some pictures that depict it as dirty, but I woulld consider it anything but. It's not a private beach so there were locals and vendors walking by. The sand bags were not an issue at all. The water was shallow so you could walk waaayyy out there and still only be up to your hips and I'm short. We had one pretty windy day so there were big waves coming in and they were really fun to play in. Activities- Thank god for the animation team! My idea for this vacation was to lay on the beach all day. My husband is way too active to just lay around so the animation team was great for him. He took part in many of their activities every day and I got to peacefully nap on the beach for a few hours! We also visited Tulum and Xel-Ha and did parasailing with the company who had a booth right on the beach. Tulum was amazing for my husband. He's a huge history buff and loved every second of it. It was way too much walking and heat for me, but it was interesting to see. Xel-Ha was an absolute blast. We only spent 5 hours there and we could have spent an entire day. I highly recommend Xel-Ha. Parasailing was a great experience. Everyone should do it atleast once in their lifetime. We also painted a vase at the ceramic booth. It's more of a kiddie thing, but I had been sick that morning so it was a fun thing to do out of the heat. The guy that works there is so nice! By time we left we were great friends! The evening dance shows were okay. We could never get ourselves to sit thru an entire show, but it was something to watch while at the bar. Okay I think that's finally it! I would recommend this hotel if someone wanted to get away to the beach, but not be treated like 5 star guests. This hotel definately served its purpose for relaxation, but having stayed at other resorts in the Riviera Maya I can say this resort does lack in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: special2001usa
Reviews.Content: Went here early May (mother's day weekend) nice place. As soon as you get in, they give you a delicious cocktail. If your room isn't ready, they will hold your bags while you change in the lobby bathroom into your swimsuit and enjoy the resort. Before all of that they try to sell you to the adults only resort right next door. The pool is nice, its first come first serve. So if you want a couple of seats, get up early. They have the staff do the same routine everyday at the same time..Its cute, your on vacation...Relax and drink away. Its okay to leave the resort, not scary at all. Restaurants: Albatros is nice and the buffet is good. Maria's, Gaviotas and the Sushi Bar was okay. Nothing too special. Didn't really go into the ocean, it was lined with sand bags and just felt weird crossing over the Bags to get in. The Gym, nothing special, they have about 3 treadmills lined up infront of the window, 1 bike (I think) and couple of pieces to do weights. The massage, hhmmm....That was okay too.. My Room was very very clean. I was very pleased. Overall, I would recommend this place for the price, but don't expect any special...Its a good place to relax and enjoy the sun.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: sagedallas
Reviews.Content: We just got back from GPR. I have stayed ther before 3 years ago and love this place. The service is unbelievable and the people are so friendly.If you drink to much and are hungover they also have a steam room and after you get out of that they have a cold whirlpool you jump into for 5 minutes and you feel great.The location is unbelievable walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Karen223
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Porto the first two weeks of July. We were both so pleased with the hotel. The staff are superb and cannot do enough for you. And as for cleanliness - I have never seen such a high standard anywhere else. We had a junior suite which overlooked the street, and down onto the Mexican Restaurant. We were a little concerned at first as we thought the restaurant might be a little noisy. How wrong we were. The restaurant actually finished serving by 11 p.m. and there was never any noise during the hours it opened. Both the Italian and Mexican A-La-Carte are a must to visit, which we both did on many an occassion! Thank you Gran Porto for a truly wonderful and relaxing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE REAL”
Reviews.Author: lvprettyplcs
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? This place is fabulous. From the time we arrived till the time we left it was nothing but FANTASTIC..... The arrival ~ We got to the airport fairly early around 10:30am & proceeded to get our luggage & find our shuttle. When people tell you about the herd of people outside the airport trying to sell you excursions & shuttles to the resort, they arn't kidding. Just walk past all of them & head straight for the van with your companyls name on them. The van was there to pick us up when we arrived & to our suprise with a cooler FULL of ice cold Coronas.. The drive from the airport to the resort was about 45 minutes due to having to stop at 2 other resorts before ours. When we arrived at the hotel our room was actually ready & we were able to check in well before noon... The Room ~ The rooms there are very nice size & very nicely decorated. We didn't have a ocean view unless you leaned waaay out our balcony & to the right down the street you could see a little bit. The beds were pretty comfy too which doesn't happen to much on vaca!!! The shower was wonderful! It had a really big shower that was large enough to fit 4 people..... Service ~ Everyone there was very nice & always spoke with an Hola when passing you in the halls or anywhere on the grounds.. THe food was really good too. The Italian restaurant was REALLY good. I think for a couple extra $$$$ (maybe 10) we had the lobster & filet at least 3 times during our stay.... The breakfast buffet was also nice & the food was always well prepared & hot.. Which I havve found to be a problem at other resorts. Activities ~ The daily activities at the pool were fun. Wether we were playing drunk bingo or the limbo. One of the guys there LUIS was the BEST. He went out of his way to make sure we had the best week ever. Each night he took us down 5th avenue to a different bar & to show us different stores & such... One night he even arranged a shuttle for about 8 -10 of us to go to Cancun for a night of partying. That was the highlight of the trip. We had VIP service at all the places we went & open bar. Weather ~ The weather is pretty HOTT! The sun is like no sun you have felt before. I got the best tan of my life that week & can't wait to go back... It rained at about 3pm everyday we were there for about 25 minutes & then it was gone & back to the pool we went. Might I add in case you have smaller ones ~~~~~ The beach to the left in the back of the hotel is TOPPLESS. Not too many go for it but some are not afraid..... All in all we loved this hotel! I can't wait to go back. I have told many of my friends about this hotel & a few have agreed upon their return...

Reviews.Title: “living als one king in mexico”
Reviews.Author: batavia-06
Reviews.Content: The GPR is a fantastic hotel,rooms are great. Wow,we had a wonderfull time. staff are some of nicest people (Rober,Jose) also de swimmingpool people is great (teresa,Pablo) I can say every body off this hotel. we were at GPR 07-04-08 t/m 28-04-08 We come back! fam e.kramer Lelystad Holland

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel off 5th Ave”
Reviews.Author: VLobos
Reviews.Content: We were at the GPR rom July 10-July 17 and absolutely loved our experience. This was our first time at an all-inclusive so were a bit apprehensive at first. We are normally the type of travelers that stay in a room only to sleep while we are out all day. The purpose of this trip was to actually relax, as it was our honeymoon. This experience has definitely opened my eyes to this kind of vacation. The minute we arrived we received a warm welcome. We upgraded and stayed in room 352 which had an excellent location, it partially faces the Royal but also the ocean. Our room was excellent; spacious, cool and in a quiet location. It had liquor dispensers as well as the stocked fridge. Pool and Beach – service was amazing! We never had to wait for a drink. The servers are extremely friendly which made our time there more comfortable. The areas are clean and well maintained. There are sand bags on the beach but that didn’t bother us since we were mainly at the pool. You can also walk further down to the Royal’s beach which is nicer. Restaurants – When in the hotel we mostly had our meals at the buffet restaurant, Las Gaviotas, which offered a vast selection. We usually grabbed lunch at the outdoor buffet where we could eat by the pool. Had dinner at Maria’s one night, varied menu, the food was delicious. Had dinner one night at Il Pescatore, the high end restaurant, the food was good but I found the menu a bit heavy as it had many pastas. I expected to be a bit lighter and more delicate. Overall, service was excellent at all the restaurants. Housekeeping – our room was always clean and well kept. I left a note for the refrigerator stocker person with some cash to let them know what we wanted in the fridge and it stayed that way throughout our stay. This trip was a dream come true. I based my decision to stay at this hotel from reading all the great Tripadvisor reviews. The one thing that made this AI and vacation perfect for us is it’s proximity to 5th Ave. We were glad to be able to walk to all the shops, restaurants and bars. We were close enough to the colectivos (busses to Tulum) and a lavanderia where we could have our clothes laundered (much cheaper than in the hotel). Being the type of travelers that we are, I think we would have gone a little crazy if we had to get a cab every time we wanted to go outside the property. Not so in this case. This is an excellent property and the staff truly makes this place shine. I can’t wait to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Gran Porto Real was Grand....”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: We had a one-week all-inclusive stay at the Gran Porto and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our junior suite (street side) was very spacious and nicely decorated (pls note I'm a guy with low interior design standards...). The floor was a bit filthy when we first checked in but otherwise no issues with the room or the service. Room was well air conditioned, which was welcomed given how hot it was outside. We were pretty well stocked (fridge, towels etc.) and the staff made sculptures out of the towels, which the g/f loved). We had issues with the safe but it was quickly serviced although it took longer to fix the issue with our dvd player. Location is fanastic - right on the beach and 1 block away from 5th ave (shopping district - never take the first price...shave off 25-50%) and a few more blocks to the bar/club district on 12th Street. There's a mini-mall and a walmart within walking distance too incase your forgot something (we forgot our memory card for the camera, doh!) I thought the food was surprisingly good for a buffet style all-inclusive resort. There was sufficient variety at the buffet as well as the beach side grill (more pub fare though and lunch only). The a la carte restaurants (2 - mexican and italian) were good as well. The buffet had different food themes every night but Mexican food was never really a focal point it seemed other than nachos and the occassional item here or there (although, I guess the Mexican a la carte venue was meant to address any Mexican food cravings) - I guess I'm a purest wanting to try the local cuisine.... Activities were good but I would have liked to have seen more - e.g. casino night was over before we finished dinner. Water sports (the paid type - e.g. jet skis etc.) seemed to be lacking but a lot of day excursions were available. Activity staff were great though. The gym was sufficient and par for the course for a hotel or resort and the g/f was very happy with the spa. Overall, we liked everything about the Gran Porto - quality, service, staff, location, food. We would recommend people go to this resort. ps. be wary of the time share presentation - g/f wanted the complimentary bag/coupon/wrap so we went but it lasted longer than we would have liked. Good deal if you can get out in 90 minutes and if the weather is poor.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ARamblinSoccerMOM
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic surprise!!!!!!!! We were staying in Playa as we had signed up to take Espanol classes. The school booked us at what they thought to be a nice hotel...Uhm, no, it was so miserable. So my twelve year old son and I, walked the beaches of Playa that whole first day. We happened upon the Gran Porto Real. We usually stay at 5 star hotels for our one fancy vaca a year, but this was not itended to be that kind of a vaca. However; we walked into the hotel, which looked like a four or five star hotel, and asked if they had availabilities. They did not until the next night. We looked at the rooms, and we were floored............they are truly beautiful, and upscale. So we signed up to arrive the next night. By the time we walked back to our first hotel, they had called us and told us they had found a room for us, that very day at 3:00pm. We packed up. and hopped in a cab, and were there at 3pm on the dot! The consierge, the employees, the manager, all so very kind, helpful and sympatico!!!!!!!!!!! We only got to stay there for our last 6 nights, but it was so amazing for the price. It truly felt like a 4 or 5vr. All inclusive, and the food was so delicious, even my son ate at the rest. There is an all around rest, an Italian, and a Mexican rest. included in the inclusive package. There are rest. all around the city you could walk to if you wanted, but we never really did, unless we were going back and forth to school. Then we might stop for a snack in town. Oh, I take that back, one night, captured by the spirit of Playa Del Carmen, we stopped at rest. to have dinner. It was pretty good food, and very enjoyable, but it cost $120.00 USD., so after that, we decided, the food was just as good at the hotel, so we would eat our main meals there. We got to know our waiters, as they remember you and say hello every time you go to their place. The specific location on the beach where this hotel is located, is the most beautiful for miles. All around it's kind of dingy and extremely rocky, but for some reason, it is less so here. We swam, kayaked, boogie boarded, sat on cababna chairs with umbrellas while served umbrella drinks for free! What a life!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Oh, so important, one could set the air conditioning in the hotel to FREEZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and every now and then, we did. And the tv has many news stations, which is nice once in awhile, also. Every day when you get back to your room, the cleaning staff has created a towel decoration, like a bunny, a dog, hearts, etc. So cute, like a 5 star in Hawaii! And at night, there is entertainment, but we were too pooped to participate by then, because we were getting up so early for school, but I heard it was really good.

Reviews.Title: “OK at best”
Reviews.Author: joyousTexas
Reviews.Content: Just got back on 7/6/08 and wanted to give my thoughts. Rooms: FANTASTIC! We upgrade to a beach walkout. With this room you get a reserved palapas. Some people said there would be some obstructions due to the palapas right in front. We didn't find that to be an issue. You could still see the ocean and with the shrubs and palapas it provided seclusion. Besides, you are right next to your room in order to use the restroom. Very convienient. Food: Average at best. The selections were minimal and I'm not a picky eater. Breakfast was the best. We went to the Italian restaurant and I found it to be good but the others I was with did not. 2 people got sick. Staff: Always friendly and hard working. However, the rooms never got cleaned before 3pm. Beach: Once again, average. Very rocky and hard to stand around in as it was very wavy. Kept having to jump around to stay standing up. Overall: Pretty good but probably won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMTULSA
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful hotel right on the beach, beautiful rooms, friendly service, cable in room, very convenient location (right around the corner from the 5th Avenue shopping district), ice cold air conditioning in rooms, open-air common areas, and VIP lounge. Cons: The food at the hotel was not very good. We weren't that disappointed though because we had read reviews that stated the food wasn't good. The outlets in the room were not compatible with my blow dryer or hair-straightener.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: mmbTexas
Reviews.Content: Our 10 day stay with a family of 12 could not have been better. The staff was eager to meet every need. The young children looked forward to visiting the kids club, the older children were made to feel so important by the recreation crew, and the adults were made comfortable in everyway. Our rooms were always cool and clean, the food was not only delicious, but the the variety was such that everyone, even the picky eaters had plenty to eat at every meal. Being close todown town was a big plus for us too. The shoppers could leave anytime, the night owls could stay out and find their way back "anytime". The resort even took buses to some of the clubs in the evenings. We wondered if10 days would be too long.... NO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great 25th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: susied07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on Wed. June 11th at 12:00pm. We were greeted immediately by Manola of Guest Services who provided us with a delicous fruity drink, while we waited and waited and waited to be checked in. I was pleasantly surprised , when we were given a room .... no bumping issues for us but still held my beath until I could actually check out the room. I booked a OV room and was so afraid we would have to break our necks to actually see the Sea. Whoo Hooo! Room 244 has a really nice view of the Sea ...not perfect but nice enough for this Midwestern Gal. Yes, Manola talked to us every day about visiting next door for a Timeshare presentation (which we actually took, one day I did not feel well and didn't want to do anything but stay inside!) Here again, these people didn't pressure us alot into buying the timeshare. It was my understanding there had been too many complaints about this! Anyway back to our room.... it was huge... Hats off to LUZ she makes the prettiest towel art! Our mini-fridge was always well stocked, I would just leave a note of what I wanted that day along with a $ and when we returned to the room the drinks would be chilling. Armondo and Lorenzo were our 2 favorite bartenders and would fix drinks to your liking. I liked my weak while my husband liked them strong. Not a problem. Both men remembered your drinks and how you took them. The food was good. I especially likes the Italian Restaurant and we ate they 3 nights... the Tuna Carpatico is to die for. We also ate at Maria's 3 nights.... my husband's favorite. As far as tours go we booked the COBA MAYAN ENCOUNTER with Alltournative . It was fun! We spent one day in Cozumel and took the tour on the submarine. way cool!!! Made many trips down 5th ave and stopped in at Bad Boys Beach Bar ( you can only get there from the beachside) say hi to Pauly. He was quite the character and could carry 3 Margaritas on the top of his head! The only complaint I had was with the front desk, if you ask them a question they didn't know anything and weren't going to do a whole lot to help you out. So if I had a question I would just go to guest services and get help from them. All in all it was a great trip and I would advise anyone to just have an open mind and enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: SunIndiana
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best vacation spot we have ever been to! The hotel was absolutely beautiful, clean and the staff couldn't have been more polite or friendly. We had a Jr. Oceanfront Suite that was very spacious with a nice terrace to relax on and view the ocean. I especially would like to comment on the sports and entertainment crew. It was very obvious that this group of young people loved their jobs. They led activities like water volleyball, beach volleyball, & water aerobics everyday. We will definitely be planning a return trip to the Gran Porto Real!! Carmen Coleman Petersburg, IN 47567

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gvf
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a desitination wedding and what an experience it was. The hotel is just beautiful. The staff unbelievably helpful. The guys at the pool were wonderful. I cannot think of one negative thing to say about this resort. I've been to several all inclusive resorts and this has to be the best. Definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: Chitown32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with two other couples, stayed at the Gran Porto from May 29 thru June 3, 2008 and had an amazing time! After reading all of the reviews, we were prepared for the worst, i.e. overbooking, time share selling, average food, etc. In fact, we were ready to pay the extra money to upgrade to the sister resort next store. But our experience was the complete opposite. We arrived at the hotel about 2:00 p.m. and were greeted with a great cocktail. The front desk then asked if all 3 couples wanted to be upgraded to an ocean front walkout room, all next to each other. For a nominal fee, we upgraded and our rooms were ready! These rooms were beautiful! Very spacious and huge bathrooms. The rooms had terraces with a table and chairs. We also had a palapa on the beach reserved just for our room. The ocean was literally 15 feet away from us! The rooms were always stocked with water, pop and beer. We also took advantage of the unlimited liquor cabinet on the wall in our room. Also, I can't say enough about how comfortable the beds were! The beach did have sandbags, but after you step over them, you are in clear blue warm water. The hotel is protected by a break wall so the water is really calm. The pool was also great and refreshing and we also took advantage of the adult pool on the 4th floor with the swim up bar and sushi bar. We never had any problems finding chairs at the pool or beach. The staff works really hard outside to make sure that the drinks are flowing and everyone is having a good time. In fact, we were served drinks right on our balcony! The food was great! The buffet offers so much variety and everything was really clean. We loved having mimosas every morning! The restaurants were also good, loved the Italian restaurant. It gave perfect portions and we were always able to get a seat on the patio to enjoy the nice weather. The hotel is in a great location. Close to all the shopping and the ferry so the guys could walk to go scuba diving in Cozumel. We checked out some local places to eat which were really good, but spent most of our time at the resort. Which, by the way, we were not hounded at all about upgrading to the sister resort or for the timeshare. We were asked about it once and were left alone after we declined. All in all, this was a great vacation and I would definitely go back. Everyone at the hotel was extremely nice and gave us excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “<3 Loved the Gran Porto Real <3”
Reviews.Author: LP531
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 AMAZING days at the Gran Porto Real while on our honeymoon. We traveled at the end of May through mid-June and had a wonderful time. Upon arrival, we were greeted with champagne and exceptional hospitality! We were able to upgrade our room to a delux ocean veiw for a minimal price...it was perfect! Every day was a new adventure for us! The Sports and Entertainment team constantly kept the guests going with activities. The housekeeping staff kept our room VERY clean, and everyday left us a little something special (a pretty towl design like a swan,fan, or hearts, and beautiful tropical flowers). The entire vacation was a dream come true. I can't wait to return to Palya, and the Gran. The hotel is in a perfect location. Walking distance to great shopping and the ferry to Cozumel are just a couple of the great perks. It's close to Mayan ruins, spectacular snorkeling, jungle adventures, and it boasts a very romantic atmosphere!
