If you get a chance to go to Mexico, visit Playa and give the Gran Porto Real a chance...I'm sure you'll love it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean View does not mean you can see the ocean”
Reviews.Author: mabelleicester
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to Junior suite, ocean view. Had to go out onto balcony and turn right to see the sea, when ever we have paid for sea view we have opened curtains and the sea is in front of you, not to stretch your neck to see it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: beatrixpeace
Reviews.Content: Our vacation in August and September of last year at the Gran Porto Real Hotel in Playa del Carmen, Mexico, was truly marvellous. We had a wonderful time, and the hotel catered to all our requirements without the slightest fuss. Our room had its own large terrace, and enabled us to step out directly onto the sandy beach. I had arrived in Mexico with a bad stomach, but I need not have worried. The restaurant manager, and his staff, ensured that they prepared for me every single day delicitious special meals and kept me on a very healthy diet, tasty, well-cooked, and full of variety. And at the end of the holiday, the hotel manageress made a private car available exclusively for me and my wife, which took us directly to the airport. Thoroughly recommended. Paul Landon & Beatrix Nemeth

Reviews.Title: “Absolute and utter paradise!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: playalvr
Reviews.Content: We went to the Gran Porto Real for two weeks (May 12-26) for our honeymoon. We had previously stayed at the budget sister resort in Playa, The Real, and had such an amazing time we vowed to return. For the extra money you can really live in style, and the Gran Porto went way beyond our expectations! First of all, the rooms are enormous and meticulously clean. Of course, we were encouraged to upgrade but a simple "no" was enough and the desk staff were sweet enough to upgrade us for free as it was our honeymoon. We stayed in room 146, Junior Suite Ocean View, on the main level, and the ocean was almost close enough to touch. We spent many nights on the patio enjoying the sounds of the ocean and the free flowing bottles of rum, tequila, vodka etc that are included in the price of the suite! The shower is lined with beautiful blue tiles and is about as big as an average New York City apartment. We would return from the beach and find hibiscus flowers strewn on our bed. It was fantastic! Remember that the cleaning staff don't earn very much and rely on tips to get by, so bring along a good supply of one dollar bills. As for the beach, well, there ARE sandbags and piles of seaweed right in front of the hotel but if you walk for about 3 minutes down the beach you can find the tropical paradise you see in all of the postcards. No problem! It was always easy to find the perfect palapa and beach chairs in front of the hotel, and the beach service was really friendly (check out Claudia's smile!) and quick. Often they would bring us refills without us even asking - that's service! Try the freshly made mojitos, the bahama mamas, and mango daiquiris. (oh, and again, TIP! we noticed that many people didn't and when you consider how much we make as opposed to these people it's the least you can do!) We didn't participate in too many of the activities, but there was a good variety, from cooking lessons at the Real beach club (just 30 seconds down with a swing bar!), handmade bracelets, salsa, yoga, pool aerobics and more. The staff seemed to really enjoy themselves and we got a kick out of them trying to teach all of the sunburned gringos how to dance! We had read many trip advisor reviews before leaving for our trip and were expecting the worst when it came to the food. Again, we were pleasantly surprised. We are both vegetarians, which usually means living off of buns and fruit at buffets, but it seems they made a real effort to accommodate every type of dietary lifestyle. Every day there was something new, and we were pleased to see that they had many traditional Mexican options to choose from. You are in Mexico, you should try the food, no?! From stuffed chiles rellenos, tortilla soup, squash burritas, to sushi and mashed potatoes, everything was fresh, presented artistically (carved fruit all over the place!) and the staff were always making sure that everything was tidy and refilled. I can't believe the attention to detail in this hotel - anything that could be cleaned or painted or pruned or freshened up was being taken care of regularly. Don't listen to the reviews - the food is really yummy and there's tons of variety. Oh, and don't forget the fresh juices and champagne in the morning! Finally, the Gran has the most ideal location in Playa (besides, perhaps, the more upscale sister resort, the Royal). Steps away from Quinta Avenida, amazing restaurants, the best people watching around, and our favorite mezcaleria, La Botica. At night it's fun to walk back along the beach from the ferry dock, you can see all the people dancing at the beach nightclubs, see the romance budding between young mexican couples, and enjoy the sight of the fishing boats bobbing on the calm water. The whole time we kept wondering "what's wrong with people?" Why would anyone give this paradise a bad review? Are they the King and Queen of England? We felt blessed and lucky for every minute we got to spend in this wonderful place and would go back in a heartbeat. It's simple - don't go to timeshare lunches, say no to upgrades, and don't expect everything to be perfect. Life never is, but this is as close as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, if you can get the right room”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTraveler51
Reviews.Content: My "Ocean Front Junior Suite" turned out to be a second floor room facing an ocean that was blocked by the pool bar palapa. In addition, we were situated right on top of the restaurant and from our sliver of a balcony we could see and be seen by 5 different tables at the restaurant. Having read some of the difficulties of past guests in getting the appropriate rooms, I approached the front desk with trepidation and dread about changing rooms. After working through 2 of the front desk personell, I got to Raul who eventually arranged for what had to be one of the most beautiful locations of all the rooms in the hotel. I had stayed in one of the "good" rooms before so I knew it was there! Thanks so much to Raul for making this happen. Our experience was enhanced so much by this great view of the riviera and the lovely balcony that even had a hammock! What I would really like to write about, however, is the unbelievable helpfulness, responsiveness, and sweetness of our housekeeper, Telma. It sounds odd to point out, I know... this group of hotel staff generally goes about its work quite invisibily, unless something goes wrong... Telma, however, became a beautiful part of our vacation. We actually began to look for her to say hello each time we returned to the hotel and goodbye whenever we left for one of our daily adventures. I would like for the hotel to know that their guests notice when someone on the staff is this incredibly hard-working, attentive, and just sweet. She is truly a gift to your organization. Kim Wallace, EdD Kellie Acosta Atlanta, Georgia

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: kiddodoc2002
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 1 week stay at Playa Del Carmen. We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from 6/2-6/7. It is a beautiful hotel and the suites are large. We only really experienced one bad thing. We stayed in room 271 which does not have a view and is right above the alley area above the kitchen. Well, starting at around 4 in the am, the staff starts unloading crates, banging pots or pans and it makes it very difficult to sleep. After 2 nights I complained about the room at 5 a.m. and the next day we were moved. From there all was good. Food was good but not great. The italian restaurant was fairly good. We didn't get a chance to eat at the sushi bar. Pool was nice and the staff were friendly. We went to Tulum/Xel Ha and was a nice excursion. Also did an ATV excursion with a swim in a Cenote(Sink Hole). Both were great for the kids. Here are some tips, take lots of ones with you for tips.....you'll get better service. Take cash since many areas and shops.....lets just say, I would be leary giving them a card. I have been to Cancun and I prefer Playa. It is more relaxing and less commercialized. Beach was better too. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: JH_SW_2008
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely great. Our honeymoon here was both relaxing and lots of fun. The staff are excellent and the activities are very well-organised. First up, the entertainment team are estupendo! So, a big hola to Victor, Hector, Gen, Mig, Carlos and Julio. The pool volleyball games were great fun, as were the very friendly ping-pong tournaments. The shows every night are high-quality and the drinks service at the pool / on the beach is brilliant. The buffet restaurant staff are fantastic and always willing to help. I kind of agree with the comments around lack of variety for lunch and dinner (especially if you're veggie like us), but still high quality and not once did we have a bad meal. The fresh fruit in particular is excellent. We tried the other restaurants (Mexican Maria's and Italian Pescatore), but didn't really like them compared to the buffet restaurant. When we arrived, I spoke a bit of Spanish. I wanted to make the effort, so always spoke to staff in their native tongue. The guys at the hotel were always keen to speak in Espanol and kindly corrected my mistakes in a helpful manner. By the time we left, I was speaking the lingo all day, every day (albeit with a few gaps)! I learned so much at the hotel, speaking to all the people there. There were also Spanish lessons every morning by the pool with the sports and entertainment guys...very helpful. Gracias, chicos - vamanos indeed! As for the comments regarding guest services, we were not approached once. We had a few bits of paper through the door offering an upgrade to The Royal, but nothing more. We also enjoyed a double massage in the spa, which was fantastic (and reasonably priced compared to the UK). We also enjoyed the (now famous) towel creations in the room - a swan and a heart. A very nice gesture. We went on two trips with GoNative, which we organised at the BestDay/Expedia stand in the hotel foyer. Both of our tour guides (Enrique and Rafael) were experts in their field and extremely knowledgeable. We would definitely recommend a day trip to Coba - absoultely amazing! A huge temple, cave cenote, Maya village and jungle tour. All for $99 with lunch and travel included. As for the sandbags on the beach - we didn't really care about those. As a fellow reviewer pointed out, one can simply walk over them!.There is also the option to walk to another part of the beach, which extends for quite a few miles away from the hotel. Avienda 5 is a great place to spend a Saturday morning. There are some really interesting shops, but be prepared to haggle with the market trader guys. You can get a good deal if you keep pushing (which I regretted not doing more)! By the end, we didn't want to leave. We had such a great honeymoon here - muchas gracias to all at the Gran Porto Real and hasta pronto. Hopefully, we will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sola29
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Mexico. I stayed at the Gran Porto from 5/24 - 5/29. This was by far the BEST vacation. I had such a great time that my boyfriend and I extended our stay. Next time we will stay for 10 days. I would advise anyone...do not go by the negative reviews. This hotel is the perfect place to stay in Playa Del Carmen. I would recommend the ocean view upgrade. Amazing view of the beach. The only problem with the beach...sandbags and the boats. we were told the sandbags were there to pervent any future high tides ( hurricane season ). Makes sense since Mexico is the #1 country that gets hit every yr. Overall, friendly hotel staff. From the minute we arrived to the minute we checked out. outstanding service. The hotel is only 2 blocks away from 5th Avenue shopping center ( which we loved ). there you will find bars, great restaruants, shops, etc... Day and night this place is live. you also feel safe. The food was great. Buffet, lunch and dinner were yummy. the drinks are OK. i would advice to get the 1hr massage at the 5th ave strip. you will find a stand that offers massages for only 33USD. you cant miss it. do not get any massages in the hotel. overpriced. the gym at the hotel is reasonable. all the basics if youre looking to workout. the 2 restaruants are very good. The italian restaurant had an amazing vegetable lasagna. Mexican restaurant was also good. This hotel does not have a night club. you will find a few on the strip. Blue Parrot has beach parties every night. Bali was OK. Senor Frogs was also good. I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place! what a beautiful anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: weloveplaya31
Reviews.Content: This is going to be a long one and i will try to not leave anything out: My husband and i spent our anniversary at the Gran Porto and just got back and we didn't want to leave. In fact, we're trying to figure out when we can go back this year. we're in our early and mid thirties. The hotel is GORGEOUS and the pics do not do it justice. it has beautiful Spanish/Mediterannian decor, its right on the beach, right near 5th ave, always clean clean clean. there were literally people cleaning this place constantly. Our maid Eugenia was amazing, she gave us beautiful towel art every day on our bed, with the wash cloths and even the toilet paper. on our first night, the manager sent up a small anniversary cake and a bottle of yummy champagne and two glasses. everything was so good. what's even better is that i didnt even think they would remember it was our anniversary since i mentioned it in an email over a month before we even arrived! how special is that. the food was excellent, especially the papaya. we didnt get sick AT ALL and we drank the water they served, the fruit, salad, etc. it is true that the menus at the two restaurants are limited but i liked the chicken parm at the Italian place. we ate there twice and once at maria's. maria's was good but i preferred the Italian place or the buffet. the buffet had something different every night and the waiters were great. my hunsband speaks spanish, not me, but i tried and they helped me along with it, very sweet people and they all spoke english so no worries. the beach was very nice too. the sandbags were not a problem for us nor anyone else there. its only a problem if you let it be i guess. the water was a little rough at times but we enjoyed it. we're beach people. the palapas were a little hard to get if you dont get out there early but that's the same everywhere. the wait staff on the beach is great, we had one guy that was a little forgettful so we just got our own drinks if we needed to. i was a little disappointed in thier pina colada's but they seemed to taste the same even on 5th ave so i dont think its the hotel's fault. i guess i'm just not used to Mexican pina coladas. :) dont let that discourage you from ordering them! the entertainment staff was so great, they work non-stop, i wonder when they have time for themselves. oh yeah, they're hot too. :) they interact with everyone and are always giving you something to do. i thought i knew salsa and merengue but they taught me more moves! the front desk will try to get you to upgrade to the royal but just say no and they leave you alone. now, the guest services people are a real pain in the [--]. we got suckered into doing thier 90 minute skit over at the royal. but we got a free breakfast over there (very good), a free beach bag and sarong plus $50 to use within the hotel or wherever you wish. we used it for the spa which is also wonderful. you also get a gold card that allows you a generous discount in the gift shop and salon but not the spa. so if you dont mind sitting through 1 1/2 - 2 hours blah blah blah for 50 bucks, go for it. just be stern and get up and walk away if you have to. one of the guys actually compared a vacation package to health and life insurance. good one. back to the guest services....no obligation doesn't mean you wont be harassed by the people at the royal. we saw 6 different people and it felt like a business transaction. my husband is very good at saying no and he has no qualms about telling someone he's not interested....he does it for a living. the last guy we saw, my husband actually had to tell him to go [--] himself, NY American style, that's how pushy this guy was. he would not let us go and would ignore us when we said we're not interested and had to go since it was almost 2 hours long now and cutting into our plans. unbelievable. Best day travel messed up our tour to chichen itza. we saw the bus come and go and the tour lady on duty that day said there was another one behind it for us stuck in traffic. i had a confirmation paper in my hand with the correct date and time. come to find out, someone over on the other end of the phone put us down for the wrong day. i had a confirmation paper in my hand with the correct date and time, etc. so i asked them to send another car since they messed up and we had the confirmation but they refused. they pretty much told us we were screwed. so after a good half hour of having myself a pity party, we got our money back with no problem and continued our vacation. we rented a car and went to Xcaret, which i highly recommend. it was so much fun and the underground river is so cool! the animals are great and they have really great stuff there. the food is good there too but we didnt' want to pay $30 p/p at the restaurants throughout the park. so we had lunch in the cafeteria by the entrance and gift shop. way cheaper and great food. rent a car!!! its so easy to drive there. highway 307 runs from north to south and you just get off where you need to. if you want to head south follow signs for tulum, if you want to go north follow signs for cancun. it was $45 usd for the day. i will add photos soon. this is definitly a place we are going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: adejejon
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here 12-19 April. On arrival, welcomed with cocktail, and friendly reception staff. Requested upgrade and shown three vacant rooms to chose from. Took one overlooking pool. Pestered by "Guest Services", who are anything but! Hard sell for vacation club at "Royal" next door, but eventually they backed off. Room - Ocean front Suite, lovely view, clean and comfortable. Huge shower. Obligatory swan towel! Food - buffet restaurant more than adequate, with plenty of choice at breakfast, lunch and dinner. Staff attentive, constantly checking to ensure nothing ran out, schoolboy Spanish appreciated by waiters. Only dissappointment were the two a-la-carte restaurants, Food nicely cooked and presented, but we felt that choice was very limited and, during our week there, menu only changed once. Bars - never had to wait, waiters soon remembered what you normally ordered. Beach service very attentive and speedy, much appreciated! Pool - always space available, even with the towel brigade evident. Pool clean and well sign-posted. Life-guards on duty throughout the day. Beach - spent more time here, and again no problem in getting beds and parasols, even when we went out for the morning, returning at lunchtime. OK, so the sand bags are still there, but this did not spoil our experience at all. Again, life-guard on duty all day. Public areas - always kept clean. Entertainment - shows OK, different show each evening At a good time(9pm) for the kids to stay up, if you wanted. Location - nice to be able to walk up to 5th Avenue and browse the shops. Problems? - not good at fixing things. 1. TV lost half channels one evening, so reported it at reception folllowing morning. That evening, no change, so reported again. Asked to stay in room for engineer. After 90 minutes, no-one had appeared, so rang again. This time someone arrived, took one look and said that it was a central computer problem. Channels back after a further 20 minutes. 2. On last day, got back to room at about 5:30pm and found it had not been made-up. Rang reception who asked us if we could go to the bar and wait whilst it was cleaned. Went back to room an hour later, and still not made-up! Back to reception who said they would get on to it. Went back to room half and hour later to find room made-up with lots of petals scattered everywhere and THREE towel sculptures!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Gran Porto Real!”
Reviews.Author: af1892gurl
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 day stay at the Gran Porto Real and was definitely happy with the trip. I went with my mom and sister, and like other reviewers, I was a little skeptical about possible overbooking issues, especially since we were not arriving until around 7pm. We booked a Jr. Suite, Garden View, and sure enough when we arrived they said they didn't have that room available, but would upgrade us to an Jr. Suite, Ocean Front view for free for the night, and we could switch the next day. We moved into our first room (117), which was near the lobby on the first floor, looking out at the pool and coast. The room was beautiful (complete with hammock on the porch) but LOUD! You could hear everything at the pool and the music in the lobby at night. If possible, request a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor, a little further away from the lobby. The next day, we went to switch our rooms and they tried to sell us on keeping our current ocean front room for only $40/person/night extra, due to a "special promotion". We declined, and that was the end of the issue. We moved to our Garden View Suite (rm. 277) and it was the same size as the Ocean Front, but admittedly the view was anything but a garden. We literally looked out to a cement wall and an alley. No big deal though, it was quiet and we didn't spend much time in the room anyways. The sandbags are still on the beach, but it's really not a big deal to just step over them if you want to get in the water. Honestly, there weren't many people in the ocean while I was there (yellow flag conditions), probably because it's so fun at the pool! After the initial room switch, everything was great! The hotel is very nice, clean, and well-maintained. The food was pretty good, especially the breakfast omelets at Albatros (the buffet restaurant). All the other restaurants were good as well. At the two specialty restaurants (Il Pescatore and Maria's) the menu is somewhat small. Ask you waiter what he/she recommends and they'll usually steer you in the right direction. The entire staff was very friendly and accommodating...they even offered us a late checkout since our transportation to the airport wasn't picking us up until 2:30 (check-out is at noon). The Sports and Entertainment staff are by far the best part of this hotel. They are the ones who organize all the activities out by the pool everyday, and they are awesome. Mike, Carlos, Hector, Gen, Victor (chicken little) and everyone else was so friendly and really tried to get to know everyone who was staying there. By the end of your stay, you'll be getting hugs and high-fives. They're all pretty cute too, which is never a bad thing : ) So, after our stay, here are some tips: 1. Definitely go to the shows each night out by the pool. The dancers are amazing and the costumes are beautiful! 2. The shopping district (5th Ave.) is a 2 minute walk from the hotel and is a fun way to spend an afternoon away from the pool without having to go too far away. 3. I wasn't able to find information about this anywhere before I went, but there is free wireless access in the lobby of the hotel, so if you bring a laptop and need internet access it's no problem! 4. Try the mango margarita...delicious. That's about it! I just got home and I already miss it and can't wait to go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: myboyblue
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Gran Porto Real for 7 days and after reading some of these reviews we began to worry a little bit - well, needless to say, my 6 year old son and I absolutely 100% loved this resort.....I don't even know where to begin, it was just outright wonderful from the second we arrived. A huge thank you to Carlos who took care of us, I was travelling with my son and my friends and their young children - Carlos made it possible for us to have our rooms next to each other so the children were together. Yasmin in the restaurant was absolutely wonderful as well, my son loves her, she couldn't have been kinder and sweeter to my son! everyone was just great, the entire staff went above and beyond!!!! Thank you to everyone for making my vacation unreal - definitely going back next year, hopefully for 10 days this time! The girls in the kids club were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real was great!!”
Reviews.Author: pwhite1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed at GPR from 5/14-5/20/2008. We had to wait about 2 hours for our rooms, but they upgraded us at no extra charge! We had a party of 8. ....5 adults and 3 children. The buffet was good.....there was something for everyone. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. The staff are awesome and willing to help with whatever you need. We had dinner one night at Maria's and that was very good. There is a coffee machine near the lobby bar that has the best coffee I've ever had!!! We're going back again next May!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: mexicanduo
Reviews.Content: What great hotel, from the minute we arrived to our last before we left. Everyone is so friendly & always has a smile. The maid we had was lovely suprising us with a different towel display everyday. We couldn't fault the hotel for cleanliness.( somebody always cleaning something). The food is great with a varied choice & always plenty of it. Thanks to the bar staff for keeping us hydrated. ha ha. We took part in the daily activities which were great thanks to carlos,hector & victor. The beach is great with white sand & blue/green waters. As with other reviews saying there are sandbags at the watersedge, this is true but they are there to help stop erosion. This doesn't spoil the wonderful view. We are looking forward to returning soon. Alan & Kim Nottingham, England.

Reviews.Title: “Its A Hit”
Reviews.Author: pnouse
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the porto for a week in april and were very pleased with all the amenities they have to offer. the food was awsome the arcutecture is beautiful and the staff very accomodating. we have been to mex many times and found this hotel to be located in a great spot. most hotels along the mayan are so far from town you have to take a half hour bus ride here your just 2blocks away from all the shopping you need. if u just want to relax u can do that to no one bothers u to play games or do activities its all up to u . the only complaint i could make would be there was no spanish coffee girl in the lobby after dinner so we had to have cappicino with kahlua instead what a shame ha.. ha.. over all we had a great stay at the porto and plan on taking our 9 year old daughter with us next year.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked-just like the playa forums warned”
Reviews.Author: moxiempls
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to my friends or family. We paid for a JR.OceanView Suite, and since it did not state those words SPECIFICALLY on our paperwork from the travel agent, we were given a regular Jr.Suite-which was basically a regular room. We tried to talk to our MLT WorryFree host at the hotel, but were told they could not do anything, and there were no other rooms available anyway, even if we wanted to pay the upgrade charge(which we shouldnt have had to, since we already paid for it back home, with the travel agent). We called our travel agent from our cell phone($3/minute) and she agreed to talk to the hotel, and MLT ended up payed our room upgrade charge. We were moved to the better room within a couple hours (wait a minute, didn't they say they didn't have any other rooms available??) We noticed MANY other people with the same complaint/problem as we experienced- and the worst?? A WEDDING party, who had some of their rooms given away since they were not there by check in time (no fault of their own-due to flight arrival time). My fiance witnessed them still waiting for rooms, close to midnight of their arrival day.... Our stay was OK. Thats it. We stayed at the RIU Playacar last year, and loved it- better food, better service, better bars, WAY better beach. The ONE thing that the Gran Porto has going for it- location. It was convenient to be able to walk right to the shops, and through town. Beach was pretty much unusable, right in front of hotel, due to fishing boats, and rocky bottom. Overall impression- overpriced for what you get. Have been to Playa 3 times, and this was my LEAST favorite place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel -- May 4 - May 9, 2008”
Reviews.Author: TxFantasia
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen and it definitely exceed our expectations. We took our 2 kids, 5 & 4, my husbands parents and my brother-in-law. We all had a fantastic time. The staff was friendly, extremely honest, we felt safe and secure the entire time. The food was great, none of us got sick, that's always a plus in Mexico. There was plenty of bottled water around the hotel and in our room. The room was stocked daily with beer, sodas and bottled water. The beach was beautiful and the water, breath-taking. We enjoyed eating at the beach buffet bar and sitting under the palapas for hours just watching the waves roll in. Our kids had such a great time, they really felt like princesses, being waited on by all of the great staff. They still talk about how they miss the "swan", in our room that the maid created. They thougth that was the greatest thing next to the "all you can drink smoothies" and cook to order breakfast they had every morning. The way the entertainment and sports staff greeted the kids daily and let them participate in any games they wanted to play was awesome. The Sports & Entertainment staff was great, they made sure eveyone knew what there was to do, if you wanted to do it. We all got a kick out of Miguel (Mikey, Mikey as my girls call him), he is in charge of the sports & entertainment staff and is awesome! Then of course, there is Chicken Little (Victor), he is so much fun and quite a character. Julio & Hector were amazing, so friendly and helpful at all times. Our kids went to the Kids Club a few times and really enjoyed it there. The girls in the Kids Club are very nice and we felt very comfortable leaving them there. It was a nice break for us to be able to drop them off just about any time of the day. The tranquil pool and sushi bar on the 3rd floor rooftop has amazing views and is cool & breezy. We didn't make it into the hot tub on the 5th floor roof, but it looked wonderful. As adults, we enjoyed the nights out with the entertainment staff and the pool volleyball, water aerobics and water basket ball. They were all great ways to meet other people at the hotel, which makes a vacation even more enjoyable. We met so many wonderful, fun people. Gran Porto Real is a great place to relax, make new friends and have a wonderful, memorable vacation. We were so happy we chose this hotel, we loved that we were minutes away from shopping, partying at other clubs if we wanted to, which we did. Whether walking in town at 12 noon or 1am you always feel safe in Playa Del Carmen. We didn't do any outside tours on this trip, after we got to the hotel and enjoyed our stay there so much, we didn't want to leave to go any where else. We will definitely be going back to Gran Porto, again & again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Best!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaCarolina
Reviews.Content: Absolute best! The location, the cleanliness, the absolute best staff. From the porter to the waitstaff, the animation group, thanks to Miguel, Chiken Little, Hectoc and Julio, you will make you feel part of this wonderful Mexican family. I adored my vacation and will definitely go back! Thanks to the DJ who made me a CD to remember my vacation by and Magda who gave me a massage and made me feel in Heaven . A litterally two minute walk from 5th Avenue in town, you can also experience a little bit of the country from this wonderful resort! I highly recommand.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: goodtimecharliesuk
Reviews.Content: shropshire england We stayed at the GPR from the 11th to 25th april after reading some of the reviews we were a little worried, but believe me there was no need it was absolutly great there were 4 of us 2 couples our rooms were on the second floor and they were great really big and spacious with a big walk in shower and two big bed so that was good start. The staff were fantastic to miles of smiles and so very helpfull all you had to do was ask them for anythink and they went out of there way to get what you wonted you treat them with respect they would treat you with respect i must say we had no problem at all, I was,nt feelling to well for a couple of days and had to see the doctor the front desk were very good telling my husband what to do and were to go which was just over the road at the royal and he was very good and also very nice he spoke good english, The food was good and plentyfull if there was one thing i had to find fault with is they could do a little more food for the english but you did not go without there was always something to eat the breakfast was great . While we were there we had our 24th wedding anniversary and when we got back to our room one day there was a bottle of champagne two glasses and a cake it was a lovely surprise thats what there like so nice, now the entertainment team were really good they would try to get you involved but if you did,nt wont to it was no problem julio carlos victor mikey and hector you were great thank you each and every one of them made our holiday fantastic and we will deffinatly be going back ....great....great ...great

Reviews.Title: “Cervezas An Mojitos.....”
Reviews.Author: shellsea420
Reviews.Content: This hotel was young,hip and located right off of fifth avenue.Perfect for those who want to shop and not go to far into town.The beach shore was a little disappointing as it was lined with sandbags,but once you were in the water it was super warm and very sandy.The service was excellent and i always was looked after in a courteous and prompt manner.The restaurants were exceptional,the meals seemed to be well thought out and with a changing menu there was always something new to try.Overall a very good experience and would forsurely go back to the resort again.The roomservice was always going with a variety of mexican and american dishes,including breakfast.Stocked mini-bar refilled on a daily basis.The kids club was excellent with a very enthusiastic crew leading allsorts of fun activities for the youngsters.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacations!!”
Reviews.Author: Cathytabonita
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the GPR from April 10 to 24. We’ve already been there few times before this trip. We had a great time as usual. The GPR is a nice hotel, great location and good services. We were treated excellent. I would like to say a BIG thank you to Carlos (front desk manager) and Barbara (general management ass.), our vacations were absolutely fantastic. The Junior Suite rooms are spacious, with a large shower and private balcony. Our roommate, Evelin, did a great job of keeping our room clean. She made swan, bunny, heart, etc.. with towels & flowers. This time our room # was 336. We also got the rooms #224, 117 and 324. The food at the buffet was really good specially the breakfast. We didn’t eat to the Italian and Mexican restaurants this time but we already tried them and they are really good as well. David, Rodrigo and Dion are the best at the buffet. There are sand bags on the beach but it didn’t matter to us. You can walk 2 minutes by the Royal and the beach is nice. Our waiters (Benito & Pablo) and waitress (Lucy) were very pleasant and were always there to refill your drinks. This time, we went to visit Isla Mujeres by catamaran and Chichen Itza. We swam in a cenote on the way back from Chichen Itza and it was absolutely amazing. We already went to Delphinus, Cobà and Tulum and all of these tours are great. If you like the history and archeology, Riviera Maya is the best place to go. The entertainment team (Mike, Hector, Julio, Victor & Carlos) was amazing, they work very hard days & nights. We went out in the night club (Señor Frog’s & Bali) with them and we had such a great time! Thank you so much guys!!! We would definitely go back again to this Resort in few months! We love Playa Del Carmen! Hasta luego! Cathy (Montreal-Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mpkissane
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent my December 1st, 2007 40th birthday with the wonderful people at Gran Porto. We enjoyed the daily water aerobics and bingo (all of the things we would usually avoid) They were absoulutely fun and funny with the humorous and energetic staff --Mike and Spike especially. Anna at the front desk was charming and the guests during our stay were intersting and wonderfully international. We loved our beach service and sports, and especially Carmpari, soda y dos limones, por favor. We were the only Americans - let alone Chicagoans in the pool! What a treat! Room service was an unexpected delight- we never knew it could be that great. I would love to go back with my husband. Thank you to all. Mary Pat Kissane

Reviews.Title: “The bumping continues...”
Reviews.Author: Brewser111
Reviews.Content: If you plan on visiting this hotel please take the time to read this. We just returned from a 9 day stay and experienced the problem with bumping right away. we booked and ocean front room and 2 JR suites 6 months ago. Upon arrival we were told that they did not have the ocean front room we reserved as well as a room for our daughter. We had to share a room the first night and were promised that the rooms that we reserved would be ready the next day. When the next day came we were told that the ocean front room was not available and that we would have to settle for a lesser room. I did settle for the lesser room to help prevent additional hassles and to help keep our group of 6 together. It took over 3 days for Carlos, the front desk manager, to work out some type of compensation package and even then it was not equal to what we should have seen in return. Please note that I saw and heard at least a dozen other people with similar problems during our stay and all had the same problems with Carlos and his lack of concern and committment to meeting customer needs. His excuse for the problems was time share people coming in and he stated that there was nothing he could do since " they only take requests, not reservations". Given his statement it appears that if you don't buy a time share from them you will be placed last on the list. Please note that I have stayed at REAL resorts regularly for over 7 years, 3 times at this hotel for example, and have never seen a front desk run as bad as this one and will not go back. Setting the front desk issues aside it was a good stay only because of the great staff in other areas of the hotel. Teresa at the pool is excellent as well as Pepe and Ivan in the buffet. There were also a number of other good people and it would take me too long to list all of their names. The bottom line is "if' you get your room you should have a good time. If you do have issues bypass Carlos and talk to the general manager Lynn De Repentigny. We were not able to get a hold of her but it might help.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe all the negativity”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey06
Reviews.Content: I was initially concerned about my holiday choice when i read so many negative reviews about this hotel but this hotel is great! We booked through an English travel agent (who were actually rubbish - First Choice) but our stay at the hotel was amazing. We had no problems with check in and our room was lovely - a standard room with a view of the main street/Royal. Although people say the rooms are old and tired, they're not at all - ours was decorated in typical Mexican Hacienda style and very spacious. The cleanliness could not be faulted and the maid left towel arrangements for us everyday! The breakfast buffet was great, lunch was also good. The buffet in the evening wasn't great but the Italian restaurant was really nice and we never needed to book. The staff were all so helpful and the entertainment staff were brilliant - although we didn't actually take part in any of the pool actuvities, they were always really friendly and they work so hard all day and night! There are sand bags on the beach but it didn't matter to us - we were still able to get in and out of the sea, and if you go further up the beach there aren't any. The only complaint i'd make is that so many people put there towels on the sunbeds around the pool and then don't use them all day - not the hotels fault though; i think this happens everywhere! Highly recommend the day trip to Xcaret as well, and swim with dolphins - amazing. I'd definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “WOW This place goes the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: mom4jesus
Reviews.Content: This place goes the extra mile our suite was not ready the first night but they gave us a room and a 40 dollar discount in the gift shoppe the room was nice but the suite the next day was amazing and the workers are wonderful speak english sometimes we would go to the resturant and say there are 30 of us and they would accomadate us . We had my Mothers 80th birthday there and they treat her like a queen for a day Its the first time I had been there and I will go back every year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: healthy4ever
Reviews.Content: As I read all the reviews prior to going I was very nervous about this hotel. I was extremely relieved when we got there and saw that the hotel and the rooms look just as they did online. We where told that although we had booked 2 junior suites without ocean views, that only one was available so they where going to upgrade the second room to an ocean view room. After going to look at the rooms available my husband and I decided to upgrade both rooms to ocean front. It cost an additional $500 USD, for 5 nights, but well worth it. The views are amazing. There are a few down sides, one is you have to wear this big yellow wristband the entire time you are there. If you lose it they charge you $100. to replace and without it you can not get your food and beverages. When you arrive they try and get you to go look at the TIMESHARE next door, and have breakfast. We chose not to do this but that didn't stop them from trying to get us to go. The Italian restaurant is great but the Mexican one is not. The Senor Frogs is the worst one I have ever been to. BEWARE the open bar trip to Senor Frogs does not include open bar for everything only applies to certain drinks but the activities guys that go with you are loads of fun. You can walk up and down 5th ave. which is great, I also recommend taking a day trip over to Cozumel. The ferry ride is short and drops you off in the middle of the activity. One of our best days was spent with Ramses in Fat Tuesdays on Cozumel!! We also took a trip to Chichenitza, the van ride there will beat you to death but the ruins are beautiful and amazing, just know that it will consume your whole day, you leave at 7 am get back at 6 pm. All in all a great trip but if I go back I will stay at the Royal next door.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real practices room scam”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelStLouis
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent warned us that this hotel would try a scam and they did. We traveled with about 10 couples. Each one got a different story. All booked Jr. Suites - some got them - some didn't. For $80 one couple upgraded to a oceanview Jr. Suite, for $120 one couple upgraded to a oceanview Jr. Suite. One couple who happened to mention they were a repeat customer got a free upgrade. All were told the room category they paid for was not available. Some were put up on the 4th floor (no elevator) and were told they would be moved the next day. They were moved but only after the travel agent and Funjet vacations argued on their behalf. All in all after the 1st horrible day - everything was wonderful. If we hadn't booked through an agent or I believe there would have been alot more problems. Four girls who booked directly with the hotel were told there were no rooms for them. Last I saw them, they were curled up in chairs in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room!!”
Reviews.Author: BarrelRacer72
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real is a fantastic hotel, with large rooms, a beatiful beach, and great service. We had an absolutely GORGEOUS room. It was huge, with a large shower, two balconies (we were in a corner on the second floor) and a very comfortable bed. The minibar was restocked daily and the maid did an excellent job of keeping our room clean. (Tip: If you can catch the guy that stocks the minibar, he will gladly fill it up with nothing but beer, if you request it.) We also ordered room service a couple of times, which is included with the all-inclusive. The food was OK - I didn't really care for the Mexican restaurant, but I had a lot to drink that day and wasn't feeling very well. The breakfast buffet was great - the omolettes are made-to-order!! Service was excellent. Everyday we would go to the bar right below our room and they would start making our drinks as soon as they saw us. (My husband is very outgoing, though, with a lot of tattoos, so it was probably easy to remember us.) The beach area was nice, although further down there was a lot of birds and seaweed. Also, be prepared for the topless sunbathers. A couple of negatives: Dos Equis was the only beer that was served. It was bottled in the minibar - everywhere else it came from the tap. Also, the swim-up bar stayed in the shade most of the day, and was VERY cold. (It is in the pool on the roof). We opted to stay at the pool on ground level, where they offer you waiter service for your drinks. All in all, this is an excellent hotel - I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good first impression”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryPlease
Reviews.Content: I looked into this property for our family vacation for July, 2008. I went to their website www.realresorts.com reserved the dates including flight. I called the 800 number to book it. The reservation girl put me on hold 3 times for over 20 minutes each time. Each time she came back on the line, she would advice me that the price of the air went up since I was on hold for so long. Since we need connecting suites, she said we have to book a master suite and the reg suite in order to connect the two, so I did. The call took over an hour and half! I received my itinerary via email that night, it was completely wrong. She had my emergency contact as one of the passengers, our travel dates incorrect, our room type incorrect. This is after I confirmed with her 2 times and had her repeat everything back to me. I phoned them immediately. They told me that the rooms I wanted are not available now, and they can no longer guarantee us having connecting suites..(we have 2 adults and 4 kids) This is by far the worst reservation experience I had with any hotel. They already charged our CC over $11K. Now we need get our money back some how. Not happy with this place!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great Experience at the Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: Jennda
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Gran Porto the first week in April and I must say we had a wonderful experience. It seems like all the reviews are either great or terrible which I really don't understand. I would be so upset if I got to the hotel and they did not have a room for us. And if that happens a lot, they should definitely do something to fix that problem. Fortunately, that was not the case for us. We booked in January through TNT travel which included our all-inclusive stay at the hotel as well as transfers to and from the airport. When we arrived at the hotel, we had a choice of 2 rooms- they took us to see both- one was an oceanfront and the other was just a regular suite. We paid the extra $40 a day for the oceanfront and it was totally worth it- great balcony and view! I think we were also lucky because we went after the majority of the college spring break is over- the hotel was only at half capacity so it was very quiet and the service was great. The waiters and waitresses were very pleasant and were always there to refill your drinks! (Frozen bahama mama is the way to go!) Another great benefit to this hotel is that it is only about a 5 minute walk to 5th ave- with all the shops, bars, and restaurants...and Starbucks! It was so convenient. I found everyone to be very friendly and helful. The Italian restaurant at the Gran Porto was great (Il Pescatore) and Maria's (Mexican food) was decent- the breakfast was great at Albertos! All in all it was a great trip. For couples traveling without children, there is a Royal Real hotel right across the street for adults only- we checked that out and it was beautiful- I think it was a little more expensive, but the people I talked to that were staying there said it was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort! great deal and location”
Reviews.Author: KtownTacoma
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort! I do see how other people would be very, very upset if they got there and the hotel didn't have room for them. However, ths was not our experience. From the time my wife and I arrived, we were treated excellent!! We were upgraded to a ocean front room for only $40 usd extra per night for both of us, well worth it. We ended up paying about $275 per night total. For that price, the location and the food, there isn't a better place to stay in Playa. We stayed half our trip there, then we stayed the last four nights at Secrets Capri, and the whole time we were at Secrets, we wished we were back at GP. We will go back in a heart beat. I don't know if it helps the overbooking problem, but we arrived on a thursday during the slow season. Check out my review on Secrets Capri titled "better hotels in town" i think that's what it's called. In that review I compare the two resorts in much more detail. Go luck and Great travels!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: ridicilous
Reviews.Content: Had a great time . THe location is excellent and the service is outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Albertagirl_8
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort in September and requested a junior suite - ocean view - balcony - when we arrived as many have said on the reviews, they were overbooked. They put us in a room that was just being cleaned at 9:00 pm, there was NO balcony and we were told to look out the window for an ocean view. We coudn't see out the window as they were so dirty. As the hotel is a long hotel, we were literally 3 blocks from the beach on the 5th floor which I requested ground level. The room is NOTHING like the pictures, the bathroom was in our room, not a seperate room. The next morning we called Signature Vacations and requested to be moved to another hotel, they accomodated us right away and we moved to the Iberostar Tucan, a true 5***** resort in Playacar. Our family has been to Playa 6 times and this was by far the worst hotel we have ever been in. I would not recommend it at all. This would be a good hotel for 18-20 year olds who don't care where they sleep, not a family or high end resort at all. Please see my review of the Iberostar Tucan.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked! Terrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ImplantDoc
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel with wife and two little girls and was told by Carlos the manager that the hotel was overbooked and we would be transferred to the Reef Playacar for one night. The Reef Playacar was a less than desireable substitution and we did not accept the small dirty room, not suites(2) we had prepaid directly to the hotel. After burning most of our first day of vacation we were moved to the Riu and put in a small room. After the bad taste filling my mouth of the poor treatment I booked another room at the Fiesta Americanna Grand Coral Beach and were treated like VIPs. I was NOT going to allow this hotel to destroy the 2nd day of our vacation. We will seek legal recourse for reimbursement against the hotel. Buyer BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “OVERBOOKED! Booked 6 months ahead!”
Reviews.Content: Grand Porto Read - Playa Del Carmen March 2008 - Spring Break Over priced and OVERBOOKED DID NOT HAVE OUR ROOM We booked our trip to Playa in August for March. This was a spring break trip for our High School daughters. We traveled the whole morning to arrive and find out that they told us they had -0- rooms for the night! After arguing for over an hour we were moved to another Hotel. We explained that we were with a group and we wanted everyone together. They moved 6 of our rooms and then we found out that the other group coming right behind us ( that booked 3 months after us!) got their rooms with out a problem! We had to check out the next morning and wait until 1:00 PM for our rooms to be ready. We waisted a full day dealing with rooms and transfers back and forth. We had paid for a ocean view suite and we got a regular room at the other Hotel. They thought they compinsated us with a 25 minute massage and a $50.00 credit to the gift shop which you had to use at one time or you lose it. I crossed through the portion that said I accepted and would not ask for further compensation. Now they tell me this is all they will do. I would never book for this reason again through e-travelsolution.com or stay at the Grand Porto Real in Playa! They did not mind collecting early and using my money for 6 months!!

Reviews.Title: “The best Destiation Wedding spot and resort for larger groups”
Reviews.Author: hair-godess
Reviews.Content: We had the Best time here! This trip was a result of our destination wedding. Our wedding was held at The Royal next door and went better than we could have imagined! Micaela and Walter, the wedding people, made every minute perfect from the decoration to the music and food. This was the easiest planning process and the outcome was beautiful. All of our guests stayed at The Gran and enjoyed ever minute. The best thing is that it is located walking distance to all of the shops and bars! The thing that concerned us was all the reviews about overbooking rooms. We had absolutely no problem with all of our 53 guests checking in and getting settled. The only time was when someone arrived before check in time and the room was not cleaned yet, but they were still catered to. Our favorite thing to do was hang out at the pool and relax. The wait staff was so great at catering to all of us. We always had a drink in hand and snacks available to grab. Our rooms were always clean and the turn down srvice was a plus! Thanks to Chicken Little(pool entertainment crew) who gave everyone a good laugh and something to talk about. Our younger guests had a good time with the kids actrivites and clean beach. I will deffinately return for an even longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mntravelers23
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real for 4 nights while visiting Playa Del Carmen for a wedding this March. The hotel/resort stay was absolutely fantastic. All of the staff were very attentive to our needs and our room was kept very clean the entire stay. We upgraded to a Beach Front Walkout which I strongly recommend over the Ocean View option. Others in our traveling party stayed in a Ocean View, which was the same style of room as ours, but did not "face" the ocean itself. All in all, the rooms were wonderful and provided us a very enjoyable stay. The pool area was a bit busy, but as expected in 90 degree weather! My only request would be to keep the pool open into the evening. The food at the buffet and restaurants was also top notch. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying at an all-inclusive such as this one. It was so nice not to have to carry money around and to eat, drink and be merry at your liesure! We also had our 4 year old with us and made use of the Kids Club for a little while. She loved the girls working there and we felt very comfortable having her play there while we were in the hotel. Even though there was live music nightly, we didn't notice anyone getting too loud and rowdy and our daughter was able to sleep soundly every night! It was spring break time, but most staying here were families, couples, and some spring breakers. WE CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK NEXT YEAR!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a room when you show up - even if you have a confirmation”
Reviews.Author: Stefan10520
Reviews.Content: Even though I called the day before we showed up to let them know that we would be arriving very late and was guaranteed that they would hold our room and make a note on our file, we were advised upon checking in at the hotel after travelling for 7 hours that the hotel was overbooked and that they had no room for us. From the shock of it, I nearly developed a case of montazuma's revenge right there in the lobby! They offered us a room at another hotel down the street and tried to sell us on the fact that the hotel they were sending us to was a five diamond property rather than a five star property (which is what this property is). After trying to beg, borrow and steal to get them to honor our reservation, we reluctantly got into a cab, which they paid for, and checked into the Royal Hideaway Playacar about 10 minutes away. When we saw how nice the Royal Hideaway Playacar was, our initial trepidation melted away. The Royal Hideaway Playacar was a much, much nicer property. It's a good thing we didn't have the kids with us, as it's an adults only resort. The next day when the General Manager from the Gran Porto Real called us up to let us know that they now had our room available and that we could come back to check in, we told him "no way, dude. We're staying at the Royal Hideaway Playacar compliments of your hotel." So, if you want to stay at a really nice resort rather than an okay resort, book yourself a room at the Gran Porto Royal and check in at 2am. Thanks for a nice vacation Gran Porto Real. We can't really rate your hotel because we never got to stay there, even though we had a confirmation from your hotel, but the Royal Hideaway Playacar was awesome (although I could have done without seeing the old bleached blonde, cosmetic surgery hag who insisted on wearing a string thong bikini to the pool every day - shudder).

Reviews.Title: “Location wonderful, food is "OK"”
Reviews.Author: kjtuttle
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful, room spacious and luxurious, beach great, pool great, service excellant, for the price, I wish the food was "wow" instead of just good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times...a few inconveniences!!!”
Reviews.Author: purplecat22
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to this property and so we knew what to expect from our previous trips. Unfortunately, it wasn't the same great welcome that we are use to. Fortunately we were not shipped off to another property, but our first room we were given was a very small, 1 king size bed for 4 people.....I went back to the front desk and requested something with at least 2 beds....got another small room, but it did have 2 beds. The next morning I had to inquire about our reserved room, which was a junior suite. We got to that room around noon. All 3 moves a bell boy came to help us with our luggage, which was very nice! They were somewhat apologetic and wanted to make sure that we felt compensated for our inconvenience. We had a few options and chose free lobster and champagne. We didn't get really angry or excited about the overbooking, but rather went along for the ride. It is such a great hotel with a great location, that we weren't about to let this ruin our vacation. The entertinment staff are alot of fun and the servers all make this place what it is. Many employees remembered us from previous years, so it really felt like home. The kids club was fantastic and my kids never wanted to leave. It is a great family resort, and if it weren't for the overbooking issues, I'd say this was a 5 star property. It is small and cozy and I'd rather stay here with a few inconveniences then stay at some gigantic Americanized resort where you are just a number.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time At The Gran....”
Reviews.Author: JEMT
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous booking at the Gran after all the negitive reviews,But we have no complaints.Our room was absolutely beautiful,we upgraded to a walk-out beach front,we couldn't of asked for anything better.The rooms where very clean and the staff was terrific.If you have kids this is the place for you,the girls at the Oki Kids Club were awesome.The food was pretty good you can always find something to eat,it's Mexico.Yes,there were sand bags on the beach and that was not very attractive,but if you walk down the beach a bit the ocean was beautiful.The room and beach service were great.It is the best location if you want to go to 5th Avenue shopping.We felt very safe,lots of security around the resort at all times.Overall we had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real, Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Angie051
Reviews.Content: More than just some problems...Arrived at hotel and was sent to another what they said was a 5 star hotel...(NOT) Could not check into our hotel until the next day after 2pm so lost more than a day of our vacation. Put us in the nosiest room in the resort (#215) but if we wanted we could watch the shows they put on in the evenings right from our balcony. Food was good, has a great Italian restaurant with the best lobster I have ever tasted. One more thing, Guest Services were the RUDEST people I have ever met..If you did not want to buy a timeshare, they did not have the time of day for you. I would go back to Playa del Carmen in an instant, but not to this resort...I would say a 2 star at the most.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: katiebeth
Reviews.Content: This was our 9th year at Porto Real. We love this place! We bought into the Real Club 8 years ago so we go every year. Other resorts are going up in Playa del Carmen as the tourists catch on to this paradise, but nothing can compare to the Gran Porto Real. We love the people who work at this beautiful hotel. We truly feel welcome and surrounded by friends. The resort is beautiful. The rooms are spacious, clean and quiet. The staff goes the extra mile to add the special touches that make us feel special. The pool, landscaping and beach are beautiful. Great spot! Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back!”
Reviews.Author: ajpaz
Reviews.Content: Just got back and would never go back! I too got bumped from my room after taking many precautions. My son was getting married next door at the Royal. The reception was at the Gran Porto. My agent called, emailed the manager to make sure this wasn't going to happen. There I was with 2 kids,11 & 14, and no room, finally found a postage stamp of a room and was to be moved the next day, the day of the wedding! We had reserved a Jr ocean front suite, even offered to pay for an upgrade and was told no. Reception desk didn't care, many people were being bumped. Police were even called one night! A bride even got bumped. We were offered a $100 credit in the gift shop BUT they wanted us to sign a waiver saying we wouldn't complain the rest of the trip or to our travel agent.. I wouldn't sign. Others were offer a lobster dinner and a bottle of cheap champagne. Big deal! Food was adequate at best. Birds were eating out of the food containers by the beach grill. The Italian restaurant was horrible, we left our food. Room service was better. Have to get up early to get a place by the pool. People would mark their spots starting at 5AM and you would never see them until late afternoon. One day there was 2 fights at the pool over chairs. The beach.......cold, rocky & dirty!

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kimichicago
Reviews.Content: stayed at hotel a few years ago, planning to return in the near future. customer service was awsome so was the food! been to other hotels where service was no where near is good. rooms were nice, hotel was very clean, pools were beautiful. within walking distance of some great little shops & restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 2nd visit to the GPR”
Reviews.Author: avanterra
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the GPR and we basically got what we expected. Last year we experienced the all-too-common overbooking issue that they always seem to have. However, my wife went [--] on them and they caved and gave us what we booked - an oceanview junior suite that looked out over Avenida Constituyentes. If this happens to you, demand more than the lobster and champagne that they like to offer as compensation. In our opinion that is just not acceptable. Anyhow, this year we booked an oceanfront junior suite (room #364), and had no problems. It probably helped that we were in PDC the day before and went to the GPR to let them know we would be checking in and to make sure everything was cool. It was. We were pleased with the room and location, except that there is a lot of noise (even on the third floor) in the mornings from the kitchen crew preparing for breakfast. It didn't bother my wife or kids, but I am a light sleeper and did hear the noise every morning around 5:00. Next year we will probably choose a location away from the restaurant. But the room was clean and always well-stocked. This room also had a great view of the shows at night from the balcony if you don't want to go poolside. Food: Average. As I said before, we knew what to expect and there were no surprises. We never tried the dinner buffet but breakfast and lunch were okay. Selection is good and quality okay. I have nothing to compare it against but it was average I thought. The snackbar on the beach (serving burgers, hot dogs, quesadillas, guacamole, salsa, fruit) was good. As for the a la carte restaurants - Maria's (Mexican) and Il Pescatore (Italian), again the food is average. We probably enjoyed the Mexican a bit more. The menu doesn't seem to have changed in the last year. Il Pescatore fills up quickly so if you don't make it there by 6:15, you'll probably need to wait until the first wave of diners finishes (about 7:30-8:09). Maria's never seemed to have a wait. We ate two meals up on Quinta (5th Ave) and always had our desserts at Ah Cacao on the northwest corner of Quinta and Constituyentes. Excellent chocolate mousse and ice cream. For the best (in my opinion) Italian food in PDC, head to Casa Mediterranea - in a little courtyard off Quinta about 1/2 way between the GPR and the pier (look for the big OndaDelMar sign on the east side of Quinta). Entertainment: The shows are okay. Fun for the kids but don't expect broadway. Poolside activities included waterpolo and volleyball, bingo, exercise and Spanish lessons. Always something going on. For the kids there is pottery painting (extra charge) and bracelet making. My kids loved it. Service: We received good service from everyone. I know there have been complaints about service, but we had no issues with anyone - front desk, restaurants, bellhops, maid service, etc. Everyone was very nice to us. Treat them with respect and they will do the same for you. Beach: this is a big issue for this place right now, and they need to do something about it quickly. There is a wall of sandbags extending almost the entire length of the resort's beachfront. I realize this is beach erosion due to weather, but they (or tourism officials or city officials or someone) need to truck in some sand to widen and repair the beach here. This is one of the reasons we come to this resort , but if they can't do anything about their beach then we may look elsewhere. Tip: if you want a good spot at the pool or beach, get up early!!! A lot people get up very to reserve a chair. My wife generally went down around 7:30 and even then she had trouble getting the spots we wanted. We never tried any of the Spa services here, mainly because you can get a great massage for about $45 (including tip) and several locations throughout PDC. We like the one next to 100% Natural - ask for Luci. In summary, we find the GPR to be a nice place, especially if you have young kids. And for us, the location can't be beat - two blocks from Quinta and right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: LoveLoons
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel in the past, and loved it ! Clean rooms, good food, and wonderful service. We are a family with a child (age 8), and if our child has a good time, so do we. We stayed at this hotel for Christmas, and the kids club was great. Many planned fun activities for the children, and the gal in charge of kids club (Jeni I think) and her staff was so conserned that the kids have plenty of fun things to do, well it just made it a fun trip for us all. My husband and I could enjoy the pool and restraurants, without worrying if our child was being well cared for. The staff even got meals delieved to kids club, so we truly could enjoy ourselves. So when we decide to visit Playa again in February it was a no brainer, everyone wanted to return to the Gran. This visit was quite different, whole new crew working in kids club who couldn't have cared less about my child or anyone elses. The day we checked in (Feb.being a busy time), not one child was in kids club, they were all outside with their parents. Strange....but we didn't catch on at first. It didn't take long to figure out that the gals working in kids club now not only did not plan any activities, but sat around eating most of the day, doing nothing with the only two children in there (and one was mine). My child stayed only two hours our first full day there, then wanted to stay with us so he could swim. All in all we had a wonderful time together regardless, but it would have been so much more fun if this hotel was still offering activities for families with children. It seems to me that if the children have a fun place to go, they won't be running around the hotel annoying others. Maybe next time we will need to find a place who takes as good of care of their smaller guest as they do the parents. Unless you feel that family vacation's are not important, this review will have no meaning to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like moving rooms”
Reviews.Author: nicurn72
Reviews.Content: We booked in July 2007, but we still did not not get the room we booked. Our first night we signed a waiver for a free upgrade because our rooms were not available. We moved the next day to another room only to come back later and find our keys would not work! "we are sorry, but we put you in the wrong rooms. You will need to change rooms again tomorrow because we don't have the rooms you booked available. We tried to find you all day." Well, we were at the front desk twice before the original move and then hanging out by the swing bar for a few hours- never left the hotel, so they didn't try at all to find us. We were very upset and held our ground- we did not move or pay for the "upgrade". They made it seem as if it was our fault for our unwillingness to move again! We had already wasted one day of our vacation waiting for them, we weren't willing to waste another because they over book and can't figure out how to get rooms correct. 3 more friends joined us later in the week and guess what? They had the same problems, as did a room full of guests without rooms at all. If I was guaranteed a room and didn't have to change rooms, I would stay here again, but it isn't worth the hassle of not knowing where you are going to be!!! Everyone else was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “"not the only ones to be Had"”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_ManNm
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Gran on Feb. 7only to be told we had no rooms.We were traveling as a group of seven,booked and paid for the rooms in October of 2007. The front desk manager said we had no options and moved us to a different hotel. We were told that we would be given a bottle of champagne, a lobster dinner, and an excursion. They had us sign a disclaimer stating we would not file any furter complaints against the hotel before they would give us vouchers for our compensation. We signed the papers and when we tried to redeem the vouchers we found out they were useless, so I am going to complain.It seems if you book this hotel as a group that there is a good chance you will get bumped.If you want to plan a fun vacation only to be dissapointed this is the place to waste your time and money!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Cat246x2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. The hotel and the staff were fabulous!! Our Jr Suite was lovely and very well maintained on a daily basis. Each day that we came back to our room, we found towels formed into hearts or swans, complete with flowers to adorn these wonderful creations. The fridge in our room was stocked daily with bottled water, beer and soft drinks. The two a la carte restaurants that were open for dinner each evening provided us with lots of dinner selections, unlimited house wine, cocktails and excellent service. The buffet style restaurant that was open for breakfast, lunch and dinner was like nothing we had ever seen before. There were so many things to choose from that it was sometimes hard to decide what one should eat today. We especially liked the fact that there was a large selection of fresh veggies and fruits at each meal and that you could have a steak grilled for you while you waited at dinner or an omelette prepared to your liking while you waited at breakfast. Once again there was unlimited house wine and cocktails offered by the very attentive wait staff. The little out door restaurant on the beach offered buffet style lunch that basically went on all day. There was a good selection of burgers, nachos and finger type food. Again, we can not say enough nice things about the staff. The days we spent on the beach, there was always someone around to bring us unlimited beer, cocktails, water and soft drinks. They also made sure that all empty glasses and trash were picked up. The same service was offered pool side. The hotel offered daily activities such as water aerobics in the pool and kyacking from the beach. The nightly entertainment consisted of colourful dancers on the stage by the pool and a small band inside the hotel in the large lounge area. They even had hotel guides that would take you to Senor Frogs for an evening and make sure that you got back safe and sound. There was a day care for the kids and lots of activities lined up to keep them busy too. Unfortunately we never did get to the roof top pool with the swim up bar or to the other pool on the second level that had a sushi bar. We were very very impressed with the hotel, the amenities and mostly the staff. The staff went out of their way to make sure that you had a good time, lots to eat and lots to drink. Many of the staff members speak english and were more than happy to talk with us about their families and daily lives. This hotel is by far an excellent value for the money and caters to families with children as well as couples and singles. There is something for everyone. We booked an all inclusive holiday and believe that that is the only way to go. We did tip the staff frequently. The level of service and friendliness warranted tipping in our opinion. We are already looking forward to our trip back next year except it will be for two weeks instead of one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull with problems”
Reviews.Author: Torero
Reviews.Content: My family and I were at the Gran Porto Real for a week Feb 2008. It was our first visit to this Hotel but we had been at the Royal four times before. We could no longer stay at the Royal because of my teenage daughters and the Royal is now an Adult Only Hotel. We knew we would be coming down in quality and I was concerned about that. Turns out that would not be the main problem. What you should know at any of the REAL properties in Playa del Carmen is that they Over Book all the time. This happens at the Gran mostly, a little less at the Royal. The amount of clients complaining about this at the reception is unbelievable. Of course it happened to us. I decided not to let them get away with it without a fight. I made a tremendous scene in the lobby to make sure we went through all the options possible. We were offered to go to their third property the REAL wihch is off of 5th Av and not anywhere as nice as the GRAN and the ROYAL. I did not like that offer but after fighting for more than an hour I realized they had no other option. In the end we spent one night at the REAL and returned to the GRAN the next day. We negotiated compensation with the Hotel manager. OK, let me put it clearly, this OVER BOOKING stuff is awful. It makes you feel like they are taking advantage of you. If you get bumped to the ROYAL you are getting a better deal. If they send you to the REAL it is much worse. Once you get passed this hurdle I must say the GRAN was not disappointing at all. Individually all staff members are extremely nice and friendly. They do their best to please you and although their standards of efficiency are not the same, we are talking about some of the best service you can expect at PLAYA del CARMEN. We had a standard room which turned out to be just fine for us. What you get by reserving a Junior suite is a larger and fancier room and bath and a liquor dispenser with four bottles of booze. With kids we didn't need that extra. Beware of the difference between Ocean View and Ocean Front. The first can be just a glimpse of the ocean in the distance. Some guests complained about not having the view or the position they expected. The rule at the REAL resorts is basic. What you pay determines where they will ultimately place you. Check their website to see the different tariff structure. Out of the three restaurants we ultimately preferred the Buffet. We thought the restaurants served poorly tasting and not well prepared food (Ours is European standard). There was more choice at the Buffet thus a better chance to find something you like. I red some reviews complaining about the Gym. Can't figure that one out. Looked fine to us. We were there every morning at 7 AM and enjoyed the Bicycles, treadmills, ellipticals, weights. The gym is a little small and can get crowded with more than 8-10 people. The Spa has a sauna, a Hammam, and small whirlpool. those are included. You pay for treatments and Massages.
