On the beach and around the pool, Guests get out early to put their towels on chairs to reserve them, and they come back at 10 - 11 AM or later. This sucks but I'm afraid there is nothing that can be done about it. Happens in all resorts. Overall The GRAN was satisfying. If you are looking for more luxury go to the ROYAL. If your budget is tight try the REAL although at this level there are other options better situated in PLAYA. The GRAN and the ROYAL are perfectly situated to go walking in PLAYA or going to the Store called MEGA up Constituyentes . So you decide. You have a massive chance of facing overbooking upon arrival. You will loose one day with this crap. After that, you will most likely enjoy your stay. Only you can say if you want to deal with it. Hi to my Canadian friend who witnessed my fuss upon arrival after dealing with the same problem himself.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start to a trip!”
Reviews.Author: Chaffey25
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Playa and had a great trip, although it started off badly. We went with a group of 5 other couples and had made our reservations in September 2007 for the Valentines weekend trip 2008. Upon arriving at the resort they escorted us into the lounge area to inform us that they had overbooked and we had to change hotels. After a heated discussion that produced nothing we were shuttled to another resort. We had paid for Ocean Front JR. Suites and at the new resort this was of course not the case. How do they constantly overbook rooms I will never understand, some other couples not in our group went through the same ordeal. The resort we were sent to was the Royal hideway which was a big step up in my opinion from the gran porto real, so I guess they did something right. All in all we loved the trip and other than the dress code for dinners at The Royal Hideway it turned out wonderful. I can honestly say that the Grand Porto Real will not be on my travel list ever again, and probably not on the list of the other 5 couples that went along. I think they need to look up the word and definition of Reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SandyLethbridge
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the Real. We booked a standard room and if you book a standard do not expect nothing special. Iwould rate the room a 3 star if that.. We upgraded to a Ocean front and it was worth the cost. Nothing like opening up the windows and having coffee on the balcony facing the ocean. The staff was very helpful and the room was spotless as well as the grounds. The food was ok (cruise the buffet before you decide). I have been to other all enclusive where the food was a lot worse. Not a fan of the mexican but did eat a few times at the Italian. The Lobster was huge. The beach was cleaned daily and the water was clear and warm... location could walk to 5th ave. and access all transportation.. easy to get anywhere. We did witness alot of people not getting the room they wanted (how frustration). We were lucky. Good idea to have alot of small change to tip with. Overall it wasn't 40 below! I wish I was still there!

Reviews.Title: “very wonderfull days”
Reviews.Author: marijkenederland
Reviews.Content: our time in this hotel was wonderfull the service was very good,in the hoteland on the beach very good and friendly people names of the people are Pablo, Jesus, Yasmin, Lucy,Teresa,Alex,they are very friendly thanks

Reviews.Title: “Not A Fan of All Inclusive but Beautiful Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Bookflyer
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful and the property is too. The people working at the Gran Porto Real were very friendly and pleasant. This is an all-inclusive resort, so when you check in you get a bracelet that tells the staff you are a guest. The bracelet entitles you to things like food and drink, and lounging in the beach chairs. All inclusive is supposed to include tips too so you don't have to feel uncomfortable about not leaving one. However there were tip jars at the bars. My wife and I stayed at this resort for my sister's wedding. Some of the other people invited did not stay on property. They were asked to either leave or purchase a bracelet for $90 a day for the services. All inclusive does not mean that all spa services, or snorkeling lessons or kayaking or similar activities are included in the price. Neither are certain premium drinks. I find it understandable, but I also felt a need to stay on the property to eat and drink my money's worth. We paid $400 a room-night for our stay. The food was cafeteria grade. I did not enjoy the buffet or the fancy restaurant much. I guess I enjoy my chickens with growth hormones and steroids and all that stuff because the chicken they had was fairly scrawny. They do have hamburgers and hot dogs ("sausages") if you want American food. It isn't good but they do have it. We had a snafu at check-in. They did not have an ocean view room so we were upgraded (black wrist bracelets whatever that means) to an ocean front room. It was very nice to walk out on the beach from our room. However, after noon the next day we could not get into our room until we visited the front desk. We were moved to another room that was ocean view. We were there for two nights only so I thought the moving was a bit much. I was surprised that the rooms were not really very big at all. Very high ceilings, a stocked fridge and alcohol mounted on the wall if you want to stay in the room. Some rooms apparently can be adjoining. The shower was awesome with strong water pressure; the drains a bit slow as in most beach front properties. The water did not smell funny like it does in Florida. Luggage being held for pre-check in or post-check out while waiting for your room to be ready or your ride to the Cancun airport is not secure, it is just left in the vestibule area. There are places in the USA that have the same/better quality at a lower price and don't require a passport to travel to. The 85 degrees was nice but I can find that in the USA in February.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee28
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent in Vancouver, and I just came back from the Porto Real. My husband and I stayed there from Jan 30th-Feb 6th. Our room was a oceanfront suite on the 3rd floor. It was the best view I ahve ever seen from ANY hotel. It was Suite #355. The hotel was very clean and spacious. The food in the buffett was very good. We ate there pretty much every day. We tried to eat at Maria's a few times. The food was pretty horrible. And I am not a picky person. We did try the italian restaurant one night and was pleasantly surprised. I do not care for italian food but it was really nicely done. The service there was great as well. Besides the beautiful view my very favorite part of the trip was the excellent customer service from a waiter named MAY in the buffett, great service from Jesus and Pablo out by the pool and Oyuka at reception. Sadly though, the service overall was very average. With a few EXCEPTIONAL highlights from the people listed. I had a really bad experience with a young guy in reception as well as a waitress at the lobby bar. But I wouldn't say that was the norm. This hotel is in the BEST possible location ever. We will stay at this hotel again! It is a much nicer hotel than I expected!

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed I could cry”
Reviews.Author: MarylandSugarcookie
Reviews.Content: I made my reservations through Expedia two months prior to trip. Received all my confirmations. When I got to the hotel, Gran Porto, they took me aside and told me they had overbooked my room and apologized and sent me to another hotel. I didn't know what recourse to take. The hotel they sent me to was nice, but I had originally booked a waterfront room with Gran Porto, and the hotel they sent me to was not waterfront. I paid $400 extra for the waterfront room. I don't know how this could happen. I got screwed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time!!”
Reviews.Author: kaylapiercey
Reviews.Content: My name is Kayla, I travelled to Mexico for the FIRST time from Canada with my Mom and my younger Sister back in August 2007 I am very impressed with the service in this resort. The workers are super friendly, energetic, and I adore every one of them. I don't know why some people said that some of the workers were mean, and unfriendly, but if you treat them with respect,, the workers will simply respect you back. I give 2 thumbs up to Spike and Mike, and the rest of the pool guys for the hard work they do everyday to keep everyone happy, and making sure that everyone is having a good time. Without them, Gran Porto would be quite boring lol. The Pool is clean, really big, not huge or anything, but big enough to keep everyone happy. Really crowed during the afternoon, personally, I'm not a big fan being around large crowds, so i usually prefer to stay on the beach where its quiet and peaceful. The beach is really nice, and clean, the sand is really white and soft. I've read alot of reviews and I can't believe that some people are complaining about the sandbags, I dont really think it's a big deal or anything, just be very careful when you step on them, But when you go past the sandbags, the water is really clear, and greenish aqua color, I thought it was really nice. The rooms were really big, very clean, I found that the beds weren't very comfortable(my opinion), but i didn't care that much, lol, there weren't very many english channels on tv, but who cares, who would want to watch tv all day during vacation?? lol It would only waste your time. There is a big closet there to put all of your clothes into. The showers is huge, you can fit like 5 people in there lol or more. The ocean view walk out is the best, its more easier to go in and out of your room whenever you want. The pool bar served good drinks, my favorite drinks were miami vice and sex on the beach. The pool bar closes around 11:00 i think..not sure..but the night life in this hotel is really quiet, not much is going on. If you want to have a wild night, this hotel may not be for you. or you would have to go to 5th ave, there are many clubs there. I can't remember the name of the bars i went to. Overall, I enjoyed my 7-day stay at the gran porto real, and I am going back there in June. & I can't wait. I hope my review helped some people, please look at some of my pictures.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming, Authentic Mexican Experience”
Reviews.Author: BobGump
Reviews.Content: Our twelth visit to this lovely hotel was as wonderful as our first visit! The rooms are large and beautifully decorated, the food is great, there are daily activities provided of interest to all ages, and the staff and service is warm and friendly. We especially enjoy the kayaks, watching beach volleyball, and the entertaining shows at night. The managers take special interest in seeing that guests are well cared for. We had a family reunion there last April and everyone was delighted with the hotel, the service, and the varied activities offered - a great family vacation! We usually see the same staff year after year and feel that we are returning to our "home" in Mexico every year. Jerry Jo and Bob Ballard February 10, 2008

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: ctsd
Reviews.Content: We have 2 children, ages 5 and 7. Gran Porto was very family-friendly. If you go, look for Alfredo, one of the many servers by the beach or pool. He took exceptional care of our family. And, book a massage on the beach with Enrique - the best massage I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry we overbooked!!”
Reviews.Author: RedheadAlabama
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Gran Porto Real in Play Del Carmen my families' excitement soon turned into a big disappointment. We were presented with our apple juice with a cherry and then escorted over to a table to be told that they had over booked and there was not a room for us. They wanted to put us up in a resort on the other end of Playa, offering us a lobster diner and free taxi back and forth to the Gran. My reservations for two Jr. Suites Garden View were booked in August so I could not understand how this could have happened. I booked this resort because of the location as well as the amenities plus we were told that we would be able to use the amenities at all of the other Real Resorts in the area, not so. What they were willing to offer and what we were willing to except for the compensation went on for several hours. They work in pairs two will come up and make an offer than two more will come and work someone else in your party. You get so confussed because you are so tired from the travel you don't know what to do. I wanted to use their phone to call my travel agent with a toll free number and was told they did not have a line to the US. After two hours of arguing we were offered rooms at the Royal Resort next door which we excepted because it was still in the same location. But.... as soon as we said yes they came up with two rooms. One room was clean but had a stale order and was hot, you could tell the room had not been used. The room next door took another two hours to clean for the rest of my family. At 5:00 the next morning I knew why the room was not being used, it was directly over the delivery area, the kitchen and resturant. The noise from the trucks slamming doors, the pot and pans banging and the poeple shouting sounded like they were in the room with us. Who wants to be woke up on their vacation at 5 in the morning. The roomservice stair way was right by our room and the sound traveled right up. The next morning I tried to get another room because we were also told we would have free upgrades, not so. Upgrade $40. per person per day was what they offered. This did not just happen to our family. Just about every one we talked to they did the same thing to them. They want you to tour their other resorts and go through this 90 min. presentation. This was even done to families that arrived at 3 and 4 in the morning. One family had a 75 year old lady who had to sit on the beach till around noon before they got a room. They did send them to a motel that was infested with lizards so they came back to the resort. The resort is beautiful but I did not have a garden view unless I went out the front door and crossed the walk way. I had a view of a resort under renovation and boxes of limes. The entertainment was good, the food was good but limited if you are staying long. Eat early, the resturants serve everyone, not just guest of the resort so you may have a long wait. The rooms were nice but the deadbolt on our room took forever to open and my husband got locked in the bathroom during the Super Bowl. They had to come and remove the door knob, thank God for him there was a phone in the restroom. Just watch out for the games they play, we come from Alabama and know BS when we hear it!!! There should be a law in overbooking to this extent. They want you to stay a day at one resort then move you back then try to get you to go to another resort in Cancun. When can you rest if you are packing and unpacking. I booked through Springdale Travel in Mobile and they had a difficult time getting a call into me, no one would answer the phone. I wasted two days trying to get some satisfaction from the management, don't bother. The only way you may get something is if you agree to visit another resort. I would definitly have in writing your room number and date in writing from the resort on letterhead. They blame it on the travel agencies and want you to book directly through them. It's not hte travel agencies fault but they do need to warn you of their South of the Border Tricks!! My travel agent did say he thought that there has been a change in ownership or management of the Real Resorts. Some of the Real Resorts listed at the time I booked had changed names. The front desk and management may stink, but the entertainment staff, the bartenders, waiters and maids all work very hard to please you. We met some wonderful people at the resort and had a good time. I don't think there was anyone left in Canada, they were all in Mexico, Great People!

Reviews.Title: “we love playa”
Reviews.Author: hanketexas
Reviews.Content: we have been to this resort at least 5 times.....some visits were just ok but enough great location to bring us back....this visit was fabulous....we were waited on hand and foot...the rooms were very updated and clean....the beach staff (where we stayed most of the trip) were so attentive....Poblo was our main man and would go to all lengths to please us....when he was on lunch he would send juan or jesus and they were great also.....the weather was perfect, beautiful beach, great food, great drink, geat staff...Jordi checked us in and was very good....he helped us find the perfect room...this place is also so close to walk to 5th street for more food, drink, and shop...great time and great place...cant wait to go back....only improvement would be beds updated and linens....but we still slept great...

Reviews.Title: “great staff at the Gran/ not so happy with the room”
Reviews.Author: Kayab55
Reviews.Content: we booked a standard ocean view. we got there to discover we had to walk the streets from 830 am to 230pm because our room was not ready. our ocean view consisted of walking out on the public balcony and leaning over the balcony to see a sliver of the ocean! A Nolitours rep called us at the hotel after we emailed home. She was very rude and would not help us unless we paid the additional $50 a day to upgrade to a suite! Enough about Nolitours as we will NEVER use them again! The staff at the hotel was super! The seating staff, waiters, desk staff and especially the maids were super! The food was very good at the buffet. So much so that we ate there more than at the a la carte restaurants. Marias was very good and we ate there 3 times in 2 weeks. The Italian a la carte was not as good in our opinion. The beach was a let down but we walked the stretch from the Royal located right next door almost every day and it was lovely not bagged like ours and not as many boats moored as there was from our hotel to the ferry stretch of beach. Location of the hotel was super as it was a block from famous 5th avenue. All in all I would say staff was wonderful but the hotel has to work on describing the rooms better on the selling end. If you tell a person they have an ocean view make it an ocean view NOT the street and facing the Royal and ps do tell us that you have to take an elevator to the 3rd floor, walk down the ramp to the 4th floor (?) and walk up a flight of wooden steps to the 5th floor. PS -before anyone sees Nolitours and thinks we are French Canadians we are from Alberta

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto was great!”
Reviews.Author: woods5
Reviews.Content: We went to the Gran Porto for our 4th time the week of Jan. 26 along with one of our daughters, her husband, and two children. We had a little problem last year getting the room we booked, but this year everthing at the hotel was great. If I had anything to complain about, it would be that it appears the food menu is being economized to some degree. I base that on my favorite steak (filet mignon) in the Italian restaurant is no longer on the menu. The food is still acceptable though. We had great service, especially from Alfredo, Jivario, and Mirium at the beach, and our maid, Nancy. Our grandchildren loved the pool and the beach, as well as the pasteries in the buffet. There are sandbags on the edge of the beach, but we didn't see that as any issue. Everything in general was very clean and well kept up. We were particularily impressed by how well everything at the beach snack bar was kept hot or cold. The hamburgers there are outstanding. We plan on returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: PalapadeBordeaux
Reviews.Content: I was in Playa del Carmen this week staying at a different hotel (which I loved). When traveling with spouse, we often stay at small boutique hotels but when traveling with out 3 teens we like all inclusive resorts. After walking along the beach and looking at various resorts throughout the morning, we decided to enter the Gran Porto Real to book out 2 week stay (with 3 teenagers) for March. As we approached the pool area, we were stopped by the 'pool gestapo' and were told we had to leave the pool area. We explained that we were heading into the lobby to make a reservation and were told we could not enter the property. Now you may think this was a language barrier issue, since why on earth would we not be allowed to MAKE A RESERVATION at the hotel but my husband is from Mexico so we told him in both English and Spanish out intent. He said we had to walk all the way around a huge area and were not welcome to walk thru the pool area. We told him he could escrot us to the desk if he wished, but he would not do it. AFter a huge walk around the hotel, we asked for the GM and got Michelle, a so-called supervisor. We told her our story and told her we would never stay at her hotel for their lack of service. I told her to look for my review. Hope you see this Michelle. This looks like a beautiful hotel but is not a place I would ever stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ColdinSD
Reviews.Content: We have been home a week now and wish we were back at Gran Porto Real. We had an awesome time there. We opted to spend a bit extra money and go for the Junior Ocean Front room. I would definitely invest in an Ocean Front room again, stear clear from the ocean view - not the same. Service was top notch. Rooms were exceptionally clean. We did not really see any of the nightly entertainment - we mostly walked up and down 5th to go shopping and people watching vs sticking around the resort at night. We had absolute no problem with overbooking. I was extremely concerned about this after reading other reviews. We actually arrived a day late to the resort due to flight problems and we still got in our room no problem. We were there with 4 other couples and we all had great rooms very close together. We want to say a very special thank you to Pablo(waiter on the beach). He was so much fun! He helped to make our trip a blast. Thanks Pablo!! The absolute ONLY thing I was a bit dissapointed with were the meals. The food was OK. Breakfast was great but I think they could improve upon the other meals. They definitely tried hard but everything started tasting the same by the end of our trip - as would any place if you ate there for 5 days straight. I do want to respond to the people who have complained about the sandbags......get over it. They did not bother us one bit. This area was hit hard with recent hurricanes and they are only using the sandbags to try and reclaim their beach. We walked up and down the beach both ways from GPR and we much preferred GPR's beach to any others. Their sister hotel's beach was nice also but it was much more crowded. GPR's was a tad bit rocky but not near what I thought it would be reading previous reviews. Kudos to all the staff, you made our stay great!! Thank you, thank you, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, We Really Enjoyed Our Stay........”
Reviews.Author: indycarluvr
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Gran Porto Real. There were 7 of us, ages 3 to 75. The hotel is in a great location, on the best end of the 5th Avenue shopping district. This a fun area. Lots of neat shops and though we didn't eat at any of the restaurants, some of them looked really interesting. The hotel itself is very clean, we could not have had better maid service all week in the room. I would recommend upgrading to the ocean FRONT jr. suites. You won't be sorry as these rooms are over sized with a guaranteed ocean view. We tipped the maid every day ($4.00 for 4 people.) We were on the top floor (3rd). The beach area was very nice. Yes, there are sand bags, but they are doing their best to refurbish the beach area after a couple hurricanes. The sandbags didn't bother anyone in our party. As an aside, last year we stayed at the Playacar Palace on the other end of 5th Avenue, while we really enjoyed the hotel, there was NO beach there as of a year ago. The pool was nice too, with terraces built out for children to play on or to lay on semi submerged lounge chairs. You can also lay out or read under thatched roof "umbrellas"on the sand. There is a smaller pool with a swim up bar on the third floor, but we did not use it.e The food was good, but I would not say great. The buffet is pretty typical with the highlights being the omelet station in the morning and the pasta station in the afternoon. The Italian Restaurant was our favorite, it was very good. I guess the only real complaint anyone had was about the service. I guess you could call it rather "spotty" at times. While everyone was very nice sometimes the servers were kind of hard to find. One night in the Italian Restaurant, tables on either side of us had come and gone before we even had our food. I would say this comment about the service applied everywhere from the pool to the restaurants. I actually didn't think the service was quite as bad as my Dad did but it still merits comment. The activities directors are an energetic lot offering everything from free bike tours to bingo, water and beach volley ball, yoga and water aerobics. The nightly shows that take place at night on a stage by the pool, aren't bad (especially after a couple margaritas, ha!) No, really they were pretty good! Overall, we had a great stay. There were so many things we really liked about this resort (including the smaller size.) We plan to return next year.....even my Dad!

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: parls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from jan 21th till jan 28th. We enjoyed everey minute of it. Very nice room (junior suite) with beautiful bathroom. The hotel is very clean. People working there are the most friendly. Special thanks to German (bell boy) Pablo (beach waitor - the nicest!) Jesus (beach waitor) Katrina (massage works at the Spa) Antonia (cleaning lady) But for all the other peolple working at the hotel: a great thank you - you were all so friendly and helpfull! We definitively will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Morf-KC
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on going to this resort, you should have a wonderful time. It is just south of Cancun and when we got in the van at the airport we had to drop off several other travelers at their hotels on the way. Each one of their hotels was at least a mile off of the road and most were secluded so that if you ever wanted to leave the hotel you had to arrange for transportation. This hotel is less than 2 blocks from a WONDERFUL shopping district. You will get hassled to look at the jewelry, get your hair braided or buy cuban cigars but it is all part of the nostalgia. The beach and water was not the best that we had seen in the area but not as bad as some want to make it out to be! The food was plentiful and sufficient, more options than you could imagine, but wasn't the best food I'd ever had by any means. If you go to Mexico for the food then you are MORON anyway. You will have no problem getting by though, there is something for everybody! All in all I would go back to this resort if I visit the area again, and next time we would bring some friends along to show them all the things we found out on our first trip. And DO NOT go to the appointment they set up for you to " tell you about the resort." It is a way to get you to listen to the dreaded TIMESHARE. If you use this advice your trip will be as pleasant as you want it to be!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Monica87
Reviews.Content: While planning a trip for a "Girls Weekend" our travel agent, Heather Di Pietro, from Berman Travel, [--] did an exceptional job of fulfilling all of our needs, both hotel and air. The hotel and resort were beautiful and very clean! The food and service were exceptional. I would definitely recommend this to couples, families and those just trying to get away from it all. There is something for everyone from the pool to the beach. The resort even had friendly staffers who got us involved in water aerobics...what a great invigorating workout, dance lessons etc.... I highly recommend this resort and would return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Playa & the Gran Porto Real!”
Reviews.Author: gemma1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from Jan.7th-13th. We have to say that we loved Playa del Carmen so much that we would probably only book there for any future carribean vacations. We have been to other areas in Mexico, Bahamas, Jamaica, St.Lucia and the Dominican and although all were nice none offer you the ambiance of Playa. In Playa you can walk in town, you have the option of nightlife with the many bars, patios etc and shopping where you don't feel harrassed and feel safe. Domican does not even come close to this place. Mexico has far more to offer. We would never go to Dominican again. The hotel Gran Porto Real was very nice, service was excellent and food was good. We would recommend that you stay in a junior suite or above as the standard rooms are not the greatest. Also for $300 you can upgrade to a suite at the sister hotel the Royal next door which does have a better beach front and nice beach beds on the beach. We paid a local fisherman $30 each for 2 1/2 hours for fishing and snorkelling which was well worth is, what a deal!!! We plan on going back and staying at the Royal for 2009. We hope you choose Playa for your next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Trip”
Reviews.Author: criwolfe
Reviews.Content: After trying to book a vacation on our own we went with Heather DiPietro at Berman Travel. ([-]) If it wasn't for her we would have never found such a great resort! The restaurants were great as was the service! Pool and beach were beautiful. I traveled with 6 other 40ish women but the hotel was great for couples as well.

Reviews.Title: “Simply AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: ktapply
Reviews.Content: What a terrific hotel property! Located on the sandy white beach of Playa del Carmen, the hotel while a few years old is in immaculate condition. The rooms are large and spacious, but I would definetly recommend paying the extra to insure you get an ocean view. We brought 20+ people for a business meeting followed by a few days of vacation and everyone rated it excellent. The food is amazing, The lobster tails at Maria's restaurant were a bargain ($14 above the all inclusive plan) when compared to the amount you pay in town for the same thing. The very best thing about the Gran Porto Real is the service. The staff is incredible. During our stay were were never once shown anything but a positive outlook and willingness to help, regardless of the request. I want to give special thanks to Edgar Adan Ruiz Rodea, it seemes he was there every moment and he worked endlessly. His outgoing smile and "can-do" attitiude demonstrated what I have to believe is the goal of the management... keep your customers happy.... We will be back and would never consider going to any other resort now in cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaHawkeye
Reviews.Content: Grand Porto Real & Spa Playa del Carmen We spent the week of January 8-15 at the Grand. It was our third visit to this beautiful location. We find the accommodations to be first rate. It offers everything that we want in a relaxed vacation. The pool area is beautiful and the beach the best we've seen in four years. The food served in the dining room was tasty, appealing to the eye and plentiful. The friendliness of the wait staff and servers is a draw as well. We are a retired couple that like to relax when on vacation. The spa services are an attraction to us. We also appreciate the location of the hotel on the beach. It is easy to walk the beach for almost two miles without distraction. Since shopping is a must when one travels it is important to note that Fifth Avenue shopping venue is a short walk from the Grand Porto Real. The desk personnel are friendly and very willing to help with any problem. We fully intend to return for many more vacations in Playa del Carmen and especially at the Grand Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing week!!”
Reviews.Author: KMac14
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen. My husband and I and our 2 children ages 8 and 11, shared an oceanfront junior suite at the east end of the hotel, away from the pool and close to the ocean. The kids slept on 2 roll-away beds and we still had tons of room. We loved the walk-in shower! We all enjoyed the food at the buffet, especially the fresh preparations. We were very happy that we could always get real food at the beachside Tradewinds restaurant and snacks in the lobby and the snack bar. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We never had to wait for service on the beach and the waiters in the buffet and the a la carte restaurants were extremely attentive. We went to bed early each night and were not bothered by the noise from the nightly theme parties. The ocean varied from day to day. We had a wonderful time boogie boarding for the first few days and on the calmest days swam and kayaked far out past the pier. We loved the kayaks and para-sailing, took a tour to Tulum and snorkeled at Aku Mal and spent a day riding motor scooters on Cozumel. We can't wait to go back!! The only disappointment was the fitness center. The equipment is dangerous. The hotel staff told us about "The Gym" around the corner from Il Piscatore restaurant and we found our workout home for the week. That gym is amazing and was well worth the $10 each per visit. We can't wait to head back to the Gran Porto Real!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryMaggie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 4 year old son just returned from two weeks in Playa del Carmen at the Gran Porto Real. First off, my wife and I did a fair bit of research before we booked the area and hotel and a little work goes a long way. I chuckle somewhat at some of the reviews on this sight that are negative, especially those that comment on points that are easily researched before hand. Anyways, we found the hotel to be everything that we expected...in a good way. We had a spacious room overlooking the pool and ocean. It was very clean and Rebecca, our maid, took the time to leave incredible animal creations made out of towels and flowers for our son. If you need more hangers, just let the front desk know and problem solved. The beach and the pool area were great. Navigation around the pool was tight at times as guests would arrange the lounges as they saw fit, but other than that it was not a problem.The shallow entry points to the pool was great for our son and a great place for play for kids in general. There is a small kids pool attached that is a foot deep which was in constant use. The beach and the swimming area were great also. We knew it was sandbagged so that was no surprise (research!) and the quality of the sand was fine and the beach was clean. None of us found a need for aqua socks and we spent a fair amount of time in the sea swimming, kayaking and boogie boarding. The food at the buffet was more or less what we expected. We knew the rating of the Porto Real so we did not expect Gourmet World Class cuisine. We were pleased with the service in the buffet area. The waiters were friendly and Yasmin, who greeted us at the entrance, always had a smile. Regarding the issue of service (overall), I will say this to those of you who had negative comments: it pains me to hear that you had problems, however, you usually get what you deserve. I heard some of the guests barking at and treating the staff like dogs. If you do this, do not expect much respect back. The staff are trying to do their best and a smile and a little patience goes a long way. The a la carte restaurants were very good, especially the Italian one. We ate there a fair bit and enjoyed every meal. They went out of their way to help our 4 year old enjoy the experience. The Mexican restaurant was similar, but we preferred the Italian food overall. And since we are not pasta eaters, this was a positive experience for us. We were very happy that the hotel did not place a restriction on the number of times we could eat at the a la cartes. We were pleased enough with the food that we did not feel it was necessary to eat outside the hotel. Some issues did arise that we did not know about prior to our trip (lack of research?). One was the noise from the nightly band and variety show in our hotel, and the bars, north along the beach at another hotel. It was quite loud and I would prefer to choose to go to a show instead of having one come to you when you're trying to sleep after a long day of sun, surf and sand. The second issue would be to have a more informed definition of "ocean view". Our original room was facing the street and the hotel across the way with only a sliver of ocean to be seen. However, a friendly chat with the front desk and an upgrade to "ocean front" was easily achieved. Ultimately, you are going to hear the music and shows regardless of where your room is, so you might as well have a good view while you are at it! To conclude, I would recommend this resort and Playa Del Carmen without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Have kids?”
Reviews.Author: kansasKansas
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real in Playa is a real treat. We have been several times and prefer this location to all of the other hotels in and near Playa. The staff is extraordinarily friendly and upbeat. The beach front rooms are very spacious....but loud due to the night entertainment (the only downfall). The best thing about this hotel is the kids club. The girls in the club are magnif. and I would take every one of them home. My child has cried at each departure and before we have gotten home had already planned the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: sunny38
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home after 2 weeks at the Gran Porto Real, which included Christmas and New Years. We were travelling in a group of 12 ranging in age from 8-81. Our first impression was good, nice hotel, nice size, nice rooms. We all had an ocean front Jr. suit, and even with 5 of us in the room, 3 children, it was still big enough, however we could have used more storage space, a chest of drawers or something would have been great, and there was plenty of room for such a thing. Also, the bathroom was large, but we really needed some shelves or something to store our toiletries. The shower is large, but if you have any mobility issues there is quite a step up in order to enter. The resort is extremely noisy!! We all had premium rooms, which looked out over the pool ,and the ocean, and every morning for the entire 2 weeks we were woken at 5:50am by the sounds of the staff getting the buffet ready!! It sounded like they were dragging man hole covers across the tile floors, but it was actually the tables. When they were done with that you could clearly hear the sounds of cutlery, and dishes ect.... Everything is open air so the sound just carries. The same thing happened every night at around 11pm, when they moved everything again to wash the floors. On top of that at night you also had all the noise from the lobby where each night a "band" was brought in for entertainment. They were always good, however, the music would start at 9pm, and the volume was very loud. You couldn't sit and listen to the music comfortably, you had to shout to talk to anyone. This would go on till 9pm when that noise would be replaced by the noise of the evening show out by the pool. These shows were poor quality, in general, and again very loud. That would end at 10pm, and then the band in the lobby would start again and go till 11pm. With all the tile and concert you just could not get away from it all!! The food was very disappointing. The buffet really left a lot to be desired, and it was the only option for breakfast and at lunch there was a pool side hut also. At dinner you could go to the buffet, or 1 of 2 restaurants, one Mexican, one Italian. The Italian one is very good, and I would have gone there every night, if we had not been travelling in a group. The buffet at dinner wasn't good at all. Often over the 2 weeks members of our group had uncooked food, everything from chicken, to salmon, to squid. The food had little flavor, and was just plain bad. It rotates themes each night, but it really didn't make a difference. The pool was nice, but I felt it could have been a little more child friendly. There is a children's program, however, it is geared more for small children. My kids are 8, 10, and 12, and there was nothing they were interested in in regards to that program. The beach is held together with sand bags!!! On either side of the resort the beach is great, but not what the pictures display right at the resort. The poolside entertainment was so so. there were the usual assortment of pool related activities, but nothing great. The outdoor entertainment staff were all very nice, and enthusiastic though. This was my first experience with an all inclusive resort. I have gone on many cruises, and done many trips independently, and I have to say that I personally found the Gran Porto Real disappointing. Others in my group had been to other all inclusive before, and they were also not happy with Gran Porto. I can't tell you how many times I was in the lobby and people were complaining about their rooms. They also overbooked the hotel, and were asking people to move to other resorts in Cancun, and across the street. I would never again choose to go to this resort, and I will not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: cenotediver
Reviews.Content: We stayed in dec 5 thru the 10 ,2007 had a great time no problems with really anything. First let me say about all the bad reviews about this place you need to look at the time of the year.high season, spring break, summer, sure expect overbooking, strained nerves, ect. But knowledge is everthing, reasearch the hotel ,the area , ect., you will be happier and oh yes remember this Mexico..If you treat the staff with digity and recpect and a happy face you will see the same. and dont to forget to tip . I hand out 2 doller bills at every meal and drink and i got great service . I gave the maid 2 dollars a day and every day my room was clean and also fresh flowers and towel animals. the last day of my stay i gave 10 dollars to her for the great job . this is our second time here and will return in 08 again in dec. so have fun, relax and stay loose

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Terrible Food”
Reviews.Author: beachbug
Reviews.Content: Admittedly my SO paid for this vacation, and I tend to be less discriminating when it isn't actually my money at stake. Overall, I thought this was a great little four star resort, with one big problem - the food. My SO had not been on a vacation in a while and requested a really nice suite. According to the the guy at the front desk we had one of the best ones at the resort. I wish I could remember the number, but I can't. Suffice it to say it was twice the size of my NYC apartment (not that that is all that difficult) and with killer views to boot! I think this may have been the nicest room/suite I have ever stayed in. We had three enormous rooms with three different balconies to choose from. The suite was as close to the water as you could be and I found myself wanting to just lay out on my patio and not even go down to the beach. Housekeeping did a great job keeping the room spotless and I LOVED having tequila on tap in my room! Room service I will warn you is not good. I was sick during my stay there and ordered one day only to never have it show up. It appears they only pick up the phone during certain hours. The location of the hotel is at one end of playa and it appears, along with the Royal Real across the street - to be one of the only true beach resorts in playa. I loved being able to walk to fifth avenue (either via the beach or the street). I also like being right on the beach and being able to have service on the beach. The food was the low point of this resort. Now, this is my first real experience at an all-inclusive and I do think if you take all of your meals at your hotel you will miss out on that true Mexico experience, but I was very disappointed that i couldn't even get mexican food at the lunch buffet! The lunch buffet tended to cater to a more Euro crowd - with lots of pasta etc. It just wasn't the food I wanted to eat at the beach. We did not have dinner at the Italian restaurant, but we did have dinner at the Mexican restaurant and I found the food to be very average at best. The service at meals was very good, but it would be great if the food could be just a little bit better. Overall, I would probably stay next time at the Royal Real across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wintergo
Reviews.Content: This was my family's first trip to Mexico and I wanted it to be great for them. I was worried about accomodations because even though on a vacation you do not spend much time in the room you do want good accomodations. Well not to worry! The Gran Porto Real was a beautiful, warm, hotel and the staff was the best! We had a junior suite which gave us the room we needed for a family of four. The food was delicious in the buffet. We did go to one of the better restaurants provided by the hotel, but we found the buffet to be just as good if not better. There were four different buffets to chose from so every member of the family got to eat what they wanted. The entertainment staff were great. They really got you going or they left you alone if that was what you wanted. The non-motorized beach equipment was fun for the kids and adults, and as for the motorized sports such as fishing, parasailing, etc. there was plenty and you were not hounded by the beach people. My husband was even snorkeling just off our beach. Shopping at fifth avenue was just two blocks down the street. I definitely would recommend this hotel and the area!

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Coobry
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from 8 nights in the Master Suite at the Gran Porto Real, I am so happy to be home to enjoy a peaceful nights sleep without the all night thumping from the local disco further on along the beach. According to the hotel staff, Playa del Carmen has no laws governing noise and our beachfront suite was not sound proof, leading to many nights of no sleep. In addition, the beds and pillows are unbearably hard and uncomfortable. The other thing you need to know, is that if you have children, the kids club here is a major disappointment. The Mexican girls who staff the club are sullen and miserable, and appear to hate their job. They don't interact much with the children, the TV is always on, and the staff just sit there and ignore the kids as much as possible. The kids club schedule tells it all, they have nothing other than "video games" until 11 am each day, and after that the list doesn't get much better. In addition, they fill the kids up with cheap candy, and have no interest in taking them outside for beach activities. We will definitely not be returning to this resort, when there great kids clubs like those found at Dreams resorts, where we stayed in June, 2007, or the Iberostar Paraiso Beach up the road..

Reviews.Title: “A Good 4 star resort”
Reviews.Author: Holiday4Princess
Reviews.Content: Overall score for the Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa – 4 star. They claim to be a 5 star, but they are not. But definitely a 4 star. I read the trip advisor comments before I left and was watching for the same things when we were there December 8 - 15, 2007. We had a great time and found the place to be wonderful. I would definitely go back. Room: very clean and well kept. Lots of room, gorgeous shower area in the bathroom. Nice large closet. My only complaint would be that there should be more drawer space or cubby-holes for putting clothes. The safe was easy to use and was a good size. The beds were very hard. Food: good variety, lots of food, greens, fruits, and desserts in the buffet restaurant. It was easy to get a seat at the Italian and Mexican restaurants available on site. I think that eating anywhere everyday for 7 days gets a bit drab. The staff: Everyone we dealt with was pleasant and helpful. Most spoke very good English which I appreciate since I don’t speak Spanish. The bar service was very good. Only on a very few occasions did we have to ask for service. Tipping: the practice seems to be $1 for a round of drinks and repeat as the day goes. Or, if you are staying in that spot for a while give $5 to the bartender upfront and they will keep the drinks coming. Housekeeping $1 per person, per day. Room upgrade: We had a room booked called “junior suite ocean view”. When we arrived we were asked if we wanted an upgrade to a suite facing the ocean. So we asked what we already had (‘ocean view’) meant and were advised that we faced the street but if we stood on our balcony and looked to the side down the street we would see the ocean. We took the upgrade. It cost $20 per night ($140) for the week. It was well worth it. Our new view was right over the swimming pools overlooking the ocean. An absolute gorgeous view. So, keep in mind that ocean view means many things…… Entertainment – most nights they had a small band in the lobby bar playing music until the outside (large stage) entertainment started at 9. It was very nice. Definitely not a disco or club atmosphere. The resort is only about 1 block from the shopping district (5th Avenue) which runs about 10 blocks. It was very nice to have that so convenient to the hotel. Lots of tourist shops, some very cheap, and others very high end. Clothing, jewelry, and trinkets are the most common. Plan to barter for just about everything. Grind, grind, grind. Good deals can be had. Also the hotel will ask you if you want to upgrade to their sister resort across the street the "Royal Real" . We did not take that option and did not take their tour. We only were in the lobby and it was certainly beautiful, much nicer than the Gran Porto. It likely is true 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Those negative reviews are worth considering”
Reviews.Author: Therandman
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: This hotel is situated right on the beach in Playa Del Carmen.It's location is ideal for those travellers who want to be close to shopping, site seeing and great day trips and of course some great night spots. We ( myself and adult daughter) had a great junior suite with an ocean view (RM 360) The room was large clean and the balcony overlooked the main pool as well as the Beach. We could see the evening shows from our balcony or just relax and listen to the music from the lobby bar. Sports and entertainment team (Shelley , Spike and Nick etc.) really gave it their best shot ......the decade show was fun, the others...well this ain't Vegas baby! Around the pool and at the tables by the Beach ,Sara, Jesus and Pablo made sure you never went thirsty. A true family style hotel and therefore just a little frustrating sometimes for those of us with grown children. The solution is simple.... either book next door at the Royal or buy the $20 day pass to use their restaurants and facilities. No children at the Royal. Again, this Hotel is located in an ideal spot for the complete Mexican/ Mayan Riviera adventure. THE BAD: Let's start with the food in the 2 restaurants ( non buffet) Maries: Actually not bad Mexican style food, well prepared but with wait staff and managers who either don't care or don't understand you. Let's face it this was supposed to be a 5 star experience but falls short Il Pescatore: It's hard to screw up pasta and you are safe there but my fish has passed away at least a couple of days ago. Again same problem with staff. My daughter says I'm too critical here but she quickly agreed to eat the rest of our lunches and dinners across the street or on 5th Avenue. In fact, aside from the sport, pool and entertainment staff, the rest of the staff really just ignore you. It's like they are doing you a favour to converse with you. THE BUFFET: I have no idea how anyone could mess up a Buffet but they did. The food was just cafeteria style and quality. The fruit was unripe in most cases, the choices were dull and uninspired and just generally plain. Nothing will make you sick but nothing makes you want to go back. We tried all meals here at various times and along with the Dinner choices available were the main reason we upgraded for day passes at the Royal. We actually wondered if the Management had actually planned this as the traffic next door at their restaurants included a lot of people from ours. In all, if you can live with uninspired middle of the road food then you'll be just fine. Besides Kids only eat Hamburgers, Hot Dogs, Grill Cheese and fries! THE UGLY: What was once a beautiful Beach has been destroyed by erosion. The Pier ( never used) has destroyed the natural reef area and a breakwater wall has been built to slow the erosion. Sand bags are everywhere and entrance to the swimming area is limited to about 50 feet ( 20 metres) of safe entry. Water shoes are a must. As the beach is now gone, the local fishing fleet now starts it's "docking" area just at the end of the Hotel property. While this makes for a great photograph, it makes for lousy swimming. If you are a Beach and Ocean swimmer this isn't the place for you. However, the same company ( Real ) owns the property on the other side of the pier where the Beach is in great shape. Only problem is you can't use the beach chairs unless you do the day pass thing again! ( Again no Kids) CONCLUSION: The Gran Porto Real is a 3.5/ 4 star property geared to non Beach people. If you can live with that and lower food quality then you are guaranteed a safe, clean holiday destination. We will not return but only because we are looking for a more upscale holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto-Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Chicabonitadiablo
Reviews.Content: For many years I have spent 2 weeks,twice a year at Gran Porto in Playa del Carmen.From my first visit it was like going Home.The staff were like family,everyone working together to make the guests feel special.Before going to Playa I had spent my Mexican vacations in Porto Vallarta.It was time for a change and I booked a room at Posada San Pedro in Playa.When I arrived I was taken to Gran Porto Real and was put in a Junior Suite! It was an amazing surprise! I then learned that Gran Porto had recently purchased San Pedro which is the adjacent property and had started the construction to join the 2 properties into 1 larger Resort.And so my adventures in Playa began and each visit brought more physical changes during the expansion. One thing did not change-the warmth of the staff and the quality of the service. The whole atmosphere created in me the desire to keep returning. I observed the staff and could clearly see the opportunities for these hard working,friendly people were given when they proved to be worthy of advancement. A few years ago Real Resorts purchased the property across the street and this became another elegant resort,The Royal,which is also a beachfront property and now an Adults Only Resort,offering their guests the same warmth and efficiency in an elaborate,Spanish style atmosphere. The cleanliness is amazing,always making sure everything is perfect.The food is truly top quality in taste,variety and presentation. Having been a guest this long has also allowed me to develop friendships with many of the staff,too numerous to put in this review.Teresa who works at Gaviota's Pool Bar became a friend on my first visit and continues to be today.Others such as Benito,Illiana and Evillia are among original friends. Edwin,who had worked as Food and Beverage Manager for a long time continues his career in a position now at The Royal,in charge of their top quality Entertainment.He is the same warm ,friendly person,working with staff and guests in a very professional manner. Enrique-Pianista,began at Gran Porto in Maria Marguaritta's a la carte Restaurant and later in the Lobby Bar. He is now sharing his Music with guests at The Royal.His repetoire ranges from Classical,Mexican and Popular to some of his own Compositions.A very accomplished Pianist who adds a special touch from his heart to the guests. If you are looking for a piece of Paradise as a Romantic vacation or with your Family of any ages you will find it here at Gran Porto. The charming atmosphere of Playa will appeal to everyone and being able to walk safely to hundreds of unique shops is a plus ! I have just returned from 2 weeks of perfect weather & relaxation and look forward to many more enjoyable visits to Gran Porto.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumBG
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Mexico...and it was fabulous! It was a group of 10 of us (being our honeymoon). We had a bit of a rocky start thru the airlines (but not the travel agent nor resort's fault). I was a little concerned after reading the other reviews, but in reflection my best advice is to understand what you are going to and enjoy it as a vacation - chill out! I thought all the pics were accurate so I had an idea of what things would look like. Overall, the resort was wonderful - the staff is extremely friendly and warm. It was hard getting used to people looking you in the eye and saying good morning (doesn't happy so much in NY). They are willing to wait on you hand n foot - it brought a great sense of relaxation to all of us during our week's stay. I would say that I was still annoyed by the room swapping they try to pull. Make sure if you've booked your room far enough in advance, they should find you a room - don't take the upgrade trick unless you really like the oceanfront vs oceanview. Don't get me wrong - oceanfront rooms are great (one couple we went with stayed there). Our oceanview rooms were around room 145-150 # - with a decent view. I think we had so much fun b/c we were together as a group, laughed a lot, and enjoy what a vacation is truly supposed to be. ROOMS - nice but the beds are definitely hard - ask for extra pillows to fluff with. As a nonsmoker, I wish there were non-smoking rooms - yuk! We looked at it like, "you only change clothes, shower, and sleep there." They were definitely clean everyday! Actually, a give a big kudos to the entire cleaning staff - they were always out and about. There wasn't a spot in the whole place you could say was dirty. FOOD - buffets are okay. They should have more variety b/c it all gets old by the end of the week. Many items in buffet were greasy though. You can't go wrong with ordering club sandwiches from room service!! I suggest skipping the burritos on the beach - we think they were made with hot dogs? Nice feature of buffet - make your own omelet and pasta stations. The Mexico and Italian restaurants were good too! Filet Mignon at Italian made the guys quite happy. DRINKS - awesome! If you ask for top shelf, you'll get it. We were very refreshed by the constant flow of Mango Coladas from Benito @ the swing bar! The mini bar in your room (which is included) is a nice feature to either start or end your day - good convenience...just make sure they restock your beverages in mini fridge. SaVe ThE wAtEr, DrInK ThE tEqUiLa! :) ENTERTAINMENT - inside night band/singer was okay. The day activities at the pool were always amusing. Thanks Spike n 'Chicken Little'! None of us had kids, but it appeared very kid friendly and orientated. I think we liked the entire resort b/c it seemed to cater to a mixed crowd - families, older adults, groups of 20-something, quiet folk, etc. The pool bar closed at 11pm and the inside bar closed at midnight. SHOPPING - Fun on 5th ave. Make sure you know how to deal with aggressive people. They were friendly and joking. You can definitely barter with the US $. SPA - heard from friends that it was spectacular...bit pricy but worth it! Sorry, on vacation - never used the gym. BEACH - Yes, there are sandbags...but if they weren't there, there would be no beach to enjoy. We found the best location to access best parts was near the swing bar - you could get to the open beach or walk across pier to Royal beach (which is nicer). You have to understand there is commercial fishing nearby - looked like a lot of people were going out and coming back with some good catches. It was neat to watch them pull up and clean fish right on shore. EXCURSIONS - Thanks to Juan/Olympus the entire group enjoyed a variety of events off the resort...ATV, Tolum, and Xel-Ha. If you go to Xel-Ha, be sure to spend the entire day - it goes by way to quickly (bring a water camera). POOL - at first I thought they'd be crowded but weren't (maybe due to time of year we went). The back pool was definitely the main one - it should have the swim up bar but thanks to Sara, we never had to worry about an empty cup! The pool upstairs was supposedly the "quiet" one which we got kicked out of by some *bleeping* guests - it wasn't that good anyway b/c it was shaded before noon. The jacuzzi on rooftop was fun - love the hammock swings located in random places. You can take a nap pretty much anywhere! There is a game/VIP lounge that some of the group used one night - Really, there's always something to see or do...you won't be bored. Advice - don't be afraid to ask - they seem to be able to do whatever they can/willing to. For instance, there was some construction in an adjacent room - asked for quiet and received. Overall, what can I say besides "you never go hungry, never thirsty, may become a ping pong champion, have a million pictures to remember and will walk away 5lbs heavier but refreshed n revived (if you enjoy your vacation as it's meant to be). Oh, there was a wedding going on too - from what I saw, it looked amazing - and we enjoyed the reception part from our balcony! We definitely plan to go back!! Enjoy - Sorry I didn't have pics ready to attach.

Reviews.Title: “Every Thing we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: moongoose
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! Went to Playa in late Oct. Beach front walk out room(the only way to stay). No booking problems, everything was in order from our check in to our departure. Some of the most friendly people dedicated to make sure we had a good time. No pressure sales in the hotel, no timeshare presentations. One of the most relaxing trips we have ever taken. We will never forget the Gran Porto Real or it's staff. Clean rooms beautiful beach still had sandbags but that's better than water in your room. In the morning we watched people fishing with nets in 3' of water with good catches. Walk the beach in the evenings with beautiful weather. Only one problem 1 week was not long enough, we were very sad to have to leave. Definately comming back to Gran Porto.

Reviews.Title: “Married at the Amazing Gran Porto Real!!”
Reviews.Author: Bruinsrock
Reviews.Content: Just got back a few weeks ago from getting married at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen. We had a group of 28 go down, and I can just not say enough good things about this resort. We were the wedding couple, so when we checked in, they had upgraded us to a suite which was huge and so nice. Check in was a breeze and only took a few minutes. We had our choice of eating at the buffet restaurant or the Mexian or Italian themed al la carte restaurants. We ate at all three and they were so delicious! Didn't even have to book in advance. The two pools are great and so was the service. The ladies serving us around the pool were so good, and would come by often and we didn't even have to get out. We had to be there four days before our wedding, so we met with Pady the wedding coordinator and Ivan the reception coordinator and they were so helpful and had everything ready for us before we even got there. So we hardly spent anytime with worrying about the wedding and we could just relax and enjoy our vacation before the big day. Playa offers so many things to do, and the Real is located in the perfect area just a few blocks from all the shopping 5th Ave has to offer. Wedding Day: We had our choice of having the wedding right on the beach, or under the atrium that over looks the beach, and luckily we picked the atrium, because it was very hot and it still a great view of the beach and ocean. Then, that night the reception was at 5:00 right on the beach, just as the sun was going down. As soon as I walked out to see it for the first time I was amazed! They had just everything perfect! The head table for the Bride and Groom, and three other tables for the guests. All with lights underneath them that looked so nice once it got dark. And there was a nice size dance floor in the middle of the tables. Just off to one side, we had our own private bar, and a djay on the other and there was tiki torches set up all around us. All the servers were just amazing with just everything! You could tell they really took pride in their jobs and I really appreciate them for it. Overall, I would have to say that this was the best possible wedding and vacation we could have had and I look forward to going back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected...and more!”
Reviews.Author: Karen_WI
Reviews.Content: If I had to choose one word to describe this place, it would be "wow". My husband and I stayed at this resort this past September. I had read numerous reviews, and asked many questions to fellow tripadvisor friends prior to leaving. (by the way, thanks to all who helped me in my decision...it was spot on!) We had previously stayed at the Gran Caribe Real in Cancun, so we were considered what they called "repeat guests" Upon check in, we were given black bracelets, which signifies this. Under NO circumstances did this give us any special treatment when it came to the staff. Everyone here is treated equally, from what I could see. We e-mailed the hotel ahead of time, informing them we would be celebrating our 15 year anniversary with this vacation. To our surprise, they upgraded us from an ocean view room to an ocean front room. Nice touch on the hotel's part. We also had a swan and flower arrangement made up on our bed, welcoming us. Another nice touch. The room was beautiful, with pillars, lovely tile work; all the little extra things to make it pleasing to the eye. Along with the standard mini fridge as in all rooms, it also included a four bottle liquor dispensor (made the husband happy!) as well as robes and slippers. Again, very nice touch. The bathroom was big, with a large walk in shower that had great HOT water pressure. No issues on this our entire stay. The first night, after getting out of the shower, I heard my husband speaking with someone (??) To our surprise, the staff had sent up an anniversary cake, along with a bottle of champagne and glasses. SUPER nice touch. They included a little note along with it, giving us best wishes for our anniversary. That really meant a lot to us, as it was not expected. I even had my picture taken on our balcony, wearing one of their bathrobes, and holding a glass of champagne. Something I'll always remember. Okay....on to the critical stuff. Food was delicious, hot food was HOT (not luke warm) cold food was cold, drinks were made the way we requested them (Bacardi and coke, not a rum and coke) The entire waitstaff went out of their way to help...nothing was too much for them to help you with. We tried both the Italian and Mexican restaurants, and liked each for it's own uniqueness. We would have been perfectly happy eating the buffet every day, though, because of the wide variety. There's a coffee machine in the lobby which is great! A good cup of Joe whenever you wanted one. Tea as well was offered. All the bartenders were very pleasant, and more than willing to have a conversation if time allowed. The one thing we definitely noticed was the people working there have been there for a number of years, and they all would say how they love their jobs. A big kudos to the Real company for making sure their staff is taken care of. How many of us can truly say we love our jobs? The activities pool was at a good temperature, and got rather busy during the peak hours. That's to be expected. The upstairs quiet pool was one of our favorite places to hang out in the late afternoons. The bartender (Pelipe?) was fantastic, and it was indeed quiet up there most of the time. Beach was great for walking in either direction. The proximity of this resort is perfect for those looking to have access to the town. A mere 2 block walk, and you're in the thick of it. After our first night there, we were given the option to "upgrade" to the ROYAL, located across the street for only $50 more per day. We went over to take a look at the grounds, and a room, and decided to stay right where we were. The only difference in the room was the royal had a jacuzzi. The additional restaurants would be nice for someone if they were staying for an extended amount of time, but we were just too happy with what we had to give it up. (sounds crazy, don't it?) On our last day, we were slipped under our door a comment card. We filled it out, listing names of staff that deserved extra mentioning. When we came to the part that said "things we (the resort) could improve on", we were dumbfounded! We couldn't think of one single thing we would have changed to make our stay any better. Would we return to this resort? In a heartbeat!! Awesome job, Gran Porto Real! Karen_WI

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort (CIAO AMICA)”
Reviews.Author: mexican_at_heart64
Reviews.Content: We would like to express our sincere thanks to all the staff at the Gran Porto Real on the kindness and great service they provided my husband and i from October 6th. to the 20th. of 2007. The management and staff at this Resort are truly outstanding, they are attentive and very polite. The goal at this resort is to do everything to please you. Everyone can not do enough for you, and always with a smile to make your stay enjoyable. They go out of their way to see you are truly happy. Everything about this Resort is special the hotel is beautiful true Mexican décor. The rooms and baths are beautiful, large and super clean….wow…wow… The food is the best, both ala carte and buffet with an amazing variety and plentiful. Then there is the location the best in Riviera maya,this resort is right in Playa De Carmen, one block from 5th. Avenue. We are looking forward to our return to the Gran Porto Real. Until then Asta Luego

Reviews.Title: “Very nice vacations in Mexico !”
Reviews.Author: McThePro
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at GPR last week. Room: we had the basic room but is was very nice, especially the shower, and everything was ultra-clean. Food: it was my first time in Mexico, but compared with Cuba and Dominican Republic the food was very good, and everything at the buffet was very clean. The "Il pescatore" restaurant is classy and the Tuna Carpachio I ate there twice was #1. Everyone (we were a group of 10) wanted to have the lobster bisquet twice. Recommended. Beach: it is the low point of the GPR. There is sand bags all over the beach (you can see them on the picture attached) and the bottom of the sea is rocky. BUT you can walk 5 minutes to the Royal's beach and there the beach is perfect. Wedding: it was my sister's wedding and we had a perfect time with the ceremony and the beach side supper. All the employees are very nice and speak good english. I never saw that many brooms in a week. They clean all the place at all time of the day To be near the 5th avenue with all its boutiques, bars and restaurants is definitively a +.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: getme2thebeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week at the GPR and had a great time - If you want to have a very nice resort that's close to the nightlife of Playa Del Carmen, choose this one. Being a 5 minute walk from 5th Avenue is well worth it! The hotel was just what we expected - affordable luxury in Mexico! We were lucky enough to recieve our Junior Suite Ocean Front room at the time we checked in (though I did see people getting the "we don't have your room ready" runaround later in the week - my advice? take an EARLY flight and check in around 3:00). It was truly ocean front and there's nothing better than sleeping with your balcony door open a crack and waking up to sunshine and waves tumbling onto the beach. We were quite happy to see the alcohol dispenser and daily stocked mini-bar! The room was nicely sized, the bed was a bit hard but we got used to it. The food was average in the buffet, above average in the other restaurants. The pool was great! The bartenders at the beach took VERY good care of us each day! We were not phazed by the fishing boats tied up - if you have a problem with looking at fishing boats anchored at the beach, then get out of Playa for your resort. I thought the sandbags were not an eyesore like other reviews say - it's either sandbags or no beach - and we could see daily how the beach down the way was eroding quickly. We avoided the lure to the Royal - they seemed offended that we didn't go over to do the tour but we were happy with where we were and figured there was a reason we chose the GPR. They really harp on the fact that the Royal is no-kids - but seeing kids around did not bother us at all. The nightly entertainment is, well, cheesy, but you do have 5th Avenue right up the way. Walk up the beach on Saturday night and see the fire show at the Blue Parrot at 11pm - it's totally worth it. All in all - we would definitely recommend this place to friends and family. Get the Ocean Front room though - it's worth the extra money! One last thing - the folks at Best Day Travel were great - they handled our transfer to/from Cancun via 10-passenger vans and it was an easy trip. But avoid the gauntlet of timeshare folks at the airport and walk DIRECTLY outside - BDT is on the right side island waiting. They did not hassle us about anything and were very courteous and on schedule both coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven~on~Earth!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: inked1957
Reviews.Content: My mom and I were at GPR from 10-17-07 to 10-24-07,It was the best vacation we have ever been on.. The staff was wonderful! the food was so good. Our room was spotless,maid service was great. The front desk was very helpful and kind. The pool was clean and well taken care of. The service poolside was more than you could have asked for..We loved our 7 day visit to gpr and will be returning next year with my hubby and many of our friends... Thank you GPR you are the Bomb!!!!!! I've been on cruises, lived in England, and traveled most all of the USA, however none can compare with my trip to GPR. See all of you in 2008...................................................

Reviews.Title: “We got bumped, upgraded and loved the GPR. Would return !”
Reviews.Author: UAtraveller
Reviews.Content: We spend 7 nights (6 actually) at the GPR OCt 13-20 '07. We spent one night up in CUN before arriving in Playa for our honeymoon. We were excited to finally be "here". When we checked in they took us around to the sofa by the gift shop ? Interesting we thought, personal service ? "we have a problem Mr & Mrs NewleyWebbs" "A problem with our computer system". "we do not have a room for you tonight". I guess they have rehersed this a few times and want you away from the desk for fear a we would make a scene.(as others did the whole week we were there). So they gave us two options 1 nt at their sister property the Real Playa del Carmen, which he did not reccommend, Or the Beach property. "the Reef". We took the beach property. We were actually Ok with the whole thing as the opportunity to explore another resort was appealing...but the Reef was appauling. Read the reviews and don't let them send you there as it's far less than the GPR. Request to be sent to their 5 star property across the street. The ROYAL. It turns out there some 20 other guests from the GPR at the Reef. (wristbands) The next day the GPR picked us up right on time, brought us back and upgraded us to a Junior suite, Oceanview. Remember Ocean view is not Ocean front. Our room was 334 and faced the ROYAL but had a nice view of the water. The rooms are huge, Big bathrooms, TV internet, Alchohol dispenser, King bed (hard) , nicely appointed but limited storage for clothing. The hotel food was above average, the Buffet changed daily with many options, The Italian rest was superb with great service and presentation. Get the Lobster !. We only went to the mexican rest once and although happy with the meal were not thrilled enough to go back. There are many good restaraunts on 5th ave so you don't have to feel trapped at the resort. If you want a drink afterhours you can go to the VIP lounge by the front desk. Sushi available too daily at the quiet pool. (ok) The Beach in front of the resort is great but isn't the best for swimming. (liked the beach snack hut) We went to the otherside of the pier, past the ROYAL. Sandy bottom, Big fun waves and warm warm water. The location of GPR is great as you can walk all over PDC for shopping, ferry to cozumel, Senor Frogs, Charlies, Blue Parrot.... Timeshares ! Everyone wants to take you for breakfast. We went to the one at the Royal to check it out. Breakfast was good, the resort beautiful and the presentation interesting. We already own a timeshare and can tell you theirs is not a bad deal. Thanks but no thanks. We got 500 peso's, a beach bag, wrap thing and a bottle of Taquilla. Perfect. It was 10am and time to hit the beach ! Go to Xcaret. Swim with the dolphins, Swim in the underground rivers and take in the evening show. Xelha has great snokeling, Tulum has the ruins and great beach. We took taxi's to and from PDC for $500peso each way. Good service, enlish speaking air conditioned both ways. I did not feel they were crazy or unsafe at all. And if you frogot to buy something, no worries, the new terminal at CUN has incredable shopping and dutyfree. Absolutletly everything MEXICO. HOLA. Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed with the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Beachbumgirl68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night trip to Playa and the Gran Porto Real. This was our first experience for both, and we were slightly disappointed in the hotel. We had heard many great things, and I had read the reviews on TripAdvisor, so I believe we arrived there expecting much more. Our room was clean and had a nice view of the Carribbean; however, we were located directly over the pool / stage and had a hard time enjoying our room in the evening due to the noise coming from the nightly show. Make sure you request a room away from the stage. It was also a bit disruptive during the day to take a nap while the pool activities / DJ were in full force. The food was also disappointing. The breakfast buffet was the best meal of the day. Burgers and nachos on the beach were average and the dinner was below average. Our meal at Il Pescatore (the Italian Restaurant) was so bad ,we could not eat it. We overheard other guests saying the same thing. I believe the all-inclusive price is too high for the quality of the food that is served.
