My husband and I chose to walk to Fifth Avenue for several meals, once we discovered that the quality of food was better there. Overall, I would rate the hotel as average. Some may really enjoy their experience if they like a busy, "cruise ship" atmoshere, but if you are looking for a quiet, romantic stay - you might consider another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: wrcady
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Thursday for a 3 night stay with a group of business travelers there for a conference. We were told at 1:30 our room would be ready in 1 hour. At 2:30 they said to come back in 30 minutes. We went back in 45 minutes and they said to give them 30 more minutes. By this time our travel agent, who was with the group, was involved. She came to us and gave us our keys and said it was all taken care of. ( I found out later that a fellow traveler did not get her room until 4:30) The next day at 5 they threw us out of our room. They said our room was a one night upgrade and that had all been explained. (But apparently not to us) They came and got our baggage and when we arrived at our new room it was still being made up. What could we do? The bellman German was very nice and said he woud speak to the manager, who sent down a bottle of champagne later. This room ended up being in a spot that was quieter than the first room was in. So, overall my personal rating and advice is: 1)The hotel is not very good at handling problems as they arise. Also, ask for a room not on the pool or ocean side, it is very noisy. Unless you are a total party animal. I rate the front desk staff as marginal to moderate. 2)The rooms are nice and clean and have DVD players, satellite TV, & alarm clocks. They come stocked with a refrigerator of beer & water and some other stuff. They also have a liquor cabinet mounted on the wall with bottles full of scotch, vodka, rum and tequila. If you can drink it, the booze is there. We don't drink THAT much. Housekeeping staff does a pretty good job of keeping the rooms tidy. 3)The bars make pretty good drinks. Try and mango or watermelon margarita. They also make a very good pina colada. When you are pool side the staff are very good and providing rapid service with drink delivery. All of the bar staff I met were very nice. 4)Out on the beach during the day there is a grill with burgers, hot dogs, etc. It is convenient and pretty good. 5)The restaurants, (a) the buffet (b) the mexican restaurant and (c) the italian restaurant are all pretty good. Some of my fellow business associates did not like the food but my wife and I thought it was just fine. The staff was all pretty friendly. 6) I would rate the facility at about 2.65 out of 5 stars. Staff 3.75, Food 3.99. It is a good tourist grade hotel and we got a lot for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the sun ...”
Reviews.Author: MnViking45
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable time at the Gran Porto Real in October 2007. I just had to test that ol' front desk so when I checked in I must admit I gave them a little bit of attitude. This time they seemed to handle it much better and got the supervisor right away. I questioned them on the wrist bands (Don't you have VIP service?) and room location per my request and their credit card policy. They kept smiling ....kudos to the front desk! Checked several times during the stay and they seemed to have good numbers of clerks to handle the checkin/out. When I checked in and the line went from 1 waiting to 4-6, they came out of the back office right away and started helping. I did hear some grumbling from guests. Mainly not getting the room they thought they should have. One couple got an upgraded room free the first night (beach front walkout) and were told if they didn't want to move to their OV room they would have to pay an additional $40 per night. They loved the room so much they paid the extra to keep it. There was plenty of "offers" to go to the Cancun hotel for any guest that wanted it. I think that it is really only that they want to increase occupancy up in Cancun. The service staff are paid on the occupancy of the hotel. (100USD of each weekly all-inclusive rental goes into the "pot" that is divided up amongst the workers) So staff try to work at the GPR and RPDC as the occupancy is high and are leaving the low occupancy Cancun hotel to work at the GPR even tho they have to take the ADO bus and commute from Cancun every day. Did not see any timeshare people but one who did say "Good Morning" and that was it. No phone calls, no disturbances, no strange visitors into the room for "maintenance". Second hand smoke was not a problem and restaurants had smoking sections. They do sell cigars in the lobby and noticed the macho late night types were enjoying their Havana knock-offs around the lobby bar and hallways. The resort is excellent for those who like to walk....we had a route through the hallways on different levels in and out of the resort and it was good exercise and always interesting. Found the ice machine too. And a back stairway to skip the normal entrance into the buffet from the lobby. Also bikes are available for the asking at the activity desk by the towel desk; they use them for tours at 10AM and 4PM when you can bike with the activity person through Playa down to Playacar and the Mayan ruins there (they go back and forth on 20th). You also see some of the houses, etc in Playacar. We preferred to wing-it and took fate in our hands without helmuts. No bike locks are provided either. Saw lots of 5 gallon water dispensers in hallways so you can fill your bottles or cups. Also bottled water is readily available. Beach-The sand area is wide (5 rows of lounge chairs) with plenty of room for both the volley ball and a soccer area. It is more crowded on the south end, away from the Royal Playa del Carmen, due to the beach buffet and tables, pool activities and the fishing boats just off the hotel property. The boats angle across the front of the hotel making the water area triangular. It is good they now have ropes and floats to keep the boats out of the swimming area. The fishermen cleaning fish is a negative if you don't want the "whiff" when the wind is of that direction. I got the impression the fishermen are doing it on purpose and love to break open the entrails just so the smell is worse. They throw them on the sand and the gulls do the cleanup. The beach area closest to the RPDC is shared by the folks from the Real hotel on 5th. They have an activiities booth there and a swing bar and lounge chairs. This area in past years was the designated topless area and you do continue to see more of that in this area. The swing bar has limited goodies including chips, pico, and that nasty cheese stuff they feel is good for nachos. The beach waiters use both this bar and the one by the pool to fill drink orders. Order "dobles" so they know you do not want flavored ice or go to the bar and watch them make them. Any tip you give to the beach waiter is shared with the bartender who makes it...however the reverse is not true. So he has an incentive at the bar to have you keep coming to him. The lounges are standard with no cushion...you sit on a nylon type web. There were no towel games and people seemed to get their chairs ...only groups of over 2 maybe couldn't get them together. Those groups seemed to pull single chairs out of the pack and make an area together on the sand in front of the lines of chairs. Also the bags of sand along the beach are great to lay on in the sun...the resort should put some portable steps or ramps on them tho to make the water more accessible on the south end. The north end (closest to the Royal) is just fine for water access. It is very shallow and waist deep out about 100 yards. Because the sand area is flat and roomy I also noticed people from the Royal coming over and grabbing chairs. At the Royal they have no area beyond their lounges and it tapers rapidly down 3-4 feet to the ocean waves. With the beach at the GPR protected by the "whale" concrete berm, the water is shallow and sandy and calmer ....perfect for the floating water enthusiast. There are 12 1-2 person kayaks, 3 2-person sail boats and a handful of boogie boards available. They need more boogie boards as they are perfect for the area. The waves beyond the whale are usually 1-2 foot and roll along the diagonal ropes giving a nice ride. Also bring a short string or shoelace and tether your board to the rope and you can float and relax without effort. It's very relaxing. (They should make a boogie board with a cup holder) Room-Great size for the room. Even with a king size bed there is plenty of room. There was iron, iron board, DVD player, coffee maker, hair dryer, and the mini-fridge in the room. TV got many international channels but no HDTV (Like in lobby and VIP lounge) There was no tub but a huge shower easily useful for two. (It could have had a second set of shower heads for a bit of luxury) Tele in the biffy. Clothesline. Good size closet. Switched ceiling fan and thermostat that really worked. The deck had a hammock, table and two chairs. (Air unit on the roof made vibrating noises detected during the night when all was quiet) Electronic safe now so no more keys...yippee! Bed was pretty standard for Mexico, hard but did the job. Hot shower water would vary in temperature(not pressure) when used by other rooms. Not a lot of room to room noise noticed. Shelves and closet were adequate for clothes. Cleanliness and maid service was good but they seemed to like to get in the room late in the day...I guess they combined the cleaning with the turn down service. Restaurants There are two main restaurants (Marias and il Pescatore) and then the buffet. Beach buffet and lobby and VIP lounge also have some food. Bars at the beach and pool and lobby. Liquor also available in VIP (XX on tap) and in the room (4 bottles-Bacardi, Smirnoff, Jose Cuervo, and a scotch.) Mini fridge had mixes and water. Marias was probably our favorite. It just seemed less formal and the staff were very willing to improvise with the selections. Ordering from 4-6 choices in 4 courses is a limited menu but was able to find something special. I had the salmon and it was a bit dry but very good...the appetizer was a little cheese empanada with a mole sauce on it. Wanted another one but didn't request it as the salad was coming... but it went very well with the mango margarita. Dessert was pretty much "Ok"....all desserts seemed to be the same...like they had been in the refrigerator a bit too long. Had the Mayan coffee ...or should say started to but just got Xtabentum on the side with my coffee. Started a trend...soon everyone around me was getting a shot or two to go with their coffee. Had the steak both times eating at il Pescatore. The first time with baked potato and a burgundy gravy, the second it came with deep fried mashed(instant) potato. The first steak was just right, tender, and as I ordered. The second was not near as good and I almost requested something else. The shrimp cocktail was good but small shrimp (6). The wine was Portuguese as were most of the wines normally served. Both restaurants were loaded with Royal guests. Got the impression from their idle conversations that they were "slumming" to be at the GPR. However they seemed to enjoying themselves. Dress code was not enforced at either restaurant so saw T-shirts, sandals, and shorts every day we were there. Both restaurants are open "to the public" and have their menu on display if folks off the street wish to pay the menu prices (195 pesos for the steak entre) The same is true of Pelicanos at the Royal. When Asiana at the Royal moves outside the Royal I assume it also will be "open to the public". The buffet had 5 main stations plus several cold island stations. Station one was cold (salad fixings and dressings) and #2 was hot food like pork loin slices, chicken, beef, and potatoes and vegetables. It varied day to day...sometimes the potatoes were mashed, or oven baked, or fried, or boiled. The meat usually had at least 3 choices here. Station # 3 was a "select the ingredients and I'll grill it" station; and sometimes it was stir fry things, other times fish, chicken, pork or beef. It was very popular and usually had a line or 4-6 people. #4 was the hand carved station (beef or turkey, pork, etc) and in the morning they did waffles, french toast or pancakes "while you wait". The 5th station was again hot food, veggies and meat but not the same as #2. Usually there were two soups, one at station 2 and the other at 5. The island cold areas were (1-desserts, 2-meats & cheeses, 3-salads, 4-varied) plus the bread/rolls station and a beverage area (although they usually served the beverages). It was great to be able to pick your piece of fish and have them cook it for you. The salmon was great although things like sauces were limited. I usually went with fresh lime or made one out of the salad dressings. Found olive oil, garlic, onion and a few other ingredients and went with the flow. The lobby seemed to be the center of the action. Lots of activity and a small snack area, a good bar, and several TV's, and a coffee machine where you pushed the button for your Espresso. This machine is a BIG negative as not being able to get a good espresso or cappuccino in the entire resort got to me...it drove me to Java Joes more than once. Lots of couches and chairs/tables and never saw them all full. A small stage and nightly music group of different venue each night. The mariachi group was super. Every night also the large stage at the pool put on a show from 9-10PM. (Era musical, Celebrity impersonators, Mayan dancing, etc) A couple were really quite good...and usually all the chairs were full and you had to sit on the ground or lean on a palm if you came late. They did have merchant tables for jewelry and paitings and knick-knacks a couple of nights also. The VIP lounge and the big screen TV was behind the front desk by the ballroom. It seemed to be a favorite with employees. Even saw waiters getting items from what was stocked, spiking from the liquor, and watching soccer. It had a wine cabinet so you could find your own bottle if you desired. I found it to be an air conditioned retreat and it also had HDTV channels not available in the rooms. There was a game table in there and sometimes the "party" noise got a bit loud. Otherwise we used it as a meeting place being convenient to the rooms, lobby, and making a break for the streets of PDC. The pool is adequate size and varied enough to use for activities. Didn't do much around the pool but heard them a lot. The pool/beach bar was a favorite, the activities people seemed to get people involved, and the kids had a great time. We did hear a complaint about the babysitting fee being high ($19 per hour) so if the kids need personal attention the free included kid's club may not be an alternative. Nightly noise from the Blue Parrot can be a distraction as it comes echoing across the water and doesn't stop til about 4AM. They must have re-aligned their speakers or got a new sound system as I don't remember it being a problem before in the ocean front rooms. The beach buffet was popular and I agree with other posts that you should eat when they first open. They need to refresh the meat/chili/and things like fries more often and in smaller quantities so they don't get cold/soggy, etc. I saw them take food from underneath the counter to refresh the food. They did not take it out of coolers or hot packs...nor did I see them bring from a kitchen to re-supply. That food sat there and got picked over for 4-5 hours. By mid-afternoon it was only chips and jalepenos for me (pretty hard to get bad ones of those) and LOTS of drinks. You will never get drunk or dehydrated if you have lots of their standard bar drinks. Thank goodness for loose liquor policies. The spa is very nice but separate facilities for men and women. Each area is the same with plunge pool, separate jacuzzi, small steam room, and 4-6 person sauna. Also the lockers, showers, that you would expect. This is all included but there is a whole list of massages, etc for upgrade. Also there is a rooftop jacuzzi and hammock/lounge area. This seemed to be a favorite with the European crowd as there is also a pool and swimup bar there in front of the standard rooms. (Note: windows under water in the pool can be viewed from hallway....be cautious with the hanky-panky or you might end up on YouTube) The Gran Porto Real continues to be a good value resort. You can stay here and get a day pass to the Royal to use all the facilities for $20 a day. Not bad if you crave to find out what you are missing and want to try their restaurants. (And no timeshare presentation included) However for the rate at the GPR it'll continue to be a great choice also due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real--Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: jstee
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the Gran Porto Real. Just returned from an "office retreat" and would recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to Playa. The rooms are beautiful and the service will exceed your expectations. The food is very good--especially at the Italian restaurant. Thanks to the management-Nicholas Vazquez, who made our stay very enjoyable and his staff-Tony, Mary, Jose, Jesus, Iliena, and Jose(@the Italian restaurant). I enjoyed the Gran Porto Real so much that I just booked another trip there with my family in May 2008. Can't Wait!!

Reviews.Title: “The resort is very nice for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: brian153
Reviews.Content: We just got back after a short 4 day stat at GPR in Playa. After reading about the overbooking issues, I was a bit worried. For us this was not an issue though. We were offered the "opportunity" to upgrade to the sister resort across the street. This hotel was fine for us however and felt no need to spend any more money or time to move our room. The room is small but very clean with a huge entertainment center (with fridge) table, two chairs and a bed and two night tables. There was only a small closet with safe in the room and a small set of shelves in the bathroom, no other cloths storage. We had a king size bed that was very (very) hard. Its an old mattress on a CONCRETE platform. There will be no bouncing on this bed! The hotel itself is very impressive on the inside but rather ordinary on the outside. We had an ocean view balcony (not private) that if you walked to the edge and leaned to the right, you would see the ocean. Not a big deal as we have seen it before and if I needed to, I could walk to the end of the block and sit on the beach. The food was not terrible for an all inclusive. The buffet is the same as anywhere else ie bland, heavy and extra greasy. The other resturaunts were a step above the normal resort places. Very good food with a very good wait staff. The room service is great too with an excellent club sandwich and again, very good staff. The pools were very nice and we very much liked the "quiet" pool on the third floor with swim up bar. It is also the sushi bar. The water however is super cold, beyond refreshing, just cold. Too cold to sit in at the swim up bar. There are no kids here though and none of the loud music like at the regular pools. One side of the regular pool was quiet enough though. We enjoyed all of the pools for the most part. We did not use the beach though there are sandbags around it. I guess it helps keep the sand from washing away. It is (the beach) nice to look at from the many bars. The gym is very small and the equipment is faily old though it all worked. One day the AC did not work and the gym was unusable. Some little things. We were in room 332. There was major construction going on in room 334 on the last day we were there. It consisted of a guy with a big hammer beating on the marble floor once every 4 seconds from 9 am till 5 pm. On that day I needed to request that the front desk send housekeeping up to make the bed and deliver fresh towels. This was done at 5:30. The regular working people seemed nice and hard working enough but the front desk/management people are useless. I got fewer dumb looks from the floor sweeping crew when I spoke to them than I did from the desk people. There is a small army of support people keeping the place clean and they really do a good job. Watch for very slippery tiles all over the resort. None of the tiles that I walked on had any texture to them. If they were wet, it was like walking on ice. There is also American TV there. You can relax to about ten channels of tv from home. The sales guys on 5th Ave (two blocks away) are the most aggressive people you will meet. Most will call you friend and tell you that they will rip you off less than the other guys. Likly the last time I will see Playa Del Carmen but all in all it was a good short trip.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time here and will be back! Kitchener Canada”
Reviews.Author: blanche12
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time at the GPR and we just love it. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The food choices and the alacarte are the best we've ever seen. Shopping is right around the corner and there's plenty of stores to choose from. The beach is lovely on an early morning or evening walk. Don't forget to stop at the swing bar for a beverage along the way! We will definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “The Gran Porto Real was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: amoorebcnc
Reviews.Content: We went to the resort for a anniversary getaway. We were greeted by Nicholas the hotel manager who went out of his way to please us in every aspect of our trip. Any time we seen him during our stay he asked how everything wasand offered his services for anything we may need. However,that was never needed throughout our trip. The room was kept absolutly clean by the staff the entire stay. We had clean sheets on our bed everyday. The food was unbelievable and the service in every resteraunt was outstanding. The grounds at the resort were kept beyound our expectations and there were always some sort of entertainment going on if you wanted to partcipate. We really enjoyed the Michael Jackson Show. We also enjoyed some of the activites around the pool on a daily bases and all the guys were very nice. i would recommend this resort to any couple or family wanting a very nice vacation. At night we enjoyed walking down 5th ave. for shopping and more entertainment, it is right by the resort. We diffinatley will go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach Hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: MikeTee530
Reviews.Content: The Porto is an excellent all inclusive hotel! The hotel is situated right on the beach. The rooms are excellent especially the ocean view Master Suites. Food: The food is excellent for an all inclusive hotel, several restaurants to choose from. Waiters, Bartenders, are right on point to deliver the best service you could as for. Hotel staff and front desk did everything to make our stay memorable. Lynn the General Manager and Nicko the Assistant Manger were always around checking to insure our stay was the going well. We had a Super stay. Housekeeping was always surprising use with decorations in room. Beaches are the best in Playa del Carmen. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sue316
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th visit to Mexico but first time to Playa Del Carmen, The Gran Porto was terrific- we stayed in room 408 which is steps from a small pool with a swim up bar, which is great if the large pool on the otherside is busy, the staff in every restaurant/bar was terrific and always willing to help with anything, the food was awsome and the whole resort was spotless... Highly recomended and would love to go back, lots of activites for Families and the excursions were alot of fun, and reasonable $$ Sue Booth Guelph On Canada

Reviews.Title: “Many thanks, Gran Porto Real.”
Reviews.Author: raimlj
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel and were delighted with the services provided by this organisation. These people in Playa del Carmen Gran Porto Real made us feel "at home" and best of all we will always remember the warmth and enthusiasm of their employees on trying to help us enjoy our stay. It is difficult to remember all names of the people who made our stay more than pleasant; but special thanks are due to Alex (the bartender in main bar) and to the staff at "Il Pescatore" restaurant. Many thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “You Gotta Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Fish0n
Reviews.Content: Considering this was our first visit to the Atlantic Ocean side of Mexico this is a A+ place to go. (We have been traveling to Mexico for 11 years now) We stayed here for 16 nights. We arrived on Sept 28th and was greeted by the Busboy, Benny then by Okyuna at the reception desk. She was very kind and informative. Spoke very good English and answered all our questions. The service is excellent and you will not regret booking this place. All the employees are happy, helpful, kind and considerate, from the housekeeper, Graciela, to waiters, Fredy, Angel and cocktail waitress Lucy. Ricardo from Best Day was right on with his information. We booked three tours and had no surprises. Close to fishing boats, 5th Ave, beach and other attractions. You can travel to Cancun and Cozumel if you desire, but you will not need to with plenty to do and see at this location. The resort is the cleanest place we have stayed and the food is great, while the chiefs will make anything you like. The nightly entertainment is entertaining. This was a trip of a life time and we will be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonitone
Reviews.Content: We went all-inclusive to this hotel and absolutely loved every minute. When we first got into our rooms, we thought they had made a mistake - they were huge with a walk in bath tub and a balcony overlooking the Caribbean. Rooms were spotless, albeit a little dated. Breakfast was great, lunch just OK (usually a buffet) but dinner was the real winner - we were allowed free room service once a day to our room (as part of the all-inclusive package) so we took advantage of this, seeing as the restaurant was usually full. Once we found out, we only ever ordered 2 things on the menu - lobster tails or filet mignon. This was as good as the food I have had anywhere else. Location-wise, it's right on the beach and has a great pool (which usually has some type of activity going on), so we tended to hang out on the beach. Again, weekends was time for a beach BBQ which was delicious. Playa del Carmen itself is really cute - especially the beach bar called the Blue Parrot. I actually met my wife there! Overall, left with a really positive impression of this place. The only negative aspect was security - very strict, we were checked every time coming back into the hotel. And we were not allowed to bring any guests into our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Get the room you paid for”
Reviews.Author: sdtravlr
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time to PLD in the last year and we had a great trip. The only complaint is that the hotel has a reputaion of not providing guest with the room they booked. Our Ocean-view junior suite was a view of the street. When we asked they suggested we upgrade. My wife and I were too busy relaxing on the beach and enjoying PDC to care, but there were others at the front desk who were prepared to spend some of their vaction arguing with the front desk staff over the same issue. The hotel staff, past the front desk, went above and beyond to ensure we had a great time. I would recommend this hotel because of its great location to explore PDC and good food for an all-inclusive, but would encourage travelers to get the room they paid for.

Reviews.Title: “50th Anniversary Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CiaoAmico
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Chicago, IL Leonardo Party All Inclusive Trip Report: Gran Porto Real, October 2007 This vacation was an extremely important event for us as it was our parent’s 50th wedding anniversary. Our family, which there was 9 of us, were all extremely happy with how things went. Although the weather was not always accommodating the staff at the Gran Porto Real was!! They made sure that if the daily functions outside could not take place that there was plenty of other entertainment indoors that the whole family (from children to adults) could do. As far as the accommodations, the rooms exceeded every expectation. They are immaculate, beautifully decorated and anything as far as movies and Internet are easily accessible from your television. If you forget something like a toothbrush or shaver, don’t worry they have it for you! The entertainment at night was great, the shows and entertainers were all truly wonderful. The restaurants had amazing food. Maria’s had Great Mexican food, El Pescatore had Phenomenal Italian food and the buffet had a wide assortment of food at every meal, the only problem we had was making choices at this restaurant, or you could be like some of us and taste a little bit of everything! The bars and bartenders were awesome also, had top shelf liquor and for me Sol beer which is my favorite. The staff exceeded every expectation we had. You want for nothing, no matter your at the pool, in a restaurant or your room. They really want to make sure your stay with them is the best ever. And the views of the Caribbean Sea from your room (we had ocean front jr. suites) are the best!!! They truly look like the website and brochures you get in the mail. Also great location, close to 5th Ave and the new developing 5th Ave going north. All of this is the reason we have returned to this resort numerous times and will continue to do so in the future. This was the best vacation at the Gran Porto Real by far so far, which is mostly because of the staff, since the weather was not so great. I honestly think anyone who stays here will have a great vacation experience!! Thank you to everyone at the Gran Porto Real for making my parents Anniversary the BEST!!!! We will post pictures later. We will never forget: Barbara Kamala Kowanda Nicholas Vazquez You both exceeded every expectation our family had!! Some of our favorite waiters, waitresses and entertainment staff (although all were great): Mary Lucy Benito Ruben Dominquez

Reviews.Title: “Real nice ...........nightlife boringgggggggg”
Reviews.Author: 1copperpenny
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st trip to Mexico. We had a group of 16. The Real was very nice, rooms were fantastic . Buffet was huge but sometimes couldn't find enough American food to suit me(not into squid or octopus). Will have to say hotel was veryyyyyyyyyy clean . Floors were very slick when wet tho......really had to be careful. Bar and waitress service was very good . The staff was pleasant enough. Had to call for maid service just about everyday even though would see them outside close to our room when we left ....didn't understand why they missed our room. Felt like maids were in room in the evening for no reason, but we knew they were there becuz they left chocolates or towels made into swans . Was very disappointed in nightlife at hotel. Bar closed at 11. Would have preferred air conditoned lounge with good bands at least until 1am. More of a family type hotel,so if u want a little more party atmosphere this is definately not the place . Shows started at 9 pm until about 10pm. Most of the shows were ok. Spike and Luis,and Andreas were fun . They took us out to Senor' Frogs, we had a blast there . A few of us went to Mombo 1 night with them ...........if was ok if you like salsa dancing. It was fun to watch the locals dance though. They are very good dancers. Beach had sandbags so only went to beach 2 times. But not sure if hotel had control over that (might be due to erosion). Still had nice time just nightlife too quiet for me .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely marvelous!!”
Reviews.Author: mae67
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on TA about the Gran Porto Real I thought I would add my thoughts. My husband and I have stayed at the Gran three times and we are sending our son and daughter-in-law there in just a few days. We LOVE the GRAN. Although it has almost 300 rooms it doesn't seem so large. The resort is very easy to get around. The rooms are hugh and very nice. You could fit 4 people in the shower, no problem. We have stayed ocean view junior suite once and ocean front junior suite twice. The room we had ocean view was #346. It IS on the side of the building but has a good view of the water. I believe our OF rooms were #355 and #325, both gorgeous. It's true that the fishing boats are out front but it doesn't hender the beauty of the water or getting in it. The resort is only two blocks from 5th Ave. which is perfect for nightly walks. It's a short walk to the ferry for a day trip over to Cozemel. The food was great. Our favorite was Il Pescadore (Italian). We've never had a problem with noise OR overbooking. The most important thing I need to mention is the care and attention that the manager Nicolas Vazquez gave to us. He has taken extra care to make sure our needs were met. I know he has been there for a long time which impresses me. If you ever stay there PLEASE go by and see Nicolas and tell him the Moore's said hello. Have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip, Awesome Time”
Reviews.Author: anna_norets
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this particular hotel...I've been to Cuba, Dominican and Costa Rico, and this is surely the best atmosphere I've encounterd! The staff is very relaxed and amusing. The nightly entertainment covers every aspect of culture so that no one really feels left out of the show and it is definitely the highlight of the evening! The staff is great, the food is great and the entertainment is terrific!!! I have never visited a vacation spot twice, but I will definitely consider returning here! .Anna.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real = One Week of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: tiated
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned back home to Vancouver, BC Canada after spending one week of paradise at the Gran Porto Real. Absolutely one of the best resorts we stayed in of all our excursions. The hotel, service, staff, food and amenities were excellent. The crystal clear beach was amazing once you swam out passed the sand bags and the kids. And our walk out ocean front junior suite was a great choice as we upgraded from a room with a double bed. The king size bed was firm and the room was equipped with a dvd player and an alarm clock. The stand up roman shower for 2 was a nice change from a regular shower/bathtub as we were able to shower together and save time. The junior suite was spectacular. We thought we would hardly spend any time in our suites but it was so hot some days and after swimming and suntanning in the 30 degree sun, it was nice to escape to a cool fanned room with a tv. It was also nice to watch Engish speaking shows. Playa del Carmen was amazing. The gym in our resort was small so we decided to get a gym pass a block away at ths beautiful gym called The Gym. And it was so worth it. The italian restaurant had an amazing filet mignon , which we paired with a lobster for $14 US. Overall, we would return to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: anitajune
Reviews.Content: On 9/15/07 we visited the Gran Porto Real for the 8th time. This was the place that our travel agent picked out for us 5 years ago. This has become our place of choice for many reasons. We are made to feel at home by every single person that we come into contact with. This IS our home away from home!! Nicholas Vazquez is the best!!! He is in charge and it is obvious that he the respect of all of his employees. To me that was important. He saw to our every need. Our room was heaven, a Jr. Suite walk out room. Every day the sheets are changed, which surprise me. Usually with a weeks stay that happens maybe twice. The room was always kept the way it was when we first walked in. Some surprise towel figures, with rose petals. To be honest there is something for everyone at this wonderful resort. We met The food, well for me it was wonderful. The Albatros offers multiple buffet choices for breakfast, lunch and dinner. There is a very special lady that has fixed my eggs every trip. The Mexican and Italian restaurants offer a fine dining experience in every way. We have made many friends, Ileana, Teresa, Benito, Jesus, Mary, Judy, Marguarite, Jorde, Ivan, Gabriel, Miriam, David. If you are looking for a place where you can relax & have the time of your life, the Gran Porto Real is the place for you!! I could go on and on.... Please contact me if you have specific questions. Our next trip is booked for the last week in Feb 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: leo1017
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real from September 16th through the 22nd for our honeymoon. We had a fantastic time! Staff was always courteous and very attentive,housekeeping was great, food was excellent. Our room was on the ground floor and overlooked the ocean and was well appointed. We had an all-inclusive plan which was great. Plenty to eat and drink at any time you wanted. Even a small bar in the room and beer in the fridge! There is a laundry mat on site and you can book tours from the lobby. We booked through "American Express" and were happy with our tours. You cannot beat the location of this hotel - about a minute walk to 5th Ave. 15 minute walk to the ferry for Cozumel. Great shopping on the street! Be prepared to have shopkeepers call you over though. I honestly was nervous after reading reviews but have figured that people simply like to complain. Given that, here are some of my feedback regarding things that people have disliked about the hotel : The beds were not hard, actually pretty comfortable. The beach is not small but there are sand bags. Totally understandable given the hurricanes and past erosion. There is an area where access to the water is easy and clear of any seaweed.Plenty of lounge chairs at the beach. Pool is well maintained and plenty of lounge chairs there as well. We were NEVER bothered by time shares. We were nervous given all that we had read. We were offered to go next store to the Royal for breakfast or lunch and we refused. Never a word mentioned after. My two "complaints"....the floors are slippery when they are wet (say, in the bathroom) and the laundry detergent they use wasn't the best scented that I have ever smelled. Seriously, those are the only two things that I can say that are slighly negative. I would completely recommend this hotel. Great price, great service, great location. Don't hesitate to book your vacation here....it really is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great all inclusive hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmb354
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks from the 15th September. Great location for shopping and sea trips. The hotel was very clean and the staff were lovely, very friendly and polite quick service at all the bars. We stayed in a junior suite with ocean view it was huge and very clean, no bath only shower but enough room for both of us. Ocean view is only a side view but a lovely breeze arrived every evening to cool you down. The maid was very good at cleaning our room and made various towel animals and lots of flower petals which were always a nice surpise. The pool was clean and very warm lots of sunbeds and umbrellas for the much needed shade. The beach had plenty of sunbeds and the snack bar was great for nachos, burgers etc. The beach does have sandbags along the edge to slow down the beach erosion. Lovely clear blue sea with plenty of fish to snorkel with. The buffet restaurant always had a great choice but it was a little bit hot (could do with air conditioning unit). The Mexican restaurant was excellent with lots of entertainment by the staff and plenty of choice on the menu. The Italian was also very good but a little bit noisy at times, great choices on the menu and the staff very helpful and always smiling. Evening entertainment was ok but to be honest we did not stay up late. Had a wonderful holiday with plenty of good memories of the staff i.e: Mirriam, Illeana, David, Margarita who all went out of their way to help you. Would love to go back and visit one day..

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: fuzzoakville
Reviews.Content: This was our second vacation at this Resort, and will definately not be our last! Everything about this resort is spectacular. The rooms are cleaned early & and the maid decorates the bed with flower pedals, the grounds are kept immaculate, the special restaurants have excellent food selection & service, the buffets are terrific, the beach is nice, and the location to shopping is a bonus! Mostly, I was again impressed with the total staff that goes out of their way to make your holiday most memorable. They "exceeded my expectations" in every way. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun for Families, Not Suggested for Singles”
Reviews.Author: carisajo83
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 16, and had no problems with overbooking that a lot of people on TripAdvisor have talked about previously, which worried me a lot. We got to the hotel about 2 hours prior to check in time, so some of our party had to wait for their rooms to be cleaned, but we all went to Albatro's and got something to eat, while the bellboys watched our luggage, and soon after, all of our rooms were ready. The rooms were BEAUTIFUL. No bathtubs as promised by our travel agent, but still beautiful. Had no problems with things being stolen as some have mentioned on this website. Just used the safe and felt very protected. First complaint is that it SERIOUSLY took the maid 2 hours to clean the room. Which was very annoying when I had to sit outside the room twice and wait for her so i could go inside and change because she couldn't understand English to let me inside long enough to change. The food at the Resort is not so great. The hambugers are AWESOME. However, if you ask the chefs very nicely, they will go out of their way to do anything for you. The last night we were there they cooked use Ribeye steaks at the buffet. And the day that we went deep sea fishing they cooked up our fish for us. (we tipped very nicely). My biggest complaint is that I am single and 24 years old and I am a nightlife kind of person. I felt that I paid enough for the all-inclusive plan (maybe I'm cheap, but I work hard for my money and I barely had enough to pay for the trip), that I wanted a bar inside the resort that stayed open past 11pm. NATTA. If you enjoy life past 11pm, this isn't the place for you. The music, the drinking, the socialization is DONE DONE DONE at 11pm. If you want to socialize past 11, you have to go out and pay to do it. And some of those bars and drinks outside of the resorts arent cheap. So I was very dissapointed. I'm not saying I want to party until like 2am and be loud about it. But 11pm is a little steep. But all in all, the resort is beautiful. The entertainment staff is a riot. So much fun, Spike and crew are GREAT and will show you a great time. I recommend this resort to families and newlyweds (middleaged, who aren't looking to party). But for singles who love the nightlife, stick to Cancun, I wish I would have just went back to Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa, Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: DLSHEEHAN
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday September 23, 2007 we had to wait on our room which was expected. We went to the sitting area to wait at the pool. My wallet was lifted out of my purse within 20 minutes of arrival the only people that were where we were sitting were these people who dressed up like mayan tribal people for phot ops. They had a photographer with them. Apparently they go to all the resorts for photo ops. They bumped into me several times so I moved my wallet to the zipper pocket of my purse and zipped it. I was finally bumped so hard I asked them politely not to bump me. Then they took off their head dress giggled and moved on.I immediately noticed they took my wallet some how. With in 10 minutes I had notified management and security. I got zero help from both. However, they were never on the resort property again during our stay. Our room had a view of propane tanks. They also own an adult only resort across the street and invited us to eat break fast there. We did. Then of course it turned into a 3 hour time share deal. The pool bar was very slow. Drinks very weak. Topless adults at a family resort at the pool on several occasions. The room service was always late by at least 30 minutes. When my wallett was stolen they offered me no assistance. The manager said he wasn't responsible and I never heard from him again. I explained however he is responsible for who he allows on his resort. The BEACH WAS TERRIBLE!!!! it was really weird this is the largest resort by far in this area and all the way down the beach is beautiful, around the corner is beautiful, but the hotel beach has sand bags that are very slippery and dangerous you have to crawl or walk over to get into the water.Worry free Vacations was awesome! Marias mexican restaurant was awesome especially the captain dominquez. Other then that the food was good but the overall experience wasn't that great. There was a huge language barrier most of the time. English to Spanish. I would not recommend or return to this place again. There are too many other places one could travel! We had an OK time. If your trip is already booked I suggest alltournative tours or any tour sponsored by alltournative tours. They were great. All in all it was not good! The beds were very hard. I could go on and on!!!!!! we weren't provided a phone when our wallett was stolen to call the US causing a massive cell phone bill. Calling from the room was nearly impossible. Floors were always dangerously slippery and wet. Again I could go on and on!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Be- Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: RupsLondon
Reviews.Content: I didn’t want to leave. The people, the atmosphere, the services, the food....everything about this hotel was excellent. Four girls on holiday loved every thing about this hotel. Located right on the beach of Player Del Carmen and seconds away from 5th Avenue, this is the place to stay. What can I say...only good things! The entertainment staff kept us all very entertained, naming Mike and Luis. They did fantastic job! Not only did they get us involved with all the activities, they made the time to make sure that all guest were having fun! The reception, especially Paco and guest services staff was more than helpful. If you are looking for a fun yet relaxing holiday, Gran Porta Real is completely the place to stay. We would love to thank everyone at Gran Porta Real for making our holiday the best holiday ever. IT WAS PERFECT!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it ...will go back in a hearbeat!”
Reviews.Author: vmartinez_sf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen from 9/17-9/23. The entire staff was amazing to us. Everyone there made our stay a true relaxing getaway! The food in all of the restaurants was delicious, from the Italian Restaurants to the hotel room service. We spent most of our time at the pool and we had so much fun with the water sports entertainment. Tequila volleyball, the dance lessons, the bingo, it was fun! We are so going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: XimenaMonterrey
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 day stay at the Gran Porto Rreal. I can truly say that what makes this resort different is the service. Check-in was sort of slow, only had two people at the front desk when there were many people arriving at the same time. Rooms (standard) are ok, I did try to get an upgrade but unfortunately none were available. Before our room was ready, we made it to the main bar...and there is where the fun started. Be sure to ask for "Beto", he is the barman and he is wonderful, the waitresses we met during our stay made it a nice experience, drinks came fast and they were always around. Thanks to Lucy, Mary, Miriiam, Teresa, Miguel and Ivan. Carlos from security was always also very attentive to all guests. The staff really makes people feel like they are at home. The entertainment staff was always ready to have fun with us, one day was rainning but they made sure everybody had a good time inside. Even Moises from guest services was always ready to answer all questions with a great smile. Aside from the slow check in, the only down side was the snacks at the beach, not many choices and not very good quality, I understand with that many people its hard to have gourmet food but being a five star resort, I would say this and the lunch and dinner buffet could improve. The best meal we had was at the Italing rest just up the street, had the best chicken parmesan ever, you have to try it. The Mexican was also good. Location is wonderful, two blocks from fifth avenue, by the way, if you want a nice massage, try SpaZul, its on fifth and corazon street. Prices are lower that at the resort and I assume just as nice. Overall I would definetely recommend this hotel and would go back the first chance I get. Keep up the good work Gran Porto Real Team...

Reviews.Title: “Never a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Chica
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I absolutely love staying at the Gran Porto! We've been there 3 times in the past year and 2 months and we just can't get enough. The atmosphere that the hotel provides is outstanding. The nightly performances are great and the animation staff is wonderful! An exceptional job well done to Miguel Morales who makes sure that all the hotels guests are entertained by the water sport activities that are provided to keep everyone active and happy during their stay in Playa del Carmen. The waiters in the restaurants are very pleasing and are the nicest people! =) Staying at the Gran Porto Real is always a pleasure because the staff amkes you feel so welcome and cared for. Can't wait to go back again! Thanks for making the stay for my Mom and I sure a great experience! *****

Reviews.Title: “Grand Porto Real Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: dmajchr8
Reviews.Content: Grand Porto Real Resort and Spa in Playa Del Carman in Mexico. It was absolutely magnificent. My husband and I went to Mexico for the first time. We are in our 50"s. We had the best time of our life. The service was excellent. The room overlooked the swimming pool and a beautiful view of the ocean. The resturants had wonderful meals. It was like eating gourmet food at every meal. You were served drinks on the beach or where ever you were sitting. They had entertainment every night at 9:00 and the showes were fantastic. We will be going back to The Grand Porto Real again. We hope to take our children and their spouces and grandchildren with us. I hope people will read this review and make reservations to stay there. Debra and Ron in Hermantown, Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: JaniMontreal
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to many places (all inclusives Turks and Caicos, Bahamas, Cuba, Punta Cana, Aruba and so on.) We went last year to the Gran Porto Real for the first time and loved it so much that we returned for 2 weeks this year. The hotel rooms themselves are beautiful and well maintained, the cleaning service (Dianela) was outstanding. Although there were not many restaurants to choose from (1 buffet, and 2 a la cartes) , the service was fast, the food was great, and the staff treated us like gold! I would like to specifically thank certain people, the waiters (including the beach waiters) Luis, Jesus, Ileana, the captains, Carlos Canella, Pablo, Gabriel, David, Benito. All the staff at the the restaurants and bars always served you with a smile.As far as the animation, Miguel Morales the entertainment manager is a definite asset to the resort. His dedication to the guests, and the drive of his team (Pina, Luis, Spike, Victor, Roberto, Andreas, etc) made every activity enjoyable. We look forward to our return in February, and recommend this resort as a must visit. Thanks again, John, Jack, Gustavo, Mary, Nia, Tota

Reviews.Title: “It was everything we hoped it would have been and much more!”
Reviews.Author: briluke
Reviews.Content: Our group consisted of 2 couples between the ages of 23 and 28 years old. We stayed at the Gran Porto Real (GPR) from September 2nd - September 9th. We arrived at about 1pm, and our rooms weren't clean yet because check-in is 3pm, so they gave us our wristbands so we could eat and drink, watched our bags while we stepped out to the beach for some drinks. The services was amazing. Once it was time to check in, they didn't have any rooms by our friends, so we were upgraded for one night into the Ocean View Junior Suite...it is the same as the Junior suite, but with a shot dispenser in the room along with a view of the pool and beach. Our representative in the hotel from Expedia (Roberto) was AMAZING at helping us coordinate all of our activities (Golfing, Deep Sea fishing, and ATV jungle tour). Dinner was tasty...Maria's had awesome Salmon, the italian restaurant had delicious alfredo sauce and buns with cream cheese inside! YUM! Anytime we needed something, we called and it was delivered. We needed more water in our fridge, they were there; our wakeup calls came on time, everytime; the food we had through room service wasa little cold, but still arrived in a timely fashion. One suggestions - either bring a big wad of US $1 bills or get change from change desk. If you ask wait staff to bring you change for 200 pesos ($20) - you'll get 50 pesos ($5) to tip with - it goes way too fast because you are tipping a lot of people, so spend wisely. To get to the bars and restaurant locations further down 5th ave, it may be quicker to walk the beach - then you can avoid spending money on a taxi and the calls from vedors on 5th avenue! Things to try: If you want a massage, try walking 5th ave and look for a different spa then the hotel spa. The girls got a our and a half massage plus a spa pedicure from a spa less then a block from the entrace of the hotel (walk towards 5th ave) on left hand side for $110.00 US. Deep Sea fishing out of Cancun was awesome. The girls were seasick, but still caught Baracuda, Bonita, Triggerfish and my boyfriend caught a 64" Blacktip shark. The ATV jungle tour was fun, but very dirty and dusty - BRING SUNGLASSES! We swam in some caves and the water was nice and cool! If you go to Cozumel for snorkeling, be sure to get there early enough - supposedly morning is best to see the most fish and activity. Also, the boat between Cozumel and Playa runs once every hour, so try to plan better than we did. We ran out of time and only got one hour of snorkeling late in the afternoon. Really delicious mexican food - La Parrilla on 5th avenue. Take a card from the Lobby/Bellboy desk and get a free drink per peron with the purchase of a meal. We can't wait to return to the area and hotel for future vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: knightlady
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a wonderful week at the Gran Porto Real. This resort has it all: beautiful and spotless accommodations, immaculate pool and beach, great food (and plenty of it), and the most incredible service! We had a junior suite which had all the amenities one could possibly want, a balcony with hammock, and a fabulous ocean view. Unfortunately, this was also the week that Hurricane Dean decided to visit! Unlike the 70K who decided to flee Mexico, we decided to "tough it out"! Boy, were we in for a surprise! Nothing came close to 'tough'...we were pampered beyond belief - taxied across the street to the government approved shelter in the Royal's ballroom where a very comfortable 'camp-out' had been arranged. The staff was there all night; showing a movie, supplying snacks, coffee, juice all night in a back room (so those who wished to sleep could ). They were even prepared to serve a full breakfast to all.... Aside from saying 'we shall return', I must say that the ROYAL HOTELS HAVE CONQUERED THE HURRICANES !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mexico or Bust!”
Reviews.Author: soonergirls07
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was great. Our airconditioner was down the entire stay execpt for one night. We called several time all of which some effort was made to fix the problem, however we were never offered another room. We did push the issue a bit and on the last evening was told we could have another room, but a cold front came through and we just dealt with it. The food in the restaurants were good, the food at the buffet was always the same and very bland. Service was great, drinks were great and the staff was always freindly. A must is a massage at the spa, well worth the money. Also would recommend the Captain Hook Dinner cruise in Cancun, this was a total party ship and a total blast. The time you spend in your room is very limited so the minor setbacks we had were not a big deal. Would definately stay here again, and recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for all ages”
Reviews.Author: goanytime
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and enjoyed the resort. The looby was not airconditioned as mentioned in other reviews but it is an open airway so airconditioning is not possible. Our Jr Suite, oceanview room was not available so they upgraded us to a Jr Suite oceanview, walkout room and we loved it. They said we could have it for one night but would have to pay extra for the rest of the time if we wanted to stay here and I insisted that I have been upgraded before and never was expected to move rooms. I was told to see the manager in the morning. The next morning they said we could have the free upgrade for the remainder of our stay and no questions asked. I'm not sure if they gave us the upgrade room hoping we would want to stay in it and pay additional or if it was truly not available but never the less we were happy with our room. The beach did have sandbag but it did not keep us or others from going in the water. I'm sure the past hurricanes have caused this and I'm not aware if there are plans to fix this. The water was very warm and comfortable and we enjoyed it very much. The Italian Restaurant was our favorite and was given excellent service. We also enjoyed the Mexican Restaurant. The plates were always presented in a gourment fashion. The buffet was OK for breakfast,. Lunch and dinner did not change much but we did always find something to eat. We also ate several lunches at the snackbar for changes. The beach/pool waiter/waitresses were very prompt and friendly and the drinks were always available. They were never too strong but that is the way I like them. We watched the nightly entertainment every night and it was better than other resorts we have stayed at. The entertainment crew works hard to please the guest working 12 hr days/6days a week and always visitiing and laughing with the guest. I left my water shoes under a chase lounger and 2 days later went to the lost and found and there they were. That says a lot for the employees. The location to the town was superior to other resorts being 1 block from 5th Ave. We took the ADO airport shuttle bus ($8 to Playa del Carmen bus station from the airport- off 5th Ave at the ferry landing) and took a taxi for $3.50-$4 to the hotel from the bus station. We also reversed this on our return. The nice part about the bus is it on the hour and arrives on the hour both directions. We made one stop along the highway and that was it. The bus was airconditioned and our luggage was put in the bins under the bus. Better than the shuttle vans that take you to many hotels and not always on time in picking you up. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel to others. It is not a 5* but between a 3 and 4*, knowing that you should be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: amvv
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a Labor Day weekend holiday that I had booked in March 2007. On arrival to the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen, Mexico we were told by the reception staff that the hotel was overbooked and they did not have any rooms available for us. We were told that we would be transferred to a comprable hotel that was a five minute cab ride away and that they would pay for all the taxi fares to and from our new hotel (The Reef Playacar). They also said we would still be able to use their facilites i.e. pools, restaurants etc. However, the hotel we were transferred to was not a comprable one. I had booked 2 junior suites at the Porto Real and at the Reef we were given 2 standard rooms. Throughout our stay we encountered several other guests which had also experienced overbooking problems from the Gran Porto Real. They too commented that The Reef was not a comprable hotel but in fact, it was a downgrade. Further problems included no hot water, beds that were hard as a board and limited food options. It is hard to believe that reservations that were made in March 2007 were not honored. I would caution anyone making reservations at the Gran Porto Real to be prepared to be moved to another hotel due to overbooking. I witnessed this happening to many other families while we were there. Since we were not happy with the situation we complained and demanded better compensation. The manager than gave us arm bands that would allow us to use the facilities of the luxury hotel (The Royal) that was located right across the street. When we asked why can't we be moved to The Royal they said that The Royal was also full and had no rooms available. In conclusion, we were horribly inconvenienced and to make matters worse we were downgraded with our hotel. I hope that our experience with the Gran Porto Real will help future travelers to Playa del Carmen make a better informed decision with regards to their hotel option.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: SAYScotland
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real Resort was all in all a very nice hotel to stay in. Have not stayed in Mexico before so have nothing to compare it to. Our standard room was adequate and the mini bar stocked up daily. The staff were friendly although the buffet restaurant staff were not very good at taking drink orders. You could be half way through your meal before someone came to take your order for dinks, which was not good. The food was pretty good, great breakfasts and lunches but the evening meal options were very similar every night. However, the two other restaurants in the Hotel - a Mexican and Italian were very good and offered a change in the evening. The lobster tails at the Italian were excellent although came with a small charge which was acceptable. The poolside bar was good and they served good cocktails. The pool snack bar was also okay for a basic snack during the day and saved you having to dress to go into the restaurant. The pool itself was lovely and plenty of chairs. The pool on the upper level is also good and there is a jaccuzi up on the roof too. I was disappointed with the beach, it seemed man-made and was not what I expected. Although a lot of guests got hassled with the Royal across the road and the timeshare sales, we didnt get approached at all for our whole 2 weeks. Just be aware of this and don't go over there! Our only time spent in the Royal over the road was part of the evacuation for Hurricane Dean. This was a very stressful experience but the staff in the Royal were excellent and it was all very well managed. Be aware that there is a building being constructed behind the hotel - rooms in the 400's will be affected I imagine as ours was in 423 - it backs on to the site and it was very noisy in the mornings with workmen. There were also workmen leering over the wall down at the pool looking at the sunbathers which I was not happy about. There was security though at the hotel keeping an eye out. The hotel is also very close to 5th Avenue for all the shops. All-in-all the hotel was good, staff friendly, very good all-inclusive option and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the place”
Reviews.Author: hemingfield
Reviews.Content: After 18 hours of travel my wife and I arrived at the hotel to be welcomed not with would you like a cup of tea and a sandwich, but with your room is not ready so we will upgrade you for the night and you can pay an extra 200 pounds to stay in the room or an extra 400 pounds to stop in the hotel across the road. The next morning I went for the room we were supposed to be having only to be told it is not avalable come back later, I ended up paying the extra 200 pounds for the upgrade as we were nearly 2 days into our holiday the suit cases were still packed, and no signs of a room. After all that we ended up calling maintenance 4 times over 3 days to get hot water in the room, once because the toilet would not flush, and then had to call them to refill the "free" mini bar, (they are not too quick to do that). I was racially abused by one of the bar staff, after waiting an age for a drink, in his words he was ignoring me and did not want to serve me because I was English, I complained to the hotel and they said they would sort the problem, no appology was forthcoming so I can only assume that sort of behaviour is acceptable at this hotel. My wife and I had only been there 2 days and they may as well have sent us home on the 3rd day as the holiday was ruined and the racist person was serving in the bar for the rest of our holidat making things very difficult for us.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: Troy33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been going to the Gran porto Real for the last 7 years usually in April August and October time frames. We would not go anywhere else the staff is always excellent and we love the large beautiful rooms. The other thing I really like about the hotel is the proximity of the beach and the pool you can vertually roll out of the pool on to the beach. We stayed at the Royal Porto Real once and we like the Gran much better. Hope you get to go to the Gran Porto real because it is Awesome-Troy/Deb

Reviews.Title: “never stay here”
Reviews.Author: ctrevino
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9-month old son, sister, and brother-in-law checked in on Friday, August 10, 2007. The check-in was horrible. The front desk personnel is incompetent and truly transparent in their objective: to get the most $$ out of you. The fact that it's very hot while you are checking in doesn't help. The only air-conditioned areas are the guest rooms, kids club, and store. The lobby and restaurants have an open-concept...bad idea. We were then asked to go to guest services for our "welcome kit". When you arrive to this desk, a person greets you and asks you to set an appointment with the Royal Hotel across the street for a "complimentary breakfast". Nothing in this life is free, and this is no exception. My husband, son and I did not go, but my sister and her husband fell into this trap. They were held for over three hours trying to convince them of buying timeshares. The service at the hotels is awful. The waiters are careless about your needs. At the buffets, there were times when we would be eating already and the waiter hadn't even bothered to come over to take the drink order. Once the orders are taken, the drinks are flat and watered down. Again, since the restaurant is by the pool, it gets hot by 8 a.m. To top it all off there are cats. Stray cats come from off the street and wander into the restaurant area. There weren't hundreds of them, but for me, one is enough. There were two throughout the week. The waiters never attempted to take them out. Disgusting. The bar service is a little better, but because the bars are also outdoors, the drinks become hot very quickly. Of course, the all-inclusive package limits you to second-rate alcohol variety and local beer. No American beers are available here. Tecate light, Dos XX, Superior and Tecate were some of the available beers. The hotel staff was mediocre. Our room sometimes wasn't cleaned until 8 or 9 p.m. This wasn't because we were in our room or asked to not be disturbed. Also, the minibar, which is included in the all-inclusive package, is sorry to say the least. It has drinks only: two sprites, two diet cokes, two cokes, two Superior beers, and two bottles of water. We were told the minibar would be restocked every day, and this did not happen. I called three times before it was given proper attention. The pool area is very family friendly. There entertainment is among the best I have seen. The nightly shows are great and they daily activities are fun. The only credit I can give the hotel is the entertainment staff. I did not use the kids club, but I was given access to its microwave to warm up my son's food. I always saw the children properly monitored and doing activities such as dress-up, crafts, dancing, and being in the playground. Again, I didn't leave my child there, but by the looks of it, it seemed okay. The beach is obviously not what is had been before Wilma hit it, and now with Dean, I can only imagine the work that will be needed to be done. Nonetheless, while we were there, the beach was beautiful and clean. All in all, I WOULD NEVER recommend this place or stay there again. C.Treviño Texas

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: owlmoongirl
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our week long 25th anniversary trip to Playa del Carmen (August 11-18th). We took our 4 kids (ages 8, 12, 18, & 22). After months of reading reviews and studying resorts, we opted to go with Gran Porto Real. Almost immediately after booking our trip, there were some very negative reviews and we were freaking out just a little. Turns out we needn't have worried. The resort and transportation were booked through Bookit.com. Bookit.com uses Best Day for the transportation to and from the airport and we used them from the hotel for booking our day at Xcaret and the Morning Glory snorkeling adventure. We have nothing but good to say about both Bookit.com and Best Day. Everything went off without a hitch and they were good about warning us away from various scams. As for Gran Porto Real, we were happily impressed. As soon as we arrived, someone brought the adults a lovely cocktail of apple liqueur, Sprite and white wine. Check-in was a cake walk with no talk of moving us to different rooms or hotels which was our biggest concern. What a relief! We had booked two ocean front Jr. Suites. They put us on the 2nd floor, side-by side and sure enough, we were right over the pool and beyond that was the ocean. Our rooms were spacious & clean & we had nice balconies. In fact, our only complaint about the rooms were the overly firm and uncomfortable mattresses. But we survived them all the same. The mini fridge was really cool as it magically refilled itself everyday. There was a nice selection of Coke, Coke "Light" , Sprite, orange soda, mineral water, bottled water, and some beer. Plus there was a selection of bottles of Scotch, rum, vodka and tequila in another cupboard set to dispense shots if you needed to strengthen a drink or make your own cocktail in your room. We needed extra towels and pillows in our room and all we had to do was ask. Also, there is one room service delivery with the all-inclusive every day, so that was cool for our kids. As for the food: We did just fine. We ate breakfast every morning at the Albatross (buffet). There were a million things to choose from so we're not sure how you could get "tired" of this for breakfast. There was a lot of fresh fruit, including guava, papaya, melon, and pineapple, tons of juices, mimosas, coffee, Mexican dishes, awesome made-to-order omelets, cold cereals, yogurts, french toast, pancakes, waffles, bacon, sausage, breads galore, eggs of all kinds...if you can't find something you like for breakfast there, you should just stay home with your soggy Wheaties, because you can't be pleased anywhere. (BTW soggy Wheaties are also available.) We had two dinners at the Italian restaurant (excellent service and truly the only Tiramisu we've ever really enjoyed) and we had two dinners at Maria's (the Mexican restaurant) where we enjoyed the flaming coffee, all the hot appetizers (especially the empanadas) and the fajitas & beef tips. One night, we went to a Moroccan restaurant off of 5th Ave. and that was great, as well. We tended to eat lunch from the beachside grill. Loved the pico de gallo & chili. Kids loved the hotdogs. It was the best for a relaxed lunch on the beach or at the pool! At the buffet, they made an effort to change the nighttime menu every night from what we could tell. Be sure to try the queso empanadas with the marinated cabbage & pico de gallo at lunch time. It was soo sooo delicious. You can get "to-go" plates and eat in your room, on the beach or out by the pool. We used the sea kayaks the first few days, but then, there was Tropical Storm Erin causing bigger waves, so they closed that down. But it was cool while it lasted. A lot of people have complained here about the beach and the freaking sand bags. Get over it already! They had a huge hurricane here a few years ago and they're trying to avoid more beach erosion. They kept the sand nice, clear of trash and there is plenty of nice beach across the street a little north of the hotel. Another great thing to try: the cabana where they give massages on the beach. The adults in our party had full body massages our first morning there and they were amazing. We also enjoyed a few 1/2 hour massages on the beach for $40 and they were so relaxing. Those women work some magic. Also, the staff there really works hard at making sure there are plenty of activities. We did stretching (yoga, pilates basically) on the sand, water aerobics, beach volleyball, pool basketball, bingo, a bike trip to see some nearby ruins, sand castle building for the kids, etc. If you want to do more than drink and sit in your chair, there is plenty to choose from. Our younger kids enjoyed ping pong and the pool table. We all enjoyed pool side drink service. There are tons of sweet island alcoholic drinks and they will make them a little stronger if you ask. Margaritas were nicely done. The younger kids ordered smoothies galore. Bring lots of U.S. singles, they're handy for tips (not mandatory since they're supposedly included, but it's obvious they are hoped for and these people work their butts off). Also, bring plenty of clothes for your trip because the laundry service is quick and wonderful but also expensive. we recommend Xcaret for a day, but don't bother with Swimming with Dophins. It's expensive and there isn't much swimming involved.We heard the nighttime shows were great, but we were exhausted after a day there and opted to go back to the resort. The Morning Glory snorkeling adventure was fun. IF you go, bring extra cash because there's a $2 fee per person to pay for the Federal Tax once you're there, and you may want to buy some biodegradable sunscreen and an underwater camera and leave some tips. Definitely use Best Day for transportation and extra adventures. Ricardo at Best Day is very helpful and rocks. We didn't really have to worry much about time share hard sells. We made it clear at one point in the lobby upon our arrival that was something we weren't interested in and we were totally left alone with it. Also, we never got sick and believe us we gave ourselves every opportunity (6 of us eating all kinds of food and drinking all kinds of beverages, ice, water, etc.) Also, at one point, we had late night munchies and made use of the VIP room where we got little sandwiches, fresh fruit and cookies. There's also a nice area in the main lounge where you can make yourself some tea. Also, in the lounge area, you can use the internet, but the connection is kind of back and forth. Better to just unplug for awhile. Anyway, if you have a family, this is a great resort. If we had been going on a couples only trip, we probably would have opted for the Royal across the street (same company). We had fabulous weather, maybe 5-10 minutes of rain each day. Got out before the potential landfall of Hurricane Dean so that was good timing. Anyway, having read the complaints before leaving, we've decided that if you can't enjoy your time at Gran Porto Real, you really should just stay home and maybe stay at your local Motel 6 or something, because you're determined to have a bad time no matter how nice the resort or the surroundings. However, if you go with a good, positive, adventurous attitude and spring for the nicer, larger rooms, we think you'll be very pleased. The 6 of us were! Adios!

Reviews.Title: “Comment Hordijk/VD Boogaard.”
Reviews.Author: Boogaard
Reviews.Content: We think the service is very good. The employes are very kind and hard working. We dont know mutch hotels but we think its very good overall. There were mutch acomodations for every age. The food is exellent three times a day. Its nice and good enough to come back. We will never forget this!!! Demian/Demy (D&D)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Holland_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed two weeks at the end of July with our family (2 adults/ 2 kids) at the Gran Porto Real. The staff were very friendly. Thanks to David, Tony and Fernando at the buffet restaurant. They made us feel at home. The girls at the kids club were also very nice. My childeren didn't want to leave when I picked them up. The food was good. A lot of variety. Gran Porto Real is a place to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real has THE greatest service”
Reviews.Author: stephmcc
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real is fantastic! Date: July 22 2007. Stayed here for a week and it is a great place to stay. The staff was so helpful and service was excellent. The rooms were very nice and we had no problems at time of check in as was written in other reviews. The food is average, but there are many choices. The beach is very clean and the view was spectacular from our balcony as well. Location is very convenient to 5th street, the ferry, nightlife. Very family friendly and lots to do. Had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Private Dinner at the Beach”
Reviews.Author: catherine529
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did not stay at this hotel but we are compelled to write a review about it because of an amazing experience with the people who work at this hotel. We booked a romantic private dinner at the beach through the restaurant manager and during the process he was more than helpful and accommodating and went as far as walking us to the actual places where we can have our dinner set up. We opted for the beach. The night of our dinner when we arrived at the hotel, the restaurant manager Carlos escorted us to the beach area. Upon seeing the set-up and our private waiter Freddie, smiling and waiting to seat us, my husband and I knew it was going to be the most romantic part of our trip! As we walked our way down the candle-lit pathway to our table, it became very windy and before we knew it, rain started coming down! Needless to say, Carlos, Freddie and a couple of other workers started moving everything into the gazebo nearby. By the time my husband and I finally sat down at the newly setup area, the rain had stopped.
