Carlos knew I was not completely happy with the area as there was no breeze in this area and it really was not quite the same ambiance as what we had wanted. Needless to say, without hesitation they offered to move everything back to the beach area since the rain had stopped!! The romantic evening became a very funny evening as we were all laughing while carrying everything back to the original spot and trying to make it look like nothing happened. They did not want us to help but my husband insisted, and I did too, since we were all in this together. We felt that this incident had added a special touch to the evening and made it a great story to tell our grandchildren someday. We looked at the rain as "good luck" and because of the extra effort made by these employees we still enjoyed the experience. When everything else was done, it was indeed, "romantic".

Reviews.Title: “for my amigos at the Gran.”
Reviews.Author: kf47
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a glorious week at the Gran Porto Real. Upon arrival we were greeted by the warm and welcoming staff. During our stay our rooms were kept immaculate and well stocked by pleasant and courteous staff. The resort is very relaxing and very family oriented. We were well taken care of from the moment of arrival to the moment of departure, thanks to the welcoming staff and fabulous management. The grounds were wonderfully maintained. The entertainment was great and so was the food. The buffet had lots to choose from and the a la carte dining was delicious. If that were not enough to feel like we were in paradise a step outside the resort and you were on Fifth Avenue, where we enjoyed the true Mexican culture and cuisine, not to mention the fabulous shopping. We enjoyed this trip so much that we have told all of our friends and are anxiously awaiting to return next year, if not possibly sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Very unsafe in kids club”
Reviews.Author: deedee0212
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but unsafe for kids to be left in the kids club. My six old daughter was allowed to leave the kids club by herself and was at the pool area alone. My daughter has eplipsey. I was very upset when I found out she was alone unsupervised when i left her at the club i confirmed that my daughter was not going to be able to leave the kids club by herself. However they were not keeping a close eye on the kids. when i spoke to the front desk they seemed very uncaring!!!! My daughter was also allowed to have 4 cans of soda in a 2 hour window of time. I dont allow soda to my daughter i took water bottles for her. The hotel is beautiful but it lacks alot of activies. At night they had shows most nights and they were pretty enjoyable . The kids club did not have any activities for the most part. THe hotel was boring all you had to do was swim in the pool all day. And they only had three resturants to eat at one buffet two that opened only at six . The beach had alot of big rock near the shoreline and they also had sand bags. For that reason I dont recomennd this hotel to people with kids. I recommend dreams resort very nice lots of activites for family.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff!”
Reviews.Author: DallasPatty
Reviews.Content: Love this resort! We have just completed our third yearly stay at the Gran Porto Real and are already planning our fourth for next year. We have stayed at a variety of resorts but what makes the Gran Porto Real unique is the wait staff - always friendly, cheerful and smiling, and ready to grant our every wish, year after year. In particular, Benito and Lucy were especially accommodating and did an amazing job. Room service was great as well - I placed an order during their busy lunch hour and received it within 20 minutes as promised. The resort location is perfect, a 5-minute walk to 5th Avenue (no taxi necessary!) where you can explore a variety of restaurants, bars and shops of every kind. If you are looking to go on a vacation that will leave you feeling relaxed, pampered and appreciated, then I would highly recommend the Gran Port Real. See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: vacationlover065
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our three children just returned from the Gran Porto Real. We had read a lot of the reviews and were becoming somewhat concerned, but once we arrived at the resort and settled in those worries were history. Upon arrival we were greeted by warm and friendly staff, and check in and out went smoothly and quickly. We enjoyed every meal we had there, great selections and plentiful amounts. The wait staff, cooks, housekeeping were all friendly and helpful. We never passed an employee who did not acknowledge us with an hola or Buenos Dias. The resort was very clean, and the spacious and immaculate rooms were cleaned by housekeeping everyday, and they did an amazing job. The location is amazing and it is walking distance from 5th avenue where you can enjoy the local atmosphere. The entire staff was fantastic and always helpful; no request was ever too much trouble for them. Obviously a well managed resort. We can not wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real es mi casa segundo”
Reviews.Author: scouse2
Reviews.Content: In May 2007 we returned from another enjoyable visit to GRAN PORT REAL. This was one of many trips we have taken to GRAN PORTO REAL since it opened where one is made to feel like "One of the Family". The responsive reaction of the bell-boys and their willingness to help guests in every way is most outstanding. Reception Desk staff have always been most accommodating, cheerful, obliging and most courteous. It is a tough job dealing with tired airline travellers!!! The attitudes of the employees, in general, were found to be exceptional as they carried out their work assignments. The Chef and his staff are to be commended for the food and service at all the restaurants . The variety to the menus, food display is outstanding and suitable to everyone's taste-buds. Maintenance and Housekeeping certainly keep the rooms very clean making sure our visits are comfortable. We appreciate the vigilant security at Gran Porto Real and the beach area. The Manager Lynn and the Manager of Operations, Nicholas can be seen around the hotel and are always happy to help in any way possible. We thank all the staff at GRAN PORTO --- we are two very happy guests and look forward to seeing all our friends again in November 2007 "Si Dios Quiere". H & H Thomas

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly comfortable and lovely”
Reviews.Author: jpferrer
Reviews.Content: This was a great affordable little resort that I found. I booked it online off a Mexican resort website so I saved a ton of money. They put us up in a beautiful room with an Ocean view (these are definitely the better rooms and worth the extra dough). We had two balconies! The food for the all-inclusive wasn't spectacular but it was passable. The alcoholic drinks were tasty for being included. I think the best food options are the hot dogs and hamburgers at the lunch time hut. The hotel is not as fine as its neighboring flagship property, but it is a great stay for the price point. The beach was affected by the hurricanes the year before, but Playa is such a cool town and its so chill. We stayed here after a three week tour all over Mexico. It was the perfect place to be pampered and just chill out sipping Pina Colada and singing Karaoke!

Reviews.Title: “Try a LITTLE customer service”
Reviews.Author: cmkAshville
Reviews.Content: Our family had 3 rooms booked for a wedding at the end of June. As soon as we went to check in the squeeze for more cash began........we did upgrade to oceanfront @$40 more per nite (even tho the internet rate had gone down by $93, from what we had paid) The oceanfront room was fine (two of the rooms had no hot water,the front desk did NOT care) This property would have impressed the group of 80 alot more by offering a block of decent rooms to begin with, rather than making us all feel like we were being taken advantage of at check-in. Management(if there is any) should read these reviews, and take them to heart........they need to put out fair pricing so the guest does not feel taken advantage of!! When my daughter complained of no hot water for two days,she was told she had paid for the view!!!Overall my feeling on this resort was they seem to pull the upgrade scam on almost everyone(the ultimate goal ,perhaps to fill up THE ROYAL) As a result........my first trip to Mexico will be my last p.s. as we were complaining sat. nite of no hot water ,a tour group was arriving............same old line.....for $40,$50 whatever we can upgrade you across the street to our sister property blah,blah,blah I'm thinking to myself is that because our group ended up paying to upgrade to the rooms they had booked?????????

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Amigos3
Reviews.Content: In April, we celebrated our 10th visit to the Gran Porto Real. We have found the charm and allure of this 5 star resort unmatched anywhere in Playa, Cancun or Cozumel. It's located on one of the finest long sandy beaches in the Carribean, and the sand is groomed and the beach palapas tidied meticulously. While maintaining the colonial Mexican atmosphere, we find new and exciting improvements every year. The rooms are spacious and immaculate, and the housekeeping staff keep them that way religiously, adding little personal touches every day. There's a spa, a fitness center and a kids club, and plenty of daily activities and nightly entertainment. We go all-inclusive, which gives us access to three superb fine-dining restaurants, a lunch buffet on the beach, and all of the "watering holes" in the resort. A large pool next to the beach features a great poolside bar as well as beverage service to your pool chair, or your palapa on the beach. Another pool on the rooftop offers peace and tranquility and a swim-up bar away from the masses. The dedicated and happy staff have always treated us like visiting family, and over the years we've witnessed their promotions and watched their families grow. Every request within reason is fulfilled, and one can't help but feel like a VIP or royal dignitary. The hotel realizes the valuable assets of their personnel, and there is very little turn over. Every time we visit, the bell captain greets us with "Welcome to your home", and we always feel as we have come home at last.

Reviews.Title: “The Beach at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Jumbotik
Reviews.Content: I booked this holiday 1 month before my stay along with my girlfriend and I was expecting one of the best beaches being on the Caribbean Sea...I was speachless as soon I saw that thing called "The Beach"... never ever seen such a crap sand and Sea Water. It was full of rubbish, sport fishing boats and whatever you could imagine but not Caribbean Sea!!!! I would never return there even if the hotel and the service were great!!! I will claim compensation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great impressions of the Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: hobber
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our 4 night stay at the Porto Real, July 7-11. We had a wonderful stay and felt the facilities and service at the resort were nicely above average. We arrived at the hotel on Saturday about 11:30 am. We found the front desk staff friendly and helpful. This was not our first stay at Real resorts and we had contacted the hotel beforehand, to make sure they realized we had stayed at their sister hotels previously. We were even greeted by the reservation manager who said he had been waiting for us. We were given our VIP bracelets and told if we would like to get something to eat or have a drink, they were preparing our room especially for us. We received our room a little over an hour later and were pleasantly surprised that we had been upgraded from ocean view to ocean front free of charge and there was a chilled bottle of champagne waiting for us in the room. The room was very nicely appointed and beautiful with high vaulted ceilings and on the third (top) floor. The temperature of the room was always comfortable and our view was a nice panorama of the ocean and the playa del Carmen beachfront. The room had nice furniture with a lot of detailed woodwork and concrete statuary and pillars (frequently part of the décor at this hotel). The bathroom was larger than most , although with only one sink, but a huge walk-in shower. There was beautiful tiles in the bathroom and we even had a small skylight. We never had any problems with any of the facilities in the bathroom and it was always well supplied with towels and other amenities. They even provide razors, toothbrushes, etc. We also had robes and slippers. Our mini-fridge was re-stocked each day with water, beer, (Superior bottles) and soda. We enjoyed the recently added addition of a mini bar in the room that dispensed exactly one shot into your glass and the liquor included Cuevo, Smirnoff, and Bacardi, and a whiskey. It was locked when we arrived, but with one phone call it was quickly unlocked and available to us. There was also a large closet, free digital safe, and a coffee maker in the room. The TV/cable system was interactive. You could get your account balance, the daily weather report, hotel activity schedule, and contact housekeeping or maintenance through your TV as well as have internet access, or watch TV. There was also a DVD player. We greatly enjoyed our maid service. Everyday she would make an elaborate towel sculpture and include lots of flowers and flower petals. She even placed flowers in the bathroom and in the shower. We had turn down service one night with chocolates. The main pool was divided into two halves, split by the Gaviotas bar. The pool was always nice and clean except for getting a little sandy in the afternoon. It was very hot while we were there (100 degrees), so the water tended to be on the warm side most of the time, but one day it was more pleasant. We sat on the shallow shelves on the pool or on the loungers in the pool at times. There were a lot of Italian and Mexican families there when we were there particularly over the weekend, so the pool area was a lot busier on those days. Ho ever, we were able to get decent loungers in the morning. Be careful, the pool deck can be slick. We watched one guy take a pretty hard fall and almost slipped myself. There is a worker who squeegees it off during the day. The great pool service made up for the lack of a swim up bar. The workers came around frequently and were able to remember what you were drinking. We didn’t frequent the roof top pool and swim up bar because they were small, but supposed you could get sushi there and the couple of times we checked it out there were always people there. The roof top Jacuzzi had a fantastic view, but was not hot. The drinks were always well-blended with none of those yucky slushee machines which we do not like for frozen drinks. You could get call liquor you just had to ask for it. Wine and champagne were also available at all the bars. Draft beer was dos equis. Modelo bottles were available at the beach bar, but no premium liquor there as it was also used by people from the two star real hotel off the beach. The Mexican restaurant had dos equis amber. We saw the Mexicans drinking Sol cans, but that is a cheap beer in Mexico. Service at the bars in the day and the evening was always good and they would refill drinks sometimes without asking. It is true, there are lots of sandbags on the beach which makes it very difficult for swimming and walking on. Later in the day, the water even seemed to get murky. There was a lot of seaweed by the fishing bots, but none really anywhere else. The beach is in much worse condition than when we had initially been there for the day 7 years ago, but is really due to the hurricane damage. I am not sure how much the hotel can control or try to fix up the beach as it is really federal property. We enjoyed swimming at the Royal side however. The water there is clear with smooth sand, and small waves. You can go out quite a bit without the water going over your head. Just take your shoes or nothing else as you cannot lay anything on or use the Royal loungers. The beach was less crowded mid afternoon, more crowed with locals on the weekend and later in the afternoon. This is not a party resort. Most activities were family friendly. While we did not partake in any, there was bike tours, kayak tours, the usual volley ball, bingo, etc. Evening entertainment was a little weak. There was music in the lobby bar every night until 11. It was ok to adequate but that’s about it-the bands were different each night. They have no theater, but do have a small stage outside by the pool . They would take up the loungers in front of it and put out tables and chairs. We did not watch the shows. We usually strolled 5th avenue for a bit after dinner. There is nothing going on at the hotel after midnight, but if you want more nightlife there are plenty of clubs on 5th avenue and the hotel usually sponsored a trip to one each night. You could also make your own party in the 24 hour all inclusive room. You just had to pour your own liquor, but they had just about everything, including premium brands, beer, wine, and champagne. By the way, they also have great white chocolate treats during the day. It was great to get a snack and cool off in this lounge. They had fruit and small appetizers during the day too and in the morning you could get muffins, fruit, and yogurt. There were other snacks in the evening. We found the food to be very good overall. The breakfast buffet had a lot of variety with an excellent omelette station. I had mimosas every morning. There was always a wide selection of juices too, and for the most part cold food was cold-on ice and the warm food was warm. We had room service for breakfast one morning and it was like they had set up the buffet in our room. You could get room service once per day between 8 am and 10 pm. We got the works-the worker taking the order over the phone just kept adding to my original request. We really enjoyed eating out on our balcony and the food was fresh and delivered promptly. For lunch, you could get snacks and appetizer food as well as burgers, etc at the Parillada grill on the beach right beside the pool. You could eat at tables on the beach or up under the palapa of the pool bar gaviotas. This food was okay, some days were better than others. The chicken wings available some days were good and the guacamole and pico de gallo were great and always available. You could also eat at the buffet which was better I thought than the grille. The made to order cooking stations has pasta, fresh burgers, and great grilled chicken. There was a good selection of veggies, side items, and salad bars. The desserts were even good for Mexico, especially the double chocolate cake and don’t forget to ask for ice cream which they will bring you if you ask-a different flavor each day. The wait staff for the most part were attentive in getting and re-filling your drinks and clearing your plates. What I did miss, was the ala carte lunches/sandwiches available at some of the other Real resorts we had been too. This is one thing I wish they would add again. We really liked that no reservations were needed for the two ala cartes, Mexican and Italian and there were no limits as to the number of times you could eat there. We alternated between the two each night. We never had a wait either. We always had a five course meal. The Italian was air conditioned or you could sit on the patio street side. We had the filet mignon, and the pork which were both very good, with nice size portions. The Mexican was open air, but you could sit further in or street side on the patio. There was fans and it was never overly uncomfortable. They serve great drinks from their bars and usually a welcome drink. The watermelon martinis at the Italian were excellent and the Mango margaritas at the Mexican were very smooth. We had fajitas one night and salmon and fish on the other night. Again both very good, everything served warm and with good proportions. The chicken salad at the Mexican was also excellent. My boyfriend’s favorite part was the Mexican and Spanish coffees made flaming table-side after dinner. We found out the trick is they will make it after 9 when they are not as busy in the restaurants. This is a special treat-just ask for it. The service was excellent in both restaurants and we have no complaints. Everything was prompt, drinks were always refilled, everyone was friendly and eager to serve., saying it is our pleasure to serve you. One night the head waiter at the Italian personally came over to our table asking how we found everything and that they would be waiting for us tomorrow. We frequently tipped bartended, drink servers and in the restaurants. We did not feel like we had to, but felt the service was very deserving. We were very pleased with the quality of service from all staff and everyone of them was friendly from the front desk to the maids and maintenance workers. We frequently travel to all-inclusive in Mexico and the Caribbean and felt this resort definitely is deserving of at least 4 ½ stars. My boyfriend said it was his favorite trip of this year (it was our 4th trip AI this year). We definitely think this is the nicest Real Resort we have stayed at and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Booked this hotel, but ran away FAST!!”
Reviews.Author: SoonerGal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at GPR on the morning of July 6. On the shuttle ride to the hotel we realized 2 other couples were booked there as well, so we began a conversation about the terrible reviews we had read just before leaving for this trip. Needless to say, I was extremely worried about what would happen once we arrived to this hotel and it did not take more than 60 seconds at the front desk to realize that we were headed for a hassle. We were immediately persuaded to go look at the rooms at the Royal (even though we were promised that a room at GPR would be available for us later in the day). We were told that for an extra $30 a night we could upgrade to the Royal across the street. So, six of us who had been on the shuttle together walked over and looked around the Royal and then came back and checked out the Gran Porto. It only took my husband and I about 2 minutes of looking at GPR to realize that upgrading to the Royal would be the best $150 we had EVER spent!! The reviews of the GPR are right on.....the beach is AWFUL, the pool was elbow to elbow with kids, and the buffet (which we tried one day for the heck of it) was simply edible, but miserably hot in there. So....to make a long review short, we didn't get to exactly experience the whole aspect of the GPR (thank goodness), and I will never book there again. P.S. at the airport on the way home we heard several couples talking about how terrible their trip was because of GPR. For a review of the resort we did get to enjoy, see The Royal in Playa Del Carmen. That's one I would definitely consider returning to!!

Reviews.Title: “Am Shocked by All the Poor Reviews”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaBlonde
Reviews.Content: My mother, sisters and I stayed at the Gran Real 20-24 June and had a wonderful experience. We were extremely concerned after reading all of the negative reviews and did not know what to expect. Our check-in was quick (the room was even ready early), we had a perfect oceanfront room overlooking the pool, the service at all the restaurants was excellent, the food was well above average for an all inclusive, and the staff was friendly and attentive. We agree it was not the best beach because of the sand bags for prior hurricane erosion but the the beach in front of the Royal Palm was fabulous and the Real pool great. Lucia at the Spa provided the best massage I have ever had. The only problem we had was with the drain in the sink and shower, but it was not enough to say we would never stay there again. It was conveniently located to 5th Ave. We thought the hotel was very nice, the staff was courteous, the rooms are huge, and the food and drinks above average. I am sorry to continue to see such negative reviews, our visit was great!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real Resort in PDC scamming”
Reviews.Author: JoAnnIllinois
Reviews.Content: July 2, 2007.... We just returned from our stay at the Gran Porto Real Resort in Playa Del Carmen. The check-in process was by far the worse experience we have ever had checking into a hotel. The front desk just doesn't care, they only want to take your money! We were there for our daughter's wedding and had 68 guests arriving, luckily not all, but most of them stayed at the Gran Porto. Please note that I watched this happen to everyone who did not already upgraded to the Ocean Front Rooms (Ocean View is not the same, just means that if you hang from your balcony you might be able to see the ocean). Apparently, their goal the week we stayed was to fill all the "upgraded" rooms. Anyway....here is what we experienced... Get to hotel, our room is not ready, will be ready at 3:00pm, but we get our bracelets so we can sit at the pool, eat and drink (hoping that you drink and just say yes to the upgrade). Anyway, at 3:00 we are told they do not have the room we paid for, but if we want to upgrade to an Ocean Front room we can have a room immediately for $40 (they come down to $30). Oh, in some cases they offer 1 free upgrade night...amazing that this is the same story time after time....if you don't take the upgrade, your room is the equivalent of a 1 or 2 star hotel...icky...icky...limited air conditioning, dirty, smelly and bad toilets! Please remember this is not only my story, but everyone of our guests (approximately 50 stayed at the Gran Porto)and they arrived at different times during the wedding week...same story and the Front Desk just doesn't care! Almost forgot one very important item...the price to stay at the Gran Porto was $50 less on the internet that week then what we were forced to pay for a sleepable room, we could have stayed at the Royal, based on the internet price for less! Some of our guests did decide after seeing the rooms to upgrade to the Royal since for them, even the upgrade at the Gran Porto was not an upgrade and the common areas including the buffet and eating areas are not air conditioned ...very hot in June/July. The Bride and Groom Story..No deals for them, even if they had 50 guests staying at the hotel during the low season. In fact, when they said no to the original upgrade price, then changed their minds after seeing the non-upgraded room, the upgrade price went up by $20/night so from $30/night to $50! Needless to say there was a lot of loud conversation about the $20 increase. And we had 50 guests coming...imagine our tension knowing our guests would be treated so poorly...the Gran Porto just doesn't care. Also, the beach is held together with sand bags, so you can not walk along the beach in front of the hotel. The beach at the Royal is very nice. Please don't stay at this resort. We had a wonderful first night at the J.W. Marriott in Cancun and the couple sitting next to me on the plane ride home said the RIU gave them a complementary upgrade because the resort was not full. Some of our guests stayed at the Blue Parrot and did not have any hassles, so there are places to stay that understand Customer Service. Concluding...we did not let the Gran Porto ruin our time wonderful time with family and friends, but they could have made the entire experience fabulous minus all the hassles...so while they won in the short term (forced us to pay more for a room), they lost in the long run...no repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible beach”
Reviews.Author: babygrand
Reviews.Content: There are sand bags everywhere on the beach - no access available to the ocean. You better be prepared to tip, even if you are staying all-inclusive, other wise the bartenders will ignore you. There are tips jars everywhere. Aviod this place! There are far better places to stay in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny27cd
Reviews.Content: This place is a terrible, a complete disaster. Let me start by saying that I go to Mexico and Playa del Carmen all the time, so I know what is out there. I chose this property this time because I was traveling with friends that wanted an all-inclusive that is still right in the city. I would say location is the only thing this property has going for it. Upon check-in I was told that all the Junior Suites were sold-out and that I was going to be upgraded to a Master Suite, but that I would have to switch rooms the next day. I explained that I did not want to switch rooms, and I wanted the room I had booked. They would not budge. I finally checked into the room out of exhaustion. When I checked in the girl at the front desk kept saying it wouldn't be a problem, it would work out, and we could keep the room. Well after a night on the town, I was woken up and told to get out of my room. They didn't care that I was fast asleep. I kept explaining that I never wanted the room in the first place. They told me they would upgrade me to an Ocean View, well when I switched rooms all on my own I realized that it was only Ocean View if you got on the deck and craned your neck. The beds were so uncomfortable, and there were ants everywhere. I was then overcharged by the in-house transportation company. When I went to try and argue it the employee called me stupid and uneduacted. After that we began receiving phone calls at all hours of the night from someone saying they were from that company. We called the front desk, and they said they were coming from somewhere in the hotel, and they couldn't do anything about it. The calls got worse and worse until they started becoming threatening and making gross sexual references. I was so scared to walk the halls by myself. I stayed at the Deseo in February, and I had such an amazing time. Every time I called the Front Desk to try and get the calls to stop they would put me on hold or act like they didn't understand my English. The food was DISGUSTING!!!! The wine and champagne was not drinkable. The service at the pool was good, but the service at the restuarants was horrible. We ended up eating out all the time because it was so gross. Three of my four companions got sick. At the Italian Restuarant one night I ordered a bottle of wine and it took 30 minutes to get it, I was eating dessert when it came. It tasted horrible, and I still had to pay for it. The hotel really ruined our vacation. I have been tryinig to call Corporate and complain, but they keep transferring me and no one picks up. They also love to act like no one speaks English, even though it wasn't an issue when I made the reservation. Playa is amazing, but this hotel is a disaster. STAY AWAY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Tigerette
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Grand Porto Real, nice rooms, clean BUT they wanted to move us around. On our arrival we were told they were over booked and wanted to move us across the street for an extra $60.00 per night. We told them our daughter's wedding party was there and wanted the rooms that had been reserved. They told us we could stay there one night but then we would be moved the next day, we refused. It ended up that we would pay an extra $40.00 just to keep our rooms. The food was fair....the same menu every day. This trip had been planned for several months and we emailed the hotel to besure everything was in order before we arrived. Will we ever go back....NO! FYI...if you are planning to wed there besure to check all the laws as we had many unexpected charges. Our daughter was told they would be married at the Grand Porto when it was actually at the Royal across the street. The photographer will take advantage of you, so take take your own.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav88
Reviews.Content: This was one of three properties my husband and I stayed at during our mid-May vacation. We enjoy visiting various locations and enjoying a variety of accomodations. Admittedly, we prefer fairly upscale hotels and great boutique hotels but are open to a wide range as well. The minute we checked in we were disappointed. We did not have any overbooking issues. In fact, my husband decided to surprise me by upgrading to a beach front room. We got to our room (probably last decorated in the late 70s/early 80s), opened the doors, and had a terrific view of some guy's big belly hanging out outside our door on a hammock - beautiful! Outside the sand and pool were filthy. Small boats were docked up and down the coastline so you certainly would not want to go for a swim. We decided to have lunch near the pool and enjoyed lsitening to several wonderful classy ladies yelling and cursing at their kids. We had dinner at the Italian restuarant which was one of the worst dinners I have ever had. It is hard to go bad with Italian but they certainly did - the most bland food. Don't even bother with the wine - do not bother. Just order up one of the few beers you can get (they do not have a large range). My husband who never ever complains lost his mind during the evening. He woke with bug bites. He spent several hours complaining on the telephone and in-person and asked for a transfer to the Royal. After hearing "No" many times, they finally agreed to move us. Just know, if you want to move, and they tell you that you cannot, be persistent. The move is well worth it. The Royal across the street is a major improvement. As soon as we got to the Royal, everything was much better. Even the ocean seemed cleaner across the street. Resturant options were better, the pool was cleaner, and the rooms were brand new. Do yourself a favor, skip the Gran Porto and head for the Royal. Maybe I am a snob but avoid the Gran Porto at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: aussieinturkey
Reviews.Content: The rooms were huuuuge and very clean, housekeeping came every day and did a wonderful job. ALL the staff were always helpful and nothing was ever too much trouble for them, especailly delivering cocktials down on the beach, i would mention names but that would be pointless as they use different name tags all the time. The restuarants were all great and the buffet breakfast and lunch had good range and cooked freash in front of you. Maybe steer clear of the snack bar on the beach. Pools were always clean and the ativities people were not preasuring people too much to join in....play bingo if you are feeling lazy :) The only possible downpoint i could give was there internet was expensive and only one computer worked while we were there for one week.

Reviews.Title: “Will be returning”
Reviews.Author: mamackaes
Reviews.Content: Went to the Gran May 19-26. This isn't our first time in Mexico but it was our first time travelling with our childeren. We have three kids under the age of 10 and choose this hotel after staying at the royal in March. I had booked 2 rooms to be ajoing rooms and when we arrived we had 2 rooms 4 doors apart. This was not acceptable so they upgraded us for free to a master suite with 2 queen beds a pull out sofa and gave us a roll away cot. The room was huge and accomidated our family of 5. I really enjoyed this hotel the food was good. I didn't really think there was much of a selection at the buffet for dinner and my kids are a little picky so it was hard to eat there in the evening. We just went to the italian or mexican and really liked that the mexican had a childerens menu. Service was great. Lucy the pool waitress took care of us well and made sure we always had cool water. The beach was nice. Evening activity was enjoyable. I can't wait to go back next spring.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Familyvactioneer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real on April vacation with a group of about 23 including kids. We were booked by being time share owners. Which the time share was orignally purchased at the Royal across the street which is much nicer, though they changed it to adult only and we were on a family group vacation, but was assured the resort was beautiful and would have same accomodations. Supposedly treated like "royalty" if you are an owner. Not so true. I had read reviews about how the rooms booked were never available and they would try to send you somewhere else or the room you booked wasn't available and they would give you a different rooms. With this information I tried continous emails (never answered) and spoke to time share company and was assured that that would not happen to us. Well, upon arrival, they did not have the rooms we requested. I also witnessed other people with the same problem get sent to difefrent hotels. The front desk people are very sneaky and you will never get to see the manager that hides behind a "hidden-like" door. After arguing (because you really need to put a stink or they won't do anything) we ended up having to stay in a different room the first night and moved to rooms the next day. They upgraded us to oceanfront rooms (I had 2-one for my children and one for me and my husband) Days later they shut our key off and told us we owe them for upgrade. I tried explaining we never asked for upgradeand was nver mentioned when they gave us the rooms and they just keep you in circles with never answering you. You talk to so many different people and you they never let you get any answers. After going back and forth day after day (each time we thought it was going to be straighten, never was) Finally ended up paying difference for one room and they comped other upgrade. They are very sneaky and I was not on vacation to argue day after day with them. Very unprofessional front desk and managers(that you never see even if you ask). The hotel itself is nice. The beach is lousy. It has sand bags on it and the color is not that blue blue ocean you expect. You will need to go on the other side where The Royal is to enjoy a nice beach, but you will not be able to get chairs or take advantage on all inclusive. The pool was nice. The rest of the staff is incredible. It's the "little people" there that make up for the lacking of professionalism on the "management" end. They were very attentive and the rooms were always clean. The location is great because you can walk right to 5th Ave. Could spice up the entertainment a little too. Never any dancing there! You would have to go to 5th Ave for that,which if you are doing all-inclusive kind of stinks that youhave to do that. Food was average. Lot's of choices at buffet. Only 2 restaurants to eat and they are kind of small and you wait awhile for a table. 5th Ave has some great restaurants again stinks if you are paying all-inclusive like we did to have to go out and pay for food and drinks, but after a few days you get sick of it. Can't beat location and we did end up having a great time, but wouldn't go back due to aggravation and not really being assured what you are going to get for a room. Wouldn't chance it again. Also, if you go, never book any excursions through Aquaworld, another deceiving group. Book through Best Day travel in the lobby. Great swim dolphin excursion! Kids ages 7-17 loved it and loved the resort, not that many activities for them but still loved it.

Reviews.Title: “GPR is great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LovePlayacar
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Grand Porto Real because I was traveling with my sister and mother who is not very mobile. I have stayed at the Iberostar Quetzal/Tucan and loved it. However, for having a non-mobile 65 yo mother with us, the GPR was perfect. The rooms were very spacious and well equiped. The food was well above average for an all inclusive. The pool is small but sufficient. Beaches are not as nice as Playacar but OK. The location is PERFECT! Right off 5th but away from the crowds. The staff took care of us with a smile and a "no es nada" or "de nada". The buffets and al la carte restaurants were varied and tasty. The resort is truly beautiful. The architechture is unbelievable. It is probably not best for young kids but everyone else should be thrilled!

Reviews.Title: “PACO-is a liar!!!”
Reviews.Author: qflihl
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Playa last Saturday 05/12/2007. We had booked a JR Suite oceanfront for 7 nights. Low and behold the reviews were right! Paco-the service associate checking us in said they were overbooked and we were being upgraded for free to The Royal. It was my wife and I so it was nice to be upgraded to Adults only. Ok anyways, we get to the Royal they claimed their computers were down, hmmmm. Please keep in mind we were traveling from Oregon, so we are talking it's 7 o'clock at night and had started our journey at 3am the same day. Once their computers were "back up" they checked us in and I asked before we left "this is an Ocean Front, correct?" They said no it's partial.....That's when T-rav got [--]. So, I called Paco from the Royal because the manager did not want to be involved, again what is with that? I ask for Paco and told the lady I was the U.S. Embassy. Paco gets on the phone and starts saying how EXPEDIA doesn't understand Ocean front means partial, so I hung up. Kids, Adults and everyone in between. Here is how to resolve an issue like this......Call your credit card company tell them services were not rendered and advise that the Hotel was unwillingly to work it out or offer a refund. They will credit your account back, but it also triggers who ever you booked through to make contact with you...You will be very surprised how quickly you get your Ocean Front that you paid for. P.S. -The Royal is the most immaculate and cleanly All inclusive I have ever stayed at. P.S.S. +Room service will bring you anything you want....I had about 2 bottles of Don Julio brought to me along with beers every other night. P.S.S.S.- Tips are expected, don't believe gratuities are included.

Reviews.Title: “No overbooking, but we got sick.”
Reviews.Author: rick830
Reviews.Content: We just got back from The Gran Porto and had no overbooking problem, but be forwarned, the ocean VIEW room is facing the street and you have to stand on the balcony and turn your head to see the ocean. So for 140 dollars we upgraded to ocean front, wich was cheaper than booking an ocean front room thru an agent or online. I would never travel to Mexico during spring break and I have noticed some of the reviews talking of overbooking were in April, but still, it shouldn't happen, and I'm glad it didn't happen to us. This place is very grand, pillars, marble, tile, etc. Its quite clean and beautiful. We had no problems with the staff, they were all friendly and helpful. There are three restaurants, a Mexican restaurant, an Italian restaurant, and the Buffet. You have to leave the hotel and walk down the street to get to the restaurants, but thats no problem, they're right there. I have been to Mexico 6 times, this time included, and I have never gotten sick, nor has my wife. The food at the Italian Restaurant was ok, but I had a tough steak, ask for A1 sauce. My wife had pasta with alfredo sauce wich was also ok. The food at the Mexican restaurant was ok too, we had tacos and enchiadas, and the buffet was ok, except food sits out too long in my opinion. STAY AWAY from the food they are serving on the beach. They cook hamburgers and hot dogs in the kitchen, then cart them all the way to the beach where they can sit for hours over a tiny little flame. We got sick, as did other people. We later talked to a waiter about it and he came right out and said "oh, did you eat the hamburgers?" So, they know there is a problem and aren't doing anything about it. We were sick for two days, but didn't let it ruin our trip. The liquor is not top shelf, there is no Corona in all of Playa, you get Dos Equis on tap in a plastic cup. All in all, I found the location great, the hotel clean, the staff friendly, but I don't think I would go back here unless they made some improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Just like advised on reviews, PROBLEMS with OVERBOOKINGS”
Reviews.Author: gruss_69
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to advise anyone wanting to stay at this resort that my trip was plan since my sister was getting married accross the street at THE ROYAL so around 25 of us decided to stay at GRAN PORTO. Well 3/4 of us had to pay for upgrades to other rooms because they said that our rooms which we had booked were not available. The next day we found out that some other guest had to change resorts completely for 2 to 4 days because there was no rooms at all available. After this was settled, the rest of the week was unbelievable the service, the rooms everything was superbe. I would of loved to stay at this resort again but kinda scared to not have a room available....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Overbooking problem”
Reviews.Author: mungi
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Apr 22-29 for our daughter's wedding. The main problem with this resort is they are famous for overbooking. Some of the people in our party were given rooms in the "frat house" area of the hotel, totally unacceptable. After complaining the hotel staff finally looked after everyone, but this should not have happened in the first place. The food is quite good, and they keep the resort very clean. The evening entertainment is horrible, even tacky. They really need a nightclub, not everyone is ready for bed at 10:00 pm! The wedding was lovely, no problems there. Personally, I would not go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Over Booked”
Reviews.Author: theezen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel every year at the same time. The end of April. When we arrived at the airport we were told that we need to fine the green shirt, we did and our name was not on the list waited 1 hour brfore we could leave. Then when we got to the hotel we were bumped to another resort. They tried to get us to stay at the other resort for 3 day of our 7 day trip, but I did not let that happen... Great hotel, great wait staff, but will not never stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: VenusSurf
Reviews.Content: First off I would like to say that Playa Del Carmen is a great place to vacation, but I can not express my EXTREME dissappointment when I arrived at the Grand Porto Real. My friend was getting married and 50 of us booked 5 months in advance. When we arrived they put us all in a "VIP" room and told us that unfortunatly they overbooked and didn't have our rooms available. I just to be thrown to a hotel 20 minutes away, it was like going from a 5 to a 3 star hotel. They gave us the run around, and nothing but empty promises. I speak spanish so therefore there was no language barrier, the hotel is a big scam. Most of my time in Playa was spent arguing with hotel staff, managers with no resolution. I am in the process of attempting to get a refund for my trip, but I would be lucky if I get a one day credit.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise, overbooked”
Reviews.Author: RayVToronto
Reviews.Content: Wasn't totally surprised about the overbooking, having read others reviews. Some people refused to be transferred and ended up with a room. Others were pleased with the upgrade to the Royal across the street. We were travelling with a 12 yr old, so couldn't get into the Royal and had to be shuttled 20 minutes up the coast to a cheaper hotel for a night. In the end we negotiated for a $100 tour for each of the five of us, at their expense, as compensation for one night in another hotel. Other than that I highly recommend this hotel. Excellent location. The Junior Suites are nice and large. Food and service was good. I think they overbook to try to force people over to their more expensive hotels, hoping to get you hooked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but overbooking is just not right”
Reviews.Author: MA623
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Gran Porto from 4/28/07-5/5/07. We arrived after a long day of travel and were pulled off to the side and told they had no rooms. So we put up a good fight and they kept denying us a room and I was done wasting more of my vacation time. They told me they'd put us up at The Sandos Caracol Beach & Spa for 1 night and also comped us a lobster & champagne and a Xel-ha/Tulum guided day trip. So they had me sign a form stating all of that and off we went to Sandos. Needless to say, we were not happy, but once we got to the sandos it was alright. We cleaned up and went swimming, got drinks and food. The hotel was nice, a little too big for our liking but nice enough. The next morning we chose to get a taxi and get back to the gran porto at 7AM. When we first arrived, they told us we were supposed to be their for two nights and we flipped. I then just kept going up to the front desk and hounding them about a room. In the meantime we ate and got chairs out by the ocean. One thing that helped I think is I walked through the halls of the hotel and saw which rooms were being turned over, not just cleaned. Then went and told the front desk the room numbers and said we would take any of those rooms. Anyway, by 11am we had a room and our vacation started, the rooms are great, very spacious and clean. We stayed in room 246 which was toward the far end of the hotel, facing the royal. The view of the ocean was great for a " jr. oceanview suite". The staff are very friendly and always help in any way they can. The beach is ok, it does have sandbags and a lot of coral/rock once in the ocean, I have been to better but is ok if you get out pretty far. The beach at the royal is much better and we went over there a few times to enjoy. The spa is great, we got massages and my girlfriend got her nails done. They gym is sufficient, could use another treadmill or so but are usually free on the odd hours. The food was good, breakfast was excellent and the reservation restaurants are nice. Our favorite thing is too just hang on the beach and get sun, so we did not do too much. I can't say I would go back unless the overbooking thing was fixed, even though it doesn't happen to everyone, its just not worth the stress and aggrivation. So all in all, its a very nice place and its proximity to 5th ave is awesome. Go there, its real fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: devilray
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our Honeymoon (4/29 – 5/5/07) at the Gran Porto Real and it was great! In the months leading up to our trip I read a lot of reviews and many worried me, but once at the hotel all those worries were forgotten. Check-in was a little confusing by American standards, but as my wife reminded me you're in a foreign country they do things different here. While our room was not immediately ready they did give us access to the buffet for a bite to eat while we waited. It was worth the wait! From the balcony of our Jr. Suite we had a magnificent view of the beach. We enjoyed the food at every meal, especially the fruit. Portions at all the included restaurants were generous and we did not go away hungry. The wait staff, cooks, housekeeping staff, and all hotel employees were friendly and quick to help or just say hola. The only individuals that seemed to have bad attitudes were a couple of guests who had no consideration for others around them. We did get a few hassles from the time-share people (this started the minute we stepped off the plane). We just ignored them, smiled and moved on. They are slick and disguise themselves well so don’t be surprised when you are engaged in a conversation only to find there is an ulterior motive. We booked a couple of tours through the “Best Day” agent in the hotel and we were very happy with the quality of the tours and tour guides. The day trip to Chichén Itzá was informative and beautiful. Swimming in the underground river was a nice way to cool off after a full day of walking in the sun around Chichén Itzá. We also enjoyed the half day Ocean Safari (Jet Skiing and Snorkeling). We booked this tour for the afternoon and turned out to be the only ones on it (the tour before ours had 14 jet skies go out). All in all we had a great time in Playa Del Carmen and at the Gran Porto Real. We would go back in a heartbeat. My advice to anyone going down there is kick back relax you’re in another world that doesn’t live and die by the clock.

Reviews.Title: “No rooms at the Real”
Reviews.Author: playajon
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to this hotel, and what a poor second preformance they gave. We had reserved ocen view rooms 3 months in advacnce. We got there 4/28/07 and there were no rooms for us at all of for the two other couples that we suggested come to this place. So they said they had another place set up for us. Shortly we learned that the more you yell, scream, shout and swear at the front desk staff the more you can get your way because as we waited for our transfer to the other hotel a guy came in and totally blew up at them, swearing and everything in the lobby and he got all six of his rooms at the place after they had just told us there were none!! So we were shipped to a resort hotel about 20 minutes down the road where our room was in the jungle about 1/2 mile from the beach. We noted the rack rate for that room was only 104 a night, a big step down from what we had already paid for Gran Porto Real, I would bet 10 to 20 other couples were moved that day because it was one after the other during the 90 minutes we argued with them. So the next day we came back and tried the yell and scream appraoch and they upgraded us to the Royal and then back to the Real and gave us all these free tours and stuff. Still we wasted at LEAST 4 hours of time in the lobby, we made 3 moves and had lots of stress. The Worry Free Vacations people offered NO HELP at all in. Last time we had so much fun, this time it is too bad that they will ruin this hotel. The rooms are nice and they tried to compensate with all these things, but you really had to battle for every little thing and that is HIGH STRESS which is not what you go to Mexico for. I can not suggest you go here until they get new booking system or new mgmt. If you have already booked, prepare to battle for what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Never Got To Stay here - Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: rocnfred
Reviews.Content: Our experience for this resort is very limited, but enough so that I will never book here again and recommend to anyone not to book here either. Maybe enough people will stop making reservations with them and they'll not be "Overbooked" anymore. When we arrived we were taken to an obscure location, away from the lobby and told they had no rooms available. We reserved an Ocean Front Jr Suite. We eventually were shipped off to another resort for two nights with a promise of an ocean front room at the Royal Porto Real when we came back. The room at the other resort was a view of a fence with wait staff traffic back and forth. When our two days of confinement were up we went to the Royal to check in. No ocean front room available! Surprise!!! We never stayed in a room that we paid for. Stay away from all hotels that "Overbook"!!! It makes for a horrible experience. Seems like a sorry way to do business.

Reviews.Title: “my wedging at gran port was amazing”
Reviews.Author: kahlua123
Reviews.Content: We went to the Gran Porto Real for 10 days the last two weeks of April for our wedding. We booked with Air Canada Vacations. First we had no trouble with overbooking, everybody( we were a group of 9) got the room they paid for. We had booked the Ocean Front Room, yes you pay a little extra but you are facing the ocean, you have a king size bed as well as a huge bathroom, a safe and no noise, so the extra money is worth it. Some of our guests had paid for a cheaper room and they got sent to the 3 rd floor no safe, small bathroom and 2 double beds. They still loved their experience(who spends time in their room anyway and on the 3rd floor there is a small pool with swim-in bar with less people.) The food was good, not excellent but still ok, especially breakfast. Great location 5th street is amazing. The beach was ok as everybody said there were sand bags , but you can go over to the Royal's beach which is perfect!! Now the wedding!! Patti the wedding planner was great, we had our wedding at The Royal because we could use the gazebo, all our guest were welcomed for free! even if they did not stay at the gran or royal. The photographer was amazing. Beware the restaurants DO NOT take reservations and when we tried to reserve anyway they tried to pull a fast one on us and wanted to charge 10$ per plate even though we were all inclusive plan. 2 days before our departure they offered us to move to the Royal in Cancun free of charge because they were overbooked. so we agreed, because we were planning to visit Cancun on that day anyway and that way people coming in on that day for their vacation had a room available to them. Let me tell you the Royal Cancun is amazing!! we do not regret our choice. We would definately stay at the Gran Porto Real again.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real - Good for groups and families”
Reviews.Author: BMP123
Reviews.Content: Good location - right on the public beach and 1/2 block away from 5th avenue, which is the main shopping and dining area in Playa. The resort and rooms were well maintained. The dining options are limited; we would have prefered to eat at the restaurants on 5th avenue. Be prepared for the beach to be packed daily - get out there early to claim your space (around 6:30 a.m. - seriously). This is a good place if you are looking for above average accomodations with OK service. The location makes it great for groups and families- lots to see and do, with shopping and nightlife nearby and a kids club on site. I would strongly suggest that you request a room at the far, east end of the resort looking over the ocean - best rooms with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Do not get married here or stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: ginaclink
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding at the Gran Porto Real on the 27th of April. I was a bridesmaid and also a professional wedding planner in the US. People in my company have done weddings there before AND the bride and groom had visited the property. The B& G got in on Monday & they didn't have a room for them, they were sent to the Royal (VERY nice) across the street. They were told to come back the next day for their room, next day-no room, this was repeated again the following day. The guests started trickeling in on Tuesday, and some had problems while others didn't. Then on Thursday (the day we had 20 people coming in) there were NO ROOMS and they wanted to ship us off to the Reef, which is 20 minutes away, thus splitting the wedding in half. Groom's family at one resort, bride's at the other. After negotiating for 5 hours, we were told that the owner overbooks the property all the time because he does not have to deal with people "face to face". So the Thurday people tranferred to the Sandos Cacos about 30 minutes away and on the day of the wedding we had to get ready in the Spa. They would not even give us a room for the bride to get dressed in! Needless to say my company will never do a wedding there again, and I am urging all others to not go there!!! They lied to us every chance they got and to top it all off other people were getting rooms after us. We booked through a travel agent, and she uses Funjet, so we all got bumped. The hotel told us the only way to get a guartanteed room is to book through them directly. They offered us a free night, but when we got our refund letter, it states that Funjet will give us a credit on a future trip. No one signed the letter and we are all fighting to be compensated for the very unrelaxing time. Please do not go there, they ruined my friends wedding day, no bride or groom should have to go through this!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCoulson
Reviews.Content: Firstly the bad news. There is definitely a major problem with booking and check in. We booked a All inclusive package with a company in the UK for which we had a firm confirmation from the tour company. Unfortunately when we arrived at the hotel, after 21 hours travelling, they had given our room to someone else and cancelled our reservation. They eventually found us a room next to the cleaners cupboard right at the back of the hotel overlooking a scruffy street. Because we were so tired we accepted it and decided to sort it out with our tour rep when we met him next day. Fortunately our rep got us moved straight away to a junior suite with a free lobster dinner thrown in for the inconvenience.We were very fortunate that we had someone to fight our corner. So if you book independently i strongly suggest that you check and doublecheck your booking.Every day we saw someone arguing with reception when trying to check in. After the initial upset we ended up with a lovely big room with all the mod cons you could want, very well maintained and we were well looked after. The hotel is very grand and painted orange and yellow and ragrolled everywhere. It is completely tiled with big colums and pillars all along the corridors and open to the elements at the staircases and reception. We could not fault the food or service in any of the restaurants and most of the staff were really friendly. There are loads of sun beds around the lovely pool and all along the beach. The beach has lovely white sand but the shoreline is sandbagged to stop the erosion. The nightly entertainment is a bit naff but some people liked it. There is an entertainments team who are quite funny when they stop posing but it is all a bit juvenile. My only other criticism of the hotel is that it is very noisy. The lay out of the hotel lets any noise carry throughout the corridors and there were some very loud groups wether it be on the beach or in the hotel. We actually had a fantastic holiday in Playa del carmen and all in all the hotel was very nice and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: ItchyItchyItchy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in Feb 2007. Before I had booked our vacation, I checked some reviews on the hotel and saw some that were not to kind. But, I figured that everyone usually has a complaint so I did not listen to them to much. I should have listened. One complaint I read was about the overbooking. I figured I would be OK since I confirmed it several times over the phone. Well, I was wrong. We arrived and were told that the hotel was overbooked. "How can this be? I've confirmed it several times" I said. The hotel staff could not care less. When asked how we would be compensated, I was told we would receive a free bottle of champagne with our dinner. Free? Kind of funny when I was at an all inclusive resort and there was free champagne in every corner. We were then shipped off to a hotel 20 miiles away and were told to return the next morning. We returned the next morning only to be told that our room was not ready. So, we got to wait 6+ hours for our room. During our wait, we were asked several times if we wanted to be the "few" who were chosen to go stay at the new resort in Cancun. I couldn't believe that they were trying to con us to go somewhere else becasue of their overbooking problems. Other than the problems with the overbooking and the staff not caring at all about the customers, it was a pretty nice hotel. The food is average, and it is pretty noisy, but the rooms are very nice and its in a good location. Would I stay here again? No way. I've tried to contact the hotel several times, but no one ever replies. I'm not sure how they are still in business when they treat their "family" like this. If they took a little time and actually gave their customers some "customer service", this would be a great hotel. Beware!!!!! Do Not Stay Here

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!! overbooked & NO follow-up help”
Reviews.Author: WWB4777
Reviews.Content: We were a group with 14 rooms. Not ONE of the rooms was as requested. EVERYONE was forced to either sleep 3/4 people in one bed, or rqst a rollaway. The hotel is LOUD & NOISY, the rooms nearest town are overlooking an alleyway - they pick up and crush the trash each morning at 6am, in the evening a large bus idles under your window waiting to drive the staffers, who apparently leave @ midnight. So, you'd better sleep between 12pm and 6am!! I understand that the rooms on the other end of the hotel, overlooking a pier, had the same noise issue. Be sure to request a room in the middle of the hotel, that is if you don't care to sleep until after 11pm - there is a floor show that is AMPLIFIED so much that the rafters shake, every evening. Not so good w/small children, I imagine. Anyway, we have been trying to get some sort of compensation & the management is MOST difficult to deal with - giving us the runaround and pointing fingers everywhere.....LOOK ELSEWHERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation - Alberta, Canada”
Reviews.Author: vacationerAlberta
Reviews.Content: My family spent a week at the GPR from April 3/07 to April 10/07. We went with another family as well. I was very worried after reading some of the reviews about the overbooking but when we arrived, there was no problem what so ever. We hade 4 rooms reserved between the two families and we were all on the same floor, in fact our room was right outside the swim-up bar. It was fantastic. The overall hotel was beautiful and very clean (we noticed the maids cleaning with bleach on the floors even). We had booked just standard rooms which are a bit smaller than the suites but for how long we were in our rooms it was fine. My husband and I had stayed at the sister resort in Cancun the year before Gran Costa Real and I would say the GPR is a slight step up. The food was good (some dishes better than others) We found if we didn't like something, we would just order a new dish. The perks of All Inclusive. We spent alot of time at the pool and ate at the beach restaurant almost every day at lunch. Their pizza was great. We had kids the ages of 6, 10, 13 & 14 (boys) and two 15 yr old girls. Everyone seemed to have a great time and always found something to do. The beach is definately not as nice as some other beaches we have been to but our kids found the pool to be the place they wanted to be. Lucy was a fantastic waitress at the pool and we definately tipped her well as she deserved every penny she made. She always had a smile on her face and we found that she was very good with our children as well (even though they weren't the ones tipping her). The location of this resort can't be beat with regards to 5th avenue. We went shopping every night there, it was a one minute walk up the street and we always felt very safe. (I found Playa del Carmen to be much cleaner than Cancun and the Mexicans to be more friendly and not as agressive in wanting you to come into their shops - will probably never go back to Cancun). I felt this holiday was worth the money and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachlover92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from April 10th thru the 15th. We had no problems at all with check in, they did offer to upgrade us to an ocean front room for an additional $50 per night, but we declined. We had a junior suite that overlooked a courtyard. The room was very clean and comfortable. All of the staff at the hotel were very nice and always smiling. We did leave a tip each day for the man who restocked our mini fridge and for the maid who cleaned our room. The food was average, not the best, but we did not go there just for the food. Breakfast buffet was the best. The other meals we could find stuff we liked, just not the greatest food I've had. The buffet always had lots of choices, seafood, chicken, beef, pork, salads, veggies, pasta, etc. The beach in front of the resort was not the best for swimming, a bit rocky. Very nice for relaxing in the sun though. When we wanted to swim, we either swam in the pool, or walked past the pier and swam in front of the royal hotel. The resort had two beach bars, one at the pool and one near the royal resort that had swings to sit on. Drinks were good. The resort is very close to fifth avenue with lots of shopping, food, and bars. A very nice walk and a great place to people watch. Lots of security in the area, we always felt safe. The only problem we had was a cellphone that was stolen off of our terrace, we had left it there briefly while we had gone back into our room to get something. This could have happened anywhere of course, and I would not let it defer me from returning to the resort. I would just keep a closer eye on my belongings. The room did have a safe that we kept our passports and cash in. All in all, we had a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBeachLover
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from Playa, and thought I wouldn't have the same problems as everyone else RE overbooking, since Spring Break is over...BUT - sure enough! As already stated - it was the BEST thing that could have happened, as the Royal was amazing! As a guest of the Royal, you have access to everything at the Gran Porto Real, so we were more than happy to upgrade for free. I will leave my review for the Royal now - but it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: FourWages
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved it! It was magnficent! We didnt want to leave! Our room was beautiful, clean. The room was upgraded from the one we paid for. Food was great. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Activities were fun. Night shows were entertaining. All in all this was the best vacation we have ever had! We cant wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: GoAmy
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time -- family of four, girls 4 and 7. Highpoints: pool is great -- ignore the reviews about not having a kids area, there are 5 shallow shelves around the pool -- all the kids we saw were thrilled!, and there is defintely a beach, but keep in mind the hurricane changed the landscape down there. The 'kids club' rocks -- our girls never wanted to leave. The resort food is pretty good -- its not 5 star but its just as good as what you get at any typical american chain -- always had fresh fruit and veggies (yes the water is purified) and fish options too: breakfast is by far the best buffet; both sit downs were nice and had little if any wait. Best part: the staff is excellent, so friendly and warm (tip: learn a few phrases of basic spanish and bring along plenty of small bills for tips -- they work 11 and 12 hour days, 6 days a week and they work had to please!). The resort is also right in town if you like to explore, 10 minute cab from Xcaret park, 5 minute walk to the ferry to Cozumel. Mild complaints: beware of the invitation to a 'celebration' next door at the Real, its a timeshare scam. (This isn't specific to this resort, its huge business in all the resort towns). Also, there are overbooking problems at Gran Porto (we didn't have a problem -- try calling a day or two ahead to confirm your room). Finally -- I wholeheartedly agree with one other reviewer on the groups of underage (under 18) spring breakers drinking and staying up (loudly!) until 3 and 4 in the morning. No fault of the hotel, I'm pretty sure you would find this anywhere in the cancun vicinity. Lucky for us they didn't arrive until our last day. We would definitely stay here again, we hated to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking is the best thing that happened to us!”
Reviews.Author: mswoojie
Reviews.Content: I have been following the reviews (especially concerns about overbooking) for the GPR for several months as I was heading down there for a wedding and my first all-inclusive experience. Yes, they overbooked the hotel but it is the best thing that happened to us. Upon check-in, they transferred us to the Royal Porto, their sister hotel across the street which is beautiful. The Royal is a larger all-adult resort and hence quieter (i'll be reviewing the Royal Porto as well). The GPR looks very nice but there were many teenagers running around in both the lobby and the restaurants (not sure if this was especially bad because of spring break). As Royal Porto guests, we were allowed to eat in the GPR restaurants and tried Maria's and Pescatore (italian place). I preferred Maria's but both were mediocre -- the pasta was overcooked and the meat was dry. Service was great but the atmosphere was loud with again lots of kids but this was less of a problem when we opted for a late dinner (9pm).

Reviews.Title: “What a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: redheaded
Reviews.Content: I was at the Gran Porto Real with my husband and some friends from February 24 until March 3, 2007. I need to say that we had the greatest of time. The staff were more than courteous, the experience was enjoyable from start to finish. We didn't have any problems with our booking and we did get a very nice room with a king size bed. My friends ended up with two double beds but this was also ok. The maid was very nice, the room nicely done and she even decorated my friend's room with flowers and was very attentive to our needs. Just a few steps from our room was the pool with the swim up bar were Philippe (one of the nicest barman) greated us the first day with teckila shots. This became a daily activy for the afternoon when the sun was too hot to stand on the beach. The food was great. The waiter and waitresses were courteous and very professional even helping us with our spanish. I felt like there was too many things to eat , too many choices, a lot of fruits and salad. Quite nice. The two restaurants were great. We did appreciate the Italian one more and went there three times. Again the service was great, the food too and the presentation was like most fine restaurants. We stayed for one show at night. (The Michael Jackson presentation) which was also very nice. We didn,t get to see the other since we were out on the fifth avenue every night, shopping and enjoying the whole atmosphere. We didn't feel that this place was at all dangerous. There were guards and police officers everywhere and the people were just very nice. We did enjoyed the beach every day. We did get 7 days of none stop sun and heat. The waitress on the beach, was the nicest of them all. She was there every day, always smiling and very helpfull . Be carefull, the sun is extremely hot and three of us got sunburns after only a few hours.... The beach is maybe not the greatest because of the sand bags, but they need to do something to keep the white sand. The water was warm and the swimming was great. We didn't feel the need to go on day tours. We came back, relaxed and we most probably return one day.

Reviews.Title: “No Overbooking Problem -- Just a Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ljdsbd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GPR in early March of 2007. This was our 5th time there since 2000 and we still love it. We saw no problems with the overbooking although it did happen to us in 2001. My advice is not to try to deal with it on your own; call your travel agent and they can straighten them out. While the hotel is starting to show some wear, it's still lovely and the location is great--right on the beach and close to 5th Avenue. Our 4 year old twin boys loved the Kid's Club and we found the kid's pool and the beach area just fine for them. The current beach area is better than it was in 2000 before the hurricane. The staff is superfriendly and seem to understand when to talk to you and when you just want quiet. The rooms are very clean, in fact the whole property is. The food is good but not great but that's the nature of the beast with all-inclusives. We love it there and while we may try to find another place for next year for some variety, I'm sure we'll be back. They did offer the ability to go over to the Royal but they no longer accept kids so that was out for us. Too bad since we'd like to try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: c2z
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our early 50s and were looking for an upscale quiet relaxing vacation spot. The good news. The hotel is a a beatiful porpety with with large rooms, weel decorated, and very comfortable. As with all Mexican resoorts we have stayed at, the staff are excellent and do everything possible to accomidate you. Now the not so good news. The hotel overbooks the rooms because they count on a certain percentage of guests to take advantage of various offers to move to their other properties, the Gran Royal Real across the street as well as their two hotels in Cancun. This practise, depending on the number of people moving, results in rooms that have been booked not being available, or guests not getting the types of accommodations that they paid for. This was a constantly heard complaint amongst guests which was discussed all over the resort. The hotel is huge, about 2 city blocks long, and their definition of Ocean View Junior Suite is if you strech over your balcony and can see a postage stamp bit of blue green water, than that's an Ocean View. Of coursewhen we checked in we were told that the room that we booked was not available, and they offered to send us to Cancun, or to give us another room and move us the next day. We opted for the later. We were put into an Ocean Front ground floor Jr. Suite and decided that rather than moving around, we would just stay where we were. The next morning when I went to advise them at the front desk that we would just keep the room we were given, I we were charged an additional $345.00 U.S., to keep the room which we paid, (according to other guest we spoke to this is their standard practice, although the price varries) Your are then referred to guest services, which are really front men for time share vacation package sales at other Real Resorts. They immediately try to encourage you to attend an information session at the property across the street, by offering you free breakfast the next morning, (which we did not go to) by mid week they would stop us when we walked by their desk and offer us car rentals and trip excursions to attend the information sessions. They also try to encourage you, for a small surcharge to move to the property across the street, or to one of their 2 Cancun resorts, which we also did not do. The guest that do move free up rooms at the over booked Gran Porto Real. Each night we would get enticements to move slipped under our door. Due to the room suffle game, the housekeeping staff was unable to keep upand on Sunday our room did not get made up, but we survived. The food at the resort was not up to par with other resorts we have stayed at, at got real old real quick, it was pretty much the same every day. Breakfast was the best meal of the day, how can you screw up bacon and eggs! The ala cart restaurants were ok but after awhile listening to drunk Americans being rude to the waiters lost its charm. The real kicker was Spring Break. Not the type of Spring Break that I anticipated. I was under the impression that Spring Break involved collage and university students. There were a few university aged people staying at the resort, the ones that were there were well behalved and considerate. For some reason Ameriacan pareents now feel that their SPAWN in the 13 to year old crowd should also be included in Spring Break.
