These kids were brought in by chapeones, usually 1 mother to 20 kids and turned loose on the All Inclusive resort, and came in on 5 day excursions. There was a consant flow of durnk teenages, throwing up, young girls falling off their high heels, crying, screaming, and putting on BARBIE parades. The young lads thought that screaming obsenities at the lobby bar in the evenings, (which is where guest would migrate to in the evenings for a drink and a QUIET conversation!), was the grown up thing to do. To get away from this, you can take a couple of drinks back to your room, go out on the balcony and be entertained by the gowings on late at night on the beach, some of which was very explicit. Where were the mother chaperones you might ask? Alot of them were gussied up hitting on the guys that ran the daily activies programs at the hotel. "What Happens in Mexico, Stays in Mexico", right mom! If your room is on the ground floor facing the beach, and the beach entertainment is slow, you can sit on your balcony at night, have a drink, listen to the sound of the waives, and count the RATS running in the greenery infront of you room. We quickly discovered why the cats are allowed to run freely in the restaurants and other parts of the hotel. We did not feel compared to other resorts we have stayed at in Mexico that, we recieved value for our dollar. We would not recommed the Gran Porto Real as a place for the 40+ crowed who are looking for a quiet relaxing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for small children”
Reviews.Author: lisarhr
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel appearance and service. We won't go back for two reasons: no real beach and the pool is over 5 feet deep throughout with some small "shelves" that the adults pull their lounge chairs onto leaving no place for small children to swim. The beach is really a marina, sandbagged all along the water's edge and boats floating just off shore. A short walk south and 80 pesos apiece got us a great little palapa and two nice beach loungers with great beach access for the kids, but this took us away from the all inclusive amenities (free drinks) for the day. Another annoyance was that our room was not ready on the day we arrived. They put us up in a really nice ocean front room with one king sized bed for the four of us. When we called down for another bed, they brought one little cot. The floor is too hard for anyone to bed down there as it is tile. When we did get our room, it was very nice, but it overlooked construction and the back loading dock. Diesel trucks began bringing provisions before 6am every morning and the air conditioner fans outside were so noisy, we couldn't comfortable sit on our terrace even later in the day. If we had been just a couple with no kids and no real need to "play in the sand," this would have been fine as we might could have changed the room or upgraded. We did discover the Shangri la Caribe on this trip and plan to try it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I changed!!!”
Reviews.Author: coviper1
Reviews.Content: I had this Hotel booked for April 11th through the 18th, but have been reading the posts about the problem with the rooms being overbooked. I'm really glad I did, because I just changed to the Royal accross the street which my travel agent just informed me was NOT owned by the same company any more, thank God! So, thank you, THANK YOU, to all that wrote of their terrible problems. I'll post when I get home of what sounds like a great time at a much better hotel with a better beach.

Reviews.Title: “Room Scoop”
Reviews.Author: MinnepolisMNGAL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this resort. I have been reading the reports on this site for months and I think this info will help if you know it ahead of time. It would have helped us to know to avoid the hassle and disappointment when we arrived to our room. The JR Suite Ocean View room is located on a long street (boulevard) and if you go out onto your deck and look down the street you get a partial view of the ocean. This may be of surprise for those that think they paid to upgrade to "ocean view" and thought they would see the ocean from inside their room. These rooms are nice-very roomy and comfortable. Jr Ocean Front supposedly offers a full ocean view from the room. They offer to upgrade for 40.00 per night. We were in line to check in and were offerred wine and when we refused, they immediately came back with bottled water. Our room was ready immediately. This is a good example of the good service we received. Would never even had to get up from our chairs on the beach because they consistantly came to check on us. This hotel is in and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!! Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Happygoluckie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just rtn'd from a wk at the GPR. We had the most wonderful time. Some background on us, we are in a early 40's have been travelling for yrs and while travelling in Mexico aside from the Gran Porto Real we have stayed at The Royal, Barcelo Maya, Cozumel Iberostar and Bahia Brincipe Coba. All beautiful resorts and yes they all had booking problems no different from the Gran Porto. When we arrived at the GPR we were anticipating on spending our 1st night in the ocean view junior suite that we had booked but not a problem, they had requested the we stay in a standard room for the night and the following day @ 11am they would have our room ready. We didn't mind, we were on holiday and the standard rooms are very nice and located close to a pool bar, outside whirlpool, gym, spa and restaurants. Still a good go. The following morning at 11am as promised our room was ready. It was beautiful!!! Worth the wait. The food, drink and service at this resort was outstanding. The waiters would bend over backwards to help out to make everyones stay a better one, if that could be possible. Even at lunch at the buffet and you didn't see anything you liked they would offer you a menu if you still didn't see anything you liked they would then just ask you to ask for anything and they would just make it for you. It was amazing. How can people complain about the service or the food?? This resort is located on the beach just a few blocks from 5th ave. So you can just go for walks or shopping if you wished at night when the entertainment was over. A few minutes walk down the beach to the ferries to Cozumel which was great for day trips (snorkeling and shopping). Of all the resorts that we have stayed at these past few yrs this is the only one that we would rtn to and if a junior suite wasn't avail I would stay in a standard room no problem. You'll also note that there as 2 restaurants that you can go to at night they do state that men wear shoes and pants however, most men wore golf shorts and sandals so take that into consideration when packing. In closing I would rate this resort 5/5 for value, food, drink, service, beautiful resort and cleanliness. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking problem was an unfounded bad rap!”
Reviews.Author: MoeOlympia
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about staying at The Gran Poto Real Resort and Spa after reading some bad reviews about the overbookoing problems here. But I had already booked our room several months prior so I was prepared for a fight upon check-in, but instead was treated personably and professionally and was immediately given the Ocean Front Jr. Suite that I had reserved without hassle or incident. The facility is very clean. The staff very attentive, helpful and friendly. The food was good. The white sand beach is superb and the surf was fun to play in. Bustling 5th Ave. is just a couple of blocks away and the passenger ferry to Cozumel is at the end of 5th Ave. as well. Only complaints is that the outdoor pool doesn't have a graduated depth. It is 5' - 3" deep which was perfect for me but my wife couldn't stand in it as she is only 5' - 0" tall. Some noisy remodeling work was being done but only during the daytime, weekday hours. Overall we had a fantastic time and would go back to The Gran Porto Real without hesitation. A bit of advice. It's an all-inclusive resort and your spending big bucks already so why not take plenty of extra $1 bills to tip your servers who are working long hours and up to six days a week for virtually peanuts. They will really appreciate the unexpected gratuity.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the five star it claims to be....”
Reviews.Author: ChikitaOttawaOntario
Reviews.Content: My family and friends booked a spring break vacation at the Gran Porto Real thinking we were headed for a relaxing and extravagant holiday. What we ended up with was disappointment, mental anguish, and plenty of wasted vacation time. After a long and tiring day of travel our group arrived at the Gran Porto Real Resort only to be told that, although they could confirm our reservations, there were no more rooms available at the resort. After much frustrating discussion, we finally agreed (under protest) to be transported 20 minutes up the beach to a luxury resort for an interim stay...we were promised that it would not be Cancun as we had already visited this place and wanted to be in the Playa del Carmen area. 45 minutes later we were back at a resort in the Cancun airport area. This proved to be only the first of many lies. The day that the Gran promised to pick us up for our return to the Gran Porto, they were two hours late in arriving. Once we finally arrived, despite guarantees that our upgraded rooms would be ready, they continued to stall and to make false promises throughout the afternoon. 6 hours later we were finally given rooms, only to discover that not only were they not the upgraded suites promised, but they weren't even the suites we had originally booked. There was no "Ocean View" to be seen anywhere...we were given standard rooms across from a construction site. We went back to the front desk for another round of aggravating discussion, in which my mother was actually insulted. While they admitted that we were not given what we had originally booked, they didn't offer to make an efforts to correct the error. Unfortunately, our case is not an isolated incident. On a daily basis, other vacationers could be seen having the same discussions with the front desk, and they too were treated with the same careless disregard. The management of bookings, the behavior and attitude of the front desk staff, and the accommodations we received were far from the five star standards that we had paid for. Added to this were several other factors that detracted from the quality we had expected. For example, cleaning staff continued to unlock the patio door and leave the front door to the room open. I would seriously caution anyone thinking of booking a vacation at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Unethical Crooks”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyV
Reviews.Content: Everything that you’re reading here at Tripadvisor about this hotel overbooking is true. We planned our vacation to Mexico last September and after much research, we picked Playa del Carmen and the Gran Porto Real Hotel based on recommendations from friends who stayed there a few years ago, its prime location in Playa del Carmen, and its high star rating. The hotel is right across the street from the 5th Ave restaurants, shops and bars too—it’s the best all-around location in Playa. We also had another couple with us who had never been to Mexico and were apprehensive about going there. We picked this hotel in hopes to ease their fears and to prove that Mexico has great accommodations and is an awesome place to winter vacation. When we arrived at the hotel (after a 1 hour shuttle ride from the Cancun airport), we were greeted with smiles and a glass of champagne. After a few minutes, we were asked to go into a back room because the “manager” wanted to speak with us (we were thinking it was going to be a timeshare pitch). We were then told that that the hotel was “overbooked” and they did not have a room for us…period. No amount of explaining how we booked this trip months ago, showing confirmation numbers, ect... was going to change their minds. When we booked, we even paid extra to stay in one of their “ocean front” rooms. They ended up shipping us to one of their sister property hotels that was still under construction—a 1 hour drive back to Cancun!! They offered us no compensation—nothing. They tried to tell us this was just a “busy weekend” and that normally this kind of thing does not happen, but after what I read here, this has been going on for months. This is an obvious plot for them to maximize their profits by filling up their sister property hotel rooms when they are vacant. If you want to business with a reputable hotel, make sure you stay clear of the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Average but nice!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianFlyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real last April for a week. The resort is very well maintained and everything is clean and in a good state of repair. The staff is very friendly and always smiling. The food is average, mostly served buffet style, with lots of choices. There is something for everyone but after a week i was getting a little bored with the buffet style arrangement and was very ready for a more formal type eatery. We had an ocean front room on the second floor, it was amazing. We have been to Sandals before and i would personally rate this room better than the Sandals we stayed at for way less money. The resort is located practically on 5th avenue which is the main touristy area, we walked around down 5th every day and found some nice places to eat. We even walked down to the ferry and rode across to Cozumel for the day. Great location, you dont need a cab to go anywhere, everything is within walking distance and we generally felt safe everywhere we went. Now for the bad; this resort as far as entertainment goes will bore you to tears. The main excitement around the pool during the daytime is bingo, and the music they play poolside over the speakers will put you to sleep. It seemed almost like they didnt want anyone to have fun in fear people would drink more or something. My wife and i are not 'party animals' by far, but we do like to be entertained to some extent with at least some nice carribean style music around the pool. By early afternoon even the horrible music is shut off and an errie silence creeps in, truly truly boring. If you want to have fun, go down to 5th avenue during the day and make your own fun, you wont get it at this resort. That being said, i would recommend this resort to someone looking to stay in Playa Del Carmen. My rating: B+

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: chihuahuawoman
Reviews.Content: I guess all the Trip Advisor letters I had read before our trip were pretty much true. The beach is bad. All sandbags and shallow water with rocks. Delightful (sarcasm) fishing boats are parked up on part of the beach. However, luckily I read another Trip Advisor beforehand, so we knew to walk around the the pier towards the Royal Real Hotel (sister hotel) and the beach is simply lovely over there. Only problem is that you cannot use their lawnchairs of course. Also, for some reason this hotel overbooks CONSTANTLY. We stayed in a standard room the first night, even though we had paid for a junior suite. They gave us a free 25 minute massage to make up for it. No big deal as the standard room was small but nice. It took forever to get it straightened out the next day. We had to come back 4 times as they kept telling us, "Come back in an hour and your room will be ready." Nobody enjoys wasting a full day on that. We were far from the only ones. Everyone around us had the same problem. We talked to another couple that had tried unsuccessfully for 3 days to get the room they were paying for and just finally gave up. No way to run a business. It rained a lot (we were there Feb. 8-13) and the sewers backed up, running into the ocean, causing a horrible odor throughout the resort and the streets. Lovely. The food was not good. It was edible, but nothing was great. The deserts were awful. Little Debbie snacks presented on a lovely plate in gourmet fashion. We found the service in the restaurants to be excellent, just not the food. I would never consider booking at this hotel again. I would either stay at the sister (more expensive) hotel across the street (Royal Real) where the beach is beautiful or staying somewhere else. While walking on the good beach, we discovered these adorable little individual huts about 100 feet from the water called the Shangri La Caribe. The prices were much cheaper than what we paid for our hotel room and they were simply adorable and so incredibly close to both downtown and the good beach. Might be worth checking out. Anyway, no more Playa del Carmen for us. Very dirty and I have become sick both times we have been there. That is enough.

Reviews.Title: “our first trip to mexico”
Reviews.Author: tweedy102
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with my bf and another couple in may '06 this was my first trip anywhere. i loved it. we got a glass of champagne when we arrived and when we left, there was a line up when we got there but there was a couple of busload at the time, it was no problem for us to wait. our room was nice. no problems there, i found the food very good, the buffet always had something good to eat. breakfast was the best, omletets were amazing, even tho i didnthave ketchup for them, we went to dennys after we got back, and i was not impressed with there breakfast! they have 2 a la carte, mexican and italian, they were both very good, the drinks were amazing, you could even mix 2 different blended drinks together, i was dissappointed about the beach, it was small and the water was not clear, but it was warm, it was much clearer where you kayakat but you could not swim there due to the boats. you could go the the royal to use that beach, we never did tho, the main pool was nice, always something going on, the swim up bar pool was on the 3rd floor below our room, it was always quiet there never crowded, the only ppl we every say there were the ones in the room around us, you could go shopping up 5th street (a couple blocks up) it was great, so much stuff to buy and see, also lots of restaurants and bars along there as well. there was construction going on outside our window of our room on some building next door, it started early so it ususally woke us up. not a big deal didnt want to sleep in anyways. overall i enjoyed this trip to the mayan rivera. we had an awesome time and terrific weather, i didtn have a problem with the hotel, the staff were very friendly, even remembered your drinks after a day or so, :) sorry this is an older review from last year, we did have a great time! my bf wanted to go back, but we are going to cuba this year!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: roadstarAlberta
Reviews.Content: We just got back from here and I would not recommend it. The food was good and the service very good. Lots of friendly staff. The problem is they are so overbooked that you don't get the room you pay for. There is always a lineup of people at the front desk yelling at the front desk staff. The manager will not come out of the office to help you. Some people were walking through the front desk area and going into the backroom to try to find the manager. Never saw anything like it before. Felt very sorry for the staff. Our problem was we just booked a standard room and it was awful. It didn't even have a window. Most of the standard rooms don't have a window or if they do it is about 1 foot by 2 feet and looks out onto an old office building. We finally got moved to a room with a window but it was tiny. No chair or table. You get ot sit on your bed for 2 weeks. We have had many standard rooms in Mexico and have always been very happy so didn't expect this. We had a note put on our door that we could move into Cancun to a brand new hotel so we thought we might as well go and see if it was any better. They told us to book the day before we wanted to go and we could leave the next day. When we went to tell them we would go the next day they said the promotion was over and we couldn't go. The next day I asked another guy at the desk and he said we could so we headed into Cancu with a van full of people who where all very unhappy. The hotel we went to was The Royal in Cancun. Very very nice. Still some construction going on but that didn't bother us. Just happy for a decent room with a window. the other problem I had was the cats. I am very frightened of cats and on some night there were up to five of them running around the dining room. I usually had to take my food and leave so never got to relax and enjoy a meal. My husband and I have been all over the world and have never been in a restaurant that had cats in it. If you want a relaxing holiday and not have to be changing rooms and wasting days I would not choose hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cdmichigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel the third week in January. The hotel is beautiful and our room was a Jr. Suite overlooking the pool and beach. Our room was very spacious and immaculate. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The location is great as the hotel is on a beautiful part of the beach and 2 blocks from 5th Ave. It is also close to the ferry to Cozumel ( about a 30 min. walk) and Xcaret is a 15 min. cab ride away. We did not rent a car and did not find a need to have one. The driving in the area would be quite challenging. We did the all inclusive and would not do that again, as we got tired of the 3 restaurants by the end of the week. The food was ok but not great. The buffet for breadfast was very lovely. The hotel has nightly entertainment outside which we enjoyed. A word of advice: Don't bother mailing any postcards as the stamps cost a dollar a piece and the ones we sent out were never received. Also, our niece stayed in Playa 2 yrs. ago and mailed gifts home that were never delivered. The mexican mail is not dependable. All things considered, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “red flag- dont stay here! for any reason!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KTCincinnati
Reviews.Content: GPR is fraudulent in their booking. They will book for an expensive room and give you a substandard room. Front desk had constant line of people reporting not getting the room that they paid for in advance! (what hotel charges in full in advance? Red flag). If you are persistent, they will offer you lobster upgrade for your already all inclusive dinner($14 value- doesn't compare to the hundred plus dollar difference between rooms). They will offer you a massage (25 minute- how chintzy is that? Then when you try and get the massage the spa won't take you because the staff doesn't get gratuity from all of these angry coupon wielding guests.) Please tell anyone you know not to stay here! When my husband and I discussed this privately on the beach other angry people joined in with their stories of spending their entire vacaion at the front desk. They will tell you "come at 11 and check, come back at 12" and so on until it's "come back tomorrow".Vacation time wasted. We read the reviews just before we left and tried to cancel and go somewhere else but realized we had already been charged in full. So then we tried to get some kind of verification that we would indeed recieve what we had paid for. "no worries" was the response. Well, we didn't get our room that we paid for. Food quality is very poor overall. Breakfast omelettes and coffee were very nice. Beach great for small children , aside from all the sandbagging. Nice pool. I'm not bothering to review the amenities in detail for the reason that it doesn't matter. Nobody should give this company further business.

Reviews.Title: “Never going back.”
Reviews.Author: MigRunner
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through our travel agent. We arrived at the airport and were mobbed by the timeshare folks. Finally waded through and waited in the rain for our van ride. All luggage was completely soaked. The one hour ride in the rain in the van with one working wiper was interesting. The "fun" really started when we arrived. We were there for a business conference with approximately 30 other associates and clients and not a single one of us got the room we booked. There were numerous people in the lobby who were still waiting from days before to get moved into the type of room they booked. The check in process was very slow and the staff didn't seem to care whether or not we got into the master suite we paid for. Once we finally got a room we discovered that there was one bed. We travelled with our 11 yr. old daughter who has grown a mite big to be sleeping with Mom & Dad. Hours later they changed our room to a another with two beds . Other than the front desk staff, the staff overall were very friendly especially the bar-tenders. The barstools at the bar poolside were without question, the most uncomfortable barstools any of us ever sat on in our lives. The beaches looked very clean in front of the hotel, raked every day however when you hear about the sewer problems later in this review you may want to reconsider the whole beach thing there anyway. The food was just OK, toughest steaks we've ever attempted to chew. Poolside buffet was the best option. The nicer of the two restaurants was the Italian place, but forget about getting into it between 6-9 pm without a very long wait. The meeting room was disgusting, smelling of mildew. The kicker here was that on the last day of the conference, they involutarily displaced us (because of a wedding party; due to rain) to the sister resort next door, only to be told we'd have to pay for the amenities (food, beverages) we wanted and were available at the all inclusive price at the meeting room (Porto Suite) that we got kicked out of. We ended up having the meeting poolside, having to compete with other conversations and loud music. The final straw was the open running sewer in the streets (see posted picture) running through the kids playground and then on into the ocean where we were swimming for the last week. Due to some periodic rain, especially the last night and the morning we left, the entire sewer system was backed up and exploding out the the man-holes and running six inches deep past the front of the resort. The smell was overwhelming nearly gagging everyone in our party. Needless to say, I will never be swimming in the ocean anywhere near the vicinity of the Porto Real Resort. The overall experience was dismal and the exploding sewers really settled the matter. Due to the overbooking and my concern about the sewers running into the ocean we will never go back to this hotel and this experience has probably ruined us for life on the Playa del Carmen area in general. We learned our lesson. Pay the extra money and go to the USVI.

Reviews.Title: “GPR a nice option”
Reviews.Author: WheelchairCowboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen for two weeks in mid-January, 2007. I am a C6 quadriplegic from a spinal cord injury and confined to a wheelchair so had some special challenges as I do on pretty much any trip. This was our sixth trip to various parts of Mexico so we have had some experience with what to expect. We flew out of Calgary so it is about five hours or more from the time you board the plane until you disembark. If you fly with Sky Service I recommend you pre-book seats with extra legroom. That may also apply to other airlines. When we arrived in Cancun we had to wait quite a while to disembark while they searched for an aisle chair even though that was supposedly arranged in advance as well by the airlines. That's Mexico! In my case, they had to carry me off the plane down steps because they don't have the ramps, but that was no problem as they have plenty of people helping. Once we got into the airport we were spotted by staff and moved into a lineup to get through customs that bypass the other long lineups. That was a nice bonus. As with all of our previous trips to Mexico, we encountered wheelchair accessibility issues with the transfer from the airport to the hotel. For this trip I was using an Esprit power chair that collapses and converts to a manual chair quite easily (although heavy for a manual chair) for traveling purposes. It has a small battery that powers motors in the hub of the wheels. My regular power chair is way too heavy to take on a trip like this and I am not aware of any adapted vehicles available there to transport that kind of chair. In order to be transported to the resort, you cannot load the traditional buses so you need to arrange special transportation in advance through your travel agent, or you can also rent a van at the airport. In my case, Signature Vacations provided the van. Most Mexican towns and businesses do not have a lot of curb cutaways, so the light weight chair gives me the flexibility to be lifted, with assistance, into awkward places. We were told in advance that the hotel was built to be wheelchair accessible. We pulled up in front of the hotel after a long day of travel and immediately noticed that it was four steps up into the hotel. There was a ramp but it required that we unload on the street, and since it was raining at the time, the people helping me had to stand in several inches of flowing rainwater. The ramp into the resort was quite steep (as were a number of the ramps in the resort), and not something a person in a wheelchair could negotiate without help. We checked into our wheelchair accessible room and immediately noticed that the room was built on two levels. The bathroom, closet and main entry area were on one level and there was about a 6 in. step down to the bedroom area. Anybody who would build a wheelchair accessible room on two levels obviously doesn’t understand how wheelchairs work. There was a ramp built but it was a very short ramp and my wheelchair anti-tippers would catch on the ramp when I was trying to go up, so there was no way I was able to get back to the main level without assistance. Some wheelchairs wouldn’t have the same issue but anyone in a wheelchair would need a considerable amount of strength to go up the ramp. As well, the bathroom had no grab bars and it was difficult to access the toilet. We went back to the front desk and were told that there were only four wheelchair accessible rooms in the hotel and they were all the same. We pushed for a resolution and were able to speak to the manager. We showed him the problem in the room and he was able to take us to another room that had a raised, accessible toilet complete with grab bars. He also promised to build a new ramp for us the next day which was done. The changes were enough to allow me the freedom to come and go on my own so after some early anxiety it all worked out. The rest of the resort was fairly accessible, and because it was a smaller resort it was very easy to get everywhere I wanted to go without major exertion. We had previously stayed at a mega resort, so I found this resort much easier to get around in. I needed some assistance to get into the multi-level a la carte restaurants. Last year we stayed at the Barcelo Maya on the Mayan Riviera. I had taken my manual chair. It is a very nice resort, reasonably accessible, but as it is a mega resort it is a long way to everything. Previous to that we stayed at the Samba Vallarta in Nuevo Vallarta. It is a very small resort, very accessible, and in a very nice location. It would be fine if you are staying for only one week, but if you are staying for two weeks the variety of food might get a little too repetitive. The Gran Porto Real is a midsize resort compared to others we have stayed at. The room was a Junior Suite, which was the largest room we have ever had in Mexico. It was a nice room, very clean, with softer beds and plusher towels than we have come to expect in Mexico. The bathroom was large, with a huge roll-in shower equipped with grab bars. It was easy to get under the sink. The pool was lovely; well situated to catch maximum sun for most of the day. Some days there were not enough lounge chairs to meet demand so it was best to get out early and reserve them. Kids are allowed at this resort so they were quite noisy from time to time. The sister resort (The Royal) across the street is adults-only if you are looking for a quieter place. The beach area in front of the hotel was beautiful. They have done a good job of repairing the beach after the damage from the hurricane. There were lots of lounge chairs available on the beach. There were a lot of Europeans at this hotel and that meant there was a greater lack of beachwear than we had previously experienced. Parents with impressionable children will want to keep that in mind. At the right edge of the hotel property the beach was pretty much washed away so there were a lot of fishing boats moored there. It was not a detriment though. It was fascinating watching the fishermen return with their catch, and the large fish were very tantalizing for people who like to fish. Playa Del Carmen has a law that does not allow vendors on the beach; a pleasant relief to not regularly be hounded to buy their wares. The beach goes for miles and miles with great footing for walking. The main food serving area was nicely located close to the pool area. We were on the all-inclusive plan. For a resort this size there was a lot of selection at every meal. The fruit, breads, desserts, coffee and hot chocolate were the highlights, with great selection and taste. For me, the main dishes were good but not great. For the most part I felt the dishes were very North Americanized whereas I would have liked to see more authentic Mexican food. My traveling companions were happier with the food than I was. There was always a lot of selection and you could always find something to meet your needs and desires. Because the dining area was open air, the food tended to cool off quickly on the plate. At the beach and pool you could find food from late morning until the supper hour. Drink servers regularly came around the pool to take your drink orders. The specialty restaurants, Mexican and Italian, again I found good but not great, but again my traveling companions enjoyed them a lot more than I. For the most part the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially the dining and beverage staff. The front desk staff was not always the quickest to help or as cooperative as you would expect. There was Internet access in the hotel but it was somewhat temperamental. Our hotel did make attempts to get us to go visit and upgrade to their sister resort, the Royal, across the street, but we did not find them overly pushy. Some of our party did go check out the Royal, with mixed reviews. The upgrade was not overly expensive but the resort did not have the same Mexican charm; it was more boutique style. It had time-share and permanent residents who were not as friendly as holiday travelers, but it was kid free. Rooms were very similar except each room had a whirlpool tub in the room. There were some language issues, as per usual, and sometimes they stretched the truth. One Guest Services representative was speaking to us, saying she had worked at the resort for three years, but when we requested something, suddenly it was her first day at the resort and she didn’t know if she would be able to meet our request. One nice aspect of staying in Playa Del Carmen was the accessibility to the shops and restaurants on 5th Ave. It was a short walk to 5th Ave. and a great way to spend some time people watching and checking out some of the local flavor and products. You do have to be careful with what you buy because if you are looking for something authentic from Mexico, if you check closely the items may not be made in Mexico. There is lots of foreign jewelry. Overall, we enjoyed our two week stay immensely. We would strongly consider returning to this resort in the future as the issues with accessibility and other concerns were not serious obstacles in the big picture.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for teens”
Reviews.Author: DVF
Reviews.Content: We had a great holiday. Jan 11-18th Flight- aborted during takeoff due to a door light malfunction, sat on plane 2 1/2 hours till they tried again, got to resort late.Got our rooms right away, but I checked it out before the bell man had our bags inside. We got a room that was above the kitchen and construction right outside our balcony (271 and 273) I forgot about calling the rep if there was a problem, so we went to the front desk right away to see if they could move us. They said to come back tomorrow at 10am. At 5am they started hauling in food and preparing breakfast and we heard every dish they stacked!! At 8am the construction started. At 10am we were at the front desk and were told to come back at 11am. At 10:15am we had the meeting with our rep (very nice young lady) and she said she would go with us to get a new room. They said to come back at 12:30 and we would have that room. 12:30 they said they just had 1 room (My sister-in-law and I were dealing with this as our guys get too excieted) my brother walked up as we were told only 1 room and he said "You have two rooms! That is what we were promised and I know you have them!" Miraculously the second room appeared and by 4pm (after wasting a full day) our stress was gone and we were ready to enjoy our vacation! The place is beautiful, rooms huge, bathrooms and showers huge. Some repainting needed on the furniture. Very clean. The beach is as advertised (rocky at places), a fishing/scuba boat area off to the right, didn't bother us. Great drinks, great food(awesome breakfast) but you get bored with it. Great service at the pool and bars and the Albatros. We tried both the Mexican and Italian and both had great food as well, no reservations needed. Awesome guacamole at the beach and pool snack areas. Need to reserve pool chairs early, beach chairs always availabe. Absolutely the best location for teens and young adults! The kids went to 5th ave once every day sometimes more! Weather- rain the first 4 mornings but by the time breakfast was over so was the rain. + 30 every day! windy the first 2 days, evenings were great! Entertainment- shows were ok, geared toward teens I would say and indoor entertainment was very loud (from 8-9 and 10-11) can be heard throughout the whole resort, they also had the same group with the same songs 3 times! Some of the outdoor shows could be heard from our room as well (116 close to lobby and lounge, also close to our kids room so that was ok with us.) Spa- sauna, hottub, steam room and cold pool were free, very small area. We did not like it that they had a seperate spa for Men and for Women Tha tme share poeple in the resort were not a bother, thankfully they left us alone after the 2nd day.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better but its the location was good”
Reviews.Author: R&R100
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Gran Porto Real January 20th. Check in went very well. Staff was very friendly. Our room was a junior suite but upon getting to our room we noticed that the A/C was not working. I call the front desk and within 5 minutes they had someone there to try and fix it. After a couple hours and the A/C still not working and we were given another room with a much better view of the ocean. The food at the resort was very good. Alway something different at the buffet. My one complaint was that they did not have enough people working at the bar. One person is not enough! At one point we were told to go to the other bar for service. I wasnt impressed. The location of the resort was great. Only 1 block way from 5th ave. 5th avenue at night was really beautiful and I felt perfectly safe wondering the street. If you want to do any emailing dont do it from the resort. There is a little internet cafe only 1 block down on 5th ave that only charged .60 US for 15mins. I must say we were hasseled every morning by different people wanting us to do the timeshare deal. But all in all the resort was clean, beach was nice, the food was good and the location was right for us.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: northerngirl543
Reviews.Content: Good: •Perfect location – 2 blocks from Playa del Carmen & Fifth Avenue, great restaurants, shopping and atmosphere. •Beach, Pool & Landscaping – soft, white sandy beach; well kept beach and pool, nice lounge chairs. •Clean and no bugs – the entire staff works hard and is pleasant (despite management putting them in some tough spots). •Jr. Suite rooms are large and comfortable; good satellite TV. •Mini-bar stocked daily; you are able to request the drinks you prefer. •Bars – wide variety of drinks and wine, but only tap beer (except in mini-bar, which is Dos Equis). Wine is watered down, but OK. •MLT/Worry-Free transfer to hotel. After a 2-hour delay on a plane that was old, cramped and caused an allergy flare-up, the MLT rep on the ride to the hotel was helpful, entertaining, and best of all, offered a variety of beverages for sale. It was one of the best Coronas of the trip. Bad & Ugly: •Serious overbooking problem at the hotel. Upon arrival, we were given the runaround, and despite some heated discussions, eventually had to spend the first night in a standard room (small, no balcony, bad location, no elevator to upper level, construction & jackhammer next door, beginning at 6am). We needed a crib for one of our 3 rooms, and it would barely fit. •There were numerous other people at the front desk having the same experience. •Despite booking (and paying in full) 6 months in advance, we did not get what we paid for. •The rooms we eventually were given were ocean front with great views, but were directly above the stage, pool area and huge speakers. The thump, thump, thump of the speakers was just a moment away - until 10p (not good with a baby). Despite requesting non-smoking rooms, one was so smoky that no amount of fresh air or spray would help. •Both the Hotel and MLT are to blame. Over the last 10+ years, MLT has been reliable, but they should not continue to offer this resort if management can’t or won’t deliver what you’ve paid for. •Due to the room problems and moving, the entire first day and half of the second day was a loss. •Due to a 6:30a pickup time on the return trip, the last day was a loss. Try to verify your pickup time – our bus was 1 hr. late. •Paid for a 7-day vacation, but only got 4.5 days. Hmmm. •Food is not very good. Ladies, don’t worry about gaining weight – you won’t be tempted to overeat.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH OUT! OVERBOOKED. Didn' even get to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: stingray789
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst vacation I have ever had. Arrived Sat morning and was told that there was no room for us. There was no appology and we had no choice but to move to another hotel 10 mins away by cab in Playacar. We had made plans with friends who were arriving the next day. We wanted to call our travel agent, and they would not give us access to a phone. After lots of arguing, we spoke to our agent who could get us in the Gran Porto on Mon. We arrive on Mon only to find that our friends were also bumped to a different resort in Playacar. We again had no choice but to move to the resort our friends were in, in order to all be together. If we did this, we were promised a free tour (a nightmare to get from them) and an hour massage (they only wanted to give us a 1/2 hrwhen we showed up - got in a huge argument with the manager for lying to us, never used the massage.) DO NOT book this resort. We asked the cab driver if this was a problem with this resort, and he said yes, it happens all the time with the Real resorts. Extremely frustrating vacation. Not relaxing due to the treatment by the Real.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2174
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The people were friendly and waited on you all the time. The location is great, just out the front door and up two blocks and you are on fifth ave. (which is their shopping strip). The food was ok but everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: hockeymom55
Reviews.Content: We travelled with friends of ours to Gran Porto Real on January 11, 2007. We stayed for one week, all inclusive and had an amazing time. There is construction at this hotel, however it did not interfere with our holiday. Our balcony faced the main street and the hallway into our room was across from the construction area and we had no problems with noise at all. The staff right to the maids and towel boy were friendly and very polite. The sports and entertainment staff were amazing -- they made everyone feel very welcome and tried to include everyone from the kids to the grandmas that were staying here. The food was good and you could dine at the a la carte restaurants as often as you wished although they were very busy. The pool is literally just steps from the beach and everything at the hotel was exactly as we had seen in our travel brochue. We enjoyed ourselves very much and plan on going back to this same resort with our teenager hopefully in a couple of years. We are recommending the Gran Porto Real to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Overbooks all the time”
Reviews.Author: brendat54
Reviews.Content: 18 Friends had all booked at the hotel (all junior suites), we arrived at 02:30 in the morning, only to be told of the overbookings, 4 of us had to go across the street to the royal , the others put in sub standard rooms, total waste of time 1st day there, I was 1 of the lucky ones to be at the royal, after 2 days all had their rooms, we at the royal had the option to stay there at no extra charge,( great hotel and service), I stayed at the royal,by talking to other visitors, overbookings are a seious issue at this resort , desk staff are very rude and don't care , you either take what they give you or you"re out of luck, we had booked our rooms last summer, so this was not a last minute deal. very poor service for the price of our vacation (Never again).

Reviews.Title: “SCAM ALERT - avoid the Gran Porto Real at all costs”
Reviews.Author: drazhen
Reviews.Content: My first time in Playa - booked everything online as I usually do. Was looking for a hotel on the beach and within walking distance from 5th Avenue so the Gran Porto Real looked like an excellent choice. They were offering $400 ocean front suites (breakfast only) during Christmas week on Travelocity. All other beachfront hotels either required a 7-day min stay (Shangri-La, La Palapas) or were too far from 5th Avenue in the Playacar section. When we arrived, the front desk first told us that they could not accomodate breakfast only packages in an all inclusive resort (they were afraid we would eat from the dinner buffets?) - they claimed to never have seen the rate and type of reservation offered by Travelocity. When I offered to pay more for an all-inclusive package they told me the hotel was overbooked and offered us a room at another hotel in Playcar that was 1-star lower category and far from 5th Avenue. The staff was rude beyond description especially a young man named Daniel who yelled his responses loudly and at times looked like he wanted to hit me. There was a line of screaming tourists building up after me - mostly American from what I could tell - I personally saw 3 couples being offered rooms in other (inferior) hotels for the same price because the Royal Porto Real was overbooked. I asked to speak with the manager (Lynn) but was told she was off on Christmas break and it was only the reception staff that could talk to me. I asked whether I could use the phone at the reception to call Travelocity (my cell phone battery was dying) but they would not let me. I borrowed a phone from a stranger and got on the phone with Travelocity trying to get them to speak to the Real Resorts reservation department with me on the line. When we finally got through, we were put on hold by Real Resorts until they could 'check the reservations' - we were kept on hold for an hour and then they hung up. Another call to Travelocity and another hold for 30 minutes or so after which they offered to put me up in a hotel across the street the Royal Porto Real for an additional $100 per night. I agreed. When we got to the Royal Porto an upset gentleman at the reception warned me that there was construction going on in the hotel and I should run away. I asked the reception staff and they assured me there was no constrruction anywehere in the hotel. I got my keys, headed to the room and... as luck would have it there was a crew of 6-7 construction workers laying concrete right under my balcony and doing something really loud in the process. I will spare you the rest of the details. Listen to the other fellow travellers on ta.com. The Gran Porto Real is a bait and swith scam - they overbook rooms by the dozens at good rates in the nice hotel and then feed the tourists into inferior sister hotels or places with ongoing construction where no sane person would otherwise stay. If you find yourself in this position it is not easy to find alternative lodging in good rooms elsewhere in Playa on the spot (we tried and failed, PDC is a busy place) so you have to stick with whatever crappy room Real resorts give you. The Gran Porto Real ruined our holiday, don't let them do the same to you. Next time I will stay in one of the cute small hotels like Acanto, Lunata or Mosquito Blue. They are very reasonably priced, really cute looking and people say service is great. True, they are not on the beach but you can always walk over a couple of blocks from the hotel to a 'beach club' that rents chairs and umbrellas. You'll save a few hundred $$$ per night. Besides, very few of the advertised ocean view rooms in the Real hotels face the ocean. Most of them are far removed from the sea (some as far as a few hundred yards) and actually face the street which runs perpendicular to the ocean - you can only see the water if you bend over the railing. If you sit on your balcony to relax (as I like to do) what you see is the balcony of the other hotel... Stay away from Gran Porto Real, they are scam artists.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Wanted & More”
Reviews.Author: Pennylane155
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at The Gran Porto Real in November and had both a fun and relaxing vacation. We were offered drinks as soon as we entered the lobby and check in was a breeze. We weren't happy with the location of our room (overlooking construction & above the staff entrence) and were told they could move us the following day. The next morning I went to the desk and they were ready with another room that was perfect. It was located over the front door so we had an extended terrace with not only a table & chairs but with a hammock & two loungers also. The cleaning staff were attentive & maintenance were quick to respond when there was a minor problem with the toilet. While they were in the room they noticed the door mechanism wasn't quite right and they repaired that while they were there. The food was fine, we always found things that we liked but I wouldn't say that was the best part of the stay. We ordered room service one morning which was quick to arrive, beautifully presented and even the toast was hot. The wait staff in the restaurants were always polite and attentive. We tipped the beach waiters and we were never without a drink. The beach was fine considering the devestation it endured from the hurricane. We didn't mind having to step over a sandbag to then be in beautiful warm, clear water with a sandy bottom. I don't know where the rocks are that have been mentioned here, we didn't see any rocks anywhere in the water in front of the hotel and we watched the staff worked tirelessly each night to improve the beach. The entertainment staff were amazing and really made our whole vacation. They were fun and easy going and encouraged us to participate in activites we may not otherwise have tried and we ended up having more fun then we could have imagined. When they took us out to enjoy the nightlife we always felt safe. Salsa lessons by the pool, water aerobics, bike tour through town, yoga on the beach, the evening shows, all were fun and fabulous. We would definitely consider a return trip to the Gran Porto Real!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of front desk”
Reviews.Author: ssminnesota
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row our family of four (ages 4 and 6) has stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa. This year we had a nighmare checking in at the front desk! The front desk staff and management lied to our faces and tried to put us into rooms less than what we had paid for and even told us they were completely booked. We read about this problem on the reviews, but had never experienced the issue. We have traveled for the past four years to Cancun and Playa with our young children at Real properties and have never experienced the extreme dishonesty as we did this year. The management actually yelled at me when I wouldn't take the crappy room they tried to shove us into. My husband stayed at the front desk while I took the room keys and checked out different rooms during the 2 hour check in process. We were just fried! Funny how when we didn't give in, they "found" a room that was similar to what we had paid for...amazing. The room had one king bed for the four of us, and of course they didn't have any rollaways available (mind you that it was 1:00 in the afternoon!). The game continued for 3 days without a rollaway,always telling us we were the first ones on the list to get it in the morning, then I finally grabbed the MLT representative and they went to the front desk for us. It did sour our entire week, as other travelers have been saying.

Reviews.Title: “Child Care is a Joke”
Reviews.Author: Kermit052
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful Gorgeous rooms and poolside and beach Food was so-so Service was below par My husband cut open his foot on glass on the beach. Hotel staff bandaged it up. The next day we went to a real doctor who said it had really needed stitches. Too late! So he was in a wheelchair for the rest/most of the trip. I was unable to see for 1-2 days (without great pain) due to sand or something extremely allergic response provoking in my eye. The child care (which consists of 1 room and a playset outside on astro turf) continually called for me to collect my child for the smallest infraction (he looked sad when I left him), or something untrue (poopy pants - but there was nothing in there when I got him up to the room!), or they refused to get my husband by the pool & lied about making an attempt. I do not advise anyone to leave their children in the care of these people! The Kids Club staff spent almost all their time sitting at the crafts table and talking amongst themselves, not interacting with the children, not supervising. The kids watched television mostly, unless they played by themselves outside or with their parents. There were some very neat Disney "Cars" trikes which my child enjoyed. We wrote 2 letters documenting our difficulties and gave them to the concierge. The response was to have the Ops guy Nicolas Vasquez(?) patronize us in front of the Kids Club staff. We wrote 2 more letters addressed to the hotel manager and left them for her at the front desk (Lynn Rementini?). No response.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time was NOT a charm”
Reviews.Author: iteachfirst
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Gran Porto Real, and we are sorry to say, that the trip was not what we hoped for. We booked several months in advance and paid for a junior suite ocean view room. However, when we checked in, we were informed that there weren't any junior suites available. The staff at the front desk was extremely unhelpful and rude and could not offer any explanation as to why our room wasn't available. The desk staff offered a lobster dinner as compensation. We were also given the choice to stay at a sister property in Cancun, but they could not assure us that any rooms would be available once we got there. We took our chances and decided to stay in Playa with the assurance that our junior room would be available the next day. We ended up staying in the standard room the first night and it was a disaster. The room was located by the pool on the roof and it also faced the street. There was noise all hours of the night from doors slamming, people yelling, and street noise. The room itself was small and cramped, and, the toilet overflowed. Again, this was not what we paid for, The second day was spent at the front desk trying to get our room changed to the junior suite. (The desk staff assured us the previous day that a room would be available and to check back in the morning.) Needless to say, the room wasn't ready and we were told to check back around noon. We finally got into the junior suite room that we paid for around 1:00 the second day. The relaxing Christmas vacation that we hoped for was tarnished by the rude desk staff, the time wasted, and the overcrowded conditions at the resort and on the beach. We will not make the mistake of booking a trip to the Gran Porto during the winter months. Our previous two trips to the Gran Porto and its sister hotel, the Real, were wonderful. We were excited to show off the property to another couple that traveled with us. This was their first trip to Playa and were excited about the resort until we arrived and the fiasco at the desk/check-in set the tone for the vacation. Needless to say, they felt cheated and we were deeply disappointed in the service provided by the desk staff. Other than the problems with our room and the overcrowded conditions, the junior rooms were immaculate and very comfortable. We most likely will return to the Gran Porto during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking a problem!”
Reviews.Author: OceanPal
Reviews.Content: We booked two junior suites at the Gran Porto Real back in September of 2006 and looked forward to a family reunion from 27 Dec 2006 to 3 Jan 2007 over the New Year's holiday. We paid for these rooms in full up front and would have been charged had we not shown up. In that case, the rooms should have been empty. It seems to be the custom at several of these all-inclusives in this part of Mexico to overbook the rooms during the Holidays. This is inexcusable! After a long trip from Seattle we were told to go to the Sandos Caracol for our first two nights. I grumbled, but what could we do? The rooms we got at the Sandos Caracol listed for $219/night but we had paid almost $400/night for our Jr. Suite at the Gran Porto Real (x two rooms). Needless to say this gringo was not in the mood to tip the taxi drivers shuttling all our bags back and forth. It's a shame to take it out on the poor people who work hard during this time. I blame management but am told it is really the owners who are guilty. Shame on them! The hotel is very nice, the food at the separate restaurants is good (okay at the buffet). The pool, staff, Kids Club, everything was as we hoped it would be. I enjoyed sailing on the sunfishes off the beach, which has been somewhat affected by Hurricane Wilma (sandbags on the north end, the beach is better as you head south toward the ferry to Cozumel). Just beware of this overbooking practice during busy times. Perhaps if we all call them to task on this practice they will change their ways!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall...”
Reviews.Author: SnowTraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real between Dec 16 and Dec 24, 2006 and we would give it an overall good review. What's not to love about an all inclusive resort in the sunshine where all your needs are met?!!! Especially if you 're leaving a Canadian winter. Here are my recollections: - The front desk: When we checked in, they asked us if we wanted to upgrade to the newer hotel across the street for $40 per night and we said no. They then asked if we would go there for free and we said no. We had heard that there was construction there so we wanted to stay put. The employee said fine, no problem and assigned us our room. - When you check in, they give you a "gold membership" card with lots of free stuff. That's the timeshare "bait"- you get free stuff but you have to listen to their spiel. Luckily one of the other guests told us not to redeem the gold card so we didn't have to waste a minute of our time with the timeshare blahblah. -Rooms were clean and tidy and mini-fridge is regularly stocked. Not sure if all rooms have a min-fridge-our room was a junior suite. -The daily buffet was closer to a nice 3 star setup rather than a 5 star. There are several food stations within the buffet so after the first day, we scoped out our favourite foods; the roasted chicken for lunch was my favourite. They could stand to put out less cold cuts; not a lot of people were eating them and they were getting a little sweaty and unattractive after a few hours. The buffet stays open for breakfast, lunch and dinner so it was the most convenient way to eat. - There's also a smaller buffet next to the beach with burgers, fries, guacamole and fixings. My husband enjoyed the burgers. - There are 2 restaurants in addition to the buffet: An Italian restaurant (il Pescatore). We ate there several nights and would give it a pretty good rating. The veal was very nice. There is also a Mexican restaurant that we didn't try. -The hotel has computers near the lobby for internet usage. I think it cost something like 5 pesos for 5 minutes. Bring some US one dollar bills; the front desk can make change if required. There are also cheaper internet cafes with internet phones along the main avenue of the town. Walk 10 minutes and you'll see more than one. Don't buy the phonecards!!! They have lousy phone connections and you can bearly hear anything. - The hotel has a laundry room- very useful !! Just one machine and dryer though. It cost approx 5 dollars to do one load of laundry- not cheap but very convenient. - Exercise Room: my husband said it was excellent, tidy, air-conditioned etc. -The staff: I give them a very good score. Friendly, efficient, no problems. No one asked for tips; although we tipped US $1 dollar bills from time to time. - The pool: a very good size pool. Remember, this is a family hotel so there are kids of all ages and they like to splash around now and then. The parents and kids were all pretty well behaved so I had no problem with it. Although, some couples who want absolute tranquility may not find this to their liking. -The beach : Very nice. Different from Cancun's main hotels; Cancun has no fishing boats anchored. However, Playa Del Carmen has a few small fishing boats along the beach- I thought it was charming. Keep in mind that the scenery is not identical to Cancun . - Cozumel- We took the ferry to Cozumel and, in my opinion, I don't recommend it too much. The town is choc ablock with shops. It's also a port for many large cruise ships. Cozumel strikes me as a tourist trap. The jewellery shops were of a much higher calibre than Playa Del Carmen though; if you like emeralds and diamonds, you might like Cozumel. Although my husband was not keen on their prices! These are just some of my observations. The most important thing, though, is that the whole holiday was tremendously relaxing. The sunshine, food, beer and romance revived my spirits. If we're in Playa in the future, we would probably stay at the Gran Porto Real again. Adios and Gracias !!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Gran Porto!”
Reviews.Author: Jen2694
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Gran Porto Real for our 10 year anniversary in early December. It was our first AI & our first trip to Mex. We are so pleased, we're planning on going back next year. Staff was wonderful, Benito & Teresa we're priceless! The food was good and we loved being so close to downtown. The atmosphere is just fabulous. The room was huge and spacious (we got upgraded to ocean front when we arrived). Watch out for the timeshare sell though. They will tell you it's breakfast and a walk through of the sister hotel next door (The Royal Porto). It's actually 3 or 4 hours and they try to get you to buy into the timeshare...we were warned by WorryFree Vacations. Overall a fantastic vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: treffsangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five wonderful days at Gran Porto Real and Spa for our honeymoon. I was sick the whole time with bronchitis, but we still had a grea time. The food was amazing and the drinks were the best we had ever had. We did not venture into the spa, and the beach left a little to be desired, but the location was perfect. We were right next the the ferry to Cozumel I think we went there three days, and we walked fifth avenue every day. We plan on returning to this resort one day hopefully in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “A great birthday get away”
Reviews.Author: minnesotafamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 16 year old daughter and our 19 year old neice to Gran Porto Real to celebrate our daughter's 17th birthday - her golden birthday. We were there for only 4 nights so spent all our time at the resort; on the beach or at the pool. We also spent some time on 5th avenue shopping and ate at 2 restaurants there. We would highly recommend the Gran Porto Real for a family vacation with teenagers. We were treated very well by the service staff and the staff in charge of entertainment were really fun!!! On the day of my daughter's birthday she had MANY of the staff wishing her a happy birthday. We ordered room service that morning and they took it upon themselves to bring her a birthday cake and some other special treats. When they cleaned our room that afternoon they somehow knew it was her birthday and they made up a beautiful display on her bed with the towels, and spread out lovely, real flowers around on the bed spread. That evening, the entertainment staff announced her birthday and everyone sang to her and then they gave her a birthday cake with her name written on it. It was AMAZING how special they made that day for her!!!!! The resort is relatively small and that was really nice. We were greated by name most of the time. The girls really enjoyed laying by the pool to enjoy the music and the social activities, but the beach was lovely as well. We originally wanted an ocean front room, but they were all booked so we got a Jr. Suite and were really happy that we didn't upgrade to the ocean view...our room was beautiful. We hope you have a chance to stay at the Gran Porto Real...you'll love it. We wish we could have stayed longer and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: OsoPolar75
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to read any negative reviews of this charming hotel after i returned from my "Hallow'een/Day of the Dead" vacation. I was nervous to book, but it is the only other all-inclusive hotel directly in Playa del Carmen (Their sister reort, The Royal Porto is the other one) and is within walking distance to everything in town. I am not a "fussy" traveller and it is easy to please me as long as there is a sincere effort made to make me feel welcome and comfortable. This place succeded in aces! From the momment I arrived it was nothing but smiles and "Hola" from ALL the staff. From the Bell Captains(expected) to the janitor (not expected!)I had no trouble checking in, the room was spacious and clean and maintained through out the trip. Don't forget to tip! These people are cleaning up after you and this is how they make a living. A few xtra peso's will go along way! F.Y.I for those that don't remember: This part of mexico was hit hard by hurricanes last year and they are still in the process of cleaning/re-building all over town. No one was spared from Ma' nature, so you will hear construction work going on. Try as you might, you can't escape the noise! But you don't go on vacation to stay in your hotel room right?! You can't control the weather either, so why complain about it. It was during the tale end of storm season when I was there and it was mostly overcast and rainy the whole time I was there. I am not one for sun worship but the sun did make an apperance once and awhile. When the rain started, all the staff were quick to accomodate the guests inside the large lobby lounge with games and activities. Take the bike tour so as to get a bearing on distance and locations of streets. The path they take you on is safe and flat. Wear a hat that protects your neck and take a bottle of water from your room. They break at a small parkette next to beach that will surprise you! With that being said, my hat goes off to all the Sports and Rec. staff. They were tireless in making sure you had a chance to join in at anytime with the numerous activities going on at any given time. They worked long hours and always had a smile on there faces and within a day or two would even remember your name! On all the Bar/Club outings they made sure we all got in right away and they watched over us like sheppards tending to their flock. They always made sure you were O.K. and let you know who and when anyone was leaving and what the options were to get back to the hotel. Bravo to Gabi,Miguel,Samantha, and Spike! I don't know how they did it?! I only ever ate at the "Buffet" restaurant and the "Beach" Grill, but the staff was very attentive and the range of food was more than ample! Since my return from Playa and the Grand Porto Real, I never hesitate to recomend that since I had such a pleasant experience, that my family and friends would too!

Reviews.Title: “Not a mistake bringin the twins”
Reviews.Author: drewsky1865
Reviews.Content: My wife, our 18month old twins, 4 year old daughter and 14 year old son plus our nanny just had the most wonderful time during our stay in the mayan riviera resort...Gran porto real. The hotel accommodated us wonderfully by providing us two cribs and two high-chairs we were able to keep in our suite the entire 2 week vacation. The staff were outstanding and the choice of meals at all three venues were out of this world....we WILL be back again...this time without the kids.. just mommy and daddy Honeymoon time next year drew&tracey from edmonton newlyweds

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: badboys
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to the Cancun area twice before and Puerto Vallarta once. Of these resorts we stayed at, the Gran Porto Real was by far the best we had for the cost. The staff was great and the buffet was very good. The rooms were more than we imagined they would be also. There were six of us together in three rooms (junior suite ocean views) and we all agreed, we will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Short Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mamatravel
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended the Gran Porto Real for a short all-inclusive trip to Playa Del Carmen. I spent some time on line reading reviews before leaving---and felt that they were helpful. We went through Funjet which was very efficient. As soon as we arrived-we ran into the same issues that I had read about. They told us that they had overbooked and we'd have to spend the first night at one of their other-Real facilities. We stayed quite firm with them and they took us around the corner in a hallway to tell us we could have a smaller room for the first night and stay at the Gran Porto Real. The entire 5 days we were there we heard this same story over and over again. We actually should have taken their offer because we could have ended up across the street and that facility is only one year old. After all that minor mess, we had an excellent time with NO complaints. The staff was extremely helpful. The food at the Italian restaurant was my favorite. But--we ate at all the restaurants and have no complaints. We met some couples and all tried the room service food which was also excellent. The evening entertainment was interesting and entertaining. My husband and I only had 4 nights, so we didn't do any of the day trips or excursions. We spend the entire time at the resort and on 5th Avenue. 5th avenue and plenty of shopping is only 2 blocks away. As I had read on "Trip Advisor", the beach directly in front of the resort has quite a few sandbags and isn't very large. But if you walk a little to the left, the beach is large and gorgeous. Overall---I can't say enough good things about the resort and our time there.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MargeWA
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Gran Porto Real for our honeymoon, and it was absolutely perfect! I decided to write a review, because I found the ones I read while choosing a destination really helpful. It is lengthy but bear with me, because there were so many nice things to say about our trip. We were booked to stay at the Gran Porto's sister resort the Real Playa del Carmen, but after reading some not so great reviews on this webiste, I contacted the resort about moving to Gran Porto. It was as easy as emailing and spending an extra $136...well worth EVER penny. We arrived on Oct. 15 and left on Oct. 21. We rented a car and drove down there. While the resodrt does not have "official" parking, one of the bellmen was very kind to find us a parking space while we checked in. We could not get to our room until 3:00, so we enjoyed some drinks in the lobby bar, and my husband got his football fix for the day! The first room they gave us was 2 doubles, but that was quickly fixed the next day to be a king bed. The room was huge by hotel standards, and the bathroom was beautiful with a spacious shower. The bed was hard, but we are in another country...Nothing is like you bed at home! The A/C worked wonderfully the whole time which was good because it was hot. They have a wide variety of food and places to eat at Porto Real. It is buffet food in the main resturant, but we enjoyed everything we had to eat. We throughly enjoyed our dinner at Maria's and the Italian resturant. The food was delicous and we could order as much as we wanted. We only ate 3 meals away from the resort. The drinks were plentiful and there were people ready to give you one at anytime or place. We came home well feed! If you are looking for 5 star food, then I don't think any AI package will work for you. We enjoyed not having to worry about how much things cost. If you are looking for a fun day trip, you have to check out Xcaret...It is a nature preseve about 20 miles from Playa. It was gorgeous, full of things to do and well worth the money. We both agreed it was one of our favorite parts. We also took the ferry to Cozumel one day which was alot of fun also. We shopped and spent some quality time at Senor Frogs. The terminal to the ferry was a nice walk down 5th Avenue, which was a great place to shop and eat. We ate dinner at a resturant called the Blue Lobster on friday night, and it was the best lobster I have ever had! Sitting by the pool can also be very entertaining...The 1 o'clock water polo match between Italy vs. The Rest of the World is a must see! They have lots of activities you can join in or just watch from the side of the pool. The service and everyone that helped ua at the resort was unbelieveably wonderful. I don't think we have encountered so many friendly people ready to help and bring you anything you needed. You are not required to tip, but you want to after all of the wonderful service and happy people. Beware that if you pay for things in US dollars or Euros, you are more then likely going to get pesos back. A good rule of thumb is $10 for every $1 Us dollar...So if you see something cost $188, that is in pesos! We got the hang of it by the end of the week! On the scale of 1 to 10, I would give our honeymoon a 10! We are already talking about going back with friends and staying at the Gran Porto Real. We could not imagine a more perfect way to relax and enjoy our time off from work. I hope this review helps you and please email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DaisyMarie
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days 4 nights at Gran Porto Real and thought it was wonderful. I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews that were written closer to our departure date. But we decided it all depended on what your expectations were so we adjusted ours a little after reading more reviews. We had a junior suite with ocean view so we weren't near the construction on the south end. Our room was beautiful and spacious as was the bathroom. Very clean and comfortable. We had a private balcony with great ocean view. Everyone was super friendly. The drinks were excellent and free-flowing! The food at the resort was good, not great. However, the breakfast buffets were hard to beat. And there was a lot of variety. There's a jetty just north of the Resort that has an impact on the beach right in front of the resort. So the water's not that beautiful crystal clear blue right there. It’s still clear though and you can wade out to "blue water". Also the beach is small. But there are plenty of lounge chairs to hangout in and sunbathe, read, or whatever. And it's just a short walk if you want broader beaches and bluer water. Also, the pools were very nice though we preferred being by the ocean. Basically, we thought it was fantastic. We felt like we got a tremendous deal for our $, such that the few things that weren’t perfect just didn’t matter. Going during hurricane season is a gamble but it paid of royally this year. We will definitely go back to Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go back To Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: mrdosxx
Reviews.Content: Been on many all inclusives and this one was one of the best, clean hotel, good food and to the people that have been bitchin about the beach, all you had to do is get off your butts and walk around the corner past the cement peer and low and behold there was the most gorgeous beach you would ever want to see, complete with screen beds. Right directly in front of the sister hotel Gran Porto Royal. But anyways, I rate this hotel 100%, To those who are complaining about the standard rooms, Next Time Go For the affordable upgrade to a junior sweet, If anyone wants clarification and more details, Email me at taraloo@redsuspenders.com. See ya at Gran Porto real In about six months. Don't forget To Go To The Mayan Ruins.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: applepiesweety
Reviews.Content: the service is great,the people are very nice. the beach and the pool are great . the standard room was horrible. It smells terrible and there is sound of construction from 6:45 in the morning, the sound of the hammer wakes you up during your vacation that only happens every once in a while.. The first night they gave us a junior suite because the standard room which we booked they said was under construction.The next day they told us to go back to the standard room. Which smelt terrible and was very small and if we decided to stay in the junior suite we had to pay $40 per nigh difference in price,but we did not. But the night we sepent in the junior suite was wonderful and the oceanview is great. The food is amazing...along with the kitchen staff.Some of the people we can remember are: recardo the chef,isoos,manuel,moises, gabriel are very nice and smiley.:)there are many more.
