The entertainment was very nice too. The people who sell timeshare wasted a lot of our time from our vacation.When we arrived at the airport and at the hotel.We wasted three days from our vacation with the timeshare people. BE CAREFUL . MAKE SURE YOU DONT WASTE YOUR PRECIOUS VACATION TIME . Overall we had a nice vacation, but it was not perfect. *if you want a comfortable accomodation,you should go with the junior suite.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Raingle
Reviews.Content: My Husband, best friend and her husband stayed at GPR Oct. 04 for 7days. Our rooms were huge and beautiful. I tipped the maid everyday and got cute folded towel art. My girlfriend didnt tip and didnt get it. HAHa cheap a>>! We had a room above the kitchen which was a little loud but we didnt mind because the balcony off our room was unbeilvable w/ longe chairs, table, hammock & flowers all around. Over looked the pool and ocean. My girlfriend balcony was a little tiny thing but she had a better view of the ocean. They will move your room if you want with no hassle. The bathroom....I wanted to pack it in my suitcase. The shower!!! Mini bar. You only get four beers a day and the maids wouldnt give us more. Weird I thought. I had to tell my girlfriend and hubby to BYOB. Toward the end of our stay we found the snack bar. They have bottles and beer there. You just take it to your room. We ate twice at the italian restaurant. Make your reservations when you check in. They are booked solid. The mexican one was ok. The buffet restaurant was our favorite. Different food and lots of choices each day. Drinks were good. Hotel entertainment was not impressive. Time share beware. Just dont do it. Unless you are short on cash and have time you want to give away. My Husband decided we should do the "not time share" time share. For a free breakfast and $100 trip voucher. We get free breakfast already and 3hours of my vacation is worth more the 100 bucks. I ended up leaving the FREE breakfast in tears without brkfst or voucher. It was aweful. We loved the pool and the beach. The pool with the swim up bar is not located with beach view. Its on top of the building overlooking construction(at the time '04) and rooms the look like motel 6 on the other side. Not my taste but my girlfriend and hubby liked it. The hot tub is up above that with unbelielvable views of Playa. We broke in after hours just for pictures and a little alone time. In a resort it is a little diffiucult if you know what I mean. Chairs at pool were an issue but big deal get in the pool instead or lay by the ocean. There was always open chairs there. If you like topless sunbathing or watching the left side of the hotel beach was full of hot Mamas and Grandmamas and old men in speedos! The boats everyone talks about added to my Mexican Yucatan experience. Go to Cancun if you want fake Mexico. My husband & his buddy went out fishing with one of the boat owners in front of the beach. He had a wonderful time...no fish but was worth the 20 bucks for the beer, boat ride and the local conversation. Dont let the neg. people stop you from going here. The beach is warm, bright and beautiful. Go left or right if you need "perfect" beaches. The sand bags...Are there to help the beach not be washed away. Its no big deal really. We went on a snorkling trip. You must do this! Ive been to other the parks..(Xhala & Xcret).There is nothing like going into the ocean (with a guide). Yes the parks are pretty but the fish and coral are nothing like what you'll see in the ocean. The package we bought took us snorkling, cenotes, cave swimming and lunch. The cenotes were ok. I jumped off a cliff that was exciting but other then that it was boring. The cave we went into wasnt very exciting either unless you like to swim in bat poop. We did get a cool picture in the cave but ....Gross. You could see all the bat poop at the bottom of the water and there were to maen people. The great thing about the hotel is that you can walk everywhere. Lunch was provided by an authentc native Mexican family. A little scary at first. The guys ate everything. I didnt. It was good food. My best part was there hut was right there and there beautiful children. I asked to take pictures of the children and gave them treats. Very sweet people. Ferry 3 bucks from the hotel to go to Cozumel. I wasnt impressed Cozumel. We just shopped. Maybe if you stay in a resort its better. I wish we would have snorkled there too. FYI...I love mango and bought it from a vender on the street. SO STUPID. I was sick like the flu sick for a day. Other then that we were all healthy the whole trip. We were worried about the weather in October. The weather was awesome. It rained(down poored) one day so we bought rain coats in the gift shop( spendy bring your own if you think it could rain) and went shopping. Oh and have lobster. We went to the Blue ? I forget. On the left of the ave with balcony you can see from the road. It was so sweet and melted in your mouth. I loved our trip and would go back to GPR again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Daboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Sept 9 - 16th 2006. lst and foremost if you are travelling with children. This is not a great hotel. Not enought for kids to do. The hotel however is beautiful. The beach is fine. The pools are very clean. The entire property is well maintained. Rooms are beautiful. Mattresses are motionless and I found them to be extremely comfortable. The shower stall is amazing. The a la carte restaurants are very good and portions my be smaller for the men but if you are going all inclusive...just order another meal. We found if we tipped, we got above average service from the wait staff. No tipping...they are still pleasant. The spa has a hot tub, sauna and steam room. There's also a cold plunge that felt wonderful and help to reduce the swelling of much walking in the market. Make sure not to stay on 5ht avenue. Too expensive. Take the $3.00 cab ride to the ferry and walk your way back. They don't deal on 5th avenue. The only 2 things I would warn against are that they have REAL time share people in the lobby -- but they are not overly aggressive and the fact that check in is at 3:00. Our travel agent did not tell us that and we had to wait from 10:30 a.m. to 2:00 pm to get our room. They put your bracelet on and you can enjoy all the amenities but that's a long time to wait after travelling for almost a whole day. I highly recommend the Gran Porto Real to anyone and would definately stay there again. WATCH OUR FOR ALL THE TIME SHARE PEOPLE. THEY ARE ALL OVER THE PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “I would return to the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: traveler037
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first all-inlcusive vacation at the Gran Porto Real. Our room was just as we requested, King size bed, ocean view, top floor. Our room was very clean and the mini bar always stocked. The food was pretty good for resort food. But after 5 days it gets a little old. I did not like the Mexican restaurant but the Italian restaurant was very good( I ordered the filet mignon). The buffet breakfast was my favorite, waffles, eggs and omelets made to order and lots of fresh juices and fruits. Franklin was our waiter in the morning and always a pleasure to talk to and would always go out of his way to get you what you needed. The beach in front of the resort was not the greatest, but just go for a walk in either direction to find a great place to swim. It is a very busy beach area. And they were working on rebuilding the beach in front of the hotel while we where there. The location is great, you can walk to shopping district, ferrry terminal and restaurants. My complaints: When we checked in they asked to visit guest services so we did. They told us we could have a free breakfast and tour of the Royal Porto Real and talk to someone about being a Real Club member. DONT FALL FOR THIS, IT IS A TIME SHARE IN DISGUISE!! Even though it says tax and tips included in the all-inclusive, I would say about 50% of the staff made you feel you owed them a tip. I still believe a tip is a GRATUITY and did tip for acceptable service. Some of the staff were great some should not work there. The drinks were good is just depended on the bartender. If I return to Playa Del Carmen for an all-inclusive vacation I would return to the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyAM2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks at the GPR and had a fabulous time. I read the reviews on tripadvisor before I left and can't believe how far from the truth some people can be. The hotel rating is 5 star and our Junior suite and the service provided by the staff was definitely 5 star. The suite was HUGE, clean decorated with taste. We had a nice balcony with a beautiful view. The staff was very friendly and the waiters kept serving us more drinks without us even asking for them. The food was OK but despite the several restaurants, it gets a little boring. But this is a good excuse to have a couple of meals oout in the charming centre of playa del carmen! I checked the weather online before I left and again it could not have been further from the truth. Thunder and rain were predicted, but in fact we had hot sunshine 95% of the time It was tempting to just stay in the hotel and be looked after all day but we wenton a few tours and they were well wrth it! Overall it was like a second honeymoon Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not a single complaint”
Reviews.Author: Meturley
Reviews.Content: We spent our Honeymoon at the GPR and could not find a single thing to complain about. We booked through Thomas Cook in the UK & requested an ocean view, which is exactly what we got. I can see why people have had bad experiences as the rooms towards the rear of the hotel are affected by external building work so make sure you request a sea view room at the front. We have never been all inclusive before and have heard bad reports from friends however we really wanted to go to Playa del Carmen & didnt really have much alternative option, but we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel classes itself as 5* - I would say it was a good 4* We did not get any hassle from anyone with regard to time shares, we did get asked if we wanted to upgrade to the other hotel but declined and that was that. Our room was great and totally spotless, the maids serviced the room 3 times a day and even returned whilst you were out at dinner to re-make the beds, leaving choccies on the pillow. Mini-bar was restocked on a daily basis. We booked a junior suite which cost a small supplement but definately worth it. Food was alot better than we expected. The choice in the buffet restaurant was really good, especially at breakfast with freshly made waffles, pancakes, omlettes on top of all the usual. We tried both restaurants which were good - a bit odd though that the Italian doesnt serve pizza? The hotel is not a big self contained resort, if thats what you want you should go book a big self contained resort! It was perfect for what we were looking for which was a good standard of hotel with excellent access to Playa del Carmen - which is a really nice resort -& surrounding area. Night time entertainment was pretty basic with the same 6 dancers doing different themed dances for 6 nights a week - which if you look at the funny side of it was actually quite amusing to watch. The only down side of this hotel was the loud obnoxious americans - (not saying that they all were and they didnt have much effect on the atmosphere) Some of their attitudes were shocking, I know it was all inclusive but these people almost expected their backsides to be wiped as part of the package! All in all, excellent service, a spotless hotel, excellent location, lovely resort, good food. Yes, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: MichaelE
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my vacation to Playa del Carmen with my girlfriend and I have been looking forward to writing my review about this hotel on this website. First of all, I want to warn you that this is quite a lengthy and detailed review, which you may not want to read entirely. However, I assume since you took the time to use this website, you would like to gather as much information as possible on this hotel before booking your trip. I will also warn you that overall, my experience with the HOTEL was very bad, and therefore, there is some bias in my review. However, I will still be objective in my review and provide both the positives and negatives of this hotel. THE GOOD… Let’s begin with the positives. The location is pretty good, depending what you are looking for. It is beachfront, as it says, and it is right in Playa del Carmen. It is good if you want to do some shopping on 5th avenue (which is overpriced, for the most part). It is in a very touristy area, therefore, you will find it is a bit commercial – there is even a McDonald’s on 5th avenue. If you want the beach and tons of local shops nearby, then this hotel or any hotel in its proximity is a good choice (based on location). If you are looking for a more secluded hotel with a more private beach and away from everything, then do not book here. Staff/Entertainment Most of the staff is nice. Specifically I am referring to restaurant staff and housekeeping, as well as the entertainment staff. I noticed someone had mentioned Spike’s name in a previous review, and I also want to mention that he was great with us too. If you are looking for a place to party at night, talk to Spike and he will give you good advice. Also, our waiter at the Mexican restaurant at the hotel was also very good. If I remember correctly, his name was Manuel, and he was the only person on our whole trip who actually asked how our vacation was going. He seemed to be a very genuine person. I think at most hotels you would stay you will find that the restaurant staff and the entertainment staff will always be nice to you since they are usually the ones who have direct contact with the visitors at the hotel. You would think that would be the same for the staff at the front desk. Unfortunately, this was not the experience I had…but I will get into more detail on that later. Food The food is ok. The Mexican restaurant I enjoyed. The Italian restaurant I did not. I thought that most Italian restaurants would at least make half-decent Italian food. This may be true in most parts of the world, but not on planet Gran Porto Real. The buffets were okay too. Breakfast tended to be better than other meals. Much of the food at dinner is fried, however you will also find grilled foods and some vegetables. If you have checked out websites and noticed it has a Health/Sushi bar and you are looking forward to it, you will be disappointed. They serve the same food as the beach bar, which are nachos and hamburgers. Not that I don’t enjoy nachos and hamburgers, but not at the health/sushi bar. I asked the bartender about it and he said it’s just a name. They used to have a health/sushi bar a few years back, he told me, but obviously not anymore. Drinks The drinks are good and bad. The good part is they give a good amount of alcohol in the drinks, like many places in Mexico do. Not that I’m a heavy drinker (only got drunk once in 7 days), but once in a while it is nice to taste the sweet nectar of liquor in your drink. The bad part is that if you order any drinks mixed with juices they are all made with frozen mixes, i.e., they are not made with fresh fruit. Therefore, they are very sugary as well. If you are a beer-drinker, then I guess you don’t have a problem. THE BAD… As you may have noticed, I have been rating various aspects of my experience on a sliding scale, and have finally reached the negatives. Beach Let’s begin with the beach. I am specifically referring to the beach right in front of the hotel. If you have browsed through pictures on various websites, then you will have noticed that there are boats docked in front of the hotel. This is an accurate depiction of what you will experience while getting your daily dose of Vitamin D in front of the hotel. Should you decide to jump in the water to cool-off from the Mexican sun, be sure to watch your step so that you don’t trip over the numerous sandbags situated along the shoreline. Once you made it to the water, it is best to float along slowly rather than sprinting in due to the numerous rocks that are all waiting for the chance to slash your soles. I will provide you with a solution to these problems: just walk across to the beach in front of the sister hotel, the Royal porto real, and lay on the sand there. If you walk past that a little bit, the beach is perfect. No rocks in the water, and no sandbags. However, if you think the sister hotel, the Royal Porto, will let you use their beach chairs (or whatever they’re called) you are sadly mistaken. My girlfriend and I were told to leave since we had pulled some of those chairs closer to the shore to sit down. Even though the chairs were about 90% empty, a man approached us and told us we could not use the chairs. When we explained to him that we were staying at the hotel next door and nobody was using the chairs, he proceeded to call security on his walkie-talkie. Luckily, we had brought our beach towels with us and lay in the sand of the public beach away from his sacred beach chairs. If you are asking yourself how he knew we were from the other hotel, the Gran porto gives you some very nice neon-yellow plastic wristbands in order to distinguish you from the guests of the Royal porto, with their much more subtle purple wristbands. Just so you know, if you want to see the Royal and its pools and entertainment, you will also not be able to do that, despite what your rep may tell you (as we were told by our Nolitours rep). However, you will have the chance to upgrade to the Royal for just a small fee. And you will be reminded of this every morning, with a pleasant note placed under your door, and every time you visit the front desk…(segway)… Room & Front Desk Finally, I will tell you about my experience when I had just arrived. When we arrived, we were told that we were moved from a standard suite (which we had paid for) to a junior suite (which was an upgrade). So obviously we were happy about it. The reason for the change was the fact that there was construction in our standard suite area, and they were taking care of us. When we had originally booked the room at the Flight Centre, three weeks before our trip, there was no mention of construction by Nolitours (a subsidiary of Airtransat). However, I did get a call from the Flight centre rep about 2 or 3 days before our departure date and he told us about the construction problem, which Nolitours had just told him about. Our options were to cancel, book at another hotel (at our expense, of course) or to go to the hotel, where we will be moved away from the construction area. Although my girlfriend and I were hesitant, we had heard about friends of ours having similar bad experiences, but the hotel and the tour operator took care of them. So we decided, after consulting with the Flight centre rep, that we would go to the hotel we originally booked with: the Gran Porto Real. Back to the front desk. So we took our bags to our assigned room. When we entered, we saw that our king-sized bed I requested, had been inexplicably converted into two double beds. Although I consider myself to be a strong, young lad, I had problems pushing the two beds together due to the immovable marble table situated between the two beds. We continued to walk through the room, which was a pretty good size, until we reached the curtains. When I pulled back on the curtains…well, I think a picture is worth a thousand words, so I have attached a few pictures of our view so you can judge for yourself. When I proceeded back down to the front desk to ask them to change our room because I wanted a different view, they told me to come back the next day because everything was full. When I returned the next day, with the Nolitours rep, Maria Cruz, they said there were no other Junior suites available and that we should come back the next day. I was hesitant, however, Maria told me she would take care of it the next day. The next day came and I went to meet Maria at 8am at the hotel lobby, but she was not there. I located her at around 11 am and we went to speak with the manager, Nicolas Vasquez. He offered me a different room and my girlfriend and I went to check it out. Although our original room offered both a riveting visual and audio experience of the construction, the acoustics in the new room they offered us were much better. Despite it being a view of the street, it sounded as if the construction crew was trying to smash the wall down outside our door. So I returned and told them it was worse. Mr. Vasquez basically told me, in as rude a manner as possible, to take it or leave it because there were no other Junior suites available. This was difficult to comprehend given the fact we had been told the day before that the hotel was not very busy and we did not need to make reservations at the a la carte restaurants due to the fact there were not many guests. He said they did me a favour by upgrading me to a Junior suite. I told him to put me back in a standard suite away from the construction since I was sick of waking up at 6am to the sound of jackhammers and drills. And that’s when we discovered that there were NO standard suites away from the construction. So I asked to be upgraded and he told me to pay for it. Maria, our Nolitours rep, did nothing either. She called her boss but her boss did not want to pay for us to upgrade. Thanks Nolitours! So we stayed in that room for the rest of the vacation. CONCLUDING THOUGHTS… I know that this review was very lengthy, but I thought I should warn you of our experience. This was not isolated either, as we came to find out that almost everyone that had booked with Nolitours (which is a large Canadian tour operator) had the same or similar experience: they booked without knowing about the construction and then found out just before the trip (or in one case, in his second day at the resort) that there was construction. Some people were moved, some were not. I guess if I had yelled obscene remarks in the hotel manager’s face it might have made a difference. So my advice is, if you still decide on staying at the Gran Porto Real, do NOT book a standard suite. I am sure you can tell by my pictures that this construction has been around for quite some time and will not be done in the near future. If you book a junior suite, you are taking your chances. If you book ocean view, you will have no problem with your room…maybe. If you have any questions at all, please do not hesitate to contact me. My email address is espinoza_michael@hotmail.com. I will be contacting Nolitours and Airtransat to see what they are going to do about this situation, because it honestly left a very sour taste in my mouth that such a large company like Nolitours would screw us –for lack of a better phrase - and it was difficult to really enjoy the trip after wasting three days with this hassle. The icing on the cake was delay on the flight home. We arrived at 3:30am instead of the 10:30pm scheduled time. The icing on top of the icing was the stomach sickness I got when I returned home and left me with diarrhea for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “love to up sell and make you wait at front desk Great hotel, good food”
Reviews.Author: canada21693
Reviews.Content: Good. Great hotel, good food clean room nice pool. overal good staff Bad. Front desk poor customer service Hasseld at the front desk to upgrade standard room to junior suite on arrival. Family adjesant room is a pain to get they even said there is none. Construction starts at 6 AM at the north end they will try and fill that area first.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return...”
Reviews.Author: Grazor
Reviews.Content: I had always been rather weary of the AI (All Inclusive) - which for me as a sci-fi fan had always and was only ever intended to mean Artificial Intelligence, rather than for the more mundane All Inclusive as in holidays. So notwithstanding my natural reluctance in my various travels all these years, I chose to jump into a hassle free, getaway with the family the week before they had to return to school. Now I did so with a certain amount of dread and anticipation recognizing that based on my luck (no luck whatsoever) that I might possibly be inviting danger :) So imagine my surprise with 3 days prior to departure that we are notified that there is construction going on at the site that leaves us with choices according to the booking agent (who bless her cotton socks is the star in all of this)! Choices are to cancel (time already booked out from work, kids quite excited about the trip and the evident disappointment if we were to cancel), book another hotel that is part of the Real Resort properties at any additional costs, or get moved to a part of the hotel, that was away from the construction. After much conversation with my wife we decided if they can move us away from the construction zone, we hopefully would not be spending too much time in the rooms and as such it would be a small inconvenience. So we arrive and get told the adjoining rooms for us and our 2 teens (16, 13) were not currently available, thus we are upgraded to junior suites on two different floors that meant that we split up and my dear wife and I each hang with one of the kids on separate floors. I would have to say that Real Resorts practice bait & switch tactics. Let me explain. I noted that I was not the only hotel guest being upgraded that evening. In fact, at least five other guests to my knowledge were upgraded to junior suites (3 families, a young couple, and two single guys out for fun and sharing a room). The junior suites are quite nice and beautifully outfitted. If anything there is almost too much room (trust me that they could have used the overall space of the hotel and make the standard rooms a tad larger). I found the standard rooms to be overly cozy, yes, they were tight and of the many rooms we viewed, none actually overlooked the beach/pool, unless you count those in the area that overlooked the upstairs pool numbered in the 400’s. Therefore, Monday morning per instructions we reported to the front desk and for 10 a.m. and spent the next two hours arguing and negotiating with management. The one thing that they always stuck in our face as they did the very first night, was what our interest would be in transferring to the Royal Porto Real across the street for USD 40 a night more per room. This became a standard part of the pitch to the extent that each night a flyer was pushed through the door with that offer. Add to that a similar offer was made to move up to junior suites inside the Gran Porto Real. With my frustration growing that for a 7 day holiday (with travel 5 days) I was still unpacked, we took a look at the standard rooms and guess and found they backed onto the construction. At that point, I picked up my cell and called our travel agent back Canada. She had spoken to the folks directly at the hotel and they had promised to have us away from the construction site. About two hours later management indicated that we would have a couple of rooms next to each other, rather than adjoining ( important for those families with kids that need a degree of privacy; but where you feel you or they should have immediate access at anytime to each other) for the following day. However he graciously put in that he could offer us a deal of only USD 30 a night to upgrade per room for the rest of our stay to junior suites, or alternatively for USD 40 a night per room an upgrade to the Royal Porto Real across the street We were told that we could keep the two junior suites for another night and that the next day (Tuesday) we should turn up at 11 a.m. and that two rooms would be provided in the 400 area ( third floor but in an area overlooking the street( above the Spa/Mexican in-house restaurant) in front of the hotel near the pool with the swim up bar . Day 3 into our holiday and we have not unpacked and we have to wait until 11 a.m The Manager that had dealt with us on Monday had the day off Tuesday and had not bothered to tell us that he would be off and worse hadn’t bothered to tell the Supervisor of our problem. So I had to regurgitate and go through the same situation to someone else. Per the instructions of our helpful booking agent, we wanted to view the rooms prior to saying yes. We were then told that the two rooms side by each (415 & 416) A/C wasn’t working in one of those rooms and as such we would in fact be provided with rooms on the 500 number level. The room was a standard and tight (as previously mentioned all the standard rooms we saw were tight). It backed onto the construction (as did all the standard rooms and quite a number of the junior suites), as we walked in to check the room, the maids were cleaning and someone was painting the lamps in the room, that was meant for us or our kids. I wasn’t happy and I really didn’t want to get into a serious amount of conversation, I just wanted to unpack and start enjoying my holiday. I went back downstairs with my wife and in essence was ready to give them a piece of my mind and then just buy the damn upgrade to go across the street; however the Supervisor recognizing my evident distaste and disgust, suggested that the junior suite next to the one that I already occupied with my son was available and that they would put us up in there at no additional cost. I acquiesced more because I was getting to the point where I was ready to lose it and also because I was now willing to pay to get peace of mind and start enjoying my holiday. So, we got two junior suites 371 & 373, as mentioned quite spacious (too much room); but we had the good luck to have the construction site as our view out the balcony and of course the non-stop noise of the kitchen to deal with at all times (I really do mean at all times). Noise carries in this place. So enough about my specific adventures, let me try and now provide a somewhat more balanced and objective view of the services. The Staff Hmmm…..most of the staff I found to be incredibly friendly and helpful. My favourites being Theresa & Miriam who served the pool area and ensured I was never without a Dos Equuis. Then my buddy Ivan one of the waiters at the a la carte Marias ( the “Mexican restaurant”) who provided great service and had a wonderful sense of humour. The Food Oh dear…I am deemed somewhat demanding even by my family so you have to balance that with my comments. First most of the chefs at the Gran Porto Real tend to have somewhat of a liberal interpretation of dishes. In the buffet, breakfast is not a bad meal. I enjoyed all my breakfasts there, as the selection is extensive. Lunches were not bad either as the burgers was consistently good, and they invariably had some grilled/bbq foods such as chicken, ribs, sausage and a number of pastas and Mexican influenced (?) dishes. My kids made good use of the numerous fruits/fruit juices available and pastries galore etc. In the evenings, something happened to the food, I think it went substantially downhill at the buffet and I am not sure why; my kids would often thumb their nose up and indicate that they had a preference to dine out with us. Despite the fact that we paid to eat there we ate away from the hotel and its restaurants as often as we ate there where lunch or dinner was concerned. Maria’s – The Mexican a La Carte… Most of the dishes weren’t at all bad. Portions are tiny by North American standards but were fine for me (233lbs), service as I mentioned was generally very very good. IL Pescatore – The Italian Restaurant I am not sure where to start laughing or what’s more ironic. That a restaurant that is named after fish has two fish dishes (salmon being one) and that the food is really, bad. (a couple of other folks who ate there suggested to me it wasn’t so bad, so there is some balance for you). The one time I ate there with my family we all sent our stuff back. Two of us had the shrimp risotto (atrocious), which was a very slovenly and lazy interpretation by the chef. A very pleasant young woman (maybe the maitre d’) asked me after the meal if I had enjoyed my meal, to which I responded would she really like to know. Poor thing said yes and so I shared with her my abject disgust at having to be subjected to long grain rice in a soupy tomato broth with burnt shrimp being paraded as shrimp risotto. The evident dismay was not by any means rewarding; but one has to sometimes speak up. Beach The beach is not bad; but it is relatively small and the sea itself is very shallow ibnfrontof t he beach as one can walk out to for maybe 60 metres and still kneel and have most of one’s body well above water. The numerous sandbags and the fishing, snorkeling boats, that are moored on the beach prevent a certain amount of access. Activities Numerous activities including sailing and kayaking in particular, much of the other activities one had to pay for. Pool and Pool Activities I had never been in a pool where you can walk across any part of it and still swim quite well. The pool at its deepest was only 5ft 3in, so quite neat for those not strong swimmers, but still deep enough for swimmers. Each day they had pool activities from aqua aerobics, volleyball to water polo, which was a great way to socialise. In summary. Would I return, absolutely not. Would I try Real Resorts other properties, no, as I felt my experience was tainted and the consistency of the push to upgrade internally or to one of their other properties was too severe and suggests to me that its' an overall corporate approach that doesnt work for me.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of the food and noise; learned the hard way”
Reviews.Author: shapnup
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 night all-inclusive trip here. This was my 3rd trip overall to Playa, which I love. 5 of 6 of us got sick eating resort food. On our first morning we were awakened by jackhammering on the roof?? I could not believe it. After complaining and requesting a room change, were were questioned by the hotel staff who suggested we were hearing things?? They accomodated the move, putting us across the other side of development. Unfortunately the nightly beach disco down the way kept us awake from 9:30 pm till 2 am. It was insanely loud and not what you'd expect from a 4-5 star resort. I would highly recommend against this hotel. This was a $6500 mistake. Toilet paper became the currency of choice. In 8-9 trips to mexico and carefully eating in restaurants, I never expected to get sick at a resort. General food choices were ok, and 2 other restaurants served good food under the all inclusive plan. Food was a good value for families. One restaurant of many you have access to was at the sister hotel across the street (mexican food) and the other was in Gran Porto (forgot the name, fancy cuisine) Recreation room and pool were nice, beach front was awesome. Do not do the all inclusive and ask questions about noise, etc. If all else fails, go to a hotel not undergoing construction like the quiet, simple beach front Playa Maya where I stayed several years ago. No elevator, reasonable rates, but people were nice, lots of restaurants and shops around

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, # 1 Philippe (Bar Tender)”
Reviews.Author: polishseniorita
Reviews.Content: The Gran Puerto Real in the Mayan Riviera had to have been the best place to visit, the people, meaning the employee's were tremendously friendly and helpful. The food was great at the a la carte restaurants, Mexican and Italian restaurants, the buffet in the hotel could have been changed up a little daily for the breakfasts, other then that a 4+ * hotel. Can't really say anything bad about the hotel once-o-ever, for a first time get-a-way I would definately recommend this hotel over many others. The beaches clean, alot of daily activities, the entertainers, Spike, Allan and the girls are a blast, they really know how to entertain there audiences. The Nightly shows were facinating as well, never a dull moment at the Mayan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: ProVacationer
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 7 days at the GPR in Playa. I took 34 family members (half kids, half adults). Everyone had a great time. The hotel was very nice, exceeding our expectations and the staff bent over backwards to make sure that we had everything we wanted or needed during our stay. We were a little concerned about a few things before the trip because of some of the reviews we had read, but that was all put to rest once we arrived. The grounds are extremely well kept, everything felt comfortable and the architecture was very high-class, yet authentic Mexican. You really felt like you were in a 4-star resort. The hotel was not overbooked and we all got the rooms we requested. The Jr. Suites we very spacious -- much bigger than almost any hotel room I've ever stayed in the US (I've stayed in hundreds all over the country). The bathrooms were very nice and the showers were to die for. The views from all of the ocean view and ocean front rooms are great. Check-in was a breeze, but there was a bit of a wait at check-out because so many people were all trying to leave at the same time. Any no, no one got hit with any unexpected or hidden charges upon check-out. The noise level was not really bad in any of our rooms (we had 9 rooms -- 5 ocean views and 4 that overlooked the construction of the new building next store). Even the construction view rooms were nice and everyone that had one confirmed that what they gave up in view was worth it for the money they saved. The food at the Albatross buffet was about on par with most Las Vegas buffets -- most was adequate, but very good and some excellent. The Mexican restaurant -- Maria's was our least favorite -- decent, but nothing to write home about. The Italian restaurant was much nicer, bigger portions, very good quality, great taste, excellent presentation and fast, courteous service. Plus, unlike the other restaurants, it was air conditioned. The beach restaurant (palapa) was nice too. Everyday they served hotdogs, hamburgers, quesadillas, chips and queso, french fries, ceviche' (very good), etc. It was good and extremely convenient, especially if you did not feel like putting on shoes and a shirt to go inside for lunch. You get room service for free once a day with the AI plan. The kids really liked this, ordering breakfast some days, lunch others and dinner one night. The room service food was very good and much better than we or anyone else we talked to had expected. The bar and wait staff were the best!!! Theresa, our go-to waitress around the pool was fabulous and was always there when you wanted a drink. She even brought extras incase you happened to miss her on her last round. Miguel, Alejandro, Norbert and the rest of the bartenders were fast with the drinks, poured/mixed/blended whatever you wanted, however you wanted it and as strong or weak as you desired ALL the time. After a couple of drinks, they usually knew what you wanted even before you asked. One thing that we did was ask for the premium liquors in our drinks so that they did not pour the cheap stuff. It doesn't cost anything extra, so you might as well get the good stuff. They will pour Suaza Commemeritivo, Absolut, etc, if you ask. But, the hotel only serves Dos XX on tap and only stocks it in the mini-fridges (mini-fridge is free and each day they will stock it with 2 bottled beers, about 6 bottled waters, cokes, diet cokes, V-8, etc. *** Note, a tip along with a note requesting extra cervezas always got us more beers in the fridge. There is also a beach bar towards the north end of the hotel. It has swings for chairs -- cool. The only bad thing is that it shuts down at 5:00. The Pool Bar closes between 10:30 and 11:30 each night and then the lobby bar will stay open for another hour or two after that. So, if you want to party late, you either have to do it in your room, bring drinks from your room or the 24-hour self-serve lounge (stocked with beer tap, various liquors, wine and champagne) or go out to the clubs. The pool is really nice. Everyone loved it. We never had to fight for chairs there or at the beach. There ware plenty of activities to keep everyone happy too -- pool and beach volleyball, water polo, water aerobics, horseshoe tournaments, kayaks, bingo, etc. The activities directors were REALLY good. Spike (head activities guy) was a kick in the butt. He even went out with us a couple of nights to Senor Frogs and Mambo Cafe. Too much fun or "Oh my gato" as he would say!!! We did not really spend much time at the 3rd floor pool with the swim up bar. It stayed fairly deserted most of the time. It was small, but still nice and the bar shut done everyday by about 5:00. The beach right behind the hotel was not really that great. We did not spend a whole lot of time there. First of all, the pool area and bars were too much fun, and secondly, if we wanted to hit the beach, we just walked 3 or 4 minutes over to the beach at the Royal (next door) which was great. In truth, no one in our group or hardly anyone else we talked too seemed to care too much about it either. Several of us booked a 4-hour fishing trip in Puerto Morelos through Best Day Tours in the lobby. The trip was nice. We fish out of El Cid marina on the 34' Il Pescadora II, a nice, well-equipped boat. The fishing was so-so, we only caught a few yellow tail snappers and I landed a 5' barracuda -- nice fight and good eating. We brought our filleted fish back to the hotel and Carlos (manager at Albatross) arranged for the chef to prepare half for lunch and the other half for dinner -- at no additional cost. They made a big deal out of it, putting on a nice show and wonderful presentation; bring out our grilled fish on big platters with garnish and side dishes like rice with shrimp and vegetables. It was great. Others in the group booked everything from Jungle Tours, snorkeling and fishing trips, and trips to Cozumel to the Pirate Ship lobster dinner cruise. Most trips were booked through the dive shop on the grounds -- in the hall next to the pool. They enjoyed everything except the jungle tour on the jet skis (boring). And, don't expect to catch many fish if you book a trip with the boats docked behind the hotel. As for the boats behind the hotel, the hotel can’t do anything about it. The beach and the water are public property and the GPR sits on the calmest beach around -- that's why the boats dock there. All in all, it really was not that bad though. The Kid's Club was great too. The kids (ages 3-10) enjoyed it a lot. There were plenty of organized and semi-organized activities to keep them busy. The location of the GPR is superb. It is just a one and a half block walk to Fifth Ave. -- the main drag with all the shops, bars and restaurants. *** Note, EVERYTHING costs less if you go a block off of 5th. There are ATMs everywhere (none in the hotel though) and the closest bank (Scotia Bank) is just 2 1/2 blocks straight down the street from the hotel. Nothing was stolen from anyone in our group or anyone else we spoke to at the hotel. *** Note, we felt VERY safe both on the hotel grounds and walking the streets of Playa. I've been to the big super resorts before and you just feel like you get lost in the crowd. The GPR only has around 300 rooms and that means that the staff really gets a chance to know you and vice-versa. We felt at home. Everyone in our group has said that they would definitely return to the GPR again and I really believe them. I know that we will likely be back too. There is no doubt that you definitely get your money's worth at the Gran Porto Real. I will post trip pictures as soon as I am able to get them all grouped together and uploaded. If you have specific questions, please e-mail me and I will respond: davidadrake@yahoo.com.

Reviews.Title: “Gan Porto "Real" value!!”
Reviews.Author: izzyinstl
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real was wonderful. Just got back today 7/21/06 after 7 wonderful nights in room 323 Jr Ocean view suite. Will post pics soon! Here is my report: THE BAD.. (not much) 1. Had trouble with card not activating the electricity or air cond. Was moved from room 327 to 323 (a better view) immeadiately so not a prob for us. 2 The ocean waters had some seaweed and rocks but not in excess. Really only swam in ocean 2x so not a big deal for us. Beach raked and cleaned daily. Security guards watched close and we felt very safe. THE GOOD: service: staff very friendly and always ready to help, room service brought us late night sandwiches, fries every night with a call. Room was cleaned every day and had fridge stocked with beer soda and water daily. food: The food was very good. Did have 1 instance where the cheese in the stuffed pepper wasn't fully melted and actually a little chilled in the center that suggests that they are refridgerated then microwaved. Other than that always was hot fresh and good! The grounds were kept very clean and they had a large staff on hand to make sure. We felt the entertainment was good and the shows were good (every nite at 9) ok guys this for you ...i could see the gals changing in the massage area. yes breasts exposed! (not that I was trying to see them :) The hotel is perfectly located! Its right on the beach and right off fifth avenue. This is perfect!!!! The whole thing was perfect cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: priscillaBurleson_TX
Reviews.Content: We went to the Gran Porto Real Resort July 2-6th. We had 29 people traveling with us and we had all read the different reviews before we went. We were also warned about the over booking problem & were scared that would happen to us & we all wanted to stay together at the same hotel. When we arrived we were treated great. We arrived early expecting our room not to be ready & it was, we were in it by 11:00am when we arrived. We paid extra for an ocean view & that is what we got. We asked to be on the 3rd floor & that too was done. (Room 360). The room was big and clean. The food was average(you are at an All Inclusive after all). The buffet for lunch will cook you anything you would like if you ask them to. Jhonny at the Mexican Food Restaurant is a very friendly waiter, ask for his table area. Spike the Activities Director is awesome!! Eva ( short for his name), he is an awesome poolside waiter that will wait on you constantly while at the pool. The pool is awesome, both pools & the hot tub. There are plenty of chairs out. The nightly entertainment is good. The beach right in front of the hotel is a little bad, but walk next door & it gets better. This is really an all around great place to stay, you can't beat the location to 5th street either! We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service ever!”
Reviews.Author: LOS CONEJOS
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our vacation to Cozumel and Playa del Carmen and the experiance with the hotel was horrible at playa del Carmen. After staying at a three star hotel in Cozumel (el Cozumeleno) where we were treated like royalty our expections were higher for the Gran Portal Real since it was a five star hotel. Before making our reservation we had read the reviews and went along with the postive views that other people had said about hotel. However, it was completely the opposite and we should had listen to the negative reviews. They were more accurate. My husband, daughter and I stayed for two nights at the hotel and we where lucky to only be there for two days and not our whole vacation. The staff is very unfriendly and unattentive. The food in the buffet was horrible along with their service. They are short staffed at the bar and you have to wait a long timefor your water down drinks that by the way are the worst. Their margaritas and pina coladas are sweet with no taste to pina or margarita. If you can't swim forget about getting inside their pool because both of them are five and half feet deep. My daughter is 10 and is only four feet three. And if you want to sit by the pool there are bugs and mosquitos flying around you. And no one in sight to provide you with a water don drink. And that is only the beginning, when we arrived at our room, we realized that our mini bar was not full. It took the hotel several hours to fill it after we requsted the service. Our balcony door latch was broken and the rail from the baclony was loose and nothing was done when I reported the problem. Also the so called concierge was never available. I didn't know what came with the alleged all inclusive package was about. To top it off when we were finally leaving that hell hole hotel,we received a notice satating that our water and electricity was going to be cut off due to inspections from the CFE (Mexico's Electric Company) also the bell boy never came to assist us with our luggage, we decided to leave after we realized that it had been over half hour since we had requested one to come to assist us. Overall the experience was horrible, I would never recomend this placed to anyone. Please do not make the same mistake we did. Oh and the pictures on their website do not pertain to the hotel. They show you parts of the hotel accross the street that is rated as a Dimaond hotel. We had the option of statying there for an addtional $40.00 a night, I am glad we didn't otherwise I would be talking bad about them too. Once again do not stay here. I know what luxury and good service is and believe me this hotel has neither. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions on the hotel. Sincerely, Jimenez Family.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did our research on the hotel and read about the negitive comments. We have a fabulous time! We took 4 kids ages 8, 12,13 and 15. Yes, the boats were on the south side of the hotel, but we found it rather charming, plus you could just walk through them to the water so I never knew what the big deal was there. The food was really good. We ate at the buffet as well as Maria's and the Italian place. We also ate tacos on 5th ave at the intersection of the main hotel road and 5th. They were excellent. Hair braiding was expensive, but like all things, you have to negotiate. We had two heads with long hair done for $80. The fishing is the same. Go see Jose on the beach. He made us a good deal. We also went to Xhel-ha and I highly recommend that. We used the spa and the gym at the hotel, both were great. All the activities put on by the hotel were very nice. The staff was great and the facilities awesome. We wanted to hear about the time share, but could not find the time to go over there with all there was to do. We did talk to another couple from Oklahoma and they told us a little about the deal. It does sound like a pretty good deal. But they said allow for more than the 90 minutes they tell you. We had a great family vacation at a great resort. We have traveled to Jamaica, Hawaii and Mexico and this was better that Jamaica and compreable to Hawaii. I think some people can find something to complain about even in paradise! If you have any questions, please fee free to email me. I'll be planning our trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel / Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: 5womack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real the week of June 25th. We had 6 people in our group, ages 17 to 43. Our vacation was spectacular. We plan to go back this fall/winter. We had excellent service, especially in the restaraunts. We aren't buffet type people, but we ate the dinner buffet the first night and it was pretty good. We thought the breakfast buffet was very good. The chefs will prepare anything you like. We really enjoyed Maria's and Il Pescatore, the food was very good. We went bill fishing and Ricardo at the main restaraunt prepared some of our fish one evening. It was absolutely delicious and they even had a special table waiting for us with a bottle of wine, etc. Another night, our son turned 21 and Maria's captain, Eleazar, had a cake prepared for him, served him a special birthday drink, in addition to the usual welcome drinks at Maria's, etc. Every encounter with hotel staff was excellent. The service was better than we could imagine. Upon arrival, we did ask for extra hangers but never received them, but that was the only oversight we experienced. Everything else was great. We loved the location. Close to shopping, beach clubs down the beach, but not too close. The rooms were nice. We had the Junior Suites which had a nice view of the ocean from the balcony. Not all of the rooms have ocean views though. Ocean front is an upgrade. We did not upgrade but still had nice view. We also went bill fishing on Albatros Charters. The whole family went. It was an excellent experience. We caught a 150+ pound shark, a white marlin, 2 mahi mahi, 3 barracudas, bonitas (one was the shark bait), a tuna got away. The crew of the Albatros were incredible. They were busy changing bait, cleaning the boat, etc. the entire trip. They even offered to prepare us fish quesadillas on the boat, but we had the hotel prepare us a box lunch for the trip. FYI: No bananas on the boat. Bad Luck for fishing. We threw them overboard. As you can see, we had pretty good luck with the fishing!!! We also rented a van and went to Tulum to see the ruins. Very pretty and interesting but go early to avoid the crowds. FYI: entrance is $4.50 USd as opposed to the $45 and up charge to go with group. You can also pay a guide once you get there. We opted to do our own thing though. We wish we were still there. Had a great time. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “The good and bad of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my first time writing a review and I thought everyone should know about our trip. My husband and I took our 14 month old to visit this hotel for the first time. I was very apprehensive after reading all the reviews, but, decided to tough it out anyways and see for myself. Well, I should've believed and heed the warnings on the reviews. Pros: - Rooms : We had suite #153, it was georgeous, big stone carved posts and lots of beautiful carved framed mirrors, door, and headboard. The suite had 2 balconies, 1 faces the street and a separate one that faces the beach. It was the last suite on the ground floor and only 10 steps away from the beach bar. The suite was huge, with huge shower, which the pressure and temperature was excellent. We lucked out in this sweet since it faced the Royal hotel (sister hotel) and it's the same side where the winds were constantly blowing. If you were in the other suites, you wont get any breeze at all and it can be hot. You don't even get the breeze in the pool, since the hotel blocked all the breeze. Can't complain about the suite itself. - Service: Was excellent. At all the bars, we didn't have to wait for more than 1 min to get served. The restaurant staff was wonderful also. They always had a highchair for our baby and made sure they were always clean. - Checkin: We got the room we requested, down to the king sized, oceanview suite with a crib. - Location: It was a couple of blocks from 5th ave, where all the vendors are and it was great to be able to take the stroller and walk down there whenever we wanted to. Now the cons: - Check-in: Took forever to check in...at least 30 min, mainly because there was only 1 person checking people in for the first 15 min. Then, there was a guy ranting and raving about being next to the construction site, which our seat was the furthest way from the site. The lobby is not air conditioned, so it was hot and humid...be prepared to sweat and wait. - Room: The minibar wasn't stocked when we got there, but, after the brought the crib, a guy came back with all the drinks and stocked it up (after being in the room for about 3 hours). - Location: It is at the end of Main Street, and it's a public beach. Therefore, lots of locals that come and watch and enjoy the beach, as well as watching you. It's good that it's close to 5th street, but, horrible since it's very busy with a bunch of locals making out or watching you. - Beach: There's only about 10 yd that doesn't have any sandbags on them. And it's very rocky once you hit the water. The beach isn't very big at all...the smallest we've been to in Mexico and we've visited several hotels in Cancun, Playa and Cozumel. The best beach is still in Barcelo Maya Hotel in PDR. Lots of seaweeds too. - Pool: Very small pool and they play the towel game here. For those of you that are not aware of the towel game, it's where you come down first thing in the morning with your beach towels and put it on the pool chairs to "reserve" it then leave....no telling when you come back, but, you'd have a chair for you. Horrible...we didn't like that at all, as we saw numerous people doing it. They just don't have enough chairs by the pool. So, we hung out in the beach instead, where there's plenty of chairs. The pool water was also warm, whereas the ocean is much nicer (cooler). - Restaurants: With a 14 month old, we didn't want to subject him, us and everyone else around us to a screaming child waiting for food, so we never did the ala carte. We heard that it wasn't that great anyways. And it looked like the italian restaurant was the only air conditioned one. Marias is at the street side so if you get a table by the street, everyone gets to watch you eat. The buffet was super hot...no AC.. if you go, go to the very back of the restaurant where at least the breeze goes to. The food was not great for a buffett. The Barcelo Hotel in PDR was much better. There were quite a few Spanish people, some from cuba there and they seemed to know most of the foods they were serving in the buffett. For us, it wasn't great. Breakfast was about the best buffett. That's it .. hope you enjoyed the review. Would we go back to this hotel? Nope, not unless it was a free trip. We just got lucky in our suite...if it wasn't for our super suite (location, size, etc), we would not be happy at all in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MKay48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Playa Del Carmen last night. We visited the G P R from Jun 22-29. Overall we had a great time. We are in our late 40's. My review may be long, but the many reviews I read before my trip were helpful to me. Hope this will help you in planning your vacation and making a resort selection. Our family has taken cruises and traveled in Europe and other locations. We honeymooned at Sandal's, in Montego Bay, Jamaca. A few years ago we stayed in Cancun, at the Beach Palace, with our teenage sons. Last year, the four of us selected the Domincan Republic. Over all, Playa Del Carmen is one of our favorite locations. This trip was for just the 2 of us. The boys would have enjoyed this location also. We flew in on a direct flight from Atlanta. We upgraded to the first class section of our Vacation Express Flight, as my husband is 6'5 and enjoyed the extra leg room. Along with this section you are served a sandwich or a salad and unlimited drinks are included. Upon arrival at the G P R check in was very easy. Our Jr. Suite was ready for us. It was located on the 2nd floor facing the street and Royal Real property next door. Although a beach view is nice, the street location was entertaining also. The room was always kept clean. The mini fridge was always stocked. Bottled water was always available as it is suggested that you not brush your teeth with the tap water. This is how our trip to the Dominican Republic was also. In Cancun the hotel water was purified. One complaint I have is that the shower pressure was low and the water was very hot one miniute and very cold the next. My second issue was that the construction was on the same end as our room, #287. Each morning hammering and saws did wake me up. A positive to this was that I got up early each day and enjoyed a much longer day at the pool and the beach. A third problem was our neighbor snored so loud the first 4 nights that it kept us awake. I would like to note that we did not complain to the hotel about any of the above issues. We enjoyed our stay even with these little inconveniences. The food in the hotel was very good. For an all inclusive we thought it rated very high. No reservations were required for either of the specialty locations. We enjoyed both of these choices in addition to the daily hotel buffet selections. Pablo, our waiter at the pool was very personable and always near by when you needed anything. Each day I enjoyed the nachos at the pool grill. Hotdogs and hambergers were also served out there. We used room service about 3 times. Having breakfast delivered to our room was a special treat. This service is available 24 hours a day. Made to order omlets and great pancakes were some of my favorites at the buffet each morning. Enjoy eating and being waited on, worry about your weight when you get home! It did not seem to matter if the men wore long or short pants for the evening meals. We had been told they must wear long pants but there was never an issue about this. There was a very relaxed dress code in this resort. I did not even observe any topless ladies. My husband saw a couple on the beach, he said. I noticed topless ladies in Cancun as well as in the Dominican Republic. Over all the service was great. The room was kept clean, we did not get any towel art, and we only left a tip one day. Tips are nice and if someone gave us special service I was happy to give a tip. The entire resort staff provided us with great service. The lobby bar staff was always friendly and willing to fix whatever we asked for. The pool staff kept the drinks coming. The entertainment staff worked hard to keep the guests who wanted to be entertained busy. Be sure to check out the swing bar,down to the left, on the beach and go up to the 3rd floor pool if you want a little quiet time in the sun. Walk down past the lobby to serve your self a drink or grab finger foods late at nignt or between meal times. The resort location was excellent if you enjoy being in walking distance to shopping. Walmart was a long walk from the hotel. We took a taxi to Akumal for a day trip, it cost about $20 US one way. We were dropped off at the dive shop on the public beach. There were a couple of places to eat and a few little shops in this area. We enjoy visiting Akumal on Sunday when the locals go to the beach. We took another day trip to Cozumel. It is serveral blocks to walk to the peir to catch the ferry. If you prefer a cab it will cost about $3 US to ride to the peir each way. The resort is very convenient to many other locations for day trips and exploring the area. One last tip. JUST SAY NO! Yes the time share people are around. One tricked us by saying they were one of the guest relations staff and wanted to tell us about the hotel and area. We were signed up for a 90 minute presentation accross the street. We did not show up and no one called or bothered us about it later. We talked with one couple who did attend the presentation. They were given a few gifts for attending (bottles of booze and a beach bag) after they insisted on collecting the items promised. Also beware of the street venders on 5th Av. and around the area. Once again Just Say NO! and keep walking if you do not want to shop in their location. We enjoyed all 7 days of our vacation and would return to the Gran Porto Real. Very few locations are perfect, but go prepared to enjoy yourself and take the good with the bad and you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a princess!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Gran Porto Real for our 25th anniversary with our friends & loved it! I spent a day on the computer reading trip advisor & we both picked this one. You will not be disappointed. It is nicer than the pictures. Greated in lobby with a drink called Hurricane Wilma. Very good. The rooms are luxurious with marble tile, columns everywhere, large bathroom & shower. Even a phone in bathroom. Our travel agent upgraded us to a Jr. suite oceanview so expected to maybe be able to see the beach from our balcony. Wow, we were oceanfront & could even lay in bed & view the turquoise water. Ate at all their restaurants which were all very good. Mostly used the buffet since it was convenient & had specially made omelet every morning as we ate facing the pool & water. Spent most of our time at the little outside swing bar at the far end of the hotel beach & loved Sergio the bartender. We wanted to take him home! The beach was very nice, but there are some sandbags at the far end and the little fishing boats at the other end. My husband chartered one of the boats for 4 hrs. of fishing, but only got 1 bite. Great location, you are only a couple of blocks from shopping in downtown Playa del Carmen. Just a short walk & it was fun to barter on everything we bought. Can ususally get it for about 1/2 price. Went to Mayan ruins in Tulum! Great.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: dwdrummer
Reviews.Content: WOW! My new wife and I just returned from our honeymoon in Mexico where we stayed in the Gran Porto Real. We didn't want to come home! We had a junior oceanview suite and the view was spectacular! 98% of our trip was awesome! There were a few hangups. the bad side is, we are picky eaters. The restraunts were alright but not incredible. We never went hungry or anything, there just wasn't anything that we had that was "jaw dropping". The shower was nice and big but the water temperature changed drastically from one second to the next. On sunburned shoulders the water seemed to be 300 degrees and the next second you were standing in 30 degree water. The pool on the beach was great. While my new wife can lay out all day and be content, i am a busy body and must be moving. The guys who planned and executed activities were amazing! They could remember just about everyone's name and where they were from after being told just one time! They were very active in getting everyone involved. While our maid did keep our room very tidy, we were a little disappointed that we didn't get any of the towel art on our bed. I even left tips and nothing was ever there. I made one phone call to the front desk and within 10 minutes a lady was making swans out of towels on our bed! All the service was great. Very fast and friendly. I was kind of worried about the construction but we never heard anything in room 343. If you go to the pool on the roof it is much more calm but you can hear the construction from there. We weren't too fond of 5th ave. While it did display alot of the spanish culture, you definatley had to keep both eyes open and watch your pockets. Vendors would constantly try to urge you into their stores and cut you off even to get you to come in. This wasn't too big of a deal, just look straight ahead and keep walking. Overall we had a great time!!! The positives definatley out-weigh the negatives and we plan to go back next year! If you have any questions about this resort just shoot me an email and i'll respond as quickly as possible! Safe Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to Gran Porto Real from Real Playa del Carmen. Real Playa del Carmen was a dump. We had a wonderful time at GPR, our standard room was spacious and nice, the pools were beautiful, food was great, nightly shows were entertaining, staff was very friendly and helpful. This resort is in a great location, walking distance from 5th avenue shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real from June 5 -13, 2006. We paid for a Jr. suite in the all-inclusive plan. The room had a view of Consitutes Avenue and if you turned your head directly to the right you could see the ocean about 200 yards away. The room was very spacious and looked exactly like the pictures I had seen on this site. I was extremely worried upon check-in after reading all the negative reviews about overbooking and not receving the room you paid for. Once we opened the door to our room I was pleasantly surpised. Room is very spacious and has a very spacious shower. So far things were going very smoothly. I was starting to relax and decided to take a shower after the long day of travel. What I experienced was a shower that exploded and was spraying me with scolding hot water. The lever in which you pull up had broken off and water was going everywhere. To my delight within 15 minutes of contacting the front desk someone came to look at the shower. He left for 10 minutes and showed back up with a new spout and did fix the shower. My girlfriend and I enjoyed the room a great deal until about our 5th night into our vacation. She started to smell some sort of chemical coming through the vent and at first I disregaded it. Then a few hours later I started to smell something and we both tried to just live with it. Each day the smell seemed to be getting worse and finally on our last day we couldn't take it anymore. We found out that the smell was coming directly above us in room 306. They were painting the entire room. After complaining numerous times they finally sent someone to our room after about an hour and a half of complaining. They brought in a deodorizer and said that would take care of it. We went back down to the beach giving it a try and when we arrived back to our room about 4 hours later the smell was worse. We demanded another room and finally got moved to another Jr. Suite but with double beds. After realizing what we were smelling for the last couple nights I was upset but I had to remember that I was in Mexico. Alright enough about the bad news! The Gran Porto Real has a great Location! It is only 2 blocks from 5th Avenue which is where you definitely need to go. It has everything from shopping to great restaurants to nightlife where you can party all night long. I highly recommend the restaurant La Adela which is on 5th Ave. It is authentic mexican food which was wonderful. The beach at Gran Porto Real is really small and the water does have a lot of rocks. Next door at the Royal Porto has a much better beach to swim in. Overall I enjoyed my stay at Gran Porto Real except for the food. I highly recommend that if anyone has a sensitive stomach to stay away from most things at the Buffet called Albatros. The buffet is an open -air restaurant where everything sits out for some time. The cheeses and meats are very questionable because you are sitting in an 80 degree or more environment. The other two restaurants are Maria's and I believe Il Pescadore. They are a Mexican and Italian Restaurant. I enjoyed both places but for some reason the food didn't agree with me. I had horrible somach pains the entire trip but fought through and enjoyed our stay. Try eating out if you get the all inclusive because the food on 5th avenue was extremely good. I really enjoyed the all inclusive drinks at the Gran Porto Real. Say hello to Evanisto on the beach. He was great and $1 tips go along way. I noticed that I tipped more frequently then most people. You need to realize they don't make a lot and what's a few more dollars when you are on vacation. Overall I would stay again at this resort but not sure I would get the all-inclusive. There are so many choices just a couple blocks away. Having a drink anytime was nice but not sure it was worth the extra money. I think next time I go to Playa Del Carmen I will stay next Door at the Royal Porto Real. Playa Del Carmen was very nice and it was very relaxing . There were a few problems along the way and yes some stomach pain. (Watch out for room service.) I had to pray to the porcelain gods my second night thanks to the chicken fried tacos. After re-evaluating my experience I would go back and just bring some more antacids. It was a very memorable experience. Its what you make it. Have fun! The service was outstanding except for a couple people at the front desk. I wish they had more choices of beer only had Dos Equis Lager. No need for reservations of any kind at the restaurants. Never needed to wait and the waiters were always on top of things. If you speak spanish that is a plus. If you are looking for a hotel where you can relax on the beach have a few cocktails and never need to take a taxi this is the spot. We stayed in or around the hotel our entire stay except for going to Cozumel and taking the Jungle Tour through Aqua World. I wish I was there right now :) Hope this helped.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time at Grand Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: kati_2005
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Vacation today i usually never write comments but this place really deserves it. This place exceeded my expectation and really knows the meaning of making a great vacation. Avenida 5 where all the shops are at is's just 2 blocks up the street you do not even need a taxi. We took our 4 children and my mother and everyone was very attentive with all of us. All the staff is very friendly and so willing to help. I will go back in a heart beat. I absolutly had a great time....When you go, go to Maria's rest and ask forJAVIER great waiter......any questions please feel free to e-mail mv7331@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Crowded and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Sheuser
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Playa Del Carman. After three nights of having to call the front desk at 2 AM due to noise we moved across the street to the Royal Porto Real and found a wonderful resort. While the staff was sympathetic they we not able to control the situation. If you are looking for loud and lively this is it. If you need a rest filled time keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Texanchick
Reviews.Content: Had a great time! Staff was great - attentive and friendly. The maids even left flowers and towels in the shape of hearts on our bed one night (our daughter's stuffed animals were propped neatly against pillows every day). Buffet was pretty good - lots of choices. The Mexican and Italian restaurants were really good! Very convenient to shopping; not too far from Tuluum and Xcaret. Only snag was the first room (junior suite with terrace) overlooked an interior roof and construction, but once we upgraded, we got a great room overlooking the pool with the ocean beyond. Nice waves to body surf in, could have done without the sandbags, but understandable due to mother nature. Nice rooms with lots of space.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: policegirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just celebrated our 10 year anniversary at the Gran Porto Real, Playa Del Carmen. I have to say we had the best time ever! The hotel was wonderful, our room was beautiful and the huge shower was awsome! The staff at this hotel were all so helpful and fun and the food was delicious! We ate mostly at the buffet because it was so easy and close but they had such a wide range of food, drinks etc. that there was always something delicious! We ate at Maria's once and at Ilpescatori once and they were both wonderful as well!!! The local people in Playa Del Carmen are truly sweet people who are eager to please you and treat you like royalty! Our room had a partial ocean view and the only thing that I would even complain about a little was the bed was a little hard, but that is too be expected when you are at a hotel. Otherwise, it was all perfect! Right on the beach, two blocks from all the shops and within walking distance to the ever important Wal-mart!! If you get a chance to go to Walmart, it was interesting to see the different types of items that they have in Mexico and the difference in the way things are sold. The beach here is gorgeous! We snorkled at this beach and saw parrot fish, box fish, lobsters, rays etc!!! The drinks are great, especially the ones that Fillipe makes at the 3rd story pool! whew!!! They also have great nightly entertainment with a different show everynight. We had swans made out of towels with flowers sprinkled over them in our room, chocolates left by the maids as well! Please remember to tip these people, maids, waiters etc!! They work hard for you and always treated us wonderful! I would recomend this place and will be back to stay again. The crowd here seemed to be a fun crowd but more mature than your typical teenage/college kids. There were also families with children here and they all seemed to have a good time. (FYI -for parents, the beaches here all have some women that go topless, although it was few and far between at this location) Also, you are within walking distance to the Ferri to Cozumel and I must recomend doing this! There was live entertainment on one of our ferries and when you get to Cozumel, rent a scooter! For $25 for the whole day it is worth it, ride around the island. It was interesting to see the other side of cozumel, it was different types of shores and waters. We also did the all day excursion to Xel-ha (pronounced "shellha") which was so much fun and for once price it included admission, snorkeling gear, drinks, food, snacks, and they will give you each a pack of their sunblock so don't pay $17 for a bottle. Good luck and have a great time on your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Gran Porto Real, we got a ----- room with a view of the street and construction noise. We complained as we had stayed there before and knew that we paid for a superior room and should get one. They said that was a superior room and they were fully booked and could do nothing. When we demanded they give us a refund because we were going home, they whisked us away for 3 days to their Sister Resort in Tulum. The Sister Resort was fabulous. Great food, beautiful beach, great service, beautiful rooms. We went back to the Gran Porto Reale for days 4 - 7 and got our superior room with an ocean view. My advice, avoid this place as they may try to screw you over like they did us. They oversell the resort and those who don't know, stick with the ----- room. Plus the food is ok for breakfast and lunch but dinner was always gross.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: sydney101
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to here from the sister hotel in Cancun (Costa Real) which was a dump. The costa real is listed as a 5 star but compared to the Porto Real was barely a 3 star. Beach & Pool great. Food lovely, particulary Asiana (great Sushi) Marie Marie (Mexican French) The buffet ala carte menu fantastic. Thought the Itialian restaurant was awful we didn't even eat our meals and the Mexican restaurant pretty bad too. Its a new hotel so I suppose a few teething problems, even though the hotel is luxurious 5 star the staff aren't trained for a 5 star. (kept red wine in fridge etc and didn't understand when I todl them it should be served at room tempeture etc) We found alot of them rude, unhelpful and when you did get a nice waiter it was an exception. All in all the service was pretty bad, mini bar never re-stocked, rude staff but still worth staying here as it is genuinely a 5 star and apart from the two bad resturants, the food is great.
