Our laundry was overcharged and it took about an hour to sort it out, again they need to learn about service, the customer is always right, instead of arguing and trying to prove they're right over 10 dollars of laundry. A ring also went missing from my room, my fault I didn't put it in the safe but annoying all the same.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we had our first holiday in Mexico and the Gran Porto was great good selection of food in the buffet the two al a carte restaraunts were great the staff were so attentive and jolly we had a standard room which was ok the room was spotless the maids doing a great job we had no problems with check in the location was good all in all i would reccomend this hotel to any one you will not be dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: VetTechGirl513
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GPR for our honeymoon and had a wonderful time! We had NO problems at check in. Our room was ready right when we got there, which was about 1pm, and it was more than I expected. Absolutely beautiful. The service at the restaurants was excellent. They always kept our drinks full, and cleared our plates the second we were done eating. The waiters were always smiling and very nice people. The bell boys were so helpful as well. The drinks were strong and the food was good. We looked forward to eating at the buffet every day! The beach does leave a little bit to be desired, but it was fine. There are sandbags and fishing boats, but if you walk alittle further down, it's fine. There were lots of lounge chairs for sunbathing as well. I thought the night entertainment wasn't too bad. We enjoyed watching them. The maid service was also excellent. I have nothing to complain about at all. A smile and a hello can go a long way, along with a good attitude, so can a tip every now and then. It was a WONDERFUL vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mayan Riviere Wedding experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was initially a bit worried about our holiday in Playa Del Carmen at the Grand Porto Real due to some not so favorable reviews on this exact site, but there was absolutely nothing the worry about. We went with a group of family & friends for a two week holiday and most importantly for a wedding and I can't express strongly enough how fabulous it was. After a long day of travelling (airport was a nightmare and then a 45 minute bus drive) we finally arrived at the Grand Porto Real. Due to the huge amount of people all trying to book in at the same time there were a few problems but it was made less painfull with the constant supply of champagne that was offered to us in line waiting. It all went UP hill from there. The hotel is beautiful, the food is very good (Maria's is not our groups favorite, no one really liked the menu) but do try the Italian restaurant, it's fabulous and the chocolate mousse is a MUST. The 24 hour V.I.P room was really nice to have (booze/snacks/games/tv) for those times when we pulled an almost all nighter. Staff is very helpful & friendy. Our favorites were Mary & Jesus (bartenders) and Spike (entertainment) they were fun, personable and very good at their jobs. Must warn that the standard rooms are extremely small. Only the very young in the group didn't mind. You would have to be traveling light with no plans to spend any length of time in the room except to shower & sleep. Most of our group had the junior suites and about 12 of us were lucky enough to have the master suites with showers large enough for 15 people. All of the All Inclusive guests get one room service free per day. Was very nice to have breakfast delivered and eaten on the balcony or a late night club sandwich. The Spa has some free things such as wet sauna, dry sauna, whirlpool and cold water dip. The gym is pretty good, the free sailing & kayaking is fun and the aquacise, water volley ball etc are great. There is afternoon Bingo around the pool and beach massages and a roof top hottub, a 3rd floor pool as well as the main pool, nightly entertainment (they aren't that great) and all this before you even hit the famous 5th Ave. Fabulous cafe's, shopping, bars, etc., all lit up and exciting at night and a little cooler. Can't imagine walking the strip during the afternoon heat. We also took in a couple of the day excusions (well worth it) and took the ferry over to Cozamel where we rented scooters and toured the whole island. All in all we had a fabulous two weeks and would definately go back. I don't understand the compaints, these must be VERY VERY picky people, or the resort has done a complete turn around. In all seriousness you have nothing to worry about. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Ever!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great flight there but..... The front desk at check-in was horrible beware of the front desk barracudas. All they want is money money money.. Hotel was nicely decorated rooms are good but the food was always the same the only restaurant worth it is the Italian one and make sure your server is Matteos he was great. Rooms well if you request ocean view and they tell you you can have it for the first night but then have to change for the next night or you can pay pay pay......We did not move so make sure to be heard and don't pay the extra. Very noisy hotel. Beach the worst I have ever been on. Boats are everywhere and the rocks in the water make it impossible to swim. The gym is ok but very hot to run in. The entertainment was terrible and always the same. I have never seen such horrible routines. I have traveled to Mexico 10 times so far and would never return to this hotel. Not worth the money at all........

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our week (April 23 - 30, 2006) at Gran Porto Real was wonderful. We were a group of 20 celebrating a wedding. The beach wedding & reception was dream-like. Though this property hosts LOTS of weddings the staff made our group, on our day, feel special. I can't think of a nicer way to begin a marriage than on vacation, on a beach, surrounded by family & friends that love & support you. The Gran Porto Real property is lovely -colourful, clean, proud, cheery. The staff are exceptionally friendly & attentive. I'm so glad to read the more recent, positive reviews that tell what we found to be true. Nearby 5th Ave. is fun with lots of good humoured invitations to buy, buy, buy! The short walk to a nearby Mega store (Wal-Mart too) was interesting. It's quite hot there at the end of April. Not being a sun worshipper I happily found several pleasant, shady, breezy spots. The construction in the area indicates a prospering economy with work for the local people. Be happy for them. As construction sites go, the noise was not excessive. I found fishing boats at a sea side village to be quite appropriate. Some in our group hired a boat for a morning of fishing - they caught a 6' marlin! I feel as if we've visited a piece of paradise - upset stomach notwithstanding. We couldn't have been happier on this very special vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Just Married!!”
Reviews.Author: Flathers
Reviews.Content: Just got married & back from a 2 week stay in Mexico! My newlywed husband and I stayed at and got married at the Gran Porto Real the 1st week (Apr 21-Apr 29) The second week we left the group of 60 people that we had came with and stayed at the Barcelo Maya Beach (Apr 30-May 6). We wished we would have stayed at the Gran Porto Real for the whole 2 week duration. The Barcelo was a huge dissapointment after staying at the GPR. (and the barcelo was quite a bit more expensive... go figure?) When we first decided to get married in the mayan riviera we researched MANY hotels on line and after much consideration and reviewing of the rates and locations we finally decided on the GPR. Our travel agent put us in contact with the wedding coordinators Paty & Walter who were amazing to deal with via email. If you are getting married here you will be totally amazed at how easy and smooth everything goes... There is absolutely nothing to worry about, and they take care of every detail. Everything was beyond perfect! Thank you GPR!! Do not believe all the bad reviews... This place was amazing. The only people posting reviews are the people who are not happy with anything in life... or the very few that did have a bad experience unfortunately. I was soo worried before going because I read the reviews each day before the trip. I wasted alot of time worrying about nothing. The Good & The Bad: Hotel: The Location is awesome!!... 5 steps from 5th Ave. The architecture is so amazing... the marbel floors, pillars, the colors, the furniture...everything looks super classy. Check In: We had a group of 63, we all checked in the moment we got off the bus (9 pm) from the airport and were all able to get into our rooms right away. Our group had come with "Nolitours" and since "Nolitours" only has a block of standard rooms available to them anyone who wanted to upgrade could at the hotel, but at an additonal cost. (tip: you can barter the nightly rate for the upgrade. Front desk charged anything from $30 - $60 american dollars per night to upgrade from standard to jr suite) My fiance and I were automatically upgraded because we were getting married there. Rooms: Standard - nice rooms, 2 beds, smaller bathroom. Nothing wrong with them. But there is construction going on behind all standard rooms (400/500's) and it looks like it will not be done anytime soon. Loud, and it starts at about 7-8am These rooms are also by the swim up bar where it tends to get a little loud in the afternoon. I kinda felt bad for the guests who chose not to upgrade... but then again most were not in there rooms unless they were sleeping. My sister stayed in one and was fine with the construction... Your in Mexico... get out of your room! Jr Suite - very nice rooms, 1 king, or 2 twin, huge bathrooms. Worth the extra money. We stayed in an ocean view. I would highly reccomend spending the few extra dollars... Not anywhere near construction and the balconies and the view of the ocean is worth every penny. Service: Almost everyone who worked there... bartenders, security, animation team, the maids... were exceptionally friendly and accommodating with the exception of front desk (rates and info vary on who is working up there) but still, the service was excellent. Hugo & Spike are so much fun (animation team) Sergio & Timiteo were awesome (bartenders) Eduardo, David & Herio (Servers/Waiters) were catering to everyones needs at all hours of the day and night. Our whole group was impressed at the service at this place. Food: The Hotel buffet was great...no complaints. The Beach buffet was okay... icecream and nacho's were the only thing I would eat at the beach buffet just to be safe. The Italian restaurant was Amazing!! And for the all inclusive plan you can go as many times as you want. I could have ate there every day!! I never got a chance to eat at the mexican restaurant and heard mixed reviews from the rest of the group I was with. It all depends on what you like. You can order room service as many times as you like in a day and it is available 24 hours... Breakfast in bed everyday or a yummy club sandwhich and fries after hitting 5th ave was nice!! Be sure to keep a few dollars on hand for the hard working staff if you do get room service, they carry your food on a tray by hand... no carts! The wedding dinner was truly Amazing... I think it was prepared by the Italian restaurant. Nothing short of Delicious! The staff who worked my reception were outstanding and probably worked a 20 hour shift that day and still were all smiles. Out of a group 63 only a couple people were sick to their tummy's the whole 2 weeks... but I am sure it was more the excessive alcohol, suntanning and the different kinds of ethnic foods moreso than the water or food itself. Dont drink the water... but I brushed my teeth with the sink water the whole 2 weeks in Mexico and was fine. Spa: Make sure to visit the Spa while you are there. My mother loved it! Massages were extra $ but well worth it. 24 hour All inclusive Room: Go pour your own drink... beer, hard liqour, coffee or wine... it's all there. Ping pong and pool. Maid Service: Hotel was kept very clean at all times. If you left a dollar or two you would get towel art. Drinks were replenished each day, or if you drank more of something you could call at anytime of the day and someone would be right up to your room with whatever you requested. Main Pool: Tempurature was just right... the size was okay, but because the hotel was full it was kind of hard to get lounge chair beside eachother if you were with a group of more than 2-3 The waiters & waitresses were constantly making the rounds to keep everyone hydrated! 3rd Floor Pool/Swim Up Bar: Great place to sit and have a few drinks in the afternoon. Smaller in size...Bartender who worked at the swimup was sooo friendly and refilled your drink without asking. Beach: Yes, there were a couple boats on one side of the beach. Did not bother us one bit. Walk over to the swing bar closer to the pier and the beach is bigger and the water is nicer to swim in. We had our ceremony and reception on the beautiful beach. My pictures are so pretty with the white sand and blue/green ocean. Wedding: Picture perfect!! The best day ever... worth the money and was less expensive than doing it at home in Calgary. We did not lift a finger with any preperations. You tell them what you want after reviewing the options available before going down there. Correspond with the hotel via email. Then once we got there 3 days later at 9:30am we had a 1/2 hour meeting with the ceremony coordinator, a 1/2 hour meeting with the reception coordinator got a blood test from a local doctor in the hotel and then just had to show up at the time of the ceremony on your wedding day.. Travis & I were blown away with the services, the set up, everything... it was beyond anything I had pictured in my mind. Thank you GPR!! Hopefully this helps anyone who is worried.... You have nothing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time at the Gran Porto during our vacation the week of April 23, 2006. No problem with check-in, got the room type we reserved, (ocean view). The room was clean and the room service was great, all the staff was very helpful. Reading the reviews on the internet was driving me crazy, to the point I was going to cancel, but I’m glad we didn't. The food was very good in the two restaurants and at the buffet. The beach grill was a beach grill. We were kind of surprised as we don't really expect much from the food. There is construction right next door, (what are they suppose to do?) and I think they moved one lady to the Royal across the street. There were a couple of people who had to wait for their room to be cleaned. We were there a little before check in time. As far as I know there was not any down grading of rooms that I know of. The boats were at the beach but didn't bother us at the least. I guess I don't expect them to move just because we want to vacation on their beach. The beach is not expansive and we heard others say the storms washed a lot of beach away. It looked like the resort were planning to build it back out but I didn't ask any questions. My wife spent most of her time at the pool or beach she was very happy with both. Yes the pool is not the largest. We didn't go to the shows the staff did at night so I can't report anytime. We've been in Playa twice before and have found the town getting more crowded each time we go. I guess the lesson I learned is "don't get worked up about the internet reviews" Relax and enjoy. If you have questions, email me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best all inclusive of the Four I have stayed at. This is a great spot. The Good - Food was be far the best selection and quality I have seen at an all inclusive, although after Seven Days you tend to get tired of anything. - Service was amazing- these guys wait on you hand and foot- we did not come accross one rude person. Service at reception desk was great. - We stayed in a Junior Suite and it was very roomy, even with Two kids. - Kids Club- we left our 4 year old for an hour a day to get out of the sun and the Girls running the clube were awesome. - Pool was nice- hotel was full but It was not problem finding loungers. - Proximity to 5th avenue was great. You will want to eat/drink/shop in this area at least once during your stay. The Not So Good - As everyone has said the beach is not too good with fishing boats and seaweed everywhere. BUT- a five minute walk puts you in an amazing spot. - I did see some ugly construction but the amount of rooms facing it was not event close to what I expected based on reviews. Very minimal, although I was in an area away from this spot. It looked to me like at least 75% of the resort faced away from the construction. We were with a group of 40 and didn't have one construction complaint.

Reviews.Title: “True but worth it!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just arrived back from the Mayan with 3 three of my friends. We were suppose to stay at the Gran Porto Real because that is where we booked, it is true what they say, once we got their it was all over booked, so they sent us to the Royal Porto Real which is the sister hotel located right next door for no extra charge. The Royal is more of an upsale hotel then the Gran and it is only 4 months old. Because we stayed at the Royal Porto Real we got to use the facilites and restaurants at the Gran Porto Real aswell. If it was the other way around then no! The Royal has a much better beach then the Gran. The rooms at the Royal are amazing, they come with jacuzzi's and hammocks. Yes at first we were upset because of the change in hotel but needless to say it is very much worth it. No complains about the food and service was superb. Very very beautiful hotel. So if this happens to you, do not panic, you will see why!!! I must say the activity staff at the Gran Porto Real is excellent especially Spike and Hugo. If you are looking to hit the clubs, they will definatley take you, just meet up in the front lobby. For a good time I would recommend The Blue Parrot and Bally's. Or if you are looking to hit the clubs in Cancun then they will definitely take you there also. I will definitley go back to either hotel!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort! Had a blast!!”
Reviews.Author: natpitre
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the GPR from April 9th to the 16th... We had an absolutely fabulous time & loved every minute of it!! This resort in my opinion is top notch for service... I have travelled extensively to the Dom. Republic, Cuba, Mexico, Florida, etc... None of the other resorts (all 5 stars) have this kind of personnalized attention!! You literally don't have to get up from your chair, EVER, for a drink!! They are right there as soon as your glass is empty, asking if you need a new drink... This is at the pool, beach, lobby lounge & all the restaurants!! The service and food at MARIAS & the mexican restaurant was excellent (ask for the Mexican coffee at the end of your meal...) They do this great little show where they light the liquor on fire before pouring it into the coffee... Very nice! Only 2 negative things to say about the GPR: (1) The beach is on the small side but we didn't mind since we mostly hung out at the pool all day! If you really want to do the beach, a 5 min. walk to the left (in front of the Royal) the water & beach there is awesome!! (2) The entertainement wasn't very good & no disco at the resort so by 11:00 it's really quiet, if you wanna party though, it's just a 5 min. walk to 5th Avenue... Thanks to everyone at the GPR, Especially Nancy, the concierge... She took very good care of us!! All in all, we loved our vacation and hope to go back there someday! Nathalie from Fredericton, NB, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had reservations along with 150 students and adults for spring break April 15-22, 2006. The hotel overbooked and we had to stay at a different hotel, which was of lesser quality. We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 p.m. and sat in the lobby until 2:30 a.m. We made our reservations through Student Breaks in East Lansing, Michigan. The hotel we were "bumped" to did not have bottled water or an alarm clock. It was a very disappointing experience. Buyer beware when going to Mexico or utilizing Student Breaks for vacation plans.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: jeldiablo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Porto Real last fall with three friends. When we pulled up to the place, I could'nt believe how nice it was, especially for the resonable price. . Our rooms were spacious and clean with a balcony that featured a great view of the beach and ocean. We chose junior suites with the all-inclusive plan. This option is really the way to go as we spent most of the time lounging around the hotel or on the ajacent beach. You can go buffet style which is more than adequate or try one of two other in- house restuarants that had great food and excellent service. The hotel's location is perfect. It's close to the clubs and shops of 5th Ave. and ajacent to the incredible, white sand beaches of Playa Del Carmen. You can socialize at two lively main pools or enjoy a more serene, intimate pool upstairs that features a swim up bar. We are planning another trip to Playa this summer, and we all agree that between the great service and the well kept grounds, the Gran Porto is a great deal! It's nice without being pretentious or stuffy. We are staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL RESORT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a very relaxing and wonderful place to stay. The service, well lets just say they really go all out for you. Whatever it takes. Staff were wonderful and friendly. Rooms were very comfortable (showers are amazing). Food was very good, lots to choose from. I'm not sure why so many people complaine about the fishing boats, they are small, and off to the side. Plus your in a fishing community!!! I just can't say enough goog things about this resort. To many to list. I would have to say to few things I did not care for was the few topless women, it's a family resort! And the number one thing that really bothered me was the RUDE teenagers who drank all day, drank all night, no respect for the staff. Come on people have some respect for this people, your in there country! I really think parents need to control this teens and their drinking from morning till night! But I give this place A++++++++++!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved it here! The staff are so nice and always ready to help you. We usally always ate at the buffet and the food was great. We had a waiter named Glider who was always there with a smile and awsome service. The pools were always clean and the location of the Hotel is great if you want to go to 5th ave. for shopping. We will definitly go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: miltie12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Gran Porto Real at Playa Del Carmen 4/8-4/13/06. We had read the bad reviews and were prepared to do whatever we had to do to get the accommodations we had booked. There were over 20 people in our group and none of us experienced any of the negatives that were listed in some of the reviews. There was no problem with overbooking with anyone in our party. The pool was wonderful and never what I would call overly crowded (there was always a lounge chair in the water available). We received great service for a very small amount of tipping (we always made sure that we had one dollar bills). The restaurants and buffets were good but not great (you are in Mexico after all). The breakfast buffet was great with made to order omelets, pancakes and french toast, bacon, cereals, and 10 fresh juices. We all liked the buffet/grill by the pool because it was so easily accessible. We walked to 5th avenue to shop every night and had a great time. Our friends were in the section near what other reviews have called "the construction" but, they said they never heard anything. We booked a junior suite and it was HUGE, there was plenty of room for the three of us. We didn't have an ocean side balcony but, we did have a view of the ocean and a great view of the Royal Porto Real accross the street. We took the ferry to Cozumel but wouldn't do that again, it wasn't very nice once we got there and the vendors were very pushy and rude. So, we did the Hard Rock and came back. The beach right outside of the resort is full of fishing boats but, that just adds to the character and culture of Mexico (a three minute walk down the sand and you are at typical beach that you can lay on and swim in. I can't say enough good things about this resort and I would be very happy to spend every Spring Break there.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand View!”
Reviews.Author: DosEquis
Reviews.Content: Do NOT pay any attention to the poor reviews written about this resort. We had an absolutely fabulous vacation and did not encounter any of the problems we had read about (over-booking, bad service, bad food etc.). We have travelled to a lot of different resorts in the Caribbean and other places and were very pleased with the facilities, food and service levels at the Gran Porto Real. We were checked in promptly by very courteous front desk staff. Our room was perfect - #152 (Junior Suite) that faced the pier, beach and the restaurant at Royal Porto Real. Our patio was perfect for watching the sunrise several mornings. The room was very large and extremely clean. The bathroom was also a great size, although lighting was somewhat dim. The large shower was a nice bonus and the water pressure fabulous! Satellite TV was a nice touch too - especially since there were a couple of local Canadian channels available! Staff kept our mini-bar well stocked with water, beer and pop the whole week! The Mexican and Italian restaurants do NOT require reservations anymore - it's first come first serve and we alternated evenings between the 2 restaurants without any reservations or having to wait in line to get in. We did not eat dinner at the buffet restaurant at all during the week, but did have breakfasts and several lunches there - breakfasts were great and lunch was pretty good. We really enjoyed both the Mexican and Italian restaurants for dinner - great service by Ivan at Maria's (Mexican). I highly recommend the "Beef Tips Mexican Style" and the "Tex Mex Fajitas" there and the Caesar Salad and "Block of Grouper" or "Chicken Parmigiana" at the Italian restaurant. The 24-hour room service was a great benefit too, especially if you plan to do an all-day excursion that leaves before the restaurant opens in the morning. Watch out for Franklin or any of the other sales people who work for the Real "Gold" Club - they're located in the main lobby of the hotel - they will try to sell you on spending 90 minutes across the street at the Royal Porto Real listening to a spiel on their "vacation club" (ie: a time share) - they will offer free breakfast and a tour of the resort (which is more upscale than the Gran Porto Real). We refused this offer as we did not want to waste 90 minutes of our precious vacation time! You will also receive offers to "upgrade" to the Royal Porto Real at a small "surcharge" - we did not even consider this as we were very happy with our room and the facilities at Gran Porto Real! The beach is good, although it has receeded due to hurricane damage. The palapas are wonderful and selection is good early in the morning. Evaristo and Mary are very attentive beach waiters who will bring you drinks all day long with big smiles on their faces! We didn't enjoy the beach-level pool that much as there were constant activities going on with loud voices pumped over a microphone - it was hard to have a swim without getting hit with a volleyball or splashed by people playing games in the pool. The 3rd floor pool was very nice in the late afternoon - nice to sit at the swim up bar and relax after a hot day! Not a lot of shade there earlier in the day though. A HUGE benefit of the Gran Porto Real is its location - right on the beach and only 2 blocks from 5th Avenue, which is a great spot to buy jewelry, souvenirs, clothing etc. There are some great restaurants and bars along the street too - it has a cool ambience! The vendors and restaurant owners are a bit pushy, but don't let this turn you off - some great deals can be found here! Negotiate at least half price on any prices they give you. Most vendors are willing to deal, but some may be rude and refuse to negotiate - don't worry, because you'll find the same things (or better) in another store! We would definitely recommend this resort to our friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort...Ignore the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me first start out by saying I am a hotel review junkie...meaning, that before I go somewhere I read as many reviews as I can possibly find about the place - good and bad. This is my first time to actually write a review myself though. With that being said, let me share our experience with you! My husband and I went to Gran Porto Real for our honeymoon April 4-8, 2006. We decided to go there based on the good reviews, in spite of the bad ones we had read. We arrived at the hotel prepared for the "unfriendly staff," "bad food," "weak drinks" etc etc that we read about. Well let me just say NONE of that was true! We had the most wonderful experience! We were greeted at the hotel with friendly faces and a glass of champagne. We had arrived earlier than check in time, so knew our room wouldn't be ready yet (our fault, not theirs). We wanted to get there as soon as possible, knowing we could walk around and check things out in the meantime. The front desk was very friendly, and asked us to stop back by around 3pm. We chose to go check out the inside bar and have a few drinks. At 3:05pm we went back to front desk and our room was ready ON TIME. We had no problems with the hotel being "overbooked" as I had read in some reviews. Nor did I hear of anyone around us having any trouble either. We went to our room and it was perfect. Exactly what we had asked for! Junior Suite with an ocean view, meaning our balcony faced the ocean...beautiful. During our stay, we decided to just enjoy the hotel and the amenities there. The service was excellent! We never had to wait for a drink, and as a side note, our drinks were never ‘weak’. The food was good. We never checked out the Italian or Mexican restaurant, but the poolside food and the buffet food were just fine with us. We had NO complaints. Definitely try the guacamole at the poolside snack bar - it was excellent! The property itself is beautiful...very clean! And maybe it was where our room was located (right outside the pool area), but we never heard any type of construction noises. Now the reviews about all the boats on the shore are true, but it didn’t hinder our good time in any way. You can still get in the water, and if you aren’t happy with the beach area in front of the Gran Porto Real, then just walk several yards down the beach and it’s great. No hassle at all. If you are looking to go to this resort, but are scared of the bad reviews you read, DON’T BE! We found none of them to be true. I’m not really sure what the travelers who wrote the bad reviews were expecting, but seems to me those are just people who would complain for the sake of complaining. GO THERE. HAVE FUN! We certainly will be going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: 414 Traveling Fools
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Gran Porto from April 7-14/06. This was my ninth time to the real resorts in the Mayan and the first for my friend. We had a great holiday as always. Service and food was great as expected, the only complaint is that the beds are way too hard. I cannot find one thing else to possibly complain about. The food is different then ours but very good. I was talking to one guy from Ontario and he was complaining about not being able to get a good steak, well it's not the same as Canadian beef so hello. The staff are so wonderful and always happy, I just don't understand some of the complaints I read. I will continue to return to the Real Resorts in Cancun and Playa as they are all wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Much too noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Gran Porto Real Resort. We were in Cancun last year so this isn't our first time in Mexico. The hotel is quite nice but they are still renovating and you are lucky if you get much sleep; at night or in the daytime. We were with a group and were spaced out over the hotel. Everyone said the same thing; TOO NOISY. The people are quite nice and the service good. This is a very active resort, so if you are looking for peace and quiet this isn't for you. Many outside activities near the pool in the daytime and into the night; late night. I guess Noisy is the word for the day here. Amy North Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recomment it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were staying at a nearby resort in Playa and tried to see some friends staying at the Porto Real. We were basically treated like criminals. I speak enough Spanish that I was able to tell security that my friends were at the pool and I wanted to see them. Instead of escorting me to the pool area, the security person told me I couldn't go. I went anyway and then they tried to charge me $75 for a day pass to walk up and talk to them. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Reconsider another Place”
Reviews.Author: stjomom
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively around the world and have stay in all types of hotels (yes, the good and the bad). Well, the Gran Porto was recommended to us as being a great hotel, in a great location with good restaurants and beaches. We were looking forward to a well deserved week’s vacation. Unfortunately, it was everything but! I’ll try to keep it to the point. I have added this one to one of the bad ones. The Good: ·Hotel staff (excluding front desk) were very cordial and quite accommodating ·Staff working in the restaurant very pleasant and would go out of the way to provide you with excellent service. ·THAT’s IT! Restaurants: -Three days prior to our departure we were informed that three restaurants at the hotel had closed. -Buffet restaurant was ok for breakfast and lunch. Don’t bother for supper – not very good -Reservations for both Mexican and Italian restaurants extremely hard to obtain, would recommend you book upon your arrival but don’t expect to obtain early sittings. -Small “take-out” type of restaurant on the beach serves that serves hotdogs/hamburgers/fast food was ok. Accommodations: -Did not get room we had reserved (jr suite with two beds). Were given jr suite with king size bed -Roll out provided but was in very bad condition -Room door did not lock, toilet did not work. Housekeeping was called (they arrived promptly) and repaired the toilet but unable to repair door – we concocted something to ensure that the door would not open that night -Bathroom not clean, and well for the beds - lets not go there. -Room located next to road where buses load and unload guests to hotel but it was better that other rooms located in the “construction” zone (construction started about 7:00 a.m. and ended about 8:00 p.m.) -Obtained the following afternoon a Jr. Suite with two beds (but had to make a bit of a fuss at the front desk in order to obtain the room we had booked. This is not my style to operate this way but even being nice for over an hour didn't work! the front desk were not very accommodating. But then again we were not the only ones complaining!!) -Both rooms had a very strong musty-damp smell. Vacation during March Break: -Given that it was spring break we had expected that spring breakers would be at hotel but the hotel was not ready for them! Hotel should have had much more security overseeing (or should I say babysitting) the breakers. -Many items broken, vomited upon all hours of the day and night. -Many unsupervised teenagers yelling/swearing/screaming at all hours of day and night but mostly night! and unfortunately for us right next door to our room (yes the room we were transferred to). I felt sorry for the families that were staying at the hotel with young children – not a pretty sight for them to see. Beach: -Not much of a beach at this hotel. Unfortunately last fall’s hurricane took care of that. The hotel is trying to save what little is left by placing huge sandbags alongside the shoreline but to no avail. The beach on the right hand side of the hotel was full of seaweed and lined up with boats (approx 10 of them when we were there) that took up the remaining portion. Misc.: Watch out for the vendors trying to sell timeshares in the hotel lobby. They are just waiting for your arrival! Location: Just a block away from 5th avenue, the hotel’s location is good if you are looking for shops (watch for a few tourist trap type of stores), good restaurants, good bars. One word of caution. Don’t go when the cruise ships arrive in Playa del Carmen (Wednesday/Thursdays). You won’t be able to walk down the street! Our third day and remainder of our vacation went very well - we transferred to the Royal Porto next door! (great hotel) – would recommend this one over the other hands-down. Sorry for being so long winded but if you are thinking of stay here – you may want to have a look/book next door.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry about this hotel, it was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto March 23-30 and it was great. I was SO worried that I made a bad choice and my husband was ready to strangle me for reading all the bad reviews, but everything turned out fine. It is a very clean hotel, the food was good and there was LOTS of it, the staff was very friendly and helpful and it was fun being close to 5th avenue. My only two complaints are that it was a little noisy late at night when the spring breakers were coming up to their rooms and that the beach isn't very nice. But the beaches in either direction are good, so you don't have to go far to swim. We ate at each place twice. We made reservations as soon as we got there. The front desk said we couldn't make reservations for the week, but the consierge said we could. If you are traveling with young children here are a few things you might want to know: The hotel has one stroller which we were lucky enough to get. I didn't think my pre-schooler would need one, but 5th Ave. is long for a tired, hot 5 year old. And we took it with us to Xcaret too. By the swing bar they have sand pails and shovels, etc. for the kids to play with, but get there before 5:00 because that's when they close. There's only one hot-tub and it's in the spa. Children are not allowed in it. Our shower had a two foot high tile basin. If you brought a rubber drain cover, you could probably give your kids a bath. (The drains don't plug, because it's supposed to be a shower only.) Don't turn your towels in at the end of the day, because you'll want them early the next morning to stake out your chairs by the pool. If you don't get any chairs, don't worry, people come and go during the day, so eventually you'll get some. 5th Avenue was fun to walk down, but it got really crowded at night. Early morning was a nice time to take a stroll or a jog. There is a lovely, little treasure of a store just off of 5th, called LUNAE. From the hotel, turn right onto 5th and then right again at the first side street (by Senor Frog's CLOTHING store.) Everything is hand made by the store owner. It's cool and funky and her prices are very reasonable - also she doesn't pressure you at all! Bring lots of ones to tip your servers and housekeepers. They work really hard and I think it's appreciated. The housekeepers for our room were nice. When I told them my 5 year old was tired and cranky, they folded the towel up like a swan and told her it was for her so she wouldn't cry. She loved it. We really did have a great time. There's always a few bumps on any vacation and you just have to deal with problems, but overall we loved our trip. My kids had tons of fun in the pool and on the scruffy beach. They only went to kid's club once and that was to play on the swing set while we packed. But the girls who work there are very sweet and it looked like they had a lot of activities. We probably wouldn't go back to the Gran Porto, just because we don't take a lot of vacations, so when we do we'll go somewhere different. But you shouldn't worry about this hotel, because it really was a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read every review for months about the Gran Porto Real and was so worried about going there. Fortunately, upon arrival this place was beautiful. Bad Stuff- 1.Our junior suite wasn't ready the first night so they upgraded us to a master suite and then they moved up to our junior suite for the remained of our trip 2. There is construction going on at one end of the resort - the people right next to it can probably hear it very well - we never really heard it at all 3. The beach in front of the hotel is not great, but you can walk down the beach a little way and find a great place to swim. We enjoyed walking on the beach daily. Mixed- 1. The food at the buffet was ok - some days were better than others. We also ate the Italian place and found it to be excellent. The early you eat at the buffet the better it is - the food sits out Good Stuff - 1. Our room was very spacious and clean. There were repainting and upating some rooms down our hall. They really take very good care of this resort. 2. The staff was attentive and very friendly. We enjoyed the daily activties put on by the hotel (bike tours, water polo, water v-ball, bracelet making) 3. The view from the hotel toward the ocean was awesome. We just loved sitting by the pool listening to the waves and looking out at the ocean. 4. The proximity to 5th Avenue couldn't be beat. We loved walking and shopping there in the evenings. Overall we loved this place and would like to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as you're led to believe.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were 12 of us total(6 kids <6 and 6 adults)who stayed here from March 4-11/06. Based on most reviews we read, we were geared up and ready for a fight the minute we got to the front desk. To our surprise, aside from a little bit of a wait at the desk to check in, we were told our room would be ready at 3:00 and it was. This hotel is truly beautiful and very clean. The food was excellent considering it was buffet. None of our party ever got sick. Our room was #403, a standard room facing the street. It was always cleaned by the time we returned from the pool. The room was a little small but considering the amount of time you spend in it-who cares?(and I had a family of 4 in there-we managed.) Here's a little piece of information..the 2 a la carte restaurants-they will tell you either they are full or give you really late times..all you have to do is give the lady at the concierge(Nancy) a few dollars and miraculously you can eat there as many times as you like whichever time works for you... The pool-a little cold but that sun makes you sooo hot the water cools you right off. We were always able to get 6 lounge chairs together-we put our towels on them around 7:00 each morn..no problems. Be careful around the pool, it is verrrry slippery when wet! The kids club-fantastic! The staff were excellent, very caring,lots of great craft ideas - a wonderful place to get the kids some relief from the sun-highly recommend it!!! The beach-and this is the only flaw with this place, the beach at the Royal is far nicer except you can't use their loungers. The boats take up alot of the beach and then there is the seaweed...not the nicest beach. But aside from that, the weather was great every day, the hotel was beautiful, nights were a little chilly, having 5th avenue a block away is so convenient and it's so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “they give service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Josmike
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to the Gran Porto Real. Unfortunately the beach had suffered from the hurricane, the sandbags were not there before but you only walk 100 yards or so up the beach and it is gorgeous. From what we saw, quite a few changes had occured thanks to the hurricane but one thing that did not was the incredible service. At the front desk they apologized because the hotel was full and we would have to spend one night in a room by the construction. Next morning we were promptly moved and upgraded at no charge to us to a Junior Suite right on the beach. Both my hubby and I had a day of being tied to our room if you get my gist, but the staff was running around trying to find some chicken soup, when that failed the Bar Manager Louis had the chef prepare some for us and had it bought to our room. When you go to another country, you have to expect that maybe their cuisine is slightly different and not up to ours but we always enjoy Marias and Il Pescatore. A smile, good word and the odd tip goes a long way. Lynn and Mike B. C. Canada

Reviews.Title: “A great experience at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: BloomingtonSue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned from a great week at Gran Porto Real. We loved it! I read the reviews before we travelled and was a bit nervous. Like any hotel, it is not for everyone. However, if you just want to relax and enjoy yourself, this is a great place. If you like diversity and not a sterile US hotel plopped in the middle of nowhere, then this is not for you. If you want a bit more culture and access to a festive and fun town, it is for you. Don't go if you are looking for gourmet food. In fact, don't go to any all-inclusive if fine dining is your goal. However, while this was not fine dining, it was quite good. There was plenty of variety and it was really pretty tasty! The breakfast was outstanding, the lunch options very good. We liked the snack bar and enjoyed the hot dogs, chili, and chips and salsa. Dinner was quite nice. The Mexican place was not very good but mainly because the service was pretty bad. The Italian place was very good. We celebrated our anniversary there and the staff was excellent. It was relaxed and quiet out on the patio. Make sure to make reservations as soon as you check in. We would have liked to eaten there twice. If you want a change of pace, 5th Avenue is full of really nice places to eat and drink. We were just happy to veg out and not worry about making reservations elsewhere. That is one reason we like all inclusives. Our room was great although we weren't thrilled when we first checked in since it was a junior suite, ocean view. That means that we were on the street side but we were up close to the beach so our view was spectacular. In fact, we decide not to switch when we had the opportunity because we loved watching the action on the street. It was particulary fun on Sunday when the beaches were filled with the locals having family get togethers. It was so nice to be reminded that people are the same all over the world. The facilty was very nice and warm but what made it awesome was the staff. If you want great beach service, find Jesus. He is one of the hardest working guys around. We were never thirsty when sitting on the beach because he waited on us hand and foot. In fact, he would bring us our drinks first thing without even asking if we wanted one! At the pool bar, Miriam was outstanding. She put up with a few wild spring breakers and always had a smile and a cold beverage. The best waiter in the morning was Mel. In fact, we called him maestro as he very willingly helped us with our attempt at speaking Spanish. Juan Carlos was helpful with information about the hotel and another Juan Carlos was a friendly and outgoing host for the buffet. We are fortunate enough to have travelled to many places in Mexico and the islands. This is one of our favorites. Watching the local fishermen cast their nets for fish while sitting under a bright blue sky sipping on a frozen marguarita is our idea of perfect day. We had 7 of them.

Reviews.Title: “Worst. Vacation. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a week there (March 11-18, 2006) #1. Do not, under any circumstances, book a standard room. We did--big mistake. The construction starts at 5-5:30am, and often doesn't stop til after 10pm. And it's loud. And it affects ALL standard rooms. The entire wing is right next to this. Don't think you can sleep through it. We're talking jackhammers, dragging about of iron bars, hammering of metal all day long. It is 8 feet from your window, and it grates on your nerves. #2. Never, ever stay here during spring break. Even if your travel agent says this isn't a student destination. One of my party is a teacher and we had to deal with about 40 screaming, vomiting, drunk and obnoxious teenagers all week long. I mean screaming obsceniies and vomiting right outside your room at 4am. (And don't forget the construction starts at 5, good luck with that half hour/hour of sleep!) And they stole things from outside rooms, too. So keep a hand on everything you own, including your bathing suits. Seriously. #3. Don't expect the rooms to be in tip-top shape. Expect at least 3 things to be broken, up to and including the bathroom lights, the sink, and the lock on your door. Have fun! #4. The front desk staff is a nightmare. They don't care about you, the customer is always wrong, and god help you if you have any problems, because the front desk sure won't. #5. If you're looking for a 4- or 5-star resort, do NOT go to Gran Porto Real. It's horrible. If you MUST go to a Real resort, shell out the extra cash and go to Royal Porto Real. But in general, I think you'd be better off staying far, far away from either. #6. Keep a careful eye on your hotel bill at the end of your stay. Sometimes, mysteriously, things are charged to your room that you did not partake in. And if you don't want to pay for someone else's salon bill or spa massage, you'd better be prepared for a long wait and a good fight, 'cause the customer is always, always wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Gran Porto Real. We were very concerned about it because of the negative posts. We had no problems, NONE. At first we were given room 115, next to lobby and almost in the pool - the worst room if you like to sleep. The very next morning we had a new quiet room right away. I do admit being very picky about eating, and since we are finally back to "normal" food I plan on eating all day today. I was just never satisfied with any food I had in Playa. Don't wast your time signing up at Maria's that was the worst food I have ever had in my whole life!! The Italian restaurant was awesome!!(OK I did like that) Make sure you "find" the swim up bar pool. Take advantage of the kayaks and sailboats - I didn't find them until the very last day and then didn't have time. Take lots of ones for tipping. DO NOT sign up to go to breakfast across the street- We signed up but luckily decided to cancel only to find out later that it was a 3 hour waste of time. You are there to relax not to talk to people!!! Overall we are very happy that we picked this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Playa. Stayed at the Gran Porto Real. Had a great time. There were 22 of us in our group (five families). We were there for Spring Break. I've read a lot of negative reviews about the place, but we had a great time. Everyone got the rooms they wanted (type and view). The only issue at registration was that one family got stuck on the first floor and we had asked for everyone to be on the second or third floors. After a short discussion, the hotel moved them to the third floor. The positives: great location right by Fifth Avenue which has all the shopping and restaurants; very nice pool and daily activities; our rooms were nice and the staff was courteous and prompt (for the most part); the food was fine--what do you expect from a buffet; we ate at the Italian restaurant two nights and the food was good; some of the couples at at the Mexican restaurant and it was good as well; I thought the fajitas at the buffet restaraunt were great. The negatives: hey, it's MEXICO; get ready for it; no one gets in a big hurry down there; the service is typically slower than equivalent resorts in the States; don't be surprised when you ask the concierge to book a reservation for you at a restaurant and she claims that she hasn't heard of the restaurant (it's only three blocks away) and she doesn't have the phone number; or when you're looking for a sports bar to watch a college basketball game and you ask a guy who works at a clothing store "where is Sports Bar '77" and he says he says "no sey" and it's actually directly across the street from his store; like I said, "hey, it's MEXICO"; the beach at the resort was not really nice, but you can walk around the corner to the beach in front of the Royal Porto Real and it's really nice--great boogie boarding. Suggestions: DO: play beach volleyball with Oscar at the volleyball court at the end of the resort by the ocean; boogie board on the beach in front of the Royal Porto Real; take nice walks down 5th Avenue either early morning (before it gets too warm) or early evening (before it gets rowdy); take part in the pool activities; relax and enjoy it; if you like golf, play the course at Playacar, but be sure to bring plenty of golf balls (I'm a 14 handicapper and lost several balls--not much rough, just jungle). DON'T: expect too much from the buffets (the food is pretty basic but it was pretty good as well); be confused about the difference between "ocean front" and "ocean view" ("ocean front" means you're facing the pool with a view of the ocean; "ocean view" means your facing the road/other hotel and can see the ocean from the edge of your balcony); expect too much in the form of speedy service (they are on beach time, so get used to it) I think a lot of the negative reviews about this place deal with either (a) people who aren't prepared for the slower pace of service you experience in Mexico; (b) who didn't realize the difference between the ocean front and ocean view; or (c) who didn't communicate with the hotel directly to make sure they were getting what room and type of room they wanted. We had a great vacation and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Whole family loved this resort!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my family (6 adults) in Sept. and we loved it. At first arriving on the bus from the airport I thought I had made a terrible mistake by the looks of the surrounding building but once we arrived we didn't want to leave. This is the third trip to Mexico (first at this resort) and I believe this was the best ever!! We had a few minor problems with wrong rooms but nothing that I couldn't fix. The food was wonderful and we did experience the a la carte restuarants once each to say we did. Fancy prep on the food but the buffet was definately worth it. Large variety of food and the breakfasts were fantastic!! I guesss after reading some of the reviews since the hurricane the beach isn't very good but when we were there we sat at the beach every day and only swam in the upper pool in the evening. I believe that when travelling you have to expect some discomforts but we never experienced anything we would complain about! Only thing we didn't enjoy that much were the shows off the lobby. The shows themselves were great but it was so hot in there we couldn't stand it! I have heard that the beach on the other side is better so I guess travellers can go there to swim. The beaches are public property and the resorts don't own them so all can use them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jchutton
Reviews.Content: MARCH 4 – 11, 2006 We were quite concerned about the overbooking issue as warned by preview reviews. As a result we phoned one week in advance to confirm our booking, then once again called the day of our flight before we flew off. Both times we were reassured they had a room for us. We were still quite concerned as we weren't arriving to the hotel until 1am. When we arrived at the airport, we saw our Nolitours person directing us to our bus, a man took our luggage out of our hands and carried it a few feet and expected a tip….we weren’t quite ready for that! A little bit of an initiation to a new culture. We noticed more “seasoned” travelers just held onto their luggage and refused help! We arrived, were promptly given room 508, a bell boy helped us with our luggage and we took a quick look around the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed and pillows were perfectly comfortable. The fridge was stocked with lots of beverages (a little freezer box area in the fridge). There was a building being constructed right outside our window, but the noise and sight never bothered us any. We tended to wake up bright and early so we weren’t bothered by early morning construction noise. It was quite quiet at our end of the building. We weren’t bothered by much noise at all. We brought along earplugs just in case of any issues in this regard, but didn’t even need them. The bathroom was quite adequate. Fresh towels were available each day. The maid created a few neat “creations” out of towels for us which brought a smile to our faces (we tipped the maid $2 CDN a day following our Nolitour reps advice). There was plenty of room for clothes storage. Big closet with lots of shelves to place clothing, an ironing board, extra pillow, safety deposit box and room to hang clothing. We were pleasantly surprised to find out we had internet available in our room…. We used that for the first couple days… However it was a little high priced for the amount we used it--$15 CDN for 3 days (and the 3rd day they were making changes to the system so it stopped working for us). From then on we used the internet in the lobby—three terminals, never busy, quick connection for 1 pessos/minute (10cents/minute). If you ventured into town you can get it for a little cheaper. We bought a phone card before heading down to Mexico. However, it wasn’t valid as they apparently have a different phone system using satellite. So, our advice, would be to purchase a phone card down there or just use the internet. At one point we needed to buy a phone card and ended up spending about $12/CDN to call a 1-800 number to our bank (long story there but won’t go into that—still not sure if the maid stole our bank card, if we dropped it somewhere or if it hiding in our yet unpacked luggage!), and used up the entire card in about 7 minutes!!! Crazy! So, internet was the best mode of communication we found. In regards to food… The breakfasts were AMAZING! Fresh custom made omelets every morning! Pancakes, French toast, sausage, bacon, cereal, toast, pastries, lots of fresh fruit, yogurt, juices, etc. definitely the BEST meal! We would fill up at breakfast and not even worry about lunch usually. Lunch options were adequate—usual fast food type stuff. In regards to the a la carte restaurants, we followed other’s advice and reserved our dinners on the first day. However, we were a little disappointed with the food at both a la carte restaurants. We preferred the supper buffet personally. Even the atmosphere in the buffet restaurant seemed a little quieter. But it was worth going for the experiece. We did one dinner at the Mexican and one at the Italian restaurant (Italian being our favorite of the two). They certainly have different meal presentation! We preferred buffet because we could take a look at the food available and taste test small portions. FABULOUS service all round at the buffet restaurants and a la carte restaurants. We tipped at the a la carte restaurants only, following our Nolitour rep’s advice. We didn’t participate in activities around the hotel much. We tended to stick to the beach and snorkeling. The beach was definitely not the best for swimming. If you like to lounge around and have shade and drinks available it was perfect… Even the boats added a nice touch to the scenery. But if you wanted to swim, it was better at the Royal Porto or better yet, further down by Cocoa Bay Resort (the last resort north). We rented a lounger and shade for two days at Mamitas just a couple minutes walk from GPR—only cost us $6 CDN for two loungers and a shade for the entire day. Warning…put sunscreen on even with the shade! We learned that one the hard way! We really enjoyed snorkeling. A man named Jesus was drumming up business on the beach one day and invited us to go snorkeling with him (he has a fishing boat right outside the GPR). So, we inquired at the hospitality desk and also with security if he was to be trusted….which they said he was. So, we ended up going on a boat with one other tourist. Jesus didn’t end up going on the boat in the end (just does advertising I guess!). A man named Jose and another man took us out about 5-10 minutes away and we did snorkeling for about 1 ½ hours for $25 CDN/each…. We LOVED it! Definitely the highlight of our week! The guide would dive down and nudge the fish, got a sting ray out of hiding, brought a star fish to the surface for me to hold, picked up a crab for us to see up close, found us a neat sea shell etc. It was just great. Definitely worth it. The next day we went to Cocoa Bay Resort beach and snorkeled. It was awesomeJ Definitely recommend that! Lots of reef right near the shore. We felt very safe. We also went to Xel-Ha and Tulum….good outings. We attended two evening shows and enjoyed. Shopping on 5th Avenue was an experience in itself! We weren’t quite prepared for the culture shock of that! Lots of people wanting to get your business (time share people on every corner!). So beware! The store owners weren’t as aggressive. And definitely bargain! We didn’t quite master the art of bargaining…just started learning a few of the tricks! Start at 50% and start walking away saying you may come back later and the price WILL come down! We noticed some paint fumes while there, but this didn’t end up being a problem for us. I imagine there would be painting and construction done at most resorts! They want to keep things up! We also noticed some people in the lobby being sent elsewhere due to overbooking….so definitely recommend calling the hotel in advance for peace of mind. Keep things locked up in the safe! Our particular room didn’t have a sliding lock or dead bolt which we found a little unsettling. However, some rooms appeared to have the sliding locks we found out later. We just created a bit of a barricade for our peace of mind. (although everyone seemed very trustworthy so no concerns founded in that regard). All in all, it was a fantastic week. We loved the look and feel of the GPR. Great archeticture. Very clean, comfortable and homey. More then enough food and drink. Amazing service. We would definitely consider returning to this resort. (FYI people from next door at the Royal Porto who had been at GPR in past years said they preferred GPR…interesting we thought) Fantastic location! Fantastic staff! Fantastic vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Had an Absolutely Great Time”
Reviews.Author: D_T_Travellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, plus two other couples, stayed at this hotel from Feb 26 - Mar 5 and had an absolutely great time. The only hitch was that our rooms were not ready when we got there, but within a couple of hours they were, and we ended up with an beautiful Master Suite, instead of the Junior Suite. So while the rooms were getting ready, we headed for the beach bar for our first, but certainly not last, Margarita of the day. We went on the all inclusive plan, the food was good, especially the breakfasts. The restaurants are quite "noveau Cusine", but good as well. Being only a block walk from the start of Fifth Avenue was very nice. The beach did have a lot of boats, but contrary to other reviews, we had no problems going to the beach further north. Both beach bars were great (Raphael, Armando, and Jimmy were fantastic bartenders), and the beach buffet had good food, but not much variety. Would I recommend this hotel? Absolutely, and we are already making plans to go back. Hola!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but caution needed”
Reviews.Author: jjeldance
Reviews.Content: We were scared to death of the hotel because of what we read here from others. Some of the claims are true. Boats are at the beach (but you can get around them or go to the end section by the Swing Bar). I called the hotel and asked to speak to the Front Desk Manager and confirmed our reservation TWICE before we left. I spoke to "Carlos". When we arrived our room was ready and waiting - no problem at all. Maid service was done well BUT two days it was done at 4:00 and 4:30 while another day at 8:30 a.m. So it was late and an unconsistent schedule. They were painting on the second floor and that did leave an odor however I supposed they must do this at some point! The food was just ok. If you want to eat at the 2 alacarte restaurants, book your reservation the day you arrive or you can't get it. But we did notice that even tho we were told they were full, that they were not. So you might want to just go directly to the restaurant and see at the time. However the service was FABULOUS. The waiters on the beach go out of their way to bring you drinks. The hotel is beautiful and the Jr. Suite Oceanview was lovely! I did hear many people arguing at the front desk w/them about room changes, etc. and spoke to others who had difficulties. I would highly recommend calling beforehand to confirm. There are plenty of lounges by the pool and beach area. Never did we not find a lounge. entertainment was second rate but it was amusing at least! Would I return? I don't think so as there are so many other places to go to and I would like a pool that accommodated those with walking problems like I have. There were no steps into the pool, just ladders and a step down with a large drop off. The water was clear and wonderful! Take the taxi down town to go to the ferry for Cozumel rather than the one by the hotel if you want to view some locals selling fresh fruits (already peeled and ready to eat) as well as selling other food items and trinkets in the area of the ferry. cost for ferry there is $22 round trip each. But we did have a fine time all in all! Feel free to email me any questions and take lots of $1.00 bills for tips it's so much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Horror Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: believe all the reviews you read here, we just returned and had all the same problems at this hotel from checking in to the painting and smelling fumes to staff being rude. They have no beach and to left is rocks, you cannot use Royal Portol Real Beach this beach is only for their guest, our room was suppose to ready on tuesday to find out after being told to come back 4x they gave it away??? I hated this hotel and sent an email to ----,mex to complain, maybe everyone else here should also. Lets see if they rspond, i will post if they do! Faith

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful!”
Reviews.Author: robnbren
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real - Be Careful! Feb 23-Mar 2/06 Three family members went to to this fairly high rated hotel for a 8 night 7 day get away. Be careful, there is absoloutely NO beach since the hurricane. Be careful about the rooms - standard is no more than a roadside Motel 6 room - small small small! No room to put clothes away, no chair, no table, beds were as hard as a rock, rooms were dark and dingy. There is no balcony only a hallway with 2 straightback chairs (2 per room) that are in the main hallway for other guests to travel to and fro! Food - well not the best, all tastes the same. Coffee was good if it was offered. Wine - my husband liked the vino tinto (red) - the only white wine tasted like gasoline!!! The front desk is a nightmare... not enough staff, the lineup is a guaranteed 25 to 45 minute wait. Would I go there again - NEVER! The northern part of the Hotel is Motel style, very small rooms, the pools are small, suishi bar has NO suishi, beach is horrid, service is poor..... I have done lots of travelling in my life - but got to say this hotel sucked! I would not recommend the Gran Porto Real to anyone. We ended up moving across the street for extra money The Royal Porto Real - now that's a resort!!!! FOOD, ROOMS etc everything is great. Email me if you like robnbren@hotmail.com Thanks.!

Reviews.Title: “worst place i ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: katana11
Reviews.Content: I've been to the caribbean dozens of times and stayed at various resorts and never had cause to complain. This place was horrible. We got to our room and the toilet was making noises, wouldn't flush and there was water on the floor. The room was also next to the elevator and above the entry where buses were dropping off guests so there was a lot of noise. We were also told we would get a partial ocean view junior suite but they told us that there weren't any left so we only had a view of the hotel next door and the parking lot. I went to the front desk and they told me they were booked and we would have to wait until tomorrow to change rooms. I read reviews about the beach having a few boats off to one side which I thought would be fine but I couldn't believe what I saw. There were 15 boats lined up across the whole length of the beach and the water was disgusting. You had to walk about 3 blocks to get to a decent beach and then you didn't get a beach chair. The food was ok in the buffet. We booked two dinners at the italian restaurant upon hearing reviews about it being excellent but we thought it was terrible and cancelled the second dinner there. We ate at the mexican restaurant the last night there and my husband got food poisoning. There was very loud construction just about every day and one entire day I could barely breathe in my room because of the strong paint fumes. I also knew to avoid time shares but these people were ridiculous. A hotel representative sat us down and told us that he might be able to transfer us to the royal porto real next door and I was amenable to the idea since the gran porto was so disappointing. However, he asked for our ID's and credit card and after he walked us over to the hotel two other representatives said we had to spend 90 minutes with them on a tour of the hotel. I told them I wasn't going to pay an extra penny to stay at the royal porto since I knew other people were transferred there for free. I got up and went to the front desk and found out they didn't have room available anyway and was then was met by all three representatives who kept pressuring us to stay for the tour. We refused and left but that didn't stop them from trying to harass us the rest of our vacation. There were other things like not getting towels and having to wait to take showers but I don't want to get into it. The positive of the whole experience was that I got to spend a week with my Husband and the weather was warm (it rained half the time) and it caused me to reconsider my policy of only vacationing in the caribbean (I think I will check out Europe for once). This was my third trip to Mexico and I will definitely avoid it from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful - Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of 4 people (2 couples) and just returned. We booked in October and were told on arrival that they were sold out and get back on the bus! You have to go to the Maya Beach resort (hey, wasnt that in the news lately?). The vacation rep for our tour operator was conveniently unavailable. One of the hotel staff told us if we paid him, he would bump another guest and we could stay at the Gran Porto. We did and eventually each got a junior suite. We were unpacking and someone walked into our room with their suitcases and a couple told us this was their room! Obviously security is an issue??? It took 2 hours to resolve this mess! They had gone through the same hassle and were as frustrated and upset as we were. We stayed in that room and by that time, our whole day was ruined. We ate at all the restaurants and the food was intolerable (except breakfast). Maria's is gross and dinner buffet is scary. There was so much more but people who have posted before us give a pretty good description of this resort's negatives and we agree with them whole-heartedly. I'm not going to regurgitate what I hope you are starting to understand about this place. I think anyone who would give this hotel an excellent or above average rating never stayed there or works for the resort or for Real Hotels. Don't waste your time or hard earned money and take a chance on these resorts. Odds are you will be very disappointed in the end. I paid almost $1800.00 to get a suntan - that was the only part of the trip I enjoyed:o(

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Front Desk Check-in”
Reviews.Author: delpay88
Reviews.Content: Believe everything you read about the bait & switch scam at the front desk. When we arrived we were told there was an error in our reservation and that our week-long vacation was booked at the Real resort in Cancun not at the Gran Porto in Playa Del Carmen. Our travel voucher clearly showed Gran Porto but the front desk personnel were claiming our travel agent made an error and booked us in Cancun. They were trying to convince us we needed to spend our week in Cancun becuase they were over booked and even the Royal Porto across the street was also overbooked. It seems overbooking is a common problem (an not just a few rooms either -- it was 35 rooms that day alone). But we had read the reviews and stood our ground... mostly. After 2+ hours of arguing with the front desk staff, them claiming to get a manager and then saying no manager was available... blah, blah, blah, we finally agreed to spend 1 night in the Real resort in Cancun (another hour's drive away) and return to the Gran Porto the following day. We made sure to get this commitment in writing and were given a room upon our return the following day. On a positive note, upon hearing our frustrations at the Gran Porto, the hotel staff in Cancun gave us the Presidential suite for the night... awesome! This hotel is also amazing. It has no beach (at least not right now) but if you just like to sit by the pool, it is a beautiful hotel with great service. Back to the Gran Porto... the remainder of our stay was good. Service was good but the room was noisy -- no construction but too close to the nightly entertainment and you're up early because of the noise in the hallways and the traffic on the street. Food was good. The a la carte restaraurants are always full, you're lucky if you can get into them but the food was good at both of them. There is no real beach... as you've already read, there are boats docked right in front of the hotel and no good swimming there anyway. But across the street in front of the Royal Porto and beyond, the beach is wonderful. Playa del Carmen is amazing. We would definitely go back but this time to the Royal Porto. Its also close to 5th ave, has an amazing beach and hopefully none of the headaches.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers BEWARE; No Five or Four Star Resort Here”
Reviews.Author: tarazan33
Reviews.Content: Not a five or even four star resort.I have just returned from the Gran Porto and travlers need to know that there are many problems going on at this resort now. If you are a beach walker or even ocean watcher, this is not the resort for you. THERE IS NO BEACH, it is all sandbagged up to your lounge chairs and the water is not blue or green it is black for all of the public boats that are docked in front of the hotel. In Playa del Carmen, the beaches are public, so you have many people walking around the beach area that are not even from your hotel, they may be from cruise ships, from Cozumel or locals. I will be as brief as possible but there is alot to be negative about. Good first: The waiters and waitresses were great, especially Benito on the beach, they kept the drinks coming. The rooms, we had Junior Suites, are very nice and the housekeeping does an excellent job. Lots of activities at the pool and in the lobby bar, you can always find something to do. Okay, the BAD: Food was mediocre at best. We have stayed at many all inclusives before but this one seems to be the worst. The buffet was OK for breakfast and lunch but awful for dinner. You could never make reservations at the other restaurants(Mexican and Italian)they were always full. The restaurants only seat about 100 people. We got there on Sunday the next reservation for Il Pescatore(Italian) was the following Saturday! They need to give the guests another option for food. There was a beach snack bar which had hot dogs and hamburgers but you can only eat them for so many days, same food everyday. Don't bother saving seats by the pool, I got up two mornings at 5 AM to save seats to find both days all stuff was moved onto two chairs, and one morning all the towels I had layed out were gone with new peoples things on the chairs I had saved. There is no beach to walk on or view beacuse of the boats, go next door to the Royal, great beach and no coral. FRONT DESK was AWFUL. They could care less about you or your reservation. Playa Del Carmen is receiving alot of influx of guests from Cancun but it does not mean that the people who have standing reservations should be told they have no rooms.We were told that and we had 14 people in our party. NO Apologies, nothing, just a shrug of the shoulders. The only good thing that came out of the front desk was that we got to stay at the Royal Porto Real next door for one night. That was excellent, pay the extra money and stay there. If we knew the difference we would have. But again, we checked in over there to check out the following morning to check back in the Gran, lots of lugging suitcases and paperwork, all in about 15 hours. No upgrade, no I'm sorry, nothing from the front desk. And when my in-laws got to there room, that had one king size bed for 3 people. No more rooms with doubles, here is a rollaway! My aunt and uncle were placed in the first room on the main floor right next to the lobby were the music played until 1:00Am and people were partying until long after that. The resort seems to be missing alot of personality and friendliness that should be standard in any resort. Please reconsider staying here, especially during a heavily traveled vacation period, you probably will not get your rooms and if you do, they probably won't be right.
