Playa Del Carmen is great, and 5th Avenue rocks but the Gran Porto Real does not. Sorry so lengthy but I want travelers to be aware!!!!

Reviews.Title: “just absolutly loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i just returned from a 2 week vacation at the grand porto real.I was so worried about going to this hotel since my sister and husband joined us on this trip.She was religiously reading trip advisory and reporting back to me on how back the hotel reviews were.I was like so scared.But the hotel was so beautiful,rooms very clean,service friendly,food was very good:buffet,il pescatore and marias restaurant had many variaties and choices to select from.There was contruction going on one of the wings of the hotel.After beeing awakened one morning at 6:20am,my sister insisted i go downstairs and asked them if they could accomodate us in another room far away from the noice,they gave me a little bit of a hard time but you simply have to speek to them very polite and diplomatic and some one will listen to your complaint.They gave us 2 junior suite partial ocean view,much more spacious then the first room we had.My 4 year old grew found of the animation staff:spikey,abraham,nathan.tavo very nice young boys and very much driven by entertaining everybody.So last but not least im very dissapointed by all the bad reviews people wrote about that hotel.I really loved it so so much that i want to go back.The hotel is small and prefectly located close to the 5th avenue and the beach is not that great but there is always the other side to go to.So to all of you please do not religiously believe all the bad reviews people write,because you might think otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real the last week of January 2006. I have been to the Cancun/Playa area 6 times but I am thankful to the people who post on here about the bait and switch problems at check-in because it made me stand my ground and we eventually ended up with a very large street/ocean room and then I can state that everthing was great from then on. We arrived on a flight from Ottawa via Washington - glad to be out of the snow to be met by a young lady who pulled our reservation out of the draw with the wrist bands attached and said "we do not have a room". I enquired as to why they had our wristbands if they did not have a room. Much discussion took place and they wanted to move us to another royal hotel " not far away" and then they would move us to the Royal Porto Real for the rest of the holiday. I asked if there was a beach at the first place and she said no. I asked if I would be compensated and she said "no". I said that it was only 1pm - why were there no rooms available - people must be checking out - they could find my husband and I a room. I asked to speak the manager and he came out and was annoyed with me. The thing that got me annoyed was the attitude. I told them that I would call a local Playa lawyer that I deal with because as far as I was concerned they had my money and I had no room. Pure magic - a room would be available at 3pm. The room was large but looked out on the airconditioning units for the hotel. I spoke to the expedia person in the lobby and she spoke to the hotel manager. She told him that the front desk needed to change their attitude because tourism was already down because of "Wilma" and they were in the hospitality business. I was to go to the front desk the next morning at 10am. We were given an "Oceanfront" jr suite - I had not paid for ocean view and I had paid for ocean view I would have been upset - it was street side but you could see the ocean. After that I had no complaints but watch the women at the front desk - I found their attitude to be unreal - but my advise is refuse to go to another hotel. They will find you a room. So frustrating to start a vacation that way. I never saw any construction - and my experience in mexican hotels is that they are always working/painting or cleaning something.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: bigdave466
Reviews.Content: Ok, it has been a few years since I went to the Gran Porto. But some of these reviews are absolutely ridiculous. The food was great, the drinks were great, the resort was beuatiful, it is right next to 5th Ave, and the staff (including front desk) was wonderful. I really wonder how some people can have such lousy vacations, they are obviously irritated about something. btw, if you paid $3600 for a week for 2 people, you grossly overpaid. The food - Marias had a different menu every night. It was always 4-5 courses, and always hot, fast, and wonderful. The atmosphere at both Marias and Pescatore was wonderful. The italian menu was the same everynight, but it had a ton of different choices. If you went to Chilis or some other chain restaurant every night for a week, you would be tired of it too. BOTH ALA CARTE restaurants are outdoors. If you go there in July or August it WILL BE HOT. Know what you are getting yourself into before you decide on a hotel. We went in October and the temp was ideal. Don't go blindly and then complain about it afterwards. The bufett was just that, a bufett. What do you expect? Cooked to order steak and lobster from the bufett? There is nothing wrong with it, but if you expect first class service and top notch food from a bufett, get real. Once again, know what you are getting yourself into. The beach side grill was wonderful for lunch and snacks. NO, once again, you will not get lobster or prime rib from the SNACK BAR, but you will get good sandwiches and quesadillas and such. There are 4 places to eat, if you are not happy with a Mexican, Italian, Bufett, and Snack Bar, then go somewhere else. I don't believe all the horror stories about overbooking. If you have problems, call your travel agent. Lets assume you used Travelocity or Expedia. Do you really think they would treat those customers wrong and risk getting delisted? Surely not. We had no problem with our room, or check in, and have never had a problem anywhere in Mexico with overbooking. I'm sure it happens, but it also happens on Delta, American, and Continental Airlines from time to time. No one is out to ruin your vacation, and risk bad PR and lose business from one of the big online travel companies. Beach - YES THERE ARE FISHING BOATS ON THE BEACH. Once again, know what you are getting yourself into. We happened to enjoy the boats, they added much character. If you want a pristine, secluded beach, you might want to think of an isolated hotel in the middle of nowhere. The beach was not a perfect swimming beach, but you can go next door in front of the Royal and find what you are looking for. Again, know what you are getting yourself into. Service - I have never been treated so well at any place before in my life. They will literally do anything to make your stay more enjoyable. Don't be afraid to drop $10-20 a day in tips, that little bit goes a long way, and obviously won't phase someone that just spent $3000 on a vacation. Rooms - We had a junior suite, and it was wonderful. No it was not oceanfront, but you know good and well to get oceanfront, you will have to pay a premium. You won't get it for free. You are in a public city, the Gran Porto management cannot help it if some other private business is constructing something next door. Don't let it ruin your vacation, if you want pristine seclusion, then you will not find it anywhere around 5th Ave in Playa del Carmen. Go somewhere else, don't whine about it afterwards. We will be back soon, most likely to try out the Royal. However, I would not hesitate for a second to go back to the Gran. I've patonized Real properties in Cancun as well, and they were just fine too. I highly recommend the Real brand of resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip in South. I could not wait to see the beach. What a disappointment! What a beach, full of fishermen, birds, fishing boats. When we arrived at the hotel, we were booked in a room in the back and when we opened the curtains, the view was a construction site. We asked to be moved but were only moved the next day. The first day I ate at the buffet, I was sick. The Mexican Restaurant was Terrible. The Italian & Caribean Restaurants were good. There were not too much excitement at this resort at night. The entertainement was pretty poor. We liked Mexico but would not return to Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Construction bothersome - check before you book”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned Feb 18 after one week vacation. One big issue was the construction just outside our bathroom window. 6:15 am woke up to jack hammer, drills, saws and such. Also throughout the day so rest in the afternoon was nil on most days. We asked for another room. Gave us another one floor down and a few doors over. There was absolutely no change in the noise level. It appeared the change of rooms was offered to appease us at the moment of complaint. We again asked for another room away from the construction and were told there was nothing available. The 400 and 500 block of rooms back onto the construction. We didn't let it ruin our vacation but that was extremely disappointing. Otherwise, the staff was great, the room was clean and the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Things to be aware of before booking at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Feb 10-17/06. People, you MUST consider what is written by myself and other posters about this resort because it definitely has major issues and the hotel management simply chooses to ignore the problem or make empty promises. It is a 2.5 - 3 star at best There is a serious lack of customer service or consideration towards their guests. People pay alot to go on vacation expecting it to be worry free but end up being more stressed than when they were are home! This resort is not worth the money they are asking. Here's why: - Right off the bat when we arrived, they said they were sold out and that we would be staying at the Barcelo for 2 nights and 5 nights at the Royal Porto Real. If you read past postings, the Barcelo is in the middle of nowhere and usually you would get stuck out there and the Royal Porto would be "sold out". The Royal Porto is like staying at a Loewes hotel and the Gran Porto is like staying in a Best Western - why would they give you a room there? I saw them turn back 3 buses full of passengers from the airport saying they were sold out and wouldn't let them get off the bus. They told the bus driver to go directly to their Real Cancun hotel (by the way, Cancun is still a huge mess with no beach and smells like raw sewage)! They start off so many people's vacation wrong. After refusing to go, the snarly lady at the font desk threw us in the noisy constuction wing in a crappy, small room with loudm banging noise on one side and traffic noise on the other! When we refused the room, she ignored us completely. We eventually had to pay off a desk clerk on the side to get a decent room on the other end a day later. - They cheaped out on everything - from the food, snacks, booze, toilet paper, room amenities to even the interior design. We had to fight to even get bottled water! - There were a few genuinely nice staff there, which we tipped generously and became friends with - The entertainment was really lousy and the daytime activites by the pool were non-existent - The food was HORRIFIC! The Mexican restaurant was really bad, the Italian restaurant was better, probably the best but stay away from the pizza. They charge all-inclusive guests 14.00USD extra for Lobster that is rubbery and overcooked. The only decent meal was breakfast at the buffet but by other hotel standards, the food was stale and overcooked, the fresh juices were watered down. The VIP room was a joke. - Our room smelt like a big, dirty cigar and the blankets/bedspread were dirty. The beds are lumpy so you woke up with a huge backache. The bathrooms were large with only a shower (no bath) but the water kept alternating from cold to hot so if you burned in the sun, the shower was extremely uncomfortable. - The beach? There is no beach at this hotel. You have to walk 5 minutes either way to use the beach because there are some boats parking directly in front of the hotel. The beach in front of the Royal is nice but dont even try to use one of their chairs or you will be escorted off by security - Room service menu is digusting and they only allow it once a day. Then, when you leave the dishes outside for them to pick up, it takes a day for someone to come by and clear it, even with repeated calls to the front desk. Three rooms on our wings were complaining about the cockroaches in their rooms. - The pools are freezing cold and there is no whirlpool. - Even after we paid off someone to get our room, the management would leave notes under our door saying that we "won" the chance to spend the rest of our vacation in Cancun at the Gran Costa Real, which I understand is less desirable than the Gran Porto! It was really insulting and thoughtless on their part to come up with such an obviously lie to compensate for overbooking 85 rooms. By this point, we were just appalled by their dishonestly. The bottom line is that this hotel does not have the hospitality mindset to ensure guests are taken care of, happy and may return the following year. They just don't care! We wont return back to any of the Real hotels. This trip was disappointing as far as the resort goes. Playa del Carmen is great :o)

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: aetutt
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to the Mayan Riviera, we thought it might be best to go through a travel agent to find a good place to stay in Playa del Carmen. The Gran Porto REal was recommended and we paid $3,600 for two of us for the week. When we arrived we were immediately told that they had overbooked and we could not stay. We were shipped off to a resort 30 minutes farther south and told they would bring us back in two days, however, they would let us stay in their sister resort that was a more expensive resort. We were told we had no alternative. They shipped us off to the Barcelo REsort, which was a nice resort but NOT what we had chosen. We even asked if we could just stay there so that we could unpack and settle in to our vacation. We were told no, that we had to return to the Gran Porto Real. The following day we received a telephone call stating that they had made another error and they would not have room at the upgraded sister resort and that we would come back to the Gran Porto REal but we would receive "compensation". On the third day we were told to be waiting with our luggage at noon because they would be picking us up to return us to Play del Carmen. Well noon came and went and no shuttle. My husband finally went to the MLT tour desk and wouldn't leave. Meanwhile we had now spent a couple of hours waiting in the lobby! The MLT rep rented a van and sent us back to the Gran Porto REal. When we arrived only one of the three couples in our group had a room available. The others had to wait. We were told that no one was going to the upgraded sister resort until the following day when they wanted to move us again!!! We finally simply refused to move again...the supposed upgrade was simply not worth having to pack up once more. When we were there this was happening to a lot of people. OUr rep told us that Gran Porto REal is notorious for overbooking. We felt like we lost three days of our seven day stay in Mexico. The staff at the hotel front desk totally didn't give a darn about us, but if they deal with this as often as it appears, then I can see why. We thought the hotel was beautiful and the other staff very nice, but it simply is not worth worrying about how many times they will move you while you are on vacation. BEWARE of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real Resort”
Reviews.Author: SandraToronto
Reviews.Content: Jan 28th - Feb 11th, 2006 We just returned from the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen where my son was married on Feb 8th. We were a group of 40 adults. The weather was perfect and with the help of a wedding planner, the wedding was wonderful. We enjoyed Mexican music during the ceremony and found terrific photo opportunities everywhere around the resort. The private reception was on the beach with a full course meal and dancing afterwards. The resort is very well situated for those who want to be close to shopping, restaurants, bars as it is located right in Playa del Carmen. The Mayan Ruins of Tulum are about 45 minutes away and well worth seeing. The resort is beautiful and if possible, you will enjoy the upgrade to a jr. suite as the regular rooms are very small. The 3rd floor swim up pool is quite nice and not crowded like the large pool on the main level. The beach is nice but small. There are several fishing boats right in front of the resort, but you won't notice these after the first day. There is a lobby bar, a pool bar and a swing bar that serve great tropical drinks. The Mexican restaurant called Maria's is great and the waiters are fun. Have a Mayan coffee, very entertaining to watch them make. The Italian restaurant "El Pescadore" is also very good. They serve the best caesar salad there. The resort buffet dining room has lots of variety and they will cook almost anything you ask for. The reception staff were friendly and very helpful. Special thanks to the Reception Manager, Carlos. Our suite was very clean and room service was fast and warm. It was a very good holiday. The only thing that we did not enjoy was the nightly entertainment. The dancers were talented, but the shows are very amateur. Audience participation might have helped guests enjoy the shows more! There is construction of a new building going on right now next to the regular rooms section. Work starts early in the morning! Take a sweater or light jacket as some nights can be cool. A great experience. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect....almost”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from a great week at Gran Porto Real. OVERALL: The hotel is beautiful and the size is perfect. We thought the food was above average for an all inclusive. The bar service was exceptional. There was always a waiter around serving drinks, even on the beach. (try a mango daiquiri) DRAWBACK: The only drawback (and this was a major one) was the construction behind our secton of the hotel. (near the 4th floor swimup bar Room 418) Every morning (6am) we woke up to the sound of a hammer and one morning a jackhammer. The manager said this was nothing to do with Real Porto and there was nothing he could do about it. If you want to stay at this hotel over the next couple of months make sure you are in the front section towards the ocean and you won't even be aware that there is construction going on. FOOD: Book your al-la carte reservations on your first day and you won't have a problem getting reservations at a reasonable time. The buffet dining room was great and if you really want to you can order room service at no extra charge. ENTERTAINMENT: The fishermen in front of the hotel will take you for a nice day fishing or snorkelling to a secluded spot and they are pretty funny guys. Make sure to try surfing a kayak (included) in the waves right in front of the hotel. The hotel is walking distance to lots of fun shops and restaurants. Yes the Blue Parrot has burned down. I guess a fire show in a straw hut isn't such a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Be Assertive At Check In and Beware the Lobby Barracuda”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, we are travelers with simple expectations- you should get what you pay for. We are not snobs and do not expect a so called 4 or 5 star in Mexico to be the same as what we have in Canada, but when you are paying so much you expect some value for your money and to be treated with truthful respect. Like so many who have posted, when we finally got to the hotel, we were told our room was not ready. The checked us in so we would have our bracelets, and said they would hold our bags and encouraged us to explore the hotel. MY ADVICE- get your bracelet, get a drink and return the desk and ask for your room. NICELY. Tell them you don’t mind if it isn’t ready, that you want to see it… Make sure they have a room for you that is what you booked. Yes, we ended up with the constructions view, when we booked ocean view, and our travel agent had requested ocean view and VIP treatment. It took MANY frustrating trips to the front desk and eventually we got moved to a street side room that was close to the ocean. (242 to the ocean end of the building really aren’t bad views, the odd ones have ocean view). It was the fact we were lied to about when a new room was available (come back at 9am, comeback at noon, come back at 3pm) mislead about room availability and had to come back four times to finally get moved really ruined the first few days of our holidays. They whole room issue could have been overcome with some simple gestures on their part-champagne or wine waiting for us in the room, a free scuba or snorkeling tour or a massage on the beach. Hey, we may have even stayed in the lousy room. Instead we got the run around and left with a sour feelings. Oh and the 24 VIP room has a funky smell and lousy snacks. And room service is free once per day and not super fast so get up, order breakfast, make coffee if you have the coffee maker and enjoy your view if you have one. They were painting on our wing but the fumes didn’t make into our rooms but we heard others complain. And the hot tub that looked so wonderful on the Expedia virtual tour, was closed as they were redoing it. It is also very annoying that the Swing Bar closes at 5 pm, the central pool side bar closes around 11 pm and they close down inside around 1 am. That is when you head to Mambo or another bar on 5th. And I agree with others, beware the time share folks they are the only barracudas we saw all week. They look like staff with their Real Resort shirts, but they are just trying to get you across the street to sell you on the Royal. Tell them you have a time share already-that might work. (I doubt it). They are persistent and annoying and I got to the point of telling them to leave me alone before I got really rude. And then I just ignored them beyond saying hello. We walked in to the Royal via the entrance by the boutique and had a quick look around. Don’t come in the front and then you can check the place out. If you can’t find your travel representative, head over to the Royal or ask the front desk for the number for the travel desk at the Royal. We could never find our North West/Worry Free representative and when we finally tracked him down, he was across the street. Yes, book your a la carte reservations early if you like dining between 6 and 8. The main buffet was extensive and better than average buffet quality. After all of the ugly, here is the good. The best part of the stay—the people. The staff is overworked and underpaid. They will treat you with the same respect and kindness you treat them with, and then some. The animation team rocks and work so very very very hard and such long hours. But they way they get transferred from hotel to hotel with in the chain, you may not come across them again. The Spanish Lessons were great, personalized and a lot of fun. Phil at the swim up bar is fabulous. The easiest way to find the swim up bar the first time is to go up the stair case past he spa and gym (streetside). The location is great as you are close to Fifth Avenue and right on the beach. You can walk down past the Royal, Las Palapas and other hotels to where the other boats are and snorkel the reef beyond the boats for free if you have your own stuff. It isn’t the best, but it is free and we saw lots of cool fish etc. The staff at the swing bar were great and if you want to chill on the beach with tunes, that is the end of the beach to find a lounger. Now here is the best tip I can give you…relax, it is a holiday. We had so much go wrong in the beginning of our trip and we jut kept repeating, “at least we are away from the snow, and can afford to get away!” And if you need a name to drop – Nicholas Vasquez (not sure of the spelling) appeared to be the hotel manager. That is the bonus for reading our whole review! If you get the right room from the start (maybe phone the week before you leave to confirm, maybe tip the guy at the front heavily) and avoid the timeshare barracudas- this isn’t too bad of a place to stay, we just never plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Please take the time to read this!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me give you a little background.This was our 9th trip to various destinations in Mexico.We have grown to love this country and its people.Also,I've never stayed at the same resort twice,and we've always found that each destination offers a different experience.We travelled to Playa Del Carmen for a week starting Jan.28th,2006.We checked in quickly,but received a room facing the street instead of Oceanview.I did go back to the lobby,and asked NICELY if there was a possibility of receiving a different room.I was told that we could change in the morning.I THANKED the fellow and was put on the list.From there I went to get a beer to go for my wife and I,as she stayed in the room to unpack.I struck up a conversation with a fellow from the UK,and asked him how he was enjoying the hotel.He had been there 8 days.I asked him where his room was located and what he thought of it.He went on to tell me that he had stayed in over 40 AIs across the world,that he loved the hotel,but found the room very small.THE BEST ROOMS,he said seem to be those facing THE Street!I thanked him,promptly went back to the check in desk,and told the clerk that we decided that our room was fine.He assured me he would move me tomorrow,but we stayed put.Great choice!We were in 289,and found the little pool with swim up bar just to our right,above Marias Restaurant.Many people don't know it's there! We loved the location.Out the back of the lobby was the pool and beach,and out the front of the lobby was a 2 block walk to 5th Avenue.Fantastic!The room was always clean,the shower that wasn't draining was fixed as soon as I ASKED NICELY,( starting to get my drift?) The food was very good FOR MEXICO,the ala carte restaurants were good,with MARIAS our favourite.Lobster Thermador for an extra 14USD,was worth it,and the Mayan Coffee was a wonderful treat,especially the presentation! TIPPING-those that say it doesn't help are very wrong.I usually tip 150 to 200 USD during the week.If you made 8 USD per DAY,not hour ,you'd appreciate it too!We usually tip more money, less frequently,quite often 5 bucks a couple of times a week per deserving individual.Believe me,they don't forget you!One day at the above mentioned quiet pool,there were 10 people at the bar,and 4 of us at a separate table on the terrace.The only bartender left the bar to wait on us at our table! The Mexican people truly live by the golden rule.If you treat them with a smile and respect,you will receive the same thing in return.If not,you too will write a negative review!Don't believe any of the complaints.Remember,you are not on a Mediterranian Cruise,in Naples Florida,or Toronto,or Orlando,Los Angeles,or dining at Ruths Chris,etc.This is Mexico,set your expectations accordingly,let your hair down,relax,etc.If you can't-go to the above places and let the rest of us have a WONDERFUL TIME. PS.I finally tried snorkeling-we spent the whole day from 9 to 5 at XEL HA.ABSOLUTELY AWESOME!!! Do the all inclusive there,which gives you unlimited food,drinks,snorkeling,etc.for 100USD! A final note-I did the math-that bartender needs 43 days to buy the patio set I saw at the MEXICAN WAL MART.He's happy- How about you? ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Gran Porto Real was great!”
Reviews.Author: dubbcee
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just got back from a week at the Gran Porto Real. The hotel is beautiful with a fantastic ocean view. Not sure how the beaches were a few months ago but from the reviews we expected bad beaches. This is not the case at all. The beach was just fine and we didn't mind the boats that were docked in front. In fact, we thought it added character. There is a little less beach than there used to be from the pictures I'd seen here, but it's not as bad as some people might think. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and housekeeping did a great job in making up the rooms everyday. The food at the buffet was good and never cold. The pancakes are FANTASTIC! If you have a chance and like pancakes, get them. You will not be disappointed. If you want fantastic food, you MUST go to Il Pescatore, the Italian restaurant. It is so good and you have to make reservations early on in your stay because it books quickly. We were lucky and got 3 days but some don't get that many. If we had the chance, we'd have been there every night. The Mexican restaurant was nothing to write home about. The service was good, but the menu was disappointing and the food was just alright. The beach service is great. Having drinks brought to you while you relax on the beach is so nice. If you have a chance, check out the pool on the 3rd floor. It's small and secluded so there isn't a lot of traffic and it's nice and relaxing. Having the pool bar is nice and convenient. Get a Miami Vice...it's lovely! The hotel is just minutes from Fifth Avenue and while you can get good deals, be careful with the vendors you first meet when you turn the corner. They'll try to rip you off like they did with me. The further you walk, the better the deals and a lot of the time you'll get better deals at the stores with fixed prices. Also, some of the vendors will ask for tips, so be cautious of that too. The only real complaints I have were that there was no iron in the room even when we called and told there were and the same thing goes for the dvd player. It's not that they didn't have them in each room that irked me, it was being misinformed that was a little irritating. All in all, it was a great resort and would highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Ozzy-E
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Gran Porto Real and had a fabulous vacation. The hotel is beautiful with lots of Mexican flare! The location of the hotel is perfect. Just steps away is 5th Ave, which is a haven for shoppers, diners and party goers. There's even a Wal-Mart, Scotia Bank and Sam's Club within walking distance. The buffet restaurant's food was wonderful and the wait staff offered excellent service with a smile. The beach offered excellant food and bar service and of course, the wait staff were always pleasant. The hotel's two A la Carte Restaurants were excellant. However, the hotel does not restrict its guests to two reservations per week, as most hotels do. This is a huge problem because there is very limited seating in these restaurants and they fill up quickly. The worst part is, that unless you book a reservation the minute you get there, you're probably S.O.L. I experienced this first had while waiting in line behind a lady who was making dinner reservations for eight people, over the next ten days, alternating nights between the two restuarants. Needless to say that others, like myself, were left with little choice. Definately a problem that the hotel needs to address. Aside from that, the food and the restaurants, buffet included, were wonderful. One could eat virtually 24 hours a day on the All Inclusive Plan, which we did! The hotel offers a safe in each room free of charge. We used the safe for everything and anything of value, every day, all day long. The Porto Real is located on the beach, but not necessarily the nicest beach. The water is somewhat rocky and local fishermen anchor their boats at the Porto Real beach. Government Property! Lots of security at the beach for the hotels guests, which wasn't needed, as we always felt safe at the hotel and anywhere that we went in Playa. We booked through Nolitours, which brags about having the exclusive to the standard rooms at the Porto Real. What a disappointment. Certainly nothing to brag about. The rooms were small. Nice, clean, but small. There are much larger rooms available, obviously through other tour operators, so beware if you book with Nolitours and room size is important to you. We chose to keep our room, since it was only a place to sleep at night. Based on the other reviews I've read since returning home, it seems we were lucky to get a room. Thankfully, we had a room ready as promised when we got there and never had a problem. We did not take in any Timeshare presentations offered by our hotel. Nor did we book any sightseeing tours with our hotel. We did get sucked into one Timeshare, at the airport. While their booths offer tourist information, their main goal is Timeshare. It turned out okay in the long run. We got two tickets each to three different attractions (turned the 4th one down) which saved us some $$$$. Lucky for me, my husband is good at saying NO to Timeshares. In closing, we had a great vacation, great food and great memories of the Porta Real and the Mayan Riveria and would not hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The Gran Porto Real almost ruined our holiday - avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned on February 4, 2006, and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Playa del Carmen is excellent, most of the staff are wonderful (although they seemed very overworked), and the food is great. However, we felt, in terns, ripped off, lied to, put off, mocked, and scammed. The managment of this place seem to have decided that the people who book are pretty easy marks. Our room was not ready when we arrived. 4 hours later, we find our room overlooks a construction site, complete with hammers, drills and a crane that starts up at 6 AM. Considering we paid for an ocean view room, we went to the front desk and were told we were lucky we got a room at all, as they were seriously overbooked (talking to other guests who had to be shipped to Cancun for a night or two, and a wedding party who's parents arrived and had no room available for them, I guess it could have been worse). The front desk told us to come back in the morning, at 9 AM, and they would move us because people should have checked out by them. So, at 9 AM we are told to come back at 11 AM. At 11 AM we are told there are no rooms. Talk to a manager, told to come back at 1 PM. It finally took us screaming in the lobby, and magically, a room appeared. I have to assume they took us for suckers who would just drop the issue and accept a construction site for a view while they enjoyed our hard earned money. As other people have said, beware the 'barracudas' in the lobby. They are paid by the Real hotels to sell you time shares, and they wont leave you alone. Ever. We ended up taking the long way around the lobby to avoid them, which is pretty sad. Overall, this place is no 4 star hotel, althought they charge as if they were. I wouldn't waste my money here ever again (or any Real resort), but am already planning another trip to the awesome Mayan Rivera.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and loved it. We had only booked at standard room and it was perfect. Our room was just outside the 3rd floor pool bar and we had these wonderful open balconys (you had to share with the room next to you and they were open) but we had no problems. We thought the food was delicious and we had no problems booking the alacarte the day ahead for the time we wanted (I would recomend booking it more in advance if you know what your plans for the days are just in case). We found the ocean to be a little disapointing.. alot of rocks everywhere and boats but we just went over to the Royal to swim. We loved being so close to the town, every night we would walk the strip. I think over all for what the area has gone thru (Wilma) they are doing a good job at trying to get things back to normal. Everyday they would haul sand to try and build up the beach where it was taken away. We would stay here again... we had a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately A Bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used to love this place! I have stayed here several times. It is so attractive, in town ,and smaller than most of the mega resorts, but on my last visit they made it virtually impossible to eat at the hotel for those who were not on the All Inclusive plan, yet would not let us upgrade to an All Inclusive option. We usually eat in town anyway, but just ordering the basics was a bit labor intensive. I think that we were the only guests there that were not on the AI plan. Getting a chair by the pool is crazy. You better rise and shine early if you want to be by the pool or under a cabana. I even get up early, but not early enough. Also, the housekeeper stole all of my money out of my wallet while I was on my balcony for less than 2 minutes. I obviously noticed immediately what had occured( when I saw my wallet splayed on the bed with evry card out on the bedspread)and after a couple of days after reporting the incident and being questioned several times, the housekeeper returned to work and admitted to taking my money. I was re-imbursed in pesos only and was told to be quiet and to not tell anyone about what had happened. I was very excited that the issue was resolved and that I was re-imbursed, but it was still a bit sketchy. A year ago I would have raved about this place, but not I am not so sure that I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Scam Artists!!! They overbook the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for our 10th wedding anniversary trip to Gran Porto we were met with a very sweet front desk clerk who informed us that there was no room. No room? We booked this trip months ago? There was no room and they would be moving us to another hotel for a few days, then bring us back. "Do you own the other hotel" I asked. Yes. "Can I see a picture of the other hotel"? We can't seem to find one. "Is it the same star class as yours" Yes. They immediately put us into their van to wisk us away to what they considered to be equivilent accomodations. Put it this way, we paid for the Hyatt and got put up in a Super 8. Everything they told us was lies. When we returned for our final two days we complained and asked to speak to the manager. We got put off for 45 minutes. After a few attempts at peace offerings of a 25 minute massage and $10 lobster, they asked us to sign a waiver claiming we could not complain about this infraction to anyone. Obviosly we did not sign. In the 45 minutes waiting for the manager we watched three other couples fresh from the airport get pitched the same scenario. And on it went. Look. Its a nice place, and the staff are good enough people. The company they work for is crooked. You will get moved around. Over promised and under delivered. And they will try to scam you into time shares and over-priced day trips. If you can manage that, then I am sure you will have a much better time then my wife and I did for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: quaz1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Porto Dec 31-Jan 7 with several members of my family. The occasion was the wedding of my nephew. Firstly, let me say that the wedding coordinator did a fabulous job. The ceremony was beautiful and perfectly suited to our family. Not too fussy but very lovely. It was obvious to me that the hotel had undergone some serious renovations due to the hurricane. Everything was spotless and newly painted. My daughter and I received a room upgrade to a junior suite upon arrival. We were told it was just for one night but we were never moved which was fine with me! The room was very large with a big walk-in closet, huge bathroom and two very comfy beds. We didn't have a view but who cares...we spent very little time in it anyway. The standard room my sister was in was a little small but very nice. I highly recommend the two a la carte restaurants...Maria's and El 'something'. Top-notch service, fun atmosphere and fabulous food presentation. You must try a Mayan Sacrifice shooter at Maria's (see Ivan about that) and a flaming Mexican flag through a straw! We would end every night at the pool bar. Raphael and Sergio 'Garcia' were our bartenders and always made our evening enjoyable. One place you should not miss is the 3rd floor pool bar. After a hot day at the beach its a great cool spot for a drink made to order by Phillipe. The buffet restaurant was very nice. The selection was good and the food very tasty...no complaints! There's a nice lobby bar with big screen TV's. There is always plenty of opportunity to eat...no problem there. The new beach buffet had great food. Burgers, hotdogs, nachos, fries....great lunch stuff. Try the squid and shrimp salad...spicy and yummy! Don't forget to walk down the beach toward the Royal Porto and have a pina coloda at the new swing bar. It's quaint and unique. Lastly, I have to say that the location of the Gran Porto is what makes it truly a great hotel. I have stayed several times farther south on the Mayan Riviera and quite frankly wasn't sure I'd like to stay in town. Well, forget about that. I'll always stay in town now. A nice 5 minute stroll and you're on Quinta Ave. Go to the Tequila Barrel for their $2 Corona. Lots of great shopping and even better people watching. Caution: if you have any pretty young 'chicas' in your group you'll have to really keep your eye on them if you go to Carlo's & Charlie's. You've been warned! We enjoyed the Friday Night Fire Show at the Blue Parrot but I've just read it burned down...possibly on Friday night? All in all, the Gran Porto is a wonderful resort and I definitely recommend it and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: gettingoutofthecold
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Porto for our honeymoon in mid January. We loved the trip. After a long flight it was great to have a fast check-in and our room was ready immediately. The room was exactly what we wanted (junior suite ocean view), very clean. The beach is somewhat small directly in front of the resort, but this was not a draw back. There is plenty of beach in front of the Royal if you want to swim. The wait staff were always there for drink orders. The food was good. We were always able to get reservations at the sit down restaraunts. We got a little tired of the buffet after a week, but that is going to happen anywhere. The grill on the beach is a nice change for some meals. The only downside was the nightly entertainment. We did not really enjoy the shows, but this was very minor as we didn't go to Mexico for this reason. Overall the trip was very relaxing. I would stay there again if we ever go back. Feel free to email.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: cravenbeach
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just arrived home from two weeks at the Gran Porto Real. We were really impressed by the hacienda style architecture of the hotel. It had alot of character compared to its stuffier sister hotel across the street. Although the Royal Porto Real was a 5 star luxary hotel, I perferred it at the Gran Porto Real. We booked a junior suite, but up graded to a junior ocean front suite after the first night. The room was huge, with tall ceilings. We had a walk in closet with lots of storage. The bathroom very nice with a huge shower with a mirror in it. The Room was very clean! I have stayed at many other all inclusives before including 5 stars which didnt have nearly as good of food as the Gran Porto Real. The buffet wasnt huge, but the quality of the food was good. Drinks were good at the bars. Try a Miami vice, chi-chi, or bahama Mama. Beach service was amazing, especially Jesus...very attentive! The entertainment staff were wonderful, and got everyone involved in all the activities. The pool area was quite loud with music, activities and children but if you are looking for quiet, once you hit the beach it becomes much quieter. The best part of the of the hotel is the location to 5th avenue. It is very close, and will possibly be part of your evening schedule. It is really, really neat! It is very unfortunate that the Blue Parrot burned down while we were there because we had enjoyed it a couple nights and planned on going a couple more times before we left. It was a really cool spot! I recommend this hotel to families and couples who like action and entertianment. People looking for a quiet secluded feel vacation this isnt the spot for you!

Reviews.Title: “poor for groups, but a great place”
Reviews.Author: saxj
Reviews.Content: we had 34 for my sisters wedding: check in was terrible. no rooms, wrong rooms, etcc. 4 people were swiched to the Royal next door which was fine but then the bride and groom could not see them in their hotel. When they could have rectified the situation, they wanted all of us to move. On vacation, when packed and settled, you do not feel like moving again and they did not have room for the 4 they removed from our group. The simple solution was to give bride and groom a wristband so they could visit their guests but they said this was impossible!!The best was the person that paid the least got right in, had a suite with double patio, while we who paid the most fought for accomodations> Real poor managers. The food is fair ; the worst is they have 2 sit down restaurants needing reservations> If you try to book, they are full until 10pm no matter what so they can steer you to buffet. if you walk by these restaurants, they are basically empty. the other hustle is in the hotel they try to have you visit the Royal to book vacation club, timeshare junk endlessly. They ought to ease up. As for the plus, LOCATION IS GREAT AND THEY PULLED OFF A GREAT WEDDING... I would try the area again but a different hotel: There must be better organized ones. Another note: Alux, a cave restaurant, beautful but food poor. Go to see , have a drink and catch the Mayan show. Blue Parrot burned down while we were there

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. Very accomodating to our every need. People there were VERY friendly, especially the poolguys (Spike, Abraham, Nathan, Papi) they made it a blast. Always something going on to entertain you.. You'll find the best food at this motel...buffet was excellent. The maids exeeded our expectations..overall just a great place to stay. The only downside we found was the pool was chilly most days.

Reviews.Title: “No more European Plan Available”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Gran Porto Real during the last 2 April vacations with my family, and we've enjoyed both visits.On both of our trips, we booked the European plan, as there are so many great restaurants in town that are within walking distance, and we've never really had a bad meal there. We were planning to go back this February, but when we tried to book our hotel reservations today, we were dismayed to find THERE IS NO EUROPEAN PLAN AVAILABLE ANYMORE.Very disappointing, as we love exploring the area, and we love the hotel, but can't imagine eating all of our meals at the same place for the week. We have recommended the Gran Porto to many of our friends, but will no longer do so, and will look for another place to stay in the future. We were looking forward to another great week, but will have to settle for Key West instead this year.Hopefully we can find a new place in Playa for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Blast!!! (After they straightened out our room situation)”
Reviews.Author: howiesgurlus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GPR Oct 3-Oct 10 2 adults and 2 teenagers (15 & 17) they didnt have our rooms correct as we specificly asked for 2 rooms together oceanfront, they had the adults on the 3rd floor and the teenagers on the 2nd floor, the next day they did move us and it was fine after that,I was disapointed to see the boats on the ocean but it was ok,we went to the jungle tour and then we also did parasaling,(that was a blast)the food and drinks and people were great(except for the little guy trying to sell you timeshares across the street,he was a bit of a pain but we never went)spike the poolguy was our escort when we went to mambo cafe (kinda boring,he is a great person with a wonderful personality!! hada blast testing tequilla on 5th street, would recommend this place to anyone, just be VERY SPECIFIC on your room,otherwise I would stay again!Be sure to trya BOOM-BOOM and also try a shot

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunite experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was wonderful - my family and I had a terrific time however we loved it so much we decided to purchase 300 advance nights from Premier Holiday which is located and solicited in their lobby. Well when I called in August to book our return trip to this hotel they would not honor the contract that we paid $7800.00 for and no one wants to be responsible and unfortunantly my husband will never go back to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “I. I. I.”
Reviews.Author: yippeesun
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived were were sad to see boats docked on our beach, but walking a little ways to the left or right and you had a decent place to swim. The food was fabulous, there was a large selection leaving something for everyone. I enjoyed the omplettes in the morning without cheese as the cheese down there is not so good. The A La Carte restaurants were so wonderful! The way that they plated their food and the fabuous waiters kept us coming back every night. The pool was nice with some very sexy guys running the activities for the day, I'd recommend the aqua fitness class followed by bracelet making or water polo. We also enjoyed taking the Kayaks out or snorkeling. There were plenty of fish to be seen in the rocky areas of the ocean. The swing bar down the far end of the beach was fun and made the best Pina Colada's. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the fabuous 5th Ave and we spent almost every evening down there. The Blue Parrot is also only a short stroll down the beach and is a great time. The evening fire show is well worth it as well as the dance floor on the beach. We also really enjoyed the pool bar with it's great staff to finish up every day or the VIP lounge with self serve alcohol and food open 24 hours. I would definately come back again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GRAN PORTO REAL”
Reviews.Author: Manhattan25
Reviews.Content: Went to Playa Del Carmen a couple years ago, my best friend and I (early 20's)... HOTEL: BEAUTIFUL and v. clean! We asked for an ocean view and was stunned with the size of the room... It was HUGE! STAFF: Everyone was friendly... Exceptly, oddly enough, the waiters. Would suggest doing the all inclusive b/c the food on 5th Avenue were horrible and over-priced. We didnt' do the all inclusive at the hotel and therefore, our options were limited. BEACH: GORGEOUS! Luckily the hotel was just a few minutes walk from the beach. Can go topless - most do. EXCURSION: La Isla Mujeres - was a waste of money. Chichen Itza was AMAZING and worth the time. Our tour guide was exceptionally knowledgeable. Tres Rios - great if you're v. active. CONS: The hotel guests were mostly Spainards and Italians. Therefore, going on some of the excursions - Isla and Tres Rios was a bit difficult since the staff only spoke Spanish. Is a bit frustrating but can get by with limited Spanish. SECRET PRO: Check out UNICO - which is this cute shop at the beginning of 5th Avenue. Definatley for the shop-aholic.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip Back in Seven Years”
Reviews.Author: SanchezFamily
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a trip to Playa Del Carmen (12/16 – 12/21). My husband and I last visited Playa Del Carmen about seven years ago, so we were amazed by how much it had changed. We couldn’t believe that Playa now has a Super Wal-Mart, SAMS, Burger King, two McDonalds, and a Papa Johns. You definitely can’t call Playa Del Carmen a sleepy fishing town any more. If it weren’t for the plethora of silver jewelry shops, we might have forgotten we were in Mexico. If I had to rate the Gran Porte Real hotel on a scale from 1-5, I’d give it a 2.5. The hotel exterior was well kept, the rooms were nice, the pool was great, the beach was okay, the evening entertainment was good, house keeping was fantastic, but the front desk personal were horrible—not very helpful, not very accommodating, and not very friendly. Because we were traveling with two young children (3 and 5), we originally requested a junior suite with double beds, which we never got. We ended up settling for a room with a king-sized bed and a cot. We went with the European plan, so we only ate in the hotel on one occasion. The restaurant atmosphere was good and the food was average. Playa Del Carmen has gotten a little too busy for our taste, so we probably won’t vacation there again. We will most likely return to Akumal or try Isla Mujeres the next time we visit the Yucatan.

Reviews.Title: “What Tennis?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Gran Porto Real, in part, because it advertised tennis as an activity. Lo and behold, the resort has no tennis court. At the front desk, we were told to talk with the concierge to arrange court time at the one roof-top tennis court at the Royal Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: LOVED the Gran Porto Real. Buyer beware though. Luckily we were very aware of what the rooms looked like. Upon arrival they tried to stick us in a standard room when we had paid for a junior suite. After much screaming we were relocated to a fantatic room. After that the trip was wonderful. Fantatic service, good food, great location, great pool. It was everything that we were looking for. We will return, but next time get an ocean FRONT room. Make sure that you do not just request ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Mexico, most of the reported damage is exagerated!”
Reviews.Author: Janinescott
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 weeks in Playa Del Carmen on Sunday Dec 12/05. Weather was excellent, beach is better than ever, hotels are up and running, most stores & resturants up & operating, most of the tour and theme parks are open and all with warm hosptitality from the Mexicans! Gran Porto Real faired very well from the hurricanes and everthing looks great now. Staff very quickly got into gear and rooms were re-painted, new plants and trees planted, plus a new bar on the beach with swings! (They had to hand dig the swimming pools out because they were filled with the beach sand) This was our 2nd time at this resort and the food, service and rooms are great and we have no complaints what so ever. We love the location because of the short walk to all the resturants / bars, shopping and incredible long walks along on the beach in either direction. We swam at a different location on the beach everyday! We have stayed at more luxurious resorts in the area but we find this one fun & friendly and the bartenders have the tequila slammers down to a fine science. Our favourite restaurant at the hotel was Maria's - features Mexican food. We have tried many of the restaurants along 5th Ave too. We met a lot of great & friendly people here and they loved the resort as well. Janine & Garry from Ontario, Canada, e-mail: janine@janinescott.com

Reviews.Title: “Charming Little Town”
Reviews.Author: Shelby1203
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10 year old daughter and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real directly following the huricane in August, and although there was a little debris here and there on the beach, everything was put back together quite nicely. Our experience was that the service was good, the people were friendly and made every effort to occomodate. For example, when we arrived at the hotel I accidentally left an envelope containing all of our passports and travel documents in the back of the cab. We told the front desk, they immediately got on the phone and contacted the cab company, and didn't stop trying until they finally figured out the name of the cab driver. We had all our documents back within 2 days and we were only charged $20 for their return. We found the food at the Italian restaurant to be very good, and room service was excellent. We did not go "all inclusive" for this vacation and we were happy with our choice. We found the food in Playa del Carmen to be good at every place we ate, from the little walk-up pizza joint to the lobster restaurant, and most of the prices were reasonable (the only expensive meal we had was the lobster dinner). The town of Playa del Carmen is a hop, skip and a jump from the hotel, and it is absolutely charming. At night the town lights up and the view is spectacular! I guess the only complaint I would have was the beach. It was rather small, but you could easily take a short walk and find a better spot.

Reviews.Title: “Got us through the hurricane”
Reviews.Author: mizer4re
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the famous hurricane and the Gran Porto Real and the Royal Porto Real where they took excellent care of us. They are some of the few hotels that will be up and running before the others. What an absolutely beautiful place before the hurricane and after, and the staff was soooo accomodating during our stay on the ballroom floor. Both are extraordinary resorts and we are planning to go back as soon as the clean up and restorations are finished. We enjoyed the atmosphere of the Gran Porto Real with it's historical villa appeal more than the modern touch of the Royal Porto Real but both were excellent in a time of crisis.

Reviews.Title: “We love the GPR”
Reviews.Author: Cindykincaid201
Reviews.Content: We just returned for PDC and absolutely love the GPR. We were there during TS Stan and had decided to try a new place. We got flooded out of the first place and decided to go over and see what GPR had. They were most gracious and showed us rooms they had available and let us choose and then negotiate. We went room only because we love the restaurants on 5th. We stayed on the 3rd floor overlooking the beach & down the beach towards the older ferry dock. GREAT VIEW. We actually love the little fishing boats tied up there. Gives it a great European flavor. The maids did a great job each day with our suite. We made drinks in our rooms since we were room only. The bartenders quickly filled our ice buckets each time. We have already made our reservations for next May, 2006 but after Jan. 1, 2006 its AI only...no room only rates any longer. So what, you eat breakfast and maybe some lunches, drink lots at GPR during day then go to 5th Ave for dinner, entertainment each night. We love it!!! We love PDC and GPR.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GPR from Oct 12-19. Got out just before the hurricane! The hotel was very nice, we didn't do all inclusive but did eat at the Italian restaurant in the hotel and liked it. The beach was great, we swam in the ocean almost every day. Only two complaints. Hotel tried to downgrade us to standard room even though we had booked Junior Suite. We wouldn't accept the switch and told them that we were going to talk to our travel agency, Worry Free, and miraculously our Junior Suite opened up. The first 2 days we were there the hotel tried to pressure us into going to a presentation at their sister hotel. Overall I would still recommend the hotel for its awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly43456
Reviews.Content: Service was great, luggage was delivered to our room before we knew what room was ours. They refilled the refrig. daily with free pop and beer. Lovely pools and great food. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Royal Porto Real!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the GPR we were told we were being upgraded to the Hotel accross the street...The Royal Porto Real. I was so glad we did! It was amazing. The rooms were beautiful. The employees went out of their way to make us happy. The beach and water was beautiful. We paid for the all-inclusive trip so we ate at the hotel (Maria Maria, Spice, Asiana, Pelicanos..etc) it was all great. We ventured over to the Gran Porto Real hotel's bar one day and the service was just not very good. Not friendly at all! My only complaints would be that the beds were a little to firm, and their was construction on the other side of the hotel which started pretty early in the morning. I would love to answer any questions you have about my stay, and I will post pictures!

Reviews.Title: “3 out of 5”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the GPR staying 7 days. Here is what I found: Pool area great. I really liked this area. Beach just ok. I have seen better and worse. The boats did not bother us but I am sure it bothers some. Food was average. Sometimes great and sometimes not so great. The room location was awesome, ocean front. The smell however from 8am until 11am was not good. Staff was friendly and most went out of their way to help. Great location to 5th Ave. Overall, just 3 out of 5. They have some problems and some pluses.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't choose it”
Reviews.Author: Sue Y
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Playa (Oct. 6-13). I had booked the Gran Porto Real through Expedia back in June. When we arrived they were "overbooked" and we were moved across the street to the sister hotel- Royal Porto Real. That hotel was fabulous! No problems. If you are thinking about booking the Gran Porto, don't. The beach is horrible. There were tons of small fishing boats anchored to the beach. Not a lot of swimming space. There was also a lot of seaweed. The hotel itself is beautiful, so if ocean swimming isn't your thing, it'll be ok. BUT, as for the Royal's beach, it was amazing! Seaweed and ship free. So, having our Gran Porto room switched to the Royal Porto was a blessing in disguise! I can't say anything about the food there because we didn't book the all inclusive. The food on 5th Avenue is amazing and cheap! Eat at Babe's Noodle bar, Los 3 Carboncitas, La Tarraya, Carmencitas, El Oasis and La Siesta. Enjoy drinks at El Pirata. On Sunday's if Carlos is working ask him to play his cd's-Big Bad Voodoo Daddy and Thompson Twins! Have some Don Julio with sangrita!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, thats about it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read another review that said dont do the all inclusive. AMEN to that. The food is absolutely DISGUSTING. My boyfriend who is not picky agrees. I would feel ill then start to feel better but as soon as I ate I was sick again. We tried to make reservations at one of the other restraunts and got the run around. One person told us we had to do it the day we wanted to eat another told us we had to do it 2 days in advance. Our room was not ready when we arrived instead of telling us this they tried to get us into the hotel across the street. We were wary of what they were trying to do as we had been told that they will try to sell you a timeshare while you are there. They made us wait three and half hours to check in, then when we came back to check in they said another 30 minutes. They also will try to trick you into meeting with them to listen to their timeshare speel. They sent us a note saying we had left something at the airport!!! UNCOOL. It was our first time in Cancun, we had heard wonderful things from friends, however after this place I'm sticking with the Bahamas.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Where Credit is Due...Loved the GPR!”
Reviews.Author: valkyrie1117
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the GPR in October 2004 so my report may be a little dated, but after reading some less than enthusiastic reviews, I think this resort deserves credit where credit is due. First, if you go to any resort or hotel from a RITZ CARLTON to a MOTEL 6 and anything in between, you will find something you don't like. Especially if you are looking for something negative! I understand that sometimes a bad experience can be completely unavoidable due to circumstances beyond anyone's control (or just plain horrible customer service), but why go on vacation with a "white glove" attitude and look for problems? Relax for crying out loud! You are on vacation! 5-Star, 5-Diamond, etc. Who really sets those standards, anyway (rhetorical question)? 5-Star standards (and perceptions) in the USA or Europe are usually quite different than other parts of the world. Now that I've vented, I can continue. My wife and I have traveled to Europe, Hawaii, Mexico, Jamaica, the Dominican Republic and several places in the mainland USA. We have stayed in everything from budget on up and thoroughly enjoyed the Gran Porto Real. ARRIVAL: Typical hustle and bustle of CUN airport and since it was our first time, we got duped into a "tour" of the Mayan Palace timeshare resort (Wow!). Didn't buy, but we left with 2 huge bottles of Kahlua, admission to Xcaret park with a free dolphin experience that we didn't use (ran out of time) and more cash than what we arrived with in Mexico. We booked round trip transfers through the GPR (Best Day Resorts) and the van ride to/from the airport was non-eventful. CHECK-IN: We were dropped off at the GPR, tipped our driver a couple bucks and were greeted with smiles and cold drinks (I think there was a cool towel there, but it's been awhile). No problems at check in and since we packed light we elected to take our bags on our own and proceeded directly to our rooms. The next day we agreed to do another “tour” of a Best Day Resorts property this time and ended up with free massages from the spa. We only agreed to do this because we were made to feel guilty for leaving the property to see another resort. In fact, I think the concierge was actually pretty angry at the bellman for letting us go. Oh well, the property was beautiful and we got more free stuff for saying “no,” what can I say? ROOMS: We stayed in a Jr. Suite on the first floor facing the new Royal Porto Real. At the time, the new RPR was still under construction but we were not bothered by any noise. The view from our balcony was nothing to write home about but it was private enough that we ordered room service for breakfast and enjoyed it every morning on our balcony. The room was very clean, stocked with various beverages (Coke, Water, Beer, etc.) and promptly serviced daily. The bathroom was more than adequate and, yes, the shower was HUGE! FOOD/BEVERAGE: The food was good with a decent selection and variety at all buffets. The snack bar at the beach was just okay and served burgers, hot dogs, nachos, tortilla chips (with a very tasty seafood salsa) and other finger foods. Didn’t make it to the Mexican restaurant but the Italian was AWESOME. The drinks did seem a bit weak so you have two choices: ask them to make it stronger or just drink more! BEACH/POOL/SPA: Playa Del Carmen is (or at least used to be) a quaint fishing village and there are boats tied up at the beach in-front of the resort. It really is NOT a big deal. There is adequate beach and shallow water all around and if a boat happens to be in your way, go around it and get over it. You will see a few topless women on the beach (not allowed at the pool) but nothing overwhelming. The swimming pool is very nice and good sized for the resort. We were there in October and really didn’t have a problem finding lounge chairs. My only complaint, and this is not directed at the resort but to most hotels in Cancun and Playa, the pools close so early. By sundown everyone was expected to be out of the pools and if not, you were told it was time to get out. A LITTLE SECRET: There is a roof-top hot tub above the spa pool with a beautiful view of the city and Cozumel that is pretty private and not really monitored much at night (wink, wink). My wife and I did visit the spa which we found was very nice and relaxing and both got a massage which I highly recommend. TIPS: Tipping is not expected and the service did not get worse if you did not tip, but we loved the idea of bringing a stack (20-25) of US $1.00 bills. Trust me on this; even a couple of dollars goes a long way. Overall, we had an excellent time at the Gran Porto Real and will definitely return the next time we go to Mexico. We recently returned from a week at Hedonism III in Jamaica which is a whole different story but if you want to relax with your spouse, significant other or the whole family, the GPR with its excellent service, facilities and proximity to almost everything Playa Del Carmen has to offer is an ideal hotel for your next visit to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: pinkyanderson
Reviews.Content: Well folks, there is virtually no beach left as of last week. The resort closed almost half the rooms due to the storm so we moved next door which made up for it. I know its not their fault but this place is now a shambles.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: jparrasmith
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 11 days of our honeymoon at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen. It was a beautiful experience. Okay, it wasn't all perfect but life never is. After the fifth day, we were a little tired of the indoors buffet, beach buffet, snack bar and 2 restaurants which you must make reservations a day before. So if you are staying for more than 5 days, I suggest you venture out and see some of the night life. Another thing that really bothered us was the fact that by 9am all the lounge chairs by the pool (which is a very large area) were already reserved by guests. It was a little bit ridiculous waking up and seeing towels in every chair. We were asked on a couple of occassions by guests to get up from the chairs they had "saved" for themselves. The people that asked us to move had gone to 5th avenue to shop and were returning 2 hours later. Lastly, if you see anything wrong in your room, need info, learn to use the tv's message system. We mentioned a few things and immediately we had additional towels, wake up calls, etc. Overall, we would definitely go back and recommend to go there. The customer service was excellent and surprisingly everyone speaks English but remember you are going to Mexico so learn a few phrases in spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation at the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from Playa del Carmen. We stayed 6 amazing nights at the Gran Porto Real. We took the all inclusive package. I think that the all inclusive was totally worth it. We didn't eat there everynight but at least twice a day. Being 22 years old you can imagine that the drinks and beer alone satisfied the value of the all inclusive not to mention activities that the resort offered you as an all inclusive memeber. The hotel was beautiful inside and out. Everyone was there to serve you. The rooms were great, very mexican cultured. I have to agree with some people that the beds were not the most comfortable in the world but then again the beds were not my main concern of my vacation. Now lets talk about the food. The buffet was a buffet. Not to mention that you are in a different country so it is expected that they are going to season the food differnetly. At any rate I enjoyed the buffet more at lunch time rather than dinner. We ate at the Italian restaruant once and it was really good. It felt like I was supposed to have like a 100 dollar checkl after the apps, dinner, dessert, wine and beer but it was all paid for. It was great. The outside environment at the beach and the pool was just my style. The music was going all day which always set my mood. The animation team had a goal to make sure everyone there was having fun. The beach was really nice. I think that all of the people that complained about the boats forgot to mention that they only took up a small portion of the beach. If you go toward the left there were none. They weren't soar to my eye either. From what I observed it was a great place for all ages. Great for honeymooners, vacationers or families. It is all about preference. Another thing is everything was very clean. I am always worried about bugs when I stay in places and I did not have any problem what so ever as far as that was concerned. Just a tip when planning your vacation. We went through a travel agency when booking the trip (Liberty Travel). Doing it that way led to a very structured vacation. There was a guy there representing the travel agency and Olympus tours which is the company that gives your transportation to and from the airport. He made sure that all of your flight info is in order and insures that you get back in time to the airport. In addition he will take care of any tours that you may want to venture out on. It felt more comfortable that way. Also the other advantage of going through the agency is Im thinking that the rooms you resevered are garenteed rather than just held. I had no problems checking in. It took me 3 minutes and I had the ocean veiw juinor suit I paid for. At any rate. I hope you find this review helpful. I really don't understand why all of the terrible reviews except for the fact that it is about preference. I think deffinately you will go crazy for the place

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from Playa. We had a great stay at the Gran Porto. Our original room was not available when we arrived and we were put up in an ocean view room & were told that we would have to move the next day. The next day we went to the lobby to change rooms but that room was not ready and we were told that we could stay in the ocean view room without an extra charge. I originally thought that it was going to be a bait and switch but it turned out perfectly. Most of the people staying at the hotel did the all inclusive but we did not. We did eat at the hotel for lunch one day. The buffet was very good but I could not see doing that every day. I would be huge. The pool was great and had a lot of activities if you like that type of thing. All in all it was a very nice hotel. I really like Playa, reminded me of Miami but without the Americans. Very Hip and even though it is a tourist spot it is not as cheesy as Cancun. I am not a big fan of the all inclusive resorts and next time I would like to stay at a cute palapa style hotel down the beach called Shangri La-Caribe.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Playa Del Carmen, but Hotel tried to scam us at 1st”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 9 days stay at the Gran Porto Real in downtown Playa Del Carmen. First of all it's a great location, close to everything and the town is very cute. We walked to 5th Avenue every nigth and sometimes during the day when we weren't enjoying the beach and pool. The hotel itself is very nice. When we arrived we get a room right away but were disappointed when we got in there. It was nothing like the room on their visual tour. Come to find out from the bellhop, it was not a Junion Suite they put us in it was a Standard Room. So we went back and complained nicely and they promotley moved us to a Junion Suite. Unfortunlatey the view was of a workers and the main street on the 1st floor. So we again asked to switch to a oceanview room and they accomidated us 2 days later. The view was perfect in this room and I recommend everyone getting a Oceanview Junion suite. From now on when we travel it's the way were are always going. I guess when you go to the ocean you kind of want to see it from your room. Overall the hotel was very nice and 5th Ave it wonderful. Lots of places to eat and shop. I recommend not doing all inclusive and checking out the town!

Reviews.Title: “I've Stayed at better !!!”
Reviews.Author: dcquad
Reviews.Content: The good : Beautiful resort, beautiful pool, beautiful views. The bad: Tiny buffet. Had friends at the Viva Whyndam Maya which is an older resort and they had a much better buffet. Staff was not friendly or eager to help. Construction morning ,noon, and night right outside of our room. Overbooked on the first night and had to stay at another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Visit Playa; Skip This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: packedsuitcase
Reviews.Content: Positive points: Our ocean view, first floor room was very clean. The A/C worked perfectly, and the cleaning crew did an excellent job each day. The bad: As you've probably read, check-in is a less than flawless procedure. We had no problems getting the key to our room; however, neither did the second couple to whom the front desk gave our door key. Having two people walk into our room thinking it was theirs was awkward. For us, the mix-up was easily fixed, but I have no idea how long the other people had to wait for an unoccupied room. If you decide to go with the European Plan, do not expect service at the on-site bars or in the restaurant. They could care less about patrons who plan to pay cash. There are plenty of amazing restaurants within walking distance, and there is no need to worry about the substandard ($18 per plate) food at the hotel. I found the hotel's overall atmosphere to be obnoxious. Instead of a serene beach setting, the activities staff could be heard throughout the day yelling into bullhorns, making it feel more like Cancun than Playa. One night, we listened to a chainsaw on the beach that ran until 2am. We will visit Playa again, but with so many hotels to choose from, we will not stay at the Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: beaner79
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very beautiful and provides a great location to the rest of the town. However, if you are looking for a hotel where you can relax this is not the place. Everytime you want to order a drink, food, or towel you have to go through the staff looking at your id bracelets writing down the numbers on it and being bombarded with other questions. Quite a pain, when you just want to lay out and order a pina colada. Also, be warned that you are not allowed to have ANY visitors, ANYWHERE in the hotel, so if you are traveling in a group you should definetely all stay in the same hotel. The staff was friendly and it was understood that they were just doing their job but people don't like being on vacation and feeling like they are being watched by the Playa Nazi. Playa was great and when I go back I will probably stay at a smaller hotel like the Blue Parrot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifuel hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the GPR early August. His son got married in the hotel at the beach. It was gorgeous. The wedding was in an outcrop hallway with a balcony to the beach.
