It was set up perfectly and the setting was beautiful. The staff was excellent and accommodating. Our room was huge and the bathroom was huge. The room was cleaned spotless everyday and the mini bar filled every day. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The beach was small but gorgeous- you must watch out for the rocks though. We thought the fishing boats were quaint. The water was aqua and warmer than the pool. The pool was great too, just make sure you stay on the right side, it was less noisey and less crowded. The food was good. We all enjoyed it. Fifth avenue was fantastic. Lots of shops and bars & restaurants. We had a wonderful, relaxing vacation and my husband's son & new wife had a beautiful wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible! Don't understand the negative reviews...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends just got back from the Gran Porto Real 2 days ago - visited Sept. 3 - Sept. 7. We were all a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews on this site. BUT we were all SO excited to be vacationing we almost didn't care if the reviews were true. BUT - goodness - I don't understand where the negative reviews came from. First off - this is an all-inclusive. We go every Labor Day to Mexico - typically Cancun - this was our first visit to Playa. Let me say first off - the rooms were the best we've been to and we typically stay at 5 star all-inclusives. So just to touch on a few things: Rooms - HUGE! We had a Junior Suite - since we all wanted to be together we didn't get Ocean View - which was fine. The bathrooms were incredible. Housekeeping extremely timely - even got turn-down service. A/C cold all the time. They refilled the mini-bar every single day with bottled water, Cokes and beer. Food - The Albatros has great buffets. Keep in mind people - this is Mexico. You don't come to an all-inclusive for incredible food do you? At the Albatros - omelet bar for breakfast YUM! Also - if they have the taco bar at night - get it. Also - room service is free once daily - BLTs are very 'American' and good if you need something late-night. Beach - Since there are boats out front, go to the left to the far beach bar - the beach is beautiful there and only a few feet away and no boats. FYI - beach bar service - impeccable. Get the Miami Vice. Also - beware of the Tequila Slammers - they will creep up on you - haha. Also - pool bar on 3rd floor - hidden treasure. Front Desk/Service in General - ZERO problems. When we checked in they asked if we wanted to go across the street to the Royal Porto Real. Just say no people if you don't want to. All these people complained of hard sells to get you to move. If you don't want to - it takes a no. If you can't stand up with your decision - that's your fault not the front desk. Time Shares - Several people mentioned getting hassled about time shares? At NO point did ANY of us (6 of us) get approached or even hear the phrase 'time share' - and we were all over the place. Hidden - the all-inclusive 'VIP' club - we didn't find it til the last day. It has a soda fountain, bottled liquor to make your own drinks and even bottles of chilled champagne you can take to your rooms! FIND IT! Air hockey for the kids, etc. - it's open 24/7. Overall I can't go on and on enough about the service we received. SO friendly, SO polite and SO accomodating. 5th Avenue shopping great mix of flea market-like deals and upper-end shops. Bourbon Street bar great. Also - we did the snorkel excursion - best I've been on. I wish I could list my email address here if anyone had specific questions. This is an awesome resort - absolutely beautiful. HIGHLY recommend. I'm going to guess the people who gave the negative reviews are ridiculously picky or not accustomed to travel for fun rather than travelling to gripe. And my glass isn't even always half-full, trust me. Paige Dallas, TX

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time....”
Reviews.Author: KaDang
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trip to Playa del Carmen and our stay at the Gran Porto Real. I was a little concerned initially about our choice in hotel after reading the other reviews, but, overall, we had a good stay. The people working at the hotel were friendly and helpful. Our room was better than we expected and the maid did a good job each day. The food was only above average, but other than that, we were satisfied with our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: DCDollSpringfield_VA
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from 8 days in Cancun/Playa del carmen. Enjoyed the 4 days at the Hilton Golf & Beach resort in Cancun much more than the 4 days at the Gran Porto. Here is my assessment of the G.P.: Pros: Nice calm, pretty water to swim in; convenient to shopping & restaurants in town (2 blocks); Really nice rooms (we got the oceanfront junior suite) - Mexican theme w/ big rooms & bathrooms & nice balcony and very clean; Good service for the most part Cons: There were TOO many people there; the beach is very small because boats take up the right side of it and you can't use the beach because their ropes & hooks are in the way; there were mostly Europeans which isn't a bad thing except when they sunbathe topless (trust me it WASNT pretty) and smoke endlessly; there was beach grass and alot of coral in the water so you had to be careful when you waded in; you couldn't get a chair under a palapa after about 10:30 am; the pool had this LOUD obnoxious music blaring out of the speakers at all times; and worst of all, there was this stench at times that can only be described as a landfill of dirty diapers. I was REALLY glad we didn't get the all inclusive because i heard the food ----; we didn't eat a single meal there but we could still get drinks from some of the bars (very reasonable). We parked our car right outside the door and there were 24 hour guards on duty which was nice. If you go, try to go more off season (they say late Sep-Nov and Mar-Jun are best) and get the ala carte as we did. Playa has some wonderful restaurants. But once you get away from 5th Avenue back toward the highway Playa is very slummy and nasty. I would recommend staying in the south end of Cancun at the Hilton as we did instead of staying here; you get the same remoteness but a much nicer hotel & beach.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!! ”
Reviews.Author: froggy8997
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week in August. This place doesnt have a clue about customer service. I chose to do the all inclusive. I wish I wouldnt have. The food was Horrible!!! Everyone was getting sick, EVERYONE! BEACH The beach was so crammed with boats you couldnt even relax and enjoy. the smell of the gas from the boats filled the air. We were walking on it one morning and came across a drug syringe. I am sooo glad I didnt step on it. (SCARY!!) ROOM Our room was filthy, the shower had a science project of mold growing in it. MAID showed up when she got there. Some mornings at 7am some days never. I complained to the front desk & management several times about my different problems. Everytime I was treated rudely. The hotel is very close to Playa del carmen with all of the wild SPRING BREAK like clubs. one evening we walked to Fifth Avenue and the things we saw were out of control! I would NEVER send my teenager to this area. Overall I would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: tracylynn36
Reviews.Content: Man, I can not beleive some of these reveiews! We spent a week at the Gran Porto Real and were amazed! We had a great room, which were hardly in anyways, always had a great chair on the beach, swam ont h ocean. I don't know where people saw the seaweed, my husband went fishing with the guys off the beach, they took him snorkling, and loved it! We had great staff, they always rememered what drinks we liked, and the food was great. It's Mexico people, of course the food is going to be different then what you have at home! Iloved it and will go back!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but the food was awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a vacation at the Gran Porto Real. The hotel and staff were exceptional, I can not say the same about the food though. We purchased the all inclusive package. There were three restaurants to chose from: an italian restaurant, a mexican restaurant and a buffet style restaurant. All restaurants had a great staff, but the food was horrible. I left every meal with an upset stomach. The variety was slim to none, they had the same thing for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The next time I go I will not be purchasing an all inclusive package. Also, you may want to bring a pair of earplugs, the maids are very loud when they clean in the mornings!!

Reviews.Title: “Lost the Safe Key”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the third floor, ocean view room, loved it and the staff. Room exceeded our expectations. Did not go all inclusive and ate our meals on 5th Avenue. Awesome restaurants. Lost key to the room safe while swimming in the pool, in my husband's swim suit secure pocket. Staff drilled out lock, 5 min, gave us new key and lock, we tipped the two $10 each and the hotel still charged us $100. Great location, too many fishing boats taking up most the hotel beach frontage. Had to do our walking at the Royal Porto Real across the street.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Grand Porto (August 11-15). We got an ocean view suite, I was a little skeptical bc of all I have read, bu it was perfect, we actually got into our room well before the 3pm checkin, the rooms were beautiful especially the bathroom, we did not get the allinclusive bc i knew we would try all the rest down 5th street...there were boats parked in front of the hotel but they were doing like parasailing, sport fishing, etc. and they didnt bother me. the guys/girls did bring us drinks out onto the beach which was nice.... all in all we had a great experience with this hotel, loved the third floor pool with swim up bar..would definately stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Problems...Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: DeborahATL
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation at the Gran Porto Real a few years ago when it first opened and when I got there, was told that the hotel had over booked and I had to stay at another, very low budget hotel that was not even on the beach. I was very disappointed but knew that there are a lot of glitches when a hotel first opens. I tried them again this summer knowing that they have a new general manager and expecting things to be different. I was wrong. If anything it was worse. The hotel was again overbooked for the first 2 nights of my stay. The reception and manager were not even apologetic. The restaurant service was very indifferent. You are pounced upon by time share salesmen every time you walk through the lobby. You have to beg for a second cup of coffee at breakfast. Food was cold and buffet not replenished often. All in all a very unsatisfactory experience. I don't know why this hotel is so popular. It is definitely not worth the money charged. I have traveled to this part of Mexico many many times and never had these types of problems any where else whether it was an all inclusive or small hotel. I will not be taking a chance on Gran Porto Real again.

Reviews.Title: “overbooked”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is common practice at this hotel to overbook for the first night, and send the customers to another hotel that is 6 or more blocks away, and is not five star rated. I was very dissapointed when my family was bumped from this hotel!!!! Get to the hotel very early in the day if you would like to get a room, if not plan on being bumped........

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms (if they give you one)”
Reviews.Author: chwtom
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for a week with my wife for our honeymoon. we booked an oceanfront suite with the all-inclusive package. because i read on this site about all the problems people had getting teh rooms they paid for, i called a week before and the day before we got there to make sure we had teh right room, because i knew how upset i would be if we got there and they stuck us in a crappy room. well guess what--they put us in a crappy room. our "oceanfront" suite actually had a view of the vacant lot to the north, and you could only see the sea if you hang over the balcony and looked left. i was very upset and made a big stink, and we still didn't get moved for two days. the rooms are beautiful on the inside, regardless of the view. the bathrooms are quite nicely appointed. the food was hit or miss. it was awesome getting the free room service for breakfast and eating on the balcony. the restaurants were just ok. the food was kind of bland and boring, and the ala carte restaurants literally only had 2 or three choices on the menu. the buffetts were just plain bad. there are a lot of really nice places nearby to eat, so we felt disappointed that we had the all-inclusive. the drinks were small, served in a styrafoam cup, and you only had one choice for beer. you couldn't drink your beer frmo the bottle, i didn't like that. the beach was very nice. the location was excellent--close enough to town but not so close that it was noisy. we didn't have kids so i can't comment on kids activities, but there was usually a nightly activity that was pretty fun like casino night. there are a lot of really nice places in playa. this place is nice, but i would never recommend it to someone, if nothing else than they seem to have a policy of overbooking the nice rooms, which is shockingly bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The GPR is a great hotel and a great place to have fun. They give you everything you need at the hotel in case you want to stay there the whole time yet they also offer (every night) the chance for you to go out at night to different venues around town, where you'll have to spend a little money but then again that helps stimulate the Mexican economy. The people that work at the hotel go out of their way to satisfy you. The food was good, especially at the restaurants, and the hotel itself is just beautiful. July was my first time there and I am already planning to go back to the same place. I was extremely pleased with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Just great ! Paul & Kim (Netherlands)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi everybody, My wife and i were at the Gran Porto Real for our Honeymoon. It was simply great, for example a lot of all inclusive hotels don't bring drinks at all. You have to get your drinks at the bar but at the GPR they even brought drinks on to the beach ! I hope the Hotel survived Emily ! Because if we go back to Mexico we would go back to GPR for sure ! It was very nice to stay there. Just try it yourself !!

Reviews.Title: “family fun”
Reviews.Author: TBR
Reviews.Content: WoW! Something for everyone. Perfect location for those wishing to stay and play in Playa Del Carmen. 2 short blocks from 5th avenue on the ocean. Beach & Pool activities included volleyball, water aerobics, bracelet making, guessing games and contests. Excellent food, great pool and amazing kids club. Friendly staff not very attentive though and poor service in the buffet dining restaurant. Some pool staff great and kids club attendants were very good. Dissapointing there is no swim up bar- to get to pool bar you need to go up beach side stairs or over pool bridge. Lobby bar is open air and adjacent to pool area- lots of comfortable seating out of the sun with a satelite tv- you can find coffee here in the morning. 24hr All inclusive room air conditioned with snacks, beverages, pool table and air hockey. Overall a great place for family fun and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Gran Porto Real was great! My boyfriend took me down there for my first trip to mexico and it was great. the food was really good at albaretos.. and if you go make sure you make a reservation the second you get there for their Italian resturant. i swear it was the best italian food ive had in a long time! Their staff was reall great too, the bartenders are great.. haha. If you do decide to take a trip down to Playa Del Carmen i strongly recommend staying at the gran porto real..

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation, overall ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read many of the reviews on this web-site and was a little nervous about my choice of this hotel ... but was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel was great. Minor glitches, such as we arrived at about 2:00AM (Continental had a weather delay) and we got a smoking room (even though we were explicit about a non-smoking room). Also, we had purchased a non-oceanview room, which was a BIG mistake. The view was terrible (construction) and there was no sea-breeze. The staff said that they would upgrade us for $40.00 USD a night - same as expedia. The staff was very helpful, got us upgraded and we were in the new room in 5 minutes. We thought that the food on the buffet was Great!. Good variety, hot food, and plentiful. The desserts were a bit weak, but overall, good. Staff was friendly, other than the odd person, which you will find anywhere on the planet. The entertainment staff were excellent. They worked extremely hard and long hours and were very polite and friendly. We did not take the all-inclusive plan since there were plenty of places within walking distance, and also we found that charging stuff to our rooms when we were there was actually cheaper than the all-inclusive. One minor point to note - if you don't get the all-inclusive, you have to pay for Kayak rentals, etc., but at $10USD an hour, it was a bargain. The fishing boats on the main beach were initially a bit of a dissapointment because it seemed that they tookup most of the beach-front. They make for a beautiful view though. The beach just by the hotel was a bit rocky, but we discovered that just past the pier, on the Royal side, is an incredible beach - it was great. We rented a car from the hotel and went to cancun for a day, did the snorkeling trip, etc. Thanks the Expedia's (Best Day's) representative who was very very helpful. This was a really neat thing to do and it made our vacation 2-in-1. Overall, our vacation was fantastic. I would not say that the hotel was perfect (no one is), but overall, if you are relaxed, in vacation mode, the hotel provides a great location, great beaches, great food, and a wonderful time. Go for it ... I would go there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week's stay in Gran Portal Real Hotel in Playa del Carmen. I would not recommend this hotel. We paid $6000 for four, all inclusive, all you can eat and drink, except the food was horrible. We could hardly eat it. The drinks were very watered down. The worst experience we had was when my son broke his "all inclusive" plastic bracelet in the ocean and lost it. They wanted to charge us 100 dollars to replace it, as that is their "policy". Since we only had one day left and weren't eating the food anyway, we decided to forget it. That is when they told us we had to turn it in when we left anyway or they would charge us anyway. So, we were cohersed into paying them the money, NO matter how hard I tried, they would not make an exception. Coincidentally,, then our hot water went off for a half a day and we couldn't get anyone to fix it. Kept getting more excuses . Finally, someone came up and turned it back on, I wonder about that. So we felt pretty ripped off and angry and will never go back there. They have two restaurants where you could supposedly eat for free. The trouble is they only take like four reservations at a time, and we could only get in our last two days. We tried to see if we could just go and get it, and although it was half empty, they said no. I guess it is cheaper for them to feed you the slop in the buffet line instead. It is just a ploy to make you think you have a choice. Choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “sick the whole time!!!”
Reviews.Author: davidroberta
Reviews.Content: Arrival -We booked into a junior suite. When we arrived, we were given a room that had a view into a back alley, a tv that didn't work etc. We immediately went down to conplain that this was not as advertised. They told us that the booking they got for us was for a regular room. They couldn't move us until our agent confirmed our booking. At that time we even offered to pay to upgrade for the night, and told them we would deal with our agent the next day. They then told us they had no suites available that night. We had to stay in the regular room that night period. To add insult to injury, we later figured out that the resort was only about 40% full the whole time we were there. So we should have had our proper room the first night, but they were not concerned about customer service at all. Needless to say we were back down at the front desk first thing the next morning, and eventually after about 3 hours of issues we were moved to our junior suite. I have to say Junior Suite was gorgeous, so we FINALLY started to relax. Beach -We ended up on the beach to the left of the resort. The area in front of the gran porto was not very nice, many fishing boats etc. The swimming was ok, not great for snorkelling, but the waves were fun. Service on the beach was next to non-existent. We were offered drinks maybe twice the whole week. (And yes we did tip, regularly). Food -Next major issue with this resort was the food. We were sick off and on the entire trip. Food was recycled, and not always fresh. We saw many breaches of proper food handling proceedures. Literally one of us was sick the entire vacation. We tried to make the best of it though. Great for weight loss actually! Service -Service was hit and miss. The beach service awful. The restaurants were hit and miss. Some waiters were great, others were not. I feel the management is the problem. It seemed like alot of unhappy workers. The front desk misled us about the hotel being full the first night, and I found there to not be a focus on customer service at all through the resort. So between checkin and the food I could not recomend this resort to anyone. If you do try it, whatever you do book the junior suite, the regular rooms are in my opinion horrible. We have been to other resorts in the Mayan Riviera area, and love the area, but try another hotel in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent time at the GPR”
Reviews.Author: MissDee422
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the GPR June 20-27. Since I was addicted to this website before we went, I thought I would post a review now that I'm home. We traveled with Worry Free Vacations, and when our shuttle pulled up at the GPR I couldn't believe how beautiful the hotel was. The location was a little odd... it's almost like the hotel is at a dead end, but the hotel is breathtaking. We checked in with no troubles (relief) and got to our two rooms within minutes. We asked for 3rd floor and ended up on 2nd floor but we did get two rooms right next to eachother and the views were blocked a little by palm trees, but I didn't mind that at all. We had a beautiful view of the ocean from either of our two balconies. Everyone is right about the showers... they are incredibly huge! We did the European Plan because I thought we'd wander for dinner, but ended up changing to AI mid-week because we thought it was a better bargain. For a family of 4, $200 a day for all meals, drinks and snacks wasn't bad. Our room was cleaned daily and we even got to know our maid and tipped her very well once we learned they only make $3 a day! I couldn't believe it. Unlike many others on the AI plan, we tipped. I can't believe people don't realize that on an AI, the hotel makes the money - not the employees, so we made sure we took care of them. I didn't care for the buffet outside, we didn't eat there at all. The inside buffet was well worth it for the money you pay. The Italian restaraunt was very very good. The Mexican restaraunt was a disappointment, the reviews are right about that. We even did room service one night and that was very interesting because they spoke no English and we ended up with a very interesting order but we thought it was humorous. If you bring kids with you, the entertainment staff at the pool does a great job. There are I think three young guys and one female that get the kids involved in different activities and they do a great job and have alot of fun while they're working. The wait staff at the pool/beach also do a great job of making sure your drinks are full. We didn't have anyone waking us up early to get towels as I've read in other reviews, and the maid didn't come until late afternoon so we had no problems with that. We didn't have anyone bothering us for timeshares, but they are trying to sell a vacation package for the Royal across the street - we bit and went for a tour and let me tell you that hotel was incredible. We went to Xel-Ha and did the Mayan Encounter tour through Alltournative, both were alot of fun but I would have to say the Mayan trip was my personal favorite. All in all we had a great trip. Playa isn't as inexpensive as other areas in Mexico, that's one thing I noticed right away but I would definately return again and again. Feel free to email any specific questions you may have, I'd be glad to answer.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned two days ago and Iam ready to go back. The Hotel was beautiful our room was great. We had a Jr. suite with an ocean view. It was great. The hotel staff was wonderful. Food at the resturants were good. Just becareful of what you eat.Especially at the buffet outside. The beach is beautiful. Make sure you have Iliana or Benito as your waiter. They were great,and very friendly, they kept the drinks comming. The water was beautiful and clean. Make sure you wake up early to put towels on your beach chairs, they go fast. The hotel is walking distance to everything,which made it nice not to have to take taxies everywhere. My only complaint is that the outside hotel bar closed too early as well as the lobby bar. Everything else was wonderful DC

Reviews.Title: “expect little and get lots”
Reviews.Author: beachsoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great . . . just don't have expectations. After reading the reviews, we thought the food would be bad, we would not get a room, there would be no beach chairs and the staff would be rude. Like most everyone else, we booked it for the location and hoped for the best. Everything turned out great on our trip because we didn't bank on it being perfect. We found little surprises that they didn't advertise such as: free water available 24 hours a day, a spa, beach-side service, great grilled and fresh food, security at night and fun staff - for the most part. Here are a few tips: Eat the fresh food off the grill - the buffet its gross except for the fruit The mexican restaurant --- Always ask for ice cream - even though they don't always feel like serving it. Always ask for a Mayan Coffee - they are soooo good but they are a pain to make - so again some days you will get them and some you won't. Put your towels out on chairs as soon as you wake up - we even put them out after we came back from a night on the town before anyone was awake and it worked like a charm. Have fun !

Reviews.Title: “Just returned!”
Reviews.Author: cheryl5418
Reviews.Content: We loved Playa Del Carmen much more than Cancun. It had a much more quaint, bohemia feel. The hotel is not a 5 star, but it was good enough. DO NOT GET THE ALL INCLUSIVE! There are so many great bars and restaurants on the beach and on 5th avenue. Do the research with Fodors, Frommers and online. The all-inclusive buffets at the hotel looked gross. The pool is nice. The beach isn't the greatest --lots of seaweed and boats. The nicest beaches are north of the hotel, near the Shangri-La hotel. Pay the extra and get the ocean view room. This will keep you away from the construction noise. Bring bug spray and afterbite! I was eaten alive. And with most of Mexico, if you don't drink alcohol, you probably won't like Playa Del Carmen. Email me with any questions. We have traveled extensively throughout Mexico and the Carribean.

Reviews.Title: “Great time.”
Reviews.Author: HawaIrvine_CA
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried reading all the bad reviews and already having booked this hotel. But I was positively surprised. We had no trouble checking in. They had overbooked our kind of rooms, so we got an upgrade to a partical oceanview which was great. The people at the reception desk do speak english, unlike what I read and the rooms are very clean. Make sure you get at least the Junior suite though. Other rooms don't have AC and they're not as nice. Best rates through expedia rather than the hotel. Bathroom was relatively large, and the room itself was larger than what we thought. Didn't eat at the hotel at all since we were warned of food poisening at the restaurants itself. However major restaurant row is only 2 blocks away. I got sick on last day of our trip, and we had eaten at a relatively nice restaurant called "Jaguar". Pool is not as large as the pictures show, but still nice. However, there's barely ever any chairs left nor is it relaxing since they have games for kids at the pool all day long. Drinks are watered down at the bar. Beach was also not great for swimming, since there are a lot of local boats docked right outside of the beach-hotel basically doesn't have its own beach. Overall a good time though and I'd recommend the hotel to whoever is staying at Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time. Going back in August”
Reviews.Author: caribbeangail
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Real Playa Carmen and got bumped to the Gran Porto. How lucky we were. The room was nice, although small. We didn't get the suites (due to being bumped I guessed) I booked the suites for the next trip. The food was good, not great. The service was fantastic.The bartenders and wait staff were all very friendly and rarely was I without a drink being offered to me. I was there the end of April and the construction was still going on. After awhile it was white noise to me and it didn't really bother me. In the room with the air on we didn't even hear it. The beach was good, plenty of chairs and good bar service. We were able to use the pool/beach area of the Royal right next door. The Caribbean restaurant that is part of the Royal was open to us and it was my favorite. I don't know any of the Royal will be open to the Gran Porto now that it is officially open. I loved being so close to 5th Ave. Walked down there everynight. I didn't partake in any of the entertainment at the Gran Porto. Nothing that interested me. My entertainment was going to 5th Ave. Lots to do there.Let me know if you have any questions. Be glad to answer them. I'm going back August 5-12th. Taking my 15 yr old daughter with me.

Reviews.Title: “Absolulely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Playa June 10. We stayed at the Gran Porto Real and it was wonderful. The rooms were great, the staff was very pleasant and honest. We left our safe open the first day, in our excitement to go to Cozemel. When we realized our mistake we stress until we returned to our room. Everything was still there, passports and money. In some of the other places i have stayed that wouldn't have happened. The food was good, service great. We our planning to go back in Oct.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not a Five Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from May 29 - June 3, 2005. The only problem we had was that we had reserved a king bed and we had to stay in a room with two doubles for the first two nights. Apparently, you reserve a room not any particular type. of room I am not sure what you would do if you came with a family. We did not do the all inclusive and did not eat any meals at the hotel. I agree with the other people who do not recommend getting the all inclusive. We ate out on 5th Ave every night and did not have any trouble with getting sick. I can understand how people would get sick as I did see the lunch buffet sitting outside in the Mexican heat. If you do choose the all-inclusive, it is $50 US per person per day once you get there. There is nothing really wrong with the resort but I would not classify it as five-star. It is perhaps a three-star. We were paying $130 night so I wouldn't really classify it as 5-star prices for a beachfront resort either. The rooms are clean and decent sized but I didn't really consider our junior-suite a suite. It was more like a regular sized room with a large bathroom. The maids did knock on the door every morning at 7:30 to 8:00 to try to collect the towels. As we were diving on going on excursions most days we were up and this was not a problem. If you are the type of person who likes to sleep in on vacation, you might find this annoying. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking to just hang around your hotel for your whole vacation. The beach is not very nice and there is not much to do in the way of watersports. The beach in front of the Gran Porto across the street is much nicer. I've stayed at the Iberostar in Playacar and I'd recommend that as an All-Inclusive option. However, if you want a clean hotel with no bugs that can serve as a home base for excursion, this is the place. It is convenient to the town and you have the opportunity to eat out each nice. Comparing this place to other All-Inclusives in the Caribbean I say it is poor. If I returned to Playa I would go back to the Iberostar as it is easy to walk into the town or take a taxi if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: jamieragan1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this resort. According to their info. online they have been open about 2 yrs--not true, they remodeled and expanded--probably within last 2 yrs. The pic. online shows gorgeous beaches--however they neglect to mention that there are locals with their fishing boats docked across their entire beach access--with all the ropes holding the boats--etc... lots of murkey and seaweed/crap in the water. The buffet was NOTHING (poor food and poor selection)--if you wanted decent food you had to make reservations (only available for dinner)--well in advance--at the 2 al la carte restaurants. Food was good here--however your 2 choices were Mexican or Italian. In the all inclusive package--did even carry Captain Morgan's Rum--apparently did last year. Didn't have an equivalent either. Lastly depending where your room is located--there is still construction and we have a 1 yr old. and all day they were jackhammering. At 5am in the morning--right below our room --was the food dock or something and was VERY LOUD and noisy. Only received 2 --12oz. bottles of water daily...

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Prepare for a serious diarrhea if you are planning to go to this resort. We got sick on the second day and only recovered on our return to Canada. The resort is obviously violating the elementary hygienic/sanitary norms of food handling and preparation. When we arrived, we were told that our room is not available, as the hotel is overbooked. It was very hard to believe, as the hotel has a computerized system. We were placed for one day in a real hole with very small windows. As a small compensation for inconvenience, we were asked to sign a letter releasing the resort from all liabilities and were provided with a voucher for a lobster dinner. When we came to a restaurant and presented this voucher, we were told that they do not have lobster. Only when we told that we are going to complain, the lobster dinner miraculously appeared from nowhere. However, it was overcooked and tasted as rubber. The staff does not speak English and it is impossible to explain what you need from them. The maids had a tendency to remove the towels from the room shortly after 9 a.m. without replacing it with clean towels. We had to search for maids all over the hotel every afternoon to obtain clean towels. There is a construction going on both sides of the hotel. Prepare for noise and dust from early morning until very late evening. The beach was a disappointment. They had never cleaned garbage, stones, and pieces of concrete from the bottom of the sea. It is very crowdy on the beach, and the security guards are practically standing above your head with very loud walkie-talkies, thus violating your piece and quiet (they probably think that they are very important FBI guys). The entertainment consisted of half-drunk middle-age men from the audience who were conned to dance on a stage in a sombrero. It is a two-star resort that markets itself and charges as for a 4-5 star resort. I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: vivalv66
Reviews.Content: We stayed May 12-19. Two couples. Booked though a TA. Caught our shuttle at airport no problem but lots of people trying to get you to buy tours etc. Hotel check in very quick. Rooms are nice. We had ocean front junior suites. Some palm trees in way but not bad. Seems like most all the rooms have palm tree obstruction. Shower is huge! Rooms very clean. Beds are hard but never bothered us. Never had problems with housekeeping. Always had clean towels. They cleaned our room pretty late.We tipped on the last day. We were on 2nd floor. Lighting in bathroom is bad. We did AI. It was fine. I had omlettes for breakfast. Tip the cooks they work so hard! Nothing spectacular as far as the food but good. Nice waiters! We left tip on table every meal as they were so friendly. Ate on 5th Ave twice. Nice places to chose from. Cost about the same as the states. The ambiance of some of the restaurants on 5th is what I liked. Nice to sit outside and people watch. Ate at the hotel restaurants also.Nice wait staff also. Some better then others as with anywhere. Got into the Italian place twice with no reservations. Mexican restaurant said no. (they were not full) who knows why they are like that. Made reservations for other nights. Make your reservations at the concierge desk right when you arrive. If you don't use them it is not a big deal but at least you will have them. The food was good. They do it up real fancy like on a cruise ship. Jorge at Mexican is very friendly! Beach is nice. There are rocks and boats but never bothered us. Cocktail service on beach was slow sometimes but you find everything is slow in Playa. We did tip them everytime. They work so hard. Beach around corner gets windier. Beach in front of Royal not as nice and really windy. You can not use the Royal anymore either. Pool is nice but it can be hard to find a chair. We liked the beach. Lots of chairs! pool on 3rd floor is not really advertised. It is really nice. Swim up bar is great. Pools close at 9. kind of early but we swam at 3rd floor after hours and nobody complained. One bit of advice..everywhere you go they want to sell you time shares, tours etc. If you are interested and want to spend the time they will pay you. If not just say no! They assign you a representitive when you arrive and make an appt for you to see them in the morning to schedule your shuttle back to airport. It is a time share and tour sell! We did not go. We scheduled our shuttle the day before we left no problem. Us 2 girls stayed on beach while husbands went diving. We also did a Catamaran tour. We booked these ourselves by asking around. Learned a lot that way. Catamaran was in Cozumel. We walked to ferry. There are 2 ferries and they scream at you to buy! It is funny and nerve racking! Check the ferry times before you buy the ticket. We got stuck in Cozumel for 2 hours- no 7:00 ferry. Missed our dinner reservations. No big deal ate in Cozumel while waiting. We also did Xcaret. Booked ourselves also and saved a little. Swam with dolphins and it was incredible. Xcaret park itself in my opinion is not really worth it. (maybe for kids)The underground river is really crowded and dirty. We left after that. A shame you have to pay the park entrance to get to the dolphins. One persons did get sick but we think it was heat exhaustion not the food. Overall we had a great vacation. We would go back but there are many other places I would like to travel to first. If you have any questions email me. Just remember your vacation is what you make it. You are in another country and they do things different. Have Fun!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Courteous, Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went here for a wedding that took place May 8th, 2005. Our stay was very enjoyable. We did not opt for the all-inclusive package and we were very happy with our choice. We were only in our rooms to sleep, shower or take a quick afternoon nap before heading out to 5th Avenue and the beach. This hotel is beautiful and very clean. There were only two problems that stood out during our stay. First, the maids, etc. knocked on our door every morning starting at 8:30 am. The maid would come by first looking for any dirty towels (apparently they have a limited number for the amount of guests). About 9:30 am, a "juice/water" person would roll up to our door (we could hear him coming because it sounded like a truck) and would try to re-stock our refrigerator. Note that his entire selection was warm and not iced down. Room service in general was great. At some point later in the afternoon they would come to clean our room. This was done very well with no issues. They even left little "towel scupltures" on our bed. The second problem was the never ending harassment we received walking through the lobby area to take a tour of the new hotel they are building next door across the street. No matter how many times we came across the same employee, they would inevitably try to stop us and get us to sign-up for the tour. By the way, you can simply walk over there and see the hotel yourself. It is beautiful. One major word of caution, it IS still under construction and will be for at least a year. My sister-in-law stayed there and had to change rooms to the north side of the hotel because of the construction that awoke her every morning at 7 AM. Note that we could not here this at all on the seaside of the older hotel. On a very positive note, our view was everything we could ask for; right on the beach, a stone's throw from the water. All in all, a great stay. We would consider going back to this hotel, but after seeing all of the others available, we will probably choose a less expensive one seeing as all of our time was spent eating out and exploring the endless amounts of bars and nightclubs. Playa del Carmen is a sight to be seen. The beach is amazing, the food/bars on 5th Avenue have all kinds of menus and pricing and everyone was nice, helpful and friendly. No problems with bad water or food. Highly recommended for at least a weeks stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: MitchyBoy
Reviews.Content: I had been watching the revues of this place for some weeks prior to our trip and I must say I was very nervous about it. We checked in Saturday late afternoon on April 23rd. We were immediately escorted to our room - across the street. My stomach sunk when we headed that direction because of all of the negative revues. But when they opened the door to our room, I thought I had died and gone to heaven! It was beautiful. We were 3rd floor directly overlooking the ocean. It was clean and spacious with beautiful fixtures, a nice big Jacuzzi. The construction was waning as the Grand Opening was set for the following Saturday the 30th for the new "Royal" Porto Real (where we stayed). There was still a bit of hammering and sawing but it really wasn't bad. I will say that our phone never worked (and we reported it twice). Which was really no big deal except as a result, we could not order room service. And the hot water was intermittent. Sometimes it took 5 minutes for it to come out hot. The housekeeping staff did a fantastic job. Picked up our few clothes we left around, organized our toiletries, etc. We did do the all-inclusive program. The people were friendly, very helpful. The wait staff were always there to freshen your drink be it pool-side or lounging on the beach. We tipped them nearly every time they came around but even the pikers who were not tipping were getting equal attention. We ate dinner at each of the three restaurants and maybe I lucked out with what I ordered, but my food was fantastic. You do have to make reservation for dinner a couple of days in advance, which I was a bit puzzled by. The first night we were there we went to Pelicano's and asked if we needed to have reservations for that night in order to eat and were told we did. What was strange was there were plenty of open tables, well over half. So, I'm not sure about that. The buffet was, well, a buffet. The food was okay but very convenient if you want to get in and out. Again, the wait staff seemed very quick to offer anything. The beach in front of the new Royal was superior to the one in front of the Grand. It could not have been improved upon. The sand was perfect, the water optimal temperature and crystal clear. Lots of Europeans and as a result, lots of topless women on the beach. Maybe 1 in 10 or 15 were sans top. We went to town a couple of times and it was a very fun place both day and night. I got tired of the venders constantly hustling you to buy something but overall it had a terrific atmosphere. We made a trip to Xcaret, which I would not recommend. It was expensive and very touristy. Overall, I would highly recommend the Porto Real. Maybe because it was, after 20 years of marriage, a second honeymoon and without our kids, but we would definatly go back again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Going back for the 7th time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely cannot wait! I am about to visit the Gran Porto Real for the 7th time! It has been so much fun to watch the hotel evolve and each time I go back they have improved upon their existing perfection! The service is unparalleled and the food, entertainmet and overall environment create a perfect vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned on May 1st from the Royal Porto Real!!! After reading all of the negative reviews regarding overbooking at the Gran Porto Real (where we initially booked) we were nervous upon check-in. We called the hotel directly two days before arrival and were told that we would not be bumped to the unfinished hotel across the street. Upon arrival, we were not given any information about the resort. No map, no list of activities, no list of services available, no list of restaurants, and no information about what the resort had to offer. To add to our aggravation at the check in desk we were told that there was NO ROOM at the Gran Porto Real and that we would be bumped across the street. When we voiced our concerns about the noise across the street we were told that construction began at 8am to 5pm and that it shouldn’t disrupt our stay. We were initially thrilled about our room in the Royal Porto Real (large Jacuzzi tub, great décor, great view from the balcony etc.) But, it was shorted lived due to Construction noise starting at 7:00 am to 2:00 am the next morning. Since the Grand Opening of the Royal Porto Real was May 1, 2005, the day of our departure, construction people worked around the clock in order to complete things before the opening. Every night was a sleepless night. We were there to vacation yet this trip has caused more stress than delight. We went to the front desk two mornings in a row to ask to be moved to the Gran Porto Real, which we had booked at, we were told that there was no room to accommodate us. A pleasant front desk worker named Louis saw that we were dissatisfied because of the noise and showed us two other suites in the Royal if we wanted to move. Unfortunately, the other two rooms were closer to the noise, so the move didn’t work for us and we stayed put. The service at this hotel was revolting. Room service food was awful. There is no menu in the room so we had no idea what was available through room service. One evening we called to order room service and had to leave a message - they never called back to take our order. We called several times and our calls went unanswered and when someone finally did speak to us we were left waiting more than half hour for items. Room service was not apparent at this hotel. Housekeeping did a deficient job at cleaning our rooms. They took our used bathroom towels in the morning and didn’t leave enough clean ones to replace them, toilet paper was never restocked and our mini bar was rarely replenished. We tipped housekeeping the first three days of our stay but than we stopped once service began to slack off even more. The buffet and a la carte restaurants were repulsive. Various guests complained of this and several people we spoke to complained of food poisoning. The food was uncooked and extremely repetitive and stale. Not what someone would expect for a so-called “4 star plus resort”. The Mexican restaurant, Maria’s was very authentic and did a great job at providing entertainment, too bad the food was terrible. The Italian restaurant, Il Pescatore, was not Italian food by any means, and being Italian I can say that it was a ignominy to Italian culture (Mexicans prepared the food so that would explain why). Any guest that enjoyed that food (and there were some people that did) clearly has no acumen of what food expectations should be on a resort. Being the frequent vacationer that I am I can honestly say that this resort is not a 5 star nor 4 star plus but quite possibly a 3+. Don’t let the gorgeous décor and views fool you. This hotel needs to better excel in service, food, entertainment and better management if it wants to grow within time.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite Finished”
Reviews.Author: ronavanamburg
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday morning at 9AM. Our hotel room was not ready until 5:00pm, so I felt like the day was a little wasted because we kept going back to the desk to see if it was ready. Our room was beautiful. It was in the new part of the resort. We stayed in a Junior Suite which included a whirlpool tub. Our balcony overlooked the beautiful pool and the ocean and beach. I believe when the resort is finished it will be a first class place to stay. I was also led to believe that there would be hobi cat sail boats and jet skis, but there wasn't. Also, the other two people who went with us stayed in a room that had just been finished. They didn't have a phone, which made it hard to communicate. The construction was bad because it would start at 7AM and go until 8PM at night. Also....three out of the four of us spent a day praying to the porcelain gods. I think it is called Montezuma's revenge. As we talked to other people, at least one person in every group had been sick. The resort was in a great location if you want to shop. It was two blocks from 5th avenue where you can shop for miles and miles. As I said the pool, rooms and when the resort is finished, it will be first class.

Reviews.Title: “Just Returned”
Reviews.Author: goshell
Reviews.Content: A group of 16 of us just returned from the Gran Porto Real. The hotel is beautiful, the food was great and service was excellent...but there were problems with overbooking of the rooms. We only received two rooms at the Gran Porto...the others were sent across the street to the new hotel, as the Gran Porto was "overbooked". Those of us staying at the Gran Porto did not receive an ocean view as booked...we received views of a huge pile of concrete (construction). Those who were staying across the street were all initially thrilled about their rooms (large jaguzzi tubs in the middle, great views, etc.). But, it was shorted lived do to no electricity, water or phones. Construction noise started at 7:00 am and most had problems with their keys not working. Long story short after MAJOR complaining, they were moved backed to the Gran Porto. My advice...if you are booked for a stay there anytime soon, DO NOT let them give you a room across the street. With that said, the resort is just lovely. DO make dinner reservations at the speciality restaurants as soon as you arrive. If not, you'll be eating at the buffet. Food is excellent at the speciality restaurants. Service is great if you tip them a little...We have been to Mexico numerous times and we will return here (after ALL of the construction is complete)

Reviews.Title: “Got very, very sick!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beach and rooms were beautiful. People were nice. Got very, very sick. Out of our group of 44 people, 20 were ill. Never been so ill in my life. Obviously they have a problem with the food handling at the restaurants as I didn't eat anywhere else. Wouldn't touch this one again, maybe never Mexico again!

Reviews.Title: “High Schoolers on Spring Break RUINED our trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got to Gran Porto Real on Easter Sunday. We were impressed with the hotel and got our room quickly - no problems there. We went out to the pool and were lucky enough to find a few chairs. Everything seemed to be going great. Then that night we noticed ALL of the high school kids there on Spring Break. Some parents were there as "chaperones - read: they just sat there and watched their kids get drunk and act stupid." We were unfortunate enough to get a room next to a group of kids who kept us up EVERY NIGHT. They came home very early in the morning/late at night and partied in their room until 5 or 6 a.m. We called to complain, but nothing really happened. We should have demanded that we be moved. It really ruined the trip for us. The Gran Porto Real should put all the kids at the hotel across the street so that the adults can get some rest. Every bar in the resort was packed with bratty kids (as well as the clubs in Playa) and a few parents who could have cared less how badly their CHILDREN annoyed everyone else there. I will NEVER go back to ANY resort during Spring Break. Since when do High School kids get to go out of the country and get trashed while their parents watch and shake their heads like it's cute???? It was incredibly disturbing. If I never hear another drunk teenage Minnesota accent I will die happy. A WARNING TO ANYONE PLANNING A TRIP DURING SPRING BREAK....STAY AWAY FROM RESORTS THAT ALLOW HIGH SCHOOL BINGE DRINKING (unless you like the sound of kids vomitting outside of your room). There are resorts that are for adults only. I highly recommend one of those. That being said, we loved the third floor bar (when it wasn't overrun by kids trying to use foul language at the top of their lungs). We enjoyed the beach and the restaurants (we were all inclusive). The buffet gets old after the first day.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort, service, atten to detail, food, rooms all need major attention”
Reviews.Author: dbaumy
Reviews.Content: - We stayed 4/16 through 4/23. I paid extra for an ocean front room, after reading the reviews, we decided to try to check in as early as possible to get our requested room (we took the earliest flight and paid for a taxi from the airport). It worked, we got the room we asked for - others we talked to were not as lucky. The room was beautiful. It had a huge two person hot tud/jacuzzi. It was in the new building, first floor overlooking the pool and beyond the pool was the ocean. We would sit in the sun on our patio and the beverage servers came right to us - Mario was awsome. We had great bar service while sitting around the pool. - Check-in was a breeze and our room was ready when we arrived. The bellboy took us right to our room. When you checkin you are not given any information about the resort. No map, no list of activities, no list of services available, no list of restaurantes, no information about where anything is or what the resort offers - very frustrating. - Our room was beautiful but had many problems. We didn't have hot water for three days. The refidgerator didnt work. A large mirror was broken. - They take your used bathroom towels in the morning but don't leave clean ones to replace them. On three days, our maid didn't make our room up until we called (that is when you get new towels). We tipped our maid nicely and were very discouraged that we had to call to get our room cleaned. - lots of misquitos in our room - One our second day, we left a nice tip for the mini-bar stocker asking for all bottled waters and diet cokes - we even left a note written in spanish and english in the fridge with this request. We only got what we requested that second day. The fridge didnt work but we worked around that by using the ice bucket and chilled our drinks before we drank them. - Room service food was awfull. Fries were very cold and old. Burgers were cold too - not even enough heat to melt the cheese. There is no menu in the room so I have no idea what else is available through room service. One evening we called to order room service and had to leave a message - they never called back to take our order. They brought us the wrong beverages (regular cokes when we ordered diets) and the guy wouldn't get us the diets even after giving him a tip. A true 5 start resort would have apologized and brought us what we asked for. - Construction was very loud but we didn't hear much while in our room. - Use calling cards from the payphone on the street - they charge $5 to connect calls - what a rip off. - The restaurantes were fantastic, I highly recommend eating all meals in them, skipping the okay buffet. We were able to make reservations for most of the nights we were there. - a lot of the workers didn't seem happy to be there - only a couple smiled or said hi. - Our stay was ok, I was expecting 5 star service with our 5 star room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but food was less than desirable”
Reviews.Author: tiffsix
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned on Saturday, April 23rd, from 10 days @ the Gran Porto. We booked a Junior Suite Ocean View, and after reading all of the negative reviews regarding overbooking, we were nervous upon check-in. Well being nervous was not necessary at all!!! We arrived around 12:30pm and our room was ready!! Room 329. It was nicely decorated and very spacious. Our balcony had a great ocean view & the bathroom was amazing!!! The only down side to the room was the bed (very hard, something we are not used to) and the pillows (lumpy & hard as well.) The maids kept the rooms cleaned and the beverage guy always kept our fridge stocked! The pool at the hotel was very nice & had a tropical feel to it. However, the beach area directly in front of the hotel had several fishing boats which took up a lot of the swimming space. The ocean had a very rocky bottom, making it hard to walk. We chose to spend our time mostly @ the Royal Porto next door. The pool there had a luxurious feel to it and it was not nearly as crowded as the Gran Porto. Probably because there was construction going on which probably prohibited people from using the pool there. The construction was not a problem for us. It was not anywhere near the pool. The hotel is mostly finished. Just working on the main lobby at this point. The beach area by the Royal Porto was nice, but had a lot of seaweed. We both had massages @ the spa, 80 minutes each. These were wonderful! The service at both hotels was very good. They were very accomodating and willing to do anything to make your vacation as wonderful as possible. The location was amazing! Being able to walk into town was very convienant. So much to see & do. Now onto the negative aspects of the trip: THE FOOD. we did the all-inclusive plan. Let me just say that THANK GOD for the restaurant at the Royal Porto, Pelicano's. It was the only decent place to grab a bite to eat. (Breakfast, lunch or dinner - dinner is reservation only) My husband & I are not picky either. The food was way less than average at all three restaurants at the Gran Porto. The only place at the Gran Porto for breakfast & lunch is the buffet restaurant, Albatros. It was not good at all. Couldn't even tell what some of the food was @ times. The other two restaurants, Maria's (mexican) and Il Pescatore (Italian) were dinner only & you had to make reservations in advance. We arrived on a Thursday. One of the first things we did was go to the Concerige desk to make reservations. The earliest we could get in was Sunday! Our advice is to make your reservations as early as possible but plan on not being able to get into the speciality restaurants for a few days into your vacation. This may be due to the fact that guests at the Gran Porto & Royal Porto are eating @ the same places. Even the food @ the speciality restaurants were not that good. They make it look good w/presentation, but eating it wasn't that enjoyable. Good desserts are hard to come by as well. Oh, and while dining @ the Mexican restaurant, Maria's, we saw a COCKROACH!!! yes, a COCKROACH. I guess maybe in Mexico, it may not be a big deal, but here in the US, it is a sign of uncleanliness. My husband & our waiter had a conversation about it. He stated that the resort is very clean (which all the public areas were kept clean, you always saw someone cleaning something) Of course, we never saw the kitchen! He blamed it on the construction next door... I want to stress this: do not go to this resort for the food. You will be very disappointed!!!! Like I said before, it was way less than average. We did however, go into town & had some great meals @ Limones, La Parilla, La Casa de Agua, & the Blue Lobster. All great restaurants. Our favorite was Limones. We also ate gelato a couple nights @ Ciao Gelato. The food was a downer but we still had a wonderful time. Probably wouldn't go back to the Gran Porto, but maybe would be interested in staying at the Royal Porto. Once that opens in the next few weeks, the guests @ the Gran Porto will not be able to dine there & vice versa. Any questions, feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read both the good and bad reviews of the hotel so I was wondering how things were going to turn out but... I was so happy with my experience there! At first check in we received a standard room which didn't appeal to us so we asked to upgrade to a junior suite and ended up in the hotel across the street. We were in a very "grand" room indeed! All marble, great shower, very clean! The construction at 7:00am was frustrating, but it did ensure we didn't miss any of the sun (I think I would have driven me crazy if I was there for more than a week). The food was quite good and I must say the staff at this place are AMAZING! Many of them have chosen to work at this hotel because it is smaller and they get to know the guests. The service is fantastic - I thought these people need to come to Canada and give a lesson or two...there was not a moment when I had an empty glass unless I wanted it to be that way. All of the waiters were very deserving of an extra tip. I loved that this was a smaller resort and that it was close to 5th Avenue. Being able to go for a stroll, window shop etc. in the evenings was such a great change of scene. The day trips were fantastic. I recommend this place and I plan to return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Service !! Would go Back!!”
Reviews.Author: Natalina
Reviews.Content: Well ... of course I did get bumped to Grand Royal.. I knew this was gonna happen.. IT WAS THE BEST THING THAT HAPPEND.. Yes they are doing construction on this hotel but it looks like there almost done all they are woking on is the front lobby. They are furnishing the rooms on the other side.. AMAZZING ROOMS.... Great foood !! We booked A la carte for 6 days out of 7. Food at the buffet at was terrible. I never ate at the buffet for breakfast lunch or dinner always one of the resturants.. Couldnt have been any better. My room for the first 3 days was pool front yes I did hear banging but the music covered it. 3rd day in the people upstairs overflowed there hot tub jucuzzi and it caved in to our room .. We were a little upset. But the staff was soo helpfull. We got bumped up to a oceanview penthouse and were given 2 t shirts. We enjoyed every min of this service. Overall I would go back to this hotel I was not impressed by the Grand porto. If your gonna stay anywhere stay at royal !!!! IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS PLEASE DONT HESITATE TO EMAIL ME !! we were there from april 11th to the 18th

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation at Porto Real!”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our second visit to Porto Real, there were approx 50 people on our bus checking in at the same time,we were in our rooms in about 15 minutes,we had a Jr Suite Ocean view room 341 which looked right up the beach toward the Cozumel Ferry,perfect. We used the pool at the new Royal and the beach in front of the Royal the days there was too much seaweed in the water in front of the Porto Real. Food was great, the Restaurants at the Porto Real plus the PELICANOS at the Royal,reservations no problem,food very good,at IL PESCATORE Jose or one of the waiters will make flaming coffee, takes about 1/2 hour depending how many is at the table..make sure you ask for it it is not on the menu..what can you say a buffet is a buffet. The wait staff are excellent, beach waiters are asking you want you want before you finish your drink. There are 3 laptops set up in the Best Day Tour Kiosk, you put in pesos and can access the internet,we discovered this by accident. Also if you need to call home buy a phone card,we bought our through our Air Can. Rep 10.00 for 20 minutes, use the pay phones outside the Porto Real and there is no connection charge, call from your room and it is 4.00 or 5.00 per call. Room service once a day, came in minutes. Weather really hot and humid the first part of the week,but the humidity cleared,thank goodness, and the evenings were cool,but nice and refreshing. Take the bike tour it is at 10 am and 4 pm daily, you see ruins in Playacar, and we stopped at Ricky Martins house!!! didnt see him..lol..when we stopped at the ruins in Playacar, there was a Mayan wedding being held,with tradional dressed people with all kinds of cermonial things, really interesting. Fifth Avenue lots of fun.. We took a cab one day to Puerto Aventuras, walked around seen the dolphins,rays,manatees,on the way back stopped at Sam's Club, you can get a day pass, did some shopping. We had gone to Cozumel and Tulum, last year, so we spent most of our time on the beach, in the water using the kayaks and boggie boards. there were a number of weddings while we were there but on Thursday night there was a wedding reception on the beach, quite a few people, we think the couple got married in the church,because we seen the wedding procession dance all the way down the street led by a mariachi Band to the Porto Real, they either had a live band or singers with canned music,but the music started around 11 pm and went on to around 2:30-3 in the morning, it was VERY VERY LOUD, I called the front desk and complained as others did, the night before there was a reception with music further down the beach which was no problem,but this was located right in front on the beach, and all rooms on the first,second and third floors facing the ocean didnt get much sleep..we complained to the Front Desk again in the am and to our Air Canada Vac Rep...not sure if this was an isolated thing,but if the wedding dances are going to be that loud,they are in for some big problems,no consideration for all the guests trying to sleep. ..Anyone going who is an animal lover esp cats, there is a vacant lot on Fifth Ave there are about 6 very thin kitties living there,each night I got take out from the buffet,lots of fish,chicken, etc and took it down to them..the lot is on the left side going down Fifth just down from the Brazilian Steak House..please feed the kitties.. If you have any question please let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from April 9th to the 16th. We went all-inclusive. There was my husband, myself, and our 2 children, age 8 and 13. I had been reading the reviews for quite awhile, and although I found as the new hotel construction was getting further along the reviews got better, I was still concerned about what was going to happen when we got there. We arrived at 10 p.m. Check in was easy, and we were told to see a bell boy for directions to our room. The bell boy told us our room was across the street at the new hotel (Royal Porto Real) and he would bring our bags up in a few minutes. I was not suprised to be sent across the street so off we went. The room was absolutely beautiful, so we decided not to complain and see how loud the construction was going to be. Well, we were not disturbed at all by the construction, but because the floors are all tile and marble, the sound carries through the hallways and from the rooms above, so when guests were walking through the hallways, it was very loud, especially late at night. We still decided to stay in the new room. The pool in the new hotel was open and had lots of room all day. There is a swim up bar and the service poolside and beachside was great. You would never go thirsty, especially if you tip the wait staff. They really do appreciate it. The beach was also beautiful and not too rocky if you walked further up a bit. The buffet did get really boring, so we ate at the a la carte restaurants quite a bit. We had the buffet for breakfast most mornings, but had lunch at the new restaurant, the Pelican, a few times. You order off the menu and the food is awesome. All the restaurants were great, and the quantity of the food was good also. This hotel lacks big time in entertainment. It was boring, boring, boring in the evenings. We were expecting more than we got. We would love to see the Royal Porto when its finished. It is going to be beautiful. The rooms at the Gran run from $99.00 to $230 USD per night. The Royal runs from $250 to $350 USD per night. We would go back to Mayan Riviera again, but I think we would try a different hotel next time, just to compare. Anyway, if you are staying at the Gran or the Royal, enjoy!! After all, its Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble in paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth year staying at the Gran Porto Real. Unfortunately it wass our worst experience there. We were assigned a room in the new hotel across the street. The first night we were there it only had beds; no tv, no dressers, no mini bar, no patio furniture. We had requested a king size bed when we reserved in October but we ended up with 2 double beds. Construction started at exactly 7am every morning. On the second day we received most of the missing furniture except the mini bar ( it never showed up). The television was not functional during our 12 day stay. I reported this every morning to the front desk but it was never fixed! The service from the front desk has never been particularly good but it was worse this year. The lack of concern and interest to guest prroblems was evident.

Reviews.Title: “Made for a great week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind that my review is based on the fact that this is the only resort i've ever stayed at. We arrived in the afternoon and were checked into our room shortly thereafter. I did see one guy pretty pissed because he didn't get a room, so i believe everyone on here who has had similar problems with the resort. Luck of the draw i guess. ROOM: Very big room, big bathroom, big shower, big everything. Plenty of space to move around, very unlike a typical American hotel. The smell was a bit musty but you get used to it quick. The beds are no good, i recommend bringing your own pillow as well. I rarely slept on the bed myself. The maids were very helpful and cleaned our rooms multiple times a day. They even folded our clothes that were all around the room. I didn't mind, but if you don't like your stuff messed with, tuck it away. FOOD: The buffet was hit or miss, but you could always find something edible. The outdoor lunch buffet was pretty good, had your american stand bys (burgers, dogs, and fries) along with some other stuff (ribs, wings). The reservation restaurants were amazing. We had all inclusive and for what you get it's a pretty good deal. The presentation is as good as the food itself. And of course, unlimited drinks, so if you are into that go all-inclusive. I tried to tally up what it would have cost if we'd paid cash and most of our dinners were close or over $100. Inflated prices or not, it was worth it when you factor in other meals and drinks all day. SERVICE: Whoever complained about service here is spoiled. If you didn't have a drink in hand you didn't have to wait more than ten minutes to be refilled. If that's two long, there are enough bars in the vicinity of the beach to waddle up to and get a drink yourself. There were never lines and the baristos were always willing to serve you. PEOPLE: Everyone seemed nice, some of them nicer than others of course. You have to realize that these people live on $200 pesos a day ($20 dollars), so if their a little cranky that you make that much an hour, let it go. I'd say 90% of the staff talked to you like they were there to serve you and into their jobs, 10% were dragging along. Not bad considering those percentages where you work, right? TOWN: Has a very European feel to it. Aside from us, everyone was either from across the pond or from Michigan. Not to many street vendors or beach vendors, and prices were not as dirt cheap as many other places in Mexico. THE CONSTRUCTION ZONE: They are building another resort on the beach right across the street. As of April 9, it was about a month away from completion. My wife and I checked it out and found the pool area was finished, and it is far superior to the pool at the Gran Real. We spent a day there just for something new. Honestly, after seeing the new building, i'd wished we had been sent over there. I'm sure it was worse off a month or two ago but it has quieted down considerably. OVERALL: We'll go back. I think it was about $1300 per person for us to stay in a jr. suite, 1st floor, including airfare. So you figure $600 round trip airfare, so maybe $100 per person per day at the resort. Not bad in my book. Worth it to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the GPR”
Reviews.Author: osparki
Reviews.Content: we were originally booked at the BPA, but they were overbooked and sent us to the GPR. they had rooms available for us in the new hotel under construction. the good and the not so good: good: staff were awesome. waiters of note: merlyn & william by the pool& beach and Franklin at the pelicanos restaurant. activity staff: sergio, ruben, tavo, nathan and paulina- you are awesome!! totally made our kids vacation and when kids are happy, parents are happy!!! food: only ate in buffet 1st night, and booked specialty every night for the rest of the trip. hotel was fully booked, but we got in someplace every night! italian, pelicano, and mexican had great food & service. drinks excellent- just ask for the good brands. fast and friendly 24 hour room service too. we ate breakfast at the pelicano every morning (menu service, not buffet), right off the ocean- hello Franklin... pools & beach: what are some people talking about?? the beach is huge & beautiful with tons of loungers & palapas. the beach is now open in front of the new hotel as well. pool at original hotel is lovely (no swim up bar), but not giant. there is a shortage of chairs there by 9am, but many moved to the huge gorgeous pool at the new hotel that just opened (it has a swim up bar). nice & quiet there also (less activities). there is also a lovely, small pool w/swim up bar on the 3rd floor. rooms: we had 2 junior suites at the new hotel. huge & gorgeous with giant king bed, huge jacuzzi, huge bathroom&dressing area, dvd player, coffee maker, iron&board, safe, marble, ect..lovely balcony with ocean & pool view, table&chairs and a hammock. most rooms in the new hotel appear to have great views. the not so good: the construction is in full swing from 6:30am-11;30pm, and it looks to us like it will be done in a few months. this place will be stunning when done. GREAT LOCATION..if you like to sleep in, you probably will be disturbed if your rooms are close to the construction. it didn't bother us much and our kids slept thru it some mornings and not others.... we will definitely return to this hotel. we were treated so well, and after being bumped from another hotel, the great service was very appreciated.the guests were wonderful and friendly as well, because we were all happy....

Reviews.Title: “Place was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there from March 26 to April 2 - Wanted to stay another week. The hotel was beautiful, the junior suites were very nice and spacious. We found a chair out at the beach each day and enjoyed the wonderful weather and Carribean Sea. The beach was beautifl and miles of it to walk. At night we enjoyed the shopping and restaurants on 5th. We did not do the all inclusive and are glad that we did not as there are plenty of restaruants within walking distance. The staff was always friendly and smiling. Even though we did not do the all inclusive, we still had the staff asking us if we wanted any drinks at the beach. There is plenty of things going on around the pool and beach each day and the kids enjoyed that (i.e., beach volleyball, water volleyball, bocce ball, water aerobics, biking, dance lessons, etc). I was concerned about the place prior to our trip based on the reviews that I had read, but after going there and experiencing it first hand, I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've traveled quite a bit and stayed at several resorts and by far this was the worst! The rooms were nice but the service and quality of food was terrible. The employees were treated poorly by thier management and they all acted like this was a rotten job and not there to accommodate thier quests. Construction was still going on in the second buiding where we stayed and personally we didn't like waking up to jack hammers at 7am. For the price (which was more than we've spent in the past) We were extremely disappointed! go past Playa del Carmen for a beauty of a stay. (Barcelo Maya, Riu Yukatan, ) Make your stay the best by not staying at the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
