Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from March 26 to April 2. We travelled with two young children (2 and 6) and had a great time. This is a great location, just off 5th Avenue where there are a lot of shops and activities. The food was good. We especially liked the à la carte restaurants. The buffet was good for breakfast and we enjoyed the beach side lunch buffet as well. We had a junior suite which was clean and spacious. We enjoyed the pool, but were somewhat disappointed by the beach which was small and where you often stumbled upon rocks. The staff was courteous and eager to please. We really had a great time at the hotel. No problems whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “2nd World Country - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chibearbob
Reviews.Content: I and my family just got back from Playa Del Carmen and our stay at the Gran Porto Real. We were there right after Easter. The weather was beautiful. 90 degrees and sunny every day - even though the weather forecast stated partly cloudy each day! The Gran Porto Real is at the end of the street on the beach. It is a very nice hotel. Two pools on the main level. Everything open. The beach was beautiful. Even though there were many fishing boats right in front of the hotel. Just north of the hotel were clear stretches of beaches. If you went about 300 yards north of the hotel, many Europeans stayed and you got to see some young women sunbathing topless. Definitely a plus!!! The Gran Porto Real is about 2 blocks from 5th Avenue, which is about 1 to 1 1/2 miles long with many great restaurants and shops. We ate at the Blue Parrot, Blue Lobster and Media Luna. All excellent restaurants. We rented a car from Executive Car Rental for $70 (US) a day and drove to Chichen Itza. We took the road to Cancun (307) and then took the toll road (180) to Chichen Itza. It took about 2 1/2 hours. We had no problems and got there before the tour buses!! Definitely a plus. Top Rental Car in the hotel rents cars for $45 (US) a day but those cars are manual only. The rental rates for both companies include all insurance. US insurance is not valid in Mexico. The Gran Portal Real is a very nice hotel. 4-5 stars. Sometimes a little noisy due to the programs near the pool at night. In addition, everything is tile which allows the noise to reverberate. We did not do the all-inclusive option and used the $150 (US) per day savings to eat in town. I think a very wise move. Most excellent meals were in the 100 to 150 peso range. ($9-14 US). There was an ATM machine on 5th Avenue. If you go to Chichen Itza, buy your souvenirs there. They were much cheaper than in Playa Del Carmen. Also if you climb El Castillo be prepared for a very steep descent. Very steep. I and my daughter came down step-by-step on our butts!!!! I'm glad we did it, but just be prepared for the steepness. Language is not an issue. Most of the Mexicans you will deal with speak excellent English. Although I think it is respectful to learn some Spanish before you go there.

Reviews.Title: “Vacationed at Gran Porto (3/19/05-3/26/05)”
Reviews.Author: MNVIkingsFan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay during Spring Break at the Gran Porto Real and we had a fantastic time. When we left Minneapolis the temperature was 26 degrees and Saturday afternoon it was 91 degrees in Playa Del Carmen. Not bad! Yes, there were some initial issues, but given the total experience, we would certainly return for another stay in the future. Here are a few of the details related to our experience. My fear of arriving and being told that the hotel was over-booked and that we needed to move across the street into the "new property", better known as "the construction zone" came true. They were out of rooms when we arrived and after some significant discussion the manager took us across the street to the first room. Unfortunately, the king bed and hot tub would have appealed to my wife and I if we were by ourselves, but our two children (ages 17 and 15) needed a place to sleep too. So, off to the next room, a junior suite with two beds. The rooms in the new property are absolutely beautiful, but there was construction going on around us. VERY LOUD. And, another surprise....we were informed that the electricity and water would be shut off until 3:00PM. They were finally turned on at 6:15PM. The next morning I demanded to be moved back across the street into a junior suite, and from then on our room worked out well and we had a great time. Other comments worth sharing would be the meal situation. We were "all inclusive", so the food and drinks are included. The main floor buffet got old real fast. It's OK for breakfast and lunch, if you don't eat at the outside beachside buffet, but I would highlighly recommend you pass on eating at the buffet in the evenings and make reservations at one of the other three casual resturants. There are mexican, seafood, and Italian options, with a menu to fit almost anyone's tastes. We took two day trips, one to Xel-Ha (snorkeling) and Tulum (Mayan Ruins) - which everyone enjoyed, and a day trip on the ferry to Cozumel. Overall, we had a great time and I wouldn't hesitate recommending Gran Porto. Have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gran Porto - WE WILL RETURN”
Reviews.Author: texanheart
Reviews.Content: We returned from the Gran Porto on Friday, March 25, and our experience was GREAT! Like many others, we had read all the reviews and were a bit concerned, but we soon found there was no reason to be. Our rooms were wonderful - 529 & 530, very large and clean, with great A/C! We had booked Jr. Suites - but these rooms were like full Suites. The location of the hotel is wonderful. Being so close to all the shops and night life was great. The beaches were very nice - the kids had a blast in the sand and with all the different daily activites the resort provided. The boats were not a problem at all - in fact after seeing how small they were (just small fishing boats) I was amazed that anyone would complain about them! The waitstaff at the beach and bars were terrific too! And we were able to eat at all of three different resturants. The A/I plan is the best way to go - our kids probably drank 7-10 non-alcohol drinks every day. The adult drinks were great too! We did hear the construction noise - but we expected it, so it wasn't a problem. The beds may not be the best - but we didn't expect them to be - we knew this resort wasn't going to be like the Ritz Carlton in the USA - we knew we would be in Mexico. WE WILL STAY AT THE GRAN PORT AGAIN SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived @ 10 pm March 5th, & were checked in without any problems. We had to spend the first night across the steet in the Royal Porto, but since we expected that, it was no problem. The Royal is going to be a Great hotel when it's done. The next morning we were moved to the Gran porto without any problems. People who complain about the front desk staff must bring the trouble on to themselves. We started out tipping the housekeeping staff right away, and always had great service. The pool chairs are always taken early, mostly by people early in the mornings, putting their towels on them, then leaving for hours! The food in the buffet is just that, buffet food. Breakfast is fine, lunch & dinner are ok, but you get tired of the same old food all the time. We had no problem booking into the 2 resturants, the Italian is the better of the two. Over all the Gran Porto is a great hotel, we would go back any time, however we are booked for the Royal as soon as it opens. We did witness a woman complaining about the service, the food, the bar... it never fails, every all inclusive includes the house tourest ----! If you can't enjoy yourself on vacation at the Gran Porto, go back to Cancun, Playa is for the more laid back crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back in a Heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Playanut
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Gran Porto, and I'm having withdrawal pangs! Our vacation went off without a hitch.We went AI, as this best suited us. But also ate out on fifth ave. The meals were all fantastic. Got our ocean-view, junior suites' (first floor; when I saw the view, it took my breath away),with no trouble. Desk staff was very nice, and helpful. Can't say enough about the great service that Hillario and his staff on the beach gave us. The rooms were kept very clean. The beach was beautiful(boats are no problem), and the seaweed that washes ashore as a natural occurence of wind and waves, was cleaned up continuously, unlike some of the other beach hotels. The food was good, enough choices for everyone. The ala carte restaurants were excellent, and the bars were all exceptional. Especially Leonel, and Mateo at the new Royal Porto bar. Anyway, go, have the time of your life, relax, and remember, you are in another country. Go with the flow. They are a warm and friendly people, the merchants on the streets are just trying to make a buck the only way they know how. And please, tip generously, these people survive on what we consider loose change.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but many problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my vacation at Gran Porto Real. The hotel is beautiful and the beach is perfect for children. But service is poor. Our room was never cleaned until almost 4 pm. Food was just OK, not many varieties. Service at restaurant was slow and waiters didn't remember what they were asked to bring. We felt like management didn't care. I would never go back to this hotel and would never recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: katga
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Gran Porto Real on Saturday, after reading all the negative comments on this Resort I had been very nervous about going there so I felt I had to write this review. Our check-in went smoothly, we all got the rooms we had reserved. We did go with the AI plan because we like the ease of going this way. The resort is very nice, rooms, lobbys, restaurants were all kept very clean, which wasn't a small task as there were alot of young kids there on spring break. The staff was wonderful, which was a great accomplishment in my book as I certainly couldn't have been as patient with all the drunk kids as they were. (My biggest question was where are the parents of the 15 to 17 year old drunken High School kids as I feel they should be the ones being responsible for their childrens behavior?) Anyway, the beach area is kept clean, the boats were no problem as there was plenty of room to the side of them to swim in the ocean. The beach itself is plenty large and there was more than enough room for everyone. Hilliaro and his staff of waiters do a wonderful job of keeping everyones glasses full while on the beach or poolside. He gaves us all big hugs when we were leaving and told us he would miss us. The rooms were kept spotless, my refrigerator was stocked daily. The location of the resort is a huge plus, about a two minute walk and you are on 5th Ave. I will definitely be going back to this resort or possibly their new Royal resort right across the street when it's completed. My thought on all the bad reviews is relax you are on vacation and all the staff is working hard to give you you you want. If you are reasonable with them they will do everything to accomadate your requests, and remember, you are in Mexico not at the Hilton in the USA, things work a little differently there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel ....but it`s the luck of the draw checking in”
Reviews.Author: DEBDAVEJ
Reviews.Content: I had read many reviews of this hotel for months, prior to planning our trip with two other couples. We knew there were problems with the hotel over booking, but like many other hopeful couples, we hoped this would not happen to us.... wrong..... What it really boils down to, if we had received the rooms we paid for, which were ocean view jr suites when we first checked in, we would have been very happy, and this review would be completely different. All the dissatified travelers are ones who were moved to the unfinished, in full swing construcion new hotel. And can you really blame them for being upset...My husband has a bad knee and had to walk up 3 flights of stairs.. yes no workng elevators, but they don`t tell you that when you are moved. So if your review was good...it goes to show... you lucked out with a good room. We had to fight with the hotel staff for 3 days, to finally get the room we had paid for...and yes it was beautiful ... Our friends never got the rooms they paid for. The 3rd floor has the good ocean view ...2nd floor the palm tree`s take up most of the view, 1st floor, too much activity and noise near the pool area of the beach. The waiters and the maids are very sweet and helpful, but if you do not go all inclusive then you are not tended to as much. We were given all inclusive for the first 2 days, as part of their compensation for not giving us our rooms we had already paid for. So my best advise to you is if you are bumped to the new hotel, be very firm and go down to the desk the very next day and insist on a room change. I feel once the new hotel is complete...which looks like at least 6 months, some of these problems should resolve. I also think the earlier you check in ensures the best chance you will have of getting a good room. On the positive side... the beach was beautiful, the town of Playa and the walk on 5th ave is so much fun...tons of shops and wonderful restaurants. Our favorite restaurants were The blue Lobster, Palapa Hemingway, La Parrilla and Casa del Agua... The day trips were wonderful... go to Xel-ha and Tulum... but Xel-ha day trip should be a full day..there is so much to see. Try to see Cozumel too. All in all I loved our vacation...had a great time with good friends... but could have done without all the hotel problems.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real Resort, Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Heather C
Reviews.Content: I came across the TA Nov/ 04... after I booked the resort for our vacation, and I have to say I was concerned about my choice after reading the negative reviews regarading this resort. Four of us stayed at the Gran Porto Real from Sat. Mar. 5th to Sat. Mar. 12th and I felt since this forum was (is) such a great help to me I would post a review. This was exactly the type of resort that I prefer...relatively small, low rise buildings, only 3 stories, within walking distance of food, drinks, shopping or what ever else you might want or need, beautiful beach (yes there are fishing boats parked in one area but I couldn't see any negative issue with them)...there was always someone cleaning, painting, repairing etc., the wait staff couldn't possibly have been more attentive, helpful or pleasant. I found the front desk staff to be for the most part great as well...having said that we were shipped across the street to the new resort but moved the next morning to the 2 Jr. King Suites we booked, by 10:00 am.... with a smile. The Royal is going to be a fabulous resort when it is completed...the two 3rd floor Jr. Suites they gave us were huge and had magnificent ocean views, although not sure the rooms were completely furnished,...we chose not to stay there because we didn't want to face the construction but more importantly for me the elevators are not installed yet and a ground floor room or elevator was what I wanted. I am sure until the Royal is finished this will continue to be an issue... There was enough variety at the buffets with something to suit all of our tastes...Maria's was good, the Italian restuarant was excellent and the newly opened Pelicano, oceanfront at the Royal was excellent the first night. The four of us had a wonderful time at the Gran Porto Real...we went with the idea it is a 4* resort and it met our expectations...I would recommend it as such!!! I have pictures of the Royal... if and when I figure out how to change them to .gif or .jpg format I will post them. I would be happy to answer any questions regarding this resort.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, terrible beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gran Porto Real for 7 days with the all-inclusive package. The hotel was very nice, clean, and the staff was pleasant and friendly. I truly have no complaints, except for the beach. It had tons of seaweeds and it was very wavy and dirty, to the point that I went in the water only once. Walking further North, you'll find a better, cleaner beach, but it is public so you will see a lot of locals and it is an inconvinience to have to walk when you are paying for a beach front hotel. Overall, a great place to stay if you are NOT a beach lover.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traveled with three other couples. They all had rooms together on the third floor. My husband & I were put in the hotel across the street. The hammers and saws started at 7 am each morning. It was very loud and impossible to "sleep in". They couldn't move us to the main hotel for three days. We all had "standard" rooms and we paid for jr. suites. All the rooms were facing the loud street, the dumpster area or a propane tank/roof view. The management was very unconcerned with our dis-satisfaction and we were basically told by the MLT representative that we should be happy we have a room and not moved to another resort. The hotel did nothing to try to accomodate our requests to move or compensate us monetarily. We will not return. If you go to this resort, be prepared that you may be put in the "new" hotel that is not finished and does not have any services (elevator, pool, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance, sister and her husband returned from a five day stay at Gran Porto Real. It was paradise! We stayed in a Junior Ocean View Suite on the 2nd floor. Each morning we opened our eyes to the beautiful Caribbean Ocean, as the resort gradually came to life. We got up around 6:30, and put our towels and books on our lounge chairs to reserve them until we got our swimsuits on, etc. It's very laid back, I just ran down in my pajamas each morning and got our chairs set up. During our stay we walked around the hotel a bit, and up to the 3rd floor, and saw the pool and rooms facing the street and construction of the new hotel. This is a whole different world from staying in an ocean view room. You need to upgrade to a Jr. Ocean View Suite if you didn't reserve one to get the most of your experience. We didn't even hear any construction going on. But, the guys thought it was interesting to watch the workers. Even if you do have a room that faces the street, you will be spending your time on the beautiful beach anyway, not to worry. How can you go wrong with the ocean...very shallow you can play in the water for hours, and then the wait staff...bringing you drinks of choice constantly! They really aim to please, but you have to remember that you are not in the U.S. and your expectations of service may differ somewhat. They do make mistakes, but SO WHAT...they are trying! Don't bring too many clothes, you stay in your swimsuit all day if you plan to do the beach thing. I was barefoot 90% of the time, even in the hotel itself. It is all beautiful there. Don't worry. Maybe those that wrote the lesser-rated reviews were thinking that a Five-star U.S. hotel could be plunked down along the Riviera Maya and have the same service. It can't happen. Sometimes you are shorted a handtowel in the bathroom, or the hairdryer doesn't work the best. Those things do not ruin a vacation to paradise. This hotel is wonderful for a Mexico hotel. Give them some slack, you are in a different country and enjoy the beauty! We want to go back twice a year. Have a wonderful time! A few tips: The bathrooms are not the cleanest in the resort, so I carried Wet Ones in my beach bag and travel size bottles of the anti-bacterial lotion in my purse. We took a Pepto-Bismol tablet each morning or something similar.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding and Honeymoon at the GPR”
Reviews.Author: Colbeyca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the GPR from Feb 20th - Mar 6th. The resort was beautiful and was kept very clean by the attentive staff. Checkin wasn't a problem either. Fast and friendly. Our first room was 229 and had a great view of a palm tree! lol. A few days later, we were transferred to room 354, which was huge and had an amazing view of the ocean and of the new pier. We were there for our wedding on Feb 23rd and our honeymoon on the 2nd week. Patty, the wedding coordinator, did a wonderful job setting everything up for us. Elsy, the concierge, also was a big help, sending up Champagne and having our bedroom decorated with rose petals on few occassions, and reserving spots for us at both Maria Marguerita and Il Pescatore. <By the way, when eating at Maria Marguerita's, try to ask for Ivan or Victor to be your waitor. They are simply amazing.> The all-inclusive package is really worth it, since if you add up what it costs you to eat at either the Mexican or Italian restaurants, or even in town, you'll find it a lot less expensive. Although, while in Mexico, you need to try out a few restaurants as well, so I recommend trying Yaxche and La Perilla. Yaxche ( just off of La Qunita ) serves a lot of traditional Mayan dishes that haven't changed recipes in hundreds of years, and La Perilla is great and always packed and is right on La Qunita. When we visit down south, we like to combine the beach with the sites of the area, so try to visit the ruins of Tulum, Coba and Chichen-Itza, Cozumel, cenotes, Little towns towards Tulum like Akumal and try to explore the streets after La Qunita, like 10th, 15th, 20th and so on. Things are cheaper the further you get from 5th Avenue, and you also get to see the people and the homes of Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got home yesterday and I had to write my review so anyone who has booked can relax and look forward to a vacation full of fun, relaxation and superb service. My husband and I had a great time, the hotel is beautiful, there is construction across the road we were on that side not a huge problem you get use to it and you don't spend much time in your room anyway. The Albatros restaurant is nice lots of variety, breakfast is good ask for Bacon from the waiter and toast. The Italian and mexican restaurants were great. The lunch served on the beach is hamburgers, hotdogs,fries, onion rings,nachos that type of food, in the restaurant you get all the extras. As for bar service we never had an empty glass before they came around again for a refill. Pablo on the poolside is the greatest, a little tip goes a long way. There are the most accomodating people and couldn't do enough for you. Franklin was great in the Albatros but he informed us he is moving to the restaurant across the road in 3 days so if we go back next year we will have to go to the other across the road to have him serve us. No over booking problems we didn't like our first room and they told us to come back at 9:00 am the next day and by noon we were in a new room no hassle to problem. The rooms were clean and very nice we were in 411 excellent room-right on the floor of the top floor pool. If you are reading bad reviews they have to be from people who have very large expectations from a country of this kind. We feel it's a five star and then some-Being that close to 5th Ave in Play del Carmen is awesome-Have a great time and if you do, put your review in so others can feel comfortable about their choice and have a Miami Vice for us!

Reviews.Title: “Just Back from 7 Days of Gran Porto Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from our first trip to the Yucatan and our stay at the Gran Porto. :( Went in a little wary after reading the reviews re: construction etc and unfortunately it is a bit loud if you happen to be on the street facing side, across from the nearly completed Royal Porto Real. At time of booking we hadnt been able to book a Junior Suite, and our Standard room, which was right across from the construction was acceptable in and of itself, but not anywhere near as nice as the rest of the Resort, which is really lovely throughout. After complaining about the noise, we were moved the next day across the street to a Junior Suite in the new Royal Porto complex and our room there was nothing short of Palatial! If I can figure out how to post pics I will!. Insuite double jacuzzi, dressing room, marble throughout, wonderful comfy king bed and just beautifully finished. No complaints at all about the food. Three restaurants, one buffet and two ala Carte...all provided lots of variety, great quality and the service was second to none. The staff is truly exceptional...in the restaurants, at the bars, on the beaches...they are all friendly, efficient and just cannot do enough for you. The beach is spectacular! We got down to the beach to reserve our lounge chairs about 7:30 each morning and didn't have any problems getting chairs. I would definitely go back to the Grand Porto Real, but would recommend that you pay the upgrade for a Junior Suite vs the Standard rooms. I don't know how much more the new Units will be selling for across the Street at the Royal Porto, but they are definitely worth it! Just beautiful! Great place, gorgeous location, exceptional service...we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Gran Porto Real, where my husbnad and I traveled with 5 other couples. We were all very nervous about the check-in process after everything we had read. I have never had an easier check-in during a stay in Mexico. What a breeze! They were also able to put all five rooms close together. We stayed on the first floor in Jr. Suites which was the perfect spot to get to the beach! I accidentally booked a double room for my husband and I, which was a blessing. MUCH bigger than a king suite. We had two sinks and the biggest shower I have ever seen. The new resort across the street is going to be huge. Our room faced the construction but it didn't bother us at all. We spent a little bit of time on the third floor pool which overlooks the new hotel. It was very loud up there, and I think that is where standard rooms are located. The beach is in a perfect location, great people watching and not nearly as windy as other beaches. We never really had to fight for chairs on the beach, although it does pay off to get up early! And unlike other Mexican cities I have travled to, there were no beach vendors trying to sell jewelry or blankets which was very nice. The wait staff was excellent and we hardly ever had an empty glass. I know some people have complained about the boats in front of the resort, but really it's only in one location. The rest of the beach is wide open with wonderful spots for snorkling and swimming. The breakfast and lunch at the resort were just what we expected, nothing fancy and perfect for what we wanted. We did opt to eat out on 5th Ave. almost everynight. We couldn't miss out on the fantastic bars and restaurants. We had so much fun people watching and checking out the local bars! I would recommend checking out the other side of 5th Ave where there are less tourist. We asked some locals where they would eat and that is the area they recommended. We also went to the bar Ole, almost everynight. Two for one drinks! All in all this was the perfect location for a goup of ten couples needing a break from the cold Pacific Northwest. Don't expect the Four Seasons, but it's not nearly as bad as some of the reveiws will lead you to believe! We had a wonderful time and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Turned out just fine...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I booked this hotel last May. Since that time, I have read the reviews from time to time. I just returned from the Gran Porto on Feb 24. My family of 4 traveled with another family of 5. When we arrived, my friend was actually upgraded to two ocean front Jr. Suites. My room was not available ( a Jr. Ocean front Suite with two double beds). I was quickly put into an Ocean front Jr. Suite with one king bed, and they brought in two rollaway beds for my children. It turned out to be just fine as the rooms are very big. We opted to stay in that room for the duration. To some extent I agree with some of the bad reviews. I did see many people not getting the rooms they had reserved and paid for. Especially when they were sent across the street to the hotel being built. So overbooking is definitely a problem. Other than that, if you get the room you booked, the hotel is great. First of all, it is beautiful, right on the beach, and very, very clean. I felt that the staff went out of their way every time a request was made. We did do the all-inclusive. I feel that it was definitely worth it with the kids. Snacks, sodas, food, etc. all day and night. The buffet is not great, not horrible. I could always find something to eat, but was not overly thrilled. Breakfast is great, though. We ate at the Italian restaurant and did not like it very much. We actually had our best dinner at the Mexican restaurant. There are plenty of places to eat in town, and we did once. The location couldn't be better. Every night after dinner we walked into town for shopping and listening to music. I did have to get up early every morning (6:15) to get beach chairs with shade. But keep in mind that it was a holiday week and I've had to do this before at other hotels, at other resorts. Unfortunately, its just the way it is. We had two 14 yr olds and one 11, two 10 yr olds. I dont really think its a great place for teens. There were not many other kids there or much for them to do. Overall, I would highly suggest this hotel. We would definitely go back, just make sure you send an email and confirm your room type. Then be patient...they will do their best to get you your room as it becomes available. If you are nice, they will treat you nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: GRETBARB
Reviews.Content: Returned to the Gran Porto Real for a second year in a row. Loved it last time, loved it this time. It's true what they say about the construction and we were sent to the "new" hotel across the street. Since we spent very little time in our room, the noise didn't bother us. I think we were the first people to inhabit our room. We broke it in good......the jacuzzi in the room is huge and takes forever to fill up. No problem as room service is great and brought us up several pina coladas and nachos while it filled. The jacuzzi is angled so you can look out the window at the ocean. It was crowded the week we went, but it did not seem to impact service. It was really hot out at the beach and our waiter brought refills on drinks before our glasses were empty. Delightful. Food was excellent. Filet mignon at the Italian resturant was as tender as I've had. Everything had great presentation and was very upscale compared to some all inclusives I've been to where they've served slop. The people that complain about the food are probably stupid Americans that think Golden Corral is fine dining. The upstairs bar had sushi at lunchtime and the beach lunch area had great calamari. We had a wonderful time (again).

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Place!!”
Reviews.Author: kbeckpta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first trip ever to mexico. I rate this resort as one of the best hotel/resorts I have been too. The room was amazing and the beach was beautiful with a perfect location. It was probably the best vaction I've ever had and the best rate. I used AAA to book my trip and everything was on time and to the tee. The staff was better than any I've experienced in the U.S. Go here, you'll love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Traveler beware!!!! Construction site, not a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Playa, and stayed at this insult to the hotel industry. They overbook as a habit (some staff admitted this), so don't expect the room you booked.... When we arrived, AFTER they swiped our credit card and handed us keys, they advised us that our ocean-front rooms were not available.... We were shown to some hideous rooms accross the parking lot, where the elevator was broken (3 flights of stairs), walls and ceilings were patched with raw sheetrock. The rooms abutted a MAJOR CONSTRUCTION SITE (Several hundred new rooms ....like a mini-Las Vegas) Noisy Work started at 7 am and lasted till 9pm. They moved us to another room which smelled ghastly, but was said to be quiet....we were awoken at 7am with MORE MAJOR CONSTRUCTION SITE NOISE (neighboring condo's). Expedia refuses to re-imburse us, the hotel offered us a free breakfast (how generous!) We checked out the following morning to a smaller less insulting environment. And if there had been no construction? No towels or chairs at the pool, lousy, rude service.....the list goes on. This hotel is THE PITS. I have detailed video to prove my case.

Reviews.Title: “Just relax and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, Thanks to the great employees at GPR. We travel with friends every year on vacation. I had heard about this resort from a family member and after many cruises we decided to check it out. Our first trip to GPR was two years ago, and we loved the facilities and staff. We would have returned last year; however, they were booked up so we decided to try a location in Cancun they were not associated with... BIG mistake. This yeas trip came around and once again we knew we wanted to return to GPR. We were at the facility Feb. 12 through 18 with friends. We had reserved a Jr. Suite and received a Jr. Suite. Yes there is construction going on across the street, but thats what happens when hotels are built. The new location was scheduled to be open; however, it is not at this time, opening is scheduled for end of March 05. Hotel was still clean, staff still exceeding expectations for MOST guest. Restaurants and beach were busier than before; however, they are accomodating guest from both hotels at this points as one wing of the new hotel is completed and being used by guest. The entire staff from Bell Boys, front desk, servers, housekeeping, etc. were great. Also, one of our friends became sick during our vacation and unfortunately had to seek medical attention. The hotel does have a doctor on call and he was great. He perfomed professional service to the patient as well as recieved high regards from US doctors once she returned to the States and had her stitches and xrays checked. I know everyones level of excellent is different; however, I can tell you if there is an issue at GPR, the staff will do everything within their power to make sure you are satisfied. If you are the type of person that is hard to please, you will not be happy anywhere. Rest and enjoy the beauty of the beach, sunshine and wonderful hospitality. Will we return... absolutely!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Safe traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: peterparker
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to Mexico and were lucky to be told about the Grand Porto Real. Having talked to lots of people from other places the Grand Porto all round seemed the best for beach and shopping/clubbing. The Hotel itself is beautiful and clean our standard room was small but very adequate as we didn't spend much time in it anyway. There were a few hurdles such as our traveling companions got bumped across the street, but into an upgraded Jr. Suite (20.00 extra per night). It was noisy from construction, but it got us up and enjoying the day. We had some trouble getting more than 2 bottles of water in our mini fridge daily. The only real complaint were whinney guests who haven't learned how to enjoy themselves and rude tourists. The food was good and fresh, and the service and staff were top shelf. Some tips before you go: -phone ahead a few days before to confirm -take a light jacket or fleece (evenings can get cool) -take a water proof wallet if you enjoy the water (for room key,cash) -take 2 swim suits as I found thats what I wore most (so 1 can dry) -plan on tipping a little they really apprieciate it -an insulated coffee mug with a lid is great for the beach -5th ave is a hoot day and night (lots of venders watch out) -SCUBA lessons and Cozumel dive package is worth it -the Italian Resteraunt is a must -coba adveuture tour was very good -guys take your wrap around sun glasses -I took my own snorkle gear but there is lots available -ear plugs if you like to sleep late( but why too much to do) -enjoy yourself and learn to relax and compromise it is Mexico

Reviews.Title: “I Love Mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from gran. about a two weeks ago, wow what a great place to stay, room was great, huge, you could fit eight people in the shower it was solarge,room was big, very nice and clean. everyone was so kind to us and always had a smile on there face, even after a 12 hour day, do you think we could all learn something from these gracious people. my drink was never empty,they took such good care of you by the pool. the pool guys were great. always something going on by the pool. the resturant in the hotel was ok not real thrilled by it, it was the mexician one not enough choices on the menu per day. the itilian sorry for the spelling, was the best, we ate there 4 times and each time was better than the 1st. the staff were out of this world, they did everything they could to please you. they always had a smile on there faces no matter what. We had no problem checking in but we did hear a few problems people had around the pool, but they did try hard to keep people happy. the shows were great, the micheal jackson show was awesome, i know what you are thinking everyone but you have to see it , true raw talent, we enjoyed it very much. The spa was great, i had a massage was so relaxing, I would suggest going to the spa not by the beach, much more quite and relaxing. The boogie boarding was so fun, scarey but fun. when that big wave comes at you and you are not ready look out it will roll you right over if your not ready. If you wear your glasses whhile you are doing this I suggest you have a lanyourd hooked on it spelling sorry. i am so impressed we never had to get a cab, we were so close to everything you could walk,how nice is that. i also waNT TO SAY I felt very safe the whole time i was there. The people of playa are so wonderful i can not say enough, always, always a smile on there face. I bet they do not have a big call for zoloft or many other kind of drugs like that, I am not saying they are bad just that they do not sweat the small stuff. I know we are so spoiled, when i returned home I almost felt guilty for all that I have. I know I could live with so much less, lets face it we are to spoiled here. it made me really appreciate life and my family so much more. iwould return to GPR in a heart beat. thank you to all of the staff that made my trip so relaxing, god bless. BETTY BOOP BIKER

Reviews.Title: “Well Done”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been travelling to Mexico once a year for the past thirteen and this was one of the best trips yet. The staff, amenities, and location of the Porta Real were exceptional. Our room was ready early, well appointed and located where reserved. We did not have the all inclusive, adventuring out on our own for food and beverage. There are several adequate establishments within a ten minute walk of the hotel. We will return next year with no hesitation. This was a great place.

Reviews.Title: “not the best of the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our 2 week all inclusive vacation at the G.P. Real in Playa Del carmen. We had read about all the problems that other people were having with this property and had expected the worst. We had a jr suite for 13 nights and 1 night in a regular room. I recommend the upgrade to jr. suite. The regular rooms are really small and the 3 of us had a hard time just walking around each other. We were all inclusive and the meals at the buffet for supper were to say the least below average. We really enjoyed our meals at the Italian restaurant, and there were afew ok suppers at the buffet. Hotel was very clean, service by the pool and beach were fantastic. Alittle tipping goes a long way. Best meal of the day is breakfast at the buffet. Our travel company rated this property at a 4+ star. They must get a star for being so close to 5th Ave in Playa or for their beach. I would rate this hotel as a 3 1/2 star. Don't expect this to be a 5 star resort. Don't stay in the construction zone. Noise, Noise, Noise. Goes until after 11:00pm and starts at 6:00am. Also don't face the road tour busses start arriving early as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: rba828
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real for almost a week in February. It is a very beautiful and clean hotel with great location. We stayed there on the second week of our stay in PDC, so we already had some experience with the area having previously stayed at a small non all-inclusive the week before. First off, the Gran Porto Real taught us that we are defiantly not all-inclusive people. The other reviews are right about the over-booking. We reserved an ocean view jr. suite and ended up in a jr. suite facing the street and construction of the new hotel, right above the main entrance to the hotel. Apparently all of the jr. suites are the same, differing only by their views from the balcony. We did try to reason with the front desk and they were pretty much rude and unresponsive. After our first day at the Gran Porto Real my husband sent me to take care of any business that required dealing with the front desk for the rest of our stay because he found them so frustrating. We were told that we would get the room we had originally requested two days into our stay, and after discussing it we decided we would rather unpack and settle in to the room we received and give up the battle. It’s vacation right? Oh, also most of the people we talked to that were visiting the hotel didn’t have a problem checking in, so we were just the unlucky ones. Maybe we weren't aggresive enough? The food at the buffet was not good. It was mass produced and cold most of the time. Every day lunch and dinner had a different theme (Italian for example) but the food was the same old boring and tasteless stuff. Don’t even bother trying dessert. On a positive note, the dining room was really nice and the breakfast was actually pretty good. The two restaurants at the Gran Porto Real were both good with nice atmosphere and they used excelent presentation. The Italian one was delicious and the service was great. They weren’t kidding when they said you have to make reservations days in advance to get into the Italian one. Even though we were warned in advance, this seemed pretty silly to me since we had already paid for the hotels amenities but hardly got the chance to use them. The room service was prompt and the people were nice. Try the club sandwich and don’t be afraid to them and ask for “a lot” of bottled water. We had them bring up about 6 bottled water at a time to keep us stocked. The fridge was stocked every day with soda and a couple beers which was nice. The pools at the Gran Porto Real were great. Very clean and refreshing. We definatly recommend going up to the second floor pool that has a swim up bar. Nobody seems to even know it is there so there were very few people hanging around. During the days we lounged on the beach and swam in the pool and the ocean. One day my husband had a really good time playing beach volleyball organized by the entertainment staff. For the most part we ended up wandering down the beach and exploring 5th Avenue. Our room was really nice, with big statue type things in the corners and beautiful furniture. The bed was huge and comfortable but the pillows were hard as a rock. Bring your own if that matters to you. The shower was really cool because of its size. Overall, we would not return to the Gran Porto Real. I must say that it looked like about half of the other guests were really enjoying themselves. There were a lot of activities for kids to do so it seemed like a good place to bring the family. To be fair I guess it just comes down to whether or not you are an “all-inclusive” person.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it.”
Reviews.Author: cantwait40
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two weeks in the sunny Mexico resort. This is our 2nd time going to this resort. We had lots of fun the first time which was 4 years ago and decided to go back and bring our friends with us. We had a group of 12. Got to the hotel expecting to be bumped from the rooms we ordered and it did happen. But because we had the mind set that this was not going to ruin our holiday, we went with the flow and ended up in the resort next door which is connected to this resort. Just across the street. Closer than going to the other end of the main hotel. We ended up with a double jacuzzi in our room, 2 double beds, huge bathroom and shower and a balcony with a hammock to lay on in the afternoon. The only thing was that the workers started work at 7:00 a.m. Didn't really bother us a bit. It was quite interesting actually. We watched them build this new hotel through the peek holes and were surprised to see the workers working in flip flops on their feet instead of steel toe boots. The resort is gorgeous and it is close to everything you can imagine. Close to 5th avenue if you are into shopping, close to the ferry to Cozumel or to Cancun if you wanted to go there for the day. You felt safe walking everywhere on the streets or on the beach by yourself. There was lots of choices for food. If you couldn't find something you liked, you are extremely picky. Lots of choose from. I enjoyed breakfasts the most because they would make omelets exactly how you wanted them with about 10-12 different choices to put in your omelets. Also the fresh fruit in the morning is great. Again lots to choose from. The people at the resort are so friendly and so helpful. They couldn't do enough for you. We got to know Iliana and David at the pool bar and also Jamie and Ivan at the restaurants. Also some other employees who also had a smile and a handshake or kiss in the morning whenever you saw them. They have added the Sports and Entertainment group since we were there 4 years ago. They sure get you involved in the Crazy Games everyday. Also they have bicycle tours of Playa del Carmen, Salsa dancing, water aerobics, Kareoke night and much much more. We had a great time with them and I think they enjoyed us including Senior Buck and Cowboy Bill. Weather was great while we were there. Sometimes cloudy but that was good to cool things down a little. The waves were great for body surfing but the water sure is salty. We also took one of the tours to Coba Jungle which I would recommend to anyone who wants to know some history about Mexico and also how the Mayan people live even today. Very interesting tour. It was all day but not real tiring except when we climbed the pyramids. I think that everyone in our party enjoyed themselves and I would not hesitate to back once again even with the mixup in the rooms. We ended up with better than we expected. You just have to have patience and the right frame of mind. Just think you are on holidays (you could be a home shoveling snow instead) If anyone wants more information regarding this resort, I would be happy to answer any questions they might have.

Reviews.Title: “Worth The Long Read”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa Feb. 6th to 13th, 2005. I had booked the new five star hotel being built next door, The Royal Porto Resort and Spa. I paid considerable dollars for this five star hotel. Unfortunately I paid upfront with Tansat and learned one week prior to departure that the new Royal Porto Hotel where I had booked was not yet ready for guests. I was offered an equivilant room at the Moon Palace which is much closer to the Airport and Cancun., which also included a day trip to Chichen Itza. I did not want this as I was looking forward to being in Playa del Carmen. I was not offered any compensation for this change. When I arrived in Cancun I was loaded onto a bus with only foreign speaking people, with me being the odd ball out. No one else from my flight was assigned to this bus. I was also told I was going to the Gran Porto Real. This was unacceptable to me as I had paid for a five star hotel and was now staying in a three star. (The Gran Porto calls themself a five star but many brochures say three and I think three is a more accurate rating) There was much new construction and renovations going on at the same time. I believe they are working on five stars but are at least a year or more away from that rating, and I believe this would only apply to the new Royal Porto Real. (Advertised but not available) However there was no hesitation to charge for a five star. I was given a junior suite on the beach and a black band to recognise me as a VIP. I found this to be a bit of a joke as my all inclusive treatment was the same as any other person staying there. I have no idea why I was given a black band instead of the usual yellow all inclusive band. I think the black band labeled me as a disgruntled visitor as I had expressed my dissatisfaction at all the changes. My room was far from the pool and lobby, however it faced the beach and had two balconies. Repairs were going on during my stay, with a tarp hanging onto one of the balconies, when I was going to sit out. The furniture is chipped and needed painting. The balcony railings had rusted out in places and in general the room needed refreshing. I would say the food is only average. I did not however eat in the separate restaurants. Reservations for these two restaurants was not always available and you had to line up in the morning at the concierge in order to get a reservation. The drinks were good and you could have more alcohol added if requested, however I felt some of the staff resented this with a look of same. I found most of the staff to be pleasant. I felt a reception for new guests would be useful, with drinks and food and introductions provided, as I did not find guests to be friendly at all. Little response was given to good morning greetings that I sent out. I had a wonderful massage on the beach, however U.S. coin tip was not welcome. The only other bill I had was a $10.00 U.S. bill which I gave her. I felt $5.00 would have been appropriate but of course not change. It is better to have some pesos available for tipping. I also had a very nice manicure at the spa. THIS HOTEL WAS OVERBOOKED TO SAY THE LEAST. One couple was put up in a room where the windows had been boarded up. Of course this was only for the first night???????? As I feel our vacation time is valuable, even one night of this kind of treatment is unacceptable. However once you are there, you have no recourse and of course they have your money. I found the beach area to be wonderful, although it could have been better maintained. They have a very large beautiful swimming pool and neat little bar close by. Repairs were being made during my stay at this bar as well as other areas. I understand this is necessary, but I do not believe I should have been charged for a five star hotel with all these canges in progress. All in all I certainly did not get what I paid for nor what I would expect with a five star cost, and I would not return without some compensation and or refund. I understand one airline that booked at this hotel compensated at least two of their passenges with a repeat reservation at the Gran Porto Real. They only have to pay their own air ticket. The people I booked through offered zip. As I said this hotel was very overbooked. A booking agent was there occasionally but she was not available upon my arrival. I received a note to tell me to be in a certain part of the hotel the next day at nine a.m. I did this but all she had the power to do was to change peoples room around. At any time that I did wish to see her she was unavailable. When she was available there was always ten people lined up to see her. Not a very satisfying situation. This was the same on a daily basis and I don't think anyone wants to spend their vacation time in a line up to see someone who is supposedly responsible for any difficulties you may encounter during your holiday, or so I thought. So I dicided to make the most of my dilemma with the way I was treated and enjoy the time I had there. Walking along Fifth Avenue was fun, lots of art, paintings and crafts. I was reluctant to try these restaurants. No information about them was provided by the hotel, and it was difficult to get close to the front desk as others also had problems to sort out. They really need a proper orientation for guests to make their arrival a pleasant and welcome experienc. The overbooking is so unfair to vacationers. I did visit one of the finished room just across the street (not on the beach which I had booked and paid for). The room was beautiful, but anyone staying there had to listen to construction sounds day and night and parts along with other construction inconveniences. ENOUGH SAID!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Paradise Feb2-Feb9 from MN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were two couples that went on our trip and we had no hitch whatsoever. We left the airport in MPLS at 6:55am and was on the beach by 1:00pm. It was a great time. Smooth check in and were very accomodating. We went AI and thought it was a great way to go. There is a restaraunt called Anjus(?) I think that was off the resort that gave us a great deal on a huge meal for 4 if you think the food at the hotel is getting tedious. Always asked the staff if they didn't have something we wanted and many times they brought it too us. Eat at the Italian restaraunt at least twice at the resort. You have to get in line in the morning for reservations for the next day. Beach was great for laying around and just being peaceful. There wasn't many people bothering you. Enjoy your time and drink the Blue Hawaiin's.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto - Lovely Resort but Total Mismanaged”
Reviews.Author: Annie-MN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real Feb. 4-11, 2005. Overall the hotel is lovely but the check in process is out of control. I too read the reviews and wasn't sure what to expect (not too much). We booked a Jr. Suite and requested two double beds as there was three in our party. We paid for this reservations 6 months ago. I called to confirm the reservation 24 hours prior to arrival and was told they could not guarantee a room...even if they had our money for six months. Upon arrival we were given a run of house room with a king bed. We were told they would move us tomorrow. Next day they said...tomorow. We ended up with a great room but getting it was a major pain. While sitting at the pool every single person we spoke with had a small horror story. We did the Europen Plan but heard the food was okay but by the end of the week many were going on 5th Avenue for dinner and asking us for suggestions. The new complex next door was suppose to be done 3 months ago and perhaps that is half of the problem. If you do need to change rooms....get down to the front desk first thing in the morining. They tell everybody to come back between 1:00 and 3:00 pm. If you would like additional information, feel free to e-mail me. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “First timer to mexico resort”
Reviews.Author: AIRPLANESCHOOL
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience at an all inclusive so we had little to compare it to. First off, the previous reviews about being bumped are true. Fortunately we were not in that group but met many others who had been sent to less than desired properties for a couple of days. The new sister property next door is not complete but some people were put up there without any restaurant/bar facilities or working elevators. This means that they came to our side which made everything more crowded. Our room (Jr Suite) was very nice but the property design is not well thought out with a step down in the room from the foyer to the bedroom. There is also a step down into the shower for 12 (big). Little closet space. Food was fine but a buffet is a buffet and sometimes not very hot. The two sitdown restaurants were fine but they at first would only make a reservation for that day or the next. We were fine with that but midway throught the week they changed the rules so you could make multiple reservations for your entire stay. We were only able to eat at each once. We did go into Playa almost nightly and did have a couple of dinners there (on our own peso). Location of Gran Porto is wonderful with 5th Ave just a couple of blocks away with all of its shopping, bars, and restaurants. We (4 of us in 2 rooms) would consider going back but only once the other property is finished. The Gran Porto is also still under construction with the Sports Bar off Constitution nearing completion. Nightly entertainment was poor. Bottom line...the place was clean; service pretty good; the beach and proxsimaty (sp) to town super; but a lot of grumbling guests.

Reviews.Title: “Stress free vacation????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just arrived from Playa Del Carmen. I was very concerned after reading all of the bad reviews, just like everyone else. Any thing bad that could happen, did happen to us. With the language barrier, it made it very difficult communicating(or they chose to not understand)We, too, were put accross the street in to the "New" hotel (we booked in the Gran Porto Real resort). After traveling all day, we were looking forward to turning in early (9:30 pm)..only to hearing the sounds of hammers right outside our door. Not only the hammering, but our room faced the parking lot, which you could hear the buses and taxis constantly drving by. In the a.m we were woke up at 6:15 am..more hammering, jackhammers, tour buses (diesel)..a few nights my husband and I could not even carry on a conversation because it was so loud. When we tried to switch, we really got the run around..whoever barks the loudest, gets what they want..we chose not to spend our vacation in office complaining. We took our vacation to get away from stress not to add to it, which is what happenend at this resort! My brother stayed at the Gala Resort down the road. Very nice and quiet. Our next visit would be to this resort. No bracelets, lots of entertainment and very good food..Also, you did not have to wake up at 6:00 am to get a chair to sit on the beach..Iwould not recommend the Gran Porto Real resort to my worst enemy...

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time...”
Reviews.Author: Bibber
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days at the Gran Porto Real Resort, and it was wonderful. There was a total of 7 of us, and we booked 3 rooms. It took us about 45 minutes from the airport to arrive, and it took about 20 minutes to get checked into the resort and our bags brought to our room. We got a jr. suite room, and it was great, I would recommend the upgrade to the jr. suite room. The room was so roomy and the bathroom was the biggest I have ever seen. They placed us on the first floor, I requested a third floor room when we arrived, but none available. They told me to come back the next day at 9:00 am to see what was available, but we liked what we had, so we stayed on first floor facing the street. The beach was wonderful, exactly what we wanted. Lots of beach, beach chairs and the swimming was awesome. We did not go all-inclusive, which worked out well for us because we like to hop around for dinner in the evening. We hung around the resort all day on our lounge chairs, had drinks brought to us, the service was perfect. We did need to wear the wrist bands, but there was no other way to have it done, everything was charged to our room so it was very convenient. We noticed no different service from all-inclusive to not all-inclusive. There was construction going on with the sister hotel across the street, but did not bother us whatsoever.......they have along way to go to finish... I would definitely stay here again, and I would recommend this resort to anybody, it was perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awesome! We were also skeptical after reading the reviews but decided to go with an open mind and take things as they came. Well, I was pleasantly surprised everything went smoothly we didnt have a problem with the check in and our rooms were right across from the construction and that wasnt a problem either. The bar service was outstanding thanks Jorge and Pablo! The food was really good, espically the Italian restaurant - great presentation guys! Finding a chair wasnt as hard as everyone makes it sound you may have to walk and look a bit, but you can always find one, and then just move to where you would like. The best thing was the entertainment crew - they kept the kids and adults busy all day and then went out of their way to take guests out at night. A big thanks to Rueben, Luis and the gang you were awesome and you made the trip extra special! I would not hestitate to go to this hotel again. I loved it, the rooms were beautiful and very clean. The service was superb and we had a great holiday.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes like everyone were worried about the GPR after the reviews but it was amazing! We had a group of 12 people 6 adults and 6 kids. The staff was very attentive. We never had a empty drink in our hands thanks to Jorge and Pablo. The entertainment staff always keeps you busy. My 7year loved to make the braclets each day and we really enjoyed the bike tour. Reuben , Louis and Sergio were great in keeping us entertained during the day. The standard rooms were fine. We had nice chairs outside to visit. We never had the overbooking problem so cannot comment. The food was good but the Itailian was the best. We got our group in twice during 1 week. Breakfast is the best meal and try eating lunch in the buffet room it is better. We really liked the access to the downtown and the beach. This place was great no complaints and I am sure we would book again. It was a wonderful holiday! I already miss the place!

Reviews.Title: “rip off”
Reviews.Author: kksheffer
Reviews.Content: I read alot of reviews about this place and wasn't sure what to believe. I am a avid traveler. To Mexico and many Carribean Islands. I know things aren't rated the same in other countries like the US. I have been all over Mexico, and have loved every place but Playa Del Carmen. First off after reading reviews about getting bumped I contacted my travel agent, she in turn called the hotel direct to ask about this problem, and was told it only applied to people who booked online not thru an agent. Bull. We were on a charter flight everyone was thru an agent. 2 other couples that was on that flight and at that hotel got bumped next door. we were not (Maybe cuz the travel agent called?) They don't have enough locks for the safes. They do have many boats right in front of hotel which means you have to go down the beach to get in the water. We did not go all inclusive(Glad we did not.) The food was terrible Not just our opinion, we ran into quite a few who had to eat outside the hotel and they were all inclusive. Our room key was shut off one day. Our minibar had 2 beers when we arrived and I brought a coke from the airport. Thay never checked the bar when other people checked out and we were charged for the sodas and juices ect. They charged us $5 for a small plastic cup per drink and no alcohol in it. after complaining we were told most people don't like alcohol. So don't think you are saving money by eating and drinking there. we ate at the hotel the first night and 1 lunch. town has a lot of resturants and all was good. Every couple of days check you hotel charges. and pay them. The pool and beach areas were crowded, but we usually found a chair. We found a really great waitress at the bar Her name is Teresa she is very friendly and helpful, she recommended places to go and see and eat ect. Please tip these people as they only make about 65$ every 2 weeks. Our vacation wasn't great and we would not go back again. But it wasn't a total wash out.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the GPR 1/27/05-1/31/05. There were 11 of us girls traveling together from MN. We're high school friends celebrating our 40th birthdays this year. Two of the girls had stayed at the GPR last year and recommended it. After reading all the reviews over the last couple months, I was very leery of this resort. However, after our stay, I'd go back in a heartbeat. We booked junior suites (not oceanfront). Although we did have the token over-booking situation at check-in (3:30pm) and had to stay across the street our first night, we were moved the next morning and everything went smoothly from there on out. The new hotel is a LONG ways away from being complete. It's merely a shell right now. There are 3 floors (or 1 wing) that is on the street side that is complete. That's where we stayed our 1st night. They told us we were going to be the very first people to ever stay in our room. I have to admit, the room was stunning. If it weren't for the 6:30am construction wake-up call, we would have just stayed there and not moved. There was a large jacuzzi in the suite and beautiful updated decor. You really are just a quick cross of the street away from the main portion of the resort. I heard so many complaints on this site about the front desk staff. I did not find them to be rude what-so-ever. Just know, when you request to move, and they tell you verbally that you'll get to move, you may need to follow-up with that same worker at the front desk the next day. Isabel said we'd move and even wrote our names down. The next morning, a guy was there and he had no record of us and didn't want to help us. Then Isabel came out from the back and remembered us, our room # and where she was going to put us. Our next junior suite was on the main resort but street side, but you couldn't hear any construction though. We were pleased. With 11 of us traveling together, getting the lounge chairs in the morning was somewhat of a chore. But we always managed to get them. You find stray single chairs and just go round them up. The beach waiters even helped us. Thanks to Jorje! We weren't down there at the crack of dawn, by any means. More like 9am. As far as food, I concur with the other reviews on the Italian restaurant. It was the best food I've ever had in Mexico. I had filet mignon that was grilled to perfection. They greeted us with a pineapple martini. It was so nice in there. Maria Margaritas was just so-so. Most of our group did not like their food there. But I ordered the lobster (extra $14) and found it to be very good. Remember to get your dinner reservations in the morning. The buffet is great for omlettes and fresh fruit in the morning, great pasta bar in the evening. The beach snacks during the day are good. Highly recommend the guacomole and fresh salsa! Drinks are good too. However, if you're a top-shelf liquor person, bring your own bottle. Beer on tap is DosEques, which was good. The pool bar is fun along with nightly entertainment. If you want your drink stronger, just say "make it strong" or "make it a double". They will do it...no problem. I'm an all day drinker kind of person, so wouldn't ask for strong until the end of the day...or I'd never make it. :) As far as going into PDC, we loved the little quaint town. You can walk up & down the streets with drink in hand and take in the sights. Stop in and grab a beer from one of the stores for $1! We ate at the Blue Lobster in town one night and bypassed our AI priveledges. AWESOME!!! I never thought you could get such good food in MX. If you're young and into nightlife, we recommend the Blue Parrot. It's right on the beach, just a quick walk to the right of the resort. Swings around the bar, dance music until 5:30am, we were there every night! If you like salsa dancing or just want to watch it, go to the Mambo Cafe. My last compliment must go to the staff at the GPR. Luis, Julio, Sergio. They all took such wonderful care of us. Every day, they'd check in and see how we were and every night, one of them were out on the town with us. They'd watch our purses while we danced, escort us around, show us the fun spots, teach us salsa dancing, etc. We can not say enough about how wonderful they were. Yes, there were 11 women and that may have drawn a little more male attention. However, they were never anything less than perfectly polite. The wait staff at the bars, beach and buffet are all wonderful. My only reason for not giving this resort a 5 rating as excellent is the over-booking problem. It is deceiving to overbook, just so you can fill the other rooms across the street. Everyone should get the room they booked upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but I expected more.”
Reviews.Author: laxford
Reviews.Content: My family recently returned from the Gran Porto Real. It is a beautiful resort, nicely laid out and always clean. The beach was wide and was generally clean, but the fisherman coming in with their catches were a bit of an eyesore as they gutted their fish right on the beach infront of the hotel. This beach was not ideal for swimming as I was told it is a dead Coral Reef and pretty rocky, although my daughters enjoyed boogy boarding on the days that it was rough. The beach was pretty busy, and I recommend that you get your towels the night before and put them out before you go for breakfast. We found the nicest place on the beach was North of the pool by the Breaksurf. It was quieter, and the breaksurf made for better swimming. I had heard a lot about the problems with overbooking at this resort, and even though I called my travel agent the day before to confirm that we were booked we were bumped across the street to the Royal Porto Real. This is supposed to be the higher class hotel but it is under construction from 7am-7pm and all the services are located across the street at the Gran Porto Real. My teenage daughters could not handle the early morning wake up call they received when the construction started and the smells from the paint were enough to make you faint. Luckily we were moved across the street the next night, and even though the rooms weren't as nice (the Rooms in the Royal Porto Real have jacuzzi tubs) we were much happier. The food at this resort was really dissappointing for a five star resort. The menu at the Mexican restaurant seemed a little Americanized and at the Italian restaurant we had undercooked pasta, and raw scampy. Although the flambe coffee they make is pretty impressive and tastey too. The buffet was even more dissapointing. Breakfast is the best meal of the day but they offered some strange choices as breakfast food (ie, Refried Beans.) The "24 Hour Club" only ever really had some pretty sad looking fruit and possibly a choice of some fried meat left over from lunch. The snack bar by the pool was repetitive and all the food had an unidentifiably after taste. Room Service was good sometimes but not consistent. The french Fries, I am informed by my daughters, are much better in room service than they are at the beach. Overall the staff at the Gran Port Real were excellent. We left a tip for our housekeeping and they left swans made out of towels covered in rose petals on our bed everyday. The waiter service on the beach was amazing. The employees work so hard to make sure you enjoy your stay you really don't mind tipping them, and I know they appreciate it because they make so little. The only bad thing I can say about the staff is that a few of them were a little too friendly to our daughters (ages 16 and 18). At one point they were afraid to leave their room for fear of running into this one employee that hounded them. They were there to relax and didn't enjoy getting hit on everytime they came down to the beach. I would definitely recommend the bicycle tour the hotel offers. You really see more of the surrounding area than you could see any other way and they even have police stopping traffic for you. Some of the sites included mayan ruins located near playa del carmen and a cenote. We enjoyed our stay but were not thoroughly impressed so we think in the future if we return to the Tiviera Maya we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Was terrified”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Grand staying the Originally we had booked the Gran Porto sister hotel, the Royal Porto which was to be completed in October of 2004 and we were disapponted to find out that it would not be completed for our January stay. We were offered the Grand as a second choice. At this point it was too late to book another five star hotel and we have had several bad experiences with less than five star hotels. In fact we have been told that we are far too critical and act like spoiled princesses. After reading earlier reviews we were convinced that we would have a terrible time, but having no alternatives other than to stay home we we decided to go. So here is a short description of our week's stay.... First off, LOCATION, LOCATION...LOCATION. The Grand is located minutes away from fifth avenue and is located on a beautiful beach which rivals even the best beaches of Cuba and the Virgin Islands. Unlike many other resorts in the Mayan Rivera, you have many options to fill your day as the resort is located right in Playa Del Carmen. You can choose to soak up the sun by the pool or lie on the beach or take a short walk within town. The ferry to cozumel is a walk or five minute taxi ride and you can find wonderful shopping on fifth avenue. Rooms/Facilities We had a Junior suite (most of the resort is junior suites with a few standard rooms) and if we wanted we could have fit six people in our large shower. The room was large and spotless. The furniture is a little dated but fits the decor. I have stayed at five star resorts that are a little nicer and at five star resorts that are not as nice as the Grand. Do not have any reservations about the room. The mini bar was stocked daily without fail and if you required extra water, pop or beer, it was no problem. The pool was a reasonable size, very clean, a little cool but wonderful to sit beside. The resort is quite well laid out, quite compact, unlike many resorts where you walk for ten minutes to get anywhere. You leave your room, walk to the pool in less than a minute. The pool blends into the beautiful beach. Food I would rate this resort a ****1/2 star in most respects except for the food. As the resort is a little smaller (around 200 rooms), there are only two ala carte restaurants and one main buffet. They set up a lunch buffet on the beach. The Italian restuarant is very good, somewhat limited menu, but we enjoyed each dinner we ordered. The staff was wonderful in all restaurants, especially Joel and Maximo. A small tip is appreciated but not required (come on, you are on holidays spread the joy). The Mexican restaurant has a different menu each night and unfortunately one night, we did not want any of the selections. But every other night the food was good. The buffet is a little limited but we were able to find something good to eat on every visit. The breakfast offered omelets, fried eggs, waffles and many other choices. Overall food would be 3 out of 5 stars. Staff In our seven day all inclusive stay, we never had a bad experience with the staff of the Grand. Everyone went out of thier way to ensure our stay was wonderful. From check in to check out we were treated as pampered guests. No line ups or waits for the bars or restaurants. Beach service was attentive and again a small tip every once in a while went a long way. In our opinion, this resort is a true four 1/2 star allowing some latitude for the food. I would not hesitate to recommend this resort and would return again. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Time”
Reviews.Author: PattyLaDuke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from one week at the Gran Porto Real and had a wonderful time. I too read all the reviews prior to and after booking and held my breath hoping all would go well and it did. We arrived on a Friday 1/21/05 and were there by noon and our room was ready! We booked an ocean front junior suite and got it. We never saw or overheard anyone who was bumped (not that it may not have happened). There were some people who were placed in the new hotel and weren't too happy as you have to cross the street to get to the beach, resturnats, etc. The staff was very accomidating. The food was very good for buffet. We never ate at the mex or italian rest as you needed to make resevations at least a day ahead of time and that was too structured for us. We ate in town a couple of times and suggest it even for the AI plans. Each day the buffet was different. I would suggest that they hire a chef that knows something about deserts. Only so many ways to fix custard. I wanted cheescake and chocolate!. The beaches are beautiful. You can walk into town and walk to the ferry dock via the beach if you like. This is our third time in the area and in the past stayed at the Eldorado Royale up the road a few miles (twice). In many ways this resort is much nicier. The staff is more attentive, the food much better, the beach and entertainment better also. The only draw back is the size of the hotel in comparison to the amount of beach frontage. I was used to a very spread out resort in the past and this is a little more crowded. You do have to get up at the crack of dawn to reserve your spot on the beach, at the pool or in the shade. If you like to shop, this is the resort for you. Every day we walked into town to shop or to have a drink, eat or just for a stroll. There are great resturants and wonderful shop keepers. We will definately be back next year. Please feel free to email me if you have any questions. proan@progressiveland.com Patty

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Spot!”
Reviews.Author: ZuZu_Goldie
Reviews.Content: We just spent two lovely weeks over Christmas and New Year's at the GPR. I agree that they had problems with over-booking, but I had called the hotel directly and confirmed our reservation, and we had a lovely junior suite overlooking the ocean as requested. The ambience of this small hotel, the entire staff, and the pool area are all terrific. I loved the fact that there is a bustling little street called 5th. Avenue just two blocks away. You could stroll there anytime of the day or evening and it was great people-watching and very safe.
