Being an all-inclusive, you can get tired of the food, but asking for anything in the restaurant is not a problem and they try to please. Being a vegetarian here wasn't that easy, but Edwin the Bar and Restaurant Manager was a doll and prepared whatever I requested. I think sometimes people forget their manners when they leave home, but everyone responds to a smile and kind words. There are Spanish lessons, bike riding, water aerobics, and lots of other activities if you wanted to partake, but if not, relaxing at the ocean or by the pool was perfect too. All in all, a great hotel and we are planning to return next Christmas!

Reviews.Title: “The true story !!!”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Sweden
Reviews.Content: Went to GPA between 11:th and 18:th of Januari. Sorry if my spelling isnt correct - im from Sweden. Before we went to GPA we read alot of these comments obout GPA.Our expectations is and are very high. Thanks all of you, it was a great help ! (good or bad). Ive looked att approx 25-30 hotels in the area, and we decided at last for GPA. Why ? Its close to 5:th av, great poolarea, right next to the beach, great hotelrooms, beatuiful sorroundings, kidsprogram etc. But we were worried obout the overbooking problems we have read obout. We chosed "all-inclusive", seawiew, and requested third floor when we booked. I think that is going to help you. We didnt get 3rd floor. we had to wait one night. Then all was ok. The food (buffe) is great , alot to choose from. The italian restaurant is great. We didnt try the Mexican restaurant - heard that some people got sick after visiting there. The beach could be better.. a lot of fishing boats in the way - but i you walk 1-2 minutes to the east of the hotel, the beach is great there, and yes they serve drinks from the hotel even there. The staff are very helpful and serviceminded - exept in one place - the front desk. They are ignorant, say one thing and do another - sometimes they do nothing.. Our lights in the bathroom broke, took them 4 calls and one visit at the front deskt to get it fixed!!. Otherwise everything else was great. Pool is great,food,drinks,clean room,great service in restaurants,water sports, entertainment in evenings, lots for the kids etc etc. We would love to get back , no doubt obout it !! If you are a couple who wants more privacy, just laying oround reading boks and so - pick another hotel - this is for families. Try the Shangri-La. I would rate the GPA as an 4 star hotel. Tim from Sweden !

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast,, going back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although not what we had expected at the start, this trip was great. Aug 2004. Planning on going back in March 2005. Staff was the best, Palo restaurant outstanding. Pool unbelievable. Disapointing was the small beachfront, and the internet pictures depicting ammenaties that are no longer there due to construction of a new hotel next door. All in all this was a great all inclusive resort, and Playa Del Carmen is one of the best places in the world that we have visited. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: maejean
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you want the "Ritz" then go there. We have stayed at the Ritz and Four Seasons and if you want glamour go there. This was our third trip to the Gran Porto Real in a year and a half. We have never been to the same destination more than once. We love the hotel and the area. We love the quantness and simplicity. We flew into Cancun each time, our transfers were prompt each time. This was the only time we have had to wait on a room and it was less than an hour. Each time we stayed in the Ocean front jr. suite, which is worth the difference in price. The first time we booked there we reserved a "standard room" which IS in the back. We quickly changed rooms. Spring for the OF or OV jr. suites. Rooms#249,349,251,351,253,353,255,355, some of the second floor OF rooms have palm tree obstruction. We have stayed 5 nites each time and the food was very adequate. I can see that if you stayed much longer it could get repeticious. Some guests don't realize that there is an Italian rest. in the hotel also. Be sure to eat there, it is our favorite. Make your reservations with "Elsey" the conceigne. Since our first visit they have improved the beach in front of the hotel. Yes, they are building an addition (actually a whole new hotel) and yes, if you stay on the construction side it would be noisy. We loved the fact that the ferry to Cozumel is a short walk and only $9 US. It leaves every hour on the hour and is a great trip, takes about 25 mins. sailing time and docks right in town. You can shop there and go to the national park to snorkle(take a taxi or rent a scooter), again about a $10 entrance fee to the park. The town of Playa Del Carmen is only two blocks from the hotel. This is a cobblestone/brick street which is blocked off to traffic and has shop after shop and restaurant after restaurant (if you get tired of the hotel food). We walked there every nite. On our previous trips we rented a car and drove to Cancun where you can go to the "sister" hotel and eat if you like. Wouldn't want to stay there, too congested. We have also been to Xcaret and Xel Ha. Xel Ha is our favorite. It is a natural water park and is beautiful and very clean. Great for tubing and snorkeling. My husband says it's the best snorkeling he has seen and we have been to the Carribbean, Hawaii, Bermuda and the Mediteranian. The price there was $29, basic (which is what we did, ask one of the restaurant staff to fix you box lunches) or $56 for all inclusive. It's a short drive, 35 mins., straight shot. We rented a car in town, American car rental, which was a short walk from the hotel. The last time we rented from Thrifty, again a few blocks. The hotel staff was very nice we had several favorites, Manuel and Fernando in the dining rooms. The hotel manager, Nicolas was great. As you can see we have enjoyed all our visits to the Gran Porto Real and look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely vacation”
Reviews.Author: Num1gm
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that we just returned from our second trip to the GPR in PDC, and the second was almost as good as the first time! The hotel is beautiful, and the beach is peaceful. My only complaint is that the food got a bit monotonous. It would be delightful if the Il Pescatore Italian restaurant would vary it's menu some. It is our favorite restaurant for dinner there, and we love the staff, but the menu got really boring real fast! I just have to say that the staff at GPR is probably the nicest bunch of people I have ever met. They just can't do enough for you while you are a guest there! EVERYBODY we came in contact with seemed like a personal friend. And even today when we were about to leave, one of our waitstaff members hugged us and said he felt like we are family. How perfectly delightful! And we will certainly return there just because of the wonderful people we met there. Thanks especially to Manual and Fernando. What a wonderful trip again!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Brochures can be very deceiving. This hotel gave an appearance of a 5 star hotel, but in reality it is a Club Med in disguise and if you dont like Club Meds, dont stay here. When we arrived the first thing we were asked was do we want to upgrade to all-inclusive which we declined as we love trying different restaurants rather than be stuck in the same place all the holiday. Well little did we know that 99% of the guest were all-inclusive and never left the grounds. With free drinks and food all day there was never room to sit at the pool, beach or even in the hotel and we ended up only using the hotel to sleep in. Wearing wrist bands all the time, like branded cattle, was another irritating factor. Rooms ( we stayed in a junior suite ocean view) were spacious but tired. This really was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in and we have travelled extensively. If we hadnt prepaid we would have immediately left and stayed at the Blue Parrot, which is small and beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again anytime!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel twice in 2004. Once in May (with friends) and again in Sept (for our anniversary). Both times were wonderful. Great location and friendly waitstaff. Food is okay...gets a little repetitive. The front desk is somewhat unorganized...the first time we came they didn't have our rooms ready until the next day. However, all and all they were both VERY pleasant trips. My advice: pay the extra money for a Jr. Suite...the regular room are MUCH smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Good for both all inclusives and non all inclusives”
Reviews.Author: VoyagingAlways
Reviews.Content: For our stay Jan 1-12, overall a great experience at Gran Porto Real. We (two families) arrived on Saturday, January 1 & were placed in the new property under construction across the street. Very beautiful & quiet on Saturday and Sunday. On Monday, the construction noise started at 7:00 a.m. and lasted until well after dark. We asked to be moved to the main building and were accommodated without problem, but it was a hassle to move--really took an entire day of our trip moving 2 families. Advice: make sure you are in the main building where the reception is. One of our families (with children) chose the all inclusive plan (they had never travelled to Mexico before) and we chose the room only plan (because we had visited Playa del Carmen a number of times before). This worked for us both. The all inclusive family joined us at a few of our favorite spots on occasion (Media Luna, La Siesta, Hemingways, Byblos) to break the monotony. Those who complain about the repetitive food at an all inclusive should venture out & try some excellent local restaurants! Staff at GPR was great, very attuned to service. Very nice, accommodating to any of our requests. A small tip here and there goes a long, long way. Enjoyed the activities around the pool. Would I stay there again? Probably not, but only because we prefer the smaller hotels in town and do not like all inclusives. The GPR was an excellent alternative for our two families with two different needs/desires since it was an all inclusive but also close enough to take advantage of the great restaurants in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Gran Porto Real for our honeymoon in December. I have to admit that I was fairly nervous about it from all of the reviews that I have read. I would also have to admit that I'm not sure what these people had to gripe about. We found the hotel staff very accomodating and helpful. The room was fabulous and the food was what we had expected. The first night we were there we were placed in the beautiful master suite which was a very nice surprise. The other 3 nights that we stayed we were in the Jr. oceanview suite. We were extremely pleased with every aspect of the trip. I would definitely recommend the Gran Porto to my friends and family! :)

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week in Playa del Carmen and we had a great time. I was very worried because of the earlier reviews but we did not experience any problems going through MLT Worryfree Vacations. I wouldn't recommend the Jeep tour but otherwise everything else was fun. We asked for a different room and did not have any problems. It is rather hard to make dinner reservations if you go on tours because the lady only works 8-5pm but we left her notes and she always gave us what we requested. Love being close enough to walk to 5th avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Are We Talking the Same Hotel???”
Reviews.Author: Tutman
Reviews.Content: January 8, 2005 Just returned about an hour ago from a week at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen. After reading some of the negative reviews, I wonder if I was staying at the same hotel. Never had a problem. Checked in by a freindly and helpful attendant. My room was ready right away. Found the hotel to be in good order...very clean and well maintained. Staff was extremely friendly, and just couldn't do enought for you. I found the food to be better than cruise ship quality, especially at the Mexican restaurant. Now, I did hear that there were some who ended up at the unfinished hotel accross the street. Sure, they were supposed to be finished in Oct. 2004, and yes, they overbooked. It caused some crowding at the Real pool and beach area. But hey, buyer beware. Don't ever expect anything to be finished on time, especially in Mexico. Sorry you got bumped, but you should know better than to book a hotel that wasn't finished. I give the REAL two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MHB01
Reviews.Content: Originally, we had booked the Royal Porto Real, however it was not finished and we were put at the Gran Porto Real. I was extremely reluctant, after reading all the reviews. However, since I take the time to read reviews, I felt I should take the time to write one. We were at the Gran Porto Real from Dec 20 2004 - Jan 3 2005 (2 weeks). Other than the food, we had a very good experience. We were two families travelling with 4 kids aged 9-13. First room we were given was terrific. Although I had a view of the construction of the new hotel, I also had a magnificent view of the ocean. The construction never bothered me. Room was very spacious. We found the staff to be extremely courteous, polite and helpful. Then again, if you're nice to them then they will be nice back. We never had a rude person. They couldn't do enough for us. The entertainment staff was also terrific. They helped to keep my kids entertained because there wasn't that much for the kids to do there. Beach was nice. I am more of a pool person so we hung around the pool all day. And yes, it is true, you need to be down extremely early to get a pool chair. Breakfast was fine because there was enough variety. Lunch, I didn't really have but it seemed the same daily. Dinners were repetitive. We were there for two weeks and ate at the Italian restaurant about 5 times and the Mexican two times. Food became very tiring and boring. Not enough variety for the kids. I never minded wearing a wristband. I actually liked the fact that security was always around checking for people not wearing the bands. It made me feel safer. 5th Avenue was a block away and I loved strolling down there many a night. It was great not having to take cabs anywhere because everything was at your fingertips. I like to try different places so I would probably not return here. But don't be fooled by all the bad reviews. Be nice and they will be nice back.

Reviews.Title: “BeWare It's only your Time and Money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Jan 5th, 2005 What can I say, we should have expected this type of treatment from this Hotel, shame on us. We are just stupid, can’t happen to us, trusting Americans, shame on us. You would think after reading this type of hotel review more than three times I would have saved myself some frustration and just found another Beautiful Five? Star Hotel in Mexico. Just as many other writers had warned, we arrived only to find out that the reservation we had made six months earlier was not available due to an over booking situation…go figure.They continued to explain that it was just a rare situation, and they don’t know why it happened. They immediately pulled us aside to talk with the concierge who tries to talk you into taking one of their other hotels 45 miles up the road in Cancun until they can get a room available, which we did not agree to. You know the routine if you have read any of the other hotel reviews at this web site. Due to no other reasonable option we agreed to relocating for the night to The Reef on Coco Beach about a half a mile down the beach. Not a bad alternative considering you really don’t have a hotel to stay in since the one you made reservations at is not letting you stay. While we were walking out of the hotel, there was another family just finding out that they too were without a hotel room at the Porto Real. The front desk arranged a hotel van take us to the Reef hotel and handed us a card with the Porto Real phone number on it, and told us to call them in the morning and they would come back over to pick us up. The next day when we called to request their van to pick us up, they told me they were too busy for the van and that we should get a taxi…oh did I mention that there we six of us plus luggage? Oh what the heck get two taxi’s, you’re on vacation. We finally get to the Porto Real hotel and of course our Ocean View Jr Suite room we that we had a confirmed reservation for was not available, but they did have a standard room that would be ready around 3 pm. Nice, they’re really nice people I’m telling you! And it appears they can do this with a straight face, day after day, week after week. I travel a lot in the US, and occasionally I have encountered this situation with US hotels, they normally call another local hotel to get you a room at no charge, find transportation if you need it, and refund you the cost of their room (you stay free for there mistake). Under normal circumstances I would accept this and move on, but knowing this was potentially going to happen at the Porto Real before you get to Playa del Carmen and then watching it unfold really can turn your stay into an unpleasant trip. It also makes you distrust others that you come in contact with due to their lack of professionalism and honesty. On the positive side, the employees are very nice people and really strive to make your stay enjoyable. If the blatant, reoccurring overbooking situation hadn’t occurred, I would have had a much different view of this hotel. Next time we travel to Playa del Carmen, I would make reservations at another hotel if you want to make sure you have a room during your stay. It really doesn’t matter how nice a place is if you can’t depend on a good reservation from honest individuals when you are traveling long distances to another country. Don't make my mistake!

Reviews.Title: “Denied our confirmed stay at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: travelrep
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival for our anniversary stay, we and many others were denied our reservation. The Sales Mgr. advised they had booked a convention over our reservations to make more money. We were told we would have to stay elsewhere but could use the AllInclusive amenities, However, The overage of people (about 200) made it impossible to use the amenities as promised! restaurants were overbooked, the buffets were empty, people were fighting over beach chairs, there was not enough staff to cover and pools were dirty. We were very dissappointed and had to cancel many plans as we were out of pocket most meals and local transportaion to get about. It truly ruined our anniversary vacation. We caution anyone that books this hotel. Even though they tell you you reservation is guaranteed.,,, it may not be! We will return to Playa del Carmen and recommend the Hacienda Vista Real, in Playacar. A 15min. walk to town, and around the corner from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS VACATION”
Reviews.Author: stryderdog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week at the GPR all-inclusive plan last April for our 10-yr anniversary. We were bumped the first night, which we expected because we arrived at 10 pm. We were quickly escorted to the Gala and treated like royalty. The Gala was nice but very BIG. We were picked up the next morning by GPR as agreed. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to VIP bracelets and our standard room was upgraded to a king deluxe suite. We ate in all of the restaurants. The buffet was best for breakfast or lunch. We loved Maria Margarita's for dinner-ate there 4 nights. We ate one night in the italian restaurant and were suprised with a cake for dessert. In all of the restarants, my wine glass was never empty. A few extra pesos go a long way with the staff. The staff treated us very well and constantly asked how our vacation was etc. We were often wished Happy Anniversary. We enjoyed the beach toward the pier the most. Less people, sea breeze and our own bar. Drinks on the beach were well chilled and checked often. We were very sad to be going home. We found a little piece of heaven at the GPR and are looking forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “It really wasn't that bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GPR Dec 17 - Dec 23/2004. Before we left, I read many reviews and I was very, very nervous. It really wasn't that bad - go with an open mind!!! Hotel: My biggest fear was being bumped out of the hotel because of overbooking. About 2 weeks before we left, I called the hotel directly and spoke to the front desk manager and explained my concerns. He reassured me that I wouldn't be bumped and left a note on their computer system not to move us. Nevertheless, we had NO problem when we checked in. We booked a standard room and were perhaps going to upgrade to a junior suite once we checked the room first. We were originally told that the standard rooms only had 2 double beds but we asked if there were any king beds in standard rooms and of course, there were 2 rooms available. We ended up keeping our standard room with the king bed but I would definitly recommend the ocean view junior suite (we went to have a look in one when the maids were cleaning and they looked absolutely beautiful!!!) The problem we encountered with our room was the noise from the "so-called quiet" pool and all the noise with the construction from the new hotel. The noise was my only complaint with the hotel. Food: The food was just fine and the drinks were good. We enjoyed Il Pascatore (Italian) most. We didn't even try the Mexican restaurant because we didn't like the menu. The buffet was also fine. We enjoyed it more for breakfast. We mostly had lunch on the beach (burgers, hot dogs, nachos, chicken etc.) I was really impressed with the beautiful grounds and the constant upkeep and cleanliness - the hotel is very pretty!! I was also very impressed the the pleasant and very friendly employees. Beach/Pool: The beach was beautiful and the weather was perfect. I cannot comment too much on the pool because we only used it for about an hour (we are beach lovers!!!) It looked busy and noisy. Chairs are pretty much reserved by 8 am - you have to get there early if you want a chair. All in all, we had a great time at the GPR. The absolute best thing about the hotel is the amazing location. We loved strolling up and down 5th avenue in the evening. It was very romantic!!!!! I don't think I would return only because I would love to try the many other beautiful resorts in the Mayan. I would recommend it though. Don't listen to the bad reviews - go with an open mind. If you want a luxiourious hotel, this is not for you. It's a "middle of the road" resort. The only suggestion is to call ahead and confirm your reservation because this hotel is quite famous for overbooking. You can email any questions or concerns: lsiklis@hotmail.com Enjoy!!!!!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location -- lots of shops, restaurants nearby, and a new ferry service to Cozumel right outside the hotel. Common areas are very beautiful. Our room (junior suite) was spacious, but a bit run down. Makes a nice first impression, but when you start to look around you see some shabbiness -- cracked and stained fixutres in bath, pathced walls, etc. There is a safe in the room, but you have to ask for a lock at the front desk and they don't have enough for all rooms. We had to go on a waiting list to lock our valuables. You must wear a wristband, even if you are not on the all-inclusive plan. Security guards won't let you enter the hotel w/o a wristband. Ours were put on fairly loosely, and we figured out how to slip our hands out of them (using a lot of hand lotion) when we went out, and put them back on before returning. This got easier toward the end of the week as the wristband started to stretch a bit. Pool area is nice, but not enough chairs in the shade. Everyone goes down early and puts towels on chairs to "reserve" them. You don't have a chance of getting a chair if you don't do this too. There is also a second "quiet" pool on the top floor. Very hard to find. Shady and quiet, with a swim-up bar. If you like a lot of activity around the pool, this probably isn't for you, but if you just want a quiet place to sit and read its quite nice. Very shallow, calm water near the beach -- excellent for poor swimmers and children. If you like a lot of wave action, you're going to have to venture pretty far out. Forget about the hotel restaurants. They try to make them exclusive by requiring reservations 24 hours in advance, but there are LOTS of great restaurants with better food within a few blocks. Hotel staff will try to encourage you to get the all-inclusive plan when you check in, and you kind of get ignored by waiters and bartenders if you don't have it, but we just didn't find the price worth it. Overall experience: good, not great. If you get a good rate, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “We've been to Cancun & the Playa area 9 times & this is the worst hotel - PERIOD!”
Reviews.Author: Akern
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have been going to Cancun & the Playa area frequently since 1992. The Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa in Playa del Carman is the WORST hotel we have ever stayed at in our lives, & I'm not exagerating. We were charged for dinners we never had, our room was pathetic even after paying for deluxe accomodations, the staff was appaulingly rude, pretending they didn't understand English. After 2 days of wasting our very precious vacation time, we made our own accomodations back up in Cancun. My husband spoke to a couple from Sweden who too were dismayed at how awful their room was and they too were in the process of cutting their vacation short as they were having an awful time at the Gran Porto Real in Playa. Our first trip to Playa was in 1992-my college graduation present. Stay at the Blue Parrot or the Continental Plaza Playacar. While both are not deluxe, they have wonderful charm and retain that gentle Mexican hospitality with an unassuming understatement.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from This One & Funjet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 5 days: No Toilet in the room No Air Conditioning in the room No attempt to take care of problems Paid for suite - got a King bed and a rollaway Paid for room with jazcuzzi - got shower Funjet would not move us Funjet would not fly us home Funjet would not refund our money We are suing Funjet

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 1 week vacation here in early December. We decided to stay here as it was one of the only nice hotels in PDC on the beach and close to 5th. I was quite hesitant to book at this hotel after reading some of the reviews but we enjoyed our stay and we would recommend this hotel. We brought our 10 month old infant and so we chose to eat from the buffet at the main restaurant for all of our meals. The food was relatively good and the service was excellent. There was a hot grill where you could order pancakes/eggs/omeletes etc for breakfast or quesadillas/etc for dinner. The waiters were all very friendly. Some of the waiters gave us flowers that they had created from coconut leaves. My only suggestion to improve the hotel would be to change the lunch and dinner buffet options more frequently as they tend to be a little repetitive. Unfortunately, we didn't get an opportunity to try the other restaurants in the hotel. We booked a Junior Suite - Ocean View. Our original room that we were assigned was on the street (construction) side of the hotel and it was close enough to the beach that we had a decent view of the ocean. The hotel next door is almost finished and there was no construction noise or disruptions. That hotel is for overbooked guests until they completely finish it. We decided, nonetheless, to ask for a room change. We provided the front desk the next morning with the room numbers of a room that we that we wanted and we were able to get one of them. Our 2nd floor room was large, clean and it had an excellent view of the beach. The maids were very friendly and they cleaned our room every day. They made cute designs from some extra towels that we had for our child. The likelihood of getting a room with a full ocean view diminishes the later in the day you check in. If you arrive in the evening you may end up at the hotel next door for the night. You can always move rooms if you don't like the one you're assigned. The beach was large and excellent for swimming. There are some boats next to the edge of the hotel that you can charter to go fishing. They do not affect swimming. There were always quite a few people swimming in the ocean. Guests reserve the beach chairs early in the morning by putting their hotel beach blanket on it. The pool has an activity hut that plays music. The pool staff coordinate activities like valleyball, aerobics etc for a good part of the late morning/afternoon. We really liked the hotel and we'll definitely stay there again if we decide to return to PDC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location in quaint Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you have already booked this hotel, don't worry you will have a great time. Yes there may be a few kinks but go with the flow... you are on vacation!!! I drove myself crazy reading all the reveiws of Gran Porto. So I guess it is now my duty to give an honest (and brief) review. Gran Porto is in the perfect location of Playa Del Carmen. It is not a huge hotel in comparison to the monstrous resorts , but it is the biggest of the hotels right off of 5th Avenue the "Main Street" (for tourists) in Playa. 5th avenue has lots of great bars and restauraunts of various sizes and styles with live music. There are also a lot of shops, if you feel like you are being hassled by vendors, just say "No Gracias" and keep walking. The Beach is beautiful without question. The fishing boats that dock to right of the hotel are quaint and clean. They float in crystal blue water and leave PLENTY of room for swimming. The hotel is also in a great spot for activities like Xcaret ecological park, Cozumel (the ferry is a short walk from the hotel), Tulum ruins, and Xel-Ha (cave snorkeling). If you are up for the 2.5 hour trip, go to Chichen-Itza ruins with the Mayan and Aztec Pyramids. They are amazing and worth the time. Don't just park yourself on a lounge chair, get out and experience Mexico. I suggest renting a car instead of doing a tour so you can be on your own schedule. For me I do not like huge resorts so the size was perfect, but of course this does lead to problem of overbooking. The hotel does need to monitor the problem of guests reserving lounge chairs and leaving for hours. If you have to go to the hotel across the street, it is still under construction but I was told rooms are very nice with big Jacuzzis. Make sure to ask for a third floor room that FACES OUTWARD. Skip the Mexican restaurant at the hotel and go to a Mexican restaurant on 5th Ave. I went with my best friend and the hotel is not really for singles looking for a non-stop party, but you can still have a lot of fun! the entertainment staff will take anyone who is up for it out on the town in Playa or Cancun (only 40 minutes away). I went to Coco Bongo in Cancun and Mambo Cafe in Playa and had a great time with some really friendly, outgoing people. Unfortunately missed the famous Blue Parrot bar. If you go, say HI to Ruben, Tavo, Luis and the ladies of the activities crew, they work very hard to make sure everyone has a good time!!!! I don't know where they get the energy. :-) I know how hard it is to pick a hotel. If you have any questions, or want more details please e-mail me! O.K. I guess this was not that brief

Reviews.Title: “Family Vaction 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Gran Porto Real from Dec. 11 to the 18 for x-mas and had a great time. We paid around $1600 and flow Westjet. The plane ride was great, a lot of room. on the flight home we all had our own tv's to watch local news. The food was great, a lot to choose from and no one got sick. The waiters are supper friendly and always have a smile. They work approx. 10 hours a day for 5 US dollars. I don't know anyone would would go to work with a smile for that but they do day after day. The rooms are standard but cleaned every day. They give you 2 bottled beer with each room cleaning. Good to drink before breakfast. The beach is small and has a number of boats infront but come March they are adding another 300 rooms and will be taken over a larger piece of the beach which is really nice. They have 2 resturants one Italian and the other Mexician and if you plan your day in the morning you can dine at one of these resturants each night. When you leave you will be soooo full you'll need a nap. Lasty, the entertainment staff were all young under the age of 28 and speach good english, make friends with these people and they will help you find good deals on bars and places to shop. PS: This is not a party place for people under 30, go to Cancun...

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week stay at the GPR and we would go back in a heart beat. We requested an upper floor ocean view room, and got the upper floor, but we could only see the ocean if we looked out the bathroom window! Found out the reason they overbook this hotel is they are trying to fill up their other less popular hotels. Had several offers to stay for last 2 nights at one of their resorts in Cancun. We went and looked at it one day, and it didn't compare to this one, so we declined. We would have liked a junior suite, but didn't want to pay the extra price. Our regular room was a little small but manageable. Our only real complaint about the room was its proximity to the so called "sports bar". It was not that at all. It was actually their venue for nightly entertainment, and because it was open air, the noise was quite loud in our room. We go to bed early, but the noise was so loud until 10 pm every night, it was impossible to go to bed before then. We never checked out the actual entertainment, so can't comment on that, but it sure was loud! We thought the resort itself was beautiful. Lots of palm trees, and palapas on the beach. Yes you did have to get up early and put towels on the chairs to claim a good spot, but we got in the habit of doing this every day and it wasn't a problem. We preferred the area to the extreme left, by the beach bar. The waiters there were awesome and really appreciated the tips we gave them. We enjoyed all our meals at both the specialty restaurants and the buffet. Our only complaint about the buffet was they only had one 4 slice toaster, and there was quite a line up every morning if you wanted to make your own toast. On our last day, they had an industrial rotating one, so that problem has been solved. We were able to eat in both specialty restaurants several times, as there was no limit. You just had to make your reservations the day before. The service and presentation of the food in both of them was spectacular. We only had one slow waiter the whole time and I think it was because he was new. We liked the proximity to 5th avenue and walked there several times to the internet cafe and shops. The only thing that will spoil this hotel in the future is the new pier they have built. It will apparently be used as a tender spot for cruise ships as well as a sailing point for the ferry to Cozumel. It will bring so many more people to the area it will spoil it. We liked the relax pool on the 3rd floor, and the waiter there Philipe was awesome! It only gets sun in the morning though, so there weren't too many people there later in the day. They don't have a problem if you bring your sports mugs - they will fill them with whatever you want! We enjoyed sitting in the bar over the main pool every evening after dinner to have a drink. We also really enjoyed eating some of our meals in the garden outside the buffet restaurant - a nice little touch. We only had a few dealings with the front desk and I must say they weren't too eager to help. I did see lots of people upset about the overbooking thing, and wanting better rooms. The staff there seemed uninterested in helping them though. The VIP room is a little plus if you want a drink or snack in the middle of the night, as it's self serve. There are a couple of pool tables in the hotel, but you have to pay 15 pesos for each game. We thought that was a little high, considering it's only a buck or so in Canada. Oh well, if that's all I have to complain about - not too bad!! We loved the place and if the new pier doesn't spoil it too much, will be going back next year. Feel free to ask me any questions.

Reviews.Title: “just checked out and it was fine”
Reviews.Author: davidgmg
Reviews.Content: i was so scared to arrive at the hotel at 2 pm and waited for the worst but my room was ready and it was a fine experience. The food wasn´t all that great but I got dinner reservations for both the mexican and the italian rest on my first try. The beach was wonderful , the drinks were fine, and you could not ask for a better location. I´m so confused by all the negativity. I heard people at the beach complaining that by NY standards this was not a five star hotel. Maybe peoples expectations are just too high to please them at all. It was my only experience with an AI and frankly i´WOULDnt probably do it again. I don´t want to get stuck at one location for every meal, but overall it was very good and non of the problems that others have encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Yes , it's all true !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel, I have to say that I agree with the majority of the things stated. My husband and I had gone Nov 29 to Dec 6, and although the weather was great, there were many things that had to be overlooked to have a good vacation. We had been told by several of the guests that they had been bumped to the other hotel across the street (which is under construction), and then moved a days later. Luckily that didn't happen to us. There were many families with children left unattended for hours at a time. The hotel also had many seniors who seemed quite unimpressed with all that was going on. The food in the main buffet restaurant was mostly Mexican Cuisine, with very little international choices. Breakfast was decent because of the Omelette and Waffle Stations but aside from that mostly Mexican Choices, even for breakfast. The "Sports Bar" is non existant all sports fans. there is no TVs showing and sports, there is no comfy chairs, it's barely a bar, let alone a sports bar. Entertainment at night is weak and amatuer. On the good side, the people are lovely, and polite. All parts of the hotel are clean, and the activities staff go non stop, and are very nice. Most people speak english .so not to worry there. Will not return, recommend Barcelo Maya, or Ibero Star over this hotel hands down Extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed December 4-11, 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant to go to the Gran Porto Real after reading some of the reviews regarding overbooking, etc. However, we were very relieved to have had no major problems on our recent trip. Upon arrival, we had booked two rooms with king-size beds. We were successful in obtaining one but settled for two queens in the other. They were in very close proximity to each other so that was nice. We loved the fact that we were directly across from the pool on the 3rd floor. The access to the spa, health club and Italian restaurant was a bonus! Fifth Avenue was within a quick walk and we visited there often. As for the wristbands, they didn't pose a problem for us. Security would check when arriving on premise but that was more reassuring than anything. We didn't have any problem with timeshare people as a simply "No, thank you" was sufficient. The same goes for vendors on 5th Avenue. Being a somewhat "picky" eater, the food was still good. We loved the Italian restaurant but didn't care much for the Mexican restaurant. The service and food was much better at the Italian restaurant. We used room service about 3-4 times during the week for lunch which we found better than the food on the beach. Eating it near the 3rd floor pool was a relaxing treat as it didn't have many visitors! Overall, we loved our vacation! The weather was gorgeous and the beach was picturesque. Tip: Put your towel on the beach chairs before going to breakfast...they fill up fast! Good thing our friends were early risers!!! :) Go there with an open-mind and experience what they have to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overbooked and told us to sleep on the Street!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed on November 22-29, 2004 and were told when we arrived at the hotel that they were overbooked and that we could stay at their near by resort which was supposed to be a 5 star resort (this resort really was a 3 star, off the ocean). We refused to stay at their 3 star resort and they told us that our options were to stay there or to sleep on the street. They would not help us whatsoever to find a hotel owned by another company. Keep in mind that this was our honeymoon. I had read that they are notorious for overbooking but thought that it wouldn't happen to us due to booking through a travel agent. There were at least five other couples there that were bumped around the same time of day. There were couples who had checked in a few days before us and kept returning to see if a room would open up, but the hotel kept telling them to come back tomorrow. Beware that this is a game to them to fill their other hotels. The well known travel company that we booked through may be pulling them from their list of hotels due to the multiple problems that travelers have had.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay, great location to 5th Ave”
Reviews.Author: rangeland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Gran Porto Nov 7th to Nov 14th. At check in ended up getting room across the street which is the new resort that is not finished. The room was very nice with a hugh jacuzzi. I asked at check in if ocean view junior suite available and she said all taken for the month. Our room was a smoking room, which was required by my husband, had king size bed. View from room was looking at main entrance of Gran Porto. Heard tour buses come and go. Food was O.K. We did all-inclusive which we would do again. Had breakfast sent over each morning which was very good. Each day by pool, every chair had green towel, with a hat or book, but no person. Maybe ten people in pool, we decided each morning people got their towel and "claimed" chair by pool or beach early each morning, then went and did other things, as you saw all these claimed chairs but no one there! The resort needs to monitor this and doesn't. Go to bar at north beach as it is best. Men, you will be happy to know quite a few females with out their bathing suit tops. My husband sure enjoyed checking out these topless women every day. He's been ready to go back. Over all,we enjoyed our stay and plan to go back. Only two blocks from 5th Ave which is great for shopping, bars, and restaurants. We did plenty tipping as we know they are trying to make a living like the rest of us. The service was good. The weather was great, only one morning we had showers that came and then cleared up that afternoon. Again, we were pleased with our stay at Gran Porto.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: moondance40
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at the Porta Real in Playa. The only bad thing is the overbooking. No one gets the room they want on the first day. Fortunatly we were told of this before we arrived and just rolled with it. The staff was amazing! The friendliest people I have ever met. All of our requests were met with smiling people. The food was outstanding and the rooms were fantastic. The shops on 5th were great! The beach was clean and the beach buffet was excellent. We loved the service we received by the wait staff on the beach. Great margaritas and other drinks. Naty, who organizes the games and other activities, is a wonderful person who makes everything fun. The evening shows were a extra special bonus. The costumes and the skill of the dancers were something to look forward to every evening. We had lots of fun on casino night also! Henon who works at marias is great. I highly recommend the mexican coffee after dinner. Our rooms were kept sparkling clean and the mini bar was always stocked. We will be returning with our children and grandchild next year. Can't wait. If you can go do it. You wont regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heart beat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's been 5 days since we left the Gran Porto Real and I wish I was still there. My boyfriend and I had a fabulous time at this resort. I was kind of nervous having read some of the reviews on this board. I was afraid of over-booking. But as soon as we arrived I realized I had nothing to fear. When checking in we simply asked (nicely, of course) if there were any KING bed, ocean front Jr. Suites available. They checked and promptly gave us room 356. It had an absolutely amazing view. Well worth the extra price. The staff is friendly and willing to help in any way. I am not kidding when I say that every single staff person we passed greeted us with an "Hola". We enjoyed talking with several staff members about life in Mexico and their jobs at the Gran Porto Real. We never had a problem getting reservations for the a-la-carte restaurants...even when we waited until after noon to book them. The Italian restaurant was our favorite. The room service menu is limited, but is a nice option to have later in the evening when craving a snack. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. Made to order omlettes, pancakes, waffles, fruit. If you didn't see what you want, ask and they will bring it to you. My boyfriend wanted bacon every morning. No problem. The beach was beautiful...especially to the north of the hotel. There were always pleanty of chairs. We loved sitting near the beach bar. Great view and great drinks just a few feet away. The location could not be any better!!! We walked to the other end of town at least once a day. It is such a charming town with lots of character. We never experienced time share sales people. However, in town lots of people tried to sell us excursions or day trips. Just say "no thanks" and be on your way. Easy enough. We saw a wedding while we were there. They had dinner set up on the beach and it looked very romantic. I have nothing negative to say about my stay here. I'm actually quite amazed that anyone would not enjoy their time at this property. My next visit I'd like to try their new resort next door. If it's not done I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OVERBOOKING NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Property is hightly overrated. 18 family members stayed at this location Nov 20-27, 2004. Rooms are not cleaned well, moldy smell. Food was barely edible, staff is rude to Americans. Property so overbooked inclusive pre-paid guests were turned away. Our oceanview deluxe suites were not available when we arrrived. Over charging on all rooms bills, inclusive did not include what was advertised. Broken equipment in the health club. Sports bar open very limited hours. Difficult to get reservations in the restaurants. Management unresponsive. Gift shop clerks use profanity at guests they think don't understand spanish. Never stay at this property!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Nan_Anne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overbooking rooms. Clients upon arrival are being asked to transfer to alternate hotels for one, two or more nights. The service provided is well below 5 star level. Staff Management are focusing on the over-booking situation and guest complaints instead of overseeing the quality of the service. There is constant disruption in the hotel reception area as staff and guests haggle over service. There is lack of good staff communication. In short the left hand often does not know what the right hand is doing. The situation is stressful for all. Restaurant reservations are difficult to make and buffet is poor quality.

Reviews.Title: “Horror Stories for GPR again-believe them!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am very amazed that GPR can even continue to double book their hotel and get away with it. Trust me when we say that the hotel will most definitely try to get you somewhere else----fast. We read the reviews here and thought that we had a trusted booking agency through American Express Travel, wrong. We were a party with 2 rooms and 4 kids and they moved us to another hotel and promised to get us back to GPR as soon as possible. Classic scam. We should have believed the reviews in here. Sure there are people that are staying here, but there were stacks of wristbands on the front desk for people that were being asked to move to other hotels. Playa Del Carmen remains a jewel in the Mexican Riviera and when the newly refurbished Continental Plaza opens on the other end of town under the Palace Hotels chain we will stay there. We are regular visitors to Playa and were taking our friends there for the first time. Shame on you GPR for allowing your double booking scam to continue.

Reviews.Title: “Not my type of Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the first week of November. The property is very pretty, looking at the pictures you'd think it was an upscale, classy place. Deceiving.. When we arrived to check in, there were huge lines and chaos... and loud hiphop music blaring from somewhere. Later we found out the music was coming from the pool area, which by the way can be heard from just about every room on the property since it was a smaller resort. After checking in, we were shocked that our room faced the parking lot. I was told garden view, and normally when you choose garden view, it is the lower floor rooms near the pool or garden areas with the view obstructed by foliage. When I asked about this, they said, no, their garden view is the back side of the hotel. Well there are a few little garden areas between the car parking strip I guess! The rooms, although spacious, seemed over the top in decor, a bit on the gaudy side. Kind of like a theme hotel in Vegas. They were decorated in busy faux finish, wall paper borders, different bright Mexican tiles, & bright painted multicolored furnishings. The a-la-carte restaraunts were booked the first night so we had to eat buffet which was pretty scary. The wait staff was not too friendly, unless of course, you leave good tips. There were live shows going on just outside the buffet restaraunt, so again, pretty noisy. Two of us got quite sick after eating here during our stay. Maybe it was all the flies that kept flying around, since it was sort-of and open air buffet. Not too smart. The pool area was very pretty, as well as the beach, but the music and the activities were so noisy. Oh and they only let you check out 1 towel at a time on your "personal" towel card, and if you lose yours, they charge you $30us. (for a worn out frayed towel?). I complained about this at the front desk and got attitude from them, stating that the towel service and cards are a privelidge, blah blah blah. I am just used to better service. It is not a lot to ask to be kind to your guests. I am not even a big complainer! And, this is not a cheap hotel by all means. There was a lobby- type bar with not so friendly wait staff and bartender. Guests were either dressed in their swim attire, or sparkling sequin gowns as if on a low budget cruise (hey this is Mexico!). Overall, this hotel is fine- if you like a noisy/busy compact resort, so-so service, and below average buffet food. It is a very clean and well kept up resort though. I also like the location. Just walking distance to many great shops and restaraunts. I just think the property was not set up quite right for what type of people they are trying to attract. It just didn't fit. Also, the spa is very nice, and has a menthol vapor steam room, sauna, jacuzzi and a cold plunge pool. Their new construction across the street looks like it will be more promising when finished. Oh- and when they overbook, you will probably get a room in the construction zone across the street. Although those rooms were beautiful and have private jacuzzis, and much more tasteful decor, it's still a construction zone.

Reviews.Title: “I should have gone to Hawaii....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews on Trip Advisor before allowing my travel agent to book my stay at the Gran Porto Real. Please do not develop any high expectations about this hotel or the surrounding area. The rooms are average, the towels like sandpaper and the hotel management staff indifferent. Overbooking is apparently rampant and created problems with my check-in. Second floor ocean views are blocked by Palm trees. The food was not very good. Although the local restaurants were a little better, dining out in a third world country made me appreciate my Hep-A and Hep-B vaccinations. I can't recommend another hotel as this was my first (and last) trip to Mexico. Final note: Just like in the US, you get what you pay for and in Mexico, a lot gets you very little. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OverBook.”
Reviews.Author: Patty789
Reviews.Content: Here is my expert advice! as some have previously stated. Book this hotel NON exclusive Junior suite ocean front, when they place you in a room you did not request (85% chance they will), you will have room to negotiate,ie. all inclusive, lobster dinner?, massages, excursions) Be nice people! Rudeness will get you no where. We chose the non exclusive because there are so many good restaurants in town. Alot has changed since I was there 6 years ago (like the prices ha!). In all of these reviews (except my single friend below) did anyONE ever mention these plastic bracelets we have to wear to "identify" us as resort guests. Well I can understand if we were all inclusive but we weren't . I think they put them on us so the time share vultures could identify us as well. Actually, we were never approached by any and probably cause we slipped our bracelets off and carried them in our pockets only to be bothered by the " resort commandos" positioned at every corner of the hotel, they use hi tech walkie talkies so don't think you are in the clear if you get by one of them. You couldn't get 10 feet near the resortt if you didn't have that bracelet. Incidentally, for you cheapos who think you can sneak someone in your room FORGET IT! (u know who u R) and especially for you single people who might meet mr. or ms wonderful for the night at least don't plan on bringing them back to this resort you will be required to pay oh and did I tell you they will get a bracelet. (a momento of your romantic encounter) Overall, for Happily Married couples as myself, this was a Beautiful hotel for a bargain price of $675 5 nights tax included nov 16-21st. Great location! Location, location! The bracelet thing is really not that big a deal. Keep your expectations at a minimum. Any questions pdelg5@aol.com. happy travels

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but beware of overbooking.........”
Reviews.Author: Jill010
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights ( November 13-19) in Playa del Carmen, Q. Roo, Mexico. We have been to PDC many many times before (7 times) and were really looking forward to staying in the Gran Porto Real (our first time there). Our group consisted of 3 families (6 adults and 6 small children). We chose this hotel, as it had the type of amenities we were looking for - cribs, refrigeration, pool,etc. When we arrived at the hotel, we were bumped for the first 2 nights (out of 5), due to serious overbooking. The problem was they are building an adjacent sister hotel with 200 rooms which were supposed to be completed, and only 57 of these rooms were done. This problem will be ongoing until the new hotel is finished. They placed us in a decent alternate resort (about 10 miles outside of PDC), and provided all the transportation, but it was quite a hassle, as traveling with small kids is not easy to begin with and we really did not want to switch hotels mid-trip. They also gave us a voucher for a future free 3 night stay, to be used within a year (but not valid during the high seasons). Despite this initial hassle, the portion of the trip spent at the Gran Porto Real was great. The hotel is beautiful and the service was very good. We had a couple of minor problems in the room, and they were attended to in a very prompt manner. We are extensive travellers and have no problem staying at this hotel again (once the new hotel is finished), but I wanted to send out a warning about this overbooking issue to anyone who is booked into this hotel over the next few months.

Reviews.Title: “stealing away your vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice place to stay, However within 15 minutes of being at the hotel my digital camera was taken, after a week there I also lost out of my room a watch a set of clothes and 140 pesos. In total just over one thousand dollars in merchandise and cash. There was probably more but these are just the items that we are sure of. I filled out reports on the camera and even offered a finders fee. I got tired of hearting lo siento! So if you stay at this resort keep anything of value tied to your person. DO NOT get taken by the freindly staff. I was also witness to three other complaints of stealing and items missing. Guests beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Mexico. The view was beautiful and so was the hotel. I was disappointed in the food. (not that I went there just to eat). After a couple days of buffet, I was ready for a change. That was the only down fall of our trip. I was a little disappointed in all the people trying to sell us time shares and day adventures. I was on vacation and I receive plenty of solicitation at home. I will keep this place in mind for another vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beach, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: neglegb
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Playa was great. The food at the Mexican and Italian Restaurants were very good. The breakfast was pretty good at the buffet too. It was convenient to have food on the beach so you can grab a snack on a whim. The beach on the other side of the pier is the best for swimming. The fishing boats are not a big deal but I wouldn't want to go swimming around them. The workers were always very nice, so nice that I have never been at a place where I have been treated this way. They have a smile on their face and seem to truely enjoy their jobs. Please tip them well. We did and it was well worth it. Very pleasant and polite. We took the ferry to Cozumel and unless you want to do some serious shopping I wouldn't recommend it. We only stayed in Cozumel for about an hour because we couldn't wait to get back to the beautiful hotel and lay on the beach. The beach chairs are very comfortable and there are many of them to choose from. The pool is great too. Lots of activities going on but you don't have to participate in them. They will try to get you to but we didn't. The volleyball sounded like fun but we didn't have time. A wonderful place to take a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed at in the South.”
Reviews.Author: afm00
Reviews.Content: The view from the room is amazing, the food excellent and the staff are happy, friendly, efficient and do everything possible to ensure their guests enjoy themselves. The hotel is beautiful - stone and columns and hand-painted walls and furniture. There are showeres only in the rooms but they are huge. Playa Del Carmen is a nice safe town to walk around in and lots of fun / night life / friendly local people, with good shopping. The only draw-back is the hotel does over-book - however the front desk was very help-full and accomodating. I believe if you treat people with respect you get it back. We were in our ocean view suite for the second night and received lobster, champagne and 2 massages as compensation (a good deal we thought). Hopefully this problem will go away once the new hotel opens. Do check out the Spa - use is free and it is very quiet and relaxing, and the massages are as good as North American massage therapy standards (and reasonably priced). The roof pool/jaccuzi are above the SPA and are a nice change from all the activities around the main pool, plus have a great view of the town and bay. I had no problem with the beach and swam in the ocean every day, but you do need to walk to the left side of the hotel. We found both the restaurants very good, and even the buffet diner on the first night was good. The menu changes each day of the week at the Mexican restaurant and the selection is more limited so look for food that is to your taste to pick the day. I liked the authentic Mexican dishes (if you don't think they are authentic you must be used to Taco Bell). My husband says this is the only place he wants to go for sun holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Sponge ball square back (the waiters body type)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not believe all the BS. If you want an honest review read on...........here is what you need to do. -get a junior suite, or suite (avoid the standard rooms) -eat breakfast in the hotel buffet, go to the omelette bar (its the chronic) -They have a lunch buffet that is set outside the hotel that is open @ 12pm and you can eat their anytime during the day. The food here is OK, but remember you are in mexico on a beach not at Mountain Jacks. -The service is fine, you just need to ask (for example, if you are at the bar near the pool ask the bartender for a drink, do not wait for him to ask you (you are in Mexico Customer service at a bar does not exist here) Out of time got to go, if you have any questions email me, Traveled from 11/6-11/13

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from 11/1/2004-11/8/2004 Let me begin with the GOOD... The Staff here is what keeps the place in business. Everyone from the front desk, to the waiters, to the bartenders are all extremely polite and curteous. We rolled in at 3pm on our check-in day and were greeted at the front door by a bellman who escorted us to the front desk and then to our ocean view junior suite. I had read a post earlier about tipping heavy early on, and it worked. I stepped out of the van with 20 or so ones in my hand subtly of course. We had no problems checking in or with our room. when we got to our room, we were literally 40 feet form the ocean. we were ocean front on the first floor. beautiful view, except the fat europeans in the speedos...whole other post. The room was huge with a king bed and a "mini-bar" (2 cokes 2 beers some mango juice and 2 waters) the shower was large enough for 4 or five people. And my wife loves a firm mattress, so we were thrilled with the room and the service so far. Heres the BAD... There are 3 restaurants there. Italian, Mexican, and Buffet. There is a sportsbar listed on expedia and the hotel website, but it was never open while we were there. For the mexican and italian places you have to make reservations a day in advance. the italian is decent at best. serving recycled food, and a complimentary crap martini when you walk in the door. My wife and I are both bartenders, and we couldnt find a decent mixed drink in the whole resort, so we were stuck with fail safe frozen margaritas. The mexican restaurant served something that resembled golden retreiver prime rib. We even gave it the benefit of the doubt and ate there twice. Even worse the second time. Thirdly, the buffet is the only place that you can just drop in. It is un airconditioned, as are most common areas of resorts in Mexico, however, the food was all at or around room temp. The same old items were there every day and i swear they were 2-3 days old at times. There is a buffet on the beach for lunch during the day, but it sonsists of soggy fried delicacies such as cheap fries, fish quesadillas, what seemed to be grade D hamburgers, some sort of meat product hot dogs, and occasionally, a fried round thing that resembled a squash, yet tasted like rancid pudding. The pool was fairly dirty and had a horendous odor to it. The beachfront was obstructed by tons of fishing boats as is most of the city. The glasses that everyone in the resort was drinking from were never washed only dipped in sanitizer. Rarely did i get a drink without lipstick or sunscreen on my glass form someone else. The television setup they had was screwy, none of the channels matched the guided that they provided on screen, they had every major american network except CBS? our maid didnt show up until the 3rd day we were there. we realized, that she was coming in and checking the little tip envelope to see if we tipped her and then leaving if we didnt. Sure enough, we left 50 pesos in the envelope and our room was magically cleaned after our return from the beach. the next day another 50 pesos...another clean room. the following day, we left nothing as an experiment. We didnt have a clean room again for the rest of the trip. According to the hotel and the travel websites, tipping is part of your price, however, it is highly expected on top of what you pay and will result in poor service and in some cases no service. like i said i am a bartender and have no problem tipping well for good service, however, tipping here is almost a prerequisite to get anything accomplished. We did get a note under our door the first day to come to the front desk where they had a welcome honeymoon package. we arrive and they shuffle us to a desk where a woman wants to give us a timeshare presentation for a free bottle of cheap tequila. we politely said nothanks. the next day we gety a flyer in our door and it is requesting us to stay in their newer hotel across the street for the remainder of our trip at a a much lower price. so apparently, the room shifting scam is prevalant and we had prime real estate in our suite. We had prepaid for the trip anyway, so we werent about to move rooms much less across the street. OVERALL: the resort is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and accomodating. The staff is extra friendly, but they all expect to be tipped for everything. The food is horrible and would make me stay away from this resort ever again. The loaction is prime for playa. Most importantly the drinks are crap, and the only beer you get is warm draft XX out of a dirty glass. any questions, email me and ask..... aejeffor@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Gran Porto Real in mid-October for a friend's wedding. It was the first time my husband had ever been to Mexico and I was really excited to show him the beautiful water of the Carribean! We were married at the Ritz-Carlton on Maui, which we adore, but it is very different from the Carribean. I had researched the hotel a little bit and found mixed reviews on this sight. We felt we had to stay there since we were part of the wedding party and didn't know anything else in the area. I had read on tripadvisor that the hotel had a reputation of switching your room when you checked in and not giving you the one you booked. Concerned about this, I asked the bride, who assured me that her travel agent had a personal relationship with the hotel and this wouldn't happen. Sure enough, we check-in, having booked and ocean front junior suite with a king bed, and they said there were none available but we could try to switch rooms the next day. We went to the room they assigned us and found it facing the ocean but the view completely blocked by trees and it was also located directly above the main restaurant, very noisy. With two double beds, we figured we'd make due until the next morning. There were no room service menus or hotel guides in our room, and it was missing a lot of little things. We decided it was not big deal for one night but soon discovered when we went to bed that evening that the pillows were ROCK hard and the bedding atrocious. The next morning we went to the front desk to see about switching and they said we weren't on the list. The man who had checked us is never mentioned anything about needing to be on a list. At this point we thought it may be futile to try and switch, but the bride's father said if we kept bothering the people at the front desk, we'd get switched. After 3 different trips to the front desk, we were "magically" switched to a room on the opposite end of the hotel (still the old wing if you've been there) to a room with a king bed and beautiful view. We were quite thrilled and tipped the desk lady accordingly. That's the other thing, they say don't worry about tipping on the all-inclusive plan, but that's a crock. I guess you don't "have to" but it really gave us a superior level of attention with the waiters and housekeepers. Back to the new room; we began to notice all of the items the 1st room they had given us was missing by everything that the 2nd room had. The mini-bar in each room as described on the website is only a TINY little refrigerator with a couple of Cokes, Beers, and bottled waters in it. The room service was fast though but had a very limited menu. The food at the hotel was terrible unless you had a waiter who loved you and had fresh french fries and quesadillas and stuff made fresh for you! The buffet is the mainstay and you have to make reservations at the Mexican or Italian (total joke) restaurants which are booked 2 days in advance. Having no experience with an all-inclusive, I knew not to expect too much of the food, but it was terrible. My husband ordered a steak in the Italian restaurant and it was charred to a crisp. If you are still reading at this point, which maybe you are not (he he he, this got really long!) the wedding was also a joke at this hotel. It was located in this "breezeway" where we couldn't do a rehearsal because somebody was having a massage. Random. There was nobody from the hotel there to help with the rehearsal either. Having been completely spoiled by the wedding department at the Ritz-Carlton in Maui, this wedding department was nothing more than a "we provide the place and you do everything else". My husband and I were SO dissapointed that we had spent time and money on this place for a vacation that we checked out a day early and spent our last night at the Ritz-Carlton Cancun for the same price. Given, it wasn't all-inclusive, but who cares? The service, room, and facilities were truly first class. One other room side note, our friends who were also there for the wedding had a room in the new part of the hotel accross the street. Not only was this extremely inconvenient, there was construction every day all day that was very loud. And this construction was not down the street or anything, it was accross the hall. The hotel opened a half-finished portion of its hotel while the other half is being worked on. In conclusion, if you are the kind of traveler who prefers service, excellent accomodations, and great food, this is not the place for you. The ONLY place we will be staying if we go back to Mexico is the Ritz in Cancun. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “I would never go back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dont book ocean view all u can see is trees i was told by one of the rude persons at the front desk ocean view means u are facing ocean not that u would be able to see ocean had to move two rooms including my 77 yrs old grandmother to another room no one even offered to help us with our luggage the food and service was bad italian restuarant was not bad this hotel has no beach just a bunch of little fishing boats in front you have to walk far left of hotel to see the pretty beach only thing good about this hotel was the location to shopping in playa del carmen i dont see how this hotel could be rated a 4 or a 5 star when u are treated like a 2 star they dont care if u happy once the get u there i would never return to this hotel i stayed at iberostar last year they know how to treat someone on vacation they would never let u carry ur own bags to ur room and the food was great i guess it all depends if u are paying for 5 star or 2 star

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice honeymoon at the Gran Porto Real!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my honeymoon at Gran Porto Real. We were there from 10/14- 10/21. I've been reading the reviews on this site since 10 months before we left so I knew in advance what to expect. I was hoping we would be one of the lucky ones and get a great room without a hassle, but we weren't. I had seen the reviews of the oceanview suites on the second floor so when we were told that's where our room was I instantly told the man at the front desk that we wanted a new room and he told me there wouldn't be any available until the next day. Well 4 days later, after making 2 daily trips to the front desk, we grabbed Hilda from Olympus tours and took her to the front desk with us. She helped out a lot and we were in a new room on the third floor 5 days into our trip. But of course it was a room with 2 double beds because that's all that they said was available!! So it is very true what the reviews say about the front desk staff. They are pretty horrible!! Now to the good stuff!! It's is a beautiful hotel and the staff is great. The wait staff was very helpful and helped make our stay much better. The food was just ok at the buffet and I wouldn't recommend Maria Margarita's. We only ate there once and didn't like it at all. The Italian restaurant was the best!! They changed the menu in the middle of our stay and no longer have steaks!! We didn't go to the main pool because it was too crowded but we did go to the upstairs pool a few times and liked it there. Most people don't know there's a spa right up from the workout room that is free. You can use the sauna, steam room, jacuzzi, and cold pool in there without a fee!! It's very relaxing there. The beach is small but still nice. It's probably really crowded Dec-Feb since that's peak season. 5th street is great. We found everything we needed and got really great deals. Captain Bob's is a great restaurant, don't pass it by! The brazilian steakhouse was also pretty good. They have an all-you-can-eat with a ridiculous number of different meats. I think we only made it to 8 or 9 before we couldn't eat anymore. We took 2 tours while we were there. We swam with the Dolphins at Wet-n-Wild in Cancun and we took the snorkeling trip that took you to 3 different locations. Both were great and well worth the money. It's my 3rd trip to mexico and now that I know the area a little better I don't think we would stay at the Porto Real again. We would consider staying at the new hotel across the street, but we plan to stay in some of the hotels further south. There's a new Secrets resort opening up between Cancun and Playa plus we're considering Adventura Spa Palace!! The Porto Real is worth checking out and it's a great deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Whats to complain about ??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at GPR from Oct 13th - 18th and for me it was NOT long enough! I completly enjoyed my stay at GPR, the staff was ever so attentive and very friendly, always with a smile. I did not expect such good service. Never a dry glass or an empty plate, if you want it they will get it for you. The grounds were very clean and well manicured , the view was BEAUTIFUL. Right by the beach are fisherman boats that I thought add charm/character to the place. You want swim space walk a few yards and there you are! The beach at GPR has numerous ''palapas' grass huts with lounges that the staff (specifically Jorge and Merlin) will bring to you any amount of beverages and munchies! we went All -Inclusive and I thought was quite worth it , considering you can eat and drink ALL you want when you want 24 hours a day , including mini-bar and free room service. NO HASSLES ! Food was good , with a decent variety , although do make plans to eat out with the locals on Ave 5 ( the shopping people watching strip) So much to SEE and DO ..Very convenient to the "STRIP" As per the construction of the new hotel across the street.... its just THAT "across the street'' IGNORE it !! GPR is so beautiful , the beach and wate is so beautiful , just ENJOY your visit. It IS a Vacation !! RELAX I cannot say enough good things about my stay at GPR, I truly enjoyed it and have already made plans for a return visit. I was satisfied. want to chat write me. Charles

Reviews.Title: “Loved GPR / Playa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at GPR Oct 6th - 10th on our honeymoon. We had a Jr Suite and did the AI plan. My thoughts on the value of AI are that it was a good deal for us as drinkers. For those who don't drink it might not be such a deal. The restaurants were good, not great (plus there are so many places in walking distance on 5th Ave to check out). The service was always top notch however. Check-in: We had read a number of reviews about over-booking and were quite concerned. Thankfully our worries did not materialize. One item to note: You can and should ask to be switched to an alternate room if they try to put you in a room facing the new hotel construction across the street. We had to do that as the initial room they put us was directly facing construction. If you've never been to Mexico/Playa before, keep in mind that the price of nearly EVERYTHING is negotiable. Taxi's, meals, handmade goods, even the boat to Cozumel! And at the GPR, you will be amazed at the service you get if you're willing to tip a few bucks here & there. (case in point, I gave our waiter at Maria Margarita a $5 US tip and he practically begged us to have dinner there again and to ask for him to be our server) The timeshare people: Yes they are there. No they aren't horrible or pushy. They asked us to go view a property but we declined. No harm done and no big deal really. The beach: The truth is the beach directly in front of the main pool is not great as it is narrow and there are boats tied right there. But as was noted by several other reviewers, if you go to the left it is much nicer and quieter as well. Length of stay: 4 full days was not long enough.
