I plan to go back again and next trip will definitely be a full week at least. Conclusion: We loved the GPR and would enthusiastically recommend to all. We met some great people there (Amanda who posted on 10/17 - we met several members of the wedding party. Doc & Carol who were also on their honeymoon) The service at GPR is fantastic. The hotel is maintained very well. There is something for everyone. If anyone has questions, feel free to email me. Thanks, josh

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel to spend your vacation. Every square inch of this hotel is beautiful and staffed with extraordinary people who really look out for you and make sure that your stay is pleasant. Alex, our bellboy, was very helpful on our initial arrival and was very informed about area sights and things to do. There are activities throughout the day for guest to participate in if you choose. One day it rained all day and I took advantage of the pottery painting class. The pool is gorgeous and has two parts to it. One side has music, volleyball, dance lessons, etc.. and the other side is more quiet. The bar is conveniently located in the middle. The pool side waiters are very friendly and attentive, especially Jorge and Mervin (our favorites)! Tips are greatly appreciated. The daily buffets are good and there is always a variety. The room service menu could use more variety though. However, this is onw of the most beautiful resorts in Playa del Carmen at a resonable price. The staff truely makes you feel at home. I will definately be planning a return trip to visit my new friends at the Gran Porto Real. See you soon! Kelly

Reviews.Title: “Don't go all inclusive!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from Gran Porto Real and I can't even begin to tell you how happy I was to sleep in my own bed! Like the previous reviews state, the beds are hard and a bit difficult to get used to. I was glad to hear others used Best Day as transfers and had success because ours was a nightmare. They said they didn't have us on their list after we previously paid so we had to pay a second time. It was like pulling teeth from both Best Day and Hotels to get either one to reimburse but finally they did. The food was terrible. Breakfast was by far the best meal since you could have omlettes and that such made. The Italian restaurant was the best food although again I would not call it great. Definitely find some local spots to eat! The hotel was overbooked by Thursday and lots of unhappy people in the lobby. We opted to do the two for one location transfer and stayed in Cancun for a couple of days (see review of Gran Caribe Real). The resort itself is absolutely beautiful and I highly suggest spending time at the upstairs pool (Filipe was a wonderful bartender) if you want to escape the MTV beachhouse atmosphere at the main pool. The staff does work very hard and I was ashamed to see some people treatment them with so much disrespect. Overall, I would highly recommend staying at this resort but do not go the all inclusive route!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to gran poro real on oct 3-7.. we were a bit scared after some of the reviews but found it really nice...We did the all inclusive, which is great. Everyone that worked there was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are clean , and big. The beach is great also, except for the boats right out front. But all u have to do is walk a few yards and the beach is wonderful. The service was excellent too..There was always some hard worker right there to get u a drink.The buffet was so -so to us ...The italian resturant is good too.I have no complaints at all with this resort. Also the 5th avenue is a greatplace to go shop in the evening when it cools down .. Alot ofwalking to do on the street. Everyone there was very helpful...If u want to know more, please e mail me...I cant wait to go back, to playa del carmen.. Also took tour of new resort right across street , which is very nice too..all rooms have large jacuzzi in them .. ey are supposed to be opening in december, you might want to stay there.....loved it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the reviews slow you down!”
Reviews.Author: Duhs9919
Reviews.Content: I was at the GPR October 7-14th and actually had my wedding there. We had 23 people attend the wedding, we were one of 20 weddings this month. I can't explain how beautiful the hotel and the surroundings are. The food is edible (no one got sick) but the lack of variety does start to get to you. Maria Margarita's was average remember this is not tex-mex food. The italian resturant is absolutely wonderful. The mini bar is free and room service once a day is free as well. The service from the staff throughout the hotel is top notch. I had read about the over booking problems but I didn't not witnesses any upset guests or fights at the front desk. Several people from my group has stayed at 6 star hotels and were amazed at how beautiful GPR was. Please remember that this is Mexico not a ritzy 5 star in LA or New York. The hotel is a 5 star based on its apperance and up keep but the lack of resturants and bars would make it a 3. We saw people daily painting or trimming bushes, someone was always working to make sure the hotel was top notch. We all went All Inclusive and was the best route. Unless you do not drink at all and do not hardly eat its worth it. Even when you travel into town the food is moderatly priced, this is a touristy area, and they know people will pay high prices. The beach is wonderful, if you walk towards the north about 500 yards the beach is not as crowded and has its own bar. There is a swim up bar pool on the 3rd floor of the hotel that seems to be the best kept secret. If you consider yourself high maintenence this place is not for you. The alcohol was free flowing and was not watered down and the staff was not constantly asking for tips. I have read horror stories about the timeshare people but no one in my group or many people I talked to had even been bothered with them. The wedding went off without a hitch it was absolutely beautiful, there was not a dry eye in the house. The hotel is 1 block from 5th Avenue the shopping center. There are a ton of resturants and nice shopping. Overal I highly recommend this hotel and will be going back next year. Please remember that this is Mexico and 1 dollar bills go a long way (but are not necessary) and try to relax and enjoy your vacation instead of looking for things to complain about. If anyone has any questions please feel free to email me.- Amanda Schul

Reviews.Title: “Typical All-Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: Trainnman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from PDC, and usual, it was beautiful. We too were hesitant about over booking, so I tried to e-mail the Hotel to confirm our recervation and to make sure that we were up-graded to an ocean view room. I tried to e-mail three time in one week prior to our departure and got NO RESPONSE. Well, we stayed two night on 1st floor over looking (you guessed it) the new Hotel construction next door. And, as mentioned in other reviews, the Front Desk is not very helpful. We Talked to Francisco, the Best Day Representative,and boy did he get the ball to rolling, with-in 2 hrs. we were assigned a new and beautiful 2nd floor room (235).and I only had to tip him $20.00,(worth $100.00). The Hotel is Spectacular, the rooms are huge and immaculate. The Maid service is too good, don't plan on sleeping past 7:00am, no napping during the day, and don't forget about them knocking on your door at 10:15pm to give you two candy mints. They work their butts off to try to please you. The Bartenders are good after a day or two and 50 pesos per day. Drinks are good, understaffed at times. Everyone is busy fixing or cleaning at ALL times, no time to goof-off here. Food was not very good, and this is my 65th trip to Mex. and 16th time at an all-inclusive, so I know. I would not choose the A/I here, there are to many excellent Restaurants on the beach and in town. The Taco wagons are ALWAYS a good bet. I don't think I would recommend this hotel, they really weren't very helpful, there is no swim-up bar down stairs, the stools at the pool bar were so high you could not sit at the bar ( on purpose, I'm sure). If you do go, don't miss the beach just north of the hotel(starting at the pier 50yards away and going unsp[oiled for 2 1/5 miles, past a few palapas and a few small resorts.) It will probably be the highlight of your trip, the water and beachare Pristine. If it were not for a few high-fiven dip---,PDC would be one of the most beautiful vacation spots in the world. If you haven't been there, it's a MUST.

Reviews.Title: “Much better thatn we were expecting.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week at the Gran Porto. Having read the reviews, I was a bit apprehensive, so here are my thoughts, written admittedly from a European point of view. We booked our stay and transfers on the web through Best Day Tours, purely by chance, as they offered the best rates. This was a masterstroke because they are associated with the hotel and there is always a rep on site if you have problems. We had booked a junior suite with ocean view. When we arrived, we were told that there were only 2 suites available and did we want to be on the first or second floor. We said second, and were taken along by Javier, who was very nice. As we went in, he said he didn’t think we would like the room and he was right. It was around the corner from the sea and faced the half finished new building. He phoned the front desk and we went to look at the first floor room. This was better but not what we wanted, so we agreed to stay there for 1 night and moved the next day. We were then given a very nice room overlooking the beach. helpful. Fortunately it did not overlook the pool, which was very, very noisy during the day. Moral – if you don’t like the room, ask nicely and they will find you one that you do like. The front desk people are not rude, but they do not go out of their way to be helpful. Yes there are boats drawn up on the beach, but one of Playa’s claims to fame is that it tries to maintain some of the fishing village atmosphere and that means boats. It is not trying to be Cancun, thank goodness. There is no high rise building at all. There is a perfectly good sandy beach at one end of the frontage. The sand is always cool by the way; it is made of fossils not silica. The new building is still not finished, although there didn’t seem to be much work going on when we were there. Some of the rooms are being used however. I would describe the food as unimaginative. There is plenty of it and the Italian restaurant is by far the best. The Mexican one has no atmosphere and the food was somewhat badly cooked and not even Mexican much of the time. The buffet restaurant needs a new head chef. The food is just bland. The staff are all delightful, from Eva (a guy) at the north beach bar, who taught us some Mayan words, to Luis and Allejandro in the Italian restaurant, who does magic tricks and now know that you call a female customer “Madam” and not “Lady”! I must admit I was surprised at the rude way some of the guests treated the staff. They are not slaves. Overall, this hotel is not 5 star by European standards, but it is very good value for money at only $100 a night A.I. If I wanted to return to Playa, I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: Claughton
Reviews.Content: Firstly Palya del Carmen is a great location and the hotel is very well situated on a beautiful beach with crystal clear water. The fishing boats moored against the beach just add colour and dont take much away as there is plenty open space left directly adjacent to the hotel. The beach would be perfect if it didnt have unsightly poles embedded in the sand every few meters. Just a short walk around the corner the beach is fantastic but less shade and no beds so take your pick. The arrivals desk was not partcularly welcoming and the noise coming from the 'Entertainment' at the bar made us feel as though we had made a dreadful mistake. The room cheered us up though and the sea veiw was magnificent. The pool area is also nice but unusable as there are always 'games' taking place and the noise is deafening.I suppose that happens at all inclusive resorts where people are drinking from 9.00am! We stayed away from the pool and at the beach which was almost perfect except for the days when the beach bar had their music system on and we had true stereo from the pool area in one ear and the beach bar in the other. We didnt get the all inclusive which was perfect as it makes you get out and the restaurants and bars locally were really good. Service generally was good both inside and outside the hotel and people are really friendly.The tours were fantastic. Would go to Playa again but would try another hotel for some peace and quiet. One last thing avoid getting ripped off at Cancun airport by time share guys. Ours was from the Aventura Spa Hotel but the shirt and tie and airport id made us think he was genuine. It wasnt a good start.

Reviews.Title: “Little piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an anniversary trip at the Gran Porto Real Resort 9/26-9/30. My husband made all of the travel arrangements and asked for extra special treatment. We were not disappointed in the staff going over and beyond the call of duty. The room had a spectacular view, I strongly recommend when booking a room you ask for a third floor room so the view of the ocean will not have to viewed inbetween palm trees. Our room and well has the entire grounds were kept immaculately clean at all times. The resturants Maria Margarita and the Italian Resturants were equally good. I suggest making reservations in advance and dining there for dinner in favor of the buffet. If you want to be pampered and have a experience you will not be disappointed please go here.

Reviews.Title: “Porto Real A+++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Best family vacation in Mexico yet. Hotel was excellent, overlooking beach from room was something to steal your breath away. Awesome rooms, great food, and a staff dedicated to you having a excellent stay at their hotel. Would come back in a heart beat. The proximity of the market area in Playa del Carmen was a real added treat.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real 9/14 thru 9/19/2004. Our trip to Playa was a great first-time experience in Mexico. We can not wait to get back. We had read ALL of the reviews on the Porto Real and were a little concerned. However, all worries were put to rest upon arrival. We booked an Ocean-view (Highly recommended) Junior Suite. Upon arrival we did indeed have what we booked except for the fact that we had 2 double beds. We requested and were put in another Ocean-View Junior Suite with a King bed the next morning. (The Hammock on the balcony was Great!!) Don't get me wrong, the 2 double beds were nice, but we didn't go to Mexico for our 16th Anniversary to sleep in separate beds. The King was MUCH better. Hey, I guess size does matter. Now for the reason that I'm rating it a four and not a five: The front desk personnel were not quite what would be expected from a 5-Star Resort. They should be a LITTLE more friendlier at the front desk. And the food at the buffet was not quite what it should be either. I HIGHLY recommend that you enjoy a dinner at Il Pascatore, the Italian restaurant. It was fabulous!! The service was outstanding. We did not particularly enjoy Maria Margarita's, the Mexican restaurant. We did get room service for dinner one evening and it was okay. The only other bad (if you call it that) thing was that ridiculous bracelet that they make the All-inclusive people wear. It is kind of annoying. Plus, when you do venture into town, it makes you a target for the tour operators/time-share folks. We did get talked in to visiting another Real property accross town by someone working at the VIP desk inside the hotel lobby. We asked all questions BEFORE we went....like....Will this cost us anything???...the answer was no....How much money do we need to bring???.....Answer, none.....Is this a Time-share venture thing????.....Answer, No.....She stated the only stipulation was to be Married, and have a credit card....Hmmm Credit Card????....Don't worry, they only look at it and do not write the number down....Well, we went on the Tour of the other hotel.....Turns out that we were indeed taken on a Timeshare tour....They all say that "This is not timeshare"....but if you've been on one timeshare venture, you've been on 'em all....Five minutes into the tour, my wife and I knew what we were in for....Once asked if we were interested in buying into the 'Vacation Package' (Not timeshare???) we simply said 'NO"....there was absolutely no pressure put on us. Now the good part....For going on the hour-long tour we received $1000.00 Pesos (Roughly $100.00 U.S. dollars), 2 Mexican blankets, and a bottle of Tequila, oh and free transportation to and from...we used the $$$ on 5th Ave. to buy souvenirs. Next time I go, I'm going to leave the wife and daughter on the beach and I'm going to hit everyone of these things and see just how much money I can make in a day..LOL....Easiest $100 we've made....Believe me, you WILL be asked plenty of times to go on these little TOURS....Just take the money and go...Something for the guy to do while the others stay on the Beach all day....LOL...Here's a tip: If you get tired of being asked to go on these tours, (and you'll be asked out on the street) simply say that it is your last day there....Then, they will know that you don't have time...It worked like a charm for us out on the Avenue.... We enjoyed our time on the beach everyday at the end of the hotel....a place called North Beach....we always got a chair right by the bar (and you don't need to get up early to find a beach chair....and Guadaloupe (the waitress) was absolutely amazing....and the bartender there was the best at the resort....They took real good care of us....It was just like living in a Corona beer commercial....sippin' on drinks and looking at the aquamarine waters of the western Carribean. Make sure you at least make a day trip over to Cozumel...Use your binoculars to make sure no cruise ships are over there before you head to the ferry....Ferry is very quick and costs roughly $18 U.S. per person/round trip...If there's a cruise ship over there, chances are that you WILL NOT get any bargains while shopping for souvenirs. Plus it will be crowded. By the way, the shopping in Playa on 5th AVE. is EXCELLENT....we enjoyed it... We will DEFINITELY go back to Playa, and will not consider staying anywhere else but the Gran Porto Real. We enjoyed our stay and wish we were there now. Don't put too much emphasis on the negative reviews...Give it a try..You'll love it....We Did!!!! Feel free to contact me with any questions/concerns via e-mail (william.e.berry@lmco.com)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: ckandil
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews about the GPR for months before our trip I was a bit worried about what we would find. We needn't have worried at all! We booked two standard rooms which are of adequate size and nice decor. Trouble was, my mother is disabled and these rooms are a long walk from the elevator. As a result we asked to be moved to rooms by the elevator (which turned about to be Jr Suites) so we had to pay a $20USD upgrade fee per night for each room. Must admit that it was worth it for the extra space and room for us to put a crib in. The double beds were a bid on the small side though. We met some people who were staying in rooms in the new hotel across the street which is not finished yet. They said that their room was huge with a lovely king bed and jucuzzi in the middle. The staff at the GPR cannot be faulted in any way. They were fantastic and nothing is too much trouble for them. They are so friendly and willing to help and you knew they weren't just doing it for the tip. As mentioned before, do take a wad of $1 bills with you as these people really deserve the service they give you (especially Jorge, the pool waiter)! My 4 year old daughter was very disappointed with the kids club. Not only did it reek of mould and damp but, as they were hardly any kids there, they didn't seem enthusiastic about doing anything with my daughter. Maybe it's better when there are more kids there but I definitely wouldn't recommend it. The pool area was lovely but it was a shame about the constant influx of "loud, crassy, drunken Americans". It really did spoil the atmosphere a bit and a lot of people by the pool (including all the other Americans) were a bit annoyed about it. These weren't young, party people either but groups of middle aged couples that really should know better. And talk about belitting the waiters!!! I'm not a beach person but I wouldn't say it was perfect - more adequate. The view is not lovely with the huge sand bags and there was a bit of a pong on some days with dead fish along the shore. The biggest nightmare for us was the humidity there. Only the rooms have A/C which meant that you were sweating into your meal every time you ate. Our 10 month baby really couldn't cope with this and he was fussy all holiday. IF you want somewhere with nice rooms and excellent service, then this is the place to go. The people working there really made our holiday for us and I wouldn't hesitate in returning when the humidity isn't quite so bad.

Reviews.Title: “GPR Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from GPR, stayed Sept 8-22 All inclusive. GPR is a real jem, stayed in a junior suite (excellent AC, great shower, mini bar restocked every day). Staff were very friendly apart from guy on the inside bar who was pretty miserable esp when busy. Employee of the month must go to Teresa (pool bar), very friendly great to chat to and v. helpful. The cocktail drinks were a bit of a lottery and the recipe seemed to change depending who was serving or how busy it was. The buffet food was above average and varied, the Italian was disappointing (I've been to some of the best Italian restauarants in the UK), service could not be faulted. The Mexican was better food wise (apart from the prime rib which was awful), also the service in this restaurant was appalling. With all the restaurants there are fans but no AC which makes lunch uncomfortable when it's 95C. Top tip which I discovered by accident is the tranquil pool on the 3rd floor with swim up bar, great to escape the noise of the main pool, the pool isn't mentioned on the hotel brochure. Also not mentioned in the roof top jacuzzi with the best views in PDC. Would recommend GPR to anyone, not 5 star but definitely 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Porto Real with my boyfriend from September 12th-19th. We had stayed in Cancun two years ago. I remembered how wonderful I thought Playa Del Carmen was(not to mention the fact that it was much less touristy than Cancun-No Wallmarts, malls and JCpenneys here). So this is why we picked the Gran Porto Real. I loved the architecture of the hotel and the fact that it had character and charm, so unlike the modern hotels on the Cancun Hotel Zone. I definitely felt like I was in Mexico, from the pillared balconies to the Talavera Pottery they put in the room. One suggestion I have if you stay here, definitely book an Ocean Veiw Suite on the 2nd or 3rd floor, it is well worth it. We originally booked a junior suite, and they put us in a room overlooking the new hotel wing they are building. You don't go on vacation to look at a construction site. They ended up giving us an upgrade for half the upgrade price and we had a beautiful view of the ocean. Eating breakfast on the balcony or sipping wine while you watch the sunset is definitely worth getting this room. Personally I would suggest unless you are on a budget, not to get the all inclusive. It's not that the food or service is bad, but you've got so many terriffic restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, it doesn't make sense to be limited to only 3. We actually had the all inclusive, and appreciated it because we were on a budget and definitely got our money's worth. Especially since you could get one meal a day room service. But the restaurants on 5th avenue are really great and so much variety from Brazillian Steak houses to Italian to places that service Lobster and Filet Mignon with a lot of ambience and atmosphere to boot. It just depends on how much you have to splurge and how much you like to get out and explore instead of staying at the hotel. We actually ate on 5th avenue a couple of times anyway and I think we still came out ahead. We ordered room service for breakfast every day. The only terrible thing we had at the hotel was Prime Rib!!! You could have thrown that at someone and split their head open, it was so tough. But that was not the norm, all the rest of the food we had at the Mexican and Italian restaurant was good. The hotel staff were very nice and attentive. I made sure to bring a wad of $1 bills for tips as well. We tipped very well there, I saw a lot of people that didn't bother to leave anything which is rude. Excellent service should always be rewarded. Plus they definitely act even more attentive and nice than they already were!!! haha. One other tip I wanted to pass on: Don't act like the "ugly american" here. I saw too many people doing that and getting nowhere. People respond much better to respect and kindness. Also: Make sure to put your "Do not Disturb" sign on the door, unless you want to be awakened several times by the maid trying to clean your room at 7 am. I didn't really see anything too bad about the beach. It was fun to take a walk down to the less isolated areas of the beach and explore. We were able to swim there and lie out under a straw thatch hut. If you don't like the beach, you can drive along highway 307 and find some really cool isolated beach spots as well. Whatever you do or whatever your preference, I think you'll end up having a good time here. I would go back again. I would most definitely pick this over the Cancun Hotel Zone. My god, it has gotten even more touristy since I was there last time. How sad, you don't even feel like you are in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Porto Real from Sept 12th- Sept 19th. It was our honeymoon and first trip to a resort so I cannot compare to anything, all I can give is an honest review. The resort itself is beautiful. Our room was great (had Jr suite), shower was huge, decent terrace, mini-bar stocked everyday, awesome A/C. Bed was hard but maybe you like a hard mattress:) Staff was friendly, hard-working and as mentioned in other reviews a couple dollar tip is appreciated by the workers and goes a long way. The pool area was very nice, big pool, some fun activites ( water vollyball, aerobics, ect), just get a chair before 8:30-9:00am or you will be on the beach. The beach is ok, a bit rocky, if thats a bother to you, just walk a little ways down and it smoothes out. There are the fishing boats docked but you get use to them, at times when the fisherman came in, you sometimes got a whiff of the morning catch but hey, they have to make a living:) The food at buffet was good, not great, remember your in Mexico, everything is just a bit different. The buffets get a little redundant after awhile but if thats the case, you can try the 2 restrurants attached to the resort (the italian being the better IMO) Just make reservations the day before. The lunch buffet on beach is great if just in mood for old fashioned hamburger and fries. Drinks were great, will make them how you want. The 5th avenue shopping strip was a cool, amusing little place. If you do not like to be slightly pestered to look in stores, don't go. If you buy stuff, talk them down, never accept the 1st or even second price they gave you, seemed to me they would ask at least 3x more then what you actually end up buying it for, especially silver. A few tour operators work out of there, so there are things to do off the resort if you want to pay. We went to Xel-Ha and if you like to snorkle, great place to do it. Overall it was a great experience, not a 5 star place, and not for people that like to look for things to complain about. But if your laid back, not picky and really realize its what you make out of it, its a good one to go to, especially considering it does not cost an arm or leg.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: vivdancing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for our anniversary and absolutely loved it. I dont know where some of these reviewers found any of the staff to be rude, unless they were rude first (which still does not make it allright bec. the customer is always right, BUT, EVERYONE was super friendly and bent over backwards for us. From the check in to the check out, everyone was pleasand inside and outside of the hotel. Location is great, near 5th street where all the shopping, clubs, restaurants are. You can also take a taxi to Xcaret, a very popular park in Cancun - that was maybe an $8-$10 cab ride, is totally worth it. The rooms are huge, as well as the bathrooms (we had the ocean view) and they were super clean. Marble floored too - very nice. We decided to stay one more night because we werent ready to go home. We then decided to get a cheaper room to save money for one night. The room was fine, small, but very nice decorated and clean. So if you can't afford a suite, I think the standard rooms are fine too. As far as the beach, people, if you walk a couple of miles pass the bridge, there's a perfect beach with blue water and no rocks...as far as the beach in front of the hotel, that was more for water sports and sailing boats or just to lay out, hang out and drink. If you want a beach walk 2 miles, is right there, so dont let these comments bother you. There IS a beach at Gran Porto. Is also fun to hang out by the pool. Overall a great experience, I'd totally recommend Gran Porto Real - I have great memories here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff...not so great beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GPR Sept 11th through 15th. My boyfriend and I were skeptical after reading all of the reviews but found we did not encounter half of the problems others seem to have had in the past. It is true that the beach is very rocky and there are boats that dock in front of the hotel but all in all our stay there was great. There is a beach behind the newest hotel that is under construction across the pier that has a full service bar that caters to GPR vacationers as well. We found that area of beach to be great and is where we spent the majority of our time during our stay. All of the staff is EXTREMELY friendly and gracious. Our favorite was Teresa who seems to serve mostly in the bar area by the pool. She was wonderful and very friendly. We never had an empty glass. Tipping is not expected but we found very much appreciated. The Hotel was absolutely beautiful and the rooms were very spacious. We unfortunately, were there during the passing of Hurrincane Ivan which forced the hotel to shut down beach and pool access and the activities crews tried to entertain everyone. This was not the most memorable part of our trip as most everything within walking distance was closed down. We would not go again during hurricane season as we were left with little to do for one entire day. With the execption of the beach we loved our stay at the GPR...if we were to go back to Playa again, we would probably stay at the newer hotel when construction is completed only because of the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a must read review. I must admit that I was hesitant when booking this hotel as I had read all the bad reviews. I traveled to Playa Del Carmen on 9/11/04 to 9/18/04. Upon arrival, I was pleasantly surprised by how beautiful this hotel was. The rooms are very clean!! Never found one bug! I've stayed at some of the most beautiful hotels such as the Ritz Carlton and Bellagio in Vegas, so I know what a nice hotel looks like. Gran Porto Real was about "almost" as good as it can get in a location right on the beach. Don't expect too much as most hotels on the beach are not as classy, due to the sand. The rooms had nice soft beds, high ceilings and great working air conditioner. The service was also pretty good. Always attentive when any problems arose. The atmosphere was very lively and they had entertainment every night which was nice. I looked at almost all the hotels on Playa and saw no other one to compare. Most of the other hotels that pop up when searching are not in Playa, but in nearby towns. You want a hotel in Playa because you are at walking distance from the main walking strip called 5th Avenue. Also I cannot say much as to the food as I didn't have the all inclusive. I did notice that lunch always consisted of hamburgers, hot dogs and taquitos. As far as the beach, it was nice and clean, but one day a cruise ship came off shore and brought in tons of dirt and seaweed. Dirtied the beach. So, I can see why some people said the beach wasn't nice. I was lucky enough to experience a nice side of it as the cruise ship came a few days after my arrival. Word of advise, when going to the beach, stear off to your left. The ocean is clearer and nicer, but just a little rockier. The left side has a small stretch of sand bags that stop the waves from comming through, so the water is nice. Great for snorkleing in the mornings. Although I was pretty happy with my stay, there were some negatives. Upon arrival, the customer service in the front desk was not what should be expected in a hotel that claims to be a 5 star (I would rate it a 4). They tried to charge us a pretty high amount to add a person compared to the original price quoted upon booking. We were able to lower it after requesting to speak to the manager and insisting we get a lower rate. We also realized that we didn't have an ocean view, but were also able to bargain for one. Be respective, but firm with your requests. Do not get a room that has no ocean view. You will get a street view, not a garden one. Also, I didn't see any standard rooms, they may have been across the street on a newer building. I wouldn't purchase a standard room. Another negative was the fact that the cable paused on us more than a few times at night. But, by far the most negative part of this hotel was the wrist band situation. They make you wear this band that you cannot take off. It's so annoying and not reflective of what you expect from a high class hotel. They want to make sure you don't have extra people in your rooms. I hated being stalked when walking to my car with luggage. We had to do so a couple of times, as we left overnight. The bell men hounded us. They wanted to make sure we were not leaving for good, so they ask all these questions. In all, I would stay here again. Just hope they work on their customer service a bit. But, the hotel itself is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful time! We were there Sept 4 - 11 and had also read all the reviews before hand. I am so glad I did not pay attention to them. I can not say enough about the place. My comment to those who read these, experience it yourself! A holiday is what you make of it. Have fun

Reviews.Title: “Great food, warm service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at the GPR for 6 days & 5 nights from Aug. 26th-31st of 04. I spent months reading reviews, and researching many hotels. We read the reviews here at the trip advisor, and the only thing that we were concerned about was the beach. According to the reviews there was no beach. After careful review we decided this (GPR) was the resort we wanted to stay at. We found out that the reason there was not much of a beach was from erosion due to previous tides/hurricanes. But they are working to build it back up. Before leaving for our flight, the night before we called "Patty" the reservation manager to let her know we were going to celebrate my boyfriends 40th B.D., and we wanted to confirm that we had the room we paid for. “A balcony with ocean view” She said, “no problem,” and she hopes we enjoy our stay. When we arrived we were greeted at the front door, by Javier he was most helpful and took our bags right away. We checked in and he took us to our room immediately. He took us to a room on the ground floor that was not an ocean view, and not much of a balcony. We told Javier that was not the room we paid for, and wanted to change. He called the manager, to let us speak with him. We were promised a room for the next day on the 3rd floor with balcony & ocean view. At check out time the next day we went to the front desk to check on the room. They said, it was ready, and Javier took our bags for us, and we were transferred to the room we paid for. It was beautiful, a perfect view. We spent all our time on the beach. Where we were served endless drinks. We purchased an AI package, and would definitely do it again. They offered premium drinks, and the service was always great! The food was great at all the restaurants, & buffets. We really loved Maria Margarita's restaurant. Were we were served by Ivan every night we ate there. He is absolutely great. He made sure we were happy at all times, and made sure we wanted to come back. Jaime in the breakfast buffet is also great, (Ivan's bro?) He served us several times in the buffet area, and was always prompt. I do suggest carrying lots of dollar bills, even if you get an AI package. If you only tip $1 here and there they are most grateful. Most of the employees at the GPR have been there for years, and take particular interest in a vacationer's stay. We were very happy with everything, and everyone and will definitely go back to the GPR.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible check in experience in Grand Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back on August 29th 2004 from our holidays. The check in experience was horrible. As we got to the counter they’ve told us they have no more rooms left and send us off across the street to the Royal Porto Real. This resort its under constriction and only has 50 rooms open. If you would like to see any staff SORRY as all of them are in Grand Porto Real across the street. My sister and I refused to stay in the RPR, sure the rooms are gorges with a BIG Jacuzzi in the middle of the room, but who wants to stay in “Dead Zone Hotel” if you can’t find a leaving soul. Finally after 1 hour 2 rooms came up which 4 of us could stay in. The broacher stated that they have a 24hour lounge with food and alcohol. NO it’s not true the lounge had some left over sandwiches wrapped in wet cellophane foil and fruits. The alcohol……..sorry you won’t find any. The beach has allot of rocks and little local fishing boats. Overall the resort its Ok + the staff is amazing VERY friendly and helpful. But I would not recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “ahhhhhh”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed @ the Porto real for two weeks in april 2004. We could not have been happier. Of our two week stay we had one 5 min. rain shower otherwise sun and 80's -90' the entire time. We too were uncertain after reading the reviews having it be our first trip to Mexico. Were we surprised. When we arrived were greeted by a very nice gentleman [Bellboy} he offered us a drink in the lobby @ the get go as we were checking in. We were delayed getting after a long travel day so it was a great start. We were put in a different room than what we ordered the first night but okay w/ us as we were exhausted. By ten the next morning we were in our Ocean front suite for the next wo weeks it was pure heaven. We were waited on hand and foot the entire time, and we were close to everything. We were never approached @ the hotel by any sales people the entire time we were there. We had signed up for a day trip to the ruins but they had us signed up for a van instead of bus, so we asked in the front lobby at 6' in the morning if they could change it to the bus we had oringinally purchased tickets for and they bent over backwards for us as we did not notice till the morning of , of the mess up. The manger drove to the hotel and contacted the bus driver and waited w/ us till the bus arrived to make sure we got on. I think my only problem was the unfriendlness of the the small store off the lobby, the people working there were very stuffy. The rest of the staff of the hotel were magnificent down to the guy who refilled the mini fridge everyday. Keep tip money handy @ all times it is very much appreciated everywhere. We will be returning in 2006 for another two week stay. Almost forgot the breakfast buffet was good lunch on the beach was great, but dinners @ the buffet could use some improvement. the next time we go we will dine else where for dinner. As they all inclusive means all inclusive there and if you want more spirts in your drinks just ask they are happy to do so. Get up early to get a good place at the pool as it gets crowed fast, but lots of fun stuff going on @ the pool everyday. we love the little jewlery places around the pool @ night w/ music and all. We loved this place Sincerely, Jim & Diane Wilson

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great experience, suited our travel plans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Grand Porto Real (21-28 Aug), and we agree that we made a good choice on our hotel. We wanted to stay at a nice hotel with good amenities that was right in Playa del Carmen, and the GPR met those requirements. The rooms were clean (we didn't see any bugs), the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the food was good. The location is great and we enjoyed walking, biking, and running in town. The GPR has a good sized swimming pool by the beach (divided in halves - one for activities and one for just swimming/lounging), and another pool on the other side of the hotel with a swim up bar. We had a lot of activities planned (two days of SCUBA diving, a snorkling trip, and a packaged tour of Tulum and Xel-Ha) so we didn't spend all of our time at the hotel. It's kind of a stretch to call the GPR a "resort"; it has nice pools and the food is good, but I don't think we could have spent all of our time there without leaving the grounds. Words to the wise: The hotel advertised free use of their sunfish sailboats, and I was really looking forward to doing some sailing. However, the sub-contractor that ran the concession - "Aqua World" - wasn't as excited to put me on the water because I wasn't a paying customer. (The attendant said that I could only use the boat for a half hour, and when I was done, he made a point to press me for a tip.) The trip to Tulum/Xel Ha was great, but be mindful that Xel Ha sells tickets that are all inclusive (five restaurants, secure lockers, towels, free drinks, etc.) and basic (park entry only). Be sure you get the one you want. We got our money's worth out of the all inclusive package at the GPR, but make sure you try some meals out in town - there are some really good restaurants on 5th Avenue. Staying at the GPR suited our vacation plan. If you want an all-inclusive resort where you don't have to leave the property, you'll probably be better somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Porto Real is a very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Porto Real a few years ago and again last year... The hotel is very nice, the staff are the friendliest that I have found in all of our travels. The food was good but not fantastic, the rooms were very nicely decorated and very clean, the maid service was excellent. Though we left a tip everyday on our bed we didn't tip excessively. The beach and grounds are very well maintained and the water is wonderful, in temperature, color and calmness. They also have a very nice pool and the hotel offers a vast array of activities during the day with a theme every night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We are planning to go back to Playa this winter but will stay at a different hotel only because we would like to experience another part of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from August 20-22 and was a bit disappointed. The hotel advertises itself as 5 stars, but it is really a 3 star place. The building is at least 30 years old, it's very noisy, and there are cockroaches. The hotel buffet is a big rip. It's incredible that people were paying $18 US dollars a head for all the hamburgers and hot dogs they could eat. I payed $134 per night including taxes. It was way too much, especially because I payed almost the same rate at Fiesta Americana - a true 5 star hotel. I might return if they offered me a room for $50.

Reviews.Title: “if you don't intend to go to the beach......”
Reviews.Author: vitoparis
Reviews.Content: The worst part of the beach in Playa del Carmen ! And if you want to get a rest next to the swimming pool, look for another place...

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Beautiful resort, wonderful warm service.”
Reviews.Author: Yesmelissa
Reviews.Content: GREAT SERVICE! Everyone really seemed to want us to have a great time. This was some of the best service I have experienced for such a reasonably priced trip. I saw the bad reviews, but found them to not pertain to our trip. I have been to Cancun and Cozumel five or six times, and I like Gran Porto Real the best. It was beautiful inside and out, the Junior Suite Ocean view is the way to go, the food is about as good as you can get in Mexico all-inclusive world. If you do the all-inclusive, make sure you book most of your nights at El Pescatore. I think unless you are a big drinker, or like complete ease, just do al a carte. I liked this resort because it is walking distance to fun city streets, really right on the beach (unlike a lot of resorts) and really caters to you service wise. The best rooms are the third floor oceanviews Junior suites (353 is the best). If you have a double bed situation, you will be over the pool. King Size bed holders will be off to the left side of the pool. The free room service once a day is limited, but fun. There is only A/C in the bedrooms, and so we found August 31st to be really hot. One fun thing to do is rent a golf cart to ride around the city. We also paid a cab driver $10.00 asked him to drive us around a bit. It is good to keep a roll of $1.00 bills with you, to thank the people around you who are giving you service. They sure appreciate it and you feel like a big spender. Most of all, remember you are in Mexico. It is not the United States, it is Mexico! Have a good attitude, go with the flow and have a good time!

Reviews.Title: “A great first time All Inclusive Package!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I enjoyed a five night six day stay at this on the All Inclusive Package and loved it. We are 21 and 22 years old. This was our first trip to Mexico and our first All Inclusive package. The Resort is beautiful, cleaned, and well kept. Our room was great. The bed was huge and comfortable. The shower was huge to. We ordered breakfast to our room almost every morning and I have to say that was the best meal of the day. The only complaint I have is the food was not the best in the world. The bar menu and breakfast is what I preferred to the restraunts (and I tried all of them). The water is beautiful and so warm!! We took out a kayack one day. The pool is very attractive and spacious. It has an area where you can set up your lawnchairs and sunbathe. We had a good time playing water volleyball. The staff was very kind and most of the other guests were. We only had a complaint of a group of people from Texas who walked around and hooted and hollared the whole time. We stayed on the resort most of the time. We did walk through the market street. I bought alot of beautiful Turqiouse jewlry for a great price. The vendors will bargain you to death. We also went to the Blue Parrot down the beach from the resort almost everynight (the resort bars close kind of early). We loved the Blue Parrot. Its an outdoor bar with a small dance floors & swings for bar stools. Also we were checked in and out of the resort in a very timely manner. And our transportation was waiting for us when we arrived and was their to take us to the airport. All in all I definatly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Gave Wrong Rating”
Reviews.Author: BelizeQueen42
Reviews.Content: I wrote a long review and realized that I gave the resort a 2 rating opposed to a 4 rating. Gran Porto Real lived up to my expectations. We payed a great price and got more than we deserved. The drinks were good, food was good, staff was great. The kids club doesn't have a lot in the space but they keep your kids busy. They had many and most of the activities outside including playing in the childrens pool. My 8 year old came home wanting to make pinatas. (They were able to make their own pinata and take them home with them.) We were served food and drinks all day and never had to leave our lounger. That is a vacation. You have to make the most of it.

Reviews.Title: “Not thoroughly impressed! Not totally disappointed though!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Playa Del Carmen on our Honeymoon in May and we stayed at the Gran Porto Real. I read all of the reviews on here about being bumped and then I contacted by travel agent and she told me that they would not bump us because we went through a travel agency. That's a load of crap! We were bumped our first night to a standard room. We were offered one day all-inclusive for free but bargained a free lobster dinner and a free thirty minute massage. The massage sucked and the lobster was so small that I had to get a bag of doritos afterward to fill me up. However, we were moved to our Jr. Suite and everything was greate after that. The staff is friendly. I reccommend going all-inclusive if you like to drink or if you like to eat at the hotel all of the time, otherwise your blowing your money. There is construction across the street and every room on the street side has to deal with it. If you can't get on the oceanview side I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Porto real July 19-23. I had spent weeks reading TripAdvisor reviews of Gran Porto Real after we had already booked and paid for our trip. My expectations were somewhat skeptical and quite cautious. But all went quite well. When we arrived the junior suite and standard room we had reserved were not available, so they upgraded us to an ocean view junior suite and the master suite for one night. The kids got the former for the night! We weren't in the master suite long, but it provided a wonderful respite after a full day's travel, and the morning off the three baclony's overlooking the Carribbean made for some excellent pictures. We moved into the rooms we reserved later the first day, and they were just fine. In fact, the junior suite was excellent. The view off the balcony was over the back of the kitchen area and an alley way, but 90% of the view as jungle with houses popping up through it, so it was really rather quaint. Our teens' standard room was immediately adjacent to the more secluded and smaller third-floor pool on the street side of the hotel. The room was too small for four adults to enjoy much time in, but the kids liked it a lot. Food was very good (buffet) to excellent (Il Pescatore). Wait staff in all eating and bar areas were outstanding. You can tell that these people really appreciate having their jobs and genuinely like working with people. They respond graciously to tips we would consider average to below average in the states. (Ask for Pasqual at Il Pescatore.) The pool was marvelous. Never too crowded. Warm, but cool enough to relax from the hot sun and wet air. The view from the south end of the pool is beautiful, and it is the more relaxed end of the pool, as well. It's easy to claim most any set of poolside chairs you want prior to 7:00 a.m. And that is really perhaps the most beautiful time of day at the pool. On our last day when I went out at 6:30 to grab our five favorite seats, I look up and saw the Carnival cruise ship Elation anchored about 1 mile directly offshore of our hotel. It was a marvelous site. The beach is not fashionable. It is narrow in front of the property, the shallows are rocky, and the entire shoreline from Gran Porto to the ferry pier is crowded with fishing boats. But this gave us a sense of Playa's fishing village origins and made for a strong local flavor. We didn't mind the conditions of the beaches at all. North of the hotel a half block begins a long stretch of beach that most people would consider what they're looking for. It was nice. Our time at Gran Porto Real went too fast. The hotel is ideal for families, honeymooners, other couples, and even groups of singles who want a more laid back, not too party-hardy atmosphere (if you want the latter just walk up the beach 100 yards). It's not the kind of trip our family can repeat often, but if we do we won't hesitate to consider going there again. Our memories will always be very positive and enjoyable. We hope yours will be, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again til checkout”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip in 6 weeks to the Gran Porto Real. We stayed there 6 weeks ago, loved it so much, had to go back. I had read about the reviews here prior to our first trip, and was apprehensive. My review from that trip June 3-6 is here. I continued to read reviews, but was very comfortable booking a second time. We just returned yesterday. July 23-26. This trip we went through travelocity, the prior trip we used a local travel agent. I did as others have stated about on-line travel agencies. I called the on-line travel agency to confirm my reservation, and I was assured there would be no problem. Well that was a bag of lies. When we arrived, there was no copy of our reservation, and they could not find us in the computor. I showed them my printed email confirmation, and they gave us a room. I thought it would be smooth sailing. They even gave us black bands instead of yellow, indicating a returning guest. Our trip was great until the time to check out. They requested our credit card to pay for the stay. We explained that this was a prepaid trip, again showed them the printed email confirmation that clearly stated PREPAID. They, or the manager Nicolaus Vazquez, could have cared less. They demanded payment. We tried to be very civil and explain that their dispute was with travelocity, not us. All in all, they threatened to call the police if we did not pay. In the end, we did pay again for the same trip. I did not want to experience the Playa del Carmen jail. I have had no luck getting a refund as of yet. Travelocity has faxed the hotel a copy of the payment, at least that is what they have told me. One thing is for sure, I will NEVER use Travelocity again. Will I go back to GPR? At this point I am not sure. The hotel is great. The rooms clean. And the old saying Location, Location, Location!!! If you have had a similiar problem with this hotel, or with travelocity, email me at cphiltexasdoob@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at the Gran Porto Real (7/10 - 7/16). As many others have commented, we were very unsure of what to expect and prepared ourselves for the worst. This was completely unnecessary, as our stay far exceeded our expectations. The staff, the property, the food, the location.....everything about our vacation was perfect. We had absolutely no problem checking in. We arrived several hours before check-in and our room was ready. There were not any ocean view rooms available, but after stating how disappointed we were, they gave us a partial ocean view at no additional cost (which I almost recommend....the ocean view rooms face the pool and all the noise associated with that). The room faced the new hotel that is going up, however the constuction noise was never a problem. You hardly noticed it was going on. We stayed in a junior suite and was definitely worth the upgrade. The room was clean and beautiful....very comfortable, with your own private balcony. I cannot say enough about how accomodating the staff was. You should definitely find Jorge (waiter) at the pool on your first day....you will be fast friends. The activities, although sometimes repetitious, were always entertaining. We thought that the food was very good, especially the Italian restaurant ( Il Pescatore). Getting reservations was no problem, as long as you make them a day ahead of time. We ate at the two speciality restaurants a total of 4 times while we were there and had excellent service and food each time. The buffet was also good and didn't require a reservation at any time, but we definitely preferred the restaurants for dinner. As far as tipping goes, the staff does not expect it, so they are very appreciative when they do receive anything additional. As many others have stated, a dollor or two can go a long way in showing your appreciation.....and for us, we were happy to do it. Very rarely do you receive that kind of service here in the States. If your looking for a moderately priced hotel with service and amenities that far exceed what you pay, this is the place for you. We are already talking about planning a trip back to this same resort. Feel free to e-mail me with any questions you may have!

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast at Gran Porto”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the Gran Porto Real for our honeymoon, June 26-July 3, 2004. I figured we would get the run around with the rooms when we checked in that most of the other reviews stated, and sure enough we did. they still gave us a junior suite, but facing the construction. no big deal it was beautiful, and we did not care, we got their around 8:00pm, and by 9:15 the next morning, we were moved and upgraded (because of the honeymoon) to an oceanfront, junior suite that was just perfect!!!! the weather was hot, hot, hot, but no rain, so we dealt with it! the food was so, so, but when you are feeding that many people, you cannot expect too much. the Italian restaurant that you have to make reservations for was the best! awesome food, and service! jose was the best waiter there!!! i am not a coffee drinker at all, but you have to order the spanish coffee. if not for the drink, for the show, put it this way, it involves fire, and was so neat!!! we had no problems making reservations, and maybe had to change the time we wanted by 15 minutes, again, no big deal. we did not visit the other mexican restaurant that you had to make reservations for, we never heard good reviews when we were done there, but i cannot judge since we did not eat there. we spent most of the time up in the pool bar and met some wonderful people that we hope to stay in contact with. plan on tipping (if you feel they deserve it) they state it is included (if you go with the all inclusive) but we alays tipped our waiter at the italian restaurant, and also the bartendars (if we used them for a few drinks) but that was about it. Modesto was als great!!!! i was very skeptical about some of the reviews, but if you sit back, and enjoy, you will have a fabulous vacation! you are in sunny mexico!! :-) we would go back there given the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel, nice beach next door”
Reviews.Author: iluvvacay
Reviews.Content: CHECK IN ---We just returned from our trip june 26-july 3. Upon arriving we were not given our ocean front room either but were upgraded to a master suite with a jacuzzi the first night-non ocean view.My parents were put far down the hall at the end of the hotel and my sister was put at the hotel next door.with a jacuzzi in her room also. We did however receive the most beautiful ocean view rooms overlooking the gorgeous pool area, the next day at 11am. They were nice enough to keep us close together,(my sisters's family and my parents were with us) We all got ocean view rooms close to each other. THis hotel obviously overbooks and my guess is it is first come first serve, we arrived late at 9pm(problem with our flight) If we had arrived earlier maybe we would have gotten our correct room initially. ROOMS_____THis hotel is beautiful, the rooms are clean and beautifully decorated. Even the hallways are beautiful POOL___ THe pool area was fantastic, there are shallow ledges where you can lay in your lounge chair and the waiters,waitresses will bring drinks right to you. THE water was very very warm at least 90 degrees. FOOD___The food was excellent for breakfast and lunch but dinner was not what we are used to. THe breakfast buffet had an assortment of delicious fresh ripe fruits, cereal,sweet rolls,croissants,french toast,scrambled eggs,bacon sausage, also the had made to order omelets and pancakes. Lunch had a huge salad bar,all veggies and fruits-bring your favorite salad dressing and keep it in your minifridge in your room.they also had chicken ,fish,meat in chafing dishes all very good and on some days had freshly prepared tortillas and mexican chcken, delicious. DInner as I said was not great, The fish was good.lobster(surcharge) was good. we had excellent filet mignon once-the other nights it was not good. food presentation was very pretty. 5th avenue has some nice restaurants we wished we had tried instead. ALL INCLUSIVE VS. NON ---If we went back we would consider not all inclusive and just pay for breakfast or lunch each day and go out to dinner at night. 15 dollars U.S. breakfast,and 18 dollars for lunch. DRINKS__ THe drinks tasted good but were a little weak,but if you ask they will give you more alcohol-no problem, just tip them a dollar. Bring lots of singles with you. They don't have corona,but they have dos equis which was fine with us. THE BEACH-THe beach as you already know from the reviews had boats docked and you have to walk over some rocks in the water,but the beach at the new hotel they are building next door is beautiful. Just walk over there and don't bring valuables because there is unlimited access to the beach,there were some locals there and my sunglasses are gone now. I still don't know who took them-it could have been some other tourist at the hotel. Who knows. THe hotel next door is under construction-looks like it will be fabulous. SNORKELING_ we went to xcaret we did the underground river and snorkeled-lots of fish at the snorkel site,not in the river, but no coral. It was 50dollars plus 12 dollars for snorkel equip. rental. It cost 8 dollars to take a cab there. Go on your own don't pay the 79 for the tour.THis way you can come back when you want to. THEn we snorkled again,down the beach the abyss dive shop offers a 1 hour snorkel trip for 20 dollars-well worth it. MY RECOMMENDATION__ Would I go back? probably ,but I would possibly try not all inclusive,and eat dinner in town-I guess it depends how much you drink. It might pay to go all inclusive and just skip dinner and pay for dinner in town a few nights as you still might wind up ahead that way. IF you want a gorgeous hotel this is the place if you don't mind walking to the beach next door. It was fun going to walk on 5th ave at night to shop and look at all of the restaurants. NO AIR CONDITIONING IN RESTAURANTS--- BY the way, the restaurants are not air conditioned. They told us the italian one was and it was a bit cooler there but the doors and windows were open when we were there and the air was not on. I was fine with it, but my parents were uncomfortably warm. If you are looking for a gorgeous hotel,this is the place,by far the most beautiful place I've stayed.with a lovely friendly staff. you can e mail me if you have any questions iluvvacay@comcast.net

Reviews.Title: “horrible beach front”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel was beautiful but the BEACH was horrible .Unable to swim killer rocks unable to enjoy the beatiful water that the rivera mayan is noted for. In the early morning while walking close to beach front a horrible stinky smell water was cloudy and muddy looking . We have been to several other places and never encountered such disgusting beach front.WE vacationed there july4th til july11th. The buffet seemed to recycle there dishes. The staff was very friendly. We will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Look at Other Options”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had no problems checking in. The junior suite was wonderful. That's the good news. The bad news is...1. The beach, or lack of one. What is there, smells. Walk left of the pier and go to the rental palapas not far down the beach. Walk past the ones with yellow and blue chairs to the ones next to it with the blue and white striped chairs. They are half the price (6USD). 2. The pool. It is large but the water is hot. 3. The drinks. They are weak and served in small plastic glasses. 4. The food. it was average. I would suggest not going to an all-inclusive and eating in town. The downtown area was fun to go to. I would definitely go back to PDC but I would stay somewhere else. A place called the Shangri-La looked good and so did Las Palapas.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back ....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We'll start with the good. The "suites" are beautiful - huge showers, service staff are very friendly and offer great service - tip well!! Food wasn't too bad, not glamourous, but good. Just off the main shopping road in town. Great Spa - good service, and decent pricing. On to the bad - VERY annoying Recreation guy from Canada - loud and obnoxious - always screaming in the pool. Everything shuts down at midnight - there is a hospitality room with sandwich stuff and pop - but no booze anywhere. You have to leave the resort if you want something to do "late night". Small pool, that is always packed with people. Beach TOTALLY sucks - broken glass and butts everywhere. Boats all docked right in front of beach, if you want to go in, you have to push through the boats, and hope you don't hit your foot on their anchors. (It happens ... trust me). We didn't hate our vacation, but after spending a full week at an amazing resort in Cancun the week prior, we would never go back here. Might be fun if you're going with a bunch of friends to party - you'll just have to pay "on top" of your All-Inclusive fees to go and party elsewhere though.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings after Wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from my wedding at the GPR with very mixed feelings. I could go on forever, so I’ll just summarize: Front Desk / Reception: 3/10 The only reason I don’t give them a ‘0’ is because of the amount of abuse these employees take on a daily basis, i.e. We reserved a Jr. Suite w/ ocean view 6 MONTHS IN ADVANCE through Funjet. We also brought nearly 60 guests to the hotel for our wedding. But does this matter . . . NO. We still got downgraded our first night (plus they tried to put us in a room with twin beds!) & ended up bunking with my in-laws who were also bumped upon there arrival at midnight. Yes, I should have expected it, but the hotel/event manager (Walter) had our guest list well in advance & assured me that all of our guests’ reservations would be honored. In the end, nearly every single member of our wedding party was bumped to Bananas their first night or had to change rooms at least once. The confusion & anger caused by the VERY DELIBERATE & CALCULATED business strategy of the hotel management completely ruined my first day of vacation. They must make a killing shifting $300+/night hotel guests to a lesser hotel & merely tossing them a frozen lobster & massage in return. Luckily, our guests saved their frustration for the hotel & didn't blame us for our choice. Warning: Our Best Man booked his room through Expedia & they denied any knowledge of the reservation, forcing them to pony up for the reservation they already paid for. Another source of contention, I gave the concierge a folder with itineraries for newly arrived guests. She said she would take care of it, but when our guests asked about them, she had no idea. I guess they were promptly thrown away. Hotel Accomodations: 9/10 The hotel itself is gorgeous. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious. I even thought the ‘standard’ rooms were quite nice. The mustiness is to be expected in such a humid climate. Just bring Benadryl & leave your patio door/window cracked if possible to allow fresh air to circulate. The pool is terrific. Never too crowded during our stay. Activities all day, but easy to tune out from the other side of the pool. Best is the keg trolley. Nothing better than dozing on the beach & having someone push a cold beer into your hand! I had no problem with the beach. Kayaking was fun, plus the beach less than 100 yards north or south is pristine & free of boats. Restaurants: (8/10) Overall, I thought the food was great. The buffet varied daily & always had a terrific spread of fresh tropical fruits & veggies. The reservation restaurants were also quite nice, although I would pass on the lobster – obviously frozen & overcooked. Room service in the morning was the best – what a treat! As for watering down drinks, I never saw any evidence of this. Plus, how would you manage to drink all day on the beach with stiff drinks. The only problem is there seems to be a need for a system to handle non-AI guests. One of my friends ended up paying $11 for a hotdog at the beach grill & was treated rather shabbily. Employees: 9/10 All employees are extremely kind & helpful. Although they appreciate the tips, they never hover as in some resorts. We simply gave out good tips in the beginning & were well taken care of the rest of our stay. Wedding Services: 7/10 Patti was very helpful, but is stretched too thin from what I gather. We were not given the option of a rehearsal (which was difficult with the size of our wedding party) so had to handle it ourselves, and also felt a bit rushed through the planning process. The flowers, champagne, etc. were nice, but still felt contrived. The photographer & DJ were terrific, though. Bottom Line: They do A LOT of weddings at the GPR (we had to take a different route back to the reception after pictures since another wedding had started exactly 1 hour after ours). If you just want a standard, factory-issue wedding in the tropics, this is great. But if you want a larger wedding, with any personal touches, I’d suggest going somewhere else. In the end, I think that Chris & I would return to the Gran Porto. Yes, I was sorely disappointed with the handling of the reservations, & it did create an enormous amount of stress for me in the days leading up to the wedding. But if it were just the two of us, I think I could have handled being bumped one day. All in all the pros of Playa & the GPR well outweigh the cons – you just have to decide whether you & your travel partners are a good fit. Happy traveling! -Laura

Reviews.Title: “With some strategy...Gran Porto Real is well worth it”
Reviews.Author: ja_mayer
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen from 6/21-6/26. We were very concerned about the many reports we had heard of the hotel overbooking so we contacted our online travel agent and insisted that they give us some assurance that we would get the room we paid for and threatened to refuse payment in the event they gave us any trouble. We got an email confirmation from the hotel and fortunately checked in without any problem. In fact the reservation slip at the hotel had “no movar” written across the top! We highly recommend this strategy for anyone concerned. The room—a ocean view junior suite—was beautiful! Lots of character, wonderful ocean and pool view. We overheard people in the standard room complaining about the small size and calling it an “airplane bathroom”. The upgrade is well worth it. The room was not too noisy except for one night when there was a pool side wedding at the hotel, but they shut down the music at 11pm sharp, so it didn’t cause too much sleep disruption. Definitely take the ocean view. There was indeed lots of construction at their new hotel across the street. They claim it is opening in July, but it looks about 10% complete so I would assume there will be loud construction for quite some time on that side of the hotel. If you’re considering staying at the new hotel – DON’T! As for the beach, it is quite small and not the ideal place for spending time in the water. That said, it’s very picturesque with lots of fishing boats. Just 1min walk on the other side of the hotel is a wonderful beach. We did NOT do the all-inclusive. In fact, we made out much better. They charge about $60/pp per day for the all-inclusive option. We found it much cheaper and the food much better and much more exciting to go out and explore the town and different restaurants. We rented a car at the airport and really enjoyed having the flexibility of a car. The ride from Cancun to PDC was really easy. A 4 lane highway runs from Cancun down to Tulum. The highway is smooth and the resorts, towns and parks are clearly marked. DO NOT USE THRIFTY. We are fighting with them now as they attempted to rip us off. They claim that by law you have to pay a required $7/day liability charge that’s in addition to the price you pay to book, even if you book through Orbitz. Reality is that only THRIFTY charges this to unsuspecting tourists. No one else does this so use another rental company. Gas is about $2/gallon. We spent a morning in Tulum (approx 45 minute dirve from PDC) and then an afternoon at Yal-Ku Lagoon in Akumal. The fee at Tulum was about $3pp and Akumal was $6 per person but rental costs were additional – well worth it, probably the best snorkeling anywhere! There were tons of parrot fish and some people even saw turtles. We spent another morning in Coba (approx 1-1 ½ hrs from PDC). On the way back we stopped at Grand Cenote which was wonderful but expensive $8 per person—despite the name, this place is quite small, but well worth it with crystal clear water, caves to explore and cliffs to jump off of. We also spent a day in Xel Ha. It was very expensive $29 per person without any rental equipment. The snorkeling was great although the water was kind of cloudy. We saw tons of fish but no coral. Finding lunch was extremely frustrating - you are limited to a few restaurants in the park and the lines were long ALL afternoon – bring your own food! The Town of PDC is definitely NOT undiscovered. It’s like walking down 5th avenue of NYC with shops, restaurants and hosts constantly nagging you to come into their restaurant. One good thing – everything is negotiable, even your meal. You can negotiate easily for free drinks and sometimes even on price, especially for the fish of the day. Prices are NOT cheap – they price everything on normal American meal costs. As an ex jewelry retailer in the states I can honestly say that the silver in PDC is a rip-off. You’ll do better at Macy’s for price and quality. RESTAURANTS – in general everything on 5th Ave is overpriced. If you are willing to explore 10th and 15th Ave you’ll find some great bargains. Don't worry about what you eat, the places along 5th Ave. all use filtered water. Even the hotel had bottled water in the hallway. 100% Natural – trendy place focused on lots of fruits, oatmeal and neat juice concoctions. You sit outside in a pseudo rainforest. Major breakfast spot. Food was good, not great but they definitely charged tourist prices. Service was horrible! Hot! - great place for a quick breakfast. Very reasonable prices. Fresh bread cooked on the premises. Banana bread loaf was average, but the Hot Muffin sandwich with egg, cheese and Ham for $2 was awesome! There are two locations so it’s convenient from either side of the strip. Ajua – on 4th st between 5th and 10th ave. Fun place for dinner. Food was really good and the American owner is there every night to meet and greet and eat. The waiters are highly entertaining and personable. The live music is a great touch (although it ends at 9pm sharp). Drinks were overpriced, but the meal was great! We had fish and steak. The steak was among the best we’ve ever had anywhere and it was cheap! Agora—10th Ave—excellent Italian seafood and pasta!! Good prices! Great drinks! THIS PLACE IS A MUST STOP! Beware that portion sizes are VERY small so order appetizers! Frida Bar—great drinks and excellent banana flambé!! Really cool atmosphere in a hidden outdoor area. Fancy-looking place with NYC / Mexico mix. Prices were reasonable. Los Rancheros – On 5th ave between 4th and 6th. This place has the best view of any restaurant in PDC on a roof-top overlooking the ocean. That alone is probably worth the trip at night. Too hot to go during the day b/c you’ll bake on the roof. The food was nothing to get excited about. The drinks were great and big and reasonable. Try the Spanish Sangria! Caribbean Paradise Hotel bar-corner of Ave Constitutionales and 5th Ave—okay food. nothing special. Good prices. Skip it. Bip Bip-corner of Ave Constitutionales and 5th Ave—Outstanding lime soup and tacos. Good prices. Friendly service. Would have frequented this place if we had discovered it before our last day. Perfect spot to grab lunch and then get back to the beach. La Parilla - don’t get fooled by the crowds. This is a chain and the food suffers expectedly. Below average food, but fairly cheap. The Lime soup was really good actually. Although we’d like to say the banana flambé was good – definitely go to Frida bar instead for desert. Brazilian Steak House – For those of you who’ve never been to a brazilian steak house, this is a MUST. For those of you who have, you’ll understand that at $18/pp you can’t pass this up! The food was great and the service outstanding. Bring your appetite! Café Tropical – for breakfast it was decent. The much touted smoothies didn’t strike me as anything special, but for about $2.50 each they were a good value for their size. They have a nice 2nd floor which overlooks 5th ave. I would probably suggest this place is better for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
