Reviews.Content: overbooked? yes. however, they apologized and gave us a free lobster and champaigne dinner. club bananas doesn't even compare to gpr. but you don't have to stay there! we sent for gpr car to pick us up to take us back to gpr that night. we enjoyed the buffet and a guest host named rodi showed us around. we had the hotel car to take us back when we were ready. don't pay for a taxi to take you back and forth! tell them to send for one b/c you were sent there! our room was ready the next morning. it was jr suite garden view. the room was awesome, the view was not. construction was going on across the street. but we really didn't notice it. i recommend the ocean view. but the only time we were in our room was to sleep and shower. the staff was great. rodi told us of places that only the locals go to. underground cave for a restaurant and a salsa dance club called mombo club. we also walked everynight to the blue parrot. they don't have bar stools. they have swings! it is a fun place!they have a fire show at 11p.m. and then we danced until late. 5th street was also very interesting. i believe you can make it what you want. my best friend and i had a blast. great for family or couples too.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We attended a wedding and activities at the Gran Porto Real. Afterward, we were glad we didn't stay there. It appears to be the most exclusive place in Playa del Carmen until you see it up close. This resort seems to cater to a 20s and 30s party crowd who may not be particular about the quality of food or drink at this all-you-can-eat and drink resort. It's entirely possible that these hotel guests haven't experienced a truly exclusive resort before. Immediately adjacent to the beautiful beach-front rooms and balconies, Rock and Roll music blasts all day from huge speakers next to the pool, as well as next to beach chairs/umbrellas. The volley ball area is right in front of the beach chairs and umbrellas. If you want a peaceful beach experience you must walk 1/4 mile or more down the beach. The wedding reception we attended blared rock and roll music untill 11PM immediately in front of the hotel. A romantic walk along the promenade, by the pool, or on the beach, or a peaceful sleep was impossible. Unlike most of the beach in Playa and other areas, the beach in front of the hotel is very narrow, which exacerbates the problems. It's littered with seaweed and the water murky from the moored fishing boats bobbing up and down all day stirring up the water. Yes, it's a beach and some of this might be expected, however, after years of beach vacations around the world, this is one of the dirtiest beaches I've seen - up close in front of this "exclusive resort." The meals we ate (including salads and filet) were plain and bland and similar to cafeteria food. The local village restaurants on the other hand had outstanding and creative food. The drinks at the Porto Real were frozen and lacked distinctive taste. They reminded us of the frozen drinks you get at a fast food place from one of those machines that turns around all day; if you order a name-brand drink you pay extra; the service was slow. The inside of the hotel, while open and beautiful, is formal looking, very stuffy and hot. The overabundance of grounds staff was insultingly obnoxious and suspicious, of anyone who wasn't staying there. I saw five stars over the Grand Porto Real name on their sign. If it's a five-star resort, it feels as if they aren't used to five-star clientele. It looks classy on the surface, but the food, treatment and atmosphere are not five star. Trisha Avery

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, where can I begin? We had 3 couples stay at GPR, and we all loved it. It was our 2nd time there, so we were farmilar with the area. The staff was great. A few of the bartenders still remembered us from last time, and even remembered our names! The food was good, and i am a picky eater. We went with the AI, and never regreted it one bit. Our ocean front jr. suit was great, we got lucky and had 2 balconys. Room service was great, and really quick. The ladies that cleaned the rooms were very trustworthy also. One of the couples with us tipped her very well, and the last night we were there, she made a big swan sculpture kissing with towels and fresh flowers. They are very appreciative of any amount of tip you leave. Remember, they are picking up after you!! 5th Ave was great. One night we were there we went to Capt. Tutix, and seen the Chipindale dancers, (I got pulled on stage) and enjoyed every minute of it. I would also recommend going see the Bull fight in Cancun. It is every Wednesday. Well worth it, and something to see!!! We went deep sea fishing, sailing, rode scooters in Cozumel, Xcaret, and more exciting activities. We got back this pass Sunday on the 20th and already have reservations again for next May! If you have any questions, or want to know more, email me and i will be happy to fill you in on any questions! Thanks and have a great vacation!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a decent time...June 14-17, 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, where to begin? I had read people's comments & was quite nervous about going, but I had already paid for my trip in advance & couldn't cancel. For starters, the hotel is beautiful. There is plenty of ambiance & I did like the beach (despite the fishing boats). Compared to Cancun & Isla Mujeres, the surf was that perfect in-between: not too tranquil & not too rough. No doubt about it, Playa del Carmen has the best beach I've experienced. Our room wasn't ready, so we had a temporary room. We booked an ocean-view junior-suite, but the temp room was on the 2nd floor, so there was only a view of the pool & a large palm tree. I think it was room 264. Anyways, the ceiling had a leak & no one came to investigate, even though we made 2 calls. As a side note, if you asked for an ocean-view room, make sure it's on the 3rd floor! We were all-inclusive, so there were no complaints about the mini bar; a bottle of Orange Fanta did the trick on a hot night. Because our room wasn't ready, we were promised a 50 minute massage, which was then demoted into a 25 minute massage. Supposedly, the person at the front desk made an error. While I was debating with the desk assistant, I witnessed multiple parties of people being relocated because of overbooking. Our television service was inconsistent and we kept having problems with the balcony lights, so I gave up trying to read at night. As for the food, the restaurant Maria Margarita is tops. The buffet at the Albatross is good for only 1 thing, the produce! Their melons, mangos, etc. were very ripe & the veggies were good; no fruit flies or anything. The food was generally bland, but a little seasoning did the trick. I would stay away from the buffet desserts...far away. There was plenty of hospitality, all the way. Their activities were mediocre. I think that they are an exceptional establishment, but they promise too much & are unable to deliver. On a final note, my friend & I noticed the utter lack of diversity at the hotel. It could be the time that we were there (June 14-17), but we did not see any Asians & I was the only African American. I have Asian friends & African American friends; I know that we travel, but apparently, the Gran Porto Real was not on the "to visit" list. Because of my Latino family I was able to communicate with the hotel staff, so I felt welcome by them, as for the other hotel guests, my friend & I were glad to leave because the stares were often cold & chilly. If you decide to go, you might have a great time, but be prepared for anything, it's a real bag of tricks! No worries here, since I do not plan to return there. But Playa del Carmen & the Mayan Riviera will always be on my "to visit" list!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am not one to complain especially if I am fortunate enough to be on vaction but my husband and I both have to agree that this hotel is not what it seems. It is at best a three star hotel. First of all we did get bumped. No big deal but the new hotel was far worse than a three star. They did upgrade us to a suite the next day and the room was fabulous. It was very spacious and had a huge shower. The strange thing about this hotel the elevator does not even go up to the fifth floor so you have to walk up two flights of stairs get to the fifth floor where our friends room was. I felt the staff was less than desirable. The bell boys were nice and Modesto at the upper pool was great. The restuarants were not that great and were miserably hot. I hate to sound so negative and gripey but this vacation was a surprise for my husaband and and we were both very disappointed. I would not go back even if they gave me a free trip. Please listen to all of the reports I have been to Mexico numerous times and stayed at five star resorts before and this is not one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Gran Porto Real was truly great. My wife and I were a bit worried after reading some of the bad reviews on Trip Advisor, but our worries were put to rest when we arrived at the resort. Yes, they had over booked, but we actually received an upgraded room the first night. There is no way our stay could be improved upon. The food was excellent and the employees were very nice and helpful. Our room was like a palace, as was the resort. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Many People were Bumped while we were there”
Reviews.Author: OpusTheCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Club Bananas which is now owned by the same company as the Grand Porto Real. The two hotels now "share" the same beach club so we almost felt like we stayed at the Grand Porto. The hotel looks very nice but the beach is less than desireable, with fishing boats and fences strewn about the place. We ran into at least 5 couples who were "bumped" from the Gran Porto and put into other hotels, mainly Club Bananas. We loved Club Bananas but we paid three times less than the people being continually bumped. Overall we would not recommend this hotel unless you don't care about pre-arranged reservations. You can see our entire trip report at

Reviews.Title: “3 Weeks of Joy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well we had the luxury of staying 3-weeks in Playa, and all of it was at the Porto Real (April10th-May1st). There was a group of 20 that went down for my wedding(April 15th). The wedding co-ordinator Patty was fabulous and had nothing to worry about. All my guests had a great time and not a single complaint among the group. As for the negative reviews, I must admit I think those people are a little picky. Remember its not the Taj Mahal. My wife and I are 31 and 27 respectively with no kids. This may aid in your decision knowing from what view point this review is from. Our group ranged from 21 - 55 and all had the same opinion about the hotel. GREAT Hotel-It is gorgeus to much to say about decor. So I'll just say beautiful The Beach- It was great they cleaned off the seaweed the first day we were there and I never saw any greenery on the beach for the next three weeks. There were a few rocks under the water, but its the ocean. Next people will complain that there were fish in the water. The boats added to the Mexican Flavor. Talk with the locals out front to take you fishing. Four can go for the day for about $65 US total if you go through a charter some were asking 65$ Us per person. Front Desk- Yes they are rude. I did hear of overbooking, but it was for only one night and those guests got a free massage. Ladies, my wife said they massages are great. You are barely in your room the first night anyways. My group all had standard rooms, we payed for a junior suite and due to the wedding we were upgraded for free to an ocean view. Yes you can fit 10 people in a shower Staff- Service is next to none. The staff is fantastic. We really got know the staff because of our long stay. Jorge (Hor-Hay) is the greatest. He even bought us a wedding present. Talking with staff we found out that they make approx. $6.00 US a day. TIP it won't kill you, and the fantastic service is even better. Many of the people in our party work as servers or bartenders. They all admitted they would be fired in five minutes. Goes to show how hard working and friendly the staff is. Food & Beverage- The Buffet changes every day of the week and then repeats itself the following week. As stated 3-weeks of the same food, and we don't have a single complaint . We never ate out once, during our stay. The All Inclusive is worth the money. The Mexican Rest. was good but the Italian Rest. is the best. Don't forget the Ceasar salad. Guys when it comes to booze, if its not strong enough just ask for more. Canadian Boys, sorry no Crown Royal only JD. I did bartended in whenI was younger and NO! they don't water down the alcohol. They go through bottles like crazy and you can see them being opened right in front of you. It's easy to see the seels have not been cracked prior. Games Staff- They were great. volley ball / bike tours / tequilla water volleyball / relay races / bochi ball / yoga 5th Ave. - Wow! shop around and bargain, take your time there is always a better deal. We found that most of our purchases were 30-50% less then the listed price. The clubs- Dance until you drop Captain Tutiks and Blue parrot are party hardy. $20 US for all you can drink wrist bands or pay $6.00 US per drink. Excursions - Rent a Jeep and drive to Chitzen Itza, its normally about $80.00 US/person for a tour. Four of us went and it worked out to $55/couple for the car rental and entry fee. The drive is half the fun and you can stop along the way in all the little towns to shop, a whole lot cheaper. TAKE A MAP. Go to Cozumel and rent scooters and tour the island. Its nice to go at your own pace and the deserted beaches are amazing you can look for miles down and not see a sole. ***TIPS*** Don't lose your safe key. Its $125.00 US to replace. OOPS! (Yes for one little key / good scam) My wife almost didn't marry me. She divorced me when we got back because I found it in the bottom of my suitcase. Well, no divorce but close. When they say stay out of the pools after 11pm every night, because of chemicals. Make sure you listen its not a ploy to keep you out of the water and from making noise. Just ask my buddies about the slight skin irratation Watch the hospitality staff. It is a time share WAKE-UP. Many places prefer US$ to Pesoes / it was 10 pesoes for every US$ (EG. buy an item at 20US so logic is 200pesoes / wrong the price then becomes 230 pesoes / pay in US) for us Canadians we get screwed no matter what. We went through Air Transat / Christine the Rep. down there was great and assisted us with anything we needed or had questions about. If you have booking issues take her to the front desk with you. I saw her in action, trust me the people got the room they paid for. Guys go golfing at playa car. $95US after 2pm includes cart / drinks (yes beer) and food (sandwiches and chips) club rentals are $25 US BRING your own balls / I suggest a dozen. I normally shoot 85-90 on 18. I lost count and only had one ball left at the end of the round. The pro shop failed to tell us about two-steppers (a snake / get bit, two steps and dead) DON'T go in the bush to look for your balls. We had a couple little mexican grounds crew almost have heartattcks when the watched us walk in to the trees. They came running and screaming to advise us about the snakes. We will be going back without question. I will only say one negative thing and that is we could not stay a 4th week

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: Jessica925
Reviews.Content: i was with a wedding party and most of the guests were bumped to another resort due to...OVERBOOKING! We decided to not do the all inclusive and were treated like the red-headed step children. There are no systems in place for payment and staff is insultingly suspicious of anyone not on the inclusive plan. Erroneous charges were added to our bill as well. Beaches are ok, not great. pool is really nice. Staff is cordial and helpful enough but management seems to have major issues.

Reviews.Title: “Been twice and I will go again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to the GPR twice (June 2002 and June 2003). I loved it so much the first time, I planned my wedding and was married there the next year. There were only 4 of us the first year, but in 2002, we returned with a group of 30. We arrived around 10pm and everyone got their rooms. (no overbooking with our excursion) The wedding was absolutely beatiful and the staff was helpful and friendly. The even arranged a "wedding reception dinner" at the resturant next to the buffet with only several hours notice. I will absolutely go back! We went to Jamaica this year and I regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Texan55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Playa del Carmen on June 12,04. We stayed at the Gran Porto Real for 5 days and were very pleased with the whole experience. We had reserved two rooms with Jr. Ste. Ocean View and although one of our rooms had two double beds instead of a King we soon forgot this was a problem. We did the all inclusive and for the money this is the only way to go. The food was absolutely excellent and we ate in every restaurant and buffet they had. The service was first class. The ocean was beautiful and even the fishing boats did not bother us. My only advice would be to stay away from the Guest Services Representative. They are trying to sell you a Vacation Package that is not worth the money. All in all we had a wonderful time, encountered very few problems and will be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best all inclusive I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in several all inclusive resorts in Mexico and were favorably impressed with this one. The only problem we had, (and it appeared that everyone had this problem) was that no matter what you had paid in advance for an ocean view room, you were told that the only ones available were more expensive. I personally heard people at the desk negotiate for ocean view rooms for $20, $40 and $80 extra per night. We paid $40 extra per night and our friends who had booked the same package managed to get their ocean view room for $20. Room briberey aside, the hotel is beautiful. the service is great and the food is excellent. The Maria Margarita Restaurant was exceptional. The location is great - walking distance to everything-and the beach is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the GPR from May 31 - June 7. We booked it because a friend was married there June 5. Upon arrival, the front desk said they were completely booked and couldn't give us the room we paid for (Jr. Ste.), but they upgraded us (Jr. Ste. oceanview) for one night for free. The next day, we were put into a regular Jr. Ste. facing the construction on the 3rd floor. To me this room was fine, but my husband's sensitive nose said otherwise. He thought the room smelled like mildew, which I can understand considering the high humidity. The next day we asked for a different room, and it was no problem. We didn't notice the construction at all. Yes, there are boats and seaweed on the beach, but it didn't interfere with me laying under a palapa and reading a book. Just north of the resort, across the pier, is the same beach without boats. Some friends of our paid one of the fisherman to take them out for 2 hours and caught a marlin. The next day he took them out again to snorkel on a reef. We were on the All-Inclusive plan and loved it. My husband put his wallet in the room safe and left it there. The food was great in the two ala carte restaurants, and good at the buffet. Plus, you can order room service once a day on the plan. We took the Coba Pac Chen tour (aka "Mayan Boot Camp") and had a blast. In talking to other people, I would look into staying at the Iberostar Lindo next time, although it's not 2 blocks from downtown like the GPR is.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Negative Reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 8 days at Gran Porto Real that were reserved in January 2004. The issues of overbooking, disgusting beaches, and poor front desk service are 100% accurate. I wish I had known about TripAdvisor prior to booking the trip.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at Grand Porta with my family. We have 2 boys, 14 and 19. We arrived at 8pm to find that we did not have a room.....overbooked. We were taken 2 blocks away for the night. We returned the next morning for breakfast, got on swim suits and spent time at beach and pool until we got a room at 2pm. We were given an upgraded room with an ocean view. The facilities were beautiful. Room was clean, food good, pool nice. We did alot of walking on the beach to the north of the hotel. You could walk 1.5-1.75 miles with a great beach front. We found the Abyss dive shop (near Blue Parrot) We snorkeled 3 days, $20 per person. You took a small boat 10-15 minutes out. Our groups were 4-7 people. It was perfect with lots of individual guidance. Much better than going through the travel groups at the hotel. Do go to the Mexican and Italian restaurants. We ate at both 2 times. Also went out on a Hobe Cat for an hour....$40 for 2 people. Walked into mail strip a few times for a little shopping. Took an hour bike tour from the hotel's activities......an adventure but got to see areas of town that we would not have seen otherwise. After the initial shock of being bumped the vacation turned out great. My boys thought it was the best one we have taken. The construction across the street is to add 500 room to Grand Porta...............maybe overbooking will not be a problem then. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked- again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want stress in your vacation book here! They constantly overbook and ship you off to lower quality resorts- if they take care of you at all. I'd never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Picking a hotel on a budget (read):”
Reviews.Author: Blueglass74
Reviews.Content: I have been to playa del carmen and this note is just my personal opinion. This posting includes a couple of other hotel choices, things to do, and tourist scams to look out for: Gran Porto Real: is beautiful and right next to a nice pier, water, beach. This hotel is walking distance to the quaint SMALL town of playa del carmen. The town streets are paved with some type of brick material...beautiful. The hotel pool is small, but right on next to the beach. This hotel has a great view of sunrises in the morning. This is the best looking hotel there is in the actual city of playa del carmen! This is a kid friendly hotel (and those with out kids will enjoy it as well) If you are going to stay here, there is no reason to go all inclusive. For those that choose NOT to go all inclusive: You can find incredible food all up and down fifth street (two minute walk from Gran Porto Real). There are small bars near the hotel such as blue parrot hotel that have swings (yes swings for adults) and you can have a beer for next to nothing. Plus cokes, water, alcohol beverages are very cheap at all the convenience stores (you can even buy snacks and breakfast foods if you want). The seafood restaurants are amazing on 5th street. Most of the restaurants have a menu outside so you can see what they serve and their prices. If you want familiar food there is a burger king and a Fridays. However, the local food is so amazing. The restaurants there can fit any ones budget. The best CHEAP fish tacos in town is near a hotel called Hotel La Torturga. It is on the other side next to the best CHEAP pizza slice place (real Italian pizza...the workers are local, but you know it is real Italian when you taste it). The fish taco place is an open bar/restaurant next to the pizza place. If you want to go all inclusive, check out Adventura Spa twenty minutes south of playa del carmen. I just don't see any point of going all inclusive at gran porto real. If you are going to be going on excursions, most feed you and give you free drinks. Save your money and have more variety with the local restaurants. If you want to go all inclusive: I recommend Adventura Spa (adults only) 20 minutes south. Awesome!! If you have children, I recommend XPU-Ha palace also like 20 minutes south of playa del carmen. There are some great photos of these two hotels on ------------------. Gran Porto Real does not have any photos on this website. Other hotel suggestions: El Faro (not all inclusive), pricey...but cute...... Hotel La Tortuga is not all inclusive and not on the beach. However, they have private Jacuzzi on the roofs. I think they are less than $100.00 a night. The normal size rooms are like $50.00 a night. Talk about saving money! Blue Parrot hotel (not all inclusive on the beach) is another good choice, it is a bit pricey, but also near it all (watch out for the noise level. Please note these hotels do have a high level of NOISE....(Blue Parrot has a "happening bar" and El Faro is right next to the night life (behind it). If you have kids and on a budget, hotel la tortuga is a better choice (that is if you don't want to stay at Gran Porto Real..which is kid friendly) Hotels not to stay at: Mosquito Blue....to loud!! There is a huge bar across the street from it, not children friendly. Adults can't even sleep at night with all the noise. Things to do: Hope this helps, I love Playa Del Carmen...If you want to do some fun fun things, try Xel Ha (great all day snorkeling, tubing, jumping of a cliff, eating, bike riding, cave exploring (in the water). If you have children, I recommend Xcaret. It is a water park/small zoo...the show at night is amazing...they have dancers from every state of Mexico (small children may get bored with the show, but older than 10, they will love it). We loved the show, we did the dinner & show combination at xcaret. You do not have to get the dinner, but is great idea for honeymooners....the dinner is somewhat romantic with the candles and the great view of the arena where all the dancing takes place (men like the show as well..trust me..it is not a girly type of show). Also, there is a fairy that goes from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel. You might want to check the prices, it could be another fun trip to a different beach (just becareful about buying tickets on the street, if you do, make sure your hotel tells you exactly where to buy the tickets, there are some fairy ticket scams going on in playa del carmen). If you decide not to go all inclusive and want some extra tips, please feel free to email me at: Carries_addrs@yahoo.com p.s watch out for scams: don't fall for any timeshare scams at the cancun airport when you arrive, walk past the visitor center (all the people there will try to give you free tickets or cash to see a timeshare. You are in mexico, they will harrass you to NO end to buy timeshares. It is not worth the four hours to see the timeshares if you ask me, but that is up to you. At the airport, walk straight outside, there you will find your ride....Also, 90% of the travel agencies or rental car places also work for time shares!! If you give them cash to rent a car, they say for you to go see a timeshare, than they will give you the car. If you want to rent a car, do it off the web before you arrive. Have a great time, try to understand you are in a different country. If the locals yell at you to go into their shop, just know they have to feed their families as well. Just say "no thank you" if you are not interested.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not book at this hotel. They constantly overbook; treated us very rudely. Demand you sign waivers to get any room. Food is poor, beaches are a mess. You'll need traquilizers if you try to stay there. There are nice places in PDC- but this is not one of them. Avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for next year!!”
Reviews.Author: VBviaTENN
Reviews.Content: We (a group of 12) just returned from our 3rd straight year there!! It's a GREAT vacation and we can't wait for our 4th year!! The staff is very attentive and friendly. They work very hard to do all they can do to make your stay pleasant. I agree the boats take away from the otherwise, beautiful beach...and the construction is a bit noisy and distracting at times....but they certainly can't close down until they are finished. It's a great vacation...just go...and have a great time. You won't want to come back to reality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of these reviews I was getting nervous! I called and confirmed the room in advance, and just as they said everything was ready to go when we got there not a problem. Room was perfect, we didn't want to pay for the ocean view so we had the construction view. The only time I notice the construction going on was in the morning sitting on the patio, it was amusing watching the way they work compared to the good ole USA, they work very slowly. The when I watched the construction was the only time I even noticed it. The food was ok once you figured out what you could eat I wouldn't call it great, there are three different places to eat at night one will work out for you. I made up for lack of eating with the drinks. They don't water down the drinks, if you want more liquor in your drink ask and you'll get it. The beach was beautiful, the boats are parked there just move down the beach to a spot that doesn't have rocks and boats. It's not hard to figure out how to fix that. The activities at the pool during the day are fun to participate or just watch. The upstairs pool bar is just as fun if your looking to hide from the down stairs pool activities. I'm very active and most of my vacations are spent snow skiing, fishing in Canada, or doing a week long bike ride across the state of Iowa. Point is I'm not much of a complainer, but this trip was with a ex girlfriend that is a complainer and we both had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't that bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Porto Real from April 24-May 1 and I had a great time. Yes, there is construction going on across the street on a new resort, but its not like it kept me up all night or anything. We switched rooms part way through so we had more of a view of the ocean, but were still near the constuction. People say the food was bad, I say it was average. There are 2 restraunts where you can make reservations for them and the Italian rest. was wonderful! We ate there 3 times in a week. The Mexican rest. was good as well. Some of the food in the buffet was a bit odd, but during the day there is a buffet on the beach with burgers, fries, etc and it was good. I thought the service was wonderful and everyone was super friendly! There are always beach chairs available on the beach, although it is sometimes hard to find one by the pool. We just found chairs on the beach, by the pool and walked back and forth. The drinks aren't super strong, but with having it all inclusive you are going to be drinking tons anyways, so you don't want to get drunk off your first drink, do you? If you want them stronger, you can ask or we found watching them actually make the drink makes them a bit stronger. I'm 24 and went with my mom and had a great time. It was also a great place for families as well as couples. I would reccommend this place to anyone. The location is great being just 2 blocks from 5th Ave, the place to be in Playa del Carmen. Yes, the construction was too bad, but once its done it really will be wonderful. And everyone that I talked to that was at other resorts down there said the same thing about food, its just not the same as the US, but it really wasn't all that bad. Clean, friendly staff, and accommadating are all words I would use to describe this resort. Its not as bad as everyone on here makes it out to be! I guess most of the comments here are from people with bad experiences anyways, so I thought I'd share some positive views! Good luck, have fun, make the most out of it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what the reviews said.......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was hestitant about staying here after reading the reviews, but also heard it was a good place to stay. I am not one to argue, but will tell the truth if it doesn't go as good as expected. Well, after having experienced it first hand, we will not be staying here again. When we arrived and tried to check in, we heard the words, sorry, we are over-booked. So we preceeded to hear their apologies and they sent us to the Riu Playacar, where we were put in the very last room at the resort. We returned the next day to check-in, since they told us our room would be ready by noon. It was noon and the room was not ready, we had to wait approximately three hours before finally getting into the room that we had paid for when booking through our travel agent. The rooms are really nice, if you get an ocean view and not a view of the street with the construction. The ocean outside the resort is not the best as there are boats all over the place. The service was great by the pools and in the restaurants, although the front desk did not have any customer service at all. Nicholas is the front desk manager, not much help from him during our stay. If you want to go for the shopping it is great, becuase you are just a block away from 5th avenue, very convenient. My suggestion, is that if you book your trip to stay at the Gran Porto Real, expect to be moved to another hotel your first night or two, then things should calm down and you will be able to enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “It's not like we weren't warned...”
Reviews.Author: Tralvez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GPR for 8 nights from 5/7-15, and had read the reviews for some time, both good and bad. Our trip was booked through a travel agent for a ocean front jr. suite, and I had faxed and emailed the hotel several times for a confirmation directly from them. I finally received a return fax confirming our reservation so I figured that we had a 75/25 chance of getting the room that we booked. We wanted to stay there anyway for the location. Upon check-in we were advised that there were no jr. suites available so we were given a standard room in front of the 3rd. floor pool across from the new hotel construction, and told to check back with the front desk the following morning. The next day we were moved to a jr. suite, non ocean view for two days before we finally got a nice suite overlooking the ocean. Throughout these 3 days I was polite, but persistant with the front desk. So we got what we paid for 5 of the 8 nights. We had a pretty good time all in all, the staff was friendly, food was ok, the service was good and the location was what we wanted. There were a few groups of people that were pretty loud and obnoxious & inconsiderate of others, but they were just having a good time. They did make a poor impression on the guests from other countries. We would prefer not to worry about accommodations when we're on vacation to relax so we won't visit the GPR again, but for the moderate price it's alright if you're flexable. There are too many places and resorts where reservations are honored without a hassle, but we normally spend more than this trip cost. Overall the experience was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading many mixed reviews I decided to book this hotel via Expedia. Expedia assured nothing negative would take place as resorts never want to endanger the relationship. I booked the Gran Porto Real 2 months in advance, paid in full for Jr. Suite Ocean View, however on arrival on May 13th 2004 the Gran Port Real mgmt advised they over booked and this has never happened before. However it seemed to me that this resort is a well oiled machine as they had documentation prepared for our arrival advising that they are sorry for the inconvience and would like to put us up at a sister resort at no additional cost (God Bless them, BAHHH!). Looking around at the lobby there must have been at least five other couples in the same situation. I have zero desire to stay with an entity that appears to have this poor of a track record for a prolonged period of time and is willing to out right LIE and deceive customers. We asked for our money back, the Resort complied despite several attempts to persuade us to stay at their sister resort. We simply grabbed our bags and found another respectable hotel without all the LAME Big Resort allure. With over 20 to 25 Mexico trips under my belt raging from the 5 Star Hotel to camping on the beach for a surf trip, I have found the Gran Port Real to be the most deceiving place I have ever attempted to stay at. I can’t understand how a Mega resort can get booking’s wrong when even the small Nicer Resorts in Playa Del Carmen can such as Mosquito Blue or Desso. My opinion is Gran Port Real are simply money Mongrels and book the highest paying customer booting the rest to a sister resort. “No Gusto Gran Port Real” If you have an important trip planned such as a Honey Moon or simply care to relax AVOID THIS PLACE, if you want to gamble go to Vegas as the odds are more in your favor. See a web site I will put up later this week documenting this. (---), you can email me here and ask questions or recommendations of where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked Too!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes they over book. I even had my travel agent call the day before to verify.Yes our room would be ready>>>WRONG>>>We arrive May 5th to May 15th. when we arrived in late morning the desk clerk said our room wasn't ready and wanted to send us to another hotel. Well I let him have it and asked to see the manager,Nicholas. This guy is anti customer service. The sent us to the RIU Yucatan. We had booked ocean view jr suites,king size bed, one of the best rooms. At the RUI we are put in the back of the property , in a small room with double beds, no kings we available. Two days there. Then back to the Gran Porto Real. We arrived again at 10am and was told our room would be ready at noon. The customer service deck hit us up on the time share thing. 1-1/2 hours to kill so I took the $100.00 and left them standing. Once your there it's not bad. 1. Room was excellect , view great ocean front 2. Service: Excellect .The wait and bar staff were great. A special thanks to the entertain staff, they really had it together and worked hard to make the customer happy. 3 Food: All-inclusive after 10 days it was boring... 4. Beach: Coral and lots of fishing boats ..the beach at the RUI was excellent I might ad, what a beach in mexico should be. 5. Pool: no one could screw this one up. 6: People: 30-60 USA, & European's , Honeymooners...In 10 days I didn't see any roudys at all. Overall: If price is a issue go here...plan to be bumped for a few days. Will I go back...probably not...Too many other places to see. We cruised last year thats what we plan on doing next year. That is always fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hotel on May 13, 2004. We had two rooms booked. One oceanview and one standard that was eventualy upgraded to oceanview for $60.00. The front desk was very helpful putting these rooms side by side. I was hesitant after reading the negative reviews but found them to be most false. I have been to Cancun, Cozumel , and Playa at least ten times and found this resort to be the best. My only disappointment is on the second floor, palm trees block the view of the ocean. It is probably a better value to just take the standard room because on the first and second floors you can not see the water. They did ask us if we wanted to spend our last night at the sister property in Cancun due to overbooking. We declined and were never asked again. Food was excellent: Lasagna and Pasta, Steaks(1"thick), Beef and chicken fajitas prepared in front of you. Resort staff was friendly and maid service excellent. The best part is its proximity to the shops and restaurant and Ferry. I would definetly go back and highly recommend this resort. There was construction during the day on the new resort across the street, but no noise could be heard at night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do the all-inclusive-get an ocean front suite”
Reviews.Author: smgapp
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Porto real at the last minute when we could not get to Belize since my passport had expired. When we checked in, we were given a room that faced a construction site in the north- absolutely no view of the water. We kept trying to upgrade the room and were told the hotel was booked. The front desk manager was very rude and totally unaccomodating. I tried to make a phone call in the lobby to change hotels and the concierge called me over. He said he could change and upgrade our room if we went to their time share meeting for two hours the next day. We went to the meeting (took about 2 1/2 hours but included a breakfast). After the time share speech, they give you vouchers that can be used to cover the cost of the room upgrade or for optional tours.We were upgraded to a beautiful suite with a huge bath with walk-in tile shower, roman arches etc...We were across the street from construction but could see the ocean from our balcony. They work all hours on the construction, so there is constant noise but we were not in the room that often. I would definitely pay extra for the ocean view suite. It is well worth it. We did not do the all-inclusive and we were happy with that decision. There are so many wonderful outdoor restaurants within a few minutes walk of the hotel. Meals were very reasonable and it was fun to pick a new restaurant every night. We ate at the hotel a few times but did not enjoy the food. The pool side barbeque is about the only meal we liked. We loved all the meals on the main street in Playa. I highly recommend not doing the all inclusive at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Frustrating Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had booked our short 4 day, 3 night vacation for the Gran Porto Real. Upon arrival on thursday afternoon, we were told at the front desk that the hotel was overbooked, they didn't have a room for us and they would transport us to another resort. I've never had that happen before and we were annoyed but what could we do. They told us to come back to the hotel at 10:30 am the next day and our room would be ready. We arrived at 11:00 am and they said it the room wouldn't be ready until 1:00 pm. When the room was finally ready, it wasn't the room we had booked. He reserved a room with a king sized bed and instead got two double beds. We weree supposed to get ocean view, we got a view of the construction across the street. It was frustrating dealing with the front desk and we never got what we booked. The food was O.K. not great but not bad. The beach was poor to fair right at the hotel. There are fishing boats parked along the entire beachfront and little room to swim. On the plus side, the dining room staff and bell hops and most of the other employees were very friendly and helpful. We would Not go back to a Real resort again.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE, Absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Five star property? Nice try. This hotel is all smoke and mirrors. It looks beautiful on the outside and in some parts on the inside, but its all a joke. I wasn't given the room that I booked, but don't find fault with the hotel for that; I blame my travel agent. This hotel is VERY noisy-- and certainly not limited to construction noise (although it is a major drag to be sitting in a beach chair hearing either a jackhammer, a cement mixer or a dump truck.) The hotel's hallways are very noisy into the wee hours of the night --I was woken up by a teenage girl screaming outside my hotel door b/c there was a giant cockroach in the hallway. Needless to say it took awhile for me to get back to sleep. And then there was the smell of a backed up septic system in the morning hours. We didn't do the AI program b/c I'm a big fan of leaving the resort. We did have some meals on the property and the buffets were mediocre at best. I've stayed at many three star properties that were better than this place. The Porto Real isn't worth the money. Its location is good, but there are plenty of other properties in and around the area that are more beautiful. I've never regretted a travel decision more than this one!

Reviews.Title: “want to feel like you are always being scammed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The food was O.K. not much to write to trip advisor about. The beach was rocky, and the service was lousy at the front desk. You must be a very assertive person to get what you paid for. I spent our 2nd day of vacation going back and forth to the front desk asking to be moved to the ocean view suite that we paid for, not the construction view suite that we were in. An older couple that I met had paid for an ocean view suite and were stuck in a dumpy room for their whole vacation. Like I said, you must be assertive and annoying to the staff to get what you paid for, and who wants that hassle on vacation. The construction does go on all night. I found that the front desk staff was very rude. I find it amusing that the hotel across the street that is being built is a 6 star hotel. Who ever heard of a 6 star hotel...I guess they figured out that what they claim to be a 5 star hotel really isn't. If you want a hassle free vacation, go to another resort....

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the best time. The beach was amazing! The room was beautiful! The staff that was there was so nice and would get you anything that you needed. The night parties at the Sports bar were great. The entertainment staff (they did volleyball and pool stuff) were the nicest, funniest people in the world. The shopping was great and 5th Avenue was a hop, skip and a jump away, although we had so much fun at the hotel we didn't go into town much. The food was great! I would have to say that my husband and I will definitly be returning to the Gran Porto Real real soon.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible- Worst Place I've Been To”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the pits. There is nothing redeeming about the place. The rooms are shabby, the food is inedible and management could care less what you think. All of the lounge chairs at the pool and beach are broken, the towels are worn down to the core, did I mention the food is horrible, the drinks are watered down, etc. Save your money, go to another hotel in Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Porto Real!”
Reviews.Author: canadagurl
Reviews.Content: just got back from Porto Real,had a standard room facing the construction of the new resort,room ws ready when we arrived. noise not a problem. No problem getting our room,although we did over hear people who did not get their room and were moved to another resort then brought back. Service at the restaurants outstanding,pool & beach bar service excellent.Staff are so nice and friendly. Food was great everywhere,ate at both a la carte restaurants, enjoyed both. There are fishing boats anchored in front,they will take you out fishing for 50.00 an hour,saw people coming in with barracudas. There is no swimming directly in front of the resort. The beaches are public property.Tons of jelly fish,little tiny ones. Got stung on the lip snorkelling in COzumel no problem. Best thing about Porto Real, is the location 2 minutes to walk to 5th Ave and all the fun places to shop. Porto Real was offering guests to stay at their resort in Cancun Caribe Real for their last 2 nights,so we decided to take them up on the offer,they transferred us there, it was formerly the Continental Plaza,they are in the process of changing over. We were given a 3 level Villa with ocean view and private terrace,but no mini bar in the room, had to pay for the safe 3.00 everyday,. so we got ripped, because our mini bar was stocked daily at the Porto Real and safe was included, Porto real has interactive TV in the room,which for 5.00 an hour you can acess your email, they had 2 small TV's that werent really great in Cancun,the staff and service in Cancun was nothing near the Porto Real, it didnt take us long to get spoiled by staying at the Porto Real. The beach in Cancun surpasses the Porto Real. Great location in Cancun, walking distance to Jimmy Buffets Margaritaville and Malls. The new Real adult only resort across from the Porto Real should be ready in June 2004. We would go back to Porto Real again,

Reviews.Title: “You pays your money, you takes your chances.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice beach, beautiful weather, excellent staff (other than the front desk), great area, fun town, it would be perfect IF the resort would learn that when a guest is on vacation they chose the place they want to stay and do not want to be told the hotel is oversold. I have stayed in many resorts and have never been told that my reservation cannot be honored and I would have to stay in a place miles away. We booked 10 junior suites for a company trip. We arrived over a three-day period. Our first day arrivals were shuffled off to substandard locations. (Read the reviews for the Continental in Cancun) One in our party spent the entire first day of their vacation in three different hotels before finally getting back to Gran Porto Real. The only way the rest of us were able to get into the hotel was to have a standoff with the front desk until they finally came up with rooms for the rest of our party, and we all heard other guests involved in arguments with the front desk about overbooking. (Typical conversation-"I don't want a free body message tomorrow, I want to stay here tonight".) It is a shame, because Playa del Carmen is one of the nicest places I have visited. The water is clean, the beach area is fine (yes there are fishing boats moored there, but the waterfront is owned by the government and not the resort), plenty of shopping in the town that is only two blocks away, internet cafe close by. The Porto staff is amazing. Looks to me like the only problem is the ownership and management. We paid for about 35 nights of lodging with these people and this is how we were treated. Do you want to take that chance with your vacation?

Reviews.Title: “No worries”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: wow.. after reading some bad reviews, we had some anxieties about staying at the Gran Porto Real. Rest assured, this resort is well run folks !! Check in and out was quick and very pleasant. We did some days on the all inclusive plan and found it to be money well spent. Plenty of quality food and drink. The beach was clean, the rooms were spotless and well maintained. The restaurants were pleasant as well. Service was friendly and very accomodating. We figured the only people to write in most of the reviews were those with an "axe to grind." So, in support of the Gran Porto Real, dont hesitate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “It was a fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was quite concerned about the hotel after reading some of the reviews. My fears were a waste of time. The hotel was fantastic! The service was great and the rooms were excellent. Yes...there were fishing boats moored along the beach. It was quite quaint and added to the atmosphere. There was plenty of beach area that was free of boats. The construction across the street was not heard all week. There was no construction on the pier on the north end of the property. Noise and congestion was simply not an issue.The pool area was wonderfull. My drink would not even be empty and I was being handed a new one. The food, while not "excellent" was just fine and very plentiful. My kids (ages 8 & 12 ) loved the place. It was their favorite vacation by far. They had access to Kid Club and a variety of projects and activities.My travel agent screwed up and did not book us the ocean view junior suite we had requested. The hotel staff was more than helpful and got the oceanview room for us on our second day. I had to pay the increased cost....but it was not a problem.Travelers should have absolutely no qualms about staying at the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Gran orto Real AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Gran Porto real on April 10, 2004. The resort was fabulous. Service staff outstanding. We brought along our 4 year old daughter and she had a blast. The resort is very Kid friendly. The food was great also. It is typical of an all inclusive resort, a bit redundant, but certainly enough to choose from that you wouldn't go hungry. Alcohol is not top shelf, but 5th avenue is a short walk away where there is a vast selection of bars carrying top shelf liquor. The beer is very good and an abundant supply. They are building a sister hotel across the street, however we weren't bothered by this. In Mexico they don't work as fast and furiously on construction sites as they do in the Northeast. The beach has alot of boats moored, but you can take a short walk up the beach to undisturbed areas. There are plenty of excursions that you can book right at the hotel. We went to Xcaret for the day and that was beautiful as well. 75.00 per person US and children under 5 free. The show they have in the evening from 7-9pm is worth the admission price alone. The only warning about the Gran I have is that you bring shoes that have a good grip. The whole resort is marble and tile and is very slippery. The pool area is extemely slippery from sand and suntan oil and water. Don't run!!!! I witnessed many a child, mine included fall down and scrape their little knees. They could do a better job at keeping this area less slick. No problems with our room reservation upon arrival. We booked through TNT. We were never approached by timeshare people either. I have been to many caribbean all inclusive resorts (never a Sandals, Beaches or Breezes) and this was clearly the best I have been to. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone. The folks that had such outrageous complaints on this site must be very difficult to please or just downright miserable and shouldn't leave their home. If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to email me at Thecleaningadvantage@comcast.net

Reviews.Title: “we love the gran porto real and playa!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: quirada
Reviews.Content: my husband and I and our two teenaged sons (19 and 16) stayed all inclusive at the gran porto real. (feb20-27/2004)The food was excellent with something new offered at the buffet every day. We also went ala carte at the italian and mexican restaurants there.(be sure to note the dress code)It was a short walk to 5th avenue where theres shopping,shopping, and more shopping along with tons of restaurants,our favourite was carlos and charlies. Our junior suite was incredible ,king bed,lovely patio,huge huge shower.The boys had a standard room.The service thru-out the hotel was exellent. The kids had a great time at a club called the Blue Parrot. They met alot of kids their age.We spent a portion of each evening enjoying 5th avenue nite life and at the sports bar at the hotel which had some unique entertainment.We have highly recommended this resort to personal friends and family and anyone who asks!!!Our friends just booked their trip at the gran in playa and they will not be dissapointed!!!!!!!! ken and karen dueck, abbotsford bc canada

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this place!!”
Reviews.Author: MNtravelersfromChan
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Porto Real, but our first visit with our two kids. What we like about the resort is the cleanliness, friendly staff, and we really like the size and proximity to everything. We like the location. We can easily walk two blocks up the street to 5th Ave. each night whether we want to shop, browse, people watch or just tale a walk. If you don't want alot of the same food every day, then don't go all-inclusive. We went all inclusive but also ate dinner three of the nights elsewhere. The kids (ages 4 & 7) both enjoyed the kids club activities. After reading several reviews before we went, I tokk it upon myself to ask several different guests how they liked this resort...and guess what?...9 out of 10 absolutely loved it. So I guess the people who complain and hard to please. We may be going there again next spring 2005.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for the Third time.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to the Gran Porto Real. My fiance had the opportunity to any resort we want in Playa and we chose to go back here. We have had a had a wonderful experience every time. We stayed for seven nights this time rather then the 4. First, there is construction. Solution: book a jr suite oceanview. The new hotel is to open this summer, we may try that out too. We were in room 329 and it does not get any better than this room. Staff is always friendly, helpful, and just great to be around. They seem to have decorated the dining room more this year, as well as adding a pool buffet. Il Pescatore is the better of the two reservation restaurants. We pretty much ate out every night in Playa. You are on vacation, live a little! The hotel is kept spotless. I am picky. I stay in 5 star domestic hotels all the time for business, so I am picky. No complaint with the Jr. Suite Oceanviw, with the hammock. We loved being under the tiki type huts all day. Lots of activities (horseshoe, water volleyball) if you choose, or just lay around (which I did) drinking a miami vice frozen drink. Great kids activities as well. The only negative is the some problems with the beach. In 9 months it has changed a lot. They put a stupid dock in and it seems to have caused some erosion issues, the hotel is on top it though, spending lots of $$ to try to find a solution. Water is still beautiful. You can walk 100 yards and have the perfect sand beach. We walked it alot. The town of playa is great. Lots of food, shops, and music. Very nice for romance. We even went off the beaten path and visited some true local establishments. Loved the diversity of the people. We are going back again, next March or April. In closing: use a reputable agent (we did AA vacations), don't book a standard, and chill out you are on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort in Playa Del Carmen!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews. What a surprise! Sure the people who booked a junior suite on the street side should have been told prior to arrival about the construction noise and dust. But the front desk staff were quick to make a switch when requested. The staff are fantastic, Eli, Fatima, Teresa, David, Gerardo, Ileana just to name a few. The food in the buffet,Mexican and Italian dining rooms was varied and excellent quality. Maybe the complainers don't travel much. The rooms were outstanding in cleanliness and features. We never had a problem with the boats, thought it was picturesque. Drinks, wine, beer and mixed were better than average. Would we stay here again? Absolutely!!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto has pros & cons”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I too read the bad reviews about room switching before I got here. Guess what? I got a room upgrade! And, I didn't ask for it. The desk clerk told me I was getting it! Here is the low down as I see it: 1) I booked the standard room, can't go any lower than that. And the standard room is fine. One person complained on this site that the bathroom was in-accessible. The bathroom is not extra large like another bedroom. I would submit that the person making that statement had a severe weight problem. 2) We booked Liberty Travel and I had travel insurance. I told my travel agent about my concern, his reply was they won't mess with you because we send too many people to them. In fact we got black wrist bands! We were VIP but can't figure out why. In all these cases I always deal with a national travel agent & I know his name & phone number, because if there is a problem, it is now HIS problem! And with the insurance, I'll be happy to make a claim if my vacation was not all that I was promised it would be. I think that helps. Our room was at the back of the hotel. It faced the construction of the new hotel across the street, BUT, I was at the beach most times and didn't hear any construction. The staff is excellent, any experienced all-inclusive traveler knows that a dollar goes a long way down here. So what's good? This is the best hotel closest to town. We walked 2 blocks every night and got into the heart of town. And walked home after partying. What else? We are very athletic and ran into Playa Car every day. Example: The Iberostar was probably 3 miles from town. But the beach was beautiful. Bottom line: each property has its pro & con. We chose Gran Porto Reale because it is very close to town. And we went in town every night. Maybe next time we will go to the Iberostar and be stuck on the resort (too far to walk to town) BUT, the beach is better. Folks, all these hotels are really 3 star, and that is OKAY. I have stayed at many all-inclusives including Sandels. Same thing: pro & con, in parts of the Caribbeane the resort is beautiful, but if you leave its going to get scarey. Take it in stride. Proximity to town: stay ay Gran Porto. Want beach & pay for taxi to town & back, stay in Playa Car about 3 miles, maybe hard if you are partying all night.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Gran Porto Real for a week and absolutely loved it! Everyone was so friendly, very clean. We stayed in an Ocean View Jr. Suite and could not have been more pleased. We arrived on a Monday approximately 5:30 PM and everything was ready for us. We did not do an all-inclusive because we did not want to eat and drink continuously. Instead, we went for a walk on the beach every morning and found a different restaurant or hotel nearby for breakfast. What an experience! Also, there were so many restaurants that we could walk to for dinner and cocktails. Never had a bad experience...I can't say enough how wonderful it was. We are in our 40's and love to have a great time. The best part was...there wasn't any college kids that were out of control...like in Cancun. There were many families there, also. I can't say enough about Gran Porto Real. Have a great time...you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Porto Gran Real and cannot speak highly enough of the service, accomodations, food, and efficiency I experienced there. Every little detail was perfecto! The reviews that I have been reading must have been from people that are mistaking the Porto for someplace else! Despite being there during Spring Break the hotel did not deter from excellence in any way. I highly recommend this resort and will be returning in the future. Oh, and you HAVE TO try the chips, pico, and guacamole by the pool in the afternoon. I am salavating just thinking about them!

Reviews.Title: “Our Family Loved the Gran Porto Real !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome stay at the Gran Porto!! My wife and I, and our four daughters, ages 11 to 17, had a great March Break in Mexico. Before we arrived, we had planned to do at least one day trip excursion during out visit, but we were having such a good time at the Gran Porto that we chose to just stay at the resort for the whole week and continue to enjoy all it had to offer. We had booked our vacation in October, requesting adjoining Jr Suite Ocean Views. When we arrived, there were not two adjoining rooms available for us, which was disappointing, (in reality they were about 6 rooms apart .. not a big deal) but the Staff worked hard on this and by the next morning had made arrangements to provide two rooms beside each other. So that helped us settle in, based on their quick resolution of the issue. From there, we had a blast!! The Sports and Entertainment team are amazing. They are a high energy team that create a fun and enthusiastic environment for those of all ages. We have great memories of water aroebics (my arms still hurt), Mexican Bingo, Bocce ball, Braiding lessons, Beach Volleyball, Water Volleyball, a Bike Tour through town, snorkelling, boogie boarding, painting Mexican pottery, and on and on. The staff also put on entertainment each night, which was very entertaining and demonstrated the personal commitment that each of this team was making to ensure that we would have a good time. Shows ranged from a Mayan/Inca festival, to a Michel Jackson review, to a Comedy night. All were great! The Beachfront waiters and Bar staff were also very attentive, as their drinks were great, and the service was top-notch. We actually said "no" more times than "yes" to their offers to get us drinks, as they always seemed to be available to serve us. The swimming was quite good, as there was a nice sandy beach with just the right aount of wave action to make it fun. There were plenty of beach chairs, and the staff would bring extras if required. The food was very good, and the restaurant staff are very attentive and extremely professional. The Mexian Restaurant obviously prepares food differently than we may eat in Canada, but it was all very good, and our daughters ordered from the menu and were prepared to experiment. They have a menu that changes each day so check ahead. The Italian restaurant was first-class and had a great menu. We had so much fun at the evening dinners with great memories and great photo opportunities created. It was easy to book reservations, up to two nights ahead, and we had no problems getting times we wanted. After dinners we would often walk to Fifth Avenue, which was a great surprise that it was such a fun shopping area, plus so close to the resort. This is a big bonus of staying at the Gran Porto. Playa del Carman is a fishing village, so you see a lot of fishing boats moored in front of the resort. To us, this gave the place a lot of character, watching the fisherman coming and going each day, plus watching them return with their catch. We would have only one hesitiation about going back to the Gran Porto....... will it really be this great the second time!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, quit compaining!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the best place ever!! I really don't know why people compain about it so much. It's definately the best resort in Playa Del Carmen , and has the BEST location around! The staff is sooooo friendly and I would stay again anytime. I do agree that the food is not the best, but that couldn't hinder my great experience with the Gran Porto Real. And to comment of the construction, I never even noticed that it was going on and it's barely audible and defintely not a problem. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest place to stay!! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I truly can not believe some of the negative responses that I am reading here!! I am wondering if they truly stayed at the same Porto Real I did!!! I have been three times now (in October) and I am returning again this October for my fourth trip. I travel with atleast 16 -18 people each time. The service is excellant!! When I travel, to me it is not only the accomodations that is important, but the customer service!!! As long as someone is waiting on me, bringing me food and drink, I am a happy camper. The staff at Porto Real go out of their way to keep you happy. All you need to do is ask! The location is great! You are in walking distance to the Avenue. No cab needed!!! As far as the boats on the beach, Hello!!! if you would read, you would find out that it used to be a fishing village, and people still fish there. I love the fact that I can still see the people who live there go fishing and bring their catch in every day. If you ask, they will take you with them!! We had a guy with us who all he did was fish with a local man on his boat all week!!! He thought he died and went to heaven. He is going back in October just to fish with the people who live there!! At Porto Real, I can eat when I want to eat, drink when I want to drink, and if I am hungry at 3:00 in the morning, I wander down to the all night cafe they have a grab a sandwich!! Anyway, I highly recommend Porto Real, truly looking forward to the opening of their new hotel next door. (I know it will be worth the little bit of inconveniece we had with noise last October) I don't know about everyone else, but I do not stay in my room but to get shower and grab some sleep anyway!! To much going on around me!

Reviews.Title: “No room at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Playa del Carmen on Feb 5th with confirmed reservations for one week at the Gran Porto Real. On arrival at the hotel, they told us they did not have a room for us because the hotel was full and after much conversation admitted that it was due to overbooking. They said that they would have to put us up in another hotel for one night and they would have a room for us the next day. We were taken to the Moon Palace Hotel, forty minutes away (almost back to the airport at Cancun). Admittedly, the Moon Palace was very nice although in a secluded location and not in town where we wanted to be. The next day (after several calls and an hour later than the time they had promised) we were picked up and taken back to the Porto Real where we got the ocean view, junior suite that we had been originally promised. The hotel had a mixture of guests, some on an all-inclusive plan and some like us on European plan. In return for our inconvenience the hotel agreed to give us free breakfast for the rest of our stay. While we were waiting for the room to be ready, I noticed that they had coffee and tea set up on a table in the lobby. There was no sign indicating that this setup was restricted in any way and no one seemed to be in charge of serving or anything, so I had a cup of tea. As we were leaving the area to go to our room, a hotel girl came up to me and said that there would be a $2.00 charge for the tea since we were only entitled to breakfast for free and this was around noon. When I objected to this and said there was no indication of the charge at the table, she said ?I am only doing my job.? However, when my husband complained about it afterward at the desk, the charge was removed from the bill. The hotel is very nice in a good location. Rooms are large with a large bathroom and shower. Our room was on the first floor and a great spot to watch the world go by, including two weddings at the hotel. Breakfast was good and service fine. People complain about the beach, which has fishing boats tied up and makes it difficult to walk. I didn?t find it a problem. They are constructing a new wing across the street, which will have a minimal ocean view. Would I return to this hotel, I think not. I now understand that the overbooking problem is not unusual and you never know if you will hav e a room when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair in Hotel Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Rolstoel
Reviews.Content: We staid at the Hotel Gran Porto Real between 9 and 16the of April, which is only one block from Quinta Avenida and the center of Playa del Carmen. So you can walk to the center and visit all the shops, restaurant, bars, ferry to Cozumel, etc. You don't need the all-inclusive concept here. Try all the restaurants for breakfest, lunch and dinner. It's cheaper and more fun to try the local food. The hotel itself is very clean, the staff very friendly, but at this time a construction site opposite to the hotel gives a lot of noise from 7 am to 7 pm for those with a room a the streetside (all accessible rooms). You can reach the swimmingpool without thresholds. The beach is not accessible from the swimmingpool, but it is from the streetside. The sand is very dense and the sea as bleu as in the pictures.These accessible rooms/ hotel are/is not as accessible as you want them/it to be. My husband depends on his powered wheelchair and cannot stand or walk at all. You can only enter the hotel by a very steap slope. Only a powered wheelchair can manage this, but you have to be carefull not to be thrown over backwards. The accessible rooms are all at the groundfloor at the streetside. The doorways are wide enough. The rooms have a step to overcome with a wooden slope not so steap. The bed is at seating height and is kingsize. The balcony is very small, you cannot turn around. The doorway to the balcony has a little threshold to overcome easily. The big problem was the bathroom. Allthough the rooms and the bathroom is beautiful furnished, the bathroom is inaccessible. The doorway is wide enough to enter the bathroom. There is enough space to turn around. There is a wheel-in-shower without grabbars or showerseat. It has a fixed showerhead and the controls are placed at 120 cm/4 feet. The washbasin is to high (1 meter, 3 feet), placed in a shelf and the controls are at the back. You have free space underneath the washbasin. The toilet is inaccessible. You cannot place your wheelchair next to it, it has no grabbars or other aids. So if you have to use it take a very strong friend, wife, husband or whoever with you to lift you.If you can overcome these shortcomings you will have a holiday of a lifetime. Friendly and helpful Mexican people, good food for low price (breakfest 35 pesos/hotel breakfest buffet 150 pesos, dinner 80 pesos), perfect beer, cocktails and smoothies (try), ideal weather, beautiful Mayasites (rented a Ford Econoline), amazing historical and folkes show in themepark Xcaret, a nice visit to Cozumel by boat, checking your email and a lot of shopping for souvenirs.Tip: Take ramps with you. Tie them to your wheelchair before checking in at the airport of departure. They can be helpful to enter the boat or the enter the car or any difference in height you want to overcome.Tip: Show yourself at all cashiers. You may get a discount to the admission charge.Tip: Bring some spare fuses for your wheelchair.Tip: Mexico has 110 Volt. Take a converter if your powered wheelchair charger depends on 220 Volts.And at last forget all the trouble that can occur maybe, discover the world and show everyone that wheelchair users can be as adventurous as anyone else. You will enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Best All inclusive we have been to!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews,we were hesitant about staying at Gran Porto Real. However after some room negotiations(desk staff were very helpful),we ended up in a fabulous ocean front room.One tip when you are booking your trip-make sure you book an ocean front room-it is worth the extra money.The hotel is beautiful and the staff were all very friendly and MOST helpful.We enjoyed the restaurants especially the Italian.We have been to several all inclusives and have never enjoyed the food so we were pleasantly surprised.We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “would not go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Playa del Carmen from Feb 21-Feb 25, 2004---and although we LOVED the location and had a wonderful time, it was all despite this really strange experience called Gran Porto Real......Our OceanView Jr. Suite was not ready on arrival. we had to switch rooms later in our stay. This is a common occurence here. We were told there were tennis courts there---but when we went to inquire for court time, told the courts were demolished and will be rebuilt. All in all it's really just an average place trying to be a deluxe resort...So keep that in mind. The service was excellent (great people), the food (breakfast was good) and drink mediocre---the rooms nice.....BUT I would not go back. The best part of this hotel is it's great location to the newer part of the town...We so enjoyed walking into the town.

Reviews.Title: “Another Beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our vacation and have had time to cool down. We were victims along with several others. The Hotel was beautiful and was by far the best hotel right in town but we had a very rough beginning. We were told that we would either have a view of the ocean or the pool when we booked our hotel room through out travel agent. When we checked in, we had a horrible view of a construction site. We were unable to sit out on our balcony or have the balcony door open due to the noise. Although the bellboy assured us that the noise would only be from 8am-6pm, the noise continued all night long. We were told by a very rude manager that we should contact our travel agent. This was not our agents fault!!! The literature that was provided to describe the room was very misleading. If you want an oceanview room make sure you are not only upgrading to the Jr. Suite but you are also specifying the Deluxe Jr. Suite. We were so upset that we chose not to spend any additional money at this hotel and we stuck to it. Too bad for them.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Vacation-So quit complaining!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Gran Porto Real in September of 2003 for our honeymoon. We stayed in an all-inclusive oceanfront jr suite, which by the way was wonderful!! Like many, I read the reviews on the resort and was very nervous about staying there. When we got there the front desk staff was very helpful and courteous, we waited for the bell boy to come back and he took us to our room and explained all that was available to us. The resort was beautiful, the staff was wonderful and always there to be helpful. Everything about our stay was great!! The breakfast buffet was our favorite meal. The italian place had very good steak and lobster. A lot of people complain about the drinks being watered down, all you have to do is ask for mucho alcohol and the bar tenders are more than happy ablige your request, in fact I think they enjoy it. If you go to Porto Real and you don't get good service it is probably because you don't tip. 5th ave. was probably our favorite place to spend time, outside of the resort, it was fun bargainig w/ the shop owners.
