Inside of the resort our favorite place was the swim-up-bar on the 3rd floor, it is a little difficult to find but, find it, it is the best place to hang out because most people don't know where it is so it is not crowded and you don't have to wait for drinks, the only down side is that it the bar closes at 5pm. We also went to cozumel on a snorkeling trip which was also very enjoyable. One problem that we had is that our alarm clock did not work right, but who cares, your on vacation you don't need an alarm. Also, the only other problem was making phone calls back to the US, but this is not the fault of Gran Porto Real. So all in all I must say we had the best time at Porto Real. It is close to everything and it is not in one of those "fake hotel zone" resorts where everything is "too beautiful" to be real. Vacation is what you make of it and if you have a bad vacation at Gran Porto Real then it is probably because you didn't want to have a good time in the first place. I just want to say shame on those of you who are so picky that you can't enjoy a beautiful place when it is put right in front of you. Also, shame on you who put bad reviews on here and made me a nervous reck on the plane ride to Mexico because I was so worried that this was a bad resort. I loved it and as long as you want to have a good time you will and if you are polite to the help and tip them then you will recieve good service, which I would think would be common sense.

Reviews.Title: “Problems Are Real, Still A Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in January 2004 for one week on an all-inclusive. The ocean-view suite, booked six months in advance, was not available and we were given a room facing the construction. They promised a move the next day, and this happened I think only because we pushed them hard to give us the promised room - three trips to the front desk to keep them moving. There were at least 14 other couples on the list in front of us who had also been "overbooked" and were changing rooms on the same day as us. The reviews about the place are accurate - food good in the Italian place, very little choice in the Mexican place, mediocre food in the buffet place. Breakfasts are good but don't expect to ever see bacon. Beach is okay, but if you don't throw a beach towel on one of the chairs before 8am then don't expect to be sitting on one any time soon. Drifters from outside the hotel sometimes take a chair for the day, leaving guests without one. The food is not American, it's the Mexican version of what they think is American, and that is not the same thing. On the plus side, this hotel could win many awards for its architecture, which is first class and a work of art. You are a one minute walk from town. The sunsets are gorgeous. There is a good wading and swimming area. The bars are great and you get prompt beach service. To us, it's the best place in Playa Del Carmen and the only one I would stay at in this town, having checked out most of the others. It's easy to realize that you are not in America here - but if you are comfortable with Mexico (and get the right room) then you can have a good time at the Real.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO GO!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was probably the best hotel to stay at in the town of Playa Del Carmen (nicest looking one also) and the location was great. I thought the service and food was great!! The beach infront of the hotel wasn't the best but you could also go south or north of the hotel to get a better beach section. I thought 5th avenue was great! A lot of fun places to eat and shop. We did do the all-inclusive, which I highly recommend! It's nice to know you don't have to worry about paying for drinks and food. We plan on returning to this hotel/area in the future. So I am not sure why people were complaining about this hotel. Remember you are in a different country! I had a GREAT time.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: elation
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from the Gran Porto Real resort after a week's stay from 2/20-2/28/04. I was very nervous about our trip after reading about all the problems people had with overbooking. I did book the trip through a large travel agency and they checked and assured me that they had not had one complaint about booking problems with the hotel. As promised, our oceanview jr. suite was waiting for us upon arrival. We were on the second floor, right over the pool, and yes the ocean view is partially blocked by the trees, but it was still beautiful, and very adequate. The room itself was spotless, and we enjoyed the hammock on the balcony. We were never bothered once by the construction; did not even hear it. My two children, ages 11 and 15, loved every minute of the vacation. They played in the daily ping-pong tournaments, played pool, and loved the casino night. The pool is large enough, and very clean. We did go out early every day to get chairs by the pool or the beach. The beach is somewhat eroded, but we met a man there who is working with the hotel on a major beach reclamation project. He felt that with some stormy weather, the beach could be rebuilt in a matter of weeks. That is the only area where I feel the hotel was not 5-star. The hotel staff is excellent, from the maids (who left us beautiful swan towels on the beds) to the waiters (especially Eliazar). Another huge plus is the walking distance to downtown. My kids loved going down to 5th avenue every night after dinner. There are some great deals , and the safe fun atmosphere of the street was a huge plus. We went to Xel--Ha, which was a fun day. We did not enjoy the trip to Cozumel, which included snorkeling and a jeep ride through the jungle. The weather was too perfect to be riding for hours in a caravan of hot, dusty jeeps. We have been to many islands, but this was right up there as one of our best vacations ever. We would definitely go back to the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “best resort ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I had a wonderful stay there in January of 2003. We also had a room problem at first (first floor near construction site), bet they immediately addressed that situation for us and transfered us in the room we had initially reserved...a Junior Suite with oceanview. I found the staff to be very accomodating, and polite. The meals were gread, I enjoyed ? la Carte as opposed to buffet eating, and was very satisfied with their menu selection. I own my own restaurant and catering business and am usually very critical of food prep and hospitality services. I noticed that the restaurant staff we all very well trained and had certainly, as was confirmed to me to have graduated from a Hospitality and Tourism program. The service on the beach was great, with a good choice of daily items from the menu for lunch , including a daily BBQ. The only complaint that I have is the Timesharing pests that are constantly HARRASSING you while on vacation. I had indicated to the hotel manager that is a terrible nuisance to tourists who are burdened enough with this on a daily basis at home, we certainly don't need it while we are vacationing. Such a classy Resort should not permit this to happen. Like someone else mentionned this is a pricy place to stay at and we should get what we pay for. I was slightly disapointed with the beach, there is a lot of seaweed that is washed up on the beach, but the view is fantastic and excellent security. I would certainly go back, and have been trying to book for quite some time now, but without luck, no rooms are available.... We also went fishing from services offered right off the beach. Great experience...

Reviews.Title: “This is our favorite place to vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: 1snowbird
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Gran Porto in January the last two years. This year we brought in-laws from Florida as well. We ALL think this place is unbelieveable. The service in the best I have seen anywhere in Mexico. I wish they had more evening entertainment, however, the rooms, food, drinks and service is wonderful! Being able to walk to everything -shopping, ferry to Cozemul...is great. Wish they weren't all booked up-I'd go again this year!

Reviews.Title: “Things to look for when booking”
Reviews.Author: Frugalpirate
Reviews.Content: Gran Porto Real 2-13-04 through 2-20-04. As several others had said, overbooked and room was not ready upon arrival. I'd gone down with another couple, too. Gave us the 3rd floor overlooking the new construction (which would have been an ocean view except for the new hotel). Noise started at 0645 which was my old time zone of 0445. So, although I'd booked months in advance and contacted Real Resorts and "confirmed" my reservation, no room as booked. Now I was sweating. Around 1 PM the next day a room finally came available and we had to repack and move. Kind of shot the day because I was skeptical about getting my money's worth. This turned out to be 2nd floor. Ocean was blocked by palm trees. Front desk apologized, admitted booking by home office was and had been causing these types of problems. I went down on the Euro plan so they gave us one day of all-inclusive. This is the only hotel I know where they charge to use the weight room. Huge beds! Walk right down to the beach. An "okay" experience but clearly more geared towards "all-inclusive" environment.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else & get a lawyer!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Buyer Beware!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We booked our vacation through a travel agent in Cincinnati, who booked 9 of us a package through Vacation Express. We paid for FIVE ocean-front all inclusive junior suites. We arrived at the Gran Porto Real at about 2:00 PM. My husband & I were the first couple to check in. I STATED "this is an ocean-front room just like we booked, RIGHT?" The manager was extremely rude and replied." your voucher does not state that and you can get a lawyer!" That was our warm greeting. WE LOOKED AT EACH OTHER IN DISBELIEF! All 9 of us went up to check out the first room before other couples checked in. We pulled back the curtain and there was a lovely view of construction about 3 city blocks long. We went back to the desk and did make COMPLETE fools of ourselves, screaming about how we paid 3 grand for oc frnt rooms 8 months prior. It was a 25th wedding anniversaries trip. Now, it was Saturday and US travel agencies are closed until Monday! The first rude manager went off duty, and another ruder manager shows up! He said, "our hotel is always full--you don't like it, go somewhere else!" He said, "Vacation Express is here every day--they should be here in 10 minutes!" One hour later, he called a rep from Vacation Express after we threatened to sue the hotel. She did come to the hotel and said she would look contact the V Exp people up in Cancun and get back to us. (NEVER DID!) We called our USA travel agent on Monday. She promised to send a fax. It showed up on Tuesday. At that point, the hotel admitted they had 2 ocean-view rooms left. We had to decline because we needed 5 rooms, and how can you tell 3 couples that they don't get the oceanview? We spent hours and money making long distance calls only to get nowhere. We got no compensation, no apology, no free massage! The front desk people are your worst nightmare. They do this every day of the year and hopefully get paid well for getting screamed at by everyone who checks in!ONCE YOU GET PAST THE FRONT DESK NIGHTMARE, NEVER OPEN YOUR CURTAINS IN YOUR ROOM, USE A GOOD SET OF EAR PLUGS FOR THE HAMMERING THAT STARTS PROMPTLY AT 7:00 AM, THE PLACE IS PRETTY SWEET......... The junior suites are very spacious and comfortable. The shower is big enough to hold 4 people. Hot water arrives 5 minutes later if you just turn on hot w/no cold. The rooms and the hotel have lovely marble floors. They are extremely clean and work on the hotel like a cruise ship (always painting & sprucing up). The staff is very courteous & the restaurants serve great food. The boats give the place a quaint feel. You can walk to the left of the construction and have a lovely beach to stroll and moderate waves. The location of the property is fabulous. You're walking distance to the ferry that goes to Cozumel, to Senior Frogs, to the bus station that goes to Old Cancun. Lots of nice shopping, bars & restaurants on Fifth Avenue right in front of the resort!Incidentally, the construction is owned by Gran Porto Real. They are building lots more ocean-front rooms to deceptively sell. They are angling the balconies and you will be able to see the ocean with a good set of binoculars.If a hotel in the USA pulled this kind of scam, it would go out of business in 2 weeks.Bottom Line -- This hotel is making fools of the American people!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real = Bad Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While the wait and room staff were fantastic, the room and property were misrepresented. Their Jr. Suite is no more than an average sized room. We had paid for a suite with an ocean view - NOT!Management was unresponsive although they admitted they did not have the room we paid for. They even had form letters on hand for this problem offering a manicure, massage or facial to compensate for the room downgrade. We ended up with one kig bed and a rollaway for three guests! The toilet did not work even after repeated repair attempts. The air conditioning never worked. As for the beach - what beach! Swiming pool was misrepresented. Food was okay. Their call liquor and wines were cheap and below mediocre. All in all - this place is a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Vacation....”
Reviews.Author: tiger120
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Gran Costa Real from February 10th through the 14th after transferring from the Costa Real. We ended up with a an ocienview jr. suite which we were very pleased with. However, the standard rooms are extremely small and the hotel does not seem to be overly concerned about putting guests who paid for an oceanview suite into standard rooms. The main positives are that the entire hotel staff is friendly and competent, the resort is clean and well maintained, and the food in the a la carte Italian restaraunt was excellent. The main negatives are that the bars all close at midnight, there are no a la carte choices for breakfeast or lunch, and the smelly erosion-formed lagoon that fronts the beach. This is the 10th all-inclusive resort I have been to in the last 10 yeart and I would return to Gran Porto Real if I could be assured of receiving a jr. suite which does not appear to be possible with the current management group.

Reviews.Title: “Will try another resort next time.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My companion and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real the week of February 6, 2004 - all inclusive. We tried to get an upgrade from a standard room to no avail. Our first night was horrible. The room was dark and we woke up to see wires and pipes hanging. We could not get the proper lock for the safe. We were then transferred to another room on the side of the construction. The noise didn't really bother us and the room was much brighter. I don't think we would do another all-inclusive since we don't drink all that much and we were getting sick of eating at the same places day in and day out. The service was ok. The room and maid service was great but the dining service left a lot to be desired. We often had to get up to fetch our coffee or a bread plate from another table. The beach was not the greatest however just left to the beach was a terrific beach. We walked it everyday and even found another resort that we may try next year. I liked the proximity to walking to 5th avenue so location was important. However, we will try another resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real-ly Sucks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I just returned from a vacation in Playa at the Gran Porto Real. There must be better experiences for the money. Upon arrival the previously described bait and switch maneuvre occurred. We had booked a junior ocean view suite through a travel agent. Paid extra for it. Had the room confirmed several times prior to arrival. Bam! Sorry Senor, there are no ocean view rooms avaible and there is nothing we can do. After about an hour of fighting and bribe offers of up to $200, the desk manager gave us a lovely construction view room complete with 7:00 AM auger drill wake up call, a bottle of champagne and a free massage. In talking with other guests down for the week, we were not alone. We were however succesful in a room change to our promised accomadation of an ocen view suite on day 2. Now I can hear folks saying, "Yo dude, chill out, it's Mexico man." That is all true but when you combine the initial battle of room change with the price of accomadation, the boat taxi line up of about 20 boats in front of the hotel that one must navigate through to get to the water and the mid-shelf alcohol brands it takes all of one's zen skills to chill out. Those who think the place is great are liklely from very small cold towns in the midwest and have rationalized the excellence of their experience because to accept the truth that they were hosed on the one week escape from the cold vacation that they had been planning for six months might result in psychiatric hospitalization or incarceration. Did I have a good time? Yes. Why? Because Playa del Carmen is beautiful, the service staff are excellent, the people that I travelled with were very cool, I have a good sense of humor and to accept that it sucked would have resulted in my psychiatric hospitalization or incarceration. Go to Playa, be open to being hosed if you stay at the Gran Porto Real, walk north of there if you want to avoid the boats on the beach and don't miss a meal at the Yaxche Restaurant. Have fun and safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking is a nightmare !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on January 26, 2004 to spend 7 nights only to find that our prepaid ocean-view suite with king bed was not available. They offered us a standard room facing the construction project and said they would throw in a massage. The construction project starts work at anywhere between 6:30 a.m. and 7:00 a.m. and runs until the last light in the sky has gone.Before you stay here read all the comments and make up your mind. We did read all the comments and thought that we had a 50% chance of having a wonderful time. My advice is "DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip..nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Mexico several times before but never to Playa Del Carmen. My boyfriend and I went to Grand Porto Real from Jan 30 - Feb 6. We had read all the reviews like everyone else, and admit, were a little reluctant. We booked thru a local travel agency (I would NEVER book a trip on the internet with seperate air and hotel reservations - that I think is what caused a lot of these booking problems). We knew the hotel was nice from the photos, and my brother and his wife had been there last year. So, OUR experiences: the hotel was very nice. Was it a super deluxe hotel? (remember..you want super deluxe, you pay a super deluxe price. I think this is a good middle of the road) No, but it was very clean, and they do have incredible staff. We paid extra to have a junior suite ocean view room. We would not go any other way at this hotel. People say you are never in your room, so who cares?..but even the time we ARE in the room is important. You can see all the complaints with the standard rooms along the street by the construction. We could not hear one bit of it from our balcony. Our room was incredible (room 354), the best I have ever had while traveling in Mexico. Like everyone says, HUGE showers! Our balcony was great and had a beautiful view. We did do the all inclusive package, and after our trip..decided we would not do it again. They have the two resturants (mexican and italian) which only serve dinner, and with a reservation ~ they were good, but have a very limited menu (especially the mexican, which was disappointing). The other dinning option is the buffet. It IS nice to have the flexibility to come and go as you please, but after 3 days of that food..it felt and tasted WAY too cafeteria-ish, even just doing lunch there. I know for the amount of people..they do their best. (breakfasts were great though) They have an outdoor palapa that serves food during the day (buffet style again) by the pool..but the exact same thing EVERY day to eat. Boring. We went out to eat the last two days, and were glad we did. We had the best shrimp dinners we ever had! They do have incredible resturants in Playa..it is worth it to take advantage of them. I guess the biggest reason to do all inclusive..if you planning to drink ~ a lot. If you add up the price of the food you may eat..you may come out ahead to NOT do all inclusive if you are not big drinkers. (and that means staying AT the hotel to drink) I am pregnant, so drinking was not an option for me.. my boyfriend had drinks, but nothing too much. The hotel has a 'sports bar', but honestly, it looked pretty boring. Never many people hanging out there. Most people ventured downtown I guess. At that point, you pay to drink. As far as the beach..it is true, the beach in front of the hotel stinks. BUT, walk to the left of the beach and they are incredible. We walked the beach every morning for a few miles..and it was amazing. There is very little on the beach to the left of the hotel (facing beach)..to the right, it is pretty packed with stuff. So, you are just a few steps to incredible beaches..but you lose the service of the hotel then. So, all in all..if you WANT to do all inclusive, this is a good hotel to pick. (great for families, although from watching, we were not too impressed with the 'Kids Club' they offer to help out with the kids and do different activities with them) Again, the staff were great. For us, we probably would stay elsewhere and go on our own, no all inclusive package. Because this hotel caters mostly to the all inclusive patrons, I would personally try another hotel that did not offer that option. Hope that helps some of you! Either way..incredible weather..and remember, you ARE on vacation! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed from Minnesota”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Gran Porto Real two days ago and would not waste my money on this resort again. We spent a week two years ago at the Continental Plaza Playacar just down the beach and loved the hotel and area but wanted to try another hotel. Our travel agent said she had been to the Gran Porto and highly recommended it. Upon arriving on Friday were placed in a room (which we were told would be a partial oceanview) with no oceanview and total construction going on outside our room. No view and very noisy! We contacted the front desk and they told us they could upgrade to guarantee the oceanview for $255.00. We spoke to others that had upgraded and their rates were less. We upgraded the next morning to a beautiful oceanview. Then-our plug-in in our room did not work, they never fixed it, we were told that because we were not all-inclusive the ice was not included. Also we ordered room service and after 2 hours we cancelled the order and went out for breakfast. Also-no hot water every morning and other times during the day. Because we were not all-inclusive and wanted to try other restaurants we were treated badly. We do have to comment on the beach-it was lovely and the rooms acceptable but we will never book this hotel again. Good luck on YOUR TRAVELS. S & V Legried Austin, MN 55912 legs1949@msn.com

Reviews.Title: “fabulous gem on the riviera”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i only stayed one night there. it was a free sample from the sister hotel costa real in cancun. we were shuttled there, given a room immediately, used our all-inclusive there, and changed our airport pick-up to there. this is a wonderful hotel. it's very grand and pristine. the staff is energetic and helpful. the grounds are impeccably clean and groomed. the rooms were even better than the costa real. hate to say it, but it's true. loved it. the beach was better at costa real. but loved the pool and facilities at gran porto. they also have a gourmet restaurant there. got to make reservations. the city of playa del carmen is smaller, but everything is within walking distance. it's more laid back and relaxing. loved 5th ave. up the street for shopping.also closer to cozumel, tulum, and xelha. would love to go back and do a half and half-week in cancun-week in playa. well worh the little bit of money we spent on the whole vacation!

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe what I am reading”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This may be a bit long but if you are planning on staying at the Gran Porto Real, it?s worth the read. First, here is an e-mail I sent "Travel Oh City" which ends in totally disgusted with Travel Oh City. To Whom It May Concern, We booked a hotel reservation through you for the Gran Porto Real Hotel in Playa del Cramen Mexico. After reading negative reviews on Trip Advisor about a "Bait & Switch" tactic, I faxed the Gran Porto Real to confirm that they had received our reservation from Travelocity for the specified dates for a front ocean view Jr. suite, all-inclusive. They sent me back a confirmation number with a person?s name. I also printed out your confirmation. Upon arrival, it was just as 35% of the numerous reviewers on Trip Advisor had experienced. Sorry sir, your reservation has been canceled. Canceled by whom I asked. Oh, by us. Why? Because for an oceanfront all-inclusive, you would have to pay $145.00 a night more. The manager tried to blame "This Travel OH City" said with a shrug of the shoulders as if he had never heard of you or pronounce your name correctly. "We do have a garden view non all inclusive" for $240.00 however, he stated. After debating with him what the word reservation means and talking the manager into an argument corner several times, with which he could just shrug and say sorry sir, there is nothing that can be done, he called "This Travel OH City" which somehow he conveniently had the phone number at his fingertips. After discussions with someone from your call center, we were offered a garden view room for $185.00 a night. I refused and had my wife wait with the luggage while I walked around Playa del Carmen for another hotel. In an hour or so, I found an acceptable hotel, booked it and stayed there. I know that Travelocity knows about this "Bait & Switch" that?s going on. As a matter of fact, most of it is through you. I have emailed several of the people from the review board on Trip Advisor to confirm this. I also know what?s going on. We booked a vacation package at the Gran Porto Real three years ago through Delta Airlines. After calculating the cheapest airfare, transfers, etc., the ocean front jr. suite all-inclusive room averaged around $350.00 a night. They are taking reservations on "Travel Oh City" far in advance to guarantee 100% occupancy, giving the ocean front jr. suites to the highest bidder, and switching who may agree to the other rooms. "Travel Oh City", being an agent for Gran Porto Real, is just as guilty as the hotel for this practice. Since this happens so often, I am sure some people have investigated legal avenues, as I will be doing Monday, I may have no recourse in that direction but I can tell you I will spend a great deal of time and effort via internet, disclosing "Travel Oh Cities" and the Gran Porto Reals deception. Also, Gran Porto will not appreciate the very unflattering pictures I plan to post on web sites and the Internet.Totally disgusted with "Travel Oh City",My wife and I did have a back up plan in case this happened. Even though we had no reservations I walked to El Faro, the hotel with the lighthouse that?s half way between the Porto Real and the ferry to Cozumel. Excellent place! Later that day, I walked down the beach to the Porto Real to check it out. Some one in an earlier review stated that they had built a children?s wading pool. Maybe that?s what the Porto Real calls it but in fact all they did was build a crescent shaped sand bar about 50' out from the shore to prevent any more erosion of the beach. This has created a stagnant pool between the hotel and the ocean full of floating algae. The beach between the hotel and the pool is about 4' wide and drops off a good 3'. If you would like pictures of this area, just email me. On the north side of the hotel is the still uncompleted pier and across the street is the new hotel being built. There are cranes all over the place. Also, the last time we were there, they did have music playing at the pool, but it is a lot louder now. They are probably trying to drown out the construction noise. That along with the volleyball ref. blowing a whistle between every serve, the terrible condition of the beach, and all the construction they really did us a favor. I am sure the service you get at the Porto Real is excellent. That?s the only reason I think people give it a good review. That or the management is busy writing reviews every day

Reviews.Title: “Playa del Carmen/ Gran Porto Real (resort)”
Reviews.Author: dantex66
Reviews.Content: We went to Mexico for our honeymoon between Oct19-Nov4. We stayed in Playa del Carmen at the Gran Porto Real which was totally awesome. Location, Location, Location is the most important aspect of this resort. It has all the amenities so you do not actually have to worry about that. The only cause for my reservations are this and listen carefully: Always drink bottled water, stay away from their fresh milk and cheese, bring on your trip power bars (especially if you want to do day trips to places (off the resort) where there is no guarentee that the food is washed in agua purificada, bring bran bars to help you digest your food and move food in your bowels if you do indeed get sick, bring gravel, Tums and other gastro-medicines just in case, sunscreen a total necissity, American one dollar bills for tipping (you will need many of these so bring a lot of them..you will be surprised at the doors that are open to you when you tip, do not go on the tours arranged by your resort (one's in town are a lot cheaper by almsot 50 percent in some cases. They have plenty of ATMS so don't worry about getting extra cash. When buying goods don't feel sorry for them and haggle the prices. These people are trained salespeople and can quickly point our weaknesses in your bargaining skills- they are professionals they do it for a living- bring a spanish book so you can learn common used phrases i.e. Kwanto es, Kwanto Costara etc etc. If you are avid snorkerlers bring your own snorkelling equipment so you don't have to pay to use for rental (we brought out own and it saved money) Bring napsacks for your back. Apart from those tips you will find other things on the way to help you out. Our resort Porto Real is situated at the beginning of Playa del Carmen and a 30 second walk to 5 avenue which is full of shops, coffee places, bistros and speciality stores are everywhere. Wonderful! 5th avenue has a European flair with a Mexican facade. Porto Real, is located right next to the Cozumel ferry which is a 5 minute walk either through the beach or 5th avenue. The ferry rates are $7.50 US to get across. If you decide to go on the ferry and have reservations about sea sickness go on the top of the ferry on the outside where your eyes can adjust to the sudden movements of the boat and view the horizon for stability. During our stay we went to Cozumel twice and checked out Chankaanab (must see A+ AWESOME snorkelling-literally a rainbow of fishes good for kids and adults), San Miguel (the main city A- (lots of shops), we rented a TJ jeep and circumnavigated the island and checked out all the beaches, checked out Punta Sur (South most part of th isalnd) has a lighthouse you can climb with some history beautiful spot for pictures, crocodiles, deer and beautiful and natural snorkelling..saw lots of star fish, parrot fishes, barracudas (etc), went to Puerto Morena for some wave surfing and checked out a restaurant overlooking cliffs called Bongos which was cool (ask to see their family albums) ha ha.In Playa, we shopped a lot and visited some restaurants, go to Java Joes for cheap coffee and read the Cancun Times and watch some hockey games on tv in Mexico quite cool. We went to Chichen Itza which the tour cost us 35 bucks each. It was a MUST SEE. (A++++++) It is something our of tomb raider AWESOME! Its worth the day trip..if your going to do a day trip go there expiecally if you appreciate history/anthropology/architecture. On the same tour we also went to a CENOTE which is an underground cavern of water with stalgammittes they are all over Mexico (are snorkelling equipment came in handy here. We also went to the city of Vallenoid which had a beautiful Catholic church and plenty of shops. (all of the above was one tour). Bought a pack of smokes for a buck here.We also went to Tulum which is an A, skipped the tour guide and went on the beach instead at Tulum which is beautiful. Beautiful places for pictures. We also went to Xel Ha which is an eco park I give it B- as i was not really impressed by it since Cozumel has similar eco parks for cheaper and there were kids everywhere not good for honeymooners. It still nice though so if you have the money and time then who cares right?Our resort had 4 restaurants we went to the Italian one 3 times. our favorite one. The main restaurant called the albatross..they do try to change up the menu and there is an attempt but still it is very easy to get sick of the food...try to diversify your eating as much as possible and take the time to make reservations for dinner instead of jsut eating there. The staff was curteous (Talk to Carlos at front desk he is good) and Benito (server) is awesome. No complaints at all.. The resort has a shop, 4 restaurants, two pools, a hot tub, spa, weight room, etc etc. It a 5 star to me.During the end of our trip we decided to got to Cancun since Porto Real is owned by Royal Holiday which has chains of its hotel all over Mexico- we could transfer)Went to Cancun for the remaining of our honeymoon at the Gran Caribe and again it was awesome, however I would say this place is a4 star not 5. Rooms are OK not bad but not great either. Pool was big which was cool and the atmosphere was not as laid back as Playa which was not better but different as there were more pools games and interactive activities with the employees. Service was not as good in Cancuun we found though but it was still good. During our stay we went to COCO BONGOS ( A+) One of the best clubs I've ever been to. You would have to go to know. Also took a Catamarin tour of ISLA MUJHERES (A_) which is right across the ocean which was fun....laid back isalnd we rented a golf cart and checked the island out and went to the turtle conservation area and had a great time on this tour. Apart from that we checked out all the malls in Cancum the La Isle Mall, Carousel and the Negro Market. Not too impressed though the Isle Mall had 'up" class clothes but none of the clothes were cutting edge or new nothing you couldn't find in a new city but the mall was beautiful, Carosel mall not that good and the market were OK. I found Cancuun a bit more aggressive and not as friendly as Playa but its to be expected in a more Americanized town.Our experience with Royal Holiday- Gran Porto in Playa and Gran Caribe in Cancuun was awesome. Our honeymoon was awesome never a dull moment and we learned a lot about Mexican culture and we had a lot of fun travelling throughout the Yucatan Penninsula. My highlights were Chichen Itza, 5th Avenue, Cozumel and Cancuun....literally Playa del Carmen is the perfect place to stay if you wish to see a lot of stuff in a limited time. Also have the Sopa del Lima soup a Yucatan must dish. Also get this book TOP 10 Cancun and the Yucatan, at Chapters and Indigo you will not be sorry that you bought it trust me.Chau,Rich & Mari

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful, relaxing week (Jan. 13-20) at this beautiful spot. After reading all the negatives here, I was quite worried what we would find. As soon as we arrived at the check-in and had our room key in hand, I relaxed and began to enjoy this first rate resort. We had a standard room which we only used to shower and sleep. It was across from the construction, but it was the early risers walking by our room talking loudly that disturbed us more than the construction noise. But, at least we were up early and out enjoying the beach and warmth. The food was good, though by the sixth day anywhere, it would get repetitive. The drinks plentiful and topped off with more liquor on request. The bar staff know what they are doing when it comes to serving 'light' drinks, otherwise they would have a lot more alcohol-related troubles. The location makes this resort worth the trip. Two minute walk from room to beach. Five minute walk to 5th Ave. Minutes from other beach areas. Great beach waiter service. Great, friendly, efficient service from all the staff we dealt with. Try the bike tour...Octavia provided us with the an exciting trip through the side streets of Playa del Carmen to Plyacar where you can see some of the other resorts to get an idea of how good the beach location of the Porto Real is. Watching the locals with their fishing boats was always fun, especially on Sunday when the wives arrived with all the children. Some may have found this fishing activity annoying, but after all the fishing village was there first and we find we like the 'ethnic touch' that this kind of thing adds to the holiday. Talking to other vacationers on the flight back, I think the Porto Real has everything going for it to make it a spot worth going back to. I can't wait to get a room next year at the new hotel going up across the street!

Reviews.Title: “10/10 with no complaints!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen during the week of Jan 14 21 2004. My wife and I had an excellent stay and we totally enjoyed ourselves. Our trip got off to a shaky start when we got to the airport at 6:15am and were told that our plane just left after a few hours working with our excellent travel agent we were booked on a half empty 1:30pm direct flight and our return flight was changed to later in the day.Once we arrived in Cancun we were bombarded with people trying to get us to take tours or get a ride with them to our hotel. It was quite overwhelming as they some of them were dressed formally and they looked like customs people we found our way out of the airport and found our ride.Once at the Gran Porto Real we made it to the front desk and this was where I was anxious to find our JR. Suite awaiting us sure enough our room was waiting and the bellman was waiting to take our luggage to our rooms. Once in the room we noticed two double beds rather than one king and the bellman explained that these rooms were away from the construction noise so it was better and we agreed. (We did bring ear plugs just in case but they were not needed.) Our tour company gave us an apology note and a fruit basket for the flight mix up which was good.The hotel room was spacious and very nice. The bathroom was well appointed and the cleaning staff took very good care of us. We tipped them $20 on the last day I don t know if this is the best approach but we wanted to keep our smaller bills for tipping throughout the week. Anyway the room was always impeccable and the sheets were turned down with chocolates on the pillow nice touch!The meals were great, the pool was great, the staff were great! We had absolutely no problems. Some meals weren t my favourite but hey, you get what you ask for! The service in the Italian and Mexican restaurants was second to none!The beach is a bit eroded and the boats are a bit of a pain, but they are also interesting to watch and the pelicans are also interesting to watch as they perch on the boats! The beaches to the north and south of our location were great and the scenery was great!The shopping and restaurants and bars on 5th Ave were good, I did hear one husband say that he didn t see the need to go any further down the street as he felt that all of the shops looked the same I m sure his wife disagreed. The Blue Parrot was a good nightspot to go to and the hotel had a night trip to Senor Frogs another good nightspot for the young and the restless.Overall, this trip was a 10/10 with no complaints I would say it s all about attitude. We did have a light burn out in our bathroom and we just left a note for the cleaning staff and it was taken care of within a day or so. There was another posting on this site where the person complained that they had to call the front desk several times and they didn t respond in a timely manner get over it if you spend your time worrying about a burned out light bulb rather than enjoying your stay you re the problem!!Don t forget to tip the staff are very nice and they work 7 days a week for only a few $ per day, they live for the tips and they work hard for them. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Some things bad, most good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is no overbooking. They have rooms at the street side of the hotel, which nobody wants (you look at construction of new hotel across the street), and inorder to fill these rooms, they tell you your room wont be available until tomorrow or the next day (that is if you paid for a jr. suite ocean view). If you complain enough they will give you a free lobster dinner and free massage, but you will not get your room the first night. I would say about 80% of people will have to wait for their jr. suite ocean view. However, once you get your room it is heaven on earth. The rooms are huge with two people showers and gorgeous tile. The beach is the best in Mexico as far as I am concerned (and we have been to many). The service is great, go all inclusive you get all drinks and all the food you can eat. Food is good, buffet is good for breakfast but not for lunch or dinner. Go to the two restaurants for the best food. The staff is great and very friendly. Avoid people in the hotel who come up to you and ask if you just got in they want to sell time shares. After you get a tan they won't bother you. A trip to XelHa is worth every penny. Its a national park where you can snorkel and swim with the dolphens. You can float down a gentle river in a inner tube which I highly recommed. Also take the ferry to Cozemel for shopping. Its a great family resort however toppless is allowed on public beach, but not around the hotel. We have traveled to many places in Mexico but I found Playa del Carmen to be about the best place to go. I would definately go back to Porto Real despite the room switching.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as some had made it sound”
Reviews.Author: Mandu
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I (29 and 27yrs old) visited the Porto Real Jan. 16-24. We both love Hawaii and we agree we would return to this exact spot for our honeymoon if we don't go to Hawaii. The hotel is immaculate, they won some sort of hygienic award last year. Everywhere you turned someone was cleaning something. The hotel location is awesome. The food was just o.k. I would recommend the euro plan if your'e not big drinkers. The town of Playa (5th Ave.) is 2 blocks away and the restaurants are fabulous: Media Luna- Fancy. Treat yourself one night. Tequila Barrel breakfast- good and cheap. La Parilla- awesome, ate there 3 times- chicken tacos with cheese, beans and the best guac in Mexico. Brunos italian joint was good too. A bottle of wine at dinner; 17 bucks. Not bad. We spent less on food than we would have if we had done all inclusive and we ate like kings and queens in town. The construction is kind of loud. It does start early and they work all day. But, when you check in ask for an odd numbered room on the 2nd or 3rd floors. The front desk was very accomadating and would have moved us as many times as we wanted, we lucked out and had the 2nd best room in the hotel. #354. It overlooked the beach and wasn't too loud. The people down there (mayans and mexicans alike) are the nicest I have ever met on any vacation. They work hard and always smile. We had towels folded like swans and heart shapes with rose petals sprinkled everywhere on our bed everyday, room service was great, cheaper lunch than if you ate by the pool or a restaurant. If you do any adventures go to Coba and Pac-Chen- book it through "All-Tournative" tours (in the hotel hospitality room) and request Deanna "Jones" for your tour guide if possible. She was hilarious and extremely smart- spoke 4 or 5 languages. Very "CHITO." that's how you say "cool" in Mexico. The overbooking people are complaining about is true. Just make sure you buy a package trip through a respected travel agent and you will not have any problems. The people who were having problems went through Expedia and stuff, never a good idea. And don't worry about the food it was great everywhere, even at Pac-Chen the Mayan village. People who complain about the food are probably picky eaters and have forgotten the fact that they are in a FOREIGN country. Come on people, this isn't America give it a rest. Enjoy your stay and appreciate how hard these people work to make you feel at home while away. The beach was fine just go to the north end of the beach or stay at the pool. If you want comfy chairs the blue ones are better than the whites but go down EARLY to reserve your spots. By 7 a.m. they were getting filled up. Overall I would say this is a 4 star hotel, sufficient for most tastes and adequate for all. Just relax, order dos Dos Equis and chill........ Your'e on Mexico time.

Reviews.Title: “What are people complaining about?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week of Jan. 17-24. The person at the front desk was very considerate concerning the construction noise going on and asked if we would prefer a junior suite w/ a king size bed across the street from the noise or a quieter room on the other side w/ 2 full size beds. We opted for the quieter room of course! We bought the all inclusive plan and ate at all the restaurants--they all served very good food with great variety. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The jucuzzi on the roof is wonderful and so's the view. The bartender was great and continually brought us drinks when we wanted them. The beach is somewhat eroded, but they have made an excellent contained shallow pool for kids to play in. Even if you don't save lounge chairs early, there are plenty of chairs by the hotel and the staff are very willing to bring them where ever you want. The location is perfect, minutes from 5th Ave. The only setback is the phones, if you buy prepaid phone cards from home, you will not be able to use them. You can't call home from your room, unless you call collect or have a regular calling card. If you buy a prepaid card from the gift shop, there are 4 phones located in the lobby and sports bar where you can call home. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would say to most of the people who make complaints to remember you are in Mexico and it is a different country. Please be generous with your tips as these people really are underpaid and work very hard!

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful trip ever !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the week of Jan.17-24th at the Grand Porto Real Resort in Playa del Carmen. We decided on the Grand Porto Hotel after researching all of the hotels in the area on the internet. We were travelling with 2 other couples. All of us were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversaries. We had such a wonderful time and all of us are already planning a return trip next year. It was all that we had hoped for and much, much more! All of the staff went out of their way to be sure that we didn't have to want for anything the whole time we were at the resort. Many little extra special surprises await you if you choose this resort. We were treated so well by the pool girls ( Hello Ileana) and the waiters in all of the restaurants were just the absolute BEST!!!! If you have never seen Mayan coffee being prepared you are in for a real treat. Yes there is construction across the street and they do start working a 7 am. It did not bother us because we did not want to sleep the day away. We wanted to get up and start another fun filled day in the tropical sunshine. We all went on the all-inclusinve plan and we all are in agreement that it is the only way to go. The food is very good at all of the restaurants. We all LOVED the Italian restaurant. The food by the poolside is also very good, and the drinks are simply delicious. We were in a standard room and when we go back we would like to upgrade to the Jr. Suite. The view from the Jr. Suites is magnificient !! If you like to shop you will love the fact that you can walk to 5th avenue from the hotel and will not have to spend money on a taxi. We met many nice people at the resort and plan to keep in contact with a very nice couple we met from Canada. Please consider this resort if you are planning a trip to Playa del carmen. WE LOVED IT !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Going back to the Grand Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to the Grand Porto Real in March of 2003 with friends and planning to return in February of 2004 with my husband. We did experience a slight difficulty with the room situation the first 3 nights of our trip, we reserved a Jr Suite Ocean Front and got a non-Ocean front Jr suite. The front desk offered compensation choices and we took them up on them. The staff was wonderful, the italian restaurant was fantastic. The trip was fun! The fact that the main shopping strip was a stones throw away made it easy to find something to do. The poolside staff was attentive even though they were very busy. Do take the time to get to the pool area early if you want a poolside deck chair, it really fills up quickly and early. We got massages just about everyday we were there - loved Anna! She gave a great massage. We never were bothered about time share, we knew who the woman was when she came up to us (just a hunch) and we just politely told her that we weren't interested. She smiled and told us to have a nice stay. I don't recall anyone in the shopping area bothering us either. I do hope that our return trip we get the room we reserved for the entire stay. But the hotel is beautiful, clean, courteous staff and we dealt with it because we really didn't spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but unorganized at the desk”
Reviews.Author: kellymq
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel with a great view and great location this is it. It does though have one small problem with overbooking. If you pay for the ocean front room you may not get it for a night or two. We were fortunate that the first night we stayed in a suite with a jacuzzi. Awesome room, but a terrible view. The next morning we were moved to an ocean front view jr suite. It was breathtaking. The service was great, the maids were great, the people were so kind and helpful that they really made your trip worth while. If you go to this hotel make sure you spend a day or two eating on 5th Ave. Le Parrilla's, Los Ranchero and Paella's are all excellent restaurants and I would strongly recommend them to all. Also do some of the sight seeing. Mexico is a very beautiful country and you should not spend you day at the hotel pool. Go to Chichen Itza, Xcaret and Cozumel. All well worth the trip. Rent a car and go on your own though, because it's a blast to stop at some of the road side shops. Hope your trip is good as ours was, and be patient at the front desk, and maybe you'll be treated as we were.

Reviews.Title: “helpful tips abt GPR...”
Reviews.Author: dananyc
Reviews.Content: just came back from a lovely week at GPR with my husband. here are the things you should know. (good things come later) 1. it is VERY NOISEY if you are not facing the ocean as there is a hotel being built across the street. i recommend getting an ocean front Jr. suite or don't go til they're done building. you are there to relax and the noise goes from 7am til 9 or 10 at night. no joke. people were ******. 2. the food is redundant and of mediocre to poor quality. if you do the all-inclusive (we did), plan on still going out a few times to eat to break it up. there was a great restaurant in town called 100% Natural.(easy to find on 5th ave) other than that, the food in town wasn't much better. 3. BOTTOM SHELF liquor is abundant. ask for something better and they will probably come up with it. if not, plan on having a killer headache. 4. there are people in the lobby that will harrass you about buying daytrips and timeshares. seriously, IGNORE THEM COMPLETELY and don't make eye contact. i saw some very uncomfortable situations where guests got the hard-sell and gave in to things they clearly didn't want to do. DON'T WORRY ABOUT BEING RUDE TO THEM. They are there to take your money. 5. also, the floors are soooo slippery. girls, leave your stilettoes at home. trust me on this.having said that, we thoroughly loved the beautiful grounds, fabulous room (ocean front jr. ste), and wonderfully attentive and gracious staff. we tipped them every day as they survive on tips. the hotel only pays them a disgraceful $3-4/day. please be generous. we gave $3/day to housekeeping and a dollar or 2 at breakfast/lunch and $4-5 at dinner. the location can't be beat as you are only about a block from the enchanting town of playa. we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location but N-O-I-S-Y!!”
Reviews.Author: PK6
Reviews.Content: This will be a great hotel when the construction is completed. Try to get a room away from the construction if at all possible. My girlfriend and I had a wonderful time at the hotel, except that we hardly slept due to the noise. Sometimes it went on until 3:00 am. We didn't mind being awakened at 7:00 am, but the late nights got a bit old. Other than the construction, we loved the hotel. The junior suite was nice-sized, although it could've used some paint! We left the maids a $1 each day and got fabulous service...refilled our fridge with bottled water and diet coke everyday as requested. They made beautiful arrangements with flowers and towels as well. Beach and pool areas were great. Even though beach is small directly in front of the hotel, there's a very expansive beach just off to the north side of the hotel...beautiful. They have a separate bar there as well.I agree with other reviewers that the drinks were weak...you need to ask for doubles and top-shelf liquor, which we did. The Italian restaurant was by far the best...I even saw the Italian tourists eating in there...great seafood, bread, and pastas. Service was excellent in bars and restaurants. Not sure if that was true for everyone or just 2 women traveling alone! We always had numerous waiters to bring us what we needed! Be sure to take advantage of the activities...bike tour at 10:00 am is especially fun...get to see a few ruins and neighborhoods where the locals live. Location of the hotel...1 block from 5th avenue...was perfect. We went into town everyday...sometimes twice a day. I got a tattoo in town from a great little shop on 6th street...between 5th and 10th avenues. Listened to some great Blues music at The Blue Parrot and Senor Frog's was the place to be for dancing. The town was very safe to walk around...even alone late at night. We shopped all over...mostly the same stuff in the shops but still fun. We'd return to this hotel, but not until the construction is completed!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked our trip to Playa del Carmen through the "Best Day" travel agency based in Cancun (12/30 - 1/6). Despite being a little nervous about the bad reviews on this site we were really happy with our trip. When we arrived at the airport our name was posted on a sign and a car was waiting for us. When we arrived at the hotel the staff was really friendly and accomodating (our room wasn't ready yet so they stowed our bags and showed us to lunch). Our Jr. suite had an obstructed view of the ocean and a perfect view of the construction site but we really didn't mind so much since we spend most of our time at the pool/beach or out sightseeing. The food wasn't bad either - we really liked the "El Pascatore" restaurant for dinner and though the breakfast buffet was the best meal of the day (omelette bar, fresh squeezed juices, fruit). We went out for dinner and lunch one time and decided some of the restaurants on 5th avenue weren't a great deal better than our hotel. We also booked some activities with the guys that work next to the towel desk. We LOVED the scuba diving excursion in Cosumel; neither of us are certified so we took a quick resort course at the hotel pool. They also talked us into the "Jungle Tour," snorkling and parasailing in Cancun which was OK. The jungle tour was definitely not worth it. If you want to dive/snorkle, take the ferry and go to Cosumel. If you want to shop for prices, walk to the end of 5th avenue (by Sr. Frogs) - there are a at least a half dozen dive/snorkle tour companies who would love to give you a deal (we didn't realize this until it was too late). I did a ton of shopping around for a hotel and decided that we really did get a great deal. Most of the other hotels we walked by seemed to pale in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre food, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although they again "overbooked" and did not have our junior sutie available on the day we arrived, we accepted a standard room in exchange for 24 hours all-inclusive. so this was a decent deal for us. Actually, I liked the standard room better. When we got the junior suite, it was on the ground floor, next to a busy street and the construction. It was too noisy and not private enough to leave the door open to the useless balcony. We only ate there sometimes, but I thought the food was mediocre at best. I was glad were did not go all-inclusive. Staff was generally friendly and helpful. The great thing about this hotel is the location--on the beach near downtown Playa. The fruity drinks were VERY weak. I think they put in about a tablespoon of liquor at most, though they would honor my request to add a little more. If it weren't for the room location and the mediocre food, this would rate much higher.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my Mexico Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Cancun for two nights, Cozumel for two and in Playa Del Carmen for only one. This hotel was terrible. I was promised an ocean view. Their idea of an ocean view was leaning WAY out on the balcony and catching a glimpse of the water through the construction zone. The construction went on until 10 at night and started at 6 in the morning. It was awful. There was a line 10 deep at the check in counter complaining of the noise/view, etc. They claimed there were no other rooms at any price! Then, they promised to keep potable water on each floor and they ran out on two separate floors. It took them over four hours and three phone calls from me to replace the empty bottles. Also, the hotel is on the beach, BUT, it is aligned with the narrow end on the beach, so 99% of the rooms are no where near the beach or water. Plus, the entire North side of the hotel faces the construction zone. Another thing...do not get a room on the first floor, there is absolutely no view except the bushes. I was really hoping that my 150 dollars would prove to be worth a lot more that that. While the room itself was nice all of the other things added up to be a miserable experience. Stay at the Westin in Cancun, it was 125 bucks, free drinks and happy hour food, great views, awesome beds and fabulous beach!

Reviews.Title: “Treated as if you were on a cruise ship”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff and food were outstanding. My wife & I were in a Jr. suite with an ocean view and were amazed at the size and cleanliness of the room and the entire resort. We read some of the reviews and were hesitant about the construction and overbooking - but we were not overbooked and the construction is an addition to the resort, which we will all enjoy when it is completed. The close proximity of Playa del Carmen is great - you don't feel as though you are trapped onto a resort. 5th Avenue is very safe to walk with great stores. The beaches were great - they go on for days. A true beach lovers resort.

Reviews.Title: “Porto Real is Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Porto Real Jan 3-10, 2004. Everything was great. The service is impeccable! You could not ask for more. The food at both al la carte restaurants is awesome. It is in a perfect location to walk to 5th ave. for shopping, restaurants. Everthing is so clean. The beds are a little hard. The Junior suites are worth the upgrade. Check out the jacuzzi and hammocks ont the roof. It is a nice view at night. You can access on stairs by the spa. Say hello to Alberto at the 3rd floor pool. He is great and will give you great service. Email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many resorts in this area and this one has good and not so good points. The rooms are close to 5 star, the service as always in Mex was good, the loction, close to town was very good. The down side is the beach is average at best. I am big on the beach so this was important to me. If going with kids try one of the all inclusives like the Iberostar Tucan or Riu

Reviews.Title: “Terrific vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leery about this resort after reading all the negative reviews on this site. Even though we arrived at almost 10:00 p.m., our rooms were ready and we were able to have a late dinner. We had a wonderful week Dec 27 to Jan 3. The entire staff is terrific, extremely helpful and very pleasant. My husband, my kids (21, 16 and 6) and I had an incredible vacation, which included something for everyone. We didn't try the kids' club - didn't need to since there was so much for my family to do together. The only annoying part was the construction which began at 7 a.m., but we could even turn that into a positive experience by exploring early. Luckily, they didn't work the 31st and 1st. The weather was perfect. Nearby, the town is quaint and wonderful, Xel-Ha and Xcaret were truly enjoyable, and the ruins at Tulum were fascinating. Unfortunately, we did not make it to Chichenitza, but we will definitely go back again as a family or even maybe just the 2 of us as it is quite romantic.

Reviews.Title: “God help this resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were four couples that went. They didn't give us the room we paid for, they jacked us around stating that they "overbooked". PLEASE!!!!! Now I just heard that a friend of ours just got married and went to the same place for there honeymoon. What a distaster. They always say your honeymoon is something to remember forever. Well ...... they will. Right now there are five couple that will NOT go back to this resort. I sure hope that get there stuff together. It's in a nice location and a nice hotel. But that is about it. P.s. They need to get the beach cleaned up. YUK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa- FAVORITE PLACE EVEr!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am 12 years old and I went to the Gran Porto Real resort with my family, cousins, and grandparents for my grandparents 50th anniversary. I shared an Oceanview room with my cousin and sister. There were two twin beds and a cot. I stayed on the cot which was wider than my bed at home and very comfy. The room was beautiful and really big and I loved the view over the pool so i could see everythig that was going on. This resort was great because my siblings, cousins, and I made friends in a few days. It is great that you can easily walk downtown and go shopping. The best part of the resort was my last night there when we attended the New Years Eve party. It was a blast!! During a musical break we were able to find an empty room to sing our grandparents an anniversary song and we didnt have to pay any extra money to reserve it or anything. After the pary my sister, cousin, a few friends, and I hung out by the pool- the best hangout place. We stayed there for like an hour and one of the gurls jumped in the pool with her dress on! They didnt care we were there as long as we were quiet. I have to say this was definatley my favorite trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: AudnDan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Porto Real from 12-3 to 12-10. The only place we have ever received better service was in Jamaica. The resort staff were incredibly helpful and nice. I am allergic to bees and had forgotten my epi-shot. Of course, I was stung on the beach. I asked one of the staff where to find a doctor and he personally escorted me all the way to him. Medical emergencies in foreign countries are always a little scary, but due to the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff, everything turned out great. Don't listen to the people who give this resort a bad mark simply because there was construction going on. Yes it was loud, and yes it obstructed the view - but we didn't spend all day in our room so it didn't really affect us. A little construction noise couldn't take away the charm of this place! Shopping is literally a few steps away and the ferry to Cozumel is a short 10 minute walk from the resort. We would happily stay here again !!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: SumGolf2
Reviews.Content: First of all, a little about us. We have been to Playa Del Carmen area nine times. The only hotel in this area that we have returned to is Gran Porto Real. This was our second trip to this resort. We have traveled quite a lot including the Caribbean many times. I feel that I should not write this review because Gran Porto Real is so great that everyone will want to go there and I won't be able to get a reservation. We booked a junior suite which is one of the best rooms that we have had in our travels to Mexico. The food rated with Sandals for quality but, there was not the vast selection of a Sandals resort. However, I paid a lot less to go to Gran Porto Real. The service was some of the best at any hotel or resort we have stay in our travels. The beach in front of the hotel is not good and has wash out much more since last year. However, a short walk to the side of the hotel is one of the greatest beaches I have ever seen. You can walk forever on this beach. Two thumbs up for Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well first let me say the hotel is Beautiful, and the service is great (in the restaurants) When we arrived they had our room all wrong, they gave us a room with 2 double beds, and just being my husband and I we requested 1 bed. The 2nd day they corrected the problem and it was much better. The beach is nice, but there is a boat problem, If you walk down just alittle bit, it is much better, No boats, and much clearer water. The drinks are GREAT (Very strong)and you never have a problem finding drinks they are EVERWHERE!! The food is somewhat good, but very different than what we are used too, They try to make everything too fancy, Our last night there they finally served steak, which was GOOD. We took the Mayan Adventure tour, I would recommend it for the snorkelers (even beginners) However to get to the places was kindof a long trip(about 1hour) But worth it....Very nice tour, There was alot of constuction going on which was pretty annoying, and that just so happened to be our"view". The sports bar is alot of fun, They have alot of great entertainment (including karaoke)that was FUN! And as far as shopping it was great, the famous 5th avenue is 2 blocks away, but be prepared for people yelling at you to come into there shops, it reminded me of going to a carnival. And there is alot of pressure to buy things, I would recomend NOT picking anything up, because if they see that you have an interest in something they will "hound" you to death, until you cant be friendly to them anymore!!And you just have to walk away. Some will go down on there prices, and some wont! I would recommend the VIP room at the hotel, It is free to the all inclusive guests, There you will find a self serve keg, a soda machine(and alot of whiskey) next to the soda machine, a fridge with hamburgers, hotdogs, salads and desserts, and an ice cream machine, also a pool table and air hockey table. The VIP room is open 24 hours a day( great after the restaurants close at 11pm) This was our first trip to MX. All in all it was a great trip! We are planning on going back next year, but not planning on staying at the Gran Porto Real. We hear the Iberostar tucan also in Playa del carmen is great! So that is our next destination!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me preface by saying that Mexico was beautiful, and the people friendly and gracious. Stayed from 12/1-12/6. That said, the hotel was TERRIBLE! My new husband I paid extra for an 'oceanview' jr suite. All we had a view of was construction walls and a crane. After traveling all day to get there, we couldn't even take a nap due to construction/generators going outside. they started at 6 am and ended at 10:30 pm! the paint on the head board was cracked and chipping off, radion didn't work, and when we asked for another room we were told there was a 20-person waiting list. we asked if they could comp us a couple of massages for our trouble. They told us no, because we were the only ones complaining! Do yourself a favor- stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip!”
Reviews.Author: trailrider717
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from 6 days at the Porto Real. We were there from Dec. 11th - Dec. 16th. Everyone at the hotel was excellent! We had reserved a Jr. Suite and they asked if we wanted to try the oceanview Jr. Suite. We could have it the first night and keep it the rest of the trip for $20 per night. Of course we kept the ocean view room. It was perfect. If you plan to stay at the Gran Porto Real you must stay in an ocean view Suite. They are worth the extra money. The construction next to the hotel will probably be done by next summer. It will be additional Jr. Suite rooms. The food was great and we received everything we asked for with no problems. The best beach is just north of the hotel. We will recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: VDaly
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to the Gran Porto Real in May 2003 and had an amzing time. We had a junior ocean sea suite, which is a must. Make sure you are atleast on the third floor so you get a good view. it really is worth paying the extra for an ocean view. The pool area was nice - it did ocassionaly get very busy when the kids club turned up though which was not nice! I think the only let down with the hotels is the restuarants. There is a buffet, mexican or al la carte. You need to book the al la carte which you should do but the food isn't really much different from the buffet. I wasnt really impresssed witht the mexican restaurant. There wasn't much to do after dinner - the bar was always empty and there wasnt much room at the pool bar. However, all in all it was a fantastic holiday - polite staff, waitors around the pool were fantastic, maids were excellent and the weather was much better than in England :)

Reviews.Title: “bumped 3 days before we left”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were scheduled to stay at the porto real 2003 Nov 30 to Dec 14, However we got a phone call 3 days prior to our departure. Our travel agent advised us that the porto real had over booked and were not honoring any air transat bookings....It was nice of them to give us so much advance warning....especially since we had booked the hotel in early August,However Air Transat upgraded us to the Riu Playacar which was a much nicer resort in my opinion....... We did walk by the Porto real, be advised that over the last year a huge pier was built in front of the property, and there were also many fishing boats docked there..if you wanted to swim you would have to walk 5 minutes down the beach to get to a nicer section of the beach...Anyways you may want to consider some other hotel that does not overbook and one that will honor their reseravtions, after all it isn't rocket science......

Reviews.Title: “we would never trust them”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: to make our vacation a dream one. We booked for a group of 10 at the GPR - and ... got bumped due to over-booking. We were informed via travel agent 2 days before departure..and were told we were being moved to the Bahia Principe Akumal (35 minutes outside of Playa) Our other option was to stay home - no refund !!!!! NOT IMPRESSED !! so if you want a problem free vacation - DO NOT book through Air Transat...or the GPR

Reviews.Title: “Why should I have expected different”
Reviews.Author: bluegrasstravel
Reviews.Content: Well - what I had read did happen. Booked the Porto Real in July for week 12/6-12/12. Read all the reviews but thought no this couldn't happen. Sure enough - it did. Not my first time to PDC - had stayed at the RIUs and never have had this problem or heard of this happening. Arrived three hours late due to bad weather on Saturday, 12/6. My party was picked up at the airport and taken to the Porto Real and at checkin was told they were overbooked and would send us to another resort with oceanfront accommodations. We were sent to the Gala for two days, stuck in a hacienda far end of the property by the road and guard gate. We called the Porto on Monday to get us and was picked up and finally checked in to continue the rest of our vacation (4 days left). This overbooking must be habit for them - another group of 4 checked in at the same time as our party of 4 and were done the same way. The accommodations at the Porto are good - we were in a jr suite ocean front but there is so much construction noise you couldn't sleep at nights. Food and service are good - the bar at the pool is great and the servers are always there to keep your drinks refilled. Beach has really eroded - so sunbathing at the resort is on top of each other. So many fishing boats and the directly off from the beach - hot and smelly fish guts don't go well together. Weather was great.

Reviews.Title: “Guess we were lucky”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the G.P.R. I became aware of the overbooking problem at the hotel well after reserving a room so when we arrived I expected the worst. We traveled with another couple and our rooms were not available but were the following day, so only one move. Friends from Seattle followed a few days later and once again their room was not available and they waited a few days in a quality of room they did not book. Funny, you spend a few thousand dollars to go on vacation and you actually feel luck to get what you paid for. After check in things were great. Plenty of food and drinks were available. No complaints on the food with enough choices you can always find something you like. The two reservation restaurants were very good. The staff was excellent. Very friendly and helpful. I did talk to many unhappy people about over booking problems and the construction noise across the street. I mean VERY UNHAPPY people. I really think the staff is required to be at their best to compensate for the terrible management at this resort. In the age of computers there is no possible way overbooking should be such a problem. My take on it is they intentionally overbook then send vacationers to hotels who are at less than capacity. The old bait and switch! Hey thats illegal! O, we're in Mexico. Try that in the U.S. But, yes I did have a very good time. I would love to go back but just knowing that after traveling across the country and booking 6 months in advance that my room might not be available. NO WAY! Repeat customers must not be a concern to management so I should not be missed. Adios!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned last Saturday from a week-long stay. Overall, GPR is probably the best resort in Playa right now. We too had some trouble with room check-in, but it worked out well for us. We were flexible -- ended up trading one night at a sister hotel for an upgrade to a junior suite. If you don't get what you reserved or want, you must be insistent and politely firm. You'll eventually get your way. Just be aware they are not very good at managing their reservations. The property is very nice, good beachfront, nice pool. We opted NOT for all-inclusive, since we like the flexibility of getting out of the hotel. But if it's for you, go for it -- all the food and drinks are right at hand and the service staff makes frequent trips to the beach to bring you whatever you want. There were some yahoos there reverting to spring break fraternity behavior. Not at all opposed to cutting loose (we sure did) but no one wants to hear you mouthing off about how drunk you're going to get. I would avoid Playa during spring break. Food was overall good. Service attentive and very polite without fawning. Activities you book at the hotel (e.g. scuba) are overpriced -- you can do much better on your own in town. Cocktails good and strong, stronger than most in town. Housekeeping very prompt. Room decor nice. Spa services fine, competent. Workout gym pretty small and if you're not all inclusive, it costs you $8 per day (we skipped). Security is good, visible and active (keep your bracelet with you). I don't know about the harassment about time shares -- I'm sure it's there somewhere but we didn't get any of it at the GPR, and very little of it in town. We recommend a junior suite. The standard room views are not very good. If you're planning a trip, you'll enjoy -- PDC is a fun little town and the Gran Porto is a nice property. Relax and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most”
Reviews.Author: Ted C
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Porto Real and other than having to switch rooms once it was a pleasant experience. This was our fifth time to Playa del Carmen(first time w/our 5 yo son). We normally stay at the Colibri, which is just south of the Blue Parrot, but I could not pass up an excellent hotel/air package that Expedia was offering.
