As others have stated there is major construction going on across the street from the hotel that starts at about 7:30 AM and ends at about 8:00 PM. Apparently it's a going to be an adult only(16 years and older) hotel operated by the Porto Real and the construction will be continuing up until at least May '04. IT IS LOUD!!! It's not a problem unless you're planning on sleeping late. As far as being harassed about time shares we did not have that problem at all. Use your head. When they slip a note under your door telling you "We have a gift waiting for you at the Customer Service Desk" ignore it. Final note, if you want the best salsa on the beach head down to the hotel "La Costa del Mar". The beach restaurant/bar "El Pirata" makes the best salsa we've ever had! Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Report”
Reviews.Author: UnoRio
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is great. Although we stayed in a standard room it was quite adequite, very clean with T.V., A.C., stocked mini fridge/bar, and an ample supply of thick bath towels, although lacking a view. There is even a small pool and swim up bar on the 3rd floor where our room was, although it is cool from being shaded much of the day. From what I could see, the upgraded suites looked very luxurious.The gardens are lush and well treed, and everything radiates out from the main lobby to the large pool, restaurants and bars. The buffet restaurant offered a fair selection of food to satisfy most tastes, although the two ala carte restaurants included in our all inclusive package offered more elegant dining and much superior food offerings including a very good filet mignon. The beach side snack bar offered a good selection of lunch and snack items too.The activity team kept guests occupied throughout the day with contests and activities. A mini-club is available for kids, but wasn't as good or extensive as I 've seen elsewhere, consisting more of a craft room , with video games and a VCR. Their staff did take the kids to the pool and beach, and provided a piniata every couple of days for the kids to wack open for candies inside. Evening shows were below expectation, with the exception of a few evenings when outside dancers were brought in to perform. Other nights were filled with games and karioki nights, which didn't appeal to us or measure up to what other resorts offer.The biggest plus for this resort has got to be its' location. Only about a block from the hotel is the 5th Ave. main drag, which is ideal for a strole any time of the day or evening for some people watching, shopping, eating , drinking, and is always entertaining.Staff throughout the hotel are friendly, welcoming, and cheerful.The hotel caters to Americans, Canadians and Europeans which ads another pleasant dimension to the atmosphere in the hotel.In all, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “timeshare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Too much timeshare harrassment

Reviews.Title: “Use a travel agent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned on the 1st from Gran Porto Real. This was our second time there and both times we had a group of 10. Our family loves this hotel because the rooms are so close to the beach, you get excellent service from everyone but the front desk if you tip some, beautiful decor, relaxing environment, beautiful scenery. I definetly recommend using a top notch travel agent and booking through a reputable company. We booked Jr. Suites ocean view but our papers didn't say ocean view so they didn't provide us with ocean view rooms until our travel agent had America West fax them the correct information and still one hour before check out the front desk manager, Nicholas, was trying to charge us $40 a day for each room. It finally got resolved through our travel agent. Overall I would go back again but just making sure my papers indicated the correct room category/rate. We went with three generations and everyone loved it. It is small enough for the older people to get around easy yet there are enough activities to keep the teenagers happy. We loved the breakfasts and lunches but the buffets at night got a little old. It's nice because you don't have to get dressed up at all. Shorts and t-shirts are fine. We ate at Il Pescadore (Italian) two nights and enjoyed that but we dressed up the first night becasue of the dress code but there were people in shorts and t-shirts. Maria Margarita's was good but we hit it on an off night. These are defintely places to go. The people down there work hard to keep the place up - the beaches (small) are great although if you want prime seats you have to reserve your chairs early. There is construction next door too. We talked to some Canadians who spent a week at Principe Bahia Tulum which 3 of 4 people liked Porto Real better - food was a bit better, proximity to the beach was huge, ocean views from the rooms were much better, close proximity to town was huge too. Overall we had a fabulous trip - just beware dealing with the front desk and getting what you paid for. They definitely try to get you to stay at their cancun property too - but we didn't get pressured. Use a great travel agent through a powerful vacation package (like America West Vacations). I'd go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Not for us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there over the Thanksgiving holiday. There is MAJOR construction going on directly across the street from the hotel. Although the conceirge told us the construction would be restricted to the hours between 9 and 5, the pounding and drilling began at 7:15AM each morning and did not let up until after 7PM in the evening. Then around 9PM each night, the deafing sounds of the poolside show made it impossible to get a good night's sleep. People who would enjoy this hotel: honeymooners, college kids, couples with small children, big drinkers. If you're a young, childless couple you will not get the peace and relaxation you're looking for in a beach vacation. My husband and I were really looking for a quite beach vacation so that we could relax. If that's what you're looking for I would recommend going to another hotel. Not only due to the construction noise, but also because the poolside entertainment is NON-stop. Really. There's an announcement for beach volleyball, bingo, or other activity at all times during the day. Also, as other people mentioned, the beach is severely eroded, making the area by the water way too crowded. On the plus side, the hotel is perfectly situated to the main shopping drag, and the quality of the food was impressive. After complaining about the construction noise, they moved us to another room without increasing the fees.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blossom
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that I didn't believe I would get bumped. I reserved and paid in full 2 months ago and went the extra mile to get confimation directly from the hotel as well as our travel agent. It was not good enough. Not only are they bumping us 2 days before we depart, but they are sending us to the middle of nowhere to a resort that is 1.5 hours away from Cancun and completely isolated. We will be stuck there with our 3 small children for 2 weeks. We booked with Air Transat and they are refusing to refund our money (all 10 of us) and even though our mother is dying and this will be our last trip with her, they say they are completely within thier rights. ( they say it's the hotel that overbooked) We are being forced to go to a resort that we would never choose on our own and have not been offered us anything in return and we have fought them tooth and nail. A complete waste of time, huge money and way too stressfull. Don't kid yourselves like we did! Thanks Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “The best of all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just cam back in late october '03. This was our 4th trip to cancun and while the other hotels we stayed at were acceptable this was without a doubt the best we have ever stayed at. Our room was a jr suite but not ocean front. We ar early risers and the hotel always had coffee ready near the bar, our room was always cleaned before 11am. Our waiter Alberto had our table ready every morning at 7:30, coffee, orange juice and bacon were waiting. The wait staff at the pool and beach were constantly seeing to your comfort and needs especiall a young man named Franklin. The two theme restaurants were great!! you could even get a good steak in those restaurants if you did not like their special that night. The beach was clean and it was only a 10 min walk to downtown (5th ave) . While this hotel like many other is all inclusive it's amazing what a dollar or two to the staff will get you. We have just booke anothe trip for our anniversary in late Jan '04 nd this time we have the oceanfron jr suite.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel at first but on our second day I went to the gym and there is a step just inside the door. It was not marked and I was looking for the treadmills I fell and was hurt. The young men at the spa helped and called a doctor,No one at the hotel was helpful.The doctor took me to his small clinic and said I had a broken femur and fractured hip. I decided against the Cancun hospital and booked a flight fod the next morning. My husband got no help from the front desk.No even asked if I was hurt badly! When we checked my husband had to find a taxi,deal with luggage and the desk people just watched and worried about room keys and towel cards and only came to the taxi to make sure we didn't take the wheel chair to the airport. 12 weeks later we are still waiting for a refund for the unused days! Don't fall at the Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Porto Real Not a place for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Playa Del Carmen and stayed at the Porto Real. The Gran Porto Real is not the kind of place to go for peace and quiet. It was packed with people who only had food and drinking on their minds. When you could find a chair to get some sun, the loud speaker would come on and announce "beach volley ball!" This is a place for people who want to eat and party. The food did not look very appetizing. There were 2 restaurants and the buffet. The restaurants took reservations at 7:00am and had limited seating. When the reservations were gone, you had to eat outside the hotel or at the buffet. I can not imagine why Honeymooners would want to stay there. The staff was plight and the rooms mostly clean. Importunely the beach is being eroded away. The fishing boats are beached in front. You have to doge the boats to swim and step over the lines to walk the beach. This place would appeal to some, but definitely not all. Beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Saved our Trip”
Reviews.Author: celticgreat
Reviews.Content: Just got back November 10, 2003, from Gran Porto Real. We too were booked with Costa Real only to be surprised by the major reconstruction. Getting switched to Gran Porto Real saved our vacation and actually got me thinking about returning to Mexico for future trips. The staff was super friendly, putting us in the upscale Master suite the first night there due to lack of availability (several couples had fled Costa Real). If your budget can handle this room (ours can't), it's fabulous with 3 seperate balconies overlooking the ocean, huge master bedroom and seperate living room. We were moved to our room the next day and I was able to interact with the reception staff often. They were friendly and helpful, offering to let me look in a new room before I took it. We ate in each of the two theme restaurants, Italian and Mexican, and found the food and service great. We liked how we could walk to 5th avenue, even with 2 small children in tow. I don't care for the time share venders on the street but they must be successful or they wouldn't be there. A buffet set up on the beach was perfect for our needs and had items to satisfy most taste. My only complaints were that in the Kid's club, the staff member would sometimes leave, saying to the kids she's be back in 1/2 hour. My girlfriends 7 year old sometimes wandered out to the pool to "visit", luckily we were there and she didn't have to search for us. I would think that they'd want to be a little more accountable for the kids. Other comment, slightly negative, not much to do while it's raining. Overall, this place saved our trip and I'd recommend it to anyone, just don't lose your kids.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be Apprehensive.....”
Reviews.Author: Brengar
Reviews.Content: Ola' -- To sum up in one word - Excellent. After the airline losing our luggage, we were very frustrated when we arrived at the Gran Porto Real. Within 10 minutes our attitude went from frustration to extreme awe. My husband and I had a oceanview jr. suite. The room overlooked the pool and the beach. The rooms are gorgeous - a true Mexican hacienda look. ALL staff were great. The activities staff especially went out of their way to try to get people to participate in events (without being overbearing or obnoxious). All guests seemed to be enjoying themselves. We went all-inclusive and I would definetely recommend that. Tip well - the staff deserve it. This is a great place to go -- it's totally up to you if you want complete relaxation and/or several different activities. Don't worry about the negative reviews. Have fun and enjoy this great place! We will definetely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We originally were booked at the Costa Real in Cancun. Having never been to Mexico, this looked and sounded like the perfect place to be. WRONG! Construction was going on, the entire place was torn apart, jack hammers, etc. Also, Cancun is one large "mini-Miami" and a "spring break" atmosphere 365 days per year. If that is what you are looking for, then go to Cancun. If NOT, then stay at the Gran Porto Real in Playa Del Carmen. Our travel agents were awesome and moved us from the Costa Real to the Gran Porto with not problems. We arrived there and it was everything I had dreamed Mexico would be. The entrance was large and tropical - all open air, grand pillars, etc. We were escorted personally by a representative of the Real hotel chain and were told that our room would be ready in about an hour. When we were finally taken to the room - were were astonished! Spacious, grand, bathroom large, etc. And the view - spectacular! We over looked the pool and then beyond that was the beautiful Caribe del Mar. The service was over the top. We wanted for nothing. They were always on top! I awoke several mornings early and would go down to the pool area and the staff were always scurrying around cleaning everything. Constantly thru the day they were be sweeping, scrubbing, wiping, etc. The food and the drinks were great! We had bought the AI and it is so worth the money. I know we drank more than our share on a daily basis. The buffet was good, we only ate breakfast there but the selection was great and the omlette bar-waffle/pancakes were great! The juice bar was great too. We also had the advantage to eat at the elPiscatore and Maria Margaritta. We ate there all the time. The food was wonderful - presented very elegantly. The waite staff were great too. No complaints about the food or drink. My husband is a Canadian Whiskey drinker. It is very expensive to import Canadian whiskey but the bar tender at the pool bar dug really deep and PRESTO found a bottle. I love the location of this hotel also. 2 blocks and you are right there at 5th Street. What a great time here. We never needed a cab or taxi. The street is fun, exciting, and if you are looking for a party - go down 5th. Blocks and blocks of restaurants, shops, bars, etc. The street is completely foot traffic. You will find everything you are looking for here. The beach at the hotel was fine. If you wanted something larger and more quiet, just walk about 1/2 mile north and you would have all the seclusion you wanted. I enjoyed watching the fishermen, the birds, etc. The sea is grand! The pools are very clean and a nice temperature. Lots of activities going on thru the day if you want to participate. One note - if you take the tour to the ruins in Chichen Itza, remember to bring some tissue, a sweatshirt and a wide brimed hat. You will need all of these. Well worth the money. Xcaret is also a wonderful place and the dolphin swim is SO worth the money. Plan your trip to the Gran Porto Real. You will NOT be disappointed. We are looking into our return trip here to this hotel for next October. Feel free to contact me if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Some people just don't get it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Prior to my recent stay at the Port Real, I read the many scathing reviews (and I mean many). These reviews made me very apprehensive about my trip. Should not have worried, as our trip was excellent, the staff was excellent, the room was excellent, the pool and beach were excellent, ... you get the picture. We had no problems with our reservations, and the front desk staff were excellent ... sorry. I did realize at the time of reading the many bad reviews that they all appeared to be from the same group. Believe a group of 10 couples stayed at the Real and did not have a good time. Each of the 10 couples submitted a seperate review, which made it seem like the worst hotel in Playa. I now believe that group of 20 people had terrible attitudes which they should have left in the states. Mexico does not need your problems. Trust me, the hotel is EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Perfect time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel! I have stayed in more expensive hotels around Playa del Carmen, but this was my best experience.Pros: 1. Great beach 2. Good food (esp. in the Mexican Restaurant) 3. Beautiful rooms 4. Nice pools 5. Location, Location, Location (on the beach, 10 minute walk to ferry to Cozumel, 2 minute walk to 5th Avenue) 6. Staff is really great 7. Great drinks 8. Waffles and omelettes at the breakfast buffet, yum!!! 9. Everything was so clean!Cons: 1. No coffee bar (actually, this is not a complaint, just a suggestions that a coffee bar for lattes for those of us who aren't big drinkers would be great!) The house coffee was only so-so. 2. The keyboard player in the bar most nights... A little too "cheap nightclub" feeling.Well, I had to really think of some cons. My husband and I went AI, but we ate out in town at least once a day, not because the GP food was not good, but because 5th avenue has the best restaurants. We ended up going out for coffee every afternoon, and usually spent lunch on 5th. The food there is quite cheap, and so excellent. But the AI was nice since we did not have to worry about finding food. And the GP's food is quite good. I am not a big buffet person (except for breakfast) so we had reservations at the Mexican or Italian restaurant every night.I really can't say enough about this place. I have traveled quite a bit, and I have to say this place is great. When I booked, I was told by some travel agents that I would not be happy here since it is only a "moderate" resort. Obviously those agents have not visited the property. We wanted to stay somewhere close to town this time (not in Playacar, where you need a taxi to go anywhere), and this hotel was just perfect. Actually, it far exceeded my expectations. My husband is quite picky, and he absolutely loved it. Anyway, don't hesitate to book here if you want a relaxing, I don't want to drive, I want to relax on the beach, inexpensive yet pampered trip. And most importantly, ignore those negative reviews. I did, and I am so thankful! Of course, I had no booking problems. That sounds like the only real complaint out there.

Reviews.Title: “dont' honor reservations”
Reviews.Author: Betsy0123
Reviews.Content: Don't consider this hotel if you are traveling during a busy time, Xmas, Spring Break etc. Everything you read about overbooking is true, even if you have confirmed your reservation. They overbook and then send you to another hotel, or give you any room you have available. We saw numerout shouting matches at the front desk. Betsy Brown

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience At The Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Playa del Carmen and cannot say enough about the resort. The junior suites are very impressive, the food and drinks are great and the pool, spa and gymn are top notch. But the service - the people, really - stood out the most. All of the staff with whom we spoke were unfailingly positive, upbeat, attentive and enthusiastic about making our stay as memorable as possible. We were surprised by the number and variety of pieces of exercise equipment, the large spa area and the other amenities. We strongly recommend the Il Pescatore restaurant as the best food in the resort. For value and excellent treatment, the resort is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Best vacation ever!! This place was absolutely amazing! After reading some of the reviews, I was a little afraid of what we had gotten into, but I was very pleasantly surprised! The beach was clean and fresh, and the waiter service was kind and friendly. Gran Porto was an excellent vacation spot, and well worth visiting. The staff there were kind and helpful, and our room was always left in the best shape. I have no complaints at all about staying at the Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa! If you want a quiet, relaxing, and beautiful atmosphere, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This summer was the first time that I had ever visited Mexico, so I had obviously never stayed at the Gran Porto Real. I had expected to show up at a great hotel, but I was wrong...it exceeded great. It was absolutely amazing. The staff was wonderful. They were all so friendly and the accomidations were perfect. I couldn't have asked for anything more, other than more time to stay there. There is no doubt in my mind that I will be returning. It was excellent. Oh did I mention the view? It's breath taking. It's right on the beach. I'm not sure of a place that can beat the Gran Porto Real in any shape, form or fashion. I loved it and if you are considering going there to spend your vaction all i have to say is stop looking for other hotels because this one is the one to go to!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the best vacation we have ever been on!! We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Gran Porto Real. I wish that we would have booked for a week at least. The resort was exceptional!! Can not say a bad thing about it. I had heard a lot about over booking problems. We made sure that we arrived at the resort by noon to check in. It could not have gone any smoother. They had our Jr. Suite ready. It was well worth the upgrade. The standard rooms were pretty small--but still nice. They treated us like kings and queens!! Make sure that you have dinner at Maria Margarita. It was a great dining experience!! The dress code is casual but not bathing suits. You do need a reservation but it was easy to get one. I got a message in the spa and it was wonderful--well worth the &70.00. Might want to get to the pool early in order to get a lounge chair. If those are taken, the beach is very nice too and just steps away. Heard that the beach was too small. I didn't find that it was too small--just steps away from the pool too. We are starting to make plans for a weeks stay next year!! I highly recommend this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at Gran Porto Real. It wasn't our first trip to Playa, but it was the best so far! This resort is 5-star and 1st class all the way! Staff members were exceptional. Room was more than we expected! Top notch! Being able to walk into town was even better than we thought it would be. Will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very worried before I got to the Gran Porto Real. I had nothing do worry about. It was the best most relaxing vacation I ever had. The Hotel and there rooms were great they were beautiful. The staff was great and helpful. They treated you like royalty. You virtually did not have to worry about anything. You just mention something and they had it too you. Baloo the party planner was awesome. He is on the go from morning till night planning and making sure the guests are being taken care of. I mentioned to him on a sunday night that we were thinking about taking his little tour to senor frogs for my friends bachlorette party and just in that passing chat he had set us a blast of the night for my friend. We went on the AI and it is the way to go. sign up for the tours and you never have to worry about getting around. They take care of you 100%. there beach was ok. it had some seaweed on it only when the water was ruff.But people were out there cleaning it all the time. The water was clear when there was not alot of waves. Next lets talk about the 3rd floor pool. madesto the bartender there is A #1. we tipped him well cause he took care of us well. there was 13 of us that went and that was our party haven. It was not as conjested as the regular pool. adn madesto was the best. I cant praise this hotel and staff enough. The check in was quick and eacy. INALL THE VACATION IS THE BEST. DONT LET THESE FEW BAD REVIEWS MAKE U UNEASY. IT IS GREAT. The only problem we ran into is that the hotel is all tile make sure you bring sandles with grip. or you will slide all over. My friend got married there and It was beautiful they did a great job with that too. if you have any questions email me and ask.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must admit, I had some reservations about the Gran Porto after reading some reviews. But as soon as we pulled up, all my doubts were gone! Check in was quick, and our room was ready (even at 1pm). We got our Jr. Suite Oceanview on the 2nd floor. The room was outstanding..all tile and marble. The shower is HUGE, the mini-bar stocked with beer, water and soda, and the Hammock on the porch was a treat! The pool area was very large, as was the beach. There were men cleaning the seaweed off the shore from morning to night. Waiters come by often to take drink and food orders. The buffett was ok (skip oriental night!!), but the 2 restaurants that are part of the AI were really good, Maria Margarita has different menus on different nights, but all regional Mexican food. Definatly pay the $14 extra for Lobster one night...you get 2 tails for that, and they were very good!! All the staff were great--even though we were AI, we tipped the staff at meals and when they brought us drinks--they work their tails of for not too much money! The activities staff were great, working from morning til late at night. Baloo, Alexis and Jorge were always running around, getting guests to play volleyball, water aerobics, etc. They had activities nightly in Challenges sports bar that were fun, and planned a few nights into town bars. If you are looking for a relaxing, fun vacation, this is the place. There is nightlife in Playa, just not as much as in Cancun (no college kids running around drunk!). One of the other great things about Gran Porto is that it is so close to 5th ave (shopping, bars, ferry, etc). All the other resorts are in Playcar, which is about 10-15 cab ride away, and from here you can walk on the beach to different bars or walk down 5th ave (beautiful at night!). Oh, make Xcaret a day trip--it was so much fun, and absolutely beautiful! I would definatly stay here again. It exceeded my expectations and was truly paradise!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel a lot. This was our first trip to mexico. There were 10 people in our group. We all had such a good time. The entertainment staff was so much fun. They kept us busy and kept us laughing. Baloo & Alex....we miss you already!!! The servive, be it food, drink, maid, bellhop, taxi, etc, was exceptional. Please tip them, even if you go all inclusive, as these people make very little in wages. Yes there was seaweed along the shore but there was someone out cleaning it steadily. This place is a must see!

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God, Oh My God!!!”
Reviews.Author: holababy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Porto Real from Sept 14-28/03. This resort is the best ever!! What makes it the best? The staff! I have never been more pampered, well treated, and just made to feel totally welcome as much as here. Check-in was a breeze & we got our junior suite as requested. We have never gone AI before, and I will never not go AI again! My 2 daughters(18 & 14), my husband, & I had the time of our lives! My youngest was actually sobbing when she had to get on the bus to go to the airport. I have to admit, I got a bit misty myself! We have made so many new friends from guests to staff. The activities crew(especially Alexis, Alejandro & Baloo) treated my girls like they were princesses & by the end of the 3rd day knew them by name & they were made to feel like they were part of the crew becuz they participated in every activity, and there were lots!! Water volleyball twice a day,beach volleyball,water polo, horseshoes, bocci ball, bike tours, Mexican Bingo, the list goes on & on! Needless to say, we were never bored.The beach is beautiful, and the only time we saw seeweed was when the wave action was quite heavy which didn't happen until our 2nd to last day there. The rocks are there, but the water is clear unless there's heavy wave action, so you can steer clear of the rocks quite easily.The food was excellent in all the restaurants, but our favourite was Il Pescatore, and the service there was great as well. Jose & Pasquale were excellent waiters. The buffet was great for breakfast & dinner, & we usually ordered from the lunch menu @ the pool bar or ordered from the grill chef.There's also the VIP Lounge which not many AI people knew about just past the lobby. It was self serve, and they had chicken wings, cold meats & cheeses, nachos & desserts. They also had juices, pop, coffee & bottles of different types of alchohol if you wanted to zip up your drinks a little. It also had a pool table & air hockey game, as well as a T.V. if you wanted to catch a movie. Our girls used that quite a few times for lunch or to hang out in the evening with friends they had made at the pool. It's definitley worth checking out!The barmaids & men around the pool were there all the time getting drinks constantly for you. These people work their butts off for about $42 a day, so I had no problem tipping them once a day!!! They also had a portable bar set up on the beach so you didn't have to go to the pool for a drink if you didn't want to wait for a waiter to come to you.The swim-up bar was at the 3rd floor pool, but we never bothered going up there becuz it was way too much fun @ the main pool, and didn't want to miss anything!There is not one single thing I can say bad about this resort. It exceeded my expectations beyond anything I could have dreamed.I would highly recommend this place to all of my family & friends, and definitely plan to return there next year!!The one thing I can complain about are how some guests treat the staff. Sometimes I wonder what makes them think they are so much more superior than the Mexican people. All I can say is, Shame on you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: uour family stayed at the Gran Porto Real 9/13 - 9/20. Our room was ready upon our noon arrival, and had a partial view of the ocean even though we did not pay for one. Took the time share trip - it lasted one hour, - let them know we were not interested, and was well worth the $100 credit in the gift shop. After taking the tour, they were courteous the rest of the stay and never bothered us. The staff is very friendly - we were AI - sometimes tipped, sometimes didn't. Our son enjoyed the kids camp, the location of the hotel was terrific, food and drinks are always available somewhere. We had no seaweed problem, and the fishing boats are parked all up and down the beach, so one beach is not better than another. We took them up on their offer to spend our last night at their resort in Cancun - it is a bigger, much grander hotel, but not friendlyand Cancun is a different attitude. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: mcfry
Reviews.Content: I recently got back from my trip to Playa Del Carmen (Sept 20, 2003) with my boyfriend and we had a wonderful time. We stayed in a standard room right next to the second pool located on the 3rd floor. I thought that the room was nice and since we only spent sleeping time in the room we felt we didn't need something fancy. We travelled in a wedding party of 31 people and not one person got "bumped" to another hotel. I had heard that it was the travel agents and not the hotel that overbooks. We travelled with Air Canada Vacations which had representatives on the resort at all times which was excellent. Two of our friends who had some minor problems got it straightened out within a few days by talking to the representatives (One friend couldn't fit a crib into her standard room so she got upgraded to a suite at half the cost). The beach was beautiful and I cannot understand why people would complain about a little seaweed and a couple of rocks. Get over it...it's nature or have you forgotten? I also loved the food and the service was good. One tip however if you decide to travel to this resort: You need to tip. I went with the impression that tipping was optional but there is a definate difference in service when you begin to tip (just a couple of bucks). The shopping on 5th Ave. was alot of fun and you need to bargain! I ate at all the restaurants and thought they were all excellent. I especially loved "Mayan Night" the food was excellent. I thought this resort was beautiful and I had a great time, I'm sure you will too!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably wonderful place to spend Christmas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Eight of us spent last Christmas at the Porto Real. We booked thru a travel agent so had transport awaiting us at the airport. Hotel was beautiful! Beach was just fine. Awesome scuba trip was booked at the hotel (best scuba diving I've EVER done!) including lessons from a dive shop a little further down island - dive area was not far offshore. I thot the food was excellent at the hotel. The rooms were huge, as were the bathrooms. The dock for the ferry to Cozumel was within walking distance from the hotel. The hotel had everything we wanted and more. We went ALL-INCLUSIVE (as we've done in other countries) and were VERY pleased with the value received. Staff was attentive at all times. This is the place to go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real is Good for some things and not for others”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from Playa. We had a blast. I thought the Gran Port Real Resort was an ok place. The rooms were very nice and the people we pretty nice. The things I did not like were: The pool did not have a swim up bar and the non-motorized water equipment was not that great. I like to go sailing and this place only had one boat and did not want to let you use it. I thought the food was decent as well. I would go back to Playa but would probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Banditos”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I am unable to comment on much about the rooms of this hotel, as we never got into one. In spite of the fact that my wife confirmed our reservations a month out, a week out, and the day before, we arrived to be told we were being moved to another hotel which was "only 5 minutes away". I'd heard that when in Mexico time seems to pass at a different rate, but I didn't think they meant that 5 minutes away was really 25 minutes by Cab. The desk crook (I mean clerk) at the Poto Real told us we would have "a nice Hacienda with a private pool that we would share with the other guests" at the new hotel. Apparently Hacienda is Spanish for so far from the beach and the real pool that they had build another pool, only smaller and with broken ceramic tiles and "Danger" signs all around it. It seems the Porto Real overbooks quite often, as we met at least 10 other couples at the hotel we ended up at who got the same treatment. It was so bad that while we were still in the lobby at the Porto that one man was screaming obcenities and actually tossed a chair across the lobby because half of his party of 20 got bumped. When the staff (or what passes for) asked him to be quiet, he yelled "what are you going to do, throw me out? Oh, yeah, you don't have a room for me anyway!" What's even worse, the Porto still probably made money off of us, because the place we stayed had a lower rate than we paid. I also heard that the Porto was bumping Americans because they could save money by selling the rooms to Europeans, who don't bathe very often, so they use less water. We actually had a good time at the other hotel (which I won't name because I don't even want to mention the nice people there in the same breath as the weasels at the Porto).

Reviews.Title: “Big overbooking problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon and arrived at the Gran Porto Real to be told they had no reservation under our name. The very unfriendly front desk people blamed everybody under the sun. There solution was to put us in a non ocean view room (even though we had paid for one) for five days and we would have to switch resorts for the remaining two days. After much yelling and screaming we were sent to the GALA Resort. These people tried to ruin our one and only honeymoon and thank god they didn't. The GALA resort was great would stay there again.STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Ripoff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Gran Porto and I have to say I'm horribliy disappointed. I found out several things while I was at the hotel. First, apparently, there is no word in Spanish that means "overbooking". The hotel overbooked half of our party (10 people) and made absolutley no apology whatsoever. No one cared. When we asked to speak with someone of authority, I learned my next lesson: Mexican hotel managers are named "Tim" and only work from 9-9:30 pm on weeknights. It was like dropping the soap in a prison shower: once you're there, there's not a lot you can do to change what is going to happen. It just seemed like the Mexicans had a different word for everything, including hospitality. For the price, aggravation, and metaphorical prison rape my friends and I suffered while at the Gran Porto, I would strongly recommend staying elsewhere. Playa is wonderful, but not when you get cheated before you even arrive. I will say that the highlight of our trip was when we walked down the beach and saw none other than Lorenzo Lamas from "Renegade" fame. We bought him several beers as he recounted story after story about action scenes from the set of "Renegade". He even talked trash about Chuck Norris! He was kind enough to take some pictures with us and signed my Dallas Burn visor. Sadly, that was the highlight of our trip. Best of luck to you in Mexico. Be careful booking at Gran Porto Ripoff. Adios!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon - ok...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, what too say! The resort itself was beautiful! The food on the otherhand - not very good. Luckily for us, we were within walking distance to the town of Playa where we had all of our dinners and a great cup of coffee! Definitely venture out into the city, lots of great shops, cafes, bars, etc. Have fun, but remember, if you're a beach person, this resort isn't for you - there isn't a swimming beach anywhere near by. The resort, EXCELLENT! Clean, bright and great service -enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “toto inclusivo, i.e. bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at the porto with lots of friends just two weeks ago. I have a busy chiropractic practice working 51 weeks out of the year, so I was appalled when I arrived at the porto and was immediately shunted to La Gala. The whole party was in an uproar, I missed hanging out with friends I haven't seen in years. My migraines, that had been in remission, flared up as well as the irritable bowel (not from the food). Let's face it, once you are down there they got ya; at least the cab drivers were friendly and seemed understanding and played lots of american music. Go fifty!

Reviews.Title: “A couple of drawbacks, but otherwise great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with the not-so-great stuff first. 1. The beach is too small. Not enough room to spread out. 2. There are a lot of rocks in the sea and I stubbed my foot quite a few times when the water was murkey. 3. It's a hit or miss on the sea being clear. 4. Not enough activities at this hotel. It rained quite a bit and we were bored. You can only shop so many times in PDC to keep yourself entertained on a rainy day. Now for the good stuff. 1. Really beautiful Jr. Suites. 2. Visually stunning architecture. 3. Great food at the specialty restaurants. 4. Room service is wonderful, especially breakfast. 5. Great service. 6. The beds aren't as hard as most of the resorts in the Yucatan. 7. Did I already mention the FABULOUS service? 8. They bring you food and drinks on the beach. Yummy shrimp cerviche. Overall, we had a great time. I wouldn't go back again though to the Porto Real, and that's just because we love the beach, not the pool. If you don't care about snorkeling off the beach than this hotel is great. I would rate it a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto y Puffer Fish NO MAS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago, some of my best friends EVER planned a joyous weekend at the Gran Porto Real Suites in Playa Del Carmen. In fact, there were 10 couples that were really looking forward to spending a few days relaxing and enjoying some fellowship. Upon arrival at the Gran Porto, half of us were told that we had to move to another hotel that was only 5 minutes away. Since they gave us no option, we moved to the other hotel that was 20 minutes away and it was a dump compared to what we were expecting at the Gran Porto. The staff at the Gran Porto couldn't have cared less that they split up our group. They showed no compassion or monetary compensation for ruining our weekend. However, the part that really upset me was that I was at the Gran Porto one day and I was almost hit by a puffer fish falling from the sky while I was laying next to the pool. I am guessing that a pelican dropped the fish from its mouth while flying over the pool (A pufferfish is actually a toxic fish according to a friend that was with us that is a doctor.........well he is a chiropractor, but he makes us call him Dr.). When I alerted the staff that their was a pufferfish laying on the pooldeck waiting to be stepped on by a guest, they acted like I "planted" the pufferfish on the walkway. NO MAS GRAN PORTO!!.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You will be bumped! If you read the other negative reviews of the porto, you will notice a pattern of overbooking and poor management. We booked our trip with a group of 20 people 3 months in advance. When we arrived 8 of us were informed we would be moved to another resort. No compensation was offered for our trouble. Management could care less. It is a classic bait and switch. Unfortunately there is not much you can do in mexico with your luggage. We were moved to the Gala which was great once we turned blue in the face insisting on an ocean view room. I don't doubt that the people who got what they paid for at the porto had a good time. In my aggravated opinion it's not worth getting furious on your vacation. There are plenty of other alternatives to this place. Our party that stayed said the service was poor due to overcrowding andt the bar closes at midnight. Try the Blue Parrot or the Gala. Both great places. The booking staff of the porto shoud be thrown in a Mexican prison...in a cell without an ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Resort & Grand Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen, Mexico two years in a row -- will certainly be going there again. Service, location, food was terrific, plus we love the small-resort atmosphere. The employees were wonderful -- can't say enough good things about Gran Porto Real. Terrific!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: steffynie
Reviews.Content: I honeymooned at the Gran Porto Real from Aug 25-27 (we spent the prior 5 days in Cancun, but wished we had stayed in Playa del Carmen the entire trip). I called to confirm our jr. suite ocean view twice before arriving after reading all the problems people have had with overbooking. We had to wait a bit for our room (but we did get there really, really early to avoid an overbooking problem). Our room was great. However, they definitely DO overbook. In fact, we wanted to extend our visit but the front desk said we could not--that they were overbooked by 35 people the next day and had to send people to their sister properties in Cancun, even if people don't want to go!! That is absurd. They admit it is a problem but seem unaware of how big a problem. It cost us about $50 to get from Cancun to the hotel and they couldn't grasp the concept that if someone paid that much in cabfare, got there and then got bumped, that person would be mad about having to pay the cabfare there since the hotel will then pay for transportation to their sister property! Anyway--aside from the overbooking problems--the hotel is beautiful. Had we been there more than 2 nights we would have gone A-IP but we opted for EP, which was great b/c we then got to try different places on 5th Ave. 5th Ave is amazing. So much character. After going to Playa, we will never return to Cancun (which we feel is about as Americanized as you can get--no Mexican flavor to it at all). Also, there are boats in front of the hotel, but there are in front of ALL hotels there. Didn't see any seaweed and there was plenty of room on the beach in front of the hotel. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel--just be sure to confirm your reservation and get there as early as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked! Stay at the GALA.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived back yesterday from a trip to Playa Del Carmen. My husband and I booked our trip 4 months ago, along with a group of 18 friends. HALF of our party, who had come from all over TX to be together, got bumped to another hotel 5 miles from the Real. THe front desk told us originally that it was one mile down the beach... Liars! The staff was arrogant, and not the slightest bit helpful. In our dealings with the hotel, we encountered at least 20 other people that had been bumped from the hotel. They repeatedly checked in time share guests, and prefered European guests who in the words of front desk representatives stay for longer periods of time. These guests arrived after my group. I read many of the postings about the overbooking situation at the Porto Real and thought this would not happen to our group. I confirmed my room three times directly with the hotel prior to arrival. The offer from the hotel to help ease our pain... a $3.50 lobster dinner. And a half hour massage that we would need to travel from our new hotel to the Porto Real for. The Gala, the hotel we ended up at was actually very nice, and had my entire party been there, we would have been very pleased with our experience. The Porto Real is basically run by jerks.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and only so-so”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice but the rooms are average and becoming dated and worn. Decent location on the beach and at the end of the restaurant and shopping row. A mediocre lobster dinner was $55 at the hotel restaurant! Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write my review for a while now. My wife and I went to the Gran Porto Real for our honeymoon from May 5th to May 14th, 2003. Our time at the resort was great. I don't need to go on and on about our trip, but I have a few comments. First, the beach. I had read some reviews about it being small and full of seaweed. The size of the beach was fine, there was plenty of room for everyone and there was some seaweed on days when it was windy. It was never a problem though and it didn't keep us from enjoying the beach and the water. We spent most of our time at the resort in the chairs under the palapas on the beach with the sun and some drinks. That was the good life. Second, the food. The food is good, although in our 9 days there it did seem a bit repetitive. The Italian restaurant was easily the best place to eat, we had dinner there 5 out of 9 nights. Overall, the place is excellent, 3 months later we can't stop talking about our trip and are looking at our pictures all the time. We're already talking about when we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the most part”
Reviews.Author: jhw349
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned at the Gran Porto Real from 7/13/03 - 7/18/03. We had a great time in Playa Del Carmen and for the most part, everything was a blast. I read tons of reviews before making my decision and didn't really know what to think. Some people said it was great, then the next said it was horrible. For anyone reading these reviews, hears what you do. Take every message and combine them and you actually get the truth. Most people complaining on here are most likely the same ones complainaing about everything life has to offer and should get over it. The hotel is astonishing, especially if your used to the Holiday Inn HA HA. The floors, walls, and ceilings are all designed and decorated nicely and the rooms are awesome and exactly like the pics, as far as the Junior Suites like we stayed in. The food was absolutly great except for a couple of items and the same could happen anywhere. Food I didnt like my wife did, so its just a matter of choice and taste. The people are more freindly than those you meet at most places, yes largely because they want a tip. Heres a tip, don't always tip because then they expect it. We rationed the tips out, but splurged a little on the first day to ensure good service. The drinks are awesome and had more alcohol in them than other places ive stayed. The pool is nice and lots of chairs. You might have to wait a little while for someone to leave but we didnt and it was a full house. If you are one of these people that I read about who are going to get up early in the morning to save a chair....get a life people, you should be ashamed of yourself. Now its time for me to complain. I am a beach and ocean person. If you are as well then this might not be the best place for you. Start of with the seaweed problem. The hotle cant stop nor be blamed for Mother Nature spotting this location as the seaweed dump site of the Carribean. The hotel does its best by having people out there all day long removing it. They even have a front end loader scraping it up. There is a new pier being built right beside the hotel and is not very pretty but will be done soon I guess and no longer a prob. The beaches are all public so no fault to the hotel, but there are all these little fishing boats tied up along the shore. You can snorkel right in front of the hotel but watch out for these things. They are supposed to drive slow but yeah right. If you are a rookie snorkeler it would be neat. If you are a pro than dont waste your energy, nothing really to see except the bottom. If you are a diver, they have a dive center/shop in the resort, but make sure to do the wall dive in Cozumel. Even though we went all inclusive we still went to town and ate twice. Be carefull were you eat but do it atleast once. No higher price than a trip to Applebees, but a neat experience. Beware that what looks like mozzerella cheese may in fact be goat cheese so asking may be in order, if not what a surprise you will get. While in town, make sure to walk down to the very end of, I think 5th Avenue, and watch the guys spray painting pictures. We bought two and they are awesome. If you have any questions feel free to email me and I will be glad to endulge further to help anyone out.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful trip with the family to Playa Del Carmen. The Gran Porto Real was absolutely wonderful. Food was great, service was excellent. Rooms were great. The entertainment staff was the best. Alexs we miss you already. This was our first trip to the Mexico. I have never seen such beautiful waters. Snorkled for the first time. It was GREAT. I highly recommend The Gran Porto Real. Playa Del Carmen is a charming place away from all the hubbub and population. The staff really goes out of there way to help in any way. From Check in to Check out it was The Best.

Reviews.Title: “You have to try the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Porto Real the first week of August. This was our first trip to this part of Mexico and we can only emphasize how TOTALLY GREAT the staff and accomadations were at the resort. We went all-inclusive and recommend this as the way to go. It makes everything so simple. Overall, the food was excellent, especially at the ala carte restaurants, the Maria Margarita and the Il Pescatore. We ate at the the Pescatore twice and strongly recommend this. Ask for Jose for your waiter and get ready to be treated like royalty! The seafood, especially the calamari, were great. We found the beach and pool areas to be wonderful and as others have noted, make use of the 3rd floor pool. It's much quieter and very few young kids are there. The spa service is incredible. We definitely are going back and after seeing how touristy Cancun was, will be going back to the Gran Porto Real. One final note, you have to do the dolphin swim at Antlatida, an incredible experience that you'll remember for a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family recenlty stayed at Gran Porto Real. We had a wonderful experience. The first room they put us in was a standard street-side room which is not what our reservations called for. However, with just one phone call by Alejandro, Bellboy, they were able to place us in a Junior Suite. It was streetside but we moved two days later to an oceanfront suite. Everyone at the resort went out of their way to be helpful. My children, ages 15 and 11, never wanted to leave the resort to venture out. We were able to go the Xel-Ha, which is overpriced for the Dolphin experience, but wonderful otherwise. It is very relaxing. We also visited Tulum which I loved! Dolphin Discovery is nice, though not as nice as Xel-Ha. Overall, the experience was exceptional. I cannot wait until we go back

Reviews.Title: “Flavor of Mexico”
Reviews.Author: wausau,traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautifull hotel! The rooms were absolutely spacious-not to mention the showers. The flavor of Mexico was all around in the decor. Make sure you go to both beaches as the main one had a major loss of sand, and a new bar has been set up on the east side of the hotel. East side is a lot more (rooms in 400's and 500's) private. Hotel staff is extremly friendly and more than willing to help in any way. Want something not on the menu- they will prepare any thing just ask. Very impressive. We have always stayed at 5 star all inclusive resorts. Other than the beach we felt thier rating could be higher.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience a must see!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all I can say that my experience at the Gran Porto Real Resort was GREAT! It was my first time traveling outside the states and to be honest it was worth the time it took for me to actually fly on a plane. My husband and I vacationed at this wonderfuly resort the week of July 21-25 2003 and we both agree that this resort is class A #1 on our list. As some of the other review writers state this is a great place to see it really was. The hotel was Beautiful and the staff went out thier way daily to make you fell like a King or Qween. The food at the buffet was good remember your are not at home where some food items taste the like they should you are in a different country and they prepare the food differently so be mindfuly of that when you din at the hotel. The waiters were all great and they all pretty much speak english well. The beach was not that great with the boats and sea weed but there are other beaches that you can walk down to enjoy the clear blue waters so don't let what you here some other reviewer say affect you not to choose the nice spot for total relaxation and freedom from your life and job back home stop you from at least seeing for yourself that this Hotel is one of the greatest in the Riviera Myan area. Be sure that take a walk down 5th Avenue there are shops and great bars to stop in a eat and have good drinks. The shops are great too. Last but not least the Ocean Jr. Suite is BEAUTIFUL and it was clean daily and the staff never left anything dirty it was all clean and the view at night on the 3rd floor was very relaxing after being out on the beach and shopping all day. The staff also keep the refigerator stocked daily with soda's,water and beer so be sure and check it out it is so wonderful to be waited on hand and foot the only this I needed was to be there another week. So keep a open mind and experience this for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed in the Real Hotels when we go to Cancun. We boked a trip for the last week of October of 2002. When we arrived we upgraded to a Jr. Suite with no problem. The staff at the front desk were all very courteous and helpful at all times of the day and night. The waiters in all of the restaurants were fabulous, (Wilbur) always brought flowers every morning for myself and my daughter for our hair. The Italian restaurant was wonderful as well, plan to be there awhile as every course is a treat in itself. Maybe it was the time of year that we were there, but the beach was great, always clean. (I do know that depending on the time of year the rocks on the beach can vary) What a beautiful place to visit. The view of the ocean from Tulum is breathtaking. Chichen Itza was a wonderful place to visit. The view from the top of the pyramid was great. We will definitely return to the Gran Port Real this fall.......

Reviews.Title: “Anyone giving this a Negative Review is a Naturally Sour Person. . . IT IS GREAT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Gran Porto Real for a week in May and are giving it two thumbs WAY UP. We didn't get the ocean view room we had hoped for (though we didn't pay for it either). . . . but that ended up not mattering in the slightest. We loved the place. It's difficult to even describe or rank the many pleasurable memories we have (partly because some of them are a bit blurry given the superb attention and service lavished upon us by the ever-attentive and friendly staff). The pool scene is great (especially the cool little pool on the 3rd floor); the restaurants are fun and convenient with very adequate food; I had a particularly great meal at the Italian restaurant. We loved the size of Gran Porto; if we forgot something when we went to the pool, we could be at our room and back in 2 or 3 minutes. I would only do it all-inclusive because it just makes life so simple and the service is excellent. We became great friends with a couple of the waiters in the Albatros (the main restaurant) as well as buddies with a couple of the staff out at the pool. They are really nice folks. Despite the All-Inclusiveness, we still got out in town a good bit and took time to do Tulum, Xel-ha and a snorkeling trip over in Cozumel. . . . all of which were a lot of fun. We loved the proximity to Playa del Carmen, the cool little town only blocks away. I just hope it doesn't become "Cancun South" I had read some of these reviews prior to my trip and, once ensconced at Gran Porto Real, was incredulous that there are any negative reviews for the place. It may not be perfect (we had issues with the phone and TV in our room, but nothing to lose sleep over . . . it's Mexico after all) but it's a lot closer to perfection than the real world is. We Will BE Back!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Were do I start. We got excatly what we paid for! Jr.suite with ocean view. The picture from the ads could have been taken from our room. This was my wife's and I 10th anv. We wanted something special and the Porto Real was it. People that moan and groan about this hotel expect too much. All employees are contintly cleaning and they add that extra special touch to help you out. For example; I left my shoes at the door full of sand. When we came back after swimming my shoes were cleaned and put away in the closet. Food was great! Buffet could use some work, but hey it was free. If you dont like what is on the buffet then just tell them what you want. My wife didnt see anything she wanted so she got a steak at 2 in the afternoon. As far as the beach. Boats and seaweed are a problem. This is something that the hotel cannot help. There are at least three guys always picking up seaweed. Remember that all beaches in Mexico are federal owned. So the hotel cannot tell someone where to park their boat. Location of the hotel is the best. Shows were great and I recomend that you try eating at a place downtown at least once (Sur, great steaks). 5th street really gets going once the sun goes down. Shops stay open until 1100pm and there is plenty of night life. I will defintly go back in a heartbeat. 5 days was great and now I want more. The staff is very freidly and will do everything to make you stay the best. All emploees speak english! Enough said, so the ugly american can stop trying to speak broken spanish to these people. It is true that the bed was hard as a rock, but if you put in a full day it dosnt matter. Plenty of sight seeing that is within 45 min at the most for all of you needs. The ferry to Cozomel is just a 30 min walk down the beach or 3 dollars in cab fare. Bottem line is that this hotel was one of the best times we have every had. If something dosnt sit right with you, all you have to do is ask and they will meet your needs. Austin, TX

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our honeymoon at the Gran Porto Real and had a wonderful time. This is a luxury hotel that was a pleasure to stay at! The service provided by the resort employees could not have been better...We were treated like a king and queen. The location of the resort is also very nice. You are easily able to take a trip into which is a pretty neat place to wander through shops. We were able to swim at the beach there are boats near the beach and on some days there was some seaweed but nothing that would ruin our vacation. This resort is tremendous and the people that run it are great. They do their best to give you the most relaxing experience possible. Take advantage of the pool on the third floor, it quiet, has a great view and swim up bar. We would return in a second!

Reviews.Title: “OCEANVIEW BEWARE!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: razzylady101
Reviews.Content: This was our second yearly "family" vacation staying at the Gran Porto Real. Stayed from July2 to July9th. This year we brought 11 people with us. Last year we didn't pay to have the ocean view rooms so we didn't have a problem with getting our rooms. This year we paid to have the ocean view rooms, only to be told that there was not one available and we stayed our first night on the second floor watching the street and listening to all the entertainment going on in the sports bar below us. Another member of our family got into an ocean view room that had a king size bed (for 4 people) and there were no roll away beds to be found. They spent the first night sleeping on the floor. So beware....no travel agency can guarantee you an ocean view room...no matter what they say...Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family returned yesterday from a 1 week stay at the Grand Porto Real and I honestly say, that our stay was wonderful! Since May I have read all the reviews that have been posted regarding this resort and at one point, I was concerned. But in speaking with our travel agent about 4 weeks ago, she assured me that none of her bookings have ever complained about the Grand Porto Real. Our agent recommended this resort, not only because of past success but also because as a family of four, we were not looking for a wild, busy, overly crowded resort. And the Grand Porto Real met all those expectations. Upon checking in before 12 noon, standard rooms were available but our original reservations for 2 Jr Suites were not available the first night; however our new rooms were ready the next morning by 12 noon (the front desk even offered to move us, if we would just pack everything up) and we took advantage of the complimentary massage that was offered to us for the inconvenience; which was great as well. Our daughter's boyfriend traveled with us as well but because he booked his reservations much later than ours, he was not able to get the All Inclusive package. In our attempt to try and keep all 3 rooms close together, the front desk offered him the All Inclusive plan free for the entire week if he would not change rooms when we did the next day; needless to say, the boyfriend was smart enough to see a great deal and stayed in the same room the whole week which ended up only being just at the other end of the hallway from us. One reviewer some time ago wrote that a smile and a kind word goes along way . . . and that is most certainly true. Even though our original reservations were not met the first night, the front desk was very accommodating for us and I firmly believe alot of that is contributed to our attitude at check in; we knew that there was a 99.9% chance that our 2 Jr Suites would not be ready the first night, but we kept a calm, positive attitude and in the end everything worked out well. Everyone at the Grand Porto Real was extremely nice; their knowledge of English varies with housekeeping really not knowing any English, to the restaurant. bell boys, and front desk understanding considerably more. The food at the buffet and at both restaurants was wonderful too. Keep in mind, you are in a foreign country so many of the meats and vegetables are prepared differently than in the states, but there was always various meats, fish, vegetables and fresh fruits ,salads to chose from; and the choices do change daily; and yes they will cook something special if there is anything in particular you want. Did not try the Mayan coffee, but the show that the waiters put on during the preparation of such is truly a sight! Mixed drinks are alittle weak, but my husband & I would just ask for shot of whatever the liquor was in a separate glass and add it to our drink. All in all our vacation was great and I would recommend the Grand Porto Real. Just keep in mind about the over booking and remember smiles and kind words go a long, long way. The staff will remember that ! And it is a shame that as adults we have to remind other adults to smile and to be kind!

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just got back from our vacation on Friday the fourth, 2003. We stayed at the Grand Porto Real. I have nothing but good to say about this hotel. I read before we left that they had problems overbooking, but my friend and I didn't encounter any of that. The whole staff at Grand Porto Real was not only courteous and friendly, but also very helpful in assisting us with whatever we needed. The entertainment that would go on daily around the pool was great! A combination of water polo, water volleyball, beach volleyball, and aquaerobics made our days fun filled. If we wanted a more quiet place to relax we would just take a minute walk over to ocean and relax there. The food was great even though it was all buffets and unlike some of these reviews say I thought there was a wide variety of drinks available. The bartenders were very concerned with making sure you got what you wanted. The hotel itself was beautiful and I felt it was very quiet except on the Caribbean night, but all the excitement ended at 11 pm. The beach did have a lot of seaweed on it but the hotel crew was out every morning and afternoon trying there best to clean it up. There were a few rocks along the beach but we found that those rocks ran all along that coast, as we walked along the beach many times to the ferry. I would say nothing but good for this hotel. I enjoyed my time there and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Yearly Retreat”
Reviews.Author: SusanGayle
Reviews.Content: I have a friend from Dallas that I go to the Gran Porto Real with every year. We always go the end of May/first week in June. I have found the hotel to be wonderful. Each time I go it exceeds my expectations. I enjoy the close shopping. (You can walk!) The staff is friendly and willing to please. Yes, there was seaweed on the beach. It is cleared away almost hourly. The pools were awsome. We upgraded our room and it was large. The Italian restraunt is the best. You will want to try both. Last year the mexican restraunt was better. I think it changes from year to year. A new tip we learned was: Do not eat a popsicle while shopping or buy any food outside of the hotel area. We ran into a girl in the lobby who was quite sick from a popsicle she had eaten the day before while out shopping. I'm already looking forward to my trip next year. Adios!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real treated us well”
Reviews.Author: bobinlakeway
Reviews.Content: Another couple and we had made reservations at the Gran Portal Real Hotel in Playa. Some reviews said that they had lost reservations or given people different rooms than requested, so when I checked in I was curious to see what happened. We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon in late May. The front desk told us they did not have a Junior Suite that was "suitable" (aha, I thought) but we would be put in a Standard Room and given one day of all inclusive (our rate was room only) for the four of us and moved to a Jr Suite the next night. I hesitated and asked to see the room. The clerk then immediately offered two days of all inclusive - so we said yes. The standard room was very nice, in the back of the hotel overlooking a terrace pool and right above the spa. View of the water from the balcony and maybe 500 feet from the water. What a good deal! Food and service were excellent and staff friendly and courteous. We were sorry to see our freebies run out on Friday afternoon since we were staying until Saturday. The beach is narrow in Playa, waves are calm, but water is nice and town has a European feel. You can walk for miles along the beach going north. We always go to Cancun and this was a nice change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking....not an understatement”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overbooking is not an understatement. It will happen to you. It seems to happen to the people with the Ocean Front Jr. Suites. I was skeptical in regards to all the reviews I read on this site.........but yes, it also happened to me. I even had the manager, Miguel confirm my reservations in writing. Thank god I had that document......or they would have shrugged it off. Insist that you get what you are paying for. Its a great hotel and the staff is great. The buffet and mexican restaraunt are not so good. The best is Pescatore.....ask for Pascual to be your waiter. The hotel is in a great location to 5th ave and everything else. The ocean is full of rocks and my girlfriend broke her toe. It is also full of boats....kind of an eye sore. Overall it was a good vacation.......but you can be guarateed the word overbooked is going to come up....especially if you have an ocean front junior suite. I can not stress this enough.........BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “Mostly wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited from 6/5 to 6/8. I would mostly describle Gran Porto Real as a wonderful resort. Our only problem was on check in. Because of the reviews I was not surprised that they "overbooked, made a mistake" and we were not given our oceanfront room that was extremely important to me. I was prepared and told them this was not a mistake, you do this all the time to customers and we demanded our oceanfront. We would not accept the massages they tried to appease us with. We were able to move into an oceanfront the next day but that took much hounding and I'd say a good 3-4 hours out of our too short vacation. I thought the rest of the trip was outstanding. The rooms were beautiful, service very good and we even liked the buffet food, especially the custom made omelets and other grill dishes and always an endless supply of fresh fruits and vegetables. As everyone says, the Il Pescador was excellent. The pool was so pretty and never a long wait for a chair around it. Some drinks were watered down, others were great (I would recommend the strawberry margarita-- very slushy and not too sweet!) The beach was full of seeweed right in front with a lot of boats. It would have been nice if it was like the better beach that was a few minutes away. We were in a party of about 45 people as our daughter was married at the resort. The wedding was beautiful beyond words, the gorgeous ocean and setting sun as the backdrop. The wedding coordinator did a great job and the waiter -served -reception on the beach was so much fun. I would highly recommend this resort for a wedding. I know that my daughter and her new husband were very happy as well. Unfortunately, we even had the opportunity to check out the hotel doctor services as well as my daughter became very sick the day after the wedding. The doctor (an American, by the way) came to her room and was very professional, explained everything well and gave appropriate treatment. I am a nurse and so is my son-in-law's mother so we watched closely and approved of everything he did. She was fine by the next day. Such an important thing to have; you never know when you will need it. I would love to go back, but only if I was sure that I would get my requested room without a fight! They definitely need to work on that area or they will lose customers.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you aren't a BEACH person...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with 4 other couples in our family, stayed at the Gran Porto Real from June 13 - 20. I had read the reviews from former guest involving room fiasco's and took the liberty to contact the Real Resorts US office (from real resorts website: ... ) to confirm whether or not this was a regular occurence? I was told this does indeed happen but I could fax Ms. Patti Leon (reservations manager for all Real Resorts) at 011-52-998-7399 with the arrival date, times and occupant names along with a description of the rooms paid for in order to confirm our arrival. I e-mailed and faxed Ms. Leon but never received a response.Therefore, I called the hotel directly and confirmed the rooms with the manager at Gran Porto Real AFTER letting him know that I subscribe to several travel review websites and wanted to make sure we would not be inconvenienced or embarrassed upon arrival. Especially when the rest of the family wanted to go back to Cancun this summer but we told them Playa was sooo much better.Nevertheless, our rooms were ready upon arrival to Gran Porto Real at 8pm. The rooms we were given were wonderful and HUGE. My husband and I paid for the Oceanfront Jr. Suite which was directly above the pool but had a good oceanview. My sister and brother-in-law were given a Jr. Suite on the 3rd floor facing the street which also had a view of the tennis courts and a partial view of the ocean. Each room was decorated wonderfully and the service was impeccable - not to mention clean! Out of all the hotels we have stayed at in Cancun, Cozumel and Playa, Gran Porto Real's architecture and colonial decor really made a difference.Now, UNLESS YOU ARE NOT A BEACH PERSON, I would suggest staying at Gran Porto Real because the beach was very disappointing. I am a very "go-with the flow" type of person who has certain levels of expectations and will try to see the best out of every negative situation. Well, I also happen to LOVE THE BEACH which is why I only got in the water at Gran Porto Real one day....out of the 8 days we were there. The boats docked on shore really emit a strong "fishy" smell which you get used to after being out there for a bit. But the seaweed is all over the place along the shoreline...so you have to get through it to go any further into the water. The rocks are pretty rough too. My husband gashed his foot walking back into the beach, my brothers-in-law (3 of them) cut the bottoms of their feet and so did my sister. I didn't get any cuts but I am pretty cautious about feeling where my foot is about to step next. Once you get past the rocks ( I suggest dropping down onto your tummy and swimming out using only your arms) the water becomes clear, sandy bottomed and really nice. You can go pretty far and stand up (I'm only 5'4" and I could stand without going under for about 10-15 yards from the buoy). So, the remainder of our stay was spent visiting Cozumel, Cancun and the other side of the ferry in Playa in order to swim in some really wonderful beaches.The pool was nice and on our days where we weren't doing an ecotour or deep sea fishing. We were at the pool playing water volleyball and relaxing. So, that's why I would warn any beach lovers to rethink staying at this hotel...unless you can be happy hanging out at the pool. The buffet food was mediocre at best. Although breakfast was always wonderful. The Chilaquiles, beans, omelette station, waffles and fruit rocked! The Pool side Grill served wonderful cheeseburgers, Pizza, ceviche and club sandwiches. So check out the buffet first and if you don't like it you can still order from the grill with the buffet waiter.
