Also, you can order from the grill whether you are at poolside or on the beach - that was great!Dinner at Il Pescatore was wonderful!!!! When you make your reservation (with the concierge) let her know you'd like to be seated in Jose's section. That guy is the ultimate in providing impeccable service during a dinning experience. The Lobster is pretty darn good too. The second time we ate there, we were seated in another guys section who was the antithesis of Jose. This waiter (can't remember his name) was put off when our table didn't want to order the same thing all around!!! I placed my order first and he tried talking my sister into having what I was having, then her husband and finally my husband. Anyhow, he was so busy kissing *** at a table of 8 that he totally ignored the four of us and finally came over and said, "chocolate cake, cheesecake and ice cream. What do you want". So, I tried to work with him thinking his english was limited and said I wanted Ice Cream. My sister said chocolate cake to which he responded angrily, "you don't want ice cream?". Then my brother-in-law was about to tell him what he wanted when this waiter simply walked away from him and ran over the table of 8 who were leaving in order to see if they left him a tip!!!!I told my husband that this was the last straw and we all agreed he was totally offensive to us the entire dining experience. So we got up and left.Funny thing was that the table of 8 didn't tip him and this guy could've gotten a good tip from us 4 if he hadn't treated us as second rate....because we were hispanic. I know this sounds crazy but on a few instances we noticed that the bartender at the swimming pool on the 3rd floor was rude and irritated we even were at his bar when instead he was doing anything and everything possible to accommodate a group of 3 non-hispanic guys and 2 non-hispanic women who were being loud, had just met and were soon being entertained with one of the very hefty women dancing on the bar which caused her sanitary napkin to slip out from under her boy short style bottoms!!! I AM TOTALLY NOT MAKING THIS UP! One of the guys merely tucked it back into her shorts - AAAAGGGGHHH! So anyway, prior to all that happening, I had asked the bartender if he could turn on some music to which he replied, "It's broken". But when Big, Foul, Redneck woman wanted to show off her "sexy" moves to another woman's husband (who was all over her - even when his wife stopped by the pool to tell him she loved him) the bartender cranked the tunes. My husband went and ordered 3 margaritas and the guy never acknowledged him, but he made the drinks and put them at the opposite side of the bar for us to get.Now, don't take any of us wrong because we totally don't like it when people pull in the "race" talk but these two instances were so offensive to us that we felt it important enough to share. Everyone likes to get good service or at least be made to feel like you paid someone to treat you well while you're on vacation...but these two guys thought we were some poor hispanics who he was sure didn't have any money to tip as opposed to the other groups of loud, lewd, vulgar groups of non-hispanics - who didn't tip them at all. Unless a dirty dance with sanitary napkins falling out of your swimsuit is "hot" or considered a good tip.My husband is a physician, my brother-in-law a nurse practitioner, my sister in criminal law and myself an in-training interior designer. We love paying tips well to people who work hard at making your vacation, dining experience, or whatever the case may be a truly enjoyable one. These were the only instances where we felt like regretting we had manners, were polite, considerate of others around us and respectable guests. So keep ask for Jose's section at Il Pescatore and watch the guy at the pool bar on the third floor in the event some unsavory behavior is brewing because he'll forget you even exist.Other than that, the front desk, bell boys, housekeepers and staff were wonderful. The hotel is not noisy...if you need total silence to sleep I suggest not staying at a resort where everyone is here to have some fun, stay up a little late and dance around. Besides, everything gets quiet around 11pm at the hotel. If you're there on a Friday night, walk down the beach towards the ferry pier and you'll run into a cool beach bar called the Blue Parrot. The music is fun, ambience cool, and the party gets started around midnight.Oh, and the massage at the hotel spa is great. Josefa was my massage therapist for 50 minutes and I was put in a wonderful state of relaxation. If anyone has any other questions for us regarding our stay at Gran Porto Real we would love to help. We can safely say that we will not return there on our next trip to Playa. The beaches on the other side of the ferry pier are indescribable. If you like parasailing go to Senor Frogs and a gentleman waits there to recruit new parasailers. They'll take you out on the gorgeous beach by jetski to a boat and you'll parasail over some of the most breathtaking waters you can find. That's why we will definitely pay more to stay on that side. PLEASE take some time to comb that side of the beach...

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel did not want to give us what we paid for -- ocean-front view junior suites. The management actually wanted to downgrade(!!!) our room to a standard room with a street view. We had to argue with rude and dishonest management for three hours upon our arrival before an ocean-front view junior suite miraculously became available. (Beware, this is a scam -- you pay extra for a guarantee that a certain room is available and the hotel overbooks. We saw many people arrive being told that they were being downgraded) The hotel is extremely noisy. There is no "quiet" pool to escape from the incessant noise of the all-day "entertainment" at the pool. The food was mediocre and the beverages were limited in variety. The beach was littered with seaweed (no fault of the hotel) and many fishing boats cluttering and obstructing the beach. I have to say that the bellboy and the waiters at all the restaurants were extremely courteous and attentive and that was the only solace in the entire place. I've travelled numerous times to Europe, Latin America and the U.S. and have never been so disappointed with a hotel. This hotel bills itself as a five-star but I've stayed a two-star hotel in Paris that was 20 times better that this one.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Relaxing Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real from May 17-24 and we had a wonderfull time. We arrived at the hotel around 11:00 in the morning and our room was not ready. Our travel agent told us this before we left so this was not a surprise. We were in the AI plan and the front desk gave us our arm bands and had someone take our luggage and we went and had a few cocktails and had lunch. By the time we were done eating our room was ready. We had reserved an Ocean Front Jr. Suite through our travel agent and this is exaclty what we received. Our room was about 5 steps from the beach and was very clean and beautiful. We were a little hesitant about the hotel from reading some of the reviews, but we certainly were happy with what we had and soon forgot all about the negative reviews. My advice about the room is to use the safe that is provided to you free of charge. My husband and I never felt unsafe the entire time we were there we had gone to the beach at night and sat in the beach chairs and never did anyone ever bother us. But I had read previous reviews about money being stolen from a room, and just wondered why you would be in a foreign country and leave your wallet or cash sitting out in view of others. The safe is there for a reason. It is not the hotel saying it is an unsafe place, but you are not in the US and they are looking out for your best interest.Even in the US money can disapear so again my advise use it, it is free and you won't have to keep track of your valuables if they are locked up. About the beach, the first day we were there, there was a lot of seaweed, but the hotel staff spent the entire day cleaning and cleaning until it was gone. The rest of the trip the water was very calm and there was not a problem with the seaweed the rest of the week. There are not rocks on the beach itself, but there are a few in the water. The water was very calm and clear when we were there so we could see the rocks and go around them. There was a lot of area that was sand that you could sit anotten our towels early and reserved a couple of chairs and never had any problems finding a place to sit by the beach or by the pool. The food was pretty good. The buffet was not that great, but the other restarants that you could order off the menu were very good. Just a tip, if you don't see something on the menu that you want just ask and if they have it they will get it for you. My husband and I took this tip from another traveler and received shrimp cocktail and other items by just asking. Try a Mayan Coffee at Maria Margarita it is a neat show and a very good drink. We took a couple of trips one to Tulum and XelHa and it was great. We would highly recommend this trip. We also went snorkeling at Paradise Reef and had a great time. The hotel staff were always pleasant and I felt that they wanted us to have a great time, the hotel itself was always very clean and beautiful. We went in a Funjet package and I would highly recommend this. The FunJet people that were at the hotel were there every day and if you had any issues they were there to help you. We have stayed at Sandals Resorts and I would say that besides the variety of the restaurants and some water activities it was pretty comparable. I think a positive attitude makes a big difference and a vacation is what you make of it. Don't go to this hotel with a negative attitude because of some of the reviews, experience it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the Grand Porto Real for our honeymoon, May 31-June 7th. I was a little nervious after reading all the reviews!!! I was not disappointed at all. We arrive at the hotel at noon, we recieved a free upgrade to an ocean suite, the room was viewing the ocean, and the street, so we asked if we could have a better room, they got us a better room above the pool, overlooking the ocean!! The buffet was ok, but the Italian resturant was the best ever!!!! The service was wonderful and the staff was always willing to help and very nice!!! Of course the pool was crowded, but it was a great time!!! Our room was always clean and fully stocked, and the hotel was clean and wonderful!! We enjoyed ourselves so much we will return next year!! Another great thing about this hotel is that it is in walking distance to 5th Ave. which was very convient!! You could enjoy the night life there and then walk home instead of paying for a taxi!!! Dont judge this hotel from this advisor, experience it on your own!! I think that this hotel will try its best to make you happy!! They certainly did for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: Cheries38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Porto Real May 26-June1 2003. I was very leary after reading all the reviews about not getting the room you wanted, and was ready to fight for what we paid for. I had even requested the North side of the 3rd floor. We traveled with another couple. We arrived around 12:30 pm and our room was still occupied by Corona, who was making a commercial, but were given the option to move to the 2nd floor away from our companions. We opted to wait, and changed to bathing suits in the other couple's room. At 5:00 pm, my husband had to threaten management that his evil wife would come back down, as we were instructed to check back every 1/2 hour, which we did. Other than that, the place was terrific, and everything positve you have read was true. We did not like the all inclusive arm bands. Other resorts did not have these. Beware of the Mexican reservation only restaruant, it was not what we expected and saw little Mexican items (if any) on the menu. The Italian restaurant was fabulous and we ate there multiple times. The barbeque buffet night was mediocore, but all other nights were very good. The beach was not very walkable due to the magnitude of boats roped up to shore. We learned from others who had visited before that the Iebustaur(spelling) and another big resort that I can't remember the name of had better walking beaches, but these resorts are a good 1-2 mile walk from 5th avenue (shopping district). One resort we visited for a snorkeling trip had a very good snorkeling reef right in front of it, but this resort is up in the 'resort mecca'. The shop owners are pushy, but not hardly as bad as Cancun's open market or on Cozumel. We all felt 'safe' in Playa Del Carmen; I didn't feel I had to clutch my purse to me at all times in a death grip. Xcaret is worth going to - although MANY of the park's features were under construction - for $71.0 a person, I'd ask in advance what's closed off if you go. The night show there is better than a lot of Broadway series shows I've seen though, es more than Cozumel or Cancun, which seem to have transformed into little Americas. I would go back to Playa in a heart beat and am actually thinking of a girls trip there later this fall (although that's hurricane season).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned recently from a trip to Playa Del Carmen. Our travel agent assured us the Gran Porto Real would be the best honeymoon spot for us. We arrived at the hotel at 1:30pm and were told our room would not be ready until 3:00pm. We had lunch at the buffet, food was ok, then went back to the desk at 2:50 and asked if we could be shown to our room. They again said our room would be ready at 3:00. We were finally allowed to enter our room at 3:10. We had no oceanview, instead, we had a view of the street with a storage shed on the other side. Our travel agent had assured us that she had requested an upgrade to an oceanview when we upgraded to a junior suite, and would make sure they knew we were a honeymoon couple. We apparently got a junior suite, but it was very small. Our mini-bar was not equipped and there was no chapaigne or any sign that anyone knew or cared that we were a honeymoon couple. We then decided to go for a swim in the ocean. The ocean was beautiful, but the beach was very seaweedy and rocks are extremely hard too avoid and sharp. It was impossible to swim there. We then went back to our room only to find that not only was the view awful but we were situated almost directly over a karaoke bar with very loud shouting and music, which went on until after 11:00. We had only had five hours of sleep the night before. I went to the front desk to complain about the noise and requested a different room. They said the could downgrade us to a standard room or opt to take their promotional deal to stay at each of their sister hotels in Cancun, but they had no other Jr. suites to move us to. Don't believe the internet pictures or anything about upgrades. It simply is not true. They are apparently always overbooked, even in the off season. However, we did not flash money in their faces, that may work. We ended up moving to the Gran Caribe Real in Cancun. It was a beautiful hotel on the gulf side of the hotel zone. We also asked that we be allowed to stay there for the entire weeitely would not return to the Gran Porto. Again, were told our room would be available at 3:00pm, even though the deskman at the Gran Porto assured us they had a room awaiting us. We ended up enjoying the Gran Caribe. The beach was gorgeous, no rocks, always chairs available, super clean, no seaweed. The pool was also very beautiful, and the food was better. The rooms were beautiful as well, and very spacious with a view of the ocean in all but a few. We did get a partial oceanview at this hotel. We did take a tour to Tulum/Xelha, which was absolutely beautiful and well worth the money. Snorkeling for the first time at Xelha is an experience I will never forget. We did have to travel farther to see Tulum and take a ferry to Cozumel but the difference in the hotels made up for the travel time. Playa Del Carmen is a quaint and beautiful town, just like they say, and a great place to spend some time, but the Gran Porto Real is quite a gamble, just like all the reviews suggest. This hotel is rated a 5-star, and if you are lucky enough to be in one of the few oceanview front rooms you may agree, because the hotel and pool is beautiful, but if you are put in one of the rooms on the street side this hotel takes a quick dive to a 3-star. If you want to swim in the ocean, you do not want to stay here. Too much of a gamble for the money in my book. We would definitely return to the Gran Caribe Real but would take an afternoon flight instead so we would make it there after the rock solid check-in time of 3:00pm. Oh, and when they jokingly refer to the mexican minute, they are covering themselves, the mexican minute does not pertain to tourists, we are shuffled around at top speed only to wait the mexican minute to begin another shuffle. I'm sure the mexicans would find our ways a bit irritating too, so remember, you are in a different country, try to relax and you will have a wonderful time, we did.

Reviews.Title: “The beach was a let down”
Reviews.Author: travelalot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mexico 5th-19th May 2003 and in that time we stayed at all 3 'Real' hotels. The only let down was the beach, it was full of boats and seaweed. However the rest of the hotel was good. The service was the slowest here out of the 3 hotels with the exception of the Italian, the food here was the best we had and the service was excellent, good red wine too! We enjoyed the pool on the 3rd floor and our little boy who is 5 learned to swim without armbands here because it was so quiet. Thank you to all the nice Americans we meet at this pool (you will remember Jack) our son played with as many people who would give him the time of day, he loved all the attention. I could not say anything bad really about this hotel only it would be a bonus if they could sort the beach out Hopefully once the jetty is complete they might! Do not be put off this hotel however if travelling from the UK I would suggest 2 weeks would be too long, do as we did and stay a week in Cancun. I would be happy to answer and questions

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: Mexico-Lovers101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real the middle of May. This was our first trip to Mexico and our feelings were mixed. Overall, the hotel was very nice. We did get the room we paid for with no problem (junior suite - not ocean view). We were pretty happy with the room - but it really wasn't anything special. The bed is as hard as a rock - it is literally a mattress on a cement slab. We really enjoyed the all-inclusive option. We thought the food was very good at the buffet. The food at Il Pescatore (I think that is how you spell it) was awesome - the coconut ice cream is the best! We went to Mexico mostly for the beach. I was kind of disappointed in the amount of seaweed that was there but was impressed with the workers that were out there daily cleaning it up. The beach area in front of the resort is very small and a lot of the area is taken up by boats. I had read in other resorts that you can walk 5 minutes to a nicer part of the beach - we did this but there are a lot more people and the farther you get away from Gran Porto Real the more trash you encounter. There didn't seem to be any seaweed anywhere else except by our resort. We thought we would enjoy a smaller resort but we ran out of stuff to do. We did go on a tour to Xel-ha/Tulum which we really enjoyed. We paid a total of $180.00 for the tour which lasted most of the day. The hotel was overbooked - they had a sign up in the lobby offering to move guests to another hotel - we decided to move to the El Dorado Royal which we were very happy with. The beach has a lot more rocks but there is absolutely no seaweed. Also, the beach area is a lot larger and the property is far enough away from town that you don't see anyone on the beach except for the guests staying at the resort. Every room had a hammock on the patio which was really nice - there were also hammocks tied to palm trees out by the beach. We enjoyed the food here also but not quite as well as Gran Porto Real. If we do go back to Mexico we will probably try staying at a ng on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (my boyfriend and I) spent 5 nights at the Gran Porto Real(5/10/03 to 5/15/03). We absolutely loved it. The room was everything advertised on the internet photos I saw. The staff was very friendly and very accommodating. The facilities were clean, and beautiful. We did not do the all-inclusive package. I think that we probably will the next time we go back. The breakfast buffet was well worth the $12.00; there was plenty of American food and some Mexican treats to try along with sweet fresh fruit. We did dine in one of the 2 restaurants on site, and the food was wonderful there too. The location is perfect, the beach in front was okay, there was a lot of seaweed the first 2 days we were there, but they had staff diligently raking it the whole time. If you take about a 2 min walk around the corner of the hotel (past the construction of the new pier) you will find one of the most amazing beaches. This was where we did all of our swimming in the Ocean. Upon our arrival, we found out that they ran out of the Jr. Suite rooms, and had upgraded us free for the night to an ocean view. We were willing to pay the additional $40.00/night for the upgrade, but we were able to barter the additional cost down to $25.00/night. Overall, we had a really positive experience (much, much better than I expected due to the reviews I read). We are defiantly going to return to the Gran Porto Real, hopefully very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay and a beautiful adventure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BELIEVE THE BAD REVIEWS ON THIS HOTEL--our stay at the porto real was the most memorable experience of our lives. four of us, ages 20, 21, 22, and 24, went down there and the hotel was beyond amazing. we had a jr. suite on the ground floor. our view wasn't the best, no ocean view, but a view of jungle and it was fine. Oscar and Armando, the bell boys were incredible, the maids, everyone at the hotel did all they could to help and make the stay wonderful. i am in a power wheelchair, but the hotel provided ramps and everything was very accessible. a short walk and the views everywhere are breathtaking. the hotel's beach was a little seaweedish, but a short walk up the beach and it was beautiful for swimming and just relaxing. two blocks from the hotel and you're at 5th avenue; cultural center, markets, lots of great food and resteraunts, and the people are amazing. Playa del Carmen is the place to stay- we were central to many Mayan Ruins: tulum, a 250 jungle park named Xcaret- the most beautiful place we have all ever been--mokeys in trees, giant iguanas everywhere, dolphins, sea turtles, mayan ruins and more and more!! Xel-ha- in Mayan it means: where the water was born-- the most beautiful place to snorkel, and the island of Cozumel-- we took a jeep 4X4 safari, AMAZING!!: beach, mayan ruins, amazing guides who are now our friends. our stay in Playa was an amazing and beautiful Mexican adventure- whatever you do-- STAY OUT OF CANCUN- unless you want to stay at your hotel the whole time. the four of us, my sister and her boyfriend, and me and my lady had the most enlightening, and romantic stay. the Gran Porto Real was a beautiful hotel to come home to after the amazing adventures. we are definitely going back soon, hopefully this December. it is hard to belive that there are a few bad reviews on this hotel- IT WAS ALL GREAT- one problem that i've read about was the overbooking. we booked our trip a little over two months in advance so we had no problems at all. however, on the last day of ook the offer to be transfered to the sister hotel in Cancun called the Gran Caribe Real-- all inclusive, all the great food drink we could handle, the pool was great, and the ocean view room was very, very nice. but

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Porto Real for our honeymoon. The second night while we were asleep, someone entered our room and stole the money out of my husband's wallet. When we reported it to the management, we were treated as if "what did we expect". They brought us a printo out that supposedly showed each time the room was entered, but it was not even correct for the times that we had entered the room. So not only use your safe while you are out of the room, but also while you are in the room sleeping. You might consider baricading your door at night with furniture. We also spoke with another guest who was staying a few doors down from us, who had had his money stolen out of his wallet as well. He said he received the same response from management.

Reviews.Title: “Going back next year!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went as tag-alongs after an invitation from a friend. Five different people I work with have all been there and loved it-3 on honeymoons! I can't say enough good things about the staff and resort inthis quaint little town. I definitely recommend the oceanfront view. Ourroom was gorgeous-especially enjoyed the hammock on the balcony. The staff worked around the clock to make sure the hotel was clean andour every need was met. Food was pretty good-room service options were alittle limited but still AI. Service at Maria Marquarita's was a littleslow, but we loved the relaxed atmosphere and the fact that we could'dress-up' for a nice dinner in shorts. The 'water activities' were onlyOK-the water was too murky for snorkeling (not sure scuba diving wouldbe any better there), but kayaking and water volleyball was fun. And playing the Mexican lottery is a must! However, we spent $200 for 2people on a combo-activity pack and went to Aquaworld for the day.Recommend this to everyone!-included transportation (on certain days)Parasailing, Jungle tour on waverunners, snorkeling at the reef, and theSubSea Explorer. There is an Aqua World rep on site, but we used ourFunJet rep for assurance reasons (he is also on site). While tipping is not expected there, we took quite a few $1 bills(poolside service seemed much better because of this). Really enjoyedthe shopping on 5th Avenue. Our drinks were never watered down and asfor limited room by the pool? Go mid-May and put a towel on the chairyou want BEFORE breakfast. We never had problems and were even able toget chairs (which sit right in the pool on a ledge-these were heaven!)at mid day. I think the resort just depends on your expectations. If you areinterested in laying pool or beachside, then this is a great place (theyeven bring menus and serve you lunch on the beach). If you are lookingfor a lot of activities, you might want to stay in the MUCH morecommercialized and busy Cancun. We are already planning our lazy,relaxing, pampered vacation next year at the Gran Porto Real.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The water and beach was nice but I had $250.00 stolen from my room. My son's wallet was stolen from his room and it took all but an act of congress to get him out of the country of Mexico without a picture ID. He cancelled his credit card that day and still had over $3500.00 in charges on it by the next day. We spent over $300.00 in phone calls to get a copy of his license faxed from the U.S. NEVER AGAIN! Plus the all inclusive wrist bands are sucker tags because everyone there bugs you to death trying to sell you another stay in a different hotel. I didn't go to be pestered to death and they won't leave you alone. Out of the six couples that we rode back to the airport with on the shuttle, four had ripped off in some way. It was a thieves paradise.

Reviews.Title: “These people are crazy....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Gran Porto Real. We found good service, good food, and a great time. Don't be scared by the bad reviews. Your vacation is what you make of it. The beach has some seaweed, but all you have to do is walk 3 minutes down the beach to a sandy, beautiful beach. If you want a stronger drink, just ask the bartender to top off your drink. If you want a seat at the pool, put your towel down before you go to breakfast. also, if you are worried about not getting a room b/c of overbooking, just call ahead the day before your arrival.For anybody with a standard room, take advantage of the pool with swim up bar on 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Porto Real May 9th -16th, 2003. We started out with the European plan but soon realized that the all inculsive was a much better deal. We switched over and loved it. The service and the food was amazing the staff really added to our experience. We were also happy with the location, the shopping district was about a block away, an easy stroll and the beach was right out front. I would advise anyone wanting to stay at this beautiful resort that when making reservations make it clear that you want an ocean view room otherwise you could be stuck with a room facing the alley of the back of the hotel. It is worth it to pay a little more to be facing the ocean. We discovered Maria Margarita's the second day, it was amazing and it is all covered under the all inculsive plan. The food and service again was great! I can not wait to go back with my family next year. If you don't like crowds than May is a perfect month to visit Mexico, it is pretty much the only down season they have. Although it was really hot and humid, I am sure there summer is worse. If it is your first time traveling to Mexico I would recommend a book from the Lonely Planet travel series called Yucatan. It helped us find the best deals for day trips around the area and when to go with a tour group and when to go out on our own. We don't like crowds so the advice of going early to places like Xel-ha and Tres Rios was really valuable. Have a good time and if you see Rolandi at Porto Real tell him hello.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Again!!”
Reviews.Author: KathiG55
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in 2 years at Porto Real in Playa del Carmen. The first was a vacation in June 2001 and we said, "we have got to come back for our honeymoon." And we did, April 25 - May 3, 2003. We did notice the beach was much smaller and attributed that to the storms - not mucb the hotel can do about that one though. They finished the street to the hotel - a bonus, and added another pool and restaurant, Il Pescatore. The service and food at Il Pescatore was fabulous. I would and have recommended this hotel to friends and family interested in a trip to Mexico. The service hadn't changed at all, and we will be heading that way again around 2005.

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is not your typical resort. Once you walk into the hotel, you feel you are in a special place. We had read some of the negative comments and were somewhat apprehensive but quickly found out that everything we hoped for was what we got. We have travelled for over 30 years and this hotel and the town is about as good as it gets. The hotel is georgous and everytime we walked to our enormous room on the 3rd floor, we marvelled at it's beauty. We had 2 queen beds, a brightly colored decor and a wonderful balcony which had a partial view of the ocean and street. The bath was hugh. The hotel provides bath robes if you ask for them, which we did, and after our shower, they were wonderful to dry off in and sit for a rest on the deck with a drink after a full day at the beach. We had the AI with room service once a day. We felt the food here was above average compared to other resorts we have stayed at. The Italian Restaurant was our favourite. Pascal was wonderful and our service was tops. We found the staff amazing and accomodating and once they got to know you, they never forget your name and your favourite drink. The hotel is always booked and it is difficult to get chairs but this is not unusual in smaller resorts. We have found this elsewhere. Also there is seaweed on the beach but this is not the hotels fault. Nature does what it does and the staff works tirelessly to keep it cleaned up. There are 2 great beaches within 2-3 minutes walk on either side of the boats and a walk is needed after eating so much. Fifth Avenue is wonderful and must be experienced. For all ages and one would never be bored. Anyone finding fault with this area has to be looking for negatives. This is not a perfect world and neither is this resort but it is a wonderful place to spend a vacation and we would recommend it to anyone. We met people from many countries and we all shared the same opinion. The Time Share Sharks are there and you just say, No, and move on. I do feel they should not be placed at the elevator to dance, you have to go outside the resort. Down the beach or street, you will find about whatever you want. Not everyone has the same experience and I feel badly for those who do have a poor room and get poor service but we are seasoned travellers and have found that a smile and trying to speak the language and enjoy the culture pays big dividends. If you like the Mexican Experience, go to a resort like this one. If not, go to Cancun for the Big Hotels and the fast night life.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT FAMILY VACATION”
Reviews.Author: billandstacey
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Playa from April 27 to May 5, 2003. We booked a Jr. Suite Double room because we were traveling with our two children. We were very surpised and pleased to be escorted directly to our room. We had a nice Jr. suite that faced the front of the hotel but also had a view of the ocean. My children did not go to the kids club, but, they did do some painting and crafts by the pool on a couple of occasions and had a great time. The food in the buffets were "ok" we preferred to eat at Maria Margarita or Il Pescador for our evening meals and did so most of the night. We found everyone to be pleasant and helpful especially Modesto and Miguel at the pool bar on the 3rd floor and Pescal at Il Pescador was just wonderful. He called the children by name when we ate there. All in All we had a great vacation at the Porto Real, to bad we can't say the same of the Gran Caribe Real in Cancun. Just a quick word on that - don't stay there. We arrived at midnight with two kids to find they were overbooked and we had no where to stay.We do highly reccomend the Gran Porto Real to people traveling with children. We had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I thought I would post mine. Although it has been some time since I stayed at the Porto Real (September 2002) for my honeymoon, I feel I should share my experience. My finance and I had extensively read about this hotel and Playa del Carmen itself before going. The mood on the trip was dampened when are plane did not leave on time due to the weather over there (hurricane Isidore!!!) We arrived at Porto and got the Jr. Suite that we had reserved no problem. Although, keep in mind we are in the middle of a hurricane so there are boards on some windows, etc. Anyway, the room was great, very large and huge bathroom!! The food was ok, we did have the AI package but ate at TGI Fridays a few times. Take a taxi, they are cheap and great. Also, the hotel is so close to the town it is unreal. There was no construction, that was finished. The pool was beautiful even though we couldn't use it due to the storm. Was able to walk over the pool to the bar and have drinks. Contrary to other posts, our drinks were great!! Staff was sooo good at refilling them and they were in no way watered down!! Actually, some (long island ice tea) were almost too strong!! The beach is beautiful. Granted there are some rocky seaweed areas but there are places all along the beach that doesn't have rocks and seaweed just walk a few feet and they are there, come on people (that keep complaining) this is a beach and none of them are perfect!! the beach is beautiful!! The food is also mediocre. We mostly ate outside the hotel did not try restaurants inside the hotel but did eat the buffet and room service. Both were just fine. We did not get to participate in any water activities due to the storm but did walk to town and experience all the unique shops. The hotel is wonderful. Some people are particularly picky which makes a bad travler. We did not notice any bad smells or bad staff. Also, we confirmed our room ourself by email with the hotel. This way I had a printed hard copy confirming just weeks bhad a hurricane over us and still kept in good spirits!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: adshansel
Reviews.Content: I really cannot understand what the bad reviews are talking about. We are seasoned travelers that have traveled the world and this is one of the best! The service has only one word to describe it, gracious. Never have I been treated so well. Of course, your treatment might have something to do with your attitude. We spoke limited spanish the whole trip and never had a problem. We did the AI and were pleasantly surprised with the food. The room was beautiful and comfortable. We spent the extra money for the oceanview, jr. suite and were glad that we did. The beach is a little deminished from storms, but not a problem and there is a great walking beach just north of the resort. This is not a large, annonymous hotel so if you want extravagance, go to Playacar. But if you want small, friendly and immpecable, go to Porto Real!

Reviews.Title: “It was a vacation in paradise”
Reviews.Author: deanie
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at the Grand Porto Real Resort from 4/13 to 4/20/03. We were somewhat apprehensive as we had read some horrible reviews. However, the resort was wonderful. We did not do the all inclusive plan as we wanted to try out the local restaurants and were planning on going on several excursions and did not wish to be locked in to eating at the resort. We did not find that out at the pool the waiters avoided us, as we had read. The entire staff was very accommodating, the only negative was when we checked out the front desk gave us a slip showing the bill had been paid but did not say I needed to keep that slip in order to drive away in a taxi. Well if you plan on being able to leave the resort you need the slip to show the bell boy or he will not let you leave the resort with your luggage. Luckily I had not thrown that slip away but I would think when you check out they should tell you that you need to have that as verification that you checked out and paid your bill. We did not eat in any of the restaurants, one morning we did eat at the breakfast buffet, which was $12, I did not really feel it was worth that much but it was convenient. The resort was always very clean and the staff was very friendly. I would go back to this resort tomorrow if I could. The pool was great, the beach was fine, a little rocky but not a problem. There was lots written about not getting a Junior Suite due to over booking. We had booked a Junior Suite and were very pleased with it. It was huge, the bathroom and shower were fantastic, I wanted to pack them and take them home with me. All in all I really have only praise for this resort and our treatment by the personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Gran Porto Real was beautiful. We asked for an ocean view and the desk clerk said they were $40.00 more per night, so we declined. We got to our room and found we did have an ocean view, but we were in the front of the hotel and did not have the full view. It was still very quiet and nice. The room and bathroom were very large, with a foyer and a very large closet. The room itself was spotless.We ate at the buffets most of the time and they were OK, but trying to get refills on coffee was like pulling teeth. Service was not very good. There were several items at the buffet that were not refilled promptly, especially the desserts. The dessert case was out of the way and was totally empty before they refilled anything and this was early in the dinner hour.We also ate at the a la carte restaurant (Maria Margarita's). The service there was great, but the menu was very limited and never changed. They had several lunch sandwiches out by the pool during lunch time, but no salads or even chips to go with them. However, you could order your lunch from one of the attendants on the beach. They were pretty good about taking orders.The only other negative about the hotel was the beach. They have lost most of their beach, so it was very narrow and full of seaweed. I went in the water once and had lots of slimy seaweed around my legs and that was it for me! There was one part of the beach that was devoid of seaweed, but it had several small boats moored there and left no room for swimming. The town is very charming and there are lots of bars, restaurants and shopping open late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible if you like luxury, the beach, and drinking. Make sure you BOOK a Jr. Suite (ocean view)and get there early or else you are sure to be in one of the standard MOTEL 6 street view rooms. The standard rooms are NOTHING compared to the rooms they show on the website/brochure. The drinks are watered down (you will have to drink about 15 to feel any type of buzz) and the food is not that good. The service is alright, EXCEPT for the manager (if you have any problems). They tend to stay OVERBOOKED, so the earlier you get there the better. The beach has too many rocks on it, you can barely walk without stumping a toe. I'm a discriminating traveler. So if you're the same, DON'T waste your money. The view is not all that (nothing but raggedy fishing boats up and down the beach) and construction and street/weed view on the other side of the hotel. Just a word of warning. you notice that SOME people have a great experience and some have a horrible experience. It just depends on if the hotel is booked up as to whether or not you get good service/room. A chance you might not want to take.I had such a horrible time with this hotel and management that they've given me another free all inclusive stay at the hotel to make up for it. (due to the nature of this hotel, one I choose not to accept)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Comfortable, Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: f00die12
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful vacation at the Gran Porto Real. Very special place--the Best hotel I have ever stayed at--anywhere in the world. Would go back in a heartbeat. This gorgeous place puts you right in the middle of authentic Mexico, yet surrounds you with world-class service and amenities. Gran Porto Real is two blocks from the very quaint cobblestoned shopping district of the port town of Playa del Carmen. Several blocks full of local treasures, authentic restaurants, strolling musicians, locals selling their handmade wares. This authenicity is in stark contrast to other all-inclusive hotels, who have built small replicas of Mexican villages--but it's all contrived. Gran Porto Real offers access to the real Mexico. Also close to wonderful day trip destinations: 20 min. to Akumal (try the snorkeling at Yal Ku lagoon!), 40 min. to the ruins of Tuluum (bring your suit and take advantage of a beautiful, small beach there), 15 min. to themepark Xcaret, 35 min. to eco-park Xel Ha, 35 min. to the airport in Cancun, 30 min. ferry ride to Cozumel.... Rent a car for a couple of the days and explore!Hotel itself is very beautiful. Rooms, balconies, hallways, courtyards, restaurants, pools, beach--everywhere you look is gorgeous. No trouble getting the oceanview jr. suite we booked. LOVELY and immaculate! We used the hammock on the balcony every day! And yes, scout out the small secret pool with swim-up bar and whirlpool on the 3rd floor!Restaurants were wonderful--esp. Pescatore, the Italian restaurant. No trouble getting reservations. Buffet was great--loaded with fresh fruits, vegetables and a comfortable combo of local cuisine and more American fare. Even our very finicky 7 year old son found an abundance of satisfying choices every day.Yes, stay away from the hard-sales pitches going on in the lobby. Smile, decline and keep moving toward the pool. And yes, the beach is small and a bit rocky--but quiet and wonderful, nonetheless. Already dreaming of our next trip! Will definitfor Jake Shannon at Orbitz (888) 656-8194 x76828. He was GREAT--patient, knowledgeable, and found us an even better price than listed online. Had never used an online travel agency before--it was a great experience! Highly recommend Gran Porto Real!!

Reviews.Title: “The Porto Real was a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: eabwood
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at the Porto Real. This is our second time we've stayed there (first time 3 years ago) and this time we took our 2 children (ages 6 and 7). As a recent review states, there is a bit of truth in each of the reviews on this site of this hotel. We had a fabulous time and would go back in a second. The kids did not want to leave. There were a wide variety of vacationers there - singles, couples, young & old, families, and very internationally diverse. The kids enjoyed exploring the hotel - finding the rooftop jacuzzi was a big hit. There are hammocks up there, and a great view of the ocean and town. There is a kid's club - the employees in charge are very kind, lots of fun, and good with the kids. Our kids weren't at the kids club much, but had a blast with crafts and sports when they were. The cleanliness and location of the hotel are excellent. The staff is its best feature. They couldn't be more customer oriented, all of them. In the restaurants, they will go out of their way to make sure you are happy. For example, one night we stood indecisively between the Albatros (buffet again!) and the Maria Margarita restaurant (menu) with our kids wanting to have buffet again and my husband and I wishfully eyeing the other menu. They sat us down in the buffet side, but served us (the adults) 2 excellent suggestions from the other restaurant. The Italian restaurant on the other side of the building is excellent. Yes, they have lost a lot of beach to storms (compared to the beach there 3 years ago, it is quite narrow), but we did not notice more seaweed there than anywhere else. There is still enough beach for plenty of loungers in front of the hotel, a volleyball net, and a walk alongside. Lots of people were swimming. (Our kids spent more time in the pool.) We found the local fishing boats tied up there to be an interesting view, not an annoyance as others have written. Playa was originally a fishing village before becoming a hot tourist destination, and we were glad to sly, you see the fishermen biking to the shore with their equipment. We had a standard room (in the annexed section) this time which I was worried about after reading some of the previous postings. We stayed oceanfront last time so had something to compare it too. We loved the Standard. The construction previously mentioned is completed. Everything clean and in working condition. The only small negative is the rooms are smaller than the oceanfront suite, but with kids this time, it did not matter. We weren't in the room for long period of time anyway. It was a great location at the resort. (We were in Room 424) The "private" pool on the with a bartender just a few steps in front of our room was wonderful. The jacuzzi and rooftop view was just upstairs from us, and the spa, salon, italian restaurant, sports bar and workout facility just downstairs. There was also an ocean view from the patio outside our room. The worst thing about the resort is the timeshare and "membership" salesmen off the lobby entrance. Just say no thank you to everything and go have a good time. Remember when you are approached that nothing is free, you will have to put in at least an hour listening to some sort of presentation for that free rental car, blanket, etc. We went to Xel-Ha (rented our own car and spent the day). The large tours do spend too much time driving around picking up people at other hotels. If you're up for something different, I highly recommend Alltournative Tours. We went to Pac-Chen and Coba with them this time. Small groups, very informative guides (ours was especially great with the 2 kids). Only do this with kids who are fairly brave about trying new things though - ours did a zip line over a cenote and were lowered into a cenote to swim. Had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Ditto on the Good & Bad @ Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the gentleman from Minnepolis.We did get the room we asked for, the staff was great, resort clean, drinks way to small. The beach is littered with boats which takes away from the view. I walked the beach daily and really liked that. The town is nice and close and you can get some good deals, be prepared to haggle or just walk away. The tours are cheaper in town down by the pier which is were you catch the ferry to Cozumel. The tours from the resort are very high priced and do take a good amount of time to get to your destination. Food was very good in all 3 restaurants. Do get up early and put your towel on your chair or you won't get a good seat. I went with my wife and 2 sons and all in all we had a very pleasant experience. I would go back. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing!! Take it from a teen's point of view!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is absoulutely gorgeous! There is not a better place that you could be in Playa del Carmen! First of all the hotel itself is just absolutely breathtaking! The staff and managment is extremely kind and courteus. The activities going on at the hotel are very entertaining. The Gran Porto Real is a very safe and fun place to be! It definately MADE my spring break!!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Playa Del Carmen the week of 3-14 thru 3-21. We made the horrible mistake of staying at the Gran Porto Real. We paid for a Jr. Suite - OCEAN VIEW. We got a Jr. Suite with a view of the dumpsters out the back of the hotel. When I went down to see the Manager he told me they were overbooked and there was nothing he could do for us. My Wife was extremely upset and went to speak to the Manager. She told him we wanted out of the Gran Porto and wanted to be moved to another Real resort. The Manager told her there were no rooms available at any of the three other Real resorts. We had read about overbooking, but our travel agent promised us this wouldn't happen to us - HA. Carlson Wagonlit booked our trip and ruined our vacation. The resort is decent, the beach is HORRIBLE. There are fishing boats tied up all along the beach, and it is full of rocks. You cannot swim there. There is seaweed that builds up everyday and it stinks. They remove the seaweed with a front-end loader each morning, but it is back by mid afternoon. The drinks are watered down and weak. I sucked down margaritas all day and never got close to a buzz. The food was average at best. The staff is the one good thing about this hell hole, they are wonderful. Staff very good - Management AWFUL. My wife and I have each been to Mexico many times, but this was the worst experience of our lives. There is construction of a new pier going on right outside the resort. This is where the ferry to Cozumel will take off from, starting at 5 a.m. These boats are so loud, you can hear them when they are a mile off shore. Imagine being right next to them as they take off at 5 a.m. Needless to say, we will never stay at the Gran Porto Real again. Shame on our travel agent who promised us a Jr. Suite Ocean View - she even called the resort in front of us confinming this. Playa Del Carmen is a wonderful place to go, and we may return. If you stay at the Gran Porto Real, you will be sorry. Trust me when I tell you DO NOT

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real, We Loved You!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from staying at Porto Real in Playa. We felt like we were so pampered! The first night we arrived we learned that the suites we were supposed to be in were not available because they had overbooked. The Jr. Suites they put us in were very nice, however, with two queen beds rather than one king, and the room was a little bit smaller, but not much. Both ours and our kids' suites that first night were located on the fourth floor by the pool, without an ocean view, but in a great location and it was private and quiet. (In fact, if we had not already paid for the fancier rooms, I could have been quite content with that arrangement.) They apologized for our inconvenience and treated all 4 of us to a complimentary massage! The next morning they moved us to our suites on the second floor. I absolutely loved the old world charm of this place. The bathrooms and decor were exactly as you'd expect in an old Spanish villa! All of the tile work, colors and columns made looking around just plain fun. The food was great, especially in Maria Margarita, and the service wonderful. Everyone was kind and helpful. We enjoyed the beach, and strolled up and down each day. We enjoyed shopping in the evenings on Quinta Avenida which is located conveniently close to Porto Real. We would return via the beach shore where the cool breeze always blows. It is a romantic stroll back after a fun evening shopping. One day we did take a taxi to the fast ferry to Cozumel. Once there, we hired a tour guide to take us out on a boat and made three stops to snorkle. This was not a prearranged tour. It is easy to find guides with boats ready to leave when you are. When we returned to the island, we spent some time shopping in the stores there, and later had a wonderful dinner at Palmeras. The garlic shrimp were large, plentiful and delicious. Because we opted to enjoy the all-inclusive plan at Porto Real, this was one of the only meals we ate outside of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our honeymoon here, at the Porto Real. It was heaven on earth. Nothing like sipping margaritas on the veranda and being 5 steps from the ocean. Walking distance from the main plaza of the town. We would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this place is amazing! the service and attention to details are tops. we went in march 2003 and the weather was PERFECT every day. 85F, bright sun, blue sky, refreshing breeze. there is not a huge beach attached to the hotel, but a 2 minute walk NORTH of the beach is one of the most expansive, gorgeous beaches i have seen. no rocks or sand, and nice, in a way, to have a stroll to take a dip. HUGE waves, too. the hotel itself is gorgeous and SPOTLESS and the jr. suites are very large and well-appointed. the views from the balconies are gorgeous. the staff EVERYWHERE are incrediby friendly and professional. the service is tops. look for jesus on the beach- he is there for you every second. the two fancy restaurants (maria margarita and il pescatore) are gorgeous, again, with exceptional service and delicious food. do the all-inclusive plan- it's the way to go. take advantage of checking out their sister resort, el gran caribe, in cancun for a day trip. another gorgeous hotel and transferring there for the day is 100% enjoyable and hassle-free. i would recommend this to anyone! 5th ave. in play del carmen is a great nite life-- the resort has something for everyone- we saw young, old, couples, singles, girlfriends, kids, honeymooners. thank you, porto real, for a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: ellabean23
Reviews.Content: After a lull in vacations my trip to the Gran Porto Real was well worth it. My fiance and I did much research and finally choose this hotel in Playa Del Carmen. We had the best time here! We stayed for 9 nights from Nov. 21 - Nov 30, 2002. Our room was overlooking the Pool and the Ocean. We arrived early and our room was not ready for us, but our luggage was taken and we went to have lunch in the hotel resturant. I would recommend the all-inclusive...if you drink and plan on staying at the hotel most of the time. This was the first time that my fiance and I actually spent all of our time at the resort. Usually, we go and do many different things while on vacation. We just layed on the beach drinking our Pina Coladas and beer. Everyone was very nice for the most part and the rooms were very nice. There is some problems at night with people talking in the hallways (which are all marble) and causing an echo. In other reviews we read that people had problems with the pushiness of time share people, that was not a problem with us. All in all this was a wonderful trip at a great location. It is all by it self which is nice if you want to just relax. If you are looking for something more then you might want to look at Playacar. I would definitly recommend this hotel and will probably return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - Totally worth it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was totally worth the change! It is far more than I expected! I had a great time - wish I could have stayed longer! THe people working there are awesome! (LUIS AND RODI!)

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Mayan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Been to Yucatan many times. Stayed various places. The Porto Real is the best for couples. Large rooms, ceramic tile, huge bathrooms w/huge walk-in showers w/benches. MiniFridges stocked daily w/water, soda, beer. All-inclusive is the best for this resort. Private balconies w/bistro table & chairs. Get Ocean Front View. Room Service. Clean, nice motif. Small beach. If your planning to go in Jan. the weather is warm, water is cold. Short walk to town (Playa) Great poolside bartenders. Plan to go to Xel-Ha for day of snorkeling in an Eco water park, protected by a natural reef. You can take the ferry in Playa & 'jet' over to Cozumel for the day. Great Resort for couples!!!

Reviews.Title: “a nice place”
Reviews.Author: lma55806
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the porto real and also a few days at thier sister hotel the gran carbie real. Both are very nice places and we had a great time. I like the fact that the porto real is such close walking distance to 5 th. ave. The beach is not nice, rocky, lots of sea weed washing ashore and lots of garbage washing up also, there was garbage washing up on the beach to the north also,the beach to the north is very nice for swimming, no rocks, but it sucks to have to walk there everytime you want to take a swim to cool off and once the pier is completed this will become much more of a problem. The food, ok, not great but very much inline with other AI places i have stayed in the area, Maria Mariritas was good, more upscale type meals and you can order most anything you want even if its not on the menu. The rooms on the street side near the sidewalk bar are very noisy until midnight when the band quits, the only way to escape this is to get an ocean side room, also you can hear everything in the room next to you so if your next to loud all nighters be prepared. The service, great service pretty much everywhere, a little slow for food at the outdoor poolside but not really bad and several days they grilled at the beach so if you wanted something quick this was nice.Overall a nice place, would we stay there again, I'm not quite sure we would, possibly but the only reason we wouldnt is the beach, we are beach people and I think once the pier is completed it will it will limit your options and unless they do something to improve the beach in front of the hotel it will only get worse. Any question I would be happy to help. The Gran Carbie was nice also and if you have any questions on there e-mail me

Reviews.Title: “not to bad...”
Reviews.Author: kevmeyeth
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a fun place to stay. Some people (people in line in front of us) had overbooking problems, but not us.. We had a standard room which was very nice compared to what I heard from others here. We had chairs outside our room with a balcony (that is shared by others, which means no barricade between rooms "no big deal"). It also had a view of the ocean and the pool! The only negitive thing was that there is a open air bar that is street level that will play music til about midnight. That really isn't bad actually.. Overall we were pleasantly surprised with the Standard room.. We will probably try a different place next time because there are cute little and cheaper places to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Don't go European Plan to this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK. The first 2 nights we were in a room over the garbage pickup and kitchen alley and the noise woke us up about every 2 hours. After the first 2 nights and much complaining we were moved into a great room with an ocean view. We had 12 people in 4 rooms. My mom had to be moved to a handicapped room - they ignored everything we asked for in a letter we had written in Spanish and faxed the week before and put us in rooms all over the hotel, but we did not run into the overbooking problem. They are in the process of building a ferry dock right next to the hotel. Once that is built this hotel is going to be very noisy. I would strongly recommend that no-one go to this hotel on the European plan. We were treated like 4th class citizens. Whenever we wanted something we had to practically tackle a person to wait on us. They had to go through the hassle of having us sign for everything so I understand it was a pain for them, but we really had to fight to get service (kept the cost down). Speaking of the cost, everything at the hotel was outrageously expensive if you are on the European plan. $12 US for the breakfast buffet (we found breakfast for $3 US 2 blocks away), $6 US for a can of Tecate from the room fridge, $3 US for a Coke, $17 US for the lunch buffet and we didn't even price the dinner. They tried to overcharge us for coffee on multiple occasions, the women by the coffee in the buffet is a bulldog and wants to charge for each pack of sugar. It was ridiculous and they really should provide free coffee (or at least free refills). The upside was that we found many reasonably priced places in town and tried out some pretty good food elsewhere. Email if you want some suggestions. The maids were great, we had flowers and our towels shaped like a heart for Valentines. Overall an OK experience. We did not run into problems with the timeshare people, they do wear hotel shirts and act like they are part of the hotel (some VIP thing). We just said we were not interested and they left us alone. We had a big problem with AquaWorld tours that is in the hotel - We booked 9 people for snorkeling and diving in Cozumel. They said we were going to Chakanaab (sp?) and then took us out by the big cruise ships in Cozumel to snorkel over sand. Then the divers got back and did not have time to eat, they ended up eating in Cozumel and spending a fortune. We complained to the tour company they said tough. Almost $900 US and we were totally ripped off. Other people recommended Scuba Playa who are downtown. They (AquaWorld) have a booth in almost every hotel in Playa de Carmen. I strongly suggest that other tourists avoid this company, they were awful and then very rude after they ripped us off. I was very unhappy with this company.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Did not have a very enjoyable stay at the hotel. They had over booked to start off with and ship us of to another hotel, and told us that they would pick us up the next morning at 11:00am. We arived at the temporary hotel, got a room and changed to go for supper, we spent approximently three hours trying to get something to eat. No eating facility would serve us because we did not have a all inclusive arm band from the hotel, and the hotel would not give us one because we were not staying at their hotel. Finally they came to pick us up at 3:00pm, after waiting from 11:00am that morning. That was two days of a weeks vacation ruined. The next came with hammering in the morning , they had placed us over their new construction project. We asked if it was possible to move to another room, but we were told there was no rooms availible. We have stayed in other hotels in the area on previous vacations and had great vacations. This was our worst vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I just got back from getting married at the Gran Porto Real on 2/7. 35 friends and family were there to join us. EVERYONE had a wonderful time. There were few if any complaints. If anyone is interested in getting married at a destination resort, the hotel staff made for a perfect wedding. Thanks to Paty, the wedding coordinator and Walter in Sales who took care of the dinner and reception as well as Luis who handled our guests reservations. They did a fabulous job and made our wedding one that was unforgettable, simple and fun! The ceremony was beautiful and the pictures turned out perfect. We wouldn't have changed a thing! The best place to eat is the Italian restaurant. The staff was perfect, especially Julio. We also enjoyed the beaches, the town, went into Cozemal, went scuba diving and swam with the dolphins. As mentioned in other comments, this is a great place for groups and families. The group actually did find a lot of night life in town! Although, I would agree that singles may be more interested in Cancun. All said and done, this resort was Excellent. Tina & Jeff

Reviews.Title: “a great trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was great! It was so close to Playa del Carmen famous 5th ave. The town was so cool especially at night. The resturants on 5th ave were very good! We ate at a great resturant called Los Rancheros. We had 1lb lobster tail with a ribey steak that was just to die for! The 2 resturants in the hotel are pretty good. We loved ordering from the pool bar. We loved the salsa and gucomole! The Beach was smaller then the other strip of hotels (Allegro/Royal Hideaway/Iberostar ect...) So, you have to decide if you want a bigger beach or stay closer to town. The rooms were beautiful! We did change our room when we got there because it was to close to alley and construction that it was to noisy (room 278). We recommend the upgrade to oceanview it was only 45$ dollars more which is worth it. The staff was wonderful. Don't go to the hotels 1 hour scheme into discounts for next trip unless your loaded. I now know better for the next time. This place is definitely not for young single people. I would say more for couples. It's not a place to party harty but a place to just enjoy and relax. There are some kids there but not bad. I hardly noticed them. Over all this was a vaction for us. The couple from Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Brochure Pictures are Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the Yucatan Peninsula with a friend and unfortunately, we chose to stay here. The rooms were small and dark with no balcony. The tiled halls outside the rooms made daily cleaning service carts your morning alarm clock. Going as a single person, this was the WRONG place to stay because almost all the people here were couples (both old and young) or families. We opted not to do the "all-inclusive" package and were treated like "second-class" citizens by the cocktail personnel who strolled the beach and totally ignored us. I ate one time at the outdoor grill and it was nothing to "write home about"!! The beaches in the brochure look fantastic . . . this was pre-hurricane. Now the beach in front of the hotel is very narrow and VERY rocky out into the water. The beach chairs are crammed in so tight, you feel like a sardine in a can. The people who ran the activities went out of their way to include everyone in all the daily events. They were all AWESOME and made the stay at this place a little more tolerable. There was beach volleyball, water aerobics, bacci ball, horseshoes, salsa dance lessons, bingo, etc.I will say that the rooms were well cleaned on a daily basis and the hotel was well maintained.I will return to this area again, but I will NEVER stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i worked very hard in planning my well needed vacation. i was traveling alone and a bit concerned about security. the hotel i booked with was considered "moderate" They had overbooked; so they upgraded me to the porto real. i received nothing but excellent service. the room was wonderful, the view so-so. i was only supposed to spend one night. i ended up staying 3night because there was still no room in the inn. I was upgraded again w/o asking. i saw others not as happy as myself but they made NO attempt to be courtious themselves. my spanish is not the best but the staff made every attempt to understand me and was very enthsiatic because i was trying and learning from them. if anyone is looking for a place "to get away from it all" i highly recommed the porto real. i will agree with some of the other reviews about the beach being sm. it looks like it took a big hit from a storm. there we NO rocks because they had people "sifting" the sand for any objects, rocks, cig, butts... It seems obvious now after reading the horrible reviews the the management did listen. the food in the albatros was very good and consistent. you had to fill out a survey about the service before leaving. I had NOBODY come up to me about the time share nor did i see anything like it. various staff members that i encounter always remembered my name making me feel even more welcome. i was very sad to leave. my vacation ended up with 4 diff hotels. 2 were the real properties which were just as their brochures showed.

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a seven-night stay at the Gran Porto Real Resort -- it was spectacular! I was nervous about getting the Jr. Suite Ocean View Room we reserved after reading some of the other postings on this site. But I am happy to report that our check-in went as planned and we were immediately shown to our room. The Jr. Suite Rooms are awesome! Definitely request something on the third floor, as the other floors would have an obstruction of the view with the palm trees etc. The Hotel: I have never seen a hotel property kept so clean! I think they must have more staff then people staying at the hotel. The hotel is constantly being cleaned. My boyfriend was sure to take care of our housekeeper, and we have fresh flowers throughout our room during our entire stay. Everyone at the hotel was so friendly, and they work so hard to ensure everyone is happy with their stay. One Note: We went with the all-inclusive plan, but still tipped at meals and with beach service, but we noticed most people did not. This is such a shame, because the staff's pay is sure to be minimal and they really work hard to please you. Tips are NOT expected, but definitely appreciated. Location: Perfect location. With the exception of the rocks in the water directly in front of the hotel. But just a few short steps, to the left or to the right you will be sure to find a great spot. Be sure to try the snorkeling, check out the fish along the jetty that is to the left side of the hotel. You will find some attempts to control beach erosion (some sand bags etc.) but this is all done to protect the beach. A trip into the quaint little town is just a short walk, perfect for daytime shopping, or an after dinner stroll. Would be happy to answer any questions. Overall, this was one of my best vacations - the hotel is beautiful, exceptionally clean, food was good, staff friendly - could not ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in early January 2003 - Very nice place. New resort. Nice staff. Offers European Plan which is nice as many terrific restaurants a few blocks away. Food at resort is very good too - cant go wrong either way. Great beach, great pool. Some rooms looked small, but we had Jr. Suite and it was awesome and not very expensive for high season. Room a little noisy, lots going on, but probably nothing can be done with tile floors and height restrictions, etc. Was really not a problem and was quiet at night for sleeping. Great location - 1 block to town for great open-air dining, art galleries, etc. Good (difficult) golf courses nearby. Lots to do in the area - go to Xel-Ha, Tulum, Cozumel for snorkeling. Lots of Europeans and families too. Everyone got along fine and no matter what language you speak (or don't speak) its easy to get around and communicate with locals and staff who all speak English and Spanish. Have always felt safe in Mexico - people are nice. Cancun airport is nice - would recommend this hotel and this area to anyone. Have been to Mexico 3 times in the winter and it has never rained one drop. Always sunny and 80 degrees during the day and about 65 at night. Sound like perfect weather - it is.

Reviews.Title: “overall, a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read some horror stories about overbooking, but we had no problems. arrived around 6:00pm and were imediatlly given our room (ocenview). The room was nicely appointed, but was a bit humid (it is the Yucatan). The fridge in the room was stocked daily with cokes and beer (modelo in the can). The crowd was mostly european (Dutch and German mainly) so topless women and speedo's are common. So Americans be forewarned, Most of the people dressed this way, shouldnt be! We found many of the Europeans(espescially Germans) to be on the rude side,and very negative about americans. we found this espescially offensive as this was just a few months after 9/11. however we met some very nice people from Amsterdam with whom we became friends and spent quite a lot of time with during our stay. The staff was generally quite nice, a little tip here and there and they became even nicer. The waiters always had a cold beer ready right as the last beer got warm. The food was good at first but got boring as the week wore on. Although it's hard to complain about steak and eggs and chile quile's for breakfast. Asked for some hot sauce and was given Tobasco, I found this interesting as so many good hot sauces are made in Mexico, why are they importing theirs from Louisiana? Some of the highlights of the stay included, fishing with some locals on one of their colorfull boats, and snorkelling in Cozumel. Now for the big negative! when you awaken on your first morning, a card is left under your door inviting you to come to the lobby to recieve your free blanket and bottle of tequila. We took our card down and it turned out that to get your freebies you had to sit through a hard sell shpeel trying to get you to buy timeshares in the company (apparently this is really big in the area). we opted to forgoe the gifts and not attend the sales pitch. This really pissed us off, we came down to have fun and relax not get hit up to buy timeshares. With all the telemarketing and spam we deal with at home, one shouldn't have to deal with it on vacation! It wouldn't have been such a big deal if you weren't slammed with this as soon as you get off the plane. Right after you get through customs you have to walk through a gauntlet of high pressure sales people trying to get you to spend a day at their resort. Then on the streets of Playa, you get more of the same. We went to Jamaica the year before and had no such problems, everyone was into you having a good time and noone tried to sell you anything, except in the tourist trap shopping centers. That being said, we would still go back but we now know to ignore the vacation pedlers. A blanket and a bottle of rotgut are not worth valuable beach time. If you go, be sure and spend an evening partying in town. senor frogs is a blast and the shrimp at Captain Bob's is great, and every beer comes with a free tequila shot.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent one Saturday night at the Gran Portal Real while in transit between resorts. We booked a junior suite which was fine for us and two children for one night. All went well with our reservation which we booked through Kuartos (who were terrific), but watching for a few moments did leave the impression, as others have noted, that the front desk is not super well organized. Still, we had no difficulties but feel we may have benefited from arriving early (the hotel was very accomodating in getting a room ready quickly). The room was older in style but very elegant and clean and the pool area was nice though crowded. We had a pool/ocean view room which, even from the main floor, was nice and for people that are into view, be sure to get that option as the view on the other side would be disappointing. The beach is rocky though swimmable if you can negotiate the rocky bottom. The hotel's location is fabulous being just at the end of the "closed to traffic" walking avenue which contains many shops and restuarants and we did not eat at the hotel. All in all, a very nice place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “would go back in a minute”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 9 year old son stayed at the Gran Porto Real in Playa del Carmen over the Christmas holidays. This was the NICEST and most WELL KEPT hotel we have ever stayed at! We've been to lots of other Carribean hotels and by far the Porto Real is the best. Food was excellent and service was great. The rooms are beautiful regardless of where they are. The only issue I had was that the ocean was a little rocky when you first went in but if you went far enough out it was fine. I do believe they have an overbooking problem as you may have read in other reviews but if you book through an agent or an all inclusive package I don't think you'll have a problem. We certainly didn't but they did keep dropping off flyers under our door offering free nights at their other hotels.
