The town of Playa del Carmen itself is quite charming as well with lots of restaurants so even if you didn't like the food at the hotel there was certainly lots of choice on the main drag. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon at Gran Porto Real”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon and our first visit to Mexico. We've seen lot's of different places in the world, from Hawaii to east Mediterenian...Quite frankly we were very pleased from what we've seen in Playa Del Carmen. I was little bit sceptic before we arrived, ready to argue with their staff at the reception if my oceanview jr.suite wasn't ready....Fortunately everything was as we paid for....even nice bottle of Champagne was ready for us. Staff at the hotel was very pleasent, they would do anything to make you happy. Service and food at italian restaurant "Il Pescatore" is absolutely amazing...ask for Matheo, the best waiter, very knowledable about vines and food... Location of the hotel is great, beach could've been little bigger, and food at Albatros could've been little bit more diverse. One thing for sure is, we've met some realy amazing people on this trip, we become good friends and that is the great memory we took with us from this little place. If we ever decide to go back to Mexico Playa Del Carmen and Gran Porto Real will be the place where we would like to stay. Yes, I would recomend this place to enyone for sure...

Reviews.Title: “I will be returning!!!”
Reviews.Author: KnoxvilleTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at Gran Porto for our late honeymoon Dec 5 - 12. I was extremely nervous before we arrived because I had heard all the horror stories regarding overbooking. I was prepared to put up a fight, but was quite pleased that there were no problems. The resort is very beautiful. My husband had no idea what to expect because I booked the whole trip and he was blown away. We booked the junior suite and were pleased with it. The shower is huge!!! It was not an ocean view room, but the balcony had a view of both the ocean and the street. (Room 340) You definitely need a third floor room to appreciate the view. I didn't hear anyone talk about overbooking and I looked into the smaller rooms and they didn't look bad. They're just the standard hotel room. But I can understand being upset not getting what you paid for. The food was pretty good, too. You can order stuff in the buffet and things that are not on the menus in the other places. My husband had filet mignon and it did not seem like filet. And you have to watch how they cook stuff. If you ask for something well done it will be medium rare. Other than that the food was great. The Maria Margarita is excellent. We had our best meal there. The italian place is good also. The beach is narrow, but we heard that was because of the hurricane. It wasn't bad though. We spent most of our time at the pool. The main pool is fun and something is always going on. There's a pool upstairs on the 3rd floor that we hung out at the most. It's very quiet and hardly anyone goes there. Great personal service at the bar! It also has a swim up bar. The drinks are good. There could have been more of a variety of beer, but they had Corona and Modelo. They had top shelf liquors and the margaritas are great. If Jesus is your bartender have him make you a Dirty Monkey. It's his speciality. The staff was wonderful. Our room was always clean and it seemed that the staff was always cleaning something. They were very friendly too. We did tip the maid $2 a day and the bartender occassionaly. They have to split the tips with everyone including the boss and don't make much. We also took the ferry to Cozumel (take Dramomine!). It wasn't that impressive. Playa del Carmen is a nicer town. The shopping is good. Remember to bargain! We also went to Tulum and there is this bar down the beach called the Blue Parrott that is awesome. YOu sit on swings and they have killer margaritas. If you have any questions feel free to email me!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Express/GPR? Don't do it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked at trip here with Vacations Express for our honeymoon. After reading some reviews on here, we were skeptical. Sure enough, when we arrived, they took us to the left waiting area by the pool and explained that there were no rooms available. There were others with us with Vacation Express who were in the same boat, and we created sort of a united front about this. We threatened to call VE, and they basically laughed at us and said to try it. They nod their heads, listen to you, and then make offers to other hotels in their chain. After several drinks to us and several of the men exchanging harsh words with the manager, who was unapologetic and looked as if he did this every five minutes (and taking the owner's name and number), the others decided to take the deal, with what they would recieve in writing - this is GPR was hoping for, obviously. I, however, decided that this was my honeymoon and I wasn't going for the "bait and switch routine" and I wasn't going to give that organization or the other hotels involved with them one dollar - especially when I saw seven more couples come in from another agency and check in to the right meeting room after I was told there were no more rooms. (I actually followed the last two couples in, with their permission, so I know that they did in fact recieve rooms.) I asked how and why the latecomers got their rooms, and they refused to answer me other than to say it was another agency that booked them. I said, "No rooms available are no rooms available, sir, that's what you told me. I deserve an answer." I got nowhere with this, and I called our travel agency, who was extremely apologetic and got us a better room at a better chain of hotels (Palace Resorts). Instantly, they started scrambling, offering us free tours, etc., and asked for us to sign a waiver not to complain to the hotel or vacation express - I did not sign it, my husband did. I also informed them that I had another couples' name and hotel, and I would be informing them of what had happened. I left a message at that hotel at the front desk anonymously for that couple, and funny thing - we saw them on the plane back home, and they said, "It was really strange - the next day they were offering us free cab rides, free tours...stuff not even written in the agreement." I said, "Did you get my message?" "No..." I figured not...all's well that ends well. They can't keep this up forever. :)

Reviews.Title: “Reservations mean little here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Porto Real on several vacations. While I actually like the hotel I have had major problems with the management following through on there comittments. I made a Guaranteed reservation almost 10 months in advance and was called three weeks before my trip and told my reservations could not be honored. I was offered rooms at the Gran Caribe in Cancun. This is a regular practice at the Porto Real and it has happened to other guests we have sent to the Hotel. The Gran Caribe is home base to the companies VIP Time share program. They have double billed my credit card. Failed to fulfill several of their written committments and are generally a fraud. Management has refused to address my complaints about the VIP club. I can no longer recomend Bestday Resorts. but if you go avoid the Sales pitches you will be constantly barraged by.

Reviews.Title: “rotten time at the porta”
Reviews.Author: husker1
Reviews.Content: We were talked into going to the Gran Porta Real by our travel agent. Before we booked the trip i raise concerns about the over-booking problem reported on this site. But I was assured that the ocean view jr suite with king bed will be waiting for my wife and I with no problems. When we arrived at the hotel after the bus driver went the wrong way down a one way street. The hotel looks great from the outside. We check in and taken up to our room a double bed, no ocean view suite, we did have a view of the alley and of some of the hotel bus boys smoking dope in the alley. I told the bell boy to take the bags back down to the lobby because this was not going to work. The hotel manager was no help at all and said maybe tomorrow. I was lucky to have my travel agent number on my e-life cell phone and call right away. By now it is 3:30 pm he told me hold tight and a funjet agent would meet me at the hotel in about 20 min. My wife and i took a nice stroll down to the rock infested beach and watched mexican dogs running around grabing food left on plates in the sand. you have to walk about a quarter mile to find any beach that was any good. now 4:00 pm still no funjet rep at 4:45 he arrived and finally at 6:30 we got a hotel in cancun. overall this trip sucked i've been in cancun 13 times and would nerver go back to playa del carman again. so if your don'twant a rotten vacation don't go to porta real goto cancun. any comments or request for pictures email me at troybomstad@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “travel agent rating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Gran Porto Real, I read alot of reviews before going and had some reservations about it, but being the in travel business and booking other people there I thought I should try it out for myself, when we checked in, we were put in a room that didn't even have a window in it, after speaking with the front desk they assured us we would be moved the following morning and we were to a ocean view on the 4th floor at no additional charge, we could not get over the staff, they were constantly cleaning something, they couldn't do enough for us, we watched them with the kids and they were great with them, we thought the food was ok, nothing special, but the service was great.....the bar tenders remembered what we drank from the day before and would have our drinks ready when they saw us coming.....and I loved the fresh popcorn in the lobby every night....Luis the entertainment guy has a great personality and made sure everyone was having a good time.......overall, I would recommend this resort to anyone, if you have any questions, email me and I will be glad to answer any questions...

Reviews.Title: “Gran Porto Real was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spend a week at Gran Porto Real from November 17th to the 24th. We were there for my daughter's wedding. We had family members there from three different countries and we were all extremely impressed. Not only did the hotel do an outstanding job of handling the wedding,the over all service and ambiance was wonderful,just a promised. On top of all of that,one evening I forgot my purse at the bar by the pool. I didn't realize it until the following morning. I went to the desk and found that my purse had been turned in,and nothing had been touched or removed. I recommend this resort to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “It is an excllent experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were at Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa for a week from Sept 29 to Oct 6. We didn't have any problem getting our room. It is probably because Sept and Oct is the hurrican season of the year and therefore it is slow. The hotel at that time was only about 60% occupancy. The hotel is beautiful. Staffs are extremely friendly. The buffet food is ok but Maria Margaritta resturant has the best food. The drinks are not water down, excellent quality. The suite we booked is a no-ocean view and yet we can actually see a bit of the ocean from our balcony. Our suite was good; clean and quiet.. They bring drinks and food right to you on the beach. That is the service I want for my vacation! It is right in the town of Playa Dell Carmen. So it is very convenient to do shopping or if you are not on all-inclusive, there are also a lot of resturants along the main street. Walking distance to bus station and ferry pier to Cozumel. If you are invited to tour around the hotel and learn more about their membership club, don't go if u are really into joining. It will be a waste of your sun & beach hours (at least 2 hours) although they say it will only take 45 mins. They have very good sales person who won't let you go easily without signing the membership contract. The only thing we don't like about the hotel is that the beach is really small and it is parked with a few speed boats which makes the beach even smaller. Not enough shade on the beach. The pool is rather small. If it is not that they have a small beach, i would rate it excellent.

Reviews.Title: “gran porto real: it met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned on Monday from a long weekend at the Gran Porto Real. We, like most other travelers, were concerned about the overbooking problem. We had a spanish speaking friend call and confirm our reservations 2 days prior and our travel agent faxed our confirmed reservation to the hotel. We were the first stop on the shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel. It was a half hour ride with no problems. We got our ocean view junior suite with a few palm trees blocking our perfect view but really no big deal. We did request a 3rd floor room but they were not able to accomodate us until the next day. Once you unpack, who wants to move rooms. The room is beautiful and large. It did need a little repair here and there in the bathroom but who cares, you're in paridise. The housekeeper made these great swans scuptures out of bath towels and sprinked them with rose petals. Very nice touch. We had NO problems with the food. We ate buffet for breakfast, poolside for lunch and Il Pescadore for dinner once and the rest at Maria Margarita's which was our favorite. Ask for the table outside, it's quiet and romantic. There was a keyboard player there who is excellent and he played our wedding song and we danced. It was very special. The gift shop is very resonable and has some things you won't find on 5th Avenue. We took out a pedal boat and rode bikes through 5th avenue. There bikes are kind of old, but it was fun to explore 5th avenue by bike instead of walking. We went on "The Fury", a catamaran which sails from Cozumel to several reefs around the island then it stops on the beach for lunch and sunbathing. Don't forget to take dramamine if you get sea sick. The ferry and catamaran can be a little rough. Very nice trip for $58.00 per person. We booked it through our tour representative (Olympus) in the lobby. There aren't many complaints about our trip. Just a few...The lighting in the bathroom isn't great to put on your makeup. Bring a travel lighted mirror if you have one. The drinks seems watered-down. And the coronas at the poolside bar were not as icy cold as I would have liked. I think that 1/3 of the bottle of rum they use for strawberry danquiri's is water! Just ask for them to top off the drink with alcohol. They didn't seem to mind. Bring some smaller bills to cash into pesoes so you don't have to exchange them back into dollars when you leave Mexico. They said you don't get back the same amount that you bought. We did find out that the front desk will cash a hundred dollar bill into 20's. And the most important thing I learned...You CANNOT use an american phone card in Mexico. You have to buy a latadel phone card to use on the latadel phones surrounding the hotel. They have a metal chip on the card that slides into the phone. We bought one in the pharmacy on 5th avenue. It was $1,000 pesoes ($10.00) for approximately 20 minutes. I wish I had known this before I spent $50.00 on phone cards in New York!! We had to leave earlier then necessary to go back to the airport on the shuttle bus with Olympus Tours. We left the hotel at 11 am to get a 2:30 flight. We were annonyed because we could have spent another hour on the beach instead of in an airport. we were checked in and went through security by 12:30. We had 2 hours to wait. Let the tour company know that you do not want to leave earlier than you have to. There is not much to do at night time unless you like to bar hop. And for those traveling with children be cautious of the topless sunbathers on the beach. They were at our hotel as well as surrounding beaches. And the only other complaint is that is wasn't long enough. We wish we could have stayed longer. They offered guest to go to there other resort in Cancun. Those that were staying for a week or longer were dividing there trip and getting to enjoy two areas of Mexico for the price of one. Not bad.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off by saying that the hotel is a great place to vacation. I just got back today, I was there from october 13-17. I was nevous about the overbooking and was prepaired to put up a fight if they did not accomadate me. I got there and check in was good it took about 2 min. and I got what I asked for. The jr. sute rooms are great. The shower is huge and the whole room is big. The service is great they do a awsome job of getting you your drinks while your at the beach and the service inside the resturants is fabulous. You must have reservations or you will not be able to eat there due to the limited space for seating. I had the lobster and paid the extra $14 and it was not worth it. the lobster was real tough and had no flavor I think it was over cooked. The room service was ok one night we had to call and check on it. It took around and hour to recieve it. But the staff is great make sure you tip them just if it's a dollar or two they really appricate it and they will do anything to make you happy. If you go up stairs to the third floor go all the way down the hall you the right and you find a pool that has a swim up bar and is never crowded. I would say that is great place to hang out. Thats where me and my girlfriend spent alot of time. I don't have any major complaints but there are a few little things such as: the beach being full all the time, the beer selection was very limited (basically they had corona and corona the main bar had 3 kinds but not the selection you would think from a five star hotel.) and the if you wanted to eat at the resturants you needed about 2 hours or so it took a while no matter what time you went. But all in all I would go back in a second the hotel was VERY clean and the service was great. I you have any questions e-mail me at LowerJms@aol.com. This is also in a great location and the tours are great expecially the atv,speed boat, and scuba diving tour.

Reviews.Title: “5 star in appearance only!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The standard rooms are sub-standard. Broken lock on door, lock missing on safety deposit box,burned out bulbs, 15 inch wide window with a view of electrical cables and jungle, no chair or desk, no balcony, glass missing on ceiling light, unmopped floors, etc. If you know the Queen song "We will rock you" you know it has other lyrics. We heardjust "we will rock you" repeated about 100 times with accompaning drum beats until midnight, like the band was playing right in our room. There was also yelling, drunks in the hallway until 3am. The buffett food was strictly cheap stuff like rice, potatoes, veggies, chicken, stewed cactus, and overcooked beef. Breakfast was the only half way decent meal but then how can you mess up fruit and eggs. Someone should tell them cut up hotdogs are not "breakfast sausages." For the same money the RIU Playacar is 5 star in every respect. Great food, Las Vegas type shows every night, swim up bar, friendly staff and beautiful rooms with balconies and a fully stocked liquor cabinet and refrigerator with soft drinks and beer. Gran Porto Real looks good but tries to get by on the cheap. It has no class! Never again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned this morning from our 15th anniversary trip to Playa del Carmen. We stayed at Cozumel in '87 for our honeymoon and decided to be in the same area, yet somewhere different. Boy, am I glad we did! We had a wonderful time at the Gran Porto Real. We had no trouble with check-in. Our room was waiting on us when we arrived at 12:30 p.m. The junior suite was lovely! It truly exceeded all of our expectations. The shower was ENORMOUS! Any and everyone who worked there was helpful and friendly. We had an AI package and I hoped for good food. I was not disappointed. We ate 3 of our 4 nights at Il Pescatore. The food was everchanging yet always delicious. Pablo, our favorite waiter, would offer to have anything we wanted prepared for us if we couldn't find anything on the menu that we liked. It was HEAVEN! Even the popcorn in the lobby was yummy! We have already begun to talk to others about a return trip...it was THAT great! Don't be discouraged by any negative reviews that you've read, our experience was outstanding in all aspects. Go and enjoy!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Porto Real - fabulous and affordable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Husband and I went to Playa on September 29, and stayed until October 3. Flew out of Atlanta, and the trip only took us about 2.5 hours. Arrived in Cancun at about 11:30 a.m. their time. We got through customs fairly easy, and were immediately shown to our shuttle van. Ride to Playa was nice and uneventful, and when we arrived at the Gran Porto, it took our breath away! Resort is beautiful, and the lobby is gorgeous, all decked out in marble with stained glass chandeliers. Check-in was a breeze, and we decided to stay with our standard room accommodations. I'm glad we did, because our room was just steps away from the pool and swim-up bar on the fourth floor. We also had a great view of the ocean from the terrace/walkway. The room was very nice and clean, and were really higher-end than I expected because of all the complaints I'd read on other boards. The beds were roomy, almost as big as a double, and the room was really cute. Maid service was good, and we even got some swan towel sculptures! Minibar was always stocked well every morning with sodas, beer and water. All-in-all, standard rooms are great - especially if travelling on a budget. Service is impeccable everywhere you go, so please tip! Folks really go the extra mile to make you feel at home at the resort, and I even had a couple waiters whip out a lighter for my cigarette! Please make sure you tip, especially if you get good service - which you will! My husband and I were on the AI plan, and we felt we got a really good value for the money. We ate at every restaurant there, and liked the Italian the best. Maria Margarita was just so-so. This time of year, the reservations process was more relaxed, and I made arrangements for dinner as late as 2 p.m. one day. If you want to treat yourself, pay the extra $14 for filet mignon and lobster one night - you won't be disappointed. As this was a relaxation vacation, we didn't do any tours, but we did rent a scooter and a jeep for a few days and zipped around town. We talked with a lot of the local folks (thanks to my broken spanish) and ventured into the "real" neighborhood one evening just to check it out. Everyone was very friendly and we never felt unsafe. We went to Cozumel one afternoon, and if you are even mildly sensitive to motion sickness, I'd recommend you get some sort of medicine. I didn't, and I suffered on the ride over. The ride back was okay, though. In a nutshell - had a wonderful time, will definitely go back to the Porto Real, and will probably go again this time of year. Weather was great (we were lucky), and prices are blessedly cheap. Complaints: Very few. Just relt really bad for the shopowners. They were really desperate, I know, but they got kinda bothersome sometimes. Flight seats were a little cramped, but besides that, the flight and service equalled all the domestic routes I've flown. MAIN COMPLAINT - Other vacationers stared a lot at my husband and I, to the point of us being uncomfortable, I figure because there weren't many black couples or people of different ethnicity. Other diners would stare during meals, when we walked together or talked to one another, just everywhere. I even had one older (white) gentleman smile and say he thought I was bringing him his food as I came back from the buffet. So please, be kind and courteous to EVERYONE while on vacation. You never know who can afford to go and have fun right alongside you!

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Family and I have just returned, and I am proud to say that after reading all the negative write-ups it was a VERY enjoyable trip. We got the room that we should have and didnt have any wait, our frig was well stocked with corona and soda , water etc. our beds were turned down nightly and the service was the best. If anything was falling a little short it was the resturants, but they were still good. my children and our entire family ate whatever we wanted and nobody had any complaints!!!!!!!!!! I give them a hand for the service!!!!!!!! hurricane kept us from some of our schedualed snorkeling , but we improvised and still enjoyed paridise. There were a few topless women on the beach but my son didnt even noticed because of all the fun. and we just appricaite being away and enjoying peace and quite! we were not used to being catered to , hats off to all the bellman , maids , waiters !!!!!!!!! signed..... Regular blue collar family in U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “My Expectations Were Exceeded, but Not By Much”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Porto Real from Sept. 18th to the 25th. When my boyfriend and I first walked in, we were awed by the beautiful, open architecture. It seemed majestic with a Mayan touch. Getting the room you want seems to almost always be a problem, from what I've read. I thought our room was going to be big, with a large bathroom, because that's what the hotel's website insisted. But instead we got a small, cramped room at the end of the hotel (probably in the part that was cannibalized). However, it was satisfactory, except for the fact that we got two beds instead of one. The next day we moved into a room downstairs with a king size bed. It was annoying having to wait a day to unpack and settle in. Other than that, the beach was AMAZING. The water was calm. And blue. And clear. (Try snorkeling there, the aquatic life is subtle but definitely there). There were hammocks and kayaks and beach chairs. The pool was beautiful and comfortably warm. The hamburgers and hot dogs were delicious, not to mention the wonderful french fries. The staff walks around asking you if you want anything...they were especially nice. The food was OK. The buffet was so-so. I didn't eat at the Maria Margarita, but we did try the Pescatore. Everything there was well-done, except that the food was somewhat lacking in flavor, but that's relative, I guess. The wait staff in the Albatros buffet was helpful and pleasant. The service in general was awesome, except maybe for the front desk. Nearby is the quaint town. I absolutely loved it...except for the shop workers who harass you to buy something. A lot of the stuff was too expensive!!! But it's a nice walk. Not too noisy and crowded, you know? The first two or three days were spent frolicking on the beach and at the pool. I have to say that the resort seems to attract mostly couples. I suppose it's because of the romantic location, away from the hustle and bustle of the city in Cancun, but not in the middle of nowhere. The remainder of the vacation was spent indoors, as hurricane Isidore made its was across the Yucatan peninsula. It got a little crowded in the lobby as it got too windy and cloudy to spend time outside (the hotel was fully booked). There were a few momentary blackouts. Just one of them lasted for a few hours, but the staff went around and gave everyone candles, which I thought was very considerate. I'm glad that it was a nice resort, though, because it would've been hell to be trapped by a hurricane in anything else. I'd recommend to you this: Get an all-inclusive package. Try to get a room # below, say, 315. Tip only the cleaning people, as I've heard they're the ones who need it most (and they're total sweethearts). Wear water shoes at the beach. Go with a significant other. And pray that you don't meet a hurricane down there, but take solace in the fact that even if you do, you'll probably have a nice time. Feel free to e-mail me with any questions. I benefited greatly from reading reviews and I'm happy to pass it on.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Had A BETTER Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Playa Del Carmen and the Gran Puerto Real Resort, and I honestly can say we couldn't have picked a BETTER hotel or location for our honeymoon!!! Now let me clairfy our travel experiences... we're Americans, however, unlike most we've been to 67 countries, all seven continents, and I've lived in Australia, Belize, England and Ireland. We've stayed in the best of hotels, castles and resorts, and of course, the not so great ones too, and based on those qualifications I would rate this hotel a 10 on a 1 to 10 scale. We had NO PROBLEMS with check in or them honoring our jr. suite. In fact we had a bottle of chilled champagne waiting for us in our room complete with snacks and finger foods when we arrived. The service was amazing... the food was great. We stopped ordering from the menu and just gave our requests to the waiters at the restaurants... we were never denied nor charged extra... from prime rib, filet mignon, to crabcakes. We were spoiled rotten by the staff who remembered us by name and everything was done with abundance and great attention to detail. A couple of suggestions... if you book this resort through a wholesaler such as American Airlines, MLT, Suntrips, etc. ask about their room allotment policy. Contrary to popular the result of overbooking is the wholesaler's fault NOT the resort, as the wholesaler operates like an airline. AA, MLT and the like typically overbook more rooms then their allotment as to have an overlap, only have final confirmation of numbers when deposits come in from passengers. Reconfirm with your wholesaler NOT the resort prior to departure and have them reconfirm with the resort. If you do book through a wholesaler, ask for their local representative's phone number. If you do have a problem while standing in the lobby these people will be the best facilitator. Also, American Airlines will accept collect calls but you cannot dial a 800 number from Mexico so you'll need to get their number with an area code. Pay the extra money and upgrade to a jr suite or oceanfront jr suite. These rooms are ONLY located in the Gran Puerto Real side, not the hotel that had been annexed. There is a little travel agency located right around the corner from the Italian restuarant... they not only post the weather for the week outside on a sign, but they are about 50% cheaper for local tours and car rentals. And if I were you, I would recommend renting a car rather than doing a group tour to do any of the ruins or cenotes... all is sign posted well and east to navigate. This is a wonderful resort and fabulious staff... you just have to take the USUAL precautions and be smart about how you book. If you have any questions at all, please feel free to email me! Heidi & Josh This was an amazing resort

Reviews.Title: “They are shooting themselves in the foot.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent Sept. 1-8,2002 at the Porto Real. The hotel is beautiful and our Jr. Suite was very nice. I had read all the reviews about the hotel being overbooked right before we left and I was paranoid. When we got there we were confirmed in our Jr. Oceanview suite. When we got to the room we found we were on the second floor right over the pool and to get a view of the ocean you had to bend over and turn sideways because of the palm trees. The room was extremely loud being right over the pool. We asked the front desk to move us to a different room, but they said they were full. Finally on the second day my wife asked to see the Manager, Enrique, who was very accomadating. He told us they were full, but would have several people checking out the next day and to check with the front desk. We did the next day and were moved to a room on the third floor away from the pool. What a difference, it was like we had 2 vacations. Three days of stress and 5 days of peace and quiet. We thought the food was excellent. Buffets and the restaurants both. The staff at the Italian restuarant was incredible as was the food. The only negative is that the restaurants are not air conditioned. We were suprised by this. It was very hot eating. As we were leaving there was a sign posted about having people enjoy their facility in Cancun complete with free transportation and upgrades. When I inquired about this I was told the hotel was overbooked from Sept. 9-12, 2002 so they were trying to find someplace to put the people. It is a real shame the hotel continues to operate this way because it is a beautiful facility. However this appears to be their modus operandi. So if you go be prepared.

HotelInfo.Name: Gran Porto Real Resort and Spa
HotelInfo.Address: Constituyentes No. 1, Playa del Carmen 77500, Mexico
